data.v: सोऽहं वागग्रसृष्टानां रसानामवलेहकः । स्वजात्यानधितिष्ठामि नक्षत्राणीव चन्द्रमाः ॥
data.md: I always lick the nectar that is at the end of their tongue, and it is for this reason that I occupy a position far above that of all others of my family like the Moon transcending all the stars.

data.v: एतत्पृथिव्याममृतमेतच्चक्षुरनुत्तमम् । यद्ब्राह्मणमुखाच्छास्त्रमिह श्रुत्वा प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: The scriptural interpretations which fall from the lips of the Brahmanas and listening to which every wise man acts in the world, form nectar on Earth and may, also be likened to most excellent.

data.v: एतत्कारणमाज्ञाय दृष्ट्वा देवासुरं पुरा । युद्धं पिता मे हृष्टात्मा विस्मितः प्रत्यपद्यत ॥
data.md: Seeing the battle between the celestials and the Asuras in days of old, and understanding the power of the instructions that fell from the Brahmanas, my father became filled with delight and wonder.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा च ब्राह्मणानां तु महिमानं महात्मनाम् । पर्यपृच्छत्कथमिमे सिद्धा इति निशाकरम् ॥
data.md: Seeing the power of great Brahmanas, my father asked the Moon the question-How do the Brahmanas acquire success?

data.v: ब्राह्मणास्तपसा सर्वे सिध्यन्ते वाग्बलाः सदा । भुजवीर्या हि राजानो वागस्त्राश्च द्विजातयः ॥
data.md: Soma said The Brahmanas become crowned with success by virtue of their penances. Their strength consists in speech. The power of Kshatriyas is in their arms. The Brahmanas, however, have words for their weapons.

data.v: प्रवसन्वाप्यधीयीत बह्वीर्दुर्वसतीर्वसन् । निर्मन्युरपि निर्मानो यतिः स्यात्समदर्शनः ॥
data.md: Undergoing the discomforts of a residence into the house of his preceptor, the Brahmana should study the Vedas or at least the Pranava. Freeing himself of anger and renouncing earthly attachments, he should become a Yati, regarding all things and all creatures with equal eyes.

data.v: अपि चेज्जातिसंपन्नः सर्वान्वेदान्पितुर्गृहे । श्लाघमान इवाधीयेद्ग्राम्य इत्येव तं विदुः ॥
data.md: If remaining in the house of his father he masters all the Vedas and acquiring great knowledge acquires a position that should command respect, people still condemn him as untravelled or home-keeping.

data.v: भूमिरेतौ निगिरति सर्पो बिलशयानिव । राजानं चाप्ययोद्धारं ब्राह्मणं चाप्रवासिनम् ॥
data.md: Like a snake swallowing mice, the Earth swallows up these two, viz., a king that is unwilling to fight and a Brahmana who is reluctant to leave home for acquiring knowiedge.

data.v: अतिमानः श्रियं हन्ति पुरुषस्याल्पमेधसः । गर्भेण दुष्यते कन्या गृहवासेन च द्विजः ॥
data.md: Pride destroys the prosperity of persons of little wit. A maiden, if she conceives, becomes stained. A Brahmana incurs reproach by remaining at home.

data.v: इत्येतन्मे पिता श्रुत्वा सोमादद्भुतदर्शनात् । ब्राह्मणान्पूजयामास तथैवाहं महाव्रतान् ॥
data.md: This is what my father heard from the revered Soma. My father, on account of this, began to adore and respect the Brahmanas. Like him, I also worship and adore all Brahmanas of high vows!

data.v: श्रुत्वैतद्वचनं शक्रो दानवेन्द्रमुखाच्च्युतम् । द्विजान्संपूजयामास महेन्द्रत्वमवाप च ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Hearing these words that fell from the mouth of that prince of Danavas, Shakra began to adore the Brahmanas, and as a result thereof he succeeded in acquiring the kingship of the celestials.

data.v: अपूर्वं वा भवेत्पात्रमथ वापि चिरोषितम् । दूरादभ्यागतं वापि किं पात्रं स्यात्पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Which among these three persons, O grandfather should be regarded as the best for making gifts, viz., one who is a thorough stranger, or one who is living with and known to the giver for a long time, or one who comes to the giver from a long distance?

data.v: क्रिया भवति केषांचिदुपांशुव्रतमुत्तमम् । यो यो याचेत यत्किंचित्सर्वं दद्याम इत्युत ॥
data.md: Bhishma said All these are equal. The fitness of some consists in their soliciting alms for celebrating sacrifices or for paying the preceptor's fee or for maintaining their wives and children. The fitness of some, for receiving gifts, consists in their following the vow of wandering over the Earth, never soliciting anything but receiving when given. We should also give to one what one seeks.

data.v: अपीडयन्भृत्यवर्गमित्येवमनुशुश्रुम । पीडयन्भृत्यवर्गं हि आत्मानमपकर्षति ॥
data.md: We should however, make gifts without afflicting those who depend upon us. This is what we have heard. By afflicting one's dependants, one afflicts his own self.

data.v: अपूर्वं वापि यत्पात्रं यच्चापि स्याच्चिरोषितम् । दूरादभ्यागतं चापि तत्पात्रं च विदुर्बुधाः ॥
data.md: The stranger, one, that is who has come for the first time, should be considered as a proper object of gifts. He who is familiar and wellknown and has been living with the giver, should also be considered in the same light. The learned know that he too who comes from a distant place should be considered in an equal light.

data.v: अपीडया च भृत्यानां धर्मस्याहिंसया तथा । पात्रं विद्याम तत्त्वेन यस्मै दत्तं न संतपेत् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said It is true that we should make gifts to others without afflicting any one and without going against the ordinances of scriptures. One should, however, correctly determine who the person is that should be considered as a proper object for making gifts. He should be such that the gift itself, when made over to him, may not grieve.

data.v: ऋत्विक्पुरोहिताचार्याः शिष्याः संबन्धिबान्धवाः । सर्वे पूज्याश्च मान्याश्च श्रुतवृत्तोपसंहिताः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said If the Ritvij, the Purohita, the preceptor, the Acharya, the disciple, the relative (by marriage), and kinsmen, happen to be endued with learning and free from malice, then should they be considered worthy of respect and adoration.

data.v: अतोऽन्यथा वर्तमानाः सर्वे नार्हन्ति सत्क्रियाम् । तस्मान्नित्यं परीक्षेत पुरुषान्प्रणिधाय वै ॥
data.md: Those persons who do not possess such qualifications cannot be considered as worthy of gifts or hospitality. Hence, one should with deliberation examine persons who one meets.

data.v: अक्रोधः सत्यवचनमहिंसा दम आर्जवम् । अद्रोहो नातिमानश्च ह्रीस्तितिक्षा तपः शमः ॥
यस्मिन्नेतानि दृश्यन्ते न चाकार्याणि भारत । भावतो विनिविष्टानि तत्पात्रं मानमर्हति ॥
data.md: Absence of anger, truthfulness of speech, abstention from injury, sincerity, peacefulness of conduct, the absence of pride, modesty, renunciation, selfcontrol and tranquillity or contentment of soul he in whom these are by nature, and in whom there are no wicked acts, should be considered as a proper object. Such a person deserves honours.

data.v: तथा चिरोषितं चापि संप्रत्यागतमेव च । अपूर्वं चैव पूर्वं च तत्पात्रं मानमर्हति ॥
data.md: Whether the person be one who is wellknown and familiar or one who has come newly, whether he has or has not been seen before, if he happens to possess these qualifications, he should be considered as worthy of honors and hospitality.

data.v: अप्रामाण्यं च वेदानां शास्त्राणां चातिलङ्घनम् । सर्वत्र चानवस्थानमेतन्नाशनमात्मनः ॥
data.md: He who denies the authority of the Vedas, or tries to show that the scriptures should be disregarded, or approves of all breaches of control in society, simply brings about his own ruin.

data.v: भवेत्पण्डितमानी यो ब्राह्मणो वेदनिन्दकः । आन्वीक्षिकीं तर्कविद्यामनुरक्तो निरर्थिकाम् ॥
हेतुवादान्ब्रुवन्सत्सु विजेताहेतुवादिकः । आक्रोष्टा चातिवक्ता च ब्राह्मणानां सदैव हि ॥
सर्वाभिशङ्की मूढश्च बालः कटुकवागपि । बोद्धव्यस्तादृशस्तात नरश्वानं हि तं विदुः ॥
यथा श्वा भषितुं चैव हन्तुं चैवावसृज्यते । एवं संभाषणार्थाय सर्वशास्त्रवधाय च । अल्पश्रुताः कुतर्काश्च दृष्टाः स्पृष्टाः कुपण्डिताः ॥
data.md: As a dog, meets others, barking the while and seeking to bite, such a person is even so, for he spends his breath in vain and tries to destroy the authority of all the scriptures.

data.v: श्रुतिस्मृतीतिहासादिपुराणारण्यवेदिनः । अनुरुन्ध्याद्बहुज्ञांश्च सारज्ञांश्चैव पण्डितान् ॥
लोकयात्रा च द्रष्टव्या धर्मश्चात्महितानि च । एवं नरो वर्तमानः शाश्वतीरेधते समाः ॥
data.md: or Those practices that support society, the duties of virtue, and all those acts which yield benefit to one's own self, should be attended to. A person that lives, attending to these, becomes prosperous for good.

data.v: ऋणमुन्मुच्य देवानामृषीणां च तथैव च । पितॄणामथ विप्राणामतिथीनां च पञ्चमम् ॥
data.md: By satisfying the debt one owes to the deities by performing sacrifices, that to the Rishis by studying the Vedas, that to the departed manes by procreating children, that to the Brahmanas by making presents to them, and that to guests by feeding them, in due order, and with purity of motive, and properly attending to the ordinances of the scriptures, a householder does not fall away from virtue.

data.v: पर्यायेण विशुद्धेन सुनिर्णिक्तेन कर्मणा । एवं गृहस्थः कर्माणि कुर्वन्धर्मान्न हीयते ॥
data.md: By satisfying the debt one owes to the deities by performing sacrifices, that to the Rishis by studying the Vedas, that to the departed manes by procreating children, that to the Brahmanas by making presents to them, and that to guests by feeding them, in due order, and with purity of motive, and properly attending to the ordinances of the scriptures, a householder does not fall away from virtue.

data.v: स्त्रीणां स्वभावमिच्छामि श्रोतुं भरतसत्तम । स्त्रियो हि मूलं दोषाणां लघुचित्ताः पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O best of the Bharatas, I wish to hear you describe the disposition of women. Women are said to be the root of all evil. They are all considered as highly frail.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । नारदस्य च संवादं पुंश्चल्या पञ्चचूडया ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited an old history, O Yudhishthira, of a conversation between Matanga and a she-ass.

data.v: लोकाननुचरन्धीमान्देवर्षिर्नारदः पुरा । ददर्शाप्सरसं ब्राह्मीं पञ्चचूडामनिन्दिताम् ॥
data.md: Once in ancient times, the celestial Rishi Narada, having roamed over all the world, met the Apsara Panchachuda of faultless, beauty, having her residence in the region of Brahman.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा चारुसर्वाङ्गीं पप्रच्छाप्सरसं मुनिः । संशयो हृदि मे कश्चित्तन्मे ब्रूहि सुमध्यमे ॥
data.md: Seeing the Apsara every limb of whose body was highly beautiful, the ascetic addressed her, saying Oyou of slender waist, I have a doubt in my mind. Do you explain it!

data.v: एवमुक्ता तु सा विप्रं प्रत्युवाचाथ नारदम् । विषये सति वक्ष्यामि समर्थां मन्यसे च माम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed by the Rishi, the Apsara said to him If the subject is one which is known to me and if you consider me competent to speak on it, I shall certainly say what is in my mind.

data.v: न त्वामविषये भद्रे नियोक्ष्यामि कथंचन । स्त्रीणां स्वभावमिच्छामि त्वत्तः श्रोतुं वरानने ॥
data.md: Narada said O amiable one, I shall not certainly ask you for any task that is beyond your power. O you of beautiful face, I wish to hear from you of the disposition of women.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचस्तस्य देवर्षेरप्सरोत्तमा । प्रत्युवाच न शक्ष्यामि स्त्री सती निन्दितुं स्त्रियः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Hearing these words of the celestial Rishi, that foremost of Apsaras replied to him, saying I am unable being myself a woman to speak ill of women.

data.v: विदितास्ते स्त्रियो याश्च यादृशाश्च स्वभावतः । न मामर्हसि देवर्षे नियोक्तुं प्रश्न ईदृशे ॥
data.md: You know what women are and with what nature they are gifted. You should not, O celestial Rishi, set me to such a task.

data.v: तामुवाच स देवर्षिः सत्यं वद सुमध्यमे । मृषावादे भवेद्दोषः सत्ये दोषो न विद्यते ॥
data.md: It is very To her the celestial Rishi said true, O you of slender waist! One commits sin by speaking what is untrue. In saying however, what is true, there can be no sin.

data.v: इत्युक्ता सा कृतमतिरभवच्चारुहासिनी । स्त्रीदोषाञ्शाश्वतान्सत्यान्भाषितुं संप्रचक्रमे ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by him, the Apsara Panchachuda of sweet smiles consented to answer Narada's question. She then addressed herself to mention what the true and eternal shortcomings are of women.

data.v: कुलीना रूपवत्यश्च नाथवत्यश्च योषितः । मर्यादासु न तिष्ठन्ति स दोषः स्त्रीषु नारद ॥
data.md: Panchachuda said Even if highborn and gifted with beauty and possessed of protectors women wish to transgress the restraints assigned to them. This fault truly attaches them, O Narada.

data.v: न स्त्रीभ्यः किंचिदन्यद्वै पापीयस्तरमस्ति वै । स्त्रियो हि मूलं दोषाणां तथा त्वमपि वेत्थ ह ॥
data.md: There is nothing else that is more sinful than women. Verily, women are the root of all evils. That is certainly known to you, O Narada.

data.v: समाज्ञातानृद्धिमतः प्रतिरूपान्वशे स्थितान् । पतीनन्तरमासाद्य नालं नार्यः प्रतीक्षितुम् ॥
data.md: Women even when having husbands of fame and wealth, of handsome features and completely obedient to them, are prepared to disregard them if they get the opportunity.

data.v: असद्धर्मस्त्वयं स्त्रीणामस्माकं भवति प्रभो । पापीयसो नरान्यद्वै लज्जां त्यक्त्वा भजामहे ॥
data.md: This, O powerful one, is a sinful disposition with us women, casting off modesty, we seek the companionship of men of sinful habits and intentions.

data.v: स्त्रियं हि यः प्रार्थयते संनिकर्षं च गच्छति । ईषच्च कुरुते सेवां तमेवेच्छन्ति योषितः ॥
data.md: Women show a liking for those men who court them, who approach their presence and who respectfully serve them to even a slight extent.

data.v: अनर्थित्वान्मनुष्याणां भयात्परिजनस्य च । मर्यादायाममर्यादाः स्त्रियस्तिष्ठन्ति भर्तृषु ॥
data.md: Through want of solicitation by persons of the other sex, or fear of relatives, women, who are naturally impatient of all control, do not transgress those that have been ordained for them, and remain by the side of their husbands.

data.v: नासां कश्चिदगम्योऽस्ति नासां वयसि संस्थितिः । विरूपं रूपवन्तं वा पुमानित्येव भुञ्जते ॥
data.md: There is none whom they cannot admit to their favours. They never consider about the age of the person they are prepared to favour. Ugly or handsome, if only the person happens to belong to the opposite sex, women are ready to enjoy his companionship.

data.v: न भयान्नाप्यनुक्रोशान्नार्थहेतोः कथंचन । न ज्ञातिकुलसंबन्धात्स्त्रियस्तिष्ठन्ति भर्तृषु ॥
data.md: That women remain faithful to their husbands is due not to their fear of sin, nor to mercy, nor to riches, nor to the affection that originates in their hearts for kinsmen and children.

data.v: यौवने वर्तमानानां मृष्टाभरणवाससाम् । नारीणां स्वैरवृत्तानां स्पृहयन्ति कुलस्त्रियः ॥
data.md: Women living in the respectable families envy the condition of those members of their sex who are young and welladorned with jewels and gems and that lead a free life.

data.v: याश्च शश्वद्बहुमता रक्ष्यन्ते दयिताः स्त्रियः । अपि ताः संप्रसज्जन्ते कुब्जान्धजडवामनैः ॥
data.md: Even those women who are loved by their husbands and treated with great respect, are seen to confer their favours upon men who are humpbacked, who are blind, who are idiots or who are dwarfs.

data.v: पङ्गुष्वपि च देवर्षे ये चान्ये कुत्सिता नराः । स्त्रीणामगम्यो लोकेऽस्मिन्नास्ति कश्चिन्महामुने ॥
data.md: Women may be seen to like the companionship of even those men who are inert or those men who are ugly to look at, O great Rishi, there is no man in this world whom women may consider as unfit for companionship!

data.v: यदि पुंसां गतिर्ब्रह्म कथंचिन्नोपपद्यते । अप्यन्योन्यं प्रवर्तन्ते न हि तिष्ठन्ति भर्तृषु ॥
data.md: Through inability to obtain persons of the opposite sex, or fear of relatives or fear of death and imprisonment, women remain, of themselves under control.

data.v: अलाभात्पुरुषाणां हि भयात्परिजनस्य च । वधबन्धभयाच्चापि स्वयं गुप्ता भवन्ति ताः ॥
data.md: Through inability to obtain persons of the opposite sex, or fear of relatives or fear of death and imprisonment, women remain, of themselves under control.

data.v: चलस्वभावा दुःसेव्या दुर्ग्राह्या भावतस्तथा । प्राज्ञस्य पुरुषस्येह यथा वाचस्तथा स्त्रियः ॥
data.md: They are highly fickle, for they always hanker after new companions. On account of their nature being unintelligible, they are incapable of being kept in obedience by loving treatment. Their nature is such that they are incapable of being controlled when bent upon transgression. Indeed, women are like the words uttered by the wise.

data.v: यथा रुचिं नावलिहेद्देवेन्द्रो भृगुसत्तम । क्रतावुपहितं न्यस्तं हविः श्वेव दुरात्मवान् ॥
data.md: O foremost one of Bhrigu's race, do you take every care for seeing that the king of the celestials may not defile this wife of mine like a wretched dog licking the Havi kept in view of a sacrifice.

data.v: एवमाख्याय स मुनिर्यज्ञकारोऽगमत्तदा । देवशर्मा महाभागस्ततो भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Having said these words, the highly blessed ascetic viz., Devasharman, celebrating a sacrifice, started from his abode, O chief of the Bharatas.

data.v: विपुलस्तु वचः श्रुत्वा गुरोश्चिन्तापरोऽभवत् । रक्षां च परमां चक्रे देवराजान्महाबलात् ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of his preceptor, Vipula began to think, I shall certainly protect this lady in every respect from the powerful king of the celestials.

data.v: किं नु शक्यं मया कर्तुं गुरुदाराभिरक्षणे । मायावी हि सुरेन्द्रोऽसौ दुर्धर्षश्चापि वीर्यवान् ॥
data.md: But what should be the means? What can I do for protecting the wife of my preceptor? The king of the celestials is endued with large powers of illusion. Gifted with great energy, he is difficult of being resisted.

data.v: नापिधायाश्रमं शक्यो रक्षितुं पाकशासनः । उटजं वा तथा ह्यस्य नानाविधसरूपता ॥
data.md: Indra cannot be kept out by enclosing this retreat of ours or fencing this yard, since he is capable of assuming numberless forms.

data.v: वायुरूपेण वा शक्रो गुरुपत्नीं प्रधर्षयेत् । तस्मादिमां संप्रविश्य रुचिं स्थास्येऽहमद्य वै ॥
data.md: Assuming the form of the wind, the king of the celestials may assault the wife of my preceptor. The best course, therefore, for me, would be to enter the body of this lady and remain there.

data.v: अथ वा पौरुषेणेयमशक्या रक्षितुं मया । बहुरूपो हि भगवाञ्छ्रूयते हरिवाहनः ॥
data.md: By displaying my prowess I shall not be able to protect the lady, for the powerful chastiser of Paka, it has been heard by me, is capable of assuming any form he likes.

data.v: सोऽहं योगबलादेनां रक्षिष्ये पाकशासनात् । गात्राणि गात्रैरस्याहं संप्रवेक्ष्येऽभिरक्षितुम् ॥
data.md: I shall, therefore, protect this one from Indra by my Yogapower. For satisfying my object I shall with my body enter the body of this lady.

data.v: यद्युच्छिष्टामिमां पत्नीं रुचिं पश्येत मे गुरुः । शप्स्यत्यसंशयं कोपाद्दिव्यज्ञानो महातपाः ॥
data.md: If my preceptor on return, sees his wife defiled, he will, forsooth, curse me through anger, for endued with great ascetic merit, he is gifted with spiritual vision.

data.v: न चेयं रक्षितुं शक्या यथान्या प्रमदा नृभिः । मायावी हि सुरेन्द्रोऽसावहो प्राप्तोऽस्मि संशयम् ॥
data.md: This lady is incapable of being protected in the way in which other women are protected by men, since the king of the celestials is gifted with large powers of illusion. Alas, the situation is very critical.

data.v: अवश्यकरणीयं हि गुरोरिह हि शासनम् । यदि त्वेतदहं कुर्यामाश्चर्यं स्यात्कृतं मया ॥
data.md: The command of my preceptor should certainly be obeyed by me. If, therefore, I protect her by my Yogapower, the feat will be considered by all as a wonderful one.

data.v: योगेनानुप्रविश्येह गुरुपत्न्याः कलेवरम् । निर्मुक्तस्य रजोरूपान्नापराधो भवेन्मम ॥
यथा हि शून्यां पथिकः सभामध्यावसेत्पथि । तथाद्यावासयिष्यामि गुरुपत्न्याः कलेवरम् ॥
असक्तः पद्मपत्रस्थो जलबिन्दुर्यथा चलः । एवमेव शरीरेऽस्या निवत्स्यामि समाहितः ॥
data.md: By my Yogapower therefore, I shall enter the body of my preceptor's lady. I shall live within her and yet not touch her body like a drop of water on a lotus leaf which lies on it yet does not drench it at all.

data.v: इत्येवं धर्ममालोक्य वेदवेदांश्च सर्वशः । तपश्च विपुलं दृष्ट्वा गुरोरात्मन एव च ॥
data.md: Giving his best consideration to these points of virtue, thinking of all the Vedas and their branches and with eye directed to the penances which his preceptor had and which he himself also was possessed of, and having settled in his mind, with a view only to protect the lady, to enter her body by Yogapower, Vipula of Bhrigu's race, took great care (for accomplishing his object. Listen now to me, O king, as I recite to you what he did.

data.v: इति निश्चित्य मनसा रक्षां प्रति स भार्गवः । आतिष्ठत्परमं यत्नं यथा तच्छृणु पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Giving his best consideration to these points of virtue, thinking of all the Vedas and their branches and with eye directed to the penances which his preceptor had and which he himself also was possessed of, and having settled in his mind, with a view only to protect the lady, to enter her body by Yogapower, Vipula of Bhrigu's race, took great care (for accomplishing his object. Listen now to me, O king, as I recite to you what he did.

data.v: गुरुपत्नीमुपासीनो विपुलः स महातपाः । उपासीनामनिन्द्याङ्गीं कथाभिः समलोभयत् ॥
data.md: Gifted with great penances, Vipula sat himself down by the side of his preceptor's wife as she of faultless features was sitting in her cottage. Vipula then began to discourse to her for bringing her over to the cause of virtue and truth.

data.v: नेत्राभ्यां नेत्रयोरस्या रश्मीन्संयोज्य रश्मिभिः । विवेश विपुलः कायमाकाशं पवनो यथा ॥
data.md: Directing his eyes then to hers and uniting the rays of light that came out from her organs of vision with those that issued from his, Vipula entered the lady's body even as the element of wind enters that of ether or space.

data.v: लक्षणं लक्षणेनैव वदनं वदनेन च । अविचेष्टन्नतिष्ठद्वै छायेवान्तर्गतो मुनिः ॥
data.md: Penetrating her eyes with his eyes and her face with his face, Vipula lived, without moving within her invisibly, like her shadow.

data.v: ततो विष्टभ्य विपुलो गुरुपत्न्याः कलेवरम् । उवास रक्षणे युक्तो न च सा तमबुध्यत ॥
data.md: Restraining every part of the lady's body, Vipula continued to live within her, intent on protecting her from Indra. The lady herself knew nothing of this.

data.v: यं कालं नागतो राजन्गुरुस्तस्य महात्मनः । क्रतुं समाप्य स्वगृहं तं कालं सोऽभ्यरक्षत ॥
data.md: It was in this way, o king, that Vipula continued to protect the lady till the time of his great preceptor's return after accomplishing the sacrifice which he had gone out to perform.

data.v: ततः कदाचिद्देवेन्द्रो दिव्यरूपवपुर्धरः । इदमन्तरमित्येवं ततोऽभ्यागादथाश्रमम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said One day the king of the celestials assuming a form of divine beauty, came to the hermitage of the Rishi, thinking that the opportunity he had been expecting had at last come.

data.v: रूपमप्रतिमं कृत्वा लोभनीयं जनाधिप । दर्शनीयतमो भूत्वा प्रविवेश तमाश्रमम् ॥
data.md: Indeed, O king, having assumed a form peerless in beauty and highly tempting to women and highly agreeable to look at, Indra entered the ascetic's asylum.

data.v: स ददर्श तमासीनं विपुलस्य कलेवरम् । निश्चेष्टं स्तब्धनयनं यथालेख्यगतं तथा ॥
data.md: He beheld the body of Vipula staying in a sitting posture, immovable as a stake and with eyes shorn of vision, like a picture drawn on the canvas.

data.v: रुचिं च रुचिरापाङ्गीं पीनश्रोणिपयोधराम् । पद्मपत्रविशालाक्षीं संपूर्णेन्दुनिभाननाम् ॥
data.md: And he beheld also Ruchi, seated there, adorned with eyes whose ends were highly beautiful, possessed of full and round hips, and having a deep and swelling bosom. Her eyes were large and expansive like lotus petals and her face was as beautiful and sweet as the full moon.

data.v: सा तमालोक्य सहसा प्रत्युत्थातुमियेष ह । रूपेण विस्मिता कोऽसीत्यथ वक्तुमिहेच्छती ॥
data.md: Seeing Indra come in that guise, the lady wished to rise up and welcome him. Her wonder having been excited at the peerless beauty of form which the person possessed, she very much wished to ask him as to who he was.

data.v: उत्थातुकामापि सती व्यतिष्ठद्विपुलेन सा । निगृहीता मनुष्येन्द्र न शशाक विचेष्टितुम् ॥
data.md: Although however, she wished to rise up and welcome him, yet her limbs having been restrained by Vipula who was living within her, she failed, O king, to do what she wished. In fact, she was unable, to move from the place where she sat.

data.v: तामाबभाषे देवेन्द्रः साम्ना परमवल्गुना । त्वदर्थमागतं विद्धि देवेन्द्रं मां शुचिस्मिते ॥
data.md: The king of the celestials then addressed her in sweet words uttered with a sweet voice.

data.v: क्लिश्यमानमनङ्गेन त्वत्संकल्पोद्भवेन वै । तत्पर्याप्नुहि मां सुभ्रु पुरा कालोऽतिवर्तते ॥
data.md: Indeed he said O you of sweet smiles, know that I am Indra, arrived there for your sake! Know, O sweet lady that I am afflicted by the god of love provoked by your thoughts. O you of beautiful brows, I have come to you. Time passes away.

data.v: तमेवंवादिनं शक्रं शुश्राव विपुलो मुनिः । गुरुपत्न्याः शरीरस्थो ददर्श च सुराधिपम् ॥
data.md: These words that Indra spoke were heard by the ascetic Vipula. Remaining within the body of his preceptor's wife, he saw everything that took place.

data.v: न शशाक च सा राजन्प्रत्युत्थातुमनिन्दिता । वक्तुं च नाशकद्राजन्विष्टब्धा विपुलेन सा ॥
data.md: The lady of faultless beauty, though she heard what Indra said, was, however, unable to rise up for welcoming or honouring the king of the celestials. Her senses restrained by Vipula she could make no reply.

data.v: आकारं गुरुपत्न्यास्तु विज्ञाय स भृगूद्वहः । निजग्राह महातेजा योगेन बलवत्प्रभो । बबन्ध योगबन्धैश्च तस्याः सर्वेन्द्रियाणि सः ॥
data.md: Judging from the marks afforded by the body of his preceptor's wife that she was not reluctant to receive Indra with kindness, that scion of Bhrigu's race, of mighty energy restrained her limbs and senses all the more effectually, O king, by his Yogapowers.

data.v: तां निर्विकारां दृष्ट्वा तु पुनरेव शचीपतिः । उवाच व्रीडितो राजंस्तां योगबलमोहिताम् ॥
data.md: With Yogafetters he bound up all her senses. Seeing her seated without any mark of agitation on her body, the husband of Sachi, abashed a little once more addressed that lady who was stupefied by the Yogapowers of her husband's disciple, in these words Come, come, O sweet lady! Then the lady tried to answer him. Vipula however, restrained the words that she intended to utter,

data.v: एह्येहीति ततः सा तं प्रतिवक्तुमियेष च । स तां वाचं गुरोः पत्न्या विपुलः पर्यवर्तयत् ॥
भोः किमागमने कृत्यमिति तस्याश्च निःसृता । वक्त्राच्छशाङ्कप्रतिमाद्वाणी संस्कारभूषिता ॥
व्रीडिता सा तु तद्वाक्यमुक्त्वा परवशा तदा । पुरंदरश्च संत्रस्तो बभूव विमनास्तदा ॥
स तद्वैकृतमालक्ष्य देवराजो विशां पते । अवैक्षत सहस्राक्षस्तदा दिव्येन चक्षुषा ॥
ददर्श च मुनिं तस्याः शरीरान्तरगोचरम् । प्रतिबिम्बमिवादर्शे गुरुपत्न्याः शरीरगम् ॥
स तं घोरेण तपसा युक्तं दृष्ट्वा पुरंदरः । प्रावेपत सुसंत्रस्तः शापभीतस्तदा विभो ॥
विमुच्य गुरुपत्नीं तु विपुलः सुमहातपाः । स्वं कलेवरमाविश्य शक्रं भीतमथाब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vipula then gifted with great ascetic power, left the body of his preceptor's wife and returned to his own body that was lying near. Then he addressed the terrified Indra in the following words.

data.v: अजितेन्द्रिय पापात्मन्कामात्मक पुरंदर । न चिरं पूजयिष्यन्ति देवास्त्वां मानुषास्तथा ॥
data.md: Vipula said O wicked Purandara, O you of sinful mind, o wretch who have no control over your senses, neither the deities nor human beings will worship you for any length of time.

data.v: किं नु तद्विस्मृतं शक्र न तन्मनसि ते स्थितम् । गौतमेनासि यन्मुक्तो भगाङ्कपरिचिह्नितः ॥
data.md: Have you forgotten it, O Shakra does it not still dwell in your remembrance that Gautama had cursed you on account of which your body became disfigured with a thousand sexmarks, which owing to the Rishi's mercy, were after words changed into so many eyes.

data.v: जाने त्वां बालिशमतिमकृतात्मानमस्थिरम् । मयेयं रक्ष्यते मूढ गच्छ पाप यथागतम् ॥
data.md: I know that you are of an exceedingly foolish understanding that, your soul is impure and that you are of an exceedingly fickle mind. O fool, know that this lady is being protected by me. O sinful wretch, return whence you came.

data.v: नाहं त्वामद्य मूढात्मन्दहेयं हि स्वतेजसा । कृपायमाणस्तु न ते दग्धुमिच्छामि वासव ॥
data.md: you of foolish soul, I do not reduce you today into ashes with my energy. Indeed, I am filled with mercy for you. It is for this that I do not, O Vasava, wish to burn you.

data.v: स च घोरतपा धीमान्गुरुर्मे पापचेतसम् । दृष्ट्वा त्वां निर्दहेदद्य क्रोधदीप्तेन चक्षुषा ॥
data.md: My preceptor gifted with great intelligence, is possessed of terrible power. With eyes blazing with anger, he would, if he saw you, have burnt your sinful self today.

data.v: नैवं तु शक्र कर्तव्यं पुनर्मान्याश्च ते द्विजाः । मा गमः ससुतामात्योऽत्ययं ब्रह्मबलार्दितः ॥
data.md: You should not, O Shakra, do its like again. The Brahmanas should be respected by you. See that you do not, with your sons and counsellors, meet with destruction, afflicted by the power of the Brahmanas.

data.v: अमरोऽस्मीति यद्बुद्धिमेतामास्थाय वर्तसे । मावमंस्था न तपसामसाध्यं नाम किंचन ॥
data.md: You think that you are an immortal and that, therefore, are at liberty to act thus. Do not, however, dishonour the Brahmanas. Know that there is nothing unattainable by penance.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं शक्रो विपुलस्य महात्मनः । अकिंचिदुक्त्वा व्रीडितस्तत्रैवान्तरधीयत ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Hearing these words of the great Vipula, Shakra without saying anything, and covered with shame, disappeared.

data.v: मुहूर्तयाते शक्रे तु देवशर्मा महातपाः । कृत्वा यज्ञं यथाकाममाजगाम स्वमाश्रमम् ॥
data.md: A moment after he had gone away, Devasharman of great ascetic merit, having accomplished the sacrifice, he had intended to perform, returned to his own hermitage.

data.v: आगतेऽथ गुरौ राजन्विपुलः प्रियकर्मकृत् । रक्षितां गुरवे भार्यां न्यवेदयदनिन्दिताम् ॥
data.md: When his preceptor returned, Vipula who had done a good deed, gave to him his wife of faultless beauty whom he had successfully protected against the machination of Indra.

data.v: अभिवाद्य च शान्तात्मा स गुरुं गुरुवत्सलः । विपुलः पर्युपातिष्ठद्यथापूर्वमशङ्कितः ॥
data.md: O tranquil soul and full of respect for his preceptor, Vipula respectfully saluted him and stood before him with a fearless heart.

data.v: विश्रान्ताय ततस्तस्मै सहासीनाय भार्यया । निवेदयामास तदा विपुलः शक्रकर्म तत् ॥
data.md: After his preceptor had rested a while and when he was seated with his wife on the same seat, Vipula told him everything that Shakra had done.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा स मुनिस्तुष्टो विपुलस्य प्रतापवान् । बभूव शीलवृत्ताभ्यां तपसा नियमेन च ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of Vipula, that foremost of Munis, gifted with great prowess, became highly pleased with him for his conduct and disposition, his penances and his observances.

data.v: विपुलस्य गुरौ वृत्तिं भक्तिमात्मनि च प्रभुः । धर्मे च स्थिरतां दृष्ट्वा साधु साध्वित्युवाच ह ॥
data.md: Observing Vipula's conduct towards himself his preceptor and his devotion also and marking his steadiness in virtue, the powerful Devasharman exclaimed-Excellent, excellent.

data.v: प्रतिनन्द्य च धर्मात्मा शिष्यं धर्मपरायणम् । वरेण च्छन्दयामास स तस्माद्गुरुवत्सलः । अनुज्ञातश्च गुरुणा चचारानुत्तमं तपः ॥
data.md: The pious Devasharman receiving his virtuous disciple with a sincere welcome, honoured him with a boon.

data.v: तथैव देवशर्मापि सभार्यः स महातपाः । निर्भयो बलवृत्रघ्नाच्चचार विजने वने ॥
data.md: Devasharman also of severe penances, with his wife, began from that day to live in those solitary woods, perfectly fearless of him who had killed Vala and Vritra.

data.v: विपुलस्त्वकरोत्तीव्रं तपः कृत्वा गुरोर्वचः । तपोयुक्तमथात्मानममन्यत च वीर्यवान् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Having satisfied his preceptor's command, Vipula practised the most severe penances. Gifted with great energy, he at last regarded himself as endued with sufficient ascetic merit.

data.v: स तेन कर्मणा स्पर्धन्पृथिवीं पृथिवीपते । चचार गतभीः प्रीतो लब्धकीर्तिर्वरो नृषु ॥
data.md: Priding himself upon the feat he had performed, he he wandered fearlessly and contentedly over the Earth, O monarch, honoured by all as one possessed of great fame for what he had done.

data.v: उभौ लोकौ जितौ चापि तथैवामन्यत प्रभुः । कर्मणा तेन कौरव्य तपसा विपुलेन च ॥
data.md: The powerful Bhargava thought that he had conquered both the worlds by that feat of his as also by his severe penances.

data.v: अथ काले व्यतिक्रान्ते कस्मिंश्चित्कुरुनन्दन । रुच्या भगिन्या दानं वै बभूव धनधान्यवत् ॥
data.md: After sometime, O delighter of the Kurus, the time came for a ceremony of gifts to take place with respect to the sister of Ruchi. Profuse wealth and corn were to be given away in it.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु दिव्या काचिद्वराङ्गना । बिभ्रती परमं रूपं जगामाथ विहायसा ॥
data.md: Meanwhile a certain celestial damsel, gifted with great beauty, was passing through the skies.

data.v: तस्याः शरीरात्पुष्पाणि पतितानि महीतले । तस्याश्रमस्याविदूरे दिव्यगन्धानि भारत ॥
data.md: From her body as she passed through the sky, some flowers dropped down on the Earth. Those flowers of celestial fragrance fell on spot not far from the hermitage of Ruchi's husband.

data.v: तान्यगृह्णात्ततो राजन्रुचिर्नलिनलोचना । तदा निमन्त्रकस्तस्या अङ्गेभ्यः क्षिप्रमागमत् ॥
data.md: As the flowers lay scattered on the ground, they were picked up by Ruchi of beautiful eyes. Soon after an invitation came to Ruchi from the country of the Angas.

data.v: तस्या हि भगिनी तात ज्येष्ठा नाम्ना प्रभावती । भार्या चित्ररथस्याथ बभूवाङ्गेश्वरस्य वै ॥
data.md: The sister, referred to above, of Ruchi, named Prabhavati was the wife of Chitraratha the king of the Angas.

data.v: पिनह्य तानि पुष्पाणि केशेषु वरवर्णिनी । आमन्त्रिता ततोऽगच्छद्रुचिरङ्गपतेर्गृहान् ॥
data.md: Ruchi, of great beauty, having attached those flowers to her hair, went to the palace of the king of the Angas to answer the invitation she had received,

data.v: पुष्पाणि तानि दृष्ट्वाथ तदाङ्गेन्द्रवराङ्गना । भगिनीं चोदयामास पुष्पार्थे चारुलोचना ॥
data.md: Seeing those flowers on her hair, the queen of the Angas having beautiful eyes, urged her sister to obtain some for her.

data.v: सा भर्त्रे सर्वमाचष्ट रुचिः सुरुचिरानना । भगिन्या भाषितं सर्वमृषिस्तच्चाभ्यनन्दत ॥
data.md: Ruchi of beautiful face, speedily informed her husband of that request of her sister. The Rishi accepted the prayer of his sisterinlaw.

data.v: ततो विपुलमानाय्य देवशर्मा महातपाः । पुष्पार्थे चोदयामास गच्छ गच्छेति भारत ॥
data.md: Summoning Vipula into his presence, Devasharman of severe penances commanded his disciple to bring him some flowers of the same sort, saying Go, go.

data.v: विपुलस्तु गुरोर्वाक्यमविचार्य महातपाः । स तथेत्यब्रवीद्राजंस्तं च देशं जगाम ह ॥
data.md: Accepting unhesitatingly the order of his preceptor, the great ascetic Vipula. O king, answered So be it! and then proceeded to that spot whence the lady Ruchi had picked up the flowers that were wanted by her sister.

data.v: यस्मिन्देशे तु तान्यासन्पतितानि नभस्तलात् । अम्लानान्यपि तत्रासन्कुसुमान्यपराण्यपि ॥
data.md: Arrived at that place where the flowers had fallen from the sky, Vipula saw some others still lying scattered. They were all as fresh as if they had been newly plucked from the plants. None of them had faded away.

data.v: ततः स तानि जग्राह दिव्यानि रुचिराणि च । प्राप्तानि स्वेन तपसा दिव्यगन्धानि भारत ॥
data.md: He took up those exquisitely beautiful celestial flowers. Possessed of celestial fragrance, O Bharata, Vipula got them there as the result of his severe penances.

data.v: संप्राप्य तानि प्रीतात्मा गुरोर्वचनकारकः । ततो जगाम तूर्णं च चम्पां चम्पकमालिनीम् ॥
data.md: The accomplisher of his his preceptor's command, having obtained them, he felt great delight and started quickly for the city of Champa adorned with festoons of Champaka flowers.

data.v: स वने विजने तात ददर्श मिथुनं नृणाम् । चक्रवत्परिवर्तन्तं गृहीत्वा पाणिना करम् ॥
data.md: As he went on, he saw on his way a human couple moving in a circle hand in hand.

data.v: तत्रैकस्तूर्णमगमत्तत्पदे परिवर्तयन् । एकस्तु न तथा राजंश्चक्रतुः कलहं ततः ॥
data.md: One of them made a rapid step and thereby destroyed the cadence of the movement. Therefore, O king, a dispute arose between them.

data.v: त्वं शीघ्रं गच्छसीत्येकोऽब्रवीन्नेति तथापरः । नेति नेति च तौ तात परस्परमथोचतुः ॥
data.md: Indeed, one of them charged the other, saying You have taken a quicker step! The other answered No, Indeed, as each held his own opinion obstinately, each. O king asserted what the other denied, and denied what the other asserted.

data.v: तयोर्विस्पर्धतोरेवं शपथोऽयमभूत्तदा । मनसोद्दिश्य विपुलं ततो वाक्यमथोचतुः ॥
data.md: While thus quarrelling with each other with great assurance, an oath was then heard among them. Indeed, each of them suddenly named Vipula in what they uttered.

data.v: आवयोरनृतं प्राह यस्तस्याथ द्विजस्य वै । विपुलस्य परे लोके या गतिः सा भवेदिति ॥
data.md: Their oath was this That one among us two who speaks falsely, shall, in the next world, meet with the end which will be the twiceborn Vipula's.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु विपुलो विषण्णवदनोऽभवत् । एवं तीव्रतपाश्चाहं कष्टश्चायं परिग्रहः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of theirs, Vipula's face became very sad. He began to commune with himself, I have practised severe penances. The dispute between this couple is hot. To me, again, it is painful. What sin have I committed that both these persons should refer to my end in the next world as the most painful one among those reserved for all creatures?

data.v: मिथुनस्यास्य किं मे स्यात्कृतं पापं यतो गतिः । अनिष्टा सर्वभूतानां कीर्तितानेन मेऽद्य वै ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of theirs, Vipula's face became very sad. He began to commune with himself, I have practised severe penances. The dispute between this couple is hot. To me, again, it is painful. What sin have I committed that both these persons should refer to my end in the next world as the most painful one among those reserved for all creatures?

data.v: एवं संचिन्तयन्नेव विपुलो राजसत्तम । अवाङ्मुखो न्यस्तशिरा दध्यौ दुष्कृतमात्मनः ॥
data.md: Thinking thus, Vipula, O best of kings, hung down his head, and with a dispirited mind began to recollect what sin he had done.

data.v: ततः षडन्यान्पुरुषानक्षैः काञ्चनराजतैः । अपश्यद्दीव्यमानान्वै लोभहर्षान्वितांस्तथा ॥
data.md: Proceeding a little way he saw six other men playing with dice made of gold and silver. Engaged in play, those individuals seerned to him to be so excited that the hairs on their bodies stood erect. They also were heard by Vipula to take the same oath that he had already heard the first couple to take. Indeed, their words had reference in the same way to Vipula.

data.v: कुर्वतः शपथं तं वै यः कृतो मिथुनेन वै । विपुलं वै समुद्दिश्य तेऽपि वाक्यमथाब्रुवन् ॥
यो लोभमास्थायास्माकं विषमं कर्तुमुत्सहेत् । विपुलस्य परे लोके या गतिस्तामवाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: He, amongst us who, led by cupidity, will act in an unfair way, shall meet with that end which is reserved for Vipula in the next world.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु विपुलो नापश्यद्धर्मसंकरम् । जन्मप्रभृति कौरव्य कृतपूर्वमथात्मनः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words, however, Vipula, although he tried earnestly to recollect, could not remember any sin of his from even his earliest years, O you of Kuru's race.

data.v: स प्रदध्यौ तदा राजन्नग्नावग्निरिवाहितः । दह्यमानेन मनसा शापं श्रुत्वा तथाविधम् ॥
data.md: Indeed, he began to burn like a fire placed in the midst of another fire. Hearing that curse, his mind burnt with grief.

data.v: तस्य चिन्तयतस्तात बह्व्यो दिननिशा ययुः । इदमासीन्मनसि च रुच्या रक्षणकारितम् ॥
data.md: In this state of anxiety a long time was passed. At last he recollected the manner in which he had acted in protecting his preceptor's wife from the machinations of Indra.

data.v: लक्षणं लक्षणेनैव वदनं वदनेन च । विधाय न मया चोक्तं सत्यमेतद्गुरोस्तदा ॥
data.md: I had entered the body of that lady, placing limb within limb, face within face. Although I had acted in this way, I did not yet tell my preceptor the truth.

data.v: एतदात्मनि कौरव्य दुष्कृतं विपुलस्तदा । अमन्यत महाभाग तथा तच्च न संशयः ॥
data.md: This was the sin, O you of Kuru's race, which Vipula recollected in himself. Indeed, O blessed king, forsooth, that was the sin which he had actually committed.

data.v: स चम्पां नगरीमेत्य पुष्पाणि गुरवे ददौ । पूजयामास च गुरुं विधिवत्स गुरुप्रियः ॥
data.md: Coming to the city of Champa, he gave the flowers to his preceptor. Devoted to superiors and seniors, he adored his preceptor in due form.

data.v: तमागतमभिप्रेक्ष्य शिष्यं वाक्यमथाब्रवीत् । देवशर्मा महातेजा यत्तच्छृणु नराधिप ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Seeing his disciple returned from his mission, Devasharman of great energy addressed him in words which I shall recite to you, O king.

data.v: किं ते विपुल दृष्टं वै तस्मिन्नद्य महावने । ते त्वा जानन्ति निपुण आत्मा च रुचिरेव च ॥
data.md: Devasharman said What have you seen, O Vipula, in course of your journey. O disciple, through the great forest? Then whom you have seen knew, you, O Vipula. I, as also my wife Ruchi, know how you had acted in the matter of protecting Ruchi.

data.v: ब्रह्मर्षे मिथुनं किं तत्के च ते पुरुषा विभो । ये मां जानन्ति तत्त्वेन तांश्च मे वक्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Vipula said O twiceborn Rishi, who are those two whom I first saw? Who also are those other six whom I saw afterwards? All of them know me. Who indeed, are they to whom you prefer in your speech to me?

data.v: यद्वै तन्मिथुनं ब्रह्मन्नहोरात्रं हि विद्धि तत् । चक्रवत्परिवर्तेत तत्ते जानाति दुष्कृतम् ॥
data.md: Devasharman said The first couple, O twiceborn one, whom you saw, are, Day and Night. They are ceaselessly moving like a circle. Both of them know the sin you have committed.

data.v: ये च ते पुरुषा विप्र अक्षैर्दीव्यन्ति हृष्टवत् । ऋतूंस्तानभिजानीहि ते ते जानन्ति दुष्कृतम् ॥
data.md: Those other men (six in number) whom, O learned Brahmana, you saw playing cheerfully at dice, are the six Seasons. They also are acquainted with your sins.

data.v: न मां कश्चिद्विजानीत इति कृत्वा न विश्वसेत् । नरो रहसि पापात्मा पापकं कर्म वै द्विज ॥
data.md: Having committed a sin secretly, no sinful man should cherish the assuring thought that his sin is known only to himself and not to any one else.

data.v: कुर्वाणं हि नरं कर्म पापं रहसि सर्वदा । पश्यन्ति ऋतवश्चापि तथा दिननिशेऽप्युत ॥
data.md: When a man commits a sinful deed in secret, the Seasons as also Day and Night see it always.

data.v: ते त्वां हर्षस्मितं दृष्ट्वा गुरोः कर्मानिवेदकम् । स्मारयन्तस्तथा प्राहुस्ते यथा श्रुतवान्भवान् ॥
data.md: You did not inform your preceptor of the whole truth, choosing to hide from him a substantial portion. The Seasons, and Day and Night whom you have heard speak thus, thought it proper to remind you of your sin.

data.v: अहोरात्रं विजानाति ऋतवश्चापि नित्यशः । पुरुषे पापकं कर्म शुभं वा शुभकर्मणः ॥
data.md: Day and Night and the Seasons, do know all the good and the bad deeds, that are in a man.

data.v: तत्त्वया मम यत्कर्म व्यभिचाराद्भयात्मकम् । नाख्यातमिति जानन्तस्ते त्वामाहुस्तथा द्विज ॥
data.md: They spoke to you in that way, O twice born one, because they have full knowledge of what you had done but which you had not the courage to inform me of, fearing you had done wrong.

data.v: ते चैव हि भवेयुस्ते लोकाः पापकृतो यथा । कृत्वा नाचक्षतः कर्म मम यच्च त्वया कृतम् ॥
data.md: Those regions that are reserved for the sinful shall be yours. What you had done, you did not tell me. That your sin was not known to any one, was your belief, and this conviction had filled you with joy.

data.v: तथा शक्या च दुर्वृत्ता रक्षितुं प्रमदा द्विज । न च त्वं कृतवान्किंचिदागः प्रीतोऽस्मि तेन ते ॥
data.md: You were fully capable, O twiceborn one, of protecting my wife whose disposition, by nature is sinful. In doing what you did, you did not commit any sin I was for this, pleased with you.

data.v: यदि त्वहं त्वा दुर्वृत्तमद्राक्षं द्विजसत्तम । शपेयं त्वामहं क्रोधान्न मेऽत्रास्ति विचारणा ॥
data.md: O best of Brahmanas, if I had known you to have acted wickedly, I would, without hesitation, have cursed you entirely.

data.v: सज्जन्ति पुरुषे नार्यः पुंसां सोऽर्थश्च पुष्कलः । अन्यथा रक्षतः शापोऽभविष्यत्ते गतिश्च सा ॥
data.md: Women become united with men, Such union, is very desirable with men. You had, however, protected my wife in a different spirit. If you had acted otherwise, I would have cursed. Even this is what I think.

data.v: रक्षिता सा त्वया पुत्र मम चापि निवेदिता । अहं ते प्रीतिमांस्तात स्वस्ति स्वर्गं गमिष्यसि ॥
data.md: You had, O son, protected my wife I have known the manner in which you had done it as if you had yourself informed me of it. I have,O son, become pleased with you. Relieved of all anxiety, you shall go to heaven.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा विपुलं प्रीतो देवशर्मा महानृषिः । मुमोद स्वर्गमास्थाय सहभार्यः सशिष्यकः ॥
data.md: Having said these words to Vipula, the great Rishi Devasharman, ascended to Heaven with his wife and his disciple and began to pass his time there in great happiness.

data.v: इदमाख्यातवांश्चापि ममाख्यानं महामुनिः । मार्कण्डेयः पुरा राजन्गङ्गाकूले कथान्तरे ॥
data.md: In course of conversation, o king, on a former occasion, the great ascetic Markandeya had described to me this history on the banks of Ganga.

data.v: तस्माद्ब्रवीमि पार्थ त्वा स्त्रियः सर्वाः सदैव च । उभयं दृश्यते तासु सततं साध्वसाधु च ॥
data.md: I therefore, recite it to you. Women should always be protected by you. Amongst them both kinds are to be seen, that is those who are virtuous and those who are not so.

data.v: स्त्रियः साध्व्यो महाभागाः संमता लोकमातरः । धारयन्ति महीं राजन्निमां सवनकाननाम् ॥
data.md: The virtuous women are highly blessed. They are the mothers of the universe. They, it is, o king, that keep up the Earth with all her waters and forests.

data.v: असाध्व्यश्चापि दुर्वृत्ताः कुलघ्न्यः पापनिश्चयाः । विज्ञेया लक्षणैर्दुष्टैः स्वगात्रसहजैर्नृप ॥
data.md: Those women who are sinful, who are of wicked conduct, who are the destroyer of their race, and who are wedded to sinful purposes, are capable of being ascertained by marks, expressive of the evil that is in them, which appear, O king, on their persons.

data.v: एवमेतासु रक्षा वै शक्या कर्तुं महात्मभिः । अन्यथा राजशार्दूल न शक्या रक्षितुं स्त्रियः ॥
data.md: It is thus that great persons are capable of protecting women. They cannot, O foremost of kings, be protected in any other way.

data.v: एता हि मनुजव्याघ्र तीक्ष्णास्तीक्ष्णपराक्रमाः । नासामस्ति प्रियो नाम मैथुने संगमे नृभिः ॥
data.md: Women, O king are fierce. They are gifted with fierce prowess. They have none whom they love or like, so much as them that have sexual intercourse with them.

data.v: एताः कृत्याश्च कार्याश्च कृताश्च भरतर्षभ । न चैकस्मिन्रमन्त्येताः पुरुषे पाण्डुनन्दन ॥
data.md: Women are like those (Atharvan) Mantrams which destroy life. Even after they have consented to live with one, they are prepared to leave him joining others. They are never satisfied with one person of the opposite sex, O son of Pandu.

data.v: नासु स्नेहो नृभिः कार्यस्तथैवेर्ष्या जनेश्वर । खेदमास्थाय भुञ्जीत धर्ममास्थाय चैव हि ॥
data.md: Men should not love them, Nor should they cherish any jealousy on account of them, O king! Only for the sake of virtue, men should enjoy their society, not with enthusiasm and attachment but with unwillingness and absence of attachment.

data.v: विहन्येतान्यथा कुर्वन्नरः कौरवनन्दन । सर्वथा राजशार्दूल युक्तिः सर्वत्र पूज्यते ॥
data.md: By acting otherwise a man is sure to meet with destruction, O delighter of the Kurus. O foremost of kings, reason is respected at all times and under all circumstances.

data.v: तेनैकेन तु रक्षा वै विपुलेन कृता स्त्रियाः । नान्यः शक्तो नृलोकेऽस्मिन्रक्षितुं नृप योषितः ॥
data.md: Only one man viz., Vipula, had succeeded in protecting woman. There is none else, o king, in the three worlds who can protect women.

data.v: यन्मूलं सर्वधर्माणां प्रजनस्य गृहस्य च । पितृदेवातिथीनां च तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Tell me of that, O grandfather, which is the root of all duties, which is the root of kinsmen of home, of the departed manes and of guests.

data.v: अयं हि सर्वधर्माणां धर्मश्चिन्त्यतमो मतः । कीदृशाय प्रदेया स्यात्कन्येति वसुधाधिप ॥
data.md: I think this should be considered as the foremost of all duties. Tell me, however, O king, to what sort of a person should one give his daughter.

data.v: शीलवृत्ते समाज्ञाय विद्यां योनिं च कर्म च । अद्भिरेव प्रदातव्या कन्या गुणवते वरे । ब्राह्मणानां सतामेष धर्मो नित्यं युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Having enquired into the conduct and nature of the person, his learning and acquirements, his birth, and his acts, good people should then confer their daughter upon accomplished bridegrooms.

data.v: आवाह्यमावहेदेवं यो दद्यादनुकूलतः । शिष्टानां क्षत्रियाणां च धर्म एष सनातनः ॥
आत्माभिप्रेतमुत्सृज्य कन्याभिप्रेत एव यः । अभिप्रेता च या यस्य तस्मै देया युधिष्ठिर । गान्धर्वमिति तं धर्मं प्राहुर्धर्मविदो जनाः ॥
data.md: When the father of the girl, without consulting his wishes, confers his own daughter upon a person whom the daughter likes and who reciprocates the girl's sentiments, the form of marriage, O Yudhishthira, is called Gandharva by those versed in the Vedas.

data.v: धनेन बहुना क्रीत्वा संप्रलोभ्य च बान्धवान् । असुराणां नृपैतं वै धर्ममाहुर्मनीषिणः ॥
data.md: The wise have declared, O king, to be the practice of the Asuras, viz., marrying a girl after buying her at a high cost and after gratifying the cupidity of her kinsmen.

data.v: हत्वा छित्त्वा च शीर्षाणि रुदतां रुदतीं गृहात् । प्रसह्य हरणं तात राक्षसं धर्मलक्षणम् ॥
data.md: Killing and chopping off the heads of weeping kinsmen, the bridegroom sometimes forcibly takes away the girl he marries. Such marriage, O son, passes by the name of Rakshasa.

data.v: पञ्चानां तु त्रयो धर्म्या द्वावधर्म्यौ युधिष्ठिर । पैशाच आसुरश्चैव न कर्तव्यौ कथंचन ॥
data.md: Of these five, (viz., the Brahma, the Kshatra, the Gandharva, the Asura, and the Rakshasa), three are righteous, O Yudhishthira, and two are unrighteous, The Paishacha and the Asura forms should, never be followed.

data.v: ब्राह्मः क्षात्रोऽथ गान्धर्व एते धर्म्या नरर्षभ । पृथग्वा यदि वा मिश्राः कर्तव्या नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: The Brahma, Kshatra, and Gandharva forms are righteous, O prince of men! Pure or mixed, these forms should forsooth be followed.

data.v: तिस्रो भार्या ब्राह्मणस्य द्वे भार्ये क्षत्रियस्य तु । वैश्यः स्वजातिं विन्देत तास्वपत्यं समं भवेत् ॥
data.md: The Brahmana can take three wives. The Kshatriya can take two wives. The Vaishya should take a wife from only his own caste. The children born of these wives should all be considered as equal.

data.v: ब्राह्मणी तु भवेज्ज्येष्ठा क्षत्रिया क्षत्रियस्य तु । रत्यर्थमपि शूद्रा स्यान्नेत्याहुरपरे जनाः ॥
data.md: Of the three wives of a Brahmana. She taken from his own caste should be considered as the foremost. Likewise, of the two wives permitted to the Kshatriya, she taken from his own caste should be considered as superior. Some say that persons belonging to the three higher castes may take, only for purposes of enjoyment, wives from the lowest or the Shudra caste. Others, however, forbid the practice.

data.v: अपत्यजन्म शूद्रायां न प्रशंसन्ति साधवः । शूद्रायां जनयन्विप्रः प्रायश्चित्ती विधीयते ॥
data.md: The righteous condemn the practice of begetting children upon Shudra women. A Brahmana, by begetting children upon a Shudra women, becomes subject to the liability of performing an expiation.

data.v: त्रिंशद्वर्षो दशवर्षां भार्यां विन्देत नग्निकाम् । एकविंशतिवर्षो वा सप्तवर्षामवाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: A person of thirty years of age should marry a girl of ten years of age wearing a single piece of cloth. Or, a person of one and twenty years of age should marry a girl of seven years of age.

data.v: यस्यास्तु न भवेद्भ्राता पिता वा भरतर्षभ । नोपयच्छेत तां जातु पुत्रिकाधर्मिणी हि सा ॥
data.md: That girl who has no brother nor father should not be married, O chief of Bharata's race, For she may be intended for giving birth to the heir of her father.

data.v: त्रीणि वर्षाण्युदीक्षेत कन्या ऋतुमती सती । चतुर्थे त्वथ संप्राप्ते स्वयं भर्तारमर्जयेत् ॥
data.md: After puberty, it in, the girl (if not married) should wait for three years. On the fourth year, she should look for a husband herself.

data.v: प्रजनो हीयते तस्या रतिश्च भरतर्षभ । अतोऽन्यथा वर्तमाना भवेद्वाच्या प्रजापतेः ॥
data.md: The children of such a girl do not lose their respectability, nor does union with such a girl become disgraceful. If, instead of selecting a husband for herself, she acts otherwise, she gets the reproach of Prajapati herself.

data.v: असपिण्डा च या मातुरसगोत्रा च या पितुः । इत्येतामनुगच्छेत तं धर्मं मनुरब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: One should marry that girl who is not a Sapinda of his mother or of the same family with his father. This is the usage which Manu has declared.

data.v: शुल्कमन्येन दत्तं स्याद्ददानीत्याह चापरः । बलादन्यः प्रभाषेत धनमन्यः प्रदर्शयेत् ॥
पाणिग्रहीता त्वन्यः स्यात्कस्य कन्या पितामह । तत्त्वं जिज्ञासमानानां चक्षुर्भवतु नो भवान् ॥
यत्किंचित्कर्म मानुष्यं संस्थानाय प्रकृष्यते । मन्त्रवन्मन्त्रितं तस्य मृषावादस्तु पातकः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The deeds of men approved by the wise, are seen to yield good. False speech, however, is always sinful.

data.v: भार्यापत्यृत्विगाचार्याः शिष्योपाध्याय एव च । मृषोक्ते दण्डमर्हन्ति नेत्याहुरपरे जनाः ॥
data.md: The girl herself who becomes wife, the sons born of her, the Ritvijas and preceptors and disciples and Upadhyayas present at the marriage all become liable to expiation if the girl gives her hand to a person other than he whom she had promised to marry. Some are of opinion that no expiation is necessary for such conduct.

data.v: न ह्यकामेन संवादं मनुरेवं प्रशंसति । अयशस्यमधर्म्यं च यन्मृषा धर्मकोपनम् ॥
data.md: Manu does not speak highly of the practice of a girl living with a person whom she does not like. Living as wife with a person whom she does not like, produces disgrace and sin. No one commits sin in any of the following cases.

data.v: नैकान्तदोष एकस्मिंस्तद्दानं नोपलभ्यते । धर्मतो यां प्रयच्छन्ति यां च क्रीणन्ति भारत ॥
data.md: In forcibly carrying away for marriage a girl that is bestowed upon the abductor by the girl's relatives with due rites, as also a girl for whom dower has been paid and accepted, there is no great sin.

data.v: बन्धुभिः समनुज्ञातो मन्त्रहोमौ प्रयोजयेत् । तथा सिध्यन्ति ते मन्त्रा नादत्तायाः कथंचन ॥
data.md: Upon the girl's kinsmen having given their consent, Mantras and Homa should be restored to. Such Mantras truly accomplish their purpose. Mantras and Homa recited and performed in the case of a girl who has not been given away by her kinsmen, do not accomplish their purpose.

data.v: यस्त्वत्र मन्त्रसमयो भार्यापत्योर्मिथः कृतः । तमेवाहुर्गरीयांसं यश्चासौ ज्ञातिभिः कृतः ॥
data.md: The engagement made by the relatives of a girl is, no doubt, binding and sacred. But the engagement that is made by the bride and bridegroom, with the help of Mantras, is very much, more so.

data.v: देवदत्तां पतिर्भार्यां वेत्ति धर्मस्य शासनात् । सा दैवीं मानुषीं वाचमनृतां पर्युदस्यति ॥
data.md: According to the injunctions of the scriptures, the husband should regard his wife as an acquisition due to his own pristine deeds or to what has been ordained by God. One, therefore, commits no sin by accepting for wife a girl who had been promised to another by her kinsmen or for whom dower had been accepted by them from another.

data.v: कन्यायां प्राप्तशुल्कायां ज्यायांश्चेदाव्रजेद्वरः । धर्मकामार्थसंपन्नो वाच्यमत्रानृतं न वा ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said When after the receipt of dower for a girl, the girl's father more eligible sees a bridegroom,-one, who is endued with the threefold objects, does the girl's father commit sin by rejecting the person from whom dower had been received in favour of him who is more eligible?

data.v: तस्मिन्नुभयतो दोषे कुर्वञ्छ्रेयः समाचरेत् । अयं नः सर्वधर्माणां धर्मश्चिन्त्यतमो मतः ॥
data.md: In such a case either alternative appears to be sinful, for to discard the person to whom the girl has been promised can never be honorable, while to reject the person who is more eligible can never be good. I ask, how should the father act so that he might be said to do that which is beneficial? To us, of all duties this seems to deserve utmost deliberation.

data.v: तत्त्वं जिज्ञासमानानां चक्षुर्भवतु नो भवान् । तदेतत्सर्वमाचक्ष्व न हि तृप्यामि कथ्यताम् ॥
data.md: We are desirous of determining the truth. You, indeed, are our eyes. Do you explain this to us. I am never satiated vith listening to you.

data.v: न वै निष्ठाकरं शुल्कं ज्ञात्वासीत्तेन नाहृतम् । न हि शुल्कपराः सन्तः कन्यां ददति कर्हिचित् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The gift of the dower does not make the girl wife. This is wellknown to the person paying it. He pays it simply as the price of the girl . Then again the good never bestow their daughters, induced by the dowers that others may offer.

data.v: अन्यैर्गुणैरुपेतं तु शुल्कं याचन्ति बान्धवाः । अलंकृत्वा वहस्वेति यो दद्यादनुकूलतः ॥
data.md: When the person desirous of marrying happens to be gifted with such qualities as do not go down with the girl's kinsmen, it is then that kinsmen demand dower from him. The person, however, who won over by another's accomplishments, says,—Do you marry my girl, adorning her with proper ornaments of gold and gems,—and that person who satisfies this request, cannot be said to demand dower or give it, for such a transaction is not a sale. The bestowal of a daughter upon acceptance of what may properly be considered as gifts is the eternal practice.

data.v: तच्च तां च ददात्येव न शुल्कं विक्रयो न सः । प्रतिगृह्य भवेद्देयमेष धर्मः सनातनः ॥
दास्यामि भवते कन्यामिति पूर्वं नभाषितम् । ये चैवाहुर्ये च नाहुर्ये चावश्यं वदन्त्युत ॥
data.md: In matters of marriage, some fathers say-I shall bestow my daughter upon such and such a person; some say-~-I shall not bestow my daughter upon such a one:—Some, again, say forcibly—I must bestow my daughter upon such an individual.

data.v: तस्मादा ग्रहणात्पाणेर्याचयन्ति परस्परम् । कन्यावरः पुरा दत्तो मरुद्भिरिति नः श्रुतम् ॥
data.md: These declarations are not tantamount to actual marriage. People are seen to solicit one another for the hands of maidens. Till the hand is actually taken with due rites, marriage does not happen. We have heard that even this was the boon granted to men formerly by the Maruts about maidens.

data.v: नानिष्टाय प्रदातव्या कन्या इत्यृषिचोदितम् । तन्मूलं काममूलस्य प्रजनस्येति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: The Rishis have laid the command upon all men that maidens should never be bestowed upon persons unless the father are eligible. The daughter is the root of desire and of descendants of the collateral line. This is what I think.

data.v: समीक्ष्य च बहून्दोषान्संवासाद्विद्विषाणयोः । यथा निष्ठाकरं शुल्कं न जात्वासीत्तथा शृणु ॥
data.md: The practice of sale and purchase of the daughter, has been known to human beings for a long time. On account of such familiarity with the practice, you may be able, upon careful examination, to find innumerable faults in it. The gift or acceptance of dower alone could not be considered as creating the relation of husband and wife. Listen to what I say on this head.

data.v: अहं विचित्रवीर्याय द्वे कन्ये समुदावहम् । जित्वा च मागधान्सर्वान्काशीनथ च कोसलान् । गृहीतपाणिरेकासीत्प्राप्तशुल्कापराभवत् ॥
data.md: was Formerly, having defeated all the Magadhas, the Kashis, and the Koshalas, I bought away by force two maidens for Vichitravirya.

data.v: पाणौ गृहीता तत्रैव विसृज्या इति मे पिता । अब्रवीदितरां कन्यामावहत्स तु कौरवः ॥
अप्यन्यामनुपप्रच्छ शङ्कमानः पितुर्वचः । अतीव ह्यस्य धर्मेप्सा पितुर्मेऽभ्यधिकाभवत् ॥
ततोऽहमब्रुवं राजन्नाचारेप्सुरिदं वचः । आचारं तत्त्वतो वेत्तुमिच्छामीति पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: I then went to my father himself, O king, and addressed him these words from desire of Knowing something about the practices of pious people in respect of marriage: I wish, O sire, to know what in truth the practices are of righteous people! I repeatedly expressed my wish. Such was my eagerness and curiosity, that I expressed my desire several times.

data.v: ततो मयैवमुक्ते तु वाक्ये धर्मभृतां वरः । पिता मम महाराज बाह्लीको वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: After I had uttered those words that foremost of pious men, viz., my father Balhika, answered me, saying-If in your opinion the relation of husband and wife belongs to the gift and acceptance of dower and not to the actual taking of the maiden's hand with due rites, the father of the maiden would show himself to be the follower of a creed other than that which comes from the ordinary scriptures. This is what the accepted scriptures say.

data.v: यदि वः शुल्कतो निष्ठा न पाणिग्रहणं तथा । लाजान्तरमुपासीत प्राप्तशुल्का पतिं वृतम् ॥
न हि धर्मविदः प्राहुः प्रमाणं वाक्यतः स्मृतम् । येषां वै शुल्कतो निष्ठा न पाणिग्रहणात्तथा ॥
data.md: Persons conversant with morality and duty do not hold that their words are at all authoritative who say that the relation of husband and wife arises from the gift and acceptance of dower, and not from the actual taking of the hand with due rites.

data.v: प्रसिद्धं भाषितं दाने तेषां प्रत्यसनं पुनः । ये मन्यन्ते क्रयं शुल्कं न ते धर्मविदो जनाः ॥
data.md: The saying is well known that the relation of husband and wife is created by actual bestowal of the daughter by the father. The relation of wife is not formed through sale and purchase. They who consider such status to be due to sale and the gift of dower are persons who are certainly unacquainted with the scriptures.

data.v: न चैतेभ्यः प्रदातव्या न वोढव्या तथाविधा । न ह्येव भार्या क्रेतव्या न विक्रेया कथंचन ॥
data.md: No one should bestow his daughter upon such persons. In fact, they are not men with whom one may marry his daughter. A wife should never be purchased. Nor should a father sell his daughter.

data.v: ये च क्रीणन्ति दासीवद्ये च विक्रीणते जनाः । भवेत्तेषां तथा निष्ठा लुब्धानां पापचेतसाम् ॥
data.md: Only those sinful persons who possessed besides, by cupidity, and who sell and purchase female slaves for making them servants, consider the relation of wife as capable of originating from the gift and acceptance of dower.

data.v: अस्मिन्धर्मे सत्यवन्तं पर्यपृच्छन्त वै जनाः । कन्यायाः प्राप्तशुल्कायाः शुल्कदः प्रशमं गतः ॥
data.md: On this subject some people on one occasion had asked prince Satyavat the are following question-If the giver of a dower to the kinsmen of a maiden happens to die before marriage, can another person take the hand of that maiden in marriage? We have doubts on this matter. Do you remove these doubts of ours for you are gifted with great wisdom and are honoured by the wise.

data.v: पाणिग्रहीता चान्यः स्यादत्र नो धर्मसंशयः । तन्नश्छिन्धि महाप्राज्ञ त्वं हि वै प्राज्ञसंमतः । तत्त्वं जिज्ञासमानानां चक्षुर्भवतु नो भवान् ॥
तानेवं ब्रुवतः सर्वान्सत्यवान्वाक्यमब्रवीत् । यत्रेष्टं तत्र देया स्यान्नात्र कार्या विचारणा । कुर्वते जीवतोऽप्येवं मृते नैवास्ति संशयः ॥
data.md: ghaflat citantsura ya taifat HyrT:114 811 Be you the eyes to ourselves who are desirous of learning the truth.—Prince Satyavat answered, saying,-The kinsmen of the maiden should bestow her upon him whom they consider proper. There need be no scruples in this. The righteous act thus without caring for the giver of the dower even if he be alive! while, about the giver who is dead, there is not the slightest doubt.

data.v: देवरं प्रविशेत्कन्या तप्येद्वापि महत्तपः । तमेवानुव्रता भूत्वा पाणिग्राहस्य नाम सा ॥
data.md: Some say that the virgin wife or widow, whose, marriage has not been consummated with her husband by actual sexual intercourse on account of his absence or death-may be allowed to unite herself with her husband's younger brother or such other relation. The husband dying before such consummation, the virginwidow may either surrender herself to her husband's younger brother or practise penances.

data.v: लिखन्त्येव तु केषांचिदपरेषां शनैरपि । इति ये संवदन्त्यत्र त एतं निश्चयं विदुः ॥
data.md: In the opinion of some, the younger brother of the husband or such other relation may thus use the virgin wife or widow, though others hold that such practice, though it is frequent, originates from desire instead of being a scriptural ordinance. They who say so are clearly of opinion that the father of a maiden has the right to bestow her upon any eligible person, disregarding the dower previously given by another and accepted by himself. one

data.v: तत्पाणिग्रहणात्पूर्वमुत्तरं यत्र वर्तते । सर्वमङ्गलमन्त्रं वै मृषावादस्तु पातकः ॥
data.md: If after the hand of a maiden has been promised all the initial rites before marriage be performed, the maiden may still be given to a person other than the one to whom she had been promised. Only the giver commits the sin of falsehood; so far, however, as the relation of wife is concerned, no injury can occur thereto.

data.v: पाणिग्रहणमन्त्राणां निष्ठा स्यात्सप्तमे पदे । पाणिग्राहस्य भार्या स्याद्यस्य चाद्भिः प्रदीयते ॥
data.md: The Mantras of marriage accomplish their object of bringing about the indissoluble union of marriage at the seventh step. The maiden becomes the wife of him to whom the gift is actually made with water.

data.v: अनुकूलामनुवंशां भ्रात्रा दत्तामुपाग्निकाम् । परिक्रम्य यथान्यायं भार्यां विन्देद्द्विजोत्तमः ॥
data.md: The gift of maidens should be made in the following way. The wise know it forsooth. A superior Brahmana should marry a maiden who is not unwilling, who belongs to a family equal to his own in purity or dignity, and who is given away by her brother. Such a girl should be married in the presence of fire, with due rites, causing her, amongst other things, to go round the bridegroom for the usual number of times.

data.v: कन्यायाः प्राप्तशुल्कायाः पतिश्चेन्नास्ति कश्चन । तत्र का प्रतिपत्तिः स्यात्तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said If a person, after having given dower for a maiden, goes away, how should the maiden's father or other kinsmen who can bestow her, act? Do tell me this, O grandfather?

data.v: यापुत्रकस्याप्यरिक्थस्य प्रतिपत्सा तदा भवेत् ॥
अथ चेत्साहरेच्छुल्कं क्रीता शुल्कप्रदस्य सा । तस्यार्थेऽपत्यमीहेत येन न्यायेन शक्नुयात् ॥
न तस्या मन्त्रवत्कार्यं कश्चित्कुर्वीत किंचन ॥
स्वयं वृतेति सावित्री पित्रा वै प्रत्यपद्यत । तत्तस्यान्ये प्रशंसन्ति धर्मज्ञा नेतरे जनाः ॥
data.md: Commanded by her father, the princess Savitri had in days of old chosen a husband and united herself with him. This act of hers is praised by some; but others, conversant with the scriptures, condemn it'.

data.v: एतत्तु नापरे चक्रुर्न परे जातु साधवः । साधूनां पुनराचारो गरीयो धर्मलक्षणम् ॥
data.md: Others who are righteous have not acted thus. Others maintain that the conduct of the righteous should ever be considered as the foremost evidence of duty or morality.

data.v: अस्मिन्नेव प्रकरणे सुक्रतुर्वाक्यमब्रवीत् । नप्ता विदेहराजस्य जनकस्य महात्मनः ॥
data.md: Upon this subject, Sukratu, the grand son of the great Janaka, the king of the Videhas, has declared the following opinion.

data.v: असदाचरिते मार्गे कथं स्यादनुकीर्तनम् । अनुप्रश्नः संशयो वा सतामेतदुपालभेत् ॥
data.md: There is the wellknown injunction of the scriptures that women can enjoy freedom at any period of their life. If this were not the path of the virtuous, how could this scriptural saying exist? As regards the pious, therefore, how can there be any question or doubt about it? How can people condemn that saying by choosing to conduct themselves otherwise?

data.v: असदेव हि धर्मस्य प्रमादो धर्म आसुरः । नानुशुश्रुम जात्वेतामिमां पूर्वेषु जन्मसु ॥
data.md: The impious violation of eternal practice is considered as the practice of the Asuras. We never hear of such practice in the conduct of the ancients.

data.v: भार्यापत्योर्हि संबन्धः स्त्रीपुंसोस्तुल्य एव सः । रतिः साधारणो धर्म इति चाह स पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: The relationship of husband and wife is very subtile. It is different from the natural relationship of male and female which consists only in the desire for sexual intercourse. This also was said by ihe king of Janaka's race.

data.v: अथ केन प्रमाणेन पुंसामादीयते धनम् । पुत्रवद्धि पितुस्तस्य कन्या भवितुमर्हति ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Under what authority is the property of men inherited (by others when they happen to have daughters)? As for her father the daughter should be considered the same as the son.

data.v: यथैवात्मा तथा पुत्रः पुत्रेण दुहिता समा । तस्यामात्मनि तिष्ठन्त्यां कथमन्यो धनं हरेत् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The son is even as one's own self, and the daughter is like the son. How, therefore, can another take the riches when one lives in his ownself in the form of his daughter?

data.v: मातुश्च यौतकं यत्स्यात्कुमारीभाग एव सः । दौहित्र एव वा रिक्थमपुत्रस्य पितुर्हरेत् ॥
data.md: Whatever is the own property of the mother, is due to the maiden daughter. If the maternal grandfather happens to die without leaving sons, the daughter's son should inherit it.

data.v: ददाति हि स पिण्डं वै पितुर्मातामहस्य च । पुत्रदौहित्रयोर्नेह विशेषो धर्मतः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: The daughter's son offers funeral cakes to his own father and the father of his mother. Hence, for the ends of justice, there is no difference between the son and their daughte son.

data.v: अन्यत्र जातया सा हि प्रजया पुत्र ईहते । दुहितान्यत्र जातेन पुत्रेणापि विशिष्यते ॥
data.md: When a person has got only a daughter and she has been invested by him with the position of a son, if he then happens to have a son, such son shares the inheritance with the daughter. When, again, a person has got a daughter and she has been invested by him with the position of a son, if he then happens to take a son by adoption or purchase, then the daughter is considered superior to such son.

data.v: दौहित्रकेण धर्मेण नात्र पश्यामि कारणम् । विक्रीतासु च ये पुत्रा भवन्ति पितुरेव ते ॥
data.md: In the following case I do not see any reason why the daughter's son should be considered as the proper heir. The case is that of the daughter who has been sold by her father. The sons born of a daughter who has been sold by her sire for actual price, belong exclusively to their father. Such sons can never belong, even as daughter's sons, to their maternal grandfather on account of his having sold their mother for price and lost all his rights in or to her by that deed.

data.v: असूयवस्त्वधर्मिष्ठाः परस्वादायिनः शठाः । आसुरादधिसंभूता धर्माद्विषमवृत्तयः ॥
data.md: Such sons, again, become full of malice, impious in conduct, the misappropriators of other people's riches, and full of deceit and cunning. Having originated from that sinful form of marriage called Asura, the offspring becomes wicked in conduct.

data.v: अत्र गाथा यमोद्गीताः कीर्तयन्ति पुराविदः । धर्मज्ञा धर्मशास्त्रेषु निबद्धा धर्मसेतुषु ॥
data.md: Persons acquainted with ancient history, conversant with duties, devoted to the scriptures and firm in maintaining the restrictions therein laid down, recite in this connection some verses sung in days of yore by Yama.

data.v: यो मनुष्यः स्वकं पुत्रं विक्रीय धनमिच्छति । कन्यां वा जीवितार्थाय यः शुल्केन प्रयच्छति ॥
data.md: That man who acquires riches by selling his own son, or who bestows his daughter after accepting a dower for his own livelihood, has to sink in seven dreadful hells one after another, known by the name of Kalas. There that wretch has to feed upon sweat and urine and stools during that period.

data.v: सप्तावरे महाघोरे निरये कालसाह्वये । स्वेदं मूत्रं पुरीषं च तस्मिन्प्रेत उपाश्नुते ॥
आर्षे गोमिथुनं शुल्कं केचिदाहुर्मृषैव तत् । अल्पं वा बहु वा राजन्विक्रयस्तावदेव सः ॥
data.md: In that form of marriage which is called Arsha, the person who marries has to give a bull and a cow and the father of the maiden accepts the gift. Some characterise this gift as a dower (or price), while some are of opinion that it should not be considered in that light. The true opinion, however, is that a gift for such a purpose, be it of small value or large, should, O king, be considered as dower or price, and the bestowal of the daughter under such circumstances should be considered as a sale.

data.v: यद्यप्याचरितः कैश्चिन्नैष धर्मः कथंचन । अन्येषामपि दृश्यन्ते लोभतः संप्रवृत्तयः ॥
data.md: Despite the fact of its having been practised by a few persons it can never be taken as the eternal practice. Other forms of marriage are seen, practiced by men, such as marrying girls after carrying them away by force from amidst their kinsmen.

data.v: वश्यां कुमारीं विहितां ये च तामुपभुञ्जते । एते पापस्य कर्तारस्तमस्यन्धेऽथ शेरते ॥
data.md: Those persons who have sexual intercourse with a maiden, by force are considered as perpetrators of sin. They have to sink in darkest hell.

data.v: अन्योऽप्यथ न विक्रेयो मनुष्यः किं पुनः प्रजाः । अधर्ममूलैर्हि धनैर्न तैरर्थोऽस्ति कश्चन ॥
data.md: Even a human being who is not a relation of blood should not be sold. What need then be said of one's own child? With the riches that is acquired by doing sinful deeds, no meritorious deed can be performed.

data.v: प्राचेतसस्य वचनं कीर्तयन्ति पुराविदः । यस्याः किंचिन्नाददते ज्ञातयो न स विक्रयः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said They who know the ancient history recite the following verse of Daksha the son of Prachetas, viz.,-That maiden, for whom nothing is taken by her kinsmen in the form of dower, cannot be said to be sold.

data.v: अर्हणं तत्कुमारीणामानृशंस्यतमं च तत् । सर्वं च प्रतिदेयं स्यात्कन्यायै तदशेषतः ॥
data.md: Honour good treatment, and everything else which is agreeable, should all be given to the maiden whose hand is taken in marriage.

data.v: पितृभिर्भ्रातृभिश्चैव श्वशुरैरथ देवरैः । पूज्या लालयितव्याश्च बहुकल्याणमीप्सुभिः ॥
data.md: Her father and brothers and fatherinlaw and husband's brothers should show her every respect and adorn her with ornaments, if they be desirous of reaping benefits, for such conduct their part always produces considerable happiness and advantage.

data.v: यदि वै स्त्री न रोचेत पुमांसं न प्रमोदयेत् । अमोदनात्पुनः पुंसः प्रजनं न प्रवर्धते ॥
data.md: If the wife does not like her husband or fails to please him, from such dislike and absence of joy, the husband can never have children for increasing his family.

data.v: पूज्या लालयितव्याश्च स्त्रियो नित्यं जनाधिप । अपूजिताश्च यत्रैताः सर्वास्तत्राफलाः क्रियाः । तदैव तत्कुलं नास्ति यदा शोचन्ति जामयः ॥
data.md: There where women are not adored, all acts become fruitless. If the women of a family, on account of the treatment they receive, indulge in grief and tears, that family soon becomes extinct.

data.v: जामीशप्तानि गेहानि निकृत्तानीव कृत्यया । नैव भान्ति न वर्धन्ते श्रिया हीनानि पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Those houses which are cursed by women meet with destruction and ruin as if scorched by some Atharvan rite. Such houses lose their splendour. Their growth and prosperity cease, O king.

data.v: स्त्रियः पुंसां परिददे मनुर्जिगमिषुर्दिवम् । अबलाः स्वल्पकौपीनाः सुहृदः सत्यजिष्णवः ॥
data.md: Manu, on the eve of his departure from this world, made over women to the care and protection of men, saying that they are weak, that they fall an easy prey to the seduction of men, disposed to accept the love which is offered them, and devoted to truth.

data.v: ईर्ष्यवो मानकामाश्च चण्डा असुहृदोऽबुधाः । स्त्रियो माननमर्हन्ति ता मानयत मानवाः ॥
data.md: There are others among them who are full of malice, covetous of honours, fierce in nature, unlovable, and impervious to reason. Women, however, deserve to be respected. Do ye men show them honour.

data.v: स्त्रीप्रत्ययो हि वो धर्मो रतिभोगाश्च केवलाः । परिचर्यान्नसंस्कारास्तदायत्ता भवन्तु वः ॥
data.md: The virtue of men depends upon women. All pleasures and enjoyments also entirely depend upon them. Do you serve them and adore them. Do ye bend your wills before them.

data.v: उत्पादनमपत्यस्य जातस्य परिपालनम् । प्रीत्यर्थं लोकयात्रा च पश्यत स्त्रीनिबन्धनम् ॥
data.md: The begetting of children, the nursing of children already born, and the accomplishment of all deeds necessary for the needs of society, see, all these have women for their cause.

data.v: संमान्यमानाश्चैताभिः सर्वकार्याण्यवाप्स्यथ । विदेहराजदुहिता चात्र श्लोकमगायत ॥
data.md: By respecting women, you are sure to acquire the fruition of all objects. Regarding it a princess of the house of Janaka the king of

data.v: नास्ति यज्ञः स्त्रियः कश्चिन्न श्राद्धं नोपवासकम् । धर्मस्तु भर्तृशुश्रूषा तया स्वर्गं जयत्युत ॥
data.md: Women have no sacrifices ordained for them. There are no Shraddhas which they are called upon to perform. They are not required to observe any fasts. To serve their husbands wish respect and willing obedience from their only duty. Through the satisfaction of that duty they succeed in conquering Heaven.

data.v: पिता रक्षति कौमारे भर्ता रक्षति यौवने । पुत्रास्तु स्थविरीभावे न स्त्री स्वातन्त्र्यमर्हति ॥
data.md: In childhood, the father protects her. The husband protects her in youth. When she becomes old, her sons protect her. At no period of her life is woman free.

data.v: श्रिय एताः स्त्रियो नाम सत्कार्या भूतिमिच्छता । लालिता निगृहीता च स्त्री श्रीर्भवति भारत ॥
data.md: Women are deities of prosperity. The person that desires affluence and prosperity should honour them. By cherishing women, O Bharata, one cherishes the goddess of prosperity herself, and by afflicting her, one is said to pain the goddess of prosperity.

data.v: सर्वशास्त्रविधानज्ञ राजधर्मार्थवित्तम । अतीव संशयच्छेत्ता भवान्वै प्रथितः क्षितौ ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You know fully well the ordinances of all the scriptures. You are the foremost of those who are acquainted with the duties of kings. You are celebrated over the whole world as a great remover of doubts.

data.v: कश्चित्तु संशयो मेऽस्ति तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह । अस्यामापदि कष्टायामन्यं पृच्छाम कं वयम् ॥
data.md: I have a doubt, do you explain it to me, O grandfather. As regards this doubt that has originated in my mind, I shall not ask any other person for its solution.

data.v: यथा नरेण कर्तव्यं यश्च धर्मः सनातनः । एतत्सर्वं महाबाहो भवान्व्याख्यातुमर्हति ॥
data.md: You should, O you of mighty arms, expound as to how a man should act who is desirous of treading along the path of duty and virtue.

data.v: चतस्रो विहिता भार्या ब्राह्मणस्य पितामह । ब्राह्मणी क्षत्रिया वैश्या शूद्रा च रतिमिच्छतः ॥
data.md: It has been laid down, O grandfather that a Brahmana can take four wives, viz., one who belongs to his own caste, one who is a Kshatriya, one who is a Vaishya, and one who is a Shudra, if the Brahmana wishes to satisfy the desire of sexual intercourse.

data.v: तत्र जातेषु पुत्रेषु सर्वासां कुरुसत्तम । आनुपूर्व्येण कस्तेषां पित्र्यं दायाद्यमर्हति ॥
data.md: Tell me, O best of the Kurus, which amongst those sons should inherit the father's riches one after another.

data.v: केन वा किं ततो हार्यं पितृवित्तात्पितामह । एतदिच्छामि कथितं विभागस्तेषु यः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Who amongst them, O grandfather shall take what share of the paternal wealth? I wish to hear this, viz., how the distribution has been ordained amongst them of the paternal property.

data.v: ब्राह्मणः क्षत्रियो वैश्यस्त्रयो वर्णा द्विजातयः । एतेषु विहितो धर्मो ब्राह्मणस्य युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The Brahman, the Kshatriya, and the Vaishya are considered the three twiceborn castes, To marry in these three castes has been ordained to be the duty of the Brahmana, O Yudhishthira.

data.v: वैषम्यादथ वा लोभात्कामाद्वापि परंतप । ब्राह्मणस्य भवेच्छूद्रा न तु दृष्टान्ततः स्मृता ॥
data.md: Through erroneous judgement or cupidity or lust, O destroyer of enemies, a Brahmana takes a Shudra wife. He is not competent to take, according to the scriptures, such wife.

data.v: शूद्रां शयनमारोप्य ब्राह्मणः पीडितो भवेत् । प्रायश्चित्तीयते चापि विधिदृष्टेन हेतुना ॥
data.md: A Brahmana, by knowing a Shudra woman comes by a low end in the next world. He should, having done such an act, perform expiation according to the rites laid down in the scriptures.

data.v: तत्र जातेष्वपत्येषु द्विगुणं स्याद्युधिष्ठिर । अतस्ते नियमं वित्ते संप्रवक्ष्यामि भारत ॥
data.md: That expiation must be twice heavier or severer if on account of such an act, O Yudhishthira, the, Brahmana gets children. I shall now tell you, O Bharata, how the (paternal), wealth is to be distributed.

data.v: लक्षण्यो गोवृषो यानं यत्प्रधानतमं भवेत् । ब्राह्मण्यास्तद्धरेत्पुत्र एकांशं वै पितुर्धनात् ॥
data.md: The son born of the Brahmani wife shall, in the first place, appropriate from his father's wealth a bull of good marks, and the best car or vehicle.

data.v: शेषं तु दशधा कार्यं ब्राह्मणस्वं युधिष्ठिर । तत्र तेनैव हर्तव्याश्चत्वारोंऽशाः पितुर्धनात् ॥
data.md: What remains of the Brahmana's property, O Yudhishthira, after this, should be divided into ten equal parts, The son by the Brahmani wife shall take four of such parts of the paternal property.

data.v: क्षत्रियायास्तु यः पुत्रो ब्राह्मणः सोऽप्यसंशयः । स तु मातृविशेषेण त्रीनंशान्हर्तुमर्हति ॥
data.md: The son that is born of the Kshatriya wife is, forsooth, possessed of the status of a Brahmana. On account, however, of the distinction attaching to his mother, he shall take three of the ten shares into which the property has been divided.
