And he yoked his wife thereto on the left and his own self on the right, And the king placed on the chariot, among its other articles, the goad which had three handles and which had a point hard as adamant and sharp as the needle.

data.v: त्रिदंष्ट्रं वज्रसूच्यग्रं प्रतोदं तत्र चादधत् । सर्वमेतत्ततो दत्त्वा नृपो वाक्यमथाब्रवीत् ॥
भगवन्क्व रथो यातु ब्रवीतु भृगुनन्दनः । यत्र वक्ष्यसि विप्रर्षे तत्र यास्यति ते रथः ॥
एवमुक्तस्तु भगवान्प्रत्युवाचाथ तं नृपम् । इतःप्रभृति यातव्यं पदकं पदकं शनैः ॥
श्रमो मम यथा न स्यात्तथा मे छन्दचारिणौ । सुखं चैवास्मि वोढव्यो जनः सर्वश्च पश्यतु ॥
नोत्सार्यः पथिकः कश्चित्तेभ्यो दास्याम्यहं वसु । ब्राह्मणेभ्यश्च ये कामानर्थयिष्यन्ति मां पथि ॥
सर्वं दास्याम्यशेषेण धनं रत्नानि चैव हि । क्रियतां निखिलेनैतन्मा विचारय पार्थिव ॥
तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा राजा भृत्यानथाब्रवीत् । यद्यद्ब्रूयान्मुनिस्तत्तत्सर्वं देयमशङ्कितैः ॥
ततो रत्नान्यनेकानि स्त्रियो युग्यमजाविकम् । कृताकृतं च कनकं गजेन्द्राश्चाचलोपमाः ॥
अन्वगच्छन्त तमृषिं राजामात्याश्च सर्वशः । हाहाभूतं च तत्सर्वमासीन्नगरमार्तिमत् ॥
तौ तीक्ष्णाग्रेण सहसा प्रतोदेन प्रचोदितौ । पृष्ठे विद्धौ कटे चैव निर्विकारौ तमूहतुः ॥
data.md: Cries of Oh and Alas arose from every part of the city which was plunged in grief at that extraordinary spectacle. The Rishi struck the king and the queen suddenly with that goad having a sharp point. Though thus struck on the back and the cheeks, the royal pair still showed no sign of agitation. On the other hand they continued to carry the Rishi on as before.

data.v: वेपमानौ विराहारौ पञ्चाशद्रात्रकर्शितौ । कथंचिदूहतुर्वीरौ दंपती तं रथोत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Trembling from head to foot, for no food had passed their lips for fifty nights, and exceedingly weak, the heroic pair somehow succeeded in dragging that excellent chariot.

data.v: बहुशो भृशविद्धौ तौ क्षरमाणौ क्षतोद्भवम् । ददृशाते महाराज पुष्पिताविव किंशुकौ ॥
data.md: Repeatedly and deeply cut by the goad, the royal pair became covered with blood. Indeed, O king, they then looked like a couple of Kinshuka trees in the flowering season.

data.v: तौ दृष्ट्वा पौरवर्गस्तु भृशं शोकपरायणः । अभिशापभयात्त्रस्तो न च किंचिदुवाच ह ॥
data.md: Seeing the plight to which their king and queen had been reduced, the citizens became afflicted with great grief. Filled with fear of the curse of the Rishi, they kept silent under their misery.

data.v: द्वन्द्वशश्चाब्रुवन्सर्वे पश्यध्वं तपसो बलम् । क्रुद्धा अपि मुनिश्रेष्ठं वीक्षितुं नैव शक्नुमः ॥
data.md: Collected in masses they said to each other-See the might of penances! Although all of us are angry, we are still unable to look at the Rishi.

data.v: अहो भगवतो वीर्यं महर्षेर्भावितात्मनः । राज्ञश्चापि सभार्यस्य धैर्यं पश्यत यादृशम् ॥
data.md: Great is the energy of the holy Rishi of purified soul! See also the endurance of the king and his royal spouse.

data.v: श्रान्तावपि हि कृच्छ्रेण रथमेतं समूहतुः । न चैतयोर्विकारं वै ददर्श भृगुनन्दनः ॥
data.md: Though exhausted with fatigue and hunger, they are still carrying the car! The son of Bhrigu, despite the misery he caused to Kushika and his queen, could see no sign of dissatisfaction or agitation in them.

data.v: ततः स निर्विकारौ तौ दृष्ट्वा भृगुकुलोद्वहः । वसु विश्राणयामास यथा वैश्रवणस्तथा ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The perpetuator of Bhrigu's race, seeing the king and the queen totally unmoved, began to distribute wealth very largely as if he were a second Lord of Treasures.

data.v: तत्रापि राजा प्रीतात्मा यथाज्ञप्तमथाकरोत् । ततोऽस्य भगवान्प्रीतो बभूव मुनिसत्तमः ॥
data.md: At this deed also, king Kushika showed no mark of dissatisfaction. He did as the Rishi ordered. Seeing all this, that illustrious and best of ascetics became pleased.

data.v: अवतीर्य रथश्रेष्ठाद्दंपती तौ मुमोच ह । विमोच्य चैतौ विधिवत्ततो वाक्यमुवाच ह ॥
data.md: Descending from that excellent car, he unharnessed the royal pair. Having freed them, he addressed them duty.

data.v: स्निग्धगम्भीरया वाचा भार्गवः सुप्रसन्नया । ददानि वां वरं श्रेष्ठं तद्ब्रूतामिति भारत ॥
data.md: Indeed the son of Bhrigu, in a soft, deep, and delighted voice, saidI am ready to give an excellent boon to you both.

data.v: सुकुमारौ च तौ विद्वान्कराभ्यां मुनिसत्तमः । पस्पर्शामृतकल्पाभ्यां स्नेहाद्भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Delicate as they were, their bodies had been pierced with the goad. Moved by affection, that best of ascetics softly touched them with his hands, whose healing virtues resembled those of ambrosia itself, O chief of the Bharatas.

data.v: अथाब्रवीन्नृपो वाक्यं श्रमो नास्त्यावयोरिह । विश्रान्तौ स्वः प्रभावात्ते ध्यानेनैवेति भार्गव ॥
data.md: Then the king answered Myself and my wife have felt no exhaustion Indeed, all their fatigue had been removed through the power of the Rishi, and hence it was that the king could say so to the Rishi.

data.v: अथ तौ भगवान्प्राह प्रहृष्टश्च्यवनस्तदा । न वृथा व्याहृतं पूर्वं यन्मया तद्भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Pleased with their conduct, the illustrious Chyavana said to them I have never before spoken falsehood; It must, therefore be as I have said.

data.v: रमणीयः समुद्देशो गङ्गातीरमिदं शुभम् । कंचित्कालं व्रतपरो निवत्स्यामीह पार्थिव ॥
data.md: This spot on the banks of Ganga is very charming and auspicious. I shall, observing a vow, live for a little while here, O king.

data.v: गम्यतां स्वपुरं पुत्र विश्रान्तः पुनरेष्यसि । इहस्थं मां सभार्यस्त्वं द्रष्टासि श्वो नराधिप ॥
data.md: Do you return to your city. You are exhausted! You shall come again. Tomorrow, O king, you shall returning with your wife, see me here.

data.v: न च मन्युस्त्वया कार्यः श्रेयस्ते समुपस्थितम् । यत्काङ्क्षितं हृदिस्थं ते तत्सर्वं संभविष्यति ॥
data.md: You should not give to anger or grief. The time is come when you shall reap a great reward! That which is coveted by you and which is in your heart will indeed be done.

data.v: इत्येवमुक्तः कुशिकः प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना । प्रोवाच मुनिशार्दूलमिदं वचनमर्थवत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by the Rishi, king Kushika, with a pleased heart, replied to the Rishi in these pregnant words.

data.v: न मे मन्युर्महाभाग पूतोऽस्मि भगवंस्त्वया । संवृत्तौ यौवनस्थौ स्वो वपुष्मन्तौ बलान्वितौ ॥
data.md: I have entertained no anger or grief, O highly blessed one! We have been cleansed and sanctified by you, O holy one! We have once more become youthful. See our bodies have become greatly beautiful and possessed of great strength.

data.v: प्रतोदेन व्रणा ये मे सभार्यस्य कृतास्त्वया । तान्न पश्यामि गात्रेषु स्वस्थोऽस्मि सह भार्यया ॥
data.md: I do not any longer see those wounds that were caused by you on our bodies with your good! Verily, with my wife, I am in good health.

data.v: इमां च देवीं पश्यामि मुने दिव्याप्सरोपमाम् । श्रिया परमया युक्तां यथादृष्टां मया पुरा ॥
data.md: I see my goddess become as beautiful in body as an Apsara. Indeed, she is endued with as much beauty and splendour as she had ever been before.

data.v: तव प्रसादात्संवृत्तमिदं सर्वं महामुने । नैतच्चित्रं तु भगवंस्त्वयि सत्यपराक्रम ॥
data.md: All this, O great ascetic, is due to your favour, Indeed, there is nothing wonderful in all this, O holy Rishi of power ever unbaffled.

data.v: इत्युक्तः प्रत्युवाचेदं च्यवनः कुशिकं तदा । आगच्छेथाः सभार्यश्च त्वमिहेति नराधिप ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by the king, Chyavana said to him – You shall, with your wife, return here tomorrow, O king.

data.v: इत्युक्तः समनुज्ञातो राजर्षिरभिवाद्य तम् । प्रययौ वपुषा युक्तो नगरं देवराजवत् ॥
data.md: With these words, the royal sage Kushika was sent away. Saluting the Rishi, the king, endued with a handsome body, returned to his capital like a second king of the celestials.

data.v: तत एनमुपाजग्मुरमात्याः सपुरोहिताः । बलस्था गणिकायुक्ताः सर्वाः प्रकृतयस्तथा ॥
data.md: The counsellors then, with the priest, came out to welcome him. His troops also and the dancing women and all his subjects, did the same.

data.v: तैर्वृतः कुशिको राजा श्रिया परमया ज्वलन् । प्रविवेश पुरं हृष्टः पूज्यमानोऽथ बन्दिभिः ॥
data.md: Surrounded by them all, King Kushika, shining in beauty and splendour, entered his city, with a delighted heart, and his praises were sung by bards and encomiasts.

data.v: ततः प्रविश्य नगरं कृत्वा सर्वाह्णिकक्रियाः । भुक्त्वा सभार्यो रजनीमुवास स महीपतिः ॥
data.md: Having entered his city and performed all his morning rites, he ate with his wife. Gifted with great splendour, the king then passed the night happy.

data.v: ततस्तु तौ नवमभिवीक्ष्य यौवनं; परस्परं विगतजराविवामरौ । ननन्दतुः शयनगतौ वपुर्धरौ; श्रिया युतौ द्विजवरदत्तया तया ॥
data.md: Each saw the other to be possessed of fresh youthfulness. All their sufferings and pains having ceased, they saw each other to resemble a celestial, Gifted with the splendour they had got as a boon from that foremost of Brahmanas, and possessed of exceedingly lovely features and beautiful forms, both of them passed a happy night in their bed.

data.v: स चाप्यृषिर्भृगुकुलकीर्तिवर्धन;स्तपोधनो वनमभिराममृद्धिमत् । मनीषया बहुविधरत्नभूषितं; ससर्ज यन्नास्ति शतक्रतोरपि ॥
data.md: In the interval spreader of the feats of Bhrigu's race, viz., the Rishi having penances for his wealth, converted by his Yogapower, that charming wood on the bank of Ganga into a retreat full of wealth of every kind and adorned with every variety of jewels and gems on account of which it excelled in beauty and splendour the very abode of the king of the celestials.

data.v: ततः स राजा रात्र्यन्ते प्रतिबुद्धो महामनाः । कृतपूर्वाह्णिकः प्रायात्सभार्यस्तद्वनं प्रति ॥
data.md: Bhishma said When that night passed away, the great king Kushika awoke and performed his morning rites. Accompanied by his wife he then went towards that forest which the Rishi had selected for his residence.

data.v: ततो ददर्श नृपतिः प्रासादं सर्वकाञ्चनम् । मणिस्तम्भसहस्राढ्यं गन्धर्वनगरोपमम् । तत्र दिव्यानभिप्रायान्ददर्श कुशिकस्तदा ॥
data.md: Arrived there, the king saw a palatial inansion made entirely of gold. Having a thousand columns each of which was made of gems and precious stones, it looked like a mansion belonging to the Gandharvas.

data.v: पर्वतान्रम्यसानूंश्च नलिनीश्च सपङ्कजाः । चित्रशालाश्च विविधास्तोरणानि च भारत । शाद्वलोपचितां भूमिं तथा काञ्चनकुट्टिमाम् ॥
data.md: Kushika saw in every part of that building signs of celestial design. And he saw hills with charming valleys, and lakes with lotuses on their bosom; and mansions full of rich and curious articles, and gateways and arches, O Bharata, and the king beheld many open glades and open spots carpeted with grass, and resembling fields of gold.

data.v: सहकारान्प्रफुल्लांश्च केतकोद्दालकान्धवान् । अशोकान्मुचुकुन्दांश्च फुल्लांश्चैवातिमुक्तकान् ॥
data.md: And he saw many Sahakaras adorned with blossoms, and Ketakas and Uddalakas, and Dhavas, and Ashokas and blossoming Kundas, and Atimuktas.

data.v: चम्पकांस्तिलकान्भव्यान्पनसान्वञ्जुलानपि । पुष्पितान्कर्णिकारांश्च तत्र तत्र ददर्श ह ॥
data.md: And he saw there many Champakas and Tilakas and Bhavyas and Panasas and Vyanjulas and Karnikaras adorned with flowers.

data.v: श्यामां वारणपुष्पीं च तथाष्टापदिकां लताम् । तत्र तत्र परिकॢप्ता ददर्श स महीपतिः ॥
data.md: And the king saw many Shyamas and Varanapushpas and the creepers called Astapadika, all clipt properly and beautifully.

data.v: वृक्षान्पद्मोत्पलधरान्सर्वर्तुकुसुमांस्तथा । विमानच्छन्दकांश्चापि प्रासादान्पद्मसंनिभान् ॥
data.md: And the king saw trees on which lotuses of various species bloomed in all their beauty, and some of which bore flowers of every season. And he saw also many mansions that looked like celestial cars or like beautiful mountains.

data.v: शीतलानि च तोयानि क्वचिदुष्णानि भारत । आसनानि विचित्राणि शयनप्रवराणि च ॥
पर्यङ्कान्सर्वसौवर्णान्परार्ध्यास्तरणास्तृतान् । भक्ष्यभोज्यमनन्तं च तत्र तत्रोपकल्पितम् ॥
data.md: And at some places, O Bharata, there were tanks and lakes full of cool water and at others were those that were full of warm or hot water. And there were various kinds of excellent seats and costly beds and bedsteads made of gold and gems and overlaid with beautiful cloths and carpets. There were profuse viands and edibles, all well dressed and ready for use.

data.v: वाणीवादाञ्छुकांश्चापि शारिकाभृङ्गराजकान् । कोकिलाञ्छतपत्रांश्च कोयष्टिमककुक्कुटान् ॥
मयूरान्कुक्कुटांश्चापि पुत्रकाञ्जीवजीवकान् । चकोरान्वानरान्हंसान्सारसांश्चक्रसाह्वयान् ॥
data.md: And there were talking parrots, she-parrots, Bhringarajas, Kokilas, Shatapatras with Koyashtikas and Kukkubhas, and peacocks and cocks and Datyuhas and Jivajivakas and Chakoras and monkeys and swans and Sarasas and Chakravakas.

data.v: समन्ततः प्रणदितान्ददर्श सुमनोहरान् । क्वचिदप्सरसां संघान्गन्धर्वाणां च पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Here and there he saw bevies of rejoicing Apsaras and conclaves of happy Gandharva, O monarch.

data.v: कान्ताभिरपरांस्तत्र परिष्वक्तान्ददर्श ह । न ददर्श च तान्भूयो ददर्श च पुनर्नृपः ॥
data.md: And he saw other Gandharvas at other places rejoicing with their dear wives. The king sometimes saw these sights and sometimes could not see them.

data.v: गीतध्वनिं सुमधुरं तथैवाध्ययनध्वनिम् । हंसान्सुमधुरांश्चापि तत्र शुश्राव पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: The king heard also sweet notes of Vocal music and the sweet voices of preceptors engaged in lecturing their disciples on the Vedas and the Scriptures. And the king also heard the harinonious notes of the geese sporting in the lakes.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वात्यद्भुतं राजा मनसाचिन्तयत्तदा । स्वप्नोऽयं चित्तविभ्रंश उताहो सत्यमेव तु ॥
data.md: Seeing such highly wonderful spectacles, the king began to reflect inwardly, saying-ls this a dream? Or, is all this due to an alienation of my mind? Or is it all real.

data.v: अहो सह शरीरेण प्राप्तोऽस्मि परमां गतिम् । उत्तरान्वा कुरून्पुण्यानथ वाप्यमरावतीम् ॥
data.md: O, I have, without renouncing my body, attained to the beatitude of Heaven. This land is cither the sacred country of the UttaraKurus, or the abode, called Amaravati, of the king of the celestials.

data.v: किं त्विदं महदाश्चर्यं संपश्यामीत्यचिन्तयत् । एवं संचिन्तयन्नेव ददर्श मुनिपुंगवम् ॥
data.md: 0, what are these wonderful spectacles that I see! Reflecting thus, the king at last saw that foremost of Rishis.

data.v: तस्मिन्विमाने सौवर्णे मणिस्तम्भसमाकुले । महार्हे शयने दिव्ये शयानं भृगुनन्दनम् ॥
data.md: In that golden palace having columns made of jewels and gems, the son of Bhrigu lay stretched on a costly and excellent bed.

data.v: तमभ्ययात्प्रहर्षेण नरेन्द्रः सह भार्यया । अन्तर्हितस्ततो भूयश्च्यवनः शयनं च तत् ॥
data.md: With his wife by his side, the king approached, with an exulting heart, the Rishi as he lay on that bed. Chyavana, however, speedily disappeared at this, with the bed itself upon which he lay.

data.v: ततोऽन्यस्मिन्वनोद्देशे पुनरेव ददर्श तम् । कौश्यां बृस्यां समासीनं जपमानं महाव्रतम् । एवं योगबलाद्विप्रो मोहयामास पार्थिवम् ॥
data.md: The king then saw the Rishi at another part of that forest, seated on a mat made of Kusha grass, and mentally engaged in the recital of some high Mantras.

data.v: क्षणेन तद्वनं चैव ते चैवाप्सरसां गणाः । गन्धर्वाः पादपाश्चैव सर्वमन्तरधीयत ॥
data.md: Through his Yoga-power, thus did that Brahmana stupefy the king. In a moment that charming forest, those bevies of Apsaras, those bands of Gandharvas, those beautiful trees, all disappeared.

data.v: निःशब्दमभवच्चापि गङ्गाकूलं पुनर्नृप । कुशवल्मीकभूयिष्ठं बभूव च यथा पुरा ॥
data.md: The bank of Ganga became as silent as usual, and appeared as before covers with Kusha grass and anthills.

data.v: ततः स राजा कुशिकः सभार्यस्तेन कर्मणा । विस्मयं परमं प्राप्तस्तद्दृष्ट्वा महदद्भुतम् ॥
data.md: Having seen that highly wonderful spectacle and its quick disappearance also, king Kushika, with his wife, became filled with wonder.

data.v: ततः प्रोवाच कुशिको भार्यां हर्षसमन्वितः । पश्य भद्रे यथा भावाश्चित्रा दृष्टाः सुदुर्लभाः ॥
data.md: With a delighted heart, the king addressed his wife saying, see, O amiable one, the various agreeable scenes and sights, occurring nowhere else, which we two have just seen.

data.v: प्रसादाद्भृगुमुख्यस्य किमन्यत्र तपोबलात् । तपसा तदवाप्यं हि यन्न शक्यं मनोरथैः ॥
data.md: All this is due to the favour of Bhrigu's son and the power of his penances. By penances one attains all which cherishes in his imagination.

data.v: त्रैलोक्यराज्यादपि हि तप एव विशिष्यते । तपसा हि सुतप्तेन क्रीडत्येष तपोधनः ॥
अहो प्रभावो ब्रह्मर्षेश्च्यवनस्य महात्मनः । इच्छन्नेष तपोवीर्यादन्याँल्लोकान्सृजेदपि ॥
data.md: Penances are superior to even the kingdom of the three worlds. With penances wellperformed, Liberation itself may be acquired. Mark the power of the great and celestial Rishi Chyavana derived from his penances! He can. at his pleasure, create even other'worlds.

data.v: ब्राह्मणा एव जायेरन्पुण्यवाग्बुद्धिकर्मणः । उत्सहेदिह कर्तुं हि कोऽन्यो वै च्यवनादृते ॥
data.md: Only Brahmanas are born in this world for uttering and understanding sacred deeds. Who else save Chyavana could do all this?

data.v: ब्राह्मण्यं दुर्लभं लोके राज्यं हि सुलभं नरैः । ब्राह्मण्यस्य प्रभावाद्धि रथे युक्तौ स्वधुर्यवत् ॥
data.md: Sovereignty may be acquired easily. But the dignity of a Brahmana is not attainable. It was through the power of a Brahmana that we were harnessed to a car like wellbroken animals.

data.v: इत्येवं चिन्तयानः स विदितश्च्यवनस्य वै । संप्रेक्ष्योवाच स नृपं क्षिप्रमागम्यतामिति ॥
data.md: These thoughts that passed through the king's mind, became known to Chyavana. Ascertaining the king's thoughts, the Rishi addressed him and saidCome here quickly.

data.v: इत्युक्तः सहभार्यस्तमभ्यगच्छन्महामुनिम् । शिरसा वन्दनीयं तमवन्दत स पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, the king and the queen approached the great ascetic, and bending their heads they adored him who were worthy of adoration.

data.v: तस्याशिषः प्रयुज्याथ स मुनिस्तं नराधिपम् । निषीदेत्यब्रवीद्धीमान्सान्त्वयन्पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: Uttering a benediction upon the king, the Rishi, gifted with great intelligence, O king, comforted the king and saidSit down on that seat.

data.v: ततः प्रकृतिमापन्नो भार्गवो नृपते नृपम् । उवाच श्लक्ष्णया वाचा तर्पयन्निव भारत ॥
राजन्सम्यग्जितानीह पञ्च पञ्चसु यत्त्वया । मनःषष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि कृच्छ्रान्मुक्तोऽसि तेन वै ॥
data.md: After this, O monarch, the son of Bhrigu, without guile or insincerity of any sort, pleased the king with many soft words, and then saido king, you have completely subjugated the five organs of action and the five organs of knowledge with the mind as their sixth. For this you have come out unhurt from the fiery ordeal I had prepared for you.

data.v: सम्यगाराधितः पुत्र त्वयाहं वदतां वर । न हि ते वृजिनं किंचित्सुसूक्ष्ममपि विद्यते ॥
data.md: I have been properly honoured and adored, O son, by you, O foremost of all persons gifted with speech. You have no sin, not even a minute one, in you.

data.v: अनुजानीहि मां राजन्गमिष्यामि यथागतम् । प्रीतोऽस्मि तव राजेन्द्र वरश्च प्रतिगृह्यताम् ॥
data.md: Give me leave, o king, for I shall now proceed to the place I came from. I have been highly pleased with you, O king. Pray accept the boon I am ready to give!

data.v: अग्निमध्यगतेनेदं भगवन्संनिधौ मया । वर्तितं भृगुशार्दूल यन्न दग्धोऽस्मि तद्बहु ॥
data.md: Kushika said Before you, O holy one, I have stood like one staying in the midst of a fire. That I have not yet, O chief of Bhrigu's race, been reduced to ashes is sufficient.

data.v: एष एव वरो मुख्यः प्राप्तो मे भृगुनन्दन । यत्प्रीतोऽसि समाचारात्कुलं पूतं ममानघ ॥
data.md: Even this is the highest boon that I have got, O delighter of Bhrigu! That you have been pleased by me, O Brahmana, and that I have succeed in rescuing my race from destruction, O sinless one, are in my case the best boons.

data.v: एष मेऽनुग्रहो विप्र जीविते च प्रयोजनम् । एतद्राज्यफलं चैव तपश्चैतत्परं मम ॥
data.md: This I consider, O learned Brahmana, as a distinct mark of your favour. The object of my life has been accomplished. Even this is what I consider the very object of my sovereignty. This is the highest fruit of my penances.

data.v: यदि तु प्रीतिमान्विप्र मयि त्वं भृगुनन्दन । अस्ति मे संशयः कश्चित्तन्मे व्याख्यातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: If, O learned Brahmana, you have been pleased with me, O delighter of Bhrigu, then do you remove some doubts which are in my mind.

data.v: वरश्च गृह्यतां मत्तो यश्च ते संशयो हृदि । तं च ब्रूहि नरश्रेष्ठ सर्वं संपादयामि ते ॥
data.md: Chyavana said Do you accept a boon from me. Do you also, O king, tell me what the doubt is that is in your mind. I shall certainly accomplish all your purposes.

data.v: यदि प्रीतोऽसि भगवंस्ततो मे वद भार्गव । कारणं श्रोतुमिच्छामि मद्गृहे वासकारितम् ॥
data.md: Kushika said If you have been pleased with me, O holy one, do you then, O son of Bhrigu, teil me your object in living in my palace for sometime, for I wish to hear it. What was your object in sleeping on the bed I assigned you for, one and twenty days continuously, without changing sides.

data.v: शयनं चैकपार्श्वेन दिवसानेकविंशतिम् । अकिंचिदुक्त्वा गमनं बहिश्च मुनिपुंगव ॥
data.md: O foremost of ascetics, what also was your object, again in going out of the room without speaking a single word.

data.v: अन्तर्धानमकस्माच्च पुनरेव च दर्शनम् । पुनश्च शयनं विप्र दिवसानेकविंशतिम् ॥
data.md: Why did you, again, without any reason, disappear and once more become visible? Why, O learned Brahmana, did you again lay yourself down on the bed, and sleep, as before, for one and twenty days.

data.v: तैलाभ्यक्तस्य गमनं भोजनं च गृहे मम । समुपानीय विविधं यद्दग्धं जातवेदसा । निर्याणं च रथेनाशु सहसा यत्कृतं त्वया ॥
data.md: Why did you go out after you were rubbed by us with oil for your bath? Why, also, after having made various kinds of food in my palace to be collected, did you consume them with fire?

data.v: धनानां च विसर्गस्य वनस्यापि च दर्शनम् । प्रासादानां बहूनां च काञ्चनानां महामुने ॥
मणिविद्रुमपादानां पर्यङ्कानां च दर्शनम् । पुनश्चादर्शनं तस्य श्रोतुमिच्छामि कारणम् ॥
अतीव ह्यत्र मुह्यामि चिन्तयानो दिवानिशम् । न चैवात्राधिगच्छामि सर्वस्यास्य विनिश्चयम् । एतदिच्छामि कार्त्स्न्येन सत्यं श्रोतुं तपोधन ॥
data.md: I cannot comprehend your motive. ( you having penances for wealth, I wish to hear the truth about all those acts of yours in full.

data.v: शृणु सर्वमशेषेण यदिदं येन हेतुना । न हि शक्यमनाख्यातुमेवं पृष्टेन पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Chyavana said Listen to me as I tell you fully the reasons which had moved me in all these acts of mine. Asked by you, O king, I cannot refuse to enlighten you.

data.v: पितामहस्य वदतः पुरा देवसमागमे । श्रुतवानस्मि यद्राजंस्तन्मे निगदतः शृणु ॥
data.md: In days of yore, on one occasion, when the deities had assembled together, the Grandfather Brahman said some words. I heard them, O king, and shall now repeat them to you.

data.v: ब्रह्मक्षत्रविरोधेन भविता कुलसंकरः । पौत्रस्ते भविता राजंस्तेजोवीर्यसमन्वितः ॥
data.md: On account of a quarrel between Brahmana and Kshatriya energy, there will occur an intermixture in my race. Your grandson, O king, will become endued with great energy and power.

data.v: ततः स्वकुलरक्षार्थमहं त्वा समुपागमम् । चिकीर्षन्कुशिकोच्छेदं संदिधक्षुः कुलं तव ॥
data.md: Hearing this, I came here resolved to exterminate your race. Indeed, I came, O Kushika, seeking the utter extermination of your family, in fact, for reducing to ashes all your descendants.

data.v: ततोऽहमागम्य पुरा त्वामवोचं महीपते । नियमं कंचिदारप्स्ये शुश्रूषा क्रियतामिति ॥
data.md: Moved by this motive I came to your palace, O monarch, and said to you I shall observe some vow. Do you attend upon me and serve me dutifully.

data.v: न च ते दुष्कृतं किंचिदहमासादयं गृहे । तेन जीवसि राजर्षे न भवेथास्ततोऽन्यथा ॥
data.md: While living, however, in your house, I could not see any shortcomings in you. It is for that reason, O royal sage, that you are still alive, for otherwise you would have by this been dead.

data.v: एतां बुद्धिं समास्थाय दिवसानेकविंशतिम् । सुप्तोऽस्मि यदि मां कश्चिद्बोधयेदिति पार्थिव ॥
data.md: It was with this resolution that I slept for twentyone days in the hope that somebody would awake me before I arose out of my own accord.

data.v: यदा त्वया सभार्येण संसुप्तो न प्रबोधितः । अहं तदैव ते प्रीतो मनसा राजसत्तम ॥
data.md: You, however, with your wife, did not awake me. Even then, O best of kings, I became delighted with you.

data.v: उत्थाय चास्मि निष्क्रान्तो यदि मां त्वं महीपते । पृच्छेः क्व यास्यसीत्येवं शपेयं त्वामिति प्रभो ॥
data.md: Rising from my bed I went out of the chamber without speaking to any of you. I did this, O king, in the hope that you would ask me and thus I would have an opportunity of cursing you.

data.v: अन्तर्हितश्चास्मि पुनः पुनरेव च ते गृहे । योगमास्थाय संविष्टो दिवसानेकविंशतिम् ॥
data.md: I then disappeared, and again showed myself in the room of your palace, and once more following Yoga slept for one and twenty days.

data.v: क्षुधितो मामसूयेथाः श्रमाद्वेति नराधिप । एतां बुद्धिं समास्थाय कर्शितौ वां मया क्षुधा ॥
data.md: My motive was this. Exhausted with toil and hunger you two would be angry with me and do what would be unpleasant to me. It was from this motive that I caused yourself and your wife to be afflicted with hunger.

data.v: न च तेऽभूत्सुसूक्ष्मोऽपि मन्युर्मनसि पार्थिव । सभार्यस्य नरश्रेष्ठ तेन ते प्रीतिमानहम् ॥
data.md: In your heart, however, O king, the slightest feeling of anger or vexation did not rise. For this, O king, I became highly pleased with you.

data.v: भोजनं च समानाय्य यत्तदादीपितं मया । क्रुध्येथा यदि मात्सर्यादिति तन्मर्षितं च ते ॥
data.md: When I caused various kinds of food to be brought and then set fire to them, I hoped that yourself with your wife would yield to anger at the sight. Even that act, however, of mine was tolerated by you.

data.v: ततोऽहं रथमारुह्य त्वामवोचं नराधिप । सभार्यो मां वहस्वेति तच्च त्वं कृतवांस्तथा ॥
data.md: I then ascended the car, o king, and addressed you, saying Do you with your wife bear me! You did what I ordered, without the least scruple, O king! I became delighted at this. The gifts of riches I made could not excite your anger.

data.v: अविशङ्को नरपते प्रीतोऽहं चापि तेन ते । धनोत्सर्गेऽपि च कृते न त्वां क्रोधः प्रधर्षयत् ॥
data.md: I then ascended the car, o king, and addressed you, saying Do you with your wife bear me! You did what I ordered, without the least scruple, O king! I became delighted at this. The gifts of riches I made could not excite your anger.

data.v: ततः प्रीतेन ते राजन्पुनरेतत्कृतं तव । सभार्यस्य वनं भूयस्तद्विद्धि मनुजाधिप ॥
data.md: Pleased with you, O king, I created with the help of my Yogapower that forest which yourself with your wife did see here. Listen, O king, to the object I had.

data.v: प्रीत्यर्थं तव चैतन्मे स्वर्गसंदर्शनं कृतम् । यत्ते वनेऽस्मिन्नृपते दृष्टं दिव्यं निदर्शनम् ॥
data.md: For pleasing you and your qucen I made you to have a glimpse of Heaven, All those things which you have seen in these woods, O king, are a foretaste of Heaven.

data.v: स्वर्गोद्देशस्त्वया राजन्सशरीरेण पार्थिव । मुहूर्तमनुभूतोऽसौ सभार्येण नृपोत्तम ॥
data.md: O best of kings, for a little while I made you and your wife behold, in even your, earthly bodies, some sights of Heaven.

data.v: निदर्शनार्थं तपसो धर्मस्य च नराधिप । तत्र यासीत्स्पृहा राजंस्तच्चापि विदितं मम ॥
data.md: All this was done for showing the power of penances and the reward that is in store for virtue. The desire that arose in your heart, O monarch, at sight of those delightful objects, is known to me.

data.v: ब्राह्मण्यं काङ्क्षसे हि त्वं तपश्च पृथिवीपते । अवमन्य नरेन्द्रत्वं देवेन्द्रत्वं च पार्थिव ॥
data.md: You became desirous of obtaining the dignity of a Brahmana and the merit of penances, O king, disregarding the sovereignty of the Earth, nay, the sovereignty of very Heaven.

data.v: एवमेतद्यथात्थ त्वं ब्राह्मण्यं तात दुर्लभम् । ब्राह्मण्ये सति चर्षित्वमृषित्वे च तपस्विता ॥
data.md: You thought this, O king. The status of a Brahmana is highly difficult to get; having become a Brahmana, it is highly difficult to obtain the status of a Rishi; having become a Rishi it is difficult to become an ascetic.

data.v: भविष्यत्येष ते कामः कुशिकात्कौशिको द्विजः । तृतीयं पुरुषं प्राप्य ब्राह्मणत्वं गमिष्यति ॥
data.md: I tell you that your desire will be fulfilled. From you, O Kushika, will originate a Brahmana who shall be called after your name. The person that will be the third in descent from you shall obtain the status of a Brahmana.

data.v: वंशस्ते पार्थिवश्रेष्ठ भृगूणामेव तेजसा । पौत्रस्ते भविता विप्र तपस्वी पावकद्युतिः ॥
data.md: Through the energy of the Bhrigus, your grandson, O king, will be an ascetic gifted with the splendour of fire.

data.v: यः स देवमनुष्याणां भयमुत्पादयिष्यति । त्रयाणां चैव लोकानां सत्यमेतद्ब्रवीमि ते ॥
data.md: He shall always strike all men, indeed, the inhabitants of the three worlds, 'vith fear. I tell you the truth.

data.v: वरं गृहाण राजर्षे यस्ते मनसि वर्तते । तीर्थयात्रां गमिष्यामि पुरा कालोऽतिवर्तते ॥
data.md: O royal sage, do you accept the boon that is now in your mind. I shall soon start for a sojourn to all the sacred water, Time is expiring.

data.v: एष एव वरो मेऽद्य यत्त्वं प्रीतो महामुने । भवत्वेतद्यथात्थ त्वं तपः पौत्रे ममानघ । ब्राह्मण्यं मे कुलस्यास्तु भगवन्नेष मे वरः ॥
data.md: Kushika said This, O great ascetic, is a high boon in my case, for you have been pleased with me! Let that take place which you have said! Let my grandson become a Brahmana, O sinless one.

data.v: पुनश्चाख्यातुमिच्छामि भगवन्विस्तरेण वै । कथमेष्यति विप्रत्वं कुलं मे भृगुनन्दन । कश्चासौ भविता बन्धुर्मम कश्चापि संमतः ॥
data.md: In what way, O delighter of Bhrigu, will the dignity of Brahmanahood attach to my family? Who will be my friend? Who will have my affection and respect?

data.v: अवश्यं कथनीयं मे तवैतन्नरपुंगव । यदर्थं त्वाहमुच्छेत्तुं संप्राप्तो मनुजाधिप ॥
data.md: I should certainly, O king, tell you everything about the circumstance for which, O monarch, I came hither for exterminating your race.

data.v: भृगूणां क्षत्रिया याज्या नित्यमेव जनाधिप । ते च भेदं गमिष्यन्ति दैवयुक्तेन हेतुना ॥
data.md: This is wellknown, o king, that the Kshatriyas should always have the help of the sons of Bhrigu in the matter of sacrifices. Through an irresistible decree of destiny, the Kshatriyas and the Bhargavas will quarrel,

data.v: क्षत्रियाश्च भृगून्सर्वान्वधिष्यन्ति नराधिप । आ गर्भादनुकृन्तन्तो दैवदण्डनिपीडिताः ॥
data.md: The Kshatriyas, o king, will kill all the descendants of Bhrigu. By an ordinance of fate, they will root out the race of Bhrigu, not sparing even infants in their mothers wombs.

data.v: तत उत्पत्स्यतेऽस्माकं कुले गोत्रविवर्धनः । और्वो नाम महातेजा ज्वलनार्कसमद्युतिः ॥
data.md: There will then be born in Bhrigu's race a Rishi of the name of Urva. Gifted with great energy, he will in splendour certainly resemble fire or the sun.

data.v: स त्रैलोक्यविनाशाय कोपाग्निं जनयिष्यति । महीं सपर्वतवनां यः करिष्यति भस्मसात् ॥
data.md: He will cherish such anger as will be sufficient to consume the three worlds. He will be competent to reduce the whole Earth with all her mountains and forests into ashes.

data.v: कंचित्कालं तु तं वह्निं स एव शमयिष्यति । समुद्रे वडवावक्त्रे प्रक्षिप्य मुनिसत्तमः ॥
data.md: For a little while he will put out the flames of that fiery rage, throwing it into the Mare's mouth that wanders through the ocean.

data.v: पुत्रं तस्य महाभागमृचीकं भृगुनन्दनम् । साक्षात्कृत्स्नो धनुर्वेदः समुपस्थास्यतेऽनघ ॥
क्षत्रियाणामभावाय दैवयुक्तेन हेतुना । स तु तं प्रतिगृह्यैव पुत्रे संक्रामयिष्यति ॥
जमदग्नौ महाभागे तपसा भावितात्मनि । स चापि भृगुशार्दूलस्तं वेदं धारयिष्यति ॥
कुलात्तु तव धर्मात्मन्कन्यां सोऽधिगमिष्यति । उद्भावनार्थं भवतो वंशस्य नृपसत्तम ॥
data.md: O you of righteous soul, Jamadagni will marry a girl, taking her from your race, for spreading its glory, O chief of the Bharatas.

data.v: गाधेर्दुहितरं प्राप्य पौत्रीं तव महातपाः । ब्राह्मणं क्षत्रधर्माणं राममुत्पादयिष्यति ॥
data.md: Having obtained for wife the daughter of Gadhi and your granddaughter, O king, that great ascetic will beget a twiceborn son gifted with Kshatriya accomplishments.

data.v: क्षत्रियं विप्रकर्माणं बृहस्पतिमिवौजसा । विश्वामित्रं तव कुले गाधेः पुत्रं सुधार्मिकम् । तपसा महता युक्तं प्रदास्यति महाद्युते ॥
data.md: In your race will be born a son, a Kshatriya gifted with the virtues of a Brahmana. Possessed of great virtue, he will be the son of Gadhi. Known by the name of Vishvamitra, he will in energy come to be considered as the equal of Brihaspati himself, the preceptor of the celestials.

data.v: स्त्रियौ तु कारणं तत्र परिवर्ते भविष्यतः । पितामहनियोगाद्वै नान्यथैतद्भविष्यति ॥
तृतीये पुरुषे तुभ्यं ब्राह्मणत्वमुपैष्यति । भविता त्वं च संबन्धी भृगूणां भावितात्मनाम् ॥
data.md: All this will take place at the command of the Grandfather. It will never be otherwise. The status of Brahmanahood will attach to one who is third in descent from you. You shall become a relative of the Bhargavas!

data.v: कुशिकस्तु मुनेर्वाक्यं च्यवनस्य महात्मनः । श्रुत्वा हृष्टोऽभवद्राजा वाक्यं चेदमुवाच ह । एवमस्त्विति धर्मात्मा तदा भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Hearing these words of the great ascetic Chyavana, king Kushika became filled with joy, and answered as followएवमस्त्विति धर्मात्मा तदा भरतसत्तम॥

data.v: च्यवनस्तु महातेजाः पुनरेव नराधिपम् । वरार्थं चोदयामास तमुवाच स पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: Indeed, O best of the Bharatas, he saidSo be it! Gifted with high energy, Chyavana once more addressed the king, and urged him to accept a boon from himself. The king replied, Very well. From you, O great ascetic, I shall obtain the fruition of my wish.

data.v: बाढमेवं ग्रहीष्यामि कामं त्वत्तो महामुने । ब्रह्मभूतं कुलं मेऽस्तु धर्मे चास्य मनो भवेत् ॥
एवमुक्तस्तथेत्येवं प्रत्युक्त्वा च्यवनो मुनिः । अभ्यनुज्ञाय नृपतिं तीर्थयात्रां ययौ तदा ॥
एतत्ते कथितं सर्वमशेषेण मया नृप । भृगूणां कुशिकानां च प्रति संबन्धकारणम् ॥
यथोक्तं मुनिना चापि तथा तदभवन्नृप । जन्म रामस्य च मुनेर्विश्वामित्रस्य चैव ह ॥
data.md: Indeed, O king, everything took place as the Rishi Chyavana had said. The birth of Rama (of Bhrigu's race) and of Vishvamitra (of Kushika's race) happened in the way that Chyavana had said,

data.v: मुह्यामीव निशम्याद्य चिन्तयानः पुनः पुनः । हीनां पार्थिवसंघातैः श्रीमद्भिः पृथिवीमिमाम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said I am stupefied, O grandfather, to hear your words! Thinking that the Earth is now destitute of a very large number of kings all of whom were gifted with great prosperity, my heart becomes filled with grief.

data.v: प्राप्य राज्यानि शतशो महीं जित्वापि भारत । कोटिशः पुरुषान्हत्वा परितप्ये पितामह ॥
data.md: Having conquered the Earth and acquired hundreds of kingdoms, O Bharata, I turn with grief, O grandfather, at the thought of the millions of men I have killed.

data.v: का नु तासां वरस्त्रीणामवस्थाद्य भविष्यति । या हीनाः पतिभिः पुत्रैर्मातुलैर्भ्रातृभिस्तथा ॥
data.md: Alas, what will the condition be of those foremost ladies who have been deprived by us of husbands and sons and maternal uncles and brothers?

data.v: वयं हि तान्गुरून्हत्वा ज्ञातींश्च सुहृदोऽपि च । अवाक्शीर्षाः पतिष्यामो नरके नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: Having killed those Kurus our kinsmen, that is, and our friends and wellwisherswe shall have to sink in hell with heads hanging downwards. There is no doubt of this.

data.v: शरीरं योक्तुमिच्छामि तपसोग्रेण भारत । उपदिष्टमिहेच्छामि तत्त्वतोऽहं विशां पते ॥
data.md: I wish, O Bharata, to afflict my body with, severe, penances. With that end in view, O king. I wish to receive instructions from you.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्य तद्वाक्यं श्रुत्वा भीष्मो महामनाः । परीक्ष्य निपुणं बुद्ध्या युधिष्ठिरमभाषत ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said The great Bhishma, hearing these words of Yudhishthira, reflected upon them acutely with the help of his understanding, and addressed Yudhishthira in reply.

data.v: रहस्यमद्भुतं चैव शृणु वक्ष्यामि यत्त्वयि । या गतिः प्राप्यते येन प्रेत्यभावेषु भारत ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Hear what I say to you. It is highly wonderful and is a great mystery. The subject is the ends that creatures acquire after death as the rewards of particular acts or courses of conduct they follow.

data.v: तपसा प्राप्यते स्वर्गस्तपसा प्राप्यते यशः । आयुःप्रकर्षो भोगाश्च लभ्यन्ते तपसा विभो ॥
data.md: One goes to Heaven by penances. By penances one acquires fame. By penances, O mighty king, one lives long and gets all articles of enjoyment.

data.v: ज्ञानं विज्ञानमारोग्यं रूपं संपत्तथैव च । सौभाग्यं चैव तपसा प्राप्यते भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: By penances one acquires knowledge, science, health and freedom from disease, beauty of person, prosperity and blessedness, O chief of Bharata's race.

data.v: धनं प्राप्नोति तपसा मौनं ज्ञानं प्रयच्छति । उपभोगांस्तु दानेन ब्रह्मचर्येण जीवितम् ॥
data.md: By penances one acquires riches. By observing the vow of silence one succeeds in bringing the whole world under his sway. By making gifts one gets all kinds of enjoyable articles. By observing the rite of Diksha one acquires birth in a good and high family. Those who spend their lives living upon only fruits and roots succeed in acquiring kingdom and sovereignty. Those who live upon the leaves of plants and trees as their food succeed in going to Heaven.

data.v: अहिंसायाः फलं रूपं दीक्षाया जन्म वै कुले । फलमूलाशिनां राज्यं स्वर्गः पर्णाशिनां भवेत् ॥
data.md: By penances one acquires riches. By observing the vow of silence one succeeds in bringing the whole world under his sway. By making gifts one gets all kinds of enjoyable articles. By observing the rite of Diksha one acquires birth in a good and high family. Those who spend their lives living upon only fruits and roots succeed in acquiring kingdom and sovereignty. Those who live upon the leaves of plants and trees as their food succeed in going to Heaven.

data.v: पयोभक्षो दिवं याति स्नानेन द्रविणाधिकः । गुरुशुश्रूषया विद्या नित्यश्राद्धेन संततिः ॥
data.md: One who live upon water only attains to Heaven. By making gifts one simply increases his wealth. By serving with reverence his preceptor, acquires learning. By performing Shraddhas every day in honour of his Departed Manes, one acquires a large number of children.

data.v: गवाढ्यः शाकदीक्षाभिः स्वर्गमाहुस्तृणाशनात् । स्त्रियस्त्रिषवणस्नानाद्वायुं पीत्वा क्रतुं लभेत् ॥
data.md: By observing Diksha upon potherbs and vegetables, one acquires a large number of kine. Those who live upon grass and straw succeed in going to Heaven. By bathing thrice every day with necessary rites, one acquires a large number of waves. By drinking the air alone, one acquires residence in the regions of Prajapati.

data.v: नित्यस्नायी भवेद्दक्षः संध्ये तु द्वे जपन्द्विजः । मरुं साधयतो राज्यं नाकपृष्ठमनाशके ॥
data.md: one The Brahmana who bathes every day and recites sacred Mantras in the two twilights, becomes possessed of the position of Daksha himself. By adoring the deities in a forest or desert, one acquires a kingdom or sovereignty, and by observing the vow of relinquishing the body by a long fast, one goes to the celestial region.

data.v: स्थण्डिले शयमानानां गृहाणि शयनानि च । चीरवल्कलवासोभिर्वासांस्याभरणानि च ॥
data.md: One having penances for wealth and always passing his days in Yoga obtains good beds and seats and Vehicles. Renouncing the body by entering a burning fire, one becomes an object of respect in the region of Brahman.

data.v: शय्यासनानि यानानि योगयुक्ते तपोधने । अग्निप्रवेशे नियतं ब्रह्मलोको विधीयते ॥
data.md: Those who lie on the hard and bare ground acquire houses and beds. Those who clothe themselves in rags and barks get good dresses and ornaments.

data.v: रसानां प्रतिसंहारात्सौभाग्यमिह विन्दति । आमिषप्रतिसंहारात्प्रजास्यायुष्मती भवेत् ॥
data.md: By avoiding the several agreeable tastes one succeeds in winning great prosperity. By abstaining from meat and fish, one gets longlived children.

data.v: उदवासं वसेद्यस्तु स नराधिपतिर्भवेत् । सत्यवादी नरश्रेष्ठ दैवतैः सह मोदते ॥
data.md: One who passes sometime in Udavasa, mode of life, becomes the very lord of the celestial region. The man who speaks the truth, O best of men, succeeds in sporting happily with the celestials themselves.

data.v: कीर्तिर्भवति दानेन तथारोग्यमहिंसया । द्विजशुश्रूषया राज्यं द्विजत्वं वापि पुष्कलम् ॥
data.md: By making gifts one acquires great fame on account of his high achievements. By abstention from cruelty, one acquires health and freedom from disease. By serving the Brahmanas with respect, one acquires kingdom and sovereignty, and the high position of a Brahmana.

data.v: पानीयस्य प्रदानेन कीर्तिर्भवति शाश्वती । अन्नपानप्रदानेन तृप्यते कामभोगतः ॥
data.md: By making gifts of water and other drinks, one acquires eternal fame on account of high achievements. By making gifts of food, one acquires various articles of enjoyment.

data.v: सान्त्वदः सर्वभूतानां सर्वशोकैर्विमुच्यते । देवशुश्रूषया राज्यं दिव्यं रूपं नियच्छति ॥
data.md: One who gives peace to all creatures, (by refraining to do them any injury), becomes freed from every region. By serving the gods, one obtains a kingdom and celestial beauty,

data.v: दीपालोकप्रदानेन चक्षुष्मान्भवते नरः । प्रेक्षणीयप्रदानेन स्मृतिं मेधां च विन्दति ॥
data.md: By presenting lights at places which are dark and frequented by men, one acquires a good eyesight. By giving away good and beautiful objects, one acquires a good memory and understanding.

data.v: गन्धमाल्यनिवृत्त्या तु कीर्तिर्भवति पुष्कला । केशश्मश्रून्धारयतामग्र्या भवति संततिः ॥
data.md: By distributing scents and garlands, one acquires farreaching fame. Those who abstain from shaving off their hair and beards, get excellent children.

data.v: उपवासं च दीक्षां च अभिषेकं च पार्थिव । कृत्वा द्वादश वर्षाणि वीरस्थानाद्विशिष्यते ॥
data.md: By observing fasts and initiation and baths, O Bharata, for twelve years one acquires a region which is superior to that attainable by unreturning heroes.

data.v: दासीदासमलंकारान्क्षेत्राणि च गृहाणि च । ब्रह्मदेयां सुतां दत्त्वा प्राप्नोति मनुजर्षभ ॥
data.md: By conferring one's daughter on an eligible bridegroom according to the Brahma form, one gets, O best of men, male and female slaves and ornaments and fields and houses.

data.v: क्रतुभिश्चोपवासैश्च त्रिदिवं याति भारत । लभते च चिरं स्थानं बलिपुष्पप्रदो नरः ॥
data.md: By celebrating sacrifices and observing fasts, one goes to the celestial region, O Bharata. The man who gives away fruits and flowers succeeds in gaining sacred knowledge.

data.v: सुवर्णशृङ्गैस्तु विभूषितानां; गवां सहस्रस्य नरः प्रदाता । प्राप्नोति पुण्यं दिवि देवलोक;मित्येवमाहुर्मुनिदेवसंघाः ॥
data.md: The man who gives away a thousand kine with horns bedecked with gold, succeeds in acquiring Heaven. This has been declared by the very deities in a celestial assemblage.

data.v: प्रयच्छते यः कपिलां सचैलां; कांस्योपदोहां कनकाग्रशृङ्गीम् । तैस्तैर्गुणैः कामदुघास्य भूत्वा; नरं प्रदातारमुपैति सा गौः ॥
data.md: One who gives away a Kapila cow with her calf, with a brazen pot for milking, with horns bedecked with gold, and possessed of various other accomplishments, obtains the fruition of all his desires from that cow.

data.v: यावन्ति लोमानि भवन्ति धेन्वा;स्तावत्फलं प्राप्नुते गोप्रदाता । पुत्रांश्च पौत्रांश्च कुलं च सर्व;मासप्तमं तारयते परत्र ॥
सदक्षिणां काञ्चनचारुशृङ्गीं; कांस्योपदोहां द्रविणोत्तरीयाम् । धेनुं तिलानां ददतो द्विजाय; लोका वसूनां सुलभा भवन्ति ॥
data.md: That man gets to the regions of the Vasus who gives away a cow with horns beautifully decorated with gold, accompanied with a brazen jar for milking, along with a piece of cloth embroidered with gold, a measure of sesame and a sum of money as gift.

data.v: स्वकर्मभिर्मानवं संनिबद्धं; तीव्रान्धकारे नरके पतन्तम् । महार्णवे नौरिव वायुयुक्ता; दानं गवां तारयते परत्र ॥
data.md: A gift of kine rescues the giver in the next world when he finds himself falling into the deep darkness of hell and fettered by his own deeds in this world, like a boat with sails that have caught the air rescuing a person drowning in the ocean.

data.v: यो ब्रह्मदेयां तु ददाति कन्यां; भूमिप्रदानं च करोति विप्रे । ददाति चान्नं विधिवच्च यश्च; स लोकमाप्नोति पुरंदरस्य ॥
data.md: He who confers a daughter according to the Brahma form upon an eligible person, or who makes a gift of land to a Brahmana, or who gives food according to due rites, succeeds in attaining to the region of Indra.

data.v: नैवेशिकं सर्वगुणोपपन्नं; ददाति वै यस्तु नरो द्विजाय । स्वाध्यायचारित्रगुणान्विताय; तस्यापि लोकाः कुरुषूत्तरेषु ॥
data.md: That man who presents a house, furnished with every sort of furniture to Brahmana given to Vedic studies and endued with every accomplishment and good behaviour, lives in the country of UttaraKurus.

data.v: धुर्यप्रदानेन गवां तथाश्वै;र्लोकानवाप्नोति नरो वसूनाम् । स्वर्गाय चाहुर्हि हिरण्यदानं; ततो विशिष्टं कनकप्रदानम् ॥
data.md: By making gifts of draft bullocks, a person acquires the region of the Vasus. Gift of gold secures Heaven. Gift of pure gold yields greater merit still.

data.v: छत्रप्रदानेन गृहं वरिष्ठं; यानं तथोपानहसंप्रदाने । वस्त्रप्रदानेन फलं सुरूपं; गन्धप्रदाने सुरभिर्नरः स्यात् ॥
data.md: By making gift of an umbrella, one acquires a palatial residence. By making gift of a pair of sandals or shoes, one acquires good cars, The reward of cloths, is personal beauty, and by making gifts of scents, one gets a fragrant body in next life.

data.v: पुष्पोपगं वाथ फलोपगं वा; यः पादपं स्पर्शयते द्विजाय । स स्त्रीसमृद्धं बहुरत्नपूर्णं; लभत्ययत्नोपगतं गृहं वै ॥
data.md: One who gives flowers and fruits and plants and trees to a Brahmana, acquires, without any toil, a palatial residence containing beautiful women and plenty of riches.

data.v: भक्षान्नपानीयरसप्रदाता; सर्वानवाप्नोति रसान्प्रकामम् । प्रतिश्रयाच्छादनसंप्रदाता; प्राप्नोति तानेव न संशयोऽत्र ॥
data.md: The giver of food and drink of different tastes and other articles of enjoyment succeeds in acquiring profuse supply of such articles. The giver, again, of houses and cloths get articles of a similar nature. There is no doubt in this.

data.v: स्रग्धूपगन्धान्यनुलेपनानि; स्नानानि माल्यानि च मानवो यः । दद्याद्द्विजेभ्यः स भवेदरोग;स्तथाभिरूपश्च नरेन्द्रलोके ॥
data.md: That person who makes gifts of garlands and incense and scents and unguents and the articles needed by men after a bath, and garlands to Brahmanas, becomes freed from cvery disease and, possessed of personal beauty, sports in joy in the region reserved for great kings.

data.v: बीजैरशून्यं शयनैरुपेतं; दद्याद्गृहं यः पुरुषो द्विजाय । पुण्याभिरामं बहुरत्नपूर्णं; लभत्यधिष्ठानवरं स राजन् ॥
data.md: That man, O king, who presents to a Brahmana a house that is stored with grain, furnished with beds, full of riches, auspicious, and delightful, acquires a palatial residence.

data.v: सुगन्धचित्रास्तरणोपपन्नं; दद्यान्नरो यः शयनं द्विजाय । रूपान्वितां पक्षवतीं मनोज्ञां; भार्यामयत्नोपगतां लभेत्सः ॥
data.md: He who gives to a Brahmana a good bed perfumed with fragrant scents, covered with an excellent sheet, and pillows, gets without any effort on his part a beautiful wife, belonging to a respectable family and of agreeable manners.

data.v: पितामहस्यानुचरो वीरशायी भवेन्नरः । नाधिकं विद्यते तस्मादित्याहुः परमर्षयः ॥
data.md: The man who takes to a hero's bed on the field of battle becomes the equal of the Grandfather Brahman himself. There is no end that is higher than this. Even this is what the great Rishis have said,

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा प्रीतात्मा कुरुनन्दनः । नाश्रमेऽरोचयद्वासं वीरमार्गाभिकाङ्क्षया ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Hearing these words of his grandfather, Yudhishthira, the delighter of the Kurus, became anxious to get the end reserved for heroes and no longer expressed any disgust for leading a domestic mode of life.

data.v: ततो युधिष्ठिरः प्राह पाण्डवान्भरतर्षभ । पितामहस्य यद्वाक्यं तद्वो रोचत्विति प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Then, O foremost of men, Yudhishthira, addressing all the other sons of Pandu, said to them Let the words which our grandfather has said, command your faith.'

data.v: ततस्तु पाण्डवाः सर्वे द्रौपदी च यशस्विनी । युधिष्ठिरस्य तद्वाक्यं बाढमित्यभ्यपूजयन् ॥
data.md: At this, all the Pandavas with the famous Draupadi amongst them, highly spoke of the words of Yudhishthira and said, yes.'

data.v: यानीमानि बहिर्वेद्यां दानानि परिचक्षते । तेभ्यो विशिष्टं किं दानं मतं ते कुरुपुंगव ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Amongst all those gifts mentioned in the work other than the Vedas, which gift, О chief of Kuru's race, is the most superior in your opinion?

data.v: कौतूहलं हि परमं तत्र मे वर्तते प्रभो । दातारं दत्तमन्वेति यद्दानं तत्प्रचक्ष्व मे ॥
data.md: O powerful one, great is my curiosity in this matter. Do you describe to me that gift which follows the giver to the next world?

data.v: अभयं सर्वभूतेभ्यो व्यसने चाप्यनुग्रहम् । यच्चाभिलषितं दद्यात्तृषितायाभियाचते ॥
दत्तं मन्येत यद्दत्त्वा तद्दानं श्रेष्ठमुच्यते । दत्तं दातारमन्वेति यद्दानं भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Bhishma said An assurance to all creatures of love and affection and abstention from every sort of injury, acts of kindness and favour done to a person in distress, gifts, of articles made to one who solicits with thirst and agreeable to the solicitor's wishes, and whatever gifts are made without the giver's ever thinking of them as gifts made by him, form, O chief of Bharata's race, the highest and best of gifts.

data.v: हिरण्यदानं गोदानं पृथिवीदानमेव च । एतानि वै पवित्राणि तारयन्त्यपि दुष्कृतम् ॥
data.md: Gift of gold, gift of kine, and gift of earth,-these are considered as sincleansing. They rescue the giver from his evil deeds.

data.v: एतानि पुरुषव्याघ्र साधुभ्यो देहि नित्यदा । दानानि हि नरं पापान्मोक्षयन्ति न संशयः ॥
data.md: O king, do you always make such gifts, to the righteous. Forsooth, gifts rescue the giver from all his sins.

data.v: यद्यदिष्टतमं लोके यच्चास्य दयितं गृहे । तत्तद्गुणवते देयं तदेवाक्षयमिच्छता ॥
data.md: That person who wishes to make his gifts eternal, should always give to persons gifted with necessary qualifications whatever articles are desired by all and whatever things are the best in his house.

data.v: प्रियाणि लभते लोके प्रियदः प्रियकृत्तथा । प्रियो भवति भूतानामिह चैव परत्र च ॥
data.md: The man who makes gifts of agreeable things and who does to others what is agreeable to others, always succeeds in getting things that are agreeable to himself. Such a person certainly becomes agreeable to all, both here and hereafter.

data.v: याचमानमभीमानादाशावन्तमकिंचनम् । यो नार्चति यथाशक्ति स नृशंसो युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: That man, O Yudhishthira, is a cruel wight, who, through vanity, does not, to the extent of his means, attend to the wishes of the poor and helpless who solicit assistance.

data.v: अमित्रमपि चेद्दीनं शरणैषिणमागतम् । व्यसने योऽनुगृह्णाति स वै पुरुषसत्तमः ॥
data.md: He is, indeed, the foremost of men who shows favour to even an helpless enemy fallen into distress when such enemy comes and prays for help.

data.v: कृशाय ह्रीमते तात वृत्तिक्षीणाय सीदते । अपहन्यात्क्षुधं यस्तु न तेन पुरुषः समः ॥
data.md: No man is equal to him who satisfies the hunger of a person who is emaciated, possessed of learning, destitute of the means of support, and weakened by misery.

data.v: ह्रिया तु नियतान्साधून्पुत्रदारैश्च कर्शितान् । अयाचमानान्कौन्तेय सर्वोपायैर्निमन्त्रय ॥
data.md: One should always, O son of Kunti, remove by ever ineans in his power, the distress of the pious observant of vows and acts, who though having no sons and wives and plunged into misery, do not yet solicit others for any kind of help.

data.v: आशिषं ये न देवेषु न मर्त्येषु च कुर्वते । अर्हन्तो नित्यसत्त्वस्था यथालब्धोपजीविनः ॥
आशीविषसमेभ्यश्च तेभ्यो रक्षस्व भारत । तान्युक्तैरुपजिज्ञास्य तथा द्विजवरोत्तमान् ॥
data.md: Those persons who do not utter blessings upon the deities and men, who are worthy of respect and always contented, and who live upon such alms as they get without begging, are considered as veritable snakes of virulent poison. Do you, O Bharata, always protect yourself from them by making gifts to them. They are capable to make the foremost of Ritwijas. You are to find them out by means of your spies and agents.

data.v: कृतैरावसथैर्नित्यं सप्रेष्यैः सपरिच्छदैः । निमन्त्रयेथाः कौरव्य सर्वकामसुखावहैः ॥
data.md: You should honour those men by gifts of good houses furnished with every necessary article, with slaves and servants, with good dresses and vestments, O son of Kuru, and with all articles bringing on pleasure, and happiness.

data.v: यदि ते प्रतिगृह्णीयुः श्रद्धापूतं युधिष्ठिर । कार्यमित्येव मन्वाना धार्मिकाः पुण्यकर्मिणः ॥
data.md: Righteous men of righteous deeds should make such gifts, moved by the desire that it is their duty to act in that way and not from desire of reaping any regards therefrom. Indeed, good men should act in this way so that the virtuous described above might not, O Yudhishthira, feel any disinclination to accept those gifts sanctified by devotion and faith.

data.v: विद्यास्नाता व्रतस्नाता ये व्यपाश्रित्यजीविनः । गूढस्वाध्यायतपसो ब्राह्मणाः संशितव्रताः ॥
data.md: There are persons bathed in learning and bathed in vows. Without depending upon anybody they get their means of living. These Brahmanas of rigid vows are given to Vedic study and penances without proclaiming their practices to any one. men

data.v: तेषु शुद्धेषु दान्तेषु स्वदारनिरतेषु च । यत्करिष्यसि कल्याणं तत्त्वा लोकेषु धास्यति ॥
data.md: Whatever gifts you may make to those persons of pure conduct, of thorough mastery over their senses, and always contented with their own married wives, are sure to acquire for you a merit that will accompany you in all the worlds into which you may go.

data.v: यथाग्निहोत्रं सुहुतं सायं प्रातर्द्विजातिना । तथा भवति दत्तं वै द्विजेभ्योऽथ कृतात्मना ॥
data.md: One reaps the same merit by making gifts to twiceborn persons of controlled souls which one acquires by properly pouring libations to the sacred fire morning and evening.

data.v: एष ते विततो यज्ञः श्रद्धापूतः सदक्षिणः । विशिष्टः सर्वयज्ञेभ्यो ददतस्तात वर्तताम् ॥
data.md: This is the sanctified spread out for you, a sacrifice that is sanctified by devotion and faith and that is accompanied with Dakshina! It is superior to all other sacrifices. Let that sacrifice ceaselessly flow from you as you give away.

data.v: निवापो दानसदृशस्तादृशेषु युधिष्ठिर । निवपन्पूजयंश्चैव तेष्वानृण्यं निगच्छति ॥
data.md: Performed in view of such men, O Yudhishthira, a sacrifice in which the water that is sprinkled for dedicating gifts forms the oblations in honour of the Departed Manes, and devotion and worship rendered to such superior men, serves to free one of the debts he owes to the deities.

data.v: य एव नो न कुप्यन्ति न लुभ्यन्ति तृणेष्वपि । त एव नः पूज्यतमा ये चान्ये प्रियवादिनः ॥
data.md: Those persons who do not give way to anger and who never desire to take even a blade of grass belonging to others, as also they who are of sweet speech, deserve to receive from us the most respectful adorations.

data.v: ये नो न बहु मन्यन्ते न प्रवर्तन्ति चापरे । पुत्रवत्परिपाल्यास्ते नमस्तेभ्यस्तथाभयम् ॥
data.md: Such persons and others never pay their regards to the giver. Nor do they try for obtaining gifts. They should, however, be maintained by givers as they maintain their own sons. I bend my head to them. From them also proceeds fearlessness.

data.v: ऋत्विक्पुरोहिताचार्या मृदुब्रह्मधरा हि ते । क्षत्रेणापि हि संसृष्टं तेजः शाम्यति वै द्विजे ॥
data.md: Ritwijas, Priests and Preceptors, when well-read in the Vedas and when behaving mildly towards disciples, become such. Forsooth, Kshatriya energy loses its force upon a Brahmana when it meets him.

data.v: अस्ति मे बलवानस्मि राजास्मीति युधिष्ठिर । ब्राह्मणान्मा स्म पर्यश्नीर्वासोभिरशनेन च ॥
data.md: Thinking that you are a king, that you are gifted with great power, and that you have riches do, not, O Yudhishthira, enjoy your affluence without giving anything to the Brahmanas.

data.v: यच्छोभार्थं बलार्थं वा वित्तमस्ति तवानघ । तेन ते ब्राह्मणाः पूज्याः स्वधर्ममनुतिष्ठता ॥
data.md: Observing the duties of your own caste, do you adore the Brahmanas with whatever riches you have, O sinless one, for purposes of adornment or sustaining your power.

data.v: नमस्कार्यास्त्वया विप्रा वर्तमाना यथातथम् । यथासुखं यथोत्साहं ललन्तु त्वयि पुत्रवत् ॥
data.md: Let the Brahmanas live in whatever way they like. You should always bend your head to them with respect. Let them always rejoice in you as your children, living happily and according to their wishes.

data.v: को ह्यन्यः सुप्रसादानां सुहृदामल्पतोषिणाम् । वृत्तिमर्हत्युपक्षेप्तुं त्वदन्यः कुरुसत्तम ॥
data.md: Who else save you, O best of the Kurus, can provide the means of livelihood for such Brahmana gifted with eternal contentment, as are your wellwishers, and as are pleased with only a little?

data.v: यथा पत्याश्रयो धर्मः स्त्रीणां लोके सनातनः । स देवः सा गतिर्नान्या तथास्माकं द्विजातयः ॥
data.md: As women have one eternal duty, in this world, viz., dependence upon, and the obedient service of their husbands, and as such duty as are forms their only end, so is the service of Brahmanas our eternal duty and end.

data.v: यदि नो ब्राह्मणास्तात संत्यजेयुरपूजिताः । पश्यन्तो दारुणं कर्म सततं क्षत्रिये स्थितम् ॥
data.md: If on seeing cruelties and other sinful deeds in Kshatriyas, the Brahmanas, O son, unhonoured by us leave us all, I say, of what use would life be to us, in the absence of all contact with the Brahmanas, especially as we shall then have to carry on our existence without being able to study the Vedas, to celebrate sacrifices, to hope for worlds of bliss hereafter, and to perform great deeds?

data.v: अवेदानामकीर्तीनामलोकानामयज्वनाम् । कोऽस्माकं जीवितेनार्थस्तद्धि नो ब्राह्मणाश्रयम् ॥
अत्र ते वर्तयिष्यामि यथा धर्मः सनातनः । राजन्यो ब्राह्मणं राजन्पुरा परिचचार ह । वैश्यो राजन्यमित्येव शूद्रो वैश्यमिति श्रुतिः ॥
data.md: I shall, about it, tell you what the eternal practice is. Formerly, O king, the Kshatriyas used to serve the Brahmanas.

data.v: दूराच्छूद्रेणोपचर्यो ब्राह्मणोऽग्निरिव ज्वलन् । संस्पर्शपरिचर्यस्तु वैश्येन क्षत्रियेण च ॥
मृदुभावान्सत्यशीलान्सत्यधर्मानुपालकान् । आशीविषानिव क्रुद्धांस्तानुपाचरत द्विजान् ॥
अपरेषां परेषां च परेभ्यश्चैव ये परे । क्षत्रियाणां प्रतपतां तेजसा च बलेन च । ब्राह्मणेष्वेव शाम्यन्ति तेजांसि च तपांसि च ॥
data.md: The energy and penances of those Kshatriyas who blaze forth with energy and power, become powerless and neutralised when they come in in contact with the Brahmanas.

data.v: न मे पिता प्रियतरो न त्वं तात तथा प्रियः । न मे पितुः पिता राजन्न चात्मा न च जीवितम् ॥
data.md: My father himself is not dearer to me than the Brahmanas. My mother is not dearer to me than they. My grandfather, O king, is not dcarer, my own life is not dearer, O king, to me than the Brahmanas.

data.v: त्वत्तश्च मे प्रियतरः पृथिव्यां नास्ति कश्चन । त्वत्तोऽपि मे प्रियतरा ब्राह्मणा भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: On Earth there is nothing, O Yudhishthira, that is dearer to me than you. But, O chief of Bharata's race, the Brahmanas are dearer to me than even you.

data.v: ब्रवीमि सत्यमेतच्च यथाहं पाण्डुनन्दन । तेन सत्येन गच्छेयं लोकान्यत्र स शंतनुः ॥
data.md: I tell you truly, O son of Pandu! I swear by this truth, by which I hope to acquire all those blissful regions that have been Shantanu's.

data.v: पश्येयं च सतां लोकाञ्छुचीन्ब्रह्मपुरस्कृतान् । तत्र मे तात गन्तव्यमह्नाय च चिराय च ॥
data.md: I see those sacred regions with Brahma shining conspicuously before them. I shall go there, O son, and live in them eternally.

data.v: सोऽहमेतादृशाँल्लोकान्दृष्ट्वा भरतसत्तम । यन्मे कृतं ब्राह्मणेषु न तप्ये तेन पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Seeing these regions. O best of the Bharatas. I am filled with joy at the thought of all these acts which I have done in aid and honour of the Brahmanas, O king.

data.v: यौ तु स्यातां चरणेनोपपन्नौ; यौ विद्यया सदृशौ जन्मना च । ताभ्यां दानं कतरस्मै विशिष्ट;मयाचमानाय च याचते च ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said To which of two Brahmanas, when both happen to be equally pure in conduct, equally, gifted with learning and purity, of birth and blood, but differing from each other in only this, viz., the one solicits and the other does not-I ask O grandfather, would a gift be more meritorious?

data.v: श्रेयो वै याचतः पार्थ दत्तमाहुरयाचते । अर्हत्तमो वै धृतिमान्कृपणादधृतात्मनः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said It has been said, O son of Pritha, that a gift made to an unsoliciting person yields greater merit than one made to a person who begs. One endued with contentment is certainly more deserving than that person who is shorn of that virtue and is, therefore, helpless amidst the storms and buffets of the world.

data.v: क्षत्रियो रक्षणधृतिर्ब्राह्मणोऽनर्थनाधृतिः । ब्राह्मणो धृतिमान्विद्वान्देवान्प्रीणाति तुष्टिमान् ॥
data.md: The firmness of a Kshatriya consists in the protection he gives to others. The firmness of a Brahmana consists in his refusal to beg. The Brahmana endued with steadiness and learning and contentment gladdens the celestials.

data.v: याच्ञामाहुरनीशस्य अभिहारं च भारत । उद्वेजयति याचन्हि सदा भूतानि दस्युवत् ॥
data.md: The wise have said that an act of begging on the part of a poor man is a great reproach. Thosc persons who solicit others are said to annoy the world like thieves and robbers.

data.v: म्रियते याचमानो वै तमनु म्रियते ददत् । ददत्संजीवयत्येनमात्मानं च युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: The person who solicits is said to meet with death. The giver, however, is said not to meet with death. The giver is said to give life to him who solicits. By an act of gift, O Yudhishthira, the giver is said to rescue his own self also.

data.v: आनृशंस्यं परो धर्मो याचते यत्प्रदीयते । अयाचतः सीदमानान्सर्वोपायैर्निमन्त्रय ॥
data.md: Mercy is a very high virtue. Led by niercy people make gifts to those who solicit. Those, however, who do not beg but are sunk into poverty and distress, should be respectfully invited for receiving help.

data.v: यदि वै तादृशा राष्ट्रे वसेयुस्ते द्विजोत्तमाः । भस्मच्छन्नानिवाग्नींस्तान्बुध्येथास्त्वं प्रयत्नतः ॥
data.md: If such Brahmanas, who must be considered as the foremost of their order, live in your kingdom, you should consider them as fire covered with ashes.

data.v: तपसा दीप्यमानास्ते दहेयुः पृथिवीमपि । पूज्या हि ज्ञानविज्ञानतपोयोगसमन्विताः ॥
तेभ्यः पूजां प्रयुञ्जीथा ब्राह्मणेभ्यः परंतप । ददद्बहुविधान्दायानुपच्छन्दानयाचताम् ॥
यदग्निहोत्रे सुहुते सायंप्रातर्भवेत्फलम् । विद्यावेदव्रतवति तद्दानफलमुच्यते ॥
विद्यावेदव्रतस्नातानव्यपाश्रयजीविनः । गूढस्वाध्यायतपसो ब्राह्मणान्संशितव्रतान् ॥
data.md: There are persons bathed in learning and bathed in vows. Without depending upon anybody they get their means of living. These Brahmanas of rigid vows are given to Vedic study and penances without proclaiming their practices to any one. men

data.v: कृतैरावसथैर्हृद्यैः सप्रेष्यैः सपरिच्छदैः । निमन्त्रयेथाः कौन्तेय कामैश्चान्यैर्द्विजोत्तमान् ॥
data.md: You should honour those men by gifts of good houses furnished with every necessary article, with slaves and servants, with good dresses and vestments, O son of Kuru, and with all articles bringing on pleasure, and happiness.

data.v: अपि ते प्रतिगृह्णीयुः श्रद्धापूतं युधिष्ठिर । कार्यमित्येव मन्वाना धर्मज्ञाः सूक्ष्मदर्शिनः ॥
data.md: Righteous men of righteous deeds should make such gifts, moved by the desire that it is their duty to act in that way and not from desire of reaping any regards therefrom. Indeed, good men should act in this way so that the virtuous described above might not, O Yudhishthira, feel any disinclination to accept those gifts sanctified by devotion and faith.

data.v: अपि ते ब्राह्मणा भुक्त्वा गताः सोद्धरणान्गृहान् । येषां दाराः प्रतीक्षन्ते पर्जन्यमिव कर्षकाः ॥
अन्नानि प्रातःसवने नियता ब्रह्मचारिणः । ब्राह्मणास्तात भुञ्जानास्त्रेताग्नीन्प्रीणयन्तु ते ॥
माध्यंदिनं ते सवनं ददतस्तात वर्तताम् । गा हिरण्यानि वासांसि तेनेन्द्रः प्रीयतां तव ॥
तृतीयं सवनं तत्ते वैश्वदेवं युधिष्ठिर । यद्देवेभ्यः पितृभ्यश्च विप्रेभ्यश्च प्रयच्छसि ॥
अहिंसा सर्वभूतेभ्यः संविभागश्च सर्वशः । दमस्त्यागो धृतिः सत्यं भवत्ववभृथाय ते ॥
एष ते विततो यज्ञः श्रद्धापूतः सदक्षिणः । विशिष्टः सर्वयज्ञेभ्यो नित्यं तात प्रवर्तताम् ॥
data.md: This is the sanctified spread out for you, a sacrifice that is sanctified by devotion and faith and that is accompanied with Dakshina! It is superior to all other sacrifices. Let that sacrifice ceaselessly flow from you as you give away.

data.v: दानं यज्ञक्रिया चेह किं स्वित्प्रेत्य महाफलम् । कस्य ज्यायः फलं प्रोक्तं कीदृशेभ्यः कथं कदा ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said I wish to know fully, O Bharata, where one get the high reward of gifts and sacrifices. Are those rewards acquired here or hereafter? Which amongst these two (viz., Gift and Sacrifice) yields superior merit? To whom should gifts be made? In what manner are gifts and sacrifices to be made? When also are they to be made? I ask you this, O learned sire? Do you discourse to me on the duty of gifts!

data.v: एतदिच्छामि विज्ञातुं याथातथ्येन भारत । विद्वञ्जिज्ञासमानाय दानधर्मान्प्रचक्ष्व मे ॥
अन्तर्वेद्यां च यद्दत्तं श्रद्धया चानृशंस्यतः । किं स्विन्निःश्रेयसं तात तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Do you tell me, O grandfather, what brings on the highest reward, viz., gifts made from the sacrificial platform or those made out of that place?

data.v: रौद्रं कर्म क्षत्रियस्य सततं तात वर्तते । तस्य वैतानिकं कर्म दानं चैवेह पावनम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said O son, a Kshatriya is generally engaged in decds of fierceness. In his case, sacrifices and gifts, are considered as cleansing or sanctifying him.

data.v: न तु पापकृतां राज्ञां प्रतिगृह्णन्ति साधवः । एतस्मात्कारणाद्यज्ञैर्यजेद्राजाप्तदक्षिणैः ॥
data.md: The good and righteous, do not accept the gifts of persons of the royal order, who perpetrate sinful deeds. Therefore, the king should celebrate sacrifices with profuse gifts in the form of Dakshina.

data.v: अथ चेत्प्रतिगृह्णीयुर्दद्यादहरहर्नृपः । श्रद्धामास्थाय परमां पावनं ह्येतदुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: If the good and righteous would accept the gifts made to them, the Kshatriya, O king, should continually make gifts with devotion and faith to them. Gifts yield great merit, and are highly cleansing.

data.v: ब्राह्मणांस्तर्पयेद्द्रव्यैस्ततो यज्ञे यतव्रतः । मैत्रान्साधून्वेदविदः शीलवृत्ततपोन्वितान् ॥
data.md: Observing vows, one should celebrate sacrifices and please with wealth, such Brahmanas as are friends of all creatures, endued with righteousness, conversant of the Vedas, and pre-eminent for acts, conduct and penances.

data.v: यत्ते तेन करिष्यन्ति कृतं तेन भविष्यति । यज्ञान्साधय साधुभ्यः स्वाद्वन्नान्दक्षिणावतः ॥
data.md: If such Brahmanas do not accept your gifts, no merit will become yours. Do you celebrate sacrifices with profuse Dakshina, and make gifts of good and agreeable food to the righteous.

data.v: इष्टं दत्तं च मन्येथा आत्मानं दानकर्मणा । पूजयेथा यायजूकांस्तवाप्यंशो भवेद्यथा ॥
data.md: By making an act of gift you should consider yourself as performing a sacrifice. You should, with gifts, worship those Brahmanas who perform sacrifices. By doing this you will acquire a share in the merits of those sacrifices of theirs.

data.v: प्रजावतो भरेथाश्च ब्राह्मणान्बहुभारिणः । प्रजावांस्तेन भवति यथा जनयिता तथा ॥
data.md: You should support such Brahmanas as have children and as are capable of sending people to heaven. By acting thus, you are sure to get a large progeny-in fact, as large a progeny as the Prajapati himself.

data.v: यावतो वै साधुधर्मान्सन्तः संवर्तयन्त्युत । सर्वे ते चापि भर्तव्या नरा ये बहुभारिणः ॥
data.md: The righteous support and advance the cause of virtue. One should, by giving up his all, support such men as also those who do good to all creatures.

data.v: समृद्धः संप्रयच्छस्व ब्राह्मणेभ्यो युधिष्ठिर । धेनूरनडुहोऽन्नानि च्छत्रं वासांस्युपानहौ ॥
data.md: Yourself being rich, do you, Yudhishthira, make gifts to Brahmans of kine and bullocks and food and umbrellas and robes and sandals or shoes.

data.v: आज्यानि यजमानेभ्यस्तथान्नाद्यानि भारत । अश्ववन्ति च यानानि वेश्मानि शयनानि च ॥
data.md: Do you give to sacrificing Brahmanas clarified butter as also food, and cars and vehicles with horses harnessed thereto, and dwelling houses and mansions and beds.

data.v: एते देया व्युष्टिमन्तो लघूपायाश्च भारत । अजुगुप्सांश्च विज्ञाय ब्राह्मणान्वृत्तिकर्शितान् ॥
data.md: Such gifts yield prosperity and affluence to the giver, and are considered as pure, O Bharata. Those Brahmanas who are not censurable for anything they do, and who have no means of support assigned to them, should be found out.

data.v: उपच्छन्नं प्रकाशं वा वृत्त्या तान्प्रतिपादय । राजसूयाश्वमेधाभ्यां श्रेयस्तत्क्षत्रियान्प्रति ॥
data.md: Covertly or publicly, do you maintain such Brahmanas by giving to them the means of support. Such conduct always gives higher benefit to Kshatriyas than the Rajasuya and the Horse-Sacrifices.

data.v: एवं पापैर्विमुक्तस्त्वं पूतः स्वर्गमवाप्स्यसि । स्रंसयित्वा पुनः कोशं यद्राष्ट्रं पालयिष्यसि ॥
data.md: Purged off of sin, you are sure of attaining to Heaven. Filling your treasury, you should do good to your kingdom.

data.v: ततश्च ब्रह्मभूयस्त्वमवाप्स्यसि धनानि च । आत्मनश्च परेषां च वृत्तिं संरक्ष भारत ॥
data.md: By such conduct you are sure to acquire immense riches, and become a Brahman (in your next life). Do you, O Bharata, protect your own means as also the means of others people's livelihood.

data.v: पुत्रवच्चापि भृत्यान्स्वान्प्रजाश्च परिपालय । योगक्षेमश्च ते नित्यं ब्राह्मणेष्वस्तु भारत ॥
data.md: Do you support your servants as your own children. Do you, O Bharata, protect the Brahmanas in the enjoyment of what they have and make gifts, to them of such articles as they have not.

data.v: अरक्षितारं हर्तारं विलोप्तारमदायकम् । तं स्म राजकलिं हन्युः प्रजाः संभूय निर्घृणम् ॥
data.md: The subjects should arm themselves for killing that king who does not protect them who simply plunders their riches, who confounds all distinctions who is incapable of taking their lead, who is without mercy, and who is considered as the most sinful of kings.

data.v: अहं वो रक्षितेत्युक्त्वा यो न रक्षति भूमिपः । स संहत्य निहन्तव्यः श्वेव सोन्माद आतुरः ॥
data.md: That king who tells his people that he is their protector but who does not or is unable to protect them, should be killed by his subjects in a body like a dog that is affected with the rabies and has become mad.

data.v: पापं कुर्वन्ति यत्किंचित्प्रजा राज्ञा ह्यरक्षिताः । चतुर्थं तस्य पापस्य राजा भारत विन्दति ॥
data.md: A fourth part of whatever sins are committed by the subjects visits that king who does not protect, О Bharata.

data.v: अप्याहुः सर्वमेवेति भूयोऽर्धमिति निश्चयः । चतुर्थं मतमस्माकं मनोः श्रुत्वानुशासनम् ॥
data.md: Some authorities say that the whole of those sins visits such a king. Others are of opinion that a half thereof visits him. Bearing in mind, However, the saying of Manu, it is our opinion that a fourth part of such sins visits the unprotecting king.

data.v: शुभं वा यत्प्रकुर्वन्ति प्रजा राज्ञा सुरक्षिताः । चतुर्थं तस्य पुण्यस्य राजा चाप्नोति भारत ॥
data.md: A fourth part of whatever sins are committed by the subjects visits that king who does not protect, О Bharata.

data.v: जीवन्तं त्वानुजीवन्तु प्रजाः सर्वा युधिष्ठिर । पर्जन्यमिव भूतानि महाद्रुममिव द्विजाः ॥
data.md: Do you, O Yudhishthira, act in such a way that all your subjects, may seek refuge with you as long as you are alive, as all creatures seek the refuge, of the god of rain or as the birds seek the refuge of a large tree.

data.v: कुबेरमिव रक्षांसि शतक्रतुमिवामराः । ज्ञातयस्त्वानुजीवन्तु सुहृदश्च परंतप ॥
data.md: Let all your kinsmen and all your friends and well-wishers, O scorcher of enemies, seek refuge with you as the Rakshasas seek Kubera or the gods seek Indra as theirs.

data.v: इदं देयमिदं देयमितीयं श्रुतिचोदना । बहुदेयाश्च राजानः किं स्विद्देयमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said People accept with respect the sayings of the Shrutis which say-This is to be given. This other thing is to be given! As regards kings, again, they make gifts of various things to various men. What, however, O grandfather is the best or foremost of all gifts?

data.v: अति दानानि सर्वाणि पृथिवीदानमुच्यते । अचला ह्यक्षया भूमिर्दोग्ध्री कामाननुत्तमान् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Of all kinds of gifts, the gift of earth is said to be the first. earth is immovable and indestructible. It is capable of giving to him who possesses it all the best things upon which he may like to have.

data.v: दोग्ध्री वासांसि रत्नानि पशून्व्रीहियवांस्तथा । भूमिदः सर्वभूतेषु शाश्वतीरेधते समाः ॥
data.md: It gives dresses and vestments, jewels and gems, animals, paddy, and barley. Amongst all creatures, the giver of earth grows rich for ever and ever.

data.v: यावद्भूमेरायुरिह तावद्भूमिद एधते । न भूमिदानादस्तीह परं किंचिद्युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: As long as the earth lasts, so long does the giver thereof grow rich. There is no gift that is higher, O Yudhishthira, than the gift of earth.

data.v: अप्यल्पं प्रददुः पूर्वे पृथिव्या इति नः श्रुतम् । भूमिमेते ददुः सर्वे ये भूमिं भुञ्जते जनाः ॥
data.md: we have heard that all men have given a little quantity of earth. All men have made gifts of earth, hence all men enjoy a little of earth.

data.v: स्वकर्मैवोपजीवन्ति नरा इह परत्र च । भूमिर्भूतिर्महादेवी दातारं कुरुते प्रियम् ॥
data.md: Whether in this or in the next world, all creatures live subject to their own deeds. Earth is Prosperity's self. She is a powerful goddess. She makes him her lord who makes gifts of her in this life to her people.

data.v: य एतां दक्षिणां दद्यादक्षयां पृथिवीपतिः । पुनर्नरत्वं संप्राप्य भवेत्स पृथिवीपतिः ॥
data.md: That person, O best of kings, who gives away earth, which is indestructible, as gift, is born in next life as a man and becomes also a lord of Earth.

data.v: यथा दानं तथा भोग इति धर्मेषु निश्चयः । संग्रामे वा तनुं जह्याद्दद्याद्वा पृथिवीमिमाम् ॥
data.md: The quantity of one's enjoyment in this life is equal to one's gifts in a pristine life. This is the conclusion pointed out by the scriptures. For a Kshatriya should either give away the Earth in gift or renounce his life in battle.

data.v: इत्येतां क्षत्रबन्धूनां वदन्ति परमाशिषम् । पुनाति दत्ता पृथिवी दातारमिति शुश्रुम ॥
data.md: This is the highest source of prosperity to Kshatriyas. We have heard that earth, when given away, cleanses and sanctifies the giver.

data.v: अपि पापसमाचारं ब्रह्मघ्नमपि वानृतम् । सैव पापं पावयति सैव पापात्प्रमोचयेत् ॥
data.md: The man who is of sinful conduct who is guilty of Brahmanicide and of falsehood, is purified by a gift of earth. Indeed, such a gift rescues even such a sinner from all his sins.

data.v: अपि पापकृतां राज्ञां प्रतिगृह्णन्ति साधवः । पृथिवीं नान्यदिच्छन्ति पावनं जननी यथा ॥
data.md: The virtuous accept gifts of earth only and no other thing from sinful kings. Like one's mother, earth, when given away, purifies the giver and the taker.

data.v: नामास्याः प्रियदत्तेति गुह्यं देव्याः सनातनम् । दानं वाप्यथ वा ज्ञानं नाम्नोऽस्याः परमं प्रियम् । तस्मात्प्राप्यैव पृथिवीं दद्याद्विप्राय पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: This is an eternal and secret name of earth. viz., Priyadatta. Given away or accepted in gift, the name that is dear to her is Priyadatta.

data.v: नाभूमिपतिना भूमिरधिष्ठेया कथंचन । न वा पात्रेण वा गूहेदन्तर्धानेन वा चरेत् । ये चान्ये भूमिमिच्छेयुः कुर्युरेवमसंशयम् ॥
data.md: None but a lord of Earth can make gifts of carth. Nor should one who is not a worthy person accept a gift of earth.

data.v: यः साधोर्भूमिमादत्ते न भूमिं विन्दते तु सः । भूमिं तु दत्त्वा साधुभ्यो विन्दते भूमिमेव हि । प्रेत्येह च स धर्मात्मा संप्राप्नोति महद्यशः ॥
data.md: By making gifts of earth to the righteous, one gets good carth. Of virtuous soul, such a giver acquires great fame both in this world and in the next.

data.v: यस्य विप्रानुशासन्ति साधोर्भूमिं सदैव हि । न तस्य शत्रवो राजन्प्रशासन्ति वसुंधराम् ॥
data.md: That pious king about whom the Brahmanas say——We live on earth given to us by him, is such that his very enemies cannot utter the least reproach about his kingdom.

data.v: यत्किंचित्पुरुषः पापं कुरुते वृत्तिकर्शितः । अपि गोचर्ममात्रेण भूमिदानेन पूयते ॥
data.md: Whatever sins a man commits from want of the means of livelihood, are all washed off by gift of only so much earth as is covered by a cowhide.

data.v: येऽपि संकीर्णकर्माणो राजानो रौद्रकर्मिणः । तेभ्यः पवित्रमाख्येयं भूमिदानमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Those kings who are mean in their acts or are of fierce deeds, should be taught that gift of earth is highly purifying and is at the same time the highest gift.

data.v: अल्पान्तरमिदं शश्वत्पुराणा मेनिरे जनाः । यो यजेदश्वमेधेन दद्याद्वा साधवे महीम् ॥
data.md: The ancients thought that there is always very little difference between the man who celebrates a Horse-Sacrifice and him who makes a gift of earth to one who is righteous.

data.v: अपि चेत्सुकृतं कृत्वा शङ्केरन्नपि पण्डिताः । अशक्यमेकमेवैतद्भूमिदानमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: The learned doubt the acquision of merit which all other pious acts yield. The only act about which they are dead certain, is the of earth which, indeed, is the foremost of all gifts.

data.v: सुवर्णं रजतं वस्त्रं मणिमुक्तावसूनि च । सर्वमेतन्महाप्राज्ञ ददाति वसुधां ददत् ॥
data.md: The wise man who makes gifts of earth, gives away all these, viz, gold, silver cloth, gems and pearls and precious stones.

data.v: तपो यज्ञः श्रुतं शीलमलोभः सत्यसंधता । गुरुदैवतपूजा च नातिवर्तन्ति भूमिदम् ॥
data.md: Penances, sacrifice, Vedic learning, good conduct, absence of cupidity, firmness in truth, adoration of elders, preceptors, and the deities, all these live in him who makes a gift of earth.

data.v: भर्तुर्निःश्रेयसे युक्तास्त्यक्तात्मानो रणे हताः । ब्रह्मलोकगताः सिद्धा नातिक्रामन्ति भूमिदम् ॥
data.md: They who ascend to the region of Brahman by renouncing their lives in battle after having fought without any consideration for themselves for securing the behoof of their masters, even they are unable to go above the merit of those who make gifts of earth.

data.v: यथा जनित्री क्षीरेण स्वपुत्रं भरते सदा । अनुगृह्णाति दातारं तथा सर्वरसैर्मही ॥
data.md: As the mother always nourishes her own child with milk from her breast, so does earth please with all the tastes the person that makes a gift of earth.

data.v: मृत्योर्वै किंकरो दण्डस्तापो वह्नेः सुदारुणः । घोराश्च वारुणाः पाशा नोपसर्पन्ति भूमिदम् ॥
data.md: Mrityu, Vaikinkara, Danda, Tama, Fire, who is highly fierce, and all heinous and terrible sins are incapable of touching the person who makes a gift of earth.

data.v: पितॄंश्च पितृलोकस्थान्देवलोके च देवताः । संतर्पयति शान्तात्मा यो ददाति वसुंधराम् ॥
data.md: That man of tranquil soul who makes a gift of earth pleases (by that act) the Departed Manes living in their region and the deities also hailing from the region that is theirs.

data.v: कृशाय म्रियमाणाय वृत्तिम्लानाय सीदते । भूमिं वृत्तिकरीं दत्त्वा सत्री भवति मानवः ॥
data.md: The man who makes a gift of earth to one who is weak and cheerless and destitute of the mcans of life and famishing with weakness, and who thereby supplies one with the means of sustenance, deserves the honour and merit of celebrating a sacrifice.

data.v: यथा धावति गौर्वत्सं क्षीरमभ्युत्सृजन्त्युत । एवमेव महाभाग भूमिर्भवति भूमिदम् ॥
data.md: As an affectionate cow runs towards her half, with full udders dropping milk, similarly the highly blessed Earth, runs towards the person who makes a gift of earth.

data.v: हलकृष्टां महीं दत्त्वा सबीजां सफलामपि । उदीर्णं वापि शरणं तथा भवति कामदः ॥
data.md: That man who makes to a Brahmana a gift of earth which has been titled, or sown with seeds, or which contains standing crops, or a palace well furnished with every necessary article, succeeds in becoming the accomplisher of the wishes of everybody.

data.v: ब्राह्मणं वृत्तसंपन्नमाहिताग्निं शुचिव्रतम् । नरः प्रतिग्राह्य महीं न याति यमसादनम् ॥
data.md: The man who makes a Brahmana having the means of life, possessing a domestic fire and of pure vows and practices, accept a gift of earth, never falls into any danger or distress.

data.v: यथा चन्द्रमसो वृद्धिरहन्यहनि जायते । तथा भूमिकृतं दानं सस्ये सस्ये विवर्धते ॥
data.md: As the moon increases day by day, so the merit of a gift of earth increases every time such earth produces crops.

data.v: अत्र गाथा भूमिगीताः कीर्तयन्ति पुराविदः । याः श्रुत्वा जामदग्न्येन दत्ता भूः काश्यपाय वै ॥
data.md: Those persons conversant with ancient history sing this verse regarding the gift of earth. Heaving that verse Jamadagni's son (Rama) gave away the whole Earth to Kashyapa.

data.v: मामेवादत्त मां दत्त मां दत्त्वा मामवाप्स्यथ । अस्मिँल्लोके परे चैव ततश्चाजनने पुनः ॥
data.md: The verse to which I refer is this. Receive me in gift. Give me away. By giving me away, you (O giver) will obtain me again! That which is given away in this life is reacquired in the next.

data.v: य इमां व्याहृतिं वेद ब्राह्मणो ब्रह्मसंश्रितः । श्राद्धस्य हूयमानस्य ब्रह्मभूयं स गच्छति ॥
data.md: That Brahmana who recites this great saying of the Vedas at the time of a Shraddha get the highest reward.

data.v: कृत्यानामभिशस्तानां दुरिष्टशमनं महत् । प्रायश्चित्तमहं कृत्वा पुनात्युभयतो दश ॥
