data.md: To one who is devoted to the Vedanta, who is gifted with great learning, who has been filled with wisdom, who has a complete mastery over his senses, who observes the restraints laid down in the scriptures, who has withdrawn himself from all worldly attachments, to him who says agreeable words to all creatures, to him who would never do an evil act even when actuated by hunger, to one who is mild or possessed of a peaceful disposition, to one that is hospitable to all guests, to such a Brahmana, should a man, possessed of similar conduct and having children and wives, assign the means of livelihood.

data.v: यः क्षुद्भयाद्वै न विकर्म कुर्या;न्मृदुर्दान्तश्चातिथेयश्च नित्यम् । वृत्तिं विप्रायातिसृजेत तस्मै; यस्तुल्यशीलश्च सपुत्रदारः ॥
शुभे पात्रे ये गुणा गोप्रदाने; तावान्दोषो ब्राह्मणस्वापहारे । सर्वावस्थं ब्राह्मणस्वापहारो; दाराश्चैषां दूरतो वर्जनीयाः ॥
data.md: The merit of the gift of kine to a worthy person is exactly equal to the sin of robbing a Brahmana of what belongs to him. Under all circumstances anything belonging to Brahmana should be avoided and his wives kept at a distance. a

data.v: अत्रैव कीर्त्यते सद्भिर्ब्राह्मणस्वाभिमर्शने । नृगेण सुमहत्कृच्छ्रं यदवाप्तं कुरूद्वह ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Regarding it, O perpetuator of Kuru race, is recited by the righteous the narrative of the great calamity that befell king Nriga on account of his taking what had belonged to a Brahmana.

data.v: निविशन्त्यां पुरा पार्थ द्वारवत्यामिति श्रुतिः । अदृश्यत महाकूपस्तृणवीरुत्समावृतः ॥
data.md: Sometime before, certain youths of Yudu's race, while searching for water, came to a large well covered with grass and creepers.

data.v: प्रयत्नं तत्र कुर्वाणास्तस्मात्कूपाज्जलार्थिनः । श्रमेण महता युक्तास्तस्मिंस्तोये सुसंवृते ॥
data.md: Desirous of drawing water from it, they worked hard for removing the creepers they covered its mouth. After the mouth had been cleaned, they saw within the well a very large lizard living within it. The youths nade strong and repeated efforts for rescuing the lizard from that plight.

data.v: ददृशुस्ते महाकायं कृकलासमवस्थितम् । तस्य चोद्धरणे यत्नमकुर्वंस्ते सहस्रशः ॥
प्रग्रहैश्चर्मपट्टैश्च तं बद्ध्वा पर्वतोपमम् । नाशक्नुवन्समुद्धर्तुं ततो जग्मुर्जनार्दनम् ॥
data.md: Resembling a very hill in size, the lizard was sought to be freed by cords and leather tongs. Not succeeding in their attempts, the youths then went to Janardana.

data.v: खमावृत्योदपानस्य कृकलासः स्थितो महान् । तस्य नास्ति समुद्धर्तेत्यथ कृष्णे न्यवेदयन् ॥
data.md: Addressing him they said— Covering the entire space of a well, there is a very large lizard to be seen. Despite our best efforts we have not succeeded in rescuing it from that plight. This was what they said to Krishna.

data.v: स वासुदेवेन समुद्धृतश्च; पृष्टश्च कामान्निजगाद राजा । नृगस्तदात्मानमथो न्यवेदय;त्पुरातनं यज्ञसहस्रयाजिनम् ॥
data.md: Madhava spoke Vasudeva then went there and took out the lizard and questioned it as who it was. The lizard said that it was the soul of king Nriga who had flourished in days of yore and who had celebrated many sacrifices.

data.v: तथा ब्रुवाणं तु तमाह माधवः; शुभं त्वया कर्म कृतं न पापकम् । कथं भवान्दुर्गतिमीदृशीं गतो; नरेन्द्र तद्ब्रूहि किमेतदीदृशम् ॥
data.md: To the lizard that said those words "You had done many pious deeds. You committed no sin. Why then, O king, have you come by such a distressful end? Do you explain what is this and why has it been caused?"

data.v: शतं सहस्राणि शतं गवां पुनः; पुनः शतान्यष्ट शतायुतानि । त्वया पुरा दत्तमितीह शुश्रुम; नृप द्विजेभ्यः क्व नु तद्गतं तव ॥
data.md: We have heared that you did repeatedly make gifts to the Brahmanas numerable kine. Why, therefore, have you come by this end.

data.v: नृगस्ततोऽब्रवीत्कृष्णं ब्राह्मणस्याग्निहोत्रिणः । प्रोषितस्य परिभ्रष्टा गौरेका मम गोधने ॥
data.md: Nriga then replied to Krishna, saying, On one occasion a cow belonging to a Brahmana who regularly adored his domestic fire, escaping from the owner's house while he was absent from home, entered my flock.

data.v: गवां सहस्रे संख्याता तदा सा पशुपैर्मम । सा ब्राह्मणाय मे दत्ता प्रेत्यार्थमभिकाङ्क्षता ॥
data.md: The keepers of my cattle included that cow in their list of a thousand. In time that cow was given away by me to a Brahmana, wishing for liappiness in heaven.

data.v: अपश्यत्परिमार्गंश्च तां यां परगृहे द्विजः । ममेयमिति चोवाच ब्राह्मणो यस्य साभवत् ॥
data.md: The true owner, returning home, sought for his lost cow and at last found it in the house of another. Finding her, the owner said, “This cow is mine."

data.v: तावुभौ समनुप्राप्तौ विवदन्तौ भृशज्वरौ । भवान्दाता भवान्हर्तेत्यथ तौ मां तदोचतुः ॥
data.md: The other person contested his claim, till both, growing wroth came to me. Addressing me, one of them said, You gave this cow. The other one said You have robbed me of this cow because she is inine.

data.v: शतेन शतसंख्येन गवां विनिमयेन वै । याचे प्रतिग्रहीतारं स तु मामब्रवीदिदम् ॥
देशकालोपसंपन्ना दोग्ध्री क्षान्तातिवत्सला । स्वादुक्षीरप्रदा धन्या मम नित्यं निवेशने ॥
कृशं च भरते या गौर्मम पुत्रमपस्तनम् । न सा शक्या मया हातुमित्युक्त्वा स जगाम ह ॥
ततस्तमपरं विप्रं याचे विनिमयेन वै । गवां शतसहस्रं वै तत्कृते गृह्यतामिति ॥
data.md: I then begged the other Brahmana offering him an exchange, and saying-Do you take a hundred thousand kine for this one cow.

data.v: न राज्ञां प्रतिगृह्णामि शक्तोऽहं स्वस्य मार्गणे । सैव गौर्दीयतां शीघ्रं ममेति मधुसूदन ॥
data.md: The Brahmana, however, replied to me saying I do not accept gifts from Kshatriyas. I am able to support myself without aid. Do you then forthwith, give me that very cow which was mine. Thus, O slayer of Madhu, did that Brahmana speak to me.

data.v: रुक्ममश्वांश्च ददतो रजतं स्यन्दनांस्तथा । न जग्राह ययौ चापि तदा स ब्राह्मणर्षभः ॥
data.md: I then offered to make gifts to him of gold and silver and horses and cars. That foremost of Brahmanas refused to accept any of these gifts and departed.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु चोदितः कालधर्मणा । पितृलोकमहं प्राप्य धर्मराजमुपागमम् ॥
data.md: Meanwhile, urged by Time's irresistible power, I had to depart from this world. Going to the region of the departed manes I was taken before Yama the king of the dead.

data.v: यमस्तु पूजयित्वा मां ततो वचनमब्रवीत् । नान्तः संख्यायते राजंस्तव पुण्यस्य कर्मणः ॥
data.md: Adoring me duly, Yama addressed me saying-The end cannot be determined, O king, of your righteous deeds.

data.v: अस्ति चैव कृतं पापमज्ञानात्तदपि त्वया । चरस्व पापं पश्चाद्वा पूर्वं वा त्वं यथेच्छसि ॥
data.md: There is, however, a little sin which was unconsciously committed by you. Do you suffer the punishment for that sin now or afterwards as you like.

data.v: रक्षितास्मीति चोक्तं ते प्रतिज्ञा चानृता तव । ब्राह्मणस्वस्य चादानं त्रिविधस्ते व्यतिक्रमः ॥
data.md: You had sworn that you would protect (all persons in the enjoyment of their own). This oath of yours was not rigidly kept by you. You took also what belonged to a Brahmana. This has been the twofold sin, you have perpetrated.

data.v: पूर्वं कृच्छ्रं चरिष्येऽहं पश्चाच्छुभमिति प्रभो । धर्मराजं ब्रुवन्नेवं पतितोऽस्मि महीतले ॥
data.md: I answered, saying-I shall first suffer the distress of punishment, and when that is over, I shall enjoy the happiness that is in store for me, O lord! After I had said these words to the king of the dead, I dropped down on the Earth.

data.v: अश्रौषं प्रच्युतश्चाहं यमस्योच्चैः प्रभाषतः । वासुदेवः समुद्धर्ता भविता ते जनार्दनः ॥
data.md: Though fallen down I still could hear the words that Yama said to me very loudly. Those words were-Janardana the son of Vasudeva, will save you.

data.v: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रान्ते क्षीणे कर्मणि दुष्कृते । प्राप्स्यसे शाश्वताँल्लोकाञ्जितान्स्वेनैव कर्मणा ॥
data.md: Upon the completion of a full thousand years, when your sin will be dissipated you shall then attain to many regions of unending happiness that have been acquired by you through your own pious deeds.

data.v: कूपेऽऽत्मानमधःशीर्षमपश्यं पतितं च ह । तिर्यग्योनिमनुप्राप्तं न तु मामजहात्स्मृतिः ॥
data.md: Falling down I found myself, with head downwards, within this well changed into a creature of the intermediate order, Memory, however, did not leave me.

data.v: त्वया तु तारितोऽस्म्यद्य किमन्यत्र तपोबलात् । अनुजानीहि मां कृष्ण गच्छेयं दिवमद्य वै ॥
data.md: By you I have been saved today. What else can it testify than the power of your penances? Let me have your permission, O Krishna. I wish to ascend to the celestial region.

data.v: अनुज्ञातः स कृष्णेन नमस्कृत्य जनार्दनम् । विमानं दिव्यमास्थाय ययौ दिवमरिंदम ॥
data.md: Permitted then by Krishna, king Nriga bowed his head to him and then mounted a celestial car and went to Heaven.

data.v: ततस्तस्मिन्दिवं प्राप्ते नृगे भरतसत्तम । वासुदेव इमं श्लोकं जगाद कुरुनन्दन ॥
data.md: After Nriga had thus proceeded to the celestial region, O best of the Bharatas, Vasudeva recited this Verse, O delighter, of the Kurus.

data.v: ब्राह्मणस्वं न हर्तव्यं पुरुषेण विजानता । ब्राह्मणस्वं हृतं हन्ति नृगं ब्राह्मणगौरिव ॥
data.md: No one should knowingly misappropriate anything belonging to a a Brahmana. The property of Brahmana, if take, destroys the taker even as the Brahmana's cow destroyed king Nriga!

data.v: सतां समागमः सद्भिर्नाफलः पार्थ विद्यते । विमुक्तं नरकात्पश्य नृगं साधुसमागमात् ॥
data.md: I tell you, again O Partha, that a meeting with the good never proves furtile. See king Nriga was rescued from Hell through a meeting of his with one that is good.

data.v: प्रदानं फलवत्तत्र द्रोहस्तत्र तथाफलः । अपचारं गवां तस्माद्वर्जयेत युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: As a gift yields merit, so an act of spoliation brings on to demerit. Hence also, O Yudhishthira one should avoid doing any injury to kine.

data.v: दत्तानां फलसंप्राप्तिं गवां प्रब्रूहि मेऽनघ । विस्तरेण महाबाहो न हि तृप्यामि कथ्यताम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O sinless one, do you describe to me more fully the merits of making gifts of kine. O you of mighty arms, I am never satiated with your words.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । ऋषेरुद्दालकेर्वाक्यं नाचिकेतस्य चोभयोः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Regarding it is cited the old discourse between the Rishi Uddalaki and Nachiketa.

data.v: ऋषिरुद्दालकिर्दीक्षामुपगम्य ततः सुतम् । त्वं मामुपचरस्वेति नाचिकेतमभाषत । समाप्ते नियमे तस्मिन्महर्षिः पुत्रमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Once on a time the Rishi Uddalaki, gifted with great intelligence, approaching his son Nachiketa, said to him, Do you wait upon and serve me.

data.v: उपस्पर्शनसक्तस्य स्वाध्यायनिरतस्य च । इध्मा दर्भाः सुमनसः कलशश्चाभितो जलम् । विस्मृतं मे तदादाय नदीतीरादिहाव्रज ॥
data.md: Upon the completion of the vow he had observed, the great Rishi once more said to his son, Engaged in performing my ablutions and deeply busy with my Vedic study, I have forgotten to bring with me the firewood, the Kusha blades, the flowers, the waterjar, and the potherbs I had collected. Bring me those things from the riverbank.

data.v: गत्वानवाप्य तत्सर्वं नदीवेगसमाप्लुतम् । न पश्यामि तदित्येवं पितरं सोऽब्रवीन्मुनिः ॥
data.md: The son went there, but found all the articles washed away by the current. Returning to his father, he said “I do not see the things."

data.v: क्षुत्पिपासाश्रमाविष्टो मुनिरुद्दालकिस्तदा । यमं पश्येति तं पुत्रमशपत्स महातपाः ॥
data.md: Stricken as he then was by hunger, thirst, and fatigue, the Rishi Uddalaki of great ascetic merit, in a sudden anger cursed his son, saying, meet with Yama today.

data.v: तथा स पित्राभिहतो वाग्वज्रेण कृताञ्जलिः । प्रसीदेति ब्रुवन्नेव गतसत्त्वोऽपतद्भुवि ॥
data.md: Thus struck by his father with the thunder of his speech, the son, with joined hands, said, “Be pleased with me. Soon, however, he dropped down on the earth dead.

data.v: नाचिकेतं पिता दृष्ट्वा पतितं दुःखमूर्छितः । किं मया कृतमित्युक्त्वा निपपात महीतले ॥
data.md: Seeing Nachiketa prostrated upon the earth, his father become senseless with grief. He, too, exclaiming, Alas, what have I done! dropped down on the earth.

data.v: तस्य दुःखपरीतस्य स्वं पुत्रमुपगूहतः । व्यतीतं तदहःशेषं सा चोग्रा तत्र शर्वरी ॥
data.md: Filled with grief as he bewailed for his son, the rest of that day passed away and night came.

data.v: पित्र्येणाश्रुप्रपातेन नाचिकेतः कुरूद्वह । प्रास्पन्दच्छयने कौश्ये वृष्ट्या सस्यमिवाप्लुतम् ॥
data.md: Then Nachiketa, O son of Kuru's race, drenched by the tears of his father, showed signs of returning life as he lay on a mat of Kusha grass. His regaining of life under the tears of his father resembled the sprouting forth of seeds when drenched with good showers.

data.v: स पर्यपृच्छत्तं पुत्रं श्लाघ्यं प्रत्यागतं पुनः । दिव्यैर्गन्धैः समादिग्धं क्षीणस्वप्नमिवोत्थितम् ॥
data.md: The son, just restored to life, was still weak. His body was smeared with scents and the looked like one just awaking from a deep sleep. The Rishi asked hiin, saying.

data.v: अपि पुत्र जिता लोकाः शुभास्ते स्वेन कर्मणा । दिष्ट्या चासि पुनः प्राप्तो न हि ते मानुषं वपुः ॥
data.md: Have you, O son, acquired auspicious regions by your own deeds? By good luck, you have been restored to me. Your body does not seem to be human.

data.v: प्रत्यक्षदर्शी सर्वस्य पित्रा पृष्टो महात्मना । अन्वर्थं तं पितुर्मध्ये महर्षीणां न्यवेदयत् ॥
data.md: Thus asked by his great father. Nachiketa who had seen every thing with his own eyes, answered thus in the midst of the Rishis.

data.v: कुर्वन्भवच्छासनमाशु यातो; ह्यहं विशालां रुचिरप्रभावाम् । वैवस्वतीं प्राप्य सभामपश्यं; सहस्रशो योजनहैमभौमाम् ॥
data.md: In obedience to your command I proceeded to the vast region of Yama which is possessed of a charming effulgence. There I saw a palatial mansion which extended for thousands of Yojanas and emitted a golden splendour on every part.

data.v: दृष्ट्वैव मामभिमुखमापतन्तं; गृहं निवेद्यासनमादिदेश । वैवस्वतोऽर्घ्यादिभिरर्हणैश्च; भवत्कृते पूजयामास मां सः ॥
data.md: As soon as Yama saw me approaching with face towards him, he ordered his attendants, saying, Give him a good seat. Indeed the king of the dead, for your sake, adored me with the Arghya and other ingredients.

data.v: ततस्त्वहं तं शनकैरवोचं; वृतं सदस्यैरभिपूज्यमानम् । प्राप्तोऽस्मि ते विषयं धर्मराज; लोकानर्हे यान्स्म तान्मे विधत्स्व ॥
data.md: Thus adored by Yama and seated in the midst of his counsellors, I then asked him mildly, I have come to your house, O judge of the dead. Do you assign me those regions which I deserve for my acts.

data.v: यमोऽब्रवीन्मां न मृतोऽसि सौम्य; यमं पश्येत्याह तु त्वां तपस्वी । पिता प्रदीप्ताग्निसमानतेजा; न तच्छक्यमनृतं विप्र कर्तुम् ॥
data.md: Yama then answered me, saying, You are not dead, ( amiable one. Gifted with penances, your father said to you meet with Yama. The energy of your father is like that of a burning fire. I could not possibly falsify that speech of his.

data.v: दृष्टस्तेऽहं प्रतिगच्छस्व तात; शोचत्यसौ तव देहस्य कर्ता । ददामि किं चापि मनःप्रणीतं; प्रियातिथे तव कामान्वृणीष्व ॥
data.md: You have seen me. Do you go hence, O child. The author of your body is bewailing for you. You are my dear guest. What wish of yours shall I fulfil? Solicit the fruition of whatever desire you may have.

data.v: तेनैवमुक्तस्तमहं प्रत्यवोचं; प्राप्तोऽस्मि ते विषयं दुर्निवर्त्यम् । इच्छाम्यहं पुण्यकृतां समृद्धाँ;ल्लोकान्द्रष्टुं यदि तेऽहं वरार्हः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by him, I replied to the king of the dead, saying, I have arrived within your territory from which no traveller ever returns. If I am worthy of your attentions, I wish, O king of the dead, to see those regions of great prosperity and happiness that have been reserved for doers of virtuous deeds.

data.v: यानं समारोप्य तु मां स देवो; वाहैर्युक्तं सुप्रभं भानुमन्तम् । संदर्शयामास तदा स्म लोका;न्सर्वांस्तदा पुण्यकृतां द्विजेन्द्र ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by me, Yama made me mount a vehicle effulgent as the Sun and to which were yoked many excellent horses. Taking me on that car, he showed me, O foremost of twice born ones, all those charming regions that are reserved for the pious.

data.v: अपश्यं तत्र वेश्मानि तैजसानि कृतात्मनाम् । नानासंस्थानरूपाणि सर्वरत्नमयानि च ॥
data.md: I saw in those regions many effulgent palaces intended for great persons. Those mansions are of various forns and are adorned with every kind of gems.

data.v: चन्द्रमण्डलशुभ्राणि किङ्किणीजालवन्ति च । अनेकशतभौमानि सान्तर्जलवनानि च ॥
data.md: Bright as the lunar disc, they are ornamented with rows of tinkling bells, Hundreds among them are many storied. Within them are charming groves and gardens and transparent pools of water.

data.v: वैडूर्यार्कप्रकाशानि रूप्यरुक्ममयानि च । तरुणादित्यवर्णानि स्थावराणि चराणि च ॥
data.md: Effulgent like lapis lazuli and the Sun, and made of silver and gold, their colour resembles that of the morning Sun. Some of them are fixed and soine movable.

data.v: भक्ष्यभोज्यमयाञ्शैलान्वासांसि शयनानि च । सर्वकामफलांश्चैव वृक्षान्भवनसंस्थितान् ॥
data.md: Within them are many hills of foods any enjoyable articles, and dresses and beds in abundance. Within them are many trees capable of granting the fruition of every desire.

data.v: नद्यो वीथ्यः सभा वापी दीर्घिकाश्चैव सर्वशः । घोषवन्ति च यानानि युक्तान्येव सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: There are also many rivers and roads and spacious halls and lakes and large tanks. Thousands of cars with rattling wheels may be seen there, having excellent horses yoked to them.

data.v: क्षीरस्रवा वै सरितो गिरींश्च; सर्पिस्तथा विमलं चापि तोयम् । वैवस्वतस्यानुमतांश्च देशा;नदृष्टपूर्वान्सुबहूनपश्यम् ॥
data.md: Many rivers of milk, many hills of clarified butter and large pieces of transparent water are there. Indeed, I saw many such regions never seen by me before, of happiness and joy, approved by the king of dead.

data.v: सर्वं दृष्ट्वा तदहं धर्मराज;मवोचं वै प्रभविष्णुं पुराणम् । क्षीरस्यैताः सर्पिषश्चैव नद्यः; शश्वत्स्रोताः कस्य भोज्याः प्रदिष्टाः ॥
data.md: Seeing all those objects, I addressed the ancient and powerful judge of the dead, saying For whose use and enjoyment have these rivers with eternal currents of milk and clarified butter been ordained?

data.v: यमोऽब्रवीद्विद्धि भोज्यास्त्वमेता; ये दातारः साधवो गोरसानाम् । अन्ये लोकाः शाश्वता वीतशोकाः; समाकीर्णा गोप्रदाने रतानाम् ॥
data.md: Yama said These rivers of milk and clarified butter are for the enjoyment of those pious persons who make gifts in the world of men. Other eternal worlds there are which are filled with such palaces free from every sort of sorrow. These are reserved for th« se persons who make gift of kine.

data.v: न त्वेवासां दानमात्रं प्रशस्तं; पात्रं कालो गोविशेषो विधिश्च । ज्ञात्वा देया विप्र गवान्तरं हि; दुःखं ज्ञातुं पावकादित्यभूतम् ॥
data.md: The mere gift of kine is not laudable. There are considerations of fitness or otherwise about the person to whom kine should be given, the time for making those gifts, the kind of kine and rites that should be observed in making the gifts. Gifts of kine should be made after knowing the qualifications of both Brahmanas and the kine themselves. Kine should not be given to one in whose house they are likely to suffer from fire or the sun.

data.v: स्वाध्यायाढ्यो योऽतिमात्रं तपस्वी; वैतानस्थो ब्राह्मणः पात्रमासाम् । कृच्छ्रोत्सृष्टाः पोषणाभ्यागताश्च; द्वारैरेतैर्गोविशेषाः प्रशस्ताः ॥
data.md: That Brahmana, who is endued with Vedic learning, who is of austere penances, and who celebrates sacrifices, is considered as worthy of receiving kine in gift. Those kine which have been saved from distressful situations, or which have been given by poor householders from want of sufficient means to feed and cherish them, are for these reasons, counted as of great value.

data.v: तिस्रो रात्रीरद्भिरुपोष्य भूमौ; तृप्ता गावस्तर्पितेभ्यः प्रदेयाः । वत्सैः प्रीताः सुप्रजाः सोपचारा;स्त्र्यहं दत्त्वा गोरसैर्वर्तितव्यम् ॥
data.md: Abstaining from all food and subsisting upon water alone for three nights and sleeping the while on the naked earth, one should, having properly fed the kine intended to be given away, give them to Brahmanas after having pleased them also (with other gifts).

data.v: दत्त्वा धेनुं सुव्रतां कांस्यदोहां; कल्याणवत्सामपलायिनीं च । यावन्ति लोमानि भवन्ति तस्या;स्तावद्वर्षाण्यश्नुते स्वर्गलोकम् ॥
data.md: The kine, given away, should be accompanied by their calves. They should, again, be such as to bring forth good calves at the proper They should be accompanied with other articles. Having completed the gift, the giver should live for three days on only milk and abstaining from food of every other kind.

data.v: तथानड्वाहं ब्राह्मणाय प्रदाय; दान्तं धुर्यं बलवन्तं युवानम् । कुलानुजीवं वीर्यवन्तं बृहन्तं; भुङ्क्ते लोकान्संमितान्धेनुदस्य ॥
data.md: He, who gives a good cow that brings forth good calves at proper time, and that does not fly away from the owner's house, and accompanies such gifts with a vessel of white brass for milking her, enjoys the divine happiness for as many years as are measured by the number of hairs on the animal's body. He who gives a bull to a Brahmana, that is wellbroken and capable of carrying loads, strong and young in years, disinclined to do any mischief, largesized and powerful enjoys those regions, approved of the righteous, that are reserved for givers of kine.

data.v: गोषु क्षान्तं गोशरण्यं कृतज्ञं; वृत्तिग्लानं तादृशं पात्रमाहुः । वृत्तिग्लाने संभ्रमे वा महार्थे; कृष्यर्थे वा होमहेतोः प्रसूत्याम् ॥
गुर्वर्थे वा बालपुष्ट्याभिषङ्गा;द्गावो दातुं देशकालोऽविशिष्टः । अन्तर्जाताः सुक्रयज्ञानलब्धाः; प्राणक्रीता निर्जिताश्चौदकाश्च ॥
श्रुत्वा वैवस्वतवचस्तमहं पुनरब्रुवम् । अगोमी गोप्रदातॄणां कथं लोकान्निगच्छति ॥
data.md: Nachiketa said Hearing these words of Vaivasvata, the Regent of the dead, I once more addressed him, saying What are those objects by giving which, when kine cannot be had, givers may yet go to regions reserved for men making gifts of kine.

data.v: ततो यमोऽब्रवीद्धीमान्गोप्रदाने परां गतिम् । गोप्रदानानुकल्पं तु गामृते सन्ति गोप्रदाः ॥
data.md: Accosted by me, the wise Yama answered, explaining further what the end is which one wins by making gifts of kine. He said, In the absence of kine, a person by making gifts of the substitute of kine, acquires the merit of making gifts of kine.

data.v: अलाभे यो गवां दद्याद्घृतधेनुं यतव्रतः । तस्यैता घृतवाहिन्यः क्षरन्ते वत्सला इव ॥
data.md: If in the absence of kine, one makes a gift of a cow made of clarified butter, observant of a vow the while, one gets for one's use these rivers of clarified butter all of which approach one like an affectionate mother approaching her loved child.

data.v: घृतालाभे च यो दद्यात्तिलधेनुं यतव्रतः । स दुर्गात्तारितो धेन्वा क्षीरनद्यां प्रमोदते ॥
data.md: If in absence of even a cow made of clarified butter, one makes a gift of a cow made of sesame seeds, observing a vow the while, one succeeds with the help of that cow to get over all calamities in this world and to enjoy great happiness hereafter from these rivers of milk that you see.

data.v: तिलालाभे च यो दद्याज्जलधेनुं यतव्रतः । स कामप्रवहां शीतां नदीमेतामुपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: If a cow made of sesame seeds, is not available, one makes a gift of a cow made of water, he succeeds in coming to these happy regions and enjoying this river of cool and transparent water, that can grant the fruition of every desire.

data.v: एवमादीनि मे तत्र धर्मराजो न्यदर्शयत् । दृष्ट्वा च परमं हर्षमवापमहमच्युत ॥
data.md: The king of the dead explained to me all this while I was his guest, and, O you of unfading glory, great was the joy that I felt on seeing all the wonders he showed me.

data.v: निवेदये चापि प्रियं भवत्सु; क्रतुर्महानल्पधनप्रचारः । प्राप्तो मया तात स मत्प्रसूतः; प्रपत्स्यते वेदविधिप्रवृत्तः ॥
data.md: I shall now tell you what would certainly be agreeable to you. I have now got a great sacrifice whose performance does not require much riches. That sacrifice may be said to originate from me, O sire. Others will obtain it also. It is not quite of a piece with the ordinances of the Vedas.

data.v: शापो ह्ययं भवतोऽनुग्रहाय; प्राप्तो मया यत्र दृष्टो यमो मे । दानव्युष्टिं तत्र दृष्ट्वा महार्थां; निःसंदिग्धं दानधर्मांश्चरिष्ये ॥
data.md: The curse that you had imprecated on me was no curse but was in sooth a blessing, since it enabled me to see the great king of the dead. There I have seen what the rewards are of gifts. I shall henceforth, O you of great soul, practise the duty of gift without any doubt about its rewards.

data.v: इदं च मामब्रवीद्धर्मराजः; पुनः पुनः संप्रहृष्टो द्विजर्षे । दानेन तात प्रयतोऽभूः सदैव; विशेषतो गोप्रदानं च कुर्याः ॥
data.md: And, O great Rishi, the righteous Yama, filled with joy, repeatedly told me. One who, by making repeated gifts, has succeeded in acquiring purity of mind should then make gift of kine in particular.

data.v: शुद्धो ह्यर्थो नावमन्यः स्वधर्मा;त्पात्रे देयं देशकालोपपन्ने । तस्माद्गावस्ते नित्यमेव प्रदेया; मा भूच्च ते संशयः कश्चिदत्र ॥
data.md: The subject is fraught with sanctity. Do you never disregard the duties of gifts. Gifts, again, should be made to worth persons, when time and place are suitable. Do you, therefore, always make gifts of kine. Never entertain any doubt about it.

data.v: एताः पुरा अददन्नित्यमेव; शान्तात्मानो दानपथे निविष्टाः । तपांस्युग्राण्यप्रतिशङ्कमाना;स्ते वै दानं प्रददुश्चापि शक्त्या ॥
data.md: Devoted to the path of gifts, formerly many great persons used to make gifts of kine. Fearing to practise austere penances, they made gifts according to their power.

data.v: काले शक्त्या मत्सरं वर्जयित्वा; शुद्धात्मानः श्रद्धिनः पुण्यशीलाः । दत्त्वा तप्त्वा लोकममुं प्रपन्ना; देदीप्यन्ते पुण्यशीलाश्च नाके ॥
data.md: In time they shook off all sentiments of pride and vanity, and purified their souls. Engaged in performing Shraddhas in honour of the departed manes and in all religious acts of righteousness, they used to make, according to their power, gifts of kine, and as the reward of those acts they have attained to the celestial region and are shining in effulgence for such virtue.

data.v: एतद्दानं न्यायलब्धं द्विजेभ्यः; पात्रे दत्तं प्रापणीयं परीक्ष्य । काम्याष्टम्यां वर्तितव्यं दशाहं; रसैर्गवां शकृता प्रस्नवैर्वा ॥
data.md: One should, on the eighth day of the moon that is known by the name of Kamyashtami, make gifts a kine, properly got, to the Brahinanas, after determining the fitness of the recipients. After making the gift, one should then live for ten days together upon only the milk of kine, their dung and their urin ..

data.v: वेदव्रती स्याद्वृषभप्रदाता; वेदावाप्तिर्गोयुगस्य प्रदाने । तीर्थावाप्तिर्गोप्रयुक्तप्रदाने; पापोत्सर्गः कपिलायाः प्रदाने ॥
data.md: The merit that one acquires by making a gift of a bull is equal to that of the divine cow. By making a gift of a couple of kine one gains, as the reward thereof, a mastery of the Vedas. By making a gift of cars and vehicles with kine yoked thereto, one wins the merit of baths in sacred water. By making a gift of a cow of the Kapila kine, one becomes purged of all his sins.

data.v: गामप्येकां कपिलां संप्रदाय; न्यायोपेतां कल्मषाद्विप्रमुच्येत् । गवां रसात्परमं नास्ति किंचि;द्गवां दानं सुमहत्तद्वदन्ति ॥
data.md: Indeed by giving away even a single cow of the Kapila kine that has been acquired by fair means, one becomes purged of all his sins. There is nothing higher than the milk which is given by kine. The gift of a cow is truly considered as a very superior gift.

data.v: गावो लोकान्धारयन्ति क्षरन्त्यो; गावश्चान्नं संजनयन्ति लोके । यस्तज्जानन्न गवां हार्दमेति; स वै गन्ता निरयं पापचेताः ॥
data.md: Kine, by giving milk, rescue all the worlds from calamity. It is kine, again, that produce the food upon which creatures live. One who, knowing the extent of the service that kine do, does not entertain in his heart love for kine, is a sinner who is sure to sink in Hell.

data.v: यत्ते दातुं गोसहस्रं शतं वा; शतार्धं वा दश वा साधुवत्साः । अप्येकां वा साधवे ब्राह्मणाय; सास्यामुष्मिन्पुण्यतीर्था नदी वै ॥
data.md: If one gives a thousand or a hundred or ten or five kine, indeed, if one gives to a pious Brahmana even a single cow which brings forth good calves at proper seasons, he is sure to see that cow approach him in Heaven in the form of a river of sacred water capable of granting the fruition of every desire.

data.v: प्राप्त्या पुष्ट्या लोकसंरक्षणेन; गावस्तुल्याः सूर्यपादैः पृथिव्याम् । शब्दश्चैकः संततिश्चोपभोग;स्तस्माद्गोदः सूर्य इवाभिभाति ॥
data.md: About prosperity and the growth that kine confer, in the matter also of the protection that kine grant to all creatures of the Earth, kine are equal to the very rays of the Sun that fall on the Earth. The word that signifies the cow means also the rays of the Sun. The giver of a cow begets a very large progeny inhabiting a large part of the Earth. Hence, he who gives a cow shines like a second Sun in effulgence.

data.v: गुरुं शिष्यो वरयेद्गोप्रदाने; स वै वक्ता नियतं स्वर्गदाता । विधिज्ञानां सुमहानेष धर्मो; विधिं ह्याद्यं विधयः संश्रयन्ति ॥
data.md: The disciple should, in the matter of making gifts of kine, select his preceptor. Such a disciple is sure to go to Heaven every time. The selection of a preceptor is considered as a high duty by persons knowing the ordinances. This is, indeed, the initial ordinance. All other ordinances depend upon it.

data.v: एतद्दानं न्यायलब्धं द्विजेभ्यः; पात्रे दत्त्वा प्रापयेथाः परीक्ष्य । त्वय्याशंसन्त्यमरा मानवाश्च; वयं चापि प्रसृते पुण्यशीलाः ॥
data.md: One should, on the eighth day of the moon that is known by the name of Kamyashtami, make gifts a kine, properly got, to the Brahinanas, after determining the fitness of the recipients. After making the gift, one should then live for ten days together upon only the milk of kine, their dung and their urin ..

data.v: इत्युक्तोऽहं धर्मराज्ञा महर्षे; धर्मात्मानं शिरसाभिप्रणम्य । अनुज्ञातस्तेन वैवस्वतेन; प्रत्यागमं भगवत्पादमूलम् ॥
data.md: Thus did the judge of the dead speak to me, O twiceborn Rishi. I then bowed my head to the righteous Yama. Getting his permission I left his kingdom and have now come to the sole of your feet.

data.v: उक्तं वै गोप्रदानं ते नाचिकेतमृषिं प्रति । माहात्म्यमपि चैवोक्तमुद्देशेन गवां प्रभो ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have O grandfather, describe to me the topic of gifts of kine in speaking of the Rishi Nachiketa You have also, related O powerful one, the efficacy and preeminence of that act.

data.v: नृगेण च यथा दुःखमनुभूतं महात्मना । एकापराधादज्ञानात्पितामह महामते ॥
data.md: You have also told me O grandfather, of great intelligence, the exceedingly painful character of the misfortune that befell the great king Nriga on account of a single transgression of his.

data.v: द्वारवत्यां यथा चासौ निविशन्त्यां समुद्धृतः । मोक्षहेतुरभूत्कृष्णस्तदप्यवधृतं मया ॥
data.md: He had to live for a long time at Dvaravati (in the form of a mighty lizard) and how Krishna became the instrument of his rescue from that miserable condition.

data.v: किं त्वस्ति मम संदेहो गवां लोकं प्रति प्रभो । तत्त्वतः श्रोतुमिच्छामि गोदा यत्र विशन्त्युत ॥
data.md: I have, however one doubt. About the regions of kine. I wish to hear particularly about those regions which are reserved for the residence of persons who make gifts of kine.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । यथापृच्छत्पद्मयोनिमेतदेव शतक्रतुः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Regarding it is cited the old discourse between him who sprang from the primeval lotus and him who performed a hundred sacrifices.

data.v: स्वर्लोकवासिनां लक्ष्मीमभिभूय स्वया त्विषा । गोलोकवासिनः पश्ये व्रजतः संशयोऽत्र मे ॥
data.md: Shakra said I see, O grandfather, that those who live in the region of kine transcend by their effulgence the prosperity of the celestial dwellers and pass them by. This has created a doubt in my mind.

data.v: कीदृशा भगवँल्लोका गवां तद्ब्रूहि मेऽनघ । यानावसन्ति दातार एतदिच्छामि वेदितुम् ॥
data.md: Of what kind, O holy one, are the regions of kine? Tell me all about them, O sinless one. Indeed, what is the nature of those regions that are inhabited by givers of kine? I wish to know this.

data.v: कीदृशाः किंफलाः कः स्वित्परमस्तत्र वै गुणः । कथं च पुरुषास्तत्र गच्छन्ति विगतज्वराः ॥
data.md: Of what kind are those regions? What fruits do they yield? What is the highest object there which the inhabitants thereof succeed in acquiring? What are its virtues. How also do men, shorn of anxiety, succeed in going to those regions?

data.v: कियत्कालं प्रदानस्य दाता च फलमश्नुते । कथं बहुविधं दानं स्यादल्पमपि वा कथम् ॥
data.md: For what period does the giver of a cow enjoy the fruits of his gift? How may persons make gifts of many kine and how may they make gifts of a few kine?

data.v: बह्वीनां कीदृशं दानमल्पानां वापि कीदृशम् । अदत्त्वा गोप्रदाः सन्ति केन वा तच्च शंस मे ॥
data.md: What are the merits of the gifts of many kine and what those of the gifts of a few only. How also do persons become givers of kine without really giving any kine? Do you tell me all this.

data.v: कथं च बहुदाता स्यादल्पदात्रा समः प्रभो । अल्पप्रदाता बहुदः कथं च स्यादिहेश्वर ॥
data.md: How does one making gifts of even many kine, O powerful lord, become the equal of one who has made gifts of only a few kine? How also does one who has made gifts of only few kine equal one who has made gifts of many kine?

data.v: कीदृशी दक्षिणा चैव गोप्रदाने विशिष्यते । एतत्तथ्येन भगवन्मम शंसितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: What kind of present is considered and distinguished for preeminence in the matter of gifts of kine? You should, O holy one, describe to me all this according to truth.

data.v: योऽयं प्रश्नस्त्वया पृष्टो गोप्रदानाधिकारवान् । नास्य प्रष्टास्ति लोकेऽस्मिंस्त्वत्तोऽन्यो हि शतक्रतो ॥
data.md: The grandfather said The questions you have put to me about kine, beginning with their gift, are such that there is none else in the three world, O you of a hundred sacrifices, who could put them.

data.v: सन्ति नानाविधा लोका यांस्त्वं शक्र न पश्यसि । पश्यामि यानहं लोकानेकपत्न्यश्च याः स्त्रियः ॥
data.md: There are many kinds of regions, O Shakra, which are invisible to even you. Those regions are seen by me. O Indra,, as also by those women who are chaste and who have been devoted to only one husband.

data.v: कर्मभिश्चापि सुशुभैः सुव्रता ऋषयस्तथा । सशरीरा हि तान्यान्ति ब्राह्मणाः शुभवृत्तयः ॥
data.md: Rishis observe excellent vows, by means of their deeds of virtue and piety and Brahmanas of righteous souls, succeed in going there in even their human bodies.

data.v: शरीरन्यासमोक्षेण मनसा निर्मलेन च । स्वप्नभूतांश्च ताँल्लोकान्पश्यन्तीहापि सुव्रताः ॥
data.md: Men who perform excellent vows see those regions which resemble the bright creations of dreams helped by their purified minds and by that (temporary) liberation which succeeds the loss of one's consciousness of body.

data.v: ते तु लोकाः सहस्राक्ष शृणु यादृग्गुणान्विताः । न तत्र क्रमते कालो न जरा न च पापकम् । तथान्यन्नाशुभं किंचिन्न व्याधिस्तत्र न क्लमः ॥
data.md: O you, of a thousand eyes, hear me as I tell you what the attributes are of those regions. There the very course of Time is stopped. Decrepitude is not there nor Fire which is omnipresent in the universe. There is slightest transgression does not take place, nor disease, nor weakness of any sort.

data.v: यद्यच्च गावो मनसा तस्मिन्वाञ्छन्ति वासव । तत्सर्वं प्रापयन्ति स्म मम प्रत्यक्षदर्शनात् । कामगाः कामचारिण्यः कामात्कामांश्च भुञ्जते ॥
data.md: The kine which live there, O Vasava, acquire the fruition of every desire which they cherish in their hearts. I have direct experience of what I say to you.

data.v: वाप्यः सरांसि सरितो विविधानि वनानि च । गृहाणि पर्वताश्चैव यावद्द्रव्यं च किंचन ॥
मनोज्ञं सर्वभूतेभ्यः सर्वं तत्र प्रदृश्यते । ईदृशान्विद्धि ताँल्लोकान्नास्ति लोकस्ततोऽधिकः ॥
तत्र सर्वसहाः क्षान्ता वत्सला गुरुवर्तिनः । अहंकारैर्विरहिता यान्ति शक्र नरोत्तमाः ॥
data.md: All those foremost of men, O Shakra, who are forgiving to all creatures, who endure everything, who are full of love for all things, who render dutiful obedience to their preceptors, and who are freed from pride and vanity, go to those regions of supreme happiness.

data.v: यः सर्वमांसानि न भक्षयीत; पुमान्सदा यावदन्ताय युक्तः । मातापित्रोरर्चिता सत्ययुक्तः; शुश्रूषिता ब्राह्मणानामनिन्द्यः ॥
अक्रोधनो गोषु तथा द्विजेषु; धर्मे रतो गुरुशुश्रूषकश्च । यावज्जीवं सत्यवृत्ते रतश्च; दाने रतो यः क्षमी चापराधे ॥
मृदुर्दान्तो देवपरायणश्च; सर्वातिथिश्चापि तथा दयावान् । ईदृग्गुणो मानवः संप्रयाति; लोकं गवां शाश्वतं चाव्ययं च ॥
न पारदारी पश्यति लोकमेनं; न वै गुरुघ्नो न मृषाप्रलापी । सदापवादी ब्राह्मणः शान्तवेदो; दोषैरन्यैर्यश्च युक्तो दुरात्मा ॥
न मित्रध्रुङ्नैकृतिकः कृतघ्नः; शठोऽनृजुर्धर्मविद्वेषकश्च । न ब्रह्महा मनसापि प्रपश्ये;द्गवां लोकं पुण्यकृतां निवासम् ॥
एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं नैपुणेन सुरेश्वर । गोप्रदानरतानां तु फलं शृणु शतक्रतो ॥
data.md: I have told you everything particularly about the regions of kine, O king of the celestials. Hear now, O you of a hundred sacrifices, the merit of persons who are engaged in making gifts of kine.

data.v: दायाद्यलब्धैरर्थैर्यो गाः क्रीत्वा संप्रयच्छति । धर्मार्जितधनक्रीतान्स लोकानश्नुतेऽक्षयान् ॥
data.md: He who makes gifts of kine, after purchasing them with money obtained by inheritance or acquired by fair means, attains, as the fruit of such an act, to many regions of endless happiness.

data.v: यो वै द्यूते धनं जित्वा गाः क्रीत्वा संप्रयच्छति । स दिव्यमयुतं शक्र वर्षाणां फलमश्नुते ॥
data.md: He who makes a gift of a cow, having acquired it with money, won at dice, enjoys happiness, O Shakra, for ten thousand celestial years.

data.v: दायाद्या यस्य वै गावो न्यायपूर्वैरुपार्जिताः । प्रदत्तास्ताः प्रदातॄणां संभवन्त्यक्षया ध्रुवाः ॥
data.md: He who acquires a cow as his share of ancestral riches is said to acquire her legitimately. Such a cow may be given away. They who make gifts of kine so acquired, obtain innumerable endless regions of eternal happiness.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य च यो दद्याद्गाः सुशुद्धेन चेतसा । तस्यापीहाक्षयाँल्लोकान्ध्रुवान्विद्धि शचीपते ॥
data.md: That person who having acquired a cow in gift makes a gift of her with a pure heart, succeeds, forsooth, O lord of Sachi, in Obtaining eternal regions of beatitude.

data.v: जन्मप्रभृति सत्यं च यो ब्रूयान्नियतेन्द्रियः । गुरुद्विजसहः क्षान्तस्तस्य गोभिः समा गतिः ॥
data.md: That person who with controlled senses speaks the truth from his birth and who endures everything at the hands of his preceptor and of the Brahmanas, and who practises forgiveness, gains an end that is equal to that of kine.

data.v: न जातु ब्राह्मणो वाच्यो यदवाच्यं शचीपते । मनसा गोषु न द्रुह्येद्गोवृत्तिर्गोनुकम्पकः ॥
data.md: Improper words, O lord of Shachi, should never be addressed to a Brahmana. One, again, should not, in even his mind, do an injury to a cow. One should in his conduct, imitate the cow, and show mercy towards the cow.

data.v: सत्ये धर्मे च निरतस्तस्य शक्र फलं शृणु । गोसहस्रेण समिता तस्य धेनुर्भवत्युत ॥
data.md: Hear, O Shakra, of the fruits which truthful persons enjoy. If such a person gives away a single cow, that becomes thousandfold.

data.v: क्षत्रियस्य गुणैरेभिरन्वितस्य फलं शृणु । तस्यापि शततुल्या गौर्भवतीति विनिश्चयः ॥
data.md: If Kshatriya endued with such qualifications, makes a gift of a single cow, his merit equals that of a Brahmana's That single cow, listen, O Shakra, which such a Kshatriya gives away produces as much merit as the single cow that a Brahmana gives away does under similar circumstances. This is the issue of the scriptures.

data.v: वैश्यस्यैते यदि गुणास्तस्य पञ्चाशतं भवेत् । शूद्रस्यापि विनीतस्य चतुर्भागफलं स्मृतम् ॥
data.md: If a Vaishya, endued with similar accomplishments, were to make a gift of a single cow, that cow would equal five hundred kine. If a Shudra endued with humility were to make a gift of a cow, such cow would be equal to a hundred and twenty five kine. one COW a a

data.v: एतच्चैवं योऽनुतिष्ठेत युक्तः; सत्येन युक्तो गुरुशुश्रूषया च । दान्तः क्षान्तो देवतार्ची प्रशान्तः; शुचिर्बुद्धो धर्मशीलोऽनहंवाक् ॥
महत्फलं प्राप्नुते स द्विजाय; दत्त्वा दोग्ध्रीं विधिनानेन धेनुम् । नित्यं दद्यादेकभक्तः सदा च; सत्ये स्थितो गुरुशुश्रूषिता च ॥
वेदाध्यायी गोषु यो भक्तिमांश्च; नित्यं दृष्ट्वा योऽभिनन्देत गाश्च । आ जातितो यश्च गवां नमेत; इदं फलं शक्र निबोध तस्य ॥
data.md: Hear, O Shakra, what the merit is of that person who, duly studying the Vedas, shows respect for kine, who always becomes glad on seeing kine, and who since his birth always bows his head to kine.

data.v: यत्स्यादिष्ट्वा राजसूये फलं तु; यत्स्यादिष्ट्वा बहुना काञ्चनेन । एतत्तुल्यं फलमस्याहुरग्र्यं; सर्वे सन्तस्त्वृषयो ये च सिद्धाः ॥
data.md: The merit which one wins by celebrating the Rajasuya sacrifice, the merit that one acquires by making gifts of heaps of gold, that high merit is acquired by a person who shows such respect for kine. Virtuous Rishis and great persons crowned with success have said so.

data.v: योऽग्रं भक्तान्किंचिदप्राश्य दद्या;द्गोभ्यो नित्यं गोव्रती सत्यवादी । शान्तो बुद्धो गोसहस्रस्य पुण्यं; संवत्सरेणाप्नुयात्पुण्यशीलः ॥
data.md: Given to truth, possessed of a tranquil soul, free from cupidity, always truthful in speech, and behaving with respect towards kine with the steadiness of a vow, the man who, for a whole year, before himself taking any food, regularly presents some food to kine, acquires the merit, by such an act, of the gift of a thousand kine.

data.v: य एकं भक्तमश्नीयाद्दद्यादेकं गवां च यत् । दश वर्षाण्यनन्तानि गोव्रती गोनुकम्पकः ॥
data.md: That man who takes only one meal a day and who gives away the entire quantity of his other meal to kine, that man, who thus respects kine with the steadiness of a vow and shows such mercy towards them, enjoys for ten years unlimited happiness.

data.v: एकेनैव च भक्तेन यः क्रीत्वा गां प्रयच्छति । यावन्ति तस्य प्रोक्तानि दिवसानि शतक्रतो । तावच्छतानां स गवां फलमाप्नोति शाश्वतम् ॥
data.md: That man who takes himself only one meal a day and with the other meal saved for some time purchases a cow and makes a gift of it, acquires, through that gift, O you of a hundred sacrifices, the eternal merit of the gift of as many kine as there are hairs on the body of that single cow so given away.

data.v: ब्राह्मणस्य फलं हीदं क्षत्रियेऽभिहितं शृणु । पञ्चवार्षिकमेतत्तु क्षत्रियस्य फलं स्मृतम् । ततोऽर्धेन तु वैश्यस्य शूद्रो वैश्यार्धतः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: That man who sells himself and with the proceeds thereof purchases kini and gives them away to Brahmanas, enjoys happiness in Heaven for as long a period as kin are seen on Earth.

data.v: यश्चात्मविक्रयं कृत्वा गाः क्रीत्वा संप्रयच्छति । यावतीः स्पर्शयेद्गा वै तावत्तु फलमश्नुते । लोम्नि लोम्नि महाभाग लोकाश्चास्याक्षयाः स्मृताः ॥
संग्रामेष्वर्जयित्वा तु यो वै गाः संप्रयच्छति । आत्मविक्रयतुल्यास्ताः शाश्वता विद्धि कौशिक ॥
अलाभे यो गवां दद्यात्तिलधेनुं यतव्रतः । दुर्गात्स तारितो धेन्वा क्षीरनद्यां प्रमोदते ॥
data.md: If in absence of even a cow made of clarified butter, one makes a gift of a cow made of sesame seeds, observing a vow the while, one succeeds with the help of that cow to get over all calamities in this world and to enjoy great happiness hereafter from these rivers of milk that you see.

data.v: न त्वेवासां दानमात्रं प्रशस्तं; पात्रं कालो गोविशेषो विधिश्च । कालज्ञानं विप्र गवान्तरं हि; दुःखं ज्ञातुं पावकादित्यभूतम् ॥
data.md: The mere gift of kine is not laudable. There are considerations of fitness or otherwise about the person to whom kine should be given, the time for making those gifts, the kind of kine and rites that should be observed in making the gifts. Gifts of kine should be made after knowing the qualifications of both Brahmanas and the kine themselves. Kine should not be given to one in whose house they are likely to suffer from fire or the sun.

data.v: स्वाध्यायाढ्यं शुद्धयोनिं प्रशान्तं; वैतानस्थं पापभीरुं कृतज्ञम् । गोषु क्षान्तं नातितीक्ष्णं शरण्यं; वृत्तिग्लानं तादृशं पात्रमाहुः ॥
data.md: One who is rich in Vedic learning, who is of pure birth, who is gifted with a tranquil soul, who is given to the celebration of sacrifices, who fears the perpetration of sin, who is gifted with varied knowledge, who is compassionate towards kine, who is mild in conduct, who gives protection to all who seek it of him, and who has no means of livelihood assigned to him, is considered as a proper person for receiving a gift of kine.

data.v: वृत्तिग्लाने सीदति चातिमात्रं; कृष्यर्थं वा होमहेतोः प्रसूत्याम् । गुर्वर्थं वा बालसंवृद्धये वा; धेनुं दद्याद्देशकाले विशिष्टे ॥
data.md: To a Brahmana who has no means of livelihood to him while he is want of food for purposes of agriculture, for a child born on account of Homa, for the purposes of his preceptor, for the sustenance of a child born should a cow be given. Indeed, the gift should be made at a proper time and in a proper place.

data.v: अन्तर्जाताः सुक्रयज्ञानलब्धाः; प्राणक्रीता निर्जिताश्चौकजाश्च । कृच्छ्रोत्सृष्टाः पोषणाभ्यागताश्च; द्वारैरेतैर्गोविशेषाः प्रशस्ताः ॥
data.md: That Brahmana, who is endued with Vedic learning, who is of austere penances, and who celebrates sacrifices, is considered as worthy of receiving kine in gift. Those kine which have been saved from distressful situations, or which have been given by poor householders from want of sufficient means to feed and cherish them, are for these reasons, counted as of great value.

data.v: बलान्विताः शीलवयोपपन्नाः; सर्वाः प्रशंसन्ति सुगन्धवत्यः । यथा हि गङ्गा सरितां वरिष्ठा; तथार्जुनीनां कपिला वरिष्ठा ॥
data.md: Or as Those kine which are strong of body, which have good dispositions and which emit a sweet fragrance, are highly spoken of in the matter of gifts. As Ganga is the foremost of all rivers, so is Kapila the foremost of all kine.

data.v: तिस्रो रात्रीस्त्वद्भिरुपोष्य भूमौ; तृप्ता गावस्तर्पितेभ्यः प्रदेयाः । वत्सैः पुष्टैः क्षीरपैः सुप्रचारा;स्त्र्यहं दत्त्वा गोरसैर्वर्तितव्यम् ॥
data.md: Abstaining from all food and subsisting upon water alone for three nights and sleeping the while on the naked earth, one should, having properly fed the kine intended to be given away, give them to Brahmanas after having pleased them also (with other gifts).

data.v: दत्त्वा धेनुं सुव्रतां साधुवत्सां; कल्याणवृत्तामपलायिनीं च । यावन्ति लोमानि भवन्ति तस्या;स्तावन्ति वर्षाणि वसत्यमुत्र ॥
data.md: By giving away a goodnatured cow, that quietly allows herself to be milked, that always brings forth living and healthy calves, and that does not fly away from the owner's house, the giver enjoys happiness in the next world for as many years as there are hairs on her body.

data.v: तथानड्वाहं ब्राह्मणायाथ धुर्यं; दत्त्वा युवानं बलिनं विनीतम् । हलस्य वोढारमनन्तवीर्यं; प्राप्नोति लोकान्दशधेनुदस्य ॥
data.md: Likewise, by giving to a Brahmana a bull that is capable of carrying heavy loads, that is young and strong and quiet, that quietly bears the yoke of the plough, and that is possessed of such energy as is sufficient to undergo even great labour, one acquires such regions as are his who gives away ten kine.

data.v: कान्तारे ब्राह्मणान्गाश्च यः परित्राति कौशिक । क्षेमेण च विमुच्येत तस्य पुण्यफलं शृणु । अश्वमेधक्रतोस्तुल्यं फलं भवति शाश्वतम् ॥
data.md: rescues That person who kine and Brahmanas in the forest, O Kaushika, is himself rescued from every sort of danger. Hear what his merit is.

यस्त्वेतेनैव विधिना गां वनेष्वनुगच्छति । तृणगोमयपर्णाशी निःस्पृहो नियतः शुचिः ॥
अकामं तेन वस्तव्यं मुदितेन शतक्रतो । मम लोके सुरैः सार्धं लोके यत्रापि चेच्छति ॥
जानन्यो गामपहरेद्विक्रीयाद्वार्थकारणात् । एतद्विज्ञातुमिच्छामि का नु तस्य गतिर्भवेत् ॥
data.md: Indra said I desire to know. O Grandfather, what the end is of his who consciously steals a cow or who sells one from motives of cupidity.

data.v: भक्षार्थं विक्रयार्थं वा येऽपहारं हि कुर्वते । दानार्थं वा ब्राह्मणाय तत्रेदं श्रूयतां फलम् ॥
data.md: The Grandfather said Hear of the consequences that befall those persons who steal a cow for killing her for food or selling her for money, or making a gift of her to a Brahmana.

data.v: विक्रयार्थं हि यो हिंस्याद्भक्षयेद्वा निरङ्कुशः । घातयानं हि पुरुषं येऽनुमन्येयुरर्थिनः ॥
data.md: He who, without being governed by the restrains of the Scriptures, sells a cow, or kills one, or eats the flesh of a cow, or they who, for the sake of money, allow a person to kill kine, all these, viz., he that kills, he that eats, and he that allows the destriction, rot in hell for as many years as there are hairs on the body of the cow so killed.

data.v: घातकः खादको वापि तथा यश्चानुमन्यते । यावन्ति तस्या लोमानि तावद्वर्षाणि मज्जति ॥
ये दोषा यादृशाश्चैव द्विजयज्ञोपघातके । विक्रये चापहारे च ते दोषा वै स्मृताः प्रभो ॥
data.md: O you of great power, those sins and those kinds of faults that have been said to attach to one which obstructs a Brahmana's sacrifice, are said to attach to the sale and the theft of kine.

data.v: अपहृत्य तु यो गां वै ब्राह्मणाय प्रयच्छति । यावद्दाने फलं तस्यास्तावन्निरयमृच्छति ॥
data.md: That man who having stolen a cow makes a gift of her to a Brahmana, enjoys happiness in Heaven as the reward of the gift but suffers misery in Hell for the sin of theft for the same period.

data.v: सुवर्णं दक्षिणामाहुर्गोप्रदाने महाद्युते । सुवर्णं परमं ह्युक्तं दक्षिणार्थमसंशयम् ॥
data.md: Gold has been said to form the present, O you of great splendour, in gifts of kine. Indeed, gold has been said to be the best present in all sacrifices.

data.v: गोप्रदानं तारयते सप्त पूर्वांस्तथा परान् । सुवर्णं दक्षिणां दत्त्वा तावद्द्विगुणमुच्यते ॥
data.md: By making a gift of kine one is said to rescue his ancestors to seventh degree as also his descendants to the seventh degree. By giving away kine with the presents of gold, one rescues his ancestors and descendants of double the number.

data.v: सुवर्णं परमं दानं सुवर्णं दक्षिणा परा । सुवर्णं पावनं शक्र पावनानां परं स्मृतम् ॥
data.md: The gift of gold is the best of gifts. Gold is, again, the best present. Gold is a great purifier. O Shakra, and is, indeed, the best of all purifying objects.

data.v: कुलानां पावनं प्राहुर्जातरूपं शतक्रतो । एषा मे दक्षिणा प्रोक्ता समासेन महाद्युते ॥
data.md: O you of a hundred sacrifices, gold has been said to be the purifier of the entire family of him who gives it away. I have thus, O you of great splendour, told you in brief of Dakshina.

data.v: एतत्पितामहेनोक्तमिन्द्राय भरतर्षभ । इन्द्रो दशरथायाह रामायाह पिता तथा ॥
data.md: Bhishma said This was said by the Grandfather to Indra, O chief of Bharata's race. Indra delivered it to Dasharatha, and Dasharatha in his turn to his son Rama.

data.v: राघवोऽपि प्रियभ्रात्रे लक्ष्मणाय यशस्विने । ऋषिभ्यो लक्ष्मणेनोक्तमरण्ये वसता विभो ॥
data.md: Rama of Raghu's race gave it to his dear and illustrious brother Lakshmana. While living in the forest, Lakshmana imparted it to the Rishis.

data.v: पारंपर्यागतं चेदमृषयः संशितव्रताः । दुर्धरं धारयामासू राजानश्चैव धार्मिकाः । उपाध्यायेन गदितं मम चेदं युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: It has then described from generation to generation, for the Rishis of rigid vows held it amongst themselves as also the pious kings of the Earth.

data.v: य इदं ब्राह्मणो नित्यं वदेद्ब्राह्मणसंसदि । यज्ञेषु गोप्रदानेषु द्वयोरपि समागमे ॥
data.md: My preceptor, O Yudhishthira, communicated it to me. That Brahmana who recites it every day in the conclaves of Brahmanas, in sacrifices, of at gifts of kine, or when two persons meet together, acquires hereafter many regions of unending happiness where he always lives with the celestials as his companions. The holy Brahman, the supreme Lord, had said so.

data.v: तस्य लोकाः किलाक्षय्या दैवतैः सह नित्यदा । इति ब्रह्मा स भगवानुवाच परमेश्वरः ॥
विस्रम्भितोऽहं भवता धर्मान्प्रवदता विभो । प्रवक्ष्यामि तु संदेहं तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said I have been greatly assured, O you of power, by you thus discoursing to me of duties. I shall, however, express the doubts I have. Explain them to me, O grandfather.

data.v: व्रतानां किं फलं प्रोक्तं कीदृशं वा महाद्युते । नियमानां फलं किं च स्वधीतस्य च किं फलम् ॥
data.md: What are the fruits, described in the scriptures, of the vows that men observe. Of what nature are the fruits, you of great splendour, of observances of other kind? What, again, are the fruits of one's Vedic studies.

data.v: दमस्येह फलं किं च वेदानां धारणे च किम् । अध्यापने फलं किं च सर्वमिच्छामि वेदितुम् ॥
data.md: What are the fruits of gifts, and what those of keeping the Vedas in memory? What are the fruits of teaching the Vedas? I wish to know all this.

data.v: अप्रतिग्राहके किं च फलं लोके पितामह । तस्य किं च फलं दृष्टं श्रुतं यः संप्रयच्छति ॥
data.md: What, O grandfather, are the merits of the nonacceptance of gifts in this world. What fruits does one enjoy who makes gifts of knowledge?

data.v: स्वकर्मनिरतानां च शूराणां चापि किं फलम् । सत्ये च किं फलं प्रोक्तं ब्रह्मचर्ये च किं फलम् ॥
data.md: What merits do persons enjoy who perform the duties of their order, as also do heroes who do not retreat from the battlefield. What are the fruits of the observance of purity and of the practice of Brahmacharya?

data.v: पितृशुश्रूषणे किं च मातृशुश्रूषणे तथा । आचार्यगुरुशुश्रूषास्वनुक्रोशानुकम्पने ॥
data.md: What are the merits of serving the parents. What also are the merits of serving preceptors and teachers, and what the merits of mercy and kindness?

data.v: एतत्सर्वमशेषेण पितामह यथातथम् । वेत्तुमिच्छामि धर्मज्ञ परं कौतूहलं हि मे ॥
data.md: I wish to know all this, O grandfather, in sooth and in particular, O you, who are conversant with all the scriptures Great is my curiosity.

data.v: यो व्रतं वै यथोद्दिष्टं तथा संप्रतिपद्यते । अखण्डं सम्यगारब्धं तस्य लोकाः सनातनाः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said He enjoys eternal regions of happiness, who, having properly commenced a Vrata (vow) completes its observance according to the scriptures.

data.v: नियमानां फलं राजन्प्रत्यक्षमिह दृश्यते । नियमानां क्रतूनां च त्वयावाप्तमिदं फलम् ॥
data.md: The fruits of restraints, O king, are visible even in this world. These rewards that you have acquired are those of Niyamas and sacrifices.

data.v: स्वधीतस्यापि च फलं दृश्यतेऽमुत्र चेह च । इहलोकेऽर्थवान्नित्यं ब्रह्मलोके च मोदते ॥
data.md: The fruits of the Vedic studies are seen both in this world and the next. The person who is given to the study of the Vedas is seen to sport happily both in this world and in the region of Brahma.

data.v: दमस्य तु फलं राजञ्शृणु त्वं विस्तरेण मे । दान्ताः सर्वत्र सुखिनो दान्ताः सर्वत्र निर्वृताः ॥
data.md: Listen now to me, O king, as I tell you in detail what that fruits, are of self-control. The self-controlled are happy everywhere. The selfcontrolled always enjoy that happiness which results from the absence or subjugation of desire.

data.v: यत्रेच्छागामिनो दान्ताः सर्वशत्रुनिषूदनाः । प्रार्थयन्ति च यद्दान्ता लभन्ते तन्न संशयः ॥
data.md: The self-controlled can go everywhere at will. The self-controlled can destroy every enemy. Forsooth, the self-controlled succeed in getting everything they seek.

data.v: युज्यन्ते सर्वकामैर्हि दान्ताः सर्वत्र पाण्डव । स्वर्गे तथा प्रमोदन्ते तपसा विक्रमेण च ॥
data.md: The self-controlled. O son of Pandu, obtain the fruition of every desire. The self-controlled and the forgiving share the happiness that men enjoy in Heaven through penances and prowess, (in arms), through gift, and through various sacrifices.

data.v: दानैर्यज्ञैश्च विविधैर्यथा दान्ताः क्षमान्विताः । दाता कुप्यति नो दान्तस्तस्माद्दानात्परो दमः ॥
यस्तु दद्यादकुप्यन्हि तस्य लोकाः सनातनाः । क्रोधो हन्ति हि यद्दानं तस्माद्दानात्परो दमः ॥
अदृश्यानि महाराज स्थानान्ययुतशो दिवि । ऋषीणां सर्वलोकेषु यानीतो यान्ति देवताः ॥
दमेन यानि नृपते गच्छन्ति परमर्षयः । कामयाना महत्स्थानं तस्माद्दानात्परो दमः ॥
data.md: O king, the great Rishis repair there, helped only by their self-control, and as the end of their efforts to attain to a region of superior happiness, Hence, self-control is superior to gift.

data.v: अध्यापकः परिक्लेशादक्षयं फलमश्नुते । विधिवत्पावकं हुत्वा ब्रह्मलोके नराधिप ॥
data.md: The person who becomes a preceptor, and who duly adores the fire taking leave of all his miseries in this world, enjoy endless happiness O King in the region of Brahma.

data.v: अधीत्यापि हि यो वेदान्न्यायविद्भ्यः प्रयच्छति । गुरुकर्मप्रशंसी च सोऽपि स्वर्गे महीयते ॥
data.md: That man who having himself read the Vedas, imparts a knowledge thereof to righteous disciples, and who praises the acts of his own preceptor, acquires great honors in Heaven.

data.v: क्षत्रियोऽध्ययने युक्तो यजने दानकर्मणि । युद्धे यश्च परित्राता सोऽपि स्वर्गे महीयते ॥
data.md: That Kshatriya who is given to the studies of the Vedas, to the celebration of sacrifices, to the making of gifts, and who rescues the lives of others in battle, similarly acquires great honors in Heaveri.

data.v: वैश्यः स्वकर्मनिरतः प्रदानाल्लभते महत् । शूद्रः स्वकर्मनिरतः स्वर्गं शुश्रूषयार्च्छति ॥
data.md: The Vaishya who, observes the duties of his caste, makes gifts, reaps as the fruit of those gifts, a crowning reward. The Shudra who duly observes the duties of his order, acquires Heaven as the reward of such services.

data.v: शूरा बहुविधाः प्रोक्तास्तेषामर्थांश्च मे शृणु । शूरान्वयानां निर्दिष्टं फलं शूरस्य चैव ह ॥
data.md: Various kinds of heroes have been spoken of. Listen to me as I explain to you what the rewards are that they attain to. The rewards are fixed of a hero belonging to a heroic race.

data.v: यज्ञशूरा दमे शूराः सत्यशूरास्तथापरे । युद्धशूरास्तथैवोक्ता दानशूराश्च मानवाः ॥
data.md: There are heroes of sacrifice, heroes of selfcontrol, heroes of truth, and others equally entitled to the name of hero. There are heroes of battle, and heroes of gift or liberality among men.

data.v: बुद्धिशूरास्तथैवान्ये क्षमाशूरास्तथापरे । आर्जवे च तथा शूराः शमे वर्तन्ति मानवाः ॥
data.md: Likewise, there are others who are called heroes of the intellect, and also heroes of forgiveness. There are other men who live in tranquillity and who are considered as heroes of virtue.

data.v: तैस्तैस्तु नियमैः शूरा बहवः सन्ति चापरे । वेदाध्ययनशूराश्च शूराश्चाध्यापने रताः ॥
data.md: There are various other kinds of heroes who practise various other kinds of vows and observances. There are heroes given to the study of the Vedas, and heroes devoted to the teaching of the same.

data.v: गुरुशुश्रूषया शूराः पितृशुश्रूषयापरे । मातृशुश्रूषया शूरा भैक्ष्यशूरास्तथापरे ॥
data.md: There are, again, men who come to be regarded as heroes for the devotion with which they wait upon and serve their preceptors, as indeed, heroes in respect of the respect they show for their fathers. There are heroes in obedience to mothers, and heroes in the life of mendicancy they lead.

data.v: सांख्यशूराश्च बहवो योगशूरास्तथापरे । अरण्ये गृहवासे च शूराश्चातिथिपूजने । सर्वे यान्ति पराँल्लोकान्स्वकर्मफलनिर्जितान् ॥
data.md: There are many persons who may be called the heroes of the Shankhya faith, there are many others that are called heroes of Yoga. There are others who are considered as heroes in the forest-life, of domesticity, and of renunciation.

data.v: धारणं सर्ववेदानां सर्वतीर्थावगाहनम् । सत्यं च ब्रुवतो नित्यं समं वा स्यान्न वा समम् ॥
data.md: Keeping all the Vedas in memory, or ablutions performed in all the sacred waters, may or may not be equal to telling the Truth every day in one's life.

data.v: अश्वमेधसहस्रं च सत्यं च तुलया धृतम् । अश्वमेधसहस्राद्धि सत्यमेव विशिष्यते ॥
data.md: A thousand Horse-sacrifices and Truth were once weighed in the balance. It was seen that Truth weighed heavier than a thousand. Horsesacrifices.

data.v: सत्येन सूर्यस्तपति सत्येनाग्निः प्रदीप्यते । सत्येन मारुतो वाति सर्वं सत्ये प्रतिष्ठितम् ॥
data.md: It is by Truth that the Sun is giving heat it is by Truth that fire bums up it is by Truth that the winds blow; indeed, everything rests upon Truth;

data.v: सत्येन देवान्प्रीणाति पितॄन्वै ब्राह्मणांस्तथा । सत्यमाहुः परं धर्मं तस्मात्सत्यं न लङ्घयेत् ॥
data.md: It is Truth that pleases the deities, the departed Manes, and the Brahmanas, Truth has been said to be the highest duty. Therefore, no one should ever transgress Truth.

data.v: मुनयः सत्यनिरता मुनयः सत्यविक्रमाः । मुनयः सत्यशपथास्तस्मात्सत्यं विशिष्यते । सत्यवन्तः स्वर्गलोके मोदन्ते भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: The Munis are all given to Truth. Their prowess depends upon Truth. They also swear by Truth. Hence Truth is pre-eminent. All truthful men, O chief of Bharata's race, succeed by their truthfulness in acquiring Heaven and sporting there in happiness.

data.v: दमः सत्यफलावाप्तिरुक्ता सर्वात्मना मया । असंशयं विनीतात्मा सर्वः स्वर्गे महीयते ॥
data.md: Selfcontrol is the attainment of the reward tha: attaches to Truth. I have described it with my whole heart. The man of humble heart who is endued with self-control, forsooth, acquires great honors in Heaven.

data.v: ब्रह्मचर्यस्य तु गुणाञ्शृणु मे वसुधाधिप । आ जन्ममरणाद्यस्तु ब्रह्मचारी भवेदिह । न तस्य किंचिदप्राप्यमिति विद्धि जनाधिप ॥
data.md: Listen now to me, o king as I explain to you the merits of Brahmacharya. That man who practises the vow of Brahmacharya from his birth to the time of his Death, know, O king, has nothing unattainable! Many millions of Rishis are living in the region of Brahma.

data.v: बह्व्यः कोट्यस्त्वृषीणां तु ब्रह्मलोके वसन्त्युत । सत्ये रतानां सततं दान्तानामूर्ध्वरेतसाम् ॥
ब्रह्मचर्यं दहेद्राजन्सर्वपापान्युपासितम् । ब्राह्मणेन विशेषेण ब्राह्मणो ह्यग्निरुच्यते ॥
data.md: All of them, while here, were given to Truth, and self-control, and had their vital seed drawn up. The vow of Brahmacharya, O king, duly observed by a Brahmana, is sure to dissipate all his sins. The Brahmana is said to be a burning fire. In those Brahmanas that are given to penances, the deity of fire becomes visible.

data.v: प्रत्यक्षं च तवाप्येतद्ब्राह्मणेषु तपस्विषु । बिभेति हि यथा शक्रो ब्रह्मचारिप्रधर्षितः । तद्ब्रह्मचर्यस्य फलमृषीणामिह दृश्यते ॥
data.md: If a Brahmacharin gives way to anger on account of any slight, the chief of the deities himself trambles in fear. This is the visible fruit of the vow of Brahamacharya that is observed by the Rishis.

data.v: मातापित्रोः पूजने यो धर्मस्तमपि मे शृणु । शुश्रूषते यः पितरं न चासूयेत्कथंचन । मातरं वानहंवादी गुरुमाचार्यमेव च ॥
तस्य राजन्फलं विद्धि स्वर्लोके स्थानमुत्तमम् । न च पश्येत नरकं गुरुशुश्रूषुरात्मवान् ॥
विधिं गवां परमहं श्रोतुमिच्छामि तत्त्वतः । येन ताञ्शाश्वताँल्लोकानखिलानश्नुवीमहि ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said I wish, O king, to hear you discourse in detail upon those high ordinances which regulate gifts of kine, for it is by making gifts (of kine) according to those ordinances that one cquires innumerable regions of eternal happiness.

data.v: न गोदानात्परं किंचिद्विद्यते वसुधाधिप । गौर्हि न्यायागता दत्ता सद्यस्तारयते कुलम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said There is no gift, O king, that is higher in point of merit than the gift of kine. A cow, lawfully acquired, if given away, immediately rescues the entire family of the giver.

data.v: सतामर्थे सम्यगुत्पादितो यः; स वै कॢप्तः सम्यगिष्टः प्रजाभ्यः । तस्मात्पूर्वं ह्यादिकाले प्रवृत्तं; गवां दाने शृणु राजन्विधिं मे ॥
data.md: That ritual which sprang for the benefit of the pious, was subsequently declared for the sake of all creatures. That ritual has come down from primeval time. It existed even before it was declared. Indeed, O king, listen to me as I recite to you that ritual which affects the gifts of kine.

data.v: पुरा गोषूपनीतासु गोषु संदिग्धदर्शिना । मान्धात्रा प्रकृतं प्रश्नं बृहस्पतिरभाषत ॥
data.md: Formerly, when a number of kine was brought, (before him), king Mandhatri, filled with doubt about the ritual he should observe, properly questioned Brihaspati for an explanation of that doubt.

data.v: द्विजातिमभिसत्कृत्य श्वः कालमभिवेद्य च । प्रदानार्थे नियुञ्जीत रोहिणीं नियतव्रतः ॥
data.md: Brihaspati said Duly observing restrains all the while, the giver of kine should, on the previous day, properly honour the Brahmanas and appoint the time of gift. As for the kine to be given away, they should be of the class called Rohini.

data.v: आह्वानं च प्रयुञ्जीत समङ्गे बहुलेति च । प्रविश्य च गवां मध्यमिमां श्रुतिमुदाहरेत् ॥
data.md: The kine also should be addressed with the wordsSamange and BahuleEntering the fold where the kine are kept, the following Shrutis should be uttered:

data.v: गौर्मे माता गोवृषभः पिता मे; दिवं शर्म जगती मे प्रतिष्ठा । प्रपद्यैवं शर्वरीमुष्य गोषु; मुनिर्वाणीमुत्सृजेद्गोप्रदाने ॥
data.md: The cow is my mother. The bull is my father. (Give me) Heaven and Earthly prosperity. The cow is my refuge. Entering the fold and acting thus, the giver should pass the night there. He should again utter the formula when actually giving away the kine.

data.v: स तामेकां निशां गोभिः समसख्यः समव्रतः । ऐकात्म्यगमनात्सद्यः कल्मषाद्विप्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: The giver, thus living with the kine in the fold without doing anything to control their freedom, and lying down on the naked earth, becomes readily cleansed of all his sins on account of his bringing himself down to a condition of perfect similitude with the kine.

data.v: उत्सृष्टवृषवत्सा हि प्रदेया सूर्यदर्शने । त्रिविधं प्रतिपत्तव्यमर्थवादाशिषः स्तवाः ॥
data.md: When the Sun rises in the morning, you should give away the cow, accompanied by her calf and a bull. As the reward of such a deed, you will surely attain to the celestial region. You will also enjoy the blessings shown by the Mantras.

data.v: ऊर्जस्विन्य ऊर्जमेधाश्च यज्ञो; गर्भोऽमृतस्य जगतश्च प्रतिष्ठा । क्षितौ राधःप्रभवः शश्वदेव; प्राजापत्याः सर्वमित्यर्थवादः ॥
data.md: The Mantras contain these references of kine: Kine are gifted with strength and energetic exertion. Kine are also wise. They are the root of that immortality which sacrifice yields. They are the root of all energy. They are the steps by which earthly prosperity is gained. They are the eternal course of the universe. The multiply one's race.

data.v: गावो ममैनः प्रणुदन्तु सौर्या;स्तथा सौम्याः स्वर्गयानाय सन्तु । आम्नाता मे ददतीराश्रयं तु; तथानुक्ताः सन्तु सर्वाशिषो मे ॥
data.md: Let the kine dissipate my sins. They have in them the nature of both the Sun and the Moon. Let them help me in the attainment of the celestial region. Let them come to me, as a mother takes to her children. May I enjoy all other blessings which have not been named in the Mantras I have uttered.

data.v: शेषोत्सर्गे कर्मभिर्देहमोक्षे; सरस्वत्यः श्रेयसि संप्रवृत्ताः । यूयं नित्यं पुण्यकर्मोपवाह्या; दिशध्वं मे गतिमिष्टां प्रपन्नाः ॥
data.md: For alleviating or curing phthisis and other wasting diseases, and for achieving freedom from the body, if a person takes the help of the five products of the cow, kine confer blessings upon the person like the river Sarasvati you kine, you are always co nveyers of all sorts of merit. Pleased with me, do you assign a desirable end for me.

data.v: या वै यूयं सोऽहमद्यैकभावो; युष्मान्दत्त्वा चाहमात्मप्रदाता । मनश्च्युता मनएवोपपन्नाः; संधुक्षध्वं सौम्यरूपोग्ररूपाः ॥
data.md: I have to day become what you are. By giving you away, I really give myself away, You do not belong to him who gives you away. You have now become mine. Possessed of the nature of both the Sun and the Moon, do you cause both the giver and the receiver the shine with all kinds of prosperity.

data.v: एवं तस्याग्रे पूर्वमर्धं वदेत; गवां दाता विधिवत्पूर्वदृष्टम् । प्रतिब्रूयाच्छेषमर्धं द्विजातिः; प्रतिगृह्णन्वै गोप्रदाने विधिज्ञः ॥
data.md: The giver should duly utter the words found in the first part of the above Verse. The twice born recipient, conversant with the ritual regulating the gift of kine, should, when receiving the kine in gift, utter the words found in the latter half of the above Verse.

data.v: गां ददानीति वक्तव्यमर्घ्यवस्त्रवसुप्रदः । ऊधस्या भरितव्या च वैष्णवीति च चोदयेत् ॥
data.md: The man who, instead of a cow, gives away the usual value thereof or cloths or gold, is considered as the giver of a cow. The giver, when giving away the usual value of a cow, should utter the words. This cow with face lipuurned is being given away. Do you accept her. The man who gives away cloths should utter the words, Bhavitavya (this should be regarded as representing a cow). The man who gives away gold should utter the word Vaishnavi i.e., the gold of the form and nature of a cow.

data.v: नाम संकीर्तयेत्तस्या यथासंख्योत्तरं स वै । फलं षड्विंशदष्टौ च सहस्राणि च विंशतिः ॥
data.md: These are the words that should be uttered according to the kind of gift mentioned above. The reward that was reaped by making gifts of kine is residence in the celestial region for six and thirty thousand years, eight thousand years, and twenty thousand years respectively.

data.v: एवमेतान्गुणान्वृद्धान्गवादीनां यथाक्रमम् । गोप्रदाता समाप्नोति समस्तानष्टमे क्रमे ॥
data.md: These are the merits, respectively, of gifts of things as substitutes of kine. While, about him who gives an actual cow all the merits that attach to gifts of kine become his at only the eighth step of the recipient.

data.v: गोदः शीली निर्भयश्चार्घदाता; न स्याद्दुःखी वसुदाता च कामी । ऊधस्योढा भारत यश्च विद्वा;न्व्याख्यातास्ते वैष्णवाश्चन्द्रलोकाः ॥
data.md: He who gives an actual cow becomes gifted with righteous conduct in this world. He who gives the valve of a cow becomes freed from every sort of fear. He who gives a cow never suffers from sorrow. All the three, as also they who regularly perform their ablutions and other acts at early dawn, and he who is well conversant with the Mahabharata, it is well known attain to the regions of Vishnu and Soma.

data.v: गा वै दत्त्वा गोव्रती स्यात्त्रिरात्रं; निशां चैकां संवसेतेह ताभिः । काम्याष्टम्यां वर्तितव्यं त्रिरात्रं; रसैर्वा गोः शकृता प्रस्नवैर्वा ॥
data.md: Having given away a cow, the giver should for three nights, adopt the vaccine vow, and pass one night with kine. Beginning again from that lunation, numbering the eighth, named Kamya, he should pass three nights, living exclusively on milk and the urine and dung of the cow.

data.v: वेदव्रती स्याद्वृषभप्रदाता; वेदावाप्तिर्गोयुगस्य प्रदाने । तथा गवां विधिमासाद्य यज्वा; लोकानग्र्यान्विन्दते नाविधिज्ञः ॥
data.md: By giving away a bull, one acquires the merit of Brahmacharya. By giving away two kine, one acquires the mastery of the Vedas. That man who celebrates a sacrifice and makes gifts of kine according to the ritual laid down, attains to many great regions. These, however, are not attainable by the person who does not know that ritual.

data.v: कामान्सर्वान्पार्थिवानेकसंस्था;न्यो वै दद्यात्कामदुघां च धेनुम् । सम्यक्ताः स्युर्हव्यकव्यौघवत्य;स्तासामुक्ष्णां ज्यायसां संप्रदानम् ॥
data.md: That man who gives away even a single cow. which gives profuse milk, acquires the merit of giving away all desirable objects on Earth collected together. What more should be said of the gift of many such kine as give Havya and Kavya on account of their fuil udders? The merit which belongs to the gift of superior oxen is greater than that of the gift of kine.

data.v: न चाशिष्यायाव्रतायोपकुर्या;न्नाश्रद्दधानाय न वक्रबुद्धये । गुह्यो ह्ययं सर्वलोकस्य धर्मो; नेमं धर्मं यत्र तत्र प्रजल्पेत् ॥
data.md: One should not, by giving a knowledge of this ritual, benefit a person who is not his disciple or who does not observe vows or who is bereft of faith or who is possessed of crooked understanding. Indeed this religion is a mystery, which many people do not know. One who knows it should not speak of it everywhere.

data.v: सन्ति लोके श्रद्दधाना मनुष्याः; सन्ति क्षुद्रा राक्षसा मानुषेषु । येषां दानं दीयमानं ह्यनिष्टं; नास्तिक्यं चाप्याश्रयन्ते ह्यपुण्याः ॥
data.md: There are, in the world, many men who have no faith. There are among men many persons who are mean and who resemble Rakshasas. This religion, if given to them, would lead to evil. It would produce equal evil it given to such sinful men as are atheists.

data.v: बार्हस्पत्यं वाक्यमेतन्निशम्य; ये राजानो गोप्रदानानि कृत्वा । लोकान्प्राप्ताः पुण्यशीलाः सुवृत्ता;स्तान्मे राजन्कीर्त्यमानान्निबोध ॥
data.md: Listen to me, O king as I recite to you the names of those pious kings who have attained son to regions of great happiness as the reward of those gifts of kine which they made according to the instructions of Brihaspati.

data.v: उशीनरो विष्वगश्वो नृगश्च; भगीरथो विश्रुतो यौवनाश्वः । मान्धाता वै मुचुकुन्दश्च राजा; भूरिद्युम्नो नैषधः सोमकश्च ॥
data.md: Ushinara, Vishvagashva, Nriga, Bhagiratha, the celebrated Mandhatri the of Yuvanashva, king Muchukunda, Bhuridyumna, Naishadha, Somaka. Pururavas, emperor Bharata to whose race belongs all the Bharatas, the heroic Rama the son of Dasharatha, and many other celebrated kings of great deeds, and also king Dilipa of widelyknown deeds, all, on account of their gifts of kine according to the ritual, attained to Heaven. King Mandhatri, was always observant of sacrifices, gifts, penances royal duties, and gifts of kine.

data.v: पुरूरवा भरतश्चक्रवर्ती; यस्यान्वये भारताः सर्व एव । तथा वीरो दाशरथिश्च रामो; ये चाप्यन्ये विश्रुताः कीर्तिमन्तः ॥
तथा राजा पृथुकर्मा दिलीपो; दिवं प्राप्तो गोप्रदाने विधिज्ञः । यज्ञैर्दानैस्तपसा राजधर्मै;र्मान्धाताभूद्गोप्रदानैश्च युक्तः ॥
तस्मात्पार्थ त्वमपीमां मयोक्तां; बार्हस्पतीं भारतीं धारयस्व । द्विजाग्र्येभ्यः संप्रयच्छ प्रतीतो; गाः पुण्या वै प्राप्य राज्यं कुरूणाम् ॥
तथा सर्वं कृतवान्धर्मराजो; भीष्मेणोक्तो विधिवद्गोप्रदाने । स मान्धातुर्देवदेवोपदिष्टं; सम्यग्धर्मं धारयामास राजा ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Thus addressed by Bhishma on the subject of properly making gifts of kine, king Yudhishthira did all that Bhishma desired. Indeed, king Yudhishthira bore in mind the whole of that religion which the preceptor of the gods imparted to the Royal Mandhatri.

data.v: इति नृप सततं गवां प्रदाने; यवशकलान्सह गोमयैः पिबानः । क्षितितलशयनः शिखी यतात्मा; वृष इव राजवृषस्तदा बभूव ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira from that time began to always make gifts of kine and to maintain himself with grains of barley and cowdung as both his food and drink, The king also began to sleep from that day on the naked earth, and possessed of controlled soul and resembling a bull in conduct, he become the foremost of monarchs.

data.v: स नृपतिरभवत्सदैव ताभ्यः; प्रयतमना ह्यभिसंस्तुवंश्च गा वै । नृपधुरि च न गामयुङ्क्त भूय;स्तुरगवरैरगमच्च यत्र तत्र ॥
data.md: The Kuru king from that day became very attentive of kine and always adored them, singing their praises. From that day, the king gave up the practice of yO king kine to his cars. Wherever he had occasion to go, he proceeded on cars drawn by horses of good breed.

data.v: ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा भूयः शांतनवं नृप । गोदाने विस्तरं धीमान्पप्रच्छ विनयान्वितः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said King Yudhishthira gifted with humility, once again asked the royal son of Shantanu on the subject of gifts of kine in full.

data.v: गोप्रदाने गुणान्सम्यक्पुनः प्रब्रूहि भारत । न हि तृप्याम्यहं वीर शृण्वानोऽमृतमीदृशम् ॥
data.md: The king said Do you, O Bharata, once more describe to me in full merits of giving away kine. Indeed, O hero, I have not been satiated with hearing your nectarlike words.

data.v: इत्युक्तो धर्मराजेन तदा शांतनवो नृप । सम्यगाह गुणांस्तस्मै गोप्रदानस्य केवलान् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Thus accosted by king Yudhishthira the just, Shantanu's son began to describe to him once again, in full, the merits of the gift of kine.

data.v: वत्सलां गुणसंपन्नां तरुणीं वस्त्रसंवृताम् । दत्त्वेदृशीं गां विप्राय सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: Bhishma said By giving to a Brahmana a cow having a calf, gifted with docility and other virtues, young in years and covered round with a piece of cloth, one is purged of all his sins.

data.v: असुर्या नाम ते लोका गां दत्त्वा तत्र गच्छति । पीतोदकां जग्धतृणां नष्टदुग्धां निरिन्द्रियाम् ॥
data.md: There are many regions which have no sun. One who makes the gift of a cow has not to go there.

data.v: जरोग्रामुपयुक्तार्थां जीर्णां कूपमिवाजलम् । दत्त्वा तमः प्रविशति द्विजं क्लेशेन योजयेत् ॥
data.md: That man, however, who gives to a Brahmana a cow that cannot drink or eat, that has her milk dried up, that has weakened senses and that is diseased and overcome with decrepitude, and that may, therefore, be compared to a tank whose water has been dried upindeed, the man who gives such cow to a Brahmana and thereby inflicts only pain and disappointment upon him, has certainly to enter into dark Hell.

data.v: दुष्टा रुष्टा व्याधिता दुर्बला वा; न दातव्या याश्च मूल्यैरदत्तैः । क्लेशैर्विप्रं योऽफलैः संयुनक्ति; तस्यावीर्याश्चाफलाश्चैव लोकाः ॥
data.md: That cow which is wrathful and vicious, or diseased, or weak, or which has been brought without the price agreed upon having been paid, or which would only afflict the twiceborn recipient with distress and disappointment, should never be given. The regions such a man may acquire would not give him any happiness or energy.

data.v: बलान्विताः शीलवयोपपन्नाः; सर्वाः प्रशंसन्ति सुगन्धवत्यः । यथा हि गङ्गा सरितां वरिष्ठा; तथार्जुनीनां कपिला वरिष्ठा ॥
data.md: Or as Those kine which are strong of body, which have good dispositions and which emit a sweet fragrance, are highly spoken of in the matter of gifts. As Ganga is the foremost of all rivers, so is Kapila the foremost of all kine.

data.v: कस्मात्समाने बहुलाप्रदाने; सद्भिः प्रशस्तं कपिलाप्रदानम् । विशेषमिच्छामि महानुभाव; श्रोतुं समर्थो हि भवान्प्रवक्तुम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Why, O grandfather, do the righteous highly speak of the gift of a Kapila cow when all good kine that are given away should be considered as equal? O you of great power, I wish to hear what the superiority is of a Kapila cow. You are indeed, competent to discourse to me on this subject.

data.v: वृद्धानां ब्रुवतां तात श्रुतं मे यत्प्रभाषसे । वक्ष्यामि तदशेषेण रोहिण्यो निर्मिता यथा ॥
data.md: Bhishma said I have, O son, heard old men recite this history about the circumstances under which the Kapila cow was created. I shall recite that old history to you.

data.v: प्रजाः सृजेति व्यादिष्टः पूर्वं दक्षः स्वयंभुवा । असृजद्वृत्तिमेवाग्रे प्रजानां हितकाम्यया ॥
data.md: Formerly the Selfcreate Brahman commanded the Rishi Daksha, saying, Do you create living creatures, For doing good to creatures, Daksha, first of all created food.

data.v: यथा ह्यमृतमाश्रित्य वर्तयन्ति दिवौकसः । तथा वृत्तिं समाश्रित्य वर्तयन्ति प्रजा विभो ॥
data.md: As the deities live upon nectar, so all living creatures, O powerful one, live upon the food assigned by Daksha.

data.v: अचरेभ्यश्च भूतेभ्यश्चराः श्रेष्ठास्ततो नराः । ब्राह्मणाश्च ततः श्रेष्ठास्तेषु यज्ञाः प्रतिष्ठिताः ॥
data.md: Among all objects mobile and immobile, the mobile are superior. Among mobile creatures, Brahmanas are superior. The sacrifices are all set upon them.

data.v: यज्ञैराप्यायते सोमः स च गोषु प्रतिष्ठितः । सर्वे देवाः प्रमोदन्ते पूर्ववृत्तास्ततः प्रजाः ॥
data.md: It is by sacrifice that Soma is got. Sacrifice has been fixed upon kine. The gods become pleased through sacrifices. The means of livelihood were created first, creatures came next.

data.v: एतान्येव तु भूतानि प्राक्रोशन्वृत्तिकाङ्क्षया । वृत्तिदं चान्वपद्यन्त तृषिताः पितृमातृवत् ॥
data.md: As soon as creatures were born, they began to cry aloud for food. All of them then approached their creator who was to give them food, like children approaching their parents.

data.v: इतीदं मनसा गत्वा प्रजासर्गार्थमात्मनः । प्रजापतिर्बलाधानममृतं प्रापिबत्तदा ॥
data.md: Approved of the desire of all his creatures, the holy lord of all creatures, viz., Daksha, for the sake of his creatures, himself drank a quantity of nectar.

data.v: स गतस्तस्य तृप्तिं तु गन्धं सुरभिमुद्गिरन् । ददर्शोद्गारसंवृत्तां सुरभिं मुखजां सुताम् ॥
data.md: He became pleased with the nectar, he drank and thereupon an eructation came out, spreading an excellent odour all around. That cruciation, Daksha saw gave birth to a cow which he named Surabhi. This Surabhi was thus a daughter of his, that had come out of his inouth.

data.v: सासृजत्सौरभेयीस्तु सुरभिर्लोकमातरः । सुवर्णवर्णाः कपिलाः प्रजानां वृत्तिधेनवः ॥
data.md: That cow called Surabhi gave birth to a number of daughters who became the mothers of the world. They were goldhued, and were all Kapilas. They were the means of livelihood for all crcatures.

data.v: तासाममृतवर्णानां क्षरन्तीनां समन्ततः । बभूवामृतजः फेनः स्रवन्तीनामिवोर्मिजः ॥
data.md: As those kine, whose complexion resembled that of nectar, began to pour milk, the forth of that inilk arose and began to spread on all sides as when the waves of a running river dashing against one another, sufficient froth is produced that spreads on all sides.

data.v: स वत्समुखविभ्रष्टो भवस्य भुवि तिष्ठतः । शिरस्यवाप तत्क्रुद्धः स तदोदैक्षत प्रभुः । ललाटप्रभवेनाक्ष्णा रोहिणीः प्रदहन्निव ॥
data.md: Some of that froth fell, from the mouths of the calves that were sucking, upon the head of Mahadeva who was then sitting on the Earth. The powerful Mahadeva thereupon, stricken with anger, looked at those kine.

data.v: तत्तेजस्तु ततो रौद्रं कपिला गा विशां पते । नानावर्णत्वमनयन्मेघानिव दिवाकरः ॥
यास्तु तस्मादपक्रम्य सोममेवाभिसंश्रिताः । यथोत्पन्नाः स्ववर्णस्थास्ता नीता नान्यवर्णताम् ॥
