अथ क्रुद्धं महादेवं प्रजापतिरभाषत । अमृतेनावसिक्तस्त्वं नोच्छिष्टं विद्यते गवाम् ॥
यथा ह्यमृतमादाय सोमो विष्यन्दते पुनः । तथा क्षीरं क्षरन्त्येता रोहिण्योऽमृतसंभवाः ॥
न दुष्यत्यनिलो नाग्निर्न सुवर्णं न चोदधिः । नामृतेनामृतं पीतं वत्सपीता न वत्सला ॥
इमाँल्लोकान्भरिष्यन्ति हविषा प्रस्नवेन च । आसामैश्वर्यमश्नीहि सर्वामृतमयं शुभम् ॥
वृषभं च ददौ तस्मै सह ताभिः प्रजापतिः । प्रसादयामास मनस्तेन रुद्रस्य भारत ॥
प्रीतश्चापि महादेवश्चकार वृषभं तदा । ध्वजं च वाहनं चैव तस्मात्स वृषभध्वजः ॥
data.md: Daksha pleased Rudra, O Bharata, with that present. Mahadeva, thus pleased, made that bull his career, And it was after the form of that bull that Mahadeva adopted the emblem on the standard floating on his battlecar. Therefore it is that Rudra came to be known as the bullbannered deity.

data.v: ततो देवैर्महादेवस्तदा पशुपतिः कृतः । ईश्वरः स गवां मध्ये वृषाङ्क इति चोच्यते ॥
data.md: It was on that occasion also that the celestials, in a body, made Mahadeva the lord of animals. Indeed, the great Rudra became the Master of kine and is named as the bullemblemed deity.

data.v: एवमव्यग्रवर्णानां कपिलानां महौजसाम् । प्रदाने प्रथमः कल्पः सर्वासामेव कीर्तितः ॥
data.md: Hence, O king, the gift of kine is considered as primarily desirable of Kapila kine which are endued with great energy and possessed of unchanged colour.

data.v: लोकज्येष्ठा लोकवृत्तिप्रवृत्ता; रुद्रोपेताः सोमविष्यन्दभूताः । सौम्याः पुण्याः कामदाः प्राणदाश्च; गा वै दत्त्वा सर्वकामप्रदः स्यात् ॥
data.md: Thus are kine the foremost of all creatures in the world. It is from them that the food of all the worlds has emanated. They have Rudra for their lord. They yield (nectar) in the form of milk. They are auspicious and sacred, and grantors of every wish and givers of life. A person by making a gift of a cow is considered as making a gift of every article that is to be enjoyed by men.

data.v: इमं गवां प्रभवविधानमुत्तमं; पठन्सदा शुचिरतिमङ्गलप्रियः । विमुच्यते कलिकलुषेण मानवः; प्रियं सुतान्पशुधनमाप्नुयात्तथा ॥
data.md: That who, wishing to acquire prosperity, reads with a pure heart and body these Verses on the origin of kine, becomes purged of all his sins and acquires prosperity and children and wealth and animals.

data.v: हव्यं कव्यं तर्पणं शान्तिकर्म; यानं वासो वृद्धबालस्य पुष्टिम् । एतान्सर्वान्गोप्रदाने गुणान्वै; दाता राजन्नाप्नुयाद्वै सदैव ॥
data.md: man He who makes a gift of a cow. O king, always succeeds in winning the merits of gifts of Havya and Kavya, of the offer of oblations of water to the departed Manes, of religious acts whose performance brings peace and happiness, of the gift of vehicles and cloths, and of cherishing of children and the old.

data.v: पितामहस्याथ निशम्य वाक्यं; राजा सह भ्रातृभिराजमीढः । सौवर्णकांस्योपदुहास्ततो गाः; पार्थो ददौ ब्राह्मणसत्तमेभ्यः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Hearing these words of his grandfather, Pritha's son, viz., the royal Yudhishthira of Ajamidha's race, uniting with his brothers, began to make gifts of both bulls and kine of different colours to foremost of Brahmanas.

data.v: तथैव तेभ्योऽभिददौ द्विजेभ्यो; गवां सहस्राणि शतानि चैव । यज्ञान्समुद्दिश्य च दक्षिणार्थे; लोकान्विजेतुं परमां च कीर्तिम् ॥
data.md: Indeed, for getting regions of felicity in the next, and acquiring great fame, king Yudhishthira celebrated many sacrifices and, as sacrificial presents, gave away hundreds of thousands of kine to such Brahmanas.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु वसिष्ठमृषिसत्तमम् । इक्ष्वाकुवंशजो राजा सौदासो ददतां वरः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Formerly, king Saudasa born of Ikshvaku's race, that foremost of eloquent men, on one occasion approached his family priest, viz., Vashishtha, that foremost of Rishis, crowned with ascetic success, capable of passing through every region, the receptacle of Brahma, and gifted with eternal life, and put to him the following question.

data.v: सर्वलोकचरं सिद्धं ब्रह्मकोशं सनातनम् । पुरोहितमिदं प्रष्टुमभिवाद्योपचक्रमे ॥
त्रैलोक्ये भगवन्किं स्वित्पवित्रं कथ्यतेऽनघ । यत्कीर्तयन्सदा मर्त्यः प्राप्नुयात्पुण्यमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Saudasa said O holy one, O sinless one, what is that in the three worlds which is sacred and by reciting which at all times a man may win high merit?

data.v: तस्मै प्रोवाच वचनं प्रणताय हितं तदा । गवामुपनिषद्विद्वान्नमस्कृत्य गवां शुचिः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Having first bowed to kine and purified himself, the learned Vashishtha described to king Saudasa who stood before him with head bent in reverence, the mystery about kine, a subject that is fraught with results highly beneficial to all persons.

data.v: गावः सुरभिगन्धिन्यस्तथा गुग्गुलुगन्धिकाः । गावः प्रतिष्ठा भूतानां गावः स्वस्त्ययनं महत् ॥
data.md: Vashishtha said Kine, are always fragrant. The perfume of the Amyris agallochum comes out of their bodies. Kine are the great refuge of all creatures. Kine form the greet source of blessings to all.

data.v: गावो भूतं भविष्यच्च गावः पुष्टिः सनातनी । गावो लक्ष्म्यास्तथा मूलं गोषु दत्तं न नश्यति । अन्नं हि सततं गावो देवानां परमं हविः ॥
data.md: Kine are the Past and the Future. Kine are the root of eternal growth. Kine are the root of Prosperity. Anything given to kine is never lost.

data.v: स्वाहाकारवषट्कारौ गोषु नित्यं प्रतिष्ठितौ । गावो यज्ञस्य हि फलं गोषु यज्ञाः प्रतिष्ठिताः ॥
सायं प्रातश्च सततं होमकाले महामते । गावो ददति वै होम्यमृषिभ्यः पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: Morning and evening kine give to the Rishis, O foremost of men, Havi for use in Homa, O you of great effulgence.

data.v: कानिचिद्यानि दुर्गाणि दुष्कृतानि कृतानि च । तरन्ति चैव पाप्मानं धेनुं ये ददति प्रभो ॥
data.md: They who make gifts of kine succeed in getting over all sins which they may have committed and all kinds of dangers into which they may fall, O you of great power.

data.v: एकां च दशगुर्दद्याद्दश दद्याच्च गोशती । शतं सहस्रगुर्दद्यात्सर्वे तुल्यफला हि ते ॥
data.md: The man possessing ten kine and making a gift of one cow, one possessing a hundred kine and making a gift of ten kine, and one possessing a thousand kine and making a gift of a hundred kine, all acquire the same measure of merit.

data.v: अनाहिताग्निः शतगुरयज्वा च सहस्रगुः । समृद्धो यश्च कीनाशो नार्घ्यमर्हन्ति ते त्रयः ॥
data.md: That man who, having hundred kine, does not establish a domestic fire for daily worship that man who though possessed of a thousand kine does not celebrate sacrifices, and that man who though having riches acts as a miser, are all three considered as not worthy of any respect.

data.v: कपिलां ये प्रयच्छन्ति सवत्सां कांस्यदोहनाम् । सुव्रतां वस्त्रसंवीतामुभौ लोकौ जयन्ति ते ॥
data.md: Those men who make gifts of Kapila kine with their calves and with vessels of white brass for milking themkine, which are not vicious and which, while given away, are one wrapped round with clothsconquer both this and the next world.

data.v: युवानमिन्द्रियोपेतं शतेन सह यूथपम् । गवेन्द्रं ब्राह्मणेन्द्राय भूरिशृङ्गमलंकृतम् ॥
data.md: Such persons as make gifts of a young bull, that has all its senses, strong, and that may be considered as the foremost among hundreds of herds, that has large horns adorned with ornaments, to a Brahmana endued with Vedic lore, succeed, O scorcher of foes, in acquiring great prosperity riches each time they are born in the world.

data.v: वृषभं ये प्रयच्छन्ति श्रोत्रियाय परंतप । ऐश्वर्यं तेऽभिजायन्ते जायमानाः पुनः पुनः ॥
नाकीर्तयित्वा गाः सुप्यान्नास्मृत्य पुनरुत्पतेत् । सायं प्रातर्नमस्येच्च गास्ततः पुष्टिमाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: One should never go to bed without reciting the names of kine. Nor should one rise from bed in the morning without similarly reciting the names of kine, Morning and evening one should bend one's head respectfully to kine. As the result of such deeds, one is sure to acquire great prosperity.

data.v: गवां मूत्रपुरीषस्य नोद्विजेत कदाचन । न चासां मांसमश्नीयाद्गवां व्युष्टिं तथाश्नुते ॥
data.md: One should never feel any repugnance for the urine and the dung of the cow. One should never eat the meat of kine. As the result of this, one is sure to acquire great prosperity.

data.v: गाश्च संकीर्तयेन्नित्यं नावमन्येत गास्तथा । अनिष्टं स्वप्नमालक्ष्य गां नरः संप्रकीर्तयेत् ॥
data.md: One should always recite the names of kine. One should never show any disregard for kine in any way. If evil dreams are seen men should recite the names of kine.

data.v: गोमयेन सदा स्नायाद्गोकरीषे च संविशेत् । श्लेष्ममूत्रपुरीषाणि प्रतिघातं च वर्जयेत् ॥
data.md: One should always bathe, using cowdung. One should sit on dried cowdung. One should never pass urine and excreta and other secretions on cowdung. One should never obstruct kine in any way.

data.v: सार्द्रचर्मणि भुञ्जीत निरीक्षन्वारुणीं दिशम् । वाग्यतः सर्पिषा भूमौ गवां व्युष्टिं तथाश्नुते ॥
data.md: One should eat, sitting on a cowhide purified by dipping it in water, and then look towards the west. Sitting with controlled speech, one should eat clarified butter using the bare earth as his dish. One reaps, on account of such deeds, that prosperity of which kine are the root.

data.v: घृतेन जुहुयादग्निं घृतेन स्वस्ति वाचयेत् । घृतं दद्याद्घृतं प्राशेद्गवां व्युष्टिं तथाश्नुते ॥
data.md: One should pour libations on the fire, using clarificd butter for purpose. One should make Brahmanas utter blessings upon one by presents of clarified butter. One should make gifts of clarified butter. One should also eat clarified butter. As the reward of such deeds one is sure to acquire that prosperity which kine grant.

data.v: गोमत्या विद्यया धेनुं तिलानामभिमन्त्र्य यः । रसरत्नमयीं दद्यान्न स शोचेत्कृताकृते ॥
data.md: That man who inspires a cow's form made of sesame seeds by uttering the Vedic Mantras named Gomati, and then adorns that form with every sort of gems and makes a gift of it, has never to suffer any grief on account of all his deeds of omission and commission.

data.v: गावो मामुपतिष्ठन्तु हेमशृङ्गाः पयोमुचः । सुरभ्यः सौरभेयाश्च सरितः सागरं यथा ॥
data.md: Let kine which give profuse milk and which have horns adorned with goldkine viz., that are Surabhis or the daughters of Surabhisapproach me even as rivers approach the ocean.

data.v: गावः पश्यन्तु मां नित्यं गावः पश्याम्यहं तदा । गावोऽस्माकं वयं तासां यतो गावस्ततो वयम् ॥
data.md: I always look at kine. Let kine always look at me. Kine are ours. We are theirs. We are there where kine are.

data.v: एवं रात्रौ दिवा चैव समेषु विषमेषु च । महाभयेषु च नरः कीर्तयन्मुच्यते भयात् ॥
data.md: Thus, at night or day, in weal or woe-at times of even great fearshould a man exclaim. By uttering such words, he is sure to become freed from every fear. By uttering such words, he is sure to become freed from every fear.

data.v: शतं वर्षसहस्राणां तपस्तप्तं सुदुश्चरम् । गोभिः पूर्वविसृष्टाभिर्गच्छेम श्रेष्ठतामिति ॥
data.md: Vasishtha said The kine which had been created in former age practised the hardest penances for a hundred thousand years with the objects of acquiring a position of great preeminence.

data.v: लोकेऽस्मिन्दक्षिणानां च सर्वासां वयमुत्तमाः । भवेम न च लिप्येम दोषेणेति परंतप ॥
data.md: Indeed, O scorcher of enemies, they said to themselves. We shall, in this world, become the best of all kinds of presents in sacrifices, and we shall not be liable to be sullied with any fault.

data.v: स एव चेतसा तेन हतो लिप्येत सर्वदा । शकृता च पवित्रार्थं कुर्वीरन्देवमानुषाः ॥
तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि स्थावराणि चराणि च । प्रदातारश्च गोलोकान्गच्छेयुरिति मानद ॥
data.md: By bathing in water mixed with our dung, people shall become purified. The celestials and men shall use our dung for the purpose of purifying all creatures mobile and immobile. They also who will give us away shall acquire those regions of happiness which will be ours.

data.v: ताभ्यो वरं ददौ ब्रह्मा तपसोऽन्ते स्वयं प्रभुः । एवं भवत्विति विभुर्लोकांस्तारयतेति च ॥
data.md: Appearing to them at the termination of their austerities, the powerful Brahman gave them the boons they sought, sayingyour desire will be fulfilled. Do you rescue all the worlds.

data.v: उत्तस्थुः सिद्धिकामास्ता भूतभव्यस्य मातरः । तपसोऽन्ते महाराज गावो लोकपरायणाः ॥
data.md: Crowned with fruition of their desires, they all rose upthose mothers of both the Past and the Future. Every morning, people should bow respectfully to kine. As the result of this, they are sure to acquire prosperity.

data.v: तस्माद्गावो महाभागाः पवित्रं परमुच्यते । तथैव सर्वभूतानां गावस्तिष्ठन्ति मूर्धनि ॥
समानवत्सां कपिलां धेनुं दत्त्वा पयस्विनीम् । सुव्रतां वस्त्रसंवीतां ब्रह्मलोके महीयते ॥
data.md: By giving away a Kapila cow with a calf resembling herself, giving profuse milk, free from every vicious habit, and covered with a piece of cloth, the giver acquires great honours in the region of Brahma.

data.v: रोहिणीं तुल्यवत्सां तु धेनुं दत्त्वा पयस्विनीम् । सुव्रतां वस्त्रसंवीतां सूर्यलोके महीयते ॥
data.md: By giving away a Kapila cow with a calf resembling herself, giving profuse milk, free from every vicious habit, and covered with a piece of cloth, the giver acquires great honours in the region of Brahma.

data.v: समानवत्सां शबलां धेनुं दत्त्वा पयस्विनीम् । सुव्रतां वस्त्रसंवीतां सोमलोके महीयते ॥
data.md: By giving away a Kapila cow with a calf resembling herself, giving profuse milk, free from every vicious habit, and covered with a piece of cloth, the giver acquires great honours in the region of Brahma.

data.v: समानवत्सां श्वेतां तु धेनुं दत्त्वा पयस्विनीम् । सुव्रतां वस्त्रसंवीतामिन्द्रलोके महीयते ॥
data.md: By giving away a Kapila cow with a calf resembling herself, giving profuse milk, free from every vicious habit, and covered with a piece of cloth, the giver acquires great honours in the region of Brahma.

data.v: समानवत्सां कृष्णां तु धेनुं दत्त्वा पयस्विनीम् । सुव्रतां वस्त्रसंवीतामग्निलोके महीयते ॥
data.md: By giving away a Kapila cow with a calf resembling herself, giving profuse milk, free from every vicious habit, and covered with a piece of cloth, the giver acquires great honours in the region of Brahma.

data.v: समानवत्सां धूम्रां तु धेनुं दत्त्वा पयस्विनीम् । सुव्रतां वस्त्रसंवीतां याम्यलोके महीयते ॥
data.md: By giving away a Kapila cow with a calf resembling herself, giving profuse milk, free from every vicious habit, and covered with a piece of cloth, the giver acquires great honours in the region of Brahma.

data.v: अपां फेनसवर्णां तु सवत्सां कांस्यदोहनाम् । प्रदाय वस्त्रसंवीतां वारुणं लोकमश्नुते ॥
data.md: Those men who make gifts of Kapila kine with their calves and with vessels of white brass for milking themkine, which are not vicious and which, while given away, are one wrapped round with clothsconquer both this and the next world.

data.v: वातरेणुसवर्णां तु सवत्सां कांस्यदोहनाम् । प्रदाय वस्त्रसंवीतां वायुलोके महीयते ॥
data.md: By giving away a frothycoloured cow, with a calf and vessel of white brass for milking her, and covered with a piece of cloth, one acquires the region of Varuna.

data.v: हिरण्यवर्णां पिङ्गाक्षीं सवत्सां कांस्यदोहनाम् । प्रदाय वस्त्रसंवीतां कौबेरं लोकमश्नुते ॥
data.md: By giving away a frothycoloured cow, with a calf and vessel of white brass for milking her, and covered with a piece of cloth, one acquires the region of Varuna.

data.v: पलालधूम्रवर्णां तु सवत्सां कांस्यदोहनाम् । प्रदाय वस्त्रसंवीतां पितृलोके महीयते ॥
data.md: Those men who make gifts of Kapila kine with their calves and with vessels of white brass for milking themkine, which are not vicious and which, while given away, are one wrapped round with clothsconquer both this and the next world.

data.v: सवत्सां पीवरीं दत्त्वा शितिकण्ठामलंकृताम् । वैश्वदेवमसंबाधं स्थानं श्रेष्ठं प्रपद्यते ॥
data.md: By giving away a fat cow with the flesh of its throat hanging down and accompanied by her calf, one acquires easily the high region of the Vishvedevas.

data.v: समानवत्सां गौरीं तु धेनुं दत्त्वा पयस्विनीम् । सुव्रतां वस्त्रसंवीतां वसूनां लोकमश्नुते ॥
data.md: By giving away a Kapila cow with a calf resembling herself, giving profuse milk, free from every vicious habit, and covered with a piece of cloth, the giver acquires great honours in the region of Brahma.

data.v: पाण्डुकम्बलवर्णां तु सवत्सां कांस्यदोहनाम् । प्रदाय वस्त्रसंवीतां साध्यानां लोकमश्नुते ॥
data.md: By giving away a frothycoloured cow, with a calf and vessel of white brass for milking her, and covered with a piece of cloth, one acquires the region of Varuna.

data.v: वैराटपृष्ठमुक्षाणं सर्वरत्नैरलंकृतम् । प्रदाय मरुतां लोकानजरान्प्रतिपद्यते ॥
data.md: By giving away a bull with a huge hump and adorned with every jewel, the giver, O king, acquires the region of the Maruts.

data.v: वत्सोपपन्नां नीलाङ्गां सर्वरत्नसमन्विताम् । गन्धर्वाप्सरसां लोकान्दत्त्वा प्राप्नोति मानवः ॥
data.md: By giving away a bluecoloured bull, that is fullgrown in years and adorned with every ornament, the giver acquires the regions of the celestial musicians and nymphs.

data.v: शितिकण्ठमनड्वाहं सर्वरत्नैरलंकृतम् । दत्त्वा प्रजापतेर्लोकान्विशोकः प्रतिपद्यते ॥
data.md: By giving away a cow with the flesh of her throat hanging down, and adorned with every ornament, the giver, shorn of grief, acquires the region of Prajapati himself.

data.v: गोप्रदानरतो याति भित्त्वा जलदसंचयान् । विमानेनार्कवर्णेन दिवि राजन्विराजता ॥
data.md: That man, O king, who habitually makes gifts of kine, proceeds passing through the clouds, on a sunny car to the celestial region and shines there in splendour.

data.v: तं चारुवेषाः सुश्रोण्यः सहस्रं वरयोषितः । रमयन्ति नरश्रेष्ठ गोप्रदानरतं नरम् ॥
data.md: That man who habitually makes gifts of kine is considered as the foremost of his kind. When thus proceeding to celestial region, he is received by a thousand celestiai damsels of beautiful hips and adorned with handsome dresses and ornaments. Those girls serve him there and minister to his delight.

data.v: वीणानां वल्लकीनां च नूपुराणां च शिञ्जितैः । हासैश्च हरिणाक्षीणां प्रसुप्तः प्रतिबोध्यते ॥
data.md: He sleeps there in peace and is awakened by the musical laughter of those gazelleeyed maidens, the sweet notes of their Vinas, the soft strains of their lutes, and the sweet tinkle of their Nupuras.

data.v: यावन्ति लोमानि भवन्ति धेन्वा;स्तावन्ति वर्षाणि महीयते सः । स्वर्गाच्च्युतश्चापि ततो नृलोके; कुले समुत्पत्स्यति गोमिनां सः ॥
data.md: The man who makes gifts of kine lives in the celestial region and is honoured there for as many years as there are hairs on the bodies of the kine he gives away. Falling off from the celestial region (upon the termination of his merit), such a man is born as a man and, in fact, in a superior family among men.

data.v: घृतक्षीरप्रदा गावो घृतयोन्यो घृतोद्भवाः । घृतनद्यो घृतावर्तास्ता मे सन्तु सदा गृहे ॥
data.md: Vasishtha said Kine give clarified butter and milk. They are the sources of clarified butter and they have originated from clarified butter. They are rivers of clarified butter, and eddies of clarified butter. Let kine ever be in my house.

data.v: घृतं मे हृदये नित्यं घृतं नाभ्यां प्रतिष्ठितम् । घृतं सर्वेषु गात्रेषु घृतं मे मनसि स्थितम् ॥
data.md: Clarified butter is always in my heart. Clarified butter is even established in my navel. Clarified butter is in every limb of mine. Clarified butter lives in my mind.

data.v: गावो ममाग्रतो नित्यं गावः पृष्ठत एव च । गावो मे सर्वतश्चैव गवां मध्ये वसाम्यहम् ॥
data.md: Kine are always at my front. Kine are always at my rear. Kine are on every side of my body. I live in the midst of kine.

data.v: इत्याचम्य जपेत्सायं प्रातश्च पुरुषः सदा । यदह्ना कुरुते पापं तस्मात्स परिमुच्यते ॥
data.md: Having purified oneself by touching water, one should, morning and evening, recite these Mantras every day. By this, one is sure to be purged of all the sins one may commit in course of the day.

data.v: प्रासादा यत्र सौवर्णा वसोर्धारा च यत्र सा । गन्धर्वाप्सरसो यत्र तत्र यान्ति सहस्रदाः ॥
data.md: They who make gifts of a thousand kine, leaving this world proceed to the regions of the Gandharvas and the celestial nymphs where there are many palatial buildings made of gold and where the celestial Ganga, called the current of Vasu, runs.

data.v: नवनीतपङ्काः क्षीरोदा दधिशैवलसंकुलाः । वहन्ति यत्र नद्यो वै तत्र यान्ति सहस्रदाः ॥
data.md: Givers of a thousand kine go there where run many rivers, having milk for their water, cheese for their mire, and curds for their floating moss.

data.v: गवां शतसहस्रं तु यः प्रयच्छेद्यथाविधि । परामृद्धिमवाप्याथ स गोलोके महीयते ॥
data.md: That man who gives hundreds of thousands of kine away according to the ritual laid down in the scriptures, acquires great prosperity (here) and great honours in the celestial region.

data.v: दश चोभयतः प्रेत्य मातापित्रोः पितामहान् । दधाति सुकृताँल्लोकान्पुनाति च कुलं नरः ॥
data.md: Such a man causes both his paternal and maternal ancestors to the tenth degree acquire regions of great happiness, and sanctifies his whole race.

data.v: धेन्वाः प्रमाणेन समप्रमाणां; धेनुं तिलानामपि च प्रदाय । पानीयदाता च यमस्य लोके; न यातनां कांचिदुपैति तत्र ॥
data.md: are Kine are sacred. They are the foremost of all things in the world. They are indeed the refuge of the universe. They are the mothers of the very celestials. They indeed incomparable. They should be dedicated in sacrifices.

data.v: पवित्रमग्र्यं जगतः प्रतिष्ठा; दिवौकसां मातरोऽथाप्रमेयाः । अन्वालभेद्दक्षिणतो व्रजेच्च; दद्याच्च पात्रे प्रसमीक्ष्य कालम् ॥
data.md: When going on journeys, one should leave the kine to his left. Determining the proper time, they should be given away to worthy persons.

data.v: धेनुं सवत्सां कपिलां भूरिशृङ्गां; कांस्योपदोहां वसनोत्तरीयाम् । प्रदाय तां गाहति दुर्विगाह्यां; याम्यां सभां वीतभयो मनुष्यः ॥
data.md: By giving away a Kapila cow, having large horns, accompanied by a calf and a vessel of white brass for milking her, and covered with a piece of cloth, one freed from fear, enters the palace of Yama that is so difficult to enter.

data.v: सुरूपा बहुरूपाश्च विश्वरूपाश्च मातरः । गावो मामुपतिष्ठन्तामिति नित्यं प्रकीर्तयेत् ॥
data.md: One should always recite this sacred Mantra, viz. Kine are of beautiful form. Kine are of various forins. They are of universal form. They are the mothers of the universe. O, let kine approach me.

data.v: नातः पुण्यतरं दानं नातः पुण्यतरं फलम् । नातो विशिष्टं लोकेषु भूतं भवितुमर्हति ॥
data.md: There is no gift more sacred than that of kine. There is no gift that yields more blessed merit. There has been nothing equal to the cow, nor will there be anything that will cqual her.

data.v: त्वचा लोम्नाथ शृङ्गैश्च वालैः क्षीरेण मेदसा । यज्ञं वहन्ति संभूय किमस्त्यभ्यधिकं ततः ॥
data.md: With her skin, her hair, her hons' the hair of her tail, her milk, and her fatwith all these togetherthe cow maintains sacrifice. What thing is there that is more useful than the cow?

data.v: यया सर्वमिदं व्याप्तं जगत्स्थावरजङ्गमम् । तां धेनुं शिरसा वन्दे भूतभव्यस्य मातरम् ॥
data.md: Bending my head to her with respect, I worship the cow who is the mother of both the Past and Future, and by whom the entire universe of mobile and immobile creatures is sustained.

data.v: गुणवचनसमुच्चयैकदेशो; नृवर मयैष गवां प्रकीर्तितस्ते । न हि परमिह दानमस्ति गोभ्यो; भवन्ति न चापि परायणं तथान्यत् ॥
data.md: O best of men, I have thus recited to you only a portion of the great merits of kine. There is no gift in this world that is superior to that of kine. There is also no refuge in this world that is higher than kine.

data.v: परमिदमिति भूमिपो विचिन्त्य; प्रवरमृषेर्वचनं ततो महात्मा । व्यसृजत नियतात्मवान्द्विजेभ्यः; सुबहु च गोधनमाप्तवांश्च लोकान् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Considering these words of the Rishi Vasishtha as highly important, that great giver of land, king Saudasa, then made gifts of a very large number of kine to the Brahmanas, controlling his senses all the while, and as the result of those gifts, the king succeeded in acquiring many regions of happiness in the next world.

data.v: पवित्राणां पवित्रं यच्छ्रेष्ठं लोके च यद्भवेत् । पावनं परमं चैव तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Tell me, O grandfather, what is that which is the most sacred of all sacred things in the world, other than that which has been already mentioned, and which is the greatest of all purifying objects.

data.v: गावो महार्थाः पुण्याश्च तारयन्ति च मानवान् । धारयन्ति प्रजाश्चेमाः पयसा हविषा तथा ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Kine are the foremost of all objects. They are highly sacred and they save men. With their milk and with the Havi manufactured therefrom, kine sustain all creatures in the universe.

data.v: न हि पुण्यतमं किंचिद्गोभ्यो भरतसत्तम । एताः पवित्राः पुण्याश्च त्रिषु लोकेष्वनुत्तमाः ॥
data.md: O best of the Bharatas, there is nothing that is more sacred than kine. The highest of all things in the three worlds, kine are themselves sacred and capable of purifying others.

data.v: देवानामुपरिष्टाच्च गावः प्रतिवसन्ति वै । दत्त्वा चैता नरपते यान्ति स्वर्गं मनीषिणः ॥
data.md: Kine live in a region that is even greater than the region of the celestials. When given away, they save their givers. Wise men succeed in acquiring the celestial region by making gifts of kine.

data.v: मान्धाता यौवनाश्वश्च ययातिर्नहुषस्तथा । गावो ददन्तः सततं सहस्रशतसंमिताः । गताः परमकं स्थानं देवैरपि सुदुर्लभम् ॥
data.md: Yuvanashvas son Mandhatri, Yayati, and Nahusha, used always to give away kine in thousands.

data.v: अपि चात्र पुरावृत्तं कथयिष्यामि तेऽनघ ॥
ऋषीणामुत्तमं धीमान्कृष्णद्वैपायनं शुकः । अभिवाद्याह्निकं कृत्वा शुचिः प्रयतमानसः । पितरं परिपप्रच्छ दृष्टलोकपरावरम् ॥
data.md: Once on a time, having finished his morning rites, the intelligent Shuka approached with a controlled mind his father, that foremost of Rishis, viz., the Island-born Krishna, who knows the distinction between the superior and the inferior, and saluting him, said, What is that sacrifice which appears to you as the foremost of all sacrifices?

data.v: को यज्ञः सर्वयज्ञानां वरिष्ठ उपलक्ष्यते । किं च कृत्वा परं स्वर्गं प्राप्नुवन्ति मनीषिणः ॥
केन देवाः पवित्रेण स्वर्गमश्नन्ति वा विभो । किं च यज्ञस्य यज्ञत्वं क्व च यज्ञः प्रतिष्ठितः ॥
दानानामुत्तमं किं च किं च सत्रमतः परम् । पवित्राणां पवित्रं च यत्तद्ब्रूहि ममानघ ॥
data.md: What forms the character of sacrifice as sacrifice? What is that upon which sacrifice rests? What is that which is considered as the best by the deities? What is that sacrifice which is above the sacrifices of this world? Do you also tell me, O father what is that which is the most sacred of all things.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु वचनं व्यासः परमधर्मवित् । पुत्रायाकथयत्सर्वं तत्त्वेन भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Having heard these words of his son, O chief of Bharata's race, Vyasa, the foremost of all persons knowing duties, said as follows to him.

data.v: गावः प्रतिष्ठा भूतानां तथा गावः परायणम् । गावः पुण्याः पवित्राश्च पावनं धर्म एव च ॥
data.md: Vyasa said Kine form the support of all creatures. Kine are the refuge of all creatures. Kine are the embodiment of virtue. Kine are sacred, and kine purifiers of all.

data.v: पूर्वमासन्नशृङ्गा वै गाव इत्यनुशुश्रुमः । शृङ्गार्थे समुपासन्त ताः किल प्रभुमव्ययम् ॥
data.md: Formerly kine were hornless as we have heard. For getting horns they adored the eternal and powerful Brahman.

data.v: ततो ब्रह्मा तु गाः प्रायमुपविष्टाः समीक्ष्य ह । ईप्सितं प्रददौ ताभ्यो गोभ्यः प्रत्येकशः प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Seeing the kine paying their adorations to him and sitting without food, the powerful Brahman granted to each of them what each desired.

data.v: तासां शृङ्गाण्यजायन्त यस्या यादृङ्मनोगतम् । नानावर्णाः शृङ्गवन्त्यस्ता व्यरोचन्त पुत्रक ॥
data.md: Thereafter their horns grew and each got what each wished. Of various colours, and gifted with horns, they began to shine beautifully, O son!

data.v: ब्रह्मणा वरदत्तास्ता हव्यकव्यप्रदाः शुभाः । पुण्याः पवित्राः सुभगा दिव्यसंस्थानलक्षणाः । गावस्तेजो महद्दिव्यं गवां दानं प्रशस्यते ॥
data.md: Favoured by Brahman himself with boons, kine are auspicious and givers of Havya and Kavya. They are the embodiments of virtue. They are sacred and highly blessed. They have excellent form and qualities.

data.v: ये चैताः संप्रयच्छन्ति साधवो वीतमत्सराः । ते वै सुकृतिनः प्रोक्ताः सर्वदानप्रदाश्च ते । गवां लोकं तथा पुण्यमाप्नुवन्ति च तेऽनघ ॥
data.md: Kine form high and excellent energy. The gift of kine is highly spoken of. Those good men who, shorn or pride, make gifts of kine, are considered as doers of righteous deeds and as givers of all articles. Such men, O sinless one, acquire the highly sacred region of kine.

data.v: यत्र वृक्षा मधुफला दिव्यपुष्पफलोपगाः । पुष्पाणि च सुगन्धीनि दिव्यानि द्विजसत्तम ॥
data.md: The trees there yield sweet fruits. Indeed, those trees are always bedecked with excellent flowers and fruits. Those flowers, O best of twiceborn persons, have celestial fragrance.

data.v: सर्वा मणिमयी भूमिः सूक्ष्मकाञ्चनवालुका । सर्वत्र सुखसंस्पर्शा निष्पङ्का नीरजा शुभा ॥
data.md: The entire soil of that region is formed of gems. The sands there are all gold. The climate there possesses the excellencies of every season. There is no mire, no dust. It is, indeed, highly sacred.

data.v: रक्तोत्पलवनैश्चैव मणिदण्डैर्हिरण्मयैः । तरुणादित्यसंकाशैर्भान्ति तत्र जलाशयाः ॥
data.md: The rivers there shine in resplendence for the red lotuses blossoming upon their bosoms, and for the jewels, gems and gold that are on their banks and which display the effulgence of the morning Sun

data.v: महार्हमणिपत्रैश्च काञ्चनप्रभकेसरैः । नीलोत्पलविमिश्रैश्च सरोभिर्बहुपङ्कजैः ॥
data.md: There are many lakes also on whose breasts are many lotuses, mixed here and there with Nymphoea stellata, and having their petals made of costly gems, and their filaments goldhued.

data.v: करवीरवनैः फुल्लैः सहस्रावर्तसंवृतैः । संतानकवनैः फुल्लैर्वृक्षैश्च समलंकृताः ॥
data.md: They are also bedecked with flowering forests of the Nerium odorum with thousands of beautiful creepers twining round them, as also with forests of Santanakas bearing flowers.

data.v: निर्मलाभिश्च मुक्ताभिर्मणिभिश्च महाधनैः । उद्धूतपुलिनास्तत्र जातरूपैश्च निम्नगाः ॥
data.md: There are rivers whose banks are variegated with many bright pearls and shining gems and gold.

data.v: सर्वरत्नमयैश्चित्रैरवगाढा नगोत्तमैः । जातरूपमयैश्चान्यैर्हुताशनसमप्रभैः ॥
data.md: Parts of those regions are covered with excellent trees that are decked with jewels and gems of every sort. Some of them are made of gold and some of them are effulgent like fire.

data.v: सौवर्णगिरयस्तत्र मणिरत्नशिलोच्चयाः । सर्वरत्नमयैर्भान्ति शृङ्गैश्चारुभिरुच्छ्रितैः ॥
data.md: There stand many mountains made of gold, and many hills made of jewels and gems. These shine in beauty on account of their tall summits made of all sorts of gems.

data.v: नित्यपुष्पफलास्तत्र नगाः पत्ररथाकुलाः । दिव्यगन्धरसैः पुष्पैः फलैश्च भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: The trees that bedeck those regions always put forth flowers and fruits, and are always covered with dense foliage. The flowers always yield a celestial fragrance and the fruits are greatly sweet, О chief of Bharata's race.

data.v: रमन्ते पुण्यकर्माणस्तत्र नित्यं युधिष्ठिर । सर्वकामसमृद्धार्था निःशोका गतमन्यवः ॥
data.md: The righteous persons, O Yudhishthira, always sport there happily. Freed from grief and anger, they spend their time there, crowned with the fruition of every desire.

data.v: विमानेषु विचित्रेषु रमणीयेषु भारत । मोदन्ते पुण्यकर्माणो विहरन्तो यशस्विनः ॥
data.md: Pious and illustrious persons sport there happily, moving from place to place, O Bharata, on delightful and highly beautiful cars.

data.v: उपक्रीडन्ति तान्राजञ्शुभाश्चाप्सरसां गणाः । एताँल्लोकानवाप्नोति गां दत्त्वा वै युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Bevies of celestial nymphs always amuse there, with music and dance. Indeed, Yudhishthira, a person goes to such regions as the fruit of his making gifts of kine.

data.v: यासामधिपतिः पूषा मारुतो बलवान्बली । ऐश्वर्ये वरुणो राजा ता मां पान्तु युगंधराः ॥
सुरूपा बहुरूपाश्च विश्वरूपाश्च मातरः । प्राजापत्या इति ब्रह्मञ्जपेन्नित्यं यतव्रतः ॥
data.md: One should always recite this sacred Mantra, viz. Kine are of beautiful form. Kine are of various forins. They are of universal form. They are the mothers of the universe. O, let kine approach me.

data.v: गास्तु शुश्रूषते यश्च समन्वेति च सर्वशः । तस्मै तुष्टाः प्रयच्छन्ति वरानपि सुदुर्लभान् ॥
data.md: He who serves kine with respect and who follows them with humility, succeeds in getting many invaluable boons from kine who become pleased with him.

data.v: न द्रुह्येन्मनसा चापि गोषु ता हि सुखप्रदाः । अर्चयेत सदा चैव नमस्कारैश्च पूजयेत् । दान्तः प्रीतमना नित्यं गवां व्युष्टिं तथाश्नुते ॥
data.md: One should never, even in his heart, injure, kine. One should indeed, always confer happiness on them. One should always respect kine and adore them, by bending low his head.

data.v: येन देवाः पवित्रेण भुञ्जते लोकमुत्तमम् । यत्पवित्रं पवित्राणां तद्घृतं शिरसा वहेत् ॥
data.md: Thatsacred thing by whose help the celestials enjoy regions of happiness, that which is most sacred of all sacred things, viz., clarified butter, should then be carried on the head.

data.v: घृतेन जुहुयादग्निं घृतेन स्वस्ति वाचयेत् । घृतं प्राशेद्घृतं दद्याद्गवां व्युष्टिं तथाश्नुते ॥
data.md: One should pour libations on the fire, using clarificd butter for purpose. One should make Brahmanas utter blessings upon one by presents of clarified butter. One should make gifts of clarified butter. One should also eat clarified butter. As the reward of such deeds one is sure to acquire that prosperity which kine grant.

data.v: त्र्यहमुष्णं पिबेन्मूत्रं त्र्यहमुष्णं पिबेत्पयः । गवामुष्णं पयः पीत्वा त्र्यहमुष्णं घृतं पिबेत् । त्र्यहमुष्णं घृतं पीत्वा वायुभक्षो भवेत्त्र्यहम् ॥
निर्हृतैश्च यवैर्गोभिर्मासं प्रसृतयावकः । ब्रह्महत्यासमं पापं सर्वमेतेन शुध्यति ॥
data.md: That man who, for a month, lives upon the gruel of barley picked up every day from cowdung, becomes purged of sins as heinous as Brahmanicide.

data.v: पराभवार्थं दैत्यानां देवैः शौचमिदं कृतम् । देवत्वमपि च प्राप्ताः संसिद्धाश्च महाबलाः ॥
data.md: After their defeat at the hands of the demons, the deities practised this expiation, It was on account of this expiation that they succeeded in regaining their position as celestials. Indeed, it was through this that they regained their strength and became successful.

data.v: गावः पवित्राः पुण्याश्च पावनं परमं महत् । ताश्च दत्त्वा द्विजातिभ्यो नरः स्वर्गमुपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: Kine are sacred. They are embodiments of virtue. They are high and most efficacious purifiers of all. By making gifts of kine to the Brahmanas one acquires the celestial region.

data.v: गवां मध्ये शुचिर्भूत्वा गोमतीं मनसा जपेत् । पूताभिरद्भिराचम्य शुचिर्भवति निर्मलः ॥
data.md: Living in a pure state, in the midst of kine, one should mentally recite those sacred Mantras named Gomati, after touching pure water. By doing this, one becomes purified.

data.v: अग्निमध्ये गवां मध्ये ब्राह्मणानां च संसदि । विद्यावेदव्रतस्नाता ब्राह्मणाः पुण्यकर्मिणः ॥
data.md: Brahmanas of righteous deeds, who have been purified by knowledge, study of the Vedas, and observance of vows, should, only in the midst of sacred fires or kine or conclaves of Brahmanas, impart to their disciples a knowledge of the Gomati Mantras which are in every way like a sacrifice. One should observed a fast for three nights for receiving the boon formed by a knowledge of the meaning of the Gomati Mantras.

data.v: अध्यापयेरञ्शिष्यान्वै गोमतीं यज्ञसंमिताम् । त्रिरात्रोपोषितः श्रुत्वा गोमतीं लभते वरम् ॥
पुत्रकामश्च लभते पुत्रं धनमथापि च । पतिकामा च भर्तारं सर्वकामांश्च मानवः । गावस्तुष्टाः प्रयच्छन्ति सेविता वै न संशयः ॥
data.md: The man who wishes to get a son may cbtain it by worshipping these Mantras, He who wishes to acquire riches may have his desire fulfilled by worshipping these Mantras. The girl desirous of having a good husband may have her wish fulfilled by the same means. In fact, one may acquire the fruition of every desire he may cherish, by worshipping these sacred Mantras.

data.v: एवमेता महाभागा यज्ञियाः सर्वकामदाः । रोहिण्य इति जानीहि नैताभ्यो विद्यते परम् ॥
data.md: When kine are pleased with the service one renders them, they are, forsooth, capable of granting the fruition of every desire. Even so, kine are highly blessed. They are the essential articles of sacrifices. They are grantors of every wish. Know that there is nothing superior to kine.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स महातेजाः शुकः पित्रा महात्मना । पूजयामास गा नित्यं तस्मात्त्वमपि पूजय ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed by his great father, Shuka, gifted with great energy, began from that time to adore kine every day. Do you also, O son, act thus.

data.v: मया गवां पुरीषं वै श्रिया जुष्टमिति श्रुतम् । एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं संशयोऽत्र हि मे महान् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said I have heard that the dung of the cow is gifted with prosperity. I wish to hear how this has been occasioned. I have doubts, O grand father which you should remove.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । गोभिर्नृपेह संवादं श्रिया भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Bhishma Said : Regarding it, O Yudhishthira, is recited the discourse that took place forinerly between a Brahmana and Yama.

data.v: श्रीः कृत्वेह वपुः कान्तं गोमध्यं प्रविवेश ह । गावोऽथ विस्मितास्तस्या दृष्ट्वा रूपस्य संपदम् ॥
data.md: Once on a time, assuming a very beautiful form, the goddess Shree entered a herd of kine. Sceing her beauty the kine became filled with wonder.

data.v: कासि देवि कुतो वा त्वं रूपेणाप्रतिमा भुवि । विस्मिताः स्म महाभागे तव रूपस्य संपदा ॥
data.md: The kine said Who are you, O goddess? Whence have you become nonpareil on Earth for beauty? O highly blessed goddess, we have been filled with wonder at your beauty.

data.v: इच्छामस्त्वां वयं ज्ञातुं का त्वं क्व च गमिष्यसि । तत्त्वेन च सुवर्णाभे सर्वमेतद्ब्रवीहि नः ॥
data.md: We wish to know who you are. Who indeed, are you? Where will you proceed? O vou of very great beauty, do tell us in detail all We wish to know!

data.v: लोककान्तास्मि भद्रं वः श्रीर्नाम्नेह परिश्रुता । मया दैत्याः परित्यक्ता विनष्टाः शाश्वतीः समाः ॥
data.md: Shree said Blessed be you, I am dear to all creatures. Indeed. I am known by the name of Shree. Forsaken by me, the demons have been lost for ever.

data.v: इन्द्रो विवस्वान्सोमश्च विष्णुरापोऽग्निरेव च । मयाभिपन्ना ऋध्यन्ते ऋषयो देवतास्तथा ॥
यांश्च द्विषाम्यहं गावस्ते विनश्यन्ति सर्वशः । धर्मार्थकामहीनाश्च ते भवन्त्यसुखान्विताः ॥
एवंप्रभावां मां गावो विजानीत सुखप्रदाम् । इच्छामि चापि युष्मासु वस्तुं सर्वासु नित्यदा । आगता प्रार्थयानाहं श्रीजुष्टा भवतानघाः ॥
data.md: I wish to always live in every one of you. Going to your presence, I solicit you. Be all of you gifted with Shree.

data.v: अध्रुवां चञ्चलां च त्वां सामान्यां बहुभिः सह । न त्वामिच्छामि भद्रं ते गम्यतां यत्र रोचते ॥
data.md: The kine said You are fickle and restless. You allow yourself to be enjoyed by many persons. We do not wish to have you! Blessed be you, go wherever you like.

data.v: वपुष्मन्त्यो वयं सर्वाः किमस्माकं त्वयाद्य वै । यत्रेष्टं गम्यतां तत्र कृतकार्या वयं त्वया ॥
data.md: As regards ourselves, all of us have good forms. What need have we with you? Go wherever you like. You have already pleased us greatly.

data.v: किमेतद्वः क्षमं गावो यन्मां नेहाभ्यनन्दथ । न मां संप्रति गृह्णीथ कस्माद्वै दुर्लभां सतीम् ॥
data.md: Shree said Is it proper with you, you kine, that you do not welcome me? I am difficult of being attained. Why then do you not accept me?

data.v: सत्यश्च लोकवादोऽयं लोके चरति सुव्रताः । स्वयं प्राप्ते परिभवो भवतीति विनिश्चयः ॥
data.md: It appears, you creatures of excellent vows, that the popular proverb is true, viz., that it is certain that when one comes to another of this own accord and without being sought, he is not much respected.

data.v: महदुग्रं तपः कृत्वा मां निषेवन्ति मानवाः । देवदानवगन्धर्वाः पिशाचोरगराक्षसाः ॥
data.md: The gods, the Danavas, the Gandharvas, the Pishachas, the Uragas, the Rakshasas, and human being succeed in getting me only after practising the severest austerities.

data.v: क्षममेतद्धि वो गावः प्रतिगृह्णीत मामिह । नावमन्या ह्यहं सौम्यास्त्रैलोक्ये सचराचरे ॥
data.md: You who have such energy, do you take me! You amiable ones, I am never dishonoured by any one in the three worlds of mobile and immobile creatures.

data.v: नावमन्यामहे देवि न त्वां परिभवामहे । अध्रुवा चलचित्तासि ततस्त्वां वर्जयामहे ॥
data.md: The kine said We do not disregard you, O goddess! We do not slight you! You are fickle and of a very restless heart. It is for this only that we take leave of you.

data.v: बहुनात्र किमुक्तेन गम्यतां यत्र वाञ्छसि । वपुष्मत्यो वयं सर्वाः किमस्माकं त्वयानघे ॥
data.md: What need of much talk? Go wherever you like. All of us have excellent forms. What need have we with you, O sinless one?

data.v: अवज्ञाता भविष्यामि सर्वलोकेषु मानदाः । प्रत्याख्यानेन युष्माभिः प्रसादः क्रियतामिति ॥
data.md: Shree said You givers of honours, renounced by you thus, I shall certainly be an object of disregard with all the world? Do you show me grace.

data.v: महाभागा भवत्यो वै शरण्याः शरणागताम् । परित्रायन्तु मां नित्यं भजमानामनिन्दिताम् । माननां त्वहमिच्छामि भवत्यः सततं शुभाः ॥
data.md: You are all highly blessed, You are ever ready to grant protection to those who seek your protection. I have come to you soliciting your refuge. I have no fault. Do you rescue me.

data.v: अप्येकाङ्गे तु वो वस्तुमिच्छामि च सुकुत्सिते । न वोऽस्ति कुत्सितं किंचिदङ्गेष्वालक्ष्यतेऽनघाः ॥
पुण्याः पवित्राः सुभगा ममादेशं प्रयच्छत । वसेयं यत्र चाङ्गेऽहं तन्मे व्याख्यातुमर्हथ ॥
एवमुक्तास्तु ता गावः शुभाः करुणवत्सलाः । संमन्त्र्य सहिताः सर्वाः श्रियमूचुर्नराधिप ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed by Shree, the kine, always auspicious and bent on showing kindness to all who are devoted to them, parleyed with one another, and then addressing Shree, said to her, O king, these words.

data.v: अवश्यं मानना कार्या तवास्माभिर्यशस्विनि । शकृन्मूत्रे निवस नः पुण्यमेतद्धि नः शुभे ॥
data.md: The kine said you of great fame, it is certainly desirable that we should honour you! Do you live in our urine and dung. Both these are sacred, O goddess.

data.v: दिष्ट्या प्रसादो युष्माभिः कृतो मेऽनुग्रहात्मकः । एवं भवतु भद्रं वः पूजितास्मि सुखप्रदाः ॥
data.md: Shree said By good luck, you have shown me much favour. Let it be even as you say! Blessed by you all, I have really been honoured by you, you givers of happiness.

data.v: एवं कृत्वा तु समयं श्रीर्गोभिः सह भारत । पश्यन्तीनां ततस्तासां तत्रैवान्तरधीयत ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Having, O Bharata, made this contract with kine, Shree there and then, before those kine, disappeared.

data.v: एतद्गोशकृतः पुत्र माहात्म्यं तेऽनुवर्णितम् । माहात्म्यं च गवां भूयः श्रूयतां गदतो मम ॥
data.md: I have thus told you, O son, the glory of the dung of kine. I shall once again describe to you the glory of kine. Do you listen to me.

data.v: ये च गाः संप्रयच्छन्ति हुतशिष्टाशिनश्च ये । तेषां सत्राणि यज्ञाश्च नित्यमेव युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Bhishma said on They who make gifts of kine, and who live upon the remnants of things offered as libations the sacred fire, are considered, O Yudhishthira as always performing sacrifices of kind.

data.v: ऋते दधिघृतेनेह न यज्ञः संप्रवर्तते । तेन यज्ञस्य यज्ञत्वमतोमूलं च लक्ष्यते ॥
data.md: No sacrifice can be performed without the help of curds and clarified butter. The very character as sacrifice which sacrifices have, depends upon clarified butter. Hence clarified butter is considered as the very root of sacrifice.

data.v: दानानामपि सर्वेषां गवां दानं प्रशस्यते । गावः श्रेष्ठाः पवित्राश्च पावनं ह्येतदुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Of all kinds of gifts, the gift of kine is spoken highest of. Kine are the foremost of all things. Themselves sacred, they are the best of purifier.

data.v: पुष्ट्यर्थमेताः सेवेत शान्त्यर्थमपि चैव ह । पयो दधि घृतं यासां सर्वपापप्रमोचनम् ॥
data.md: People should cherish kine for getting prosperity and even peace. The milk, curds, and clarified butter that kine yield are capable of purifying one from every kind of sin.

data.v: गावस्तेजः परं प्रोक्तमिह लोके परत्र च । न गोभ्यः परमं किंचित्पवित्रं पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: Kine are said to represent the highest energy both in this world and the next. There is nothing that is more sacred or purifying than kine, O chief of the Bharatas.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । पितामहस्य संवादमिन्द्रस्य च युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Bhishma Said : Regarding it, O Yudhishthira, is recited the discourse that took place forinerly between a Brahmana and Yama.

data.v: पराभूतेषु दैत्येषु शक्रे त्रिभुवनेश्वरे । प्रजाः समुदिताः सर्वाः सत्यधर्मपरायणाः ॥
data.md: After the demons had been defeated and Shakra had become the lord of the three worlds, all creatures grew prosperous and became devoted to the true religion.

data.v: अथर्षयः सगन्धर्वाः किंनरोरगराक्षसाः । देवासुरसुपर्णाश्च प्रजानां पतयस्तथा । पर्युपासन्त कौरव्य कदाचिद्वै पितामहम् ॥
नारदः पर्वतश्चैव विश्वावसुहहाहुहू । दिव्यतानेषु गायन्तः पर्युपासन्त तं प्रभुम् ॥
तत्र दिव्यानि पुष्पाणि प्रावहत्पवनस्तथा । आजह्रुरृतवश्चापि सुगन्धीनि पृथक्पृथक् ॥
तस्मिन्देवसमावाये सर्वभूतसमागमे । दिव्यवादित्रसंघुष्टे दिव्यस्त्रीचारणावृते । इन्द्रः पप्रच्छ देवेशमभिवाद्य प्रणम्य च ॥
देवानां भगवन्कस्माल्लोकेशानां पितामह । उपरिष्टाद्गवां लोक एतदिच्छामि वेदितुम् ॥
किं तपो ब्रह्मचर्यं वा गोभिः कृतमिहेश्वर । देवानामुपरिष्टाद्यद्वसन्त्यरजसः सुखम् ॥
data.md: What austerities, what Brahmacharya, O lord, did kine perform on account of which they are able to live happily in a region that is even above that of the celestials.

data.v: ततः प्रोवाच तं ब्रह्मा शक्रं बलनिसूदनम् । अवज्ञातास्त्वया नित्यं गावो बलनिसूदन ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by Indra, Brahman said to the destroyer of Bala, You have always, O destroyer of Bala, disregarded kine.

data.v: तेन त्वमासां माहात्म्यं न वेत्थ शृणु तत्प्रभो । गवां प्रभावं परमं माहात्म्यं च सुरर्षभ ॥
data.md: Hence, you are not acquainted with glorious pereminence of kine. Listen now to me, o powerful one, as I explain to you the great energy and glorious pereminence of kine, O king of the celestials.

data.v: यज्ञाङ्गं कथिता गावो यज्ञ एव च वासव । एताभिश्चाप्यृते यज्ञो न प्रवर्तेत्कथंचन ॥
data.md: Kine have been said to be the limbs of sacrifice. They represent sacrifice itself, O Vasava! Without them there can be no sacrifice.

data.v: धारयन्ति प्रजाश्चैव पयसा हविषा तथा । एतासां तनयाश्चापि कृषियोगमुपासते ॥
data.md: With their milk and the Havi produced therefrom, they sustain all creatures. Their male children are engaged in helping the cultivation and thereby produce various kinds of paddy and other seeds.

data.v: जनयन्ति च धान्यानि बीजानि विविधानि च । ततो यज्ञाः प्रवर्तन्ते हव्यं कव्यं च सर्वशः ॥
पयो दधि घृतं चैव पुण्याश्चैताः सुराधिप । वहन्ति विविधान्भारान्क्षुत्तृष्णापरिपीडिताः ॥
data.md: From them originate sacrifices and Havya and Kavya, and milk and curds and clarified butter. Hence, O chief of the celestials, kine are sacred. Stricken with hunger and thirst, they carry various burthens.

data.v: मुनींश्च धारयन्तीह प्रजाश्चैवापि कर्मणा । वासवाकूटवाहिन्यः कर्मणा सुकृतेन च । उपरिष्टात्ततोऽस्माकं वसन्त्येताः सदैव हि ॥
data.md: Kine support ascetics. They sustain all creatures by various acts. O Vasava, kine are guileless in their conduct on account of such conduct and of many wellperformed acts, they are able to live always in regions that are even above ours.

data.v: एतत्ते कारणं शक्र निवासकृतमद्य वै । गवां देवोपरिष्टाद्धि समाख्यातं शतक्रतो ॥
एता हि वरदत्ताश्च वरदाश्चैव वासव । सौरभ्यः पुण्यकर्मिण्यः पावनाः शुभलक्षणाः ॥
यदर्थं गा गताश्चैव सौरभ्यः सुरसत्तम । तच्च मे शृणु कार्त्स्न्येन वदतो बलसूदन ॥
पुरा देवयुगे तात दैत्येन्द्रेषु महात्मसु । त्रीँल्लोकाननुशासत्सु विष्णौ गर्भत्वमागते ॥
data.md: Formerly , O son, when in the golden age the great Danavas became lords of the three worlds, Aditi performed the severest austerities and got Vishnu within her womb. Indeed, O chief of the celestials, she had stood upon one leg for many long years, desirous of having a son.

data.v: अदित्यास्तप्यमानायास्तपो घोरं सुदुश्चरम् । पुत्रार्थममरश्रेष्ठ पादेनैकेन नित्यदा ॥
तां तु दृष्ट्वा महादेवीं तप्यमानां महत्तपः । दक्षस्य दुहिता देवी सुरभिर्नाम नामतः ॥
अतप्यत तपो घोरं हृष्टा धर्मपरायणा । कैलासशिखरे रम्ये देवगन्धर्वसेविते ॥
व्यतिष्ठदेकपादेन परमं योगमास्थिता । दश वर्षसहस्राणि दश वर्षशतानि च ॥
संतप्तास्तपसा तस्या देवाः सर्षिमहोरगाः । तत्र गत्वा मया सार्धं पर्युपासन्त तां शुभाम् ॥
अथाहमब्रुवं तत्र देवीं तां तपसान्विताम् । किमर्थं तप्यते देवि तपो घोरमनिन्दिते ॥
प्रीतस्तेऽहं महाभागे तपसानेन शोभने । वरयस्व वरं देवि दातास्मीति पुरंदर ॥
वरेण भगवन्मह्यं कृतं लोकपितामह । एष एव वरो मेऽद्य यत्प्रीतोऽसि ममानघ ॥
तामेवं ब्रुवतीं देवीं सुरभीं त्रिदशेश्वर । प्रत्यब्रुवं यद्देवेन्द्र तन्निबोध शचीपते ॥
अलोभकाम्यया देवि तपसा च शुभेन ते । प्रसन्नोऽहं वरं तस्मादमरत्वं ददानि ते ॥
data.md: You will live in a region that is higher than the three worlds, through my favour. That region shall be known to all by the name of Goloka.

data.v: त्रयाणामपि लोकानामुपरिष्टान्निवत्स्यसि । मत्प्रसादाच्च विख्यातो गोलोकः स भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Your offspring, ever engaged in doing good deeds, will live in the world of men, In fact, O highly blessed one, your daughters will live there.

data.v: मानुषेषु च कुर्वाणाः प्रजाः कर्म सुतास्तव । निवत्स्यन्ति महाभागे सर्वा दुहितरश्च ते ॥
data.md: You will readily get all kinds of enjoyment, celestial and human, that you may think of. You will get whatever happiness exists in the celestial region, O blessed one! The regions, O you of a hundred eyes, that are Surabhi's are replete with means for the satisfaction of every desire, Neither Death, nor Decrepitude, nor fire, can overcome its inhabitants.

data.v: मनसा चिन्तिता भोगास्त्वया वै दिव्यमानुषाः । यच्च स्वर्गसुखं देवि तत्ते संपत्स्यते शुभे ॥
data.md: You will readily get all kinds of enjoyment, celestial and human, that you may think of. You will get whatever happiness exists in the celestial region, O blessed one! The regions, O you of a hundred eyes, that are Surabhi's are replete with means for the satisfaction of every desire, Neither Death, nor Decrepitude, nor fire, can overcome its inhabitants.

data.v: तस्या लोकाः सहस्राक्ष सर्वकामसमन्विताः । न तत्र क्रमते मृत्युर्न जरा न च पावकः । न दैन्यं नाशुभं किंचिद्विद्यते तत्र वासव ॥
data.md: O you, of a thousand eyes, hear me as I tell you what the attributes are of those regions. There the very course of Time is stopped. Decrepitude is not there nor Fire which is omnipresent in the universe. There is slightest transgression does not take place, nor disease, nor weakness of any sort.

data.v: तत्र दिव्यान्यरण्यानि दिव्यानि भवनानि च । विमानानि च युक्तानि कामगानि च वासव ॥
data.md: There may be seen many beautiful cars, all excellently equipt and which move at the will of the rider, O Vasava. O you having eyes like lotus petals, it is only by celibacy, by penances, by Truth, by self-control, by gifts, by various kinds of righteous deeds, by sojourns lo sacred waters, in fact, by severe austerities and righteous deeds well-performed, that one can attain to Goloka.

data.v: व्रतैश्च विविधैः पुण्यैस्तथा तीर्थानुसेवनात् । तपसा महता चैव सुकृतेन च कर्मणा । शक्यः समासादयितुं गोलोकः पुष्करेक्षण ॥
data.md: You had asked me, O Shakra and I have answered you in full. O destroyer of Asuras, you should never disregard kine!

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं मया शक्रानुपृच्छते । न ते परिभवः कार्यो गवामरिनिसूदन ॥
एतच्छ्रुत्वा सहस्राक्षः पूजयामास नित्यदा । गाश्चक्रे बहुमानं च तासु नित्यं युधिष्ठिर ॥
एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं पावनं च महाद्युते । पवित्रं परमं चापि गवां माहात्म्यमुत्तमम् । कीर्तितं पुरुषव्याघ्र सर्वपापविनाशनम् ॥
य इदं कथयेन्नित्यं ब्राह्मणेभ्यः समाहितः । हव्यकव्येषु यज्ञेषु पितृकार्येषु चैव ह । सार्वकामिकमक्षय्यं पितॄंस्तस्योपतिष्ठति ॥
गोषु भक्तश्च लभते यद्यदिच्छति मानवः । स्त्रियोऽपि भक्ता या गोषु ताश्च कामानवाप्नुयुः ॥
data.md: The man who is devoted to kine succeeds in getting the fruition of every desire of his. Indeed, even those women who are devoted 10 kine succeed in securing the fulfilment of every desire of theirs.

data.v: पुत्रार्थी लभते पुत्रं कन्या पतिमवाप्नुयात् । धनार्थी लभते वित्तं धर्मार्थी धर्ममाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: He who wishes for sons obtains them. He who desires daughters obtains them. He who desires riches succeeds in acquiring wealth, and he who desires religions merit succeeds in winning it.

data.v: विद्यार्थी प्राप्नुयाद्विद्यां सुखार्थी प्राप्नुयात्सुखम् । न किंचिद्दुर्लभं चैव गवां भक्तस्य भारत ॥
data.md: He who desires knowledge acquires it, and he who desires happiness succeeds in acquiring happiness. Indeed, O Bharata, there is nothing which one devoted to kine cannot obtain. l at

data.v: उक्तं पितामहेनेदं गवां दानमनुत्तमम् । विशेषेण नरेन्द्राणामिति धर्ममवेक्षताम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have, O grandfather, expounded to me the highly meritorious gift of kine. In the case of kings performing their duties, that gift is most meritorious.

data.v: राज्यं हि सततं दुःखमाश्रमाश्च सुदुर्विदाः । परिवारेण वै दुःखं दुर्धरं चाकृतात्मभिः । भूयिष्ठं च नरेन्द्राणां विद्यते न शुभा गतिः ॥
data.md: Sovereignty is always painful. It is incapable of being borne by persons of impure souls. Generally kings fail to acquire auspicious ends.

data.v: पूयन्ते तेऽत्र नियतं प्रयच्छन्तो वसुंधराम् । पूर्वं च कथिता धर्मास्त्वया मे कुरुनन्दन ॥
data.md: By always making, however, gifts of earth, they succeed in purifying themselves. You have, O prince of Kuru's race, describe to me many duties.

data.v: एवमेव गवामुक्तं प्रदानं ते नृगेण ह । ऋषिणा नाचिकेतेन पूर्वमेव निदर्शितम् ॥
data.md: You have described to me the gifts of kine formerly made by king Nriga. The Rishi Nachiketa, in ancient times, had described the merits of this act.

data.v: वेदोपनिषदे चैव सर्वकर्मसु दक्षिणा । सर्वक्रतुषु चोद्दिष्टं भूमिर्गावोऽथ काञ्चनम् ॥
data.md: The Vedas and the Upanishads also have laid down that in all sacrifices, in fact, in all sorts of religious rites, the sacrificial present should be earth or kine or gold.

data.v: तत्र श्रुतिस्तु परमा सुवर्णं दक्षिणेति वै । एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं पितामह यथातथम् ॥
data.md: The Shrutis, however, declare that of all presents, gold is very superior and is, indeed, the best. I wish, O grandfather, to hear you describe truly this subject.

data.v: किं सुवर्णं कथं जातं कस्मिन्काले किमात्मकम् । किं दानं किं फलं चैव कस्माच्च परमुच्यते ॥
data.md: What is gold? How did it spring up? When did it come into existence? What is its essence? Who is its presiding god? What are its fruits. Why is it considered as the foremost of all things?

data.v: कस्माद्दानं सुवर्णस्य पूजयन्ति मनीषिणः । कस्माच्च दक्षिणार्थं तद्यज्ञकर्मसु शस्यते ॥
data.md: Why do wise men applaud the gift of gold? Why is gold considered as the best of presents in all sacrifices?

data.v: कस्माच्च पावनं श्रेष्ठं भूमेर्गोभ्यश्च काञ्चनम् । परमं दक्षिणार्थे च तद्ब्रवीहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Why also is gold considered as a purifier superior to earth itself and kine? Why, indeed, is it considered so superior as a sacrificial present? Do you, O grandfather, describe to me all this.

data.v: शृणु राजन्नवहितो बहुकारणविस्तरम् । जातरूपसमुत्पत्तिमनुभूतं च यन्मया ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Listen, O king, with rapt attention to me as I recite to you in detail the circumstances connected with the origin of gold as understood by me.

data.v: पिता मम महातेजाः शंतनुर्निधनं गतः । तस्य दित्सुरहं श्राद्धं गङ्गाद्वारमुपागमम् ॥
data.md: When my highly energetic father Shantanu died, I proceeded to Gangadvara for performing his Shraddha.

data.v: तत्रागम्य पितुः पुत्र श्राद्धकर्म समारभम् । माता मे जाह्नवी चैव साहाय्यमकरोत्तदा ॥
data.md: Arrived there I began the Shraddha of my father. My mother Janhavi coming there, gave me great assistance.

data.v: ततोऽग्रतस्तपःसिद्धानुपवेश्य बहूनृषीन् । तोयप्रदानात्प्रभृति कार्याण्यहमथारभम् ॥
data.md: Inviting many ascetics crowned with success and making them take their seats before me, I began the preliminary rites consisting of gifts of water and of other things.

data.v: तत्समाप्य यथोद्दिष्टं पूर्वकर्म समाहितः । दातुं निर्वपणं सम्यग्यथावदहमारभम् ॥
data.md: Having with concentrated mind performed all preliminary rites as laid down in the scriptures, I began to duly offer the obsequial cake.

data.v: ततस्तं दर्भविन्यासं भित्त्वा सुरुचिराङ्गदः । प्रलम्बाभरणो बाहुरुदतिष्ठद्विशां पते ॥
data.md: I then saw, O king, that a beautiful arm, adorned with armlets and other ornaments, rose a up, piercing the ground, through the blades of Kusha grass which I had spread.

data.v: तमुत्थितमहं दृष्ट्वा परं विस्मयमागमम् । प्रतिग्रहीता साक्षान्मे पितेति भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Seeing that arm rise from the ground, I became stricken with wonder. Indeed, O chief of Bharata's race, I thought that my father had come himself for accepting the cake I was about to offer.

data.v: ततो मे पुनरेवासीत्संज्ञा संचिन्त्य शास्त्रतः । नायं वेदेषु विहितो विधिर्हस्त इति प्रभो । पिण्डो देयो नरेणेह ततो मतिरभून्मम ॥
साक्षान्नेह मनुष्यस्य पितरोऽन्तर्हिताः क्वचित् । गृह्णन्ति विहितं त्वेवं पिण्डो देयः कुशेष्विति ॥
ततोऽहं तदनादृत्य पितुर्हस्तनिदर्शनम् । शास्त्रप्रमाणात्सूक्ष्मं तु विधिं पार्थिव संस्मरन् ॥
ततो दर्भेषु तत्सर्वमददं भरतर्षभ । शास्त्रमार्गानुसारेण तद्विद्धि मनुजर्षभ ॥
ततः सोऽन्तर्हितो बाहुः पितुर्मम नराधिप । ततो मां दर्शयामासुः स्वप्नान्ते पितरस्तदा ॥
प्रीयमाणास्तु मामूचुः प्रीताः स्म भरतर्षभ । विज्ञानेन तवानेन यन्न मुह्यसि धर्मतः ॥
data.md: On that night as I slept, the departed Manes appeared to me in a dream. Pleased with me they said, O chief of Bharata's race, these words, We have been pleased with you, for the mark you have shown today of your adherence to the ordinance. It has pleased us to see that you have not deviated from the injunctions of the scriptures. The scriptural ordinance, followed by you, has become authoritative, O king.

data.v: त्वया हि कुर्वता शास्त्रं प्रमाणमिह पार्थिव । आत्मा धर्मः श्रुतं वेदाः पितरश्च महर्षिभिः ॥
साक्षात्पितामहो ब्रह्मा गुरवोऽथ प्रजापतिः । प्रमाणमुपनीता वै स्थितिश्च न विचालिता ॥
data.md: By such conduct you have honoured and maintained the authority of yourself, the scriptures, the Vedas, the Pitris and the Rishis, the Grandfather Brahman himself, and those elders, viz., the Prajapatis. Adherence to the scriptures has been upheld. You have today, O chief of the Bharatas, acted very properly.

data.v: तदिदं सम्यगारब्धं त्वयाद्य भरतर्षभ । किं तु भूमेर्गवां चार्थे सुवर्णं दीयतामिति ॥
एवं वयं च धर्मश्च सर्वे चास्मत्पितामहाः । पाविता वै भविष्यन्ति पावनं परमं हि तत् ॥
दश पूर्वान्दश परांस्तथा संतारयन्ति ते । सुवर्णं ये प्रयच्छन्ति एवं मे पितरोऽब्रुवन् ॥
ततोऽहं विस्मितो राजन्प्रतिबुद्धो विशां पते । सुवर्णदानेऽकरवं मतिं भरतसत्तम ॥
इतिहासमिमं चापि शृणु राजन्पुरातनम् । जामदग्न्यं प्रति विभो धन्यमायुष्यमेव च ॥
जामदग्न्येन रामेण तीव्ररोषान्वितेन वै । त्रिःसप्तकृत्वः पृथिवी कृता निःक्षत्रिया पुरा ॥
ततो जित्वा महीं कृत्स्नां रामो राजीवलोचनः । आजहार क्रतुं वीरो ब्रह्मक्षत्रेण पूजितम् ॥
वाजिमेधं महाराज सर्वकामसमन्वितम् । पावनं सर्वभूतानां तेजोद्युतिविवर्धनम् ॥
विपाप्मापि स तेजस्वी तेन क्रतुफलेन वै । नैवात्मनोऽथ लघुतां जामदग्न्योऽभ्यगच्छत ॥
स तु क्रतुवरेणेष्ट्वा महात्मा दक्षिणावता । पप्रच्छागमसंपन्नानृषीन्देवांश्च भार्गवः ॥
पावनं यत्परं नॄणामुग्रे कर्मणि वर्तताम् । तदुच्यतां महाभागा इति जातघृणोऽब्रवीत् ॥
देवतास्ते प्रयच्छन्ति सुवर्णं ये ददत्युत । अग्निर्हि देवताः सर्वाः सुवर्णं च तदात्मकम् ॥
data.md: Indeed, they who make gifts of gold are considered as givers of celestials. Agni is all the deities in one, and gold has Agni for its essence.

data.v: तस्मात्सुवर्णं ददता दत्ताः सर्वाश्च देवताः । भवन्ति पुरुषव्याघ्र न ह्यतः परमं विदुः ॥
data.md: Hence it is that the person who makes gift of gold gives away all the celestials. Hence, O king, there is no gift higher than the gift of gold.

data.v: भूय एव च माहात्म्यं सुवर्णस्य निबोध मे । गदतो मम विप्रर्षे सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वर ॥
data.md: Vashishtha said Hear once more, O twice born Rishi, as I describe the superiority of gold, O foremost of all wielders weapons.

data.v: मया श्रुतमिदं पूर्वं पुराणे भृगुनन्दन । प्रजापतेः कथयतो मनोः स्वायंभुवस्य वै ॥
data.md: I heard this formerly in the Purana, O son of Bhrigu's race. It represents the speech of Prajapati himself.

data.v: शूलपाणेर्भगवतो रुद्रस्य च महात्मनः । गिरौ हिमवति श्रेष्ठे तदा भृगुकुलोद्वह ॥
देव्या विवाहे निर्वृत्ते रुद्राण्या भृगुनन्दन । समागमे भगवतो देव्या सह महात्मनः । ततः सर्वे समुद्विग्ना भगवन्तमुपागमन् ॥
ते महादेवमासीनं देवीं च वरदामुमाम् । प्रसाद्य शिरसा सर्वे रुद्रमूचुर्भृगूद्वह ॥
अयं समागमो देव देव्या सह तवानघ । तपस्विनस्तपस्विन्या तेजस्विन्यातितेजसः । अमोघतेजास्त्वं देव देवी चेयमुमा तथा ॥
अपत्यं युवयोर्देव बलवद्भविता प्रभो । तन्नूनं त्रिषु लोकेषु न किंचिच्छेषयिष्यति ॥
data.md: The offspring that will result from a union like this, will, forsooth, O illustrious deity, be gifted with very great might. Indeed, powerful lord, that offspring will consume all things in the three worlds without leaving a residue.

data.v: तदेभ्यः प्रणतेभ्यस्त्वं देवेभ्यः पृथुलोचन । वरं प्रयच्छ लोकेश त्रैलोक्यहितकाम्यया । अपत्यार्थं निगृह्णीष्व तेजो ज्वलितमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Do you then, O lord of all the universe, O you having large eyes, grant to these celestials prostrated before you, a boon from desire of benefiting the three worlds.

data.v: इति तेषां कथयतां भगवान्गोवृषध्वजः । एवमस्त्विति देवांस्तान्विप्रर्षे प्रत्यभाषत ॥
data.md: To the deities that said so, the holy Mahadeva having the bull for his sign, O twiceborn Rishi, answered, saying, So be it!

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा चोर्ध्वमनयत्तद्रेतो वृषवाहनः । ऊर्ध्वरेताः समभवत्ततःप्रभृति चापि सः ॥
रुद्राणी तु ततः क्रुद्धा प्रजोच्छेदे तथा कृते । देवानथाब्रवीत्तत्र स्त्रीभावात्परुषं वचः ॥
data.md: Having said so, the deity that has the bull for his vehicle, drew up his vital seed. From that time he passed by the name of Urddharetas (one that has drawn up the vital seed). At this attempt of the celestials to stop procreation, the consort of Rudra became highly wroth. On account of her being the opposite sex, she used hard words. On account of her being the opposite sex, she used hard words.

data.v: यस्मादपत्यकामो वै भर्ता मे विनिवर्तितः । तस्मात्सर्वे सुरा यूयमनपत्या भविष्यथ ॥
data.md: Since you have opposed my lord in procreating an offspring when he was desirous of procrcating one upon me, as the result of this act, you celestials, you all shall become sonless.

data.v: प्रजोच्छेदो मम कृतो यस्माद्युष्माभिरद्य वै । तस्मात्प्रजा वः खगमाः सर्वेषां न भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Indeed, since you have opposed the birth of an offspring from me, therefore, you shall have no offspring of your own When this curse was imprecated.

data.v: पावकस्तु न तत्रासीच्छापकाले भृगूद्वह । देवा देव्यास्तथा शापादनपत्यास्तदाभवन् ॥
data.md: O perpetuator of Bhrigu's race, the deity of fire was not there. It is on account of this curse of the goddess that the deities have become childless.

data.v: रुद्रस्तु तेजोऽप्रतिमं धारयामास तत्तदा । प्रस्कन्नं तु ततस्तस्मात्किंचित्तत्रापतद्भुवि ॥
data.md: Rudra begged them, held in himself his energy of incomparable power. A small quantity, however, that came out o this body dropped on the Earth.

data.v: तत्पपात तदा चाग्नौ ववृधे चाद्भुतोपमम् । तेजस्तेजसि संपृक्तमेकयोनित्वमागतम् ॥
data.md: That seed, falling on the Earth, leaped into a burning fire and there began to grow most wonderfully.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु देवाः शक्रपुरोगमाः । असुरस्तारको नाम तेन संतापिता भृशम् ॥
data.md: The energy of Rudra, coming in contact with another energy of great power, became une with it in essence. Mean while, all the celestials headed by Indra were scorched by the Asura named Taraka. The Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Maruts, the Ashvins, and the Saddhyas all became greatly afflicted on account of the prowess of that son of Diti.

data.v: आदित्या वसवो रुद्रा मरुतोऽथाश्विनावपि । साध्याश्च सर्वे संत्रस्ता दैतेयस्य पराक्रमात् ॥
data.md: The energy of Rudra, coming in contact with another energy of great power, became une with it in essence. Mean while, all the celestials headed by Indra were scorched by the Asura named Taraka. The Adityas, the Vasus, the Rudras, the Maruts, the Ashvins, and the Saddhyas all became greatly afflicted on account of the prowess of that son of Diti.

data.v: स्थानानि देवतानां हि विमानानि पुराणि च । ऋषीणामाश्रमाश्चैव बभूवुरसुरैर्हृताः ॥
data.md: All the regions of the celestials, their beautiful cars, and their palaces, and the asylums of the Rishis, we.e snatched away by the Asuras.

data.v: ते दीनमनसः सर्वे देवाश्च ऋषयश्च ह । प्रजग्मुः शरणं देवं ब्रह्माणमजरं प्रभुम् ॥
data.md: Then the celestials and the Rishis, with depressed hearts, sought the protection of the illustrious and powerful Brahman of unfading glory.

data.v: असुरस्तारको नाम त्वया दत्तवरः प्रभो । सुरानृषींश्च क्लिश्नाति वधस्तस्य विधीयताम् ॥
data.md: The Deities said The Asura named Taraka who has received boons from you, O powerful one, is assailing the celestials and the Rishis. Let his death be ordained by you.

data.v: तस्माद्भयं समुत्पन्नमस्माकं वै पितामह । परित्रायस्व नो देव न ह्यन्या गतिरस्ति नः ॥
data.md: O Grandfather, we fear him greatly. O illustrious one, do you save us! We have no other refuge than you.

data.v: समोऽहं सर्वभूतानामधर्मं नेह रोचये । हन्यतां तारकः क्षिप्रं सुरर्षिगणबाधकः ॥
data.md: Brahman said I treat all creatures equally, I cannot however, approve of sin, Let Taraka, that enemy of the celestials and Rishis, be speedily destroyed.

data.v: वेदा धर्माश्च नोत्सादं गच्छेयुः सुरसत्तमाः । विहितं पूर्वमेवात्र मया वै व्येतु वो ज्वरः ॥
data.md: The Vedas and the eternal duties shall not be rooted out, you foremost of celestials, I have ordained what is proper, in this matter. Let the anxiety of your hearts be removed.

data.v: वरदानाद्भगवतो दैतेयो बलगर्वितः । देवैर्न शक्यते हन्तुं स कथं प्रशमं व्रजेत् ॥
data.md: The Celestials said For your having granted him boons, that son of Diti has been proud of his power. He is incapable of being killed by the deities. How then will his death be engendered?

data.v: स हि नैव स्म देवानां नासुराणां न रक्षसाम् । वध्यः स्यामिति जग्राह वरं त्वत्तः पितामह ॥
data.md: The boon which, O Grandfather, he has obtained from you is that he should not be killed by celestials or Asuras or Rakshasas.

data.v: देवाश्च शप्ता रुद्राण्या प्रजोच्छेदे पुरा कृते । न भविष्यति वोऽपत्यमिति सर्वजगत्पते ॥
data.md: The celestials have also been cursed by the wife of Rudra on account of their attempt of step propagation. The curse imprecated by her has been, O lord of the universe, this viz., that they are not to have any offspring.

data.v: हुताशनो न तत्रासीच्छापकाले सुरोत्तमाः । स उत्पादयितापत्यं वधार्थं त्रिदशद्विषाम् ॥
तद्वै सर्वानतिक्रम्य देवदानवराक्षसान् । मानुषानथ गन्धर्वान्नागानथ च पक्षिणः ॥
अस्त्रेणामोघपातेन शक्त्या तं घातयिष्यति । यतो वो भयमुत्पन्नं ये चान्ये सुरशत्रवः ॥
सनातनो हि संकल्पः काम इत्यभिधीयते । रुद्रस्य तेजः प्रस्कन्नमग्नौ निपतितं च तत् ॥
data.md: Will is eternal. That Will is known by the name of Kama and is at one with Rudra's seed a portion of which fell into the burning form of Agni.

data.v: तत्तेजोऽग्निर्महद्भूतं द्वितीयमिव पावकम् । वधार्थं देवशत्रूणां गङ्गायां जनयिष्यति ॥
data.md: That energy, which is a powerful substance, and which resembles a second Agni, will be cast by Agni into Ganga for producing a child upon her in order to bring about the destruction of the enemies of the gods.

data.v: स तु नावाप तं शापं नष्टः स हुतभुक्तदा । तस्माद्वो भयहृद्देवाः समुत्पत्स्यति पावकिः ॥
data.md: Agni did not come within the range of Uma's curse. The eater of sacrificial libations was not present there when the curse was imprecated.

data.v: अन्विष्यतां वै ज्वलनस्तथा चाद्य नियुज्यताम् । तारकस्य वधोपायः कथितो वै मयानघाः ॥
data.md: Let the god of fire, therefore, be searched out. Let him now be set to this task. You sinless ones, I have told you the means for the destruction of Taraka.

data.v: न हि तेजस्विनां शापास्तेजःसु प्रभवन्ति वै । बलान्यतिबलं प्राप्य नबलानि भवन्ति वै ॥
data.md: The curses of the energetic cannot produce any effect upon the energetic. Forces, when they come into contact with a stronger force, become weakened.

data.v: हन्यादवध्यान्वरदानपि चैव तपस्विनः । संकल्पाभिरुचिः कामः सनातनतमोऽनलः ॥
data.md: They who are endued with penances can destroy even the boongiving deities who are indestructible. Will, or Like, or Desire sprang in former times and is the most eternal of all creatures.

data.v: जगत्पतिरनिर्देश्यः सर्वगः सर्वभावनः । हृच्छयः सर्वभूतानां ज्येष्ठो रुद्रादपि प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Agni is the Lord of the universe. He is incapable of being apprehended or described. Capable of going every where and present in all things he is the Creator of all beings. He lives in the hearts of all creatures, Gifted with great power, He is older than Rudra himself.

data.v: अन्विष्यतां स तु क्षिप्रं तेजोराशिर्हुताशनः । स वो मनोगतं कामं देवः संपादयिष्यति ॥
data.md: Let that eater of sacrificial libations, who is mass of energy, be found out. That illustrious deity will fulfil this desire of your hearts, Hearing these word of the Grandfather, the great gods then proceeded to find out to the god of fire with cheerful hearts on account of their purpose having been crowned with success. possessed

data.v: एतद्वाक्यमुपश्रुत्य ततो देवा महात्मनः । जग्मुः संसिद्धसंकल्पाः पर्येषन्तो विभावसुम् ॥
data.md: Let that eater of sacrificial libations, who is mass of energy, be found out. That illustrious deity will fulfil this desire of your hearts, Hearing these word of the Grandfather, the great gods then proceeded to find out to the god of fire with cheerful hearts on account of their purpose having been crowned with success. possessed

data.v: ततस्त्रैलोक्यमृषयो व्यचिन्वन्त सुरैः सह । काङ्क्षन्तो दर्शनं वह्नेः सर्वे तद्गतमानसाः ॥
data.md: The gods and the Rishis then searched every portion of the three worlds their hearts being busy with the thought of Agni and eagerly desiring to see him.

data.v: परेण तपसा युक्ताः श्रीमन्तो लोकविश्रुताः । लोकानन्वचरन्सिद्धाः सर्व एव भृगूद्वह । नष्टमात्मनि संलीनं नाधिजग्मुर्हुताशनम् ॥
data.md: Gifted with penances, of prosperity celebrated over all the worlds, those great ones, all crowned with ascetic success, sojourned over every part of the universe, O foremost one of Bhrigu's race.

data.v: ततः संजातसंत्रासानग्नेर्दर्शनलालसान् । जलेचरः क्लान्तमनास्तेजसाग्नेः प्रदीपितः । उवाच देवान्मण्डूको रसातलतलोत्थितः ॥
रसातलतले देवा वसत्यग्निरिति प्रभो । संतापादिह संप्राप्तः पावकप्रभवादहम् ॥
स संसुप्तो जले देवा भगवान्हव्यवाहनः । अपः संसृज्य तेजोभिस्तेन संतापिता वयम् ॥
data.md: The illustrious bearer of sacrificial offerings ye gods, is now under the waters. He has created a mass of waters within which he is living. All of us have been scorched by his energy.

data.v: तस्य दर्शनमिष्टं वो यदि देवा विभावसोः । तत्रैनमभिगच्छध्वं कार्यं वो यदि वह्निना ॥
data.md: If, ye gods, you wish to see himif you have any business with him, go to him there.

data.v: गम्यतां साधयिष्यामो वयं ह्यग्निभयात्सुराः । एतावदुक्त्वा मण्डूकस्त्वरितो जलमाविशत् ॥
data.md: As regards ourselves, we shall fly from this place, O celestials, from fear of Agni! Having said this much, the frog dived into the water.

data.v: हुताशनस्तु बुबुधे मण्डूकस्याथ पैशुनम् । शशाप स तमासाद्य न रसान्वेत्स्यसीति वै ॥
data.md: The eater of sacrificial libations came to know of the treachery of the frog. Coming to that animal, he cursed the whole race, saying, You will be deprived of the organ of taste.

data.v: तं स संयुज्य शापेन मण्डूकं पावको ययौ । अन्यत्र वासाय विभुर्न च देवानदर्शयत् ॥
data.md: Having made this curse on the frog, he left spot immediately for living else, where. Indeed the powerful celestial did not show himself.

data.v: देवास्त्वनुग्रहं चक्रुर्मण्डूकानां भृगूद्वह । यत्तच्छृणु महाबाहो गदतो मम सर्वशः ॥
data.md: Seeing the condition to which the frogs were reduced for having done them a service, the celestials o best of the Bhrigus, showed favour to those creatures. I shall tell you everything about it. Do you hear me, O mightyarmed hero.

data.v: अग्निशापादजिह्वापि रसज्ञानबहिष्कृताः । सरस्वतीं बहुविधां यूयमुच्चारयिष्यथ ॥
data.md: The Deities said Though deprived of tongues through the curse of Agni and, therefore of the sensation of taste, you will be able to utter various kinds of words.

data.v: बिलवासगतांश्चैव निरादानानचेतसः । गतासूनपि वः शुष्कान्भूमिः संधारयिष्यति । तमोगतायामपि च निशायां विचरिष्यथ ॥
data.md: Living within holes, deprived of food, shorn of consciousness, wasted and dried up, and more dead than alive, the Earth will yet hold you all.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा तांस्ततो देवाः पुनरेव महीमिमाम् । परीयुर्ज्वलनस्यार्थे न चाविन्दन्हुताशनम् ॥
data.md: You shall also be able to move about at nighttime when everything is covered with thick darkness! Having said this to the frogs, the celestials once more journeyed over every part of the Earth for finding out the god of fire. Despite all their endeavours however, they could not find him out.

data.v: अथ तान्द्विरदः कश्चित्सुरेन्द्रद्विरदोपमः । अश्वत्थस्थोऽग्निरित्येवं प्राह देवान्भृगूद्वह ॥
data.md: Then, O perpetuator of Bhrigu's race, an elephant, as large and powerful as the elephant of Shakra addressed the gods, sayingAgni is now living within this Ashvattha tree!

data.v: शशाप ज्वलनः सर्वान्द्विरदान्क्रोधमूर्छितः । प्रतीपा भवतां जिह्वा भवित्रीति भृगूद्वह ॥
data.md: Worked up with anger, Agni cursed all the elephants, O descendent of Bhrigu, sayingYour tongues will be bent back.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा निःसृतोऽश्वत्थादग्निर्वारणसूचितः । प्रविवेश शमीगर्भमथ वह्निः सुषुप्सया ॥
data.md: Having been pointed out by the elephants, the God of Fire cursed all elephants thus and then went away and entered the heart of the Shami tree for living within it for sometime.

data.v: अनुग्रहं तु नागानां यं चक्रुः शृणु तं प्रभो । देवा भृगुकुलश्रेष्ठ प्रीताः सत्यपराक्रमाः ॥
data.md: Listen now, O powerful hero, what favour was shown to the elephants, O foremost one of Bhrigu's race; by the celestials of unbaffled prowess who were all pleased with the service one of their representatives had rendered them.

data.v: प्रतीपया जिह्वयापि सर्वाहारान्करिष्यथ । वाचं चोच्चारयिष्यध्वमुच्चैरव्यञ्जिताक्षरम् । इत्युक्त्वा पुनरेवाग्निमनुसस्रुर्दिवौकसः ॥
data.md: The Deities said With the help of even your tongues bent inwards you shall be able to eat all things, and with even those tongues you shall be able to utter cries which will only be indistinct. Having blessed the elephants thus, the inhabitants of the celestial region once more began to search Agni.

data.v: अश्वत्थान्निःसृतश्चाग्निः शमीगर्भगतस्तदा । शुकेन ख्यापितो विप्र तं देवाः समुपाद्रवन् ॥
शशाप शुकमग्निस्तु वाग्विहीनो भविष्यसि । जिह्वां चावर्तयामास तस्यापि हुतभुक्तदा ॥
दृष्ट्वा तु ज्वलनं देवाः शुकमूचुर्दयान्विताः । भविता न त्वमत्यन्तं शकुने नष्टवागिति ॥
data.md: Indeed, the eater of sacrificial offerings turned up the tongues of all the parrots. Seeing Agni at the place pointed out by the parrot, and beholding the curse imprecated upon him, the gods, moved by mercy for the poor creature. blessed him, saying, on account of your being a parrot, you shall not be wholly deprived of the power of speech. Though your tongue has been turned backwards, yet you will only be able to speak the letter K.

data.v: आवृत्तजिह्वस्य सतो वाक्यं कान्तं भविष्यति । बालस्येव प्रवृद्धस्य कलमव्यक्तमद्भुतम् ॥
इत्युक्त्वा तं शमीगर्भे वह्निमालक्ष्य देवताः । तदेवायतनं चक्रुः पुण्यं सर्वक्रियास्वपि ॥
data.md: Like that of a child or an old man, your words shall be sweet and indistinct and wonderfulHaving said these words to the parrot, and seeing the god of fire within the heart of the Shami, the gods made Shami wood a sacred fuel fit for producing fire in all religious rites. It was from that time that fire is seen to live in the heart of the Shami.

data.v: ततःप्रभृति चाप्यग्निः शमीगर्भेषु दृश्यते । उत्पादने तथोपायमनुजग्मुश्च मानवाः ॥
आपो रसातले यास्तु संसृष्टाश्चित्रभानुना । ताः पर्वतप्रस्रवणैरूष्मां मुञ्चन्ति भार्गव । पावकेनाधिशयता संतप्तास्तस्य तेजसा ॥
data.md: Those heated waters, O you of Bhrigu's race, are vomited forth by the mountain springs. On account, of Agni's having lived in them for sometime, they became hot through his power.

data.v: ततोऽग्निर्देवता दृष्ट्वा बभूव व्यथितस्तदा । किमागमनमित्येवं तानपृच्छत पावकः ॥
data.md: Meanwhile Agni, seeing the gods, became grieved. Addressing the celestials, he asked them, Why have you come here?

data.v: तमूचुर्विबुधाः सर्वे ते चैव परमर्षयः । त्वां नियोक्ष्यामहे कार्ये तद्भवान्कर्तुमर्हति । कृते च तस्मिन्भविता तवापि सुमहान्गुणः ॥
data.md: To him the celestials and the great Rishis said, We wish to engage you in a particular work. You should perform it. When done, it will redound greatly to your credit.

data.v: ब्रूत यद्भवतां कार्यं सर्वं कर्तास्मि तत्सुराः । भवतां हि नियोज्योऽहं मा वोऽत्रास्तु विचारणा ॥
data.md: Agni said Tell me what your business is. I shall, O gods accomplish it. I am always willing to do anything for you. Do not, hesitate, therefore, to command me.

data.v: असुरस्तारको नाम ब्रह्मणो वरदर्पितः । अस्मान्प्रबाधते वीर्याद्वधस्तस्य विधीयताम् ॥
data.md: The celestials said There is an Asura of the name of Taraka who has been filled with pride on account of the boon he has obtained from Brahman. By his power he is able to oppose and discomfit us. Do you bring about his destruction.

data.v: इमान्देवगणांस्तात प्रजापतिगणांस्तथा । ऋषींश्चापि महाभागान्परित्रायस्व पावक ॥
data.md: O sire, do you rescue these celestials, these Prajapatis, and these Rishis, O highly blessed Pavaka.

data.v: अपत्यं तेजसा युक्तं प्रवीरं जनय प्रभो । यद्भयं नोऽसुरात्तस्मान्नाशयेद्धव्यवाहन ॥
data.md: O powerful one, do you beget a heroic son possessed of your power, who will remove, O bearer of sacrificial libations, our fears from that Asura.

data.v: शप्तानां नो महादेव्या नान्यदस्ति परायणम् । अन्यत्र भवतो वीर्यं तस्मात्त्रायस्व नस्ततः ॥
data.md: We have been cursed by the great goddess Uma. There is nothing else than your power which can be our refuge now. Do you, therefore, O powerful deity, rescue us all.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तथेत्युक्त्वा भगवान्हव्यकव्यभुक् । जगामाथ दुराधर्षो गङ्गां भागीरथीं प्रति ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, the illustrious and irresistible bearer of sacrificial libations answered, saying, Be it so! and he then proceeded towards Ganga otherwise called Bhagirathi.

data.v: तया चाप्यभवन्मिश्रो गर्भश्चास्याभवत्तदा । ववृधे स तदा गर्भः कक्षे कृष्णगतिर्यथा ॥
data.md: He knew her and caused her to conceive. Indeed, in the womb of Ganga the seed of Agni began to grow even as Agni himself grows.

data.v: तेजसा तस्य गर्भस्य गङ्गा विह्वलचेतना । संतापमगमत्तीव्रं सा सोढुं न शशाक ह ॥
data.md: With the energy of that god, Ganga became greatly moved at heart. Indeed, she suffered great distress and became unable to bear it.

data.v: आहिते ज्वलनेनाथ गर्भे तेजःसमन्विते । गङ्गायामसुरः कश्चिद्भैरवं नादमुत्सृजत् ॥
data.md: When the deity of fire cast his seed gifted with great energy into the womb of Ganga, a certain Asura uttered a terrific roar.

data.v: अबुद्धापतितेनाथ नादेन विपुलेन सा । वित्रस्तोद्भ्रान्तनयना गङ्गा विप्लुतलोचना । विसंज्ञा नाशकद्गर्भं संधारयितुमात्मना ॥
data.md: On account of that dreadful roar uttered by the Asura for purposes of his own, Ganga became very much terrified and her eyes rolled in fear and betrayed her agitation.

data.v: सा तु तेजःपरीताङ्गी कम्पमाना च जाह्नवी । उवाच वचनं विप्र तदा गर्भबलोद्धता । न ते शक्तास्मि भगवंस्तेजसोऽस्य विधारणे ॥
data.md: Overwhelmed with the energy of the seed she held in her womb, O learned Brahmana, she then addressed the god of fire, saying, I cannot any longer, O illustrious one, bear your seed in my womb.

data.v: विमूढास्मि कृतानेन तथास्वास्थ्यं कृतं परम् । विह्वला चास्मि भगवंस्तेजो नष्टं च मेऽनघ ॥
data.md: Indeed, I am overcome with weakness by this seed of yours. The health I had in days before, is no longer mine. I have been greatly agitated, O illustrious one, and my heart is dead within me, O sinless one.

data.v: धारणे नास्य शक्ताहं गर्भस्य तपतां वर । उत्स्रक्ष्येऽहमिमं दुःखान्न तु कामात्कथंचन ॥
data.md: O foremost of all persons gifted with penances, I cannot bear your seed any longer. I shall throw it off, induced by the distress that has befallen me, and not by caprice.

data.v: न चेतसोऽस्ति संस्पर्शो मम देव विभावसो । आपदर्थे हि संबन्धः सुसूक्ष्मोऽपि महाद्युते ॥
data.md: There has been no actual contact of my body with your seed, O illustrious deity of fire. Our union, having for its cause the distress that has befallen the celestials, has been subtile and not of the flesh, O highly effulgent one.

data.v: यदत्र गुणसंपन्नमितरं वा हुताशन । त्वय्येव तदहं मन्ये धर्माधर्मौ च केवलौ ॥
data.md: Whatever merit or otherwise they may be in this deed, O eater of sacrificial offerings, must belong to you. indeed, I think, you will be visited by virtue or sin of this deed.

data.v: तामुवाच ततो वह्निर्धार्यतां धार्यतामयम् । गर्भो मत्तेजसा युक्तो महागुणफलोदयः ॥
