data.md: To her the god of fire said, Do you carry the seed. Do, indeed, bear the foetus endued with my power. It will produce great results.

data.v: शक्ता ह्यसि महीं कृत्स्नां वोढुं धारयितुं तथा । न हि ते किंचिदप्राप्यं मद्रेतोधारणादृते ॥
data.md: You are, indeed, capable of bearing the entire Earth. You will gain nothing by not holding this energy. That foremost of rivers, though thus dissuaded by the deity of fire as also by all the other celestials, cast off the seed on the breast of Meru, that foremost of all mountains.

data.v: सा वह्निना वार्यमाणा देवैश्चापि सरिद्वरा । समुत्ससर्ज तं गर्भं मेरौ गिरिवरे तदा ॥
data.md: You are, indeed, capable of bearing the entire Earth. You will gain nothing by not holding this energy. That foremost of rivers, though thus dissuaded by the deity of fire as also by all the other celestials, cast off the seed on the breast of Meru, that foremost of all mountains.

data.v: समर्था धारणे चापि रुद्रतेजःप्रधर्षिता । नाशकत्तं तदा गर्भं संधारयितुमोजसा ॥
data.md: Capable of bearing that seed, yet oppressed by the power of Rudra, she could not hold that seed longer on account of its burning energy.

data.v: सा समुत्सृज्य तं दुःखाद्दीप्तवैश्वानरप्रभम् । दर्शयामास चाग्निस्तां तदा गङ्गां भृगूद्वह । पप्रच्छ सरितां श्रेष्ठां कच्चिद्गर्भः सुखोदयः ॥
कीदृग्वर्णोऽपि वा देवि कीदृग्रूपश्च दृश्यते । तेजसा केन वा युक्तः सर्वमेतद्ब्रवीहि मे ॥
जातरूपः स गर्भो वै तेजसा त्वमिवानल । सुवर्णो विमलो दीप्तः पर्वतं चावभासयत् ॥
data.md: Ganga said The foetus is of goldhue. In energy it is like you, O sinless one! Of an excellent colour, perfectly stainless, and burning with splendour, it has lighted the entire mountain.

data.v: पद्मोत्पलविमिश्राणां ह्रदानामिव शीतलः । गन्धोऽस्य स कदम्बानां तुल्यो वै तपतां वर ॥
data.md: O foremost of all persons gifted with penances, the fragrance of it resembles the cool perfume that is scattered by lakes adorned with lotuses.

data.v: तेजसा तस्य गर्भस्य भास्करस्येव रश्मिभिः । यद्द्रव्यं परिसंसृष्टं पृथिव्यां पर्वतेषु वा । तत्सर्वं काञ्चनीभूतं समन्तात्प्रत्यदृश्यत ॥
data.md: With the splendour of that foetus everything around it seemed to be changed into gold as all things on mountain and low land seem to be changed into gold by the rays of the Sun.

data.v: पर्यधावत शैलांश्च नदीः प्रस्रवणानि च । व्यदीपयत्तेजसा च त्रैलोक्यं सचराचरम् ॥
एवंरूपः स भगवान्पुत्रस्ते हव्यवाहन । सूर्यवैश्वानरसमः कान्त्या सोम इवापरः । एवमुक्त्वा तु सा देवी तत्रैवान्तरधीयत ॥
data.md: The splendour of that foetus, spreading far and wide, falls upon mountains and rivers and springs. It seems that the three worlds, with all their mobile and immobile creatures, are being lighted up by it. Such is your child, O illustrious bearer of sacrificial offerings. Like the Sun or your blazing self, in beauty it is like second Soma!

data.v: पावकश्चापि तेजस्वी कृत्वा कार्यं दिवौकसाम् । जगामेष्टं ततो देशं तदा भार्गवनन्दन ॥
data.md: Having said these words, the goddess-disappeared. The highly energetic god of fire also, having performed the business of the celestials, proceeded to the place he liked, O delighter of the Bhrigus.

data.v: एतैः कर्मगुणैर्लोके नामाग्नेः परिगीयते । हिरण्यरेता इति वै ऋषिभिर्विबुधैस्तथा । पृथिवी च तदा देवी ख्याता वसुमतीति वै ॥
data.md: It was on account of the result of this act that the Rishis and the celestials bestowed the name of Hiranyaretas upon the gods of fire. . And because the Earth held that seed she also came to be called by the name of Vasumati.

data.v: स तु गर्भो महातेजा गाङ्गेयः पावकोद्भवः । दिव्यं शरवणं प्राप्य ववृधेऽद्भुतदर्शनः ॥
data.md: Meanwhile, that foetus, which had originated from the god of fire and been held for a time by Ganga, having fallen on a forest of reeds, began to grow and at last assumed a wonderful form.

data.v: ददृशुः कृत्तिकास्तं तु बालार्कसदृशद्युतिम् । जातस्नेहाश्च तं बालं पुपुषुः स्तन्यविस्रवैः ॥
data.md: The presiding goddess of the constellation Krittika saw that form resembling the rising Sun.

data.v: ततः स कार्त्तिकेयत्वमवाप परमद्युतिः । स्कन्नत्वात्स्कन्दतां चापि गुहावासाद्गुहोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: She henceforth began to bring up that child as her son with the milk of her breast. For this reason that highly effulgent child came to be called Kartikeya after her name.

data.v: एवं सुवर्णमुत्पन्नमपत्यं जातवेदसः । तत्र जाम्बूनदं श्रेष्ठं देवानामपि भूषणम् ॥
data.md: And because he grew from seed that fell out of Rudra's body, he came to be called Skanda. The incident also of his birth having taken place in the forest of reeds, concealed from every body's view, gave him the name of Guha. It was thus that gold came into existence as the offspring of the god of fire.

data.v: ततःप्रभृति चाप्येतज्जातरूपमुदाहृतम् । यत्सुवर्णं स भगवानग्निरीशः प्रजापतिः ॥
पवित्राणां पवित्रं हि कनकं द्विजसत्तम । अग्नीषोमात्मकं चैव जातरूपमुदाहृतम् ॥
data.md: Gold is truly the illustrious Agni, the Lord of all things, and the foremost of all Prajapatis. The most sacred of all sacred things if gold, O foremost of twiceborn ones. Indeed, gold is said to have for its essence Agni and Soma.

data.v: रत्नानामुत्तमं रत्नं भूषणानां तथोत्तमम् । पवित्रं च पवित्राणां मङ्गलानां च मङ्गलम् ॥
अपि चेदं पुरा राम श्रुतं मे ब्रह्मदर्शनम् । पितामहस्य यद्वृत्तं ब्रह्मणः परमात्मनः ॥
data.md: Vashishtha said Formerly I also heard this history, O Rama, called Brahmadarshana, about the achievement of the Grandfather Brahman who is at one with the Supreme Soul.

data.v: देवस्य महतस्तात वारुणीं बिभ्रतस्तनुम् । ऐश्वर्ये वारुणे राम रुद्रस्येशस्य वै प्रभो ॥
data.md: To a sacrifice performed formerly by that foremost of gods, viz., the Lord of Rudra, O you of great power, who on that occasion had assumed the form of Varuna, there came the ascetics and all the celestials headed by Agni. There also came to that sacrifice all the sacrificial limbs (in their embodied forms), and the Mantra called Vashat in his embodied forin.

data.v: आजग्मुर्मुनयः सर्वे देवाश्चाग्निपुरोगमाः । यज्ञाङ्गानि च सर्वाणि वषट्कारश्च मूर्तिमान् ॥
data.md: To a sacrifice performed formerly by that foremost of gods, viz., the Lord of Rudra, O you of great power, who on that occasion had assumed the form of Varuna, there came the ascetics and all the celestials headed by Agni. There also came to that sacrifice all the sacrificial limbs (in their embodied forms), and the Mantra called Vashat in his embodied forin.

data.v: मूर्तिमन्ति च सामानि यजूंषि च सहस्रशः । ऋग्वेदश्चागमत्तत्र पदक्रमविभूषितः ॥
data.md: All the Samans also and all the Yajushas, in thousands and in their embodied forms, came there. The Rig Veda also came there, adorned with the rules of orthoepy.

data.v: लक्षणानि स्वराः स्तोभा निरुक्तं स्वरभक्तयः । ओंकारश्चावसन्नेत्रे निग्रहप्रग्रहौ तथा ॥
data.md: The Lakshnanas, the Svaras, the stotras, the Niruktas, the Notes arranged in rows, and the syllable Om, as also Nigraha and Pragraha, all came there and lived in the eye of Mahadeva.

data.v: वेदाश्च सोपनिषदो विद्या सावित्र्यथापि च । भूतं भव्यं भविष्यच्च दधार भगवाञ्शिवः । जुह्वच्चात्मन्यथात्मानं स्वयमेव तदा प्रभो ॥
data.md: The Vedas with the Upanishads, Vidya, and Savitri, as also, the Past, the Present, and the Future, all came there and were held by the illustrious Shiva.

data.v: देवपत्न्यश्च कन्याश्च देवानां चैव मातरः । आजग्मुः सहितास्तत्र तदा भृगुकुलोद्वह ॥
data.md: Sacrifice, Penance, all the rites, the goddess Diksha burning with rigid observances, the several Points with the presiding deities, the consorts of all the deities, their daughters, and the celestials mothers, all came to Pashupati, O perpetuator of Bhrigu's race, together in a body.

data.v: यज्ञं पशुपतेः प्रीता वरुणस्य महात्मनः । स्वयंभुवस्तु ता दृष्ट्वा रेतः समपतद्भुवि ॥
data.md: Seeing that sacrifice of the great Mahadeva who had assumed the form of Varuna, all of them became highly pleased. Seeing the celestial ladies of great beauty, the seed of Brahman came out and dropped upon the Earth.

data.v: तस्य शुक्रस्य निष्पन्दात्पांसून्संगृह्य भूमितः । प्रास्यत्पूषा कराभ्यां वै तस्मिन्नेव हुताशने ॥
data.md: On account of the seed having fallen on the dust, the Sun took up that dust mixed with the particles of seed from the Earth with his hands and cast it into the sacrificial fire.

data.v: ततस्तस्मिन्संप्रवृत्ते सत्रे ज्वलितपावके । ब्रह्मणो जुह्वतस्तत्र प्रादुर्भावो बभूव ह ॥
data.md: Meanwhile, the sacrifice with the sacred fire of burning flames was commenced and it is went on. Brahman was pouring libations on the fire. While thus engaged, the Grandfather became worked up with desire.

data.v: स्कन्नमात्रं च तच्छुक्रं स्रुवेण प्रतिगृह्य सः । आज्यवन्मन्त्रवच्चापि सोऽजुहोद्भृगुनन्दन ॥
data.md: As soon as the seed came out, he took it up with the sacrificial ladle and poured it as a libation of clarified butter, O delighter of the Bhrigus with the necessary Mantras, on the burning fire.

data.v: ततः संजनयामास भूतग्रामं स वीर्यवान् । ततस्तु तेजसस्तस्माज्जज्ञे लोकेषु तैजसम् ॥
data.md: From that seed, Brahman of great power caused the four orders of creatures to come into being. That seed of the Grandfather was endued with the three qualities of Goodness, Darkness, and Ignorance. From that element in it which represented the quality of Goodness, sprang all mobile creatures gifted with the principle of action.

data.v: तमसस्तामसा भावा व्यापि सत्त्वं तथोभयम् । सगुणस्तेजसो नित्यं तमस्याकाशमेव च ॥
data.md: From the element of Ignorance in it. sprang all immobile creatures. The quality of Goodness, however, which lived in that seed, entered both kinds of existence. That quality of Goodness is of the nature of Light. It is eternal and of it is unending Space.

data.v: सर्वभूतेष्वथ तथा सत्त्वं तेजस्तथा तमः । शुक्रे हुतेऽग्नौ तस्मिंस्तु प्रादुरासंस्त्रयः प्रभो ॥
data.md: In all the creatures the quality of Goodness is present and is at one with that light which shows what is right and what is wrong. When the seed of Brahman was thus poured as a libation on that sacrificial fire, there came from it, O powerful one, three beings into existence.

data.v: पुरुषा वपुषा युक्ता युक्ताः प्रसवजैर्गुणैः । भृगित्येव भृगुः पूर्वमङ्गारेभ्योऽङ्गिराभवत् ॥
data.md: They were three male persons, gifted with bodies that partook of the nature of the circumstances from which they respectively originated. One arose first from the fire (called Bhrik) and hence he passed by the name of Bhrigu. A second came from the burning charcoals and hence he passed the name of Angirasa.

data.v: अङ्गारसंश्रयाच्चैव कविरित्यपरोऽभवत् । सह ज्वालाभिरुत्पन्नो भृगुस्तस्माद्भृगुः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: The third originated from a heap of extinguished charcoals and he passed by the name of Kavi. It has been already said that the first came out with flames issuing from his body and hence he was called Bhrigu,

data.v: मरीचिभ्यो मरीचिस्तु मारीचः कश्यपो ह्यभूत् । अङ्गारेभ्योऽङ्गिरास्तात वालखिल्याः शिलोच्चयात् । अत्रैवात्रेति च विभो जातमत्रिं वदन्त्यपि ॥
data.md: From the rays of the sacrificial fire originated another called Marichi. From Marichi (afterwards) sprang Kashyapa. It has been already said that from the (burning) charcoals originated Angiras. The dwarf Rishis called Valikhillyas originated from the blades of Kusha grass spread out in that sacrifice.

data.v: तथा भस्मव्यपोहेभ्यो ब्रह्मर्षिगणसंमिताः । वैखानसाः समुत्पन्नास्तपःश्रुतगुणेप्सवः । अश्रुतोऽस्य समुत्पन्नावश्विनौ रूपसंमतौ ॥
data.md: From the same blades of Kusha grass, O you of great power originated Atri. From the ashes of the fire originated the twiceborn Rishis, viz., the Vaikhanashas, endued with penances and given to Vedic learning and all of excellent qualities. From the eyes of Agni originated the twin Ashvins endued with great beauty. At last, from his ears, originated the Prajapatis.

data.v: शेषाः प्रजानां पतयः स्रोतोभ्यस्तस्य जज्ञिरे । ऋषयो लोमकूपेभ्यः स्वेदाच्छन्दो मलात्मकम् ॥
एतस्मात्कारणादाहुरग्निं सर्वास्तु देवताः । ऋषयः श्रुतसंपन्ना वेदप्रामाण्यदर्शनात् ॥
यानि दारूणि ते मासा निर्यासाः पक्षसंज्ञिताः । अहोरात्रा मुहूर्तास्तु पित्तं ज्योतिश्च वारुणम् ॥
रौद्रं लोहितमित्याहुर्लोहितात्कनकं स्मृतम् । तन्मैत्रमिति विज्ञेयं धूमाच्च वसवः स्मृताः ॥
अर्चिषो याश्च ते रुद्रास्तथादित्या महाप्रभाः । उद्दिष्टास्ते तथाङ्गारा ये धिष्ण्येषु दिवि स्थिताः ॥
आदिनाथश्च लोकस्य तत्परं ब्रह्म तद्ध्रुवम् । सर्वकामदमित्याहुस्तत्र हव्यमुदावहत् ॥
ततोऽब्रवीन्महादेवो वरुणः परमात्मकः । मम सत्रमिदं दिव्यमहं गृहपतिस्त्विह ॥
त्रीणि पूर्वाण्यपत्यानि मम तानि न संशयः । इति जानीत खगमा मम यज्ञफलं हि तत् ॥
मदङ्गेभ्यः प्रसूतानि मदाश्रयकृतानि च । ममैव तान्यपत्यानि वरुणो ह्यवशात्मकः ॥
data.md: "Agni said, These children have originated from my limbs. They have all depended upon me as the cause of their being. They should, therefore, be considered as my children. Mahadeva in the form of Varuna has erred in this matter.

data.v: अथाब्रवील्लोकगुरुर्ब्रह्मा लोकपितामहः । ममैव तान्यपत्यानि मम शुक्रं हुतं हि तत् ॥
data.md: After this, the Master of all the worlds, the Grandfather of all creatures, viz., Brahman, then said, These children are mine! The seed which I poured upon the sacrificial fire was mine.

data.v: अहं वक्ता च मन्त्रस्य होता शुक्रस्य चैव ह । यस्य बीजं फलं तस्य शुक्रं चेत्कारणं मतम् ॥
data.md: I am the performer of this Sacrifice. I poured on the sacrificial fire, the seed that came out of myself. He who has planted the seed always enjoys the fruit. The principal cause of these births is my seed.

data.v: ततोऽब्रुवन्देवगणाः पितामहमुपेत्य वै । कृताञ्जलिपुटाः सर्वे शिरोभिरभिवन्द्य च ॥
वयं च भगवन्सर्वे जगच्च सचराचरम् । तवैव प्रसवाः सर्वे तस्मादग्निर्विभावसुः । वरुणश्चेश्वरो देवो लभतां काममीप्सितम् ॥
निसर्गाद्वरुणश्चापि ब्रह्मणो यादसां पतिः । जग्राह वै भृगुं पूर्वमपत्यं सूर्यवर्चसम् ॥
ईश्वरोऽङ्गिरसं चाग्नेरपत्यार्थेऽभ्यकल्पयत् । पितामहस्त्वपत्यं वै कविं जग्राह तत्त्ववित् ॥
तदा स वारुणः ख्यातो भृगुः प्रसवकर्मकृत् । आग्नेयस्त्वङ्गिराः श्रीमान्कविर्ब्राह्मो महायशाः । भार्गवाङ्गिरसौ लोके लोकसंतानलक्षणौ ॥
data.md: Gifted with every prosperity, Angirasa passed as the offspring of Agni, and the celebrated Kavi came to be known as the child of Brahman himself. Bhrigu and Angirasa, who had originated from the fire and the charcoals of Agni respectively, became the procreators of extensive races and tribes in the world,

data.v: एते विप्रवराः सर्वे प्रजानां पतयस्त्रयः । सर्वं संतानमेतेषामिदमित्युपधारय ॥
data.md: Indeed, these three, viz., Bhrigu and Angirasa and Kavi, considered as Prajapati, are the progenitors of many races and tribes. All are the children of these three. Know this, o powerful hero.

data.v: भृगोस्तु पुत्रास्तत्रासन्सप्त तुल्या भृगोर्गुणैः । च्यवनो वज्रशीर्षश्च शुचिरौर्वस्तथैव च ॥
data.md: Bhrigu beget seven sons all whom became equal to him in merits and qualities. Their names are Chyavana, Vajrashirshan, Suchi, Urva, Shukra, that giver of boons, Vibhu and Savana. These are the seven. They are children of Bhrigu and are hence Bhargavas. They are also called Varunas on account of their ancestor Bhrigu having been adopted by Mahadeva in the form of Varuna. You belong to the race of Bhrigu.

data.v: शुक्रो वरेण्यश्च विभुः सवनश्चेति सप्त ते । भार्गवा वारुणाः सर्वे येषां वंशे भवानपि ॥
data.md: Bhrigu beget seven sons all whom became equal to him in merits and qualities. Their names are Chyavana, Vajrashirshan, Suchi, Urva, Shukra, that giver of boons, Vibhu and Savana. These are the seven. They are children of Bhrigu and are hence Bhargavas. They are also called Varunas on account of their ancestor Bhrigu having been adopted by Mahadeva in the form of Varuna. You belong to the race of Bhrigu.

data.v: अष्टौ चाङ्गिरसः पुत्रा वारुणास्तेऽप्युदाहृताः । बृहस्पतिरुतथ्यश्च वयस्यः शान्तिरेव च ॥
data.md: Angirasa begot eight sons. They also are known as Varunas. Their names are Brihaspati, Utatthya, Payasya, Shanti, Dhira, Virupa, Samvarta, and Sudhanvan the eighth. These eight are considered also as the children of Agni. Freed from every evil, they are devoted to knowledge only.

data.v: घोरो विरूपः संवर्तः सुधन्वा चाष्टमः स्मृतः । एतेऽष्टावग्निजाः सर्वे ज्ञाननिष्ठा निरामयाः ॥
data.md: Angirasa begot eight sons. They also are known as Varunas. Their names are Brihaspati, Utatthya, Payasya, Shanti, Dhira, Virupa, Samvarta, and Sudhanvan the eighth. These eight are considered also as the children of Agni. Freed from every evil, they are devoted to knowledge only.

data.v: ब्राह्मणस्य कवेः पुत्रा वारुणास्तेऽप्युदाहृताः । अष्टौ प्रसवजैर्युक्ता गुणैर्ब्रह्मविदः शुभाः ॥
data.md: The sons of Kavi who was adopted by Brahman himself are also known as Varunas. Eight in number all of them became progenitors of races and tribes. Auspicious by nature, they all knew Brahma.

data.v: कविः काव्यश्च विष्णुश्च बुद्धिमानुशनास्तथा । भृगुश्च विरजाश्चैव काशी चोग्रश्च धर्मवित् ॥
data.md: The names of the eight sons of Kavi are Kavi, Kavya, Dhrishnu, Ushanas endued with great intelligence, Bhrigu, Viraja, Kashi, and Ugra knowing every duty.

data.v: अष्टौ कविसुता ह्येते सर्वमेभिर्जगत्ततम् । प्रजापतय एते हि प्रजानां यैरिमाः प्रजाः ॥
data.md: These are the eight sons of Kavi. By them the whole world has been peopled. They are all called Prajapatis, and they have procreated many offspring.

data.v: एवमङ्गिरसश्चैव कवेश्च प्रसवान्वयैः । भृगोश्च भृगुशार्दूल वंशजैः सततं जगत् ॥
data.md: Thus, O chief of Bhrigu's race, has the whole world been peopled with the children of Angirasa, and Kavi and Bhrigu,

data.v: वरुणश्चादितो विप्र जग्राह प्रभुरीश्वरः । कविं तात भृगुं चैव तस्मात्तौ वारुणौ स्मृतौ ॥
data.md: The powerful and supreme Lord Mahadeva in the form of Varuna which he had assumed for this sacrifice had first, О learned Brahmana, adopted both Kavi and Angirasa. Hence, these two are considered as of Varuna.

data.v: जग्राहाङ्गिरसं देवः शिखी तस्माद्धुताशनः । तस्मादङ्गिरसो ज्ञेयाः सर्व एव तदन्वयाः ॥
data.md: After that the eater of sacrificial libations, viz., the god of fire, adopted of Angirasa. Hence, all the children of Angirasa are known as belonging to the race of Agni.

data.v: ब्रह्मा पितामहः पूर्वं देवताभिः प्रसादितः । इमे नः संतरिष्यन्ति प्रजाभिर्जगदीश्वराः ॥
data.md: The Grandfather Brahman was, formerly propitiated by all the deities who said to him, Let these lords of the universe save us all.

data.v: सर्वे प्रजानां पतयः सर्वे चातितपस्विनः । त्वत्प्रसादादिमं लोकं तारयिष्यन्ति शाश्वतम् ॥
data.md: Let all of them become progenitors of offspring. Let all of them become endued with penances. Through your favour, let all these rescue the world.

data.v: तथैव वंशकर्तारस्तव तेजोविवर्धनाः । भवेयुर्वेदविदुषः सर्वे वाक्पतयस्तथा ॥
data.md: Let them become procreators and extenders of races and tribes and let them increase your power. Let all of them become thorough masters of the Vedas and let them be performers of great deeds.

data.v: देवपक्षधराः सौम्याः प्राजापत्या महर्षयः । आप्नुवन्ति तपश्चैव ब्रह्मचर्यं परं तथा ॥
data.md: Let all of them be friends to the divine cause. Indeed, let all of them become gifted with auspiciousness. Let become founders of extensive races and tribes and let them be great Rishis. Let all of them be gifted with great penances and let all of them be devoted to high celibacy'.

data.v: सर्वे हि वयमेते च तवैव प्रसवः प्रभो । देवानां ब्राह्मणानां च त्वं हि कर्ता पितामह ॥
data.md: All of us, as also all these, are your offspring, O you of great power. You, O Grandfather, are the Creator of both the celestials and the Brahmanas.

data.v: मरीचिमादितः कृत्वा सर्वे चैवाथ भार्गवाः । अपत्यानीति संप्रेक्ष्य क्षमयाम पितामह ॥
data.md: Marichi is your first offspring. All these also that are called Bhargavas are your progeny. LoO king at this fact, O Grandfather, we shall all help and support one another.

data.v: ते त्वनेनैव रूपेण प्रजनिष्यन्ति वै प्रजाः । स्थापयिष्यन्ति चात्मानं युगादिनिधने तथा ॥
data.md: All these shall, thus, multiply their progeny and establish yourself at the beginning of each one after the universal destruction. Thus addressed by them, Brahman, the grandfather of all the worlds, said to them, So be it! I am pleased with you all! Having said so to the celestials, he proceeded to the place he had come from.

data.v: एवमेतत्पुरा वृत्तं तस्य यज्ञे महात्मनः । देवश्रेष्ठस्य लोकादौ वारुणीं बिभ्रतस्तनुम् ॥
data.md: This is what took place in days of your in that sacrifice of the great Mahadeva, that foremost, one of all the celestials, in the beginning of creation, when he for the purposes of his sacrifice had assumed the form of Varuna.

data.v: अग्निर्ब्रह्मा पशुपतिः शर्वो रुद्रः प्रजापतिः । अग्नेरपत्यमेतद्वै सुवर्णमिति धारणा ॥
data.md: Agni is Brahman. He is Pashupati. He is Sarva. He is Rudra. He is Prajapati. It is wellknown that gold is the offspring of Agni.

data.v: अग्न्यभावे च कुर्वन्ति वह्निस्थानेषु काञ्चनम् । जामदग्न्य प्रमाणज्ञा वेदश्रुतिनिदर्शनात् ॥
data.md: When fire is not to be had, gold is used as a substitute. Guided by the marks of the auditions of the Veda, one who is conversant with authorities and who knows the identity of gold with fire, acts thus.

data.v: कुशस्तम्बे जुहोत्यग्निं सुवर्णं तत्र संस्थितम् । हुते प्रीतिकरीमृद्धिं भगवांस्तत्र मन्यते ॥
data.md: Putting a piece of gold on some blades of Kusha grass spread out on the ground, the sacrificer pours libations upon it. If libations are poured upon also the pores of an anthill, upon the right ear of a goat, upon a piece of level earth, upon the waters of a Tirtha, or on the hand of a Brahmana, the illustrious god of fire becomes pleased and considers it as a source of his own advancement as also that of the celestials through his.

data.v: तस्मादग्निपराः सर्वा देवता इति शुश्रुम । ब्रह्मणो हि प्रसूतोऽग्निरग्नेरपि च काञ्चनम् ॥
data.md: Hence, it is that we have heard that all the celestials consider Agni as their refuge and are devoted to him. Agni originated from Brahman, and from, Agni originated gold.

data.v: तस्माद्ये वै प्रयच्छन्ति सुवर्णं धर्मदर्शिनः । देवतास्ते प्रयच्छन्ति समस्ता इति नः श्रुतम् ॥
data.md: Hence, we have heard that those virtuous persons who make gifts of gold are considered as giving away all the deities.

data.v: तस्य चातमसो लोका गच्छतः परमां गतिम् । स्वर्लोके राजराज्येन सोऽभिषिच्येत भार्गव ॥
data.md: The man who makes gifts of gold acquires a very high end. Regions of burning effulgence are his. Indeed, O Bhargava, he becomes installed as the king of kings in the celestial region.

data.v: आदित्योदयने प्राप्ते विधिमन्त्रपुरस्कृतम् । ददाति काञ्चनं यो वै दुःस्वप्नं प्रतिहन्ति सः ॥
data.md: That person who, at sunrise, makes a gift of gold according to the ordinance and with proper Mantras, succeeds in warding off the evils foreshadowed by ominous dreams.

data.v: ददात्युदितमात्रे यस्तस्य पाप्मा विधूयते । मध्याह्ने ददतो रुक्मं हन्ति पापमनागतम् ॥
data.md: The man who, as soon as the Sun has risen, makes a gift of gold becomes purged of all his sins. He who makes a gift of gold at midday destroys all his future sins.

data.v: ददाति पश्चिमां संध्यां यः सुवर्णं धृतव्रतः । ब्रह्मवाय्वग्निसोमानां सालोक्यमुपयाति सः ॥
data.md: He who, with controlled soul, makes a gift of gold at the second twilight succeeds in living with Brahman and the god of wind and Agni and Soma in their respective regions.

data.v: सेन्द्रेषु चैव लोकेषु प्रतिष्ठां प्राप्नुते शुभाम् । इह लोके यशः प्राप्य शान्तपाप्मा प्रमोदते ॥
data.md: Such a man acquires fame in regions of great happiness that belong to Indra himself. Acquiring great fame in this world also, and purged of all his sins, he sports on joy and happiness.

data.v: ततः संपद्यतेऽन्येषु लोकेष्वप्रतिमः सदा । अनावृतगतिश्चैव कामचारी भवत्युत ॥
data.md: Such a man acquires many other regions of happiness and becomes peerless for glory and fame. His course perfectly unobstructed he succeeds in going every where at will.

data.v: न च क्षरति तेभ्यः स शश्वच्चैवाप्नुते महत् । सुवर्णमक्षयं दत्त्वा लोकानाप्नोति पुष्कलान् ॥
data.md: He has never to fall down from the regions which he acquires, and the glory he attains to, becomes very great. Indeed, by making gifts of gold one acquires numberless regions of a happiness all of which he enjoys for good.

data.v: यस्तु संजनयित्वाग्निमादित्योदयनं प्रति । दद्याद्वै व्रतमुद्दिश्य सर्वान्कामान्समश्नुते ॥
data.md: That man who, having lighted a fire at sunrise, makes gifts of gold in view of the observance of a particular vow, succeeds in acquiring the fruition of all his desires.

data.v: अग्निरित्येव तत्प्राहुः प्रदानं वै सुखावहम् । यथेष्टगुणसंपन्नं प्रवर्तकमिति स्मृतम् ॥
data.md: It has been said that gold is at one with Agni. The gift of gold, therefore, yields great happiness. The gift of gold leads to the possession of those merits and qualities that are desired, and purifies the heart.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स वसिष्ठेन जामदग्न्यः प्रतापवान् । ददौ सुवर्णं विप्रेभ्यो व्यमुच्यत च किल्बिषात् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed by Vashishtha, Jamadagni's son of great power then made gifts of gold to the Brahmanas and became cleansed of his sins.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं सुवर्णस्य महीपते । प्रदानस्य फलं चैव जन्म चाग्न्यमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: I have thus, told you, O king, everything about the merits of the gifts of gold and about its origin also, O Yudhishthira.

data.v: तस्मात्त्वमपि विप्रेभ्यः प्रयच्छ कनकं बहु । ददत्सुवर्णं नृपते किल्बिषाद्विप्रमोक्ष्यसि ॥
data.md: Do you also, therefore, make profuse gift of gold to the Brahmanas. Indeed, O king, by making such gifts of gold, you will surely be purged of all you sins.

data.v: उक्ताः पितामहेनेह सुवर्णस्य विधानतः । विस्तरेण प्रदानस्य ये गुणाः श्रुतिलक्षणाः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have, O grandfather described to me fully the merits of the gift of gold according to the ordinances laid down in the scriptures and the Veda.

data.v: यत्तु कारणमुत्पत्तेः सुवर्णस्येह कीर्तितम् । स कथं तारकः प्राप्तो निधनं तद्ब्रवीहि मे ॥
data.md: You have also described the origin of gold. Do you tell me now how Taraka met with destruction.

data.v: उक्तः स देवतानां हि अवध्य इति पार्थिव । न च तस्येह ते मृत्युर्विस्तरेण प्रकीर्तितः ॥
data.md: You have, said, O king, that Asura had become unslayable by the gods. Do you tell me fully how his destruction was brought about.

data.v: एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं त्वत्तः कुरुकुलोद्वह । कार्त्स्न्येन तारकवधं परं कौतूहलं हि मे ॥
data.md: Operpetuator of Kuru's race, I wish to hear this from you, I mean the details of Taraka's destruction. Great is my curiosity to hear the narrative.

data.v: विपन्नकृत्या राजेन्द्र देवता ऋषयस्तथा । कृत्तिकाश्चोदयामासुरपत्यभरणाय वै ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The gods and the Rishis, O king reduced to great distress, urged the six Krittikas to rear that child.

data.v: न देवतानां काचिद्धि समर्था जातवेदसः । एकापि शक्ता तं गर्भं संधारयितुमोजसा ॥
data.md: Amongst the celestial ladies there were none, except these, who could by their power, bear the seed of Agni in their wombs.

data.v: षण्णां तासां ततः प्रीतः पावको गर्भधारणात् । स्वेन तेजोविसर्गेण वीर्येण परमेण च ॥
data.md: The god of fire became highly pleased with those goddesses for their readiness to sustain the conception caused by the seed of Agni which was gifted with his own great power.

data.v: तास्तु षट्कृत्तिका गर्भं पुपुषुर्जातवेदसः । षट्सु वर्त्मसु तेजोऽग्नेः सकलं निहितं प्रभो ॥
data.md: When the energy of Agni, O king, was divided into six parts and placed within the channels, the six Krittikas began to nourish the portion that each held in her womb.

data.v: ततस्ता वर्धमानस्य कुमारस्य महात्मनः । तेजसाभिपरीताङ्ग्यो न क्वचिच्छर्म लेभिरे ॥
data.md: As the great Kumara, however, began to grow within their wombs their bodies being possessed by his energy, they could not get peace anywhere.

data.v: ततस्तेजःपरीताङ्ग्यः सर्वाः काल उपस्थिते । समं गर्भं सुषुविरे कृत्तिकास्ता नरर्षभ ॥
data.md: Filled with energy as their bodies were, the time at last came for delivery. All of them, it so happened, O prince of men, delivered simultaneously.

data.v: ततस्तं षडधिष्ठानं गर्भमेकत्वमागतम् । पृथिवी प्रतिजग्राह कान्तीपुरसमीपतः ॥
data.md: Though held in six different wombs, yet when all the parts, as they came out, united into one. The goddess Earth held the child, taking it up from a mass of gold.

data.v: स गर्भो दिव्यसंस्थानो दीप्तिमान्पावकप्रभः । दिव्यं शरवणं प्राप्य ववृधे प्रियदर्शनः ॥
data.md: Meanwhile, that foetus, which had originated from the god of fire and been held for a time by Ganga, having fallen on a forest of reeds, began to grow and at last assumed a wonderful form.

data.v: ददृशुः कृत्तिकास्तं तु बालं वह्निसमद्युतिम् । जातस्नेहाश्च सौहार्दात्पुपुषुः स्तन्यविस्रवैः ॥
data.md: The presiding goddess of the constellation Krittika saw that form resembling the rising Sun.

data.v: अभवत्कार्त्तिकेयः स त्रैलोक्ये सचराचरे । स्कन्नत्वात्स्कन्दतां चाप गुहावासाद्गुहोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: She henceforth began to bring up that child as her son with the milk of her breast. For this reason that highly effulgent child came to be called Kartikeya after her name.

data.v: ततो देवास्त्रयस्त्रिंशद्दिशश्च सदिगीश्वराः । रुद्रो धाता च विष्णुश्च यज्ञः पूषार्यमा भगः ॥
अंशो मित्रश्च साध्याश्च वसवो वासवोऽश्विनौ । आपो वायुर्नभश्चन्द्रो नक्षत्राणि ग्रहा रविः ॥
पृथग्भूतानि चान्यानि यानि देवार्पणानि वै । आजग्मुस्तत्र तं द्रष्टुं कुमारं ज्वलनात्मजम् । ऋषयस्तुष्टुवुश्चैव गन्धर्वाश्च जगुस्तथा ॥
षडाननं कुमारं तं द्विषडक्षं द्विजप्रियम् । पीनांसं द्वादशभुजं पावकादित्यवर्चसम् ॥
शयानं शरगुल्मस्थं दृष्ट्वा देवाः सहर्षिभिः । लेभिरे परमं हर्षं मेनिरे चासुरं हतम् ॥
data.md: His shoulders were broad, and he had twelve arms, and the splendour of his body resembled that of fire and Aditya. As he lay stretched on a clump of heath, the gods with the Rishis, seeing him, became filled with great joy and considered the great Asura as already Killed. The celestials then began to bring him various kinds of toys and articles that could amuse him.

data.v: ततो देवाः प्रियाण्यस्य सर्व एव समाचरन् । क्रीडतः क्रीडनीयानि ददुः पक्षिगणांश्च ह ॥
सुपर्णोऽस्य ददौ पत्रं मयूरं चित्रबर्हिणम् । राक्षसाश्च ददुस्तस्मै वराहमहिषावुभौ ॥
कुक्कुटं चाग्निसंकाशं प्रददौ वरुणः स्वयम् । चन्द्रमाः प्रददौ मेषमादित्यो रुचिरां प्रभाम् ॥
गवां माता च गा देवी ददौ शतसहस्रशः । छागमग्निर्गुणोपेतमिला पुष्पफलं बहु ॥
सुधन्वा शकटं चैव रथं चामितकूबरम् । वरुणो वारुणान्दिव्यान्भुजंगान्प्रददौ शुभान् । सिंहान्सुरेन्द्रो व्याघ्रांश्च द्वीपिनोऽन्यांश्च दंष्ट्रिणः ॥
श्वापदांश्च बहून्घोरांश्छत्राणि विविधानि च । राक्षसासुरसंघाश्च येऽनुजग्मुस्तमीश्वरम् ॥
वर्धमानं तु तं दृष्ट्वा प्रार्थयामास तारकः । उपायैर्बहुभिर्हन्तुं नाशकच्चापि तं विभुम् ॥
data.md: Seeing the son of Agni grow up, Taraka sought, by various means, to bring about his destruction, but could not do anything to that powerful deity.

data.v: सेनापत्येन तं देवाः पूजयित्वा गुहालयम् । शशंसुर्विप्रकारं तं तस्मै तारककारितम् ॥
data.md: The gods in time invested Agni's son born a solitary forest with the command of their arıy. And they also informed him of the oppressions made upon them by the Asura Taraka.

data.v: स विवृद्धो महावीर्यो देवसेनापतिः प्रभुः । जघानामोघया शक्त्या दानवं तारकं गुहः ॥
data.md: The commanderinchief of the celestial army grew up and became possessed of great energy and power. In time Guha killed Taraka, with his irresistible dart.

data.v: तेन तस्मिन्कुमारेण क्रीडता निहतेऽसुरे । सुरेन्द्रः स्थापितो राज्ये देवानां पुनरीश्वरः ॥
data.md: Indeed, Kumara killed the Asura as easily as if in sport. Having brought about the destruction of Taraka the reestablished the king of the celestials in his sovereignty of the three worlds.

data.v: स सेनापतिरेवाथ बभौ स्कन्दः प्रतापवान् । ईशो गोप्ता च देवानां प्रियकृच्छंकरस्य च ॥
data.md: Gifted with mighty power, the celestial general shone in beauty and splendour. The powerful Skanda became the protector of the celestials and did what was agreeable to Shankara.

data.v: हिरण्यमूर्तिर्भगवानेष एव च पावकिः । सदा कुमारो देवानां सेनापत्यमवाप्तवान् ॥
data.md: The illustrious son of Pavaka had a golden form. Indeed, Kumara is always the leader of the celestial arms.

data.v: तस्मात्सुवर्णं मङ्गल्यं रत्नमक्षय्यमुत्तमम् । सहजं कार्त्तिकेयस्य वह्नेस्तेजः परं मतम् ॥
data.md: Gold is the powerful energy of the god of fire and was born with Kartikeya. Hence is gold highly sacred, valuable, and excellent and has unending merit.

data.v: एवं रामाय कौरव्य वसिष्ठोऽकथयत्पुरा । तस्मात्सुवर्णदानाय प्रयतस्व नराधिप ॥
data.md: Thus, O son of Kuru's race, did Vasishtha recite formerly this topic to Rama of Bhrigu's race. Do you, therefore, O king of men, try to make gifts of gold.

data.v: रामः सुवर्णं दत्त्वा हि विमुक्तः सर्वकिल्बिषैः । त्रिविष्टपे महत्स्थानमवापासुलभं नरैः ॥
data.md: By making gifts of gold, Rama became purged of all his sins, and finally acquired a high place in Heaven that is unattainable by other men.

data.v: चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य धर्मात्मन्धर्मः प्रोक्तस्त्वयानघ । तथैव मे श्राद्धविधिं कृत्स्नं प्रब्रूहि पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have described to me, you of righteous soul, the duties of the four castes. Do you, similarly, O king, describe to me now all the ordinances regarding the Shraddha.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरेणैवमुक्तो भीष्मः शांतनवस्तदा । इमं श्राद्धविधिं कृत्स्नं प्रवक्तुमुपचक्रमे ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Thus addressed by Yuthishthira, the son of Shantanu began of recite to him the following ritual, consistent with the ordinances, of the Shraddha.

data.v: शृणुष्वावहितो राजञ्श्राद्धकल्पमिमं शुभम् । धन्यं यशस्यं पुत्रीयं पितृयज्ञं परंतप ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Listen, O king, with rapt attention, to me as I describe to you the ritual of the Shraddha. or That ritual is auspicious, laudable, productive of fame and progeny, and is considered as a sacrifice, O scorcher of enemies, in honour of the departed Manes.

data.v: देवासुरमनुष्याणां गन्धर्वोरगरक्षसाम् । पिशाचकिंनराणां च पूज्या वै पितरः सदा ॥
data.md: Gods or Asuras human beings, Gandharvas or Uragas or Rakshasas, Pishachas or Kinnaras, every one should always adore the departed Manes.

data.v: पितॄन्पूज्यादितः पश्चाद्देवान्संतर्पयन्ति वै । तस्मात्सर्वप्रयत्नेन पुरुषः पूजयेत्सदा ॥
data.md: It is seen that people adore the departed Manes first, and please the celestials next by offering them their worship. Hence, one should always adore the departed Manes with every care.

data.v: अन्वाहार्यं महाराज पितॄणां श्राद्धमुच्यते । तच्चामिषेण विधिना विधिः प्रथमकल्पितः ॥
data.md: It is said, O king, that the Shraddha perforined in honour of the departed Manes is performable afterwards. But this general rule has a special restraint.

data.v: सर्वेष्वहःसु प्रीयन्ते कृतैः श्राद्धैः पितामहाः । प्रवक्ष्यामि तु ते सर्वांस्तिथ्यां तिथ्यां गुणागुणान् ॥
data.md: The (deceased) grandfather become gratified with the Shraddha that may be performed on any day. I shall, however, tell you now what the merits and demerits are of the respective lunar days.

data.v: येष्वहःसु कृतैः श्राद्धैर्यत्फलं प्राप्यतेऽनघ । तत्सर्वं कीर्तयिष्यामि यथावत्तन्निबोध मे ॥
data.md: I shall describe to you, O sinless one, what fruits are attained on what days by performing the Shraddha. Do you listen to me with rapt attention.

data.v: पितॄनर्च्य प्रतिपदि प्राप्नुयात्स्वगृहे स्त्रियः । अभिरूपप्रजायिन्यो दर्शनीया बहुप्रजाः ॥
data.md: By worshipping the departed Manes on the first day of the light fortnight, one obtains in his abode beautiful wives capable of producing many children all endued with desirable accomplishments.

data.v: स्त्रियो द्वितीयां जायन्ते तृतीयायां तु वन्दिनः । चतुर्थ्यां क्षुद्रपशवो भवन्ति बहवो गृहे ॥
data.md: By performing the Shraddha on the second day of the light fortnight, one gets many daughters. By performing on the third day, one acquires many horses. By performing it on the fourth day, one gets a large herd of smaller arimals in his house.

data.v: पञ्चम्यां बहवः पुत्रा जायन्ते कुर्वतां नृप । कुर्वाणास्तु नराः षष्ठ्यां भवन्ति द्युतिभागिनः ॥
data.md: They, O king, who perform the Shraddha on the fifth day, get many sons. Those men who perform the Shraddha on the sixth day, acquire great splendour.

data.v: कृषिभागी भवेच्छ्राद्धं कुर्वाणः सप्तमीं नृप । अष्टम्यां तु प्रकुर्वाणो वाणिज्ये लाभमाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: By performing it on the seventh day, O king, one wins great fame. By performing it on the eighth day one, secures great profits in commercial pursuits.

data.v: नवम्यां कुर्वतः श्राद्धं भवत्येकशफं बहु । विवर्धन्ते तु दशमीं गावः श्राद्धानि कुर्वतः ॥
data.md: By performing it on the ninth day, one, acquires many animals of uncloven hoofs. By performing it on the tenth day, one acquires many valuable kine.

data.v: कुप्यभागी भवेन्मर्त्यः कुर्वन्नेकादशीं नृप । ब्रह्मवर्चस्विनः पुत्रा जायन्ते तस्य वेश्मनि ॥
data.md: By performing it on the eleventh day one gets valuable cloths and utensils. Such a man also gets many sons all of whom become endued with Brahma splendour.

data.v: द्वादश्यामीहमानस्य नित्यमेव प्रदृश्यते । रजतं बहु चित्रं च सुवर्णं च मनोरमम् ॥
data.md: By performing the Shraddha on the twelfth day, one always sees if he desires various sorts of beautiful silver and gold articles.

data.v: ज्ञातीनां तु भवेच्छ्रेष्ठः कुर्वञ्श्राद्धं त्रयोदशीम् । अवश्यं तु युवानोऽस्य प्रमीयन्ते नरा गृहे ॥
data.md: on By performing the Shraddha the thirteenth day, one reigns supreme over his kinsmen. Forsooth, all the young men in the family of him who performs the Shraddha on the fourteenth day die. Such a man becomes entangled in war. By performing the Shraddha on the day of the new moon, one gets the fruition of every desire.

data.v: युद्धभागी भवेन्मर्त्यः श्राद्धं कुर्वंश्चतुर्दशीम् । अमावास्यां तु निवपन्सर्वान्कामानवाप्नुयात् ॥
कृष्णपक्षे दशम्यादौ वर्जयित्वा चतुर्दशीम् । श्राद्धकर्मणि तिथ्यः स्युः प्रशस्ता न तथेतराः ॥
data.md: In the dark fortnight, all the days beginning with the tenth, Icaving only the fourteenth day out, are good days for the performance of the Shraddha. Other days of that fortnight are not SO.

data.v: यथा चैवापरः पक्षः पूर्वपक्षाद्विशिष्यते । तथा श्राद्धस्य पूर्वाह्णादपराह्णो विशिष्यते ॥
data.md: Then, again, as the dark fortnight is better than the light one, so the afternoon of the day is better than the forenoon for the Shraddha.

data.v: किं स्विद्दत्तं पितृभ्यो वै भवत्यक्षयमीश्वर । किं हविश्चिररात्राय किमानन्त्याय कल्पते ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O you of great power, tell me what that object is which if dedicated to the departed Manes, becomes inexhaustible! What Havi, again, (if offered) lasts for all time? What, indeed, is that which becomes eternal?

data.v: हवींषि श्राद्धकल्पे तु यानि श्राद्धविदो विदुः । तानि मे शृणु काम्यानि फलं चैषां युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Hear me, O Yudhishthira, what those Havis are which persons conversant with the ritual of the Shraddha consider as suitable for the Shraddha and what the fruits are of each.

data.v: तिलैर्व्रीहियवैर्माषैरद्भिर्मूलफलैस्तथा । दत्तेन मासं प्रीयन्ते श्राद्धेन पितरो नृप ॥
data.md: With sesame seeds, rice, barley, Masha water, root and fruits, if given at Shraddhas, the departed Manes, O king, remain pleased for a month.

data.v: वर्धमानतिलं श्राद्धमक्षयं मनुरब्रवीत् । सर्वेष्वेव तु भोज्येषु तिलाः प्राधान्यतः स्मृताः ॥
data.md: Manu has said that if a Shraddha is performed with profuse sesame, such Shraddha becomes inexhaustible. Of all sorts of food, sesame seeds are considered as the best.

data.v: द्वौ मासौ तु भवेत्तृप्तिर्मत्स्यैः पितृगणस्य ह । त्रीन्मासानाविकेनाहुश्चातुर्मास्यं शशेन तु ॥
data.md: With fishes offered at Shraddhas, the departed Manes remain pleased for two months. With mutton they remain pleased for three months and with the flesh of the hare for four.

data.v: आजेन मासान्प्रीयन्ते पञ्चैव पितरो नृप । वाराहेण तु षण्मासान्सप्त वै शाकुनेन तु ॥
data.md: With the flesh of the goat, o king, they remain pleased for five months, with becon for six months, and with the flesh of birds for seven.

data.v: मासानष्टौ पार्षतेन रौरवेण नवैव तु । गवयस्य तु मांसेन तृप्तिः स्याद्दशमासिकी ॥
data.md: With venison got from those deer that are called Prishata, they remain pleased for eight months, and with that obtained from the Ruru for nine months, and with the meat of the Gavaya for ten months.

data.v: मासानेकादश प्रीतिः पितॄणां माहिषेण तु । गव्येन दत्ते श्राद्धे तु संवत्सरमिहोच्यते ॥
यथा गव्यं तथा युक्तं पायसं सर्पिषा सह । वाध्रीणसस्य मांसेन तृप्तिर्द्वादशवार्षिकी ॥
data.md: With the meat of the buffalo they remain pleased for eleven months. With beef presented at the Shraddha, they remain pleased for a full year. Payas mixed with clarified butter is as much as acceptable to the departed Manes as beef. With the meat of the Vadhrinasa the Pitris remained pleased for twelve years.

data.v: आनन्त्याय भवेद्दत्तं खड्गमांसं पितृक्षये । कालशाकं च लौहं चाप्यानन्त्यं छाग उच्यते ॥
data.md: The flesh of the Rhinoceros, offered to the departed Manes on the anniversaries of the lunar days on which they died, becomes endless. The potherb called Kalashaka, the petals of the Kanchana flower, and meat of the goat also, thus offered, prove inexhaustible.

data.v: गाथाश्चाप्यत्र गायन्ति पितृगीता युधिष्ठिर । सनत्कुमारो भगवान्पुरा मय्यभ्यभाषत ॥
data.md: Regarding it, O Yudhishthira, there are some Verses, originally sung by the departed Manes, that are now sung (in the world). Sanatkumara communicated them to me former days.

data.v: अपि नः स कुले जायाद्यो नो दद्यात्त्रयोदशीम् । मघासु सर्पिषा युक्तं पायसं दक्षिणायने ॥
data.md: He who has taken birth in our race, should give us Payasa mixed with clarified butter on the thirteenth day (of the dark fortnight), under the constellation Magha, during the Sun's southward course.

data.v: आजेन वापि लौहेन मघास्वेव यतव्रतः । हस्तिच्छायासु विधिवत्कर्णव्यजनवीजितम् ॥
data.md: One born in our race, should under the constellation Magha, as if in the observance of a vow, offer the meat of goat or the petals of the Kanchana flower. One should also offer us, with due rites, Payasa mixed with clarified butter, dedicating it on a spot covered by the shadow of an elephant.

data.v: एष्टव्या बहवः पुत्रा यद्येकोऽपि गयां व्रजेत् । यत्रासौ प्रथितो लोकेष्वक्षय्यकरणो वटः ॥
data.md: Many sons should be coveted so that even one may go to Gaya, where stands the banian that is celebrated over all the worlds and that makes all offerings made under its branches endless.

data.v: आपो मूलं फलं मांसमन्नं वापि पितृक्षये । यत्किंचिन्मधुसंमिश्रं तदानन्त्याय कल्पते ॥
data.md: Even a little of water, roots, fruits, meat, and rice, mixed with honey, if offered on the anniversary of the day of death, becomes endless.

data.v: यमस्तु यानि श्राद्धानि प्रोवाच शशबिन्दवे । तानि मे शृणु काम्यानि नक्षत्रेषु पृथक्पृथक् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Hear me, O Yudhishthira, as I tell you what those optional Shraddhas are that should be performed under the different constellations and that were first spoken of by Yama of king Shashabindu.

data.v: श्राद्धं यः कृत्तिकायोगे कुर्वीत सततं नरः । अग्नीनाधाय सापत्यो यजेत विगतज्वरः ॥
data.md: That man who always perforins the Shraddha under the constellation Krittika, is considered as performing a sacrifice after establishing the sacred fire. Such a person, freed from fever, goes to Heaven with his children.

data.v: अपत्यकामो रोहिण्यामोजस्कामो मृगोत्तमे । क्रूरकर्मा ददच्छ्राद्धमार्द्रायां मानवो भवेत् ॥
data.md: He who is desirous of children should perform the Shraddha under the constellation Rohini, while he who is desirous of power should do it under the constellation Mrigashiras. By performing the Shraddha under the constellation Ardra, a man becomes the doer of terrific deeds.

data.v: कृषिभागी भवेन्मर्त्यः कुर्वञ्श्राद्धं पुनर्वसौ । पुष्टिकामोऽथ पुष्येण श्राद्धमीहेत मानवः ॥
data.md: A man, by performing the Shraddha under Punarvasu, makes much gain by agriculture. The man who is desirous of growth and advancement should perform the Shraddha under Pushya.

data.v: आश्लेषायां ददच्छ्राद्धं वीरान्पुत्रान्प्रजायते । ज्ञातीनां तु भवेच्छ्रेष्ठो मघासु श्राद्धमावपन् ॥
data.md: By doing it under the constellation Ashlesha one begets heroic children. By doing it under the Maghas onc gains superiority over kinsmen.

data.v: फल्गुनीषु ददच्छ्राद्धं सुभगः श्राद्धदो भवेत् । अपत्यभागुत्तरासु हस्तेन फलभाग्भवेत् ॥
data.md: By doing it under the (prior) Phalgunis, one gains good fortune. By doing the Shraddha under the later Phalgunas one gets many children; while by performing it under Hasta, one gets the fruition of his wishes.

data.v: चित्रायां तु ददच्छ्राद्धं लभेद्रूपवतः सुतान् । स्वातियोगे पितॄनर्च्य वाणिज्यमुपजीवति ॥
data.md: By performing it under the constellation Chitra one gets beautiful children. By doing it under the constellation Svati, one makes much profit by trade.

data.v: बहुपुत्रो विशाखासु पित्र्यमीहन्भवेन्नरः । अनुराधासु कुर्वाणो राजचक्रं प्रवर्तयेत् ॥
data.md: The man who desires children, acquires the fruition of his desire by performing the Shraddha under the constellation Vishakha. By doing it under Anuradha, one becomes an Emperor.

data.v: आदिपत्यं व्रजेन्मर्त्यो ज्येष्ठायामपवर्जयन् । नरः कुरुकुलश्रेष्ठ श्रद्धादमपुरःसरः ॥
data.md: By making offerings in honour of the departed Manes Manes under the constellation Jeshthya, with devotion and humility, one acquires sovereignty, O foremost one of Kuru's race.

data.v: मूले त्वारोग्यमर्च्छेत यशोऽषाढास्वनुत्तमम् । उत्तरासु त्वषाढासु वीतशोकश्चरेन्महीम् ॥
data.md: By doing the Shraddha under Mula, one gains health, and by doing it under the prior Ashada, one acquires excellent fame. By performing it under the later Ashada, one succeeds in travelling over the whole world, freed from every sorrow.

data.v: श्राद्धं त्वभिजिता कुर्वन्विद्यां श्रेष्ठामवाप्नुयात् । श्रवणे तु ददच्छ्राद्धं प्रेत्य गच्छेत्परां गतिम् ॥
data.md: By doing it under the constellation Abhijit, one acquires great knowledge. By doing it under Shravana, one, after death, attains to a very high end.

data.v: राज्यभागी धनिष्ठायां प्राप्नुयान्नापदं नरः । नक्षत्रे वारुणे कुर्वन्भिषक्सिद्धिमवाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: The man who performs the Shraddha under the constellation Dhanistha becomes a king. By doing it under the constellation presided over by Varuna (viz., Shatavisha), one becomes a successful physician.

data.v: पूर्वप्रोष्ठपदाः कुर्वन्बहु विन्देदजाविकम् । उत्तरास्वथ कुर्वाणो विन्दते गाः सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: By performing the Shraddha under the constellation of the prior Bhadrapada, one acquires many goats and sheep: while by doing it under the later Bhadrapada, one acquires thousands of kine.

data.v: बहुरूप्यकृतं वित्तं विन्दते रेवतीं श्रितः । अश्वांश्चाश्वयुजे वेत्ति भरणीष्वायुरुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: By performing the Shraddha under the constellation Revati, one acquires many utensils of white brass and copper. By doing it under Ashvini, one acquires many horses, while under Bharani, one live long.

data.v: इमं श्राद्धविधिं श्रुत्वा शशबिन्दुस्तथाकरोत् । अक्लेशेनाजयच्चापि महीं सोऽनुशशास ह ॥
data.md: Listening to these ordinances about the Shraddha king Shashabindu acted accordingly, and succeeded in easily conquering and ruling the whole Earth.

data.v: कीदृशेभ्यः प्रदातव्यं भवेच्छ्राद्धं पितामह । द्विजेभ्यः कुरुशार्दूल तन्मे व्याख्यातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said. You should, O foremnost one of Kuru's race, tell me to what kind of Brahmanas, O grandfather, should the offers made at Shraddhas, be given away.

data.v: ब्राह्मणान्न परीक्षेत क्षत्रियो दानधर्मवित् । दैवे कर्मणि पित्र्ये तु न्याय्यमाहुः परीक्षणम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The Kshatriya who is conversant with the ordinances about gift, should never examine Brahmanas. In all matters, however, relating to the worship of the deities and the departed Manes, an examination has been said to be proper.

data.v: देवताः पूजयन्तीह दैवेनैवेह तेजसा । उपेत्य तस्माद्देवेभ्यः सर्वेभ्यो दापयेन्नरः ॥
data.md: The deities are adored on Earth by men only when they are filled with devotion originating from the celestials themselves. Hence, one should, approaching them, make gifts to all Brahmanas, respecting such gifts as are made to the celestial themselves.

data.v: श्राद्धे त्वथ महाराज परीक्षेद्ब्राह्मणान्बुधः । कुलशीलवयोरूपैर्विद्ययाभिजनेन च ॥
data.md: In Shraddhas, however, O king, the man of intelligence should examine the Brahmanas. Such examination should be about their birth, conduct, age, appearance, and learning.

data.v: एषामन्ये पङ्क्तिदूषास्तथान्ये पङ्क्तिपावनाः । अपाङ्क्तेयास्तु ये राजन्कीर्तयिष्यामि ताञ्शृणु ॥
data.md: Amongst the Brahmanas there are some who pollute the line and some who purify it. Listen to me, O king, as I tell you those Brahmanas are that should be excluded from the line.

data.v: कितवो भ्रूणहा यक्ष्मी पशुपालो निराकृतिः । ग्रामप्रेष्यो वार्धुषिको गायनः सर्वविक्रयी ॥
अगारदाही गरदः कुण्डाशी सोमविक्रयी । सामुद्रिको राजभृत्यस्तैलिकः कूटकारकः ॥
पित्रा विवदमानश्च यस्य चोपपतिर्गृहे । अभिशस्तस्तथा स्तेनः शिल्पं यश्चोपजीवति ॥
पर्वकारश्च सूची च मित्रध्रुक्पारदारिकः । अव्रतानामुपाध्यायः काण्डपृष्ठस्तथैव च ॥
श्वभिर्यश्च परिक्रामेद्यः शुना दष्ट एव च । परिवित्तिश्च यश्च स्याद्दुश्चर्मा गुरुतल्पगः । कुशीलवो देवलको नक्षत्रैर्यश्च जीवति ॥
एतानिह विजानीयादपाङ्क्तेयान्द्विजाधमान् । शूद्राणामुपदेशं च ये कुर्वन्त्यल्पचेतसः ॥
data.md: That littlewitted man who makes gifts of such articles to such men knowing their dispositions, obliges, by such conduct, his departed Manes to eat human excreta in the next world.

data.v: षष्टिं काणः शतं षण्ढः श्वित्री यावत्प्रपश्यति । पङ्क्त्यां समुपविष्टायां तावद्दूषयते नृप ॥
data.md: You should know that these wretched Brahmanas deserve to be excluded from the line. Those Brahmanas also of little energy who are engaged in instructing Shudras belong to the same class.

data.v: यद्वेष्टितशिरा भुङ्क्ते यद्भुङ्क्ते दक्षिणामुखः । सोपानत्कश्च यद्भुङ्क्ते सर्वं विद्यात्तदासुरम् ॥
data.md: A Brahmana who is blind stains sixty individuals of the line, one who is destitute of manly powers stains a hundred; while one who is afflicted with white leprosy stains as many as he looks upon, O king.

data.v: असूयता च यद्दत्तं यच्च श्रद्धाविवर्जितम् । सर्वं तदसुरेन्द्राय ब्रह्मा भागमकल्पयत् ॥
data.md: Whatever offerings made at Shraddhas are eaten by one with his head wrapped round with a cloth, whatever is eaten by one with face southwards, and whatever is eaten with shoes or sandals on, all goes to please the Asuras.

data.v: श्वानश्च पङ्क्तिदूषाश्च नावेक्षेरन्कथंचन । तस्मात्परिवृते दद्यात्तिलांश्चान्ववकीरयेत् ॥
data.md: Whatever, again is given with malice, and whatever is given without respect, have been ordained by Brahman himself as the portion of the king of Asuras (viz., Bali.)

data.v: तिलादाने च क्रव्यादा ये च क्रोधवशा गणाः । यातुधानाः पिशाचाश्च विप्रलुम्पन्ति तद्धविः ॥
data.md: Dogs, and such Brahmanas as are polluters of lines, should not be suffered to look upon the offerings made at Shraddhas performed at a place that is properly hedged around or concealed from the view. That spot should also be covered with sesame seeds.

data.v: यावद्ध्यपङ्क्त्यः पङ्क्त्यां वै भुञ्जानाननुपश्यति । तावत्फलाद्भ्रंशयति दातारं तस्य बालिशम् ॥
data.md: That Shraddha which is done without sesame seeds, or that which is done by a person in anger, has its Havi robbed by Rakshasas and Pishachas.

data.v: इमे तु भरतश्रेष्ठ विज्ञेयाः पङ्क्तिपावनाः । ये त्वतस्तान्प्रवक्ष्यामि परीक्षस्वेह तान्द्विजान् ॥
data.md: According to the number of Brahmanas seen by one who deserves to be excluded from the line, is the loss of merit he causes of the foolish perforiner of the Shraddha who invites him to the feast.

data.v: वेदविद्याव्रतस्नाता ब्राह्मणाः सर्व एव हि । पाङ्क्तेयान्यांस्तु वक्ष्यामि ज्ञेयास्ते पङ्क्तिपावनाः ॥
त्रिणाचिकेतः पञ्चाग्निस्त्रिसुपर्णः षडङ्गवित् । ब्रह्मदेयानुसंतानश्छन्दोगो ज्येष्ठसामगः ॥
मातापित्रोर्यश्च वश्यः श्रोत्रियो दशपूरुषः । ऋतुकालाभिगामी च धर्मपत्नीषु यः सदा । वेदविद्याव्रतस्नातो विप्रः पङ्क्तिं पुनात्युत ॥
अथर्वशिरसोऽध्येता ब्रह्मचारी यतव्रतः । सत्यवादी धर्मशीलः स्वकर्मनिरतश्च यः ॥
ये च पुण्येषु तीर्थेषु अभिषेककृतश्रमाः । मखेषु च समन्त्रेषु भवन्त्यवभृथाप्लुताः ॥
अक्रोधना अचपलाः क्षान्ता दान्ता जितेन्द्रियाः । सर्वभूतहिता ये च श्राद्धेष्वेतान्निमन्त्रयेत् । एतेषु दत्तमक्षय्यमेते वै पङ्क्तिपावनाः ॥
इमे परे महाराज विज्ञेयाः पङ्क्तिपावनाः । यतयो मोक्षधर्मज्ञा योगाः सुचरितव्रताः ॥
ये चेतिहासं प्रयताः श्रावयन्ति द्विजोत्तमान् । ये च भाष्यविदः केचिद्ये च व्याकरणे रताः ॥
data.md: Anything given to these, becomes endless. These, indeed, are purifiers of lines. There are others also, highly blessed, who should be considered as purifiers of the line.

data.v: अधीयते पुराणं ये धर्मशास्त्राण्यथापि च । अधीत्य च यथान्यायं विधिवत्तस्य कारिणः ॥
उपपन्नो गुरुकुले सत्यवादी सहस्रदः । अग्र्यः सर्वेषु वेदेषु सर्वप्रवचनेषु च ॥
यावदेते प्रपश्यन्ति पङ्क्त्यास्तावत्पुनन्त्युत । ततो हि पावनात्पङ्क्त्याः पङ्क्तिपावन उच्यते ॥
क्रोशादर्धतृतीयात्तु पावयेदेक एव हि । ब्रह्मदेयानुसंतान इति ब्रह्मविदो विदुः ॥
अनृत्विगनुपाध्यायः स चेदग्रासनं व्रजेत् । ऋत्विग्भिरननुज्ञातः पङ्क्त्या हरति दुष्कृतम् ॥
अथ चेद्वेदवित्सर्वैः पङ्क्तिदोषैर्विवर्जितः । न च स्यात्पतितो राजन्पङ्क्तिपावन एव सः ॥
तस्मात्सर्वप्रयत्नेन परीक्ष्यामन्त्रयेद्द्विजान् । स्वकर्मनिरतान्दान्तान्कुले जातान्बहुश्रुतान् ॥
यस्य मित्रप्रधानानि श्राद्धानि च हवींषि च । न प्रीणाति पितॄन्देवान्स्वर्गं च न स गच्छति ॥
data.md: He who performs Shraddhas for feeding only his friends and whose Havi does not please the celestials and the departed Manes, fails to ascend to Heaven.

data.v: यश्च श्राद्धे कुरुते संगतानि; न देवयानेन पथा स याति । स वै मुक्तः पिप्पलं बन्धनाद्वा; स्वर्गाल्लोकाच्च्यवते श्राद्धमित्रः ॥
तस्मान्मित्रं श्राद्धकृन्नाद्रियेत; दद्यान्मित्रेभ्यः संग्रहार्थं धनानि । यं मन्यते नैव शत्रुं न मित्रं; तं मध्यस्थं भोजयेद्धव्यकव्ये ॥
यथोषरे बीजमुप्तं न रोहे;न्न चास्योप्ता प्राप्नुयाद्बीजभागम् । एवं श्राद्धं भुक्तमनर्हमाणै;र्न चेह नामुत्र फलं ददाति ॥
ब्राह्मणो ह्यनधीयानस्तृणाग्निरिव शाम्यति । तस्मै श्राद्धं न दातव्यं न हि भस्मनि हूयते ॥
data.md: As seed sown on a barren soil does not sprout forth, or as one who has not sown does not get a share of the produce, so that Shraddha the offerings in which are eaten by an unworthy person, yields no fruit either in this : world or in the next.

data.v: संभोजनी नाम पिशाचदक्षिणा; सा नैव देवान्न पितॄनुपैति । इहैव सा भ्राम्यति क्षीणपुण्या; शालान्तरे गौरिव नष्टवत्सा ॥
data.md: That Brahmana who is destitute of Vedic study, is like a fire made by burning grass or straw; and becomes soon put out even like such a fire. The offerings inade at Shraddhas should not be given to him even as libations should not be poured on the ashes of the sacrificial fire.

data.v: यथाग्नौ शान्ते घृतमाजुहोति; तन्नैव देवान्न पितॄनुपैति । तथा दत्तं नर्तने गायने च; यां चानृचे दक्षिणामावृणोति ॥
data.md: When the offerings made at Shraddhas are exchanged by the performers with one another, they become Pishacha presents. Such offerings please neither the gods nor the departed Manes, Instead of reaching the other world, they wander about even here like a cow which has lost her calf wandering about within the fold.

data.v: उभौ हिनस्ति न भुनक्ति चैषा; या चानृचे दक्षिणा दीयते वै । आघातनी गर्हितैषा पतन्ती; तेषां प्रेतान्पातयेद्देवयानात् ॥
data.md: As those libations of clarified butter that are poured upon the extinguished ashes of a sacrificial fire never reach either the gods or the departed Manes, similarly a gift that is inade to a dancer or a singer or a Dakshina presented to a lying or deceitful person, yields no merit.

data.v: ऋषीणां समयं नित्यं ये चरन्ति युधिष्ठिर । निश्चिताः सर्वधर्मज्ञास्तान्देवा ब्राह्मणान्विदुः ॥
data.md: The present that is given to a lying or deceitful person destroys both the giver and the receiver without benefiting them in any way. Such a present is destructive and highly censurable. The Pitris of the person making it have to fall down form the celestial path.

data.v: स्वाध्यायनिष्ठा ऋषयो ज्ञाननिष्ठास्तथैव च । तपोनिष्ठाश्च बोद्धव्याः कर्मनिष्ठाश्च भारत ॥
data.md: The gods know thein to he Brahmanas who always walk, O Yudhishthira, within the limits set up by the Rishis who know all duties, and who have a firm faith in their efficacy.

data.v: कव्यानि ज्ञाननिष्ठेभ्यः प्रतिष्ठाप्यानि भारत । तत्र ये ब्राह्मणाः केचिन्न निन्दति हि ते वराः ॥
data.md: Those Brahmanas who are given to Vedic study, to knowledge, to penances, and to acts, O Bharata, should be known as Rishis.

data.v: ये तु निन्दन्ति जल्पेषु न ताञ्श्राद्धेषु भोजयेत् । ब्राह्मणा निन्दिता राजन्हन्युस्त्रिपुरुषं कुलम् ॥
data.md: The offerings made at Shraddhas, should be given to those who are devoted to knowledge. Indeed, they are to be considered as men who never speak ill of the Brahmanas.

data.v: वैखानसानां वचनमृषीणां श्रूयते नृप । दूरादेव परीक्षेत ब्राह्मणान्वेदपारगान् । प्रियान्वा यदि वा द्वेष्यांस्तेषु तच्छ्राद्धमावपेत् ॥
data.md: Those men should never be fed on occasions of Shraddhas who speak ill of Brahmanas in course of conversation in the midst of conclaves. If Brahmanas, O king, be vilified, they would destroy three generations of the calumniator.

data.v: यः सहस्रं सहस्राणां भोजयेदनृचां नरः । एकस्तान्मन्त्रवित्प्रीतः सर्वानर्हति भारत ॥
data.md: This is saying, O king, of the Vaikhanasa Rishis. Brahmanas knowing the Vedas should be examined from a distance. Whether one likes them or not, one should give to such Brahmanas the offerings made at Shraddhas. That man who feeds thousands upon thousands of unworthy Brahmanas acquires merit that is attainable by feeding even one Brahmana if the latter happens to be endued with a knowledge of the Vedas, o Bharata!

data.v: केन संकल्पितं श्राद्धं कस्मिन्काले किमात्मकम् । भृग्वङ्गिरसके काले मुनिना कतरेण वा ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said By whom was the Shraddha first conceived and at what time? What also is its substance? In the time when the world was inhabited by only the descendants of Bhrigu and Angirasa who was the Muni who established the Shraddha?

data.v: कानि श्राद्धेषु वर्ज्यानि तथा मूलफलानि च । धान्यजातिश्च का वर्ज्या तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: What deeds should not be done at Shraddha? What are those Shraddhas in which fruits and roots are to be offered? What kinds also of paddy should be avoided in Shraddhas? Tell me all this, O grandfather.

data.v: यथा श्राद्धं संप्रवृत्तं यस्मिन्काले यदात्मकम् । येन संकल्पितं चैव तन्मे शृणु जनाधिप ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Listen to me, O kine, as I tell you how the Shraddha was introduced, the time of such introduction, the essence of the rite, and the ascetic who conceived it.

data.v: स्वायंभुवोऽत्रिः कौरव्य परमर्षिः प्रतापवान् । तस्य वंशे महाराज दत्तात्रेय इति स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Form the SelfCreate Brahman sprang Atri, O you of Kuru's race. In Atri's family was born a Muni named Dattatreya.

data.v: दत्तात्रेयस्य पुत्रोऽभून्निमिर्नाम तपोधनः । निमेश्चाप्यभवत्पुत्रः श्रीमान्नाम श्रिया वृतः ॥
data.md: Dattatreya got a son named Nimi having asceticism for wealth. Nimi got a son named Shrimat who was gifted with great beauty of person.

data.v: पूर्णे वर्षसहस्रान्ते स कृत्वा दुष्करं तपः । कालधर्मपरीतात्मा निधनं समुपागतः ॥
data.md: Upon the expiration of a full thousand years, Shrimat having practised the practised the severest austerities, yielded to the influence of Time and departed from this world.

data.v: निमिस्तु कृत्वा शौचानि विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा । संतापमगमत्तीव्रं पुत्रशोकपरायणः ॥
data.md: His father Nimi, having performed the purificatoy rites according to sanctioned rites, because stricken with great grief, thinking continually of the loss of his son.

data.v: अथ कृत्वोपहार्याणि चतुर्दश्यां महामतिः । तमेव गणयञ्शोकं विरात्रे प्रत्यबुध्यत ॥
data.md: Thanking of that cause of sorrow, the great Nimi collected together various agreeable objects on the fourteenth day of the moon. The next morning he rose from bed.

data.v: तस्यासीत्प्रतिबुद्धस्य शोकेन पिहितात्मनः । मनः संहृत्य विषये बुद्धिर्विस्तरगामिनी ॥
data.md: Stricken as his heart was with grief, as he rose from sleep that day he succeeded in withdrawing it from the one object upon which it had been working. His mind became busy with other matters.

data.v: ततः संचिन्तयामास श्राद्धकल्पं समाहितः । यानि तस्यैव भोज्यानि मूलानि च फलानि च ॥
data.md: With rapt attention he then conceived the idea of a Shraddha. All those articles of his own fond, containing fruits and roots, and all those kinds of staple grains which he liked, were carefully thought of by that sage having penances for wealth.

data.v: उक्तानि यानि चान्यानि यानि चेष्टानि तस्य ह । तानि सर्वाणि मनसा विनिश्चित्य तपोधनः ॥
data.md: With rapt attention he then conceived the idea of a Shraddha. All those articles of his own fond, containing fruits and roots, and all those kinds of staple grains which he liked, were carefully thought of by that sage having penances for wealth.

data.v: अमावास्यां महाप्राज्ञ विप्रानानाय्य पूजितान् । दक्षिणावर्तिकाः सर्वा बृसीः स्वयमथाकरोत् ॥
data.md: On the day of the New Moon he invited a number of worthy Brahmanas. Gifted with great wisdom, Nimi made them sit on seats and honoured them by going round thein.

data.v: सप्त विप्रांस्ततो भोज्ये युगपत्समुपानयत् । ऋते च लवणं भोज्यं श्यामाकान्नं ददौ प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Approaching seven such Brahmanas whom he had brought to his house together, the powerful Nimi gave them food consisting of Shyamaka rice, unmixed with salt.

data.v: दक्षिणाग्रास्ततो दर्भा विष्टरेषु निवेशिताः । पादयोश्चैव विप्राणां ये त्वन्नमुपभुञ्जते ॥
data.md: Towards the feet of those Brahmanas engaged in eating the food that was served to them a number of Kusha blades was spread out, on the seats they occupied, with the tops of the blades directed towards the south.

data.v: कृत्वा च दक्षिणाग्रान्वै दर्भान्सुप्रयतः शुचिः । प्रददौ श्रीमते पिण्डं नामगोत्रमुदाहरन् ॥
data.md: With a pure body and mind and with rapt attention, Niini, having placed those blades of sacred grass in the way indicated, offered cakes of rice to his dead son, uttering his name and family.

data.v: तत्कृत्वा स मुनिश्रेष्ठो धर्मसंकरमात्मनः । पश्चात्तापेन महता तप्यमानोऽभ्यचिन्तयत् ॥
data.md: Having done this, that foremost of ascetics became filled with regret at the idea of having done a deed that had not been laid down in any of the scriptures. Indeed, filled with regret, he began to think of what he had done.

data.v: अकृतं मुनिभिः पूर्वं किं मयैतदनुष्ठितम् । कथं नु शापेन न मां दहेयुर्ब्राह्मणा इति ॥
data.md: Never done before by the ascetics, alas, what have I done! How shall I avoid being cursed by the Brahmanas?

data.v: ततः संचिन्तयामास वंशकर्तारमात्मनः । ध्यातमात्रस्तथा चात्रिराजगाम तपोधनः ॥
data.md: He then thought of the original founder of his race. As soon as he was thought of, Atri having penances for wealth came there.

data.v: अथात्रिस्तं तथा दृष्ट्वा पुत्रशोकेन कर्शितम् । भृशमाश्वासयामास वाग्भिरिष्टाभिरव्ययः ॥
data.md: Seeing him greatly stricken with grief consequent on the death of his son, the immortal Atri comforted him with agreeable advice.

data.v: निमे संकल्पितस्तेऽयं पितृयज्ञस्तपोधनः । मा ते भूद्भीः पूर्वदृष्टो धर्मोऽयं ब्रह्मणा स्वयम् ॥
data.md: He said to him, O Nimi, this rite that you have conceived, is a sacrifice in honour of the departed Manes. Do not fear, O you, having asceticism for wealth. Formerly the Grandfather Brahman himself laid it down.

data.v: सोऽयं स्वयंभुविहितो धर्मः संकल्पितस्त्वया । ऋते स्वयंभुवः कोऽन्यः श्राद्धेयं विधिमाहरेत् ॥
data.md: This rite that you have conceived, has been ordained by the SelfCreate himself. Who else save the SelfCreate could ordain this ritual in Shraddhas?

data.v: आख्यास्यामि च ते भूयः श्राद्धेयं विधिमुत्तमम् । स्वयंभुविहितं पुत्र तत्कुरुष्व निबोध मे ॥
data.md: I shall now tell you, O son, the excellent ordinance laid down in the Shraddhas. Ordained by the SelfCreate himself, O son follow it. Listen to me first.

data.v: कृत्वाग्निकरणं पूर्वं मन्त्रपूर्वं तपोधन । ततोऽर्यम्णे च सोमाय वरुणाय च नित्यशः ॥
data.md: Having first performed the Karna on the sacred fire with the help of Mantras, O you having penances for wealth, one should always pour libations next to the god of fire, and Soma, and Varuna.

data.v: विश्वेदेवाश्च ये नित्यं पितृभिः सह गोचराः । तेभ्यः संकल्पिता भागाः स्वयमेव स्वयंभुवा ॥
data.md: The Self Create next ordained a portion of the offerings to the Vishvedevas also, who are always the companions of the departed Manes.

data.v: स्तोतव्या चेह पृथिवी निवापस्येह धारिणी । वैष्णवी काश्यपी चेति तथैवेहाक्षयेति च ॥
data.md: The Earth also, as the goddess who sustains the offerings made at Shraddhas, should then be lauded under the names of Vaishnavi, Kashyapi, and the inexhaustible,

data.v: उदकानयने चैव स्तोतव्यो वरुणो विभुः । ततोऽग्निश्चैव सोमश्च आप्याय्याविह तेऽनघ ॥
data.md: When water is being fatched for the Shraddha, the powerful god Varuna should be lauded. After this, both Agni and Soma should be invoked with respect and pleased (with libations), O sinless one.

data.v: देवास्तु पितरो नाम निर्मिता वै स्वयंभुवा । ऊष्मपाः सुमहाभागास्तेषां भागाः प्रकल्पिताः ॥
data.md: Those deities named Pitris were created by the SelfCreate. Others also, highly blessed, viz., the Ushmapas, were created by him. For all these, shares have been sanctioned of the offerings made at Shraddhas.

data.v: ते श्राद्धेनार्च्यमाना वै विमुच्यन्ते ह किल्बिषात् । सप्तकः पितृवंशस्तु पूर्वदृष्टः स्वयंभुवा ॥
data.md: By worshipping all those gods at Shraddhas, the ancestors of the persons performing them become purged of all sins. The departed Manes referred to above as those created by the SelfCreate are seven in number.

data.v: विश्वे चाग्निमुखा देवाः संख्याताः पूर्वमेव ते । तेषां नामानि वक्ष्यामि भागार्हाणां महात्मनाम् ॥
data.md: The Vishvedevas, having Agni for their mouth, have been mentioned before. I shall now mention the names of those great deities who deserve shares of the offerings made at Shraddhas.

data.v: सहः कृतिर्विपाप्मा च पुण्यकृत्पावनस्तथा । ग्राम्निः क्षेमः समूहश्च दिव्यसानुस्तथैव च ॥
विवस्वान्वीर्यवान्ह्रीमान्कीर्तिमान्कृत एव च । विपूर्वः सोमपूर्वश्च सूर्यश्रीश्चेति नामतः ॥
सोमपः सूर्यसावित्रो दत्तात्मा पुष्करीयकः । उष्णीनाभो नभोदश्च विश्वायुर्दीप्तिरेव च ॥
चमूहरः सुवेषश्च व्योमारिः शंकरो भवः । ईशः कर्ता कृतिर्दक्षो भुवनो दिव्यकर्मकृत् ॥
गणितः पञ्चवीर्यश्च आदित्यो रश्मिमांस्तथा । सप्तकृत्सोमवर्चाश्च विश्वकृत्कविरेव च ॥
अनुगोप्ता सुगोप्ता च नप्ता चेश्वर एव च । जितात्मा मुनिवीर्यश्च दीप्तलोमा भयंकरः ॥
अतिकर्मा प्रतीतश्च प्रदाता चांशुमांस्तथा । शैलाभः परमक्रोधी धीरोष्णी भूपतिस्तथा ॥
स्रजी वज्री वरी चैव विश्वेदेवाः सनातनाः । कीर्तितास्ते महाभागाः कालस्य गतिगोचराः ॥
अश्राद्धेयानि धान्यानि कोद्रवाः पुलकास्तथा । हिङ्गु द्रव्येषु शाकेषु पलाण्डुं लशुनं तथा ॥
data.md: Kodrava, and Pulaka are the species of paddy which should not be offered at Shraddhas. Asafoetida also, among articles used in coO king, should not be offered, as also onions and garlic's, the produce of the Moringa, pterygosperma, Bauhinia, Variegataa, the meat of animals killed with poisoned arrows, all varieties of Cucurbita Pepo, Cucurbita lagenaria, and black salt. All articles, again, upon which any one has spat or upon which tears have fallen should be avoided at Shraddhas.

data.v: पलाण्डुः सौभञ्जनकस्तथा गृञ्जनकादयः । कूष्माण्डजात्यलाबुं च कृष्णं लवणमेव च ॥
data.md: Kodrava, and Pulaka are the species of paddy which should not be offered at Shraddhas. Asafoetida also, among articles used in coO king, should not be offered, as also onions and garlic's, the produce of the Moringa, pterygosperma, Bauhinia, Variegataa, the meat of animals killed with poisoned arrows, all varieties of Cucurbita Pepo, Cucurbita lagenaria, and black salt. All articles, again, upon which any one has spat or upon which tears have fallen should be avoided at Shraddhas.

data.v: ग्राम्यं वाराहमांसं च यच्चैवाप्रोक्षितं भवेत् । कृष्णाजाजी विडश्चैव शीतपाकी तथैव च । अङ्कुराद्यास्तथा वर्ज्या इह शृङ्गाटकानि च ॥
data.md: The other articles that should not be offered at Shraddhas are the flesh of the domesticated hog, the meat of all animals not killed at sacrifices, Nigella sativa, salt of the variety called Vid, the potherb that is called Shitapaki, all sprouts and also the Trapa bispinosa. All kinds of salt should be excluded from the offerings made at Shraddhas, and also fruits of the Eugenia Jambolana.

data.v: वर्जयेल्लवणं सर्वं तथा जम्बूफलानि च । अवक्षुतावरुदितं तथा श्राद्धेषु वर्जयेत् ॥
निवापे हव्यकव्ये वा गर्हितं च श्वदर्शनम् । पितरश्चैव देवाश्च नाभिनन्दन्ति तद्धविः ॥
data.md: Among offerings made to the departed Manes or with the Havya and Kavya offered to the celestials, the potherb called Sudarshana should not be included. Havi mixed with this is not acceptable to the departed Manes.

data.v: चण्डालश्वपचौ वर्ज्यौ निवापे समुपस्थिते । काषायवासी कुष्ठी वा पतितो ब्रह्महापि वा ॥
data.md: From the place where the Shraddha is being performed, the Chandala and the Shvapacha should be excluded, as also all who wear yellow clothes and persons suffering from leprosy, or one who has bcen outcasted, or one who is guilty of Brahmanicide, or a Brahmana of mixed descent, or one who is the relative of an outcast man. These all should be excluded by wise persons from the place where a Shraddha is being performed.

data.v: संकीर्णयोनिर्विप्रश्च संबन्धी पतितश्च यः । वर्जनीया बुधैरेते निवापे समुपस्थिते ॥
data.md: From the place where the Shraddha is being performed, the Chandala and the Shvapacha should be excluded, as also all who wear yellow clothes and persons suffering from leprosy, or one who has bcen outcasted, or one who is guilty of Brahmanicide, or a Brahmana of mixed descent, or one who is the relative of an outcast man. These all should be excluded by wise persons from the place where a Shraddha is being performed.

data.v: इत्येवमुक्त्वा भगवान्स्ववंशजमृषिं पुरा । पितामहसभां दिव्यां जगामात्रिस्तपोधनः ॥
data.md: Having said these words formerly to the Rishi Nimi of his own race, the illustrious Atri having penances for wealth then went back to the Grandfather's court in the celestial region.

data.v: तथा विधौ प्रवृत्ते तु सर्व एव महर्षयः । पितृयज्ञानकुर्वन्त विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा ॥
data.md: Bhishma said After Nini had acted thus, all the great Rishis began to celebrate the sacrifice in honour of the departed Manes (called the Shraddha) according to rites laid down in the ordinance.

data.v: ऋषयो धर्मनित्यास्तु कृत्वा निवपनान्युत । तर्पणं चाप्यकुर्वन्त तीर्थाम्भोभिर्यतव्रताः ॥
data.md: Performing all duties, the Rishis, having performed Shraddhas, began to also offer oblations of sacred waters, with attention.

data.v: निवापैर्दीयमानैश्च चातुर्वर्ण्येन भारत । तर्पिताः पितरो देवास्ते नान्नं जरयन्ति वै ॥
data.md: On account, however, of the offerings made by persons of all classes, the departed Manes began to digest that food.

data.v: अजीर्णेनाभिहन्यन्ते ते देवाः पितृभिः सह । सोममेवाभ्यपद्यन्त निवापान्नाभिपीडिताः ॥
data.md: Soon they, and the celestials also with them, became afflicted with indigestion. Indeed, afflicted with the heaps of food that all persons began to give them, they went to Soma.

data.v: तेऽब्रुवन्सोममासाद्य पितरोऽजीर्णपीडिताः । निवापान्नेन पीड्यामः श्रेयो नोऽत्र विधीयताम् ॥
तान्सोमः प्रत्युवाचाथ श्रेयश्चेदीप्सितं सुराः । स्वयंभूसदनं यात स वः श्रेयो विधास्यति ॥
ते सोमवचनाद्देवाः पितृभिः सह भारत । मेरुशृङ्गे समासीनं पितामहमुपागमन् ॥
निवापान्नेन भगवन्भृशं पीड्यामहे वयम् । प्रसादं कुरु नो देव श्रेयो नः संविधीयताम् ॥
data.md: The gods said o illustrious one, with the food that is offered us in sacrifices and Shraddhas, we are suffering very much. O lord, show us favour and do what would be for our behoof.

data.v: इति तेषां वचः श्रुत्वा स्वयंभूरिदमब्रवीत् । एष मे पार्श्वतो वह्निर्युष्मच्छ्रेयो विधास्यति ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of theirs, the SelfCreate said to them in reply, Here, the god of fire is sitting beside me. Even he will do what is for your good.

data.v: सहितास्तात भोक्ष्यामो निवापे समुपस्थिते । जरयिष्यथ चाप्यन्नं मया सार्धं न संशयः ॥
data.md: Agni said You sires, when a Shraddha comes, we shall in a body eat the offerings made to us. If you eat those offerings with me, you shall, forsooth, succeed in digesting them easily.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु पितरस्ततस्ते विज्वराभवन् । एतस्मात्कारणाच्चाग्नेः प्राक्तनं दीयते नृप ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of the God of Fire, the departed Manes became comforted it is for this reason also that in making offerings at Shraddhas a share is first offered to the God of Fire, O king.

data.v: निवप्ते चाग्निपूर्वे वै निवापे पुरुषर्षभ । न ब्रह्मराक्षसास्तं वै निवापं धर्षयन्त्युत । रक्षांसि चापवर्तन्ते स्थिते देवे विभावसौ ॥
data.md: If a portion of the offerings be first made of the God of Fire at a Shraddha, O king, Rakshasas of twiceborn origin cannot then do any injury to such a Shraddha.

data.v: पूर्वं पिण्डं पितुर्दद्यात्ततो दद्यात्पितामहे । प्रपितामहाय च तत एष श्राद्धविधिः स्मृतः ॥
ब्रूयाच्छ्राद्धे च सावित्रीं पिण्डे पिण्डे समाहितः । सोमायेति च वक्तव्यं तथा पितृमतेति च ॥
रजस्वला च या नारी व्यङ्गिता कर्णयोश्च या । निवापे नोपतिष्ठेत संग्राह्या नान्यवंशजाः ॥
data.md: This other Mantra also should be uttered, viz., to Soma who is fond of the departed manes. A woman that has become impure on account of her season, or one whose ears have been cut off, should not be allowed to remain where a Shraddha is being done, Nor should a woman be brought from a family other than that of the person who is performing the Shraddha.

data.v: जलं प्रतरमाणश्च कीर्तयेत पितामहान् । नदीमासाद्य कुर्वीत पितॄणां पिण्डतर्पणम् ॥
data.md: While crossing a river, one should offer oblations of water to his Pitris, naming them all. Indeed, when one comes upon a river one should please his Pitris with oblations of water.

data.v: पूर्वं स्ववंशजानां तु कृत्वाद्भिस्तर्पणं पुनः । सुहृत्संबन्धिवर्गाणां ततो दद्याज्जलाञ्जलिम् ॥
data.md: Having offered oblations of water first to the ancestors of his race, one should next offer such oblations to his departed friends and relatives.

data.v: कल्माषगोयुगेनाथ युक्तेन तरतो जलम् । पितरोऽभिलषन्ते वै नावं चाप्यधिरोहतः । सदा नावि जलं तज्ज्ञाः प्रयच्छन्ति समाहिताः ॥
data.md: When one crosses a river on a car to which is yoked a couple of oxen of variegated colour, or from them that cross a river on boats, the departed Manes expect oblations of water.

data.v: मासार्धे कृष्णपक्षस्य कुर्यान्निवपनानि वै । पुष्टिरायुस्तथा वीर्यं श्रीश्चैव पितृवर्तिनः ॥
पितामहः पुलस्त्यश्च वसिष्ठः पुलहस्तथा । अङ्गिराश्च क्रतुश्चैव कश्यपश्च महानृषिः । एते कुरुकुलश्रेष्ठ महायोगेश्वराः स्मृताः ॥
data.md: Growth, longevity, energy, and prosperity became all attainable through devotion to the departea Manes. The Grandfather Brahman, Pulastya, Vasishtha, Pulaha, Angirasa, Kratu, and the great Rishi Kashyapa, these O prince of Kuru's race, are considered as great masters of Yoga.

data.v: एते च पितरो राजन्नेष श्राद्धविधिः परः । प्रेतास्तु पिण्डसंबन्धान्मुच्यन्ते तेन कर्मणा ॥
data.md: They are numbered among the departed Manes. Even this is the high ritual in the matter of Shraddha, O king. Through Shraddhas performed on Earth, the deceased members of his race become freed from a poison of misery.

data.v: इत्येषा पुरुषश्रेष्ठ श्राद्धोत्पत्तिर्यथागमम् । ख्यापिता पूर्वनिर्दिष्टा दानं वक्ष्याम्यतः परम् ॥
data.md: I have thus, O prince of Kuru's explained to you, according to the scriptures, the ordinances relating to Shraddhas. I shall one more discourse to you on gifts. race

data.v: द्विजातयो व्रतोपेता हविस्ते यदि भुञ्जते । अन्नं ब्राह्मणकामाय कथमेतत्पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said If Brahmanas who observe a vow (viz., fast) eat, at the invitation of a Brahmana, the Havi, can they be charged with the sin of violating their vow? Tell me this, O Grandfather.

data.v: अवेदोक्तव्रताश्चैव भुञ्जानाः कार्यकारिणः । वेदोक्तेषु तु भुञ्जाना व्रतलुप्ता युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Let those Brahmanas eat, moved by desire, who observe such vows as are not laid down in the Vedas. About those Brahmanas, however, who observe such vows as are laid down in the Vedas, they are considered as guilty of a breach of their vow, O Yudhishthira, by eating the Havi of Shraddha at the request of him who performs the Shraddha.

data.v: यदिदं तप इत्याहुरुपवासं पृथग्जनाः । तपः स्यादेतदिह वै तपोऽन्यद्वापि किं भवेत् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Some people say that fast is a penance. Is penance really at one with fast or is it not so? Tell me this, O grandfather.

data.v: मासार्धमासौ नोपवसेद्यत्तपो मन्यते जनः । आत्मतन्त्रोपघाती यो न तपस्वी न धर्मवित् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said People do consider a regular fast for a month or a half month as a penance. The truth, however, is that one who mortifies his own body is not to be considered, either as an ascetic or as one conversant with duty.

data.v: त्यागस्यापि च संपत्तिः शिष्यते तप उत्तमम् । सदोपवासी च भवेद्ब्रह्मचारी तथैव च ॥
data.md: Renunciation, however, is considered as the best of penances. A Brahmana should always abstain from food, and observe the vow of celibacy.

data.v: मुनिश्च स्यात्सदा विप्रो देवांश्चैव सदा यजेत् । कुटुम्बिको धर्मकामः सदास्वप्नश्च भारत ॥
data.md: A Brahmana should always practise self denial controlling even speech, and recite the marry and Vedas. The Brahmana should surround himself with children and relatives, from desire of acquiring virtue. He should never sleep.

data.v: अमृताशी सदा च स्यात्पवित्री च सदा भवेत् । ऋतवादी सदा च स्यान्नियतश्च सदा भवेत् ॥
data.md: He should abstain from meat. He should always read the Vedas and the scriptures. He should always speak the truth, and practise selfcontrol.

data.v: विघसाशी सदा च स्यात्सदा चैवातिथिप्रियः । अमांसाशी सदा च स्यात्पवित्री च सदा भवेत् ॥
data.md: He should eat the residue, (viz., of what remains after serving the deities and guests). Indeed, he should be hospitable towards all that come should be hospitable towards all that come to his house. He should always eat nectar, He should duly observe all rites and celebrate sacrifices.

data.v: कथं सदोपवासी स्याद्ब्रह्मचारी च पार्थिव । विघसाशी कथं च स्यात्कथं चैवातिथिप्रियः ॥
data.md: Yuthishthira said How may one come to be considered as always observant of fasts? How may one become observant of vows? How, O king, may one come to be an eater of the residue? By doing what may one be said to be fond of guests.

data.v: अन्तरा सायमाशं च प्रातराशं तथैव च । सदोपवासी भवति यो न भुङ्क्तेऽन्तरा पुनः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said He who takes food only morning and evening at the appointed hours and abstains from all food during the interval, is said to be an abstainer from food.

data.v: भार्यां गच्छन्ब्रह्मचारी सदा भवति चैव ह । ऋतवादी सदा च स्याद्दानशीलश्च मानवः ॥
data.md: He who knows only his married wife and that only at her season, is said to be observant of the vow of celibacy. By always making gifts, one comes to be considered as truthful in speech,

data.v: अभक्षयन्वृथा मांसममांसाशी भवत्युत । दानं ददत्पवित्री स्यादस्वप्नश्च दिवास्वपन् ॥
data.md: By abstaining from all meat obtained from animals killed for nothing, one becomes an abstainer from meat. By making gifts one becomes purged of all sins, and by abstaining from sleep during day time, one comes to be considered always awake,

data.v: भृत्यातिथिषु यो भुङ्क्ते भुक्तवत्सु नरः सदा । अमृतं केवलं भुङ्क्ते इति विद्धि युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: He who always eats what remains after serving the guests and servants, know, O Yuthishthira, is said to always eat nectar.

data.v: अभुक्तवत्सु नाश्नाति ब्राह्मणेषु तु यो नरः । अभोजनेन तेनास्य जितः स्वर्गो भवत्युत ॥
data.md: He who abstains from eating till Brahmanas have eaten, is considered considered as conquering Heaven by such abstention.

data.v: देवेभ्यश्च पितृभ्यश्च भृत्येभ्योऽतिथिभिः सह । अवशिष्टानि यो भुङ्क्ते तमाहुर्विघसाशिनम् ॥
data.md: He who eats what remains after serving the celestials, the departed Manes, and relatives and dependants, is said to eat Vighasa or the residue.

data.v: तेषां लोका ह्यपर्यन्ताः सदने ब्रह्मणः स्मृताः । उपस्थिता ह्यप्सरोभिर्गन्धर्वैश्च जनाधिप ॥
data.md: Such man acquire many regions of happiness in the abode of Brahman himself, There, o king, they live in the company of Apsaras and Gandharvas.

data.v: देवतातिथिभिः सार्धं पितृभिश्चोपभुञ्जते । रमन्ते पुत्रपौत्रैश्च तेषां गतिरनुत्तमा ॥
data.md: Indeed, they sport and enjoy in these regions, with the celestials and guests and the departed Manes in their company, and surrounded by their children and grandchildren. Even such becomes their high end. own

data.v: ब्राह्मणेभ्यः प्रयच्छन्ति दानानि विविधानि च । दातृप्रतिग्रहीत्रोर्वा को विशेषः पितामह ॥
data.md: Yuthishthira said People are seen to make various kinds of gifts to the Brahmanas. What, however, is the difference, O grandfather, between the giver and the receiver?

data.v: साधोर्यः प्रतिगृह्णीयात्तथैवासाधुतो द्विजः । गुणवत्यल्पदोषः स्यान्निर्गुणे तु निमज्जति ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The Brahmana accepts gifts from him who is righteous, and from him who is sinful. If the giver happens to be virtuous, the receiver commits little sin. If, on the other hand, the giver happens to be impious, the receiver sinks in hell.
