data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । वृषादर्भेश्च संवादं सप्तर्षीणां च भारत ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Regarding it is cited the old story, O king of the conversation between kine and godless of prosperity, O best of the Bharatas.

data.v: कश्यपोऽत्रिर्वसिष्ठश्च भरद्वाजोऽथ गौतमः । विश्वामित्रो जमदग्निः साध्वी चैवाप्यरुन्धती ॥
data.md: Kashyapa, Atri, Vashishtha, Bharadvaja, Gautama, Visvamitra, Jamadagni, and chaste Arundhati (the wife of Vashishtha), all had a common maidservant whose name was Ganda. A Shudra named Pashusakha married Ganda and became her husband.

data.v: सर्वेषामथ तेषां तु गण्डाभूत्कर्मकारिका । शूद्रः पशुसखश्चैव भर्ता चास्या बभूव ह ॥
data.md: Kashyapa, Atri, Vashishtha, Bharadvaja, Gautama, Visvamitra, Jamadagni, and chaste Arundhati (the wife of Vashishtha), all had a common maidservant whose name was Ganda. A Shudra named Pashusakha married Ganda and became her husband.

data.v: ते वै सर्वे तपस्यन्तः पुरा चेरुर्महीमिमाम् । समाधिनोपशिक्षन्तो ब्रह्मलोकं सनातनम् ॥
data.md: Kashyapa and others, formerly, observed the austeresi penances and roved over the world, desirous of acquiring the eternal region of Brahman by the help of Yogameditation.

data.v: अथाभवदनावृष्टिर्महती कुरुनन्दन । कृच्छ्रप्राणोऽभवद्यत्र लोकोऽयं वै क्षुधान्वितः ॥
data.md: About that time, O delighter of the Kurus, there took place a severe drought. Stricken with hunger, the whole world of living creiures become greatly weak.

data.v: कस्मिंश्चिच्च पुरा यज्ञे याज्येन शिबिसूनुना । दक्षिणार्थेऽथ ऋत्विग्भ्यो दत्तः पुत्रो निजः किल ॥
data.md: At a sacrifice which had been performed formerly by Shibi's son, he had given away to the Ritviks a son of his as the sacrificial present.

data.v: तस्मिन्कालेऽथ सोऽल्पायुर्दिष्टान्तमगमत्प्रभो । ते तं क्षुधाभिसंतप्ताः परिवार्योपतस्थिरे ॥
data.md: About this time, longlived as the prince was, he died of starvation. The Rishis named, afflicted with hunger, approached the dead prince and sat encircling him.

data.v: याज्यात्मजमथो दृष्ट्वा गतासुमृषिसत्तमाः । अपचन्त तदा स्थाल्यां क्षुधार्ताः किल भारत ॥
निराद्ये मर्त्यलोकेऽस्मिन्नात्मानं ते परीप्सवः । कृच्छ्रामापेदिरे वृत्तिमन्नहेतोस्तपस्विनः ॥
अटमानोऽथ तान्मार्गे पचमानान्महीपतिः । राजा शैब्यो वृषादर्भिः क्लिश्यमानान्ददर्श ह ॥
प्रतिग्रहस्तारयति पुष्टिर्वै प्रतिगृह्णताम् । मयि यद्विद्यते वित्तं तच्छृणुध्वं तपोधनाः ॥
data.md: The acceptance of a gift will immediately relieve you all. Do you, therefore, accept a gift for the maintenance of your bodies! you ascetics having penances for wealth, listen to me as I declare what wealth I have.

data.v: प्रियो हि मे ब्राह्मणो याचमानो; दद्यामहं वोऽश्वतरीसहस्रम् । एकैकशः सवृषाः संप्रसूताः; सर्वेषां वै शीघ्रगाः श्वेतलोमाः ॥
data.md: That Brahmana who solicits me is ever dear to me. Indeed I shall give you a thousand kine of white hair, foremost in speed, each accompanied by a bull, and each having a wellborn calf, and, therefore, giving milk.

data.v: कुलंभराननडुहः शतंशता;न्धुर्याञ्शुभान्सर्वशोऽहं ददानि । पृथ्वीवाहान्पीवरांश्चैव ताव;दग्र्या गृष्ट्यो धेनवः सुव्रताश्च ॥
data.md: I shall also give you a thousand bulls of white colour and of the best species and capable of carrying heavy loads. I shall also give you a large number of kine, of good nature, the foremost of their kind, all fat, and each of which, having brought forth her first calf, is quick with her second.

data.v: वरान्ग्रामान्व्रीहियवं रसांश्च; रत्नं चान्यद्दुर्लभं किं ददानि । मा स्माभक्ष्ये भावमेवं कुरुध्वं; पुष्ट्यर्थं वै किं प्रयच्छाम्यहं वः ॥
data.md: The son of Vrishadarbha said Tell me what else I shall give of foremost villages, of grain, of barley, and of even the rarer and more precious jewels. Do not seek to eat this food that is inedible. Tell me what should I give you for the maintenance of your bodies.

data.v: राजन्प्रतिग्रहो राज्ञो मध्वास्वादो विषोपमः । तज्जानमानः कस्मात्त्वं कुरुषे नः प्रलोभनम् ॥
data.md: The Rishis said O king, to accept gifts from a monarch is very sweet at first but it is poison in the end. Knowing this well, why do you, O king, tempt us then with these offers?

data.v: क्षत्रं हि दैवतमिव ब्राह्मणं समुपाश्रितम् । अमलो ह्येष तपसा प्रीतः प्रीणाति देवताः ॥
data.md: The body of the Brahmana is the divine field. By penance, it is purified. Then again, by pleasing the Brahmana, one pleases the celestials.

data.v: अह्नापीह तपो जातु ब्राह्मणस्योपजायते । तद्दाव इव निर्दह्यात्प्राप्तो राजप्रतिग्रहः ॥
data.md: If a Brahmana accepts the gifts made to him by the king, he loses, by such acceptance, the merit that he would otherwise win by a his penances, they day. Indeed, such acceptance destroys that merit as a burning fire destroys a wilderness.

data.v: कुशलं सह दानेन राजन्नस्तु सदा तव । अर्थिभ्यो दीयतां सर्वमित्युक्त्वा ते ततो ययुः ॥
data.md: May you be happy, O king, as the result of the gifts you make to those who solicit you. Saying these words to them, they left that place, proceeding by another way,

data.v: अपक्वमेव तन्मांसमभूत्तेषां च धीमताम् । अथ हित्वा ययुः सर्वे वनमाहारकाङ्क्षिणः ॥
ततः प्रचोदिता राज्ञा वनं गत्वास्य मन्त्रिणः । प्रचीयोदुम्बराणि स्म दानं दातुं प्रचक्रमुः ॥
data.md: After this, urged by their master, the ministers of the king, entered those woods and plucking certain figs tried to give them away to those Rishis.

data.v: उदुम्बराण्यथान्यानि हेमगर्भाण्युपाहरन् । भृत्यास्तेषां ततस्तानि प्रग्राहितुमुपाद्रवन् ॥
data.md: The offers of king filled some of those figs with gold and mixing them with others tried to induce those ascetics to accept thein.

data.v: गुरूणीति विदित्वाथ न ग्राह्याण्यत्रिरब्रवीत् । न स्म हे मूढविज्ञाना न स्म हे मन्दबुद्धयः । हैमानीमानि जानीमः प्रतिबुद्धाः स्म जागृमः ॥
data.md: Atri took up some of those figs, and finding them heavy refused to take them. He said, We are not shorn of knowledge. We are not fools.

data.v: इह ह्येतदुपादत्तं प्रेत्य स्यात्कटुकोदयम् । अप्रतिग्राह्यमेवैतत्प्रेत्य चेह सुखेप्सुना ॥
data.md: We know that there is gold within these figs. We have our senses about us. Indeed, we are awake instead of being asleep. If accepted in this world, those will yield bitter results hereafter. He who seeks happiness both in this world and in the next, should never accept these.

data.v: शतेन निष्कं गणितं सहस्रेण च संमितम् । यथा बहु प्रतीच्छन्हि पापिष्ठां लभते गतिम् ॥
data.md: Vasishtha said If we accept even one gold coin, it will be counted as a hundred or even a thousand. If, therefor, we accept many coins, we shall surely attain to an unhappy end in the next world.

data.v: यत्पृथिव्यां व्रीहियवं हिरण्यं पशवः स्त्रियः । सर्वं तन्नालमेकस्य तस्माद्विद्वाञ्शमं व्रजेत् ॥
data.md: Kashyapa said All the paddy and barley on Earth, all the gold and animals and women that are in the world, are incapable of satisfying the desire of a single person. Hence, a wise man should, removing cupidity, adopt tranquillity.

data.v: उत्पन्नस्य रुरोः शृङ्गं वर्धमानस्य वर्धते । प्रार्थना पुरुषस्येव तस्य मात्रा न विद्यते ॥
data.md: Bharadvaja said The horns of a Ruru, when they first appear, begin to grow with the growth of the animal. The cupidity of man is like this. It has no limit.

data.v: न तल्लोके द्रव्यमस्ति यल्लोकं प्रतिपूरयेत् । समुद्रकल्पः पुरुषो न कदाचन पूर्यते ॥
data.md: Gautama said All the objects which exist in the world cannot satisfy even a single person. Man is like the ocean, for he can never be filled (i.e., satisfied)

data.v: कामं कामयमानस्य यदा कामः समृध्यते । अथैनमपरः कामस्तृष्णा विध्यति बाणवत् ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said When one desire cherished by a person becomes satisfied, there originates immediately another whose satisfaction sought and which pierces him like an arrow.

data.v: प्रतिग्रहे संयमो वै तपो धारयते ध्रुवम् । तद्धनं ब्राह्मणस्येह लुभ्यमानस्य विस्रवेत् ॥
data.md: Jamadagni said Abstention from accepting gifts supports penances as their root. Acceptance however, destroys that.

data.v: धर्मार्थं संचयो यो वै द्रव्याणां पक्षसंमतः । तपःसंचय एवेह विशिष्टो द्रव्यसंचयात् ॥
data.md: Arundhati said Some people hold that things of the world may be stored for spending them upon the acquisition of virtue. I think, however, that the acquisition of virtue is better than that of riches.

data.v: उग्रादितो भयाद्यस्माद्बिभ्यतीमे ममेश्वराः । बलीयांसो दुर्बलवद्बिभेम्यहमतः परम् ॥
data.md: Ganda said When these my lords, who are gifted with great energy, are so very much afraid of this when seems to be a great terror, weak as I am, I fear it the more.

data.v: यद्वै धर्मे परं नास्ति ब्राह्मणास्तद्धनं विदुः । विनयार्थं सुविद्वांसमुपासेयं यथातथम् ॥
data.md: Pashusakha said The value of virtue is very superior, There is nothing superior to it. That wealth is known to the Brahmanas. I wait upon them as their servant, only for learning to prize that wealth.

data.v: कुशलं सह दानाय तस्मै यस्य प्रजा इमाः । फलान्युपधियुक्तानि य एवं नः प्रयच्छसि ॥
data.md: The Rishis said May he be, as the result of the gifts he makes, who is king of the people of this land. Let his gift bear fruit who has sent these fruit s to us, enclosing gold within them.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा हेमगर्भाणि हित्वा तानि फलानि ते । ऋषयो जग्मुरन्यत्र सर्व एव धृतव्रताः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Having said these words, those Rishis of steadfast vows, abandoning the figs having gold within them, left that place and proceeded where they liked.

data.v: उपधिं शङ्कमानास्ते हित्वेमानि फलानि वै । ततोऽन्येनैव गच्छन्ति विदितं तेऽस्तु पार्थिव ॥
data.md: The ministers said O king, coming to know of the existence of gold within the figs, the Rishis have departed. Let this be known to you.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तु भृत्यैस्तैर्वृषादर्भिश्चुकोप ह । तेषां संप्रतिकर्तुं च सर्वेषामगमद्गृहम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed by his ministers, king Vrishadarbhi became stricken with anger against all those Rishis. Indeed, to take vengeance upon them, the king entered his own apartment.

data.v: स गत्वाहवनीयेऽग्नौ तीव्रं नियममास्थितः । जुहाव संस्कृतां मन्त्रैरेकैकामाहुतिं नृपः ॥
data.md: Practising the austerest of penances, he poured on his sacred fire libations of clarified butter, accompanying each with Mantras uttered by him.

data.v: तस्मादग्नेः समुत्तस्थौ कृत्या लोकभयंकरी । तस्या नाम वृषादर्भिर्यातुधानीत्यथाकरोत् ॥
data.md: From that fire there then originated, as the outcome of the incantation, a form capable of striking every one with fear. Vrishadarbhi named her as Yatudhani.

data.v: सा कृत्या कालरात्रीव कृताञ्जलिरुपस्थिता । वृषादर्भिं नरपतिं किं करोमीति चाब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: That form which had originated from the incantations of the king, loO king as dreadful as the Last Night, appeared with joined hands before the king. Addressing king Vrishadarbhi, she said, What shall I do?

data.v: ऋषीणां गच्छ सप्तानामरुन्धत्यास्तथैव च । दासीभर्तुश्च दास्याश्च मनसा नाम धारय ॥
data.md: Vrishadarbhi said Go and follow the seven Rishis, as also Arundhati, and the husband of their maidservant, and the maid-servant herself, and understand what the meanings are of their names.

data.v: ज्ञात्वा नामानि चैतेषां सर्वानेतान्विनाशय । विनष्टेषु यथा स्वैरं गच्छ यत्रेप्सितं तव ॥
data.md: Having learnt their names, do you kill all of them. After killing them you may go wherever you like.

data.v: सा तथेति प्रतिश्रुत्य यातुधानी स्वरूपिणी । जगाम तद्वनं यत्र विचेरुस्ते महर्षयः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Saying, So be it. The who had been named Yatudhani, in her proper form, went to that forest in which the great Rishis, travelled in search of food.

data.v: अथात्रिप्रमुखा राजन्वने तस्मिन्महर्षयः । व्यचरन्भक्षयन्तो वै मूलानि च फलानि च ॥
data.md: Indeed, O king, those great Rishis, with Atri among them, roamed within the forest, living upon fruits and roots.

data.v: अथापश्यन्सुपीनांसपाणिपादमुखोदरम् । परिव्रजन्तं स्थूलाङ्गं परिव्राजं शुनःसखम् ॥
data.md: In course of their travel they saw a mendicant of broad shoulders, and plump arms and legs and wellgrown face and abdomen. Of limbs that were all adipose, he was travelling with a dog in his company.

data.v: अरुन्धती तु तं दृष्ट्वा सर्वाङ्गोपचितं शुभा । भवितारो भवन्तो वै नैवमित्यब्रवीदृषीन् ॥
data.md: Seeing that mendicant whose limbs were all well-developed and beautiful, Arundhati exclaimed, addressing the Rishis, None of you will ever be able to show such wellgrown features.

data.v: नैतस्येह यथास्माकमग्निहोत्रमनिर्हुतम् । सायं प्रातश्च होतव्यं तेन पीवाञ्शुनःसखः ॥
data.md: Vashishtha said The sacred fire of this person is not like ours, for while he is able to pour libations on it, morning and evening, none of us can do the same. It is therefore that we see both him and his dog so well-formed.

data.v: नैतस्येह यथास्माकं क्षुधा वीर्यं समाहतम् । कृच्छ्राधीतं प्रनष्टं च तेन पीवाञ्शुनःसखः ॥
data.md: Atri said This man does not like us, feel the sufferings of hunger. His energy has not suffered, like ours, any decrease. Acquired with the greatest difficulty, his Vedas have not, like ours disappeared. Hence it is that we see both him and his dog so wellgrown.

data.v: नैतस्येह यथास्माकं शश्वच्छास्त्रं जरद्गवः । अलसः क्षुत्परो मूर्खस्तेन पीवाञ्शुनःसखः ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said This man is not, like us, unable to observe the eternal duties laid down in the scriptures, I have become idle. I fell the sufferings of hunger, I have lost the knowledge I had acquired. This man is not like us in this matter. Hence I see both him and his dog so wellgrown.

data.v: नैतस्येह यथास्माकं भक्तमिन्धनमेव च । संचिन्त्य वार्षिकं किंचित्तेन पीवाञ्शुनःसखः ॥
data.md: Jamadagni said This man has not to think of storing his annual grain and fuel as we are to do. Hence I see both him and his dog so well formed.

data.v: नैतस्येह यथास्माकं चत्वारश्च सहोदराः । देहि देहीति भिक्षन्ति तेन पीवाञ्शुनःसखः ॥
data.md: Kashyapa said This man has not, like us, four brothers of the same blood who are begging from house to house, uttering the words, GiveGive! Hence it is that i see him and his dog so wellgrown.

data.v: नैतस्येह यथास्माकं ब्रह्मबन्धोरचेतसः । शोको भार्यापवादेन तेन पीवाञ्शुनःसखः ॥
data.md: Bharadvaja said This man has no regret like ours for having condemned and cursed his wife. He has not acted so wickedly and foolishly. Hence I see both him and his dog so well formed.

data.v: नैतस्येह यथास्माकं त्रिकौशेयं हि राङ्कवम् । एकैकं वै त्रिवार्षीयं तेन पीवाञ्शुनःसखः ॥
data.md: Gautama said This man has not like us only three pieces of covering made of Kusha grass, and a single Ranku skin, each of which, again, is three years old. Hence it is that I see both him and his dog so well formed.

data.v: अथ दृष्ट्वा परिव्राट्स तान्महर्षीञ्शुनःसखः । अभिगम्य यथान्यायं पाणिस्पर्शमथाचरत् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Seeing those great Rishis, the wandering mendicant, approached them and accosted them all by touching their hand, according to the practice.

data.v: परिचर्यां वने तां तु क्षुत्प्रतीघातकारिकाम् । अन्योन्येन निवेद्याथ प्रातिष्ठन्त सहैव ते ॥
data.md: Conversing then with each other about the difficulty of getting sustenance in that forest and the consequent necessity of under going the pangs of hunger, all of them left that place.

data.v: एकनिश्चयकार्याश्च व्यचरन्त वनानि ते । आददानाः समुद्धृत्य मूलानि च फलानि च ॥
data.md: Indeed, they travelled through that forest, all bent upon a common object, viz., the plucking of fruits and the extraction of roots for maintenance.

data.v: कदाचिद्विचरन्तस्ते वृक्षैरविरलैर्वृताम् । शुचिवारिप्रसन्नोदां ददृशुः पद्मिनीं शुभाम् ॥
data.md: One day, as they were travelling, they saw a beautiful lake filled with lotuses. Its banks were covered with trees which stood thickly ncar one another. The waters of the lake were pure and transparent.

data.v: बालादित्यवपुःप्रख्यैः पुष्करैरुपशोभिताम् । वैदूर्यवर्णसदृशैः पद्मपत्रैरथावृताम् ॥
data.md: Indeed, the lotuses that adorned the lake were all of the colour of the rising sun. The leaves that floated on the water were of the colour of lapis lazuli.

data.v: नानाविधैश्च विहगैर्जलप्रकरसेविभिः । एकद्वारामनादेयां सूपतीर्थामकर्दमाम् ॥
data.md: Various kinds of aquatic fowls were sporting on its bosom. There was but one path leading to it. The banks were not covered with mire and the access to the water was easy.

data.v: वृषादर्भिप्रयुक्ता तु कृत्या विकृतदर्शना । यातुधानीति विख्याता पद्मिनीं तामरक्षत ॥
data.md: Urged by Vrishadarbhi, the Rakshasi of dreadful appearance who had originated from his incantations and who had been named Yatudhani, guarded the lake.

data.v: शुनःसखसहायास्तु बिसार्थं ते महर्षयः । पद्मिनीमभिजग्मुस्ते सर्वे कृत्याभिरक्षिताम् ॥
data.md: Those foremost Rishis, with Pashusakha in their company, went towards the lake, which was thus guarded by Yatudhani, for the object of collecting some lotusstalks.

data.v: ततस्ते यातुधानीं तां दृष्ट्वा विकृतदर्शनाम् । स्थितां कमलिनीतीरे कृत्यामूचुर्महर्षयः ॥
data.md: Seeing Yatudhani of fearful aspect standing on the banks of the lake, those great Rishis addressed her, saying Who are you who thus stand alone in this solitary forest? For whom do you wait here? What indeed, is your purpose? What do you do here on the banks of this lake adorned with lotuses?

data.v: एका तिष्ठसि का नु त्वं कस्यार्थे किं प्रयोजनम् । पद्मिनीतीरमाश्रित्य ब्रूहि त्वं किं चिकीर्षसि ॥
data.md: Seeing Yatudhani of fearful aspect standing on the banks of the lake, those great Rishis addressed her, saying Who are you who thus stand alone in this solitary forest? For whom do you wait here? What indeed, is your purpose? What do you do here on the banks of this lake adorned with lotuses?

data.v: यास्मि सास्म्यनुयोगो मे न कर्तव्यः कथंचन । आरक्षिणीं मां पद्मिन्या वित्त सर्वे तपोधनाः ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said It matters not who I am. I deserve not to be accosted. You having ascetic wealth, know that I am the guard set to watch this lake.

data.v: सर्व एव क्षुधार्ताः स्म न चान्यत्किंचिदस्ति नः । भवत्याः संमते सर्वे गृह्णीमहि बिसान्युत ॥
data.md: The Rishis said All of us are hungry. We have nothing else to eat. With your permission we would collect some lotusstalks.

data.v: समयेन बिसानीतो गृह्णीध्वं कामकारतः । एकैको नाम मे प्रोक्त्वा ततो गृह्णीत माचिरम् ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said According to agreement, do you take he lotusstalks as you please. You must, one by one, give me your names. You may then, without delay, take the stalks!

data.v: विज्ञाय यातुधानीं तां कृत्यामृषिवधैषिणीम् । अत्रिः क्षुधापरीतात्मा ततो वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Ascertaining that her name was Yatudhani and that she stood there for killing thein, Atri, who was famishing with hunger, addressed her and said those words.

data.v: अरात्रिरत्रेः सा रात्रिर्यां नाधीते त्रिरद्य वै । अरात्रिरत्रिरित्येव नाम मे विद्धि शोभने ॥
data.md: Atri said I am called Atri because I purify the world from sin. For, again, thrice studying the Vedas every day, I have made days of may nights. That, again, is no night in which I have not studied the Vedas. Therefore also I am called Atri, O beautiful lady!

data.v: यथोदाहृतमेतत्ते मयि नाम महामुने । दुर्धार्यमेतन्मनसा गच्छावतर पद्मिनीम् ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said O you of great effulgence, the explanation you have given me of your name is incapable of being understood by me. Do you, therefore, go and plunge into this tank filled with lotuses.

data.v: वसिष्ठोऽस्मि वरिष्ठोऽस्मि वसे वासं गृहेष्वपि । वरिष्ठत्वाच्च वासाच्च वसिष्ठ इति विद्धि माम् ॥
data.md: Vasishtha said I am gifted with Yoga powers, I live again, as a householder, and am considered as the foremost of all persons that lead such a mode of life. On account of my being gifted with (such) powers, of my having as a householder, and of my being considered, as the foremost of all householders, I am called Vasishtha.

data.v: नामनैरुक्तमेतत्ते दुःखव्याभाषिताक्षरम् । नैतद्धारयितुं शक्यं गच्छावतर पद्मिनीम् ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said The explanation you have given of your name is what I cannot understand, on account of the inflections which the roots have undergone. Go and plunge into this lake of lotuses.

data.v: कुलं कुलं च कुपपः कुपयः कश्यपो द्विजः । काश्यः काशनिकाशत्वादेतन्मे नाम धारय ॥
data.md: Kashyapa said I always protect my body, and on account of my penances I have become gifted with effulgence. For thus protecting the body and for this effulgence that is due to my penances, I pass by the name of Kashyapa.

data.v: यथोदाहृतमेतत्ते मयि नाम महामुने । दुर्धार्यमेतन्मनसा गच्छावतर पद्मिनीम् ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said O you of great effulgence, the explanation you have given me of your name is incapable of being understood by me. Do you, therefore, go and plunge into this tank filled with lotuses.

data.v: भरे सुतान्भरे शिष्यान्भरे देवान्भरे द्विजान् । भरे भार्यामनव्याजो भरद्वाजोऽस्मि शोभने ॥
data.md: Bharadvaja said I always support my sons, my disciples, the celestials, the Brahmanas, and my wife. On account of my thus supporting all with ease, I pass by the name of Bharadvaja.

data.v: नामनैरुक्तमेतत्ते दुःखव्याभाषिताक्षरम् । नैतद्धारयितुं शक्यं गच्छावतर पद्मिनीम् ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said The explanation you have given of your name is what I cannot understand, on account of the inflections which the roots have undergone. Go and plunge into this lake of lotuses.

data.v: गोदमो दमगोऽधूमो दमो दुर्दर्शनश्च ते । विद्धि मां गौतमं कृत्ये यातुधानि निबोध मे ॥
data.md: Gautama said I have conquered Heaven and Earth by the help of selfcontrol. For my considering all creatures and objects impartially, I am like a smokeless fire. Hence I am incapable of being subjugated by you. When, again, I was born, the effulgence of my body removed the surrounding darkness. For these reasons I am called Gautama.

data.v: यथोदाहृतमेतत्ते मयि नाम महामुने । नैतद्धारयितुं शक्यं गच्छावतर पद्मिनीम् ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said O you of great effulgence, the explanation you have given me of your name is incapable of being understood by me. Do you, therefore, go and plunge into this tank filled with lotuses.

data.v: विश्वेदेवाश्च मे मित्रं मित्रमस्मि गवां तथा । विश्वामित्रमिति ख्यातं यातुधानि निबोध मे ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said The celestials of the universe are my friends. I am also the friend of the universe. Hence, O Yatudhani, I am called Vishvamitra.

data.v: नामनैरुक्तमेतत्ते दुःखव्याभाषिताक्षरम् । नैतद्धारयितुं शक्यं गच्छावतर पद्मिनीम् ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said The explanation you have given of your name is what I cannot understand, on account of the inflections which the roots have undergone. Go and plunge into this lake of lotuses.

data.v: जाजमद्यजजा नाम मृजा माह जिजायिषे । जमदग्निरिति ख्यातमतो मां विद्धि शोभने ॥
data.md: Jamadagni said I have originated from the sacrificial fire of the celestials. Hence am I called Jamadagni, O you of beautiful features.

data.v: यथोदाहृतमेतत्ते मयि नाम महामुने । नैतद्धारयितुं शक्यं गच्छावतर पद्मिनीम् ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said O you of great effulgence, the explanation you have given me of your name is incapable of being understood by me. Do you, therefore, go and plunge into this tank filled with lotuses.

data.v: धरां धरित्रीं वसुधां भर्तुस्तिष्ठाम्यनन्तरम् । मनोऽनुरुन्धती भर्तुरिति मां विद्ध्यरुन्धतीम् ॥
data.md: Arundhati said I always live by the side of my husband, and hold the Earth jointly with him. I always incline my husband's heart towards me. I am, therefore, called Arundhati.

data.v: नामनैरुक्तमेतत्ते दुःखव्याभाषिताक्षरम् । नैतद्धारयितुं शक्यं गच्छावतर पद्मिनीम् ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said The explanation you have given of your name is what I cannot understand, on account of the inflections which the roots have undergone. Go and plunge into this lake of lotuses.

data.v: गण्डं गण्डं गतवती गण्डगण्डेति संज्ञिता । गण्डगण्डेव गण्डेति विद्धि मानलसंभवे ॥
नामनैरुक्तमेतत्ते दुःखव्याभाषिताक्षरम् । नैतद्धारयितुं शक्यं गच्छावतर पद्मिनीम् ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said The explanation you have given of your name is what I cannot understand, on account of the inflections which the roots have undergone. Go and plunge into this lake of lotuses.

data.v: सखा सखे यः सख्येयः पशूनां च सखा सदा । गौणं पशुसखेत्येवं विद्धि मामग्निसंभवे ॥
data.md: Pashusakha said I protect and tend all animals I see, and I am always a friend to all animals. Hence am I called Pashusakha, O you who have originated from the (sacrificial) fire (of king Vrishadarbhi).

data.v: नामनैरुक्तमेतत्ते दुःखव्याभाषिताक्षरम् । नैतद्धारयितुं शक्यं गच्छावतर पद्मिनीम् ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said The explanation you have given of your name is what I cannot understand, on account of the inflections which the roots have undergone. Go and plunge into this lake of lotuses.

data.v: एभिरुक्तं यथा नाम नाहं वक्तुमिहोत्सहे । शुनःसखसखायं मां यातुधान्युपधारय ॥
data.md: Shunasakha said I cannot explain the etymology of my name like these ascetics. But know, O Yatudhani, that I am called by the name of Shunasakha.

data.v: नाम तेऽव्यक्तमुक्तं वै वाक्यं संदिग्धया गिरा । तस्मात्सकृदिदानीं त्वं ब्रूहि यन्नाम ते द्विज ॥
data.md: Yatudhani said You have mentioned your name only once. I have not been able to understand the explanation you have given, do you, therefore, mention it again, O twiceborn one.

data.v: सकृदुक्तं मया नाम न गृहीतं यदा त्वया । तस्मात्त्रिदण्डाभिहता गच्छ भस्मेति माचिरम् ॥
data.md: Shunasakha said Since you have not been able to catch my name on account of my having mentioned it only once, I shall strike you with my triple stick! Struck with it, be you reduced forthwith into ashes.

data.v: सा ब्रह्मदण्डकल्पेन तेन मूर्ध्नि हता तदा । कृत्या पपात मेदिन्यां भस्मसाच्च जगाम ह ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Struck then, on the head, by the Sannyasin, with his triple stick which resembled the punishment inflicted by a Brahmana, the Rakshasi who had originated from the incantations of king Vrishadarbhi dropped down on the Earth and becoine reduced to ashes.

data.v: शुनःसखश्च हत्वा तां यातुधानीं महाबलाम् । भुवि त्रिदण्डं विष्टभ्य शाद्वले समुपाविशत् ॥
data.md: Having thus killed the powerful Rakshasi, Shunasakha thrust his stick into the earth and sat himself down on a grassy plot of land.

data.v: ततस्ते मुनयः सर्वे पुष्कराणि बिसानि च । यथाकाममुपादाय समुत्तस्थुर्मुदान्विताः ॥
data.md: The Rishis then, having, as they liked, plucked a number of lotuses and taken up a number of lotusstalks, came up from the lake filled with joy.

data.v: श्रमेण महता युक्तास्ते बिसानि कलापशः । तीरे निक्षिप्य पद्मिन्यास्तर्पणं चक्रुरम्भसा ॥
data.md: Throwing on the ground the mass of lotuses which they had collected with great labour, they plunged once more into it for offering oblations of water to the departed Manes.

data.v: अथोत्थाय जलात्तस्मात्सर्वे ते वै समागमन् । नापश्यंश्चापि ते तानि बिसानि पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: Coming up, they went to that side of the bank where they had placed the lotusstalks. Reaching that place, those foremost of men found that the stalks were nowhere to be seen.

data.v: केन क्षुधाभिभूतानामस्माकं पापकर्मणा । नृशंसेनापनीतानि बिसान्याहारकाङ्क्षिणाम् ॥
data.md: The Rishis said What sinful and cruel men has stolen away the lotusstalks collected by our hungry selves from desire of eating.

data.v: ते शङ्कमानास्त्वन्योन्यं पप्रच्छुर्द्विजसत्तमाः । त ऊचुः शपथं सर्वे कुर्म इत्यरिकर्शन ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Those foremost of twiceborn persons, suspecting one another, o destroyer of enemies, said We shall each have to swear to our innocence.

data.v: त उक्त्वा बाढमित्येव सर्व एव शुनःसखम् । क्षुधार्ताः सुपरिश्रान्ताः शपथायोपचक्रमुः ॥
data.md: All those ascetics then, exhausted with hunger and exertion, agreeing to the proposal, took these oaths,

data.v: स गां स्पृशतु पादेन सूर्यं च प्रतिमेहतु । अनध्यायेष्वधीयीत बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
data.md: Atri said a Let him who has stolen the lotus stalks touch kine with his foot, pass urine facing the sun, and study the Vedas on excluded days.

data.v: अनध्यायपरो लोके शुनः स परिकर्षतु । परिव्राट्कामवृत्तोऽस्तु बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
शरणागतं हन्तु मित्रं स्वसुतां चोपजीवतु । अर्थान्काङ्क्षतु कीनाशाद्बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
सर्वत्र सर्वं पणतु न्यासलोपं करोतु च । कूटसाक्षित्वमभ्येतु बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
data.md: Kashyapa said Let him who has stolen the lotusstalks give vent to all sorts of words in all places, give false evidence in a court of law, eat the flesh of animals not killed in sacrifices, make gifts to unworthy persons or to worthy persons at unseasonable times, and have sexual connection with women during daytime.

data.v: वृथामांसं समश्नातु वृथादानं करोतु च । यातु स्त्रियं दिवा चैव बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
नृशंसस्त्यक्तधर्मास्तु स्त्रीषु ज्ञातिषु गोषु च । ब्राह्मणं चापि जयतां बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
data.md: Bharadvaja said Let him who has stolen the lotusstalks be cruel and sinful in his conduct towards women and kinsmen and kine, Let him humiliate Brahmanas, in disputations, by showing his superior knowledge and skill. Let him study the Richs and the Yajushes, disregarding his preceptor. Let him pour libations upon fires made with dry grass or straw.

data.v: उपाध्यायमधः कृत्वा ऋचोऽध्येतु यजूंषि च । जुहोतु च स कक्षाग्नौ बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
पुरीषमुत्सृजत्वप्सु हन्तु गां चापि दोहिनीम् । अनृतौ मैथुनं यातु बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
द्वेष्यो भार्योपजीवी स्याद्दूरबन्धुश्च वैरवान् । अन्योन्यस्यातिथिश्चास्तु बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
data.md: Jamadagni said Let him who has stolen the lotusstalks be guilty of throwing filth and dirt on water. Let him be filled with enmity towards kine. Let him be guilty of having sexual union with women at times other than their season. Let him incur the hatred of all persons. Let him gain the living from the earnings of his wife. Let him have no friends and let him have many enemies. Let him be another's guest for getting in return those acts of hospitality which he has done to that other.

data.v: अधीत्य वेदांस्त्यजतु त्रीनग्नीनपविध्यतु । विक्रीणातु तथा सोमं बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
data.md: Gautama said Let him who has stolen the lotusstalks be guilty of throwing away the Vedas after having read them. Let him renounce the three sacred fires. Let him be a seller of the Soma (plant or juice). Let him live with that Brahmana who lives in a village which has only one well from which water is drawn by all classes and who has married a Shudra woman.

data.v: उदपानप्लवे ग्रामे ब्राह्मणो वृषलीपतिः । तस्य सालोक्यतां यातु बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
data.md: Dilipa said Let him who has stolen your stalks attain to those regions of misery an infamy which are reserved for that Brahmana who lives in a village having but one well and who knows a Shudra woman.

data.v: जीवतो वै गुरून्भृत्यान्भरन्त्वस्य परे जनाः । अगतिर्बहुपुत्रः स्याद्बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said Let him who has stolen the lotus stalks be doomed to see his preceptors and seniors and his servants maintained by others during his own lifetime. Let him not have a good end. Let him be the father of many children.

data.v: अशुचिर्ब्रह्मकूटोऽस्तु ऋद्ध्या चैवाप्यहंकृतः । कर्षको मत्सरी चास्तु बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
data.md: Let him be always impure and wretch among Brahmanas. Let him be proud of his riches. Let him be a tiller of the soil and let him be filled with malice.

data.v: वर्षान्करोतु भृतको राज्ञश्चास्तु पुरोहितः । अयाज्यस्य भवेदृत्विग्बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
data.md: Let him wander in the rainy season. Let him be a paid servant. Let him be the priest of the king. Let him assist at the sacrifices of such impure persons who are not worthy of being assisted at their sacrifices.

data.v: नित्यं परिवदेच्छ्वश्रूं भर्तुर्भवतु दुर्मनाः । एका स्वादु समश्नातु बिसस्तैन्यं करोति या ॥
data.md: Arundhati said Let her who has stolen the lotusstalks always humiliate her motherinlaw. Let her be always vexed with her husband. Let her eat whatever good things come to her house without giving a part to others.

data.v: ज्ञातीनां गृहमध्यस्था सक्तूनत्तु दिनक्षये । अभाग्यावीरसूरस्तु बिसस्तैन्यं करोति या ॥
data.md: Disregarding the kinsmen of her husband, let her live in her husband's house and eat, every evening, the flour of fried barley! Let her come to be considered as unenjoyable. Let her be the mother of a heroic son.

data.v: अनृतं भाषतु सदा साधुभिश्च विरुध्यतु । ददातु कन्यां शुल्केन बिसस्तैन्यं करोति या ॥
data.md: Ganda said Let her who has stolen the lotusstalks be always a speaker of untruth. Let her always fall out with her kinsmen! Let her give away her daughter in marriage for money.

data.v: साधयित्वा स्वयं प्राशेद्दास्ये जीवतु चैव ह । विकर्मणा प्रमीयेत बिसस्तैन्यं करोति या ॥
data.md: Let her cat the food which she has cooked, alone and without giving a part it to of anybody! Let her pass her whole life as a slave. Indeed, let her who has stolen the lotusstalks be quick with child on account of sexual union under circumstances of guilt.

data.v: दास्य एव प्रजायेत सोऽप्रसूतिरकिंचनः । दैवतेष्वनमस्कारो बिसस्तैन्यं करोति यः ॥
data.md: Pashusakha said Let him who has stolen the lotusstalks be born of a slavemother. Let him who have many unworthy children. And let him never bow to the celestials.

data.v: अध्वर्यवे दुहितरं ददातु; च्छन्दोगे वा चरितब्रह्मचर्ये । आथर्वणं वेदमधीत्य विप्रः; स्नायीत यो वै हरते बिसानि ॥
data.md: Shunasa kha said Let him who has removed the lotusstalks acquire the merit of bestowing his daughter in marriage upon a Brahmana who has studied all the Samans and the Yajushes and who has carefully observed the vow of celibacy. Let him perform the final ablutions after having read all the Atharvans!

data.v: इष्टमेतद्द्विजातीनां योऽयं ते शपथः कृतः । त्वया कृतं बिसस्तैन्यं सर्वेषां नः शुनःसख ॥
data.md: All the Rishis said The oath you have taken is no oath at all, for all the deeds which you have mentioned are very desirable for the Brahmanas! It is evident, Shunasakha, that you have appropriated our lotusstalks.

data.v: न्यस्तमाद्यमपश्यद्भिर्यदुक्तं कृतकर्मभिः । सत्यमेतन्न मिथ्यैतद्बिसस्तैन्यं कृतं मया ॥
data.md: Shunasakha said Not seeing the lotusstalks deposited by you, what you say is indeed true, for it is I who have actually stolen them.

data.v: मया ह्यन्तर्हितानीह बिसानीमानि पश्यत । परीक्षार्थं भगवतां कृतमेतन्मयानघाः । रक्षणार्थं च सर्वेषां भवतामहमागतः ॥
data.md: Before you all I have made those stalks disappear. You sinless ones, the act was done by me for testing you.

data.v: यातुधानी ह्यतिक्रुद्धा कृत्यैषा वो वधैषिणी । वृषादर्भिप्रयुक्तैषा निहता मे तपोधनाः ॥
दुष्टा हिंस्यादियं पापा युष्मान्प्रत्यग्निसंभवा । तस्मादस्म्यागतो विप्रा वासवं मां निबोधत ॥
अलोभादक्षया लोकाः प्राप्ता वः सार्वकामिकाः । उत्तिष्ठध्वमितः क्षिप्रं तानवाप्नुत वै द्विजाः ॥
data.md: It was for killing her and saving you that I came here, O you learned Brahmanas. Know that I am Vasava! you have entirely got rid of the influence of cupidity. On account of this, you have acquired many eternal regions fraught with the fruition of every desire as soon as it rises in the heart! Do you rise, forth with from this place and go to those regions of beatitude, O twiceborn ones, that are reserved for you.

data.v: ततो महर्षयः प्रीतास्तथेत्युक्त्वा पुरंदरम् । सहैव त्रिदशेन्द्रेण सर्वे जग्मुस्त्रिविष्टपम् ॥
एवमेते महात्मानो भोगैर्बहुविधैरपि । क्षुधा परमया युक्ताश्छन्द्यमाना महात्मभिः । नैव लोभं तदा चक्रुस्ततः स्वर्गमवाप्नुवन् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The great Rishis, highly pleased at this, replied to Purandara, saying, So be it! They then ascended to the celestial region the company of Indra himself. Even this, those high souled Rishis giving up all foods and other desirable articles as they are not touched with greed and they obtained the abode of heaven.

data.v: तस्मात्सर्वास्ववस्थासु नरो लोभं विवर्जयेत् । एष धर्मः परो राजन्नलोभ इति विश्रुतः ॥
इदं नरः सच्चरितं समवायेषु कीर्तयेत् । सुखभागी च भवति न च दुर्गाण्यवाप्नुते ॥
प्रीयन्ते पितरश्चास्य ऋषयो देवतास्तथा । यशोधर्मार्थभागी च भवति प्रेत्य मानवः ॥
अत्रैवोदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । यद्वृत्तं तीर्थयात्रायां शपथं प्रति तच्छृणु ॥
data.md: Bhishina said Regarding it is cited the old history of the oaths on the occasion of a sojourn to the sacred waters.

data.v: पुष्करार्थं कृतं स्तैन्यं पुरा भरतसत्तम । राजर्षिभिर्महाराज तथैव च द्विजर्षिभिः ॥
data.md: O best of the Bharatas, the act of theft had been committed by Indra, and the oaths were taken by many royal and twiceborn Rishis.

data.v: ऋषयः समेताः पश्चिमे वै प्रभासे; समागता मन्त्रममन्त्रयन्त । चराम सर्वे पृथिवीं पुण्यतीर्थां; तन्नः कार्यं हन्त गच्छाम सर्वे ॥
data.md: Once upon a time, the Rishis, having assembled together, proceeded to the western Prabhasa. They held a consultation there which resulted in a determination on their part to sojourn to all sacred waters on Earth.

data.v: शुक्रोऽङ्गिराश्चैव कविश्च विद्वां;स्तथागस्त्यो नारदपर्वतौ च । भृगुर्वसिष्ठः कश्यपो गौतमश्च; विश्वामित्रो जमदग्निश्च राजन् ॥
data.md: There were Shakra, Angirasa the highly learned Kavi, Agastya, Narada and Parvata; and Bhrigu and Vasishtha and Kashyapa and Gautama and Vishvamitra and Jamadagni, O king.

data.v: ऋषिस्तथा गालवोऽथाष्टकश्च; भरद्वाजोऽरुन्धती वालखिल्याः । शिबिर्दिलीपो नहुषोऽम्बरीषो; राजा ययातिर्धुन्धुमारोऽथ पूरुः ॥
data.md: There were also the Rishi Galava, and Ashtaka and Bharadvaja and Arundhati and the Valakhilyas, and Shibi and Dilipa and Nahusha and Ambarisha and the royal Yayati and Dhundhumara and Puru.

data.v: जग्मुः पुरस्कृत्य महानुभावं; शतक्रतुं वृत्रहणं नरेन्द्र । तीर्थानि सर्वाणि परिक्रमन्तो; माघ्यां ययुः कौशिकीं पुण्यतीर्थाम् ॥
data.md: These foremost of men, headed the great performer of hundred sacrifices, the slayer of Vritra, sojourned to all the sacred waters one after another, and at last reached the highly sacred Kaushiki on the day of the full moon in the month of Magha.

data.v: सर्वेषु तीर्थेष्वथ धूतपापा; जग्मुस्ततो ब्रह्मसरः सुपुण्यम् । देवस्य तीर्थे जलमग्निकल्पा; विगाह्य ते भुक्तबिसप्रसूनाः ॥
data.md: Having purified themselves of all sins by ablutions performed in all the sacred waters, they at last proceeded to the very sacred Brahmasara. Bathing in that lake, those Rishis gifted with fiery energy began to gather and eat the stalks of the lotus.

data.v: केचिद्बिसान्यखनंस्तत्र राज;न्नन्ये मृणालान्यखनंस्तत्र विप्राः । अथापश्यन्पुष्करं ते ह्रियन्तं; ह्रदादगस्त्येन समुद्धृतं वै ॥
data.md: Amongst those Brahmanas, some had extracted the stalks of the louts and some the stalks of the Nymphoca stellata. Soon they found that the stalks extracted by Agastya had been taken away by somebody.

data.v: तानाह सर्वानृषिमुख्यानगस्त्यः; केनादत्तं पुष्करं मे सुजातम् । युष्माञ्शङ्के दीयतां पुष्करं मे; न वै भवन्तो हर्तुमर्हन्ति पद्मम् ॥
data.md: The foremost of Rishis, Agastya, addressing them all, said, Who has taken away good stalks which I had extracted and deposited here? I suspect some one amongst you must have taken them. Let him who has taken them away return them to me. You should not thus misappropriate my stalks.

data.v: शृणोमि कालो हिंसते धर्मवीर्यं; सेयं प्राप्ता वर्धते धर्मपीडा । पुराधर्मो वर्धते नेह याव;त्तावद्गच्छामि परलोकं चिराय ॥
data.md: It is heard that Time attacks the energy of virtue. That Time has come upon us. Hence, virtue is afflicted. It is proper that I should go to Heaven for good, before sin assails the world and establishes itself fully here.

data.v: पुरा वेदान्ब्राह्मणा ग्राममध्ये; घुष्टस्वरा वृषलाञ्श्रावयन्ति । पुरा राजा व्यवहारानधर्म्या;न्पश्यत्यहं परलोकं व्रजामि ॥
data.md: Before the time comes when Brahmanas, loudly uttering the Vedas, within the precincts of villages and inhabited places, cause the Shudras hear them, before the time comes when kings offered against the rules of virtue from motives of policy, I shall go to the celestial region for good.

data.v: पुरावरान्प्रत्यवरान्गरीयसो; यावन्नरा नावमंस्यन्ति सर्वे । तमोत्तरं यावदिदं न वर्तते; तावद्व्रजामि परलोकं चिराय ॥
data.md: Before men cease to regard the distinctions between the lower, the middle, and the higher classes, I shall go to the celestial region for good. Before Ignorance attacks the world and covers all things in darkness, I shall go to the celestial region for good.

data.v: पुरा प्रपश्यामि परेण मर्त्या;न्बलीयसा दुर्बलान्भुज्यमानान् । तस्माद्यास्यामि परलोकं चिराय; न ह्युत्सहे द्रष्टुमीदृङ्नृलोके ॥
data.md: Before the time comes when the strong begin to oppress the weak and treat them as slaves, I shall go to the celestial region for ever. Indeed, I dare not remain on Earth for seeing these things.

data.v: तमाहुरार्ता ऋषयो महर्षिं; न ते वयं पुष्करं चोरयामः । मिथ्याभिषङ्गो भवता न कार्यः; शपाम तीक्ष्णाञ्शपथान्महर्षे ॥
data.md: The Rishis, much concerned at what he said, addressed that great ascetic and said-We have not stolen your stalks! You should not cherish these suspicions against us, O great Rishi, we shall take the most dreadful oaths.

data.v: ते निश्चितास्तत्र महर्षयस्तु; संमन्यन्तो धर्ममेवं नरेन्द्र । ततोऽशपञ्शपथान्पर्ययेण; सहैव ते पार्थिव पुत्रपौत्रैः ॥
data.md: Having said these words, conscious as they were of their own innocence, and desirous of upholding the cause of virtue, those Rishis and royal sages then began to swear, one after another, the following oaths.

data.v: प्रत्याक्रोशेदिहाक्रुष्टस्ताडितः प्रतिताडयेत् । खादेच्च पृष्ठमांसानि यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Bhrigu said Let him who has stolen your stalks censure when censured, assail when assail, and eat the flesh that is attached to the backbone of animals.

data.v: अस्वाध्यायपरो लोके श्वानं च परिकर्षतु । पुरे च भिक्षुर्भवतु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Vasishtha said Let him who has stolen your stalks neglect his Vedic studies, leash hounds, and having taken himself to the mendicani order live in a city or town.

data.v: सर्वत्र सर्वं पणतु न्यासे लोभं करोतु च । कूटसाक्षित्वमभ्येतु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Kashyapa said Let him who has stolen your stalks sell all things in all places, misappropriate trusts, and give false evidence!

data.v: जीवत्वहंकृतो बुद्ध्या विपणत्वधमेन सः । कर्षको मत्सरी चास्तु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Gautama said Let him who has stolen your stalks live, all things, with an understanding that does not see all creatures with an equal eye, and always giving way to the influence of desire and anger. Let him be a cultivator of the soil, and let him be moved by malice.

data.v: अशुचिर्ब्रह्मकूटोऽस्तु श्वानं च परिकर्षतु । ब्रह्महानिकृतिश्चास्तु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Angirasa said Let him who has stolen your stalks be always impure! Let him be a censurable Brahmana. Let him leash hounds. Let him be guilty of Brahmanicide. Let him be averse to expiations after having committed sin.

data.v: अकृतज्ञोऽस्तु मित्राणां शूद्रायां तु प्रजायतु । एकः संपन्नमश्नातु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Dhundhumara said Let him who has stolen your stalks be ungrateful to his friends! Let him take birth in a Shudra woman! Let him eat alone any good food.

data.v: चिकित्सायां प्रचरतु भार्यया चैव पुष्यतु । श्वशुरात्तस्य वृत्तिः स्याद्यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Puru said Let him who has stolen your stalks practise as a physician! Let him be supported by the earnings of his wife! Let him draw his maintenance from his fatherinlaw!

data.v: उदपानप्लवे ग्रामे ब्राह्मणो वृषलीपतिः । तस्य लोकान्स व्रजतु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Dilipa said Let him who has stolen your stalks attain to those regions of misery an infamy which are reserved for that Brahmana who lives in a village having but one well and who knows a Shudra woman.

data.v: पृष्ठमांसं समश्नातु दिवा गच्छतु मैथुनम् । प्रेष्यो भवतु राज्ञश्च यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Shukra said Let him who has stolen your stalks eat the flesh of animals not killed in sacrifices! Let him have sexual union at daytime! Let him be a servant of the king.

data.v: अनध्यायेष्वधीयीत मित्रं श्राद्धे च भोजयेत् । श्राद्धे शूद्रस्य चाश्नीयाद्यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Jamadagni said Let him who has stolen your stalks study the Vedas of forbidden days or occasions. Let him feed friends at Shraddhas performed by him! Let him eat at the Shraddha of a Shudra.

data.v: अनाहिताग्निर्म्रियतां यज्ञे विघ्नं करोतु च । तपस्विभिर्विरुध्येत यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Shibi said Let him who has stolen you stalks die without having established a fire (for daily worship)! Let him be guilty of obstructing the celebration of sacrifices by others! Let him fall out with those who practise penances!

data.v: अनृतौ जटी व्रतिन्यां वै भार्यायां संप्रजायतु । निराकरोतु वेदांश्च यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Yayati said Let him who has stolen your stalks be guilty of having sexual union with his wife when she is not in her season and when he is himself in the observance of a vow and bears matted locks on his head! Let him also disregard the Vedas!

data.v: अतिथिं गृहस्थो नुदतु कामवृत्तोऽस्तु दीक्षितः । विद्यां प्रयच्छतु भृतो यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Nahusha said Let him who has stolen your stalks live in domesticity after having betaken himself to the vow of mendicancy! Let him act in whatever way he pleases, after having performed the initiatory rites in view of a sacrifice or some solemn observance! Let him take pecuniary satisfaction for teaching his disciples.

data.v: नृशंसस्त्यक्तधर्मोऽस्तु स्त्रीषु ज्ञातिषु गोषु च । ब्राह्मणं चापि जहतु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Ambarisha said Let him who has stolen your stalks be cruel and sinful in his conduct towards women and kinsmen and kine! Let him be guilty also of Brahmanicide!

data.v: गूढोऽज्ञानी बहिः शास्त्रं पठतां विस्वरं पदम् । गरीयसोऽवजानातु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Narada said Let him who has stolen your stalks be one who identifies the body with the soul! Let him study the scriptures with an unworthy preceptor. Let him chaunt the Vedas, violating at each step the rules of orthoepy! Let him disregard all his elders.

data.v: अनृतं भाषतु सदा सद्भिश्चैव विरुध्यतु । शुल्केन कन्यां ददतु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Nabhaga said Let him who has stolen your stalks always speak untruth and quarrel with those who are pious. Let him bestow his daughter in marriage after accepting a pecuniary satisfaction offered by his soninlaw.

data.v: पदा स गां ताडयतु सूर्यं च प्रति मेहतु । शरणागतं च त्यजतु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Kavi said Let him who has stolen your stalks be guilty of striking a cow with his foot. Let him pass urine, facing the sun! Let him renounce the person who seeks shelter at his hands.

data.v: करोतु भृतकोऽवर्षां राज्ञश्चास्तु पुरोहितः । ऋत्विगस्तु ह्ययाज्यस्य यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra said Let him who has stolen your stalks become a servant who acts deceitfully towards his master! Let him be the priest of a king! Let him officiate as the sacrificial priest of one who should not be assisted at his sacrifices!

data.v: ग्रामे चाधिकृतः सोऽस्तु खरयानेन गच्छतु । शुनः कर्षतु वृत्त्यर्थे यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Parvata said Let him who has stolen your stalks be the head of a village. Let him make journeys on asses. Let him leash hounds for maintenance.

data.v: सर्वपापसमादानं नृशंसे चानृते च यत् । तत्तस्यास्तु सदा पापं यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Bharadvaja said Let him who has stolen your stalks be guilty of all the transgressions of him who is cruel in conduct and untruthful in speech.

data.v: स राजास्त्वकृतप्रज्ञः कामवृत्तिश्च पापकृत् । अधर्मेणानुशास्तूर्वीं यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Ashtaka said Let him who has stolen your stalks be a king shorn of wisdom, capricious and sinful in his conduct, and disposed to rule the Earth impiously.

data.v: पापिष्ठेभ्यस्त्वनर्घार्हः स नरोऽस्तु स्वपापकृत् । दत्त्वा दानं कीर्तयतु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Galava said Let him who has stolen your stalks be more infamous than a sinful man. Let him be sinful in his deeds towards his kinsmen and relatives. Let him proclaim the gifts he makes to others.

data.v: श्वश्र्वापवादं वदतु भर्तुर्भवतु दुर्मनाः । एका स्वादु समश्नातु या ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Arundhati said Let her who has stolen your stalks speak ill of her motherinlaw. Let her dislike her husband. Let her eat alone any good food that comes to her house.

data.v: एकपादेन वृत्त्यर्थं ग्रामद्वारे स तिष्ठतु । धर्मज्ञस्त्यक्तधर्मोऽस्तु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: The Balakhilyas said Let him who has stolen your stalks stand on one foot at the entrance of a village. Let him, while knowing all duties, be guilty of every transgression.

data.v: अग्निहोत्रमनादृत्य सुखं स्वपतु स द्विजः । परिव्राट्कामवृत्तोऽस्तु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Shunasakha said Let him who has stolen your stalks be a Brahmana who sleeps happily having neglected his daily Homa. Let him, after becoming a religious mendicant, act in any way he likes, without observing any control.

data.v: बाल्वजेन निदानेन कांस्यं भवतु दोहनम् । दुह्येत परवत्सेन या ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Surabhi said Let her who has stolen your stalks be milked, with he, (hind) legs bound with a rope of human hair, and with the help of a calf not her own, and, while milked, let her be held in vessel of white brass.

data.v: ततस्तु तैः शपथैः शप्यमानै;र्नानाविधैर्बहुभिः कौरवेन्द्र । सहस्राक्षो देवराट्संप्रहृष्टः; समीक्ष्य तं कोपनं विप्रमुख्यम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said After the Rishis and the royal sages had taken various oaths, O Kuru king, the thousand eye chief of the celestials, filled with joy, looked at the angry Rishi Agastya.

data.v: अथाब्रवीन्मघवा प्रत्ययं स्वं; समाभाष्य तमृषिं जातरोषम् । ब्रह्मर्षिदेवर्षिनृपर्षिमध्ये; यत्तन्निबोधेह ममाद्य राजन् ॥
data.md: Addressing the Rishi who was very angry at the disappearance of his lotus stalks, Indra thus declared what was passing in his mind. Hear, O king, the words Indra spoke in the midst of those twiceborn and celestial Rishis and royal sages.

data.v: अध्वर्यवे दुहितरं ददातु; च्छन्दोगे वा चरितब्रह्मचर्ये । आथर्वणं वेदमधीत्य विप्रः; स्नायीत यः पुष्करमाददाति ॥
data.md: Shunasa kha said Let him who has removed the lotusstalks acquire the merit of bestowing his daughter in marriage upon a Brahmana who has studied all the Samans and the Yajushes and who has carefully observed the vow of celibacy. Let him perform the final ablutions after having read all the Atharvans!

data.v: सर्वान्वेदानधीयीत पुण्यशीलोऽस्तु धार्मिकः । ब्रह्मणः सदनं यातु यस्ते हरति पुष्करम् ॥
data.md: Let him who has stolen your stalks acquire the mcrit of having studied all the Vedas. Let him be observant of all duties and rightcous in his conduct. Indeed, let him go to the region of Brahman.

data.v: आशीर्वादस्त्वया प्रोक्तः शपथो बलसूदन । दीयतां पुष्करं मह्यमेष धर्मः सनातनः ॥
data.md: Agastya said You have, O destroyer of Vala, uttered a benediction instead of a course. Give them to me, for that is eternal duty.

data.v: न मया भगवँल्लोभाद्धृतं पुष्करमद्य वै । धर्मं तु श्रोतुकामेन हृतं न क्रोद्धुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Indra said O holy one, I did not remove your stalks, moved by cupidity. Indeed, I removed them from desire of hearing this assembly recite what the duties are that we should observe. You should not yield to anger.

data.v: धर्मः श्रुतिसमुत्कर्षो धर्मसेतुरनामयः । आर्षो वै शाश्वतो नित्यमव्ययोऽयं मया श्रुतः ॥
data.md: Duties are the foremost of Shrutis. Duties form the eternal path. I have listened to this discourse of the Rishis (on duties) that is eternal and immutable, and that is above all change.

data.v: तदिदं गृह्यतां विद्वन्पुष्करं मुनिसत्तम । अतिक्रमं मे भगवन्क्षन्तुमर्हस्यनिन्दित ॥
data.md: Do you then, foremost of learned Brahmanas, take back these stalks of yours. O holy one, you should forgive my transgression, (you who are free from every fault.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स महेन्द्रेण तपस्वी कोपनो भृशम् । जग्राह पुष्करं धीमान्प्रसन्नश्चाभवन्मुनिः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed by the king of the celestials, the ascetics viz., Agastya, who had been very angry, took back his stalks. Gifted with intelligence, the Rishi became cheerful.

data.v: प्रययुस्ते ततो भूयस्तीर्थानि वनगोचराः । पुण्यतीर्थेषु च तथा गात्राण्याप्लावयन्ति ते ॥
data.md: After this, those dwellers of the forest went to various other sacred waters. Indeed, going to those sacred waters they performed their ablutions everywhere.

data.v: आख्यानं य इदं युक्तः पठेत्पर्वणि पर्वणि । न मूर्खं जनयेत्पुत्रं न भवेच्च निराकृतिः ॥
data.md: The man who reads this discourse with rapt attention on every Parva day, will not beget an ignorant and wicked son. He will never be shorn of fearing

data.v: न तमापत्स्पृशेत्काचिन्न ज्वरो न रुजश्च ह । विरजाः श्रेयसा युक्तः प्रेत्य स्वर्गमवाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: No calamity will ever befall him. He will, besides, be free from every sort of sorrow. He will never suffer from decrepitude and decay. Freed from stains and evil of every sort, and gifted with merit, he is sure to acquire Heaven,

data.v: यश्च शास्त्रमनुध्यायेदृषिभिः परिपालितम् । स गच्छेद्ब्रह्मणो लोकमव्ययं च नरोत्तम ॥
data.md: He who studies this Shastra observed by the Rishis, is sure, O king, to attain to the eternal region of Brahman that is full of happiness.

data.v: यदिदं श्राद्धधर्मेषु दीयते भरतर्षभ । छत्रं चोपानहौ चैव केनैतत्संप्रवर्तितम् । कथं चैतत्समुत्पन्नं किमर्थं च प्रदीयते ॥
न केवलं श्राद्धधर्मे पुण्यकेष्वपि दीयते । एतद्विस्तरतो राजञ्श्रोतुमिच्छामि तत्त्वतः ॥
शृणु राजन्नवहितश्छत्रोपानहविस्तरम् । यथैतत्प्रथितं लोके येन चैतत्प्रवर्तितम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Do you, O prince, attentively listen to the details I shall recite about the custom of giving away umbrellas and shocs at religious rites, and as to how and by whom it was introduced.

data.v: यथा चाक्षय्यतां प्राप्तं पुण्यतां च यथा गतम् । सर्वमेतदशेषेण प्रवक्ष्यामि जनाधिप ॥
data.md: I shall also tell you in full, O prince, how it acquired the force of a permanent observance and how it came to be considered as a meritorious act.

data.v: इतिहासं पुरावृत्तमिमं शृणु नराधिप । जमदग्नेश्च संवादं सूर्यस्य च महात्मनः ॥
पुरा स भगवान्साक्षाद्धनुषाक्रीडत प्रभो । संधाय संधाय शरांश्चिक्षेप किल भार्गवः ॥
तान्क्षिप्तान्रेणुका सर्वांस्तस्येषून्दीप्ततेजसः । आनाय्य सा तदा तस्मै प्रादादसकृदच्युत ॥
अथ तेन स शब्देन ज्यातलस्य शरस्य च । प्रहृष्टः संप्रचिक्षेप सा च प्रत्याजहार तान् ॥
ततो मध्याह्नमारूढे ज्येष्ठामूले दिवाकरे । स सायकान्द्विजो विद्ध्वा रेणुकामिदमब्रवीत् ॥
गच्छानय विशालाक्षि शरानेतान्धनुश्च्युतान् । यावदेतान्पुनः सुभ्रु क्षिपामीति जनाधिप ॥
सा गच्छत्यन्तरा छायां वृक्षमाश्रित्य भामिनी । तस्थौ तस्या हि संतप्तं शिरः पादौ तथैव च ॥
स्थिता सा तु मुहूर्तं वै भर्तुः शापभयाच्छुभा । ययावानयितुं भूयः सायकानसितेक्षणा । प्रत्याजगाम च शरांस्तानादाय यशस्विनी ॥
सा प्रस्विन्ना सुचार्वङ्गी पद्भ्यां दुःखं नियच्छती । उपाजगाम भर्तारं भयाद्भर्तुः प्रवेपती ॥
स तामृषिस्ततः क्रुद्धो वाक्यमाह शुभाननाम् । रेणुके किं चिरेण त्वमागतेति पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: The Rishis, stricken with anger, repeatedly addressed his fairfaced wife, saying, O Renuka, why have you been so late in returning?

data.v: शिरस्तावत्प्रदीप्तं मे पादौ चैव तपोधन । सूर्यतेजोनिरुद्धाहं वृक्षच्छायामुपाश्रिता ॥
data.md: Renuka said O you, having penances for wealth, my hand and feet were scorched by the rays of the Sun! Oppressed by the heat, I took shelter under the shade of a tree!

data.v: एतस्मात्कारणाद्ब्रह्मंश्चिरमेतत्कृतं मया । एतज्ज्ञात्वा मम विभो मा क्रुधस्त्वं तपोधन ॥
data.md: with me. This . has been the cause of the delay! Informed of the cause, do you, O lord, cease to be angry

data.v: अद्यैनं दीप्तकिरणं रेणुके तव दुःखदम् । शरैर्निपातयिष्यामि सूर्यमस्त्राग्नितेजसा ॥
data.md: Jamadagni said O Renuka, this very day shall I destroy, with the fiery energy of my weapons, the star of the day with his burning rays, who has afflicted you thus.

data.v: स विस्फार्य धनुर्दिव्यं गृहीत्वा च बहूञ्शरान् । अतिष्ठत्सूर्यमभितो यतो याति ततोमुखः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Drawing his celestial bow, and taking up many arrows, Jamadagni stood, turning his face towards the Sun and watching him as he moved on.

data.v: अथ तं प्रहरिष्यन्तं सूर्योऽभ्येत्य वचोऽब्रवीत् । द्विजरूपेण कौन्तेय किं ते सूर्योऽपराध्यते ॥
data.md: Then O son of Kunti, seeing him ready for fight, the Sun approached him in the guise of a Brahmana, and said to him, What has the Sun done to offend you?

data.v: आदत्ते रश्मिभिः सूर्यो दिवि विद्वंस्ततस्ततः । रसं स तं वै वर्षासु प्रवर्षति दिवाकरः ॥
data.md: Passing through the sky, he draws up the moisture from the Earth and in the form of rains he pours it down once more on her.

data.v: ततोऽन्नं जायते विप्र मनुष्याणां सुखावहम् । अन्नं प्राणा इति यथा वेदेषु परिपठ्यते ॥
data.md: It is through this, O twiceborn one, that the food of human beings springs up, food that is so agreeable to them! The Vedas say that it is food that forms the vital airs.

data.v: अथाभ्रेषु निगूढश्च रश्मिभिः परिवारितः । सप्त द्वीपानिमान्ब्रह्मन्वर्षेणाभिप्रवर्षति ॥
data.md: O Brahmana, hidden in the clouds and encompassed by his rays, the Sun drenches the seven insular continents with showers of rain.

data.v: ततस्तदौषधीनां च वीरुधां पत्रपुष्पजम् । सर्वं वर्षाभिनिर्वृत्तमन्नं संभवति प्रभो ॥
data.md: O powerful one, the moisture, thus poured, spreading itself into the leaves and fruits of vegetables and herbs, is changed into food.

data.v: जातकर्माणि सर्वाणि व्रतोपनयनानि च । गोदानानि विवाहाश्च तथा यज्ञसमृद्धयः ॥
data.md: O son of Bhrigu, the rites consequent on birth, religious observances, investiture with the sacred thread, gifts of kine, marriage, all articles in view of sacrifices, the rules for the governance of men, gifts all sorts of union, and the acquisition of riches, originate from food! You know this well!

data.v: सत्राणि दानानि तथा संयोगा वित्तसंचयाः । अन्नतः संप्रवर्तन्ते यथा त्वं वेत्थ भार्गव ॥
data.md: O son of Bhrigu, the rites consequent on birth, religious observances, investiture with the sacred thread, gifts of kine, marriage, all articles in view of sacrifices, the rules for the governance of men, gifts all sorts of union, and the acquisition of riches, originate from food! You know this well!

data.v: रमणीयानि यावन्ति यावदारम्भकाणि च । सर्वमन्नात्प्रभवति विदितं कीर्तयामि ते ॥
data.md: All the good and sweet things in the universe, and all the efforts made by living creatures, originate from food. I duly recite what is well known to you! Indeed, you fully know all that I have said.

data.v: सर्वं हि वेत्थ विप्र त्वं यदेतत्कीर्तितं मया । प्रसादये त्वा विप्रर्षे किं ते सूर्यो निपात्यते ॥
data.md: Do you therefore, O twiceborm Rishi, appease your anger! What will you gain by annihilating the Sun?

data.v: एवं तदा प्रयाचन्तं भास्करं मुनिसत्तमः । जमदग्निर्महातेजाः किं कार्यं प्रत्यपद्यत ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said What did that foremost of ascetics, viz., Jamadagni gifted with great energy, do when thus besought by the Sun?

data.v: तथा प्रयाचमानस्य मुनिरग्निसमप्रभः । जमदग्निः शमं नैव जगाम कुरुनन्दन ॥
data.md: Bhishma said O descendant of Kuru, inspite of all the prayers of the Sun, the sage Jamadagni, effulgent like fire, continued to cherish his anger.

data.v: ततः सूर्यो मधुरया वाचा तमिदमब्रवीत् । कृताञ्जलिर्विप्ररूपी प्रणम्येदं विशां पते ॥
चलं निमित्तं विप्रर्षे सदा सूर्यस्य गच्छतः । कथं चलं वेत्स्यसि त्वं सदा यान्तं दिवाकरम् ॥
data.md: Then, O king, the Sun, in the guise of a Brahmana, bowed his head to him and addressed him, with clasped hands, in these sweet words, O twiceborn Rishi, the Sun is always moving! How shall you pierce the Lord of day who is continually moving forward?

data.v: स्थिरं वापि चलं वापि जाने त्वां ज्ञानचक्षुषा । अवश्यं विनयाधानं कार्यमद्य मया तव ॥
data.md: Jamadagni said With the eye of knowledge I know you to be both moving and motionless! I shall surely read you a lesson this day.

data.v: अपराह्णे निमेषार्धं तिष्ठसि त्वं दिवाकर । तत्र वेत्स्यामि सूर्य त्वां न मेऽत्रास्ति विचारणा ॥
data.md: At midday you appear to stay in the firmament for a moment. It is then, O Sun, that I shall pierce you with my arrows! There is no swerving from this resolution of mine.

data.v: असंशयं मां विप्रर्षे वेत्स्यसे धन्विनां वर । अपकारिणं तु मां विद्धि भगवञ्शरणागतम् ॥
data.md: Surya said O twiceborn Rishi, forsooth, you know me, O best of archers! But, O holy one, though I have offended, see I pray for your protection.

data.v: ततः प्रहस्य भगवाञ्जमदग्निरुवाच तम् । न भीः सूर्य त्वया कार्या प्रणिपातगतो ह्यसि ॥
data.md: Bhishma said At this, the worshipful Jamadagni smilingly addressed the Sun, saying, O Sun, when you have sought my protection, you have nothing to fear.

data.v: ब्राह्मणेष्वार्जवं यच्च स्थैर्यं च धरणीतले । सौम्यतां चैव सोमस्य गाम्भीर्यं वरुणस्य च ॥
data.md: He would get over the simplicity that exists in Brahmanas, the stability that exists in the Earth, the mildness existing in the Moon, the gravity existing in Varuna, the effulgence existing in Agni, the brightness of Meru, and the heat of the Sun, who would kill a suppliant for protection.

data.v: दीप्तिमग्नेः प्रभां मेरोः प्रतापं तपनस्य च । एतान्यतिक्रमेद्यो वै स हन्याच्छरणागतम् ॥
data.md: He would get over the simplicity that exists in Brahmanas, the stability that exists in the Earth, the mildness existing in the Moon, the gravity existing in Varuna, the effulgence existing in Agni, the brightness of Meru, and the heat of the Sun, who would kill a suppliant for protection.

data.v: भवेत्स गुरुतल्पी च ब्रह्महा च तथा भवेत् । सुरापानं च कुर्यात्स यो हन्याच्छरणागतम् ॥
data.md: The man who can kill a suppliant is capable of violating the bed of his preceptor, of killing ! a Brahmana and of drinking alcohol.

data.v: एतस्य त्वपनीतस्य समाधिं तात चिन्तय । यथा सुखगमः पन्था भवेत्त्वद्रश्मितापितः ॥
data.md: Do you, therefore, think of some remedy for this evil, by which people may be relieved when heated by your rays.

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा स तदा तूष्णीमासीद्भृगूद्वहः । अथ सूर्यो ददौ तस्मै छत्रोपानहमाशु वै ॥
data.md: Bhishma said So saying, that exceilent descendant of Bhrigu remained silent for some time, and the Sun immediately gave him an umbrella and a pair of sandals,

data.v: महर्षे शिरसस्त्राणं छत्रं मद्रश्मिवारणम् । प्रतिगृह्णीष्व पद्भ्यां च त्राणार्थं चर्मपादुके ॥
data.md: Surya said Do you, O great Rishi, take this umbrella with which the head may be protected and my rays warded off. This pair of sandals is made of leather for the protection of the feet.

data.v: अद्यप्रभृति चैवैतल्लोके संप्रचरिष्यति । पुण्यदानेषु सर्वेषु परमक्षय्यमेव च ॥
data.md: From this day the gift of these articles in all religious rites shall be established as a custom.

data.v: उपानच्छत्रमेतद्वै सूर्येणेह प्रवर्तितम् । पुण्यमेतदभिख्यातं त्रिषु लोकेषु भारत ॥
data.md: Bhishma said This custom of giving umbrella and shoes was introduced by the Sun. O descendant of Bharata, these gifts are regarded meritorious in the three worlds.

data.v: तस्मात्प्रयच्छ विप्रेभ्यश्छत्रोपानहमुत्तमम् । धर्मस्ते सुमहान्भावी न मेऽत्रास्ति विचारणा ॥
data.md: Do you, therefore, give away umbrellas and shoes to Brahmanas. I have no doubt that you will then acquire great religious merit by the deed.

data.v: छत्रं हि भरतश्रेष्ठ यः प्रदद्याद्द्विजातये । शुभ्रं शतशलाकं वै स प्रेत्य सुखमेधते ॥
data.md: O foremost one of Bharata's race, he who gives away a white umbrella with a hundred ribs to a Brahmana, acquires eternal happiness after death and lives the region of Indra, respected by Brahmanas, Apsaras, and Devas.

data.v: स शक्रलोके वसति पूज्यमानो द्विजातिभिः । अप्सरोभिश्च सततं देवैश्च भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: O foremost one of Bharata's race, he who gives away a white umbrella with a hundred ribs to a Brahmana, acquires eternal happiness after death and lives the region of Indra, respected by Brahmanas, Apsaras, and Devas.

data.v: दह्यमानाय विप्राय यः प्रयच्छत्युपानहौ । स्नातकाय महाबाहो संशिताय द्विजातये ॥
data.md: O powerful one, he who gives shoes to Snataka Brahmanas as also to Brahmanas practising the rites of religion whose feet have become sore with the heat of the Sun, acquires regions coveted by the very celestials. Such a man, O Bharata, lives happily in the highest Heaven after his death.

data.v: सोऽपि लोकानवाप्नोति दैवतैरभिपूजितान् । गोलोके स मुदा युक्तो वसति प्रेत्य भारत ॥
data.md: O powerful one, he who gives shoes to Snataka Brahmanas as also to Brahmanas practising the rites of religion whose feet have become sore with the heat of the Sun, acquires regions coveted by the very celestials. Such a man, O Bharata, lives happily in the highest Heaven after his death.

data.v: एतत्ते भरतश्रेष्ठ मया कार्त्स्न्येन कीर्तितम् । छत्रोपानहदानस्य फलं भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: O foremost one of Bharata's race. I have thus recited to you, in full the merits of giving away shoes and umbrellas at religious ceremonies.

data.v: आरामाणां तडागानां यत्फलं कुरुनन्दन । तदहं श्रोतुमिच्छामि त्वत्तोऽद्य भरतर्षभ ॥
सुप्रदर्शा वनवती चित्रधातुविभूषिता । उपेता सर्वबीजैश्च श्रेष्ठा भूमिरिहोच्यते ॥
तस्याः क्षेत्रविशेषं च तडागानां निवेशनम् । औदकानि च सर्वाणि प्रवक्ष्याम्यनुपूर्वशः ॥
तडागानां च वक्ष्यामि कृतानां चापि ये गुणाः । त्रिषु लोकेषु सर्वत्र पूजितो यस्तडागवान् ॥
अथ वा मित्रसदनं मैत्रं मित्रविवर्धनम् । कीर्तिसंजननं श्रेष्ठं तडागानां निवेशनम् ॥
धर्मस्यार्थस्य कामस्य फलमाहुर्मनीषिणः । तडागं सुकृतं देशे क्षेत्रमेव महाश्रयम् ॥
चतुर्विधानां भूतानां तडागमुपलक्षयेत् । तडागानि च सर्वाणि दिशन्ति श्रियमुत्तमाम् ॥
देवा मनुष्या गन्धर्वाः पितरोरगराक्षसाः । स्थावराणि च भूतानि संश्रयन्ति जलाशयम् ॥
तस्मात्तांस्ते प्रवक्ष्यामि तडागे ये गुणाः स्मृताः । या च तत्र फलावाप्तिरृषिभिः समुदाहृता ॥
वर्षमात्रे तडागे तु सलिलं यस्य तिष्ठति । अग्निहोत्रफलं तस्य फलमाहुर्मनीषिणः ॥
शरत्काले तु सलिलं तडागे यस्य तिष्ठति । गोसहस्रस्य स प्रेत्य लभते फलमुत्तमम् ॥
हेमन्तकाले सलिलं तडागे यस्य तिष्ठति । स वै बहुसुवर्णस्य यज्ञस्य लभते फलम् ॥
यस्य वै शैशिरे काले तडागे सलिलं भवेत् । अग्निष्टोमस्य यज्ञस्य फलमाहुर्मनीषिणः ॥
तडागं सुकृतं यस्य वसन्ते तु महाश्रयम् । अतिरात्रस्य यज्ञस्य फलं स समुपाश्नुते ॥
निदाघकाले पानीयं तडागे यस्य तिष्ठति । वाजपेयसमं तस्य फलं वै मुनयो विदुः ॥
स कुलं तारयेत्सर्वं यस्य खाते जलाशये । गावः पिबन्ति पानीयं साधवश्च नराः सदा ॥
तडागे यस्य गावस्तु पिबन्ति तृषिता जलम् । मृगपक्षिमनुष्याश्च सोऽश्वमेधफलं लभेत् ॥
यत्पिबन्ति जलं तत्र स्नायन्ते विश्रमन्ति च । तडागदस्य तत्सर्वं प्रेत्यानन्त्याय कल्पते ॥
दुर्लभं सलिलं तात विशेषेण परत्र वै । पानीयस्य प्रदानेन प्रीतिर्भवति शाश्वती ॥
तिलान्ददत पानीयं दीपान्ददत जाग्रत । ज्ञातिभिः सह मोदध्वमेतत्प्रेतेषु दुर्लभम् ॥
सर्वदानैर्गुरुतरं सर्वदानैर्विशिष्यते । पानीयं नरशार्दूल तस्माद्दातव्यमेव हि ॥
एवमेतत्तडागेषु कीर्तितं फलमुत्तमम् । अत ऊर्ध्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि वृक्षाणामपि रोपणे ॥
स्थावराणां च भूतानां जातयः षट्प्रकीर्तिताः । वृक्षगुल्मलतावल्ल्यस्त्वक्सारास्तृणजातयः ॥
एता जात्यस्तु वृक्षाणां तेषां रोपे गुणास्त्विमे । कीर्तिश्च मानुषे लोके प्रेत्य चैव फलं शुभम् ॥
लभते नाम लोके च पितृभिश्च महीयते । देवलोकगतस्यापि नाम तस्य न नश्यति ॥
अतीतानागते चोभे पितृवंशं च भारत । तारयेद्वृक्षरोपी च तस्माद्वृक्षान्प्ररोपयेत् ॥
तस्य पुत्रा भवन्त्येते पादपा नात्र संशयः । परलोकगतः स्वर्गं लोकांश्चाप्नोति सोऽव्ययान् ॥
पुष्पैः सुरगणान्वृक्षाः फलैश्चापि तथा पितॄन् । छायया चातिथींस्तात पूजयन्ति महीरुहाः ॥
किंनरोरगरक्षांसि देवगन्धर्वमानवाः । तथा ऋषिगणाश्चैव संश्रयन्ति महीरुहान् ॥
पुष्पिताः फलवन्तश्च तर्पयन्तीह मानवान् । वृक्षदं पुत्रवद्वृक्षास्तारयन्ति परत्र च ॥
तस्मात्तडागे वृक्षा वै रोप्याः श्रेयोर्थिना सदा । पुत्रवत्परिपाल्याश्च पुत्रास्ते धर्मतः स्मृताः ॥
तडागकृद्वृक्षरोपी इष्टयज्ञश्च यो द्विजः । एते स्वर्गे महीयन्ते ये चान्ये सत्यवादिनः ॥

data.md: Yudhishthira said O foremost one of Bharata's race, do you describe to me all the deities of the household mode and tell me all that a man should do in order to acquire prosperity in this world.

data.v: अत्र ते वर्तयिष्यामि पुरावृत्तं जनाधिप । वासुदेवस्य संवादं पृथिव्याश्चैव भारत ॥

data.md: The Goddess Earth said O Madhava, the Rishis, the celestials the departed Manes, and men should be adored, and sacrifices should be performed by a householder.

data.md: Do you also learn this from me that the celestials are always pleased with sacrifices, and are pleased with hospitality. Therefore, the householder should please them with such objects as they desire.

data.md: He should offer food to men at the entrance of his house. These, O Madhava, are known as the Bali offerings. The Bali should be offered to the Maruts and the deities in the interior of one's house.

data.v: तथैव विश्वेदेवेभ्यो बलिमाकाशतो हरेत् । निशाचरेभ्यो भूतेभ्यो बलिं नक्तं तथा हरेत् ॥
data.md: To the Vishvedevas it should be offered in open air, and to the Rakshasas and evil spirits the offerings should be made at night.

data.v: एवं कृत्वा बलिं सम्यग्दद्याद्भिक्षां द्विजातये । अलाभे ब्राह्मणस्याग्नावग्रमुत्क्षिप्य निक्षिपेत् ॥
data.md: After making these offerings, the householder should make offerings to Brahmanas, and if no Brahmana be present, the first portion of the food should be thrown into the fire.

data.v: यदा श्राद्धं पितृभ्यश्च दातुमिच्छेत मानवः । तदा पश्चात्प्रकुर्वीत निवृत्ते श्राद्धकर्मणि ॥
data.md: When a man wishes to offers Shraddha to his ancestors, he should, when the Shraddha ceremony is donc, please his ancestors and then make the Bali offerings duly.

data.v: पितॄन्संतर्पयित्वा तु बलिं कुर्याद्विधानतः । वैश्वदेवं ततः कुर्यात्पश्चाद्ब्राह्मणवाचनम् ॥
data.md: He should then make offerings to the Vishwedevas. He should next invite Brahmanas, and then properly entertain guests arrived at his house, with food.

data.v: ततोऽन्नेनावशेषेण भोजयेदतिथीनपि । अर्चापूर्वं महाराज ततः प्रीणाति मानुषान् ॥
data.md: By this act, O prince, are guests pleased. He who does not live in the house long, or, having come, goes away after a short time, is called guest.

data.v: अनित्यं हि स्थितो यस्मात्तस्मादतिथिरुच्यते ॥
आचार्यस्य पितुश्चैव सख्युराप्तस्य चातिथेः । इदमस्ति गृहे मह्यमिति नित्यं निवेदयेत् ॥
data.md: To his preceptor, to his father, to his friend and to a guest, a householder should say, I have got this in my house to offer you today! And he should offer it accordingly every day.

data.v: ते यद्वदेयुस्तत्कुर्यादिति धर्मो विधीयते । गृहस्थः पुरुषः कृष्ण शिष्टाशी च सदा भवेत् ॥
data.md: The house holder should do whatever they would order him to do. This is the established custom. The householder, O Krishna should take his food the last of all, after having offered food to all of them.

data.v: राजर्त्विजं स्नातकं च गुरुं श्वशुरमेव च । अर्चयेन्मधुपर्केण परिसंवत्सरोषितान् ॥
data.md: The householder should adore with offerings of honey, etc., his king his priest, his preceptor, and his fatherinlaw, as also Snataka Brahmanas even if they were to live in his house for whole year.

data.v: श्वभ्यश्च श्वपचेभ्यश्च वयोभ्यश्चावपेद्भुवि । वैश्वदेवं हि नामैतत्सायंप्रातर्विधीयते ॥
data.md: In the morning as well as in the evening, food should be offered on the ground to dogs, the cooks for dogs and birds. This is called the Vaishvedeva offerings.

data.v: एतांस्तु धर्मान्गार्हस्थान्यः कुर्यादनसूयकः । स इहर्द्धिं परां प्राप्य प्रेत्य नाके महीयते ॥
data.md: The householder, who performs these ceremonies with mind shorn of passion, obtains the blessings of the Rishis in this world, and after death acquires the heavenly regions.

data.v: इति भूमेर्वचः श्रुत्वा वासुदेवः प्रतापवान् । तथा चकार सततं त्वमप्येवं समाचर ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Having heard all this from the goddess Earth, the powerful Vasudeva acted accordingly. Do you also act in the same way.

data.v: एवं गृहस्थधर्मं त्वं चेतयानो नराधिप । इहलोके यशः प्राप्य प्रेत्य स्वर्गमवाप्स्यसि ॥
data.md: By performing these duties of a householder. O king, you shall acquire fame in this world and Heaven after death?

data.md: Yudhishthira said Of what kind is the gift of light, О chief of Bharata's race? How did this gift originate? What are the merits of it? Do you tell me all this.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । मनोः प्रजापतेर्वादं सुवर्णस्य च भारत ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited an old history of the conversation between Vrishadarbhi and the seven Rishis, O Bharata.

data.v: तपस्वी कश्चिदभवत्सुवर्णो नाम नामतः । वर्णतो हेमवर्णः स सुवर्ण इति पप्रथे ॥
data.md: These was formerly an ascetic, O Bharata named Suvarna. His complexion was like that of gold and hence he was called Suvarna.

data.v: कुलशीलगुणोपेतः स्वाध्याये च परं गतः । बहून्स्ववंशप्रभवान्समतीतः स्वकैर्गुणैः ॥
data.md: Gifted with good birth, good conduct and good qualities, he had mastered all the Vedas. Indeed, by the accomplishments he possessed, he succeeded in excelling many persons of noble birth.

data.v: स कदाचिन्मनुं विप्रो ददर्शोपससर्प च । कुशलप्रश्नमन्योन्यं तौ च तत्र प्रचक्रतुः ॥
data.md: One day that learned Brahmana beheld Manu, the lord of all creatures, and approached him. Meeting each other, they made the usual polite enquires.

data.v: ततस्तौ सिद्धसंकल्पौ मेरौ काञ्चनपर्वते । रमणीये शिलापृष्ठे सहितौ संन्यषीदताम् ॥
data.md: Both of them were in the truth. Having met each other, they sat down on charming breast of the golden mount Meru.

data.v: तत्र तौ कथयामास्तां कथा नानाविधाश्रयाः । ब्रह्मर्षिदेवदैत्यानां पुराणानां महात्मनाम् ॥
data.md: Seated there they began to talk with each other on various subjects about the great deities and twiceborn Rishis and Daityas of ancient times.

data.v: सुवर्णस्त्वब्रवीद्वाक्यं मनुं स्वायंभुवं प्रभुम् । हितार्थं सर्वभूतानां प्रश्नं मे वक्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Then Suvarna addressing the Selfcreate Manu, said these words:You should answer one question of mine for the behoof of all creatures.
