data.md: O lord of all creatures, the celestials are scen to be adored with presents of flowers and other good scents. What is this? How has this practice come into operation? What also are the merits of it? Do you describe this subject to me.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । शुक्रस्य च बलेश्चैव संवादं वै समागमे ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited an old history of the conversation between Vrishadarbhi and the seven Rishis, O Bharata.

data.v: बलेर्वैरोचनस्येह त्रैलोक्यमनुशासतः । समीपमाजगामाशु शुक्रो भृगुकुलोद्वहः ॥
data.md: Once on a time, Shukra of Bhrigu's race approached Bali the son of Virochana while he was ruling the three worlds.

data.v: तमर्घ्यादिभिरभ्यर्च्य भार्गवं सोऽसुराधिपः । निषसादासने पश्चाद्विधिवद्भूरिदक्षिणः ॥
data.md: Having adored the descendant of Bhrigu with the Arghya, the king of the Asuras, that profuse giver of sacrificial presents, sat down after his guest had seated himself.

data.v: कथेयमभवत्तत्र या त्वया परिकीर्तिता । सुमनोधूपदीपानां संप्रदाने फलं प्रति ॥
data.md: This very subject which you have introduced regarding the merits of the gift of flowers and incense and lamps, came up on the occasion. Indeed the king of the Daityas put this high question of Shukra that most learned of all ascetics.

data.v: ततः पप्रच्छ दैत्येन्द्रः कवीन्द्रं प्रश्नमुत्तमम् । सुमनोधूपदीपानां किं फलं ब्रह्मवित्तम । प्रदानस्य द्विजश्रेष्ठ तद्भवान्वक्तुमर्हति ॥
data.md: Bali said O foremost of all persons conversant with Brahma, what, indeed, is the merit of giving flowers and incense and lamps? You should, O foremost of Brahmanas, describe this to me.

data.v: तपः पूर्वं समुत्पन्नं धर्मस्तस्मादनन्तरम् । एतस्मिन्नन्तरे चैव वीरुदोषध्य एव च ॥
data.md: Shukra said Penance first sprang into existence. Afterwards came religion. In the interval many creepers and herbs sprang up.

data.v: सोमस्यात्मा च बहुधा संभूतः पृथिवीतले । अमृतं च विषं चैव याश्चान्यास्तुल्यजातयः ॥
data.md: Their species were innumerable. All of them have the Moon for their lord. Some of these creepers and herbs came to be considered as Ambrosia and some came to be considered as Poison. Others that were neither this nor that formed one class.

data.v: अमृतं मनसः प्रीतिं सद्यः पुष्टिं ददाति च । मनो ग्लपयते तीव्रं विषं गन्धेन सर्वशः ॥
data.md: That is Ambrosia which gives immediate pleasure and joy to the mind. That is Poison which tortures the mind greatly by its smell.

data.v: अमृतं मङ्गलं विद्धि महद्विषममङ्गलम् । ओषध्यो ह्यमृतं सर्वं विषं तेजोऽग्निसंभवम् ॥
data.md: men Know again that Ambrosia is highly auspicious and that Poison Poison is highly inauspicious. All the herbs are Ambrosia. Poison is born of the energy of fire.

data.v: मनो ह्लादयते यस्माच्छ्रियं चापि दधाति ह । तस्मात्सुमनसः प्रोक्ता नरैः सुकृतकर्मभिः ॥
data.md: Flowers please the mind and confer prosperity. Hence of pious deeds bestowed the name Sumanas on thein.

data.v: देवताभ्यः सुमनसो यो ददाति नरः शुचिः । तस्मात्सुमनसः प्रोक्ता यस्मात्तुष्यन्ति देवताः ॥
data.md: That man who in a state of purity offers flowers to the celestials finds that the celestials become pleased with him, and as the result of such satisfaction confer prosperity upon him.

data.v: यं यमुद्दिश्य दीयेरन्देवं सुमनसः प्रभो । मङ्गलार्थं स तेनास्य प्रीतो भवति दैत्यप ॥
data.md: O king of the Daityas, those celestials to whom worshippers offer flowers, O lord, uttering their names the while, become pleased with the offerers on account of their devotion.

data.v: ज्ञेयास्तूग्राश्च सौम्याश्च तेजस्विन्यश्च ताः पृथक् । ओषध्यो बहुवीर्याश्च बहुरूपास्तथैव च ॥
data.md: The (deciduous) herbs are of various kinds and possess different qualities. They should be classed as fierce, mild, and powerful.

data.v: यज्ञियानां च वृक्षाणामयज्ञियान्निबोध मे । आसुराणि च माल्यानि दैवतेभ्यो हितानि च ॥
data.md: Listen to me as I tell you which tress are useful for purposes of sacrifice and which are not so. Hear also what garlands are acceptable to Asuras, and what are beneficial when offered to the celestials.

data.v: राक्षसानां सुराणां च यक्षाणां च तथा प्रियाः । पितॄणां मानुषाणां च कान्ता यास्त्वनुपूर्वशः ॥
data.md: I shall also set forth in due order what garlands are killed by the Rakshasas, what by the Uragas, what by the Yakshas, what by human beings, and what by the departed Manes, in proper order.

data.v: वन्या ग्राम्याश्चेह तथा कृष्टोप्ताः पर्वताश्रयाः । अकण्टकाः कण्टकिन्यो गन्धरूपरसान्विताः ॥
data.md: Flowers are of various kinds. Some are wild, some are from iress which grow in the midst of human dwellings; some belong to trees which never grow unless planted on wellcultivated soil; some are from trees growing on mountains,; some are from trees which are not prickly; and some from tress which are prickly. Fragrance, beauty of form and taste also make grounds of classification.

data.v: द्विविधो हि स्मृतो गन्ध इष्टोऽनिष्टश्च पुष्पजः । इष्टगन्धानि देवानां पुष्पाणीति विभावयेत् ॥
data.md: The scent of flowers is of two kinds, agreeable and disagreeable. Those flowers which have sweet smell should be offered to the celestials.

data.v: अकण्टकानां वृक्षाणां श्वेतप्रायाश्च वर्णतः । तेषां पुष्पाणि देवानामिष्टानि सततं प्रभो ॥
data.md: The flowers of trees which have no thorns are generally white in colour. Such flowers are always acceptable to the celestials, O lord.

data.v: जलजानि च माल्यानि पद्मादीनि च यानि च । गन्धर्वनागयक्षेभ्यस्तानि दद्याद्विचक्षणः ॥
data.md: A wise man should offer garlands red of aquatic flowers, such as the lotus and the like, to the Gandharvas and Nagas and Yakshas.

data.v: ओषध्यो रक्तपुष्पाश्च कटुकाः कण्टकान्विताः । शत्रूणामभिचारार्थमथर्वसु निदर्शिताः ॥
data.md: Such plants and herbs as produce red flowers, as have been scent, and as are prickly, have been laid down in the Atharvans as fit for all acts of incantation for injuring enemies.

data.v: तीक्ष्णवीर्यास्तु भूतानां दुरालम्भाः सकण्टकाः । रक्तभूयिष्ठवर्णाश्च कृष्णाश्चैवोपहारयेत् ॥
data.md: Such flowers as have keen energy, as are painful to the touch, as grow on trees and plants having thorns, and as are either bloodyred or black, should be offered to (evil) spirits an unearthly beings.

data.v: मनोहृदयनन्दिन्यो विमर्दे मधुराश्च याः । चारुरूपाः सुमनसो मानुषाणां स्मृता विभो ॥
data.md: Such flowers as please the mind and heart, as are very agreeable when pressed, and as are of beautiful form, have been said, O lord, to be worthy of being offered to men.

data.v: न तु श्मशानसंभूता न देवायतनोद्भवाः । संनयेत्पुष्टियुक्तेषु विवाहेषु रहःसु च ॥
data.md: Such flowers as grow on cemeteries and crematoria, or in places dedicated to the celestials, should not be brought and used for marriage and other rites having growth and prosperity for their object, or for acts of pleasure in secrecy.

data.v: गिरिसानुरुहाः सौम्या देवानामुपपादयेत् । प्रोक्षिताभ्युक्षिताः सौम्या यथायोगं यथास्मृति ॥
data.md: Such flowers as grow on mountains and in vales, and as are beautiful to look at and sweetscented; should be offered to the celestials. Sprinkling them with sandal paste, such sweet flowers should be duly offered according to the scriptural ordinances.

data.v: गन्धेन देवास्तुष्यन्ति दर्शनाद्यक्षराक्षसाः । नागाः समुपभोगेन त्रिभिरेतैस्तु मानुषाः ॥
data.md: The celestials become pleased with the scent of flowers; the Yakshas and Rakshasas with their sight; the Nagas with their touch; and human beings with all three, viz., scent, sight, and touch.

data.v: सद्यः प्रीणाति देवान्वै ते प्रीता भावयन्त्युत । संकल्पसिद्धा मर्त्यानामीप्सितैश्च मनोरथैः ॥
data.md: Flowers, when offered to the celestials please them immediately. They are capable of accomplishing every object by merely wishing its accomplishment. As such, when pleased with devotees offering them flowers, they cause all the objects cherished by their worshippers to be immediately achieved.

data.v: देवाः प्रीणन्ति सततं मानिता मानयन्ति च । अवज्ञातावधूताश्च निर्दहन्त्यधमान्नरान् ॥
data.md: Pleased, they gratify their worshippers. Honoured they make their worshippers enjoy all honors. Disregarded and insulted, they make those vilest of men to be ruined and consumed.

data.v: अतऊर्ध्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि धूपदानविधौ फलम् । धूपांश्च विविधान्साधूनसाधूंश्च निबोध मे ॥
data.md: I shall, after this, speak to you of the merits of the ordinances about the gift of incense. Know, O king of Asuras, that incenses are of various sorts. Some of them are auspicious and some inauspicious.

data.v: निर्यासः सरलश्चैव कृत्रिमश्चैव ते त्रयः । इष्टानिष्टो भवेद्गन्धस्तन्मे विस्तरतः शृणु ॥
data.md: Some incenses consists of exudations. Some are made of fragrant wood set on fire. And some are artificial, being made by the hand, of various articles mixed together. Their scent is of two sorts, viz., agreeable and disagreeable. Listen to me as I describe the subject fully.

data.v: निर्यासाः सल्लकीवर्ज्या देवानां दयितास्तु ते । गुग्गुलुः प्रवरस्तेषां सर्वेषामिति निश्चयः ॥
data.md: All exudations except that of the Boswellia serrata are agreeable to the celestials. It is, however, certain that the best of all cxudations is that of the Balsamodendron Mukul.

data.v: अगुरुः सारिणां श्रेष्ठो यक्षराक्षसभोगिनाम् । दैत्यानां सल्लकीजश्च काङ्क्षितो यश्च तद्विधः ॥
data.md: Of all Dhupas of the Sari class, the Aquilaria Agallocha is the best. It is very acceptable to the Yakshas, the Rakshasas, and Nagas. The exudation of the Boswellia serratta, and others of the same class, are much acceptable to the Daityas.

data.v: अथ सर्जरसादीनां गन्धैः पार्थिवदारवैः । फाणितासवसंयुक्तैर्मनुष्याणां विधीयते ॥
data.md: Dhupas made of the exudation of the Shorea robusta and the Pinus deodara, mixed with various spirits of strong scent, are, O king, acceptable to human beings.

data.v: देवदानवभूतानां सद्यस्तुष्टिकरः स्मृतः । येऽन्ये वैहारिकास्ते तु मानुषाणामिति स्मृताः ॥
data.md: Such Dhupas are said to immediately please the celestials, the Danavas, and spirits. Besides these, there are many other kinds of Dhupas used by men for purposes of pleasure or enjoyment.

data.v: य एवोक्ताः सुमनसां प्रदाने गुणहेतवः । धूपेष्वपि परिज्ञेयास्त एव प्रीतिवर्धनाः ॥
data.md: The offer of flowers and the gift of such Dhupas as yield gratification are equal in merits.

data.v: दीपदाने प्रवक्ष्यामि फलयोगमनुत्तमम् । यथा येन यदा चैव प्रदेया यादृशाश्च ते ॥
data.md: I shall now speak of the merits of the gift of Jights, and who may give them at what time and in what manner, and what should be the kind of lights that should be offered.

data.v: ज्योतिस्तेजः प्रकाशश्चाप्यूर्ध्वगं चापि वर्ण्यते । प्रदानं तेजसां तस्मात्तेजो वर्धयते नृणाम् ॥
data.md: Light is said to be energy and fame and goes upwards. Hence the gift of light, which is energy, increases the energy of men.

data.v: अन्धं तमस्तमिस्रं च दक्षिणायनमेव च । उत्तरायणमेतस्माज्ज्योतिर्दानं प्रशस्यते ॥
data.md: There is a hell named Andhatamas. The period also of the Sun's southward course is considered as dark. For avoiding that hell and the darkness of this period, one should give lights during that period when the Sun is in northern solstice. Such an act is highly spoken of by the good.

data.v: यस्मादूर्ध्वगमेतत्तु तमसश्चैव भेषजम् । तस्मादूर्ध्वगतेर्दाता भवेदिति विनिश्चयः ॥
data.md: Since, again, light has an upward course and is considered as a remedy for darkness, therefore one should give lights. This is the conclusion of the scriptures.

data.v: देवास्तेजस्विनो यस्मात्प्रभावन्तः प्रकाशकाः । तामसा राक्षसाश्चेति तस्माद्दीपः प्रदीयते ॥
data.md: It is by giving lights that the celestials have become gifted with beauty, energy, and resplendence. By abstention from such a deed, the Rakshasas have become gifted with the opposite attributes. Hence, one should always give lights.

data.v: आलोकदानाच्चक्षुष्मान्प्रभायुक्तो भवेन्नरः । तान्दत्त्वा नोपहिंसेत न हरेन्नोपनाशयेत् ॥
data.md: By giving lights a man becomes gifted with keen vision and resplendence. Onc who gives lights should not be looked with jealousy by others. Lights, again, should not be stolen, nor put out when given by others.

data.v: दीपहर्ता भवेदन्धस्तमोगतिरसुप्रभः । दीपप्रदः स्वर्गलोके दीपमाली विराजते ॥
data.md: One who steals a light becomes blind. Such a man has to grope through darkness and becomes shorn of resplendence. One who gives lights shines in beauty in the celestial regions like a row of lights,

data.v: हविषा प्रथमः कल्पो द्वितीयस्त्वौषधीरसैः । वसामेदोस्थिनिर्यासैर्न कार्यः पुष्टिमिच्छता ॥
data.md: Among lights, the best are those in which clarified butter is burnt. Next in order are those in which the juice of deciduous herbs is burnt. One seeking prosperity and growth should never burn fat or marrow or the juice that comes from the bones of creatures.

data.v: गिरिप्रपाते गहने चैत्यस्थाने चतुष्पथे । दीपदाता भवेन्नित्यं य इच्छेद्भूतिमात्मनः ॥
data.md: The who desires his aggrandisement and prosperity should always give lights at descents from mountains, in roads through forests and inaccessible regions, under sacred tress standing in the midst of human dwellings, and in crossings of streets.

data.v: कुलोद्द्योतो विशुद्धात्मा प्रकाशत्वं च गच्छति । ज्योतिषां चैव सालोक्यं दीपदाता नरः सदा ॥
data.md: The man who gives lights always illumines his race, acquires purity of soul and effulgence of form. Indeed, such a man, after death, lives in the company of the luminous bodies in the sky.

data.v: बलिकर्मसु वक्ष्यामि गुणान्कर्मफलोदयान् । देवयक्षोरगनृणां भूतानामथ रक्षसाम् ॥
data.md: I shall now describe to you the merits, with the fruits they bring about, of Bali offerings man own made to the celestials, the Yakshas, the Uragas, human beings, spirits and Rakshasas.

data.v: येषां नाग्रभुजो विप्रा देवतातिथिबालकाः । राक्षसानेव तान्विद्धि निर्वषट्कारमङ्गलान् ॥
data.md: Those unscrupulous and wicked men who eat without First serving Brahmanas and celestials and guests and children, should be known as Rakshasas,

data.v: तस्मादग्रं प्रयच्छेत देवेभ्यः प्रतिपूजितम् । शिरसा प्रणतश्चापि हरेद्बलिमतन्द्रितः ॥
data.md: Hence, one should first offer the food one has got ready to the celestials after having adored them duly with controlled senses and rapt attention. One should offer the Bali to the celestials, bending his head in respect.

data.v: गृह्या हि देवता नित्यमाशंसन्ति गृहात्सदा । बाह्याश्चागन्तवो येऽन्ये यक्षराक्षसपन्नगाः ॥
data.md: The celestials are always supported by food that householders offer. They bless such houses in which offerings are made to them. The Yakshas and Rakshasas and Pannagas, as also guests and all houseless persons, are supported by the food offered by householders.

data.v: इतो दत्तेन जीवन्ति देवताः पितरस्तथा । ते प्रीताः प्रीणयन्त्येतानायुषा यशसा धनैः ॥
data.md: Indeed, the celestials and the departed, Manes derive their sustenance from such offerings. Pleased with such offerings they please the offerer in return with longevity and fame and riches.

data.v: बलयः सह पुष्पैस्तु देवानामुपहारयेत् । दधिद्रप्सयुताः पुण्याः सुगन्धाः प्रियदर्शनाः ॥
data.md: Clean food, of sweet scent and look, mixed with milk and curds, should, along with flowers, be offered to the celestials.

data.v: कार्या रुधिरमांसाढ्या बलयो यक्षरक्षसाम् । सुरासवपुरस्कारा लाजोल्लेपनभूषिताः ॥
data.md: The Balis that should be offered to Yakshas and Rakshasas should be rich with blood and meat, with wines and spirits accompanying, and adorned with friend paddy.

data.v: नागानां दयिता नित्यं पद्मोत्पलविमिश्रिताः । तिलान्गुडसुसंपन्नान्भूतानामुपहारयेत् ॥
data.md: Balis mixed with lotuses and Utpalas are very acceptable to the Nagas. Sesame seeds, boiled in raw sugar, should he offered to the spirits and other unearthly Beings.

data.v: अग्रदाताग्रभोगी स्याद्बलवर्णसमन्वितः । तस्मादग्रं प्रयच्छेत देवेभ्यः प्रतिपूजितम् ॥
data.md: He who never takes any food without first giving a part of it to the Brahmanas and celestials and guests, becomes entitled to first portions of food. Such a man becomes gifted with strength and energy. Hence one should never take any food without first offering a portion thereof to the celestial after adoring them with respect.

data.v: ज्वलत्यहरहो वेश्म याश्चास्य गृहदेवताः । ताः पूज्या भूतिकामेन प्रसृताग्रप्रदायिना ॥
data.md: One's house always shines in beauty on account of the household deities that live in it. Hence, he who desires his own advancement and prosperity should adore the household gods by offering them the first portion of every food.

data.v: इत्येतदसुरेन्द्राय काव्यः प्रोवाच भार्गवः । सुवर्णाय मनुः प्राह सुवर्णो नारदाय च ॥
data.md: Thus did the learned Kavi oi Bhrigu's race discourse to Bali the chief of the Asuras. That discourse was next recited by Manu to the Rishi Suvarna. Suvarna, in his turn, recited it to Narada.

data.v: नारदोऽपि मयि प्राह गुणानेतान्महाद्युते । त्वमप्येतद्विदित्वेह सर्वमाचर पुत्रक ॥
data.md: The celestial Rishi Narada recited to me merits of the several acts mentioned. Informed of those merits, do you, O son, perform the several acts mentioned.

data.v: श्रुतं मे भरतश्रेष्ठ पुष्पधूपप्रदायिनाम् । फलं बलिविधाने च तद्भूयो वक्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said I have, O chief of the Bharatas, heard what the merits which presenters of flowers and lincense and lights acquire. I have heard you speak also of the merits of a due observance of the ordinances in respect of the presentation of the Bali. You should, O grandfather, discourse to me once more on this subject.

data.v: धूपप्रदानस्य फलं प्रदीपस्य तथैव च । बलयश्च किमर्थं वै क्षिप्यन्ते गृहमेधिभिः ॥
data.md: Indeed, tell me. O Sire once more of the merits of presenting incense and lights. Why Balis offered the ground by householders. are on

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । नहुषं प्रति संवादमगस्त्यस्य भृगोस्तथा ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited an old history of the conversation between Vrishadarbhi and the seven Rishis, O Bharata.

data.v: नहुषो हि महाराज राजर्षिः सुमहातपाः । देवराज्यमनुप्राप्तः सुकृतेनेह कर्मणा ॥
data.md: The royal sage Nahusha, O monarch, having penances for wealth, acquired the sovereignty of the celestial region by his own good deeds.

data.v: तत्रापि प्रयतो राजन्नहुषस्त्रिदिवे वसन् । मानुषीश्चैव दिव्याश्च कुर्वाणो विविधाः क्रियाः ॥
data.md: With controlled senses, O king, he lived in the celestial region, engaged in doing diverse acts of both human an celestial nature.

data.v: मानुष्यस्तत्र सर्वाः स्म क्रियास्तस्य महात्मनः । प्रवृत्तास्त्रिदिवे राजन्दिव्याश्चैव सनातनाः ॥
data.md: From that great kuig flowed various kinds of human acts and various kinds of celestial deeds, also, O king.

data.v: अग्निकार्याणि समिधः कुशाः सुमनसस्तथा । बलयश्चान्नलाजाभिर्धूपनं दीपकर्म च ॥
सर्वं तस्य गृहे राज्ञः प्रावर्तत महात्मनः । जपयज्ञान्मनोयज्ञांस्त्रिदिवेऽपि चकार सः ॥
data.md: The various rites with respect to the sacrificial fire, the collection of sacred fuel and of Kusha grass, as also of flowers, and the presentation of Bali consisting of food adorned with fried paddy, and the offer of incense and of light, all there, O monarch, occurred daily in the house of that great king while he lived in the celestial region. Indeed, though living in the celestial region. he celebrated the sacrifice of recitation and the sacrifice of meditation.

data.v: दैवतान्यर्चयंश्चापि विधिवत्स सुरेश्वरः । सर्वाण्येव यथान्यायं यथापूर्वमरिंदम ॥
data.md: And, O chastiser of foes, Nahusha, although he had become the king's of the deities, yet adored all the deities, as he used to do formerly, with due rites and ceremonies.

data.v: अथेन्द्रस्य भविष्यत्वादहंकारस्तमाविशत् । सर्वाश्चैव क्रियास्तस्य पर्यहीयन्त भूपते ॥
data.md: Sometime after, Nahusha realised his position as the king of the deities. This filled him with pride. From that time all his deeds were suspended.

data.v: स ऋषीन्वाहयामास वरदानमदान्वितः । परिहीनक्रियश्चापि दुर्बलत्वमुपेयिवान् ॥
data.md: Filled with pride on account of the boon he had received from all the celestials, Nahusha caused the very Rishis to bear hiin on their shoulders. On account, however, of his abstention from all religious acts, his energy began to wane.

data.v: तस्य वाहयतः कालो मुनिमुख्यांस्तपोधनान् । अहंकाराभिभूतस्य सुमहानत्यवर्तत ॥
data.md: The time was very long for which Nahusha, filled with arrogance, continued to employ the foremost of Rishis, having penances for wealth, as the bearers of his vehicles.

data.v: अथ पर्यायश ऋषीन्वाहनायोपचक्रमे । पर्यायश्चाप्यगस्त्यस्य समपद्यत भारत ॥
data.md: He make the Rishis perform by turns this humiliating work. The day came when it was Agastya's turn to carry the vehicle, O Bharata.

data.v: अथागम्य महातेजा भृगुर्ब्रह्मविदां वरः । अगस्त्यमाश्रमस्थं वै समुपेत्येदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: At that time, Bhrigu, that foremost of all persons conversant with Brahma went to Agastya while the latter was seated in his hermitage, and addressing him said, O great ascetic, why should we patiently suffer such indignities inflicted on us by this wicked Nahusha who has become the king of the deities.

data.v: एवं वयमसत्कारं देवेन्द्रस्यास्य दुर्मतेः । नहुषस्य किमर्थं वै मर्षयाम महामुने ॥
data.md: At that time, Bhrigu, that foremost of all persons conversant with Brahma went to Agastya while the latter was seated in his hermitage, and addressing him said, O great ascetic, why should we patiently suffer such indignities inflicted on us by this wicked Nahusha who has become the king of the deities.

data.v: कथमेष मया शक्यः शप्तुं यस्य महामुने । वरदेन वरो दत्तो भवतो विदितश्च सः ॥
data.md: Agastya said How can, succeed in cursing Nahusha, O great Rishi? You know how the Boongiving (Brahman) himself has given Nahusha the best of boons.

data.v: यो मे दृष्टिपथं गच्छेत्स मे वश्यो भवेदिति । इत्यनेन वरो देवाद्याचितो गच्छता दिवम् ॥
data.md: Coming to the celestial region, the boon that Nahusha prayed for, was that, whoever would come within the range of his vision would, deprived of all energy, come within his control.

data.v: एवं न दग्धः स मया भवता च न संशयः । अन्येनाप्यृषिमुख्येन न शप्तो न च पातितः ॥
data.md: The selfborn Brahman granted him this boon, and it is therefore that neither yourself nor I have been able to consume him. Forsooth, it is for this reason that none one else amongst the foremost of Rishis has been able to consume or throw him down from his elevated position.

data.v: अमृतं चैव पानाय दत्तमस्मै पुरा विभो । महात्मने तदर्थं च नास्माभिर्विनिपात्यते ॥
data.md: Formerly, O lord, nectar was given by Brahman to Nahusha for drinking. Therefore we can do nothing to him.

data.v: प्रायच्छत वरं देवः प्रजानां दुःखकारकम् । द्विजेष्वधर्मयुक्तानि स करोति नराधमः ॥
data.md: The great god, it appears, gave that boon to Nahusha for plunging all creatures into grief. That wretched behaves most unrighteously towards the Brahmanas.

data.v: अत्र यत्प्राप्तकालं नस्तद्ब्रूहि वदतां वर । भवांश्चापि यथा ब्रूयात्कुर्वीमहि तथा वयम् ॥
data.md: O foremost of all speakers, tell us what should be done under the circumstances. Forsooth, I shall do what you will advise. man

data.v: पितामहनियोगेन भवन्तमहमागतः । प्रतिकर्तुं बलवति नहुषे दर्पमास्थिते ॥
data.md: Bhrigu said It is at the command of the Grandfather that I have come to you with the view of counteracting the power of Nahusha who is gifted with great energy but who has been stupefied by fatc.

data.v: अद्य हि त्वा सुदुर्बुद्धी रथे योक्ष्यति देवराट् । अद्यैनमहमुद्वृत्तं करिष्येऽनिन्द्रमोजसा ॥
data.md: That exceedingly wicked being who has become the king of the celestials, will today yoke you to his car. With the help of my power I shall today hurl him down from his position as Indra on account of his having transcended all restraints.

data.v: अद्येन्द्रं स्थापयिष्यामि पश्यतस्ते शतक्रतुम् । संचाल्य पापकर्माणमिन्द्रस्थानात्सुदुर्मतिम् ॥
data.md: I shall today, in your very sight, reestablish the true Indra in his position, him, viz., who has celebrated a hundred horse sacrifices, having hurled the wicked and sinful Nahusha from that seat.

data.v: अद्य चासौ कुदेवेन्द्रस्त्वां पदा धर्षयिष्यति । दैवोपहतचित्तत्वादात्मनाशाय मन्दधीः ॥
data.md: That impious king of the celestials will today insult you by a kick, on account of his understanding being afflicted by fate and for bringing about his own downfall.

data.v: व्युत्क्रान्तधर्मं तमहं धर्षणामर्षितो भृशम् । अहिर्भवस्वेति रुषा शप्स्ये पापं द्विजद्रुहम् ॥
data.md: Euraged at such an insult I shall today curse that sinful wretch, that enemy of the Brahmanas, who has transcended all restrains, saying, Be you metamorphosed into a snake.

data.v: तत एनं सुदुर्बुद्धिं धिक्शब्दाभिहतत्विषम् । धरण्यां पातयिष्यामि प्रेक्षतस्ते महामुने ॥
data.md: Before your eyes, O great ascetic, I shall today hurl down on the Earth the wicked Nahusha who shall be deprived of all power on account of the cries of Fie that will be uttered from all sides.

data.v: नहुषं पापकर्माणमैश्वर्यबलमोहितम् । यथा च रोचते तुभ्यं तथा कर्तास्म्यहं मुने ॥
data.md: Indeed, I shall hurl down Nahusha today, that sinful man, who has, besides, been stupefied by lordship and power. I shall do this, if you like it, О ascetic.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु भृगुणा मैत्रावरुणिरव्ययः । अगस्त्यः परमप्रीतो बभूव विगतज्वरः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by Bhrigu, Mitravaruna's son Agastya of unfading power and glory, became highly pleased and freed from every anxiety.

data.v: कथं स वै विपन्नश्च कथं वै पातितो भुवि । कथं चानिन्द्रतां प्राप्तस्तद्भवान्वक्तुमर्हति ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said How was Nahusha plunged into distress? How was he hurled down on the Earth? How, indeed, was he deprived of the sovereignty of the celestials? You should recite everything to me.

data.v: एवं तयोः संवदतोः क्रियास्तस्य महात्मनः । सर्वा एवाभ्यवर्तन्त या दिव्या याश्च मानुषाः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus did those two Rishis, viz., Bhrigu and Agastya, talk with each other, I have already told you how Nahusha, when he first become the king of the celestials, acted in a proper way. Indeed, that great royal sage performed all human and celestial deeds.

data.v: तथैव दीपदानानि सर्वोपकरणानि च । बलिकर्म च यच्चान्यदुत्सेकाश्च पृथग्विधाः । सर्वास्तस्य समुत्पन्ना देवराज्ञो महात्मनः ॥
data.md: Nahusha who had become the king of the celestials, made gifts of light, and properly deserved all other rites of a similar nature, the due presentation of Balis, and all rites as are performed on especially sacred days. Pious acts are always done by wise men, in both the world of men and that of the celestials, Indeed, O foremost of kings, if such acts are observed, householders always succeed in acquiring prosperity and aggrandisement.

data.v: देवलोके नृलोके च सदाचारा बुधैः स्मृताः । ते चेद्भवन्ति राजेन्द्र ऋध्यन्ते गृहमेधिनः । धूपप्रदानैर्दीपैश्च नमस्कारैस्तथैव च ॥
data.md: Even such is the effect of the gift of lamps and of incense, as also of bows and prostrations, to the celestials.

data.v: यथा सिद्धस्य चान्नस्य द्विजायाग्रं प्रदीयते । बलयश्च गृहोद्देशे अतः प्रीयन्ति देवताः ॥
data.md: When food is cooked, the first portion thereof should be offered to a Brahmana. The particular offerings called Bali should also be presented to the household gods. The deities become pleased with such gifts.

data.v: यथा च गृहिणस्तोषो भवेद्वै बलिकर्मणा । तथा शतगुणा प्रीतिर्देवतानां स्म जायते ॥
data.md: It is also well known that the measure of gratification which the celestials derive from such offerings is a hundred times as great as that which the householder himself gets from making them.

data.v: एवं धूपप्रदानं च दीपदानं च साधवः । प्रशंसन्ति नमस्कारैर्युक्तमात्मगुणावहम् ॥
data.md: Pious and wise persons make offering of incense and lights, accompanying them with bows and prostrations. Such acts always yield advancement and prosperity to those that do them.

data.v: स्नानेनाद्भिश्च यत्कर्म क्रियते वै विपश्चिता । नमस्कारप्रयुक्तेन तेन प्रीयन्ति देवताः । गृह्याश्च देवताः सर्वाः प्रीयन्ते विधिनार्चिताः ॥
data.md: Those rites which the learned perform in course of their ablutions, and with the help of waters, accompanied with bows to the gods, always contribute to the satisfaction of the celestials.

data.v: इत्येतां बुद्धिमास्थाय नहुषः स नरेश्वरः । सुरेन्द्रत्वं महत्प्राप्य कृतवानेतदद्भुतम् ॥
data.md: Filled with such ideas, Nahusha, that great king, when he obtained the sovereignty of the celestials, observed all these rites and duties fraught with great glory.

data.v: कस्यचित्त्वथ कालस्य भाग्यक्षय उपस्थिते । सर्वमेतदवज्ञाय न चकारैतदीदृशम् ॥
data.md: Sometime after, the good fortune of Nahusha decreased, and as the outcome of it, he neglected all these observances and began to act in defiance of all control in the manner I have already described.

data.v: ततः स परिहीणोऽभूत्सुरेन्द्रो बलिकर्मतः । धूपदीपोदकविधिं न यथावच्चकार ह । ततोऽस्य यज्ञविषयो रक्षोभिः पर्यबाध्यत ॥
data.md: The king of the celestials, on account of his abstention from observing the ordinances about the offers of incense and light, began to decline in power.

data.v: अथागस्त्यमृषिश्रेष्ठं वाहनायाजुहाव ह । द्रुतं सरस्वतीकूलात्स्मयन्निव महाबलः ॥
ततो भृगुर्महातेजा मैत्रावरुणिमब्रवीत् । निमीलयस्व नयने जटा यावद्विशामि ते ॥
स्थाणुभूतस्य तस्याथ जटाः प्राविशदच्युतः । भृगुः स सुमहातेजाः पातनाय नृपस्य ह ॥
data.md: Do you shut your eyes till I enter into the matted locks on your head. Having said this, Bhrigu of unfading glory and great energy entered into the matted locks of Agastya who stood still like a wooden post, for hurling king Nahusha from the throne of Heaven. Soon after Nahusha saw Agastya approach him for bearing his car.

data.v: ततः स देवराट्प्राप्तस्तमृषिं वाहनाय वै । ततोऽगस्त्यः सुरपतिं वाक्यमाह विशां पते ॥
योजयस्वेन्द्र मां क्षिप्रं कं च देशं वहामि ते । यत्र वक्ष्यसि तत्र त्वां नयिष्यामि सुराधिप ॥
इत्युक्तो नहुषस्तेन योजयामास तं मुनिम् । भृगुस्तस्य जटासंस्थो बभूव हृषितो भृशम् ॥
न चापि दर्शनं तस्य चकार स भृगुस्तदा । वरदानप्रभावज्ञो नहुषस्य महात्मनः ॥
न चुकोप स चागस्त्यो युक्तोऽपि नहुषेण वै । तं तु राजा प्रतोदेन चोदयामास भारत ॥
न चुकोप स धर्मात्मा ततः पादेन देवराट् । अगस्त्यस्य तदा क्रुद्धो वामेनाभ्यहनच्छिरः ॥
तस्मिञ्शिरस्यभिहते स जटान्तर्गतो भृगुः । शशाप बलवत्क्रुद्धो नहुषं पापचेतसम् ॥
यस्मात्पदाहनः क्रोधाच्छिरसीमं महामुनिम् । तस्मादाशु महीं गच्छ सर्पो भूत्वा सुदुर्मते ॥
इत्युक्तः स तदा तेन सर्पो भूत्वा पपात ह । अदृष्टेनाथ भृगुणा भूतले भरतर्षभ ॥
भृगुं हि यदि सोऽद्राक्षीन्नहुषः पृथिवीपते । न स शक्तोऽभविष्यद्वै पातने तस्य तेजसा ॥
स तु तैस्तैः प्रदानैश्च तपोभिर्नियमैस्तथा । पतितोऽपि महाराज भूतले स्मृतिमानभूत् । प्रसादयामास भृगुं शापान्तो मे भवेदिति ॥
ततोऽगस्त्यः कृपाविष्टः प्रासादयत तं भृगुम् । शापान्तार्थं महाराज स च प्रादात्कृपान्वितः ॥
data.md: Agastya also, filled with mercy joined Nahusha in pacifying Bhrigu for the termination of the curse. At last Bhrigu felt mercy for Nahusha and arranged for the working out of the curse.

data.v: राजा युधिष्ठिरो नाम भविष्यति कुरूद्वहः । स त्वां मोक्षयिता शापादित्युक्त्वान्तरधीयत ॥
data.md: Bhrigu said There will appear a king (on Earth) of the name of Yudhishthira, the foremost of his race. He will rescue you from this curse! Having said this, the Rishi disappeared from the presence of Nahusha.

data.v: अगस्त्योऽपि महातेजाः कृत्वा कार्यं शतक्रतोः । स्वमाश्रमपदं प्रायात्पूज्यमानो द्विजातिभिः ॥
data.md: Agastya also, of great energy, having thus performed the business of the true Indra, that arbitrator of a hundred sacrifices, returned to his hermitage, adored of all members of the regenerate order.

data.v: नहुषोऽपि त्वया राजंस्तस्माच्छापात्समुद्धृतः । जगाम ब्रह्मसदनं पश्यतस्ते जनाधिप ॥
data.md: You have, o king rescued Nahusha from Bhrigu's curse. Rescued by you, he ascended to the region of Brahman before your eyes.

data.v: तदा तु पातयित्वा तं नहुषं भूतले भृगुः । जगाम ब्रह्मसदनं ब्रह्मणे च न्यवेदयत् ॥
data.md: As regards, Bhrigu, having hurled Nahusha on the Earth, he went to the region of Brahman and informed the Grandfather of it.

data.v: ततः शक्रं समानाय्य देवानाह पितामहः । वरदानान्मम सुरा नहुषो राज्यमाप्तवान् । स चागस्त्येन क्रुद्धेन भ्रंशितो भूतलं गतः ॥
data.md: The Grandfather having called Indra back, addressed the celestials, saying, You celestials, through the boon I had granted him, Nahusha had obtained the sovereignty of Heaven.

data.v: न च शक्यं विना राज्ञा सुरा वर्तयितुं क्वचित् । तस्मादयं पुनः शक्रो देवराज्येऽभिषिच्यताम् ॥
एवं संभाषमाणं तु देवाः पार्थ पितामहम् । एवमस्त्विति संहृष्टाः प्रत्यूचुस्ते पितामहम् ॥
सोऽभिषिक्तो भगवता देवराज्येन वासवः । ब्रह्मणा राजशार्दूल यथापूर्वं व्यरोचत ॥
एवमेतत्पुरावृत्तं नहुषस्य व्यतिक्रमात् । स च तैरेव संसिद्धो नहुषः कर्मभिः पुनः ॥
तस्माद्दीपाः प्रदातव्याः सायं वै गृहमेधिभिः । दिव्यं चक्षुरवाप्नोति प्रेत्य दीपप्रदायकः । पूर्णचन्द्रप्रतीकाशा दीपदाश्च भवन्त्युत ॥
data.md: The giver of lights is sure to win celestial vision after death. Givers of light become as resplendent as the full moon.

data.v: यावदक्षिनिमेषाणि ज्वलते तावतीः समाः । रूपवान्धनवांश्चापि नरो भवति दीपदः ॥
data.md: The giver of lights becomes gifted with beauty of form and strength for years corresponding with the number of twinkles for which the lights given by him burn or blaze.

data.v: ब्राह्मणस्वानि ये मन्दा हरन्ति भरतर्षभ । नृशंसकारिणो मूढाः क्व ते गच्छन्ति मानवाः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Where do those foolish, wretched, and sinful men go, O king, who steal misappropriate such articles as belong to Brahmanas? or

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । चण्डालस्य च संवादं क्षत्रबन्धोश्च भारत ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited an old history of the conversation between Vrishadarbhi and the seven Rishis, O Bharata.

data.v: वृद्धरूपोऽसि चण्डाल बालवच्च विचेष्टसे । श्वखराणां रजःसेवी कस्मादुद्विजसे गवाम् ॥
data.md: This Kshatriya said You seem, O Chandala, to be old in years, but your conduct appears to be like that of a boy! Your body is besmeared with the dust raised by dogs and asses, but without minding thal dust you are anxious about the little drops of milk that have fallen upon you persons.

data.v: साधुभिर्गर्हितं कर्म चण्डालस्य विधीयते । कस्माद्गोरजसा ध्वस्तमपां कुण्डे निषिञ्चसि ॥
data.md: It is plain that such acts as are censured by the pious are ordained for the Chandala. Why, indeed, do you seek to wash off the spots of milk from your body.

data.v: ब्राह्मणस्य गवां राजन्ह्रियतीनां रजः पुरा । सोममुद्ध्वंसयामास तं सोमं येऽपिबन्द्विजाः ॥
दीक्षितश्च स राजापि क्षिप्रं नरकमाविशत् । सह तैर्याजकैः सर्वैर्ब्रह्मस्वमुपजीव्य तत् ॥
data.md: The Chandala said Formerly, O king, certain kine belonging to a Brahmana were stolen, While they were being carried away, some milk from their udders dropped upon a number of Soma plants that grew by the roadside. Those Brahmanas who drank the juice of the plants thus bedewed with milk, as also the king who celebrated the sacrifice in which that Soma was drunk, had to sink in hell. Indeed, for having thus appropriated something belonging to a Brahmana, the king with all the Brahmanas who had helped him had to go to hell.

data.v: येऽपि तत्रापिबन्क्षीरं घृतं दधि च मानवाः । ब्राह्मणाः सहराजन्याः सर्वे नरकमाविशन् ॥
data.md: All those men also, Brahmanas and Kshatriyas, who drank milk or clarified butter or curds, in the palace of the king who had stolen the Brahmana's kine, had to fall into hell.

data.v: जघ्नुस्ताः पयसा पुत्रांस्तथा पौत्रान्विधुन्वतीः । पशूनवेक्षमाणाश्च साधुवृत्तेन दंपती ॥
data.md: The stolen kine also, shaking their bodies, killed with their milk the sons and grandsons of those who had stolen them, as also the king and the queen although the latter treated the animals, with great care and attention.

data.v: अहं तत्रावसं राजन्ब्रह्मचारी जितेन्द्रियः । तासां मे रजसा ध्वस्तं भैक्षमासीन्नराधिप ॥
data.md: As for myself, O king, I used to live the life of a celibate in that place where these kine were placed after they had been stolen away. The food I had got by begging became sprinkled over with the milk of those kine.

data.v: चण्डालोऽहं ततो राजन्भुक्त्वा तदभवं मृतः । ब्रह्मस्वहारी च नृपः सोऽप्रतिष्ठां गतिं ययौ ॥
data.md: Having taken that food, O Kshatriya, I have, in this life, become a Chandala. The king who had stolen the kine belonging to a Brahmana came by a wretched end.

data.v: तस्माद्धरेन्न विप्रस्वं कदाचिदपि किंचन । ब्रह्मस्वरजसा ध्वस्तं भुक्त्वा मां पश्य यादृशम् ॥
data.md: Hence, one should never steal or appropriate anything belonging to a Brahmana. Mark, to what state I am reduced on account of my having eaten food that had been sprinkled over with milk belonging to a Brahmana.

data.v: तस्मात्सोमोऽप्यविक्रेयः पुरुषेण विपश्चिता । विक्रयं हीह सोमस्य गर्हयन्ति मनीषिणः ॥
data.md: It is for this reason that Soma plants should never be destroyed by wise men. They who sell the Soma plant are held in low esteem by the wise.

data.v: ये चैनं क्रीणते राजन्ये च विक्रीणते जनाः । ते तु वैवस्वतं प्राप्य रौरवं यान्ति सर्वशः ॥
data.md: Indeed, O son, they who purchase Soma and they who sell it, both sink in the hell called Raurava after death.

data.v: सोमं तु रजसा ध्वस्तं विक्रीयाद्बुद्धिपूर्वकम् । श्रोत्रियो वार्धुषी भूत्वा चिररात्राय नश्यति । नरकं त्रिंशतं प्राप्य श्वविष्ठामुपजीवति ॥
data.md: That man who, possessing a knowledge of the Vedas, duly sells Soma, becomes in his next life a usurer and speedily meets with destruction.

data.v: श्वचर्यामतिमानं च सखिदारेषु विप्लवम् । तुलयाधारयद्धर्मो ह्यतिमानोऽतिरिच्यते ॥
श्वानं वै पापिनं पश्य विवर्णं हरिणं कृशम् । अतिमानेन भूतानामिमां गतिमुपागतम् ॥
अहं वै विपुले जातः कुले धनसमन्विते । अन्यस्मिञ्जन्मनि विभो ज्ञानविज्ञानपारगः ॥
अभवं तत्र जानानो ह्येतान्दोषान्मदात्तदा । संरब्ध एव भूतानां पृष्ठमांसान्यभक्षयम् ॥
सोऽहं तेन च वृत्तेन भोजनेन च तेन वै । इमामवस्थां संप्राप्तः पश्य कालस्य पर्ययम् ॥
आदीप्तमिव चैलान्तं भ्रमरैरिव चार्दितम् । धावमानं सुसंरब्धं पश्य मां रजसान्वितम् ॥
स्वाध्यायैस्तु महत्पापं तरन्ति गृहमेधिनः । दानैः पृथग्विधैश्चापि यथा प्राहुर्मनीषिणः ॥
तथा पापकृतं विप्रमाश्रमस्थं महीपते । सर्वसङ्गविनिर्मुक्तं छन्दांस्युत्तारयन्त्युत ॥
अहं तु पापयोन्यां वै प्रसूतः क्षत्रियर्षभ । निश्चयं नाधिगच्छामि कथं मुच्येयमित्युत ॥
जातिस्मरत्वं तु मम केनचित्पूर्वकर्मणा । शुभेन येन मोक्षं वै प्राप्तुमिच्छाम्यहं नृप ॥
data.md: I cannot see clearly how I may succeed in purifying myself from all sins. On account of some meritorious deed of a former life, I have not lost the memory of my previous births.

data.v: त्वमिमं मे प्रपन्नाय संशयं ब्रूहि पृच्छते । चण्डालत्वात्कथमहं मुच्येयमिति सत्तम ॥
data.md: O king, I throw myself on your mercy! I ask you. Do you remove my doubt. By what auspicious course of conduct should I wish to acquire my liberation? O foremost of men, by what means shall I succeed in getting rid of my Chandalahood.

data.v: चण्डाल प्रतिजानीहि येन मोक्षमवाप्स्यसि । ब्राह्मणार्थे त्यजन्प्राणान्गतिमिष्टामवाप्स्यसि ॥
data.md: The Kshatriya said Know, O Chandala, the means by which you may be able to acquire liberation. By renouncing your life for the sake of a Brahmana, you may come by a desirable end.

data.v: दत्त्वा शरीरं क्रव्याद्भ्यो रणाग्नौ द्विजहेतुकम् । हुत्वा प्राणान्प्रमोक्षस्ते नान्यथा मोक्षमर्हसि ॥
data.md: By throwing your body on the fire of battle as a libation to the beasts and birds of prey for the sake of a Brahmana, indeed, by renouncing your life thus, you may achieve liberation. By no other means will you succeed in acquitting it.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तदा राजन्ब्रह्मस्वार्थे परंतप । हुत्वा रणमुखे प्राणान्गतिमिष्टामवाप ह ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus accosted, that Chandala, O scorcher of enemies, poured his lifebreaths as a libation on the fire of battle for the sake of protecting a Brahmana's riches and as the result of that act attained to a very desirable end.

data.v: तस्माद्रक्ष्यं त्वया पुत्र ब्रह्मस्वं भरतर्षभ । यदीच्छसि महाबाहो शाश्वतीं गतिमुत्तमाम् ॥
data.md: Hence, O son, you should always protect the property of the Brahmanas, if, O chicf of Bharata's race, you wish, O you of mighty arms, an end consisting of eternal happiness. Hence, O son, you should always protect the property of the Brahmanas, if, O chicf of Bharata's race, you wish, O you of mighty arms, an end consisting of eternal happiness.

data.v: एको लोकः सुकृतिनां सर्वे त्वाहो पितामह । उत तत्रापि नानात्वं तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O grandfather, it has been said that all righteous men attain to the same region after death. It is true, O Bharata, that there is difference of position among them?

data.v: कर्मभिः पार्थ नानात्वं लोकानां यान्ति मानवाः । पुण्यान्पुण्यकृतो यान्ति पापान्पापकृतो जनाः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said By different acts, O son of Pritha, men acquire different regions. They who are righteous in conduct acquire blissful regions, while they who are sinful acquire miserable regions.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । गौतमस्य मुनेस्तात संवादं वासवस्य च ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited an old history of the conversation between Vrishadarbhi and the seven Rishis, O Bharata.

data.v: ब्राह्मणो गौतमः कश्चिन्मृदुर्दान्तो जितेन्द्रियः । महावने हस्तिशिशुं परिद्यूनममातृकम् ॥
data.md: A certain Brahmana named Gautama, mild and selfcontrolled and with all his senses under complete control, saw an infant elephant that had lost his mother and that was highly cheerless on that account.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा जीवयामास सानुक्रोशो धृतव्रतः । स तु दीर्घेण कालेन बभूवातिबलो महान् ॥
data.md: Full of mercy and steady in the observance of his vows, the ascetic nursed that infant animal. After a long time the little beast grew up into a large and powerful elephant.

data.v: तं प्रभिन्नं महानागं प्रस्रुतं सर्वतो मदम् । धृतराष्ट्रस्य रूपेण शक्रो जग्राह हस्तिनम् ॥
data.md: One day, Indra, in the guise of king Dhritarashtra, scized that powerful clephant which was as huge as a hill and from whose rent temples the juice was trickling down.

data.v: ह्रियमाणं तु तं दृष्ट्वा गौतमः संशितव्रतः । अभ्यभाषत राजानं धृतराष्ट्रं महातपाः ॥
मा मे हार्षीर्हस्तिनं पुत्रमेनं; दुःखात्पुष्टं धृतराष्ट्राकृतज्ञ । मित्रं सतां सप्तपदं वदन्ति; मित्रद्रोहो नैव राजन्स्पृशेत्त्वाम् ॥
इध्मोदकप्रदातारं शून्यपालकमाश्रमे । विनीतमाचार्यकुले सुयुक्तं गुरुकर्मणि ॥
शिष्टं दान्तं कृतज्ञं च प्रियं च सततं मम । न मे विक्रोशतो राजन्हर्तुमर्हसि कुञ्जरम् ॥
data.md: Gautamia said You should not, O king, take away by force this elephant which brings me my fuel and water, which protects my hermitage when I am away, which is exceedingly docile and obedient to his instructor, which carefully does what his preceptor commands, which is mild and wellbroken, and which is grateful and very dear to me. Indeed, you should not take it away without caring for my protestalions and cries.

data.v: गवां सहस्रं भवते ददामि; दासीशतं निष्कशतानि पञ्च । अन्यच्च वित्तं विविधं महर्षे; किं ब्राह्मणस्येह गजेन कृत्यम् ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said I shall give you a thousand kine, a hundred maidservants, and five hundred pieces of gold. I shall also, O great Rishi, give you various other kinds of wealth. What use can Brahmanas have with elephant?

data.v: त्वामेव गावोऽभि भवन्तु राज;न्दास्यः सनिष्का विविधं च रत्नम् । अन्यच्च वित्तं विविधं नरेन्द्र; किं ब्राह्मणस्येह धनेन कृत्यम् ॥
data.md: Gautama said Keep O king, your kine and maid servants and coins of gold and various gems and various other kinds of riches. What, o king, have Brahmanas to do with riches.

data.v: ब्राह्मणानां हस्तिभिर्नास्ति कृत्यं; राजन्यानां नागकुलानि विप्र । स्वं वाहनं नयतो नास्त्यधर्मो; नागश्रेष्ठाद्गौतमास्मान्निवर्त ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Brahmanas have no use for elephants. Indeed, O learned Brahmana, elephants are intended for Kshatriyas. In taking away an animal, viz., this foremost of elephants, for my use, I cannot be considered as committing any sin. Do you cease obstructing me thus, o Gautama.

data.v: यत्र प्रेतो नन्दति पुण्यकर्मा; यत्र प्रेतः शोचति पापकर्मा । वैवस्वतस्य सदने महात्मन;स्तत्र त्वाहं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
data.md: Gautama said O illustrious king, going even to that region of Yama where the pious live happily and the sinful in grief, I shall take from you this my elephants.

data.v: ये निष्क्रिया नास्तिकाः श्रद्दधानाः; पापात्मान इन्द्रियार्थे निविष्टाः । यमस्य ते यातनां प्राप्नुवन्ति; परं गन्ता धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said They who are destitute of religious acts, they who have no religious faith and are atheists, they who are sinful and are always engaged in pleasing their appetites only they have to go to the region of Yama and suffer the misery he inflicts. Dhritarashtra shall go to a higher region and not there.

data.v: वैवस्वती संयमनी जनानां; यत्रानृतं नोच्यते यत्र सत्यम् । यत्राबला बलिनं यातयन्ति; तत्र त्वाहं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
data.md: Gautama said Men are restrained in the region of Yama. No falsehood can be told there. Only truth prevails in that place. There the weak persecute the strong. Going there I shall compel you to yield up this elephant to me.

data.v: ज्येष्ठां स्वसारं पितरं मातरं च; गुरुं यथा मानयन्तश्चरन्ति । तथाविधानामेष लोको महर्षे; परं गन्ता धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Only those persons who, intoxicated with pride, treat their eldest sister and father and mother as enemies, have to go, O great ascetic, to such a region. I shall go to a higher region. Indeed, Dhritarashtra shall not have to go there.

data.v: मन्दाकिनी वैश्रवणस्य राज्ञो; महाभोगा भोगिजनप्रवेश्या । गन्धर्वयक्षैरप्सरोभिश्च जुष्टा; तत्र त्वाहं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
data.md: Gautama said Those highly blessed ones go to the region called Mandakini, of king Vaishravana for enjoying joy and comfort. There live Gandharvas and Yakshas and Apsaras. Going even there, O kine, I shall compel you to yield up this elephant to me.

data.v: अतिथिव्रताः सुव्रता ये जना वै; प्रतिश्रयं ददति ब्राह्मणेभ्यः । शिष्टाशिनः संविभज्याश्रितांश्च; मन्दाकिनीं तेऽपि विभूषयन्ति ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Those persons who consider hospitality to guests as a vow, who observe good vows, who give shelter to Brahmanas, and who eat what remains after distribution among his dependants, adorn the region called Mandakini of Kubera. I shall not go there, for a higher region is reserved for me.

data.v: मेरोरग्रे यद्वनं भाति रम्यं; सुपुष्पितं किंनरगीतजुष्टम् । सुदर्शना यत्र जम्बूर्विशाला; तत्र त्वाहं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
data.md: Gautama said If you go to those charming woods, decked with flowers, which stand on the summit of Meru, which echo with the melodious notes of Kinnaris, and which are graced with beautiful Jamvus of wide spreading branches, I shall proceed even there and compell you to yield up this elephant to me. Dhritarashtra said

data.v: ये ब्राह्मणा मृदवः सत्यशीला; बहुश्रुताः सर्वभूताभिरामाः । येऽधीयन्ते सेतिहासं पुराणं; मध्वाहुत्या जुह्वति च द्विजेभ्यः ॥
तथाविधानामेष लोको महर्षे; परं गन्ता धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र । यद्विद्यते विदितं स्थानमस्ति; तद्ब्रूहि त्वं त्वरितो ह्येष यामि ॥
सुपुष्पितं किंनरराजजुष्टं; प्रियं वनं नन्दनं नारदस्य । गन्धर्वाणामप्सरसां च सद्म; तत्र त्वाहं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
data.md: Gautama said If you go to the woods owned by Narada and held dear by him, which are adorned with flowers and which echo with the melodious songs of the prince of Kinnaras, and which are the eternal habitation of Gandharvas an Apsaras. I shall follow you there and compell you to yield up this elephant to me.

data.v: ये नृत्तगीतकुशला जनाः सदा; ह्ययाचमानाः सहिताश्चरन्ति । तथाविधानामेष लोको महर्षे; परं गन्ता धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said They who never beg, they who cultivate music and dancing, and always move about happily, proceed to such regions. O great Rishi, I shall go to a region which is higher. Indeed Dhritarashtra shall not have to go there.

data.v: यत्रोत्तराः कुरवो भान्ति रम्या; देवैः सार्धं मोदमाना नरेन्द्र । यत्राग्नियौनाश्च वसन्ति विप्रा; ह्ययोनयः पर्वतयोनयश्च ॥
यत्र शक्रो वर्षति सर्वकामा;न्यत्र स्त्रियः कामचाराश्चरन्ति । यत्र चेर्ष्या नास्ति नारीनराणां; तत्र त्वाहं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
ये सर्वभूतेषु निवृत्तकामा; अमांसादा न्यस्तदण्डाश्चरन्ति । न हिंसन्ति स्थावरं जङ्गमं च; भूतानां ये सर्वभूतात्मभूताः ॥
निराशिषो निर्ममा वीतरागा; लाभालाभे तुल्यनिन्दाप्रशंसाः । तथाविधानामेष लोको महर्षे; परं गन्ता धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र ॥
ततः परं भान्ति लोकाः सनातनाः; सुपुण्यगन्धा निर्मला वीतशोकाः । सोमस्य राज्ञः सदने महात्मन;स्तत्र त्वाहं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
data.md: Gautama said Next to these shine in beauty those eternal regions, full of excellent perfumes which are free from passions of every kind and which are destitute of sorrow. These forin the abode of the great king Soma. If you go there, even there shall I proceed and compell you to yield up this elephant to me.

data.v: ये दानशीला न प्रतिगृह्णते सदा; न चाप्यर्थानाददते परेभ्यः । येषामदेयमर्हते नास्ति किंचि;त्सर्वातिथ्याः सुप्रसादा जनाश्च ॥
ये क्षन्तारो नाभिजल्पन्ति चान्या;ञ्शक्ता भूत्वा सततं पुण्यशीलाः । तथाविधानामेष लोको महर्षे; परं गन्ता धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र ॥
ततः परं भान्ति लोकाः सनातना; विरजसो वितमस्का विशोकाः । आदित्यस्य सुमहान्तः सुवृत्ता;स्तत्र त्वाहं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
data.md: Gautama said Next to these shine in beauty those eternal regions, full of excellent perfumes which are free from passions of every kind and which are destitute of sorrow. These forin the abode of the great king Soma. If you go there, even there shall I proceed and compell you to yield up this elephant to me.

data.v: स्वाध्यायशीला गुरुशुश्रूषणे रता;स्तपस्विनः सुव्रताः सत्यसंधाः । आचार्याणामप्रतिकूलभाषिणो; नित्योत्थिता गुरुकर्मस्वचोद्याः ॥
तथाविधानामेष लोको महर्षे; विशुद्धानां भावितवाङ्मतीनाम् । सत्ये स्थितानां वेदविदां महात्मनां; परं गन्ता धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र ॥
ततः परे भान्ति लोकाः सनातनाः; सुपुण्यगन्धा विरजा विशोकाः । वरुणस्य राज्ञः सदने महात्मन;स्तत्र त्वाहं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
data.md: Gautama said Next to these shine in beauty those eternal regions, full of excellent perfumes which are free from passions of every kind and which are destitute of sorrow. These forin the abode of the great king Soma. If you go there, even there shall I proceed and compell you to yield up this elephant to me.

data.v: चातुर्मास्यैर्ये यजन्ते जनाः सदा; तथेष्टीनां दशशतं प्राप्नुवन्ति । ये चाग्निहोत्रं जुह्वति श्रद्दधाना; यथान्यायं त्रीणि वर्षाणि विप्राः ॥
स्वदारिणां धर्मधुरे महात्मनां; यथोचिते वर्त्मनि सुस्थितानाम् । धर्मात्मनामुद्वहतां गतिं तां; परं गन्ता धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र ॥
इन्द्रस्य लोका विरजा विशोका; दुरन्वयाः काङ्क्षिता मानवानाम् । तस्याहं ते भवने भूरितेजसो; राजन्निमं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
data.md: Gautama said Above them are the regions of Indra, free from passion and sorrow, which are difficult of access and coveted by all men. Going even to the abode of indra himself of great energy, I shall, O king, compel you to yield up this elephant to me.

data.v: शतवर्षजीवी यश्च शूरो मनुष्यो; वेदाध्यायी यश्च यज्वाप्रमत्तः । एते सर्वे शक्रलोकं व्रजन्ति; परं गन्ता धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said He who lives for a hundred years, who is gifted with heroism, who studies the Vedas and who celebrates sacrifices with devotion, indeed, such men proceed to the region of Shakra. I shall go to a higher region, Indeed, Dhritarashtra shall not go there.

data.v: प्राजापत्याः सन्ति लोका महान्तो; नाकस्य पृष्ठे पुष्कला वीतशोकाः । मनीषिताः सर्वलोकोद्भवानां; तत्र त्वाहं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
data.md: Gautama said Above the firmament are the regions of the Prajapatis, of superior happiness, abounding in every happiness, and shorn of sorrow. Belonging to those powerful ones from whom the creation has originated, they are coveted by all persons. If you go there, even their shall I go and compel you to yield up this elephant to me.

data.v: ये राजानो राजसूयाभिषिक्ता; धर्मात्मानो रक्षितारः प्रजानाम् । ये चाश्वमेधावभृथाप्लुताङ्गा;स्तेषां लोका धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said Those kings who have bathed upon the termination of the Rajasuya sacrifice, who are gifted with righteous souls, who have protected their subjects properly, and who have washed their limbs with purified water upon the termination of the Horsesacrifice, go to such regions. Indeed Dhritarashtra shall not go there.

data.v: ततः परं भान्ति लोकाः सनातनाः; सुपुण्यगन्धा विरजा वीतशोकाः । तस्मिन्नहं दुर्लभे त्वाप्रधृष्ये; गवां लोके हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
data.md: Gautama said Next to these shine in beauty those eternal regions, full of excellent perfumes which are free from passions of every kind and which are destitute of sorrow. These forin the abode of the great king Soma. If you go there, even there shall I proceed and compell you to yield up this elephant to me.

data.v: यो गोसहस्री शतदः समां समां; यो गोशती दश दद्याच्च शक्त्या । तथा दशभ्यो यश्च दद्यादिहैकां; पञ्चभ्यो वा दानशीलस्तथैकाम् ॥
ये जीर्यन्ते ब्रह्मचर्येण विप्रा; ब्राह्मीं वाचं परिरक्षन्ति चैव । मनस्विनस्तीर्थयात्रापरायणा;स्ते तत्र मोदन्ति गवां विमाने ॥
प्रभासं मानसं पुण्यं पुष्कराणि महत्सरः । पुण्यं च नैमिषं तीर्थं बाहुदां करतोयिनीम् ॥
गयां गयशिरश्चैव विपाशां स्थूलवालुकाम् । तूष्णींगङ्गां दशगङ्गां महाह्रदमथापि च ॥
गौतमीं कौशिकीं पाकां महात्मानो धृतव्रताः । सरस्वतीदृषद्वत्यौ यमुनां ये प्रयान्ति च ॥
तत्र ते दिव्यसंस्थाना दिव्यमाल्यधराः शिवाः । प्रयान्ति पुण्यगन्धाढ्या धृतराष्ट्रो न तत्र वै ॥
यत्र शीतभयं नास्ति न चोष्णभयमण्वपि । न क्षुत्पिपासे न ग्लानिर्न दुःखं न सुखं तथा ॥
data.md: Gautama said Next to these are regions where there is no fear of the least cold or heat, no hunger, no thirst, no pain, no sorrow, no joy, no one who is agreeable or disagreeable, no friend, and no enemy, no decrepitude and no death, and where there is neither virtue nor sin.

data.v: न द्वेष्यो न प्रियः कश्चिन्न बन्धुर्न रिपुस्तथा । न जरामरणे वापि न पुण्यं न च पातकम् ॥
data.md: Gautama said Next to these are regions where there is no fear of the least cold or heat, no hunger, no thirst, no pain, no sorrow, no joy, no one who is agreeable or disagreeable, no friend, and no enemy, no decrepitude and no death, and where there is neither virtue nor sin.

data.v: तस्मिन्विरजसि स्फीते प्रज्ञासत्त्वव्यवस्थिते । स्वयंभुभवने पुण्ये हस्तिनं मे यतिष्यति ॥
data.md: Going, even to that region which is freed from passion, which is full of happiness, and where there is wisdom and the quality of Sattwa, indeed, going to even that sacred abode of the selfcreate Brahman, I shall compel you to yield up this elephant to me.

data.v: निर्मुक्ताः सर्वसङ्गेभ्यो कृतात्मानो यतव्रताः । अध्यात्मयोगसंस्थाने युक्ताः स्वर्गगतिं गताः ॥
ते ब्रह्मभवनं पुण्यं प्राप्नुवन्तीह सात्त्विकाः । न तत्र धृतराष्ट्रस्ते शक्यो द्रष्टुं महामुने ॥
रथन्तरं यत्र बृहच्च गीयते; यत्र वेदी पुण्डरीकैः स्तृणोति । यत्रोपयाति हरिभिः सोमपीथी; तत्र त्वाहं हस्तिनं यातयिष्ये ॥
data.md: Gautama said There where the foremost of Rathantaras is sung, where altars are covered with the sacred Kusha blades, for the celebration of Pundarika sacrifices, there where Soma drinking Brahmanas sojourn on cars drawn by excellent horses, going even there I shall compel you to yield up this elephant.

data.v: बुध्यामि त्वां वृत्रहणं शतक्रतुं; व्यतिक्रमन्तं भुवनानि विश्वा । कच्चिन्न वाचा वृजिनं कदाचि;दकार्षं ते मनसोऽभिषङ्गात् ॥
data.md: I think you are the destroyer of Vritra, viz., the god who has celebrated a hundred sacrifices, engaged in passing through all the regions of the universe. I hope I have not through mental weakness, committed any fault by the words I have addressed you.

data.v: यस्मादिमं लोकपथं प्रजाना;मन्वागमं पदवादे गजस्य । तस्माद्भवान्प्रणतं मानुशास्तु; ब्रवीषि यत्तत्करवाणि सर्वम् ॥
data.md: The God of a hundred sacrifices said Yes, I am Maghavat. I come on earth for seizing this elephant. I bow to you. Do you command me. I shall immediately accomplish all that you may be pleased to say.

data.v: श्वेतं करेणुं मम पुत्रनागं; यं मेऽहार्षीर्दशवर्षाणि बालम् । यो मे वने वसतोऽभूद्द्वितीय;स्तमेव मे देहि सुरेन्द्र नागम् ॥
data.md: Gautama said Do you give me, O king, of the celestials, this white elephant that is so young, for it is only ten years of age. I have raised it as a child of my own. Living in this forest, it has grown under my eye and has been to me a dear companion. Do you set free this my child that you have seized and wish to take away.

data.v: अयं सुतस्ते द्विजमुख्य नाग;श्चाघ्रायते त्वामभिवीक्षमाणः । पादौ च ते नासिकयोपजिघ्रते; श्रेयो मम ध्याहि नमश्च तेऽस्तु ॥
data.md: The god of a hundred sacrifices said This elephant that has been a son, to you, O foremost of Brahmanas, comes to you loO king wistfully at you. See, it smells your feet with its nostrils. My salutations to you. Do you pray for my wellbeing.

data.v: शिवं सदैवेह सुरेन्द्र तुभ्यं; ध्यायामि पूजां च सदा प्रयुञ्जे । ममापि त्वं शक्र शिवं ददस्व; त्वया दत्तं प्रतिगृह्णामि नागम् ॥
data.md: Gautama said O king, of the celestials, I do always think of your good. I always offer you worship. Do you also, O Shakra, impart your blessings to me. Given by you, I accept this elephant.

data.v: येषां वेदा निहिता वै गुहायां; मनीषिणां सत्त्ववतां महात्मनाम् । तेषां त्वयैकेन महात्मनास्मि; बुद्धस्तस्मात्प्रीतिमांस्तेऽहमद्य ॥
data.md: The God of a hundred sacrifices said Amongst all those great and foremost of Rishis, who firmly follow truth and who have the Vedas planted in their heart, you alone have been able to recognise me. Therefore I am exceedingly pleased with you.

data.v: हन्तैहि ब्राह्मण क्षिप्रं सह पुत्रेण हस्तिना । प्राप्नुहि त्वं शुभाँल्लोकानह्नाय च चिराय च ॥
data.md: Do you, therefore, O Brahmana, come with me speedily, accompanied by this your son. You are worthy of going to various regions of great happiness, without the delay of even a single day.

data.v: स गौतमं पुरस्कृत्य सह पुत्रेण हस्तिना । दिवमाचक्रमे वज्री सद्भिः सह दुरासदम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Having said these words, the holder of the thunderbolt, taking Gautama with him and placing him before, along with his son, viz., that elephant, went to Heaven, that is difficult of attainment by even the pious.

data.v: दानं बहुविधाकारं शान्तिः सत्यमहिंसता । स्वदारतुष्टिश्चोक्ता ते फलं दानस्य चैव यत् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have described to us the various kinds of gifts, tranquillity of soul, Truth, mercy, contentment with one's married wife, and the merits of gift.

data.v: पितामहस्य विदितं किमन्यत्र तपोबलात् । तपसो यत्परं तेऽद्य तन्मे व्याख्यातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: You know very well, O grandfather, that there is nothing whose power is superior to that of Penances. You should explain to us what forms the highest penance.

data.v: तपः प्रचक्षते यावत्तावल्लोका युधिष्ठिर । मतं मम तु कौन्तेय तपो नानशनात्परम् ॥
अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । भगीरथस्य संवादं ब्रह्मणश्च महात्मनः ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited an old history of the conversation between Vrishadarbhi and the seven Rishis, O Bharata.

data.v: अतीत्य सुरलोकं च गवां लोकं च भारत । ऋषिलोकं च सोऽगच्छद्भगीरथ इति श्रुतिः ॥
data.md: We have heard, O Bharata, that Bhagiratha attained to that region which is superior to that of the celestials of kine, and of the Rishis.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा स वचः प्राह ब्रह्मा राजन्भगीरथम् । कथं भगीरथागास्त्वमिमं देशं दुरासदम् ॥
data.md: Seeing this, O monarch, the Grandfather Brahman, addressing Bhagirama, said, How, O Bhagiratha, have you attained to this region that is so hard to get at.

data.v: न हि देवा न गन्धर्वा न मनुष्या भगीरथ । आयान्त्यतप्ततपसः कथं वै त्वमिहागतः ॥
data.md: Neither the celestials, nor Gandharvas, nor mankind, o Bhagiratha, succeed in coming here without having performed the severest austerities. How, indeed, have you come by this region.

data.v: निःशङ्कमन्नमददं ब्राह्मणेभ्यः; शतं सहस्राणि सदैव दानम् । ब्राह्मं व्रतं नित्यमास्थाय विद्धि; न त्वेवाहं तस्य फलादिहागाम् ॥
data.md: Bhagiratha said I used to make gifts of hundred thousands of gold coins to the Brahmanas practising the vow of celibacy all the while. It is not by dint of the merit of those, gifts, O learned one, that I have acquired this region.

data.v: दशैकरात्रान्दश पञ्चरात्रा;नेकादशैकादशकान्क्रतूंश्च । ज्योतिष्टोमानां च शतं यदिष्टं; फलेन तेनापि च नागतोऽहम् ॥
data.md: I celebrated the Ekaratri (onenight's) sacrifice (consisting of fasts and gifts) for ten times, and the Pancharatri (fivenights) sacrifices for as many times. I performed eleven times the Ekadashratri sacrifice. I performed a hundred times the great sacrifices of Jyotishtoma. It is not, however, through the merits of those sacrifices that I have acquired this region of happiness.

data.v: यच्चावसं जाह्नवीतीरनित्यः; शतं समास्तप्यमानस्तपोऽहम् । अदां च तत्राश्वतरीसहस्रं; नारीपुरं न च तेनाहमागाम् ॥
data.md: For a hundred years I lived continuously by the side of the sacred Jahnavi, all the while performed the severest austerities. There I made gifts to the Brahmanas of thousands of males and numberless female slaves.

data.v: दशायुतानि चाश्वानामयुतानि च विंशतिम् । पुष्करेषु द्विजातिभ्यः प्रादां गाश्च सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: By the side of the Pushkara lake I made gifts to the Brahmanas, for a hundred thousand times, a hundred thousand horses, and two hundred thousand kine.

data.v: सुवर्णचन्द्रोडुपधारिणीनां; कन्योत्तमानामददं स्रग्विणीनाम् । षष्टिं सहस्राणि विभूषितानां; जाम्बूनदैराभरणैर्न तेन ॥
data.md: I also gave away a thousand women of great beauty, each adorned with golden moons, and sixty thousand more, decked with ornaments of pure gold. It is not, however, through the merits of those deeds that I have succeeded in acquiring these regions.

data.v: दशार्बुदान्यददं गोसवेज्या;स्वेकैकशो दश गा लोकनाथ । समानवत्साः पयसा समन्विताः; सुवर्णकांस्योपदुहा न तेन ॥
data.md: O lord of the universe, performing those sacrifices known as Gosava, I gave away ten Arvudas of kine, presenting each Brahmana with ten kine, each of whom was accompanied with her calf, each of whom gave milk at the time, and with each of whom were given a vessel of gold and one white brass for milking her.

data.v: अप्तोर्यामेषु नियतमेकैकस्मिन्दशाददम् । गृष्टीनां क्षीरदात्रीणां रोहिणीनां न तेन च ॥
data.md: Celebrating many Soma sacrifices, I gave away to cach Brahinana ten kine each of whom gave milk, and each of whom had brought forth only her first calf, besides making presents to them of hundreds of kine belonging to that kind which is known by the name of Rohini.

data.v: दोग्ध्रीणां वै गवां चैव प्रयुतानि दशैव ह । प्रादां दशगुणं ब्रह्मन्न च तेनाहमागतः ॥
data.md: I also gave away to the Brahmanas twice ten Prayutas of other kine, all giving milk, It is not through the merit of those gifts, O Brahman, that I have succeeded in acquiring to this region of happiness.

data.v: वाजिनां बाह्लिजातानामयुतान्यददं दश । कर्काणां हेममालानां न च तेनाहमागतः ॥
data.md: I also gave away a hundred thousand horses of the Valhika breed, all of white complexion, and adorned with garlands of gold. It is not, however, through the merits of those deeds that I have acquired this region.

data.v: कोटीश्च काञ्चनस्याष्टौ प्रादां ब्रह्मन्दश त्वहम् । एकैकस्मिन्क्रतौ तेन फलेनाहं न चागतः ॥
data.md: I gave also eight crores of golden coins to the Brahmanas, O Brahmana, and another ten crores also in each sacrifice that I celebrated. It is not, however, through the merits of those deeds that I have acquired this region of happiness.

data.v: वाजिनां श्यामकर्णानां हरितानां पितामह । प्रादां हेमस्रजां ब्रह्मन्कोटीर्दश च सप्त च ॥
data.md: I also gave away seventeen crors of horses, O Grandfather, each of green colour, each having black ears, and each adorned with garlands of gold.

data.v: ईषादन्तान्महाकायान्काञ्चनस्रग्विभूषितान् । पत्नीमतः सहस्राणि प्रायच्छं दश सप्त च ॥
data.md: I also gave away seventeen thousand huge elephants having teeth as large as ploughshares, each having those whirls on its body, which are called Padmas, and each bedecked with garlands of gold.

data.v: अलंकृतानां देवेश दिव्यैः कनकभूषणैः । रथानां काञ्चनाङ्गानां सहस्राण्यददं दश । सप्त चान्यानि युक्तानि वाजिभिः समलंकृतैः ॥
data.md: I gave away ten thousand cars, Grandfather, whose parts were made of gold, and which were adorned with various ornaments of gold.

data.v: दक्षिणावयवाः केचिद्वेदैर्ये संप्रकीर्तिताः । वाजपेयेषु दशसु प्रादां तेनापि नाप्यहम् ॥
शक्रतुल्यप्रभावानामिज्यया विक्रमेण च । सहस्रं निष्ककण्ठानामददं दक्षिणामहम् ॥
विजित्य नृपतीन्सर्वान्मखैरिष्ट्वा पितामह । अष्टभ्यो राजसूयेभ्यो न च तेनाहमागतः ॥
data.md: Spending a of money, O Grandfather, and celebrating eight Rajasuya Sacrifices. I gave away to the Brahmanas who officiated in them, a thousand kings whose necks were adorned with garlands of gold, after having defeated them in battle. It is not, however, through the merits of those deeds that I have acquired this region.

data.v: स्रोतश्च यावद्गङ्गायाश्छन्नमासीज्जगत्पते । दक्षिणाभिः प्रवृत्ताभिर्मम नागां च तत्कृते ॥
data.md: In those sacrifices, O Lord of the universe, I made presents as profuse as the stream of Ganga herself. Each Brahmana I gave two thousand elephants decked with gold, as many horses adorned with golden ornaments, and a hundred villages of the best kind.

data.v: वाजिनां च सहस्रे द्वे सुवर्णशतभूषिते । वरं ग्रामशतं चाहमेकैकस्य त्रिधाददम् । तपस्वी नियताहारः शममास्थाय वाग्यतः ॥

data.md: Indeed, I gave these thrice to each Brahmana obscrvant of penances, living on regulated dict, adopting tranquillity of soul, and controlling speech, I lived for a long time on the breast of Himavat by the side of that Ganga whose irresistible current was borne by Mahadeva on his head. It is not through the merit of these deeds, O grandfather, that I have acquired this region.

data.md: I also gave away inasses of gold and wealth of other kinds. I gave away hills of gems and valuable stones. I gave away Villages, thousands in number and filled with wealth and corn.

data.md: I also gave each Branis. 17 a forest of Kanchana trees extending for Yojana on every side, and with each tree adorned with jewels and gems. It is not through the merits of that deed that I have acquired this region.

data.md: For thirty years, with heart perfectly freed from anger, I observed the Turayana vow that has very superior merit, and gave away to the Brahmanas every day nine hundred kine.

data.md: Indeed, O Lord of the universe, every one of those kine belonged to the Rohini species and gave milk at the time I gave them away. It is not through the merits of those deeds, O king of the deities, that I have acquired this region.

data.md: On the banks of Sarayu and Vahuda and Ganga, as also in the forest of Naimisha, I gave away millions of kine to the Brahmanas. It is not through the merits of those deeds that I have acquired this region.

data.md: The vow of fast had been known to Indra. He had, however, kept it a secret. Shukra, the descendent of Bhrigu, gained a knowledge of it by means of spiritual sight acquired through penances. Burning with energy as he does, it is Ushanas who first made it known to the universe. I observed that vow, O boongiving Deity.

data.v: ततो मे ब्राह्मणास्तुष्टास्तस्मिन्कर्मणि साधिते । सहस्रमृषयश्चासन्ये वै तत्र समागताः । उक्तस्तैरस्मि गच्छ त्वं ब्रह्मलोकमिति प्रभो ॥
data.md: When I finished that very superior vow, the Brahmanas became all pleased with me. A thousand Rishis came there.

data.v: प्रीतेनोक्तः सहस्रेण ब्राह्मणानामहं प्रभो । इमं लोकमनुप्राप्तो मा भूत्तेऽत्र विचारणा ॥
data.md: All those Brahmanas and Rishis, O powerful lord, pleased with me, said, do you go to the region of Brahman! It is on account of the merits of that vow that I have succeeded in acquiring this region of very superior happiness. There is no doubt in this.

data.v: कामं यथावद्विहितं विधात्रा; पृष्टेन वाच्यं तु मया यथावत् । तपो हि नान्यच्चानशनान्मतं मे; नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसीद ॥
data.md: Asked by the Supreme Creator of all things, I have duly explained the merits of the vow of fast. In my opinion, there is no penance higher than fast. I bow to you, o foremost of all the celestials. Be propitiated with me.

data.v: इत्युक्तवन्तं तं ब्रह्मा राजानं स्म भगीरथम् । पूजयामास पूजार्हं विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा ॥
data.md: Bhishma said King Bhagiratha, who had said so and who was worthy of every honour, was, on the conclusion of his speech, honoured by Brahman according to the rites ordained for that purpose.

data.v: शतायुरुक्तः पुरुषः शतवीर्यश्च वैदिके । कस्मान्म्रियन्ते पुरुषा बाला अपि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Man, it is said, is gifted with a period of life extending for a hundred years, and with great energy and power. Why then, O grandfather, do human beings die even in their youth?

data.v: आयुष्मान्केन भवति स्वल्पायुर्वापि मानवः । केन वा लभते कीर्तिं केन वा लभते श्रियम् ॥
data.md: By what does a man become longlived, and by what is his life shortened? Through what does a man acquire the fame that depends upon great deeds? Through what does one acquire wealth and prosperity?

data.v: तपसा ब्रह्मचर्येण जपैर्होमैस्तथौषधैः । जन्मना यदि वाचारात्तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Is it by penances, or celibacy or silent recitation of sacred Mantras, or drugs? Is it by his deeds, or mind, or speech? Do you explain to me this, O grandfather.

data.v: अत्र ते वर्तयिष्यामि यन्मां त्वमनुपृच्छसि । अल्पायुर्येन भवति दीर्घायुर्वापि मानवः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said I shall tell you what you ask me. In fact, I shall tell you what the reason is for which one becomes short lived, and what the reason is for which one becomes longlived.

data.v: येन वा लभते कीर्तिं येन वा लभते श्रियम् । यथा च वर्तन्पुरुषः श्रेयसा संप्रयुज्यते ॥
data.md: I shall also explain to you the reason for which one succeeds in winning the fame that depends on great deeds, and the reason for which one succeeds in acquiring riches and prosperity. Indeed, I shall enlighten you about the manner in which one must live in order to be possessed of what is good for him. one own

data.v: आचाराल्लभते ह्यायुराचाराल्लभते श्रियम् । आचारात्कीर्तिमाप्नोति पुरुषः प्रेत्य चेह च ॥
data.md: It is by conduct that one acquires a long life, and it is by conduct that one acquires riches and prosperity. Indeed, it is by conduct that one acquires the fame that depends upon great deeds both in this world and in the next.

data.v: दुराचारो हि पुरुषो नेहायुर्विन्दते महत् । त्रसन्ति यस्माद्भूतानि तथा परिभवन्ति च ॥
data.md: The man whose conduct is improper or wicked never acquires a long life. All creatures fear such a man and are oppressed by him.

data.v: तस्मात्कुर्यादिहाचारं य इच्छेद्भूतिमात्मनः । अपि पापशरीरस्य आचारो हन्त्यलक्षणम् ॥
data.md: If, therefore, wishes his advancement and prosperity, one should, in this world, follow the path of rightcousness and conduct himself properly. Good conduct succeeds in removing the inauspiciousness and misery of even one that is sinful.

data.v: आचारलक्षणो धर्मः सन्तश्चाचारलक्षणाः । साधूनां च यथा वृत्तमेतदाचारलक्षणम् ॥
data.md: Virtue is singled out by conduct. The good and virtuous are so on account of the conduct they follow. The marks, again, of good conduct are afforded by the deeds of those that are good Or righteous.

data.v: अप्यदृष्टं श्रुतं वापि पुरुषं धर्मचारिणम् । भूतिकर्माणि कुर्वाणं तं जनाः कुर्वते प्रियम् ॥
data.md: People regard that who righteously and who does good acts even if they only hear of him without actually seeing him.

data.v: ये नास्तिका निष्क्रियाश्च गुरुशास्त्रातिलङ्घिनः । अधर्मज्ञा दुराचारास्ते भवन्ति गतायुषः ॥
data.md: The atheists they who are destitute of all acts, they who are disobedient to preceptors and violate the injunctions of the scriptures, they who are unacquainted with and, therefore, unobservant of duties, and they who are wicked of conduct, become shortlived. man acts

data.v: विशीला भिन्नमर्यादा नित्यं संकीर्णमैथुनाः । अल्पायुषो भवन्तीह नरा निरयगामिनः ॥
data.md: They who are of improper conduct, they who violate all restraints, they who are unscrupulous about sexual congress, become shortlived here and have to go to Hell hereafter.

data.v: सर्वलक्षणहीनोऽपि समुदाचारवान्नरः । श्रद्दधानोऽनसूयश्च शतं वर्षाणि जीवति ॥
data.md: Even those men live for a hundred years who, though destitute of all accomplishments, follow propriety and righteousness of conduct and become endued with faith and freed from malice.

data.v: अक्रोधनः सत्यवादी भूतानामविहिंसकः । अनसूयुरजिह्मश्च शतं वर्षाणि जीवति ॥
data.md: He who is free from anger, who is truthful in speech, who never does any injury to any creature in the universe, who is shorn of malice and crookedness and insincerity, succeeds in living for a hundred years.

data.v: लोष्टमर्दी तृणच्छेदी नखखादी च यो नरः । नित्योच्छिष्टः संकुसुको नेहायुर्विन्दते महत् ॥
data.md: He who always breaks little clods of carth, or tears up the grass that grows under his feet, or cuts off his nails with his teeth, or is always impure, or very restless, never succeeds in living long.

data.v: ब्राह्मे मुहूर्ते बुध्येत धर्मार्थौ चानुचिन्तयेत् । उत्थायाचम्य तिष्ठेत पूर्वां संध्यां कृताञ्जलिः ॥
data.md: One should wake up from sleep at the hour known as the Brahma Muhurta and then think of both religion and worldly profit. Getting up from bed, one should then wash his face and mouth, and joining his hands in an attitude of respect, then say the morning prayers.

data.v: एवमेवापरां संध्यां समुपासीत वाग्यतः । नेक्षेतादित्यमुद्यन्तं नास्तं यान्तं कदाचन ॥
data.md: In this way, one should when evening sets in say his evening prayers also, controlling speech the while. One should never look at the rising sun, nor at the setting sun.

ये च पूर्वामुपासन्ते द्विजाः संध्यां न पश्चिमाम् । सर्वांस्तान्धार्मिको राजा शूद्रकर्माणि कारयेत् ॥
data.md: Hence one should controlling speech, say his prayers regularly at the two twilight's. As regards those Brahmanas who do not say their prayers at the two twilight's, a righteous king should set them to perform such deeds as are ordained for the Shudras. Persons of every caste should never have sexual congress with other people's wives.

data.md: One should dress one's hair, apply collyrium to one's eyes, and wash one's teeth, as also worship the celestials in the forenoon.

आयुष्यं प्राङ्मुखो भुङ्क्ते यशस्यं दक्षिणामुखः । धन्यं पश्चान्मुखो भुङ्क्ते ऋतं भुङ्क्ते उदङ्मुखः ॥

मूत्रं न तिष्ठता कार्यं न भस्मनि न गोव्रजे ॥
data.md: One should always eat in a seated posture. One should never eat while walking. One should never answer a call of nature standing. One should never answer a call of nature on ashes or in a cowpen.

data.v: आर्द्रपादस्तु भुञ्जीत नार्द्रपादस्तु संविशेत् । आर्द्रपादस्तु भुञ्जानो वर्षाणां जीवते शतम् ॥
data.md: One should wash his feet before sitting to one's meals. One should never sit or lie down for slecp with wet feet. One who sits to his meals after having washed his feet, lives for a century.

data.v: त्रीणि तेजांसि नोच्छिष्ट आलभेत कदाचन । अग्निं गां ब्राह्मणं चैव तथास्यायुर्न रिष्यते ॥
data.md: One should never touch these three things, while one is in an impure state, viz., fire, a cow and a Brahmana. By observing this rule one lives long.

data.v: त्रीणि तेजांसि नोच्छिष्ट उदीक्षेत कदाचन । सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ चैव नक्षत्राणि च सर्वशः ॥
data.md: One should not, while he is in an impure state, cast one's eyes on these three things, viz., the sun, the moon and the stars.

data.v: ऊर्ध्वं प्राणा ह्युत्क्रामन्ति यूनः स्थविर आयति । प्रत्युत्थानाभिवादाभ्यां पुनस्तान्प्रतिपद्यते ॥
data.md: The lifebreaths of a young man go up wards, when an old and venerable person comes to his house. He gets them back by standing up and properly saluting the guest.

data.v: अभिवादयेत वृद्धांश्च आसनं चैव दापयेत् । कृताञ्जलिरुपासीत गच्छन्तं पृष्ठतोऽन्वियात् ॥
data.md: Old men should always be saluted. One should, upon seeing them, offer seats with his own hand. After the old man has taken his seat, a person should sit and remain with hands joined in respect. When an old man goes along the road, one should always follow him instead of walking ahead.
