न दिवा मैथुनं गच्छेन्न कन्यां न च बन्धकीम् । न चास्नातां स्त्रियं गच्छेत्तथायुर्विन्दते महत् ॥
स्वे स्वे तीर्थे समाचम्य कार्ये समुपकल्पिते । त्रिः पीत्वापो द्विः प्रमृज्य कृतशौचो भवेन्नरः ॥
data.md: One should never know a woman who has not bathed after the expiry of her menses. By avoiding such acts one succeeds in acquiring a long life. After washing the several limbs directed, in view of religious acts, one should wash his lips thrice, and once more twice. By doing this, one becomes purified and fit for religious rites. The several organs of sense should each be washed once, and water should also be sprinkled over the entire body.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणि सकृत्स्पृश्य त्रिरभ्युक्ष्य च मानवः । कुर्वीत पित्र्यं दैवं च वेददृष्टेन कर्मणा ॥
ब्राह्मणार्थे च यच्छौचं तच्च मे शृणु कौरव । प्रवृत्तं च हितं चोक्त्वा भोजनाद्यन्तयोस्तथा ॥
सर्वशौचेषु ब्राह्मेण तीर्थेन समुपस्पृशेत् । निष्ठीव्य तु तथा क्षुत्वा स्पृश्यापो हि शुचिर्भवेत् ॥
वृद्धो ज्ञातिस्तथा मित्रं दरिद्रो यो भवेदपि । गृहे वासयितव्यास्ते धन्यमायुष्यमेव च ॥
data.md: After ejecting any matter from the throat or spitting, one should wash his mouth before he can become pure. A kinsman who happens to be old, or a friend who happens to be poor, should be accommodated in one's house and his comforts looked after as if he were a member of the family. By doing this, one succeeds in winning both fame and longevity. To keep pigeons as also parrots both male and female, in one's house is highly blessed.

data.v: गृहे पारावता धन्याः शुकाश्च सहसारिकाः । गृहेष्वेते न पापाय तथा वै तैलपायिकाः ॥
उद्दीपकाश्च गृध्राश्च कपोता भ्रमरास्तथा । निविशेयुर्यदा तत्र शान्तिमेव तदाचरेत् ॥
अमङ्गल्यानि चैतानि तथाक्रोशो महात्मनाम् । महात्मनां च गुह्यानि न वक्तव्यानि कर्हिचित् ॥
अगम्याश्च न गच्छेत राजपत्नीः सखीस्तथा । वैद्यानां बालवृद्धानां भृत्यानां च युधिष्ठिर ॥
बन्धूनां ब्राह्मणानां च तथा शारणिकस्य च । संबन्धिनां च राजेन्द्र तथायुर्विन्दते महत् ॥
ब्राह्मणस्थपतिभ्यां च निर्मितं यन्निवेशनम् । तदावसेत्सदा प्राज्ञो भवार्थी मनुजेश्वर ॥
संध्यायां न स्वपेद्राजन्विद्यां न च समाचरेत् । न भुञ्जीत च मेधावी तथायुर्विन्दते महत् ॥
नक्तं न कुर्यात्पित्र्याणि भुक्त्वा चैव प्रसाधनम् । पानीयस्य क्रिया नक्तं न कार्या भूतिमिच्छता ॥
वर्जनीयाश्च वै नित्यं सक्तवो निशि भारत । शेषाणि चावदातानि पानीयं चैव भोजने ॥
सौहित्यं च न कर्तव्यं रात्रौ नैव समाचरेत् । द्विजच्छेदं न कुर्वीत भुक्त्वा न च समाचरेत् ॥
महाकुलप्रसूतां च प्रशस्तां लक्षणैस्तथा । वयःस्थां च महाप्राज्ञ कन्यामावोढुमर्हति ॥
अपत्यमुत्पाद्य ततः प्रतिष्ठाप्य कुलं तथा । पुत्राः प्रदेया ज्ञानेषु कुलधर्मेषु भारत ॥
कन्या चोत्पाद्य दातव्या कुलपुत्राय धीमते । पुत्रा निवेश्याश्च कुलाद्भृत्या लभ्याश्च भारत ॥
शिरःस्नातोऽथ कुर्वीत दैवं पित्र्यमथापि च । नक्षत्रे न च कुर्वीत यस्मिञ्जातो भवेन्नरः । न प्रोष्ठपदयोः कार्यं तथाग्नेये च भारत ॥
data.md: One should never perform a Shraddha under the constellation of his nativity. No Shraddha should be performed under any of the Bhadrapadas (prior or later), nor under the constellation Krittika, O Bharata.

data.v: दारुणेषु च सर्वेषु प्रत्यहं च विवर्जयेत् । ज्योतिषे यानि चोक्तानि तानि सर्वाणि वर्जयेत् ॥
data.md: The Shraddha should never be performed under any of those constellations that are considered as dreadful (such as Ashlesha, etc.,) and any of those that upon calculation, seem to be hostile. Indeed, in this matter, all these constellations should be avoided which are forbidden in astrology.

data.v: प्राङ्मुखः श्मश्रुकर्माणि कारयेत समाहितः । उदङ्मुखो वा राजेन्द्र तथायुर्विन्दते महत् ॥
data.md: One should sit facing either the east or the north while being shaved by a barber. By so doing, O great king, one succeeds in living long.

data.v: परिवादं न च ब्रूयात्परेषामात्मनस्तथा । परिवादो न धर्माय प्रोच्यते भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: One should neither 'vilify others reproach himself for, O chief of the Bharatas, it is said that calumny is sinful whether of others or of oneself.

data.v: वर्जयेद्व्यङ्गिनीं नारीं तथा कन्यां नरोत्तम । समार्षां व्यङ्गितां चैव मातुः स्वकुलजां तथा ॥
data.md: In marrying, one should avoid a woman who is deficient of any limb. A maiden too, if such, should also be avoided. A woman of the same Pravars should also be avoided; as also one who is ill-formed in body; as also one who has been born in the race to which one's mother belongs. nor

data.v: वृद्धां प्रव्रजितां चैव तथैव च पतिव्रताम् । तथातिकृष्णवर्णां च वर्णोत्कृष्टां च वर्जयेत् ॥
data.md: A wise man should never know a woman who is old, or one who has given up the domestic mode of life for entering the forest mode, or one who is faithful to her husband or one whose organs of generation are not healthy or well-formed.

data.v: अयोनिं च वियोनिं च न गच्छेत विचक्षणः । पिङ्गलां कुष्ठिनीं नारीं न त्वमावोढुमर्हसि ॥
अपस्मारिकुले जातां निहीनां चैव वर्जयेत् । श्वित्रिणां च कुले जातां त्रयाणां मनुजेश्वर ॥
लक्षणैरन्विता या च प्रशस्ता या च लक्षणैः । मनोज्ञा दर्शनीया च तां भवान्वोढुमर्हति ॥
महाकुले निवेष्टव्यं सदृशे वा युधिष्ठिर । अवरा पतिता चैव न ग्राह्या भूतिमिच्छता ॥
अग्नीनुत्पाद्य यत्नेन क्रियाः सुविहिताश्च याः । वेदेषु ब्राह्मणैः प्रोक्तास्ताश्च सर्वाः समाचरेत् ॥
data.md: One who is desirous of his own prosperity, should never marry a woman who is of an inferior caste or who has fallen away from the caste of her birth. Carefully lighting up the fire, one should perform all those acts which have been ordained and declared in the Vedas or by the Brahinanas. One should never seek to injure women. Wives should always be protected.

data.v: न चेर्ष्या स्त्रीषु कर्तव्या दारा रक्ष्याश्च सर्वशः । अनायुष्या भवेदीर्ष्या तस्मादीर्ष्यां विवर्जयेत् ॥
अनायुष्यो दिवास्वप्नस्तथाभ्युदितशायिता । प्रातर्निशायां च तथा ये चोच्छिष्टाः स्वपन्ति वै ॥
पारदार्यमनायुष्यं नापितोच्छिष्टता तथा । यत्नतो वै न कर्तव्यमभ्यासश्चैव भारत ॥
संध्यां न भुञ्जेन्न स्नायान्न पुरीषं समुत्सृजेत् । प्रयतश्च भवेत्तस्यां न च किंचित्समाचरेत् ॥
ब्राह्मणान्पूजयेच्चापि तथा स्नात्वा नराधिप । देवांश्च प्रणमेत्स्नातो गुरूंश्चाप्यभिवादयेत् ॥
अनिमन्त्रितो न गच्छेत यज्ञं गच्छेत्तु दर्शकः । अनिमन्त्रिते ह्यनायुष्यं गमनं तत्र भारत ॥
न चैकेन परिव्राज्यं न गन्तव्यं तथा निशि । अनागतायां संध्यायां पश्चिमायां गृहे वसेत् ॥
मातुः पितुर्गुरूणां च कार्यमेवानुशासनम् । हितं वाप्यहितं वापि न विचार्यं नरर्षभ ॥
data.md: Before evening sets in, one should return to his house and remain within it. One should always obey the commands of his parents and preceptor, without at all judging whether those commands are good or not. One should, O king, attend carefully of the Vedas and the military science.

data.v: धनुर्वेदे च वेदे च यत्नः कार्यो नराधिप । हस्तिपृष्ठेऽश्वपृष्ठे च रथचर्यासु चैव ह । यत्नवान्भव राजेन्द्र यत्नवान्सुखमेधते ॥
data.md: Do then, O king, carefully attend to the practice of riding an elephant, a horse and a warchariot. The man who attends to these with care, succeeds in acquiring happiness.

data.v: अप्रधृष्यश्च शत्रूणां भृत्यानां स्वजनस्य च । प्रजापालनयुक्तश्च न क्षतिं लभते क्वचित् ॥
data.md: Such a king succeeds in becoming unconquerable by enemies, and govern his servants and kinsmen without any of them being able to subjugate him. The king who attains to such a position and who carefully attends to the duty of protecting his subjects, has never to incur any loss.

data.v: युक्तिशास्त्रं च ते ज्ञेयं शब्दशास्त्रं च भारत । गन्धर्वशास्त्रं च कलाः परिज्ञेया नराधिप ॥
data.md: You should, O king, be proficient in logic, as also the science of words, the science of music and the four and the sixty branches of knowledge known by the name of Kala.

data.v: पुराणमितिहासाश्च तथाख्यानानि यानि च । महात्मनां च चरितं श्रोतव्यं नित्यमेव ते ॥
data.md: One should every day hear the Puranas and the histories and all the other narratives that cxist, as also the biographies of all great men.

data.v: पत्नीं रजस्वलां चैव नाभिगच्छेन्न चाह्वयेत् । स्नातां चतुर्थे दिवसे रात्रौ गच्छेद्विचक्षणः ॥
data.md: When one's wife is in her season, one should never know her, nor even summon her for conversation. A wise man may take her into his company on the fourth day after the bath of purification.

data.v: पञ्चमे दिवसे नारी षष्ठेऽहनि पुमान्भवेत् । एतेन विधिना पत्नीमुपगच्छेत पण्डितः ॥
data.md: If one holds sexual union on the fifth day from the first appearance of the cataminal flow he gets a daughter. By holding it on the sixth day, he gets a son. A wise man should, in the matter of sexual intercourse attend to this rule.

data.v: ज्ञातिसंबन्धिमित्राणि पूजनीयानि नित्यशः । यष्टव्यं च यथाशक्ति यज्ञैर्विविधदक्षिणैः । अतऊर्ध्वमरण्यं च सेवितव्यं नराधिप ॥
data.md: Kinsmen and relatives by marriage and friends should all be treated with respect. One should, to the best of his power, worship the celestials in sacrifices, giving away various kinds of articles as sacrificial presents.

data.v: एष ते लक्षणोद्देश आयुष्याणां प्रकीर्तितः । शेषस्त्रैविद्यवृद्धेभ्यः प्रत्याहार्यो युधिष्ठिर ॥
आचारो भूतिजनन आचारः कीर्तिवर्धनः । आचाराद्वर्धते ह्यायुराचारो हन्त्यलक्षणम् ॥
आगमानां हि सर्वेषामाचारः श्रेष्ठ उच्यते । आचारप्रभवो धर्मो धर्मादायुर्विवर्धते ॥
एतद्यशस्यमायुष्यं स्वर्ग्यं स्वस्त्ययनं महत् । अनुकम्पता सर्ववर्णान्ब्रह्मणा समुदाहृतम् ॥
data.md: It is conduct which begets virtue, and it is virtue which prolongs life. Conduct gives fame, long life, and Heaven. Conduct is the most efficacious rite of propitiating the celestials. The self-create Brahman himself has said that one should show mercy to all orders of men.

data.v: यथा ज्येष्ठः कनिष्ठेषु वर्तते भरतर्षभ । कनिष्ठाश्च यथा ज्येष्ठे वर्तेरंस्तद्ब्रवीहि मे ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Tell me, O chief of Bharata's race, how the eldest brother should treat his younger brothers, and how the younger brothers should behave towards their eldest brother.

data.v: ज्येष्ठवत्तात वर्तस्व ज्येष्ठो हि सततं भवान् । गुरोर्गरीयसी वृत्तिर्या चेच्छिष्यस्य भारत ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Do you, O son, always behave towards your younger brothers as their eldest brother should. You are always the eldest of all these your brothers. You should always treat your younger brothers in the way in which a preceptor treats his disciples.

data.v: न गुरावकृतप्रज्ञे शक्यं शिष्येण वर्तितुम् । गुरोर्हि दीर्घदर्शित्वं यत्तच्छिष्यस्य भारत ॥
data.md: If the preceptor happens to happens the disciple cannot possibly behave towards him in a respectful or proper way. If the preceptor is possessed of purity and good conduct, the disciple also succeeds in acquiring conduct of the same kind, O Bharata.

data.v: अन्धः स्यादन्धवेलायां जडः स्यादपि वा बुधः । परिहारेण तद्ब्रूयाद्यस्तेषां स्याद्व्यतिक्रमः ॥
data.md: The eldest brother should at times not notice the acts of his younger brothers, and though possessed of wisdom should at times act as if he does not understand their acts. If the younger brothers be guilty of any sin, the eldest brother should correct them by indirect ways and means.

data.v: प्रत्यक्षं भिन्नहृदया भेदयेयुः कृतं नराः । श्रियाभितप्ताः कौन्तेय भेदकामास्तथारयः ॥
data.md: If there be good understanding among brothers and if the oldest brother seeks to correct his younger brothers by director ostensible means, persons who are enemies, O son of Kunti, who feel pain on seeing such good understanding and who, therefore, always seek to bring about a disunion, try to disunite the brothers and sow dissension among them.

data.v: ज्येष्ठः कुलं वर्धयति विनाशयति वा पुनः । हन्ति सर्वमपि ज्येष्ठः कुलं यत्रावजायते ॥
data.md: It is the eldest brother who increases the prosperity of the family or destroys it entirely. If the eldest brother happens to be not gifted with sense and wicked in conduct, he encompasses the destruction of the whole family.

data.v: अथ यो विनिकुर्वीत ज्येष्ठो भ्राता यवीयसः । अज्येष्ठः स्यादभागश्च नियम्यो राजभिश्च सः ॥
data.md: That eldest brother who injures his younger brothers ceases to be considered as the eldest and forfeits his share in the family property and deserves to be checked by the king.

data.v: निकृती हि नरो लोकान्पापान्गच्छत्यसंशयम् । विदुलस्येव तत्पुष्पं मोघं जनयितुः स्मृतम् ॥
data.md: That man who acts deceitfully, has, forsooth, to go to the regions of grief and every kind of evil. The birth of such a person is of no avail like the flowers of the cane.

data.v: सर्वानर्थः कुले यत्र जायते पापपूरुषः । अकीर्तिं जनयत्येव कीर्तिमन्तर्दधाति च ॥
data.md: That family in which a sinful person is born becomes subject to every evil. Such a person brings about infamy, and all the good deeds of the family disappear.

data.v: सर्वे चापि विकर्मस्था भागं नार्हन्ति सोदराः । नाप्रदाय कनिष्ठेभ्यो ज्येष्ठः कुर्वीत यौतकम् ॥
data.md: Such among the brothers as are addicted to wicked deeds forfeit their shares of the family property. In such a case, the eldest brother may appropriate the entire joint property without giving any portion thereof to his younger brothers.

data.v: अनुजं हि पितुर्दायो जङ्घाश्रमफलोऽध्वगः । स्वयमीहितलब्धं तु नाकामो दातुमर्हति ॥
data.md: If the eldest brother makes any money, without using the paternal property and by going to a distant place he may appropriate for his own use, such wealth without giving any share thereof to his younger brothers.

data.v: भ्रातॄणामविभक्तानामुत्थानमपि चेत्सह । न पुत्रभागं विषमं पिता दद्यात्कथंचन ॥
data.md: If brothers wish (during the lifetime of their father) to partition the family property, the father should give equal shares to all his sons.

data.v: न ज्येष्ठानवमन्येत दुष्कृतः सुकृतोऽपि वा । यदि स्त्री यद्यवरजः श्रेयः पश्येत्तथाचरेत् । धर्मं हि श्रेय इत्याहुरिति धर्मविदो विदुः ॥
data.md: If the eldest brother happens to be a vicious man and without any accomplishments, he inay be disregarded by his younger brothers. If the wife or the younger brother happens to be sinful, her or his good must still be looked alier.

data.v: दशाचार्यानुपाध्याय उपाध्यायान्पिता दश । दश चैव पितॄन्माता सर्वां वा पृथिवीमपि ॥
गौरवेणाभिभवति नास्ति मातृसमो गुरुः । माता गरीयसी यच्च तेनैतां मन्यते जनः ॥
ज्येष्ठो भ्राता पितृसमो मृते पितरि भारत । स ह्येषां वृत्तिदाता स्यात्स चैतान्परिपालयेत् ॥
कनिष्ठास्तं नमस्येरन्सर्वे छन्दानुवर्तिनः । तमेव चोपजीवेरन्यथैव पितरं तथा ॥
data.md: It is the eldest brother who should assign to them their means of support and protect and maintain them. All the younger brothers should bow to him and obey his command. Indeed, they should depend upon him, as they did upon their father during his lifetime.

data.v: शरीरमेतौ सृजतः पिता माता च भारत । आचार्यशास्ता या जातिः सा सत्या साजरामरा ॥
data.md: So far as the body is concerned, O Bharata, it is the father and the mother who creates it. That birth, however, which the Acharya ordains, is considered as the true birth which is really unfading and immortal.

data.v: ज्येष्ठा मातृसमा चापि भगिनी भरतर्षभ । भ्रातुर्भार्या च तद्वत्स्याद्यस्या बाल्ये स्तनं पिबेत् ॥
data.md: The eldest sister, O chief of Bharata's race, is like a mother. The wife of the eldest brother also is like the mother, for the younger brother, in infancy receives nursing from her.

data.v: सर्वेषामेव वर्णानां म्लेच्छानां च पितामह । उपवासे मतिरियं कारणं च न विद्महे ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O grandfather, all the orders of men, including the very Mlechchhas, are naturally disposed to observe fasts. We, however, do not know the reason thereof.

data.v: ब्रह्मक्षत्रेण नियमाश्चर्तव्या इति नः श्रुतम् । उपवासे कथं तेषां कृत्यमस्ति पितामह ॥
data.md: We have heard that only Brahmanas and Kshatriyas should observe the vow of fasts. How, O grandfather, are the other castes to be taken as acquiring any merit by the observance of fasts?

data.v: नियमं चोपवासानां सर्वेषां ब्रूहि पार्थिव । अवाप्नोति गतिं कां च उपवासपरायणः ॥
data.md: How have vows and fasts come to be observed by persons of all castes, O king? What is that end which one devoted to the observance of fasts, acquires?

data.v: उपवासः परं पुण्यमुपवासः परायणम् । उपोष्येह नरश्रेष्ठ किं फलं प्रतिपद्यते ॥
data.md: It has been said that fasts are greatly meritorious and that fasts are a great refuge. O king, what is the fruit that is acquired in this world by the man who observes fasts?

data.v: अधर्मान्मुच्यते केन धर्ममाप्नोति वै कथम् । स्वर्गं पुण्यं च लभते कथं भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: By what means is one purged of his sins? By what means does one acquire virtue. By what means, O best of the Bharatas, does one succeed in acquiring Heaven and merit.

data.v: उपोष्य चापि किं तेन प्रदेयं स्यान्नराधिप । धर्मेण च सुखानर्थाँल्लभेद्येन ब्रवीहि तम् ॥
data.md: After having observed a fast, what should one give away, O king? O tell me, what those duties are by which one may succeed in acquiring objects leading to happiness.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवाणं कौन्तेयं धर्मज्ञं धर्मतत्त्ववित् । धर्मपुत्रमिदं वाक्यं भीष्मः शांतनवोऽब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Kunti's son begotten by the deity of Dharma, who was conversant with every duty and who said so to him, Shantanu's son, Bhishma, who knew every duty, answered in the following words.

data.v: इदं खलु महाराज श्रुतमासीत्पुरातनम् । उपवासविधौ श्रेष्ठा ये गुणा भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Formerly, O king, I heard of these high merits O chief of Bharata's race, as belonging to the observance of fasts according to the ordinance.

data.v: प्राजापत्यं ह्यङ्गिरसं पृष्टवानस्मि भारत । यथा मां त्वं तथैवाहं पृष्टवांस्तं तपोधनम् ॥
data.md: I had, O Bharata, asked the Rishi Angirasa of great ascetic merit, the very same questions which you have asked me today.

data.v: प्रश्नमेतं मया पृष्टो भगवानग्निसंभवः । उपवासविधिं पुण्यमाचष्ट भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Accosted by me thus, the illustrious Rishi, who originated from the sacrificial fire, answered me even thus about the observance of fasts according to the ordinance.

data.v: ब्रह्मक्षत्रे त्रिरात्रं तु विहितं कुरुनन्दन । द्विस्त्रिरात्रमथैवात्र निर्दिष्टं पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: Angirasa said Fasts for three nights together, ordained for Brahmanas and Kshatriyas, O delighter of the Kurus. Indeed, O king, a fast for one night, for two nights, and for three nights may be observed by them.

data.v: वैश्यशूद्रौ तु यौ मोहादुपवासं प्रकुर्वते । त्रिरात्रं द्विस्त्रिरात्रं वा तयोः पुष्टिर्न विद्यते ॥
data.md: Fast for one night is ordained for Vaishyas and Shudras. If they observe fasts for two or three nights by mistake, such fasts never bring on their advancement.

data.v: चतुर्थभक्तक्षपणं वैश्यशूद्रे विधीयते । त्रिरात्रं न तु धर्मज्ञैर्विहितं ब्रह्मवादिभिः ॥
data.md: Fasts for two nights have been ordained for Vaishyas and Shudras (on certain special occasions). Fasts for three nights, however, have not been ordained for them by persons knowing duties.

data.v: पञ्चम्यां चैव षष्ठ्यां च पौर्णमास्यां च भारत । क्षमावान्रूपसंपन्नः श्रुतवांश्चैव जायते ॥
data.md: The wise man who, with his senses and soul under restraint, O Bharata, fasts, by abstaining from one of the two meals, on the fifth and the sixth days of the moon as also on the day of the full moon, becomes gifted with forgiveness and personal beauty and knowledge of scriptures. Such a person never becomes childless and poor.

data.v: नानपत्यो भवेत्प्राज्ञो दरिद्रो वा कदाचन । यजिष्णुः पञ्चमीं षष्ठीं क्षपेद्यो भोजयेद्द्विजान् ॥
अष्टमीमथ कौन्तेय शुक्लपक्षे चतुर्दशीम् । उपोष्य व्याधिरहितो वीर्यवानभिजायते ॥
मार्गशीर्षं तु यो मासमेकभक्तेन संक्षिपेत् । भोजयेच्च द्विजान्भक्त्या स मुच्येद्व्याधिकिल्बिषैः ॥
सर्वकल्याणसंपूर्णः सर्वौषधिसमन्वितः । कृषिभागी बहुधनो बहुपुत्रश्च जायते ॥
पौषमासं तु कौन्तेय भक्तेनैकेन यः क्षपेत् । सुभगो दर्शनीयश्च यशोभागी च जायते ॥
data.md: That man, O son of Kunti, who passes the whole month of Pausha abstaining every day from one of two meals, becomes a gainer of good fortune and pleasant features and great fame.

data.v: पितृभक्तो माघमासमेकभक्तेन यः क्षपेत् । श्रीमत्कुले ज्ञातिमध्ये स महत्त्वं प्रपद्यते ॥
data.md: He who passes the whole month of Magha, abstaining every day from one of the two mcals, is born in a high family and attains to a position of eminence among his kinsmen.

data.v: भगदैवं तु यो मासमेकभक्तेन यः क्षपेत् । स्त्रीषु वल्लभतां याति वश्याश्चास्य भवन्ति ताः ॥
data.md: He who passes the whole month of Bhagadaivata, confining himself every day to only one meal, becomes a favourite with women who, indeed, readily acknowledge his sway.

data.v: चैत्रं तु नियतो मासमेकभक्तेन यः क्षपेत् । सुवर्णमणिमुक्ताढ्ये कुले महति जायते ॥
data.md: He who passes the whole of the month of Chaitra, taking every day one meal only, is born in high family and becomes rich in gold, gems, and pearls.

data.v: निस्तरेदेकभक्तेन वैशाखं यो जितेन्द्रियः । नरो वा यदि वा नारी ज्ञातीनां श्रेष्ठतां व्रजेत् ॥
data.md: The person, whether male or female, who passes the month of Baishakha, taking himself or herself every day one meal, and keeping his or her senses under restraint, succeeds in attaining to a position of eminence among kinsmen.

data.v: ज्येष्ठामूलं तु यो मासमेकभक्तेन संक्षपेत् । ऐश्वर्यमतुलं श्रेष्ठं पुमान्स्त्री वाभिजायते ॥
data.md: The person who passes the month of Jaishthya taking himself every day one meal, succeeds in acquiring a position of eminence and great riches. If a woman, she reaps the same reward.

data.v: आषाढमेकभक्तेन स्थित्वा मासमतन्द्रितः । बहुधान्यो बहुधनो बहुपुत्रश्च जायते ॥
data.md: He who passes the month of Ashada, taking himself one meal a day and with senses steadily concentrated upon his duties, becomes possessed of much corn, great riches and large progeny.

data.v: श्रावणं नियतो मासमेकभक्तेन यः क्षपेत् । यत्र तत्राभिषेकेण युज्यते ज्ञातिवर्धनः ॥
data.md: He who passes the month of Sravana, taking himself one meal a day receives the honors of Abhisheka wherever he may happen to live, and attains to a position of eminence among kinsmen whom he supports.

data.v: प्रौष्ठपदं तु यो मासमेकाहारो भवेन्नरः । धनाढ्यं स्फीतमचलमैश्वर्यं प्रतिपद्यते ॥
data.md: That man who takes himself only one meal a day for the whole month of Proshthapada, becomes possessed of great riches.

data.v: तथैवाश्वयुजं मासमेकभक्तेन यः क्षपेत् । प्रजावान्वाहनाढ्यश्च बहुपुत्रश्च जायते ॥
data.md: The man who passes the month of Ashvin, taking himself one meal a day, becomes pure in soul and body, possessed of many animals and vehicles and large progeny.

data.v: कार्त्तिकं तु नरो मासं यः कुर्यादेकभोजनम् । शूरश्च बहुभार्यश्च कीर्तिमांश्चैव जायते ॥
data.md: He who passes the month of Kartika, taking himself one meal every day, becomes possessed of heroism, many wives and great fame.

data.v: इति मासा नरव्याघ्र क्षपतां परिकीर्तिताः । तिथीनां नियमा ये तु शृणु तानपि पार्थिव ॥
data.md: I have now told you, O king, what the fruits are that are obtained by men by observing fasts for the two and ten months in detail. Listen now, O king, to me as I tell you what the rules are about the lunar days.

data.v: पक्षे पक्षे गते यस्तु भक्तमश्नाति भारत । गवाढ्यो बहुपुत्रश्च दीर्घायुश्च स जायते ॥
data.md: The man who, abstaining from it every day, takes rice at the termination of every fortnight becomes possessed of a great many kine, a large progeny, and a long life.

data.v: मासि मासि त्रिरात्राणि कृत्वा वर्षाणि द्वादश । गणाधिपत्यं प्राप्नोति निःसपत्नमनाविलम् ॥
data.md: He whọ observes fasts for three nights every month and acts thus for two and ten years, acquires a position of eminence among his kinsmen and friends, without a rival to contest his claim and without any anxiety caused by any one trying to rise to the same height.

data.v: एते तु नियमाः सर्वे कर्तव्याः शरदो दश । द्वे चान्ये भरतश्रेष्ठ प्रवृत्तिमनुवर्तता ॥
data.md: These rules which I speak of, O chief of Bharata's race, should be observed for twelve years. Be disposed to do it.

data.v: यस्तु प्रातस्तथा सायं भुञ्जानो नान्तरा पिबेत् । अहिंसानिरतो नित्यं जुह्वानो जातवेदसम् ॥
data.md: That man who eats once in the forenoon and once after evening and abstains from drinking at the interval, and who shows mercy towards all creatures, and pours libations of clarified butter on his sacred fire every day, acquires success, O king, in six years. There is no doubt in this. Such a man acquires the merit of the Agnishtoma sacrifice.

data.v: षड्भिः स वर्षैर्नृपते सिध्यते नात्र संशयः । अग्निष्टोमस्य यज्ञस्य फलं प्राप्नोति मानवः ॥
data.md: That man who eats once in the forenoon and once after evening and abstains from drinking at the interval, and who shows mercy towards all creatures, and pours libations of clarified butter on his sacred fire every day, acquires success, O king, in six years. There is no doubt in this. Such a man acquires the merit of the Agnishtoma sacrifice.

data.v: अधिवासे सोऽप्सरसां नृत्यगीतविनादिते । तप्तकाञ्चनवर्णाभं विमानमधिरोहति ॥
पूर्णं वर्षसहस्रं तु ब्रह्मलोके महीयते । तत्क्षयादिह चागम्य माहात्म्यं प्रतिपद्यते ॥
यस्तु संवत्सरं पूर्णमेकाहारो भवेन्नरः । अतिरात्रस्य यज्ञस्य स फलं समुपाश्नुते ॥
दशवर्षसहस्राणि स्वर्गे च स महीयते । तत्क्षयादिह चागम्य माहात्म्यं प्रतिपद्यते ॥
यस्तु संवत्सरं पूर्णं चतुर्थं भक्तमश्नुते । अहिंसानिरतो नित्यं सत्यवाङ्नियतेन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: Upon the termination of that merit he returns to the Earth and acquires a position of eminence. He who passes one whole year fasting for three days in succession and taking food on every fourth day, and abstaining from injury from every sort, adhering to truthfulness of speech, and keeping his senses under control, acquires the merit of the Vajapeya sacrifice.

data.v: वाजपेयस्य यज्ञस्य फलं वै समुपाश्नुते । त्रिंशद्वर्षसहस्राणि स्वर्गे च स महीयते ॥
षष्ठे काले तु कौन्तेय नरः संवत्सरं क्षपेत् । अश्वमेधस्य यज्ञस्य फलं प्राप्नोति मानवः ॥
data.md: Such a person ascends to Heaven after death and receives great honours there. That man, O son of Kunti, who passes a whole year observing fasts for five days and taking food on only the sixth day, gains the merit of Horse sacrifice. The chariot he rides, is drawn by Chakravakas.

data.v: चक्रवाकप्रयुक्तेन विमानेन स गच्छति । चत्वारिंशत्सहस्राणि वर्षाणां दिवि मोदते ॥
data.md: Such a man rides a chariot drawn by lions and tigers. He lives in Heaven for seventy thousand years in the enjoyment of every sort of happiness.

data.v: अष्टमेन तु भक्तेन जीवन्संवत्सरं नृप । गवामयस्य यज्ञस्य फलं प्राप्नोति मानवः ॥
data.md: Such a man enjoys every kind of happiness in Heaven for full forty thousand years. He who passes a whole year observing fasts for seven days and taking food on only every eighth day, gains the merit of the Gavamaya sacrifice. The chariot he rides, is drawn by swans and cranes.

data.v: हंससारसयुक्तेन विमानेन स गच्छति । पञ्चाशतं सहस्राणि वर्षाणां दिवि मोदते ॥
data.md: Such a man rides a chariot drawn by lions and tigers. He lives in Heaven for seventy thousand years in the enjoyment of every sort of happiness.

data.v: पक्षे पक्षे गते राजन्योऽश्नीयाद्वर्षमेव तु । षण्मासानशनं तस्य भगवानङ्गिराब्रवीत् । षष्टिं वर्षसहस्राणि दिवमावसते च सः ॥
data.md: Such a person enjoys all kinds of happiness in Heaven for fifty thousand years. He who passes a whole year, o king, taking food only at intervals of a fortnight, gains the merit of a continuous fast for six months. This has been said by the illustrious Angirasa himself. Such a man Lives in Heaven for sixty thousand years.

data.v: वीणानां वल्लकीनां च वेणूनां च विशां पते । सुघोषैर्मधुरैः शब्दैः सुप्तः स प्रतिबोध्यते ॥
data.md: He is roused every morning from his bed by the sweet notes of Vinas and Vallakis and flutes, O king.

data.v: संवत्सरमिहैकं तु मासि मासि पिबेत्पयः । फलं विश्वजितस्तात प्राप्नोति स नरो नृप ॥
data.md: He who passes a whole year, drinking only a little water at the termination of every month, acquires, O king, the merit of the Vishvajit sacrifice.

data.v: सिंहव्याघ्रप्रयुक्तेन विमानेन स गच्छति । सप्ततिं च सहस्राणि वर्षाणां दिवि मोदते ॥
data.md: Such a man rides a chariot drawn by lions and tigers. He lives in Heaven for seventy thousand years in the enjoyment of every sort of happiness.

data.v: मासादूर्ध्वं नरव्याघ्र नोपवासो विधीयते । विधिं त्वनशनस्याहुः पार्थ धर्मविदो जनाः ॥
data.md: No fast for more than a month, O king, has been ordained. Even this, O son of Pritha, is the ordinance about fasts that has been declared by sages conversant with duties.

data.v: अनार्तो व्याधिरहितो गच्छेदनशनं तु यः । पदे पदे यज्ञफलं स प्राप्नोति न संशयः ॥
data.md: That man who, unafflicted by discase and free from every malady, observes a fast, indeed acquires, at every step the merits of Sacrifices.

data.v: दिवं हंसप्रयुक्तेन विमानेन स गच्छति । शतं चाप्सरसः कन्या रमयन्त्यपि तं नरम् ॥
आर्तो वा व्याधितो वापि गच्छेदनशनं तु यः । शतं वर्षसहस्राणां मोदते दिवि स प्रभो । काञ्चीनूपुरशब्देन सुप्तश्चैव प्रबोध्यते ॥
data.md: He is roused from his bed every morning by the sound of the Kanchis and the Nupuras of those ladies.

data.v: सहस्रहंससंयुक्ते विमाने सोमवर्चसि । स गत्वा स्त्रीशताकीर्णे रमते भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Such a person rides on a car drawn by a thousand swans. Living, again, in a region teeming with hundreds of the most beautiful ladies, he passes his time in great joy.

data.v: क्षीणस्याप्यायनं दृष्टं क्षतस्य क्षतरोहणम् । व्याधितस्यौषधग्रामः क्रुद्धस्य च प्रसादनम् ॥
data.md: The person who seeks Heaven, does not want strength when he becomes weak, or the cure of wounds when he is wounded, or the administration of medicine when he is ill, or soothings, by others when he is angry, or the mitigation, by the expenditure of money, of sorrows caused by poverty.

data.v: दुःखितस्यार्थमानाभ्यां द्रव्याणां प्रतिपादनम् । न चैते स्वर्गकामस्य रोचन्ते सुखमेधसः ॥
अतः स कामसंयुक्तो विमाने हेमसंनिभे । रमते स्त्रीशताकीर्णे पुरुषोऽलंकृतः शुभे ॥
data.md: Leaving this world, where he suffers all sorts of privations, he proceeds to Heaven and rides on cars bedecked with gold, his body adorned with all sorts of ornaments. There in the midst of hundreds of beautiful ladies, he enjoys all sorts of pleasure and happiness, cleansed of every sin.

data.v: स्वस्थः सफलसंकल्पः सुखी विगतकल्मषः । अनश्नन्देहमुत्सृज्य फलं प्राप्नोति मानवः ॥
data.md: Indeed, abstaining from food and enjoyments in this world, he renounces this body and ascends to Heaven as the fruit of his penances, There purged of all his sins, he enjoys health and happiness and all his wishes become crowned with success.

data.v: बालसूर्यप्रतीकाशे विमाने हेमवर्चसि । वैडूर्यमुक्ताखचिते वीणामुरजनादिते ॥
data.md: Such a person rides on a celestials car of golden colour, effulgent like the morning sun, set with pearls and lapis lazuli, resounding with the music of Vinas and Murajas, adorned with banners and lamps, and echoing with the sounds of celestial bells.

data.v: पताकादीपिकाकीर्णे दिव्यघण्टानिनादिते । स्त्रीसहस्रानुचरिते स नरः सुखमेधते ॥
data.md: Such a person rides on a celestials car of golden colour, effulgent like the morning sun, set with pearls and lapis lazuli, resounding with the music of Vinas and Murajas, adorned with banners and lamps, and echoing with the sounds of celestial bells.

data.v: यावन्ति रोमकूपाणि तस्य गात्रेषु पाण्डव । तावन्त्येव सहस्राणि वर्षाणां दिवि मोदते ॥
data.md: Such a person enjoys all sorts of happiness in Heaven for as many years as there are pores in his body.

data.v: नास्ति वेदात्परं शास्त्रं नास्ति मातृसमो गुरुः । न धर्मात्परमो लाभस्तपो नानशनात्परम् ॥
data.md: There is no Shastra superior to the Veda. There is no person more worthy of respect than the mother. There is no acquisition superior to that of virtue, and no penance superior to fast.

data.v: ब्राह्मणेभ्यः परं नास्ति पावनं दिवि चेह च । उपवासैस्तथा तुल्यं तपःकर्म न विद्यते ॥
data.md: There is nothing, more sacred, in Heaven or Earth, than Brahmanas. Similarly there is no penance that is superior to the observance of fasts.

data.v: उपोष्य विधिवद्देवास्त्रिदिवं प्रतिपेदिरे । ऋषयश्च परां सिद्धिमुपवासैरवाप्नुवन् ॥
data.md: It was by fasts that the celestials have succeeded in becoming dwellers of Heaven. It is by fasts that the Rishis have acquired high success.

data.v: दिव्यं वर्षसहस्रं हि विश्वामित्रेण धीमता । क्षान्तमेकेन भक्तेन तेन विप्रत्वमागतः ॥
data.md: Vishvamitra passed a thousand celestial years, taking one meal a day, and as the consequence thereof acquired the status of a Brahmana.

data.v: च्यवनो जमदग्निश्च वसिष्ठो गौतमो भृगुः । सर्व एव दिवं प्राप्ताः क्षमावन्तो महर्षयः ॥
data.md: Chyavana, Jamadagni, Vasishtha, Gautama and Bhriguall these great Rishis gifted with the virtue of forgivenesshave attained to Heaven through the observance of fasts.

data.v: इदमङ्गिरसा पूर्वं महर्षिभ्यः प्रदर्शितम् । यः प्रदर्शयते नित्यं न स दुःखमवाप्नुते ॥
data.md: Forinerly Angirasa declared so to the great Rishis. The man who teaches another the merit of fasts, has never to suffer any sort of misery.

data.v: इमं तु कौन्तेय यथाक्रमं विधिं; प्रवर्तितं ह्यङ्गिरसा महर्षिणा । पठेत यो वै शृणुयाच्च नित्यदा; न विद्यते तस्य नरस्य किल्बिषम् ॥
data.md: The ordinances about fasts, in their due order, O son of Kunti, have originated from the great Rishi Angirasa. The man who daily reads these ordinances or hears them read, becomes freed from all sins.

data.v: विमुच्यते चापि स सर्वसंकरै;र्न चास्य दोषैरभिभूयते मनः । वियोनिजानां च विजानते रुतं; ध्रुवां च कीर्तिं लभते नरोत्तमः ॥
data.md: Not only is such a person freed from every calamity, but his mind rises above all sorts of shortcomings. Such a person succeeds in understanding the sounds of all creatures other than human, and acquiring eternal fame, becomes the foremost of men.

data.v: पितामहेन विधिवद्यज्ञाः प्रोक्ता महात्मना । गुणाश्चैषां यथातत्त्वं प्रेत्य चेह च सर्वशः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O grandfather, you have duly described to us the subject of Sacrifices, including the merits in full that attach to them both here and hereafter.

data.v: न ते शक्या दरिद्रेण यज्ञाः प्राप्तुं पितामह । बहूपकरणा यज्ञा नानासंभारविस्तराः ॥
data.md: It should be remembered, however, O grandfather, that Sacrifices are incapable of being celebrated by poor men, for these require a large store of various articles.

data.v: पार्थिवै राजपुत्रैर्वा शक्याः प्राप्तुं पितामह । नार्थन्यूनैरवगुणैरेकात्मभिरसंहतैः ॥
data.md: Indeed, O grandfather, the merit attaching to Sacrifices can be acquired by only kings and princes. That merit is incapable of being acquired by those who have no wealth and power and who live alone and are helpless.

data.v: यो दरिद्रैरपि विधिः शक्यः प्राप्तुं सदा भवेत् । तुल्यो यज्ञफलैरेतैस्तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Do you tell, us O grandfather, what the ordinances are about those acts that are fraught with merit equal to what belongs to Sacrifices and which, therefore, are capable of being performed by poor men.

data.v: इदमङ्गिरसा प्रोक्तमुपवासफलात्मकम् । विधिं यज्ञफलैस्तुल्यं तन्निबोध युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Listen, O Yudhishthira! Those ordinances that I have told you of, those, viz., that were first promulgated by the great Rishis Angirasa, and that have reference to meritorious fasts for their soul, are considered as equal to Sacrifices.

data.v: यस्तु कल्यं तथा सायं भुञ्जानो नान्तरा पिबेत् । अहिंसानिरतो नित्यं जुह्वानो जातवेदसम् ॥
data.md: That man who eats once in the forenoon and once after evening and abstains from drinking at the interval, and who shows mercy towards all creatures, and pours libations of clarified butter on his sacred fire every day, acquires success, O king, in six years. There is no doubt in this. Such a man acquires the merit of the Agnishtoma sacrifice.

data.v: षड्भिरेव तु वर्षैः स सिध्यते नात्र संशयः । तप्तकाञ्चनवर्णं च विमानं लभते नरः ॥
देवस्त्रीणामधीवासे नृत्यगीतनिनादिते । प्राजापत्ये वसेत्पद्मं वर्षाणामग्निसंनिभे ॥
त्रीणि वर्षाणि यः प्राशेत्सततं त्वेकभोजनम् । धर्मपत्नीरतो नित्यमग्निष्टोमफलं लभेत् ॥
data.md: He who passes three years, taking one meal a day and abstaining all the while from intercourse with any other woman except his own married wife, attains to the merit of the Agnishtoma sacrifice.

data.v: द्वितीये दिवसे यस्तु प्राश्नीयादेकभोजनम् । सदा द्वादशमासांस्तु जुह्वानो जातवेदसम् । यज्ञं बहुसुवर्णं वा वासवप्रियमाहरेत् ॥
सत्यवाग्दानशीलश्च ब्रह्मण्यश्चानसूयकः । क्षान्तो दान्तो जितक्रोधः स गच्छति परां गतिम् ॥
पाण्डुराभ्रप्रतीकाशे विमाने हंसलक्षणे । द्वे समाप्ते ततः पद्मे सोऽप्सरोभिर्वसेत्सह ॥
तृतीये दिवसे यस्तु प्राश्नीयादेकभोजनम् । सदा द्वादशमासांस्तु जुह्वानो जातवेदसम् ॥
data.md: That man who having fasted for twenty four days, takes a single meal on the twentyfifth day, and acts thus for full year, Succeeds in getting a car of the foremost kind, full of every object of enjoyment.

data.v: अतिरात्रस्य यज्ञस्य फलं प्राप्नोत्यनुत्तमम् । मयूरहंससंयुक्तं विमानं लभते नरः ॥
सप्तर्षीणां सदा लोके सोऽप्सरोभिर्वसेत्सह । निवर्तनं च तत्रास्य त्रीणि पद्मानि वै विदुः ॥
दिवसे यश्चतुर्थे तु प्राश्नीयादेकभोजनम् । सदा द्वादशमासान्वै जुह्वानो जातवेदसम् ॥
data.md: Fasting for three days successively, he who takes only one meal every fourth day, and pours libations every day on his sacred fire, acquires the great merit of the Vajapeya sacrifice. The car he acquires is graced by highly beautiful celestial ladies who have Indra for their father.

data.v: वाजपेयस्य यज्ञस्य फलं प्राप्नोत्यनुत्तमम् । इन्द्रकन्याभिरूढं च विमानं लभते नरः ॥
सागरस्य च पर्यन्ते वासवं लोकमावसेत् । देवराजस्य च क्रीडां नित्यकालमवेक्षते ॥
दिवसे पञ्चमे यस्तु प्राश्नीयादेकभोजनम् । सदा द्वादशमासांस्तु जुह्वानो जातवेदसम् ॥
data.md: That man who having fasted for twenty four days, takes a single meal on the twentyfifth day, and acts thus for full year, Succeeds in getting a car of the foremost kind, full of every object of enjoyment.

data.v: अलुब्धः सत्यवादी च ब्रह्मण्यश्चाविहिंसकः । अनसूयुरपापस्थो द्वादशाहफलं लभेत् ॥
जाम्बूनदमयं दिव्यं विमानं हंसलक्षणम् । सूर्यमालासमाभासमारोहेत्पाण्डुरं गृहम् ॥
data.md: The car he rides, is made of gold and drawn by swans and effulgent like many suns rising together. He acquires, besides, a palatial building of pure white.

data.v: आवर्तनानि चत्वारि तथा पद्मानि द्वादश । शराग्निपरिमाणं च तत्रासौ वसते सुखम् ॥
data.md: He lives there happily for full one and fifty Padmas of years.

data.v: दिवसे यस्तु षष्ठे वै मुनिः प्राशेत भोजनम् । सदा द्वादशमासान्वै जुह्वानो जातवेदसम् ॥
data.md: He who fasting for five days, takes food only on the sixth day, and pious libations on his sacred fire every day for one year, and who performs three ablutions in course of the day for purifying himself and saying his prayers and paying his adoration, and who leads a celibate life, divested of malice in his conduct, acquires the merit of the Gomedha sacrifice.

data.v: सदा त्रिषवणस्नायी ब्रह्मचार्यनसूयकः । गवामयस्य यज्ञस्य फलं प्राप्नोत्यनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: He who fasting for five days, takes food only on the sixth day, and pious libations on his sacred fire every day for one year, and who performs three ablutions in course of the day for purifying himself and saying his prayers and paying his adoration, and who leads a celibate life, divested of malice in his conduct, acquires the merit of the Gomedha sacrifice.

data.v: अग्निज्वालासमाभासं हंसबर्हिणसेवितम् । शातकुम्भमयं युक्तं साधयेद्यानमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: He acquires an excellent car adorned with pure gold, effulgent like a blazing fire and drawn by swans and peacocks.

data.v: तथैवाप्सरसामङ्के प्रसुप्तः प्रतिबुध्यते । नूपुराणां निनादेन मेखलानां च निस्वनैः ॥
data.md: He sleeps on the lap of Apsaras and is awakened every morning by the melodious sound of Nupuras and Kanchis.

data.v: कोटीसहस्रं वर्षाणां त्रीणि कोटिशतानि च । पद्मान्यष्टादश तथा पताके द्वे तथैव च ॥
data.md: He leads such a happy life for ten thousand millions of years and three thousand millions besides and eight and ten Padmas and two Patakas.

data.v: अयुतानि च पञ्चाशदृक्षचर्मशतस्य च । लोम्नां प्रमाणेन समं ब्रह्मलोके महीयते ॥
data.md: Such a man lives also, honoured by all, in the region of Brahma for as many years as there are hairs on the bodies of five thousand bears.

data.v: दिवसे सप्तमे यस्तु प्राश्नीयादेकभोजनम् । सदा द्वादशमासान्वै जुह्वानो जातवेदसम् ॥
data.md: That man who having fasted for seventeen days, takes only one meal on the eighteenth day, and acts thus for a whose year, succeeds! in seeing the seven regions of the universe.

data.v: सरस्वतीं गोपयानो ब्रह्मचर्यं समाचरन् । सुमनोवर्णकं चैव मधुमांसं च वर्जयेत् ॥
पुरुषो मरुतां लोकमिन्द्रलोकं च गच्छति । तत्र तत्र च सिद्धार्थो देवकन्याभिरुह्यते ॥
फलं बहुसुवर्णस्य यज्ञस्य लभते नरः । संख्यामतिगुणां चापि तेषु लोकेषु मोदते ॥
यस्तु संवत्सरं क्षान्तो भुङ्क्तेऽहन्यष्टमे नरः । देवकार्यपरो नित्यं जुह्वानो जातवेदसम् ॥
data.md: He who shows mercy to all and fasting for seven days eats on every eighth day for whole year, and, pouring libations every day on the sacred fire, worship the celestials, regularly, acquires the great merits of the Paundarika sacrifice. The car he rides is lotus-hued.

data.v: पौण्डरीकस्य यज्ञस्य फलं प्राप्नोत्यनुत्तमम् । पद्मवर्णनिभं चैव विमानमधिरोहति ॥
कृष्णाः कनकगौर्यश्च नार्यः श्यामास्तथापराः । वयोरूपविलासिन्यो लभते नात्र संशयः ॥
यस्तु संवत्सरं भुङ्क्ते नवमे नवमेऽहनि । सदा द्वादशमासान्वै जुह्वानो जातवेदसम् ॥
data.md: He who fasts for eight days and takes only one meal on every ninth day for one full year, and pours libations on the sacred fire every day, wine the great merits of a thousand Horse sacrifices. The car he rides in Heaven is beautiful like a lotus.

data.v: अश्वमेधस्य यज्ञस्य फलं प्राप्नोति मानवः । पुण्डरीकप्रकाशं च विमानं लभते नरः ॥
दीप्तसूर्याग्नितेजोभिर्दिव्यमालाभिरेव च । नीयते रुद्रकन्याभिः सोऽन्तरिक्षं सनातनम् ॥
अष्टादशसहस्राणि वर्षाणां कल्पमेव च । कोटीशतसहस्रं च तेषु लोकेषु मोदते ॥
यस्तु संवत्सरं भुङ्क्ते दशाहे वै गते गते । सदा द्वादशमासान्वै जुह्वानो जातवेदसम् ॥
ब्रह्मकन्यानिवेशे च सर्वभूतमनोहरे । अश्वमेधसहस्रस्य फलं प्राप्नोत्यनुत्तमम् ॥
रूपवत्यश्च तं कन्या रमयन्ति सदा नरम् । नीलोत्पलनिभैर्वर्णै रक्तोत्पलनिभैस्तथा ॥
data.md: These ladies, possessed of such beauty, and some of them possessed of colour of the lotus and some like that of the same flower of the blue variety, always keep him in joy. He acquires a beautiful car which moves in beautiful circles and which looks like the dense cloud called Avarta, resemble also an ocean wave.

data.v: विमानं मण्डलावर्तमावर्तगहनावृतम् । सागरोर्मिप्रतीकाशं साधयेद्यानमुत्तमम् ॥

सप्तविंशे तु दिवसे यः प्राशेदेकभोजनम् । सदा द्वादश मासांस्तु जुह्वानो जातवेदसम् ॥
data.md: That man who having fasted for twenty four days, takes a single meal on the twentyfifth day, and acts thus for full year, Succeeds in getting a car of the foremost kind, full of every object of enjoyment.

data.v: फलं प्राप्नोति विपुलं देवलोके च पूज्यते । अमृताशी वसंस्तत्र स वितृप्तः प्रमोदते ॥
data.md: That man who having fasted for twentysix days eats a single meal on the twentyseventh day, and acts thus for a full year, pouring libations every day on his sacred fire, acquires great merit and proceeding to the celestial region, receives honours from the deities, Living there he subsists on nectar freed from thirst of every kind, and enjoying every happiness.

data.v: देवर्षिचरितं राजन्राजर्षिभिरधिष्ठितम् । अध्यावसति दिव्यात्मा विमानवरमास्थितः ॥
data.md: His soul purified of every dross and making his journeys on a celestial car of great beauty, he lives there, O king, acting like the celestial Rishis and the royal sages.

data.v: स्त्रीभिर्मनोभिरामाभी रममाणो मदोत्कटः । युगकल्पसहस्राणि त्रीण्यावसति वै सुखम् ॥
data.md: Gifted with great energy, he lives there in great happiness in the company of celestial ladies of highly agreeable manners, for three thousand cycles and aeons.

data.v: योऽष्टाविंशे तु दिवसे प्राश्नीयादेकभोजनम् । सदा द्वादश मासांस्तु जितात्मा विजितेन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: That man who having fasted for seventeen days, takes only one meal on the eighteenth day, and acts thus for a whose year, succeeds! in seeing the seven regions of the universe.

data.v: फलं देवर्षिचरितं विपुलं समुपाश्नुते । भोगवांस्तेजसा भाति सहस्रांशुरिवामलः ॥
सुकुमार्यश्च नार्यस्तं रममाणाः सुवर्चसः । पीनस्तनोरुजघना दिव्याभरणभूषिताः ॥
data.md: Sportive ladies of the most delicate features and gifted with splendour of complexion, having deep bosoms, tapering thighs and full and round hips, decked with celestial ornaments, please him with their company while he rides on a delightent and excellent car effulgent like the sun and equipped with every article of enjoyment for thousands and thousands of aeons.

data.v: रमयन्ति मनः कान्ता विमाने सूर्यसंनिभे । सर्वकामगमे दिव्ये कल्पायुतशतं समाः ॥
data.md: Sportive ladies of the most delicate features and gifted with splendour of complexion, having deep bosoms, tapering thighs and full and round hips, decked with celestial ornaments, please him with their company while he rides on a delightent and excellent car effulgent like the sun and equipped with every article of enjoyment for thousands and thousands of aeons.

data.v: एकोनत्रिंशे दिवसे यः प्राशेदेकभोजनम् । सदा द्वादश मासान्वै सत्यव्रतपरायणः ॥
data.md: That man who having fasted for seventeen days, takes only one meal on the eighteenth day, and acts thus for a whose year, succeeds! in seeing the seven regions of the universe.

data.v: तस्य लोकाः शुभा दिव्या देवराजर्षिपूजिताः । विमानं चन्द्रशुभ्राभं दिव्यं समधिगच्छति ॥
जातरूपमयं युक्तं सर्वरत्नविभूषितम् । अप्सरोगणसंपूर्णं गन्धर्वैरभिनादितम् ॥
तत्र चैनं शुभा नार्यो दिव्याभरणभूषिताः । मनोभिरामा मधुरा रमयन्ति मदोत्कटाः ॥
data.md: Thereon he is attended by auspicious ladies adorned with celestial ornaments of every sort. Gifted with sweet dispositions and agreeable features, and endued with great energy, se gladden him with their company.

data.v: भोगवांस्तेजसा युक्तो वैश्वानरसमप्रभः । दिव्यो दिव्येन वपुषा भ्राजमान इवामरः ॥
data.md: Endued with every article of enjoyment and with great energy, and possessed of the splendour of a burning fire, he shines like a celestial, with a celestial form having every excellence.

data.v: वसूनां मरुतां चैव साध्यानामश्विनोस्तथा । रुद्राणां च तथा लोकान्ब्रह्मलोकं च गच्छति ॥
data.md: The regions he attains are those of the Vasus and the Maruts, of the Saddhyas and the Ashvins, of the Rudras and of Brahman himself.

data.v: यस्तु मासे गते भुङ्क्ते एकभक्तं शमात्मकः । सदा द्वादश मासान्वै ब्रह्मलोकमवाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: That man who having fasted for a full month, takes a single meal on the first day of the following month, and acts thus for a full year, loO king on all things impartially, attains to the regions of Brahman himself.

data.v: सुधारसकृताहारः श्रीमान्सर्वमनोहरः । तेजसा वपुषा लक्ष्म्या भ्राजते रश्मिवानिव ॥
data.md: There he lives upon ambrosia. Gifted with a beautiful form highly agreeable to all, he shines with energy and prosperity like the sun himself of a thousand rays.

data.v: दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरो दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनः । सुखेष्वभिरतो योगी दुःखानामविजानकः ॥
data.md: Devoted to yoga and adorned with celestial dresses and garlands and smeared with celestial pertumes and unguents, he passes his time in great happiness, not experiencing the least sorrow. He shines on his car attended by ladies that blaze forth with effulgence emitted by themselves.

data.v: स्वयंप्रभाभिर्नारीभिर्विमानस्थो महीयते । रुद्रदेवर्षिकन्याभिः सततं चाभिपूज्यते ॥
data.md: Those ladies the daughters of the celestial Rishis and the Rudras, worship him with veneration.

data.v: नानाविधसुरूपाभिर्नानारागाभिरेव च । नानामधुरभाषाभिर्नानारतिभिरेव च ॥
data.md: Capable of assuming various forms that are highly delightful and highly agreeable, their speech is characterized by various kinds of sweetness, and they are able to please the person they wait upon in various kinds of ways.

data.v: विमाने नगराकारे सूर्यवत्सूर्यसंनिभे । पृष्ठतः सोमसंकाशे उदक्चैवाभ्रसंनिभे ॥
दक्षिणायां तु रक्ताभे अधस्तान्नीलमण्डले । ऊर्ध्वं चित्राभिसंकाशे नैको वसति पूजितः ॥
data.md: While making his journeys, he rides on a car that looks like the sky itself in colour, In his rear are cars which look like the Moon; before him are those which resemble the clouds; on his right are cars that are red; below him are those that are blue and above, him are those that are of variegated colour. He is always worshipped by those who wait upon him.

data.v: यावद्वर्षसहस्रं तु जम्बूद्वीपे प्रवर्षति । तावत्संवत्सराः प्रोक्ता ब्रह्मलोकस्य धीमतः ॥
data.md: Gifted with great wisdom, he lives in the region of Brahman for as many years as are measured by the drops of rain that fall in course of a thousand years on the insular continent of Jamvudvipa.

data.v: विप्रुषश्चैव यावन्त्यो निपतन्ति नभस्तलात् । वर्षासु वर्षतस्तावन्निवसत्यमरप्रभः ॥
data.md: Indeed, gifted with the effulgence a deity, he lives in that region of unalloyed happiness for as many years as the drops of rain which fall upon the Earth in the rainy season.

data.v: मासोपवासी वर्षैस्तु दशभिः स्वर्गमुत्तमम् । महर्षित्वमथासाद्य सशरीरगतिर्भवेत् ॥
data.md: The man who having fasted for a whole month, eats on the first day of the following months and acts thus for ten years, acquires the status of a great Rishi. He has not to undergo any change of form while going to the celestial region for enjoying the rewards of his deeds in this life.

data.v: मुनिर्दान्तो जितक्रोधो जितशिश्नोदरः सदा । जुह्वन्नग्नींश्च नियतः संध्योपासनसेविता ॥
data.md: Indeed, this is the status which one acquires by controlling speech, practising self-denial, subjugating anger, sexual appetite, and the desire to eat, pouring libations on the sacred fire, and regularly worshipping the twotwilight's.

data.v: बहुभिर्नियमैरेवं मासानश्नाति यो नरः । अभ्रावकाशशीलश्च तस्य वासो निरुच्यते ॥
data.md: That man who purifies hiinself by the observance of these and similar vows and practices, and who eats in this way, becomes as pure as other and gifted with solar effulgence.

data.v: दिवं गत्वा शरीरेण स्वेन राजन्यथामरः । स्वर्गं पुण्यं यथाकाममुपभुङ्क्ते यथाविधि ॥
data.md: Such a man, o king proceeding to the celestial region in even his own corporeal frame, enjoys all the, happiness that is there like a celestial at his will.

data.v: एष ते भरतश्रेष्ठ यज्ञानां विधिरुत्तमः । व्याख्यातो ह्यानुपूर्व्येण उपवासफलात्मकः ॥
data.md: I have thus told you, O chief of the Bharatas, what the excellent ordinances are as son about sacrifices, one ' after another, dependent upon the fruits of fasts.

data.v: दरिद्रैर्मनुजैः पार्थ प्राप्यं यज्ञफलं यथा । उपवासमिमं कृत्वा गच्छेच्च परमां गतिम् । देवद्विजातिपूजायां रतो भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Poor men, O of Pritha, may, nevertheless, acquire the fruits thereof (by the observance of fasts). By observing these fasts, even a poor man may acquire the highest end, O foremost one of Bharata's race, devoting himself all the while besides, to the worship of the celestials and the Brahinanas. I have thus recited to you in full the ordinance about fasts.

data.v: उपवासविधिस्त्वेष विस्तरेण प्रकीर्तितः । नियतेष्वप्रमत्तेषु शौचवत्सु महात्मसु ॥
दम्भद्रोहनिवृत्तेषु कृतबुद्धिषु भारत । अचलेष्वप्रकम्पेषु मा ते भूदत्र संशयः ॥
data.md: Do not entertain any doubt about those men who so observe vows, who are so hecdful and pure and great, who are so freed from pride and malice, who are endued with such devoted understandings, and who pursue their end with such firinness and fixity of purpose without ever deviating from their path.

data.v: यद्वरं सर्वतीर्थानां तद्ब्रवीहि पितामह । यत्र वै परमं शौचं तन्मे व्याख्यातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Tell me, o grandfather of that which is considered as the foremost of all Tirthas. Indeed, you should expound to me what that Tirtha is which conduces to the greatest purity.

data.v: सर्वाणि खलु तीर्थानि गुणवन्ति मनीषिणाम् । यत्तु तीर्थं च शौचं च तन्मे शृणु समाहितः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Forsooth, all Tirthas are possessed of merit. Listen, however, with attention to me as I tell you what the Tirtha, the cleanser, is of men gifted with wisdom.

data.v: अगाधे विमले शुद्धे सत्यतोये धृतिह्रदे । स्नातव्यं मानसे तीर्थे सत्त्वमालम्ब्य शाश्वतम् ॥
data.md: Following eternal Truth one should bathe in the Tirtha called Manasa, which is unfathomable, stainless, and pure, and which has Truth for its waters and the understanding for its lake.

data.v: तीर्थशौचमनर्थित्वमार्दवं सत्यमार्जवम् । अहिंसा सर्वभूतानामानृशंस्यं दमः शमः ॥
data.md: The fruits, in the form of cleansing, that one gains by bathing in the Tirtha, are freedom from cupidity, sincerity, truthfulness, mildness, mercy, abstention from injuring any creature, selfcontrol, and tranquillity.

data.v: निर्ममा निरहंकारा निर्द्वंद्वा निष्परिग्रहाः । शुचयस्तीर्थभूतास्ते ये भैक्षमुपभुञ्जते ॥
data.md: Those men who are freed from attachments, who are shorn of pride, who are above all pairs of opposites, who have no wives and children and houses and gardens, etc., who are gifted with purity, and who live upon the alms given to them by others, are considered as Tirthas.

data.v: तत्त्ववित्त्वनहंबुद्धिस्तीर्थं परममुच्यते । शौचलक्षणमेतत्ते सर्वत्रैवान्ववेक्षणम् ॥
data.md: He who knows the truths of all things and who is freed from the idea of mineness, is said to be the highest Tirtha. In finding out the marks of purity, your gaze should ever be directed towards these qualities.

data.v: रजस्तमः सत्त्वमथो येषां निर्धौतमात्मनः । शौचाशौचे न ते सक्ताः स्वकार्यपरिमार्गिणः ॥
सर्वत्यागेष्वभिरताः सर्वज्ञाः सर्वदर्शिनः । शौचेन वृत्तशौचार्थास्ते तीर्थाः शुचयश्च ते ॥
data.md: Those persons from whose souls the qualities of goodness, darkness, and ignorance have been washed off, they who, not caring for purity and impurity, pursue the ends they have proposed to themselves, they who have renounced everything, they who are possessed of omniscience and gifted with universal sight, and they who are of pure conduct, are considered as Tirthas possessing the purifying power.

data.v: नोदकक्लिन्नगात्रस्तु स्नात इत्यभिधीयते । स स्नातो यो दमस्नातः सबाह्याभ्यन्तरः शुचिः ॥
data.md: That man whose limbs only are wet with water is not considered as one that is washed. He, on the other hand, is considered as washed who has washed himself by selfdenial. Even such a person is said to be pure both internally and externally.

data.v: अतीतेष्वनपेक्षा ये प्राप्तेष्वर्थेषु निर्ममाः । शौचमेव परं तेषां येषां नोत्पद्यते स्पृहा ॥
data.md: They who never busy themselves with what is past, they who feel no attachment for present acquisitions, indeed, they who are free from desire, are said to be possessed of the highest purity.

data.v: प्रज्ञानं शौचमेवेह शरीरस्य विशेषतः । तथा निष्किंचनत्वं च मनसश्च प्रसन्नता ॥
data.md: Knowledge is said to form the especial purity of the body. So also freedom from desire, and cheerfulness of mind.

data.v: वृत्तशौचं मनःशौचं तीर्थशौचं परं हितम् । ज्ञानोत्पन्नं च यच्छौचं तच्छौचं परमं मतम् ॥
data.md: Purity of conduct forms the purity of the mind. The purity that one acquires by ablutions in sacred waters is considered as inferior. Indeed that purity which originates from knowledge, is considered as the best.

data.v: मनसाथ प्रदीपेन ब्रह्मज्ञानबलेन च । स्नाता ये मानसे तीर्थे तज्ज्ञाः क्षेत्रज्ञदर्शिनः ॥
data.md: Those ablutions which one performs with a burning mind in the waters of the knowledge of Brahma in the Tirtha called Manasa, are the true ablutions for truth knowing persons.

data.v: समारोपितशौचस्तु नित्यं भावसमन्वितः । केवलं गुणसंपन्नः शुचिरेव नरः सदा ॥
data.md: That man who is endued with true purity of conduct and who is always given to the preservation of a proper attitude to wards all, indeed, he who is gifted with attributes and merit, is considered as truly pure.

data.v: शरीरस्थानि तीर्थानि प्रोक्तान्येतानि भारत । पृथिव्यां यानि तीर्थानि पुण्यानि शृणु तान्यपि ॥
data.md: These that I have mentioned have been said to be the Tirthas of the body. Listen to me as I tell you what those sacred Tirthas are that are situate on the Earth also.

data.v: यथा शरीरस्योद्देशाः शुचयः परिनिर्मिताः । तथा पृथिव्या भागाश्च पुण्यानि सलिलानि च ॥
data.md: As special attributes of the body have been said to be sacred, so there are particulars spots on Earth as well, and particular waters, which are considered sacred.

data.v: प्रार्थनाच्चैव तीर्थस्य स्नानाच्च पितृतर्पणात् । धुनन्ति पापं तीर्थेषु पूता यान्ति दिवं सुखम् ॥
data.md: By reciting the names of the Tirthas, by performing ablutions there, and by offering oblations to the departed Manes in those places, one's sins are dissipated. Those men whose sins are thus dissipated, succeed in acquiring the celestial region, when they leave this world.

data.v: परिग्रहाच्च साधूनां पृथिव्याश्चैव तेजसा । अतीव पुण्यास्ते भागाः सलिलस्य च तेजसा ॥
data.md: On account of their association with pious persons through the special efficacy of the earth itself, of those spots and of particular waters, there are certain portions of the Earth that have come to be considered as sacred.

data.v: मनसश्च पृथिव्याश्च पुण्यतीर्थास्तथापरे । उभयोरेव यः स्नातः स सिद्धिं शीघ्रमाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: The mental Tirthas are separate and distinct from those of the Earth. That person who bathes in both acquires success forthwith.

data.v: यथा बलं क्रियाहीनं क्रिया वा बलवर्जिता । नेह साधयते कार्यं समायुक्तस्तु सिध्यति ॥
data.md: As strength without exertion, or exertion without strength can never perform anything, singly, and as these, when combined, can do all things, so one that becomes gifted with the purity that is contributed by the Tirthas in the body as also by that which is contributed by the Tirthas on the Earth, becomes truly pure and acquires success. That purity which is derived from both sources is the best.

data.v: एवं शरीरशौचेन तीर्थशौचेन चान्वितः । ततः सिद्धिमवाप्नोति द्विविधं शौचमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: As strength without exertion, or exertion without strength can never perform anything, singly, and as these, when combined, can do all things, so one that becomes gifted with the purity that is contributed by the Tirthas in the body as also by that which is contributed by the Tirthas on the Earth, becomes truly pure and acquires success. That purity which is derived from both sources is the best.

data.v: पितामह महाबाहो सर्वशास्त्रविशारद । श्रोतुमिच्छामि मर्त्यानां संसारविधिमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said o grandfather, O greatly wise one, conversant with all the scriptures, I wish to know those excellent ordinances by which mortals have to travel through their rounds of rebirth.

data.v: केन वृत्तेन राजेन्द्र वर्तमाना नरा युधि । प्राप्नुवन्त्युत्तमं स्वर्गं कथं च नरकं नृप ॥
data.md: What is that conduct by following which O king, men succeed in acquiring high heaven and what is that conduct by which one sinks in Hell?

data.v: मृतं शरीरमुत्सृज्य काष्ठलोष्टसमं जनाः । प्रयान्त्यमुं लोकमितः को वै ताननुगच्छति ॥
data.md: When renouncing the dead body that is as inert as a piece of wood or clod of earth people proceed to the other world, what are those which follow them there?

data.v: असावायाति भगवान्बृहस्पतिरुदारधीः । पृच्छैनं सुमहाभागमेतद्गुह्यं सनातनम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Yonder comes the illustrious and highly intelligent Brihaspati. Do you ask his blessed self. The subject is an eternal mystery.

data.v: नैतदन्येन शक्यं हि वक्तुं केनचिदद्य वै । वक्ता बृहस्पतिसमो न ह्यन्यो विद्यते क्वचित् ॥
data.md: None else is capable of explaining the matter. There is no speaker like Brihaspati.

data.v: तयोः संवदतोरेवं पार्थगाङ्गेययोस्तदा । आजगाम विशुद्धात्मा भगवान्स बृहस्पतिः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said While the son of Pritha and the son of Ganga were thus conversing with each other, there came at the spot from the sky the illustrious Brihaspati of purified soul.

data.v: ततो राजा समुत्थाय धृतराष्ट्रपुरोगमः । पूजामनुपमां चक्रे सर्वे ते च सभासदः ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira, and all others, headed by Dhritarashtra, stood up and received Brihaspati with proper honours. Excellent was the worship they offered to the preceptor of the celestials.

data.v: ततो धर्मसुतो राजा भगवन्तं बृहस्पतिम् । उपगम्य यथान्यायं प्रश्नं पप्रच्छ सुव्रतः ॥
data.md: Then approaching the illustrious Brihaspati, Dharma's royal son, Yudhishthira, asked him the question in proper form, desirous of knowing the truth.

data.v: भगवन्सर्वधर्मज्ञ सर्वशास्त्रविशारद । मर्त्यस्य कः सहायो वै पिता माता सुतो गुरुः ॥
मृतं शरीरमुत्सृज्य काष्ठलोष्टसमं जनाः । गच्छन्त्यमुत्रलोकं वै क एनमनुगच्छति ॥
data.md: When renouncing the dead body that is as inert as a piece of wood or clod of earth people proceed to the other world, what are those which follow them there?

data.v: एकः प्रसूतो राजेन्द्र जन्तुरेको विनश्यति । एकस्तरति दुर्गाणि गच्छत्येकश्च दुर्गतिम् ॥
असहायः पिता माता तथा भ्राता सुतो गुरुः । ज्ञातिसंबन्धिवर्गश्च मित्रवर्गस्तथैव च ॥
data.md: Is the father, or mother, or son, or preceptor, or kinsmen, or relatives, or those called friends, that may be said to truly form the friend of a mortal creature? One goes to the next world, leaving his dead body that is like a piece of wood or a clod of earth. Who is it that follows him there?

data.v: मृतं शरीरमुत्सृज्य काष्ठलोष्टसमं जनाः । मुहूर्तमुपतिष्ठन्ति ततो यान्ति पराङ्मुखाः । तैस्तच्छरीरमुत्सृष्टं धर्म एकोऽनुगच्छति ॥
तस्माद्धर्मः सहायार्थे सेवितव्यः सदा नृभिः । प्राणी धर्मसमायुक्तो गच्छते स्वर्गतिं पराम् । तथैवाधर्मसंयुक्तो नरकायोपपद्यते ॥
data.md: A virtuous man would acquire that high end which is formed by Heaven. If sinful he goes to hell.

data.v: तस्मान्न्यायागतैरर्थैर्धर्मं सेवेत पण्डितः । धर्म एको मनुष्याणां सहायः पारलौकिकः ॥
data.md: Hence, an intelligent man should always seek to acquire virtue through wealth acquired by fair means. Virtue is the one only friend whichcrcatures have in the next world.

data.v: लोभान्मोहादनुक्रोशाद्भयाद्वाप्यबहुश्रुतः । नरः करोत्यकार्याणि परार्थे लोभमोहितः ॥
data.md: Moved by cupidity, or stupefaction, or mercy, or fear, one shorn of knowledge is seen to do unfair deeds, for sake of even another, his judgement thus stupefied by cupidity.

data.v: धर्मश्चार्थश्च कामश्च त्रितयं जीविते फलम् । एतत्त्रयमवाप्तव्यमधर्मपरिवर्जितम् ॥
data.md: Virtue, wealth, and pleasure, these three form the fruit of life. Onc should win these three by means of being free from impropriety and sin.

data.v: श्रुतं भगवतो वाक्यं धर्मयुक्तं परं हितम् । शरीरविचयं ज्ञातुं बुद्धिस्तु मम जायते ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said I have carefully heard the words spoken by your illustrious self, these words that are fraught with virtue, and that are highly beneficial, I wish now to know of the state of the body (after death.)

data.v: मृतं शरीररहितं सूक्ष्ममव्यक्ततां गतम् । अचक्षुर्विषयं प्राप्तं कथं धर्मोऽनुगच्छति ॥
data.md: The dead body of man becomes subtile and unmanifest. It becomes invisible. How is it possible for virtue to follow it?

data.v: पृथिवी वायुराकाशमापो ज्योतिश्च पञ्चमम् । बुद्धिरात्मा च सहिता धर्मं पश्यन्ति नित्यदा ॥
प्राणिनामिह सर्वेषां साक्षिभूतानि चानिशम् । एतैश्च स ह धर्मोऽपि तं जीवमनुगच्छति ॥
त्वगस्थिमांसं शुक्रं च शोणितं च महामते । शरीरं वर्जयन्त्येते जीवितेन विवर्जितम् ॥
data.md: When the body becomes bereft of life, skin, bones flesh, the vital seed, and blood, leave it simultaneously.

data.v: ततो धर्मसमायुक्तः स जीवः सुखमेधते । इह लोके परे चैव किं भूयः कथयामि ते ॥
data.md: What else do you wish to hear? If gifted with virtue, individual soul enjoys happiness. What other subject, belonging to this or the other world shall I describe to you?

data.v: अनुदर्शितं भगवता यथा धर्मोऽनुगच्छति । एतत्तु ज्ञातुमिच्छामि कथं रेतः प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Your illustrious self has explained how virtuc follows individual soul. I wish to know how the vital seed is originated.

data.v: अन्नमश्नन्ति ये देवाः शरीरस्था नरेश्वर । पृथिवी वायुराकाशमापो ज्योतिर्मनस्तथा ॥
ततस्तृप्तेषु राजेन्द्र तेषु भूतेषु पञ्चसु । मनःषष्ठेषु शुद्धात्मन्रेतः संपद्यते महत् ॥
data.md: Brihaspati said The food that these gods, O king, who live in the body viz Earth, Wind, Ether, Water, Light and Mind, cat, pleases them. When those five elements become pleased, O monarch with Mind numbering as their sixth, their vital seed then becomes generated, O you of purified Soul.

data.v: ततो गर्भः संभवति स्त्रीपुंसोः पार्थ संगमे । एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं किं भूयः श्रोतुमिच्छसि ॥
आख्यातमेतद्भवता गर्भः संजायते यथा । यथा जातस्तु पुरुषः प्रपद्यति तदुच्यताम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have, O illustrious one, said how conception takes piace. Do you explain how the individual soul that takes birth, grows.

data.v: आसन्नमात्रः सततं तैर्भूतैरभिभूयते । विप्रमुक्तश्च तैर्भूतैः पुनर्यात्यपरां गतिम् । स तु भूतसमायुक्तः प्राप्नुते जीव एव ह ॥
data.md: Brihaspati said As soon as individual soul enters the vital seed, he becomes overwhelmed by the elements already mentioned. When individual soul become disunited therewith, he is said to attain to the other end (viz., death).

data.v: ततोऽस्य कर्म पश्यन्ति शुभं वा यदि वाशुभम् । देवताः पञ्चभूतस्थाः किं भूयः श्रोतुमिच्छसि ॥
data.md: Gifted with merit (and demerit) individual soul (after the destruction of this body) comes by another body. After the attainment by individual soul of that body the presiding deities of the five elements once more witness all his deeds, good and bad.

data.v: त्वगस्थिमांसमुत्सृज्य तैश्च भूतैर्विवर्जितः । जीवः स भगवन्क्वस्थः सुखदुःखे समश्नुते ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Living off skin, bone and flesh, and becoming destitute of all those elements, in what does individual soul reside, O illustrious one, for enjoying and suffering happiness and imisery?

data.v: जीवो धर्मसमायुक्तः शीघ्रं रेतस्त्वमागतः । स्त्रीणां पुष्पं समासाद्य सूते कालेन भारत ॥
data.md: Brihaspati said Endued with all his acts, individual soul quickly enters the vital seed, and availing of the menstrual flow of women, takes birth in time, O Bharata.

data.v: यमस्य पुरुषैः क्लेशं यमस्य पुरुषैर्वधम् । दुःखं संसारचक्रं च नरः क्लेशं च विन्दति ॥
data.md: After birth individual soul receives woe and death from the messengers of Yama. Indeed, he goes through misery and a painful round of rebirth.

data.v: इहलोके च स प्राणी जन्मप्रभृति पार्थिव । स्वकृतं कर्म वै भुङ्क्ते धर्मस्य फलमाश्रितः ॥
data.md: Endued with life, O king, individual soul in this world, from the moment of his birth, enjoys and suffers his own (pristine deeds), depending upon virtue (and its reverse).

data.v: यदि धर्मं यथाशक्ति जन्मप्रभृति सेवते । ततः स पुरुषो भूत्वा सेवते नित्यदा सुखम् ॥
data.md: If individual soul according to the best of his power, follows virtue from the day of his birth, he them succeeds in enjoying uninterruptedly, when reborn, happiness.

data.v: अथान्तरा तु धर्मस्य अधर्ममुपसेवते । सुखस्यानन्तरं दुःखं स जीवोऽप्यधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: If, on the other hand, without following virtue without interruption, he acts sinfully, he reaps happiness at first as the reward of his virtue and suffers misery after that.

data.v: अधर्मेण समायुक्तो यमस्य विषयं गतः । महद्दुःखं समासाद्य तिर्यग्योनौ प्रजायते ॥
data.md: Endued with sin, individual soul has to go the dominions of Yama and suffering great misery there he has to take birth in an intermediate order of being.

data.v: कर्मणा येन येनेह यस्यां योनौ प्रजायते । जीवो मोहसमायुक्तस्तन्मे निगदतः शृणु ॥
data.md: Listen to me as I tell you, what the different acts are by doing which individuals soul, Stupefied by folly, has to take birth in different orders of being, as declared in the Vedas, the scriptures, and the histories, Mortals have to go to the dreadful regions of Yama.

data.v: यदेतदुच्यते शास्त्रे सेतिहासे सच्छन्दसि । यमस्य विषयं घोरं मर्त्यो लोकः प्रपद्यते ॥
data.md: Listen to me as I tell you, what the different acts are by doing which individuals soul, Stupefied by folly, has to take birth in different orders of being, as declared in the Vedas, the scriptures, and the histories, Mortals have to go to the dreadful regions of Yama.

data.v: अधीत्य चतुरो वेदान्द्विजो मोहसमन्वितः । पतितात्प्रतिगृह्याथ खरयोनौ प्रजायते ॥
data.md: I shall after this tell you what those acts and dispositions are on account of which a person acquires an end that is fraught with great misery and terror.

data.v: खरो जीवति वर्षाणि दश पञ्च च भारत । खरो मृतो बलीवर्दः सप्त वर्षाणि जीवति ॥
data.md: He has to live as an ass for fifteen years, Shaking off his assinine form, he has next to take birth as an ox and which state he has to live for seven years.

data.v: बलीवर्दो मृतश्चापि जायते ब्रह्मराक्षसः । ब्रह्मरक्षस्तु त्रीन्मासांस्ततो जायति ब्राह्मणः ॥
data.md: Throwing off his bovine forın, he has next to take birth as a Rakshasa of the twice born order. Living as a Rakshasa of the twice born order for three months, he then regains his status of a Brahmana.

data.v: पतितं याजयित्वा तु कृमियोनौ प्रजायते । तत्र जीवति वर्षाणि दश पञ्च च भारत ॥
data.md: A Brahmana, by officiating at the sacrifice of a degraded person, has to take birth as a vile worm. In this form he has to live for fifteen years, O Bharata.

data.v: कृमिभावात्प्रमुक्तस्तु ततो जायति गर्दभः । गर्दभः पञ्च वर्षाणि पञ्च वर्षाणि सूकरः । श्वा वर्षमेकं भवति ततो जायति मानवः ॥
data.md: Freed from his worm birth, he is next born as an ass. As an ass he has to live for five years, and then as a hog, in which state also he has to reinain for as many years.

data.v: उपाध्यायस्य यः पापं शिष्यः कुर्यादबुद्धिमान् । स जीव इह संसारांस्त्रीनाप्नोति न संशयः ॥
data.md: That foolish disciple who offends his preceptor by injuring him, has certainly to undergo three changes in this world.

data.v: प्राक्श्वा भवति राजेन्द्र ततः क्रव्यात्ततः खरः । ततः प्रेतः परिक्लिष्टः पश्चाज्जायति ब्राह्मणः ॥
data.md: Such a person, o king, has in the first instance to become a dog. He has then to become a beast of prey, and then an ass. Living his assinine form he has to wander for sometime in great, misery as a spirit. After the expiration of that time, he is born as a Brahmana.

data.v: मनसापि गुरोर्भार्यां यः शिष्यो याति पापकृत् । सोऽधमान्याति संसारानधर्मेणेह चेतसा ॥
data.md: That sinful disciple who even in thought knows the wife of his preceptor, has, on account of such a sinful heart, to undergo many dreadful shapes in this world.

data.v: श्वयोनौ तु स संभूतस्त्रीणि वर्षाणि जीवति । तत्रापि निधनं प्राप्तः कृमियोनौ प्रजायते ॥
data.md: First taking birth in the canine order he has to live for three years. Throwing off the canine forin when death comes, he is born as a vile vermin.

data.v: कृमिभावमनुप्राप्तो वर्षमेकं स जीवति । ततस्तु निधनं प्राप्य ब्रह्मयोनौ प्रजायते ॥
data.md: In this form he has to live for a year. Renouncing that form he succeeds in regaining his status as a human being of the twice born order.

data.v: यदि पुत्रसमं शिष्यं गुरुर्हन्यादकारणे । आत्मनः कामकारेण सोऽपि हंसः प्रजायते ॥
data.md: If the preceptor kills, without reason, his disciple who is even as a son to him, he has on account of such a wilful deed of sin on his part, to take birth as a beast of prey.

data.v: पितरं मातरं वापि यस्तु पुत्रोऽवमन्यते । सोऽपि राजन्मृतो जन्तुः पूर्वं जायति गर्दभः ॥
data.md: That son who disregards his father and mother, O king, is born after renouncing his human form as an ass.

data.v: खरो जीवति मासांस्तु दश श्वा च चतुर्दश । बिडालः सप्त मासांस्तु ततो जायति मानवः ॥
data.md: As an ass he has to live for ten months. He is next born as a dog and has to remain as such for fourteen months. After that he is born as a cat and living in that form for seven months he regains his human form.

data.v: मातापितरमाक्रुश्य सारिकः संप्रजायते । ताडयित्वा तु तावेव जायते कच्छपो नृप ॥
data.md: Having spoken ill of parents one is born as a Sarika. Striking them one is born, O king as a tortoise.

data.v: कच्छपो दश वर्षाणि त्रीणि वर्षाणि शल्यकः । व्यालो भूत्वा तु षण्मासांस्ततो जायति मानुषः ॥
data.md: Living as a tortoise for ten years, he is born as a porcupine. After that he has to take birth as a snake, and living for six months in that form he regains human form.

data.v: भर्तृपिण्डमुपाश्नन्यो राजद्विष्टानि सेवते । सोऽपि मोहसमापन्नो मृतो जायति वानरः ॥
data.md: That man who, while living upon the food that his royal master supplies, commits deeds injurious to the interests of his master, stupefied by folly, has, after death, to take birth as a monkey.

data.v: वानरो दश वर्षाणि त्रीणि वर्षाणि मूषकः । श्वा भूत्वा चाथ षण्मासांस्ततो जायति मानुषः ॥
data.md: Living as a tortoise for ten years, he is born as a porcupine. After that he has to take birth as a snake, and living for six months in that form he regains human form.

data.v: न्यासापहर्ता तु नरो यमस्य विषयं गतः । संसाराणां शतं गत्वा कृमियोनौ प्रजायते ॥
data.md: That man who misappropriates what is deposited with him in trust, has to undergo a hundred births. He at last takes birth as a vile worm.

data.v: तत्र जीवति वर्षाणि दश पञ्च च भारत । दुष्कृतस्य क्षयं गत्वा ततो जायति मानुषः ॥
data.md: In that order he has to live for fifteen years, O Bharata. Upon the exhaustion of his sin in this way, he succeeds in regaining his human form.

data.v: असूयको नरश्चापि मृतो जायति शार्ङ्गकः । विश्वासहर्ता तु नरो मीनो जायति दुर्मतिः ॥
data.md: That man who has malice towards others, has, after death, to take birth as a sharngaka. That wicked man who becomes guilty of breach of trust has to take birth as a fish.

data.v: भूत्वा मीनोऽष्ट वर्षाणि मृगो जायति भारत । मृगस्तु चतुरो मासांस्ततश्छागः प्रजायते ॥
data.md: Living as a fish for eight years he is born, O Bharata, as a deer. Living as a deer for four months he is next born as a goat.

data.v: छागस्तु निधनं प्राप्य पूर्णे संवत्सरे ततः । कीटः संजायते जन्तुस्ततो जायति मानुषः ॥
data.md: After the expiration of a full year, he renounces his goatish body, and is then born as a worm. After that he succeeds in regaining his human form.

data.v: धान्यान्यवांस्तिलान्माषान्कुलत्थान्सर्षपांश्चणान् । कलायानथ मुद्गांश्च गोधूमानतसीस्तथा ॥
data.md: That shameless insensate man who, through stupefaction, steals paddy, barley sesame, Masha, Kulattha, oil seeds, oats Kalaya, Mudga, wheat, Atasi, and other kinds of corn, is born as a mouse.

data.v: सस्यस्यान्यस्य हर्ता च मोहाज्जन्तुरचेतनः । स जायते महाराज मूषको निरपत्रपः ॥
ततः प्रेत्य महाराज पुनर्जायति सूकरः । सूकरो जातमात्रस्तु रोगेण म्रियते नृप ॥
data.md: After leading the life for sometime, he is next born as a hog. As soon as he is born as a hog he has to die of diseasc.

data.v: श्वा ततो जायते मूढः कर्मणा तेन पार्थिव । श्वा भूत्वा पञ्च वर्षाणि ततो जायति मानुषः ॥
data.md: On account of his sin, that foolish man has next to take birth as a dog, O king. Living as a dog for five years, he then regains his human form.

data.v: परदाराभिमर्शं तु कृत्वा जायति वै वृकः । श्वा सृगालस्ततो गृध्रो व्यालः कङ्को बकस्तथा ॥
data.md: Having committed an act of adultery with the wife of another man, one is born as a wolf. After that he has to assume the forms of a dog and jacka! and vulture. He has next to take birth as a snake and then as a Kanka (a bird of prey) and then as a crane.

data.v: भ्रातुर्भार्यां तु दुर्बुद्धिर्यो धर्षयति मोहितः । पुंस्कोकिलत्वमाप्नोति सोऽपि संवत्सरं नृप ॥
data.md: That sinful wight who out of foolishness, knows his brother's wife, has to take birth as a male Coel and to live in that form for a whole year, O king.

data.v: सखिभार्यां गुरोर्भार्यां राजभार्यां तथैव च । प्रधर्षयित्वा कामाद्यो मृतो जायति सूकरः ॥
data.md: He who, through lust, knows the wife of a friend, or the wife of preceptor, or the wife of his king, has after death to take the form of a hog.

data.v: सूकरः पञ्च वर्षाणि पञ्च वर्षाणि श्वाविधः । पिपीलकस्तु षण्मासान्कीटः स्यान्मासमेव च । एतानासाद्य संसारान्कृमियोनौ प्रजायते ॥
तत्र जीवति मासांस्तु कृमियोनौ त्रयोदश । ततोऽधर्मक्षयं कृत्वा पुनर्जायति मानुषः ॥
उपस्थिते विवाहे तु दाने यज्ञेऽपि वाभिभो । मोहात्करोति यो विघ्नं स मृतो जायते कृमिः ॥
data.md: When a marriage is about to take place a sacrifice or an act of gifts is about to be made, O you of great power the man who puts in any impediment has to take birth in his next life as a vile worm.

data.v: कृमिर्जीवति वर्षाणि दश पञ्च च भारत । अधर्मस्य क्षयं कृत्वा ततो जायति मानुषः ॥
data.md: In that order he has to live for fifteen years, O Bharata. Upon the exhaustion of his sin in this way, he succeeds in regaining his human form.

data.v: पूर्वं दत्त्वा तु यः कन्यां द्वितीये संप्रयच्छति । सोऽपि राजन्मृतो जन्तुः कृमियोनौ प्रजायते ॥
data.md: Having once bestowed his daughter in marriage upon a person, he who seeks to bestow her again upon a second husband, is compelled, O king, to take birth among vile worms.

data.v: तत्र जीवति वर्षाणि त्रयोदश युधिष्ठिर । अधर्मसंक्षये युक्तस्ततो जायति मानुषः ॥
data.md: In that order he has to live for fifteen years, O Bharata. Upon the exhaustion of his sin in this way, he succeeds in regaining his human form.

data.v: देवकार्यमुपाकृत्य पितृकार्यमथापि च । अनिर्वाप्य समश्नन्वै ततो जायति वायसः ॥
data.md: He who eats without having performed the rites in honour of the celestials or those in honour of the departed Manes or without having offered (even) oblations of water to both the Rishis and the departed Manes has to take birth as a crow.

data.v: वायसो दश वर्षाणि ततो जायति कुक्कुटः । जायते लवकश्चापि मासं तस्मात्तु मानुषः ॥
data.md: Living as a crow for a hundred years, he next assumes the forin of a cock. His next change is that of a snake for a month. After this he regains the human form.

data.v: ज्येष्ठं पितृसमं चापि भ्रातरं योऽवमन्यते । सोऽपि मृत्युमुपागम्य क्रौञ्चयोनौ प्रजायते ॥
data.md: He who disregards his eldest brother who is like a father, has, after death, to take birth as a crane.

data.v: क्रौञ्चो जीवति मासांस्तु दश द्वौ सप्त पञ्च च । ततो निधनमापन्नो मानुषत्वमुपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: Having assumed that form he has to live in it for two years. Renouncing that form at the conclusion of that period, he regains the human forin.

data.v: वृषलो ब्राह्मणीं गत्वा कृमियोनौ प्रजायते । तत्रापत्यं समुत्पाद्य ततो जायति मूषकः ॥
data.md: That Shudra who knows a Brahmani woman has after death, to take birth as hog.

data.v: कृतघ्नस्तु मृतो राजन्यमस्य विषयं गतः । यमस्य विषये क्रुद्धैर्वधं प्राप्नोति दारुणम् ॥
data.md: The who becomes guilty of ingratitude, O king, has to go to the regions of Yama and there to suffer very painful and severe treatment at the hands of the emissaries, provoked to fury of the grim king of the dead.

data.v: पट्टिसं मुद्गरं शूलमग्निकुम्भं च दारुणम् । असिपत्रवनं घोरं वालुकां कूटशाल्मलीम् ॥
एताश्चान्याश्च बह्वीः स यमस्य विषयं गतः । यातनाः प्राप्य तत्रोग्रास्ततो वध्यति भारत ॥
data.md: Clubs with heavy hammers and mallets sharppointed lances heated jars, dreadful sword blades heated sands, thorny Shalmalisthese and many other engines of torture such a man has to suffer in the regions of Yama, O Bharata,

data.v: संसारचक्रमासाद्य कृमियोनौ प्रजायते । कृमिर्भवति वर्षाणि दश पञ्च च भारत । ततो गर्भं समासाद्य तत्रैव म्रियते शिशुः ॥
data.md: He has to live as a vile vermin for a period of fifteen years, O Bharata. He has then to enter the womb and dic prematurely before birth.

data.v: ततो गर्भशतैर्जन्तुर्बहुभिः संप्रजायते । संसारांश्च बहून्गत्वा ततस्तिर्यक्प्रजायते ॥
data.md: After this that person has to enter the womb a hundred times successively. Indeed, having undergone a hundred rebirths, he at last is born as a creature in some interinediate order between man and inanimate nature.

data.v: मृतो दुःखमनुप्राप्य बहुवर्षगणानिह । अपुनर्भावसंयुक्तस्ततः कूर्मः प्रजायते ॥
data.md: Having suffered misery for a great many years, he has to take birth as hairless tortoise.

data.v: अशस्त्रं पुरुषं हत्वा सशस्त्रः पुरुषाधमः । अर्थार्थी यदि वा वैरी स मृतो जायते खरः ॥
data.md: That wretch who, himself wellarmed, kills another while that other is unarined, for getting his riches or out of hostile feelings, has, after renouncing his human body, to take birth as an ass.

data.v: खरो जीवति वर्षे द्वे ततः शस्त्रेण वध्यते । स मृतो मृगयोनौ तु नित्योद्विग्नोऽभिजायते ॥
data.md: Assuming that assinine form, he has to live for a period of two years and then he is killed by a weapon, Renouncing his assinine body, he has to take birth, in his next life, as a deer always anxious (for fear of being killed.)

data.v: मृगो वध्यति शस्त्रेण गते संवत्सरे तु सः । हतो मृगस्ततो मीनः सोऽपि जालेन बध्यते ॥
मासे चतुर्थे संप्राप्ते श्वापदः संप्रजायते । श्वापदो दश वर्षाणि द्वीपी वर्षाणि पञ्च च ॥
ततस्तु निधनं प्राप्तः कालपर्यायचोदितः । अधर्मस्य क्षयं कृत्वा ततो जायति मानुषः ॥
data.md: Actuated by the change that is occasioned by time, he then renounces that form and, his sin having been exhausted, he regains the human form.

data.v: स्त्रियं हत्वा तु दुर्बुद्धिर्यमस्य विषयं गतः । बहून्क्लेशान्समासाद्य संसारांश्चैव विंशतिम् ॥
data.md: That man of little understanding who slays a woman has to go to the regions of Yama and to suffer various kinds of pain and misery. He then has to pass through full twentyone transformations.

data.v: ततः पश्चान्महाराज कृमियोनौ प्रजायते । कृमिर्विंशतिवर्षाणि भूत्वा जायति मानुषः ॥
data.md: After that, О king, he has to take birth as a vile vermin. Living as a vermin for twenty years, he regains the human form.

data.v: भोजनं चोरयित्वा तु मक्षिका जायते नरः । मक्षिकासंघवशगो बहून्मासान्भवत्युत । ततः पापक्षयं कृत्वा मानुषत्वमवाप्नुते ॥
data.md: By stealing food, one has to take birth as a bee. Living for many months in the company of other bees, his sin become exhausted and he regains the human form. By stealing paddy, one becomes a cat.
