data.v: वाद्यं हृत्वा तु पुरुषो मशकः संप्रजायते । तथा पिण्याकसंमिश्रमशनं चोरयेन्नरः । स जायते बभ्रुसमो दारुणो मूषको नरः ॥
data.md: That man who steals food mixed with sesame cakes is in his next birth born as a mouse large or small according to the largeness or smallness of the quantity stolen.

data.v: लवणं चोरयित्वा तु चीरीवाकः प्रजायते । दधि हृत्वा बकश्चापि प्लवो मत्स्यानसंस्कृतान् ॥
चोरयित्वा पयश्चापि बलाका संप्रजायते । यस्तु चोरयते तैलं तैलपायी प्रजायते । चोरयित्वा तु दुर्बुद्धिर्मधु दंशः प्रजायते ॥
अयो हृत्वा तु दुर्बुद्धिर्वायसो जायते नरः । पायसं चोरयित्वा तु तित्तिरित्वमवाप्नुते ॥
data.md: That littlewitted man who steals iron has to take birth as a cow. That man who steals white brass, is born as a bird of the Harita spccies.

data.v: हृत्वा पैष्टमपूपं च कुम्भोलूकः प्रजायते । फलं वा मूलकं हृत्वा अपूपं वा पिपीलिकः ॥
कांस्यं हृत्वा तु दुर्बुद्धिर्हारीतो जायते नरः । राजतं भाजनं हृत्वा कपोतः संप्रजायते ॥
data.md: That littlewitted man who steals iron has to take birth as a cow. That man who steals white brass, is born as a bird of the Harita spccies.

data.v: हृत्वा तु काञ्चनं भाण्डं कृमियोनौ प्रजायते । क्रौञ्चः कार्पासिकं हृत्वा मृतो जायति मानवः ॥
चोरयित्वा नरः पट्टं त्वाविकं वापि भारत । क्षौमं च वस्त्रमादाय शशो जन्तुः प्रजायते ॥
वर्णान्हृत्वा तु पुरुषो मृतो जायति बर्हिणः । हृत्वा रक्तानि वस्त्राणि जायते जीवजीवकः ॥
वर्णकादींस्तथा गन्धांश्चोरयित्वा तु मानवः । छुच्छुन्दरित्वमाप्नोति राजँल्लोभपरायणः ॥
data.md: By stealing a piece of red cloth one is born as a bird of the Jivajivaka species. By stealing unguents (such as sandalpaste) and perfumes in this world, the avaricious man, O king, is born as a mole. Assuming the form of a mole one has to live in it for fifteen years.

data.v: विश्वासेन तु निक्षिप्तं यो निह्नवति मानवः । स गतासुर्नरस्तादृङ्मत्स्ययोनौ प्रजायते ॥
data.md: That man who misappropriates trust property, has to suffer a diminution in the period of his life and dying has to take birth ainong fishes.

data.v: मत्स्ययोनिमनुप्राप्य मृतो जायति मानुषः । मानुषत्वमनुप्राप्य क्षीणायुरुपपद्यते ॥
data.md: Having lived for sometime as a fish, he dies and regains the human form. Regaining, however, the human form he becomes short lived.

data.v: पापानि तु नरः कृत्वा तिर्यग्जायति भारत । न चात्मनः प्रमाणं ते धर्मं जानन्ति किंचन ॥
data.md: Indeed having perpetrated sins, O Bharata, one has to take birth in an order intermediate between that of humanity and vegetables. Those people do not know the principles of virtue who take their own hearts for their guide.

data.v: ये पापानि नराः कृत्वा निरस्यन्ति व्रतैः सदा । सुखदुःखसमायुक्ता व्याधितास्ते भवन्त्युत ॥
data.md: Those men who commit various sinful deeds, and then scck to expiate them by continuous vows and observances of piety, enjoy happiness and suffer misery and live in great anxiety of heart.

data.v: असंवासाः प्रजायन्ते म्लेच्छाश्चापि न संशयः । नराः पापसमाचारा लोभमोहसमन्विताः ॥
data.md: Those sinful men who yield to the influence of cupidity and stupefaction, are surely born as Mlechchhas who are uriworthy of being associated with.

data.v: वर्जयन्ति च पापानि जन्मप्रभृति ये नराः । अरोगा रूपवन्तस्ते धनिनश्च भवन्त्युत ॥
data.md: Those men, on the other hand, who abstain from sin all their lives, become free from disease of every sort gifted with beauty of form, and possessed of riches.

data.v: स्त्रियोऽप्येतेन कल्पेन कृत्वा पापमवाप्नुयुः । एतेषामेव जन्तूनां पत्नीत्वमुपयान्ति ताः ॥
data.md: Women also when they act in this way attain to births of the same kind. Indeed, they have to take births as the males of the animals I have mentioned.

data.v: परस्वहरणे दोषाः सर्व एव प्रकीर्तिताः । एतद्वै लेशमात्रेण कथितं ते मयानघ । अपरस्मिन्कथायोगे भूयः श्रोष्यसि भारत ॥
data.md: I have told you all the faults of the misappropriation of others' properties. I have described to you very briefly the subject, O sinless one.

data.v: एतन्मया महाराज ब्रह्मणो वदतः पुरा । सुरर्षीणां श्रुतं मध्ये पृष्टश्चापि यथातथम् ॥
मयापि तव कार्त्स्न्येन यथावदनुवर्णितम् । एतच्छ्रुत्वा महाराज धर्मे कुरु मनः सदा ॥
अधर्मस्य गतिर्ब्रह्मन्कथिता मे त्वयानघ । धर्मस्य तु गतिं श्रोतुमिच्छामि वदतां वर । कृत्वा कर्माणि पापानि कथं यान्ति शुभां गतिम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have told me, O twiceborn one, what the end is of virtue or sin, I wish now to hear, O foremost of speakers, of what the end is of virtue.

data.v: कृत्वा पापानि कर्माणि अधर्मवशमागतः । मनसा विपरीतेन निरयं प्रतिपद्यते ॥
data.md: Brihaspati said By committing sinful deeds with perverted mind, one gives way to the influence of sin, and accordingly goes to Hell.

data.v: मोहादधर्मं यः कृत्वा पुनः समनुतप्यते । मनःसमाधिसंयुक्तो न स सेवेत दुष्कृतम् ॥
data.md: That man who having perpetrated sinful deeds through stupefaction of mind, feels the pangs of repentance and sets his heart on meditation (of the deity), has not to suffer the consequences of his sins. One becomes freed from his sins inasmuch as he repents for them.

data.v: यथा यथा नरः सम्यगधर्ममनुभाषते । समाहितेन मनसा विमुच्यति तथा तथा । भुजंग इव निर्मोकात्पूर्वभुक्ताज्जरान्वितात् ॥
data.md: Accordingly as one mentions his sins, fully or otherwise, with concentrated mind, he becomes cleansed there from fully or otherwise, like a snake freed from his diseased slough.

data.v: अदत्त्वापि प्रदानानि विविधानि समाहितः । मनःसमाधिसंयुक्तः सुगतिं प्रतिपद्यते ॥
data.md: By making with a concentrated mind, gifts of various kinds to Brahmana, and concentrating the mind (on the deity), one attains to an auspicious end.

data.v: प्रदानानि तु वक्ष्यामि यानि दत्त्वा युधिष्ठिर । नरः कृत्वाप्यकार्याणि तदा धर्मेण युज्यते ॥
data.md: I shall now tell you what those gifts are, o Yudhishthira, by making which a person, even if guilty of having committed sinful deeds, may become gifted with merit.

data.v: सर्वेषामेव दानानामन्नं श्रेष्ठमुदाहृतम् । पूर्वमन्नं प्रदातव्यमृजुना धर्ममिच्छता ॥
data.md: Of all kinds of gifts, that of food is considered as the best. One desirous of acquiring merit should, with a sincere heart, make gifts of food.

data.v: प्राणा ह्यन्नं मनुष्याणां तस्माज्जन्तुश्च जायते । अन्ने प्रतिष्ठिता लोकास्तस्मादन्नं प्रकाशते ॥
data.md: Food is the vital air of men. From it all creatures originate. All the worlds of living creatures are established upon food. Hence food is highly spoken of.

data.v: अन्नमेव प्रशंसन्ति देवर्षिपितृमानवाः । अन्नस्य हि प्रदानेन स्वर्गमाप्नोति कौशिकः ॥
data.md: The deities Rishis, departed manes, and men, all praise food. Formerly king Rantideva, proceeded to the celestial region by making gifts of food.

data.v: न्यायलब्धं प्रदातव्यं द्विजेभ्यो ह्यन्नमुत्तमम् । स्वाध्यायसमुपेतेभ्यः प्रहृष्टेनान्तरात्मना ॥
data.md: Good food that has been acquired by fair means, should be given with a cheerful heart, lo Brahmanas possessed of Vedic learning.

data.v: यस्य ह्यन्नमुपाश्नन्ति ब्राह्मणानां शता दश । हृष्टेन मनसा दत्तं न स तिर्यग्गतिर्भवेत् ॥
data.md: That man, whose food, given with a cheerful heart, is taken by a is taken by a thousand Brahmanas, has never to take birth in an intermediate order.

data.v: ब्राह्मणानां सहस्राणि दश भोज्य नरर्षभ । नरोऽधर्मात्प्रमुच्येत पापेष्वभिरतः सदा ॥
data.md: A person, O king, by feeding ten thousand Brahmanas, becomes cleansed of sin and devoted to Yoga practices.

data.v: भैक्षेणान्नं समाहृत्य विप्रो वेदपुरस्कृतः । स्वाध्यायनिरते विप्रे दत्त्वेह सुखमेधते ॥
data.md: A Brahmana knowing the Vedas, by giving away food acquired by him as alms, to a Brahmana devoted to the study of the Vedas, succeeds in acquiring happiness here.

data.v: अहिंसन्ब्राह्मणं नित्यं न्यायेन परिपाल्य च । क्षत्रियस्तरसा प्राप्तमन्नं यो वै प्रयच्छति ॥
data.md: That Kshatriya who, without taking anything belonging to a Brahmana, protects his subjects lawfully, and makes gifts of food, obtained by his strength. to Brahmanas foremost in Vedic knowledge, with concentrated heart, succeeds by such conduci, O you of righteous soul in cleansing himself, O son of Pandu, of all his sinful deeds.

data.v: द्विजेभ्यो वेदवृद्धेभ्यः प्रयतः सुसमाहितः । तेनापोहति धर्मात्मा दुष्कृतं कर्म पाण्डव ॥
data.md: That Kshatriya who, without taking anything belonging to a Brahmana, protects his subjects lawfully, and makes gifts of food, obtained by his strength. to Brahmanas foremost in Vedic knowledge, with concentrated heart, succeeds by such conduci, O you of righteous soul in cleansing himself, O son of Pandu, of all his sinful deeds.

data.v: षड्भागपरिशुद्धं च कृषेर्भागमुपार्जितम् । वैश्यो ददद्द्विजातिभ्यः पापेभ्यः परिमुच्यते ॥
data.md: Thai Vaishya who divides the produce of his fields into six equal parts and makes of gift a one of those shares to Brahmanas, succeeds by such conduct in cleansing himself from every sin.

data.v: अवाप्य प्राणसंदेहं कार्कश्येन समार्जितम् । अन्नं दत्त्वा द्विजातिभ्यः शूद्रः पापात्प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: That Shudra who acquiring food by hard labour and at the risk of life itself, makes a gift of it to Brahmanas, becomes purged off of every sin.

data.v: औरसेन बलेनान्नमर्जयित्वाविहिंसकः । यः प्रयच्छति विप्रेभ्यो न स दुर्गाणि सेवते ॥
data.md: That man who, by dint of his physical strength acquires food without doing any act of injury to any creature, and makes gift of it to Brahmanas, succeeds in avoiding all calamities.

data.v: न्यायेनावाप्तमन्नं तु नरो लोभविवर्जितः । द्विजेभ्यो वेदवृद्धेभ्यो दत्त्वा पापात्प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: A person by cheerfully making gifts of food acquired by fair means to Brahmans pereminent for Vedic learning, becomes purged off of all his sins.

data.v: अन्नमूर्जस्करं लोके दत्त्वोर्जस्वी भवेन्नरः । सतां पन्थानमाश्रित्य सर्वपापात्प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: By treading in the path of the pious, one becomes freed from all sins, A person by making gifts of such food as creates great energy becomes himself endued with great energy.

data.v: दानकृद्भिः कृतः पन्था येन यान्ति मनीषिणः । ते स्म प्राणस्य दातारस्तेभ्यो धर्मः सनातनः ॥
data.md: The path made by charitable persons, is always trod by the wise. They who make gifts of food, are considered as givers of life. The merit they acquire by such gifts, is eternal.

data.v: सर्वावस्थं मनुष्येण न्यायेनान्नमुपार्जितम् । कार्यं पात्रगतं नित्यमन्नं हि परमा गतिः ॥
data.md: Hence, person should, under all circumstances, seek to acquire food by fair means, and having got it to make always gifts of it to worthy men. Food is the great support of living creatures.

data.v: अन्नस्य हि प्रदानेन नरो दुर्गं न सेवते । तस्मादन्नं प्रदातव्यमन्यायपरिवर्जितम् ॥
data.md: By making gifts of food, one has never to go to hell. Hence one should always make gifts of food, having got it by fair means. a

data.v: यतेद्ब्राह्मणपूर्वं हि भोक्तुमन्नं गृही सदा । अवन्ध्यं दिवसं कुर्यादन्नदानेन मानवः ॥
data.md: The householder should always try to eat after having made a gift of food to a Brahmana. Every man should make the day fruitful by making gifts of food.

data.v: भोजयित्वा दशशतं नरो वेदविदां नृप । न्यायविद्धर्मविदुषामितिहासविदां तथा ॥
data.md: A person by feeding, O king a thousand Brahmanas who are all conversant with duties and the scriptures and the sacred histories, has not to go to Hell and to return to this world for going through rebirths. Gifted with the fruition of every desire he enjoys great happiness in the next world.

data.v: न याति नरकं घोरं संसारांश्च न सेवते । सर्वकामसमायुक्तः प्रेत्य चाप्यश्नुते फलम् ॥
data.md: A person by feeding, O king a thousand Brahmanas who are all conversant with duties and the scriptures and the sacred histories, has not to go to Hell and to return to this world for going through rebirths. Gifted with the fruition of every desire he enjoys great happiness in the next world.

data.v: एवं सुखसमायुक्तो रमते विगतज्वरः । रूपवान्कीर्तिमांश्चैव धनवांश्चोपपद्यते ॥
data.md: Gifted with such merit, he sports in happiness, freed from every anxiety, possessed of personal beauty and great fame and endued with wealth.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातमन्नदानफलं महत् । मूलमेतद्धि धर्माणां प्रदानस्य च भारत ॥
data.md: I have thus told you all about the great merit of gifts of food. This is the root of all virtue and merit, as also of all gifts, O Bharata.

data.v: अहिंसा वैदिकं कर्म ध्यानमिन्द्रियसंयमः । तपोऽथ गुरुशुश्रूषा किं श्रेयः पुरुषं प्रति ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Which amongst these is more efficacious to a person, namely abstention from injury, the observance of the Vedic, ritual, meditation, control over the senses, penances and obedient services rendered to the preceptors.

data.v: सर्वाण्येतानि धर्मस्य पृथग्द्वाराणि सर्वशः । शृणु संकीर्त्यमानानि षडेव भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Brihaspati said All these six are meritorious. They are different doors of virtue. I shall discourse upon them now. Do you listen to them O chief of the Bharatas!

data.v: हन्त निःश्रेयसं जन्तोरहं वक्ष्याम्यनुत्तमम् । अहिंसापाश्रयं धर्मं यः साधयति वै नरः ॥
data.md: I shall tell you what forms the highest good of a human being. That man who practises the religion of universal mercy, acquires his highest good.

data.v: त्रीन्दोषान्सर्वभूतेषु निधाय पुरुषः सदा । कामक्रोधौ च संयम्य ततः सिद्धिमवाप्नुते ॥
data.md: That man who keeps under restraint the three passions, viz., lust, anger and avarice by throwing them upon all creatures, acquires success.

data.v: अहिंसकानि भूतानि दण्डेन विनिहन्ति यः । आत्मनः सुखमन्विच्छन्न स प्रेत्य सुखी भवेत् ॥
data.md: He who, for his own happiness, kills other innocent creatures with the rod of punishment never acquires happiness in the next world.

data.v: आत्मोपमश्च भूतेषु यो वै भवति पूरुषः । न्यस्तदण्डो जितक्रोधः स प्रेत्य सुखमेधते ॥
data.md: That man who considers all creatures as his own self, and treats them as his own self, laying aside the rod of punishment and completely controlling his anger, succeeds in acquiring happiness.

data.v: सर्वभूतात्मभूतस्य सर्वभूतानि पश्यतः । देवापि मार्गे मुह्यन्ति अपदस्य पदैषिणः ॥
data.md: in The very celestials who are desirous of a fixed habitation, become stupefied ascertaining the road of that person who forms himself the soul of all creatures and considers them all as his own self, for such a person leaves no track behind.

data.v: न तत्परस्य संदद्यात्प्रतिकूलं यदात्मनः । एष संक्षेपतो धर्मः कामादन्यः प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: One should never do that to another which he considers as injurious to his own self. This in brief, is the rule of virtue. One by acting in a different way by giving way to desire, becomes guilty of sin.

data.v: प्रत्याख्याने च दाने च सुखदुःखे प्रियाप्रिये । आत्मौपम्येन पुरुषः समाधिमधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: In refusing and giving, in weal and woe, in the agrecable and the disagreeable, one should judge of their effects by considering his own self.

data.v: यथा परः प्रक्रमतेऽपरेषु; तथापरः प्रक्रमते परस्मिन् । एषैव तेऽस्तूपमा जीवलोके; यथा धर्मो नैपुणेनोपदिष्टः ॥
data.md: When one injures another, the injured in return injures the injurer. Likewise, when one cherishes another, that other cherishes the cherisher. One should forin his own rule of conduct according to this, I have told you what virtue is even by this subtile way.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा तं सुरगुरुर्धर्मराजं युधिष्ठिरम् । दिवमाचक्रमे धीमान्पश्यतामेव नस्तदा ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana continued: The preceptor of the celestials endued with great intelligence, having said this to king, Yudhishthira the just, ascended upwards for proceeding to the celestial region before our eyes.

data.v: ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा शरतल्पे पितामहम् । पुनरेव महातेजाः पप्रच्छ वदतां वरम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said After this, king, Yudhishthira gifted with great energy, and the foremost of eloquent men, addressed his grandfather lying on his bed of arrows, in the following words.

data.v: ऋषयो ब्राह्मणा देवाः प्रशंसन्ति महामते । अहिंसालक्षणं धर्मं वेदप्रामाण्यदर्शनात् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O You of great intelligence, the Rishi and Brahmanas and the celestials led by the authority of the Vedas, all speak highly of the religion of mercy.

data.v: कर्मणा मनुजः कुर्वन्हिंसां पार्थिवसत्तम । वाचा च मनसा चैव कथं दुःखात्प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: But, o king, what I ask you is this how does a man who has perpetrated acts of injury to others in word, thought and deed, succeed in purifying himself from misery.

data.v: चतुर्विधेयं निर्दिष्टा अहिंसा ब्रह्मवादिभिः । एषैकतोऽपि विभ्रष्टा न भवत्यरिसूदन ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Brahmavadins have said that there are four kinds of mercy or abstention from injury. If even one of those four kinds be not observed. The religion of mercy, it is said, is not observed.

data.v: यथा सर्वश्चतुष्पादस्त्रिभिः पादैर्न तिष्ठति । तथैवेयं महीपाल प्रोच्यते कारणैस्त्रिभिः ॥
data.md: As all quadruped animals are incapable of standing on three legs so the religion of mercy cannot stand if any of those four divisions or parts be wanting.

data.v: यथा नागपदेऽन्यानि पदानि पदगामिनाम् । सर्वाण्येवापिधीयन्ते पदजातानि कौञ्जरे । एवं लोकेष्वहिंसा तु निर्दिष्टा धर्मतः परा ॥
data.md: As the footprints of all other animals are sunk in those of the elephant, so all other religions are said to be contained in that of mercy. A person becomes guilty of injury through acts, words, and thoughts.

data.v: कर्मणा लिप्यते जन्तुर्वाचा च मनसैव च ॥
पूर्वं तु मनसा त्यक्त्वा तथा वाचाथ कर्मणा । त्रिकारणं तु निर्दिष्टं श्रूयते ब्रह्मवादिभिः ॥
data.md: Discarding it mentally in the beginning, one should next discard it in word and thought. He who according to this rule, abstains from eating meat is said to be purified in a three fold way.

data.v: मनोवाचि तथास्वादे दोषा ह्येषु प्रतिष्ठिताः । न भक्षयन्त्यतो मांसं तपोयुक्ता मनीषिणः ॥
दोषांस्तु भक्षणे राजन्मांसस्येह निबोध मे । पुत्रमांसोपमं जानन्खादते यो विचेतनः ॥
मातापितृसमायोगे पुत्रत्वं जायते यथा । रसं च प्रति जिह्वायाः प्रज्ञानं जायते तथा । तथा शास्त्रेषु नियतं रागो ह्यास्वादिताद्भवेत् ॥
data.md: As the tongue is the cause of sensation of taste, so, the scriptures declare, attachment proceeds from taste.

data.v: असंस्कृताः संस्कृताश्च लवणालवणास्तथा । प्रज्ञायन्ते यथा भावास्तथा चित्तं निरुध्यते ॥
data.md: Well-dressed, cooked with salt or without salt, meat, in whatever form one may take it, by and by attracts the mind and enslaves it.

data.v: भेरीशङ्खमृदङ्गाद्यांस्तन्त्रीशब्दांश्च पुष्कलान् । निषेविष्यन्ति वै मन्दा मांसभक्षाः कथं नराः ॥
data.md: How will those foolish men who live upon meat succeed in listening to the sweet music of celestial drums and cymbals and lyres and harps?

data.v: अचिन्तितमनुद्दिष्टमसंकल्पितमेव च । रसं गृद्ध्याभिभूता वै प्रशंसन्ति फलार्थिनः । प्रशंसा ह्येव मांसस्य दोषकर्मफलान्विता ॥
data.md: They who eat meat highly speak of it, allowing themselves to be stupefied by its taste which they declare be something inconceivable, undesirable, and unimaginable.

data.v: जीवितं हि परित्यज्य बहवः साधवो जनाः । स्वमांसैः परमांसानि परिपाल्य दिवं गताः ॥
data.md: Such pradise even of meat is sinful. Formerly, many pious men, by giving the flesh of their own bodies, protected the flesh of other creatures and as a result of such deeds of merit, have proceeded to the celestial region.

data.v: एवमेषा महाराज चतुर्भिः कारणैर्वृता । अहिंसा तव निर्दिष्टा सर्वधर्मार्थसंहिता ॥
data.md: In this way, O king, the religion of mercy is surrounded by four considerations. I have thus declared to you that religion which contains all other religions within it. to

data.v: अहिंसा परमो धर्म इत्युक्तं बहुशस्त्वया । श्राद्धेषु च भवानाह पितॄनामिषकाङ्क्षिणः ॥
मांसैर्बहुविधैः प्रोक्तस्त्वया श्राद्धविधिः पुरा । अहत्वा च कुतो मांसमेवमेतद्विरुध्यते ॥
जातो नः संशयो धर्मे मांसस्य परिवर्जने । दोषो भक्षयतः कः स्यात्कश्चाभक्षयतो गुणः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You have told it many times that abstention from injury is the highest Religion. In Shraddhas, however, that are performed in honour of the departed Manes, persons for their own behoof, should make offerings of various kinds of meat. A doubt has, therefore, sprung in our mind about the duty of abstaining from meat. What are the sins that one commits by eating meat, and what are the merits that one acquires?

data.v: हत्वा भक्षयतो वापि परेणोपहृतस्य वा । हन्याद्वा यः परस्यार्थे क्रीत्वा वा भक्षयेन्नरः ॥
data.md: You have said SO So while discoursing formerly upon the ordinances about Shraddhas. How can meat, however, be procured without killing a living creature? Your declarations, therefore, appear to me to be contradictory.

data.v: एतदिच्छामि तत्त्वेन कथ्यमानं त्वयानघ । निश्चयेन चिकीर्षामि धर्ममेतं सनातनम् ॥
data.md: What are the demerits of him who eats meat by himself slaying a living creature? What are the merits of him who eats the meat of animals, slain by others? What the merits or demerits of hini who kills a living creature for another? Or of him who eats meat buying it of others? I wish, O sinless one, that you should describe to me this subject in full. I wish to ascertain this eternal Religion with certainty.

data.v: कथमायुरवाप्नोति कथं भवति सत्त्ववान् । कथमव्यङ्गतामेति लक्षण्यो जायते कथम् ॥
data.md: How does one acquire longevity? How does onc acquire strength? How does one acquire faultlessness of limbs? Indeed, how does one become gifted with excellent marks?

data.v: मांसस्य भक्षणे राजन्योऽधर्मः कुरुपुंगव । तं मे शृणु यथातत्त्वं यश्चास्य विधिरुत्तमः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Listen to me, O scion of Kuru's race, what the merit is of abstention from meat. Listen to me as I declare to you what the excellent ordinances, in sooth, are on this subject.

data.v: रूपमव्यङ्गतामायुर्बुद्धिं सत्त्वं बलं स्मृतिम् । प्राप्तुकामैर्नरैर्हिंसा वर्जिता वै कृतात्मभिः ॥
data.md: Those great inen who desire beauty, faultessness of limbs, long life, understanding mental and physical strength, and memory should abstain from acts of injury.

data.v: ऋषीणामत्र संवादो बहुशः कुरुपुंगव । बभूव तेषां तु मतं यत्तच्छृणु युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Numberless discourses took place. between the Rishis on this subject, O scion of Kuru's race. Listen, O Yudhishthira, what their opinion was.

data.v: यो यजेताश्वमेधेन मासि मासि यतव्रतः । वर्जयेन्मधु मांसं च सममेतद्युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: The merit acquired by that person, O Yudhishthira, who, with the steadiness of a vow, worship the celestials every month in Horse sacrifices, is equal to him who discards honey and meat.

data.v: सप्तर्षयो वालखिल्यास्तथैव च मरीचिपाः । अमांसभक्षणं राजन्प्रशंसन्ति मनीषिणः ॥
data.md: The highly wise seven celestial Rishis, the Valakhillyas, and those Rishi, who drink the rays of the sun, all speak highly of abstention from ineat.

data.v: न भक्षयति यो मांसं न हन्यान्न च घातयेत् । तं मित्रं सर्वभूतानां मनुः स्वायंभुवोऽब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: The self-create Manu has said that man who does not eat meat, or who does not kill living creatures, or who does not cause them to be killed, is a friend of all creatures.

data.v: अधृष्यः सर्वभूतानां विश्वास्यः सर्वजन्तुषु । साधूनां संमतो नित्यं भवेन्मांसस्य वर्जनात् ॥
data.md: Such a man is incapable of being oppressed by any creature. He enjoys the confidence of all living beings. He always enjoys, besides, the praise of the pious.

data.v: स्वमांसं परमांसेन यो वर्धयितुमिच्छति । नारदः प्राह धर्मात्मा नियतं सोऽवसीदति ॥
data.md: The virtuous Narada has said that that man who wishes to multiply his own flesh by eating the flesh of other creatures, meet with disaster.

data.v: ददाति यजते चापि तपस्वी च भवत्यपि । मधुमांसनिवृत्त्येति प्राहैवं स बृहस्पतिः ॥
data.md: Brihaspati has said that that man who abstains from honey and meat, gains the merit of gifts and sacrifices and penances.

data.v: मासि मास्यश्वमेधेन यो यजेत शतं समाः । न खादति च यो मांसं सममेतन्मतं मम ॥
data.md: In my view, these two persons are equal viz.hc who worships the celestials every month in a Horse-sacrifice for a century and he who abstains from honey and meat.

data.v: सदा यजति सत्रेण सदा दानं प्रयच्छति । सदा तपस्वी भवति मधुमांसस्य वर्जनात् ॥
data.md: On account of abstention from meat, one is considered as one who always worships the celestials in sacrifices, or as one who always makes gifts to others, or as one who always practises the severest austerities.

data.v: सर्वे वेदा न तत्कुर्युः सर्वयज्ञाश्च भारत । यो भक्षयित्वा मांसानि पश्चादपि निवर्तते ॥
data.md: That inan who having eaten meal, gives it up afterwards, wins merit by such a deed that is so great that a study of all the Vedas or a performance, O Bharata, of all the sacrifices, cannot give its like.

data.v: दुष्करं हि रसज्ञेन मांसस्य परिवर्जनम् । चर्तुं व्रतमिदं श्रेष्ठं सर्वप्राण्यभयप्रदम् ॥
data.md: It is very difficult to abstain from meat after one has known itstaste. Indeed, it is extremely difficult for such a person to observe the great vow abstention from meat, a vow that assures every creature by removing all fear.

data.v: सर्वभूतेषु यो विद्वान्ददात्यभयदक्षिणाम् । दाता भवति लोके स प्राणानां नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: That learned person who gives to all living creatures the gift of complete assurance, is forsooth, regarded as the giver of lifc-breaths in this world.

data.v: एवं वै परमं धर्मं प्रशंसन्ति मनीषिणः । प्राणा यथात्मनोऽभीष्टा भूतानामपि ते तथा ॥
data.md: This is the high Religion which wise men esteem very highly. The vital airs of other creatures are as dear to them as those of his own self.

data.v: आत्मौपम्येन गन्तव्यं बुद्धिमद्भिर्महात्मभिः । मृत्युतो भयमस्तीति विदुषां भूतिमिच्छताम् ॥
data.md: Men gifted with intelligence and purified souls should always treat others as they theinselves wish to be treated. It is seen that even those men who are endued with learning and who seek to acquire the greatest good in the shape of Liberation, are not free from of the fear of death.

data.v: किं पुनर्हन्यमानानां तरसा जीवितार्थिनाम् । अरोगाणामपापानां पापैर्मांसोपजीविभिः ॥
data.md: What necessity there be said those innocent and healthy creatures gifted with love of life, when they are sought to be killed by sinful wretches living by slaughter?

data.v: तस्माद्विद्धि महाराज मांसस्य परिवर्जनम् । धर्मस्यायतनं श्रेष्ठं स्वर्गस्य च सुखस्य च ॥
data.md: Therefore, O king, know that the discarding of meat is the highest refuge of Religion, of the celestial region, and of happiness.

data.v: अहिंसा परमो धर्मस्तथाहिंसा परं तपः । अहिंसा परमं सत्यं ततो धर्मः प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: Abstention from injury is the highest Religion. It is, again, the highest penance. It is also the highest truth from which all duty emanates.

data.v: न हि मांसं तृणात्काष्ठादुपलाद्वापि जायते । हत्वा जन्तुं ततो मांसं तस्माद्दोषोऽस्य भक्षणे ॥
data.md: Flesh cannot be had from grass or wood or stone. Unless a living creature is killed it cannot be procured. Hence is the fault in eating flesh.

data.v: स्वाहास्वधामृतभुजो देवाः सत्यार्जवप्रियाः । क्रव्यादान्राक्षसान्विद्धि जिह्मानृतपरायणान् ॥
data.md: The celestials, who live upon Svaha, Svadha, and nectar, are given to truth and sincerity. Those persons, however, who are for satisfying the sensation of taste, should be known as Rakshasas pervaded by the quality of Darkness.

data.v: कान्तारेष्वथ घोरेषु दुर्गेषु गहनेषु च । रात्रावहनि संध्यासु चत्वरेषु सभासु च । अमांसभक्षणे राजन्भयमन्ते न गच्छति ॥
data.md: That man who abstains from meat, is never put in fear, O king, by any creature, wherever hic may be, viz., in terrible forest or inaccessible fastnesses, by day or by night, or at the two twilight's, in the open squares of towns or in conclaves of men, from upraised weapons or in places where there is great fright from wild animals or snakes.

data.v: यदि चेत्खादको न स्यान्न तदा घातको भवेत् । घातकः खादकार्थाय तं घातयति वै नरः ॥
data.md: If there were nobody who ate flesh there would then be nobody to slay living creatures. The man who slays living creatures kills them for the sake of the person who eats flesh.

data.v: अभक्ष्यमेतदिति वा इति हिंसा निवर्तते । खादकार्थमतो हिंसा मृगादीनां प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: If flesh were not considered as food, there would then be no destruction of living creatures. It is for the sake of the eater that the destruction of living creatures is carried on in the world.

data.v: यस्माद्ग्रसति चैवायुर्हिंसकानां महाद्युते । तस्माद्विवर्जयेन्मांसं य इच्छेद्भूतिमात्मनः ॥
data.md: Since, O you of great splendour, the period of life is shortened of persons who kills living creatures or cause them to be killed, it is clear that the person who seeks his own, behoof, I should give up meat altogether.

data.v: त्रातारं नाधिगच्छन्ति रौद्राः प्राणिविहिंसकाः । उद्वेजनीया भूतानां यथा व्यालमृगास्तथा ॥
data.md: Those dreadful persons who are engaged in the destruction of living creatures never find protectors when they are in need. Such persons should always be molested and punished even as beasts of prey.

data.v: लोभाद्वा बुद्धिमोहाद्वा बलवीर्यार्थमेव च । संसर्गाद्वाथ पापानामधर्मरुचिता नृणाम् ॥
data.md: Through cupidity or stupefaction of sense, for the sake of strength and energy, or through association with the sinful, men show tendency for committing sin.

data.v: स्वमांसं परमांसेन यो वर्धयितुमिच्छति । उद्विग्नवासे वसति यत्रतत्राभिजायते ॥
data.md: That man who seeks to multiply his own flesh by (eating) the flesh of others has to live in this world in great anxiety and after death has to take birth in indifferent races and families.

data.v: धन्यं यशस्यमायुष्यं स्वर्ग्यं स्वस्त्ययनं महत् । मांसस्याभक्षणं प्राहुर्नियताः परमर्षयः ॥
data.md: High Rishis given to the observance of vows and self control have said that abstention from meat is worthy of praise, productive of fame and Heaven and a great satisfaction itself.

data.v: इदं तु खलु कौन्तेय श्रुतमासीत्पुरा मया । मार्कण्डेयस्य वदतो ये दोषा मांसभक्षणे ॥
data.md: This I heard forinerly, O son of Kunti, from Markandeya when that Rishi discoursed on the sins of eating flesh.

data.v: यो हि खादति मांसानि प्राणिनां जीवितार्थिनाम् । हतानां वा मृतानां वा यथा हन्ता तथैव सः ॥
data.md: He who eats the flesh of animals are who desirous of living but who have been slain by either himself or others, commits the sin of slaughter for his this act of cruelty.

data.v: धनेन क्रायको हन्ति खादकश्चोपभोगतः । घातको वधबन्धाभ्यामित्येष त्रिविधो वधः ॥
data.md: He who purchases flesh, kills living crcatures through his money. He who eats flesh, kills living creatures through such act of caling. He who binds or seizes and actually kilis living creatures, is the slaughterer. These are the three sorts of slaughter, each of these three acts being so.

data.v: अखादन्ननुमोदंश्च भावदोषेण मानवः । योऽनुमन्येत हन्तव्यं सोऽपि दोषेण लिप्यते ॥
data.md: He who does not himself eat flesh but approves of an act of slaughter, becomes stained with the sin of slaughter.

data.v: अधृष्यः सर्वभूतानामायुष्मान्नीरुजः सुखी । भवत्यभक्षयन्मांसं दयावान्प्राणिनामिह ॥
data.md: By abstaining from meat and showing mercy to all creatures one becomes incapable of being molested by any creature, and acquires longevity perfect health and happiness.

data.v: हिरण्यदानैर्गोदानैर्भूमिदानैश्च सर्वशः । मांसस्याभक्षणे धर्मो विशिष्टः स्यादिति श्रुतिः ॥
data.md: The merit won by abstaining from meat, we have heard is superior to that of one who makes presents of gold, of kine, and of land.

data.v: अप्रोक्षितं वृथामांसं विधिहीनं न भक्षयेत् । भक्षयन्निरयं याति नरो नास्त्यत्र संशयः ॥
प्रोक्षिताभ्युक्षितं मांसं तथा ब्राह्मणकाम्यया । अल्पदोषमिह ज्ञेयं विपरीते तु लिप्यते ॥
खादकस्य कृते जन्तुं यो हन्यात्पुरुषाधमः । महादोषकरस्तत्र खादको न तु घातकः ॥
data.md: If ong cats the meat that has been sanctified on account of its having been procured from animals dedicated in sacrifices and that have been killed for the purpose of feeding Brahmanas, one incurs a little fault. By behaving otherwise, one becomes stained with sin. That wretched man who kills living creatures for the sake of those who would eat them commits great sin. The eater's sin is not so great.

data.v: इज्यायज्ञश्रुतिकृतैर्यो मार्गैरबुधो जनः । हन्याज्जन्तुं मांसगृद्ध्री स वै नरकभाङ्नरः ॥
data.md: That wretched man who following the path of religious rites and sacrifices laid down in the Vedas, would kill a living creature from desire of eating its flesh, would certainly go to Hell. One should never eat meat of animals not dedicated in sacrifices and that are, therefore, killed uselessly, and that has not been offered to the gods and departed Manes with the help of the ordinances. There is not the least doubt that a person by eating such meat goes to Hell.

data.v: भक्षयित्वा तु यो मांसं पश्चादपि निवर्तते । तस्यापि सुमहान्धर्मो यः पापाद्विनिवर्तते ॥
data.md: That man who having eaten flesh abstains from it afterwards acquires great merit on account of such abstention from sin.

data.v: आहर्ता चानुमन्ता च विशस्ता क्रयविक्रयी । संस्कर्ता चोपभोक्ता च घातकाः सर्व एव ते ॥
data.md: He who arranges for obtaining flesh, he who approves of those arrangements, he who kills, he who, buys or sells, he who cooks, and he who eats, are all considered as caters of flesh.

data.v: इदमन्यत्तु वक्ष्यामि प्रमाणं विधिनिर्मितम् । पुराणमृषिभिर्जुष्टं वेदेषु परिनिश्चितम् ॥
data.md: I shall now cite another authority, depending upon the saying of the ordainer himself, that is ancient, worshipped by the Rishis, and established in the Vedas.

data.v: प्रवृत्तिलक्षणे धर्मे फलार्थिभिरभिद्रुते । यथोक्तं राजशार्दूल न तु तन्मोक्षकाङ्क्षिणाम् ॥
data.md: It has been said that religion which has acts for its marks, has been ordained for householders O chief of kings, and not for those men who are desirous of Liberation.

data.v: हविर्यत्संस्कृतं मन्त्रैः प्रोक्षिताभ्युक्षितं शुचि । वेदोक्तेन प्रमाणेन पितॄणां प्रक्रियासु च । अतोऽन्यथा वृथामांसमभक्ष्यं मनुरब्रवीत् ॥
अस्वर्ग्यमयशस्यं च रक्षोवद्भरतर्षभ । विधिना हि नराः पूर्वं मांसं राजन्नभक्षयन् ॥
य इच्छेत्पुरुषोऽत्यन्तमात्मानं निरुपद्रवम् । स वर्जयेत मांसानि प्राणिनामिह सर्वशः ॥
data.md: That man who wishes to avoid disaster should abstain from the meat of every living creature.

data.v: श्रूयते हि पुराकल्पे नृणां व्रीहिमयः पशुः । येनायजन्त यज्वानः पुण्यलोकपरायणाः ॥
data.md: It is heard that in the former Aeon persons, desirous of acquiring regions of merit hereafter, celebrated sacrifices with seeds, regarding such animals as dedicated by them.

data.v: ऋषिभिः संशयं पृष्टो वसुश्चेदिपतिः पुरा । अभक्ष्यमिति मांसं स प्राह भक्ष्यमिति प्रभो ॥
data.md: Doubtful about the propriety of eating flesh, the Rishis asked Vasu the king of the Chedis, for removing their doubt. King Vasu, knowing that flesh should not be taken, answered that it was edible, O king.

data.v: आकाशान्मेदिनीं प्राप्तस्ततः स पृथिवीपतिः । एतदेव पुनश्चोक्त्वा विवेश धरणीतलम् ॥
data.md: From that moment Vasu dropped down from the sky on the Earth. After this he once more repeated his opinion, with the result that he had to go down below the earth for it.

data.v: प्रजानां हितकामेन त्वगस्त्येन महात्मना । आरण्याः सर्वदैवत्याः प्रोक्षितास्तपसा मृगाः ॥
क्रिया ह्येवं न हीयन्ते पितृदैवतसंश्रिताः । प्रीयन्ते पितरश्चैव न्यायतो मांसतर्पिताः ॥
इदं तु शृणु राजेन्द्र कीर्त्यमानं मयानघ । अभक्षणे सर्वसुखं मांसस्य मनुजाधिप ॥
data.md: Listen to me, O king of kings, as I tell you this, O sinless one, There is absolute happiness ! in abstaining from meat, O king.

data.v: यस्तु वर्षशतं पूर्णं तपस्तप्येत्सुदारुणम् । यश्चैकं वर्जयेन्मांसं सममेतन्मतं मम ॥
data.md: He who practises severe austerities for a century, and he who abstains from ineat, are both equally meritorious. This is my opinion.

data.v: कौमुदे तु विशेषेण शुक्लपक्षे नराधिप । वर्जयेत्सर्वमांसानि धर्मो ह्यत्र विधीयते ॥
data.md: In the light half of the month of Kartika in especial, one should abstain from honey and mcat. It has been ordained, that there is great merit in it.

data.v: चतुरो वार्षिकान्मासान्यो मांसं परिवर्जयेत् । चत्वारि भद्राण्याप्नोति कीर्तिमायुर्यशो बलम् ॥
data.md: He who abstains from meat for the four months of the rainy season, acquires the blessed achievements, viz., longevity, fame and power.

data.v: अथ वा मासमप्येकं सर्वमांसान्यभक्षयन् । अतीत्य सर्वदुःखानि सुखी जीवेन्निरामयः ॥
data.md: He who abstains for the whole month of Kartika from meat of every kind, gets over all sorts of woe and lives in complete happiness.

data.v: ये वर्जयन्ति मांसानि मासशः पक्षशोऽपि वा । तेषां हिंसानिवृत्तानां ब्रह्मलोको विधीयते ॥
data.md: They who abstain from flesh by either months or fortnights, have the region of Brahma ordained for them on account of their abstention from cruelty.

data.v: मांसं तु कौमुदं पक्षं वर्जितं पार्थ राजभिः । सर्वभूतात्मभूतैस्तैर्विज्ञातार्थपरावरैः ॥
data.md: Formerly many kings, O son of Pritha who had forined themselves the souls of all creatures and who has known the truths of all things viz., Soul and Not Soul, had abstained from flesh either for the whole of the month of Kartika or for the whole of the light fortnight in that month.

data.v: नाभागेनाम्बरीषेण गयेन च महात्मना । आयुषा चानरण्येन दिलीपरघुपूरुभिः ॥
कार्तवीर्यानिरुद्धाभ्यां नहुषेण ययातिना । नृगेण विष्वगश्वेन तथैव शशबिन्दुना । युवनाश्वेन च तथा शिबिनौशीनरेण च ॥
श्येनचित्रेण राजेन्द्र सोमकेन वृकेण च । रैवतेन रन्तिदेवेन वसुना सृञ्जयेन च ॥
दुःषन्तेन करूषेण रामालर्कनलैस्तथा । विरूपाश्वेन निमिना जनकेन च धीमता ॥
सिलेन पृथुना चैव वीरसेनेन चैव ह । इक्ष्वाकुणा शंभुना च श्वेतेन सगरेण च ॥
एतैश्चान्यैश्च राजेन्द्र पुरा मांसं न भक्षितम् । शारदं कौमुदं मासं ततस्ते स्वर्गमाप्नुवन् ॥
ब्रह्मलोके च तिष्ठन्ति ज्वलमानाः श्रियान्विताः । उपास्यमाना गन्धर्वैः स्त्रीसहस्रसमन्विताः ॥
तदेतदुत्तमं धर्ममहिंसालक्षणं शुभम् । ये चरन्ति महात्मानो नाकपृष्ठे वसन्ति ते ॥
data.md: Those great men who practise this excellent Religion which is marked out by abstention from injury, succeed in living in the celestial region.

data.v: मधु मांसं च ये नित्यं वर्जयन्तीह धार्मिकाः । जन्मप्रभृति मद्यं च सर्वे ते मुनयः स्मृताः । विशिष्टतां ज्ञातिषु च लभन्ते नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: Those pious inen who from the time of birth abstain from honey and meat and wine are considered as ascetics.

data.v: आपन्नश्चापदो मुच्येद्बद्धो मुच्येत बन्धनात् । मुच्येत्तथातुरो रोगाद्दुःखान्मुच्येत दुःखितः ॥
data.md: When afflicted with calanity, he immediately gets over it. When obstructed with obstacles, he succeeds in freeing himself from them with the utmost case. When suffering from a disease, he becomes quickly cured, and afflicted with sorrow he becomes liberated from it with greatest ease.

data.v: तिर्यग्योनिं न गच्छेत रूपवांश्च भवेन्नरः । बुद्धिमान्वै कुरुश्रेष्ठ प्राप्नुयाच्च महद्यशः ॥
data.md: Such a man has never to take birth in the intermediate order of animals or birds. Born in the order of men, he attains to great personal beauty. Gifted with great prosperity, O chief of Kuru's race, he acquires great fame as well.

data.v: एतत्ते कथितं राजन्मांसस्य परिवर्जने । प्रवृत्तौ च निवृत्तौ च विधानमृषिनिर्मितम् ॥
data.md: I have thus told you, O king, all that should be said about the subject of abstention from meat, together with the ordinances about both the religion of action and inaction as framed by the Rishis.

data.v: इमे वै मानवा लोके भृशं मांसस्य गृद्धिनः । विसृज्य भक्षान्विविधान्यथा रक्षोगणास्तथा ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Alas, those cruel men, who not caring for various other sorts of food, want only flesh, are really like great Rakshasa.

data.v: नापूपान्विविधाकाराञ्शाकानि विविधानि च । षाडवान्रसयोगांश्च तथेच्छन्ति यथामिषम् ॥
data.md: Alas, they do not relish various kinds of cakes and diverse sorts of potherbs and various species of Khanda with juicy flavour so much as they do flesh.

data.v: तत्र मे बुद्धिरत्रैव विसर्गे परिमुह्यते । न मन्ये रसतः किंचिन्मांसतोऽस्तीह किंचन ॥
data.md: I cannot understand this at all I think they feel that there is nothing so tasteful as mcat.

data.v: तदिच्छामि गुणाञ्श्रोतुं मांसस्याभक्षणेऽपि वा । भक्षणे चैव ये दोषास्तांश्चैव पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: I wish therefore, O powerful one, to hear what the merits are of abstention from flesh and the sin about the eating of flesh, O chief of Bharata's race.

data.v: सर्वं तत्त्वेन धर्मज्ञ यथावदिह धर्मतः । किं वा भक्ष्यमभक्ष्यं वा सर्वमेतद्वदस्व मे ॥
data.md: You know every duty. Describe to me, in full according to the ordinances on duty, this subject. Do tell me what indeed is edible and what inedible ?

data.v: एवमेतन्महाबाहो यथा वदसि भारत । न मांसात्परमत्रान्यद्रसतो विद्यते भुवि ॥
data.md: Bhishma said O mighty armed one, O Bharata, It is the same as you submit. There is nothing on Earth that is superior to meat in taste.

data.v: क्षतक्षीणाभितप्तानां ग्राम्यधर्मरताश्च ये । अध्वना कर्शितानां च न मांसाद्विद्यते परम् ॥
data.md: There is nothing that is more beneficial than meat to persons who are lean or weak, or afflicted with disease or addicted to sexual union or exhausted with travel.

data.v: सद्यो वर्धयति प्राणान्पुष्टिमग्र्यां ददाति च । न भक्षोऽभ्यधिकः कश्चिन्मांसादस्ति परंतप ॥
data.md: Meat quickly increases strength. It ordains great development. There is no food. O scorcher of enemies, that is superior to meat.

data.v: विवर्जने तु बहवो गुणाः कौरवनन्दन । ये भवन्ति मनुष्याणां तान्मे निगदतः शृणु ॥
data.md: But, O delighter of Kurus, those who abstain from it win great merits. Listen to me as I describe it to you.

data.v: स्वमांसं परमांसैर्यो विवर्धयितुमिच्छति । नास्ति क्षुद्रतरस्तस्मान्न नृशंसतरो नरः ॥
data.md: The virtuous Narada has said that that man who wishes to multiply his own flesh by eating the flesh of other creatures, meet with disaster.

data.v: न हि प्राणात्प्रियतरं लोके किंचन विद्यते । तस्माद्दयां नरः कुर्याद्यथात्मनि तथा परे ॥
data.md: In this world there is nothing that is dearer to a creature than his life. Hence, one should show mercy to the lives of others as he does to his own life.

data.v: शुक्राच्च तात संभूतिर्मांसस्येह न संशयः । भक्षणे तु महान्दोषो वधेन सह कल्पते ॥
data.md: Forsooth, O son, flesh has its origin in the vital seed. There is great sin attaching to its eating, as, indeed, there is merit in abstaining from it.

data.v: अहिंसालक्षणो धर्म इति वेदविदो विदुः । यदहिंस्रं भवेत्कर्म तत्कुर्यादात्मवान्नरः ॥
data.md: Persons conversant with duty say that Religion is worthy of being called Religion which is characterised by abstention from cruelty. The man of purified soul should do only such acts as have mercy for their soul.

data.v: पितृदैवतयज्ञेषु प्रोक्षितं हविरुच्यते । विधिना वेददृष्टेन तद्भुक्त्वेह न दुष्यति ॥
यज्ञार्थे पशवः सृष्टा इत्यपि श्रूयते श्रुतिः । अतोऽन्यथा प्रवृत्तानां राक्षसो विधिरुच्यते ॥
data.md: One does not, however, commit any sin by eating flesh sanctified according to the ordinances to the Vedas. The Shruti says that animal were created for sacrifice. They wlio eat flesh in any other way are said to follow Rakshasa practice.

data.v: क्षत्रियाणां तु यो दृष्टो विधिस्तमपि मे शृणु । वीर्येणोपार्जितं मांसं यथा खादन्न दुष्यति ॥
data.md: Listen to me as I tell you what the ordinances is for the Kshatriyas. They do not commit any sin by eating flesh that has been acquired power.

data.v: आरण्याः सर्वदैवत्याः प्रोक्षिताः सर्वशो मृगाः । अगस्त्येन पुरा राजन्मृगया येन पूज्यते ॥
data.md: All wild deer have been dedicated to the celestials and the departed Manes in days of old, O king, by Agastya. Hence the hunting of dcer is not censured.

data.v: नात्मानमपरित्यज्य मृगया नाम विद्यते । समतामुपसंगम्य रूपं हन्यान्न वा नृप ॥
data.md: There can be no hunting without risk of one's own life. There is equality of risk between the killer and the killed. Either the animal is killed or it kills the hunter.

data.v: अतो राजर्षयः सर्वे मृगयां यान्ति भारत । लिप्यन्ते न हि दोषेण न चैतत्पातकं विदुः ॥
data.md: Hence, O Bharata, even royal sages take to hunting. By such conduct they do not become stained with sin. Indeed the practice is not considered sinful.

data.v: न हि तत्परमं किंचिदिह लोके परत्र च । यत्सर्वेष्विह लोकेषु दया कौरवनन्दन ॥
data.md: There is nothing O, delighter of the Kurus, that is equal in point of merit, either in this world or in the next to the practice of mercy to all living creatures.

data.v: न भयं विद्यते जातु नरस्येह दयावतः । दयावतामिमे लोकाः परे चापि तपस्विनाम् ॥
data.md: A kind-hearted man seldom has to suffer from any fright. A gracious and austerious person enjoys equal pleasure in this world and the next.

data.v: अभयं सर्वभूतेभ्यो यो ददाति दयापरः । अभयं तस्य भूतानि ददतीत्यनुशुश्रुमः ॥
क्षतं च स्खलितं चैव पतितं क्लिष्टमाहतम् । सर्वभूतानि रक्षन्ति समेषु विषमेषु च ॥
data.md: It is heard that all creatures abstain from causing any fear to such a creature. All creatures protect him when he is wounded or fallen down or prostrated or weakened or bruised. Indeed they do under all circumstances, whether he is on even uneven ground. Neither snakes nor wild animals neither Pishachas nor Rakshasas, ever kill him.

data.v: नैनं व्यालमृगा घ्नन्ति न पिशाचा न राक्षसाः । मुच्यन्ते भयकालेषु मोक्षयन्ति च ये परान् ॥
प्राणदानात्परं दानं न भूतं न भविष्यति । न ह्यात्मनः प्रियतरः कश्चिदस्तीति निश्चितम् ॥
अनिष्टं सर्वभूतानां मरणं नाम भारत । मृत्युकाले हि भूतानां सद्यो जायति वेपथुः ॥
जातिजन्मजरादुःखे नित्यं संसारसागरे । जन्तवः परिवर्तन्ते मरणादुद्विजन्ति च ॥
गर्भवासेषु पच्यन्ते क्षाराम्लकटुकै रसैः । मूत्रश्लेष्मपुरीषाणां स्पर्शैश्च भृशदारुणैः ॥
जाताश्चाप्यवशास्तत्र भिद्यमानाः पुनः पुनः । पाट्यमानाश्च दृश्यन्ते विवशा मांसगृद्धिनः ॥
कुम्भीपाके च पच्यन्ते तां तां योनिमुपागताः । आक्रम्य मार्यमाणाश्च भ्राम्यन्ते वै पुनः पुनः ॥
नात्मनोऽस्ति प्रियतरः पृथिव्यामनुसृत्य ह । तस्मात्प्राणिषु सर्वेषु दयावानात्मवान्भवेत् ॥
सर्वमांसानि यो राजन्यावज्जीवं न भक्षयेत् । स्वर्गे स विपुलं स्थानं प्राप्नुयान्नात्र संशयः ॥
ये भक्षयन्ति मांसानि भूतानां जीवितैषिणाम् । भक्ष्यन्ते तेऽपि तैर्भूतैरिति मे नास्ति संशयः ॥
मां स भक्षयते यस्माद्भक्षयिष्ये तमप्यहम् । एतन्मांसस्य मांसत्वमतो बुध्यस्व भारत ॥
घातको वध्यते नित्यं तथा वध्येत बन्धकः । आक्रोष्टाक्रुश्यते राजन्द्वेष्टा द्वेष्यत्वमाप्नुते ॥
येन येन शरीरेण यद्यत्कर्म करोति यः । तेन तेन शरीरेण तत्तत्फलमुपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: He who acts with hostility towards another becomes the victim of similar deeds done by that other. Whatever acts one does in whatever bodies, he has to suffer the consequences thereof in those bodies.

data.v: अहिंसा परमो धर्मस्तथाहिंसा परो दमः । अहिंसा परमं दानमहिंसा परमं तपः ॥
data.md: Abstention from injury is the highest Religion. It is, again, the highest penance. It is also the highest truth from which all duty emanates.

data.v: अहिंसा परमो यज्ञस्तथाहिंसा परं बलम् । अहिंसा परमं मित्रमहिंसा परमं सुखम् । अहिंसा परमं सत्यमहिंसा परमं श्रुतम् ॥
सर्वयज्ञेषु वा दानं सर्वतीर्थेषु चाप्लुतम् । सर्वदानफलं वापि नैतत्तुल्यमहिंसया ॥
data.md: Gifts made in all sacrifices, ablutions performed in all sacred waters, and the merit which one acquires from making all kinds of gifts mentioned in the scriptures all these do not equal abstention from cruelty in merit.

data.v: अहिंस्रस्य तपोऽक्षय्यमहिंस्रो यजते सदा । अहिंस्रः सर्वभूतानां यथा माता यथा पिता ॥
data.md: The penances of a man who abstains from cruelty are endless. The man who abstains from cruelty is considered as always perforining sacrifices. The man who abstains from cruelty is the father and mother of all creatures.

data.v: एतत्फलमहिंसाया भूयश्च कुरुपुंगव । न हि शक्या गुणा वक्तुमिह वर्षशतैरपि ॥
data.md: Even these, chief of Kuru's race, are some of the merits of abstention from cruelty. Altogether, the merits of it are so many that they are incapable of being exhausted even if one were to speak for a century.

data.v: अकामाश्च सकामाश्च हता येऽस्मिन्महाहवे । कां योनिं प्रतिपन्नास्ते तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Wishing to die and wishing to live many persons surrender their lives in the great sacrifice (of battle). Tell me O grandfather what is the end that these attain to.

data.v: दुःखं प्राणपरित्यागः पुरुषाणां महामृधे । जानामि तत्त्वं धर्मज्ञ प्राणत्यागं सुदुष्करम् ॥
समृद्धे वासमृद्धे वा शुभे वा यदि वाशुभे । कारणं तत्र मे ब्रूहि सर्वज्ञो ह्यसि मे मतः ॥
data.md: To give up life in battle is fraught with sorrow for men. O you of great wisdom you know that to give up life if difficult for men whether they are rich or poor or are in happiness or misery. In my opinion you are gifted with omniscience. Do you tell me the reason of this.

data.v: समृद्धे वासमृद्धे वा शुभे वा यदि वाशुभे । संसारेऽस्मिन्समाजाताः प्राणिनः पृथिवीपते ॥
data.md: Bhishma said In prosperity or adversity in weal or woe, living creatures, O king, coming into this world, live according to a particular method.

data.v: निरता येन भावेन तत्र मे शृणु कारणम् । सम्यक्चायमनुप्रश्नस्त्वयोक्तश्च युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Listen to me as I explain the reason to you. The question you have put to me is indeed, excellent, O Yudhishthira!

data.v: अत्र ते वर्तयिष्यामि पुरावृत्तमिदं नृप । द्वैपायनस्य संवादं कीटस्य च युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Regarding it, О king, I shall explain to you the old discourse that took place formerly between the Dvaipayana Rishi and a crawling worm.

data.v: ब्रह्मभूतश्चरन्विप्रः कृष्णद्वैपायनः पुरा । ददर्श कीटं धावन्तं शीघ्रं शकटवर्त्मनि ॥
data.md: Formerly when that learned Brahmana, viz., the Krishna Dvaipayana having identified himself with Brahma, roamed over the world, he saw on a road over which cars used to pass a worm moving quickly.

data.v: गतिज्ञः सर्वभूतानां रुतज्ञश्च शरीरिणाम् । सर्वज्ञः सर्वतो दृष्ट्वा कीटं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: The Rishi knew the of every creature and the language of every animal, Gifted with omniscience, he addressed the worm he saw in these words. course

data.v: कीट संत्रस्तरूपोऽसि त्वरितश्चैव लक्ष्यसे । क्व धावसि तदाचक्ष्व कुतस्ते भयमागतम् ॥
data.md: Vyasa said O worm, you appear to be greatly alarmed and to be in great haste. Tell me, where do you run and whence have you been afraid?

data.v: शकटस्यास्य महतो घोषं श्रुत्वा भयं मम । आगतं वै महाबुद्धे स्वन एष हि दारुणः । श्रूयते न स मां हन्यादिति तस्मादपाक्रमे ॥
data.md: The worm said I am stricken with fear on hearing the rattle of that large car. O you of great intelligence, it makes a fearful roar. It is almost come.

data.v: श्वसतां च शृणोम्येवं गोपुत्राणां प्रचोद्यताम् । वहतां सुमहाभारं संनिकर्षे स्वनं प्रभो । नृणां च संवाहयतां श्रूयते विविधः स्वनः ॥
data.md: They are breathing hard under the whip of the driver, as they are carrying the heavy load. I hear also the various sound made by the men who are driving the bulls.

data.v: सोढुमस्मद्विधेनैष न शक्यः कीटयोनिना । तस्मादपक्रमाम्येष भयादस्मात्सुदारुणात् ॥
data.md: Creatures which like us are born as worms, cannot bear such sounds. It is therefore that I am flying from this situation of great fright.

data.v: दुःखं हि मृत्युर्भूतानां जीवितं च सुदुर्लभम् । अतो भीतः पलायामि गच्छेयं नासुखं सुखात् ॥
data.md: Death is considered by all creatures as painful. Life is an acquisition difficult to make. Hence, I fly away in fear, I do not wish to pass from a state of weal to one of woe.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तु तं प्राह कुतः कीट सुखं तव । मरणं ते सुखं मन्ये तिर्यग्योनौ हि वर्तसे ॥
data.md: Bhishma said O worm, whence can be your happiness? You belong to the intermediate order of being. I think death would be of happiness to you.

data.v: शब्दं स्पर्शं रसं गन्धं भोगांश्चोच्चावचान्बहून् । नाभिजानासि कीट त्वं श्रेयो मरणमेव ते ॥
data.md: Sound touch, taste, scent, and various kinds of excellent enjoyments are unknown to you, O worm! I think death will prove a benefit to you.

data.v: सर्वत्र निरतो जीव इतीहापि सुखं मम । चेतयामि महाप्राज्ञ तस्मादिच्छामि जीवितुम् ॥
data.md: The Worm said A living creature however circumstanced he may be becomes attached to it. In even this order of being I am happy, I think, O you of great wisdom! It is for this that I wish to live.

data.v: इहापि विषयः सर्वो यथादेहं प्रवर्तितः । मानुषास्तिर्यगाश्चैव पृथग्भोगा विशेषतः ॥
data.md: In this condition every object of enjoyment exists for me according to the necessity of my body. Human beings and those creatures which originate from immobile objects have different enjoyments.

data.v: अहमासं मनुष्यो वै शूद्रो बहुधनः पुरा । अब्रह्मण्यो नृशंसश्च कदर्यो वृद्धिजीवनः ॥
data.md: In my former life I was a human being. O powerful one, I was a wealthy Shudra. I was not devoted to the Brahmanas. I was cruel, vile in conduct, and a usurer.

data.v: वाक्तीक्ष्णो निकृतिप्रज्ञो मोष्टा विश्वस्य सर्वशः । मिथःकृतोऽपनिधनः परस्वहरणे रतः ॥
data.md: I was harsh in speech. I considered cunning as wisdom. I hated all creatures. Taking advantage of pretexts in agreements made between myself and others I used always to take away what belonged to others.

data.v: भृत्यातिथिजनश्चापि गृहे पर्युषितो मया । मात्सर्यात्स्वादुकामेन नृशंसेन बुभूषता ॥
data.md: Without feeding servants and guests arrived at my house, I used to fill, when hungry, my own stomach, proud, covetous of good food, cruel as I was.

data.v: देवार्थं पितृयज्ञार्थमन्नं श्रद्धाकृतं मया । न दत्तमर्थकामेन देयमन्नं पुनाति ह ॥
data.md: Greedy as I was of riches, I never dedicated, with faith and respect any food to the celestials and the departed Manes, although duty required me to dedicate food to them.

data.v: गुप्तं शरणमाश्रित्य भयेषु शरणागताः । अकस्मान्नो भयात्त्यक्ता न च त्राताभयैषिणः ॥
data.md: Those men who moved by fear, came to me, for seeking my help, I sent adrift without giving them any protection. I did not extend my help to those who came to me with prayers for removing their fear.

data.v: धनं धान्यं प्रियान्दारान्यानं वासस्तथाद्भुतम् । श्रियं दृष्ट्वा मनुष्याणामसूयामि निरर्थकम् ॥
data.md: I used to feel unreasonable envy at seeing other people's riches and corn, and wives held dear by them, and articles of drink, and good palaces.

data.v: ईर्ष्युः परसुखं दृष्ट्वा आतताय्यबुभूषकः । त्रिवर्गहन्ता चान्येषामात्मकामानुवर्तकः ॥
data.md: Seeing the happiness of other I was filled with envy and I always wished them poverty. Acting thus which promised to crown my own wishes with fruition, I sought to destroy the virtue, riches, and pleasures of other people.

data.v: नृशंसगुणभूयिष्ठं पुरा कर्म कृतं मया । स्मृत्वा तदनुतप्येऽहं त्यक्त्वा प्रियमिवात्मजम् ॥
data.md: In that past life of mine, I committed various deeds moved by cruelty and such other passions. Recollecting those deeds I am filled with repentance and grief, as one is filled with grief at the loss of his dear son.

data.v: शुभानामपि जानामि कृतानां कर्मणां फलम् । माता च पूजिता वृद्धा ब्राह्मणश्चार्चितो मया ॥
data.md: On account of those deeds of mine, I do not know what the fruits are of good deeds. I, however, adored my old mother and on one occasion adored a Brahmana.

data.v: सकृज्जातिगुणोपेतः संगत्या गृहमागतः । अतिथिः पूजितो ब्रह्मंस्तेन मां नाजहात्स्मृतिः ॥
data.md: Gifted with birth and accomplishments, that Brahmana, while travelling, came to my house once as a guest. I received him with respectful hospitality. One account of the merit of that deed my memory has not forsaken me.

data.v: कर्मणा तेन चैवाहं सुखाशामिह लक्षये । तच्छ्रोतुमहमिच्छामि त्वत्तः श्रेयस्तपोधन ॥
data.md: I think that on account of that deed, I shall once more succeed in regaining happiness. O you having asceticism for wealth you know everything, Tell me please what is for my behoof.

data.v: शुभेन कर्मणा यद्वै तिर्यग्योनौ न मुह्यसे । ममैव कीट तत्कर्म येन त्वं न प्रमुह्यसे ॥
data.md: Vyasa said On account of a meritorious deed, Oworm, that you, though born in the intermediate order of being are not stupefied. For a deed of mine, Oworm you are not stupefied.

data.v: अहं हि दर्शनादेव तारयामि तपोबलात् । तपोबलाद्धि बलवद्बलमन्यन्न विद्यते ॥
data.md: On account of the power of my penances, I am able to rescue a being of sin by granting him sight only of my body. There is no stronger power than that of penances.

data.v: जानामि पापैः स्वकृतैर्गतं त्वां कीट कीटताम् । अवाप्स्यसि परं धर्मं धर्मस्थो यदि मन्यसे ॥
data.md: I know, O worm that you have taken birth in the order of worms through the evil deeds of your past life. If, however, you think of acquiring virtue and inerit, you may again attain to it.

data.v: कर्म भूमिकृतं देवा भुञ्जते तिर्यगाश्च ये । धर्मादपि मनुष्येषु कामोऽर्थश्च यथा गुणैः ॥
data.md: Deities as well as beings crowned with ascetic success, enjoy suffer the consequence of deeds done by them in this field of action. Men perform acts of merit from desire of fruit. The very accomplishinents that one seeks to acquire are sought from desire of the happiness they will produce.

data.v: वाग्बुद्धिपाणिपादैश्चाप्युपेतस्य विपश्चितः । किं हीयते मनुष्यस्य मन्दस्यापि हि जीवतः ॥
data.md: Learned or ignorant (in a previous existence) the creature that is in this life, shorn of speech and understanding and hands and feet, is really shorn of everything. or

data.v: जीवन्हि कुरुते पूजां विप्राग्र्यः शशिसूर्ययोः । ब्रुवन्नपि कथां पुण्यां तत्र कीट त्वमेष्यसि ॥
data.md: He who becomes a superior Brahmana worships while alive, the deities of the sun and the moon, uttering various sacred Mantras. O worm, you will come by that state of existence.

data.v: गुणभूतानि भूतानि तत्र त्वमुपभोक्ष्यसे । तत्र तेऽहं विनेष्यामि ब्रह्मत्वं यत्र चेच्छसि ॥
data.md: Acquiring that status you will enjoy all the clements converted into articles of enjoyinent. When you have acquired that state, I shall impart to you Brahma. Or, if you wish, I may place you in any other status.

data.v: स तथेति प्रतिश्रुत्य कीटो वर्त्मन्यतिष्ठत । तमृषिं द्रष्टुमगमत्सर्वास्वन्यासु योनिषु ॥
data.md: Agreeing to the words of Vyasa, the worm did not leave the road, but remained on it. Meanwhile, the large car which was coming ini that direction came there.

data.v: श्वाविद्गोधावराहाणां तथैव मृगपक्षिणाम् । श्वपाकवैश्यशूद्राणां क्षत्रियाणां च योनिषु ॥
स कीटेत्येवमाभाष्य ऋषिणा सत्यवादिना । प्रतिस्मृत्याथ जग्राह पादौ मूर्ध्ना कृताञ्जलिः ॥
इदं तदतुलं स्थानमीप्सितं दशभिर्गुणैः । यदहं प्राप्य कीटत्वमागतो राजपुत्रताम् ॥
data.md: The Worm said My present status is that great one which is coveted by all and which only persons having ten well known attribute, can get. Indeed, I who was formerly a worm have thus acquired the status of a prince.

data.v: वहन्ति मामतिबलाः कुञ्जरा हेममालिनः । स्यन्दनेषु च काम्बोजा युक्ताः परमवाजिनः ॥
data.md: Elephants of great strength, decked with golden chains, carry me on their backs. To my cars are yoked Kamboja horses of High mettle.

data.v: उष्ट्राश्वतरयुक्तानि यानानि च वहन्ति माम् । सबान्धवः सहामात्यश्चाश्नामि पिशितौदनम् ॥
data.md: Numerous cars to which are attached camels and mules bear me. With all my relatives and friends I now eat food rich with meat.

data.v: गृहेषु सुनिवासेषु सुखेषु शयनेषु च । परार्ध्येषु महाभाग स्वपामीह सुपूजितः ॥
data.md: Adored by all, I sleep, O highly blessed one on rich beds in charming rooms to which disagreeable winds cannot blow.

data.v: सर्वेष्वपररात्रेषु सूतमागधबन्दिनः । स्तुवन्ति मां यथा देवं महेन्द्रं प्रियवादिनः ॥
data.md: Towards the dawn bards and encomiasts sing my praises even as the deities utter the agreeable praises of Indra their chief.

data.v: प्रसादात्सत्यसंधस्य भवतोऽमिततेजसः । यदहं कीटतां प्राप्य संप्राप्तो राजपुत्रताम् ॥
data.md: Through your favour who are firm in truth and gifted with immeasurable energy, I who was before a worin have now become a Kshatriya.

data.v: नमस्तेऽस्तु महाप्राज्ञ किं करोमि प्रशाधि माम् । त्वत्तपोबलनिर्दिष्टमिदं ह्यधिगतं मया ॥
data.md: I bow my head to you, O you of great wisdom. Do you command me as to what I should now do. Ordained by the power of your penances, I have come by this position.

data.v: अर्चितोऽहं त्वया राजन्वाग्भिरद्य यदृच्छया । अद्य ते कीटतां प्राप्य स्मृतिर्जाताजुगुप्सिता ॥
data.md: Vyasa said I have today been adored by you, O king, with various words expressive of respect. Changed into a worm your memory had become clouded. That memory has again appeared.

data.v: न तु नाशोऽस्ति पापस्य यत्त्वयोपचितं पुरा । शूद्रेणार्थप्रधानेन नृशंसेनाततायिना ॥
data.md: The sin you had committed in a pristine life, has not yet been dissipated that sin viz., which was acquired by you while you were a Shudra covetous of riches and cruel in conduct and hostile to the Brahmanas.

data.v: मम ते दर्शनं प्राप्तं तच्चैव सुकृतं पुरा । तिर्यग्योनौ स्म जातेन मम चाप्यर्चनात्तथा ॥
इतस्त्वं राजपुत्रत्वाद्ब्राह्मण्यं समवाप्स्यसि । गोब्राह्मणकृते प्राणान्हुत्वात्मीयान्रणाजिरे ॥
data.md: You were able to obtain a sight of my body. That was an act of merit to you while you were a worm. On account of your having saluted and worshipped me, you shall rise higher for, from the Kshatriya order you shall rise to the status of a Brahinana, if only you die on the field of battle for the sake of kine or Brahmanas.

data.v: राजपुत्रसुखं प्राप्य ऋतूंश्चैवाप्तदक्षिणान् । अथ मोदिष्यसे स्वर्गे ब्रह्मभूतोऽव्ययः सुखी ॥
data.md: O prince, enjoying much happiness and celebrating many sacrifices with profuse presents, you shall attain to Heaven and, changed into eternal Brahma, you shall enjoy perfect beatitude.

data.v: तिर्यग्योन्याः शूद्रतामभ्युपैति; शूद्रो वैश्यत्वं क्षत्रियत्वं च वैश्यः । वृत्तश्लाघी क्षत्रियो ब्राह्मणत्वं; स्वर्गं पुण्यं ब्राह्मणः साधुवृत्तः ॥
data.md: Those who take birth in the intermediate order become Shudras. The Shudra rises to the status of the Vaishya; and the Vaishya to that of the Kshatriya. The charge of the duties of his caste succeeds in acquiring the status of a Brahmana. The Brahmana, by following a righteous conduct, acquires Heaven which is full of happiness.

data.v: क्षत्रधर्ममनुप्राप्तः स्मरन्नेव स वीर्यवान् । त्यक्त्वा स कीटतां राजंश्चचार विपुलं तपः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Having renounced the status of a worm and taken birth as a Kshatriya of great energy, the person remembering his previous changes, O monarch began to practise severe austerities.

data.v: तस्य धर्मार्थविदुषो दृष्ट्वा तद्विपुलं तपः । आजगाम द्विजश्रेष्ठः कृष्णद्वैपायनस्तदा ॥
data.md: Seeing those severe austerities of the Kshatriya who was well conversant with religion and Profit, Krishna Dvaipayana, that foremost of Brahmanas, went to him.

data.v: क्षात्रं चैव व्रतं कीट भूतानां परिपालनम् । क्षात्रं चैव व्रतं ध्यायंस्ततो विप्रत्वमेष्यसि ॥
data.md: Vyasa said The penances, O worm, of the Kshatriyas consist of the protection of all creatures. Consider these duties of the Kshatriya to be the penances laid down for you. You shall come by the status of a Brahmana.

data.v: पाहि सर्वाः प्रजाः सम्यक्शुभाशुभविदात्मवान् । शुभैः संविभजन्कामैरशुभानां च पावनैः ॥
data.md: Ascertaining what is right and what is wrong, and purifying your soul, do you duly cherish and protect all creatures, judiciously satisfying all good desires and correcting all that is unholy.

data.v: आत्मवान्भव सुप्रीतः स्वधर्मचरणे रतः । क्षात्रीं तनुं समुत्सृज्य ततो विप्रत्वमेष्यसि ॥
data.md: Be you of purified soul, be contented and be devoted to the practice of virtue. Acting thus, you will then, when you die, become a Brahmana.

data.v: सोऽथारण्यमभिप्रेत्य पुनरेव युधिष्ठिर । महर्षेर्वचनं श्रुत्वा प्रजा धर्मेण पाल्य च ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Although he had retired into the forest yet, O Yudhishthira, having heard the words of the great Rishi, he began to cherish and protect his subjects righteously.

data.v: अचिरेणैव कालेन कीटः पार्थिवसत्तम । प्रजापालनधर्मेण प्रेत्य विप्रत्वमागतः ॥
data.md: Soon O best of kings, that worm, on account of the duty of protecting his subjects became a Brahmana after renouncing his Kshatriya body.

data.v: ततस्तं ब्राह्मणं दृष्ट्वा पुनरेव महायशाः । आजगाम महाप्राज्ञः कृष्णद्वैपायनस्तदा ॥
data.md: Seeing those severe austerities of the Kshatriya who was well conversant with religion and Profit, Krishna Dvaipayana, that foremost of Brahmanas, went to him.

data.v: भो भो विप्रर्षभ श्रीमन्मा व्यथिष्ठाः कथंचन । शुभकृच्छुभयोनीषु पापकृत्पापयोनिषु । उपपद्यति धर्मज्ञ यथाधर्मं यथागमम् ॥
data.md: Vyasa said ochief of Brahmanas, O blessed one, be not troubled. He who acts piously, comes by a respectable birth. He on the other hand, who acts impiously comes by a low and vile birth. O you who are conversant with virtue, one attains to misery according to the measure of his sin.

data.v: तस्मान्मृत्युभयात्कीट मा व्यथिष्ठाः कथंचन । धर्मलोपाद्भयं ते स्यात्तस्माद्धर्मं चरोत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Therefore, O worm do not be troubled through fear of death. The only fear you should entertain is about the loss of virtue. Do you therefore, go on practising virtue.

data.v: सुखात्सुखतरं प्राप्तो भगवंस्त्वत्कृते ह्यहम् । धर्ममूलां श्रियं प्राप्य पाप्मा नष्ट इहाद्य मे ॥
data.md: The Worm said Through your favour, O Holy one, I have attained from happy to happier positions! Having obtained such prosperity as is established in virtue, I think my demerits have been lost.

data.v: भगवद्वचनात्कीटो ब्राह्मण्यं प्राप्य दुर्लभम् । अकरोत्पृथिवीं राजन्यज्ञयूपशताङ्किताम् । ततः सालोक्यमगमद्ब्रह्मणो ब्रह्मवित्तमः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The worin having at the command of the holy Rishi acquired the status of a Brahmana that is so difficult to attain, caused the Earth to be marked with a thousand sacrificial stakes.

data.v: अवाप च परं कीटः पार्थ ब्रह्म सनातनम् । स्वकर्मफलनिर्वृत्तं व्यासस्य वचनात्तदा ॥
तेऽपि यस्मात्स्वभावेन हताः क्षत्रियपुंगवाः । संप्राप्तास्ते गतिं पुण्यां तस्मान्मा शोच पुत्रक ॥
data.md: Those foremost of Kshatriyas, also, who have renounced their lifebreaths, exerting their energy all the while have all acquired a meritorious end. Therefore, O king, do not mourn on their account.

data.v: विद्या तपश्च दानं च किमेतेषां विशिष्यते । पृच्छामि त्वा सतां श्रेष्ठ तन्मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Which amongst these three is superior, viz.,. knowledge, Penances, and Gifts? I ask foremost of pious men. Tell me this, O grandfather.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । मैत्रेयस्य च संवादं कृष्णद्वैपायनस्य च ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Regarding it is cited the old conversation between Maitreya and Krishna Dvaipayana.

data.v: कृष्णद्वैपायनो राजन्नज्ञातचरितं चरन् । वाराणस्यामुपातिष्ठन्मैत्रेयं स्वैरिणीकुले ॥
data.md: Once on a time Krishna Dvaipayana, O king, while wandering over the world in disguisc, proceeded to Varanasi and waited tipon Maitreya who belonged by birth to a race of ascetics.

data.v: तमुपस्थितमासीनं ज्ञात्वा स मुनिसत्तमम् । अर्चित्वा भोजयामास मैत्रेयोऽशनमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Seeing Vyasa arrive, that foremost of Rishis viz., Maitreya, gave him a seat and after adoring him with due rites, entertained him with excellent food.

data.v: तदन्नमुत्तमं भुक्त्वा गुणवत्सार्वकामिकम् । प्रतिष्ठमानोऽस्मयत प्रीतः कृष्णो महामनाः ॥
data.md: Having eaten that good food which was very wholesome and which gave every kind of ratification the great Krishna become highly pleased and as he sat there, he even laughed aloud.

data.v: तमुत्स्मयन्तं संप्रेक्ष्य मैत्रेयः कृष्णमब्रवीत् । कारणं ब्रूहि धर्मात्मन्योऽस्मयिष्ठाः कुतश्च ते । तपस्विनो धृतिमतः प्रमोदः समुपागतः ॥
data.md: Seeing Krishna laugh, Maitreya addressed him. saying Tell me, O Righteous souled one, what the reason is of your laughter! You are an ascetic, gifted with power to control your emotions. Great joy, it appears has come over yoll.

data.v: एतत्पृच्छामि ते विद्वन्नभिवाद्य प्रणम्य च । आत्मनश्च तपोभाग्यं महाभाग्यं तथैव च ॥
पृथगाचरतस्तात पृथगात्मनि चात्मनोः । अल्पान्तरमहं मन्ये विशिष्टमपि वा त्वया ॥
data.md: The acts I do are different from those of yours. You are already emancipated though alive. I however am not yet freed. For all that, I think that there is not much difference between you and me. I am, again distinguished by birth.

data.v: अतिच्छेदातिवादाभ्यां स्मयोऽयं समुपागतः । असत्यं वेदवचनं कस्माद्वेदोऽनृतं वदेत् ॥
data.md: Vyasa said This wonder that has filled me, has originated from an ordinance which appears like a hyperbole for the comprehension of the people. The declaration of the Vedas seems to be untrue. But why should the Vedas say an untruth?

data.v: त्रीण्येव तु पदान्याहुः पुरुषस्योत्तमं व्रतम् । न द्रुह्येच्चैव दद्याच्च सत्यं चैव परं वदेत् । इदानीं चैव नः कृत्यं पुरस्ताच्च परं स्मृतम् ॥
data.md: It has been said that there are three roads which form the best vows of a man. One should never injure; one should always tell the truth; and one should make gift.

data.v: अल्पोऽपि तादृशो दायो भवत्युत महाफलः । तृषिताय च यद्दत्तं हृदयेनानसूयता ॥
data.md: Even a small gift, made under the circumstances laid down, yields great fruits. You have given a little water with a sincere heart to a thirsty man.

data.v: तृषितस्तृषिताय त्वं दत्त्वैतदशनं मम । अजैषीर्महतो लोकान्महायज्ञैरिवाभिभो । अतो दानपवित्रेण प्रीतोऽस्मि तपसैव च ॥
data.md: Yourself thirsty and hungry, you have by giving me such food, conquered many high regions of happiness, O powerful one, as one does by many sacrifices.

data.v: पुण्यस्यैव हि ते गन्धः पुण्यस्यैव च दर्शनम् । पुण्यश्च वाति गन्धस्ते मन्ये कर्मविधानतः ॥
अधिकं मार्जनात्तात तथैवाप्यनुलेपनात् । शुभं सर्वपवित्रेभ्यो दानमेव परं भवेत् ॥
यानीमान्युत्तमानीह वेदोक्तानि प्रशंससि । तेषां श्रेष्ठतमं दानमिति मे नास्ति संशयः ॥
data.md: All those rites laid down in the Vedas which you highly speak of, do not equal a gift for, gift is undoubtedly fraught with very superior merit.

data.v: दानकृद्भिः कृतः पन्था येन यान्ति मनीषिणः । ते हि प्राणस्य दातारस्तेषु धर्मः प्रतिष्ठितः ॥
data.md: The path made by charitable persons, is always trod by the wise. They who make gifts of food, are considered as givers of life. The merit they acquire by such gifts, is eternal.

data.v: यथा वेदाः स्वधीताश्च यथा चेन्द्रियसंयमः । सर्वत्यागो यथा चेह तथा दानमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: As the Vedas when well-studied, as the controlling of the senses, as a life of universal Renunciation, so is gift which is fraught with very superior merit.

data.v: त्वं हि तात सुखादेव सुखमेष्यसि शोभनम् । सुखात्सुखतरप्राप्तिमाप्नुते मतिमान्नरः ॥
data.md: You, O son will rise from joy to greater joy (for performing the duty of making gifts.). The intelligent man certainly rises from joy to greater joy.

data.v: तन्नः प्रत्यक्षमेवेदमुपलब्धमसंशयम् । श्रीमन्तमाप्नुवन्त्यर्था दानं यज्ञस्तथा सुखम् ॥
data.md: We have undoubtedly seen many instances of this men gifted with prosperity succeed in acquiring riches, making gifts celebrating sacrifices, and acquiring happiness as the result thereof.

data.v: सुखादेव परं दुःखं दुःखादन्यत्परं सुखम् । दृश्यते हि महाप्राज्ञ नियतं वै स्वभावतः ॥
data.md: It is always observed, O you of great wisdom to happen naturally that happiness is followed by misery, and misery is followed by happiness.

data.v: त्रिविधानीह वृत्तानि नरस्याहुर्मनीषिणः । पुण्यमन्यत्पापमन्यन्न पुण्यं न च पापकम् ॥
data.md: Wise men have said that human beings in this world have three kinds of conduct. Some are righteous; some are sinful; and some are neither righteous nor sinful.

data.v: न वृत्तं मन्यतेऽन्यस्य मन्यतेऽन्यस्य पापकम् । तथा स्वकर्मनिर्वृत्तं न पुण्यं न च पापकम् ॥
data.md: The conduct of the person who is devoted to Brahman is not considered either way. His sins are never considered as sins. So also the man who is devoted to the duties laid down for him, is considered as neither pious nor sinful.

data.v: रमस्वैधस्व मोदस्व देहि चैव यजस्व च । न त्वामभिभविष्यन्ति वैद्या न च तपस्विनः ॥
data.md: Do you sport and grow and rejoice and make gifts and celebrated sacrifices. Neither men of knowledge nor those gifted with penances will then be able to get the better of you.

data.v: एवमुक्तः प्रत्युवाच मैत्रेयः कर्मपूजकः । अत्यन्तं श्रीमति कुले जातः प्राज्ञो बहुश्रुतः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed by Vyasa, Maitreya, who was a worshipper of deeds, who had been born in a family gifted with great prosperity, who was wise and endued with great learning said to him these words.

data.v: असंशयं महाप्राज्ञ यथैवात्थ तथैव तत् । अनुज्ञातस्तु भवता किंचिद्ब्रूयामहं विभो ॥
data.md: Maitreya said O you of great wisdom, it is what you have said O powerful one, with your permission I wish to say something.

data.v: यद्यदिच्छसि मैत्रेय यावद्यावद्यथा तथा । ब्रूहि तावन्महाप्राज्ञ शुश्रूषे वचनं तव ॥
data.md: Vyasa said Whatever you wish to say, O Maitreya in what way so even, do you say, O man of great wisdom, for I wish to hear you.

data.v: निर्दोषं निर्मलं चैव वचनं दानसंहितम् । विद्यातपोभ्यां हि भवान्भावितात्मा न संशयः ॥
data.md: Maitreya said Your words on the subject of gift are faultless and pure. Forsooth, your soul has been purified by knowledge and penances.

data.v: भवतो भावितात्मत्वाद्दायोऽयं सुमहान्मम । भूयो बुद्ध्यानुपश्यामि सुसमृद्धतपा इव ॥
data.md: On account of your soul being purified, even this is the great advantage I reap from it. With the help of my understanding I see that you are gifted with high penances.

data.v: अपि मे दर्शनादेव भवतोऽभ्युदयो महान् । मन्ये भवत्प्रसादोऽयं तद्धि कर्म स्वभावतः ॥
data.md: As regards ourselves we succeed in acquiring prosperity through only seeing personages like you. I think that is due to your favour and originates from the nature of my own acts.

data.v: तपः श्रुतं च योनिश्चाप्येतद्ब्राह्मण्यकारणम् । त्रिभिर्गुणैः समुदितस्ततो भवति वै द्विजः ॥
data.md: Penances, knowledge of the Vedas, and birth in a pure family, these are the causes of the status which one acquires of a Brahmana. When one is possessed of these three qualities then does he coine to be called a twice born person.

data.v: तस्मिंस्तृप्ते च तृप्यन्ते पितरो दैवतानि च । न हि श्रुतवतां किंचिदधिकं ब्राह्मणादृते ॥
data.md: If the Brahmana be pleased, the departed Manes and the deities also are pleased. There is nothing superior to a Brahmana possessed of Vedic learning.

data.v: यथा हि सुकृते क्षेत्रे फलं विन्दति मानवः । एवं दत्त्वा श्रुतवति फलं दाता समश्नुते ॥
data.md: Men, when they sow on a wellcultivated field reap an abundant harvest. Even so one reaps great merit by making gifts to a Brahmana endued with great learning.

data.v: ब्राह्मणश्चेन्न विद्येत श्रुतवृत्तोपसंहितः । प्रतिग्रहीता दानस्य मोघं स्याद्धनिनां धनम् ॥
data.md: If there were no Brahmana gifted with Vedic learning and good conduct for accepting gifts, the wealth possessed by rich men would be useless.

data.v: अदन्ह्यविद्वान्हन्त्यन्नमद्यमानं च हन्ति तम् । तं च हन्यति यस्यान्नं स हत्वा हन्यतेऽबुधः ॥
data.md: The ignorant Brahmana, by eating the food that is offered to him, destroys what he eats. The food also that is eaten destroys the eater. That is called food which is given away to a worthy man, in all other cases he who takes it, makes the donor's gift thrown away and the receiver is likewise ruined for his unduly taking it.

data.v: प्रभुर्ह्यन्नमदन्विद्वान्पुनर्जनयतीश्वरः । स चान्नाज्जायते तस्मात्सूक्ष्म एव व्यतिक्रमः ॥
data.md: The Brahmana endued with learning, becomes the subjugator of the food that he eats. Having eaten it, be begets other food. The ignorant man who eats the food offered to him, loses his right to the children he procreates for the latter become his whose food has enabled the progenitor to beget them. This is the shortcoming of persons eating other people's food when they have not the power to conquer that food.

data.v: यदेव ददतः पुण्यं तदेव प्रतिगृह्णतः । न ह्येकचक्रं वर्तेत इत्येवमृषयो विदुः ॥
data.md: The merit which the giver wins by making the gift is equal to what the taker acquires by accepting the food Both the giver and the taker depend equally upon each other. This is what the Rishis have said.

data.v: यत्र वै ब्राह्मणाः सन्ति श्रुतवृत्तोपसंहिताः । तत्र दानफलं पुण्यमिह चामुत्र चाश्नुते ॥
data.md: There where Brahmanas exist, gifted with Vedic learning and conduct people are enabled to acquire the sacred fruits of gifts and to enjoy them both in this world and the next.

data.v: ये योनिशुद्धाः सततं तपस्यभिरता भृशम् । दानाध्ययनसंपन्नास्ते वै पूज्यतमाः सदा ॥
data.md: Those men who are of pure birth, who are devoted to penances and who make gifts and study the Vedas, are considered as worthy of the most respectful adoration

data.v: तैर्हि सद्भिः कृतः पन्थाश्चेतयानो न मुह्यते । ते हि स्वर्गस्य नेतारो यज्ञवाहाः सनातनाः ॥
data.md: It is those good men who have chalked out the path by treading on which one does not become stupefied. It is those men who take others to the celestial region. They are the Men who carry on their shoulders the burthen of Sacrifices and live for good.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स भगवान्मैत्रेयं प्रत्यभाषत । दिष्ट्यैवं त्वं विजानासि दिष्ट्या ते बुद्धिरीदृशी । लोको ह्ययं गुणानेव भूयिष्ठं स्म प्रशंसति ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed, the Holy one replied to Maitreya, saying, By good luck you are gifted with knowledge. By good luck your understanding is of this kind.

data.v: रूपमानवयोमानश्रीमानाश्चाप्यसंशयम् । दिष्ट्या नाभिभवन्ति त्वां दैवस्तेऽयमनुग्रहः । यत्ते भृशतरं दानाद्वर्तयिष्यामि तच्छृणु ॥
data.md: This favour done to you is due to kindness of the celestials. Listen to me, as I describe to you what is even superior to gift.

data.v: यानीहागमशास्त्राणि याश्च काश्चित्प्रवृत्तयः । तानि वेदं पुरस्कृत्य प्रवृत्तानि यथाक्रमम् ॥
data.md: All scriptures, religious treatises, and rites that are seen in the world, have all originated from the Vedas, according to their due order.

data.v: अहं दानं प्रशंसामि भवानपि तपःश्रुते । तपः पवित्रं वेदस्य तपः स्वर्गस्य साधनम् ॥
data.md: Following them I highly speak of gift. You highly speak of penances and Vedic learning. Penances are sacred. Penances are the means by which one may acquire the Vedas and the celestial region.

data.v: तपसा महदाप्नोति विद्यया चेति नः श्रुतम् । तपसैव चापनुदेद्यच्चान्यदपि दुष्कृतम् ॥
data.md: With the help of penances and of knowledge one acquires the highest fruits.; It is by penances that onc dissipates his sins and all else that is evil.

data.v: यद्यद्धि किंचित्संधाय पुरुषस्तप्यते तपः । सर्वमेतदवाप्नोति ब्राह्मणो वेदपारगः ॥
data.md: We have heard that with whatever purpose in view one performs performs one acquires the fruition thereof on account of those penances. The same may be said of knowledge.

data.v: दुरन्वयं दुष्प्रधृष्यं दुरापं दुरतिक्रमम् । सर्वं वै तपसाभ्येति तपो हि बलवत्तरम् ॥
data.md: Whatever is difficult to do whatever is dificult to conquer whatever is difficult to attain, and whatever is difficult to cross, can all be done with the help of penances. Of all things, penaces are of very superior power.

data.v: सुरापोऽसंमतादायी भ्रूणहा गुरुतल्पगः । तपसा तरते सर्वमेनसश्च प्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: The man who drinks alcohol, or he who takes forcibly other men's properties, or he who is guilty of focticide, or he who violates the bed of his preceptor, succeeds in crossing with the help of penances. Indeed, one becomes purged off of all these sins through penances.

data.v: सर्वविद्यस्तु चक्षुष्मानपि यादृशतादृशः । तपस्विनौ च तावाहुस्ताभ्यां कार्यं सदा नमः ॥
data.md: One gifted with all knowledge and therefore, having true vision and an ascetic of whatever kind, are equal. One should always bow to these two.

data.v: सर्वे पूज्याः श्रुतधनास्तथैव च तपस्विनः । दानप्रदाः सुखं प्रेत्य प्राप्नुवन्तीह च श्रियम् ॥
data.md: All men who have the Vedas for their wealth should be adored. Likewise all men gifted with penances deserve to be adored. They who make gifts get happiness in the next world and much prosperity in this world.

data.v: इमं च ब्रह्मलोकं च लोकं च बलवत्तरम् । अन्नदानैः सुकृतिनः प्रतिपद्यन्ति लौकिकाः ॥
data.md: By making gifts of food righteous men of this world obtain both this world and that of Brahiman himself with many other regions of superior happiness.

data.v: पूजिताः पूजयन्त्येतान्मानिता मानयन्ति च । अदाता यत्र यत्रैति सर्वतः संप्रणुद्यते ॥
data.md: Those men who are worshipped by all, theinselves worship him who makes gifts. Those men who are honoured everywhere, themselves honour him who makes gifts. Wherever the giver goes, he hears himself his own praise.

data.v: अकर्ता चैव कर्ता च लभते यस्य यादृशम् । यद्येवोर्ध्वं यद्यवाक्च त्वं लोकमभियास्यसि ॥
data.md: He who docs acts and he who omits to do them, gets each what is proportionate to his acts and omissions. Whether one lives in the upper regions or in the nether, one always acquires those places to which one becomes entitled by his deeds.

data.v: प्राप्स्यसे त्वन्नपानानि यानि दास्यसि कानिचित् । मेधाव्यसि कुले जातः श्रुतवाननृशंसवान् ॥
data.md: As regards yourself you will certainly obtain whatever food and drink you may covet, for you are gifted with intelligence, good birth, Vedic learning and mercy.

data.v: कौमारदारव्रतवान्मैत्रेय निरतो भव । एतद्गृहाण प्रथमं प्रशस्तं गृहमेधिनाम् ॥
data.md: You are possessed of youth, O Maitreya! you are observant of vows. Be devoted to virtuc. Do you take instructions from me about thosc duties which you should first follow, the duties, viz., of householders.

data.v: यो भर्ता वासितातुष्टो भर्तुस्तुष्टा च वासिता । यस्मिन्नेवं कुले सर्वं कल्याणं तत्र वर्तते ॥
data.md: That house in which the husband is pleased with his married wife, and the wife pleased with her husband, all auspicious results ensue.

data.v: अद्भिर्गात्रान्मलमिव तमोऽग्निप्रभया यथा । दानेन तपसा चैव सर्वपापमपोह्यते ॥
data.md: As filth is washed away from the body with water, as darkness is removed by the light of fire, so is sin washed off by gifts and penances.

data.v: स्वस्ति प्राप्नुहि मैत्रेय गृहान्साधु व्रजाम्यहम् । एतन्मनसि कर्तव्यं श्रेय एवं भविष्यति ॥
