data.md: Bless you, O Maitreya, may you have palaces! I depart hence in peace. Do you remember what I have said. You shall then be able to reap many advantages!

data.v: तं प्रणम्याथ मैत्रेयः कृत्वा चाभिप्रदक्षिणम् । स्वस्ति प्राप्नोतु भगवानित्युवाच कृताञ्जलिः ॥
data.md: Maitreya then walked round his illustrious guest and bowed his head to him, and joining his hands in respect said, Let blessing be to you also, O Holy one!

data.v: सत्स्त्रीणां समुदाचारं सर्वधर्मभृतां वर । श्रोतुमिच्छाम्यहं त्वत्तस्तं मे ब्रूहि पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O you who know all duties, I wish to hcar in full, what forms the excellent conduct of good and chaste women. Do you, O grandfather, describe this to me.!

data.v: सर्वज्ञां सर्वधर्मज्ञां देवलोके मनस्विनीम् । कैकेयी सुमना नाम शाण्डिलीं पर्यपृच्छत ॥
केन वृत्तेन कल्याणि समाचारेण केन वा । विधूय सर्वपापानि देवलोकं त्वमागता ॥
हुताशनशिखेव त्वं ज्वलमाना स्वतेजसा । सुता ताराधिपस्येव प्रभया दिवमागता ॥
अरजांसि च वस्त्राणि धारयन्ती गतक्लमा । विमानस्था शुभे भासि सहस्रगुणमोजसा ॥
data.md: You put on dresses of pure white, and as quite cheerful and at your case. Scated on that celestial car, you shine, O auspicious dame, with energy multiplied a thousand fold.

data.v: न त्वमल्पेन तपसा दानेन नियमेन वा । इमं लोकमनुप्राप्ता तस्मात्तत्त्वं वदस्व मे ॥
data.md: You have not, I understand, attained to this region of happiness by great penances and gifts and vows. Do you tell me the truth!

data.v: इति पृष्टा सुमनया मधुरं चारुहासिनी । शाण्डिली निभृतं वाक्यं सुमनामिदमब्रवीत् ॥
नाहं काषायवसना नापि वल्कलधारिणी । न च मुण्डा न जटिला भूत्वा देवत्वमागता ॥
अहितानि च वाक्यानि सर्वाणि परुषाणि च । अप्रमत्ता च भर्तारं कदाचिन्नाहमब्रुवम् ॥
देवतानां पितॄणां च ब्राह्मणानां च पूजने । अप्रमत्ता सदायुक्ता श्वश्रूश्वशुरवर्तिनी ॥
data.md: I was always devoted to the adoration of the celestials the departed Manes, and the Brahmanas. Always careful I waited upon and served my motherin law and father-in-law.

data.v: पैशुन्ये न प्रवर्तामि न ममैतन्मनोगतम् । अद्वारे न च तिष्ठामि चिरं न कथयामि च ॥
data.md: This was my resolution that I should never act deceitfully. I never used of stay at the door of our house nor did I speak long with anybody.

data.v: असद्वा हसितं किंचिदहितं वापि कर्मणा । रहस्यमरहस्यं वा न प्रवर्तामि सर्वथा ॥
data.md: I never did any evil deed. I never laughed aloud; I never did any injury; I never gave out any secret. Thus did I myself act.

data.v: कार्यार्थे निर्गतं चापि भर्तारं गृहमागतम् । आसनेनोपसंयोज्य पूजयामि समाहिता ॥
data.md: When my husband, having left home upon any business, used to return, I always served him by giving him a seat, and adored him with respect.

data.v: यद्यच्च नाभिजानाति यद्भोज्यं नाभिनन्दति । भक्ष्यं वाप्यथ वा लेह्यं तत्सर्वं वर्जयाम्यहम् ॥
data.md: I never ate food of any kind which was unknown to my husband and with which my husband was not pleased.

data.v: कुटुम्बार्थे समानीतं यत्किंचित्कार्यमेव तु । प्रातरुत्थाय तत्सर्वं कारयामि करोमि च ॥
data.md: Rising early in the morning I did and caused to be done whatever was brought about and required to be done for the sake of relatives and kinsmen.

data.v: प्रवासं यदि मे भर्ता याति कार्येण केनचित् । मङ्गलैर्बहुभिर्युक्ता भवामि नियता सदा ॥
data.md: When my husband leaves home for going to a distant place on any errand, I remained at home engaged in various kinds of auspicious deeds for blessing his enterprise.

data.v: अञ्जनं रोचनां चैव स्नानं माल्यानुलेपनम् । प्रसाधनं च निष्क्रान्ते नाभिनन्दामि भर्तरि ॥
data.md: During the absence of my husband I never use collyrium or ornaments; I never wash myself properly or use garlands and unguents or adorn my feet with lacdye or body with ornaments.

data.v: नोत्थापयामि भर्तारं सुखसुप्तमहं सदा । आतुरेष्वपि कार्येषु तेन तुष्यति मे मनः ॥
data.md: When my husband sleeps in peace I never awake him even if important business wanted his attention. I was happy to sit by him lying asleep.

data.v: नायासयामि भर्तारं कुटुम्बार्थे च सर्वदा । गुप्तगुह्या सदा चास्मि सुसंमृष्टनिवेशना ॥
data.md: I never urged my husband to work hard for acquiring riches to support his family and relatives. I always kept secrets without giving them out to others. I used to always keep our premises clean.

data.v: इमं धर्मपथं नारी पालयन्ती समाहिता । अरुन्धतीव नारीणां स्वर्गलोके महीयते ॥
data.md: That woman who with rapt attention, follows her duty, receives profuse honors in the celestial region like a second Arundhati.

data.v: एतदाख्याय सा देवी सुमनायै तपस्विनी । पतिधर्मं महाभागा जगामादर्शनं तदा ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The illustrious and highly blessed Shandili, of pious conduct having said these words to Sumana on the subject of woman's duties towards her husband, disappeared there and then.

data.v: यश्चेदं पाण्डवाख्यानं पठेत्पर्वणि पर्वणि । स देवलोकं संप्राप्य नन्दने सुसुखं वसेत् ॥
data.md: That man, O son of Pandu, who reads this discourse at every full moon and new moon, succeeds in acquiring the celestial region and enjoying great happiness in the bowers of Nandana.

data.v: साम्ना वापि प्रदाने वा ज्यायः किं भवतो मतम् । प्रब्रूहि भरतश्रेष्ठ यदत्र व्यतिरिच्यते ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said In which is superior efficacy, conciliation or Gifts? Tell me, O chief of Bharata's race, which of these two is superior in efficacy.

data.v: साम्ना प्रसाद्यते कश्चिद्दानेन च तथापरः । पुरुषः प्रकृतिं ज्ञात्वा तयोरेकतरं भजेत् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Some become pleased by Conciliation, while others are pleased by Gifts. Every man, according to his own nature, likes the one or the other.

data.v: गुणांस्तु शृणु मे राजन्सान्त्वस्य भरतर्षभ । दारुणान्यपि भूतानि सान्त्वेनाराधयेद्यथा ॥
data.md: Listen to me, O king, as I explain to you the merits of Conciliation, O chief of Bharata's race so that the most furious creatures may be cooled down by it.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । गृहीत्वा रक्षसा मुक्तो द्विजातिः कानने यथा ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited the ancient narrative of how a Brahmana who had been seized in the forest by a Rakshasa, was freed.

data.v: कश्चित्तु बुद्धिसंपन्नो ब्राह्मणो विजने वने । गृहीतः कृच्छ्रमापन्नो रक्षसा भक्षयिष्यता ॥
data.md: A certain Brahmana, gifted with eloquence and intelligence fell into distress, for he was seized in a lone forest by a Rakshasa who wished to feed on him.

data.v: स बुद्धिश्रुतसंपन्नस्तं दृष्ट्वातीव भीषणम् । सामैवास्मिन्प्रयुयुजे न मुमोह न विव्यथे ॥
data.md: The Brahmana gifted as he was with understanding and learning was not at all moved. Without allowing himself to be stupefied at the sight of that terrible cannibal, he resolved to apply Conciliation and see its effect on the Rakshasa.

data.v: रक्षस्तु वाचा संपूज्य प्रश्नं पप्रच्छ तं द्विजम् । मोक्ष्यसे ब्रूहि मे प्रश्नं केनास्मि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Respectfully saluting the Brahmana with words, the Rakshasa put to him this question: You shall escape, but tell me why I am so pale and lean.

data.v: मुहूर्तमथ संचिन्त्य ब्राह्मणस्तस्य रक्षसः । आभिर्गाथाभिरव्यग्रः प्रश्नं प्रतिजगाद ह ॥
data.md: Reflecting for a short time, the Brahmana accepted the question of the Rakshasa and replied in the following well spoken words.

data.v: विदेशस्थो विलोकस्थो विना नूनं सुहृज्जनैः । विषयानतुलान्भुङ्क्षे तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: The Brahman. said Living in a place distant from your house, moving in a sphere that is not your own, and deprived of the company of your friends and kinsmen, you are enjoying vast riches. It is, therefore, that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: नूनं मित्राणि ते रक्षः साधूपचरितान्यपि । स्वदोषादपरज्यन्ते तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Indeed, O Rakshasa, your friends thought welltreated by you are still not welldisposed towards you on account of their own vicious nature. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: धनैश्वर्याधिकाः स्तब्धास्त्वद्गुणैः परमावराः । अवजानन्ति नूनं त्वां तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: You are gifted with merit and wisdom and a wellcontrolled soul. Yet it is your lot to see others who have merit and wisdom honoured in preference to yourself. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: गुणवान्विगुणानन्यान्नूनं पश्यसि सत्कृतान् । प्राज्ञोऽप्राज्ञान्विनीतात्मा तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Persons having riches much greater than yours but inferior to you in merit, are indeed, disregarding you. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: अवृत्त्या क्लिश्यमानोऽपि वृत्त्युपायान्विगर्हयन् । माहात्म्याद्व्यथसे नूनं तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Though distressed for want of the means of support yet you are actuated by the greatness of your mind to disregard such means as are open to you for getting your sustenance. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: संपीड्यात्मानमार्यत्वात्त्वया कश्चिदुपस्कृतः । जितं त्वां मन्यते साधो तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: On account of your virtuous nature you had deprived yourself for doing good to another. This person, O righteous Rakshasa, considers you deceived and defeated. It is for this that you are so pale and lean,

data.v: क्लिश्यमानान्विमार्गेषु कामक्रोधावृतात्मनः । मन्ये नु ध्यायसि जनांस्तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: I think you are grieving for those persons who with souls possessed by lust and anger, are suffering inisery in this world. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: प्राज्ञैः संभावितो नूनं नप्राज्ञैरुपसंहितः । ह्रीमानमर्षी दुर्वृत्तैस्तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Though wise, you are ridiculed by others who are entirely destitute of it. Persons of wicked conduct are vilifying you. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: नूनं मित्रमुखः शत्रुः कश्चिदार्यवदाचरन् । वञ्चयित्वा गतस्त्वां वै तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Indeed some enemy of yours, with a friendly tongue, coming to you behaved at first like a pious man and then has left you, beguiling you like a knave. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: प्रकाशार्थगतिर्नूनं रहस्यकुशलः कृती । तज्ज्ञैर्न पूज्यसे नूनं तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: You are well conversant with the course of world's affairs. You are well skilled in all mysteries. You are gifted with power. Those who know you to be such do not yet respect and praise you. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: असत्स्वभिनिविष्टेषु ब्रुवतो मुक्तसंशयम् । गुणास्ते न विराजन्ते तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Staying in the midst of bad men engaged together in some business, you had discoursed to them removing their doubts. Still they did not admit your superior merits. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: धनबुद्धिश्रुतैर्हीनः केवलं तेजसान्वितः । महत्प्रार्थयसे नूनं तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Indeed though destitute of riches and intelligence and Vedic learning you wish yet, with the help of your energy alonc, to accomplish something great. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: तपःप्रणिहितात्मानं मन्ये त्वारण्यकाङ्क्षिणम् । बन्धुवर्गो न गृह्णाति तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: It appears that although you are resolved to practise severe austerities by retiring into the forest, yet your kinsmen are not favourably disposed towards this project of yours. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: नूनमर्थवतां मध्ये तव वाक्यमनुत्तमम् । न भाति कालेऽभिहितं तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: The words spoken by you, even when excellent in the midst of rich men, are not regarded by them as wise or well timed. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: दृढपूर्वश्रुतं मूर्खं कुपितं हृदयप्रियम् । अनुनेतुं न शक्नोषि तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Some dear kinsman of yours, shorn of intelligence though repeatedly instructed in the scriptures has become angry. You have not been able to pacify him. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: नूनमासंजयित्वा ते कृत्ये कस्मिंश्चिदीप्सिते । कश्चिदर्थयतेऽत्यर्थं तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Indeed somebody, having first set you to the accomplishment of some object desirable to you, is now trying to deprive you of the fruit thereof. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: नूनं त्वा स्वगुणापेक्षं पूजयानं सुहृद्ध्रुवम् । मयार्थ इति जानाति तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Though possessed of excellent qualities and adored by all on that account, you are yet considered by your kinsmen as adored for their sakc and not for your own. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: अन्तर्गतमभिप्रायं न नूनं लज्जयेच्छसि । विवक्तुं प्राप्तिशैथिल्यात्तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Indeed, through shame you are unable to give out some purpose in your heart, moved also by the inevitable delay that will take place in its accomplishment. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: नानाबुद्धिरुचीँल्लोके मनुष्यान्नूनमिच्छसि । ग्रहीतुं स्वगुणैः सर्वांस्तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Indeed, you wish with the help of your intelligence, to control various persons with various kinds of understandings and inclinations. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: अविद्वान्भीरुरल्पार्थो विद्याविक्रमदानजम् । यशः प्रार्थयसे नूनं तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Shorn of learning without courage, and without much riches you seek such fame as is won by knowledge and prowess and gifts. Indeed, it is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: चिराभिलषितं किंचित्फलमप्राप्तमेव ते । कृतमन्यैरपहृतं तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: You have not been able to get something which you have long been seeking for. Or, what you try to do is sought to be undone by soinebody else. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: नूनमात्मकृतं दोषमपश्यन्किंचिदात्मनि । अकारणेऽभिशस्तोऽसि तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Indeed without being able to see any fault on your part, you have been cursed by somebody. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: सुहृदामप्रमत्तानामप्रमोक्ष्यार्थहानिजम् । दुःखमर्थगुणैर्हीनं तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Seeing virtuous persons living like householders, unrighteous persons living according to the forest mode, and liberated persons attached to domesticity and fixed abodes, you have become so pale and lean.

data.v: साधून्गृहस्थान्दृष्ट्वा च तथासाधून्वनेचरान् । मुक्तांश्चावसथे सक्तांस्तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Having no wealth and accomplishments you try in vain to remove the grief of your friends and the sorrows of sorrowing men. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: धर्म्यमर्थं च काले च देशे चाभिहितं वचः । न प्रतिष्ठति ते नूनं तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Indeed, your acts connected with Virtue. Profit, and Pleasure, as also the well-time words spoken by you do not produce fruit. It is for this that you are so pale and lean,

data.v: दत्तानकुशलैरर्थान्मनीषी संजिजीविषुः । प्राप्य वर्तयसे नूनं तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Though gifted with wisdom, yet desirous of living, you live with wealth obtained by you in gift from somebody of evil conduct. It is for this that you are pale and lean.

data.v: पापान्विवर्धतो दृष्ट्वा कल्याणांश्चावसीदतः । ध्रुवं मृगयसे योग्यं तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Seeing sinful persons multiplying on every side and virtue languishing, you are filled with grief. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: परस्परविरुद्धानां प्रियं नूनं चिकीर्षसि । सुहृदामविरोधेन तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Urged by them you seek to please all your friends even when they are quarrelling and opposing one another. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: श्रोत्रियांश्च विकर्मस्थान्प्राज्ञांश्चाप्यजितेन्द्रियान् । मन्येऽनुध्यायसि जनांस्तेनासि हरिणः कृशः ॥
data.md: Seeing persons gifted with Vedic learning engaged in improper deeds, and learned persons unable to keep their senses under control, you are filled with grief. It is for this that you are so pale and lean.

data.v: एवं संपूजितं रक्षो विप्रं तं प्रत्यपूजयत् । सखायमकरोच्चैनं संयोज्यार्थैर्मुमोच ह ॥
data.md: Thus praised the Rakshasa adored that learned Brahmana in return, and making him his friend and bestowing sufficient riches upon himn in gift, sent him away.

data.v: पितामह महाप्राज्ञ सर्वशास्त्रविशारद । आगमैर्बहुभिः स्फीतो भवान्नः प्रथितः कुले ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O grandfather, you are endued with great wisdom. Indeed, you are fully conversant with every branch of learning. In our great family you are the only individual who have mastered sciences.

data.v: त्वत्तो धर्मार्थसंयुक्तमायत्यां च सुखोदयम् । आश्चर्यभूतं लोकस्य श्रोतुमिच्छाम्यरिंदम ॥
data.md: I wish to hear from you discourses of Religion and Profit, which bring on happiness in the next world, and that are fraught with wonder to all creatures.

data.v: अयं च कालः संप्राप्तो दुर्लभज्ञातिबान्धवः । शास्ता च न हि नः कश्चित्त्वामृते भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: The time that has come is full of distress. The like of it does not generally come to kinsmen and friends. Indeed, except you, O foremost of men, we have now none else who can take the place of an instructor.

data.v: यदि तेऽहमनुग्राह्यो भ्रातृभिः सहितोऽनघ । वक्तुमर्हसि नः प्रश्नं यत्त्वां पृच्छामि पार्थिव ॥
data.md: If, O sinless one, I with my brothers deserve your labour, you should answer the questions I wish to ask you.

data.v: अयं नारायणः श्रीमान्सर्वपार्थिवसंमतः । भवन्तं बहुमानेन प्रश्रयेण च सेवते ॥
data.md: This one is Narayana who is gifted with every prosperity and is honoured by all the kings. Even he waits upon you, showing you every indulgence and honoring you greatly.

data.v: अस्य चैव समक्षं त्वं पार्थिवानां च सर्वशः । भ्रातॄणां च प्रियार्थं मे स्नेहाद्भाषितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: You should describe it to me, through affection, for my benefit as also for that of my brothers, in the presence of Vasudeva himself and of all these kings.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा स्नेहादागतसंभ्रमः । भीष्मो भागीरथीपुत्र इदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Hearing these words of king Yudhishthira, Bhishma, the son of the river Ganges, filled with joy on account of his affection for the monarch and his brothers, said what follows.

data.v: हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि कथामतिमनोरमाम् । अस्य विष्णोः पुरा राजन्प्रभावोऽयं मया श्रुतः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said I shall certainly recite to you discourses that are charming on the subject, o king, of the power of this Vishnu as displayed in days of yore and as I have heard (from my preceptors).

data.v: यश्च गोवृषभाङ्कस्य प्रभावस्तं च मे शृणु । रुद्राण्याः संशयो यश्च दंपत्योस्तं च मे शृणु ॥
data.md: Listen to me also as I describe the power of that great god who has a bull for his emblem. Listen to me as I describe also the doubt that filled the mind of the wife of Rudra and that of Rudra himself.

data.v: व्रतं चचार धर्मात्मा कृष्णो द्वादशवार्षिकम् । दीक्षितं चागतौ द्रष्टुमुभौ नारदपर्वतौ ॥
data.md: Once on a time the virtuous Krishna observed a vow extending for two and ten years. For seeing him who had performed the rite of initiation for the observance of his great vow, there came to that place. Narada and Parvata, and Krishna Dvaipayana and Dhaumya that foremost of silent reciters, Devala, Kashyapa, and Hastikashyapa.

data.v: कृष्णद्वैपायनश्चैव धौम्यश्च जपतां वरः । देवलः काश्यपश्चैव हस्तिकाश्यप एव च ॥
data.md: Once on a time the virtuous Krishna observed a vow extending for two and ten years. For seeing him who had performed the rite of initiation for the observance of his great vow, there came to that place. Narada and Parvata, and Krishna Dvaipayana and Dhaumya that foremost of silent reciters, Devala, Kashyapa, and Hastikashyapa.

data.v: अपरे ऋषयः सन्तो दीक्षादमसमन्विताः । शिष्यैरनुगताः सर्वे देवकल्पैस्तपोधनैः ॥
data.md: Other Rishis also, gifted with initiation and self-restraint, followed by their disciples and accompanied by many Siddhas and many ascetics of great merit, came there.

data.v: तेषामतिथिसत्कारमर्चनीयं कुलोचितम् । देवकीतनयः प्रीतो देवकल्पमकल्पयत् ॥
data.md: The son of Devaki offered them such laudable honors of hospitality as are offered to the gods alone.

data.v: हरितेषु सुवर्णेषु बर्हिष्केषु नवेषु च । उपोपविविशुः प्रीता विष्टरेषु महर्षयः ॥
data.md: Those great Rishis sat themselves down upon seats some of which were green and some were goldhued and some were made of the plumes of the peacock and some were perfectly new and fresh.

data.v: कथाश्चक्रुस्ततस्ते तु मधुरा धर्मसंहिताः । राजर्षीणां सुराणां च ये वसन्ति तपोधनाः ॥
data.md: Thus seated, they began to converse sweetly with one another on subjects of Religion and Duty as also with many royal sages and celestials.

data.v: ततो नारायणं तेजो व्रतचर्येन्धनोत्थितम् । वक्त्रान्निःसृत्य कृष्णस्य वह्निरद्भुतकर्मणः ॥
data.md: At that time the energy, in the form of fire, of Narayana, rising from the fuel that consisted of the rigid observance of his vow, came out of the mouth of Krishna of wonderful deeds.

data.v: सोऽग्निर्ददाह तं शैलं सद्रुमं सलताक्षुपम् । सपक्षिमृगसंघातं सश्वापदसरीसृपम् ॥
data.md: That fire began to consume those mountains with their trees and creepers and little plants, as also with their birds and deer and beasts of prey and reptiles.

data.v: मृगैश्च विविधाकारैर्हाहाभूतमचेतनम् । शिखरं तस्य शैलस्य मथितं दीप्तदर्शनम् ॥
data.md: Soon the summit of that mountain presented a distressing and pitiful sight. Inhabited by animals of various kinds which began to utter cries of woe and pain, the summit soon became bereft of every living creature. more

data.v: स तु वह्निर्महाज्वालो दग्ध्वा सर्वमशेषतः । विष्णोः समीपमागम्य पादौ शिष्यवदस्पृशत् ॥
data.md: That fire of powerful flames, having consumed everything without living a residue, at last returned to Vishnu and touched his feet like a docile disciple.

data.v: ततो विष्णुर्वनं दृष्ट्वा निर्दग्धमरिकर्शनः । सौम्यैर्दृष्टिनिपातैस्तत्पुनः प्रकृतिमानयत् ॥
data.md: That crusher of enemies, viz., Krishna, seeing that mountain burnt, cast a benignant look upon it and thereby brought it back to its former condition.

data.v: तथैव स गिरिर्भूयः प्रपुष्पितलताद्रुमः । सपक्षिगणसंघुष्टः सश्वापदसरीसृपः ॥
data.md: That mountain thereupon once becaine bedecked with flowering trees and creepers, and once more echoed with the notes and cries of birds and deer and animals of prey and reptiles.

data.v: तदद्भुतमचिन्त्यं च दृष्ट्वा मुनिगणस्तदा । विस्मितो हृष्टलोमा च बभूवास्राविलेक्षणः ॥
data.md: Seeing that wonderful and inconceivable spectacle, al the ascetics became filled with wonder. Their hair stood erect and their vision was disturbed with tears.

data.v: ततो नारायणो दृष्ट्वा तानृषीन्विस्मयान्वितान् । प्रश्रितं मधुरं स्निग्धं पप्रच्छ वदतां वरः ॥
data.md: Seeing those Rishis thus stricken with wonder, that foremost of speakers. Narayana, addressed them in these sweet and refreshing words:

data.v: किमस्य ऋषिपूगस्य त्यक्तसङ्गस्य नित्यशः । निर्ममस्यागमवतो विस्मयः समुपागतः ॥
data.md: Why, indeed, has wonder filled the hearts of this collection of Rishis, these ascetics who are always free from attachment of every kind, who are divested of the idea of mineness, and who are fully conversant with every sacred science.

data.v: एतं मे संशयं सर्वं याथातथ्यमनिन्दिताः । ऋषयो वक्तुमर्हन्ति निश्चितार्थं तपोधनाः ॥
data.md: These Rishis having penances for wealth and freed from every stain, should explain to me truly this doubt which has originated in my mind.

data.v: भवान्विसृजते लोकान्भवान्संहरते पुनः । भवाञ्शीतं भवानुष्णं भवानेव प्रवर्षति ॥
data.md: The Rishis said You are the creator of all the worlds, and the destroyer of them again. You are Winter, you are Summer, and you are the season of Rains.

data.v: पृथिव्यां यानि भूतानि स्थावराणि चराणि च । तेषां पिता त्वं माता च प्रभुः प्रभव एव च ॥
data.md: Of all the creatures, mobile and immobile, that exist on Earth, you are the father, you are the mother, you are the master, and you are the origin.

data.v: एतन्नो विस्मयकरं प्रशंस मधुसूदन । त्वमेवार्हसि कल्याण वक्तुं वह्नेर्विनिर्गमम् ॥
data.md: Even this, O destroyer of Madhu, is a matter of wonder and doubt with us. O source of all auspiciousness, you should explain to us that doubt, viz., the issue of fire from your mouth.

data.v: ततो विगतसंत्रासा वयमप्यरिकर्शन । यच्छ्रुतं यच्च दृष्टं नस्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामहे हरे ॥
data.md: Our fears being removed, we shall then, O Hari, recite to you what we have heard and seen.

data.v: एतत्तद्वैष्णवं तेजो मम वक्त्राद्विनिःसृतम् । कृष्णवर्त्मा युगान्ताभो येनायं मथितो गिरिः ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said The fire that came out from my mouth and that resembles the all destroying Yuga Fire in splendour, and by which this mountain has been crushed and scorched is nothing else than the power of Vishnu.

data.v: ऋषयश्चार्तिमापन्ना जितक्रोधा जितेन्द्रियाः । भवन्तो व्यथिताश्चासन्देवकल्पास्तपोधनाः ॥
data.md: Ye Rishis, ye are persons who have governed anger, who have brought your senses under complete control, who are gifted with wealth of penances, and who are very gods in power. Yet you have allowed yourselves to be agitated and distressed.

data.v: व्रतचर्यापरीतस्य तपस्विव्रतसेवया । मम वह्निः समुद्भूतो न वै व्यथितुमर्हथ ॥
data.md: I am now engaged wholly with the observances about a rigid: vow. Indeed, on account of my observing the vows of an ascetic, a fire came out from my mouth. You should not allow yourselves to be agitated therefor.

data.v: व्रतं चर्तुमिहायातस्त्वहं गिरिमिमं शुभम् । पुत्रं चात्मसमं वीर्ये तपसा स्रष्टुमागतः ॥
data.md: It is for observing a rigid vow that I came to this charming and sacred mountain. The object that has brought me here is to acquire, by the help of penances, a son that would be my equal in power.

data.v: ततो ममात्मा यो देहे सोऽग्निर्भूत्वा विनिःसृतः । गतश्च वरदं द्रष्टुं सर्वलोकपितामहम् ॥
data.md: On account of iny penances, the Soul existing in my body became changed into fire and came out of my mouth. That fire had gone to see the boongiving Grandfather all the universe.

data.v: तेन चात्मानुशिष्टो मे पुत्रत्वे मुनिसत्तमाः । तेजसोऽर्धेन पुत्रस्ते भवितेति वृषध्वजः ॥
data.md: The Grandfather, ye foremost of ascetics, told my soul that the energy of the great god having the bull for his embalmer would take birth as my son.

data.v: सोऽयं वह्निरुपागम्य पादमूले ममान्तिकम् । शिष्यवत्परिचर्याथ शान्तः प्रकृतिमागतः ॥
data.md: That fire returning from its mission, has come back to me and approached my feet like a disciple desirous of attending to me dutifully. Indeed, renouncing its fury it has come back to its own proper nature.

data.v: एतदस्य रहस्यं वः पद्मनाभस्य धीमतः । मया प्रेम्णा समाख्यातं न भीः कार्या तपोधनाः ॥
data.md: I have thus told you, in brief, a mystery belonging to Him who has the lotus for the origin and who is gifted with great intelligence. Ye Rishis having penances for wealth, you should not yield to fear.

data.v: सर्वत्र गतिरव्यग्रा भवतां दीर्घदर्शनाः । तपस्विव्रतसंदीप्ता ज्ञानविज्ञानशोभिताः ॥
data.md: You are gifted with farreaching vision. You can proceed to every place without any obstacle. Radiant with vows observed by ascetics, you are adorned with knowledge and science.

data.v: यच्छ्रुतं यच्च वो दृष्टं दिवि वा यदि वा भुवि । आश्चर्यं परमं किंचित्तद्भवन्तो ब्रुवन्तु मे ॥
data.md: I now ask you to tell me something that is highly wonderful which you have heard of or seen on Earth or in the celestial region.

data.v: तस्यामृतनिकाशस्य वाङ्मधोरस्ति मे स्पृहा । भवद्भिः कथितस्येह तपोवननिवासिभिः ॥
data.md: I am anxious to taste the honey of words which will drop from your lips and which, I am sure, will be as sweet as a jet of nectar itself.

data.v: यद्यप्यहमदृष्टं वा दिव्यमद्भुतदर्शनम् । दिवि वा भुवि वा किंचित्पश्याम्यमलदर्शनाः ॥
data.md: If I see anything on Earth or in the celestial region, which is highly delightful and wonderful but which is unknown to all of you, O god like Rishis, that is on account of my own supreme Nectar which is incapable of being obstructed by anything. Anything wonderful which I know by nature or by my own inspiration, ceases to appear wonderful to me.

data.v: प्रकृतिः सा मम परा न क्वचित्प्रतिहन्यते । न चात्मगतमैश्वर्यमाश्चर्यं प्रतिभाति मे ॥
data.md: If I see anything on Earth or in the celestial region, which is highly delightful and wonderful but which is unknown to all of you, O god like Rishis, that is on account of my own supreme Nectar which is incapable of being obstructed by anything. Anything wonderful which I know by nature or by my own inspiration, ceases to appear wonderful to me.

data.v: श्रद्धेयः कथितो ह्यर्थः सज्जनश्रवणं गतः । चिरं तिष्ठति मेदिन्यां शैले लेख्यमिवार्पितम् ॥
data.md: Anything, however, that is recited by pious persons and that is heard from those who are good, deserves to be accepted with respect and faith. Such discourses exist on Earth for a long time and will last like characters engraved on rocks.

data.v: तदहं सज्जनमुखान्निःसृतं तत्समागमे । कथयिष्याम्यहरहर्बुद्धिदीपकरं नृणाम् ॥
data.md: I wish, therefore, to hear at this meeting of ourselves, something dropping from the lips of persons who are good and who cannot fail to be productive of good to men.

data.v: ततो मुनिगणाः सर्वे प्रश्रिताः कृष्णसंनिधौ । नेत्रैः पद्मदलप्रख्यैरपश्यन्त जनार्दनम् ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of Krishna, all those ascetics became filled with wonder. They began to look at Janardana with those eyes of theirs that were as beautiful and large as the petals of the lotus.

data.v: वर्धयन्तस्तथैवान्ये पूजयन्तस्तथापरे । वाग्भिरृग्भूषितार्थाभिः स्तुवन्तो मधुसूदनम् ॥
data.md: Some of them began to glorify him and some began to adore him with respect. Indeed, all of them then sang the praises of the destroyer of Madhu with words whose meanings were adorned with the eternal Richs.

data.v: ततो मुनिगणाः सर्वे नारदं देवदर्शनम् । तदा नियोजयामासुर्वचने वाक्यकोविदम् ॥
data.md: all those ascetics then appointed Narada, that foremost of all persons conversant with words, to satisfy the request of Vasudeva.

data.v: यदाश्चर्यमचिन्त्यं च गिरौ हिमवति प्रभो । अनुभूतं मुनिगणैस्तीर्थयात्रापरायणैः ॥

data.md: The great energy of that eye crushed and consumed this mountain. For pleasing you, however, O goddess, I once more restored Himavat to his pristine condition for making good the injury.

data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed by the daughter of the king of mountains, the illustrious holder of Pinaka, the powerful Mahadeva became highly pleased with her.

data.md: The great god then addressed her, saying. O blessed lady, hear as I explain with the reasons thereof, why my forms are so.

data.md: One day, that lady of beautiful face, peerless in the universe for beauty of form, came to me, O goddess, for circumambulating me but, in sooth, moved by the desire of tempting me.

data.md: In whatever direction that lady of beautiful teeth turned, a new face to mine instantly appeared. All these faces of mine became handsome to look at.

data.v: तां दिदृक्षुरहं योगाच्चतुर्मूर्तित्वमागतः । चतुर्मुखश्च संवृत्तो दर्शयन्योगमात्मनः ॥
data.md: Thus, on account of the desire of seeing her, I became fourfaced, through Yogapower. Thus I showed my high Yogapower in becoming fourfaced.

data.v: पूर्वेण वदनेनाहमिन्द्रत्वमनुशास्मि ह । उत्तरेण त्वया सार्धं रमाम्यहमनिन्दिते ॥
data.md: With that face of mine which is turned towards the east, I exercise the sovereignty of the universe. With that face of mine which is turned towards the north, I sport with you, O you of faultless features.

data.v: पश्चिमं मे मुखं सौम्यं सर्वप्राणिसुखावहम् । दक्षिणं भीमसंकाशं रौद्रं संहरति प्रजाः ॥
data.md: That face of mine which is turned towards the west is handsome and auspicious. With it I ordain the happiness of all creatures. That face cf mine which is turned towards the south is dreadful. With it I destroy all creatures.

data.v: जटिलो ब्रह्मचारी च लोकानां हितकाम्यया । देवकार्यार्थसिद्ध्यर्थं पिनाकं मे करे स्थितम् ॥
data.md: I live as a Brahmacharin with matted locks on iny head, for doing good in all creatures. The bow Pinaka is always in my hand for accomplishing the work of the celestials.

data.v: इन्द्रेण च पुरा वज्रं क्षिप्तं श्रीकाङ्क्षिणा मम । दग्ध्वा कण्ठं तु तद्यातं तेन श्रीकण्ठता मम ॥
data.md: Formerly, Indra, desirous of acquiring my prosperity, had hurled his thunderbolt at me. With that weapon my throat was scorched. Therefore I have become bluethroated.

data.v: वाहनेषु प्रभूतेषु श्रीमत्स्वन्येषु सत्सु ते । कथं गोवृषभो देव वाहनत्वमुपागतः ॥
data.md: Uma said When, O foremost of all creatures, there are so many excellent beautiful cars, why have you selected a bull for your vehicle?

data.v: सुरभीं ससृजे ब्रह्मामृतधेनुं पयोमुचम् । सा सृष्टा बहुधा जाता क्षरमाणा पयोऽमृतम् ॥
data.md: Maheshvara said Formerly, the Grandfather Brahman created the celestial cow Surabhi giving profuse milk After her creation there sprang from her a large number of king all of which gave sufficient quantities of milk sweet as nectar.

data.v: तस्या वत्समुखोत्सृष्टः फेनो मद्गात्रमागतः । ततो दग्धा मया गावो नानावर्णत्वमागताः ॥
data.md: Once on a time a quantity of froth fell from the mouth of one of her calves on my body. I was enraged at this and my anger scorched all the kine which there upon became diversified in colour.

data.v: ततोऽहं लोकगुरुणा शमं नीतोऽर्थवेदिना । वृषं चेमं ध्वजार्थं मे ददौ वाहनमेव च ॥
data.md: I was then pacified by the Lord of all the worlds, viz., Brahman, conversant this bull both as a car for bearing me and as device on my banner.

data.v: निवासा बहुरूपास्ते विश्वरूपगुणान्विताः । तांश्च संत्यज्य भगवञ्श्मशाने रमसे कथम् ॥
data.md: Uma said You have many houses, in the celestial region, of various forms and possessed of every comfort and luxury. Why, O Holy One, do you live in the crematorium, abandoning all those delightful palaces.

data.v: केशास्थिकलिले भीमे कपालघटसंकुले । गृध्रगोमायुकलिले चिताग्निशतसंकुले ॥
data.md: The crematorium is full of the hair and bones (of the dead), abounds with vultures and jackals, and is covered with hundreds of funeral pyres.

data.v: अशुचौ मांसकलिले वसाशोणितकर्दमे । विनिकीर्णामिषचये शिवानादविनादिते ॥
data.md: Full of carrion and muddy with fat and blood, with entrails and bones scattered all over it, and always echoing with the howls of jackals, it is certainly an impure place.

data.v: मेध्यान्वेषी महीं कृत्स्नां विचरामि निशास्वहम् । न च मेध्यतरं किंचिच्छ्मशानादिह विद्यते ॥
data.md: Maheshvara said I always travel over the whole Earth in search after a sacred spot. I do not, however, see any spot that is more sacred than the crematorium.

data.v: तेन मे सर्ववासानां श्मशाने रमते मनः । न्यग्रोधशाखासंछन्ने निर्भुक्तस्रग्विभूषिते ॥
data.md: Therefore, of all houses, the crematorium appears to me to be the best, shaded as it generally is by branches of the banian and adorned with torn garlands of flowers.

data.v: तत्र चैव रमन्ते मे भूतसंघाः शुभानने । न च भूतगणैर्देवि विनाहं वस्तुमुत्सहे ॥
data.md: O you of sweet smiles, the multitudes of goblins that are my companions love to live in such spots. I do not like, O goddess, to live anywhere, without those goblins by my side.

data.v: एष वासो हि मे मेध्यः स्वर्गीयश्च मतो हि मे । पुण्यः परमकश्चैव मेध्यकामैरुपास्यते ॥
data.md: Therefore, the crematorium is a sacred house to me. Indeed, O auspicious lady, it appears to me to be very Heaven. Highly sacred and endued with great merit, the crematorium is much praised by persons desirous of having holy abodes.

data.v: भगवन्सर्वभूतेश सर्वधर्मभृतां वर । पिनाकपाणे वरद संशयो मे महानयम् ॥
data.md: Uma said O Holy One, O lord of all creatures, O foremost of all observers of duties and religious rites, I have a great doubt, O holder of Pinaka, O giver of boons.

data.v: अयं मुनिगणः सर्वस्तपस्तप इति प्रभो । तपोन्वेषकरो लोके भ्रमते विविधाकृतिः ॥
data.md: These ascetics, O powerful lords, have practised various kinds of austerities. In the world are seen ascetics wandering everywhere under various forms and clad in various kinds of dress.

data.v: अस्य चैवर्षिसंघस्य मम च प्रियकाम्यया । एतं ममेह संदेहं वक्तुमर्हस्यरिंदम ॥
data.md: For benefiting this large number of Rishis, as also myself, do you kindly remove, O chaister of all enemies, this doubt of mine.

data.v: धर्मः किंलक्षणः प्रोक्तः कथं वाचरितुं नरैः । शक्यो धर्ममविन्दद्भिर्धर्मज्ञ वद मे प्रभो ॥
data.md: What are the characteristics of Religion or Duty? How, indeed, do men unacquainted with the details of Religion or Duty succeed in observing them. O powerful lord, O you who are conversant with Religion, do you tell me this.

data.v: ततो मुनिगणः सर्वस्तां देवीं प्रत्यपूजयत् । वाग्भिरृग्भूषितार्थाभिः स्तवैश्चार्थविदां वर ॥
data.md: Narada said When the daughter of Himavat, put this question, the assemblage of Rishis there present, adored the goddess with words adorned with Richs and with hymns fraught with deep meaning.

data.v: अहिंसा सत्यवचनं सर्वभूतानुकम्पनम् । शमो दानं यथाशक्ति गार्हस्थ्यो धर्म उत्तमः ॥
data.md: Maheshvara said Abstention from injury, truthfulness of speech, mercy towards all beings, tranquillity of soul, and the making of gifts to the best of one's power, form the foremost duties of the householder.

data.v: परदारेष्वसंकल्पो न्यासस्त्रीपरिरक्षणम् । अदत्तादानविरमो मधुमांसस्य वर्जनम् ॥
data.md: Abstention from sexual union with the wife of other men, protection of the riches and the woman committed to his care, reluctance to appropriate what is not given to one, and avoidance of honey and meat, these are the five chief duties. Indeed, Religion or Duty had many branches all of which yield happy results. These are the duties which those embodied creatures who consider duty as superior, should observe and practise. These are the sources of merit.

data.v: एष पञ्चविधो धर्मो बहुशाखः सुखोदयः । देहिभिर्धर्मपरमैः कर्तव्यो धर्मसंचयः ॥
भगवन्संशयं पृष्टस्तं मे व्याख्यातुमर्हसि । चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य यो धर्मः स्वे स्वे वर्णे गुणावहः ॥
data.md: Uma said O Holy One, I wish to ask you another question about with I entertain great doubts. You should answer it and remove my doubts. What are the meritorious duties of the four castes.

data.v: ब्राह्मणे कीदृशो धर्मः क्षत्रिये कीदृशो भवेत् । वैश्ये किंलक्षणो धर्मः शूद्रे किंलक्षणो भवेत् ॥
data.md: What are the duties of the Brahmana? What of the Kshatriya? What are the duties of the Vaishya? And what are the duties of the Shudra.

data.v: न्यायतस्ते महाभागे संशयः समुदीरितः । भूमिदेवा महाभागाः सदा लोके द्विजातयः ॥
data.md: Maheshvara said O highly blessed lady, the question you have put, is a very proper one. Those persons who belong to the twice bom order, are considered as highly blessed, and are, indeed, gods on earth.

data.v: उपवासः सदा धर्मो ब्राह्मणस्य न संशयः । स हि धर्मार्थमुत्पन्नो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥
data.md: Forsooth, the observance of fasts, is always the duty of the Brahmana. When the Brahmana succeeds in properly observing all his duties, he becomes at one with Brahma.

data.v: तस्य धर्मक्रिया देवि व्रतचर्या च न्यायतः । तथोपनयनं चैव द्विजायैवोपपद्यते ॥
data.md: The proper observance of the duties of Brahmacharya, O goddess, are his ritual. The observar ce of vows and the investiture with the sacred thread form his other duties. It is by these that he becomes truly twice born.

data.v: गुरुदैवतपूजार्थं स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनात्मकः । देहिभिर्धर्मपरमैश्चर्तव्यो धर्मसंभवः ॥
data.md: He becomes a Brahinana for adoring his preceptors and other elders as also the celestials. Indeed, that religion which has for its soul the study of the Vedas, is the source of all virtue. Even that is the religion which those embodied creatures who are given to virtue and duty, should observe and practise.

data.v: भगवन्संशयो मेऽत्र तं मे व्याख्यातुमर्हसि । चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य धर्मं हि नैपुण्येन प्रकीर्तय ॥
data.md: Uma said O Holy One, my doubts have not been removed. You should explain in detail what the duties are of the four respective castes of men.

data.v: रहस्यश्रवणं धर्मो वेदव्रतनिषेवणम् । व्रतचर्यापरो धर्मो गुरुपादप्रसादनम् ॥
भैक्षचर्यापरो धर्मो धर्मो नित्योपवासिता । नित्यस्वाध्यायिता धर्मो ब्रह्मचर्याश्रमस्तथा ॥
गुरुणा त्वभ्यनुज्ञातः समावर्तेत वै द्विजः । विन्देतानन्तरं भार्यामनुरूपां यथाविधि ॥
data.md: After the student life is over, the Brahmana, at the behest of his preceptor, should leave his preceptor's abode for returning to his fathers' house. Upon his return he should duly marry a proper wife.

data.v: शूद्रान्नवर्जनं धर्मस्तथा सत्पथसेवनम् । धर्मो नित्योपवासित्वं ब्रह्मचर्यं तथैव च ॥
data.md: Another duty of the Brahmana consists of avoiding the food prepared by the Shudra. Walking along the path of virtue, always obscrving fasts and the practices of Brahmacharya form his other duties.

data.v: आहिताग्निरधीयानो जुह्वानः संयतेन्द्रियः । विघसाशी यताहारो गृहस्थः सत्यवाक्शुचिः ॥
data.md: The householder should keep up his domestic fire for daily adoration. He should study the Vedas. He should pour libations in honour of the departed Manes and the celestials. He should keep his senses under proper restraint. He should eat what remains after serving gods and guests and all his dependants. He should be abstemious in food, truthful in words, and pure both in body and mind.

data.v: अतिथिव्रतता धर्मो धर्मस्त्रेताग्निधारणम् । इष्टीश्च पशुबन्धांश्च विधिपूर्वं समाचरेत् ॥
data.md: Attending to guests is another duty of the householder, as also the keeping up of the three sacrificial fires. The householder should also attend to the ordinary sacrifices called Ishti and should also dedicate animals to the deities according to the ordinances.

data.v: यज्ञश्च परमो धर्मस्तथाहिंसा च देहिषु । अपूर्वभोजनं धर्मो विघसाशित्वमेव च ॥
data.md: Indeed, the celebration of sacrifices is his greatest duty as also a complete abstention from injury to all creatures. Never to eat before serving the celestials and guests and dependants is another duty of the householder. The food that remains after serving gods and guests and the dependants is called Vighasa. The householder should eat Vighasa.

data.v: भुक्ते परिजने पश्चाद्भोजनं धर्म उच्यते । ब्राह्मणस्य गृहस्थस्य श्रोत्रियस्य विशेषतः ॥
data.md: Indeed, to eat after the members of his family including servants and other dependants, is considered as one of the especial duties of the twiceborn householder, who should, besides, be conversant with the Vedas.

data.v: दंपत्योः समशीलत्वं धर्मश्च गृहमेधिनाम् । गृह्याणां चैव देवानां नित्यं पुष्पबलिक्रिया ॥
data.md: The conduct of husband and wife, in the case of the householder, should be equal. He should every day make offerings of flowers and other articles to those celestials who preside over domesticity.

data.v: नित्योपलेपनं धर्मस्तथा नित्योपवासिता । सुसंमृष्टोपलिप्ते च साज्यधूमोद्गमे गृहे ॥
data.md: The householder should see that his house is every day properly rubbed with (cowdung and water). He should also observe fasts every day. Wellcleaned and wellrubbed, his house should also be every day fumigated with the smoke of clarified butter poured on his sacred fire in honour of the celestials and the departed Manes.

data.v: एष द्विजजने धर्मो गार्हस्थ्यो लोकधारणः । द्विजातीनां सतां नित्यं सदैवैष प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: Even these are the duties of a twice born householder. Those duties really upholds the world. Those duties always and eternally emanate from those pious persons among the Brahmanas who live like householders.

data.v: यस्तु क्षत्रगतो देवि त्वया धर्म उदीरितः । तमहं ते प्रवक्ष्यामि तं मे शृणु समाहिता ॥
data.md: Do you listen to me with rapt attention, O goddess, for I shall now tell you what the dutics are of the Kshatriya and about which you have asked me.

data.v: क्षत्रियस्य स्मृतो धर्मः प्रजापालनमादितः । निर्दिष्टफलभोक्ता हि राजा धर्मेण युज्यते ॥
data.md: From the beginning it has been said that the duty of the Kshatriya is to protect all creatures. The king gets a fixed share of the merits acquired by his subjects. By that means the king becomes gifted with righteousness.

data.v: प्रजाः पालयते यो हि धर्मेण मनुजाधिपः । तस्य धर्मार्जिता लोकाः प्रजापालनसंचिताः ॥
data.md: The king who rules and protects his subjects piously, acquires, by virtue of the protection he offers to others, many regions of happiness in the next world.

data.v: तत्र राज्ञः परो धर्मो दमः स्वाध्याय एव च । अग्निहोत्रपरिस्पन्दो दानाध्ययनमेव च ॥
data.md: The other duties of a Kshatriya consist of self-control and Vedic study, the pouring of libations on the sacred fire, the making of gifts, study, the bearing of the sacred thread, sacrifices, the performance of religious rites, the support of servants and dependants, and perseverance in acts that have been undertaken.

data.v: यज्ञोपवीतधारणं यज्ञो धर्मक्रियास्तथा । भृत्यानां भरणं धर्मः कृते कर्मण्यमोघता ॥
सम्यग्दण्डे स्थितिर्धर्मो धर्मो वेदक्रतुक्रियाः । व्यवहारस्थितिर्धर्मः सत्यवाक्यरतिस्तथा ॥
data.md: Another duty of his is to give punishments proportionate to the offences committed. It is also his duty to celebrate sacrifices and other religious rites according to the ordinances laid down in the Vedas. Properly judging the disputes of litigants before him, and truthfulness of speech, and interference for helping the distressed, are the other duties by doing which the king acquires great glory both in this world and in the next. He should also sacrifice his life on the field of battle, having shown great prowess on behalf of kine and Brahmanas.

data.v: आर्तहस्तप्रदो राजा प्रेत्य चेह महीयते । गोब्राह्मणार्थे विक्रान्तः संग्रामे निधनं गतः । अश्वमेधजिताँल्लोकान्प्राप्नोति त्रिदिवालये ॥
data.md: Such a king acquires in the celestial region। such regions of happiness as are capable of being acquired by the performance of Horsesacrifices.

data.v: वैश्यस्य सततं धर्मः पाशुपाल्यं कृषिस्तथा । अग्निहोत्रपरिस्पन्दो दानाध्ययनमेव च ॥
data.md: The duties of the Vaishya always are the keep of cattle and agriculture, the pouring of libations on the sacred fire, the making of gifts, and study.

data.v: वाणिज्यं सत्पथस्थानमातिथ्यं प्रशमो दमः । विप्राणां स्वागतं त्यागो वैश्यधर्मः सनातनः ॥
data.md: Trade, walking in the path of virtue, hospitality, peacefulness, self-control, welcoming of Brahmanas, and renouncing things are the other eternal duties of the Vaishya.

data.v: तिलान्गन्धान्रसांश्चैव न विक्रीणीत वै क्वचित् । वणिक्पथमुपासीनो वैश्यः सत्पथमाश्रितः ॥
data.md: The Vaishya, engaged in trade and walking in the path of virtue, should never sell sesame and perfumery and juices or liquid substances. He should perform the duties of hospitality towards all.

data.v: सर्वातिथ्यं त्रिवर्गस्य यथाशक्ति यथार्हतः । शूद्रधर्मः परो नित्यं शुश्रूषा च द्विजातिषु ॥
data.md: He is at liberty to pursue virtue and profit and pleasure according to his means and asmuch as is judicious for him. The service of the three twice born classes forins the high duty of the Shudra.

data.v: स शूद्रः संशिततपाः सत्यसंधो जितेन्द्रियः । शुश्रूषन्नतिथिं प्राप्तं तपः संचिनुते महत् ॥
data.md: That Shudra who is truthful in speech and who has controlled his senses, is considered as having acquired meritorious penances. Indeed, the Shudra, who having got a guest, performs the duties of hospitality towards him, is considered as acquiring the merit of great penances.

data.v: त्यक्तहिंसः शुभाचारो देवताद्विजपूजकः । शूद्रो धर्मफलैरिष्टैः संप्रयुज्येत बुद्धिमान् ॥
data.md: That intelligent Shudra whose wonduct is virtuous and who adores the deities and Brahmanas, gets desirable rewards of virtue.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं चातुर्वर्ण्यस्य शोभने । एकैकस्येह सुभगे किमन्यच्छ्रोतुमिच्छसि ॥
data.md: O beautiful lady, I have thus recited to you what are the duties of the four castes. Indeed,O blessed lady, I have told you what are their respective duties. What else do you wish to hear?

data.v: उक्तास्त्वया पृथग्धर्माश्चातुर्वर्ण्यहिताः शुभाः । सर्वव्यापी तु यो धर्मो भगवंस्तं ब्रवीहि मे ॥
data.md: Uma said You have recited to me what are the respective duties of the four castes, auspicious and beneficial for them. Do you now tell me, O Holy One, what are the common duties of the all castes.

data.v: ब्राह्मणा लोकसारेण सृष्टा धात्रा गुणार्थिना । लोकांस्तारयितुं कृत्स्नान्मर्त्येषु क्षितिदेवताः ॥
data.md: Maheshvara said The foremost of all beings in the universe, viz., the Creator Brahmana, always seeking righteous accomplishinents, created the Brahinanas for rescuing all the worlds. Among all created beings they are gods on Earth.

data.v: तेषामिमं प्रवक्ष्यामि धर्मकर्मफलोदयम् । ब्राह्मणेषु हि यो धर्मः स धर्मः परमो मतः ॥
data.md: I shall at the beginning tell you what are the religious acts which they should do and what are the rewards which they acquire through them. The religion of the Brahmanas is the foremost of all religions.

data.v: इमे तु लोकधर्मार्थं त्रयः सृष्टाः स्वयंभुवा । पृथिव्याः सर्जने नित्यं सृष्टास्तानपि मे शृणु ॥
data.md: For the sake of the virtue, three religions were created by the self-create. Whenever the world is created, those Religions are created by the Grand-father. Do you listen.

data.v: वेदोक्तः परमो धर्मः स्मृतिशास्त्रगतोऽपरः । शिष्टाचीर्णः परः प्रोक्तस्त्रयो धर्माः सनातनाः ॥
data.md: These are the three eternal Religions. The Religion prescribed in the Vedas is the greatest; that of the Smritis is the next in the order of importance; the Third in importance is that which is based upon the practices of the virtuous.

data.v: त्रैविद्यो ब्राह्मणो विद्वान्न चाध्ययनजीवनः । त्रिकर्मा त्रिपरिक्रान्तो मैत्र एष स्मृतो द्विजः ॥
data.md: The Brahmana, endued with learning, should have the three Vedas. He should never make the study of the Vedas. He should devoie himself to the three well known deeds (of making gifts, studying the Vedas, and performing sacrifices). He should be above the three (viz., lust, anger and cupidity). He should be the friend of all creatures. A person who possesses these qualities is called a Brahmana.

data.v: षडिमानि तु कर्माणि प्रोवाच भुवनेश्वरः । वृत्त्यर्थं ब्राह्मणानां वै शृणु तानि समाहिता ॥
data.md: The lord of the universe declared these six deeds for the observance of Brahmanas. Listen to those eternal duties.

data.v: यजनं याजनं चैव तथा दानप्रतिग्रहौ । अध्यापनमधीतं च षट्कर्मा धर्मभाग्द्विजः ॥
data.md: The celebration of sacrifices, officiating at the sacrifices of others, the making of gifts, the acceptance of gifts, teaching and study, are the six deeds by doing which a Brahmana acquires religious merit.

data.v: नित्यस्वाध्यायता धर्मो धर्मो यज्ञः सनातनः । दानं प्रशस्यते चास्य यथाशक्ति यथाविधि ॥
data.md: Indeed, the daily study of the Vedas is a duty. Sacrifice is (another) eternal duty. The making of gifts according to his power and the ordinance, is, in his case, much praised.

data.v: अयं तु परमो धर्मः प्रवृत्तः सत्सु नित्यशः । गृहस्थता विशुद्धानां धर्मस्य निचयो महान् ॥
data.md: Tranquillity of mind is a great duty that is in vogue among the righteous. Householders of pure mind are capable of acquiring very great merit.

data.v: पञ्चयज्ञविशुद्धात्मा सत्यवागनसूयकः । दाता ब्राह्मणसत्कर्ता सुसंमृष्टनिवेशनः ॥
data.md: Indeed, he who purifies his soul by the performance of the five sacrifices, who is truthful in speech, who is shorn of malice, who makes gifts, who treats with hospitality and honour all regenerate guests, who lives in wellcleaned houses, who is shorn of pride, who is always sincere in his dealings, who uses sweet and assuring words towards others, who takes a pleasure in serving guests and others arrived at his house, and who eats the food that remains after the requirements have been satisfied of all the members of his family and dependants, acquires great merit.

data.v: अमानी च सदाजिह्मः स्निग्धवाणीप्रदस्तथा । अतिथ्यभ्यागतरतिः शेषान्नकृतभोजनः ॥
data.md: Indeed, he who purifies his soul by the performance of the five sacrifices, who is truthful in speech, who is shorn of malice, who makes gifts, who treats with hospitality and honour all regenerate guests, who lives in wellcleaned houses, who is shorn of pride, who is always sincere in his dealings, who uses sweet and assuring words towards others, who takes a pleasure in serving guests and others arrived at his house, and who eats the food that remains after the requirements have been satisfied of all the members of his family and dependants, acquires great merit.

data.v: पाद्यमर्घ्यं यथान्यायमासनं शयनं तथा । दीपं प्रतिश्रयं चापि यो ददाति स धार्मिकः ॥
data.md: That man who offers water to his guests for washing their feet and hands, who presents and Arghya for honouring him, who duly gives seats, and beds, and lamps for lightning the darkness, and shelter to those who come to his house, is considered, as highly righteous.

data.v: प्रातरुत्थाय चाचम्य भोजनेनोपमन्त्र्य च । सत्कृत्यानुव्रजेद्यश्च तस्य धर्मः सनातनः ॥
data.md: That householder who rises at dawn and washes his mouth and face and gives food to his guests, and having honoured them duly dismisses them from his house and follows them for a little distance, wins eternal merit.

data.v: सर्वातिथ्यं त्रिवर्गस्य यथाशक्ति दिवानिशम् । शूद्रधर्मः समाख्यातस्त्रिवर्णपरिचारणम् ॥
data.md: He is at liberty to pursue virtue and profit and pleasure according to his means and asmuch as is judicious for him. The service of the three twice born classes forins the high duty of the Shudra.

data.v: प्रवृत्तिलक्षणो धर्मो गृहस्थेषु विधीयते । तमहं कीर्तयिष्यामि सर्वभूतहितं शुभम् ॥
data.md: The Religion laid down for the householder has action for its chief characteristic. Auspicious, and beneficial to all creatures, I shall explain it to you.

data.v: दातव्यमसकृच्छक्त्या यष्टव्यमसकृत्तथा । पुष्टिकर्मविधानं च कर्तव्यं भूतिमिच्छता ॥
data.md: The householder should always make gifts according to his power. He should also perform sacrifices frequently. Indeed, he who wishes to secure his own good, should always achieve meritorious acts.

data.v: धर्मेणार्थः समाहार्यो धर्मलब्धं त्रिधा धनम् । कर्तव्यं धर्मपरमं मानवेन प्रयत्नतः ॥
data.md: The householder should acquire riches by fair means, The riches thus acquired should be carefully divided into three parts, keeping the requirements of virtue in view.

data.v: एकेनांशेन धर्मार्थश्चर्तव्यो भूतिमिच्छता । एकेनांशेन कामार्थ एकमंशं विवर्धयेत् ॥
data.md: With one of those portions he should accomplish all acts of virtue. With another he should seek to satisfy his carvings for pleasure. The third portion he should lay out for increasing.

data.v: निवृत्तिलक्षणस्त्वन्यो धर्मो मोक्ष इति स्मृतः । तस्य वृत्तिं प्रवक्ष्यामि शृणु मे देवि तत्त्वतः ॥
data.md: The Religion of Renunciation is different. It exists for liberation. I shall tell you the conduct that constitutes it. Listen to me in full, O goddess.

data.v: सर्वभूतदया धर्मो न चैकग्रामवासिता । आशापाशविमोक्षश्च शस्यते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिणाम् ॥
data.md: One of the duties inculcated by that Religion is Mercy towards all creatures. The man who follows it should not live in one place for more than a day. For acquiring Liberation, the followers of this Religion free themselves from the fetters of hope (or desire).

data.v: न कुण्ड्यां नोदके सङ्गो न वाससि न चासने । न त्रिदण्डे न शयने नाग्नौ न शरणालये ॥
data.md: They have no attachment to habitation, to the Kamandalu they bear for the keep of water, to the clothes that cover their loins, or the scat whereupon they rest, or the triple stick they bear in their hands, or the bed they sleep on, or the fire they want, or the chamber in which it lies.

data.v: अध्यात्मगतचित्तो यस्तन्मनास्तत्परायणः । युक्तो योगं प्रति सदा प्रतिसंख्यानमेव च ॥
data.md: A follower of this Religion fixes his heart upon the working of his soul. His mind is devoted to Supreme Brahma. He is filled with the idea of attaining to Brahman. He is always devoted to Yoga and the Sankhya philosophy.

data.v: वृक्षमूलशयो नित्यं शून्यागारनिवेशनः । नदीपुलिनशायी च नदीतीररतिश्च यः ॥
data.md: He seeks for no other shelter than the foot of a tree, He lives in vacant houses of men. He sleeps on the banks of rivers. He takes a pleasure in living by such banks.

data.v: विमुक्तः सर्वसङ्गेषु स्नेहबन्धेषु च द्विजः । आत्मन्येवात्मनो भावं समासज्याटति द्विजः ॥
data.md: He is freed from every attachment, and from every bond of affection. He merges the existence of his own soul into the Supreme Soul.

data.v: स्थाणुभूतो निराहारो मोक्षदृष्टेन कर्मणा । परिव्रजति यो युक्तस्तस्य धर्मः सनातनः ॥
data.md: Standing like a stake of wood, and abstaining from all food, he does only such deeds as point to Liberation. Or, he may wander about, devoted to Yoga. These are the eternal duties of a follower of the Religion of Renunciation

data.v: न चैकत्र चिरासक्तो न चैकग्रामगोचरः । युक्तो ह्यटति निर्मुक्तो न चैकपुलिनेशयः ॥
data.md: He lives aloof from men. He is freed from all attachments. He never lives in the same place for more than a day. Freed from all fetters, he roves over the world. Freed from all ties, he never sleeps on even the same riverbank for more than a day.

data.v: एष मोक्षविदां धर्मो वेदोक्तः सत्पथः सताम् । यो मार्गमनुयातीमं पदं तस्य न विद्यते ॥
data.md: This is the Religion of persons conversant with Liberation, as declared in the Vedas. This is the righteous path that is trodden by this virtuous, He who follows in this path, leaves no vestige behind.

data.v: चतुर्विधा भिक्षवस्ते कुटीचरकृतोदकः । हंसः परमहंसश्च यो यः पश्चात्स उत्तमः ॥
data.md: Bhikshus (mendicants) are of four kinds. They are Kutichakas, Bahudakas, Hansas, and Paramahansas. The second is superior to the first, the third to the second, and the fourth to the third.

data.v: अतः परतरं नास्ति नाधरं न तिरोऽग्रतः । अदुःखमसुखं सौम्यमजरामरमव्ययम् ॥
data.md: There is nothing superior to the Paramahansa; nor is there anything inferior to it or equal to it or superior to it. It is a condition shorn sorrow and happiness; auspicious and freed from decrepitude and death, and without any change.

data.v: गार्हस्थ्यो मोक्षधर्मश्च सज्जनाचरितस्त्वया । भाषितो मर्त्यलोकस्य मार्गः श्रेयस्करो महान् ॥
data.md: Uma said You have described the Religion of the householders, that of Liberation, and that which is based upon the observances of the pious. These paths are noble and highly beneficial to the world of living creatures.

data.v: ऋषिधर्मं तु धर्मज्ञ श्रोतुमिच्छाम्यनुत्तमम् । स्पृहा भवति मे नित्यं तपोवननिवासिषु ॥
data.md: you who are conversant with every religion, I wish to hear what the high Religion is of the Rishis. I always have a liking for those who live in hermitage.

data.v: आज्यधूमोद्भवो गन्धो रुणद्धीव तपोवनम् । तं दृष्ट्वा मे मनः प्रीतं महेश्वर सदा भवेत् ॥
data.md: The perfume that comes out of the smoke of the libations of clarified butter poured on the sacred fire, seems to pervade all the hermitages and make them delightful. Seeing this, O great god, my heart becomes always filled with joy.

data.v: एतं मे संशयं देव मुनिधर्मकृतं विभो । सर्वधर्मार्थतत्त्वज्ञ देवदेव वदस्व मे । निखिलेन मया पृष्टं महादेव यथातथम् ॥
data.md: O powerful god, I have doubts about the Religion of the Ascetics. You are conversant with the details of all religions. Do you enlighten me, O god of gods, in detail about this subject truly about which I have asked you, O great god.

data.v: हन्त तेऽहं प्रवक्ष्यामि मुनिधर्ममनुत्तमम् । यं कृत्वा मुनयो यान्ति सिद्धिं स्वतपसा शुभे ॥
data.md: The Blessed and Holy One said Yes, I shall recite to you the high and excellent Religion of the Ascetic. By following the dictates of that Religion, O auspicious lady, the Ascetics acquire success through the severe penances they practise.

data.v: फेनपानामृषीणां यो धर्मो धर्मविदां सदा । तं मे शृणु महाभागे धर्मज्ञे धर्ममादितः ॥
data.md: O highly blessed one, do you hear, from the beginning, what are the duties of those pious Rishis who know every duty and who are known by the name of Phenapas.

data.v: उञ्छन्ति सततं तस्मिन्ब्राह्मं फेनोत्करं शुभम् । अमृतं ब्रह्मणा पीतं मधुरं प्रसृतं दिवि ॥
data.md: The Grandfather Brahman drank some nectar. That water had flowed in the celestial। region from a great sacrifice.

data.v: एष तेषां विशुद्धानां फेनपानां तपोधने । धर्मचर्याकृतो मार्गो वालखिल्यगणे शृणु ॥
data.md: The froth of that water is highly sacred and it partook of His own nature. Those Rishis who live upon the measure of froth that thus came out are called. Phenapas (Frotheaters). This is the conduct of those pure Rishis, O lady having penances for wealth! Listen now to me as I explain to you who the Valakhilyas arc.

data.v: वालखिल्यास्तपःसिद्धा मुनयः सूर्यमण्डले । उञ्छमुञ्छन्ति धर्मज्ञाः शाकुनीं वृत्तिमास्थिताः ॥
data.md: The Valakhilyas are ascetics who have acquired success by their penances. They live in the solar disc. Living like birds, those Rishis, conversant with every duty of righteousness, live according to the Uncha mode.

data.v: मृगनिर्मोकवसनाश्चीरवल्कलवाससः । निर्द्वंद्वाः सत्पथं प्राप्ता वालखिल्यास्तपोधनाः ॥
data.md: Their dress consists of deerskins or barks of trees. Freed from pairs of opposites, the Valakhilyas, having penances for wealth, walk in this track of virtue. They are as big as a digit of the thumb. Divided into classes, each class lives in the practice of its duties. They wish only to practise penances. The merits they acquire by their righteous conduct are very great.

data.v: अङ्गुष्ठपर्वमात्रास्ते स्वेष्वङ्गेषु व्यवस्थिताः । तपश्चरणमीहन्ते तेषां धर्मफलं महत् ॥
ते सुरैः समतां यान्ति सुरकार्यार्थसिद्धये । द्योतयन्तो दिशः सर्वास्तपसा दग्धकिल्बिषाः ॥
data.md: They are considered as having acquired an equality with the gods and exist for the fulfilment of the purposes of the gods. Having dissipated all their sins by severe penances, they shine in effulgence, lighting up all the points of the compass.

data.v: ये त्वन्ये शुद्धमनसो दयाधर्मपरायणाः । सन्तश्चक्रचराः पुण्याः सोमलोकचराश्च ये ॥
data.md: Others, called Chakracharas, are gifted with cleansed souls and devoted to the practice of mercy, Righteous in their conduct and possessed of great purity, they live in the region of Soma.

data.v: पितृलोकसमीपस्थास्त उञ्छन्ति यथाविधि । संप्रक्षालाश्मकुट्टाश्च दन्तोलूखलिनस्तथा ॥
data.md: Thus living near enough to the region of the departed manes, they duly live by drinking the rays of Soma. There are others called Samprakshalas and Ashmakuttas and Dantolukhalas.

data.v: सोमपानां च देवानामूष्मपाणां तथैव च । उञ्छन्ति ये समीपस्थाः स्वभावनियतेन्द्रियाः ॥
data.md: These live near the Somadrinking celestials and others that drink flames of fire. With their wedded wives and with passions under complete restraint, they too live upon the rays of Soma.

data.v: तेषामग्निपरिष्यन्दः पितृदेवार्चनं तथा । यज्ञानां चापि पञ्चानां यजनं धर्म उच्यते ॥
data.md: They pour libations of clarified butter on the sacred fire, and worship the departed Manes under proper forms. They also celebrate the wellknown sacrifices. This is said to form their religion.

data.v: एष चक्रचरैर्देवि देवलोकचरैर्द्विजैः । ऋषिधर्मः सदा चीर्णो योऽन्यस्तमपि मे शृणु ॥
data.md: This religion of the Rishis, O goddess, is always observed by those who are houseless and who are free to go through every region including that of the celestials. There are, again, other classes about whom, I shall speak now. Do you listen.

data.v: सर्वेष्वेवर्षिधर्मेषु जेय आत्मा जितेन्द्रियः । कामक्रोधौ ततः पश्चाज्जेतव्याविति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: It is necessary that they who observe the different religions of the Rishis, should control their passions and know the Soul. Indeed, in my opinion, lust and anger should be completely controlled.

data.v: अग्निहोत्रपरिस्पन्दो धर्मरात्रिसमासनम् । सोमयज्ञाभ्यनुज्ञानं पञ्चमी यज्ञदक्षिणा ॥
data.md: With corn (wealth) acquired by the Uncha mode, they should perform the following duties, viz., the pouring of libations on the sacred fire, occupying a fixed seat employing oneself during the time in the sacrifice called Dharmaratri, performance of the SomaSacrifice, acquisition of especial knowledge, the giving of sacrificial presents, which forms the fifth, the daily performance of sacrifices, devotion to the worship of the ancestors and the deities, hospitality towards all.

data.v: नित्यं यज्ञक्रिया धर्मः पितृदेवार्चने रतिः । सर्वातिथ्यं च कर्तव्यमन्नेनोञ्छार्जितेन वै ॥
data.md: With corn (wealth) acquired by the Uncha mode, they should perform the following duties, viz., the pouring of libations on the sacred fire, occupying a fixed seat employing oneself during the time in the sacrifice called Dharmaratri, performance of the SomaSacrifice, acquisition of especial knowledge, the giving of sacrificial presents, which forms the fifth, the daily performance of sacrifices, devotion to the worship of the ancestors and the deities, hospitality towards all.

data.v: निवृत्तिरुपभोगस्य गोरसानां च वै रतिः । स्थण्डिले शयनं योगः शाकपर्णनिषेवणम् ॥
फलमूलाशनं वायुरापः शैवलभक्षणम् । ऋषीणां नियमा ह्येते यैर्जयन्त्यजितां गतिम् ॥
data.md: Abstention from all luxurious dishes prepared from cow's milk, taking a pleasure in tranquility of heart, lying on naked rocks or the earth, devotion to Yoga, eating potherbs and leaves of trees, and living upon fruits and roots, and wind and water and moss, are some of practices of the Rishis by which they acquire the end that belongs to persons unsubjugated.

data.v: विधूमे न्यस्तमुसले व्यङ्गारे भुक्तवज्जने । अतीतपात्रसंचारे काले विगतभैक्षके ॥
data.md: When the smoke has ceased to curl upwards from a house, when the husking machine has ceased to play, when the hearthfire has been put out, when all the inmates have taken their food, when dishes are no longer carried from room to room when mendicants have ceased to walk the streets, it is then that the man who is devoted to the Religion of Truth and tranquillity of soul, wishing to have a guest, should eat what remnant of food may still remain in the house. By acting thus, one becomes a practiser of the Religion of the Munis.

data.v: अतिथिं काङ्क्षमाणो वै शेषान्नकृतभोजनः । सत्यधर्मरतिः क्षान्तो मुनिधर्मेण युज्यते ॥
data.md: When the smoke has ceased to curl upwards from a house, when the husking machine has ceased to play, when the hearthfire has been put out, when all the inmates have taken their food, when dishes are no longer carried from room to room when mendicants have ceased to walk the streets, it is then that the man who is devoted to the Religion of Truth and tranquillity of soul, wishing to have a guest, should eat what remnant of food may still remain in the house. By acting thus, one becomes a practiser of the Religion of the Munis.

data.v: न स्तम्भी न च मानी यो न प्रमत्तो न विस्मितः । मित्रामित्रसमो मैत्रो यः स धर्मविदुत्तमः ॥
data.md: One should not be arrogant; nor proud; nor cheerless and discontented; nor wonder at anything. Indeed, one should treat his friends and enemies alike. Indeed, one who is the foremost of all persons conversant with duties should treat all creatures like friends.

data.v: देशेषु रमणीयेषु गिरीणां निर्झरेषु च । स्रवन्तीनां च कुञ्जेषु पर्वतोपवनेषु च ॥
देशेषु च विचित्रेषु फलवत्सु समाहिताः । मूलवत्सु च देशेषु वसन्ति नियतव्रताः ॥
तेषामपि विधिं पुण्यं श्रोतुमिच्छामि शंकर । वानप्रस्थेषु देवेश स्वशरीरोपजीविषु ॥
data.md: I wish, O Shankara, to hear the sacred ordinances which they follow. These hermits, O god of all gods, are persons who depend, for the protection of their bodies, upon themselves alone.

data.v: वानप्रस्थेषु यो धर्मस्तं मे शृणु समाहिता । श्रुत्वा चैकमना देवि धर्मबुद्धिपरा भव ॥
data.md: Maheshvara said Do you hear with rapt attention what are the duties of Hermits. Having listened to them with one mind. O goddess, do you fix your heart upon virtue.

data.v: संसिद्धैर्नियतैः सद्भिर्वनवासमुपागतैः । वानप्रस्थैरिदं कर्म कर्तव्यं शृणु यादृशम् ॥
data.md: Listen then to what the acts are that should be practised by righteous hermits crowned with success, observant of rigid vows and rules, and living in woods and forests.

data.v: त्रिकालमभिषेकार्थः पितृदेवार्चनं क्रिया । अग्निहोत्रपरिस्पन्द इष्टिहोमविधिस्तथा ॥
नीवारग्रहणं चैव फलमूलनिषेवणम् । इङ्गुदैरण्डतैलानां स्नेहार्थं च निषेवणम् ॥
data.md: Performing ablutions thrice a day, adoring the departed Manes and the celestial, pouring libations on the sacred fire, performing of those sacrifices and rites called Ishti-Homa, picking up the grains of Nivara-paddy, eating fruits and roots, and using oil that is pressed out from Inguda and castor seeds, form their duties.

data.v: योगचर्याकृतैः सिद्धैः कामक्रोधविवर्जनम् । वीरशय्यामुपासद्भिर्वीरस्थानोपसेविभिः ॥
data.md: Having performed the practises of Yoga and become crowned with (ascetic) success and freed from lust and anger, they should seat themselves in the attitude called Virasana. Indeed, they should live in those places which are inaccessible to cowards.

data.v: युक्तैर्योगवहैः सद्भिर्ग्रीष्मे पञ्चतपैस्तथा । मण्डूकयोगनियतैर्यथान्यायनिषेविभिः ॥
data.md: Observant of the excellent ordinances about Yoga, sitting in summer in the midst of four fires on four sides with the sun overhead, duly practising what is called Manduka-Yoga, and always seated in the attitude called Virasana, and lying on naked rocks or the earth, these men, with hearts fixed upon virtue, must expose themselves to cold and water and fire.

data.v: वीरासनगतैर्नित्यं स्थण्डिले शयनैस्तथा । शीतयोगोऽग्नियोगश्च चर्तव्यो धर्मबुद्धिभिः ॥
अब्भक्षैर्वायुभक्षैश्च शैवालोत्तरभोजनैः । अश्मकुट्टैस्तथा दान्तैः संप्रक्षालैस्तथापरैः ॥
data.md: They live upon water or air or moss. They use two pieces of stone only for husking their corn. Some of them use their teeth only for such a purpose. They do not keep utensils of any sort.

data.v: चीरवल्कलसंवीतैर्मृगचर्मनिवासिभिः । कार्या यात्रा यथाकालं यथाधर्मं यथाविधि ॥
data.md: Some of them clothe themselves with rage and barks of trees or deer skins. Thus do they pass their lives for the time allotted to them, according to the ordinances.

data.v: वननित्यैर्वनचरैर्वनपैर्वनगोचरैः । वनं गुरुमिवासाद्य वस्तव्यं वनजीविभिः ॥
data.md: Remaining in woods and forests, they wander within woods and forests, live within them, and are always to be found within them. Indeed, these hermits entering into woods and forests live within them as disciples, obtaining a preceptor, live with him.

data.v: तेषां होमक्रिया धर्मः पञ्चयज्ञनिषेवणम् । नागपञ्चमयज्ञस्य वेदोक्तस्यानुपालनम् ॥
अष्टमीयज्ञपरता चातुर्मास्यनिषेवणम् । पौर्णमास्यां तु यो यज्ञो नित्ययज्ञस्तथैव च ॥
विमुक्ता दारसंयोगैर्विमुक्ताः सर्वसंकरैः । विमुक्ताः सर्वपापैश्च चरन्ति मुनयो वने ॥
स्रुग्भाण्डपरमा नित्यं त्रेताग्निशरणाः सदा । सन्तः सत्पथनित्या ये ते यान्ति परमां गतिम् ॥
data.md: The sacrificial ladle and the water vessel are their chief properties. They are always devoted to the three fires. Virtuous in their conduct and adhering to the path of virtue, they acquire the highest end.

data.v: ब्रह्मलोकं महापुण्यं सोमलोकं च शाश्वतम् । गच्छन्ति मुनयः सिद्धा ऋषिधर्मव्यपाश्रयात् ॥
data.md: These Munis, crowned with success and ever given to the Religion of Truth, acquire the highly sacred region of Brahman, or the eternal region of Soma.

data.v: एष धर्मो मया देवि वानप्रस्थाश्रितः शुभः । विस्तरेणार्थसंपन्नो यथास्थूलमुदाहृतः ॥
data.md: O auspicious goddess, I have thus recited to you, in brief, the outlines of the religion that is followed by hermits and that has many practices in detail.

data.v: भगवन्देवदेवेश सर्वभूतनमस्कृत । यो धर्मो मुनिसंघस्य सिद्धिवादेषु तं वद ॥
data.md: Uma said O Holy One, O lord of all creatures, O you adored of all beings, I wish to hear what is the religion of those conclaves of ascetics who are followers of the scriptures describing ascetic success. Do you recite it to me.

data.v: सिद्धिवादेषु संसिद्धास्तथा वननिवासिनः । स्वैरिणो दारसंयुक्तास्तेषां धर्मः कथं स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Living in woods and forest and well accomplished in the scriptures of success, some amongst them live and act as they like, without being controlled by particular practices; others have wives. How, indeed, have their practices been ordained.

data.v: स्वैरिणस्तापसा देवि सर्वे दारविहारिणः । तेषां मौण्ड्यं कषायश्च वासरात्रिश्च कारणम् ॥
data.md: Mahadeva said O goddess, the shaving of the head and the wearing of the brown robes are the characteristics of those recluses who rove about freely; while the characteristics of those who sport with wives consist in passing their nights at home.

data.v: त्रिकालमभिषेकश्च होत्रं त्वृषिकृतं महत् । समाधिः सत्पथस्थानं यथोदितनिषेवणम् ॥
data.md: Performing ablutions three times a day is the duty of both the classes, while the Homa, with water and wild fruits, belongs to the married recluses as performed by the Rishis in general. Absorption in YogaMeditation, and performance of those duties which form righteousness and which have been laid down as such, are some of the other duties prescribed for them.

data.v: ये च ते पूर्वकथिता धर्मा वननिवासिनाम् । यदि सेवन्ति धर्मांस्तानाप्नुवन्ति तपःफलम् ॥
data.md: All those duties also of which I have spoken to you before as belonging to recluses living in forests, are the duties of these also. Indeed, if those duties are observed, they who observe them acquire the rewards of severe penances.

data.v: ये च दंपतिधर्माणः स्वदारनियतेन्द्रियाः । चरन्ति विधिदृष्टं तदृतुकालाभिगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those forest recluses who lead married lives should indulge in the gratification of their senses with these married wives of theirs. By indulging in sexual union with their wives at only those times when their seasons come, they perform the duties which have been laid down for thein.

data.v: तेषामृषिकृतो धर्मो धर्मिणामुपपद्यते । न कामकारात्कामोऽन्यः संसेव्यो धर्मदर्शिभिः ॥
data.md: The religion which these virtuous men are to follow is the Religion that has been laid down and followed by the Rishis. With their eyes set upon the acquisition of virtue, they should never pursue any other object of desire from a sense of uncontrolled caprice.

data.v: सर्वभूतेषु यः सम्यग्ददात्यभयदक्षिणाम् । हिंसारोषविमुक्तात्मा स वै धर्मेण युज्यते ॥
data.md: That man who gives promises of safety to all creatures, freed as his soul becomes from the stain of malice or harmfulness, becomes gifted with virtue.

data.v: सर्वभूतानुकम्पी यः सर्वभूतार्जवव्रतः । सर्वभूतात्मभूतश्च स वै धर्मेण युज्यते ॥
data.md: Indeed, that person who shows mercy to all creatures, who adopts as a vow of sincere conduct towards all creatures, and who forms himself the soul of all creatures, becomes gifted with virtue.

data.v: सर्ववेदेषु वा स्नानं सर्वभूतेषु चार्जवम् । उभे एते समे स्यातामार्जवं वा विशिष्यते ॥
data.md: A bath in all the shrines, and sincere conduct towards all crcatures, are regarded as equal in point of merit; or, perhaps, the latter is a little distinguished above the other in point of merit.

data.v: आर्जवं धर्म इत्याहुरधर्मो जिह्म उच्यते । आर्जवेनेह संयुक्तो नरो धर्मेण युज्यते ॥
data.md: Sincerity, it has been said, is Virtue; while insincerity or crookedness is sin. That man who acts sincerely becomes indeed with Virtue.

data.v: आर्जवो भुवने नित्यं वसत्यमरसंनिधौ । तस्मादार्जवनित्यः स्याद्य इच्छेद्धर्ममात्मनः ॥
data.md: The man who is always devoted to sincerity of conduct, succeeds in acquiring a residence among the celestials. Hence, he who wishes to achieve the merit of virtue, should be sincere.

data.v: क्षान्तो दान्तो जितक्रोधो धर्मभूतोऽविहिंसकः । धर्मे रतमना नित्यं नरो धर्मेण युज्यते ॥
data.md: Gifted with a forgiving nature and selfcontrol, and with anger under complete subjection, one should transform himself into an embodiment of Virtue and become freed from malice. Such a man, who becomes devoted, besides, to the discharge of all the duties of religion, becomes indued with the merit of virtue.

data.v: व्यपेततन्द्रो धर्मात्मा शक्या सत्पथमाश्रितः । चारित्रपरमो बुद्धो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥
data.md: Freed from drowsiness and procrastination, the righteous person, who follows the path of Virtue to the best of his power, and becomes possessed of pure conduct, and who is venerable in years, comes to be considered as equal to Brahma itself.

data.v: आश्रमाभिरता देव तापसा ये तपोधनाः । दीप्तिमन्तः कया चैव चर्ययाथ भवन्ति ते ॥
data.md: Uma said By what course of duties, O god, do those ascetics who are attached to their respective retreats and have penances for wealth, succeed in becoming indued with great splendour?

data.v: राजानो राजपुत्राश्च निर्धना वा महाधनाः । कर्मणा केन भगवन्प्राप्नुवन्ति महाफलम् ॥
data.md: By what acts, again, do kings and princes who are immensely rich, and others who are poor, succeed in getting high rewards?

data.v: नित्यं स्थानमुपागम्य दिव्यचन्दनरूषिताः । केन वा कर्मणा देव भवन्ति वनगोचराः ॥
data.md: By what acts, O god, do dwellers of the forest succeed in acquiring that place which is eternal and in adoring their persons with celestial sandal paste.

data.v: एतं मे संशयं देव तपश्चर्यागतं शुभम् । शंस सर्वमशेषेण त्र्यक्ष त्रिपुरनाशन ॥
data.md: O illustrious god of three eyes, O destroyer of the triple city, do you remove this doubt of mine about the auspicious subject of the observance of penances by telling everything in full.

data.v: उपवासव्रतैर्दान्ता अहिंस्राः सत्यवादिनः । संसिद्धाः प्रेत्य गन्धर्वैः सह मोदन्त्यनामयाः ॥
data.md: The Illustrious Deity said Those who observe the vows of fasts and control their senses, who abstain from injury of any kind to any creature, and who practise truthfulness of speech, acquire success and ascending to the celestial region sport in happiness with the Gandharvas as as their companions, freed from every kind of evil.

data.v: मण्डूकयोगशयनो यथास्थानं यथाविधि । दीक्षां चरति धर्मात्मा स नागैः सह मोदते ॥
data.md: That pious man who lies down in the attitude of Manduka Yoga, and who properly and according to the ordinance performs meritorious deeds after having been duly initiated, sports in happiness in the next world in the company of the Nagas.

data.v: शष्पं मृगमुखोत्सृष्टं यो मृगैः सह सेवते । दीक्षितो वै मुदा युक्तः स गच्छत्यमरावतीम् ॥
data.md: That man who lives in the company of deer and lives upon such grass and vegetables as drop from their mouths and who was undergone the initiation and attends to the duties attached to it, succeeds in going to the capital of Indra.

data.v: शैवालं शीर्णपर्णं वा तद्व्रतो यो निषेवते । शीतयोगवहो नित्यं स गच्छेत्परमां गतिम् ॥
data.md: That man who lives upon the moss he gathers and the fallen leaves of trees that he picks up, and puts up with all the severities of cold, acquires a very high place.

data.v: वायुभक्षोऽम्बुभक्षो वा फलमूलाशनोऽपि वा । यक्षेष्वैश्वर्यमाधाय मोदतेऽप्सरसां गणैः ॥
data.md: That man who lives upon either air or water or fruits and roots, acquires in the next life the affluence that belongs to the Yakshas and sports in happiness in the company of the various tribes of Apsaras.

data.v: अग्नियोगवहो ग्रीष्मे विधिदृष्टेन कर्मणा । चीर्त्वा द्वादश वर्षाणि राजा भवति पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: Having practised practised for twelve years, according to the rites laid down in the ordinances, the vow relating to the endurance of the five fires in the summer season, one becomes in his next life a king.

data.v: आहारनियमं कृत्वा मुनिर्द्वादशवार्षिकम् । मरुं संसाध्य यत्नेन राजा भवति पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: That man who, having observed vows about food, practises penances for twelve years, carefully abstaining from all interdicted food, and forbidden hours as well, during the period, becomes in his next life a king.

data.v: स्थण्डिले शुद्धमाकाशं परिगृह्य समन्ततः । प्रविश्य च मुदा युक्तो दीक्षां द्वादशवार्षिकीम् ॥
data.md: That man who sits and lies on the bare ground with the canopy of heaven over his head, observes the course of duties of initiation, and then renounces his body by abstaining from all food, acquires great happiness in the celestial region.

data.v: स्थण्डिलस्य फलान्याहुर्यानानि शयनानि च । गृहाणि च महार्हाणि चन्द्रशुभ्राणि भामिनि ॥
आत्मानमुपजीवन्यो नियतो नियताशनः । देहं वानशने त्यक्त्वा स स्वर्गं समुपाश्नुते ॥
आत्मानमुपजीवन्यो दीक्षां द्वादशवार्षिकीम् । त्यक्त्वा महार्णवे देहं वारुणं लोकमश्नुते ॥
data.md: He who lives in entire dependence upon his own self and observes for twelve years the duties of initiation and finally renounces his body on the fire as an oblation to the celestials, acquires the region of Brahman and is held in high esteem there.

data.v: आत्मानमुपजीवन्यो दीक्षां द्वादशवार्षिकीम् । अश्मना चरणौ भित्त्वा गुह्यकेषु स मोदते ॥
data.md: He who lives in entire dependence upon his own self and observes for twelve years the duties of initiation and finally renounces his body on the fire as an oblation to the celestials, acquires the region of Brahman and is held in high esteem there.

data.v: साधयित्वात्मनात्मानं निर्द्वंद्वो निष्परिग्रहः । चीर्त्वा द्वादश वर्षाणि दीक्षामेकां मनोगताम् । स्वर्गलोकमवाप्नोति देवैश्च सह मोदते ॥
आत्मानमुपजीवन्यो दीक्षां द्वादशवार्षिकीम् । हुत्वाग्नौ देहमुत्सृज्य वह्निलोके महीयते ॥
data.md: He who lives in entire dependence upon his own self and observes for twelve years the duties of initiation and finally renounces his body on the fire as an oblation to the celestials, acquires the region of Brahman and is held in high esteem there.

data.v: यस्तु देवि यथान्यायं दीक्षितो नियतो द्विजः । आत्मन्यात्मानमाधाय निर्द्वंद्वो निष्परिग्रहः ॥
