चीर्त्वा द्वादश वर्षाणि दीक्षामेकां मनोगताम् । अरणीसहितं स्कन्धे बद्ध्वा गच्छत्यनावृतः ॥
वीराध्वानमना नित्यं वीरासनरतस्तथा । वीरस्थायी च सततं स वीरगतिमाप्नुयात् ॥
स शक्रलोकगो नित्यं सर्वकामपुरस्कृतः । दिव्यपुष्पसमाकीर्णो दिव्यचन्दनभूषितः । सुखं वसति धर्मात्मा दिवि देवगणैः सह ॥
data.md: Such a man goes to the eternal region of Shakra where he becomes crowned with the fruition of all his desires and where he sports in joy, his body decked with garlands of celestial flowers and celestial perfumes.

data.v: वीरलोकगतो वीरो वीरयोगवहः सदा । सत्त्वस्थः सर्वमुत्सृज्य दीक्षितो नियतः शुचिः । वीराध्वानं प्रपद्येद्यस्तस्य लोकाः सनातनाः ॥
data.md: Indeed, that pious person lives happily in Heaven, with the celestials as his companions. The hero, following the practices of heroes and devoted to that Yoga which belongs to heroes, living in the practice of Goodness, having renounced everything performed the initiation, controlled his senses, and observing purity of both body and mind, is sure to acquire that path which is reserved for heroes. Eternal regions of happiness are his.

data.v: कामगेन विमानेन स वै चरति च्छन्दतः । शक्रलोकगतः श्रीमान्मोदते च निरामयः ॥
data.md: Riding on a car that moves at the will of the rider, he passes through all happy regions as he likes. Indeed living in the regions of Shakra, that blessed person always sports in joy, freed from every calamity.

data.v: भगवन्भगनेत्रघ्न पूष्णो दशनपातन । दक्षक्रतुहर त्र्यक्ष संशयो मे महानयम् ॥
data.md: Uma said O Holy one, O you who had torn off the cyes of Bhaga and the teeth of Pushan, O destroyer of the sacrifice of Daksha, O threecyed deity, I have a great doubt.

data.v: चातुर्वर्ण्यं भगवता पूर्वं सृष्टं स्वयंभुवा । केन कर्मविपाकेन वैश्यो गच्छति शूद्रताम् ॥
data.md: Forinerly, the illustrious self-create created the four castes. Through the evil result of what deeds does a Vaishya became a Shudra?

data.v: वैश्यो वा क्षत्रियः केन द्विजो वा क्षत्रियो भवेत् । प्रतिलोमः कथं देव शक्यो धर्मो निषेवितुम् ॥
data.md: Through, what acts does a Kshatriya become a Vaishya and a Brahmana becomes a Kshatriya? By what means may such degradation of castes bc warded off?

data.v: केन वा कर्मणा विप्रः शूद्रयोनौ प्रजायते । क्षत्रियः शूद्रतामेति केन वा कर्मणा विभो ॥
data.md: Through what deeds' does a Brahmana take birth in his next life, in the Shudra caste? Through what acts, O powerful deity, does a Kshatriya also come down to the status of a Shudra?

data.v: एतं मे संशयं देव वद भूतपतेऽनघ । त्रयो वर्णाः प्रकृत्येह कथं ब्राह्मण्यमाप्नुयुः ॥
data.md: O sinless one, O lord of all created beings, do you, O illustrious one, remove this doubt of mine. How, again can the three castes naturally succeed in acquiring the status Brahmanahood?

data.v: ब्राह्मण्यं देवि दुष्प्रापं निसर्गाद्ब्राह्मणः शुभे । क्षत्रियो वैश्यशूद्रौ वा निसर्गादिति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: The Illustrious One said The status of a Brahmana, O goddess is highly difficult to attain. O auspicious lady, one becomes a Brahmana through creation or birth. Similarly the Kshatriya, the Vaishya, and the Shudra, all becomes so through original creation. This is my opinion.

data.v: कर्मणा दुष्कृतेनेह स्थानाद्भ्रश्यति वै द्विजः । ज्येष्ठं वर्णमनुप्राप्य तस्माद्रक्षेत वै द्विजः ॥
data.md: He, however, that is born a Brahmana goes down from his status through his own evil deeds. Hence, the Brahmana, after having acquired the status of the first order, should always protect it.

data.v: स्थितो ब्राह्मणधर्मेण ब्राह्मण्यमुपजीवति । क्षत्रियो वाथ वैश्यो वा ब्रह्मभूयाय गच्छति ॥
data.md: If one who is a Kshatriya or Vaishya performs those duties which are assigned to the Brahmana, after the manner of a Brahmana, he becomes a Brahman.

data.v: यस्तु विप्रत्वमुत्सृज्य क्षात्रं धर्मं निषेवते । ब्राह्मण्यात्स परिभ्रष्टः क्षत्रयोनौ प्रजायते ॥
data.md: That Brahmana who renounces the duties of his order for following those of the Kshatriya, is considered as one who has fallen away from the status of a Brahmana and who has become a Kshatriya.

data.v: वैश्यकर्म च यो विप्रो लोभमोहव्यपाश्रयः । ब्राह्मण्यं दुर्लभं प्राप्य करोत्यल्पमतिः सदा ॥
data.md: That little-witted Brahmana, who, moved by cupidity and folly, follows the practices assigned to Vaishyas, forgetful of his position as a Brahmana that is highly difficult to attain, comes to be considered as one who has become a Vaishya. Likewise, one who is a Vaishya by birth may, by following the practices of a Shudra, become a Shudra. Indeed, a Brahmana falling away from the duties of his own order. may go down to the status of even a Shudra.

data.v: स द्विजो वैश्यतामेति वैश्यो वा शूद्रतामियात् । स्वधर्मात्प्रच्युतो विप्रस्ततः शूद्रत्वमाप्नुते ॥
data.md: That little-witted Brahmana, who, moved by cupidity and folly, follows the practices assigned to Vaishyas, forgetful of his position as a Brahmana that is highly difficult to attain, comes to be considered as one who has become a Vaishya. Likewise, one who is a Vaishya by birth may, by following the practices of a Shudra, become a Shudra. Indeed, a Brahmana falling away from the duties of his own order. may go down to the status of even a Shudra.

data.v: तत्रासौ निरयं प्राप्तो वर्णभ्रष्टो बहिष्कृतः । ब्रह्मलोकपरिभ्रष्टः शूद्रः समुपजायते ॥
data.md: Such a Brahmana, degraded from the order of his birth and outcasted, without attaining to the region of Brahman, sinks into Hell, and in his next birth becomes born as a Shudra.

data.v: क्षत्रियो वा महाभागे वैश्यो वा धर्मचारिणि । स्वानि कर्माण्यपाहाय शूद्रकर्माणि सेवते ॥
स्वस्थानात्स परिभ्रष्टो वर्णसंकरतां गतः । ब्राह्मणः क्षत्रियो वैश्यः शूद्रत्वं याति तादृशः ॥
data.md: A highly blessed Kshatriya or a Vaishya, who renounces the duties of his order, and follows the practices of a Shudra, falls away from his own order and becomes a person of mixed caste. It is in this way that a Brahmana, or a Kshatriya, or a Vaishya, comes by the position of a Shudra.

data.v: यस्तु शुद्धः स्वधर्मेण ज्ञानविज्ञानवाञ्शुचिः । धर्मज्ञो धर्मनिरतः स धर्मफलमश्नुते ॥
data.md: That man who has acquired clearness of vision through practice of the duties of his own casic, who is gifted with knowledge and science, who is pure (in body and inind), who knows every duty and is devoted to the practice of all his duties, is sure to enjoy the rewards of virtue.

data.v: इदं चैवापरं देवि ब्रह्मणा समुदीरितम् । अध्यात्मं नैष्ठिकं सद्भिर्धर्मकामैर्निषेव्यते ॥
data.md: I shall now recite to you, O goddess, a saying uttered by Brahman on this subject. The virtuous and those who are desirous of acquiring mcrit always pursue with firmness the culture of the soul.

data.v: उग्रान्नं गर्हितं देवि गणान्नं श्राद्धसूतकम् । घुष्टान्नं नैव भोक्तव्यं शूद्रान्नं नैव कर्हिचित् ॥
data.md: The food that comes from cruel and fierce persons is censurable. So also is the food that has been cooked for serving a large number of persons. The same is said of the food that is cooked for the first Shraddha of a dead person. So also is the food that is sullied for the usual faults and the food that is supplied by a Shudra. These should never be taken by a Brahmana at any time.

data.v: शूद्रान्नं गर्हितं देवि देवदेवैर्महात्मभिः । पितामहमुखोत्सृष्टं प्रमाणमिति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: The food of a Shudra, O goddess, is always disapproved of by the great deities. This, I think, is the authority enunciated by the Grandfather with his own mouth.

data.v: शूद्रान्नेनावशेषेण जठरे यो म्रियेत वै । आहिताग्निस्तथा यज्वा स शूद्रगतिभाग्भवेत् ॥
data.md: If a Brahmana, who has set up the sacred fire and who performs sacrifices, were to die with any portion of a Shudra's food remaining undigested in his stomach, he is sure to be born a Shudra.

data.v: तेन शूद्रान्नशेषेण ब्रह्मस्थानादपाकृतः । ब्राह्मणः शूद्रतामेति नास्ति तत्र विचारणा ॥
data.md: On account of those remains of a Shudra's food in his stomach, he falls away from the position of a Brahmana. Such a Brahmana becomes surely a Shudra.

data.v: यस्यान्नेनावशेषेण जठरे यो म्रियेत वै । तां तां योनिं व्रजेद्विप्रो यस्यान्नमुपजीवति ॥
data.md: The Brahmana in his next life comes by the position of that order upon whose food he lives through life or with the undigested portion of whose food in his stomach he dies.

data.v: ब्राह्मणत्वं शुभं प्राप्य दुर्लभं योऽवमन्यते । अभोज्यान्नानि चाश्नाति स द्विजत्वात्पतेत वै ॥
data.md: That man who having acquired the sacred position of a Brahmana which is so difficult to acquire, disregards it and eats forbidden food, falls away from his high status.

data.v: सुरापो ब्रह्महा क्षुद्रश्चौरो भग्नव्रतोऽशुचिः । स्वाध्यायवर्जितः पापो लुब्धो नैकृतिकः शठः ॥
data.md: That Brahmana who drinks alcohol, who becomes guilty of Brahmanicide or mean in his conduct, or a thief, or who breaks his vows, or becomes impure, or unmindful of his Vedic studies, or sinful, or characterised by cupidity, or guilty of cunning, or a cheat, or who does not observe vows, or who marries a Shudra woman, or who derives his livelihood by pandering to the lusts of other people, or who sells the Soma plant, or who serves a person of a low caste, falls away from his status of Brahman-hood.

data.v: अव्रती वृषलीभर्ता कुण्डाशी सोमविक्रयी । निहीनसेवी विप्रो हि पतति ब्रह्मयोनितः ॥
data.md: That Brahmana who drinks alcohol, who becomes guilty of Brahmanicide or mean in his conduct, or a thief, or who breaks his vows, or becomes impure, or unmindful of his Vedic studies, or sinful, or characterised by cupidity, or guilty of cunning, or a cheat, or who does not observe vows, or who marries a Shudra woman, or who derives his livelihood by pandering to the lusts of other people, or who sells the Soma plant, or who serves a person of a low caste, falls away from his status of Brahman-hood.

data.v: गुरुतल्पी गुरुद्वेषी गुरुकुत्सारतिश्च यः । ब्रह्मद्विट्चापि पतति ब्राह्मणो ब्रह्मयोनितः ॥
data.md: That Brahmana who violates the bed of his preceptor, or who takes a pleasure in speaking ill of him, falls away from the status of Brahmanahood even if he knows Brahma.

data.v: एभिस्तु कर्मभिर्देवि शुभैराचरितैस्तथा । शूद्रो ब्राह्मणतां गच्छेद्वैश्यः क्षत्रियतां व्रजेत् ॥
data.md: By these good deeds again, O goddess, when performed, a Shudra becomes Brahmana, and Vaishya becomes Kshatriya.

data.v: शूद्रकर्माणि सर्वाणि यथान्यायं यथाविधि । शुश्रूषां परिचर्यां च ज्येष्ठे वर्णे प्रयत्नतः । कुर्यादविमनाः शूद्रः सततं सत्पथे स्थितः ॥
data.md: The Shudra should perform all the duties sanctioned for him, properly and according to the ordinance. He should always serve, with obedience and humility, persons of the three others castes and serve them with care.

data.v: दैवतद्विजसत्कर्ता सर्वातिथ्यकृतव्रतः । ऋतुकालाभिगामी च नियतो नियताशनः ॥
चौक्षश्चौक्षजनान्वेषी शेषान्नकृतभोजनः । वृथामांसान्यभुञ्जानः शूद्रो वैश्यत्वमृच्छति ॥
ऋतवागनहंवादी निर्द्वंद्वः शमकोविदः । यजते नित्ययज्ञैश्च स्वाध्यायपरमः शुचिः ॥
दान्तो ब्राह्मणसत्कर्ता सर्ववर्णबुभूषकः । गृहस्थव्रतमातिष्ठन्द्विकालकृतभोजनः ॥
शेषाशी विजिताहारो निष्कामो निरहंवदः । अग्निहोत्रमुपासंश्च जुह्वानश्च यथाविधि ॥
सर्वातिथ्यमुपातिष्ठञ्शेषान्नकृतभोजनः । त्रेताग्निमन्त्रविहितो वैश्यो भवति वै यदि । स वैश्यः क्षत्रियकुले शुचौ महति जायते ॥
स वैश्यः क्षत्रियो जातो जन्मप्रभृति संस्कृतः । उपनीतो व्रतपरो द्विजो भवति सत्कृतः ॥
data.md: If a Vaishya, after having taken birth as a Kshatriya, performs the usual purificatory rites, becomes invested with the sacred thread, and betakes himself of the observance of vows, he becomes, in his next life, an honoured Brahmana.

data.v: ददाति यजते यज्ञैः संस्कृतैराप्तदक्षिणैः । अधीते स्वर्गमन्विच्छंस्त्रेताग्निशरणः सदा ॥
data.md: Indeed, after his birth as a Kshatriya, he should make presents, worship the deities in great sacrifices with profuse presents, study the Vedas, and desirous of attaining to Heaven, should adore the three fires.

data.v: आर्तहस्तप्रदो नित्यं प्रजा धर्मेण पालयन् । सत्यः सत्यानि कुरुते नित्यं यः सुखदर्शनः ॥
data.md: He should interfere for removing the sorrows of the distressed, and should always rightcously cherish and protect his subjects. He should be truthful, and do all true works, and seek happiness in conduct like this.

data.v: धर्मदण्डो न निर्दण्डो धर्मकार्यानुशासकः । यन्त्रितः कार्यकरणे षड्भागकृतलक्षणः ॥
data.md: He should administer proper punishments, without laying aside the rod of punishment for good. He should induce men to do righteous deeds. Guided by considerations of policy, he should take a sixth of the produce of the fields.

data.v: ग्राम्यधर्मान्न सेवेत स्वच्छन्देनार्थकोविदः । ऋतुकाले तु धर्मात्मा पत्नीं सेवेत नित्यदा ॥
data.md: He should never indulge in sexual pleasure, but live cheerfully and independently, wellconversant with the science of Wealth or Profit. Of righteous soul, he should seek his married with only in her season.

data.v: सर्वोपवासी नियतः स्वाध्यायपरमः शुचिः । बर्हिष्कान्तरिते नित्यं शयानोऽग्निगृहे सदा ॥
data.md: He should always observe fasts, keep his soul under restraint, devote himself to the study of the Vedas, and be pure in body and mind, He should sleep on blades of Kusha grass spread out in his fired chamber.

data.v: सर्वातिथ्यं त्रिवर्गस्य कुर्वाणः सुमनाः सदा । शूद्राणां चान्नकामानां नित्यं सिद्धमिति ब्रुवन् ॥
data.md: He should pursue the three-fold objects of life, and be always cheerful. He should always say "it is ready” to Shudras desirous of food.

data.v: स्वार्थाद्वा यदि वा कामान्न किंचिदुपलक्षयेत् । पितृदेवातिथिकृते साधनं कुरुते च यः ॥
data.md: He should never wish for anything from motives of gain or pleasure. He should adore the ancestors and gods and guests.

data.v: स्ववेश्मनि यथान्यायमुपास्ते भैक्षमेव च । त्रिकालमग्निहोत्रं च जुह्वानो वै यथाविधि ॥
data.md: In his own house he should live the life of a mendicant. He should duly worship the deities in his Agnihotra, morning, noon, and evening every day, by pouring libations according to the ordinance.

data.v: गोब्राह्मणहितार्थाय रणे चाभिमुखो हतः । त्रेताग्निमन्त्रपूतं वा समाविश्य द्विजो भवेत् ॥
data.md: With his face turned towards the enemy, he should renounce his life-breaths in battle fought for the behoof of kine and Brahmanas. Or he may enter the three fires sanctified with Mantras and renounce his body. By doing all this he is born in his next life as a Brahmana.

data.v: ज्ञानविज्ञानसंपन्नः संस्कृतो वेदपारगः । विप्रो भवति धर्मात्मा क्षत्रियः स्वेन कर्मणा ॥
data.md: Gifted with knowledge and science, purified from all dross, and fully conversant with the Vedas, a pious Kshatriya, by his own deeds, becomes, a Brahmana.

data.v: एतैः कर्मफलैर्देवि न्यूनजातिकुलोद्भवः । शूद्रोऽप्यागमसंपन्नो द्विजो भवति संस्कृतः ॥
data.md: It is with the help of these deeds, goddess, that a person who has originated from a dreaded caste, viz., a Shudra, may become a Brahmana purged off of all sins and possessed of Vedic learning.

data.v: ब्राह्मणो वाप्यसद्वृत्तः सर्वसंकरभोजनः । ब्राह्मण्यं पुण्यमुत्सृज्य शूद्रो भवति तादृशः ॥
data.md: One who is a Brahmana, when he becomes wicked in conduct and observes no distinction about food, falls away from the status of Brahmanahood and becomes a Shudra.

data.v: कर्मभिः शुचिभिर्देवि शुद्धात्मा विजितेन्द्रियः । शूद्रोऽपि द्विजवत्सेव्य इति ब्रह्माब्रवीत्स्वयम् ॥
data.md: Even a Shudra, O goddess, who has purified his soul by pure deeds and who has controlled all his senses, deserves to be waited upon and served with respect as a Brahmana. This has been said by the SelfCreate Brahman himself.

data.v: स्वभावकर्म च शुभं यत्र शूद्रेऽपि तिष्ठति । विशुद्धः स द्विजातिर्वै विज्ञेय इति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: When a pious nature and pious deeds are seen in even a Shudra, he should, according to my opinion, be held supcrior to a person of the three twiceborn classes.

data.v: न योनिर्नापि संस्कारो न श्रुतं न च संनतिः । कारणानि द्विजत्वस्य वृत्तमेव तु कारणम् ॥
data.md: Neither birth, nor the purificatory rites, nor learning, nor offspring, can be considered as grounds for conferring upon one the dignity of a twiceborn person Indeed, conduct is the only ground.

data.v: सर्वोऽयं ब्राह्मणो लोके वृत्तेन तु विधीयते । वृत्ते स्थितश्च सुश्रोणि ब्राह्मणत्वं निगच्छति ॥
data.md: All Brahmanas in this world are Brahmanas on account of conduct. A Shudra, if he is of good conduct, is considered as equal to a B-ahmana.

data.v: ब्राह्मः स्वभावः कल्याणि समः सर्वत्र मे मतिः । निर्गुणं निर्मलं ब्रह्म यत्र तिष्ठति स द्विजः ॥
data.md: The position of Brahma, O auspicious lady, is equal wherever it exists. This is my opinion. He, indeed, is a Brahmana in whom the dignity of Brahman exists, that condition which is bereft of qualities and which has no stain attached to it.

data.v: एते योनिफला देवि स्थानभागनिदर्शकाः । स्वयं च वरदेनोक्ता ब्रह्मणा सृजता प्रजाः ॥
data.md: The boongiving Brahman, while he created all creatures, himself said that the division of human beings into the four orders as dependant on birth is only for purposes of classification.

data.v: ब्राह्मणो हि महत्क्षेत्रं लोके चरति पादवत् । यत्तत्र बीजं वपति सा कृषिः पारलौकिकी ॥
data.md: The Brahmana is a great field in this world, a field having feet, for it moves from place to place. He who plants seeds in that field, O beautiful lady, reaps the corps in the next world.

data.v: मिताशिना सदा भाव्यं सत्पथालम्बिना सदा । ब्राह्ममार्गमतिक्रम्य वर्तितव्यं बुभूषता ॥
data.md: That Brahmana who wishes to secure his own good, should always live upon the remains of the food that may remain in his house after satisfying the need of all others. He should always follow the path of virtue. Indeed, he should tread along the path of Brahma.

data.v: संहिताध्यायिना भाव्यं गृहे वै गृहमेधिना । नित्यं स्वाध्याययुक्तेन दानाध्ययनजीविना ॥
data.md: He should live, engaged in the study of the Samhitas, and remaining at home he should perform all the duties of a householder. He should always be given to the study of the Vedas, but be should never derive the means of livelihood from such study.

data.v: एवंभूतो हि यो विप्रः सततं सत्पथे स्थितः । आहिताग्निरधीयानो ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥
data.md: That Brahmana who always acts thus, following the path of virtue, adoring his sacred fire, and engaged in the study of the Vedas, comes to be considered as Brahma.

data.v: ब्राह्मण्यमेव संप्राप्य रक्षितव्यं यतात्मभिः । योनिप्रतिग्रहादानैः कर्मभिश्च शुचिस्मिते ॥
data.md: Having acquired the position of a Brahinana, it should always be protected with care, O you of sweet smiles, by avoiding the stain of contact with persons born in inferior castes, by abstaining from the acceptance of gifts, and by other acts laid down in the scriptures.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यथा शूद्रो भवेद्द्विजः । ब्राह्मणो वा च्युतो धर्माद्यथा शूद्रत्वमाप्नुते ॥
data.md: I have thus told you a mystery, viz., the manner in which a Shudra may become a Brahmana, or that by which a Brahmana falls away from his own pure position and becomes a Shudra,

data.v: भगवन्सर्वभूतेश सुरासुरनमस्कृत । धर्माधर्मे नृणां देव ब्रूहि मे संशयं विभो ॥
data.md: Uma said O Holy One, O lord of all beings, O you adored of deities and Asuras equally, tell me what are the duties and derelictions of men. Indeed, O powerful one, remove my doubts.

data.v: कर्मणा मनसा वाचा त्रिविधं हि नरः सदा । बध्यते बन्धनैः पाशैर्मुच्यतेऽप्यथ वा पुनः ॥
data.md: It is by these three, viz., thought, word, and deed, that men become fettered with bonds. It is by the same three that they become freed from these fetters.

data.v: केन शीलेन वा देव कर्मणा कीदृशेन वा । समाचारैर्गुणैर्वाक्यैः स्वर्गं यान्तीह मानवाः ॥
data.md: By following what conduct, Ogod, indeed, by what kind of acts, by what behaviour and qualities and words, do men succeed in ascending to Heaven?

data.v: देवि धर्मार्थतत्त्वज्ञे सत्यनित्ये दमे रते । सर्वप्राणिहितः प्रश्नः श्रूयतां बुद्धिवर्धनः ॥
data.md: The God of Gods said O goddess, you are well conversant with the true meaning of duties. You are ever devoted to Virtue and Self-control. The question you have asked me is fraught with the benefit of all creatures. It increases the intelligence of all persons. Do you, therefore, listen to the answer.

data.v: सत्यधर्मरताः सन्तः सर्वलिप्साविवर्जिताः । नाधर्मेण न धर्मेण बध्यन्ते छिन्नसंशयाः ॥
data.md: Those persons who are devoted to the Religion of Truth, who are righteous and destitute of the indications of the several modes of life, and who enjoy the wealth acquired by fair means, succeeds in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: प्रलयोत्पत्तितत्त्वज्ञाः सर्वज्ञाः समदर्शिनः । वीतरागा विमुच्यन्ते पुरुषाः सर्वबन्धनैः ॥
data.md: Those men who are freed froin all doubts, who are gifted with omniscience, and who have eyes for seeing all things, are never fettered by either virtue or sin. Those men who are shorn of all attachments, can never be fettered by the chains of action.

data.v: कर्मणा मनसा वाचा ये न हिंसन्ति किंचन । ये न सज्जन्ति कस्मिंश्चिद्बध्यन्ते ते न कर्मभिः ॥
data.md: They who never injure others in thoughts, word, or deed, and who never attach themselves to anything, can never be fettered by deeds.

data.v: प्राणातिपाताद्विरताः शीलवन्तो दयान्विताः । तुल्यद्वेष्यप्रिया दान्ता मुच्यन्ते कर्मबन्धनैः ॥
data.md: They who abstain from kiiling any creature, who are gifted with righteous conduct, who have mercy, who treat friends and foes equally, and who are self-controlled, can never be fettered by acts.

data.v: सर्वभूतदयावन्तो विश्वास्याः सर्वजन्तुषु । त्यक्तहिंसासमाचारास्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who are gifted with mercy towards all beings, who succeed in creating the confidence of all living creatures, and who men have shaken off malice in their conduct, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: परस्वे निर्ममा नित्यं परदारविवर्जकाः । धर्मलब्धार्थभोक्तारस्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those persons who are devoted to the Religion of Truth, who are righteous and destitute of the indications of the several modes of life, and who enjoy the wealth acquired by fair means, succeeds in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: मातृवत्स्वसृवच्चैव नित्यं दुहितृवच्च ये । परदारेषु वर्तन्ते ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who treat the wives of other people as their own mothers and sisters and daughters, succeed in attaining to Heaven.

data.v: स्तैन्यान्निवृत्ताः सततं संतुष्टाः स्वधनेन च । स्वभाग्यान्युपजीवन्ति ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those who abstain from misappropriating others' things, who are perfectly contented with what they themselves possess, and who live depending upon their own destiny, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: स्वदारनिरता ये च ऋतुकालाभिगामिनः । अग्राम्यसुखभोगाश्च ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who never know other peoples' wives, who are masters of their senses, and who are given to righteous conduct, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: परदारेषु ये नित्यं चारित्रावृतलोचनाः । यतेन्द्रियाः शीलपरास्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: This is the path, created by the gods, that the pious should follow. This is the path, freed from passion and aversion, sanctioned for the pious to follow.

data.v: एष देवकृतो मार्गः सेवितव्यः सदा नरैः । अकषायकृतश्चैव मार्गः सेव्यः सदा बुधैः ॥
data.md: Those men who are devoted to their own wives and who seek them in only their seasons, and who do not indulge in sexual pleasure, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: दानधर्मतपोयुक्तः शीलशौचदयात्मकः । वृत्त्यर्थं धर्महेतोर्वा सेवितव्यः सदा नरैः । स्वर्गवासमभीप्सद्भिर्न सेव्यस्त्वत उत्तरः ॥
data.md: For the sake of multiplying their merit or for acquiring their means of livelihood, the wise should follow charity, penances and purity of both body and mind. Those who wish to ascend to Heaven, should follow in this tract and not any other.

data.v: वाचाथ बध्यते येन मुच्यतेऽप्यथ वा पुनः । तानि कर्माणि मे देव वद भूतपतेऽनघ ॥
data.md: Uma said Tell me, O illustrious-god, O sinless lord of all creatures, what are those words by which one becomes fettered and what are those words by speaking which one may be freed from fetters.

data.v: आत्महेतोः परार्थे वा नर्महास्याश्रयात्तथा । ये मृषा न वदन्तीह ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Maheshvara said Those men who never tell falschood for either themselves or for others, or in jest or for exciting laughter, succeed in ascending Heaven.

data.v: वृत्त्यर्थं धर्महेतोर्वा कामकारात्तथैव च । अनृतं ये न भाषन्ते ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: They who never tell lies for acquiring their livelihood or for acquiring merit or through mere caprice, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: श्लक्ष्णां वाणीं निराबाधां मधुरां पापवर्जिताम् । स्वागतेनाभिभाषन्ते ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: They who utter words which are smooth and sweet and faultless, and who with sincerity welcome all whom they meet with, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: कटुकां ये न भाषन्ते परुषां निष्ठुरां गिरम् । अपैशुन्यरताः सन्तस्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: They who never utter words which are harsh, bitter and cruel, and who are free from deceitfulness and evil of every kind, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: पिशुनां ये न भाषन्ते मित्रभेदकरीं गिरम् । ऋतां मैत्रीं प्रभाषन्ते ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who never utter deceitful words which create disunion between friends and who always speak what is true and what promotes good feelings, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: वर्जयन्ति सदा सूच्यं परद्रोहं च मानवाः । सर्वभूतसमा दान्तास्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who avoid harsh words and abstains from quarrels with others, who are equal in their conduct to all creatures, and who have governed their souls, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: शठप्रलापाद्विरता विरुद्धपरिवर्जकाः । सौम्यप्रलापिनो नित्यं ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: They who abstain from evil speech or sinful conversation, who avoid disagreeable speeches, and who utter only auspicious and agreeable words, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: न कोपाद्व्याहरन्ते ये वाचं हृदयदारणीम् । सान्त्वं वदन्ति क्रुद्धापि ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: They who never utter, under anger, such words as cut others to the quick, and who, even when under the influence of anger, speak words what are peaceful and agreeable, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: एष वाणीकृतो देवि धर्मः सेव्यः सदा नरैः । शुभः सत्यगुणो नित्यं वर्जनीया मृषा बुधैः ॥
data.md: This religion, O goddess of speech, should always be followed by men. It is auspicious and characterised by Truth. The wise should always avoid untruth.

data.v: मनसा बध्यते येन कर्मणा पुरुषः सदा । तन्मे ब्रूहि महाभाग देवदेव पिनाकधृक् ॥
data.md: Uma said Tell me, O god of gods, O holder of Pinaka, O you who are highly blessed, what those thoughts are by which a person may be fettered.

data.v: मानसेनेह धर्मेण संयुक्ताः पुरुषाः सदा । स्वर्गं गच्छन्ति कल्याणि तन्मे कीर्तयतः शृणु ॥
data.md: Maheshvara said Gifted with merit that originates from mental acts, O goddess, one ascends to Heaven. Listen to me, O auspicious one, as I recite to you what those acts are.

data.v: दुष्प्रणीतेन मनसा दुष्प्रणीततराकृतिः । बध्यते मानवो येन शृणु चान्यच्छुभानने ॥
data.md: Listen to me, Oyou of sweet face, how also a mind of illregulated features, becomes fettered by illregulated or evil thoughts.

data.v: अरण्ये विजने न्यस्तं परस्वं वीक्ष्य ये नराः । मनसापि न हिंसन्ति ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who do not seek, even mentally, to take other peoples things even when they lie in a lone forest, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: ग्रामे गृहे वा यद्द्रव्यं पारक्यं विजने स्थितम् । नाभिनन्दन्ति वै नित्यं ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those who not others' belongings, even when they see it lying in a house or a village that has been deserted, ascend to Heaven.

data.v: तथैव परदारान्ये कामवृत्तान्रहोगतान् । मनसापि न हिंसन्ति ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who do not seek, even mentally, to associate with the married wives of others, even when they see them in deserted places and under the influence of desire, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: शत्रुं मित्रं च ये नित्यं तुल्येन मनसा नराः । भजन्ति मैत्राः संगम्य ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who, meeting with friends or enemies behave in the same friendly way towards all, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: श्रुतवन्तो दयावन्तः शुचयः सत्यसंगराः । स्वैरर्थैः परिसंतुष्टास्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who are possessed of learning and mercy, who are pure in body and mind, men care who are firm in truth, and who are contented with what belongs to them, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: अवैरा ये त्वनायासा मैत्रचित्तपराः सदा । सर्वभूतदयावन्तस्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who do not bear illwell to any creature, who do not stand in need of labour for their livelihood, who bear friendly hearts towards all beings, and who entertain mercy towards all, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: श्रद्धावन्तो दयावन्तश्चोक्षाश्चोक्षजनप्रियाः । धर्माधर्मविदो नित्यं ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who have faith, who have mercy, who are holy, who scek the company of holy men, and who know the distinctions between right and wrong, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: शुभानामशुभानां च कर्मणां फलसंचये । विपाकज्ञाश्च ये देवि ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men, O goddess, who know the consequences of good and bad deeds, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: न्यायोपेता गुणोपेता देवद्विजपराः सदा । समतां समनुप्राप्तास्ते नराः स्वर्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who are just in all their dealings, who have desirable accomplishinents, who are devoted to the deities and the Brahmanas, and who are persevering in doing all good acts, succeed in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: शुभैः कर्मफलैर्देवि मयैते परिकीर्तिताः । स्वर्गमार्गोपगा भूयः किमन्यच्छ्रोतुमिच्छसि ॥
data.md: All these me, O goddess, succeed in ascending to Heaven through the meritorious results of their deeds. What else do you wish to hear?

data.v: महान्मे संशयः कश्चिन्मर्त्यान्प्रति महेश्वर । तस्मात्तं नैपुणेनाद्य ममाख्यातुं त्वमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Uma said I have a great doubt, O Maheshvara, on a subject about human beings. You should explain it to me carefully.

data.v: केनायुर्लभते दीर्घं कर्मणा पुरुषः प्रभो । तपसा वापि देवेश केनायुर्लभते महत् ॥
data.md: By what deeds does a man succeed, O powerful deity, in acquiring a long life? By what penances also does one acquire a long life?

data.v: क्षीणायुः केन भवति कर्मणा भुवि मानवः । विपाकं कर्मणां देव वक्तुमर्हस्यनिन्दित ॥
data.md: By what acts does one become shortlived on Earth? O you who are perfectly stainless, you should tell me what are the consequences of acts.

data.v: अपरे च महाभोगा मन्दभोगास्तथापरे । अकुलीनास्तथा चान्ये कुलीनाश्च तथापरे ॥
data.md: Some have great good fortune and some suffer from misfortune. Some are possessed of noble, and some are of ignoble, birth.

data.v: दुर्दर्शाः केचिदाभान्ति नराः काष्ठमया इव । प्रियदर्शास्तथा चान्ये दर्शनादेव मानवाः ॥
data.md: Some have such repulsive features as if they are made of wood, while others look very handsome at even the first sight.

data.v: दुष्प्रज्ञाः केचिदाभान्ति केचिदाभान्ति पण्डिताः । महाप्रज्ञास्तथैवान्ये ज्ञानविज्ञानदर्शिनः ॥
data.md: Some appear to have no wisdom, while others are possessed of it. Some, again, are seen gifted with high intelligence and wisdom, enlightened by knowledge and science.

data.v: अल्पाबाधास्तथा केचिन्महाबाधास्तथापरे । दृश्यन्ते पुरुषा देव तन्मे शंसितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Some have to suffer little pain, while others there are that are loaded with heavy calamities. Such diverse sights are seen of men. O illustrious one, you should tell me the reason of all this!

data.v: हन्त तेऽहं प्रवक्ष्यामि देवि कर्मफलोदयम् । मर्त्यलोके नराः सर्वे येन स्वं भुञ्जते फलम् ॥
data.md: The God of Gods said Indeed, O goddess, I shall describe to you the fruits of acts. It is by them that all human beings in this world enjoy or suffer the consequences of their acts.

data.md: One who, having sunk in Hell, rises therefrom, takes birth as a shortlived man.

data.md: The man who is cruel, goes to Hell, while he who is merciful, ascends to Hcaven. The man who goes to Hell, has to suffer great misery.

data.md: If such a person is ever born in the world of men, he becomes longlived and enjoys great happiness.

data.v: एवं दीर्घायुषां मार्गः सुवृत्तानां सुकर्मणाम् । प्राणिहिंसाविमोक्षेण ब्रह्मणा समुदीरितः ॥
data.md: This is the way of those who are uf righteous conduct and righteous deeds, and who are blessed with longevity, the way that was marked out by the SelfCreate Brahman himself and which is marked by abstention from the destruction of living creatures.

data.v: किंशीलाः किंसमाचाराः पुरुषाः कैश्च कर्मभिः । स्वर्गं समभिपद्यन्ते संप्रदानेन केन वा ॥
data.md: Uma said By what nature, what conduct, what deeds, and what gifts, does a man succeed in attaining to Heaven.

data.md: He lives there for a long time, enjoying various kinds of superior articles. Passing his time happily in the company of the Apsaras, he sports in the garden of Nandana and other delightful regions.

data.v: तस्मात्स्वर्गाच्च्युतो लोकान्मानुषेषूपजायते । महाभोगे कुले देवि धनधान्यसमाचिते ॥
data.md: After the exhaustion of his merits he falls down from the celestial region and takes birth in the order of humanity, in a rich family, O goddess, which has a large command of every article of enjoyment.

data.v: तत्र कामगुणैः सर्वैः समुपेतो मुदा युतः । महाभोगो महाकोशो धनी भवति मानवः ॥
data.md: In that life he gets all articles for gratifying his wishes and appetites. Indeed, blessed with the possession of such articles, he gets riches and a wellfilled treasury.

data.v: एते देवि महाभोगाः प्राणिनो दानशीलिनः । ब्रह्मणा वै पुरा प्रोक्ताः सर्वस्य प्रियदर्शनाः ॥
data.md: The SelfCreate Brahman himself declared it formerly that it is even such persons, O goddess, who become highly blessed and possessed of liberal dispositions and handsome features.

data.v: अपरे मानवा देवि प्रदानकृपणा द्विजैः । याचिता न प्रयच्छन्ति विद्यमानेऽप्यबुद्धयः ॥
data.md: There are others, O goddess, who are incapable of making gifts, Gifted with small understandings. They cannot make gifts even when solicited by Brahmanas and possessed of immense riches.

data.v: दीनान्धकृपणान्दृष्ट्वा भिक्षुकानतिथीनपि । याच्यमाना निवर्तन्ते जिह्वालोभसमन्विताः ॥
data.md: Seeing the destitute, the blind, the distressed, and mendicants, and even guests arrived at their houses, those persons always filled with the desire of pleasing the organ of taste, turn away, even when expressly solicited by them.

data.v: न धनानि न वासांसि न भोगान्न च काञ्चनम् । न गावो नान्नविकृतिं प्रयच्छन्ति कदाचन ॥
data.md: They never make gifts of wealth or dresses, or viands, or gold, or kine, or any kind of food. Those men who are disinclined to relieve the distress of others, who are full of cupidity, who have no faith in the scriptures, and who do not make gifts. Verily, these of little understanding, O goddess, have to sink in Hell.

data.v: अप्रवृत्तास्तु ये लुब्धा नास्तिका दानवर्जिताः । एवंभूता नरा देवि निरयं यान्त्यबुद्धयः ॥
data.md: They never make gifts of wealth or dresses, or viands, or gold, or kine, or any kind of food. Those men who are disinclined to relieve the distress of others, who are full of cupidity, who have no faith in the scriptures, and who do not make gifts. Verily, these of little understanding, O goddess, have to sink in Hell.

data.v: ते चेन्मनुष्यतां यान्ति यदा कालस्य पर्ययात् । धनरिक्ते कुले जन्म लभन्ते स्वल्पबुद्धयः ॥
data.md: In course of time, when their sufferings in Hell, terminate they take birth in the order of humanity, in poor families.

data.v: क्षुत्पिपासापरीताश्च सर्वभोगबहिष्कृताः । निराशाः सर्वभोगेभ्यो जीवन्त्यधमजीविकाम् ॥
data.md: Always suffering from hunger and thirst, excluded from all decent society, hopeless of ever enjoying all goodly things, they lead wretched lives.

data.v: अल्पभोगकुले जाता अल्पभोगरता नराः । अनेन कर्मणा देवि भवन्त्यधनिनो नराः ॥
data.md: Born in families which are destitute of all articles of enjoyment, these men never succeed in enjoying the goodly things of Earth. Indeed, O goddess, it is through deeds that persons become wretched and poor.

data.v: अपरे स्तम्भिनो नित्यं मानिनः पापतो रताः । आसनार्हस्य ये पीठं न प्रयच्छन्त्यचेतसः ॥
data.md: There are others who are arrogant and proud for the possession of riches. Those senseless wretches never offer seats to worthy persons.

data.v: मार्गार्हस्य च ये मार्गं न यच्छन्त्यल्पबुद्धयः । पाद्यार्हस्य च ये पाद्यं न ददत्यल्पबुद्धयः ॥
data.md: Gifted with little understanding, they do not give way to them who deserve such an honour. Nor do they give water for washing the feet to persons to whom it should be given.

data.v: अर्घार्हान्न च सत्कारैरर्चयन्ति यथाविधि । अर्घ्यमाचमनीयं वा न यच्छन्त्यल्पबुद्धयः ॥
data.md: Indeed, they do not honour, according to the ordinance, with gifts of the Arghya, such persons as deserve to be honoured therewith. They do not offer water for washing the mouth to such as deserve to have that honour.

data.v: गुरुं चाभिगतं प्रेम्णा गुरुवन्न बुभूषते । अभिमानप्रवृत्तेन लोभेन समवस्थिताः ॥
data.md: They do not treat their very preceptors, when the latter arrive at their houses, in the manner in which preceptors should be treated. Living in cupidity and pride, they refuse to treat their elders and aged men with love and affection, even insulting those who deserve to be honoured and asserting their superiority over them without showing reverence and humility. Such men, O goddess, sink in Hell.

data.v: संमान्यांश्चावमन्यन्ते वृद्धान्परिभवन्ति च । एवंविधा नरा देवि सर्वे निरयगामिनः ॥
data.md: They do not treat their very preceptors, when the latter arrive at their houses, in the manner in which preceptors should be treated. Living in cupidity and pride, they refuse to treat their elders and aged men with love and affection, even insulting those who deserve to be honoured and asserting their superiority over them without showing reverence and humility. Such men, O goddess, sink in Hell.

data.v: ते वै यदि नरास्तस्मान्निरयादुत्तरन्ति वै । वर्षपूगैस्ततो जन्म लभन्ते कुत्सिते कुले ॥
data.md: When their sufferings terminate after many years, they rise from Hell and take birth as men, in low and wretched families.

data.md: Indeed, they who humiliate their preceptors and seniors, have to take birth in such castes as those of Svapakas and Pukkasas who are greatly vile and bereft of intelligence.

data.md: In that life he gets all articles of enjoyment in profusion and jewels and gems and every kind of riches in abundance. He gives to worthy persons what they deserve. He performs every duty and every act of virtuc.

data.v: संमतः सर्वभूतानां सर्वलोकनमस्कृतः । स्वकर्मफलमाप्नोति स्वयमेव नरः सदा ॥
data.md: Honoured of all creatures and receiving their respect, he obtains the fruits of his own deeds.

data.v: उदात्तकुलजातीय उदात्ताभिजनः सदा । एष धर्मो मया प्रोक्तो विधात्रा स्वयमीरितः ॥
data.md: Even such a person acquires a high birth in this world. This that I have recited to you, was said by the Ordainer (Brahman) himself formerly.

स चेन्मानुषतां गच्छेद्यदि कालस्य पर्ययात् । बह्वाबाधपरिक्लिष्टे सोऽधमे जायते कुले ॥
data.md: If in course of time he is born as man in a low and wretched family which meets with obstacles of every kind on every side.

data.v: लोकद्वेष्योऽधमः पुंसां स्वयं कर्मकृतैः फलैः । एष देवि मनुष्येषु बोद्धव्यो ज्ञातिबन्धुषु ॥
data.md: He is hated by all. A wretch among men, he becomes so for his own deeds.

data.v: अपरः सर्वभूतानि दयावाननुपश्यति । मैत्रदृष्टिः पितृसमो निर्वैरो नियतेन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: Another, who is possessed of mercy, casts his (beings) eye on all creatures. Gifted with a friendly vision, treating all creatures as if he were their father, shorn of every hostile feeling, with all his passions under complete restraint, he never vexes any creature and never fills them with fear by means of his hands or feet which are always under his control. He inspires the confidence of all beings.

data.v: नोद्वेजयति भूतानि न विहिंसयते तथा । हस्तपादैः सुनियतैर्विश्वास्यः सर्वजन्तुषु ॥
न रज्ज्वा न च दण्डेन न लोष्टैर्नायुधेन च । उद्वेजयति भूतानि श्लक्ष्णकर्मा दयापरः ॥
data.md: He never afflicts any creature with either cords or clubs or brickbats or clods of hard earth or weapons of any sort. His deeds are never fierce or cruel, and he is full of mercy.

data.v: एवंशीलसमाचारः स्वर्गे समुपजायते । तत्रासौ भवने दिव्ये मुदा वसति देववत् ॥
data.md: One who is given to such practices and conduct, certainly ascends to Heaven. There he lives like a god in a celestial palace full of comfort.

data.v: स चेत्कर्मक्षयान्मर्त्यो मनुष्येषूपजायते । अल्पाबाधो निरीतीकः स जातः सुखमेधते ॥
data.md: If, upon the exhaustion of his merit, he has to take birth as a man, he becomes born as a man who has not to fight with difficulties of any kind or to meet with any fear. Indeed, he enjoys great happiness.

data.v: सुखभागी निरायासो निरुद्वेगः सदा नरः । एष देवि सतां मार्गो बाधा यत्र न विद्यते ॥
data.md: Happy and not compelled to work for his livelihood, he lives freed from every kind of anxiety. Even this, O goddess, is the path of the virtuous. In it there are no obstacles or afflictions.

data.v: इमे मनुष्या दृश्यन्ते ऊहापोहविशारदाः । ज्ञानविज्ञानसंपन्नाः प्रज्ञावन्तोऽर्थकोविदाः । दुष्प्रज्ञाश्चापरे देव ज्ञानविज्ञानवर्जिताः ॥
data.md: Uma said In the world some men are inasters of inferences and the premises leading to them. Indeed, they are masters of science and knowledge, have large progeny, and are gifted with learning and wisdom.

data.v: केन कर्मविपाकेन प्रज्ञावान्पुरुषो भवेत् । अल्पप्रज्ञो विरूपाक्ष कथं भवति मानवः । एतं मे संशयं छिन्द्धि सर्वधर्मविदां वर ॥
data.md: By what acis, again, docs one become of little wisdom and distorted vision? Do you remove this doubt of mine. O you who are the foremost of all beings knowing duties.

data.v: जात्यन्धाश्चापरे देव रोगार्ताश्चापरे तथा । नराः क्लीबाश्च दृश्यन्ते कारणं ब्रूहि तत्र वै ॥
data.md: Others there are, O god, who are blind from the moment of their birth. Others there are who are diseased and impotent. Do you, O god, tell me the reason of this.

data.v: ब्राह्मणान्वेदविदुषः सिद्धान्धर्मविदस्तथा । परिपृच्छन्त्यहरहः कुशलाकुशलं तथा ॥
वर्जयन्त्यशुभं कर्म सेवमानाः शुभं तथा । लभन्ते स्वर्गतिं नित्यमिह लोके सुखं तथा ॥
स चेन्मानुषतां याति मेधावी तत्र जायते । श्रुतं प्रज्ञानुगं चास्य कल्याणमुपजायते ॥
data.md: Indeed, upon the exhaustion of their merit, when they take their birth in the order of humanity, they become born as men endued with great intelligence. They enjoy every kind of happiness and auspiciousness on account of that intelligence with which they are born.

data.v: परदारेषु ये मूढाश्चक्षुर्दुष्टं प्रयुञ्जते । तेन दुष्टस्वभावेन जात्यन्धास्ते भवन्ति ह ॥
data.md: Those men of foolish understandings who cast wicked eyes upon the married wives of other men, become cursed with congenital blindness on account of that sinfulness of theirs.

data.v: मनसा तु प्रदुष्टेन नग्नां पश्यन्ति ये स्त्रियम् । रोगार्तास्ते भवन्तीह नरा दुष्कृतकर्मिणः ॥
data.md: Those men who, moved by desire in their hearts, cast their eyes on naked women, those men of wicked acts take birth in this world to pass their whole lives in one continuous disease.

data.v: ये तु मूढा दुराचारा वियोनौ मैथुने रताः । पुरुषेषु सुदुष्प्रज्ञाः क्लीबत्वमुपयान्ति ते ॥
data.md: Those men of foolish and wicked acts who indulge in sexual union with women of castes different from their own, those men of little wisdom, have to take birth in their next lives as persons shorn of the virility.

data.v: पशूंश्च ये बन्धयन्ति ये चैव गुरुतल्पगाः । प्रकीर्णमैथुना ये च क्लीबा जायन्ति ते नराः ॥
data.md: Those men who cause animals to be killed and those who violate the beds of their preceptors, and those who indulge in promiscuous intercourse have to take birth in their next lives as persons shorn of manhood.

data.v: सावद्यं किं नु वै कर्म निरवद्यं तथैव च । श्रेयः कुर्वन्नवाप्नोति मानवो देवसत्तम ॥
data.md: Uma said What deeds, O foremost of the celestials, are faulty, and what deeds are faultless? What, indeed, are those deeds by doing which a man succeeds in acquiring what is for your highest good?

data.v: श्रेयांसं मार्गमातिष्ठन्सदा यः पृच्छते द्विजान् । धर्मान्वेषी गुणाकाङ्क्षी स स्वर्गं समुपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: Maheshvara said That man who is desirous of determing what is righteousness, and who wishes to acquire prominent virtues and qualities, and who always puts questions to the Brahmanas with a view to find out the path leading to his highest good, succeeds in ascending to Heaven.

data.v: यदि मानुषतां देवि कदाचित्स निगच्छति । मेधावी धारणायुक्तः प्राज्ञस्तत्राभिजायते ॥
data.md: If, he is born as a man, he becomes gifted with intelligence and memory and great wisdom.

data.v: एष देवि सतां धर्मो मन्तव्यो भूतिकारकः । नृणां हितार्थाय तव मया वै समुदाहृतः ॥
data.md: This, O goddess, is the line of conduct that the pious are to follow and that is fraught with great good. I have told you of it for the behoof of human beings.

data.v: अपरे स्वल्पविज्ञाना धर्मविद्वेषिणो नराः । ब्राह्मणान्वेदविदुषो नेच्छन्ति परिसर्पितुम् ॥
data.md: Uma said There are men who hate virtue and who are gifted with little understandings. Thcy never wish to approach Brahmanas knowing the Vedas.

data.v: व्रतवन्तो नराः केचिच्छ्रद्धादमपरायणाः । अव्रता भ्रष्टनियमास्तथान्ये राक्षसोपमाः ॥
data.md: There are others who observe vows and who are given to the duty of performing Shraddhas. Others, again, are destitute of all vows. They do not care for observances and are like Rakshasas in conduct.

data.v: यज्वानश्च तथैवान्ये निर्होमाश्च तथापरे । केन कर्मविपाकेन भवन्तीह वदस्व मे ॥
data.md: Some there are who are given to the performance of sacrifices and some who do not care for Homa. For what deeds to men become possessed of these different natures.

data.v: आगमाल्लोकधर्माणां मर्यादाः पूर्वनिर्मिताः । प्रामाण्येनानुवर्तन्ते दृश्यन्ते हि दृढव्रताः ॥
data.md: Maheshvara said Through the Vedas, the limits have been laid out of all the acts of human beings. Those men who acts thus according to the authority of the Vedas, are seen to become devoted to the observance of vows.

data.v: अधर्मं धर्ममित्याहुर्ये च मोहवशं गताः । अव्रता नष्टमर्यादास्ते प्रोक्ता ब्रह्मराक्षसाः ॥
data.md: Those men, however who being influenced by folly accept unrighteousness for its reverse become destitute of vows, transgress all restraints, and come to be considered as Brahmarakshasas. Indeed, it is these men who do not care for Homa, who never utter the Vashat and other sacred Mantras, and who come to be considered as the lowest and vilest of men.

data.v: ते चेत्कालकृतोद्योगात्संभवन्तीह मानुषाः । निर्होमा निर्वषट्कारास्ते भवन्ति नराधमाः ॥
data.md: Those men, however who being influenced by folly accept unrighteousness for its reverse become destitute of vows, transgress all restraints, and come to be considered as Brahmarakshasas. Indeed, it is these men who do not care for Homa, who never utter the Vashat and other sacred Mantras, and who come to be considered as the lowest and vilest of men.

data.v: एष देवि मया सर्वः संशयच्छेदनाय ते । कुशलाकुशलो नॄणां व्याख्यातो धर्मसागरः ॥
data.md: Thus, O goddess, have I explained to you the entire ocean of duties of human beings for the sake of removing your doubts, not omitting the sins of which they become guilty.

data.v: परावरज्ञे धर्मज्ञे तपोवननिवासिनि । साध्वि सुभ्रु सुकेशान्ते हिमवत्पर्वतात्मजे ॥
data.md: Mahadeva said You, O goddess, know what is Supreme and what is not so. You know all duties, O you who love to live in the retreats of ascetics. You are gifted with every virtue, possessed of beautiful eyebrows, and hair ending in the fairest earls, O daughter of Himavat, the king of mountains.

data.v: दक्षे शमदमोपेते निर्ममे धर्मचारिणि । पृच्छामि त्वां वरारोहे पृष्टा वद ममेप्सितम् ॥
data.md: You are skilled in every work. You are gifted with self-control and look impartially towards all creatures. Divested of the senses of mineness, you are devoted to the practice of all the duties. O you of beautiful features, I wish to ask you (about something). I wish that, asked by me, you will describe to me that subject.

data.v: सावित्री ब्रह्मणः साध्वी कौशिकस्य शची सती । मार्तण्डजस्य धूमोर्णा ऋद्धिर्वैश्रवणस्य च ॥
data.md: Savitri is the chaste wife of Brahman. The caste Shachi is the wife of Indra. Dhumorna is the wife of Markandeya, and Riddhi of (king) Vaishravana.

data.v: वरुणस्य ततो गौरी सूर्यस्य च सुवर्चला । रोहिणी शशिनः साध्वी स्वाहा चैव विभावसोः ॥
data.md: Varuna has Gouri for his consort, and the Sun God has Suvarchala. Rohini is the chaste wife of Shashin, and Svaha of Vibhavasu.

data.v: अदितिः कश्यपस्याथ सर्वास्ताः पतिदेवताः । पृष्टाश्चोपासिताश्चैव तास्त्वया देवि नित्यशः ॥
data.md: Kashyapa has Aditi. All these consider their husbands as their gods. You have, O goddess, conversed and associated with all of them every day.

data.v: तेन त्वां परिपृच्छामि धर्मज्ञे धर्मवादिनि । स्त्रीधर्मं श्रोतुमिच्छामि त्वयोदाहृतमादितः ॥
data.md: It is, therefore, O you knowing every duty, that I wish to question you about the duties of women, you whose words are always consistent with righteousness. I wish to hear you describe that subject from the beginning.

data.v: सहधर्मचरी मे त्वं समशीला समव्रता । समानसारवीर्या च तपस्तीव्रं कृतं च ते । त्वया ह्युक्तो विशेषेण प्रमाणत्वमुपैष्यति ॥
data.md: You practice all the duties of virtue with me. Your conduct is exactly like mine, and the vows you observe are the same that are observed by me. Your power and energy are equal to mine, and you have practised the austerest penances.

data.v: स्त्रियश्चैव विशेषेण स्त्रीजनस्य गतिः सदा । गौर्गां गच्छति सुश्रोणि लोकेष्वेषा स्थितिः सदा ॥
data.md: Women, in especial, are the highest refuge of women. O you of beautiful hips, among human beings the course of conduct laid down by you will be followed from generation to generation.

data.v: मम चार्धं शरीरस्य मम चार्धाद्विनिःसृता । सुरकार्यकरी च त्वं लोकसंतानकारिणी ॥
data.md: Half of my body is made up of half your body. You are always engaged in doing the work of the celestials, and it is you are the cause of have peopling the Earth.

data.v: तव सर्वः सुविदितः स्त्रीधर्मः शाश्वतः शुभे । तस्मादशेषतो ब्रूहि स्त्रीधर्मं विस्तरेण मे ॥
data.md: O auspicious lady, you know all the eternal duties of women. Do you, therefore, tell me in full what the duties are of your sex.

data.v: भगवन्सर्वभूतेश भूतभव्यभवोद्भव । त्वत्प्रभावादियं देव वाक्चैव प्रतिभाति मे ॥
data.md: Uma said O holy one, O lord of all created things o source of all that is past, present, and future, it is through your favour that the words I am uttering are originating in my inind.

data.v: इमास्तु नद्यो देवेश सर्वतीर्थोदकैर्युताः । उपस्पर्शनहेतोस्त्वा समीपस्था उपासते ॥
data.md: All these Rivers (that are of my sex), O god of gods, having the waters of all the Tirthas, are approaching your presence for enabling you to perform your ablutions in them.

data.v: एताभिः सह संमन्त्र्य प्रवक्ष्याम्यनुपूर्वशः । प्रभवन्योऽनहंवादी स वै पुरुष उच्यते ॥
data.md: After consulting them I shall describe the subject in duc order. That person who, though capable, is still free from egotism, is rightly called a Purusha.

data.v: स्त्री च भूतेश सततं स्त्रियमेवानुधावति । मया संमानिताश्चैव भविष्यन्ति सरिद्वराः ॥
data.md: As for women, O lord of all beings, she follows persons of her sex. By consulting these foremost of Rivers, they will be honoured by me.

data.v: एषा सरस्वती पुण्या नदीनामुत्तमा नदी । प्रथमा सर्वसरितां नदी सागरगामिनी ॥
data.md: The sacred Sarasvati is the foremost river of all rivers. She goes towards the ocean and is truly the first of all rivers.

data.v: विपाशा च वितस्ता च चन्द्रभागा इरावती । शतद्रुर्देविका सिन्धुः कौशिकी गोमती तथा ॥
तथा देवनदी चेयं सर्वतीर्थाभिसंवृता । गगनाद्गां गता देवी गङ्गा सर्वसरिद्वरा ॥
इत्युक्त्वा देवदेवस्य पत्नी धर्मभृतां वरा । स्मितपूर्वमिवाभाष्य सर्वास्ताः सरितस्तदा ॥
अपृच्छद्देवमहिषी स्त्रीधर्मं धर्मवत्सला । स्त्रीधर्मकुशलास्ता वै गङ्गाद्याः सरितां वराः ॥
data.md: Indeed, the wife of the great god, devoted to the performance of all duties, questioned those individuals of her sex about the duties of women. Indeed, those foremost of rivers, having Ganga for their first all know the duties of women.

data.v: अयं भगवता दत्तः प्रश्नः स्त्रीधर्मसंश्रितः । तं तु संमन्त्र्य युष्माभिर्वक्तुमिच्छामि शंकरे ॥
data.md: Uma said The illustrious god has asked a question about the duties of women. I wish to answer Shankara after having consulted with you.

data.v: न चैकसाध्यं पश्यामि विज्ञानं भुवि कस्यचित् । दिवि वा सागरगमास्तेन वो मानयाम्यहम् ॥
data.md: I do not find any branch of knowledge on Earth or Heaven that is capable of being mastered by any individual without your hcip. You rivers that run towards the ocean, it is, therefore, that I seek your opinions.

data.v: एवं सर्वाः सरिच्छ्रेष्ठाः पृष्टाः पुण्यतमाः शिवाः । ततो देवनदी गङ्गा नियुक्ता प्रतिपूज्य ताम् ॥
data.md: It was in this way that those foremost of Rivers, all of whom were auspicious and highly sacred, were accosted by Shiva's wife. Then the celestial River Ganga, who adored the daughter of the king of mountains in return, was selected for answering the question,

data.v: बह्वीभिर्बुद्धिभिः स्फीता स्त्रीधर्मज्ञा शुचिस्मिता । शैलराजसुतां देवीं पुण्या पापापहां शिवाम् ॥
data.md: Indeed, she of sweet smiles is held as swelling with various kinds of understanding and well conversant with the duties of women. The sacred goddess capable of removing all fear of sin, gifted with humility in consequence of her intelligence, well acquainted with all duties, and endued with an exceedingly comprehensive intelligence sweetly smiling, uttered these words :

data.v: बुद्ध्या विनयसंपन्ना सर्वज्ञानविशारदा । सस्मितं बहुबुद्ध्याढ्या गङ्गा वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
धन्याः स्मोऽनुगृहीताः स्मो देवि धर्मपरायणा । या त्वं सर्वजगन्मान्या नदीर्मानयसेऽनघे ॥
data.md: O goddess, you are always given to the due performance of all duties. You have favored me highly by thus questioning me. O sinless one, you are honoured by the entire universe. yet you ask me that am but a River.

data.v: प्रभवन्पृच्छते यो हि संमानयति वा पुनः । नूनं जनमदुष्टात्मा पण्डिताख्यां स गच्छति ॥
data.md: That person who, though himself competent yet asks another, or who pays a graceful tribute to another certainly deserves, I think, to be considered as righteoussouled. Indeed, such a person deserves to be called learned and wise.

data.v: ज्ञानविज्ञानसंपन्नानूहापोहविशारदान् । प्रवक्तॄन्पृच्छते योऽन्यान्स वै ना पदमर्च्छति ॥
data.md: That person never falls into disgrace who asks such speakers as are gifted with knowledge and science and as are well conversant with premises and inferences.

data.v: अन्यथा बहुबुद्ध्याढ्यो वाक्यं वदति संसदि । अन्यथैव ह्यहंमानी दुर्बलं वदते वचः ॥
data.md: A proud man, even when gifted with intelligence, by speaking in the midst of an assembly otherwise, finds himself uttering only words of weak meaning.

data.v: दिव्यज्ञाने दिवि श्रेष्ठे दिव्यपुण्ये सदोत्थिते । त्वमेवार्हसि नो देवि स्त्रीधर्ममनुशासितुम् ॥
data.md: You are gifted with spiritual insight. You are the foremost of all the celestials. You have taken your rise accompanied by various kinds of excellent merit. You, O goddess are fully competent to describe the duties of women.

data.v: ततः साराधिता देवी गङ्गया बहुभिर्गुणैः । प्राह सर्वमशेषेण स्त्रीधर्मं सुरसुन्दरी ॥
data.md: In this way, the goddess Uma was adored by Ganga and honoured with the ascription of many high merits. The beautiful goddess, thus praised, then began to discourse upon all the duties of women in full.

data.v: स्त्रीधर्मो मां प्रति यथा प्रतिभाति यथाविधि । तमहं कीर्तयिष्यामि तथैव प्रथितो भवेत् ॥
data.md: Uma said I shall, according to the ordinance, describe the subject of women's duties as far as they are known to me. Do you all listen with rapt attention.

data.v: स्त्रीधर्मः पूर्व एवायं विवाहे बन्धुभिः कृतः । सहधर्मचरी भर्तुर्भवत्यग्निसमीपतः ॥
data.md: The duties of women begin when created by kinsmen in the rites of wedding. Indeed, woman becomes, in the presence of the nuptial fire, the companion of her husband in the performance of all righteous acts.

data.v: सुस्वभावा सुवचना सुवृत्ता सुखदर्शना । अनन्यचित्ता सुमुखी भर्तुः सा धर्मचारिणी ॥
सा भवेद्धर्मपरमा सा भवेद्धर्मभागिनी । देववत्सततं साध्वी या भर्तारं प्रपश्यति ॥
शुश्रूषां परिचारं च देववद्या करोति च । नान्यभावा ह्यविमनाः सुव्रता सुखदर्शना ॥
पुत्रवक्त्रमिवाभीक्ष्णं भर्तुर्वदनमीक्षते । या साध्वी नियताचारा सा भवेद्धर्मचारिणी ॥
श्रुत्वा दंपतिधर्मं वै सहधर्मकृतं शुभम् । अनन्यचित्ता सुमुखी भर्तुः सा धर्मचारिणी ॥
परुषाण्यपि चोक्ता या दृष्टा वा क्रूरचक्षुषा । सुप्रसन्नमुखी भर्तुर्या नारी सा पतिव्रता ॥
न चन्द्रसूर्यौ न तरुं पुंनाम्नो या निरीक्षते । भर्तृवर्जं वरारोहा सा भवेद्धर्मचारिणी ॥
दरिद्रं व्याधितं दीनमध्वना परिकर्शितम् । पतिं पुत्रमिवोपास्ते सा नारी धर्मभागिनी ॥
या नारी प्रयता दक्षा या नारी पुत्रिणी भवेत् । पतिप्रिया पतिप्राणा सा नारी धर्मभागिनी ॥
शुश्रूषां परिचर्यां च करोत्यविमनाः सदा । सुप्रतीता विनीता च सा नारी धर्मभागिनी ॥
न कामेषु न भोगेषु नैश्वर्ये न सुखे तथा । स्पृहा यस्या यथा पत्यौ सा नारी धर्मभागिनी ॥
कल्योत्थानरता नित्यं गुरुशुश्रूषणे रता । सुसंमृष्टक्षया चैव गोशकृत्कृतलेपना ॥
अग्निकार्यपरा नित्यं सदा पुष्पबलिप्रदा । देवतातिथिभृत्यानां निरुप्य पतिना सह ॥
शेषान्नमुपभुञ्जाना यथान्यायं यथाविधि । तुष्टपुष्टजना नित्यं नारी धर्मेण युज्यते ॥
श्वश्रूश्वशुरयोः पादौ तोषयन्ती गुणान्विता । मातापितृपरा नित्यं या नारी सा तपोधना ॥
data.md: That woman who is gifted with accomplishments, who salutes the feet of her father-in-law and mother-in-law, and who is always devoted to his father and mother, is considered as possessed of ascetic merit.

data.v: ब्राह्मणान्दुर्बलानाथान्दीनान्धकृपणांस्तथा । बिभर्त्यन्नेन या नारी सा पतिव्रतभागिनी ॥
data.md: That woman who supports with food Brahmanas who are weak and helpless, who are distressed or blind or destitute, comes to be considered as entitled to share the merits of her husband.

data.v: व्रतं चरति या नित्यं दुश्चरं लघुसत्त्वया । पतिचित्ता पतिहिता सा पतिव्रतभागिनी ॥
data.md: That woman who always observes, with a light heart, vows which are difficult of observance, whose heart is devoted to her husband, and who always seeks the behoof of her husband, is considered as entitled to share the merits of her husband.

data.v: पुण्यमेतत्तपश्चैव स्वर्गश्चैष सनातनः । या नारी भर्तृपरमा भवेद्भर्तृव्रता शिवा ॥
data.md: Devotion to her husband is woman's merit; it is her penance; it is her eternal Heaven. Merit, penances and Heaven become hers who considers her husband as her all in all, and who gifted with chastity, seeks to devote herself to her husband in all things.

data.v: पतिर्हि देवो नारीणां पतिर्बन्धुः पतिर्गतिः । पत्या समा गतिर्नास्ति दैवतं वा यथा पतिः ॥
data.md: The husband is the god which women have. The husband is their friend. The husband is their great refuge. Women have no refuge that can compare with their husband, and no god that can compare with him.

data.v: पतिप्रसादः स्वर्गो वा तुल्यो नार्या न वा भवेत् । अहं स्वर्गं न हीच्छेयं त्वय्यप्रीते महेश्वर ॥
data.md: A woman considers husband's grace and Heaven as equal; or, if unequal the inequality is very trivial. O Maheshvara 1 do not wish Heaven itself if you are not satisfied with me.

data.v: यद्यकार्यमधर्मं वा यदि वा प्राणनाशनम् । पतिर्ब्रूयाद्दरिद्रो वा व्याधितो वा कथंचन ॥
data.md: If the husband that is poor, or diseased or distressed, or fallen among enemies, or afflicted by a Brahmana's curse, were to command the wife to accomplish anything that is improper or unrighteous or that may bring on the destruction of life itself, the wife should, without any hesitation, accomplish it, guided by the code whose propriety is sanctioned by the Law of Distress.

data.v: आपन्नो रिपुसंस्थो वा ब्रह्मशापार्दितोऽपि वा । आपद्धर्माननुप्रेक्ष्य तत्कार्यमविशङ्कया ॥
data.md: If the husband that is poor, or diseased or distressed, or fallen among enemies, or afflicted by a Brahmana's curse, were to command the wife to accomplish anything that is improper or unrighteous or that may bring on the destruction of life itself, the wife should, without any hesitation, accomplish it, guided by the code whose propriety is sanctioned by the Law of Distress.

data.v: एष देव मया प्रोक्तः स्त्रीधर्मो वचनात्तव । या त्वेवंभाविनी नारी सा भवेद्धर्मभागिनी ॥
data.md: I have thus, O god, explained at your command, what the duties of women are. Indeed, that woman who acts thus, becomes entitled to a share of the merits acquired by her husband.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तु देवेशः प्रतिपूज्य गिरेः सुताम् । लोकान्विसर्जयामास सर्वैरनुचरैः सह ॥
data.md: Narada said Thus addressed, the great god highly spoke of the daughter of the king of mountains and then dismissed all persons who had assembled there, together with all his own attendants.

data.v: ततो ययुर्भूतगणाः सरितश्च यथागतम् । गन्धर्वाप्सरसश्चैव प्रणम्य शिरसा भवम् ॥
data.md: The various tribes of ghostly beings, as also all the embodied Rivers, and the Gandharvas and Apsaras, all bowed their heads to Mahadeva and departed for returning to the places whence they had come. The various tribes of ghostly beings, as also all the embodied Rivers, and the Gandharvas and Apsaras, all bowed their heads to Mahadeva and departed for returning to the places whence they had come.

data.v: श्रुत्वा धर्मानशेषेण पावनानि च सर्वशः । युधिष्ठिरः शांतनवं पुनरेवाभ्यभाषत ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having heard all the duties in full and all those sacred deeds and objects which purify human beings of their sins, Yudhishthira once inore addressed the son of Shantanu in the following words.

data.v: किमेकं दैवतं लोके किं वाप्येकं परायणम् । स्तुवन्तः कं कमर्चन्तः प्राप्नुयुर्मानवाः शुभम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Who may be said to be the One God in the world? Who may be said to be the One Object which is our only refuge? Who is He by adoring whom or singing whose praises human beings would get what is beneficial?

data.v: को धर्मः सर्वधर्माणां भवतः परमो मतः । किं जपन्मुच्यते जन्तुर्जन्मसंसारबन्धनात् ॥
data.md: What religion is that which, according to your judgment, is the foremost of all religions? What are those Mantras by reciting which a living creature becomes freed from the fetters of birth and life?

data.v: जगत्प्रभुं देवदेवमनन्तं पुरुषोत्तमम् । स्तुवन्नामसहस्रेण पुरुषः सततोत्थितः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said One should always, diligently and throwing away all idleness, sing the praises of that Lord of the universe, that God of gods, (viz., Vasudeva), who is Infinite and the foremost of all Beings, by uttering His thousand names.

data.v: तमेव चार्चयन्नित्यं भक्त्या पुरुषमव्ययम् । ध्यायन्स्तुवन्नमस्यंश्च यजमानस्तमेव च ॥
data.md: By always adoring with respect and devotion that immutable Being, by meditating on Him, by singing His praises, and bowing the head to Him, and by celebrating sacrifices to Him, indeed, by always praising Vishnu, who is without beginning and without end or destruction, who is the Supreme Lord of all the worlds, and who is the Master and Controller of the universe, one can succeed in getting over all sorrow.

data.v: अनादिनिधनं विष्णुं सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम् । लोकाध्यक्षं स्तुवन्नित्यं सर्वदुःखातिगो भवेत् ॥
data.md: By always adoring with respect and devotion that immutable Being, by meditating on Him, by singing His praises, and bowing the head to Him, and by celebrating sacrifices to Him, indeed, by always praising Vishnu, who is without beginning and without end or destruction, who is the Supreme Lord of all the worlds, and who is the Master and Controller of the universe, one can succeed in getting over all sorrow.

data.v: ब्रह्मण्यं सर्वधर्मज्ञं लोकानां कीर्तिवर्धनम् । लोकनाथं महद्भूतं सर्वभूतभवोद्भवम् ॥
data.md: Indeed, He is devoted to the Brahmanas, knowing all duties and practices, the enhancer of the fame and achievements of all persons, the Lord of all the worlds, highly wonderful, and the prime cause of the origin of all creatures.

data.v: एष मे सर्वधर्माणां धर्मोऽधिकतमो मतः । यद्भक्त्या पुण्डरीकाक्षं स्तवैरर्चेन्नरः सदा ॥
data.md: This, in my judgment, is the foremost religion of all religions, viz., one should always adore and sing the praises of the lotus-eyed Vasudeva with devotion.

data.v: परमं यो महत्तेजः परमं यो महत्तपः । परमं यो महद्ब्रह्म परमं यः परायणम् ॥
data.md: He is the highest Energy. He is the highest Penance. He is the highest Brahma. He is the highest Refuge.

data.v: पवित्राणां पवित्रं यो मङ्गलानां च मङ्गलम् । दैवतं देवतानां च भूतानां योऽव्ययः पिता ॥
data.md: He is the most Holy of all holies, the most sacred of all sacred objects. He is the God of all the gods, and He is the immutabie Father of all creatures.

data.v: यतः सर्वाणि भूतानि भवन्त्यादियुगागमे । यस्मिंश्च प्रलयं यान्ति पुनरेव युगक्षये ॥
data.md: On the advent of the primitive cycle, all creatures originate from Him. On the expiration, again of the cycle, all things disappear in Him.

data.v: तस्य लोकप्रधानस्य जगन्नाथस्य भूपते । विष्णोर्नामसहस्रं मे शृणु पापभयापहम् ॥
data.md: Hear, O king, the thousand names, highly efficacious in dissipating sins, of that Foremost One in all the worlds, that Master of the universe, viz., Vishnu.

data.v: यानि नामानि गौणानि विख्यातानि महात्मनः । ऋषिभिः परिगीतानि तानि वक्ष्यामि भूतये ॥
data.md: All those names, derived from His attributes, secret and wellknown, of the great Vasudeva, which were sung by the Rishis, I shall recite to you for the good of all.

data.v: विश्वं विष्णुर्वषट्कारो भूतभव्यभवत्प्रभुः । भूतकृद्भूतभृद्भावो भूतात्मा भूतभावनः ॥
data.md: They are, Om! He who enters all things besides Himself. He who covers all things, He to whom sacrificial libations are poured, the Lord of the Past, the Present, and the Future, the Creator (or Destroyer) of all existent things, the preserver of all existent things, the Existent, the Soul of all things, the Originator of all things. (1-9)

data.v: पूतात्मा परमात्मा च मुक्तानां परमा गतिः । अव्ययः पुरुषः साक्षी क्षेत्रज्ञोऽक्षर एव च ॥
data.md: Of purified Soul, the Supreme Soul the Highest Refuge of all liberated persons, the Immutable, He who lies enclosed in a case, the Witness. He who knows the material case in which He lives, the Indestructible. (10-17)

data.v: योगो योगविदां नेता प्रधानपुरुषेश्वरः । नारसिंहवपुः श्रीमान्केशवः पुरुषोत्तमः ॥
data.md: He upon whom the mind rests during Yogameditation, the Guide or leader of all persons conversant with Yoga, the Lord of both Pradhana or Prakriti and Purusha. He who assumed a human form with a leonine head, He of beautiful features and equipments, He of beautiful hair, the foremost of Purushas. (1824)

data.v: सर्वः शर्वः शिवः स्थाणुर्भूतादिर्निधिरव्ययः । संभवो भावनो भर्ता प्रभवः प्रभुरीश्वरः ॥
data.md: The embodiment of all things, the Destroyer of all things. He who transcends the three qualities of Goodness, Darkness, and Ignorance, the Motionless, the Beginning of all things, the source into which all things go at the universal Dissolution, the Immutable, He who takes birth at his own will. He who causes the acts of all living creatures to fructify, the Upholder of all things, the Source from which the primal elements have originated, the Powerful One. He in whom exists the unbounded Lordship over all things; (25-36)

data.v: स्वयंभूः शंभुरादित्यः पुष्कराक्षो महास्वनः । अनादिनिधनो धाता विधाता धातुरुत्तमः ॥
data.md: The SelfCreate, He who gives happiness to His worshippers, the presiding Genius in the midst of the Solar disc, the LotusEyed. the LoudVoiced, He who is without beginning and without end, He who upholds the universe, he who ordains all deeds and their fruits, He who is superior to the Grandfather Brahman; (3745)

data.v: अप्रमेयो हृषीकेशः पद्मनाभोऽमरप्रभुः । विश्वकर्मा मनुस्त्वष्टा स्थविष्ठः स्थविरो ध्रुवः ॥
अग्राह्यः शाश्वतः कृष्णो लोहिताक्षः प्रतर्दनः । प्रभूतस्त्रिककुब्धाम पवित्रं मङ्गलं परम् ॥
data.md: He who is incapable of being apprehended (by either the senses or the mind), the Eternal One, Krishna, the RedEyed. He who kills all creatures at the time of the universal dissolution. He who is vast for knowledge and power and other attributes of thic kind. He who resides in three parts of every creature. That which cleanses, is auspicious and high. (55-63)

data.v: ईशानः प्राणदः प्राणो ज्येष्ठः श्रेष्ठः प्रजापतिः । हिरण्यगर्भो भूगर्भो माधवो मधुसूदनः ॥
data.md: He who urges all creatures in their acts. He who makes the vital airs work. He who causes all living creatures to live, the Eldest, the Foremost of all those who are considered as the Lords of all creatures. He who has gold in his abdomen, He who has the Earth for his abdomen, the Lord of Shree or Lakshini, the Destroyer of Madhu. (64-73)

data.v: ईश्वरो विक्रमी धन्वी मेधावी विक्रमः क्रमः । अनुत्तमो दुराधर्षः कृतज्ञः कृतिरात्मवान् ॥
data.md: The Omnipotent, He who is endued with great prowess. He who is armed with the bow. He who is possessed of a mind capable of understanding all treatises. He who roves through the universe, riding on Garuda. He who is well suited to the offerings made to him and who has the power to enjoy them properly, the peerless. He who is incapable of being discomfited. He who knows all acts that are done. He who is at one with all deeds. He who rests on His own true self. (74-84)

data.v: सुरेशः शरणं शर्म विश्वरेताः प्रजाभवः । अहः संवत्सरो व्यालः प्रत्ययः सर्वदर्शनः ॥
data.md: The Lord of all the celestials. He who is the Refuge of all, the embodiment of the highest happiness. He whose seed is the universe. He who is the source of all things, the Day, the Year, the Snake, the embodiment of Conviction. He who sees all things; (85-94)

data.v: अजः सर्वेश्वरः सिद्धः सिद्धिः सर्वादिरच्युतः । वृषाकपिरमेयात्मा सर्वयोगविनिःसृतः ॥
data.md: The Unborn, the Lord of all creatures, He who has acquired success. He who is Success itself. He who is the beginning of all things. He who is above deterioration. He who is virtue in the form of the bull and the great boar that raised the submerged Earth. He who is of immeasurable soul. He who stands aloof from all kinds of union ; (95-103)

data.v: वसुर्वसुमनाः सत्यः समात्मा संमितः समः । अमोघः पुण्डरीकाक्षो वृषकर्मा वृषाकृतिः ॥
data.md: He who is Pavaka among the deities called Vasus, He that is of liberal soul, being shorn of anger, hatred, pride and other evil passions. Truth. He is whose soul is equable on account of His perfect impartiality. He who has been measured by His adorers. He who is always equal, being above all change or modification. He who never refuses to grant the wishes of His adorers. He whose eyes are like lotus petals. He whose deeds are always marked by Virtue; (104-113)

data.v: रुद्रो बहुशिरा बभ्रुर्विश्वयोनिः शुचिश्रवाः । अमृतः शाश्वतः स्थाणुर्वरारोहो महातपाः ॥
data.md: He who destroys all creatures, the Manyheaded, He who upholds the universe. He who is the source of the universe. He who is of pure or spotless reputation, the Immortal One, He who is Eternal and Fixed, He who has beautiful limbs. He who has such knowledge having penance for its mark that He is able to agitate Nature for evolving the universe out of her; (114-122)

data.v: सर्वगः सर्वविद्भानुर्विष्वक्सेनो जनार्दनः । वेदो वेदविदव्यङ्गो वेदाङ्गो वेदवित्कविः ॥
data.md: He who goes everywhere, the Omniscient One. He who shines forth in unmodified effulgence, He whose troops are everywhere. He who is coveted by all, He who is the Veda, He who is conversant with the Veda, Ho who is conversant with all the branches of the Veda. He who represents the branches of the Veda. He who settles the interpretations of the Vedas. He who has no superior in wisdom; (123-132)

data.v: लोकाध्यक्षः सुराध्यक्षो धर्माध्यक्षः कृताकृतः । चतुरात्मा चतुर्व्यूहश्चतुर्दंष्ट्रश्चतुर्भुजः ॥
data.md: He who is the Master of all the worlds. He who is the Lord of the celestials. He who is the Supervisor of both Virtue and Sin. He who is both Effect and Cause. He who is foursouled. He who is known by four forms (as above). He who has four horns. He who has four arms; (133-140)

data.v: भ्राजिष्णुर्भोजनं भोक्ता सहिष्णुर्जगदादिजः । अनघो विजयो जेता विश्वयोनिः पुनर्वसुः ॥
data.md: He who shines forth in effulgence. He who is the giver of food and cherishes the good. He who does not put up with those that are wicked. (or He who puts up with the occasional transgressions of his devotees). He who existed before the universe came into life; He who is stainless. He who is ever victorious. He who defeats the very celestials. He who is the material cause of the universe. He who repeatedly Lives in material causes; (141-150)

data.v: उपेन्द्रो वामनः प्रांशुरमोघः शुचिरूर्जितः । अतीन्द्रः संग्रहः सर्गो धृतात्मा नियमो यमः ॥
data.md: He who is the younger brother of Indra. He who took birth as a dwarf, He who is tall. He whose acts are never futile. He who cleanses. He who is gifted with preeminent energy and strength. He who transcends Indra in all attributes. He who accepts all His worshippers. He who is the Creation itself on account of His being the Causes thereof. He who upholds His self in the same form without being ever subject to birth, growth, or death. He who sustains all creatures in creatures in their respective functions in the universe. He who controls the hearts of all creatures; (151-162)

data.v: वेद्यो वैद्यः सदायोगी वीरहा माधवो मधुः । अतीन्द्रियो महामायो महोत्साहो महाबलः ॥
data.md: He who is worthy of being known by those who wish to acquire what is for their highest good. He who is the celestial physician in the form of Dhanvantari. He who is always engaged in Yoga. He who kills great Asuras for establishing virtue. He who is the Lord of that Lakshmi who originated from the ocean when it was churned by the celestials and the Asuras. He who is honey. He who is above the senses. He who is gifted with great powers of illusion. He who displays great energy. He who transcends all in energy. (163-172)

data.v: महाबुद्धिर्महावीर्यो महाशक्तिर्महाद्युतिः । अनिर्देश्यवपुः श्रीमानमेयात्मा महाद्रिधृक् ॥
data.md: He who transcends all in intelligence. He who transcends all in power. He who transcends all in ability. He who discovers the universe by the effulgence coming out from His body. He whose body is incapable of being seen by the eye. He who is gifted with every beauty. He whose soul is incapable of being comprehended by either the celestials or the mortals. He who held on His back. in the form of the vast tortoise, the huge mountain. Mandara, which was made the churning rod by the celestials and the Asuras when they began to churn the great ocean for getting therefrom all the valuables hid in his bosom. (173-180)
