data.v: धनुर्धरो धनुर्वेदो दण्डो दमयिता दमः । अपराजितः सर्वसहो नियन्ता नियमो यमः ॥
data.md: He who is armed with the bow. He who is conversant with the science of arms. He who is the rod of punishment. He who is chastiser. He who executes all sentences of punishment. He who has never been defeated. He who is competent in all acts. He who engages all persons in their respective duties. He who has none to set Him to any work. He who has no Yama to kill Him. (857-866)

data.v: सत्त्ववान्सात्त्विकः सत्यः सत्यधर्मपरायणः । अभिप्रायः प्रियार्होऽर्हः प्रियकृत्प्रीतिवर्धनः ॥
data.md: He who is gifted with heroism and prowess. He who has the quality of Sallva (Goodness). He who is identical with Truth. He who is devoted to Truth and Virtue. He who is sought by those who are determined upon acquiring Liberation. He who deserves to have all objects which His worshippers present to Him. He who is worthy of being adored. He who does good to all. He who increases the delights of all. (867-875)

data.v: विहायसगतिर्ज्योतिः सुरुचिर्हुतभुग्विभुः । रविर्विरोचनः सूर्यः सविता रविलोचनः ॥
data.md: He whose track is through the sky. He who shines in His own effulgence He who is gifted with great beauty. He who eats the offerings made on the sacrificial fire. He who lives everywhere and is gifted with supreme power. He who sucks the moisture of the Earth in the form of the Sun. He who has various desires. He who brings forth all things. He who is the parent of the universe. He who has the Sun for His eye. (876-885)

data.v: अनन्तो हुतभुग्भोक्ता सुखदो नैकदोऽग्रजः । अनिर्विण्णः सदामर्षी लोकाधिष्ठानमद्भुतम् ॥
data.md: He who is Infinite. He who accepts all sacrificial offerings. He who enjoys Nature in the form of Mind. He who gives happiness. He who has taken repeated births. He who is the firstborn of all existent things. He who is above despair. He who forgives the pious when they trip. He who is the foundation of the universe. He who is most wonderful. (886-895)

data.v: सनात्सनातनतमः कपिलः कपिरव्ययः । स्वस्तिदः स्वस्तिकृत्स्वस्ति स्वस्तिभुक्स्वस्तिदक्षिणः ॥
data.md: He who is existent from the beginning of Time. He who is existing from before the birth of the Grandfather and others. He who is of a tawny colour. He who assumed the form of the great Boar. He who exists even when all things are dissolved. He who is the giver of all blessings. He who creates blessing. He who is identifiable with all blessings. He who enjoys blessings. He who is able to scatter blessing. (896-905)

data.v: अरौद्रः कुण्डली चक्री विक्रम्यूर्जितशासनः । शब्दातिगः शब्दसहः शिशिरः शर्वरीकरः ॥
data.md: He who is without anger, He who lies ensconced in folds, He who is armed with the discus, He who is gifted with great prowess, He whose sway is governed by the great precepts of the Shrutis and the Smritis, He who is incapable of being described by speech, He whom the Vedantas have tried to express with the help of speech, He who is the dew which cools those who are afflicted with the three kinds of grief, He who lives in all bodies, gifted with the power of removing darkness. (906-914)

data.v: अक्रूरः पेशलो दक्षो दक्षिणः क्षमिणां वरः । विद्वत्तमो वीतभयः पुण्यश्रवणकीर्तनः ॥
data.md: He who is shorn of anger, He who is expert in doing all acts by thought, word, and deed, He who can do all acts within the shortest time, He who destroys the wicked, He who is the foremost of all forgiving persons, He who is foremost of all persons gifted with knowledge, He who is above all fear, He whose names and deeds, heard and recited, lead to virtue. (915922)

data.v: उत्तारणो दुष्कृतिहा पुण्यो दुःस्वप्ननाशनः । वीरहा रक्षणः सन्तो जीवनः पर्यवस्थितः ॥
data.md: He who rescucs the Virtuous from the tempestuous ocean of the world, He who destroys the wicked. He who is Virtue, le who removes all evil dreams, He who destroys all bad paths for leading, His worshippers to the good path of Liberation, He who protects the universe by staying in the quality of Goodness, He who walks along the good path. He who is Life, He who exists exists overspreading the universe. (923-931)

data.v: अनन्तरूपोऽनन्तश्रीर्जितमन्युर्भयापहः । चतुरस्रो गभीरात्मा विदिशो व्यादिशो दिशः ॥
data.md: He who is of infinite forms, He who is gified with infinite prosperity, He who has subdued anger, He who destroys the fears of the pious, He who gives just fruits, on every side, i sentient beings according to their thoughts and deeds, He who is of immeasurable Soul, He who bestows various kinds of fruits on worthy persons for their various deeds, He who issues various commands, He who attaches to every deed its proper fruit. (932-940)

data.v: अनादिर्भूर्भुवो लक्ष्मीः सुवीरो रुचिराङ्गदः । जननो जनजन्मादिर्भीमो भीमपराक्रमः ॥
data.md: He who has no beginning, He who is the receptacle of all causes as well as of the Earth, He who has the goddess of Prosperity always by his side, He who is the foremost of all heroes, He who is adorned with beautiful armlets, He who produces all creatures, He who is the original cause of the birth of all creatures, He who is the terror of all the wicked Asuras, He who is gifted with terrible prowess. (941-949)

data.v: आधारनिलयो धाता पुष्पहासः प्रजागरः । ऊर्ध्वगः सत्पथाचारः प्राणदः प्रणवः पणः ॥
data.md: He who is the receptacle and abode of the five primal elements, He who gulps down His throat all creatures at the time of the universal dissolution, He whose smile is as pleasant as the sight of flowers, He who is always wakeful, He who stays at the head of all creatures, He whose conduct consists of those acts which the Pious do, He who revives the dead, He who is the mystic syllable Om, He who has ordained all pious deeds. (950-958)

data.v: प्रमाणं प्राणनिलयः प्राणकृत्प्राणजीवनः । तत्त्वं तत्त्वविदेकात्मा जन्ममृत्युजरातिगः ॥
data.md: He who displays the truth about the Supreme Soul, He who is the abode of the five life-breaths and the senses, He who is the food which maintains all living creatures, He who causes all living creatures to live with the help of the vital air called Prana, He who is the One Soul in the universe, He who is the One Soul in the universe, He who is above birth, decrepitude, and death. (959-966)

data.v: भूर्भुवः स्वस्तरुस्तारः सविता प्रपितामहः । यज्ञो यज्ञपतिर्यज्वा यज्ञाङ्गो यज्ञवाहनः ॥
data.md: He who rescues the universe on account of the sacred syllables Bhuh, Bhuvah, Svah and the others with which Homa-offerings are made, He who is the great rescuer, He who is the father of all, He who is the father of even the Grandfather (Brahman), He who is of the form of Sacrifice, He who is the Lord of all sacrifices, He who is the sacrificer, He who has sacrifices for His limbs, He who upholds all sacrifices. (967-975)

data.v: यज्ञभृद्यज्ञकृद्यज्ञी यज्ञभुग्यज्ञसाधनः । यज्ञान्तकृद्यज्ञगुह्यमन्नमन्नाद एव च ॥
data.md: He who protects sacrifices, He who has created sacrifices, He who is the foremost of all performers of sacrifices, He who enjoys the rewards of all sacrifices, He who causes the celebration of all sacrifices, He who completes all sacrifices by accepting the full libation at the end. He who is a one with such sacrifices as are perforined without desire of fruit, He who is the food which sustain all living creatures; He who is also the eater of that food. (976-984)

data.v: आत्मयोनिः स्वयंजातो वैखानः सामगायनः । देवकीनन्दनः स्रष्टा क्षितीशः पापनाशनः ॥
data.md: He who is Himself the cause of His existence, He who is self-born, He who penetrated through the Solid Earth, He who sings the Samans, He who is the delighter of Devaki, He who is the Creator of all. He who is the Lord of Earth, He who is the destroyer of the sins of His worshippers. (985-992)

data.v: शङ्खभृन्नन्दकी चक्री शार्ङ्गधन्वा गदाधरः । रथाङ्गपाणिरक्षोभ्यः सर्वप्रहरणायुधः ॥
data.md: He who bears the conch (Panchajanya) in His hand, He who bears the sword of knowledge and illusion, He who sets the wheel of the cycles to revolve ceaselessly, He who invests Himself with consciousness and the senses, He who is gifted with the mace of the inost solid understanding, He who is armed with a carwhcel, He who is incapable of being agitated, He who is armed with all kinds of weapons. (993-1000)

data.v: इतीदं कीर्तनीयस्य केशवस्य महात्मनः । नाम्नां सहस्रं दिव्यानामशेषेण प्रकीर्तितम् ॥
data.md: Thus I have recited to you, without any exception the thousand excellent names of the a great Keshava whose glory should always be sung.

data.v: य इदं शृणुयान्नित्यं यश्चापि परिकीर्तयेत् । नाशुभं प्राप्नुयात्किंचित्सोऽमुत्रेह च मानवः ॥
data.md: The man who hears these names every day or who recites them every day, never meets with any evil either in this world or in the next.

data.v: वेदान्तगो ब्राह्मणः स्यात्क्षत्रियो विजयी भवेत् । वैश्यो धनसमृद्धः स्याच्छूद्रः सुखमवाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: If a Brahmana does this, he succeeds in mastering the Vedanta; if a Kshatriya does it, he becomes always victorious in battle. A Vaishya, by doing it, becomes possessed of riches, while Shudra acquires great happiness.

data.v: धर्मार्थी प्राप्नुयाद्धर्ममर्थार्थी चार्थमाप्नुयात् । कामानवाप्नुयात्कामी प्रजार्थी चाप्नुयात्प्रजाः ॥
data.md: If one becomes desirous of acquiring the merit of virtue, one succeeds in acquiring it. If it is riches which one desires, one succeeds in acquiring them. So also the man who wishes for the gratification of the senses, succeeds in enjoying all kinds of pleasures, and the man desirous of children, acquires them.

data.v: भक्तिमान्यः सदोत्थाय शुचिस्तद्गतमानसः । सहस्रं वासुदेवस्य नाम्नामेतत्प्रकीर्तयेत् ॥
यशः प्राप्नोति विपुलं ज्ञातिप्राधान्यमेव च । अचलां श्रियमाप्नोति श्रेयश्चाप्नोत्यनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: That whc with devotion and perseverance and heart wholly turned towards him, recites these thousand names of Vasudeva every day, after having purified himself, succeeds in winning great fame, an eminent position among his kinsinen, enduring prosperity, and lastly, that which is of the highest good to him (viz., Emancipation itself).

data.v: न भयं क्वचिदाप्नोति वीर्यं तेजश्च विन्दति । भवत्यरोगो द्युतिमान्बलरूपगुणान्वितः ॥
data.md: Such a man never meets with fear at any time, and acquires great prowess and energy. Disease never afflicts him; sheen complexion, strength, beauty and accomplishments, because his. man

data.v: रोगार्तो मुच्यते रोगाद्बद्धो मुच्येत बन्धनात् । भयान्मुच्येत भीतश्च मुच्येतापन्न आपदः ॥
data.md: The sick become sound; the afflicted become freed from their miseries; the affrighted become freed from fear, and he who is plunged in calamity becomes freed from calamity.

data.v: दुर्गाण्यतितरत्याशु पुरुषः पुरुषोत्तमम् । स्तुवन्नामसहस्रेण नित्यं भक्तिसमन्वितः ॥
data.md: The man who sings the praises of that foremost of Beings by reciting His thousand names with devotion succeeds in speedily getting over all difficulties.

data.v: वासुदेवाश्रयो मर्त्यो वासुदेवपरायणः । सर्वपापविशुद्धात्मा याति ब्रह्म सनातनम् ॥
data.md: That mortal who takes refuge in Vasudeva and who becomes devoted to Him, becomes freed of all sins and acquires eternal Brahman,

data.v: न वासुदेवभक्तानामशुभं विद्यते क्वचित् । जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिभयं वाप्युपजायते ॥
data.md: They who are devoted to Vasudeva have never to meet with any evil. They become freed from the fear of birth, death, decrepitude, and disease.

data.v: इमं स्तवमधीयानः श्रद्धाभक्तिसमन्वितः । युज्येतात्मसुखक्षान्तिश्रीधृतिस्मृतिकीर्तिभिः ॥
data.md: That man who with devotion and faith recites this hymn succeeds in acquiring beatitude, forgiveness, prosperity, intelligence, memory, and fame.

data.v: न क्रोधो न च मात्सर्यं न लोभो नाशुभा मतिः । भवन्ति कृतपुण्यानां भक्तानां पुरुषोत्तमे ॥
data.md: Neither anger, nor jealousy, nor cupidity, nor evil understanding, ever appears in those virtuous men who are devoted to that foremost of Beings.

data.v: द्यौः सचन्द्रार्कनक्षत्रा खं दिशो भूर्महोदधिः । वासुदेवस्य वीर्येण विधृतानि महात्मनः ॥
data.md: The sky with the sun, moon, and stars, the points of the compass, the Earth, and the Ocean, are all held and supported by the might of the great Vasudeva.

data.v: ससुरासुरगन्धर्वं सयक्षोरगराक्षसम् । जगद्वशे वर्ततेदं कृष्णस्य सचराचरम् ॥
data.md: The entire mobile and immobile universe with the celestials, Asuras, and Gandharvas, Yakshas, Uragas and Rakshasas, is under the sway of Krishna.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणि मनो बुद्धिः सत्त्वं तेजो बलं धृतिः । वासुदेवात्मकान्याहुः क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञ एव च ॥
data.md: The senses, mind, understanding, life, energy, strength, and memory, it has been said, have Vasudeva for their root. Indeed, this body that is called Kshetra, and the intelligent soul within, that is called the knower of Kshetra, also have Vasudeva for their root.

data.v: सर्वागमानामाचारः प्रथमं परिकल्प्यते । आचारप्रभवो धर्मो धर्मस्य प्रभुरच्युतः ॥
data.md: Conduct is said to be the foremost of all subjects treated of in the scriptures. Virtue has conduct for its root. The unfading Vasudeva is said to be the Lord of Virtue.

data.v: ऋषयः पितरो देवा महाभूतानि धातवः । जङ्गमाजङ्गमं चेदं जगन्नारायणोद्भवम् ॥
data.md: The Rishis, the manes, the celestials, the great (Primal) elements, the metals, indeed, the entire inobile and immobile universe, has originated from Narayana.

data.v: योगो ज्ञानं तथा सांख्यं विद्याः शिल्पानि कर्म च । वेदाः शास्त्राणि विज्ञानमेतत्सर्वं जनार्दनात् ॥
data.md: Yoga, the Sankhya philosophy, knowledge, all mechanical arts, the Vedas, the various scriptures, and all learning, have originated from Janardana.

data.v: एको विष्णुर्महद्भूतं पृथग्भूतान्यनेकशः । त्रीँल्लोकान्व्याप्य भूतात्मा भुङ्क्ते विश्वभुगव्ययः ॥
data.md: Vishnu is one great element or substance which has spread itself out into various forms. Covering the three worlds, He, the soul of all things, enjoys them all. His glory knows no decrease, and He it is that is the Enjoyer of the universe.

data.v: इमं स्तवं भगवतो विष्णोर्व्यासेन कीर्तितम् । पठेद्य इच्छेत्पुरुषः श्रेयः प्राप्तुं सुखानि च ॥
data.md: This hymn in praise of the illustrious Vishnu, composed by Vyasa, should be recited by that person who desires to acquire happiness and that which is of the highest benefit (viz., Emancipation).

data.v: विश्वेश्वरमजं देवं जगतः प्रभवाप्ययम् । भजन्ति ये पुष्कराक्षं न ते यान्ति पराभवम् ॥
data.md: Those persons who worship and adore the Lord of universe, that Deity who is unborn and endued with blazing effulgence, who is the origin or cause of the universe, who knows no decay, and who has eyes that are as large and beautiful as the petals of the lotus have never to meet with any discomfiture.

data.v: के पूज्याः के नमस्कार्याः कथं वर्तेत केषु च । किमाचारः कीदृशेषु पितामह न रिष्यते ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Who are worthy of being adored? Who are they to whom we should bow? How, Indeed, should we behave towards whom? What course of conduct, O grandfather, towards what classes of persons is considered faultless?

data.v: ब्राह्मणानां परिभवः सादयेदपि देवताः । ब्राह्मणानां नमस्कर्ता युधिष्ठिर न रिष्यते ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The humiliation of Brahmanas would humiliate the very celestials. By bowing to Brahmanas, one does not, O Yudhishthira, commit any fault.

data.v: ते पूज्यास्ते नमस्कार्या वर्तेथास्तेषु पुत्रवत् । ते हि लोकानिमान्सर्वान्धारयन्ति मनीषिणः ॥
data.md: They, indeed, deserve to be adored. They deserve to have our vows. You should bchave towards them as if they are your sons. Indeed, it is those wise men who upholds all the worlds.

data.v: ब्राह्मणाः सर्वलोकानां महान्तो धर्मसेतवः । धनत्यागाभिरामाश्च वाक्संयमरताश्च ये ॥
data.md: The Brahmanas are the great causeways of Virtue about all the worlds. Their happiness consists in renouncing all kinds of riches. They are devoted to the vow of controlling speech.

data.v: रमणीयाश्च भूतानां निधानं च धृतव्रताः । प्रणेतारश्च लोकानां शास्त्राणां च यशस्विनः ॥
data.md: They are agreeable to all creatures, and observe various excellent vows. They are the refuge of all creatures in the universe. They are the authors of all the regulations which govern the worlds. They are endued with great fame.

data.v: तपो येषां धनं नित्यं वाक्चैव विपुलं बलम् । प्रभवश्चापि धर्माणां धर्मज्ञाः सूक्ष्मदर्शिनः ॥
data.md: Penances are always their great riches. Their power consists in speech. Their energy emanates from the duties they observe. Knowing all duties, they are gifted with minute vision, so that they are cognizant of the subtlest consideration.

data.v: धर्मकामाः स्थिता धर्मे सुकृतैर्धर्मसेतवः । यानुपाश्रित्य जीवन्ति प्रजाः सर्वाश्चतुर्विधाः ॥
data.md: They are of righteous desires. They live in the observance of welldone duties. They are the causeways of Virtue. The four kinds of living creatures exist, depending upon them as their refuge.

data.v: पन्थानः सर्वनेतारो यज्ञवाहाः सनातनाः । पितृपैतामहीं गुर्वीमुद्वहन्ति धुरं सदा ॥
data.md: They are the path or road along which all should go. They are the guides of all. They are the eternal upholders of all the sacrifices. They always upholds the heavy loads of fathers and grandfathers.

data.v: धुरि ये नावसीदन्ति विषमे सद्गवा इव । पितृदेवातिथिमुखा हव्यकव्याग्रभोजिनः ॥
data.md: They never droop under heavy loads even when passing along difficult roads, like strong cattle. They are attentive to the requirements of manes and deities and guests. They are entitles to eat the first portions of Havya and Kavya.

data.v: भोजनादेव ये लोकांस्त्रायन्ते महतो भयात् । दीपाः सर्वस्य लोकस्य चक्षुश्चक्षुष्मतामपि ॥

data.md: Even such, O_king, was Utathya, that foremost of Brahmanas. Shall I go on? Or, will you yet persist in your opinion? What, is there a Kshatriya that is superior to Utathya?

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तदा तूष्णीमभूद्वायुस्ततोऽब्रवीत् । शृणु राजन्वसिष्ठस्य मुख्यं कर्म यशस्विनः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed, king Arjuna remained silent. The god of wind once more spoke to him. Listen now, O king, to the greatness of the Brahmana Agastya.

data.v: आदित्याः सत्रमासन्त सरो वै मानसं प्रति । वसिष्ठं मनसा गत्वा श्रुत्वा तत्रास्य गोचरम् ॥
data.md: Once on a time the celestials were engaged in celebrating a sacrifice on the shores of the lake Vaikhanasa. Knowing his power, the sacrificing gods thought of Vasishtha and made him their priest in imagination.

data.v: यजमानांस्तु तान्दृष्ट्वा व्यग्रान्दीक्षानुकर्शितान् । हन्तुमिच्छन्ति शैलाभाः खलिनो नाम दानवाः ॥
data.md: Meanwhile, seeing the gods reducer and emaciated on account of the initiation they were undergoing, a race of Danavas, of the name of Khalins, of statures as gigantic as mountains, wished to kill them.

data.v: अदूरात्तु ततस्तेषां ब्रह्मदत्तवरं सरः । हता हता वै ते तत्र जीवन्त्याप्लुत्य दानवाः ॥
data.md: Those amongst the Danavas that were either disabled or killed in the fight were plunged into the waters of the Manasa lake and on account of the boon of the Grandfather they immediately came back to vigour and life.

data.v: ते प्रगृह्य महाघोरान्पर्वतान्परिघान्द्रुमान् । विक्षोभयन्तः सलिलमुत्थिताः शतयोजनम् ॥
data.md: Taking up huge and terrible mountain summits and maces and trees, they agitated the waters of the lake, making them swell up to the height of a hundred Yojanas.

data.v: अभ्यद्रवन्त देवांस्ते सहस्राणि दशैव ह । ततस्तैरर्दिता देवाः शरणं वासवं ययुः ॥
data.md: They then ran against the celestials numbering ten thousand. Afflicted by the Danavas, the gods then sought the refuge of their king Vasava.

data.v: स च तैर्व्यथितः शक्रो वसिष्ठं शरणं ययौ । ततोऽभयं ददौ तेभ्यो वसिष्ठो भगवानृषिः ॥
data.md: Shakra, however, was soon afflicted by them. In his distress he sought the protection of Vasishtha. At this, the holy Rishi Vasishtha assured the celestials, removing their fears.

data.v: तथा तान्दुःखिताञ्जानन्नानृशंस्यपरो मुनिः । अयत्नेनादहत्सर्वान्खलिनः स्वेन तेजसा ॥
data.md: Understanding that the gods had become greatly dispirited, the ascetic did this through mercy. He displayed his energy and burnt, without any exertion, those Danavas called Khalins.

data.v: कैलासं प्रस्थितां चापि नदीं गङ्गां महातपाः । आनयत्तत्सरो दिव्यं तया भिन्नं च तत्सरः ॥
data.md: Having penances for wealth, the Rishi brought the River Ganga who had gone to Kailasa, to that spot, Indeed, Ganga appeared, piercing through the waters of the lake.

data.v: सरो भिन्नं तया नद्या सरयूः सा ततोऽभवत् । हताश्च खलिनो यत्र स देशः खलिनोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: The lake was penetrated by that river. And as that celestial river piercing through the waters of the lake, appeared, it flowed on, under the name of Sarayu. The palace whereon those Danavas fell came to be called after them.

data.v: एवं सेन्द्रा वसिष्ठेन रक्षितास्त्रिदिवौकसः । ब्रह्मदत्तवराश्चैव हता दैत्या महात्मना ॥
data.md: Thus were the dwellers of Heaven, headed by Indra, rescued from great distress by Vasishtha. It was thus that those Danavas, who had received boons from Brahman, were killed by that great Rishi.

data.v: एतत्कर्म वसिष्ठस्य कथितं ते मयानघ । ब्रवीम्यहं ब्रूहि वा त्वं वसिष्ठात्क्षत्रियं वरम् ॥
data.md: O sinless one, so was Agastya as described by me. Shall I continue? Or, will you say anything in reply? Is there any Kshatriya who is greater than Agastya?

data.v: इत्युक्तस्त्वर्जुनस्तूष्णीमभूद्वायुस्तमब्रवीत् । शृणु मे हैहयश्रेष्ठ कर्मात्रेः सुमहात्मनः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed, Arjuna remained silent. The god of wind once more addressed him, saying, Hear me, O foremost one of the Haihayas, as I describe to you the achicvement of the great Atri.

data.v: घोरे तमस्ययुध्यन्त सहिता देवदानवाः । अविध्यत शरैस्तत्र स्वर्भानुः सोमभास्करौ ॥
data.md: Once on a time as the gods and Danavas were fighting each other in the dark, Rahu pierced both the Sun and Moon with his arrows.

data.v: अथ ते तमसा ग्रस्ता निहन्यन्ते स्म दानवैः । देवा नृपतिशार्दूल सहैव बलिभिस्तदा ॥
data.md: The gods, overwhelmed by darkness, began to fall before the powerful Danavas, O foremost of kings.

data.v: असुरैर्वध्यमानास्ते क्षीणप्राणा दिवौकसः । अपश्यन्त तपस्यन्तमत्रिं विप्रं महावने ॥
अथैनमब्रुवन्देवाः शान्तक्रोधं जितेन्द्रियम् । असुरैरिषुभिर्विद्धौ चन्द्रादित्याविमावुभौ ॥
data.md: Repeatedly struck by the Asuras, the celestials began to lose their strength. They then saw the learned Brahmana Atri, having penances for wealth, engaged in in the observance of austerities. Addressing that Rishi who had all his senses and in whom anger had been extinguished, they said, Sce, O Rishi, these two, viz., the Moon and the Sun who have both been pierced by the Asuras with their arrows.

data.v: वयं वध्यामहे चापि शत्रुभिस्तमसावृते । नाधिगच्छाम शान्तिं च भयात्त्रायस्व नः प्रभो ॥
data.md: On account of this, darkness has overtaken us, and we are being struck down by the enemy. We do not see the end of our troubles. Do you, O lord of great power, rescue us from this great fear.

data.v: कथं रक्षामि भवतस्तेऽब्रुवंश्चन्द्रमा भव । तिमिरघ्नश्च सविता दस्युहा चैव नो भव ॥
data.md: The Rishi said How, indeed, shall I protect you? They answered, saying, Do you become the Moon. Do you also become the Sun, and do you begini to kill these robbers.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तदात्रिस्तु तमोनुदभवच्छशी । अपश्यत्सौम्यभावं च सूर्यस्य प्रतिदर्शनम् ॥
data.md: Thus begged by them, Atri assumed the form of the darknessdestroying Moon. Indeed, on account of his agreeable disposition, he began to look as beautiful and delightful as the Moon himself.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा नातिप्रभं सोमं तथा सूर्यं च पार्थिव । प्रकाशमकरोदत्रिस्तपसा स्वेन संयुगे ॥
data.md: Seeing that the real Moon and the real Sun had become darkened by the arrows of the enemy, Atri, assuming the forms of those luminaries, began to shine forth over the field of battle, helped by the power of his penances.

data.v: जगद्वितिमिरं चापि प्रदीप्तमकरोत्तदा । व्यजयच्छत्रुसंघांश्च देवानां स्वेन तेजसा ॥
अत्रिणा दह्यमानांस्तान्दृष्ट्वा देवा महासुरान् । पराक्रमैस्तेऽपि तदा व्यत्यघ्नन्नत्रिरक्षिताः ॥
उद्भासितश्च सविता देवास्त्राता हतासुराः । अत्रिणा त्वथ सोमत्वं कृतमुत्तमतेजसा ॥
अद्वितीयेन मुनिना जपता चर्मवाससा । फलभक्षेण राजर्षे पश्य कर्मात्रिणा कृतम् ॥
तस्यापि विस्तरेणोक्तं कर्मात्रेः सुमहात्मनः । ब्रवीम्यहं ब्रूहि वा त्वमत्रितः क्षत्रियं वरम् ॥
data.md: I have thus described to you, in full, the feat of the great Atri. Shail I go on? Or, will you say anything? Is there a Kshatriya who is superior to this twiceborn Rishi?

data.v: इत्युक्तस्त्वर्जुनस्तूष्णीमभूद्वायुस्तमब्रवीत् । शृणु राजन्महत्कर्म च्यवनस्य महात्मनः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Thus addressed, king Arjuna remained silent. The god of wind once more spoke to him. Listen now, O king, to the greatness of the Brahmana Agastya.

data.v: अश्विनोः प्रतिसंश्रुत्य च्यवनः पाकशासनम् । प्रोवाच सहितं देवैः सोमपावश्विनौ कुरु ॥
data.md: Having made his promise to the twin Ashvins, Chyavana addressed the chastiser of Paka, saying, Do you make the Ashvins drinkers of Soma with all the other celestials.

data.v: अस्माभिर्वर्जितावेतौ भवेतां सोमपौ कथम् । देवैर्न संमितावेतौ तस्मान्मैवं वदस्व नः ॥
data.md: Indra said The Ashvins have been outcasted by us. How, then, can these be admitted into the sacrificial circle for drinking Soma with the others? They are not classed with the celestials. Do not, therefore, tell us so.

data.v: अश्विभ्यां सह नेच्छामः पातुं सोमं महाव्रत । पिबन्त्वन्ये यथाकामं नाहं पातुमिहोत्सहे ॥
data.md: Indra said I shall not, O foremost of twiceborn persons, drink Soma with the Ashvins. Let others drink with them as they please. As for mysclf, I dare not do it.

data.v: न चेत्करिष्यसि वचो मयोक्तं बलसूदन । मया प्रमथितः सद्यः सोमं पास्यसि वै मखे ॥
data.md: Chyavana said If, O destroyer of Vala, you will not obey my words, you shall, this very day, drink Soma with them in sacrifice, compelled by me.

data.v: ततः कर्म समारब्धं हिताय सहसाश्विनोः । च्यवनेन ततो मन्त्रैरभिभूताः सुराभवन् ॥
data.md: The god of wind said Then Chyavana, taking the Ashvins with him, began a great religious rite for their bencfit. The gods all became stupefied by Chyavana with the help of his Mantras.

data.v: तत्तु कर्म समारब्धं दृष्ट्वेन्द्रः क्रोधमूर्छितः । उद्यम्य विपुलं शैलं च्यवनं समुपाद्रवत् । तथा वज्रेण भगवानमर्षाकुललोचनः ॥
data.md: Seeing that feat undertaken by Chyavana, Indra became enraged. Taking up a huge mountain he ran against that Rishi.

data.v: तमापतन्तं दृष्ट्वैव च्यवनस्तपसान्वितः । अद्भिः सिक्त्वास्तम्भयत्तं सवज्रं सहपर्वतम् ॥
अथेन्द्रस्य महाघोरं सोऽसृजच्छत्रुमेव ह । मदं मन्त्राहुतिमयं व्यादितास्यं महामुनिः ॥
तस्य दन्तसहस्रं तु बभूव शतयोजनम् । द्वियोजनशतास्तस्य दंष्ट्राः परमदारुणाः । हनुस्तस्याभवद्भूमावेकश्चास्यास्पृशद्दिवम् ॥
data.md: Of terrible appearance, his fangs were two hundred Yojanas in length. One of his cheeks rested on the Earth and the other touched the sky.

data.v: जिह्वामूले स्थितास्तस्य सर्वे देवाः सवासवाः । तिमेरास्यमनुप्राप्ता यथा मत्स्या महार्णवे ॥
data.md: Indeed, all the gods with Vasava seemed to stand at the root of that great Asura's tongue, as fishes when they enter into the wide open mouth of a leviathan.

data.v: ते संमन्त्र्य ततो देवा मदस्यास्यगतास्तदा । अब्रुवन्सहिताः शक्रं प्रणमास्मै द्विजातये । अश्विभ्यां सह सोमं च पिबामो विगतज्वराः ॥
data.md: While standing within the mouth of Mada, the gods consulted speedily and then addressing Indra, said, Do you soon bend your head in respect to this twiceborn personage.

data.v: ततः स प्रणतः शक्रश्चकार च्यवनस्य तत् । च्यवनः कृतवांस्तौ चाप्यश्विनौ सोमपीथिनौ ॥
ततः प्रत्याहरत्कर्म मदं च व्यभजन्मुनिः । अक्षेषु मृगयायां च पाने स्त्रीषु च वीर्यवान् ॥
एतैर्दोषैर्नरो राजन्क्षयं याति न संशयः । तस्मादेतान्नरो नित्यं दूरतः परिवर्जयेत् ॥
एतत्ते च्यवनस्यापि कर्म राजन्प्रकीर्तितम् । ब्रवीम्यहं ब्रूहि वा त्वं च्यवनात्क्षत्रियं वरम् ॥
data.md: Even such, O_king, was Utathya, that foremost of Brahmanas. Shall I go on? Or, will you yet persist in your opinion? What, is there a Kshatriya that is superior to Utathya?

data.v: तूष्णीमासीदर्जुनस्तु पवनस्त्वब्रवीत्पुनः । शृणु मे ब्राह्मणेष्वेव मुख्यं कर्म जनाधिप ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Hearing these words of the god of wind, Arjuna remained silent. At this, the god of wind once more addressed him saying, When the dwellers of Heaven, headed by Indra, found themselves within the mouth of the Asura Mada, at that time, Chyavana took away from them the Earth.

data.v: मदस्यास्यमनुप्राप्ता यदा सेन्द्रा दिवौकसः । तदेयं च्यवनेनेह हृता तेषां वसुंधरा ॥
उभौ लोकौ हृतौ मत्वा ते देवा दुःखिताभवन् । शोकार्ताश्च महात्मानं ब्रह्माणं शरणं ययुः ॥
data.md: Deprived previously of Heaven and now of the Earth also, the gods became very dispirited. Indeed, those great ones, afflicted with grief, then threw themselves unreservedly upon the Grandfather's protection.

data.v: मदास्यव्यतिषिक्तानामस्माकं लोकपूजित । च्यवनेन हृता भूमिः कपैश्चापि दिवं प्रभो ॥
data.md: The Gods said O you who are adored by all creatures of the universe, the Earth has been taken away from us by Chyavana, while we have been deprived of Heaven by the Kapas, O powerful one.

data.v: गच्छध्वं शरणं विप्रानाशु सेन्द्रा दिवौकसः । प्रसाद्य तानुभौ लोकाववाप्स्यथ यथा पुरा ॥
data.md: Brahman said You dwellers of Heaven, do you, with Indra, repair speedily and scck the protection of the Brahmanas. By pleasing them you will succeed in regaining both the regions as before.

data.v: ते ययुः शरणं विप्रांस्त ऊचुः काञ्जयामहे । इत्युक्तास्ते द्विजान्प्राहुर्जयतेह कपानिति । भूगतान्हि विजेतारो वयमित्येव पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Thus instructed by the Grandfather, the deities went to the Brahmanas and begged for their protection. The Brahmanas replied, enquiring, Whom shall we subjugate? Thus asked, the celestials said to them, Do you subjugate the Kapas.

data.v: ततः कर्म समारब्धं ब्राह्मणैः कपनाशनम् । तच्छ्रुत्वा प्रेषितो दूतो ब्राह्मणेभ्यो धनी कपैः ॥
data.md: The Brahmanas then said, Bringing them down on the Earth first, we shall quickly subjugate them. After this, the Brahmanas began a rite having for its object the destruction of the Kapas. As soon as this was heard of by the Kapas, they immediately sent a messenger of theirs, named Dhani, to those Brahmanas.

data.v: स च तान्ब्राह्मणानाह धनी कपवचो यथा । भवद्भिः सदृशाः सर्वे कपाः किमिह वर्तते ॥
data.md: Dhani, coming to them as they sat on the Earth, thus communicated to them the message of the Kapas, The Kapas are like you all. Hence, what will be the results of these rites which it appears you are determined upon?

data.v: सर्वे वेदविदः प्राज्ञाः सर्वे च क्रतुयाजिनः । सर्वे सत्यव्रताश्चैव सर्वे तुल्या महर्षिभिः ॥
data.md: Of all them are well conversant with the Vedas and gifted with wisdom. All of them care for sacrifices. All of them have Truth for their vow, and for these reasons all of them are considered as equal to great Rishis.

data.v: श्रीश्चैव रमते तेषु धारयन्ति श्रियं च ते । वृथा दारान्न गच्छन्ति वृथामांसं न भुञ्जते ॥
data.md: The goddess of Prosperity sports among them, and they, in their turn, support her with respect. They They never know their wives uselessly, and they never eat the flesh of such animals as have not been killed in sacrifices.

data.v: दीप्तमग्निं जुह्वति च गुरूणां वचने स्थिताः । सर्वे च नियतात्मानो बालानां संविभागिनः ॥
data.md: They pour libations in the sacrificial fire (every day) and obey the commands of their preceptors and elders. All of them are of souls under perfect restraint, and never take any food without dividing it duly among their children.

data.v: उपेत्य शकटैर्यान्ति न सेवन्ति रजस्वलाम् । अभुक्तवत्सु नाश्नन्ति दिवा चैव न शेरते ॥
data.md: They always proceed on cars and other vehicles together. They never know their wives when the latter are in mcnses. They all act in such a way as to acquire regions of happiness hercafter. Indeed, they are always righteous in their deeds.

data.v: एतैश्चान्यैश्च बहुभिर्गुणैर्युक्तान्कथं कपान् । विजेष्यथ निवर्तध्वं निवृत्तानां शुभं हि वः ॥
data.md: When the Kapas have these and many other virtues and qualities, why, indeed, would you seek to subjugate them? You should abstain from the attempt. Indeed, by such abstention you would achieve what is for your good.

data.v: कपान्वयं विजेष्यामो ये देवास्ते वयं स्मृताः । तस्माद्वध्याः कपास्माकं धनिन्याहि यथागतम् ॥
data.md: The Brahmanas said Oh, we shail subjugate the Kapas. In this matter, we are quite of a piece with the celestials. Hence, the Kapas deserve to be killed by us. As regards Dhanin, he should return whence he came.

data.v: धनी गत्वा कपानाह न वो विप्राः प्रियंकराः । गृहीत्वास्त्राण्यथो विप्रान्कपाः सर्वे समाद्रवन् ॥
data.md: After this, Dhanin, returning to the Kapas, said to them, The Brahmans are not disposed to do you any good. Hearing this, all the Kapas took up their weapons and went towards the Brahmanas.

data.v: समुदग्रध्वजान्दृष्ट्वा कपान्सर्वे द्विजातयः । व्यसृजञ्ज्वलितानग्नीन्कपानां प्राणनाशनान् ॥
data.md: Seeing the Kapas advancing against them with the standard of their cars upraised, the Brahmanas immediately created certain fires for the destruction of the vital airs of the Kapas.

data.v: ब्रह्मसृष्टा हव्यभुजः कपान्भुक्त्वा सनातनाः । नभसीव यथाभ्राणि व्यराजन्त नराधिप । प्रशशंसुर्द्विजांश्चैव ब्रह्माणं च यशस्विनम् ॥
data.md: Having brought about the destruction of the Kapas, those eternal fires, created with the help of the Vedic Mantras, began to shine in the firmament like so many clouds.

data.v: तेषां तेजस्तथा वीर्यं देवानां ववृधे ततः । अवाप्नुवंश्चामरत्वं त्रिषु लोकेषु पूजितम् ॥
data.md: The energy and prowess of the celestials then began to increase, and adored in all the worlds, they acquired also the boon of immortality.

data.v: इत्युक्तवचनं वायुमर्जुनः प्रत्यभाषत । प्रतिपूज्य महाबाहो यत्तच्छृणु नराधिप ॥
data.md: After the god of wind had said these words, king Arjuna adored him duly and addressing him answered in these words. Hear, O mightyarmed king, what Arjuna said.

data.v: जीवाम्यहं ब्राह्मणार्थे सर्वथा सततं प्रभो । ब्रह्मणे ब्राह्मणेभ्यश्च प्रणमामि च नित्यशः ॥
data.md: Arjuna said O powerful god, always and by all means do I live for the Brahmanas. Devoted to them, I adore them always.

data.v: दत्तात्रेयप्रसादाच्च मया प्राप्तमिदं यशः । लोके च परमा कीर्तिर्धर्मश्च चरितो महान् ॥
data.md: Through the favour of Dattatreya I have acquired this might of mine. Through his favour I have been able to perform great feats in the world and acquire high inerit.

data.v: अहो ब्राह्मणकर्माणि यथा मारुत तत्त्वतः । त्वया प्रोक्तानि कार्त्स्न्येन श्रुतानि प्रयतेन ह ॥
data.md: Oh, I have with attention, heard the achievements, O god of wind, of the Brahmanas with all their interesting details as described by you truly.

data.v: ब्राह्मणान्क्षत्रधर्मेण पालयस्वेन्द्रियाणि च । भृगुभ्यस्ते भयं घोरं तत्तु कालाद्भविष्यति ॥
data.md: The god of wind said Do you protect and maintain the Brahmanas, by performing those Kshatriya duties which are yours by birth. Do you protect them even as you protect your own senses. There is danger to you from the family of Bhrigu. All that, however, will happen on a distant day.

data.v: ब्राह्मणानर्चसे राजन्सततं संशितव्रतान् । कं तु कर्मोदयं दृष्ट्वा तानर्चसि नराधिप ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You always worship, O king, Brahmanas of praiseworthy vows. What, however, is that fruit sceing which you adore them, O king?

data.v: कां वा ब्राह्मणपूजायां व्युष्टिं दृष्ट्वा महाव्रत । तानर्चसि महाबाहो सर्वमेतद्वदस्व मे ॥
data.md: O you of high vows, secing what prosperity of the worship of the Brahmanas, do you worship them? Tell me all this, you of mighty arms.

data.v: एष ते केशवः सर्वमाख्यास्यति महामतिः । व्युष्टिं ब्राह्मणपूजायां दृष्टव्युष्टिर्महाव्रतः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Here is Keshava gifted with great intelligence. He will tell you everything. Of high vows and gifted with prosperity, he will tell you what the prosperity is of the worship of Brahmanas.

data.v: बलं श्रोत्रे वाङ्मनश्चक्षुषी च; ज्ञानं तथा न विशुद्धं ममाद्य । देहन्यासो नातिचिरान्मतो मे; न चातितूर्णं सविताद्य याति ॥
data.md: My strength, cars, speech, mind, eyes, and that clear understanding of mine, are all clouded today. I think the time is not distant when I shall have to renounce my body. The Sun seems to me to go very slowly.

data.v: उक्ता धर्मा ये पुराणे महान्तो; ब्राह्मणानां क्षत्रियाणां विशां च । पौराणं ये दण्डमुपासते च; शेषं कृष्णादुपशिक्षस्व पार्थ ॥
data.md: Those high duties, O king, which are mentioned in the Puranas as observed by Brahmanas and Kshatriyas and Vaishyas and Shudras, have all been described by me. Do you, O son of Pritha, learn from Krishna what little remains to be learnt about them.

data.v: अहं ह्येनं वेद्मि तत्त्वेन कृष्णं; योऽयं हि यच्चास्य बलं पुराणम् । अमेयात्मा केशवः कौरवेन्द्र; सोऽयं धर्मं वक्ष्यति संशयेषु ॥
data.md: I know Krishna truly. I know who he is and what his ancient might is. O chief of the Kauravas, Keshava is of immeasurable soul. Whenever doubts arise, it is he who upholds virtue then.

data.v: कृष्णः पृथ्वीमसृजत्खं दिवं च; वराहोऽयं भीमबलः पुराणः । अस्य चाधोऽथान्तरिक्षं दिवं च; दिशश्चतस्रः प्रदिशश्चतस्रः । सृष्टिस्तथैवेयमनुप्रसूता; स निर्ममे विश्वमिदं पुराणम् ॥
data.md: Below Him are the sky, Heaven, the four cardinal points, and ihe four subsidiary points. It is from Him that the entirc crcation has emanated. It is He who has created this ancient universe.

data.v: अस्य नाभ्यां पुष्करं संप्रसूतं; यत्रोत्पन्नः स्वयमेवामितौजाः । येनाच्छिन्नं तत्तमः पार्थ घोरं; यत्तत्तिष्ठत्यर्णवं तर्जयानम् ॥
data.md: In His navel appeared a Lotus. Within that Lotus originated Brahman, himself of immeasurable energy. It was Brahman, O son of Pritha, who broke open that darkness which existed surpassing the very occan (in depth and extent).

data.v: कृते युगे धर्म आसीत्समग्र;स्त्रेताकाले ज्ञानमनुप्रपन्नः । बलं त्वासीद्द्वापरे पार्थ कृष्णः; कलावधर्मः क्षितिमाजगाम ॥
data.md: In the Krita age, O Partha, Krishna existed in the form of Virtuc. In the Treta age, he existed in the form of Knowledge. In the Dvapara age, he existed in the form of power. In the Kali age, he came to the Earth in the form of sin.

data.v: स पूर्वदेवो निजघान दैत्या;न्स पूर्वदेवश्च बभूव सम्राट् । स भूतानां भावनो भूतभव्यः; स विश्वस्यास्य जगतश्चापि गोप्ता ॥
data.md: It is He who formerly killed the Dailyas. It is he who is the Ancient God. It is He who ruled the Asuras in the form of their Emperor (Balin). It is He who is the Creator of all beings. It is He who is also the fulure of all created Beings. It is He who is also the protector of this universe having the seed of destruction.

data.v: यदा धर्मो ग्लायति वै सुराणां; तदा कृष्णो जायते मानुषेषु । धर्मे स्थित्वा स तु वै भावितात्मा; परांश्च लोकानपरांश्च याति ॥
data.md: When the cause of Virtue suffers, this Krishna takes birth in the family of either the gods or among men. Staying on Virtuc, this Krishna of purified soul (on such occasions) protects both the higher and the lower worlds.

data.v: त्याज्यांस्त्यक्त्वाथासुराणां वधाय; कार्याकार्ये कारणं चैव पार्थ । कृतं करिष्यत्क्रियते च देवो; मुहुः सोमं विद्धि च शक्रमेतम् ॥
data.md: Sparing those who deserve to be spared, Krishna sets himself to the destruction of the Asuras, O Partha. It is he who is all acts proper and improper and it is he who is the cause. It is Krishna who is the act done, the act to be done, and the act that is being done. Know that the illustrious one is Rahu and Soma and Shakra.

data.v: स विश्वकर्मा स च विश्वरूपः; स विश्वभृद्विश्वसृग्विश्वजिच्च । स शूलभृच्छोणितभृत्कराल;स्तं कर्मभिर्विदितं वै स्तुवन्ति ॥
data.md: It is he who is Vishvakarman. It is he who is of universal forin. He is the destroyer and he is the Creator of the universe. He is the holder of the Shula (lance); He is of human form; and he is of terrible forin. All crcatures sing his praises, for he is known by his decds.

data.v: तं गन्धर्वा अप्सरसश्च नित्य;मुपतिष्ठन्ते विबुधानां शतानि । तं राक्षसाश्च परिसंवहन्ते; रायस्पोषः स विजिगीषुरेकः ॥
data.md: Hundreds of Gandharvas and Apsaras and celestials always accompany him. The very Rakshasas sing his praises. He is the Enhancer of Wealth; He is the one Victorian Being in the universe.

data.v: तमध्वरे शंसितारः स्तुवन्ति; रथंतरे सामगाश्च स्तुवन्ति । तं ब्राह्मणा ब्रह्ममन्त्रैः स्तुवन्ति; तस्मै हविरध्वर्यवः कल्पयन्ति ॥
data.md: In Sacrifices, cloqucnt men sing His praises. The singers of Samans praise him by reciting the Rathantaras. The Brahmanas praise him with Vedic Mantras. It is to him that the sacrificial priests pour their libations.

data.v: स पौराणीं ब्रह्मगुहां प्रविष्टो; महीसत्रं भारताग्रे ददर्श । स चैव गामुद्दधाराग्र्यकर्मा; विक्षोभ्य दैत्यानुरगान्दानवांश्च ॥
data.md: The celestials headed by Indra sang his praises when he lifted up thc Gobardhana mountains for protecting the cowherds of Vrindavan against the incessant showers that Indra poured in anger. He is, O Bharata, the one Blessing to all creatures. He, O Bharata, having entered the old Brahmacave, saw from that place the original cover of the world in the beginning of time.

data.v: तस्य भक्षान्विविधान्वेदयन्ति; तमेवाजौ वाहनं वेदयन्ति । तस्यान्तरिक्षं पृथिवी दिवं च; सर्वं वशे तिष्ठति शाश्वतस्य ॥
स कुम्भरेताः ससृजे पुराणं; यत्रोत्पन्नमृषिमाहुर्वसिष्ठम् । स मातरिश्वा विभुरश्ववाजी; स रश्मिमान्सविता चादिदेवः ॥
तेनासुरा विजिताः सर्व एव; तस्य विक्रान्तैर्विजितानीह त्रीणि । स देवानां मानुषाणां पितॄणां; तमेवाहुर्यज्ञविदां वितानम् ॥
स एव कालं विभजन्नुदेति; तस्योत्तरं दक्षिणं चायने द्वे । तस्यैवोर्ध्वं तिर्यगधश्चरन्ति; गभस्तयो मेदिनीं तापयन्तः ॥
तं ब्राह्मणा वेदविदो जुषन्ति; तस्यादित्यो भामुपयुज्य भाति । स मासि मास्यध्वरकृद्विधत्ते; तमध्वरे वेदविदः पठन्ति ॥
स एकयुक्चक्रमिदं त्रिनाभि; सप्ताश्वयुक्तं वहते वै त्रिधामा । महातेजाः सर्वगः सर्वसिंहः; कृष्णो लोकान्धारयते तथैकः । अश्नन्ननश्नंश्च तथैव धीरः; कृष्णं सदा पार्थ कर्तारमेहि ॥
data.md: Gifted with great energy, pervading all things, the foremost of all creatures, it is Krishna who alone upholds all the worlds. He is the Sun, the remover of all darkness. He is the Creator of all. Do you, O hero, approach that Krishna.

data.v: स एकदा कक्षगतो महात्मा; तृप्तो विभुः खाण्डवे धूमकेतुः । स राक्षसानुरगांश्चावजित्य; सर्वत्रगः सर्वमग्नौ जुहोति ॥
data.md: Once on a time, the great and powerful Krishna lives, for a while, in the form of Agni in the forest of Khandava among some straw or dry grass. Soon was he pleased. Capable of going everywhere at will, it was Krishna who, having subjugated the Rakshasas and Uragas, poured thein as libations upon the burning fire.

data.v: स एवाश्वः श्वेतमश्वं प्रयच्छ;त्स एवाश्वानथ सर्वांश्चकार । त्रिवन्धुरस्तस्य रथस्त्रिचक्र;स्त्रिवृच्छिराश्चतुरस्रश्च तस्य ॥
data.md: It is Krishna who gave to Arjuna a number of white horses. It is he who is the creator of all horses. This world represents his car. He it is who yokes that car for setting it in motion. That car has three whcels. It has three kinds of motion. It has four horses yoked it. It has three naves.

data.v: स विहायो व्यदधात्पञ्चनाभिः; स निर्ममे गां दिवमन्तरिक्षम् । एवं रम्यानसृजत्पर्वतांश्च; हृषीकेशोऽमितदीप्ताग्नितेजाः ॥
स लङ्घयन्वै सरितो जिघांस;न्स तं वज्रं प्रहरन्तं निरास । स महेन्द्रः स्तूयते वै महाध्वरे; विप्रैरेको ऋक्सहस्रैः पुराणैः ॥
दुर्वासा वै तेन नान्येन शक्यो; गृहे राजन्वासयितुं महौजाः । तमेवाहुरृषिमेकं पुराणं; स विश्वकृद्विदधात्यात्मभावान् ॥
data.md: It was this Krishna, O king, who alone was able to keep the highly energetic Rishi Durvasas as a guest for some time in his house. He is said to be the one ancient Rishi. He is the Creator of the universe. Indeed, he creates everything from his own nature.

data.v: वेदांश्च यो वेदयतेऽधिदेवो; विधींश्च यश्चाश्रयते पुराणान् । कामे वेदे लौकिके यत्फलं च; विष्वक्सेने सर्वमेतत्प्रतीहि ॥
data.md: Superior to all the celestials, it is he who teaches all the deities. He scrupulously observes all ancient ordinances. Know, O king, that this Krishna, who is called Vishvaksena, is the fruit of all deeds which relate to pleasure, of all deeds which are founded on the Vedas, and of all deeds which appertain to the world.

data.v: ज्योतींषि शुक्लानि च सर्वलोके; त्रयो लोका लोकपालास्त्रयश्च । त्रयोऽग्नयो व्याहृतयश्च तिस्रः; सर्वे देवा देवकीपुत्र एव ॥
data.md: He is the white rays of light which are seen in all the worlds. He is the threc worlds. He is the thrce Regents of all the worlds. He is the threc sacrificial fires He is the three Vyahritis; indeed, this son of Devaki is all the gods together.

data.v: संवत्सरः स ऋतुः सोऽर्धमासः; सोऽहोरात्रः स कला वै स काष्ठाः । मात्रा मुहूर्ताश्च लवाः क्षणाश्च; विष्वक्सेने सर्वमेतत्प्रतीहि ॥
data.md: He is the Ycar; He is the Season; He is the Fortnights; He is the Day and the Night; He is those divisions of time which are called Kalas, and Kashthas, and Matras, and Muhurtas, and Lavas, and Kshanas, Know that this Vishvaksena is all these.

data.v: चन्द्रादित्यौ ग्रहनक्षत्रताराः; सर्वाणि दर्शान्यथ पौर्णमास्यः । नक्षत्रयोगा ऋतवश्च पार्थ; विष्वक्सेनात्सर्वमेतत्प्रसूतम् ॥
data.md: The Moon and the Sun, the Planets, the Constellations, and the Stars, all the Parva days, including the day of the full moon, the conjunctions of the constellations, and the seasons, have, O son of Pritha, emanated from this Krishna who is Vishvaksena.

data.v: रुद्रादित्या वसवोऽथाश्विनौ च; साध्या विश्वे मरुतां षड्गणाश्च । प्रजापतिर्देवमातादितिश्च; सर्वे कृष्णादृषयश्चैव सप्त ॥
data.md: The Rudras, the Adityas, the Vasus, the Ashvins, the Saddhyas, the Vishvedevas, the Maruts, Prajapati himself, the mother of the celestials, viz., Aditi and the seven Rishis, have all originated from Krishna.

data.v: वायुर्भूत्वा विक्षिपते च विश्व;मग्निर्भूत्वा दहते विश्वरूपः । आपो भूत्वा मज्जयते च सर्वं; ब्रह्मा भूत्वा सृजते विश्वसंघान् ॥
data.md: Changing himself into the Wind, he scatters the universe. Of universal form, he becomes fire which consumes all things. Changing himself into Water, he drenches and submerges all, and assuming the form of Brahmans, he creates all the various animate and inanimate creatures.

data.v: वेद्यं च यद्वेदयते च वेदा;न्विधिश्च यश्चाश्रयते विधेयान् । धर्मे च वेदे च बले च सर्वं; चराचरं केशवं त्वं प्रतीहि ॥
data.md: He is himself the Veda, yet he learns all the Vedas. He is himself all the ordinances, yet he observes all the ordinances which have been laid down in matters connccted with Righteousness and the Vedas and that force or might which rules the world. Indeed, know, O Yudhishthira, that this Keshava is all the mobile and immobile universe.

data.v: ज्योतिर्भूतः परमोऽसौ पुरस्ता;त्प्रकाशयन्प्रभया विश्वरूपः । अपः सृष्ट्वा ह्यात्मभूरात्मयोनिः; पुराकरोत्सर्वमेवाथ विश्वम् ॥
data.md: He is of the form of the most resplendent light. Of universal form, this Krishna is shorn in that blazing cffulgence. The original cause of the soul of all existent crcatures, he at first created the waters. Afterwards he created this universe.

data.v: ऋतूनुत्पातान्विविधान्यद्भुतानि; मेघान्विद्युत्सर्वमैरावतं च । सर्वं कृष्णात्स्थावरं जङ्गमं च; विश्वाख्याताद्विष्णुमेनं प्रतीहि ॥
data.md: Know that this Krishna is Vishnu. Know him to be the soul of the entire universe. Know him to be all the scasons; he is these various wonderful visitations of Nature which we sec; he is the clouds that pour rain and the lightning which fleshes in the sky. He is the clephant Airavata. In fact, he is the immobile and mobile universe.

data.v: विश्वावासं निर्गुणं वासुदेवं; संकर्षणं जीवभूतं वदन्ति । ततः प्रद्युम्नमनिरुद्धं चतुर्थ;माज्ञापयत्यात्मयोनिर्महात्मा ॥
data.md: The clay of the universe and above all attributes, this Krishna is Vasudeva When he becomes individual soul he is called Sankarshana. Next, he changes himself into Pradyumna and them into Aniruddha. Thus, the great Krishna, who has sprung from himself, divides himself in fourfold form.

data.v: स पञ्चधा पञ्चजनोपपन्नं; संचोदयन्विश्वमिदं सिसृक्षुः । ततश्चकारावनिमारुतौ च; खं ज्योतिरापश्च तथैव पार्थ ॥
data.md: For crcating this universe which consists of the five primal elements, he begins this work, and causcs it to go on in the fivefold form of animate existence containing celestial and Asuras and human beings and beasts and birds. He it is who then creates the Earth and the Wind, the Sky, Light, and also Water, O son of Pritha.

data.v: स स्थावरं जङ्गमं चैवमेत;च्चतुर्विधं लोकमिमं च कृत्वा । ततो भूमिं व्यदधात्पञ्चबीजां; द्यौः पृथिव्यां धास्यति भूरि वारि । तेन विश्वं कृतमेतद्धि राज;न्स जीवयत्यात्मनैवात्मयोनिः ॥
data.md: Having created this universe of immobile and mobile objects divided into four orders of being (viz., viviparous, oviparous, vegetable, and fifthborn), he then created the Earth with her five fold seed. He then created the Sky for pouring copious rain on the Earth,

data.v: ततो देवानसुरान्मानुषांश्च; लोकानृषींश्चाथ पितॄन्प्रजाश्च । समासेन विविधान्प्राणिलोका;न्सर्वान्सदा भूतपतिः सिसृक्षुः ॥
शुभाशुभं स्थावरं जङ्गमं च; विष्वक्सेनात्सर्वमेतत्प्रतीहि । यद्वर्तते यच्च भविष्यतीह; सर्वमेतत्केशवं त्वं प्रतीहि ॥
मृत्युश्चैव प्राणिनामन्तकाले; साक्षात्कृष्णः शाश्वतो धर्मवाहः । भूतं च यच्चेह न विद्म किंचि;द्विष्वक्सेनात्सर्वमेतत्प्रतीहि ॥
यत्प्रशस्तं च लोकेषु पुण्यं यच्च शुभाशुभम् । तत्सर्वं केशवोऽचिन्त्यो विपरीतमतो भवेत् ॥
data.md: All that is noble and meritorious in the universe, all that is good and evil, is Keshava who is inconccivable. Hence, it is absurd to think of anything which is superior to Keshava.

data.v: एतादृशः केशवोऽयं स्वयंभू;र्नारायणः परमश्चाव्ययश्च । मध्यं चास्य जगतस्तस्थुषश्च; सर्वेषां भूतानां प्रभवश्चाप्ययश्च ॥
data.md: Keshava is such. More than this. He is Narayana, the highest of the high, immutable and undecaying. He is the cternal and changeless cause of the entire mobile and immobile universe with its beginning, middle, and end, as also of all creatures whose birth follows their wish.

data.v: ब्रूहि ब्राह्मणपूजायां व्युष्टिं त्वं मधुसूदन । वेत्ता त्वमस्य चार्थस्य वेद त्वां हि पितामहः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Tell us, O destroyer of Madhu, the prosperity which originates from the worship of the Brahmanas. You are a master of this subject. Indeed, our grandfather knows you.

data.v: शृणुष्वावहितो राजन्द्विजानां भरतर्षभ । यथातत्त्वेन वदतो गुणान्मे कुरुसत्तम ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said Hear me, O king, with attention, O chief of Bharata's race, as I recite to you what the merits of the Brahmanas are, O foremost one of Kuru's race.

data.v: प्रद्युम्नः परिपप्रच्छ ब्राह्मणैः परिकोपितः । किं फलं ब्राह्मणेष्वस्ति पूजायां मधुसूदन । ईश्वरस्य सतस्तस्य इह चैव परत्र च ॥
data.md: Once on a time while I was scated at Dvaravati, O delighter of the Kurus, my son Pradyumna, enraged by certain Brahmanas, came to me and said, O destroyer of Madhu, what mcrit is there for adoring the Brahmanas. Whence is their lordship derived both in this world and in the next.

data.v: सदा द्विजातीन्संपूज्य किं फलं तत्र मानद । एतद्ब्रूहि पितः सर्वं सुमहान्संशयोऽत्र मे ॥
data.md: O giver of honours, what rewards are gained by constantly adoring the Brahmanas? Kindly explain this clearly to me, for my mind is disturbed by doubts about this.

data.v: इत्युक्तवचनस्तेन प्रद्युम्नेन तदा त्वहम् । प्रत्यब्रुवं महाराज यत्तच्छृणु समाहितः ॥
data.md: When Pradyuinna said, these words to me, I answered him as follows. Do you hear, O king, with rapt attention, what those words were.

data.v: व्युष्टिं ब्राह्मणपूजायां रौक्मिणेय निबोध मे । एते हि सोमराजान ईश्वराः सुखदुःखयोः ॥
data.md: O child of Rukmini, listen to me as I tell you what prosperity one may acquire by adoring the Brahmanas. When one tries to acquire the threefold objects of life (viz., Virtue, Profit and Pleasure). or Emancipation, or fame and prosperity, or the treatment and cure of disease, or the worship of the deities and the departed manes, he should take care to please the twiceborn ones. They are each a king Soma. They are the dispensers of happiness and misery.

data.v: अस्मिँल्लोके रौक्मिणेय तथामुष्मिंश्च पुत्रक । ब्राह्मणप्रमुखं सौख्यं न मेऽत्रास्ति विचारणा ॥
data.md: O child of Rukmini, whether in this or in the next world, O son, everything agrecable has originated from the Brahmanas. I have no doubt in this.

data.v: ब्राह्मणप्रमुखं वीर्यमायुः कीर्तिर्यशो बलम् । लोका लोकेश्वराश्चैव सर्वे ब्राह्मणपूर्वकाः ॥
तत्कथं नाद्रियेयं वै ईश्वरोऽस्मीति पुत्रक । मा ते मन्युर्महाबाहो भवत्वत्र द्विजान्प्रति ॥
data.md: How then, O son, can we disregard them, thinking that we are lords of the Earth? O mighty armed onc, do not allow your anger to embrace the Brahmanas as its objeci.,

data.v: ब्राह्मणो हि महद्भूतमस्मिँल्लोके परत्र च । भस्म कुर्युर्जगदिदं क्रुद्धाः प्रत्यक्षदर्शिनः ॥
data.md: In this as also the next world, Brahmanas are considered as great Beings. They have direct knowledge of everything in the universe. Verily, they are capable of reducing everything into ashes, if angry.

data.v: अन्यानपि सृजेयुश्च लोकाँल्लोकेश्वरांस्तथा । कथं तेषु न वर्तेय सम्यग्ज्ञानात्सुतेजसः ॥
data.md: They are capable of creating other worlds and other Regents of worlds. Why then should not persons gifted with energy and true knowledge treat thein with obcdience and respect?

data.v: अवसन्मद्गृहे तात ब्राह्मणो हरिपिङ्गलः । चीरवासा बिल्वदण्डी दीर्घश्मश्रुनखादिमान् । दीर्घेभ्यश्च मनुष्येभ्यः प्रमाणादधिको भुवि ॥
data.md: Formerly in my house, O son, lived the Brahmana Durvasas whose complexion was green and tawny. Clad in rags, he had a stick made of the Bilva tree. His bcard was long and he was greatly emaciated.

data.v: स स्म संचरते लोकान्ये दिव्या ये च मानुषाः । इमा गाथा गायमानश्चत्वरेषु सभासु च ॥
दुर्वाससं वासयेत्को ब्राह्मणं सत्कृतं गृहे । परिभाषां च मे श्रुत्वा को नु दद्यात्प्रतिश्रयम् । यो मां कश्चिद्वासयेत न स मां कोपयेदिह ॥
तं स्म नाद्रियते कश्चित्ततोऽहं तमवासयम् ॥
स स्म भुङ्क्ते सहस्राणां बहूनामन्नमेकदा । एकदा स्माल्पकं भुङ्क्ते न वैति च पुनर्गृहान् ॥
data.md: On certain days hic would cat the food sufficient for the needs of thousands of persons. On other days he would eat very little. On some days he would go out of my house and would not return.

data.v: अकस्माच्च प्रहसति तथाकस्मात्प्ररोदिति । न चास्य वयसा तुल्यः पृथिव्यामभवत्तदा ॥
data.md: He would sometimes laugh without any reason and sometimes cry uselessly At that time there was nobody on Earth a old as he.

data.v: सोऽस्मदावसथं गत्वा शय्याश्चास्तरणानि च । कन्याश्चालंकृता दग्ध्वा ततो व्यपगतः स्वयम् ॥
data.md: One day, entering the quarters which were given to him, he burnt all the beds and coveriets and all the welladorned damsels who were there for serving him. Doing this, he went Out.

data.v: अथ मामब्रवीद्भूयः स मुनिः संशितव्रतः । कृष्ण पायसमिच्छामि भोक्तुमित्येव सत्वरः ॥
data.md: Of highly praiseworthy vows, he met me shortly after this and addressing me, said, O Krishna, I wish to cal frumenty forthwith.

data.v: सदैव तु मया तस्य चित्तज्ञेन गृहे जनः । सर्वाण्येवान्नपानानि भक्ष्याश्चोच्चावचास्तथा । भवन्तु सत्कृतानीति पूर्वमेव प्रचोदितः ॥
data.md: Having understood his mind previously. I had set my servams to prepare every kind of food and drink.

data.v: ततोऽहं ज्वलमानं वै पायसं प्रत्यवेदयम् । तद्भुक्त्वैव तु स क्षिप्रं ततो वचनमब्रवीत् । क्षिप्रमङ्गानि लिम्पस्व पायसेनेति स स्म ह ॥
data.md: Having eaten some, he quickly said to me, O Krishna, take some of this frumenty and smear all your limbs with it.

data.v: अविमृश्यैव च ततः कृतवानस्मि तत्तथा । तेनोच्छिष्टेन गात्राणि शिरश्चैवाभ्यमृक्षयम् ॥
data.md: Unhesitatingly I did as directed. Indeed, with the residuc of that frumenty I smeared my body and head.

data.v: स ददर्श तदाभ्याशे मातरं ते शुभाननाम् । तामपि स्मयमानः स पायसेनाभ्यलेपयत् ॥
data.md: The ascetic at that time saw your beautiful mother standing near. Laughing the while, he sineared her body also with that frumenty.

data.v: मुनिः पायसदिग्धाङ्गीं रथे तूर्णमयोजयत् । तमारुह्य रथं चैव निर्ययौ स गृहान्मम ॥
data.md: The ascetic then caused your mother, whose body was sicared over with frumenty, to be yoked to a car without any delay. Ascending that car he started from my house.

data.v: अग्निवर्णो ज्वलन्धीमान्स द्विजो रथधुर्यवत् । प्रतोदेनातुदद्बालां रुक्मिणीं मम पश्यतः ॥
data.md: Highly intelligent that Brahmana shone with effulgence like fire, and struck, before, me, my youthful Rukmini, as if she were an animal born to drag the cars of human beings.

data.v: न च मे स्तोकमप्यासीद्दुःखमीर्ष्याकृतं तदा । ततः स राजमार्गेण महता निर्ययौ बहिः ॥
data.md: Secing this, I did not feel the slightest grief bom of malice or the desire to injure the Rishi. Having yoked Rukmini to the car, he went out, desirous of passing along the high road of the city.

data.v: तद्दृष्ट्वा महदाश्चर्यं दाशार्हा जातमन्यवः । तत्राजल्पन्मिथः केचित्समाभाष्य परस्परम् ॥
data.md: Secing that extraordinary spectacle, some Dasharhas, filled with anger, addressed one another and began to converse thus; Who else is there on Earth who would live afier having yoke Rukmini to a car! Indeed, let the world be filled with Bralımanas only! Let no other orders take birth here!

data.v: ब्राह्मणा एव जायेरन्नान्यो वर्णः कथंचन । को ह्येनं रथमास्थाय जीवेदन्यः पुमानिह ॥
data.md: Secing that extraordinary spectacle, some Dasharhas, filled with anger, addressed one another and began to converse thus; Who else is there on Earth who would live afier having yoke Rukmini to a car! Indeed, let the world be filled with Bralımanas only! Let no other orders take birth here!

data.v: आशीविषविषं तीक्ष्णं ततस्तीक्ष्णतरं विषम् । ब्रह्माशीविषदग्धस्य नास्ति कश्चिच्चिकित्सकः ॥
data.md: The poison of a virulent snake greatly powerful. More powerful thc poison is a Brahmana. There is no physician for a person who has been bit or burn by the virulent snake of a Brahmana.

data.v: तस्मिन्व्रजति दुर्धर्षे प्रास्खलद्रुक्मिणी पथि । तां नामर्षयत श्रीमांस्ततस्तूर्णमचोदयत् ॥
data.md: As the irresistible Durvasas proceeded on the car, Rukmini tottered on the road and frequently dropped down. At this the twiceborn Rishi became angry and began to urge Rukmini on by striking her with the whip.

data.v: ततः परमसंक्रुद्धो रथात्प्रस्कन्द्य स द्विजः । पदातिरुत्पथेनैव प्राधावद्दक्षिणामुखः ॥
data.md: At last, filled with an irresistible passion, the Brahmana leaped down from the car, and fled towards the south, running on foot, over a pathless ground.

data.v: तमुत्पथेन धावन्तमन्वधावं द्विजोत्तमम् । तथैव पायसादिग्धः प्रसीद भगवन्निति ॥
data.md: Seeing that foremost of Brahmanas, flying along the pathless ground, we followed him, although we were smeared with frumenty, exclaiming behind him, Be pleased with us, O holy onc.

data.v: ततो विलोक्य तेजस्वी ब्राह्मणो मामुवाच ह । जितः क्रोधस्त्वया कृष्ण प्रकृत्यैव महाभुज ॥
data.md: Gifted with great energy, the Brahmana, seeing me, said, O mightyarmed Krishna, you have subdued anger by the strength of your nature.

data.v: न तेऽपराधमिह वै दृष्टवानस्मि सुव्रत । प्रीतोऽस्मि तव गोविन्द वृणु कामान्यथेप्सितान् । प्रसन्नस्य च मे तात पश्य व्युष्टिर्यथाविधा ॥
data.md: O you of excellent vows, I have not found the slightest fault in you. O Govinda, I have been highly pleased with you. Do you solicit the fruition of such desires as you please.

data.v: यावदेव मनुष्याणामन्ने भावो भविष्यति । यथैवान्ने तथा तेषां त्वयि भावो भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Behold duly, O son, what the power is of myself when I become pleased with any one. As long as celestials and human beings will continue to entertain a liking for food, so long will every one among them cherish the same liking for you that they cherish for their food. As long, again as there will be Virtue in the several worlds, so long will the fame of your deeds last.

data.v: यावच्च पुण्या लोकेषु त्वयि कीर्तिर्भविष्यति । त्रिषु लोकेषु तावच्च वैशिष्ट्यं प्रतिपत्स्यसे । सुप्रियः सर्वलोकस्य भविष्यसि जनार्दन ॥
data.md: Indeed, your distinction will last so long in the three worlds. O Janardana, agreeable you will be to all persons.

data.v: यत्ते भिन्नं च दग्धं च यच्च किंचिद्विनाशितम् । सर्वं तथैव द्रष्टासि विशिष्टं वा जनार्दन ॥
data.md: Whatever articles of yours have been broken or burnt or otherwise destroyed (by me). you will see restored, O Janardana, to their former state or they will reappear even in a better forin.

data.v: यावदेतत्प्रलिप्तं ते गात्रेषु मधुसूदन । अतो मृत्युभयं नास्ति यावदिच्छा तवाच्युत ॥
data.md: As long again, O) you of unfading glory, as you will wish to live, so long will you have no fear of death attacking you through such parts of your body as have been smeared with the frumenty I gave you.

data.v: न तु पादतले लिप्ते कस्मात्ते पुत्रकाद्य वै । नैतन्मे प्रियमित्येव स मां प्रीतोऽब्रवीत्तदा । इत्युक्तोऽहं शरीरं स्वमपश्यं श्रीसमायुतम् ॥
data.md: O son, why did you not smear that frumenty on the soles of your feet as well? By not doing it, you have acted in a way that is not approved by me. These were the words that he said, well pleased with me on that occasion. After he had ceased speaking, I saw that my body became gifted with great beauty and splendour.

data.v: रुक्मिणीं चाब्रवीत्प्रीतः सर्वस्त्रीणां वरं यशः । कीर्तिं चानुत्तमां लोके समवाप्स्यसि शोभने ॥
data.md: To Rukmini also, the Rishi, well pleased with her, said, O beautiful lady, you will be the foremost one of they sex in fame, and you will enjoy great glory, and achievements. You will never suffer from decrepitude or disease or loss of complexion.

data.v: न त्वां जरा वा रोगो वा वैवर्ण्यं चापि भामिनि । स्प्रक्ष्यन्ति पुण्यगन्धा च कृष्णमाराधयिष्यसि ॥
data.md: Every one will see you engaged in waiting upon Krishna, possessed as you already are with a fragrant odor which is always present in you.

data.v: षोडशानां सहस्राणां वधूनां केशवस्य ह । वरिष्ठा सहलोक्या च केशवस्य भविष्यसि ॥
data.md: You will become the foremost of all wives, numbering sixteen thousand, of Keshava. At last, when the time comes for your departure from the world, you will acquire the inseparable companionship of Krishna hereafter.

data.v: तव मातरमित्युक्त्वा ततो मां पुनरब्रवीत् । प्रस्थितः सुमहातेजा दुर्वासा वह्निवज्ज्वलन् ॥
data.md: Having said these words to your mother, the Rishi once more addressed me and uttering the following words, left the spot. Indeed, the Rishi Durvasa, shining like a fire, said, ) Keshava, may you be so disposed always towards the Brahmanas. After uttering these words, that Brahmana disappeared there and then before my eyes.

data.v: एषैव ते बुद्धिरस्तु ब्राह्मणान्प्रति केशव । इत्युक्त्वा स तदा पुत्र तत्रैवान्तरधीयत ॥
data.md: Having said these words to your mother, the Rishi once more addressed me and uttering the following words, left the spot. Indeed, the Rishi Durvasa, shining like a fire, said, ) Keshava, may you be so disposed always towards the Brahmanas. After uttering these words, that Brahmana disappeared there and then before my eyes.

data.v: तस्मिन्नन्तर्हिते चाहमुपांशुव्रतमादिशम् । यत्किंचिद्ब्राह्मणो ब्रूयात्सर्वं कुर्यामिति प्रभो ॥
data.md: After his disappearance, I began to follow the vow of uttering certain Mantras silently without being heard by anybody. From that day I resolved to do whatever commands I should receive from the Brahmanas.

data.v: एतद्व्रतमहं कृत्वा मात्रा ते सह पुत्रक । ततः परमहृष्टात्मा प्राविशं गृहमेव च ॥
data.md: Having adopted this vow, O son, along with your mother, both of us, with hearts filled with joy re-entered our palace.

data.v: प्रविष्टमात्रश्च गृहे सर्वं पश्यामि तन्नवम् । यद्भिन्नं यच्च वै दग्धं तेन विप्रेण पुत्रक ॥
data.md: Entering our house I saw that everything which the Rishi had broken or burnt had reappeared fresh.

data.v: ततोऽहं विस्मयं प्राप्तः सर्वं दृष्ट्वा नवं दृढम् । अपूजयं च मनसा रौक्मिणेय द्विजं तदा ॥
data.md: Seeing those new articles, which had besides become more durable, I became stricken with wonder. O son of Rukmini, from that day forth I have always adored the Brahmanas in my mind.

data.v: इत्यहं रौक्मिणेयस्य पृच्छतो भरतर्षभ । माहात्म्यं द्विजमुख्यस्य सर्वमाख्यातवांस्तदा ॥
data.md: This, O chief of Bharata's race, is what I said on that occasion about the greatness of those Brahmanas who are the foremost of their order.

data.v: तथा त्वमपि कौन्तेय ब्राह्मणान्सततं प्रभो । पूजयस्व महाभागान्वाग्भिर्दानैश्च नित्यदा ॥
data.md: Do you also, O son of Kunti, adore the highly blessed Brahmanas every day with gifts of wealth and kind, O powerful one.

data.v: एवं व्युष्टिमहं प्राप्तो ब्राह्मणानां प्रसादजाम् । यच्च मामाह भीष्मोऽयं तत्सत्यं भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: It was thus that I won the prosperity I enjoy, the prosperity that is born of the favour of Brahmanas. Whatever, again, Bhishma has said of me, O chief of the Bharatas, is all true.

data.v: दुर्वाससः प्रसादात्ते यत्तदा मधुसूदन । अवाप्तमिह विज्ञानं तन्मे व्याख्यातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You should, O destroyer of Madhu, explain lo me that knowledge which you have acquired through the favour of Durvasas.

data.v: महाभाग्यं च यत्तस्य नामानि च महात्मनः । तत्त्वतो ज्ञातुमिच्छामि सर्वं मतिमतां वर ॥
data.md: O foremost of all persons having intelligence, I wish to know everything about the great blessedness and all the names of that great one truly and in detail!

data.v: हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि नमस्कृत्वा कपर्दिने । यदवाप्तं महाराज श्रेयो यच्चार्जितं यशः ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said I shall recite to you the good which I have acquired and the fame which I have won through the favour of that great one. I shall describe to you the subject, after having bowed unto Kaparddin.

data.v: प्रयतः प्रातरुत्थाय यदधीये विशां पते । प्राञ्जलिः शतरुद्रीयं तन्मे निगदतः शृणु ॥
data.md: O king, listen to me as I recite to you that Shatarudriya which I repeat, with controlled senses, every morning after rising from bed.

data.v: प्रजापतिस्तत्ससृजे तपसोऽन्ते महातपाः । शंकरस्त्वसृजत्तात प्रजाः स्थावरजङ्गमाः ॥
data.md: The great lord of all creatures, viz., the Grandfather Brahman himself, having penances for riches, composed those Mantras, after having observed especial penances for some time. O sire, it is Shankara who created all the creatures in the universe, mobile and immobile.

data.v: नास्ति किंचित्परं भूतं महादेवाद्विशां पते । इह त्रिष्वपि लोकेषु भूतानां प्रभवो हि सः ॥
data.md: There is no being who is superior, O monarch, lo Mahadeva. He is the highest of all beings in the three worlds.

data.v: न चैवोत्सहते स्थातुं कश्चिदग्रे महात्मनः । न हि भूतं समं तेन त्रिषु लोकेषु विद्यते ॥
data.md: There is no one who is capable of attending before the great Being. Indeed, there is no Being in the three worlds who is his equal.

data.v: गन्धेनापि हि संग्रामे तस्य क्रुद्धस्य शत्रवः । विसंज्ञा हतभूयिष्ठा वेपन्ति च पतन्ति च ॥
data.md: When he stands, filled with anger, on the field of battle, the very scent of his body deprives all foes of consciousness and they who are not killed tremble and fall down.

data.v: घोरं च निनदं तस्य पर्जन्यनिनदोपमम् । श्रुत्वा विदीर्येद्धृदयं देवानामपि संयुगे ॥
data.md: His roars are terrible, like the mutterings of clouds. Hearing those roars in battle, the very hearts of the celestials break in twain.

data.v: यांश्च घोरेण रूपेण पश्येत्क्रुद्धः पिनाकधृक् । न सुरा नासुरा लोके न गन्धर्वा न पन्नगाः । कुपिते सुखमेधन्ते तस्मिन्नपि गुहागताः ॥
प्रजापतेश्च दक्षस्य यजतो वितते क्रतौ । विव्याध कुपितो यज्ञं निर्भयस्तु भवस्तदा । धनुषा बाणमुत्सृज्य सघोषं विननाद च ॥
ते न शर्म कुतः शान्तिं विषादं लेभिरे सुराः । विद्रुते सहसा यज्ञे कुपिते च महेश्वरे ॥
data.md: Indeed, when Maheshvara became angry and suddenly pierced with his arrow the embodied form of sacrifice, the celestials became filled with sorrow, losing happiness and tranquility of heart.

data.v: तेन ज्यातलघोषेण सर्वे लोकाः समाकुलाः । बभूवुरवशाः पार्थ विषेदुश्च सुरासुराः ॥
data.md: On account of the iwang of his bowstring the whole universe became agitated. The celestials and the Asuras, O son of Pritha, all became cheerless and stupefied.

data.v: आपश्चुक्षुभिरे चैव चकम्पे च वसुंधरा । व्यद्रवन्गिरयश्चापि द्यौः पफाल च सर्वशः ॥
data.md: The Ocean rolled in agitation and the Earth trembled to her centre. The hills and mountains began to move from their bases and ran on all sides. The Vault of the sky became cracked.

data.v: अन्धेन तमसा लोकाः प्रावृता न चकाशिरे । प्रनष्टा ज्योतिषां भाश्च सह सूर्येण भारत ॥
data.md: All the worlds became covered with darkness. Nothing could be seen. The light of all the luminaries became darkened, along with that of the Sun himself, O Bharata.

data.v: भृशं भीतास्ततः शान्तिं चक्रुः स्वस्त्ययनानि च । ऋषयः सर्वभूतानामात्मनश्च हितैषिणः ॥
data.md: The great Rishis, stricken with fear and desirous of doing good to themselves and the universe, performed the usual usual rites of propitiation and peace.

data.v: ततः सोऽभ्यद्रवद्देवान्क्रुद्धो रौद्रपराक्रमः । भगस्य नयने क्रुद्धः प्रहारेण व्यशातयत् ॥
data.md: Meanwhile, Rudra of terrible prowess rushed against the celestials. Filled with anger, he tore out the eyes of Bhaga.

data.v: पूषाणं चाभिदुद्राव परेण वपुषान्वितः । पुरोडाशं भक्षयतो दशनान्वै व्यशातयत् ॥
data.md: Excited with anger, he attacked Pushan with his foot. He tore out the teeth of that god as he satemployed in cating the large sacrificial ball (called Purodasha).

data.v: ततः प्रणेमुर्देवास्ते वेपमानाः स्म शंकरम् । पुनश्च संदधे रुद्रो दीप्तं सुनिशितं शरम् ॥
data.md: Trembling with fear, the celestials bent their heads to Shankara. Without being appeased, Rudra once more placed on his bowstring a sharp and blazing arrow.

data.v: रुद्रस्य विक्रमं दृष्ट्वा भीता देवाः सहर्षिभिः । ततः प्रसादयामासुः शर्वं ते विबुधोत्तमाः ॥
data.md: Seeing his prowess, the celestials and the Rishis became all alarmed. Those foremost of gods began to pacify him.

data.v: जेपुश्च शतरुद्रीयं देवाः कृत्वाञ्जलिं ततः । संस्तूयमानस्त्रिदशैः प्रससाद महेश्वरः ॥
data.md: Joining their hands in respect, they began to recite the Shata Rudriya Mantras. Thus lauded by the celestials, at last Maheshvara became gratified.

data.v: रुद्रस्य भागं यज्ञे च विशिष्टं ते त्वकल्पयन् । भयेन त्रिदशा राजञ्शरणं च प्रपेदिरे ॥
data.md: The deities then assigned a large share to him. Trembling with fear, O king, they sought refuge with him.

data.v: तेन चैवातिकोपेन स यज्ञः संधितोऽभवत् । यद्यच्चापि हतं तत्र तत्तथैव प्रदीयते ॥
data.md: When Rudra became pleased, the embodiment of sacrifice, which had been cut in twain, became once more united. Whatever limbs of his had been destroyed by the arrows of Mahadeva, became once more whole and sound.

data.v: असुराणां पुराण्यासंस्त्रीणि वीर्यवतां दिवि । आयसं राजतं चैव सौवर्णमपरं तथा ॥
data.md: The Asuras gifted with great energy had formerly threc cities in the firmament. One of these had been, made of iron; one of silver; and the third of gold.

data.v: नाशकत्तानि मघवा भेत्तुं सर्वायुधैरपि । अथ सर्वेऽमरा रुद्रं जग्मुः शरणमर्दिताः ॥
data.md: With all his weapons, Maghavat the chief of the celestials, was unable to pierce those cities. Afflicted by the Asuras, all the celestials then sought the protection of the great Rudra.

data.v: तत ऊचुर्महात्मानो देवाः सर्वे समागताः । रुद्र रौद्रा भविष्यन्ति पशवः सर्वकर्मसु । जहि दैत्यान्सह पुरैर्लोकांस्त्रायस्व मानद ॥
data.md: The highsouled celestials in a body addressed him, saying, O Rudra, the Asuras threaten to display their destructive influence in all deeds.

data.v: स तथोक्तस्तथेत्युक्त्वा विष्णुं कृत्वा शरोत्तमम् । शल्यमग्निं तथा कृत्वा पुङ्खं वैवस्वतं यमम् । वेदान्कृत्वा धनुः सर्वाञ्ज्यां च सावित्रिमुत्तमाम् ॥
data.md: He made the deity of fire his shaftrced, and the SunGod's son Yama the wings of that arrow. He made the Vedas his bow and the goddess Savittri his excellent bowstring.

data.v: देवान्रथवरं कृत्वा विनियुज्य च सर्वशः । त्रिपर्वणा त्रिशल्येन तेन तानि बिभेद सः ॥
data.md: And he made the Grandfather Brahman his charioteer. Applying all these, he pierced the triple city of the Asuras with that arrow of his, consisting of three Parvans and three Shalyas.

data.v: शरेणादित्यवर्णेन कालाग्निसमतेजसा । तेऽसुराः सपुरास्तत्र दग्धा रुद्रेण भारत ॥
data.md: Indeed, O Bharata, the Asuras with their cities, were all burnt by Rudra with that arrow which had solar effulgence and whose energy resembled that of the fire which appcars at the end of the cycle for consuming all things.

data.v: तं चैवाङ्कगतं दृष्ट्वा बालं पञ्चशिखं पुनः । उमा जिज्ञासमाना वै कोऽयमित्यब्रवीत्तदा ॥
data.md: Seeing that Mahadeva changed into a child with five locks of hair lying on the lap of Parvati, the latter asked the celestials as to who he was.

data.v: असूयतश्च शक्रस्य वज्रेण प्रहरिष्यतः । सवज्रं स्तम्भयामास तं बाहुं परिघोपमम् ॥
data.md: Seeing the child, Shakra became suddenly filled with jealousy and anger and determined to kill him with his thunder. The child, however, paralysed the arm, appearing like a mace of iron, of Indra with the thunderbolt in it.

data.v: न संबुबुधिरे चैनं देवास्तं भुवनेश्वरम् । सप्रजापतयः सर्वे तस्मिन्मुमुहुरीश्वरे ॥
data.md: The celestials all became stupefied, and they could not understand that child was the Master of the universe. Indeed, all of them, along with the very Regents of the world, found their intellects stupefied about that child who was none else than the Supreme Being.

data.v: ततो ध्यात्वाथ भगवान्ब्रह्मा तममितौजसम् । अयं श्रेष्ठ इति ज्ञात्वा ववन्दे तमुमापतिम् ॥
data.md: Then reflecting with the help of his penances, the Illustrious Grandfather Brahman found out that that child was the foremost of al! beings, the lord of Uma, Mahadeva of immeasurable prowess. He then lauded the Lord.

data.v: ततः प्रसादयामासुरुमां रुद्रं च ते सुराः । बभूव स तदा बाहुर्बलहन्तुर्यथा पुरा ॥
data.md: The celestials also began to sing the praises of both Uma and Rudra. The arm (which had been paralysed) of the destroyer of Vala then became restored to its former state. That Mahadeva, taking birth as the highly energetic Brahmana Durvasas, lived for a long time at Dvaravati in my house.

data.v: स चापि ब्राह्मणो भूत्वा दुर्वासा नाम वीर्यवान् । द्वारवत्यां मम गृहे चिरं कालमुपावसत् ॥
data.md: The celestials also began to sing the praises of both Uma and Rudra. The arm (which had been paralysed) of the destroyer of Vala then became restored to its former state. That Mahadeva, taking birth as the highly energetic Brahmana Durvasas, lived for a long time at Dvaravati in my house.

data.v: विप्रकारान्प्रयुङ्क्ते स्म सुबहून्मम वेश्मनि । तानुदारतया चाहमक्षमं तस्य दुःसहम् ॥
data.md: While living in my house he committed various mischief's. Thought difficult of being borne. I suffered them yet from magnanimity of heart.

data.v: स देवेन्द्रश्च वायुश्च सोऽश्विनौ स च विद्युतः । स चन्द्रमाः स चेशानः स सूर्यो वरुणश्च सः ॥
स कालः सोऽन्तको मृत्युः स तमो रात्र्यहानि च । मासार्धमासा ऋतवः संध्ये संवत्सरश्च सः ॥
data.md: He is the Moon; he is Ishana; he is the Sun; he is Varuna; he is Time; he is the Destroyer; he is death; he is the day and the Night; he is the fortnight; he is the seasons; he is the two twilghts; he is the year. He is Dhatri; and he is Vidhatri; and he is Vishwakarinan; and he knows all things.

data.v: स धाता स विधाता च विश्वकर्मा स सर्ववित् । नक्षत्राणि दिशश्चैव प्रदिशोऽथ ग्रहास्तथा । विश्वमूर्तिरमेयात्मा भगवानमितद्युतिः ॥
data.md: He is the cardinal points of the compass and the subsidiary points also. Of universal form, he is of great soul. The holy and illustrious Durvasas is of the colour of the celestials.

data.v: एकधा च द्विधा चैव बहुधा च स एव च । शतधा सहस्रधा चैव तथा शतसहस्रधा ॥
data.md: He sometimes shows himself singly; sometimes divides himself into two parts; and sometimes shows himself in many a hundred, a thousand, a hundred thousand, forms.

data.v: ईदृशः स महादेवो भूयश्च भगवानतः । न हि शक्या गुणा वक्तुमपि वर्षशतैरपि ॥
data.md: Even such is Mahadeva. He is, again, that god who is unborn. In even a hundred years, one cannot exhaust his merits by rccounting them.

data.v: युधिष्ठिर महाबाहो महाभाग्यं महात्मनः । रुद्राय बहुरूपाय बहुनाम्ने निबोध मे ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said O mighiyarmed Yudhishthira, listen to me as I recite to you the many names of Rudra as also the high blessedness of that great one.

data.v: वदन्त्यग्निं महादेवं तथा स्थाणुं महेश्वरम् । एकाक्षं त्र्यम्बकं चैव विश्वरूपं शिवं तथा ॥
data.md: The Rishis describe Mahadeva as Agni, and Sthanu, and Maheshvara; as oneeyed, and threeeyed, of universal form, and Shiva or highly auspicious.

data.v: द्वे तनू तस्य देवस्य वेदज्ञा ब्राह्मणा विदुः । घोरामन्यां शिवामन्यां ते तनू बहुधा पुनः ॥
data.md: Brahmanas knowing the Vedas say that god has two forins. (One of these is terrible, and the other mild and auspicious. Those two forms, again, arc subdivided into many forms.

data.v: उग्रा घोरा तनूर्यास्य सोऽग्निर्विद्युत्स भास्करः । शिवा सौम्या च या तस्य धर्मस्त्वापोऽथ चन्द्रमाः ॥
data.md: That form which is fierce and terrible is considered as identical with Agni and Lightning and the Sun. That other form which is mild and auspicious is identical with Virtue and Water and the Moon.

data.v: आत्मनोऽर्धं तु तस्याग्निरुच्यते भरतर्षभ । ब्रह्मचर्यं चरत्येष शिवा यास्य तनुस्तथा ॥
data.md: Then, again, it is said that half his body is fire and half is the moon. That form of his which is mild and auspicious, is said to be engaged in the practice of the vow of celibacy.

data.v: यास्य घोरतमा मूर्तिर्जगत्संहरते तया । ईश्वरत्वान्महत्त्वाच्च महेश्वर इति स्मृतः ॥
data.md: That other form of his which is highly terrible performs all the destructive operations in the universe. Because he is great and the Supreme Lord of all (Ishvara), therefore he is called Maheshivara.

data.v: यन्निर्दहति यत्तीक्ष्णो यदुग्रो यत्प्रतापवान् । मांसशोणितमज्जादो यत्ततो रुद्र उच्यते ॥
data.md: And because he burns and oppresses, is keen and fierce, and gifted with great energy, and is engaged in cating flesh and blood and marrow, that he is called Rudra.

data.v: देवानां सुमहान्यच्च यच्चास्य विषयो महान् । यच्च विश्वं महत्पाति महादेवस्ततः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Because he is the foremost of all the celestials, and because his dominion and acquisitions are very extensive, and because he protects the vast universe, therefore is called Mahadeva.

data.v: समेधयति यन्नित्यं सर्वार्थान्सर्वकर्मभिः । शिवमिच्छन्मनुष्याणां तस्मादेष शिवः स्मृतः ॥
दहत्यूर्ध्वं स्थितो यच्च प्राणोत्पत्तिः स्थितिश्च यत् । स्थिरलिङ्गश्च यन्नित्यं तस्मात्स्थाणुरिति स्मृतः ॥
यदस्य बहुधा रूपं भूतं भव्यं भवत्तथा । स्थावरं जङ्गमं चैव बहुरूपस्ततः स्मृतः ॥
धूम्रं रूपं च यत्तस्य धूर्जटीत्यत उच्यते । विश्वे देवाश्च यत्तस्मिन्विश्वरूपस्ततः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: He is mobile and immobilc. For this he is called Vahurupa. Thc celestials called Vishvedevas live in his body. Ile is, for this, called Vishvarupa having an universal form.

data.v: सहस्राक्षोऽयुताक्षो वा सर्वतोक्षिमयोऽपि वा । चक्षुषः प्रभवस्तेजो नास्त्यन्तोऽथास्य चक्षुषाम् ॥
data.md: He has a thousand eyes; or, he has numberless cyes; or, he has cycs on all sides and on every part of his body. His cncrgy comes out through his cyes. There is no end of his eyes.

data.v: सर्वथा यत्पशून्पाति तैश्च यद्रमते पुनः । तेषामधिपतिर्यच्च तस्मात्पशुपतिः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Because he always nourishes all crcatures and sports also with them, and because he is their lord or master, therefore is he called Pashupati (the lord of all creatures).

data.v: नित्येन ब्रह्मचर्येण लिङ्गमस्य यदा स्थितम् । महयन्त्यस्य लोकाश्च महेश्वर इति स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Because his emblem always observes the of Brahmacharya, all the worlds, therefore, adore it. This act of worship is said to please him highly.

data.v: विग्रहं पूजयेद्यो वै लिङ्गं वापि महात्मनः । लिङ्गं पूजयिता नित्यं महतीं श्रियमश्नुते ॥
data.md: If there is one who adorcs him by creating his image, and another who adores his emblem, the latter it is who wins great prosperity for ever. VOW

data.v: ऋषयश्चापि देवाश्च गन्धर्वाप्सरसस्तथा । लिङ्गमेवार्चयन्ति स्म यत्तदूर्ध्वं समास्थितम् ॥
data.md: The Rishis, the celestials, the Gandharvas, and the Apsaras, adore that emblem of his which is every erect and upraised.

data.v: पूज्यमाने ततस्तस्मिन्मोदते स महेश्वरः । सुखं ददाति प्रीतात्मा भक्तानां भक्तवत्सलः ॥
data.md: If his emblem is adored, Maheshvara becomes highly pleased with the adorer. Affectionate towards his devotees, he confers happiness upon them with a chcerful soui.

data.v: एष एव श्मशानेषु देवो वसति नित्यशः । यजन्ते तं जनास्तत्र वीरस्थाननिषेविणम् ॥
data.md: This great god loves to live in crematoria and there he burns and consumes all dead bodies. Those persons who celebrate sacrifices on such grounds attain at the end to the regions of heroes.

data.v: विषमस्थः शरीरेषु स मृत्युः प्राणिनामिह । स च वायुः शरीरेषु प्राणोऽपानः शरीरिणाम् ॥
data.md: Engaged in his proper duty, he it is who is considered as the Death who live in the bodies of all creatures. He is, again, those vital airs called Prana and Apana, in the bodies of all embodied creatures.

data.v: तस्य घोराणि रूपाणि दीप्तानि च बहूनि च । लोके यान्यस्य पूज्यन्ते विप्रास्तानि विदुर्बुधाः ॥
data.md: He has many burning and terrible forms. All those forms are adored in the world and are known to Brahmanas gifted with knowledge.

data.v: नामधेयानि वेदेषु बहून्यस्य यथार्थतः । निरुच्यन्ते महत्त्वाच्च विभुत्वात्कर्मभिस्तथा ॥
data.md: Amongst the gods he has many significant names. Indeed, the meanings of those names are derived from either his greatness or vastness, or his feats, or his conduct.
