data.v: वेदे चास्य विदुर्विप्राः शतरुद्रीयमुत्तमम् । व्यासादनन्तरं यच्चाप्युपस्थानं महात्मनः ॥
data.md: The Brahmanas always recite the excellent ShataRudriya in his honour, thai is in the Vedas as also that which has been composed by Vyasa.

data.v: प्रदाता सर्वलोकानां विश्वं चाप्युच्यते महत् । ज्येष्ठभूतं वदन्त्येनं ब्राह्मणा ऋषयोऽपरे ॥
data.md: These provide all worlds with the desired things. This huge universe has been told as their own appearance. Indeed, the Brahmanas and Rishis call him the eldest of all beings.

data.v: प्रथमो ह्येष देवानां मुखादग्निरजायत । ग्रहैर्बहुविधैः प्राणान्संरुद्धानुत्सृजत्यपि ॥
data.md: He is the first of all the celestials, and it was from his mouth that he created Agni. That great deity, ever willing to grant protection to all, never forsakes his suppliants.

data.v: स मोचयति पुण्यात्मा शरण्यः शरणागतान् । आयुरारोग्यमैश्वर्यं वित्तं कामांश्च पुष्कलान् ॥
data.md: He would much rather give up his own life and suffer all possible afflictions himself. Long life, health and freedom from disease, affluence, wealth, various kinds of pleasures and enjoyinents, are conferred by him, and it is he also who snatches them away. The lordship and affluence that one sees in Shakra and the Other celestials are, indeed, his.

data.v: स ददाति मनुष्येभ्यः स एवाक्षिपते पुनः । शक्रादिषु च देवेषु तस्य चैश्वर्यमुच्यते ॥
स एवाभ्यधिको नित्यं त्रैलोक्यस्य शुभाशुभे । ऐश्वर्याच्चैव कामानामीश्वरः पुनरुच्यते ॥
data.md: It is he who is always engaged in all that is good and evil in the three worlds. On account of his fullest control over all objects of enjoyment he is called Ishvara.

data.v: महेश्वरश्च लोकानां महतामीश्वरश्च सः । बहुभिर्विविधै रूपैर्विश्वं व्याप्तमिदं जगत् । तस्य देवस्य यद्वक्त्रं समुद्रे वडवामुखम् ॥
data.md: Because he is the master of the vast universe, therefore he is called Maheshvara. The whole universe is pervaded by him in various forms. His mouth roars and burns the waters of the sea in the form of the huge mare's head.

data.v: इत्युक्तवति वाक्यं तु कृष्णे देवकिनन्दने । भीष्मं शांतनवं भूयः पर्यपृच्छद्युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said After Krishna, the son of Devaki, had said these words, Yudhishthira once more asked Bhishma the son of Shantanu, saying, O you of great intelligence, O foremost of all persons, knowing duties, which, indeed of the two, direct perception and the scriptures, is to be considered as authority for coming to a conclusion?

data.v: निर्णये वा महाबुद्धे सर्वधर्मभृतां वर । प्रत्यक्षमागमो वेति किं तयोः कारणं भवेत् ॥
नास्त्यत्र संशयः कश्चिदिति मे वर्तते मतिः । शृणु वक्ष्यामि ते प्राज्ञ सम्यक्त्वमनुपृच्छसि ॥
data.md: Bhishma said I think there is no doubt in this. Listen to me, O you of great wisdom. I shall answer you. The question you have asked is indeed proper. It is easy to entertain doubt. But the solution of that doubt is difficult.

data.v: संशयः सुगमो राजन्निर्णयस्त्वत्र दुर्गमः । दृष्टं श्रुतमनन्तं हि यत्र संशयदर्शनम् ॥
प्रत्यक्षं कारणं दृष्टं हेतुकाः प्राज्ञमानिनः । नास्तीत्येवं व्यवस्यन्ति सत्यं संशयमेव च । तदयुक्तं व्यवस्यन्ति बालाः पण्डितमानिनः ॥
data.md: They assert that nothing, however true, exists which is not directly perceivable; or, at least, they doubt the existence of those objects. Such assertions however are absurd and they who make them are fools, whatever their pride of learning.

data.v: अथ चेन्मन्यसे चैकं कारणं किं भवेदिति । शक्यं दीर्घेण कालेन युक्तेनातन्द्रितेन च । प्राणयात्रामनेकां च कल्पयानेन भारत ॥
data.md: If, on the other hand, you entertain any doubt how the one indivisible Brahman could be the cause, I answer that one would understand it only after many years and with the help of Yoga practised assiduously.

data.v: तत्परेणैव नान्येन शक्यं ह्येतत्तु कारणम् । हेतूनामन्तमासाद्य विपुलं ज्ञानमुत्तमम् । ज्योतिः सर्वस्य लोकस्य विपुलं प्रतिपद्यते ॥
data.md: When one gets to the very end of reasons, he attains to that excellent and all comprehending knowledge—that vast mass of effulgence, which illumines all the universe (called Brahma).

data.v: तत्त्वेनागमनं राजन्हेत्वन्तगमनं तथा । अग्राह्यमनिबद्धं च वाचः संपरिवर्जनम् ॥
data.md: That knowledge, O king, which is derived from can hardly be said to be knowledge. Such knowledge should rejected. It should be understood, that it is not defined or comprehended by the word. It should, therefore, be rejected.

data.v: प्रत्यक्षं लोकतः सिद्धं लोकाश्चागमपूर्वकाः । शिष्टाचारो बहुविधो ब्रूहि तन्मे पितामह ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Tell me, O grandfather, which among these (four) is most authoritative, viz., direct reason be perception, Inference from observation, the science of scriptures, and various kinds of practices which distinguish the good.

data.v: धर्मस्य ह्रियमाणस्य बलवद्भिर्दुरात्मभिः । संस्था यत्नैरपि कृता कालेन परिभिद्यते ॥
data.md: Bhishma said While virtue is sought to be destroyed by wicked persons possessed of great power, it is capable of being protected for the time being by those who are good if they work with care and earnestness. Such protection, however, is of no use in the long run, for destruction does overtake virtue at the end.

data.v: अधर्मा धर्मरूपेण तृणैः कूपा इवावृताः । ततस्तैर्भिद्यते वृत्तं शृणु चैव युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Then, again, virtue often proves a mark for covering sin, like grass and straw covering the mouth of a deep pit and concealing it from the view. Hear, again, O Yudhishthira. On account of this, the practices of the good are interfered with and destroyed by the wicked.

data.v: अवृत्त्या ये च भिन्दन्ति श्रुतत्यागपरायणाः । धर्मविद्वेषिणो मन्दा इत्युक्तस्तेषु संशयः ॥
data.md: Those persons who are evildoers, who discard the Shrutis, indeed, those wicked persons who are haters of virtue destroy that good conduct, hence, doubts attach to direct perception, Inference, and good conduct.

data.v: अतृप्यन्तस्तु साधूनां य एवागमबुद्धयः । परमित्येव संतुष्टास्तानुपास्स्व च पृच्छ च ॥
data.md: Those, therefore, among the good who are possessed of understanding purified by the scriptures and who are ever contented, are to be considered as the foremost. Let those who are anxious and deprived of tranquility of soul, approach these. Indeed, O Yudhishthira, do you seek them and ask them for the solutions of your doubts.

data.v: कामार्थौ पृष्ठतः कृत्वा लोभमोहानुसारिणौ । धर्म इत्येव संबुद्धास्तानुपास्स्व च पृच्छ च ॥
data.md: Disregarding both Pleasure and Profit which always follow cupidity and cherishing the condition that only virtues should be sought, do you, O Yudhishthira, wait upon and ask those persons.

data.v: न तेषां भिद्यते वृत्तं यज्ञस्वाध्यायकर्मभिः । आचारः कारणं चैव धर्मश्चैव त्रयं पुनः ॥
data.md: The conduct of those persons never goes wrong or meets with destruction, as also their sacrifices and Vedic study and rites. Indeed, these three, viz., good conduct, mental purity, and the Vedas together form virtue.

data.v: पुनरेवेह मे बुद्धिः संशये परिमुह्यते । अपारे मार्गमाणस्य परं तीरमपश्यतः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O grandfather, my understanding is once more stupefied by doubt. I am on this side of the ocean, engaged in searching after the ineans of crossing it. I do not, however, see the other shore of the ocean.

data.v: वेदाः प्रत्यक्षमाचारः प्रमाणं तत्त्रयं यदि । पृथक्त्वं लभ्यते चैषां धर्मश्चैकस्त्रयं कथम् ॥
data.md: If these three, viz., the Vedas, direct perception and behaviour (or mental purity) together form what is to be considered as authority, it can be alleged that there is difference between each. Virtue then becomes really of three kinds although it is one and indivisible.

data.v: धर्मस्य ह्रियमाणस्य बलवद्भिर्दुरात्मभिः । यद्येवं मन्यसे राजंस्त्रिधा धर्मविचारणा ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Virtue is sometimes seen to be destroyed by a wicked man of great power. If you think, O king, that virtue should really be of three sorts. I answer that your conclusion is supported by reason.

data.v: एक एवेति जानीहि त्रिधा तस्य प्रदर्शनम् । पृथक्त्वे चैव मे बुद्धिस्त्रयाणामपि वै तथा ॥
data.md: The truth is that virtue is one and indivisible, although it is capable of being scen from three different points.

data.v: उक्तो मार्गस्त्रयाणां च तत्तथैव समाचर । जिज्ञासा तु न कर्तव्या धर्मस्य परितर्कणात् ॥
data.md: The paths, of those three, which form the foundation of virtue have each been laid down. Do you act according to the instructions laid down. You should never wrangle about virtue and then seek to have those doubts of yours removed.

data.v: सदैव भरतश्रेष्ठ मा ते भूदत्र संशयः । अन्धो जड इवाशङ्को यद्ब्रवीमि तदाचर ॥
data.md: O chief of the Bharatas, let no doubts like these ever take possession of your mind. Do you obey unhesitatingly what I say. Follow me like a blind man or like one who, having no sense himself, has to depend upon that of another.

data.v: अहिंसा सत्यमक्रोधो दानमेतच्चतुष्टयम् । अजातशत्रो सेवस्व धर्म एष सनातनः ॥
data.md: Abstention from injury, truth, absence of anger (or forgiveness), and liberality or gifts, these four, O king do you practise, for these four form eternal virtue.

data.v: ब्राह्मणेषु च वृत्तिर्या पितृपैतामहोचिता । तामन्वेहि महाबाहो स्वर्गस्यैते हि देशिकाः ॥
data.md: Do you also, O mightyarmed prince, follow that conduct towards the Brahmanas which is consistent with what has been observed towards them by your father and grandfather. These are the principal marks of virtue.

data.v: प्रमाणमप्रमाणं वै यः कुर्यादबुधो नरः । न स प्रमाणतामर्हो विवादजननो हि सः ॥
data.md: That foolish wight, who would destroy the weight of authority by denying that to be a standard which has always been accepted as such, would himself fail to become an authority among men. Such a man becomes the cause of much sorrow in the world.

data.v: ब्राह्मणानेव सेवस्व सत्कृत्य बहुमन्य च । एतेष्वेव त्विमे लोकाः कृत्स्ना इति निबोध तान् ॥
data.md: Do you respect the Brahmanas and treat them with hospitality. Do you always serve them in this way. The universe rests on them. Do you understand them to be such.

data.v: ये च धर्ममसूयन्ति ये चैनं पर्युपासते । ब्रवीतु भगवानेतत्क्व ते गच्छन्ति तादृशाः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Tell me, O grandfather, what the respective ends are of those who hate virtue and of those who worship and observe it.

data.v: रजसा तमसा चैव समवस्तीर्णचेतसः । नरकं प्रतिपद्यन्ते धर्मविद्वेषिणो नराः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said Those men who hate virtue are said to have their hearts possessed by the qualities of passion and darkness. Such men have always to go to Hell.

data.v: ये तु धर्मं महाराज सततं पर्युपासते । सत्यार्जवपराः सन्तस्ते वै स्वर्गभुजो नराः ॥
data.md: Those men, on the other hand, O king, who always observe virtue, those men who are given to truth and sincerity, are called good. They always enjoy the pleasures or happiness of the celestial region.

data.v: धर्म एव रतिस्तेषामाचार्योपासनाद्भवेत् । देवलोकं प्रपद्यन्ते ये धर्मं पर्युपासते ॥
data.md: On account of their waiting upon their preceptors with respect their hearts always turn towards virtue. Indeed they, who worship virtuc, attain to the region of the celestials.

data.v: मनुष्या यदि वा देवाः शरीरमुपताप्य वै । धर्मिणः सुखमेधन्ते लोभद्वेषविवर्जिताः ॥
data.md: Those individuals, whether men or celestials, who are shorn of cupidity and malice and who emaciate or afflict their bodies by the practice of austerities succeed, on account of the virtle which they thus acquire, to attain to great happiness.

data.v: प्रथमं ब्रह्मणः पुत्रं धर्ममाहुर्मनीषिणः । धर्मिणः पर्युपासन्ते फलं पक्वमिवाशयः ॥
data.md: The righteous always adore them with love and affection as a hungry man's stomach longs for ripe and sweet fruits.

data.v: असतां कीदृशं रूपं साधवः किं च कुर्वते । ब्रवीतु मे भवानेतत्सन्तोऽसन्तश्च कीदृशाः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said What are the marks of the wicked, and what are those deeds which the good do? Explain to me this, O holy one, Indeed, tell me what characteristics are of the good and the wicked.

data.v: दुराचाराश्च दुर्धर्षा दुर्मुखाश्चाप्यसाधवः । साधवः शीलसंपन्नाः शिष्टाचारस्य लक्षणम् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said The wicked are evil in their practices, incapable of being governed by rules, and eviltongued. The good are, however, always good in their deeds. Indeed the acts these men do are considered as the characteristics of good deeds.

data.v: राजमार्गे गवां मध्ये गोष्ठमध्ये च धर्मिणः । नोपसेवन्ति राजेन्द्र सर्गं मूत्रपुरीषयोः ॥
data.md: The good or the righteous, O king, never answer the two calls of nature on the public road, or in the midst of a cowpen or on a field of paddy.

data.v: पञ्चानामशनं दत्त्वा शेषमश्नन्ति साधवः । न जल्पन्ति च भुञ्जाना न निद्रान्त्यार्द्रपाणयः ॥
data.md: After feeding the five they take their own food. They never talk while eating, and never go to sleep with wet hands.

data.v: चित्रभानुमनड्वाहं देवं गोष्ठं चतुष्पथम् । ब्राह्मणं धार्मिकं चैत्यं ते कुर्वन्ति प्रदक्षिणम् ॥
data.md: Whenever they see any of the following, they go round them for showing them respect, viz., a burning fire, a bull, the image of a deity, a cowpen, a crossing place of four roads, and an old and virtuous Brahmana.

data.v: वृद्धानां भारतप्तानां स्त्रीणां बालातुरस्य च । ब्राह्मणानां गवां राज्ञां पन्थानं ददते च ते ॥
data.md: Themselves standing aside they give the way to those that are old, those that are afflicted with burdens, ladies, those that hold high appointments in the village or town administration, Brahmanas, kine, and kings.

data.v: अतिथीनां च सर्वेषां प्रेष्याणां स्वजनस्य च । तथा शरणकामानां गोप्ता स्यात्स्वागतप्रदः ॥
data.md: The righteous or good man is he who protects his guests, servants and other dependants, his own relatives, and all those who seek his protection. Such a man always welcomes these with the usual polite enquiries.

data.v: सायं प्रातर्मनुष्याणामशनं देवनिर्मितम् । नान्तरा भोजनं दृष्टमुपवासविधिर्हि सः ॥
data.md: As ordained by the deities human beings should take their food twice a day. viz., morning and evening. During the interval one should not eat anything. By following this rule about cating, one is said to observe a fast.

data.v: होमकाले यथा वह्निः कालमेव प्रतीक्षते । ऋतुकाले तथा नारी ऋतुमेव प्रतीक्षते । न चान्यां गच्छते यस्तु ब्रह्मचर्यं हि तत्स्मृतम् ॥
data.md: As the sacred fire waits for libations to be poured upon it when the hour for Homa arrives, so a woman, when her period is over, cxpects sexual union with her husband.

data.v: अमृतं ब्राह्मणा गाव इत्येतत्त्रयमेकतः । तस्माद्गोब्राह्मणं नित्यमर्चयेत यथाविधि ॥
यजुषा संस्कृतं मांसमुपभुञ्जन्न दुष्यति । पृष्ठमांसं वृथामांसं पुत्रमांसं च तत्समम् ॥
स्वदेशे परदेशे वाप्यतिथिं नोपवासयेत् । कर्म वै सफलं कृत्वा गुरूणां प्रतिपादयेत् ॥
गुरुभ्य आसनं देयमभिवाद्याभिपूज्य च । गुरूनभ्यर्च्य वर्धन्ते आयुषा यशसा श्रिया ॥
वृद्धान्नातिवदेज्जातु न च संप्रेषयेदपि । नासीनः स्यात्स्थितेष्वेवमायुरस्य न रिष्यते ॥
न नग्नामीक्षते नारीं न विद्वान्पुरुषानपि । मैथुनं सततं गुप्तमाहारं च समाचरेत् ॥
तीर्थानां गुरवस्तीर्थं शुचीनां हृदयं शुचि । दर्शनानां परं ज्ञानं संतोषः परमं सुखम् ॥
सायं प्रातश्च वृद्धानां शृणुयात्पुष्कला गिरः । श्रुतमाप्नोति हि नरः सततं वृद्धसेवया ॥
स्वाध्याये भोजने चैव दक्षिणं पाणिमुद्धरेत् । यच्छेद्वाङ्मनसी नित्यमिन्द्रियाणां च विभ्रमम् ॥
संस्कृतं पायसं नित्यं यवागूं कृसरं हविः । अष्टकाः पितृदैवत्या वृद्धानामभिपूजनम् ॥
श्मश्रुकर्मणि मङ्गल्यं क्षुतानामभिनन्दनम् । व्याधितानां च सर्वेषामायुषः प्रतिनन्दनम् ॥
न जातु त्वमिति ब्रूयादापन्नोऽपि महत्तरम् । त्वंकारो वा वधो वेति विद्वत्सु न विशिष्यते । अवराणां समानानां शिष्याणां च समाचरेत् ॥
data.md: One should never address an eminent person familiarly. Under even the greatest difficulties one should never do this. To you such a person are degraded by such a manner of address.

data.v: पापमाचक्षते नित्यं हृदयं पापकर्मिणाम् । ज्ञानपूर्वं विनश्यन्ति गूहमाना महाजने ॥
data.md: Those men, who have deliberately committed sins, meet with destruction by trying to conceal them from the good. Indeed, the confirmed sinners try to conceal their sinful deeds from others.

data.v: ज्ञानपूर्वं कृतं कर्म च्छादयन्ते ह्यसाधवः । न मां मनुष्याः पश्यन्ति न मां पश्यन्ति देवताः । पापेनाभिहतः पापः पापमेवाभिजायते ॥
data.md: Such persons think that their sins are seen neither by men nor the celestials. The sinful man, laden with his sins, takes birth in a miserable order of being.

data.v: यथा वार्धुषिको वृद्धिं देहभेदे प्रतीक्षते । धर्मेणापिहितं पापं धर्ममेवाभिवर्धयेत् ॥
data.md: The sins of such a man continually grow, even as the interest charged by an usurer daily multiplies itself. If having committed a sin, one seeks to have it covered by virtue, that sin becomes destroyed and leads to virtue instead of to other sins.

data.v: यथा लवणमम्भोभिराप्लुतं प्रविलीयते । प्रायश्चित्तहतं पापं तथा सद्यः प्रणश्यति ॥
data.md: If a quantity of water be poured upon salt, the latter is immediately dissolved. So when expiation is performed, sin is dissipated.

data.v: तस्मात्पापं न गूहेत गूहमानं विवर्धते । कृत्वा तु साधुष्वाख्येयं ते तत्प्रशमयन्त्युत ॥
data.md: For these reasons one should never conceal a sin. Concealed, it is sure to increase, Having committed a sin, one should confess it before the good. They would then destroy it forthwith.

data.v: आशया संचितं द्रव्यं यत्काले नोपभुज्यते । अन्ये चैतत्प्रपद्यन्ते वियोगे तस्य देहिनः ॥
data.md: If one does not enjoy in good time what he has stored with hope, the result is that the stored wealth passes into another man's hands after the death of him who has stored it.

data.v: मानसं सर्वभूतानां धर्ममाहुर्मनीषिणः । तस्मात्सर्वाणि भूतानि धर्ममेव समासते ॥
data.md: The wise have said that the mind of every creature is the true test of virtue Hence, all creatures in this world have an innate tendency to achieve virtue.

data.v: एक एव चरेद्धर्मं न धर्मध्वजिको भवेत् । धर्मवाणिजका ह्येते ये धर्ममुपभुञ्जते ॥
data.md: One should achieve virtue alone singlehanded. Indeed, one should not proclaim himself virtuous and walk with the standard of virtue upraised for purposes of show. They are said to be traders in virtue who practice it for enjoying its fruits.

data.v: अर्चेद्देवानदम्भेन सेवेतामायया गुरून् । निधिं निदध्यात्पारत्र्यं यात्रार्थं दानशब्दितम् ॥
data.md: One should worship the celestials without giving way to sentiments of pride. Similarly, one should serve his preceptor without deceit. or One should make arrangements for securing to himself invaluable riches in the next world which consists in gifts made here to worthy; persons. One should make arrangements for securing to himself invaluable riches in the next world which consists in gifts made here to worthy; persons.

data.v: नाभागधेयः प्राप्नोति धनं सुबलवानपि । भागधेयान्वितस्त्वर्थान्कृशो बालश्च विन्दति ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said It is seen that if a person happens to be unfortunate, he fails to acquire riches how greatsoever his strength. On the other hand, if he happens to be fortunate, he amasses riches, even if he be a weak or a foolish wight.

data.v: नालाभकाले लभते प्रयत्नेऽपि कृते सति । लाभकालेऽप्रयत्नेन लभते विपुलं धनम् । कृतयत्नाफलाश्चैव दृश्यन्ते शतशो नराः ॥
data.md: When, again, the time does not come for acquisition, one cannot make an acquisition, even if he tries his best. When, however, the time comes for acquisition, one acquires great wealth without any exertion.

data.v: यदि यत्नो भवेन्मर्त्यः स सर्वं फलमाप्नुयात् । नालभ्यं चोपलभ्येत नृणां भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: If riches were the result of exertion, then one could, with exertion, acquire it forthwith. Among men, that which is not to be attained, O chief of the Bharatas, is never attained. Men are seen to fail in gaining results even if they try their best.

data.v: यदा प्रयत्नं कृतवान्दृश्यते ह्यफलो नरः । मार्गन्नयशतैरर्थानमार्गंश्चापरः सुखी ॥
अकार्यमसकृत्कृत्वा दृश्यन्ते ह्यधना नराः । धनयुक्तास्त्वधर्मस्था दृश्यन्ते चापरे जनाः ॥
अधीत्य नीतिं यस्माच्च नीतियुक्तो न दृश्यते । अनभिज्ञश्च साचिव्यं गमितः केन हेतुना । विद्यायुक्तो ह्यविद्यश्च धनवान्दुर्गतस्तथा ॥
data.md: One, again, may be seen appointed as the prime minister of a king without having at all studied the moral and political sciences. A learned man may be seen who has wealth. An ignorant man may be seen having wealth. Both kinds of men, again, may be seen who has wealth.

data.v: यदि विद्यामुपाश्रित्य नरः सुखमवाप्नुयात् । न विद्वान्विद्यया हीनं वृत्त्यर्थमुपसंश्रयेत् ॥
data.md: If by the acquisition of learning one could acquire the happiness of riches then no man of learning could be found living, for the very means of his livelihood, under the protection of one shorn of learning.

data.v: यथा पिपासां जयति पुरुषः प्राप्य वै जलम् । दृष्टार्थो विद्ययाप्येवमविद्यां प्रजहेन्नरः ॥
data.md: Indeed, if one could obtain, by the acquisition of learning, all desirable objects like a thirsty individual having his thirst satisfied upon getting water, then none in this world would have shown idleness in acquiring learning.

data.v: नाप्राप्तकालो म्रियते विद्धः शरशतैरपि । तृणाग्रेणापि संस्पृष्टः प्राप्तकालो न जीवति ॥
data.md: If one's time has not come, one does not die even if cut with hundreds of shafts. On the other hand, one dies if his hour has come, even if it be a blade of grass with which he is struck.

data.v: ईहमानः समारम्भान्यदि नासादयेद्धनम् । उग्रं तपः समारोहेन्न ह्यनुप्तं प्ररोहति ॥
data.md: Bhishma said If one, by performing arduous works, fails to acquire wealth, he should then practise severe austeritics. Unless seeds be sown, no crops appear.

data.v: दानेन भोगी भवति मेधावी वृद्धसेवया । अहिंसया च दीर्घायुरिति प्राहुर्मनीषिणः ॥
data.md: It is by making gifts that one gets numerous objects of enjoyment; one becomes endued with intelligence and wisdom by waiting upon the elders. The wise have said that one becomes longlived by practising the duty of abstention from cruelty to all creatures.

data.v: तस्माद्दद्यान्न याचेत पूजयेद्धार्मिकानपि । स्वाभाषी प्रियकृच्छुद्धः सर्वसत्त्वाविहिंसकः ॥
data.md: Hence, one should make gifts and not solicit and one should adore individuals. Indeed one should be sweet-speeched towards all, and always do what is agreeable to others. One should seek to attain to purity; one should always abstain from doing injury 10 any crcature,

data.v: यदा प्रमाणप्रभवः स्वभावश्च सुखासुखे । मशकीटपिपीलानां स्थिरो भव युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: It is but proper, O Yudhishthira, that you should be possessed by peaceful sentiments, since their deeds and Nature are the ruling causes of happiness and misery to even insects and ants.

data.v: कार्यते यच्च क्रियते सच्चासच्च कृतं ततः । तत्राश्वसीत सत्कृत्वा असत्कृत्वा न विश्वसेत् ॥
data.md: Bhishma said If one does good deeds or causes others to do them, he should then expect to attain to the merits of virtue; likewise if one does evil deeds and causes others to do them, he should never expect to attain to the merits of virtue.

data.v: काल एवात्र कालेन निग्रहानुग्रहौ ददत् । बुद्धिमाविश्य भूतानां धर्मार्थेषु प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: At all times, it is Time, which entering the understanding of all creatures, sets them to deeds of virtue or sin and then confers happiness or misery upon them.

data.v: यदा त्वस्य भवेद्बुद्धिर्धर्म्या चार्थप्रदर्शिनी । तदाश्वसीत धर्मात्मादृढबुद्धिर्न विश्वसेत् ॥
data.md: When a person, seeing the fruits of virtue understands virtue to be superior, it is then that he inclines towards virtue and puts faith in il. One, however, whose understanding is not firm, cannot place faith in it.

data.v: एतावन्मात्रमेतद्धि भूतानां प्राज्ञलक्षणम् । कालयुक्तोऽप्युभयविच्छेषमर्थं समाचरेत् ॥
data.md: As regards faith in virtue, it is this. To place faith in virtue is the mark of the wisdom of all persons. One, who is acquainted with what should be done and what should not be done, with a view to opportuneness, should, with care and devotion, do what is right.

data.v: यथा ह्युपस्थितैश्वर्याः पूजयन्ते नरा नरान् । एवमेवात्मनात्मानं पूजयन्तीह धार्मिकाः ॥
data.md: Those virtuous men, who have in this life been blessed with riches acting of their own accord, take particular care of their souls so that they may not, in their next lives, have to take birth as persons with the quality of darkness predominating in them.

data.v: न ह्यधर्मतया धर्मं दद्यात्कालः कथंचन । तस्माद्विशुद्धमात्मानं जानीयाद्धर्मचारिणम् ॥
data.md: Time can never make the cause of misery. One should, therefore, know that the soul which is virtuous is certainly pure.

data.v: स्प्रष्टुमप्यसमर्थो हि ज्वलन्तमिव पावकम् । अधर्मः सततो धर्मं कालेन परिरक्षितम् ॥
data.md: As regards sin, it may be said that, even when it is very great it is incapable of even touching virtue which is always protected by time and which shines like a burning fire.

data.v: कार्यावेतौ हि कालेन धर्मो हि विजयावहः । त्रयाणामपि लोकानामालोककरणो भवेत् ॥
data.md: These are the two results achieved by virtue, viz., the purity of the soul and unsusceptibility of being touched by iniquity Indeed virtue is fraught with victory. Its effulgence is so great that it lights up the three worlds.

data.v: तत्र कश्चिन्नयेत्प्राज्ञो गृहीत्वैव करे नरम् । उह्यमानः स धर्मेण धर्मे बहुभयच्छले ॥
data.md: A wise man cannot catch holds of a sinful person and forcibly make him pious. When seriously urged to act piously the sinful only act with hypocrisy, moved by fear.

data.v: किं श्रेयः पुरुषस्येह किं कुर्वन्सुखमेधते । विपाप्मा च भवेत्केन किं वा कल्मषनाशनम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said What, indeed, is beneficial for a person in this world? What is that by doing which one may acquire happiness? By what may one be purged of all his sins? Indeed, what is that which destroys sins?

data.v: अयं दैवतवंशो वै ऋषिवंशसमन्वितः । द्विसंध्यं पठितः पुत्र कल्मषापहरः परः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said O son, the following names of the celestials with those of the Rishis, if duly recited morning, noon, and evening, destroy all sins.

data.v: देवासुरगुरुर्देवः सर्वभूतनमस्कृतः । अचिन्त्योऽथाप्यनिर्देश्यः सर्वप्राणो ह्ययोनिजः ॥
data.md: The master of all the celestials and Apsaras, resplendent with effulgence, adored of all creatures, inconceivable, indescribable, the life of all living beings, and unborn is the Grandfather Brahman, that Lord of the universe. His chaste wife is Savittri. Then comes that origin of the Vedas, the creator Vishnu, otherwise called Narayana of immeasurable power.

data.v: पितामहो जगन्नाथः सावित्री ब्रह्मणः सती । वेदभूरथ कर्ता च विष्णुर्नारायणः प्रभुः ॥
उमापतिर्विरूपाक्षः स्कन्दः सेनापतिस्तथा । विशाखो हुतभुग्वायुश्चन्द्रादित्यौ प्रभाकरौ ॥
शक्रः शचीपतिर्देवो यमो धूमोर्णया सह । वरुणः सह गौर्या च सह ऋद्ध्या धनेश्वरः ॥
सौम्या गौः सुरभिर्देवी विश्रवाश्च महानृषिः । षट्कालः सागरो गङ्गा स्रवन्त्योऽथ मरुद्गणाः ॥
वालखिल्यास्तपःसिद्धाः कृष्णद्वैपायनस्तथा । नारदः पर्वतश्चैव विश्वावसुर्हहाहुहूः ॥
तुम्बरुश्चित्रसेनश्च देवदूतश्च विश्रुतः । देवकन्या महाभागा दिव्याश्चाप्सरसां गणाः ॥
उर्वशी मेनका रम्भा मिश्रकेशी अलम्बुषा । विश्वाची च घृताची च पञ्चचूडा तिलोत्तमा ॥
आदित्या वसवो रुद्राः साश्विनः पितरोऽपि च । धर्मः सत्यं तपो दीक्षा व्यवसायः पितामहः ॥
शर्वर्यो दिवसाश्चैव मारीचः कश्यपस्तथा । शुक्रो बृहस्पतिर्भौमो बुधो राहुः शनैश्चरः ॥
नक्षत्राण्यृतवश्चैव मासाः संध्याः सवत्सराः । वैनतेयाः समुद्राश्च कद्रुजाः पन्नगास्तथा ॥
शतद्रूश्च विपाशा च चन्द्रभागा सरस्वती । सिन्धुश्च देविका चैव पुष्करं तीर्थमेव च ॥
गङ्गा महानदी चैव कपिला नर्मदा तथा । कम्पुना च विशल्या च करतोयाम्बुवाहिनी ॥
सरयूर्गण्डकी चैव लोहित्यश्च महानदः । ताम्रारुणा वेत्रवती पर्णाशा गौतमी तथा ॥
गोदावरी च वेण्णा च कृष्णवेणा तथाद्रिजा । दृषद्वती च कावेरी वंक्षुर्मन्दाकिनी तथा ॥
प्रयागं च प्रभासं च पुण्यं नैमिषमेव च । तच्च विश्वेश्वरस्थानं यत्र तद्विमलं सरः ॥
पुण्यतीर्थैश्च कलिलं कुरुक्षेत्रं प्रकीर्तितम् । सिन्धूत्तमं तपोदानं जम्बूमार्गमथापि च ॥
हिरण्वती वितस्ता च तथैवेक्षुमती नदी । वेदस्मृतिर्वैदसिनी मलवासाश्च नद्यपि ॥
भूमिभागास्तथा पुण्या गङ्गाद्वारमथापि च । ऋषिकुल्यास्तथा मेध्या नदी चित्रपथा तथा ॥
कौशिकी यमुना सीता तथा चर्मण्वती नदी । नदी भीमरथी चैव बाहुदा च महानदी । महेन्द्रवाणी त्रिदिवा नीलिका च सरस्वती ॥
नन्दा चापरनन्दा च तथा तीर्थं महाह्रदम् । गयाथ फल्गुतीर्थं च धर्मारण्यं सुरैर्वृतम् ॥
तथा देवनदी पुण्या सरश्च ब्रह्मनिर्मितम् । पुण्यं त्रिलोकविख्यातं सर्वपापहरं शिवम् ॥
हिमवान्पर्वतश्चैव दिव्यौषधिसमन्वितः । विन्ध्यो धातुविचित्राङ्गस्तीर्थवानौषधान्वितः ॥
मेरुर्महेन्द्रो मलयः श्वेतश्च रजताचितः । शृङ्गवान्मन्दरो नीलो निषधो दर्दुरस्तथा ॥
चित्रकूटोऽञ्जनाभश्च पर्वतो गन्धमादनः । पुण्यः सोमगिरिश्चैव तथैवान्ये महीधराः । दिशश्च विदिशश्चैव क्षितिः सर्वे महीरुहाः ॥
विश्वेदेवा नभश्चैव नक्षत्राणि ग्रहास्तथा । पान्तु वः सततं देवाः कीर्तिताकीर्तिता मया ॥
कीर्तयानो नरो ह्येतान्मुच्यते सर्वकिल्बिषैः । स्तुवंश्च प्रतिनन्दंश्च मुच्यते सर्वतो भयात् । सर्वसंकरपापेभ्यो देवतास्तवनन्दकः ॥
data.md: The man, who takes the names of these, becomes purged of all his sins. By singing their praises and pleasing them, one becomes freed from every fear.

data.v: देवतानन्तरं विप्रांस्तपःसिद्धांस्तपोधिकान् । कीर्तितान्कीर्तयिष्यामि सर्वपापप्रमोचनान् ॥
यवक्रीतोऽथ रैभ्यश्च कक्षीवानौशिजस्तथा । भृग्वङ्गिरास्तथा कण्वो मेधातिथिरथ प्रभुः । बर्ही च गुणसंपन्नः प्राचीं दिशमुपाश्रिताः ॥
data.md: After this recital of the deities, I shall name those learned Brahmanas crowned with ascetic merit and success and capable of purifying one of every sin. They are Yavakrita and Raibhya and Kakshivat and Aushija, and Bhrigu and Angirasa and Kanva and the powerful Medhatithi, and Varhi endued with every accomplishment. These all belong to the Eastern region.

data.v: भद्रां दिशं महाभागा उल्मुचुः प्रमुचुस्तथा । मुमुचुश्च महाभागः स्वस्त्यात्रेयश्च वीर्यवान् ॥
data.md: Others, viz., Unmuchu, Pramuchu, Mumuchu, all highly blessed, the highly energetic Svastyatreya, the highly powerful Agastya, the son of Mitra and Varuna; Dridhayu and Urdhavahu, those two foremost and celebrated of Rishis, these live in the Southern quarter.

data.v: मित्रावरुणयोः पुत्रस्तथागस्त्यः प्रतापवान् । दृढायुश्चोर्ध्वबाहुश्च विश्रुतावृषिसत्तमौ ॥
data.md: Others, viz., Unmuchu, Pramuchu, Mumuchu, all highly blessed, the highly energetic Svastyatreya, the highly powerful Agastya, the son of Mitra and Varuna; Dridhayu and Urdhavahu, those two foremost and celebrated of Rishis, these live in the Southern quarter.

data.v: पश्चिमां दिशमाश्रित्य य एधन्ते निबोध तान् । उषद्गुः सह सोदर्यैः परिव्याधश्च वीर्यवान् ॥
ऋषिर्दीर्घतमाश्चैव गौतमः कश्यपस्तथा । एकतश्च द्वितश्चैव त्रितश्चैव महर्षयः । अत्रेः पुत्रश्च धर्मात्मा तथा सारस्वतः प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Listen now to me as I name those Rishis who live in the Western quarter. They are Ushangu with his uterine brothers, greatly energetic, Dirghatamas, Gautama, Kashyapa, Ekata, Dvita, Trita, the righteous-souled son of Atri (viz., Durvasa). and and the powerful Sarasvati, Listen now to me as I name those Rishis who adore the celestial in sacrifices, living in the Northern region.

data.v: उत्तरां दिशमाश्रित्य य एधन्ते निबोध तान् । अत्रिर्वसिष्ठः शक्तिश्च पाराशर्यश्च वीर्यवान् ॥
विश्वामित्रो भरद्वाजो जमदग्निस्तथैव च । ऋचीकपौत्रो रामश्च ऋषिरौद्दालकिस्तथा ॥
श्वेतकेतुः कोहलश्च विपुलो देवलस्तथा । देवशर्मा च धौम्यश्च हस्तिकाश्यप एव च ॥
लोमशो नाचिकेतश्च लोमहर्षण एव च । ऋषिरुग्रश्रवाश्चैव भार्गवश्च्यवनस्तथा ॥
एष वै समवायस्ते ऋषिदेवसमन्वितः । आद्यः प्रकीर्तितो राजन्सर्वपापप्रमोचनः ॥
data.md: They are primeval Rishis, O king, whose names, if taken, are capable of purifying one of every sin. After this I shall recite the names of the principle kings.

data.v: नृगो ययातिर्नहुषो यदुः पूरुश्च वीर्यवान् । धुन्धुमारो दिलीपश्च सगरश्च प्रतापवान् ॥
कृशाश्वो यौवनाश्वश्च चित्राश्वः सत्यवांस्तथा । दुःषन्तो भरतश्चैव चक्रवर्ती महायशाः ॥
यवनो जनकश्चैव तथा दृढरथो नृपः । रघुर्नरवरश्चैव तथा दशरथो नृपः ॥
रामो राक्षसहा वीरः शशबिन्दुर्भगीरथः । हरिश्चन्द्रो मरुत्तश्च जह्नुर्जाह्नविसेविता ॥
महोदयो ह्यलर्कश्च ऐलश्चैव नराधिपः । करंधमो नरश्रेष्ठः कध्मोरश्च नराधिपः ॥
दक्षोऽम्बरीषः कुकुरो रवतश्च महायशाः । मुचुकुन्दश्च राजर्षिर्मित्रभानुः प्रियंकरः ॥
त्रसदस्युस्तथा राजा श्वेतो राजर्षिसत्तमः । महाभिषश्च विख्यातो निमिराजस्तथाष्टकः ॥
आयुः क्षुपश्च राजर्षिः कक्षेयुश्च नराधिपः । शिबिरौशीनरश्चैव गयश्चैव नराधिपः ॥
प्रतर्दनो दिवोदासः सौदासः कोसलेश्वरः । ऐलो नलश्च राजर्षिर्मनुश्चैव प्रजापतिः ॥
हविध्रश्च पृषध्रश्च प्रतीपः शंतनुस्तथा । कक्षसेनश्च राजर्षिर्ये चान्ये नानुकीर्तिताः ॥
मा विघ्नं मा च मे पापं मा च मे परिपन्थिनः । ध्रुवो जयो मे नित्यं स्यात्परत्र च परा गतिः ॥
data.md: Let no calamity visit me, let no sin define me, and let there be no opponents or enemies of mine. Forsooth, I will always have victory and an auspicious end hereafter.

data.v: तूष्णींभूते तदा भीष्मे पटे चित्रमिवार्पितम् । मुहूर्तमिव च ध्यात्वा व्यासः सत्यवतीसुतः । नृपं शयानं गाङ्गेयमिदमाह वचस्तदा ॥
राजन्प्रकृतिमापन्नः कुरुराजो युधिष्ठिरः । सहितो भ्रातृभिः सर्वैः पार्थिवैश्चानुयायिभिः ॥
data.md: Then Vyasa the son of Satyavati, having thought for a moment, addressed the royal son of Ganga, saying, O king, the Kuru king Yudhishthira has been restored to his own nature, with all his brothers and followers.

data.v: उपास्ते त्वां नरव्याघ्र सह कृष्णेन धीमता । तमिमं पुरयानाय त्वमनुज्ञातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: With highly intelligent Krishna by his side he bends his head in respect to you. You should give him leave for returning to the city.

data.v: एवमुक्तो भगवता व्यासेन पृथिवीपतिः । युधिष्ठिरं सहामात्यमनुजज्ञे नदीसुतः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by the holy Vyasa, the royal son of Shantanu and Ganga dismissed Yudhishthira and his counsellors.

data.v: उवाच चैनं मधुरं ततः शांतनवो नृपः । प्रविशस्व पुरं राजन्व्येतु ते मानसो ज्वरः ॥
data.md: Addressing his grandson in a sweet voice, the royal son of Shantanu, also said, Do you return to your city, O king, Let the fever of your heart be removed.

data.v: यजस्व विविधैर्यज्ञैर्बह्वन्नैः स्वाप्तदक्षिणैः । ययातिरिव राजेन्द्र श्रद्धादमपुरःसरः ॥
data.md: Do you adore the celestials in various sacrifices distinguished by large gifts of food and riches like Yayati himself, O foremost of kings, gifted with devotion and selfcontrol.

data.v: क्षत्रधर्मरतः पार्थ पितॄन्देवांश्च तर्पय । श्रेयसा योक्ष्यसे चैव व्येतु ते मानसो ज्वरः ॥
data.md: Devoted to the practices of the Kshatriya do you, O son of Pritha, please the departed manes and the celestials. You shall then acquire great benefits. Indeed let the fever of your heart be removed.

data.v: रञ्जयस्व प्रजाः सर्वाः प्रकृतीः परिसान्त्वय । सुहृदः फलसत्कारैरभ्यर्चय यथार्हतः ॥
data.md: Do you please all your subjects. Do you assure them and establish peace among all. Do you also honour all your wellwishers with such rewards as they deserve.

data.v: अनु त्वां तात जीवन्तु मित्राणि सुहृदस्तथा । चैत्यस्थाने स्थितं वृक्षं फलवन्तमिव द्विजाः ॥
data.md: Let all your friends and wellwishers live, depending on you for their means, as birds live, depending for their means upon a full grown tree laden with fruits and standing on a sacred spot.

data.v: आगन्तव्यं च भवता समये मम पार्थिव । विनिवृत्ते दिनकरे प्रवृत्ते चोत्तरायणे ॥
data.md: When the hour comes for departure from this world, do you come here, O king, I shall relinquish my body when the Sun, stopping in his southward course, will begin to return northwards.

data.v: तथेत्युक्त्वा तु कौन्तेयः सोऽभिवाद्य पितामहम् । प्रययौ सपरीवारो नगरं नागसाह्वयम् ॥
data.md: The son of Kunti answered, 'So be it!' and saluted his grandfather with respect and then started with all his relatives and followers, for the city of Hastinapur.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्रं पुरस्कृत्य गान्धारीं च पतिव्रताम् । सह तैरृषिभिः सर्वैर्भ्रातृभिः केशवेन च ॥
data.md: Headed by Dhritarashtra and also Gandhari who was greatly devoted to her husband and accompanied by the Rishis and Keshava as also by the citizens and the inhabitants of the country and by his counsellors, O monarch, that foremost one of Kuru's race entered the city of Hastinapur.

data.v: पौरजानपदैश्चैव मन्त्रिवृद्धैश्च पार्थिवः । प्रविवेश कुरुश्रेष्ठ पुरं वारणसाह्वयम् ॥
data.md: Headed by Dhritarashtra and also Gandhari who was greatly devoted to her husband and accompanied by the Rishis and Keshava as also by the citizens and the inhabitants of the country and by his counsellors, O monarch, that foremost one of Kuru's race entered the city of Hastinapur.

data.v: ततः कुन्तीसुतो राजा पौरजानपदं जनम् । पूजयित्वा यथान्यायमनुजज्ञे गृहान्प्रति ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Then having duly honoured the citizens and the inhabitants of the province, the royal son of Kunti dismissed them to their respective homes.

data.v: सान्त्वयामास नारीश्च हतवीरा हतेश्वराः । विपुलैरर्थदानैश्च तदा पाण्डुसुतो नृपः ॥
data.md: The Pandava king then consoled those women, who had lost their heroic husbands and sons in the battle, with profuse gifts of wealth.

data.v: सोऽभिषिक्तो महाप्राज्ञः प्राप्य राज्यं युधिष्ठिरः । अवस्थाप्य नरश्रेष्ठः सर्वाः स्वप्रकृतीस्तदा ॥
data.md: Having recovered his kingdom, Yudhishthira caused himself to be duly installed on the throne. That foremost of men then assured all his subjects by various deeds of good will.

data.v: द्विजेभ्यो बलमुख्येभ्यो नैगमेभ्यश्च सर्वशः । प्रतिगृह्याशिषो मुख्यास्तदा धर्मभृतां वरः ॥
data.md: That foremost of righteous men set himself to acquire the substantial blessings of the Brahmanas, of the foremost inilitary officers, and the leading citizens.

data.v: उषित्वा शर्वरीः श्रीमान्पञ्चाशन्नगरोत्तमे । समयं कौरवाग्र्यस्य सस्मार पुरुषर्षभः ॥
data.md: Having passed fifty nights in the capital, the blessed monarch recollected the time indicated by his grandfather as the hour of his departure from this world.

data.v: स निर्ययौ गजपुराद्याजकैः परिवारितः । दृष्ट्वा निवृत्तमादित्यं प्रवृत्तं चोत्तरायणम् ॥
data.md: Accompanied by a number of priests he then left the city of Hastinapur having seen that the sun ceasing to go southwards, had begun to proceed in his northward course.

data.v: घृतं माल्यं च गन्धांश्च क्षौमाणि च युधिष्ठिरः । चन्दनागरुमुख्यानि तथा कालागरूणि च ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira, the son of Kunti, took with bin a large quantity of clarified butter and floral garlands and scents and silken cloths and excellent sandal wood and Aquilaria Agallocha and dark cloewood, for cremating the body of Bhishma. Various kinds of rich garlands and gems also were among those stores.

data.v: प्रस्थाप्य पूर्वं कौन्तेयो भीष्मसंसाधनाय वै । माल्यानि च महार्हाणि रत्नानि विविधानि च ॥
धृतराष्ट्रं पुरस्कृत्य गान्धारीं च यशस्विनीम् । मातरं च पृथां धीमान्भ्रातॄंश्च पुरुषर्षभः ॥
जनार्दनेनानुगतो विदुरेण च धीमता । युयुत्सुना च कौरव्यो युयुधानेन चाभिभो ॥
महता राजभोग्येन परिबर्हेण संवृतः । स्तूयमानो महाराज भीष्मस्याग्नीननुव्रजन् ॥
निश्चक्राम पुरात्तस्माद्यथा देवपतिस्तथा । आससाद कुरुक्षेत्रे ततः शांतनवं नृपम् ॥
data.md: Thus accompanied, the king started from his city like a second king of the celestials. Soon he came upon the spot where the son of Shantanu was still lying on his bed of arrows.

data.v: उपास्यमानं व्यासेन पाराशर्येण धीमता । नारदेन च राजर्षे देवलेनासितेन च ॥
हतशिष्टैर्नृपैश्चान्यैर्नानादेशसमागतैः । रक्षिभिश्च महात्मानं रक्ष्यमाणं समन्ततः ॥
शयानं वीरशयने ददर्श नृपतिस्ततः । ततो रथादवारोहद्भ्रातृभिः सह धर्मराट् ॥
अभिवाद्याथ कौन्तेयः पितामहमरिंदमम् । द्वैपायनादीन्विप्रांश्च तैश्च प्रत्यभिनन्दितः ॥
ऋत्विग्भिर्ब्रह्मकल्पैश्च भ्रातृभिश्च सहाच्युतः । आसाद्य शरतल्पस्थमृषिभिः परिवारितम् ॥
data.md: Accompanied by his priests each of whom resembled the grandfather Brahman himself, as also by his brothers, Yudhishthira, of undecaying glory, then approach that spot whereon Bhishma lay on his bed of arrows surrounded by those reverend Rishis.

data.v: अब्रवीद्भरतश्रेष्ठं धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः । भ्रातृभिः सह कौरव्य शयानं निम्नगासुतम् ॥
data.md: Then king Yudhishthira the just with all his brothers, addressed that foremost one of Kuru's race, the son of the River Ganga, as he lay on that bed of his saying, I am Yudhishthira, O king. Salutations to thee, O son of the River Janhavi. If you hearest me still, O tell me what I am to do for thee.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरोऽहं नृपते नमस्ते जाह्नवीसुत । शृणोषि चेन्महाबाहो ब्रूहि किं करवाणि ते ॥
data.md: Then king Yudhishthira the just with all his brothers, addressed that foremost one of Kuru's race, the son of the River Ganga, as he lay on that bed of his saying, I am Yudhishthira, O king. Salutations to thee, O son of the River Janhavi. If you hearest me still, O tell me what I am to do for thee.

data.v: प्राप्तोऽस्मि समये राजन्नग्नीनादाय ते विभो । आचार्या ब्राह्मणाश्चैव ऋत्विजो भ्रातरश्च मे ॥
data.md: Carrying with me thy sacrificial fires, I have come here, O king and wait upon thec at the hour appointed. Preceptors of all branches of learning, Brahmanas, Ritvijas, all iny brothers, thy son the king Dhritarashtra of great energy, are all here with my counsellors as also Vasudeva of great prowess.

data.v: पुत्रश्च ते महातेजा धृतराष्ट्रो जनेश्वरः । उपस्थितः सहामात्यो वासुदेवश्च वीर्यवान् ॥
data.md: Carrying with me thy sacrificial fires, I have come here, O king and wait upon thec at the hour appointed. Preceptors of all branches of learning, Brahmanas, Ritvijas, all iny brothers, thy son the king Dhritarashtra of great energy, are all here with my counsellors as also Vasudeva of great prowess.

data.v: हतशिष्टाश्च राजानः सर्वे च कुरुजाङ्गलाः । तान्पश्य कुरुशार्दूल समुन्मीलय लोचने ॥
data.md: The remnant of unslain warriors, and all the denizens of Kurujangala, are also here, Opening the eyes, O chief of Kuru's race, do you see them.

data.v: यच्चेह किंचित्कर्तव्यं तत्सर्वं प्रापितं मया । यथोक्तं भवता काले सर्वमेव च तत्कृतम् ॥
data.md: Whatever should be done on this occasion have all been arranged and provided for by me. Indeed, at this hour which you hadst spoken of, all things have been kept in readiness.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु गाङ्गेयः कुन्तीपुत्रेण धीमता । ददर्श भारतान्सर्वान्स्थितान्संपरिवार्य तम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Thus addressed by the highly intelligent Kunti's son the son, of Ganga opened his eyes and all the Bharatas assembled there and stood around him.

data.v: ततश्चलवलिर्भीष्मः प्रगृह्य विपुलं भुजम् । ओघमेघस्वनो वाग्मी काले वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: The mighty Bhishma then, taking the strong hand of Yudhishthira, addressed hiin, in a voice deep as that of the clouds.

data.v: दिष्ट्या प्राप्तोऽसि कौन्तेय सहामात्यो युधिष्ठिर । परिवृत्तो हि भगवान्सहस्रांशुर्दिवाकरः ॥
data.md: By good luck, O son of Kunti, you have come here with all your counsellors, O Yudhishthira. The thousandrayed maker of day, the holy Sun, has begun his northward course.

data.v: अष्टपञ्चाशतं रात्र्यः शयानस्याद्य मे गताः । शरेषु निशिताग्रेषु यथा वर्षशतं तथा ॥
data.md: I have been lying on my bed here for fiftycight nights. Stretched these on shai ppointed arrows, I have felt this period to be as long as if it was a century.

data.v: माघोऽयं समनुप्राप्तो मासः पुण्यो युधिष्ठिर । त्रिभागशेषः पक्षोऽयं शुक्लो भवितुमर्हति ॥
data.md: O Yuthishthira, the lunar month of Magha has come. This is, again, the lighted fortnight and a fourth part of it ought by this (according to my calculations) be over.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा तु गाङ्गेयो धर्मपुत्रं युधिष्ठिरम् । धृतराष्ट्रमथामन्त्र्य काले वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Having said so to Yudhishthira the son of Dharma, Ganga's son Bhishma then saluted Dhritarashtra and said to him as follows.

data.v: राजन्विदितधर्मोऽसि सुनिर्णीतार्थसंशयः । बहुश्रुता हि ते विप्रा बहवः पर्युपासिताः ॥
data.md: Bhishma said O king, you know well the duties. All your doubts, again, relating to the science of wealth, have been well solved. You have served many learned Brahmanas.

data.v: वेदशास्त्राणि सर्वाणि धर्मांश्च मनुजेश्वर । वेदांश्च चतुरः साङ्गान्निखिलेनावबुध्यसे ॥
data.md: You know the subtile sciences connected with the Vedas, all the duties of religion, O king, and the whole of the four Vedas.

data.v: न शोचितव्यं कौरव्य भवितव्यं हि तत्तथा । श्रुतं देवरहस्यं ते कृष्णद्वैपायनादपि ॥
data.md: You should not grieve, therefore, O son of Kuru. That which was preordained has come to pass. It could not be otherwise. You have heard the mysteries relating to the deities from the lips of the Islandborn Rishi himself.

data.v: यथा पाण्डोः सुता राजंस्तथैव तव धर्मतः । तान्पालय स्थितो धर्मे गुरुशुश्रूषणे रतान् ॥
data.md: Yuthishthira and his brothers are morally as much your sons as are the sons of Pandu. Following the duties of religion, cherish and protect them. In their turn, they are always devoted to the service of their elders.

data.v: धर्मराजो हि शुद्धात्मा निदेशे स्थास्यते तव । आनृशंस्यपरं ह्येनं जानामि गुरुवत्सलम् ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira, the just, is pure souled. He will always be obedient to you. I know that he is given to the virtue of mercy or abstention from injury. He is devoted to his elders and preceptors.

data.v: तव पुत्रा दुरात्मानः क्रोधलोभपरायणाः । ईर्ष्याभिभूता दुर्वृत्तास्तान्न शोचितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Your sons wore all wickedsouled. They were full of anger and cupidity. Overwhelmed by envy they were all of wicked conduct. You should not grieve for them.

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा वचनं धृतराष्ट्रं मनीषिणम् । वासुदेवं महाबाहुमभ्यभाषत कौरवः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having said this much to Dhritarashtra of great wisdom, the Kuru chief then addressed Vasudeva of great arms.

data.v: भगवन्देवदेवेश सुरासुरनमस्कृत । त्रिविक्रम नमस्तेऽस्तु शङ्खचक्रगदाधर ॥
data.md: O holy one, O god of all gods O you adored by all the deities and Asuras, O you who didst cover the three worlds with three steps of thine, I bow unto thee, O wielder of the conch, the discus, and the mace.

data.v: अनुजानीहि मां कृष्ण वैकुण्ठ पुरुषोत्तम । रक्ष्याश्च ते पाण्डवेया भवान्ह्येषां परायणम् ॥
उक्तवानस्मि दुर्बुद्धिं मन्दं दुर्योधनं पुरा । यतः कृष्णस्ततो धर्मो यतो धर्मस्ततो जयः ॥
data.md: Formerly, I spoke the foolish Duryodhana of wicked understanding that there is Virtue where Krishna is, and that there is victory where Virtue is.

data.v: वासुदेवेन तीर्थेन पुत्र संशाम्य पाण्डवैः । संधानस्य परः कालस्तवेति च पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: I further advised him that depending on Vasudeva as his refuge, he should make peace with the Pandavas, Indeed, I repeatedly told him, “This is the fittest time for you to make peace.'

data.v: न च मे तद्वचो मूढः कृतवान्स सुमन्दधीः । घातयित्वेह पृथिवीं ततः स निधनं गतः ॥
data.md: The foolish and wicked Duryodhana however did not do what I said. Having caused a great havoc on Earth, at last, he himself gave up his life.

data.v: त्वां च जानाम्यहं वीर पुराणमृषिसत्तमम् । नरेण सहितं देवं बदर्यां सुचिरोषितम् ॥
data.md: I know thee, O illustrious one, to be that ancient and best of Rishis who lived for many years in the company of Nara, in hermitage of Badari.

data.v: तथा मे नारदः प्राह व्यासश्च सुमहातपाः । नरनारायणावेतौ संभूतौ मनुजेष्विति ॥
data.md: The celestial Rishi Narada told me this, as also Vyasa of austere penances. Even they have said to me that, Thyself and Arjuna are the old Rishis Narayana and Nara born among men.

data.v: अनुजानामि भीष्म त्वां वसूनाप्नुहि पार्थिव । न तेऽस्ति वृजिनं किंचिन्मया दृष्टं महाद्युते ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said I give you leave, O Bhishma, O king, to attain to the status of the Vasus. O you of great splendour, you have not been guilty of a single sin, in this world.

data.v: पितृभक्तोऽसि राजर्षे मार्कण्डेय इवापरः । तेन मृत्युस्तव वशे स्थितो भृत्य इवानतः ॥
data.md: O royal sage, you are devoted to your father. You are, therefore, like a second Markandeya. It is, therefore, that death depends upon your pleasure like a slave.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु गाङ्गेयः पाण्डवानिदमब्रवीत् । धृतराष्ट्रमुखांश्चापि सर्वान्ससुहृदस्तथा ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having said these words, the son of Ganga once more addressed the Pandavas headed by Dhritarashtra, and other friends and wellwishers of his.

data.v: प्राणानुत्स्रष्टुमिच्छामि तन्मानुज्ञातुमर्हथ । सत्ये प्रयतितव्यं वः सत्यं हि परमं बलम् ॥
data.md: I wish to renounce my life. You should give me leave. You should strive for attaching to truth. Truth forms the highest power.

data.v: आनृशंस्यपरैर्भाव्यं सदैव नियतात्मभिः । ब्रह्मण्यैर्धर्मशीलैश्च तपोनीत्यैश्च भारत ॥
data.md: You should always live with Brahmanas of righteous conduct, devoted to penances, ever abstaining from cruel conduct, and who have their souls under restraint.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा सुहृदः सर्वान्संपरिष्वज्य चैव ह । पुनरेवाब्रवीद्धीमान्युधिष्ठिरमिदं वचः ॥
data.md: Having said these words to his friends and embraced them all, the intelligent Bhishma once more addressed Yudhishthira, saying, "O king, worship all Brahmanas, especially those who are gifted with wisdom, them who are preceptors, those who are priests capable of assisting at sacrifices.

data.v: ब्राह्मणाश्चैव ते नित्यं प्राज्ञाश्चैव विशेषतः । आचार्या ऋत्विजश्चैव पूजनीया नराधिप ॥
data.md: Having said these words to his friends and embraced them all, the intelligent Bhishma once more addressed Yudhishthira, saying, "O king, worship all Brahmanas, especially those who are gifted with wisdom, them who are preceptors, those who are priests capable of assisting at sacrifices.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा कुरून्सर्वान्भीष्मः शांतनवस्तदा । तूष्णीं बभूव कौरव्यः स मुहूर्तमरिंदम ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having said so to all the Kurus, Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, remained silent for some time, O chastiscr of enemies.

data.v: धारयामास चात्मानं धारणासु यथाक्रमम् । तस्योर्ध्वमगमन्प्राणाः संनिरुद्धा महात्मनः ॥
data.md: He then held forth his lifebreaths successively in those parts of his body which are indicated in Yoga. The vital airs of that great one, restrained duly, then rose up.

data.v: इदमाश्चर्यमासीच्च मध्ये तेषां महात्मनाम् । यद्यन्मुञ्चति गात्राणां स शंतनुसुतस्तदा । तत्तद्विशल्यं भवति योगयुक्तस्य तस्य वै ॥
data.md: In the midst of those great persons, including those great Rishis headed by Vyasa, the sight seemed to be a strange one, O king.

data.v: क्षणेन प्रेक्षतां तेषां विशल्यः सोऽभवत्तदा । तं दृष्ट्वा विस्मिताः सर्वे वासुदेवपुरोगमाः । सह तैर्मुनिभिः सर्वैस्तदा व्यासादिभिर्नृप ॥
data.md: Within a short time, the eniire body of Bhishma became arrowless and soreless. Seeing it, all those great personages, headed by Vasudeva, and all the ascetics with Vyasa, became filled with wonder.

data.v: संनिरुद्धस्तु तेनात्मा सर्वेष्वायतनेषु वै । जगाम भित्त्वा मूर्धानं दिवमभ्युत्पपात च ॥
data.md: The vital airs, restrained and unable to escape through any of the outlets, at last passed through the crown of the head and proceeded upwards to Heaven.

data.v: महोल्केव च भीष्मस्य मूर्धदेशाज्जनाधिप । निःसृत्याकाशमाविश्य क्षणेनान्तरधीयत ॥
data.md: The vital airs of Bhishma, piercing through the crown of his head, shot up through the sky like a large metcor and soon became invisible.

data.v: एवं स नृपशार्दूल नृपः शांतनवस्तदा । समयुज्यत लोकैः स्वैर्भरतानां कुलोद्वहः ॥
data.md: O great king, thus did Shantanu's son, that pillar of Bharata's race, unite himself with eternity.

data.v: ततस्त्वादाय दारूणि गन्धांश्च विविधान्बहून् । चितां चक्रुर्महात्मानः पाण्डवा विदुरस्तथा । युयुत्सुश्चापि कौरव्यः प्रेक्षकास्त्वितरेऽभवन् ॥
data.md: Then the great Pandavas and Vidura, taking a large quantity of wood and various kinds of fragrant scents, made a funeral pyre.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्तु गाङ्गेयं विदुरश्च महामतिः । छादयामासतुरुभौ क्षौमैर्माल्यैश्च कौरवम् ॥
data.md: Yuyutsu and others stood as spectators of the preparations. Then Yudhishthira and the great Vidura wrapped Bhishma body with silken cloth and floral garlands. Yuyutsu held an excellent uinbrella over it.

data.v: धारयामास तस्याथ युयुत्सुश्छत्रमुत्तमम् । चामरव्यजने शुभ्रे भीमसेनार्जुनावुभौ । उष्णीषे पर्यगृह्णीतां माद्रीपुत्रावुभौ तदा ॥
data.md: Bhimasena and Arjuna both held in their hands a couple of pure white yaktails. The two sons of Madri held two headgears in their hands.

data.v: स्त्रियः कौरवनाथस्य भीष्मं कुरुकुलोद्भवम् । तालवृन्तान्युपादाय पर्यवीजन्समन्ततः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira and Dhritarashtra stood at the feet of the body, taking up palmyra fans, the wives of the lord of the Kurus stood around the body and began to fan it softly. The Pitri sacrifice of the great Bhishma was then duly performed. Many libations were poured upon the sacred fire. The singers of Samans sang many Samans.

data.v: ततोऽस्य विधिवच्चक्रुः पितृमेधं महात्मनः । याजका जुहुवुश्चाग्निं जगुः सामानि सामगाः ॥
ततश्चन्दनकाष्ठैश्च तथा कालेयकैरपि । कालागरुप्रभृतिभिर्गन्धैश्चोच्चावचैस्तथा ॥
समवच्छाद्य गाङ्गेयं प्रज्वाल्य च हुताशनम् । अपसव्यमकुर्वन्त धृतराष्ट्रमुखा नृपाः ॥
संस्कृत्य च कुरुश्रेष्ठं गाङ्गेयं कुरुसत्तमाः । जग्मुर्भागीरथीतीरमृषिजुष्टं कुरूद्वहाः ॥
data.md: Having thus cremated the body of the son of Ganga those foremost ones of Kuru's race proceeded the sacred Bhagirathi, accompanied by the Rishis.

data.v: अनुगम्यमाना व्यासेन नारदेनासितेन च । कृष्णेन भरतस्त्रीभिर्ये च पौराः समागताः ॥
data.md: They were followed by Vyasa, Narada, Asita, Krishna, by the ladies of the Bharata family, as also by such of the citizens of Hastinapur as had come to the place.

data.v: उदकं चक्रिरे चैव गाङ्गेयस्य महात्मनः । विधिवत्क्षत्रियश्रेष्ठाः स च सर्वो जनस्तदा ॥
data.md: to All of them, the foremost of the Kshatriyas, arrived at the sacred river, duly offered Oblations of water to the great son of Ganga.

data.v: ततो भागीरथी देवी तनयस्योदके कृते । उत्थाय सलिलात्तस्माद्रुदती शोकलालसा ॥
data.md: After those oblations of water had been offered by them to her son the goddess Bhagirathi, rose up from the river, weeping and distracted by sorrow.

data.v: परिदेवयती तत्र कौरवानभ्यभाषत । निबोधत यथावृत्तमुच्यमानं मयानघाः ॥
data.md: In the midst of her lamentations, she addressed the Kurus, saying, You sinless ones, listen to me as I say to you all that took place.

data.v: राजवृत्तेन संपन्नः प्रज्ञयाभिजनेन च । सत्कर्ता कुरुवृद्धानां पितृभक्तो दृढव्रतः ॥
data.md: Gitted with royal conduct and disposition, and endued with wisdom and high birth, my Son was the benefactor of all the elders of his family. He was devoted to his father and was of high vows.

data.v: जामदग्न्येन रामेण पुरा यो न पराजितः । दिव्यैरस्त्रैर्महावीर्यः स हतोऽद्य शिखण्डिना ॥
data.md: He could not be defeated by even Rama of Jamadagni's race with his highly powerful celestial weapons; alas, that hero has been killed by Shikhandin.

data.v: अश्मसारमयं नूनं हृदयं मम पार्थिवाः । अपश्यन्त्याः प्रियं पुत्रं यत्र दीर्यति मेऽद्य वै ॥
data.md: You kings, forsooth, my heart is made of adamant, for it does not break even at the disappearance of that son from my view.

data.v: समेतं पार्थिवं क्षत्रं काशिपुर्यां स्वयंवरे । विजित्यैकरथेनाजौ कन्यास्ता यो जहार ह ॥
data.md: At the Svayamvara at Kashi, he defeated on a single car the assembled Kshatriyas and carried away the three princesses.

data.v: यस्य नास्ति बले तुल्यः पृथिव्यामपि कश्चन । हतं शिखण्डिना श्रुत्वा यन्न दीर्यति मे मनः ॥
जामदग्न्यः कुरुक्षेत्रे युधि येन महात्मना । पीडितो नातियत्नेन निहतः स शिखण्डिना ॥
एवंविधं बहु तदा विलपन्तीं महानदीम् । आश्वासयामास तदा साम्ना दामोदरो विभुः ॥
समाश्वसिहि भद्रे त्वं मा शुचः शुभदर्शने । गतः स परमां सिद्धिं तव पुत्रो न संशयः ॥
data.md: Hearing the goddess of the great river thus bewail the powerful Krishna consoled her with many soothing words. Krishna said, “O amiable one, be comforted. Do not give way to sorrow, O you of beautiful features. Forsooth, your son has gone to the highest region of happiness.

data.v: वसुरेष महातेजाः शापदोषेण शोभने । मनुष्यतामनुप्राप्तो नैनं शोचितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: O nice lady! He was ihe great effulgent Vasu compaled to take birth as a man on account of the curse of the sage Vasistha. Hence, it is not fair to wail for him.

data.v: स एष क्षत्रधर्मेण युध्यमानो रणाजिरे । धनंजयेन निहतो नैष नुन्नः शिखण्डिना ॥
data.md: According to Kshatriya duties, he was killed by Dhananjaya on the field of battle while engaged in battle. He has not been killed, O goddess, by Shikhandin.

data.v: भीष्मं हि कुरुशार्दूलमुद्यतेषुं महारणे । न शक्तः संयुगे हन्तुं साक्षादपि शतक्रतुः ॥
data.md: The very king of the celestials himself could not kill Bhishma in battle when he stood with stretched bow in hand.

data.v: स्वच्छन्देन सुतस्तुभ्यं गतः स्वर्गं शुभानने । न शक्ताः स्युर्निहन्तुं हि रणे तं सर्वदेवताः ॥
data.md: (you of beautiful face, your son has happily gone to to Heaven. All the gods assembled together could not kill him in battle.

data.v: तस्मान्मा त्वं सरिच्छ्रेष्ठे शोचस्व कुरुनन्दनम् । वसूनेष गतो देवि पुत्रस्ते विज्वरा भव ॥
data.md: Do not, therefore, O goddess Ganga, grieve for that son of Kuru's race. He was one of the Vasus, O goddess, your son has gone to Heaven. Let the fever of your heart be removed."

data.v: इत्युक्ता सा तु कृष्णेन व्यासेन च सरिद्वरा । त्यक्त्वा शोकं महाराज स्वं वार्यवततार ह ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Thus addressed by Krishna that foremost of all rivers cast off her grief, O great king, and became consoled.

data.v: सत्कृत्य ते तां सरितं ततः कृष्णमुखा नृपाः । अनुज्ञातास्तया सर्वे न्यवर्तन्त जनाधिपाः ॥
data.md: O monarch, having honoured that goddess duly all the kings there present, headed by Krishna, received her permission to go away from her banks.

data.v: कृतोदकं तु राजानं धृतराष्ट्रं युधिष्ठिरः । पुरस्कृत्य महाबाहुरुत्तताराकुलेन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said After the king Dhritarashtra had offered libations of water, the mighty-armed Yudhishthira, with his senses bewildered, and keeping the former in his front, ascended the banks (of the river), and as his eyes which filled with tears, he dropt down on the tank of the Ganga like an elephant pierced by the hunter.

data.v: उत्तीर्य च महीपालो बाष्पव्याकुललोचनः । पपात तीरे गङ्गाया व्याधविद्ध इव द्विपः ॥
तं सीदमानं जग्राह भीमः कृष्णेन चोदितः । मैवमित्यब्रवीच्चैनं कृष्णः परबलार्दनः ॥
data.md: Then, asked by Krishna, Bhima pulled him up from sinking. This must not be so, said Krishna, the anihilator of hostile armies.

data.v: तमार्तं पतितं भूमौ निश्वसन्तं पुनः पुनः । ददृशुः पाण्डवा राजन्धर्मात्मानं युधिष्ठिरम् ॥
data.md: The Pandavas, O king, beheld Yudhishthira, the son of Dharma troubled, lying on the ground and also sighing again and again.

data.v: तं दृष्ट्वा दीनमनसं गतसत्त्वं जनेश्वरम् । भूयः शोकसमाविष्टाः पाण्डवाः समुपाविशन् ॥
data.md: And seeing the king despondent and feeble, the Pandavas, over-laden with grief, sat down surrounding him.

data.v: राजा च धृतराष्ट्रस्तमुपासीनो महाभुजः । वाक्यमाह महाप्राज्ञो महाशोकप्रपीडितम् ॥
उत्तिष्ठ कुरुशार्दूल कुरु कार्यमनन्तरम् । क्षत्रधर्मेण कौरव्य जितेयमवनिस्त्वया ॥
तां भुङ्क्ष्व भ्रातृभिः सार्धं सुहृद्भिश्च जनेश्वर । न शोचितव्यं पश्यामि त्वया धर्मभृतां वर ॥
शोचितव्यं मया चैव गान्धार्या च विशां पते । पुत्रैर्विहीनो राज्येन स्वप्नलब्धधनो यथा ॥
अश्रुत्वा हितकामस्य विदुरस्य महात्मनः । वाक्यानि सुमहार्थानि परितप्यामि दुर्मतिः ॥
उक्तवानेष मां पूर्वं धर्मात्मा दिव्यदर्शनः । दुर्योधनापराधेन कुलं ते विनशिष्यति ॥
स्वस्ति चेदिच्छसे राजन्कुलस्यात्मन एव च । वध्यतामेष दुष्टात्मा मन्दो राजा सुयोधनः ॥
कर्णश्च शकुनिश्चैव मैनं पश्यतु कर्हिचित् । द्यूतसंपातमप्येषामप्रमत्तो निवारय ॥
अभिषेचय राजानं धर्मात्मानं युधिष्ठिरम् । स पालयिष्यति वशी धर्मेण पृथिवीमिमाम् ॥
अथ नेच्छसि राजानं कुन्तीपुत्रं युधिष्ठिरम् । मेढीभूतः स्वयं राज्यं प्रतिगृह्णीष्व पार्थिव ॥
data.md: If you would not have king Yudhishthira, son of Kunti, then, O monarch, you yourself, celebrating a sacrifice, take charge of the kingdom, and regarding all creatures impartially, ( king, you let your kinsmen, O you benefactor of your kindred, subsist on your bounty.

data.v: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु वर्तमानं नराधिप । अनुजीवन्तु सर्वे त्वां ज्ञातयो ज्ञातिवर्धन ॥
एवं ब्रुवति कौन्तेय विदुरे दीर्घदर्शिनि । दुर्योधनमहं पापमन्ववर्तं वृथामतिः ॥
data.md: When, O Kunti's son, the far-sighted Vidura said this, foolishly I followed the wicked Duryodhana.

data.v: अश्रुत्वा ह्यस्य वीरस्य वाक्यानि मधुराण्यहम् । फलं प्राप्य महद्दुःखं निमग्नः शोकसागरे ॥
data.md: Having paid no heed to the sweet words of that sedate one, I have obtained this powerful grief as a consequence, and have been plunged in an occan of misery.

data.v: वृद्धौ हि ते स्वः पितरौ पश्यावां दुःखितौ नृप । न शोचितव्यं भवता पश्यामीह जनाधिप ॥
data.md: See your old father and mother, O king, plunged in misery. But, O master of men, I find no reason for your sorrow.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु राज्ञा स धृतराष्ट्रेण धीमता । तूष्णीं बभूव मेधावी तमुवाचाथ केशवः ॥
data.md: Thus accosted by the intelligent king Dhritarashtra, Yudhishthira, gifted with understanding, became calm. And then Keshava (Krishna) said to him.

data.v: अतीव मनसा शोकः क्रियमाणो जनाधिप । संतापयति वैतस्य पूर्वप्रेतान्पितामहान् ॥
data.md: If a person indulges excessively in sorrow for his departed manes he grieves them.

data.v: यजस्व विविधैर्यज्ञैर्बहुभिः स्वाप्तदक्षिणैः । देवांस्तर्पय सोमेन स्वधया च पितॄनपि ॥
data.md: Do you (now) celebrate many a sacrifice with suitable presents to the priests; and do you please the celestials with Soma juice and the manes of your forefathers, with their due food and drink.

data.v: त्वद्विधस्य महाबुद्धे नैतदद्योपपद्यते । विदितं वेदितव्यं ते कर्तव्यमपि ते कृतम् ॥
श्रुताश्च राजधर्मास्ते भीष्माद्भागीरथीसुतात् । कृष्णद्वैपायनाच्चैव नारदाद्विदुरात्तथा ॥
data.md: You knew what ought to be known, you have performed what ought to be donc, and you have heard the duties of the Kshatriyas, recit ed by Bhishma, the son of Bhagirathi, by Krishna Dvaipayana, Narada and Vidura.

data.v: नेमामर्हसि मूढानां वृत्तिं त्वमनुवर्तितुम् । पितृपैतामहीं वृत्तिमास्थाय धुरमुद्वह ॥
data.md: Therefore you should not act like a stupid; but following the course of your forefathers, sustain the burthen (of the Empire).

data.v: युक्तं हि यशसा क्षत्रं स्वर्गं प्राप्तुमसंशयम् । न हि कश्चन शूराणां निहतोऽत्र पराङ्मुखः ॥
data.md: It is proper that a Kshatriya should attain the celestial region for certain by his (own) renown. Of heroes, those who came to be killed never shall have to turn away.

data.v: त्यज शोकं महाराज भवितव्यं हि तत्तथा । न शक्यास्ते पुनर्द्रष्टुं त्वया ह्यस्मिन्रणे हताः ॥
data.md: Renounce your grief, O powerful king. Indeed, what has taken place was destined to happen so. You can in no way see those that have been killed in this war.

data.v: एतावदुक्त्वा गोविन्दो धर्मराजं युधिष्ठिरम् । विरराम महातेजास्तमुवाच युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: Having said this to Yudhishthira, prince of the pious, the high-spirited Govinda stopped; and Yudhishthira answered him thus.

data.v: गोविन्द मयि या प्रीतिस्तव सा विदिता मम । सौहृदेन तथा प्रेम्णा सदा मामनुकम्पसे ॥
data.md: O Govinda, Is know full well your fondness for me. You have ever favoured me with your love and friendship.

data.v: प्रियं तु मे स्यात्सुमहत्कृतं चक्रगदाधर । श्रीमन्प्रीतेन मनसा सर्वं यादवनन्दन ॥
data.md: And, O holder of the mace and the discus, O scion of Yudhu's race, O glorious one, if (now) do you gladly permit me to retire into the woods, then you would do what is greatly desired by me.

data.v: यदि मामनुजानीयाद्भवान्गन्तुं तपोवनम् । न हि शान्तिं प्रपश्यामि घातयित्वा पितामहम् । कर्णं च पुरुषव्याघ्रं संग्रामेष्वपलायिनम् ॥
data.md: After having killed my grandfather, and that foremost of men, Karna, who never fled from the field of battle, I find no peace.

data.v: कर्मणा येन मुच्येयमस्मात्क्रूरादरिंदम । कर्मणस्तद्विधत्स्वेह येन शुध्यति मे मनः ॥
data.md: Do you, O Janardana, so ordain that I may be feed from this heinous sin and that iny mind may be purified.

data.v: तमेवंवादिनं व्यासस्ततः प्रोवाच धर्मवित् । सान्त्वयन्सुमहातेजाः शुभं वचनमर्थवत् ॥
data.md: As Pritha's son was speaking thus, the highly energetic Vyasa, knowing the duties of life, soothing him, spoke these excellent words.

data.v: अकृता ते मतिस्तात पुनर्बाल्येन मुह्यसे । किमाकाशे वयं सर्वे प्रलपाम मुहुर्मुहुः ॥
data.md: My child, your mind is not yet calmed; and therefore you are again stupefied by childish feelings. And wherefore, O child, do we over and over again throw our words to the winds?

data.v: विदिताः क्षत्रधर्मास्ते येषां युद्धेन जीविका । यथा प्रवृत्तो नृपतिर्नाधिबन्धेन युज्यते ॥
data.md: You know the duties of the Kshatriyas, who live by warfare. A king who has done his duty, should not allow himself to be overwhelmed by grief.

data.v: मोक्षधर्माश्च निखिला याथातथ्येन ते श्रुताः । असकृच्चैव संदेहाश्छिन्नास्ते कामजा मया ॥
data.md: You have faithfully listened to the entire doctrine of salvation; and I have repeatedly removed your misgivings originating from desire.

data.v: अश्रद्दधानो दुर्मेधा लुप्तस्मृतिरसि ध्रुवम् । मैवं भव न ते युक्तमिदमज्ञानमीदृशम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, But not paying due heed to what I have unfolded, you of perverse understanding have doubtless forgotten it clean. Be it not so. Such ignorance is not worthy of you.

data.v: प्रायश्चित्तानि सर्वाणि विदितानि च तेऽनघ । युद्धधर्माश्च ते सर्वे दानधर्माश्च ते श्रुताः ॥
data.md: O sinless one, you are cognizant of all kinds of expiation; and you have also heard of the virtues of kings, as well as the merits of gifts.

data.v: स कथं सर्वधर्मज्ञः सर्वागमविशारदः । परिमुह्यसि भूयस्त्वमज्ञानादिव भारत ॥
data.md: Wherefore then, O Bharata, knowing every form of morality and versed in all the Agamas, are you overwhelmed (with grief) as if from ignorance.

data.v: युधिष्ठिर तव प्रज्ञा न सम्यगिति मे मतिः । न हि कश्चित्स्वयं मर्त्यः स्ववशः कुरुते क्रियाः ॥
data.md: Vyasa said. O Yudhishthira, your wisdom, I conceive, is not sufficient. None does a work by his own power.

data.v: ईश्वरेण नियुक्तोऽयं साध्वसाधु च मानवः । करोति पुरुषः कर्म तत्र का परिदेवना ॥
data.md: It is god who engages him in deeds, good or bad, O bestower of honour. What is the cause then for repentance?

data.v: आत्मानं मन्यसे चाथ पापकर्माणमन्ततः । शृणु तत्र यथा पापमपकृष्येत भारत ॥
data.md: You consider yourself as having perpetrated impious deeds. Do you therefore, O Bharata, listen to the way in which sins, may be removed.

data.v: तपोभिः क्रतुभिश्चैव दानेन च युधिष्ठिर । तरन्ति नित्यं पुरुषा ये स्म पापानि कुर्वते ॥
data.md: O Yudhishthira, those who commit sins, can always free themselves from them through penance, sacrifice and gifts.

data.v: यज्ञेन तपसा चैव दानेन च नराधिप । पूयन्ते राजशार्दूल नरा दुष्कृतकर्मिणः ॥
data.md: O king, O foremost of men, sinful people are purified by sacrifice, austerities and charity.

data.v: असुराश्च सुराश्चैव पुण्यहेतोर्मखक्रियाम् । प्रयतन्ते महात्मानस्तस्माद्यज्ञाः परायणम् ॥
data.md: The great celestials and Asuras celebrate sacrifices for acquiring religious mcrit; and therefore sacrifices are of great importance.

data.v: यज्ञैरेव महात्मानो बभूवुरधिकाः सुराः । ततो देवाः क्रियावन्तो दानवानभ्यधर्षयन् ॥
data.md: It is through sacrifices that the great celestials had grown so wondrously powerful; and having celebrated rites did they defeat the Danavas.

data.v: राजसूयाश्वमेधौ च सर्वमेधं च भारत । नरमेधं च नृपते त्वमाहर युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Do you, O Yudhishthira, prepare for the Rajasuya, and the Horse-Sacrifice, as well as. O Bharata, for the Sarvamedha and the Naramedha.

data.v: यजस्व वाजिमेधेन विधिवद्दक्षिणावता । बहुकामान्नवित्तेन रामो दाशरथिर्यथा ॥
data.md: And as Dasharatha's son, Rama or as Dushyanta's and Shakuntala's son your ancestor, the lord of the Earth, thc exceedingly powerful king Bharata, had done, do you according to the ordinance celebrate the HorseSacrifice with presents.

data.v: यथा च भरतो राजा दौःषन्तिः पृथिवीपतिः । शाकुन्तलो महावीर्यस्तव पूर्वपितामहः ॥
data.md: And as Dasharatha's son, Rama or as Dushyanta's and Shakuntala's son your ancestor, the lord of the Earth, thc exceedingly powerful king Bharata, had done, do you according to the ordinance celebrate the HorseSacrifice with presents.

data.v: असंशयं वाजिमेधः पावयेत्पृथिवीमपि । अभिप्रायस्तु मे कश्चित्तं त्वं श्रोतुमिहार्हसि ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira replied:-Undoubtedly, the Horse-Sacrifice purifics princes. But I have a purpose of which you should hear.

data.v: इमं ज्ञातिवधं कृत्वा सुमहान्तं द्विजोत्तम । दानमल्पं न शक्यामि दातुं वित्तं च नास्ति मे ॥
data.md: Having caused this huge slaughter of kindred, I cannot, O best of the twice-born ones, dispense gifts even on a small scale, I have no riches to give.

data.v: न च बालानिमान्दीनानुत्सहे वसु याचितुम् । तथैवार्द्रव्रणान्कृच्छ्रे वर्तमानान्नृपात्मजान् ॥
data.md: Nor can I for riches solicit these young sons of kings, living wretchedly with their wounds yet green, and undergoing suffering.

data.v: स्वयं विनाश्य पृथिवीं यज्ञार्थे द्विजसत्तम । करमाहारयिष्यामि कथं शोकपरायणान् ॥
data.md: How, O foremost of twice-born ones, having myself destroyed the Earth, can I, overwhelmed with sorrow, levy dues for celebrating a sacrifice?

data.v: दुर्योधनापराधेन वसुधा वसुधाधिपाः । प्रनष्टा योजयित्वास्मानकीर्त्या मुनिसत्तम ॥
data.md: Through Duryodhana's folly, O best of ascetics, the kings of the Earth have met with destruction, and we with ignominy.

data.v: दुर्योधनेन पृथिवी क्षयिता वित्तकारणात् । कोशश्चापि विशीर्णोऽसौ धार्तराष्ट्रस्य दुर्मतेः ॥
data.md: Duryodhana had wasted the Earth for money; and the treasury of that wicked son of Dhritarashtra is empty.

data.v: पृथिवी दक्षिणा चात्र विधिः प्रथमकल्पिकः । विद्वद्भिः परिदृष्टोऽयं शिष्टो विधिविपर्ययः ॥
data.md: (In this sacrifice), the Earth is the sacrificial gift; this is the rule that is prescribed in the first instance. The learned observe the usual reversal of this rule though sanctioned.

data.v: न च प्रतिनिधिं कर्तुं चिकीर्षामि तपोधन । अत्र मे भगवन्सम्यक्साचिव्यं कर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Nor, O ascetic, do I like to have a substitute. In this matter, O reverend sir, you should favour me with your advice.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु पार्थेन कृष्णद्वैपायनस्तदा । मुहूर्तमनुसंचिन्त्य धर्मराजानमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by Pritha's son, KrishnaDvaipayana, thinking for a while, spoke to the righteous king. This treasury, (now) exhausted, shall be full. O son of Pritha, in the mountain Himavan (Himalaya) there is gold which had been left behind by Brahmanas at the sacrifice of the great Marutia.

data.v: विद्यते द्रविणं पार्थ गिरौ हिमवति स्थितम् । उत्सृष्टं ब्राह्मणैर्यज्ञे मरुत्तस्य महीपतेः । तदानयस्व कौन्तेय पर्याप्तं तद्भविष्यति ॥
data.md: O son of Pritha, today your treasury is cmply but it is expected to be filled very soon. In the sacrifice of high souled Marutta at mountain Himavat, left riches, you should collect them which is sufficient for yourself.

data.v: कथं यज्ञे मरुत्तस्य द्रविणं तत्समाचितम् । कस्मिंश्च काले स नृपो बभूव वदतां वर ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira asked: How in that sacrifice celebrated by Marutta, was so much gold collected? And, O foremost of speakers, when did he reign?

data.v: यदि शुश्रूषसे पार्थ शृणु कारंधमं नृपम् । यस्मिन्काले महावीर्यः स राजासीन्महाधनः ॥
data.md: Vyasa said If, O Pritha's son, you are anxious to hear, about that king of the Karandhama line, then listen to me as I tell you when that highly powerful king having immense riches reigned.

data.v: शुश्रूषे तस्य धर्मज्ञ राजर्षेः परिकीर्तनम् । द्वैपायन मरुत्तस्य कथां प्रब्रूहि मेऽनघ ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O righteous one, I wish to hear the history of that royal sage Marutta. Do you ( Dvaipayana, describe this to me, O sinless one.

data.v: आसीत्कृतयुगे पूर्वं मनुर्दण्डधरः प्रभुः । तस्य पुत्रो महेष्वासः प्रजातिरिति विश्रुतः ॥
data.md: Vyasa said O child, in the golden age Manu was lord wielding the sceptre. His son was known under the name of Prasandhi.

data.v: प्रजातेरभवत्पुत्रः क्षुप इत्यभिविश्रुतः । क्षुपस्य पुत्रस्त्विक्ष्वाकुर्महीपालोऽभवत्प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Prasandhi had a son named Kshupa. Kshupa's son was king Ikshvaku.

data.v: तस्य पुत्रशतं राजन्नासीत्परमधार्मिकम् । तांस्तु सर्वान्महीपालानिक्ष्वाकुरकरोत्प्रभुः ॥
data.md: He, O king, had a hundred sons possessed of pre-eminent picty. And all of them were inade monarchs by king Ikshvaku.

data.v: तेषां ज्येष्ठस्तु विंशोऽभूत्प्रतिमानं धनुष्मताम् । विंशस्य पुत्रः कल्याणो विविंशो नाम भारत ॥
data.md: The eldest of them, Vinsha, became an ideal bowman. Vinsha's son, O Bharata, was the auspicious Vivinsha.

data.v: विविंशस्य सुता राजन्बभूवुर्दश पञ्च च । सर्वे धनुषि विक्रान्ता ब्रह्मण्याः सत्यवादिनः ॥
data.md: Vivinsha, O king, had fifteen sons; all of them powerful archers, respecting Brahmanas and speaking the truth, gentle and everspeaking fair. The eldest brother Khaninetra, oppressed all his brothers.

data.v: दानधर्मरताः सन्तः सततं प्रियवादिनः । तेषां ज्येष्ठः खनीनेत्रः स तान्सर्वानपीडयत् ॥
data.md: Vivinsha, O king, had fifteen sons; all of them powerful archers, respecting Brahmanas and speaking the truth, gentle and everspeaking fair. The eldest brother Khaninetra, oppressed all his brothers.

data.v: खनीनेत्रस्तु विक्रान्तो जित्वा राज्यमकण्टकम् । नाशक्नोद्रक्षितुं राज्यं नान्वरज्यन्त तं प्रजाः ॥
data.md: And having conquered the entire kingdom shorn of all troubles, Khaninetra, could not retain his supremacy; nor were the people satisfied with him.

data.v: तमपास्य च तद्राष्ट्रं तस्य पुत्रं सुवर्चसम् । अभ्यषिञ्चत राजेन्द्र मुदितं चाभवत्तदा ॥
data.md: And dethroning him, they, O foremost of kings invested his son Suvarcha with the rights of sovereignty, and experiences joy.

data.v: स पितुर्विक्रियां दृष्ट्वा राज्यान्निरसनं तथा । नियतो वर्तयामास प्रजाहितचिकीर्षया ॥
data.md: Seeing the reverses of his father and his expulsion from the empire he was ever busy with encompassing the well-being of the people, being devoted to Brahman, speaking the truth, practising purity and controlling his senses and thoughts. And the subjects were well-pleased with that grcat one constant in virtue.

data.v: ब्रह्मण्यः सत्यवादी च शुचिः शमदमान्वितः । प्रजास्तं चान्वरज्यन्त धर्मनित्यं मनस्विनम् ॥
data.md: Seeing the reverses of his father and his expulsion from the empire he was ever busy with encompassing the well-being of the people, being devoted to Brahman, speaking the truth, practising purity and controlling his senses and thoughts. And the subjects were well-pleased with that grcat one constant in virtue.

data.v: तस्य धर्मप्रवृत्तस्य व्यशीर्यत्कोशवाहनम् । तं क्षीणकोशं सामन्ताः समन्तात्पर्यपीडयन् ॥
data.md: But he being constantly engaged in virtuous Works, His treasures and vehicles became greatly reduced. And on his treasury having become exhausted, the feudatory princes gathered round him and began to gave him trouble.

data.v: स पीड्यमानो बहुभिः क्षीणकोशस्त्ववाहनः । आर्तिमार्छत्परां राजा सह भृत्यैः पुरेण च ॥
data.md: Being thus oppressed by many enemies while his treasury, horses and vehicles were impoverished, the king suffered great tribulation along with his retainers and the citizens.

data.v: न चैनं परिहर्तुं तेऽशक्नुवन्परिसंक्षये । सम्यग्वृत्तो हि राजा स धर्मनित्यो युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Although his power decreased greatly, yet the enemies could not kill the king, for his power, ( Yudhishthira, was established in virtue.

data.v: यदा तु परमामार्तिं गतोऽसौ सपुरो नृपः । ततः प्रदध्मौ स करं प्रादुरासीत्ततो बलम् ॥
data.md: And when he had reached the worst point of misery along with the citizens, he blew his hand, and from that there appeared a supply of forces.

data.v: ततस्तानजयत्सर्वान्प्रातिसीमान्नराधिपान् । एतस्मात्कारणाद्राजन्विश्रुतः स करंधमः ॥
data.md: And then he defeated all the kings living along the borders of his dominions And from this incident, O king, he hath been celebrated as Karandhama.

data.v: तस्य कारंधमः पुत्रस्त्रेतायुगमुखेऽभवत् । इन्द्रादनवरः श्रीमान्देवैरपि सुदुर्जयः ॥
data.md: His son, Karandhama was born at the commencement of the Treta age, equalling Indra himself, gifted with grace, and invincible even by the immortals.

data.v: तस्य सर्वे महीपाला वर्तन्ते स्म वशे तदा । स हि सम्राडभूत्तेषां वृत्तेन च बलेन च ॥
data.md: At that time all the kings were under his control; and alike by virtue of his riches and of prowess, he became their emperor.

data.v: अविक्षिन्नाम धर्मात्मा शौर्येणेन्द्रसमोऽभवत् । यज्ञशीलः कर्मरतिर्धृतिमान्संयतेन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: In short, the righteous king Avikshit became like Indra himself in Heroism; and he was given to sacrifices, delighted in virtue and held his senses under control.

data.v: तेजसादित्यसदृशः क्षमया पृथिवीसमः । बृहस्पतिसमो बुद्ध्या हिमवानिव सुस्थिरः ॥
data.md: And in energy he resembled the sun and in patience, Earth herself; in intelligence, he was like Brihaspati, and in calmness the mountain Himavan himself.

data.v: कर्मणा मनसा वाचा दमेन प्रशमेन च । मनांस्याराधयामास प्रजानां स महीपतिः ॥
data.md: And that king pleased the hearts of his subjects by act, thought, speech, self control, and forbearance.

data.v: य ईजे हयमेधानां शतेन विधिवत्प्रभुः । याजयामास यं विद्वान्स्वयमेवाङ्गिराः प्रभुः ॥
data.md: The lords who celebrated hundreds of Horse-Sacrifices, and whom the powerful and learned Angira himself served as priest.

data.v: तस्य पुत्रोऽतिचक्राम पितरं गुणवत्तया । मरुत्तो नाम धर्मज्ञश्चक्रवर्ती महायशाः ॥
data.md: His son excelled his father in the possession of good qualities; named Marutta, that lord of kings was righteous and of great fame; having the power of ten thousand elephants, and like unto Vishnu's second self.

data.v: नागायुतसमप्राणः साक्षाद्विष्णुरिवापरः । स यक्ष्यमाणो धर्मात्मा शातकुम्भमयान्युत । कारयामास शुभ्राणि भाजनानि सहस्रशः ॥
मेरुं पर्वतमासाद्य हिमवत्पार्श्व उत्तरे । काञ्चनः सुमहान्पादस्तत्र कर्म चकार सः ॥
ततः कुण्डानि पात्रीश्च पिठराण्यासनानि च । चक्रुः सुवर्णकर्तारो येषां संख्या न विद्यते ॥
तस्यैव च समीपे स यज्ञवाटो बभूव ह । ईजे तत्र स धर्मात्मा विधिवत्पृथिवीपतिः । मरुत्तः सहितैः सर्वैः प्रजापालैर्नराधिपः ॥
data.md: And the sacrificial ground was near this place. And that righteous king Marutta, with other princes, celebrated a sacrifice there.

data.v: कथंवीर्यः समभवत्स राजा वदतां वरः । कथं च जातरूपेण समयुज्यत स द्विज ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O best of speakers, how that king waxed so powerful? And how, O twice-born one, did he get so much gold?

data.v: क्व च तत्सांप्रतं द्रव्यं भगवन्नवतिष्ठते । कथं च शक्यमस्माभिस्तदवाप्तुं तपोधन ॥
data.md: And where now, O reverend sire, is all his wealth? And, O ascetic, how can we secure the same?

data.v: असुराश्चैव देवाश्च दक्षस्यासन्प्रजापतेः । अपत्यं बहुलं तात तेऽस्पर्धन्त परस्परम् ॥
तथैवाङ्गिरसः पुत्रौ व्रततुल्यौ बभूवतुः । बृहस्पतिर्बृहत्तेजाः संवर्तश्च तपोधनः ॥
तावपि स्पर्धिनौ राजन्पृथगास्तां परस्परम् । बृहस्पतिश्च संवर्तं बाधते स्म पुनः पुनः ॥
स बाध्यमानः सततं भ्रात्रा ज्येष्ठेन भारत । अर्थानुत्सृज्य दिग्वासा वनवासमरोचयत् ॥
data.md: And always troubled by his elder brother, he, O Bharata, renouncing his riches, went to the forest, with nothing to cover his body except the open sky.

data.v: वासवोऽप्यसुरान्सर्वान्निर्जित्य च निहत्य च । इन्द्रत्वं प्राप्य लोकेषु ततो वव्रे पुरोहितम् । पुत्रमङ्गिरसो ज्येष्ठं विप्रश्रेष्ठं बृहस्पतिम् ॥
याज्यस्त्वङ्गिरसः पूर्वमासीद्राजा करंधमः । वीर्येणाप्रतिमो लोके वृत्तेन च बलेन च । शतक्रतुरिवौजस्वी धर्मात्मा संशितव्रतः ॥
वाहनं यस्य योधाश्च द्रव्याणि विविधानि च । ध्यानादेवाभवद्राजन्मुखवातेन सर्वशः ॥
स गुणैः पार्थिवान्सर्वान्वशे चक्रे नराधिपः । संजीव्य कालमिष्टं च सशरीरो दिवं गतः ॥
बभूव तस्य पुत्रस्तु ययातिरिव धर्मवित् । अविक्षिन्नाम शत्रुक्षित्स वशे कृतवान्महीम् । विक्रमेण गुणैश्चैव पितेवासीत्स पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: And having lives as long as he desired, he ascended the celestial region in his bodily form. And his named Avikshitconqueror of enemies-righteous like Yayati, brought all the Earth under his sway. And both in merit and power the king resembled his father. son

data.v: तस्य वासवतुल्योऽभून्मरुत्तो नाम वीर्यवान् । पुत्रस्तमनुरक्ताभूत्पृथिवी सागराम्बरा ॥
data.md: He had a son named Marutta, gifted with energy, and resembling Vasava himself. This earth clad in oceans felt herself attracted towards him.

data.v: स्पर्धते सततं स स्म देवराजेन पार्थिवः । वासवोऽपि मरुत्तेन स्पर्धते पाण्डुनन्दन ॥
data.md: He always used to defy the king of the celestials; and, O son of Pandu, Vasava also defied Marutta.

data.v: शुचिः स गुणवानासीन्मरुत्तः पृथिवीपतिः । यतमानोऽपि यं शक्रो न विशेषयति स्म ह ॥
data.md: And Marutta-master of Earth-was pure and perfect. And despite his striving, Shakra could not prevail over him.

data.v: सोऽशक्नुवन्विशेषाय समाहूय बृहस्पतिम् । उवाचेदं वचो देवैः सहितो हरिवाहनः ॥
data.md: And unable to control him, he riding on the horse, along with the celestials summoning Brihaspati, spoke to him thus.

data.v: बृहस्पते मरुत्तस्य मा स्म कार्षीः कथंचन । दैवं कर्माथ वा पित्र्यं कर्तासि मम चेत्प्रियम् ॥
data.md: O Brihaspati, if we wish to do what is agreeable to me, do not perform priestly offices for Marutta on behalf of the celestials or the departed Manes. I have, O Brihaspati, obtained the sovereignty of the three worlds, while Marutta is merely the king of the Earth.

data.v: अहं हि त्रिषु लोकेषु सुराणां च बृहस्पते । इन्द्रत्वं प्राप्तवानेको मरुत्तस्तु महीपतिः ॥
कथं ह्यमर्त्यं ब्रह्मंस्त्वं याजयित्वा सुराधिपम् । याजयेर्मृत्युसंयुक्तं मरुत्तमविशङ्कया ॥
data.md: How, O Brahmana, having acted as priest to the immortal king of the celestials, will you unhesitatingly act as a priest to Marutta subject to death?

data.v: मां वा वृणीष्व भद्रं ते मरुत्तं वा महीपतिम् । परित्यज्य मरुत्तं वा यथाजोषं भजस्व माम् ॥
data.md: May you fare well. Either take up my side or that of the king, Marutta, or forsaking Marutta, gladly come over to me.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स कौरव्य देवराज्ञा बृहस्पतिः । मुहूर्तमिव संचिन्त्य देवराजानमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by the king of the Brihaspati, thinking for a mc.nent, replied to the king of the celestials.
