data.v: नाहं पुनरिहागन्ता मर्त्यलोकं परंतप । प्रीतोऽस्मि ते महाप्राज्ञ ब्रूहि किं करवाणि ते ॥
यदीप्सुरुपपन्नस्त्वं तस्य कालोऽयमागतः । अभिजाने च तदहं यदर्थं मा त्वमागतः । अचिरात्तु गमिष्यामि येनाहं त्वामचूचुदम् ॥
data.md: I know that object for which you have sought me. I shall soon depart from this world. Hence it is that I have given you this hint.

data.v: भृशं प्रीतोऽस्मि भवतश्चारित्रेण विचक्षण । परिपृच्छ यावद्भवते भाषेयं यत्तवेप्सितम् ॥
data.md: O you of great wisdom and experience, I have been highly pleased with you for your behaviour. Do you question me! I shall discourse on what is beneficial to you as desired by you.

data.v: बहु मन्ये च ते बुद्धिं भृशं संपूजयामि च । येनाहं भवता बुद्धो मेधावी ह्यसि काश्यप ॥
data.md: I think your intelligence is great, Indeed I speak highly of it, for it was with the help of that intelligence that you were able to recognise me. Surely, O Kashyapa, you are endued with great intelligence.

data.v: ततस्तस्योपसंगृह्य पादौ प्रश्नान्सुदुर्वचान् । पप्रच्छ तांश्च सर्वान्स प्राह धर्मभृतां वरः ॥
data.md: Touching the feet of that sage Brahmana asked him some very difficult questions. That foremost of all pious persons then described those duties that were referred to.

data.v: कथं शरीरं च्यवते कथं चैवोपपद्यते । कथं कष्टाच्च संसारात्संसरन्परिमुच्यते ॥
data.md: Kashyapa said How does the body dissolve away, and how is another is acquired? How does one become liberated after passing through a repeated round of painful re-births?

data.v: आत्मानं वा कथं युक्त्वा तच्छरीरं विमुञ्चति । शरीरतश्च निर्मुक्तः कथमन्यत्प्रपद्यते ॥
data.md: Enjoying Nature for sometime, how does the individual Soul cast off the particular body? How does the Individual Soul, freed from the body, attain to what is different from it, (viz., Brahman)?

data.v: कथं शुभाशुभे चायं कर्मणी स्वकृते नरः । उपभुङ्क्ते क्व वा कर्म विदेहस्योपतिष्ठति ॥
data.md: How does a human being enjoy the good and bad deeds done by him? Where do the acts exist of one that is devoid of body?

data.v: एवं संचोदितः सिद्धः प्रश्नांस्तान्प्रत्यभाषत । आनुपूर्व्येण वार्ष्णेय यथा तन्मे वचः शृणु ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said Thus urged by Kashyapa, the Liberated Sage answered those questions one after another. Do you listen to me, O hero of the Vrishni race, as I recite to you the answers he gave.

data.v: आयुःकीर्तिकराणीह यानि कर्माणि सेवते । शरीरग्रहणेऽन्यस्मिंस्तेषु क्षीणेषु सर्वशः ॥
आयुःक्षयपरीतात्मा विपरीतानि सेवते । बुद्धिर्व्यावर्तते चास्य विनाशे प्रत्युपस्थिते ॥
data.md: The Liberated Sage said, Upon the exhaustion of those deeds capable of prolonging life and bringing on fame which are done in a particular body that the Individual Soul assumes, the embodied Jiva, with the span of his life shortened, begins to do acts hostile to life and hcalth. On the approach of destruction, his understanding deviates from the proper course.

data.v: सत्त्वं बलं च कालं चाप्यविदित्वात्मनस्तथा । अतिवेलमुपाश्नाति तैर्विरुद्धान्यनात्मवान् ॥
data.md: The man of inipure soul, after even a correct understanding of his constitution and strength and of the season of both his own life and of the year, begins to eat at irregular intervals and to eat such food as is hostile to him.

data.v: यदायमतिकष्टानि सर्वाण्युपनिषेवते । अत्यर्थमपि वा भुङ्क्ते न वा भुङ्क्ते कदाचन ॥
data.md: At such a time he does practices that are greatly harmful. He sometimes eats excessively and sometimes abstains altogether from food.

data.v: दुष्टान्नं विषमान्नं च सोऽन्योन्येन विरोधि च । गुरु वापि समं भुङ्क्ते नातिजीर्णेऽपि वा पुनः ॥
data.md: He eats bad food or bad meat or takes bad drinks, or food that has been made up of hostile ingredients. He eats food that is heavy and more than what is beneficial, or before the food previously taken, has been digested.

data.v: व्यायाममतिमात्रं वा व्यवायं चोपसेवते । सततं कर्मलोभाद्वा प्राप्तं वेगविधारणम् ॥
data.md: He indulges in physical exercise and sexual pleasure in excess, or through avidity for work, suppresses the urgings of his corporeal organism even when they become pronounced.

data.v: रसातियुक्तमन्नं वा दिवास्वप्नं निषेवते । अपक्वानागते काले स्वयं दोषान्प्रकोपयन् ॥
data.md: Or, he taken juicy food or indulges in sleep during daytime. Food that is not properly digested, of itself excites the faults, when the times comes.

data.v: स्वदोषकोपनाद्रोगं लभते मरणान्तिकम् । अथ चोद्बन्धनादीनि परीतानि व्यवस्यति ॥
data.md: From such excitement of the faults in his body, he gets disease ultimately bringing on death. Sometimes the person engages in unnatural deeds like strangling.

data.v: तस्य तैः कारणैर्जन्तोः शरीराच्च्यवते यथा । जीवितं प्रोच्यमानं तद्यथावदुपधारय ॥
data.md: Through these causes the living body of the creature dissolves away. Understand correctly the manner as I declare it to you.

data.v: ऊष्मा प्रकुपितः काये तीव्रवायुसमीरितः । शरीरमनुपर्येति सर्वान्प्राणान्रुणद्धि वै ॥
data.md: Urged on by the Wind which becomes violent, the heat in the body, becoming excited, and reaching every part of the body one after another, restrains all the vital airs.

data.v: अत्यर्थं बलवानूष्मा शरीरे परिकोपितः । भिनत्ति जीवस्थानानि तानि मर्माणि विद्धि च ॥
data.md: Know truly that excited all over the body, the heat becomes very strong, and pierces every vital part where life may be said to live.

data.v: ततः सवेदनः सद्यो जीवः प्रच्यवते क्षरन् । शरीरं त्यजते जन्तुश्छिद्यमानेषु मर्मसु । वेदनाभिः परीतात्मा तद्विद्धि द्विजसत्तम ॥
data.md: On account of this, the Individual Soul, feeling great pain, quickly takes leave of the body. Know, O foremost of twice-born ones, that when the vital parts of the body become thus afflicted, Individual Soul passes away from he body, suffering from great pain. All living creatures repeatedly suffer from birth and death.

data.v: जातीमरणसंविग्नाः सततं सर्वजन्तवः । दृश्यन्ते संत्यजन्तश्च शरीराणि द्विजर्षभ ॥
गर्भसंक्रमणे चापि मर्मणामतिसर्पणे । तादृशीमेव लभते वेदनां मानवः पुनः ॥
data.md: It is seen, O chief of Brahman's, that the pain which is felt by a person when renouncing his bodies is like to what is felt by him when first entering the womb or when coming out of it. His joints become almost dislocated and he derives much distress from the waters.

data.v: भिन्नसंधिरथ क्लेदमद्भिः स लभते नरः । यथा पञ्चसु भूतेषु संश्रितत्वं निगच्छति । शैत्यात्प्रकुपितः काये तीव्रवायुसमीरितः ॥
data.md: Moved by (another) violent wind, the wind in the body becomes excited through cold, and dissolves away the union of matter into its five primal elements.

data.v: यः स पञ्चसु भूतेषु प्राणापाने व्यवस्थितः । स गच्छत्यूर्ध्वगो वायुः कृच्छ्रान्मुक्त्वा शरीरिणम् ॥
data.md: That wind which lives in the vital airs called Prana and Apana occurring within this compound of the five primal elements, rushes upwards, from a situation of distress, leaving the embodied creature.

data.v: शरीरं च जहात्येव निरुच्छ्वासश्च दृश्यते । निरूष्मा स निरुच्छ्वासो निःश्रीको गतचेतनः ॥
data.md: It is thus that the wind leaves the body. Then is seen breathlessness. The man then becomes destitute of heat, of breath, of beauty, and of consciousness.

data.v: ब्रह्मणा संपरित्यक्तो मृत इत्युच्यते नरः । स्रोतोभिर्यैर्विजानाति इन्द्रियार्थाञ्शरीरभृत् । तैरेव न विजानाति प्राणमाहारसंभवम् ॥
data.md: Deserted by Brahma, the person is said to be dead. By those canals through which he perceives all sensuous objects, the bearer of the body no longer perceives them.

data.v: तत्रैव कुरुते काये यः स जीवः सनातनः । तेषां यद्यद्भवेद्युक्तं संनिपाते क्वचित्क्वचित् । तत्तन्मर्म विजानीहि शास्त्रदृष्टं हि तत्तथा ॥
data.md: The elements gathered together become in certain parts firmly united. Know that those parts are called the vitals of the body. It is said so in the Shastras.

data.v: तेषु मर्मसु भिन्नेषु ततः स समुदीरयन् । आविश्य हृदयं जन्तोः सत्त्वं चाशु रुणद्धि वै । ततः स चेतनो जन्तुर्नाभिजानाति किंचन ॥
data.md: When those vital parts are cut, the Individual Soul, rising up, enters the heat of the living creature and restrains the principle of animation forthwith.

data.v: तमसा संवृतज्ञानः संवृतेष्वथ मर्मसु । स जीवो निरधिष्ठानश्चाव्यते मातरिश्वना ॥
data.md: The creature then, though still possessed of consciousness, fails to know anything. The vital part being all worked up, the knowledge of the living creature becomes overwhelmed by darkness.

data.v: ततः स तं महोच्छ्वासं भृशमुच्छ्वस्य दारुणम् । निष्क्रामन्कम्पयत्याशु तच्छरीरमचेतनम् ॥
data.md: The individual Soul then, who has been deprived of everything upon which to stay, is then agitated by the wind. He then, deeply breathing a long an painful breath, goes out speedily, making the inanimate body to tremble. Separated from the body, the Individual Soul, however, is surrounded by his deeds.

data.v: स जीवः प्रच्युतः कायात्कर्मभिः स्वैः समावृतः । अङ्कितः स्वैः शुभैः पुण्यैः पापैर्वाप्युपपद्यते ॥
data.md: The individual Soul then, who has been deprived of everything upon which to stay, is then agitated by the wind. He then, deeply breathing a long an painful breath, goes out speedily, making the inanimate body to tremble. Separated from the body, the Individual Soul, however, is surrounded by his deeds.

data.v: ब्राह्मणा ज्ञानसंपन्ना यथावच्छ्रुतनिश्चयाः । इतरं कृतपुण्यं वा तं विजानन्ति लक्षणैः ॥
यथान्धकारे खद्योतं लीयमानं ततस्ततः । चक्षुष्मन्तः प्रपश्यन्ति तथा तं ज्ञानचक्षुषः ॥
पश्यन्त्येवंविधाः सिद्धा जीवं दिव्येन चक्षुषा । च्यवन्तं जायमानं च योनिं चानुप्रवेशितम् ॥
तस्य स्थानानि दृष्टानि त्रिविधानीह शास्त्रतः । कर्मभूमिरियं भूमिर्यत्र तिष्ठन्ति जन्तवः ॥
ततः शुभाशुभं कृत्वा लभन्ते सर्वदेहिनः । इहैवोच्चावचान्भोगान्प्राप्नुवन्ति स्वकर्मभिः ॥
data.md: This world where creatures live is called the field of action. Performing acts, good or bad, all embodied creatures attain to the fruits thereof.

data.v: इहैवाशुभकर्मा तु कर्मभिर्निरयं गतः । अवाक्स निरये पापो मानवः पच्यते भृशम् । तस्मात्सुदुर्लभो मोक्ष आत्मा रक्ष्यो भृशं ततः ॥
data.md: On account of their own decds, creatures acquirc even here superior or inferiors enjoyments. Doers of evil deeds here, on ! account of those deeds of theirs, attain to hell.

data.v: ऊर्ध्वं तु जन्तवो गत्वा येषु स्थानेष्ववस्थिताः । कीर्त्यमानानि तानीह तत्त्वतः संनिबोध मे । तच्छ्रुत्वा नैष्ठिकीं बुद्धिं बुध्येथाः कर्मनिश्चयात् ॥
data.md: This condition of sinking with head downwards, in which creatures are boiled is one of great misery. It is such that a rescue therefrom is highly difficult. Indeed, one should try hard for saving himself from this misery.

data.v: तारारूपाणि सर्वाणि यच्चैतच्चन्द्रमण्डलम् । यच्च विभ्राजते लोके स्वभासा सूर्यमण्डलम् । स्थानान्येतानि जानीहि नराणां पुण्यकर्मणाम् ॥
data.md: By listening to what I say, you will acquire firmness of understanding and a clear apprehension of deeds. Know that even those are the regions of all creatures of righteous deeds, viz., the stellar worlds that shine in the sky, the lunar disc, and the solar disc as well that shines in the universe in its own light.

data.v: कर्मक्षयाच्च ते सर्वे च्यवन्ते वै पुनः पुनः । तत्रापि च विशेषोऽस्ति दिवि नीचोच्चमध्यमः ॥
data.md: Upon the termination, again, of their merits, they fall away from those regions repeatedly. There is distinction of inferior, superior and middling happiness even in the celestial region.

data.v: न तत्राप्यस्ति संतोषो दृष्ट्वा दीप्ततरां श्रियम् । इत्येता गतयः सर्वाः पृथक्त्वे समुदीरिताः ॥
data.md: There is discontent at sight of prosperity more burning than one's own even in the celestial region. Even these are the goals which I have mentioned in full.

data.v: उपपत्तिं तु गर्भस्य वक्ष्याम्यहमतः परम् । यथावत्तां निगदतः शृणुष्वावहितो द्विज ॥
data.md: I shall, after this, describe to you the attainment by the Individual Soul of the condition of residence in the womb. Do you hear me, with rapt attention, O twice-born one, as I speak to you.

data.v: शुभानामशुभानां च नेह नाशोऽस्ति कर्मणाम् । प्राप्य प्राप्य तु पच्यन्ते क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रं तथा तथा ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said The acts, good and bad, that the Individual Soul, docs are not subject 10 destruction. Upon attainment of body after body, those deeds yield fruits corresponding with then.

data.v: यथा प्रसूयमानस्तु फली दद्यात्फलं बहु । तथा स्याद्विपुलं पुण्यं शुद्धेन मनसा कृतम् ॥
data.md: As a fruit bearing tree, when the scason for production comes, yields a large quantity of fruit, merit, achieved with a pure heart, likewise yields a large measure of happiness.

data.v: पापं चापि तथैव स्यात्पापेन मनसा कृतम् । पुरोधाय मनो हीह कर्मण्यात्मा प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: Similarly, sin, committed with a sinful heart, produces a large quantity of misery. The Individual Soul, placing the mind a head, performs action.

data.v: यथा कर्मसमादिष्टं काममन्युसमावृतः । नरो गर्भं प्रविशति तच्चापि शृणु चोत्तरम् ॥
data.md: Hear then how the Individual Soul, cquipped with all his deeds and overwhelmed with lust and anger, enters the womb.

data.v: शुक्रं शोणितसंसृष्टं स्त्रिया गर्भाशयं गतम् । क्षेत्रं कर्मजमाप्नोति शुभं वा यदि वाशुभम् ॥
data.md: The vital seed, mixed with blood, enters the womb of females and becomes the held (of the Individual Soul), good or bad, born of (his) deeds.

data.v: सौक्ष्म्यादव्यक्तभावाच्च न स क्वचन सज्जते । संप्राप्य ब्रह्मणः कायं तस्मात्तद्ब्रह्म शाश्वतम् । तद्बीजं सर्वभूतानां तेन जीवन्ति जन्तवः ॥
data.md: On account of his subtlety and the condition of being unmanifest, the Individual Soul does not become attached to anything even after coming by a body. Therefore, he is called Eternal Brahma.

data.v: स जीवः सर्वगात्राणि गर्भस्याविश्य भागशः । दधाति चेतसा सद्यः प्राणस्थानेष्ववस्थितः । ततः स्पन्दयतेऽङ्गानि स गर्भश्चेतनान्वितः ॥
data.md: That (viz., Jiva or Brahma) is the seed of all crcatures. It is on account of Him that living creatures live. That the Individual Soul, cntering all the limbs of the foetus part by part, accepting the attribute of mind, and living within all the regions that belong to vital air, supports (life). On account of this, the foetus, becoming possessed of mind, begins to move its limbs.

data.v: यथा हि लोहनिष्यन्दो निषिक्तो बिम्बविग्रहम् । उपैति तद्वज्जानीहि गर्भे जीवप्रवेशनम् ॥
data.md: As liquefied iron, poured (into a mould), takes the form of the mould, so is the entrance of the Individual Soul into the foetus.

data.v: लोहपिण्डं यथा वह्निः प्रविशत्यभितापयन् । तथा त्वमपि जानीहि गर्भे जीवोपपादनम् ॥
data.md: As fire, entering a mass of iron, heats it greatly, so is the manifestation of the Individual Soul in the foetus.

data.v: यथा च दीपः शरणं दीप्यमानः प्रकाशयेत् । एवमेव शरीराणि प्रकाशयति चेतना ॥
data.md: As a lamp, burning in a room, discovers (all things within it), so does the mind discover the different limbs of the body.

data.v: यद्यच्च कुरुते कर्म शुभं वा यदि वाशुभम् । पूर्वदेहकृतं सर्वमवश्यमुपभुज्यते ॥
data.md: Whatever deeds, good or bad, the Individual Soul does in a former body, have certainly to be enjoyed or endured by him.

data.v: ततस्तत्क्षीयते चैव पुनश्चान्यत्प्रचीयते । यावत्तन्मोक्षयोगस्थं धर्मं नैवावबुध्यते ॥
data.md: By such enjoyment and endurance former deeds are exhausted, and other deeds, again, accumulate, till the Individual Soul succeed in acquiring a knowledge of the duties included in that contemplation which leads to Liberation.

data.v: तत्र धर्मं प्रवक्ष्यामि सुखी भवति येन वै । आवर्तमानो जातीषु तथान्योन्यासु सत्तम ॥
data.md: Regarding this, I shall tell you those deeds by which the individual Soul, O best of men, while passing through a repeated round of rebirths, becomes happy.

data.v: दानं व्रतं ब्रह्मचर्यं यथोक्तव्रतधारणम् । दमः प्रशान्तता चैव भूतानां चानुकम्पनम् ॥
संयमश्चानृशंस्यं च परस्वादानवर्जनम् । व्यलीकानामकरणं भूतानां यत्र सा भुवि ॥
मातापित्रोश्च शुश्रूषा देवतातिथिपूजनम् । गुरुपूजा घृणा शौचं नित्यमिन्द्रियसंयमः ॥
प्रवर्तनं शुभानां च तत्सतां वृत्तमुच्यते । ततो धर्मः प्रभवति यः प्रजाः पाति शाश्वतीः ॥
एवं सत्सु सदा पश्येत्तत्र ह्येषा ध्रुवा स्थितिः । आचारो धर्ममाचष्टे यस्मिन्सन्तो व्यवस्थिताः ॥
data.md: Such conduct one would always see among good persons. Indeed, such conduct lives there for good. That course of practices which persons of tranquil souls follow, indicates Virtue.

data.v: तेषु तद्धर्मनिक्षिप्तं यः स धर्मः सनातनः । यस्तं समभिपद्येत न स दुर्गतिमाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: Among them is thrown that course of practices which forms eternal Virtue. He who would follow virtue would never have to come by a miserable end.

data.v: अतो नियम्यते लोकः प्रमुह्य धर्मवर्त्मसु । यस्तु योगी च मुक्तश्च स एतेभ्यो विशिष्यते ॥
data.md: It is by the conduct of the good that the world is restrained in the paths of Virtue when it falls away, He who is a Yogin is Liberated, and is, therefore, distinguished above these (viz., the good).

data.v: वर्तमानस्य धर्मेण पुरुषस्य यथा तथा । संसारतारणं ह्यस्य कालेन महता भवेत् ॥
data.md: Deliverance from the world occurs, after a long time, of one who acts righteously and well on every occasion as he should.

data.v: एवं पूर्वकृतं कर्म सर्वो जन्तुर्निषेवते । सर्वं तत्कारणं येन निकृतोऽयमिहागतः ॥
data.md: A living creature thus always meets with his pristine deeds. All these deeds form the cause in consequence of which he comes into this world in a state different from his true form.

data.v: शरीरग्रहणं चास्य केन पूर्वं प्रकल्पितम् । इत्येवं संशयो लोके तच्च वक्ष्याम्यतः परम् ॥
data.md: There is a doubt in the world about this question. By what was the acceptance (by the individual Soul) of a body first determined.

data.v: शरीरमात्मनः कृत्वा सर्वभूतपितामहः । त्रैलोक्यमसृजद्ब्रह्मा कृत्स्नं स्थावरजङ्गमम् ॥
data.md: Having first formed a body of his own, the Grandfather of all the worlds viz., Brahman, then created the three worlds, of mobile and immobile creatures.

data.v: ततः प्रधानमसृजच्चेतना सा शरीरिणाम् । यया सर्वमिदं व्याप्तं यां लोके परमां विदुः ॥
data.md: Having first himself taken a body, he then created Pradhana. That Pradhana is the material cause of all embodied creatures, by whom is all this covered, and whom all came to know as the greatest.

data.v: इह तत्क्षरमित्युक्तं परं त्वमृतमक्षरम् । त्रयाणां मिथुनं सर्वमेकैकस्य पृथक्पृथक् ॥
data.md: This which is seen is said to be destructible; while the other is immortal and indestructible. This which (is seen) is said to be Kshara (the destructible); that, however, which is the other is the Iminortal (as also) Akshara (the Indestructible). Of each Purusha taken separately, the whole is duality among these three.

data.v: असृजत्सर्वभूतानि पूर्वसृष्टः प्रजापतिः । स्थावराणि च भूतानि इत्येषा पौर्विकी श्रुतिः ॥
data.md: Seen first (to appear in an embodied form). Prajapati (then) created all the primal elements and all immobile creatures. This is the ancient Shruti.

data.v: तस्य कालपरीमाणमकरोत्स पितामहः । भूतेषु परिवृत्तिं च पुनरावृत्तिमेव च ॥
data.md: Of that (acceptance of body), thc Grandfather put down a limit about time, and migrations among various creatures and return or re-birth.

data.v: यथात्र कश्चिन्मेधावी दृष्टात्मा पूर्वजन्मनि । यत्प्रवक्ष्यामि तत्सर्वं यथावदुपपद्यते ॥
data.md: All that I say is proper and correct, as a person who has intelligence and who has seen his Soul, would say on this subject of previous births.

data.v: सुखदुःखे सदा सम्यगनित्ये यः प्रपश्यति । कायं चामेध्यसंघातं विनाशं कर्मसंहितम् ॥
data.md: That person who considers pleasure and pain as inconstant, which, indced, is the correct view, who regards the body as an unholy collection, and destruction as ordained in action, and who remembers that what little of pleasure there is, is really all pain, will succeed in crossing this terrible ocean of worldly migration which is so difficult to cross.

data.v: यच्च किंचित्सुखं तच्च सर्वं दुःखमिति स्मरन् । संसारसागरं घोरं तरिष्यति सुदुस्तरम् ॥
data.md: That person who considers pleasure and pain as inconstant, which, indced, is the correct view, who regards the body as an unholy collection, and destruction as ordained in action, and who remembers that what little of pleasure there is, is really all pain, will succeed in crossing this terrible ocean of worldly migration which is so difficult to cross.

data.v: जातीमरणरोगैश्च समाविष्टः प्रधानवित् । चेतनावत्सु चैतन्यं समं भूतेषु पश्यति ॥
data.md: Though attacked by decrepitude and death and disease, he who understand Pradhana sees with an equal eye that Consciousness which lives in all beings gifted with Consciousness.

data.v: निर्विद्यते ततः कृत्स्नं मार्गमाणः परं पदम् । तस्योपदेशं वक्ष्यामि याथातथ्येन सत्तम ॥
data.md: Seeking the supreme seat, he then becomes utterly indifferent to all (other) things. O best of men, I shall now deliver instruction to you, according to truth, concerning this.

data.v: शाश्वतस्याव्ययस्याथ पदस्य ज्ञानमुत्तमम् । प्रोच्यमानं मया विप्र निबोधेदमशेषतः ॥
data.md: Do you, O learned Brahmana, understand in full what form the excellent knowledge, as I declare it, of that indestructible seat.

data.v: यः स्यादेकायने लीनस्तूष्णीं किंचिदचिन्तयन् । पूर्वं पूर्वं परित्यज्य स निरारम्भको भवेत् ॥
data.md: Brahman said He who becomes immerged in the one receptacle (of all things), freeing himself from cven the thought of his own identity with all things, indeed, ccasing to things of even his own existencc-gradually renouncing one after another, will succeed in crossing his bonds.

data.v: सर्वमित्रः सर्वसहः समरक्तो जितेन्द्रियः । व्यपेतभयमन्युश्च कामहा मुच्यते नरः ॥
data.md: That man who is the friend of all, who endures all, who is attached to tranquillity, who has conquered all his senses, who is shorn of fear and anger, and who is of controlled soul, succeeds in liberating himself.

data.v: आत्मवत्सर्वभूतेषु यश्चरेन्नियतः शुचिः । अमानी निरभीमानः सर्वतो मुक्त एव सः ॥
data.md: He who treats all creatures as his ownself, who is restrained, pure, free froin vanity, and shorn of egoism, is considered as liberated from everything

data.v: जीवितं मरणं चोभे सुखदुःखे तथैव च । लाभालाभे प्रियद्वेष्ये यः समः स च मुच्यते ॥
data.md: He also is libcrated who considers in the same light life and death, pleasure and pain, gain and loss, agreeable and disagrecable.

data.v: न कस्यचित्स्पृहयते नावजानाति किंचन । निर्द्वंद्वो वीतरागात्मा सर्वतो मुक्त एव सः ॥
data.md: He is in every way liberated who does not covet others' properties, who never disregards any body, who is above all pairs of opposites, and whose soul is shorn of attachments.

data.v: अनमित्रोऽथ निर्बन्धुरनपत्यश्च यः क्वचित् । त्यक्तधर्मार्थकामश्च निराकाङ्क्षी स मुच्यते ॥
data.md: He is liberated who has no enemy, no। kinsman, and no child, who has cast off religion, riches and pleasure, and who is freed from desire or cupidity.

data.v: नैव धर्मी न चाधर्मी पूर्वोपचितहा च यः । धातुक्षयप्रशान्तात्मा निर्द्वंद्वः स विमुच्यते ॥
data.md: He becomes liberated who acquires neither merit nor demerit, who casts off the merits and demerits accumulated in pristine births, who wastes the elements of his body for attaining to a tranquillised soul, and who gets over all pairs of opposites.

data.v: अकर्मा चाविकाङ्क्षश्च पश्यञ्जगदशाश्वतम् । अस्वस्थमवशं नित्यं जन्मसंसारमोहितम् ॥
वैराग्यबुद्धिः सततं तापदोषव्यपेक्षकः । आत्मबन्धविनिर्मोक्षं स करोत्यचिरादिव ॥
data.md: He who abstains from all deeds, who is free from desire or cupidity, who considers the universe as un-enduring or as like an Ashvatha tree, ever gifted with birth, death, and ! decrepitude, whose understanding is fixed on renunciation, and whose eyes are always directed towards his own faults, soon succeeds in freeing himself from the fetters that bind him.

data.v: अगन्धरसमस्पर्शमशब्दमपरिग्रहम् । अरूपमनभिज्ञेयं दृष्ट्वात्मानं विमुच्यते ॥
data.md: He who sees his soul void of smell, of taste and touch, of sound, of belongings, of vision, and unknowable, becomes liberated.

data.v: पञ्चभूतगुणैर्हीनममूर्तिमदलेपकम् । अगुणं गुणभोक्तारं यः पश्यति स मुच्यते ॥
data.md: He who sces his soul shorn of the attributes of the five elements, to be without form and cause, to be really destitute of attributes though enjoying them, becomes liberated.

data.v: विहाय सर्वसंकल्पान्बुद्ध्या शारीरमानसान् । शनैर्निर्वाणमाप्नोति निरिन्धन इवानलः ॥
data.md: Abandoning, with the help of the understanding, all purposes relating to body and mind, one gradually attains to cessation of separate existence, like a fire unfed with fuel.

data.v: विमुक्तः सर्वसंस्कारैस्ततो ब्रह्म सनातनम् । परमाप्नोति संशान्तमचलं दिव्यमक्षरम् ॥
data.md: Having become freed from all impressions, one then attains to Brahma which is Eternal and supreme, and tranquil, and stable, and enduring and indestructible.

data.v: अतः परं प्रवक्ष्यामि योगशास्त्रमनुत्तमम् । यज्ज्ञात्वा सिद्धमात्मानं लोके पश्यन्ति योगिनः ॥
data.md: After this I shall describe the science of Yoga than which there is nothing superior, and how Yogins, by concentration, sce the perfect soul.

data.v: तस्योपदेशं पश्यामि यथावत्तन्निबोध मे । यैर्द्वारैश्चारयन्नित्यं पश्यत्यात्मानमात्मनि ॥
data.md: I shall communicate the instructions about it duly. Do you learn from me those doors by which directing the soul within the body one sees that which is without beginning and end.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणि तु संहृत्य मन आत्मनि धारयेत् । तीव्रं तप्त्वा तपः पूर्वं ततो योक्तुमुपक्रमेत् ॥
data.md: Withdrawing the senses from their objects, one should fix the mind upon the soul; having previously practised the severest austerities, one should practise that concentration of mind which leads to Liberation.

data.v: तपस्वी त्यक्तसंकल्पो दम्भाहंकारवर्जितः । मनीषी मनसा विप्रः पश्यत्यात्मानमात्मनि ॥
data.md: Observant of penances and always practising concentration of mind, the learned Brahmana, gifted with intelligence, should observe the precepts of the Science of Yoga, seeing the soul in the body.

data.v: स चेच्छक्नोत्ययं साधुर्योक्तुमात्मानमात्मनि । तत एकान्तशीलः स पश्यत्यात्मानमात्मनि ॥
data.md: If the good man succeeds in concentrating the mind on the soul, he then, used to exclusive meditation, secs the Supreme Soul in his own soul.

data.v: संयतः सततं युक्त आत्मवान्विजितेन्द्रियः । तथायमात्मनात्मानं साधु युक्तः प्रपश्यति ॥
data.md: Self-controlled and always concentrated, and with all his senses completely conquered, the man of purified soul, on account of such complete concentration of mind, succeeds in seeing the soul by soul.

data.v: यथा हि पुरुषः स्वप्ने दृष्ट्वा पश्यत्यसाविति । तथारूपमिवात्मानं साधु युक्तः प्रपश्यति ॥
data.md: As a person seeing some unseen individual in a dream recognises him, saying. This is he, when he sees him after waking, similar.y the good man having seen the Supreme Soul in the deep contemplation of Samadhi recognises it upon waking from Samadhi.

data.v: इषीकां वा यथा मुञ्जात्कश्चिन्निर्हृत्य दर्शयेत् । योगी निष्कृष्टमात्मानं तथा संपश्यते तनौ ॥
data.md: As one sees the fibrous pith after extracting it from a blade of the Saccharum Munja, so the Yogin sees the Soul, extracting it from the body.

data.v: मुञ्जं शरीरं तस्याहुरिषीकामात्मनि श्रिताम् । एतन्निदर्शनं प्रोक्तं योगविद्भिरनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: The body has been called the Saccharum Munja and the filbrons pith is called the Soul. This is the excellent illustration given by persons knowing Yoga.

data.v: यदा हि युक्तमात्मानं सम्यक्पश्यति देहभृत् । तदास्य नेशते कश्चित्त्रैलोक्यस्यापि यः प्रभुः ॥
data.md: When the bearer of a body adequately sees the Soul in Yoga, he then has no one to master him, for he then becomes the lord of three worlds.

data.v: अन्योन्याश्चैव तनवो यथेष्टं प्रतिपद्यते । विनिवृत्य जरामृत्यू न हृष्यति न शोचति ॥
data.md: He succeeds in assuming various bodies according as as he wishes. Turning away decrepitude and death, he neither grieves nor exalis.

data.v: देवानामपि देवत्वं युक्तः कारयते वशी । ब्रह्म चाव्ययमाप्नोति हित्वा देहमशाश्वतम् ॥
data.md: The self controlled man, concentrated in Yoga, can create (for himself) the godship of the very gods. Renouncing his transient body he attains to immutable Brahma.

data.v: विनश्यत्स्वपि लोकेषु न भयं तस्य जायते । क्लिश्यमानेषु भूतेषु न स क्लिश्यति केनचित् ॥
data.md: He does not fear even at on seçing all creatures falling victims to destruction. When all creatures are afflicted, he can never be afflicted by any one.

data.v: दुःखशोकमयैर्घोरैः सङ्गस्नेहसमुद्भवैः । न विचाल्येत युक्तात्मा निःस्पृहः शान्तमानसः ॥
data.md: Devoid of desire and gifted with a tranquil mind, the person in Yoga is never affected by pain and sorrow and fear and the dreadful effects of attachment and affection.

data.v: नैनं शस्त्राणि विध्यन्ते न मृत्युश्चास्य विद्यते । नातः सुखतरं किंचिल्लोके क्वचन विद्यते ॥
data.md: Weapons never pierce him; death does not exist for him. Nowhere in the world can be seen any one who is happier than he.

data.v: सम्यग्युक्त्वा यदात्मानमात्मन्येव प्रपश्यति । तदैव न स्पृहयते साक्षादपि शतक्रतोः ॥
data.md: When one, after adequate devotion to Yoga, sees the Soul in his ownself, he then ceases to have any regard for even him of a hundred sacrifices (India).

data.v: निर्वेदस्तु न गन्तव्यो युञ्जानेन कथंचन । योगमेकान्तशीलस्तु यथा युञ्जीत तच्छृणु ॥
दृष्टपूर्वां दिशं चिन्त्य यस्मिन्संनिवसेत्पुरे । पुरस्याभ्यन्तरे तस्य मनश्चार्यं न बाह्यतः ॥
पुरस्याभ्यन्तरे तिष्ठन्यस्मिन्नावसथे वसेत् । तस्मिन्नावसथे धार्यं सबाह्याभ्यन्तरं मनः ॥
प्रचिन्त्यावसथं कृत्स्नं यस्मिन्कायेऽवतिष्ठते । तस्मिन्काये मनश्चार्यं न कथंचन बाह्यतः ॥
संनियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं निर्घोषे निर्जने वने । कायमभ्यन्तरं कृत्स्नमेकाग्रः परिचिन्तयेत् ॥
दन्तांस्तालु च जिह्वां च गलं ग्रीवां तथैव च । हृदयं चिन्तयेच्चापि तथा हृदयबन्धनम् ॥
इत्युक्तः स मया शिष्यो मेधावी मधुसूदन । पप्रच्छ पुनरेवेमं मोक्षधर्मं सुदुर्वचम् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by me, that intelligent disciple, O destroyer of Madhu, once more asked me about this religion of Liberation that is so difficult to explain.

data.v: भुक्तं भुक्तं कथमिदमन्नं कोष्ठे विपच्यते । कथं रसत्वं व्रजति शोणितं जायते कथम् । तथा मांसं च मेदश्च स्नाय्वस्थीनि च पोषति ॥
data.md: How does this food that is eaten from time to time become digested in the stomach? How does it become changed into juice? How, again, into blood.

data.v: कथमेतानि सर्वाणि शरीराणि शरीरिणाम् । वर्धन्ते वर्धमानस्य वर्धते च कथं बलम् । निरोजसां निष्क्रमणं मलानां च पृथक्पृथक् ॥
data.md: How does the strength grow of the growing man? How takes place the escape of all such elements as are not nutritive, and of all impurities separately?

data.v: कुतो वायं प्रश्वसिति उच्छ्वसित्यपि वा पुनः । कं च देशमधिष्ठाय तिष्ठत्यात्मायमात्मनि ॥
data.md: How does this one inhale and again, exhale? Staying upon what particular part does the Soul live in the body?

data.v: जीवः कायं वहति चेच्चेष्टयानः कलेवरम् । किंवर्णं कीदृशं चैव निवेशयति वै मनः । याथातथ्येन भगवन्वक्तुमर्हसि मेऽनघ ॥
data.md: How does the Individual Soul, exerting himself, bear the body? Of what colour and of what kind is the body n which he lives again?

data.v: इति संपरिपृष्टोऽहं तेन विप्रेण माधव । प्रत्यब्रुवं महाबाहो यथाश्रुतमरिंदम ॥
यथा स्वकोष्ठे प्रक्षिप्य कोष्ठं भाण्डमना भवेत् । तथा स्वकाये प्रक्षिप्य मनो द्वारैरनिश्चलैः । आत्मानं तत्र मार्गेत प्रमादं परिवर्जयेत् ॥
data.md: I replied to him. O you of mighty arms, as I myself had heard, O chastiser of all enemies! As onc, placi.:g some precious object in his store-room, should keep his mind on it, so placing the mind within one's own body, one should then, controlling all the senses, seek after the Soul, avoiding all carclessness.

data.v: एवं सततमुद्युक्तः प्रीतात्मा नचिरादिव । आसादयति तद्ब्रह्म यद्दृष्ट्वा स्यात्प्रधानवित् ॥
data.md: One should, becoming always assiduous in this way and pleased with his own self, within a very short time, attain to that Brahman by seeing which one would become conversant with Pradhana.

data.v: न त्वसौ चक्षुषा ग्राह्यो न च सर्वैरपीन्द्रियैः । मनसैव प्रदीपेन महानात्मनि दृश्यते ॥
data.md: He is not capable of being apprehended by the eye; nor even by all the senses. It is only with the lamp of the mind that the great Soul can be seell.

data.v: सर्वतःपाणिपादं तं सर्वतोक्षिशिरोमुखम् । जीवो निष्क्रान्तमात्मानं शरीरात्संप्रपश्यति ॥
स तदुत्सृज्य देहं स्वं धारयन्ब्रह्म केवलम् । आत्मानमालोकयति मनसा प्रहसन्निव ॥
इदं सर्वरहस्यं ते मयोक्तं द्विजसत्तम । आपृच्छे साधयिष्यामि गच्छ शिष्य यथासुखम् ॥
data.md: O foremost of twice both oncs, all this mystery has now been declared by me. I ask your permission, for I shall leave this place. Do you (also) go wherever you like.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तदा कृष्ण मया शिष्यो महातपाः । अगच्छत यथाकामं ब्राह्मणश्छिन्नसंशयः ॥
data.md: Thus, addressed by me, O Krishna, on that occasion that disciple of mine, gifted with austere penances, that Brahmana of rigid vows, went away according to this pleasure.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा स तदा वाक्यं मां पार्थ द्विजपुंगवः । मोक्षधर्माश्रितः सम्यक्तत्रैवान्तरधीयत ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said O'son of Pritha having said these words to me, on that occasion, about the Religion of Emancipation, that best of Brahmanas disappeared then and there.

data.v: कच्चिदेतत्त्वया पार्थ श्रुतमेकाग्रचेतसा । तदापि हि रथस्थस्त्वं श्रुतवानेतदेव हि ॥
data.md: Have you heard this discourse, O son of Pritha, with mind directed solely to wards it? This you did hear on that occasion while you were on your car.

data.v: नैतत्पार्थ सुविज्ञेयं व्यामिश्रेणेति मे मतिः । नरेणाकृतसंज्ञेन विदग्धेनाकृतात्मना ॥
data.md: I think, O son of Pritha, that this is difficult of being comprehended by one whose understanding is confused, or who has acquired no wisdom by study, or who eats food not suited to his body' or whose Soul is not purified.

data.v: सुरहस्यमिदं प्रोक्तं देवानां भरतर्षभ । कच्चिन्नेदं श्रुतं पार्थ मर्त्येनान्येन केनचित् ॥
data.md: O chief of Bharata's race, this is a great mystery among the celestials that has been declared. At no time or place; O son of Pritha, has this teen heard by man in this world.

data.v: न ह्येतच्छ्रोतुमर्होऽन्यो मनुष्यस्त्वामृतेऽनघ । नैतदद्य सुविज्ञेयं व्यामिश्रेणान्तरात्मना ॥
data.md: O sinless one, save yourself no other man is worthy of hearing it. It is not, at this time, capable of being easily understood by one whose inner soul is confused.

data.v: क्रियावद्भिर्हि कौन्तेय देवलोकः समावृतः । न चैतदिष्टं देवानां मर्त्यै रूपनिवर्तनम् ॥
data.md: The world of the celestials is filled, O son of Kunti, with those who follow the religion of actions. The cessation of the body is not liked by the celestials.

data.v: परा हि सा गतिः पार्थ यत्तद्ब्रह्म सनातनम् । यत्रामृतत्वं प्राप्नोति त्यक्त्वा दुःखं सदा सुखी ॥
data.md: That goal, O son of Pritha, is the highest which is forined by eternal Brahman where (Onc, renouncing the body, attains to immortality and becomes always happy.

data.v: एवं हि धर्ममास्थाय येऽपि स्युः पापयोनयः । स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम् ॥
data.md: By following this religion, even they who are of sinful birth, such as women and Vaishyas and Shudras, come by the highest goal.

data.v: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पार्थ क्षत्रिया वा बहुश्रुताः । स्वधर्मरतयो नित्यं ब्रह्मलोकपरायणाः ॥
data.md: What need be said then, O son of Pritha, of Brahmanas and Kshatriyas endued with great learning, always devoted to the duties of their own orders, and who are intent on the region of Brahma?

data.v: हेतुमच्चैतदुद्दिष्टमुपायाश्चास्य साधने । सिद्धेः फलं च मोक्षश्च दुःखस्य च विनिर्णयः । अतः परं सुखं त्वन्यत्किं नु स्याद्भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: This has been laid down with the reasons; and also the means for its acquisition; and as complete attainment and fruit, viz., Liberation and the ascertainment of the truth about pain.

data.v: श्रुतवाञ्श्रद्दधानश्च पराक्रान्तश्च पाण्डव । यः परित्यजते मर्त्यो लोकतन्त्रमसारवत् । एतैरुपायैः स क्षिप्रं परां गतिमवाप्नुयात् ॥
data.md: O chief of Bharata's race, there is nothing else which yields happiness greater than is That mortal, O son of Pandu, who gifted with intelligence, and faith, and prowess, renounces unsubstantial what is considered substantial by the world, succeeds within a short time in obtaining the Supreme by these as as jeans.

data.v: एतावदेव वक्तव्यं नातो भूयोऽस्ति किंचन । षण्मासान्नित्ययुक्तस्य योगः पार्थ प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: This is all that is to be said-there is nothing else which is higher than this. He, O son of Pritha, who devotes himself to its constant practice for a period of six months, succeeds in attaining to Yoga.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । दंपत्योः पार्थ संवादमभयं नाम नामतः ॥
data.md: Vyasa said Regarding it is cited the ancient legend of Brihaspati and the wise Marutta.

data.v: ब्राह्मणी ब्राह्मणं कंचिज्ज्ञानविज्ञानपारगम् । दृष्ट्वा विविक्त आसीनं भार्या भर्तारमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: A certain Brahmana's wife, seeing the Brahmana, her husband, who was a complete master of every kind of knowledge and wisdom, seated in seclusion, said to him, Into what region shall I go, depending on you as my husband, you who are seated, having cast off all (religious) acts, who are harsh in your conduct towards me, and who undiscerning?

data.v: कं नु लोकं गमिष्यामि त्वामहं पतिमाश्रिता । न्यस्तकर्माणमासीनं कीनाशमविचक्षणम् ॥
data.md: A certain Brahmana's wife, seeing the Brahmana, her husband, who was a complete master of every kind of knowledge and wisdom, seated in seclusion, said to him, Into what region shall I go, depending on you as my husband, you who are seated, having cast off all (religious) acts, who are harsh in your conduct towards me, and who undiscerning?

data.v: भार्याः पतिकृताँल्लोकानाप्नुवन्तीति नः श्रुतम् । त्वामहं पतिमासाद्य कां गमिष्यामि वै गतिम् ॥
data.md: We have heard that a wife attains to those regions which are acquired by her husband. What, indeed, is the goal that I shall attain, having obtained you for my husband.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स शान्तात्मा तामुवाच हसन्निव । सुभगे नाभ्यसूयामि वाक्यस्यास्य तवानघे ॥
data.md: Thus questioned, that Brahmana of tranquil soul then said to her, smilingly, O blessed dame, I am not offended with these words of yours, O sinless one.

data.v: ग्राह्यं दृश्यं च श्राव्यं च यदिदं कर्म विद्यते । एतदेव व्यवस्यन्ति कर्म कर्मेति कर्मिणः ॥
data.md: Whatever acts exist which are adopted with the help of others, which are seen and which are true, are done, as acts, by men, devoted to acts. are SO are

data.v: मोहमेव नियच्छन्ति कर्मणा ज्ञानवर्जिताः । नैष्कर्म्यं न च लोकेऽस्मिन्मौर्तमित्युपलभ्यते ॥
data.md: Those persons who are destitute of knowledge, only store delusion by deeds. Freedom from acts, again, cannot even be momentarily attained in this world.

data.v: कर्मणा मनसा वाचा शुभं वा यदि वाशुभम् । जन्मादिमूर्तिभेदानां कर्म भूतेषु वर्तते ॥
data.md: From birth to the attainment of a different form, action good or bad, and accomplished by deeds, mind, or speech, exists in all beings.

data.v: रक्षोभिर्वध्यमानेषु दृश्यद्रव्येषु कर्मसु । आत्मस्थमात्मना तेन दृष्टमायतनं मया ॥
data.md: Those paths (of action) which characterised by visible objects (such as Somajuice and clarified butter for libations) being destroyed by Rakshasa, turning away from them I have perceived the scat (of the soul) that is in the body, with the help of the soul.

data.v: यत्र तद्ब्रह्म निर्द्वंद्वं यत्र सोमः सहाग्निना । व्यवायं कुरुते नित्यं धीरो भूतानि धारयन् ॥
data.md: There lives Brahma transcending all pairs of opposites; there Soma with Agni; and there the mover of the under standing, (viz., Vayu) always moves, upholding all creatures.

data.v: यत्र ब्रह्मादयो युक्तास्तदक्षरमुपासते । विद्वांसः सुव्रता यत्र शान्तात्मानो जितेन्द्रियाः ॥
data.md: It is for that seat that the Grandfather Brahman and others, concentrated in Yoga, adorc thc Indestructible. It is for that seat that men of learning an excellent vows, of tranquil souls, and of senses completely controlled, strive.

data.v: घ्राणेन न तदाघ्रेयं न तदाद्यं च जिह्वया । स्पर्शेन च न तत्स्पृश्यं मनसा त्वेव गम्यते ॥
data.md: That is not capable of being smelt by the sense of smell; nor tasted by the tongue; or touched by the organs of It is by the mind that that is attained.

data.v: चक्षुषा न विषह्यं च यत्किंचिच्छ्रवणात्परम् । अगन्धमरसस्पर्शमरूपाशब्दमव्ययम् ॥
data.md: It is incapable of being conquered by the cye. It is above the sense of hearing. It is shorn of scent, taste, touch, and form as attributes.

data.v: यतः प्रवर्तते तन्त्रं यत्र च प्रतितिष्ठति । प्राणोऽपानः समानश्च व्यानश्चोदान एव च ॥
data.md: It is that from which proceeds the wellordained universe, and it that upon which it depends. The vital airs called Prana, Apana, Samana, Vyana and Udana, flow from it, and it is that into which they again enter. The vital airs Prana and Apana move between Samana and Vyana.

data.v: तत एव प्रवर्तन्ते तमेव प्रविशन्ति च । समानव्यानयोर्मध्ये प्राणापानौ विचेरतुः ॥
data.md: It is that from which proceeds the wellordained universe, and it that upon which it depends. The vital airs called Prana, Apana, Samana, Vyana and Udana, flow from it, and it is that into which they again enter. The vital airs Prana and Apana move between Samana and Vyana.

data.v: तस्मिन्सुप्ते प्रलीयेते समानो व्यान एव च । अपानप्राणयोर्मध्ये उदानो व्याप्य तिष्ठति । तस्माच्छयानं पुरुषं प्राणापानौ न मुञ्चतः ॥
data.md: When the soul sleeps, both Samana and Vyana are absorbed. Between Apana and Frana, Udana lives, pervading all.

data.v: प्राणानायम्यते येन तमुदानं प्रचक्षते । तस्मात्तपो व्यवस्यन्ति तद्भवं ब्रह्मवादिनः ॥
data.md: Hence, Prana and Apana do not desert a sleeping person. On account of its controlling all the vital airs, the controlling breath is so called Udana.

data.v: तेषामन्योन्यभक्षाणां सर्वेषां देहचारिणाम् । अग्निर्वैश्वानरो मध्ये सप्तधा विहितोऽन्तरा ॥
घ्राणं जिह्वा च चक्षुश्च त्वक्च श्रोत्रं च पञ्चमम् । मनो बुद्धिश्च सप्तैता जिह्वा वैश्वानरार्चिषः ॥
data.md: The nose, the eye, the tongue, the skin, and the ear numbering the fifth, the mind, and the understanding, these are the seven sacrificing priests standing distinctly from one another.

data.v: घ्रेयं पेयं च दृश्यं च स्पृश्यं श्रव्यं तथैव च । मन्तव्यमथ बोद्धव्यं ताः सप्त समिधो मम ॥
घ्राता भक्षयिता द्रष्टा स्प्रष्टा श्रोता च पञ्चमः । मन्ता बोद्धा च सप्तैते भवन्ति परमर्त्विजः ॥
घ्रेये पेये च दृश्ये च स्पृश्ये श्रव्ये तथैव च । हवींष्यग्निषु होतारः सप्तधा सप्त सप्तसु । सम्यक्प्रक्षिप्य विद्वांसो जनयन्ति स्वयोनिषु ॥
पृथिवी वायुराकाशमापो ज्योतिश्च पञ्चमम् । मनो बुद्धिश्च सप्तैते योनिरित्येव शब्दिताः ॥
हविर्भूता गुणाः सर्वे प्रविशन्त्यग्निजं मुखम् । अन्तर्वासमुषित्वा च जायन्ते स्वासु योनिषु । तत्रैव च निरुध्यन्ते प्रलये भूतभावने ॥
ततः संजायते गन्धस्ततः संजायते रसः । ततः संजायते रूपं ततः स्पर्शोऽभिजायते ॥
ततः संजायते शब्दः संशयस्तत्र जायते । ततः संजायते निष्ठा जन्मैतत्सप्तधा विदुः ॥
data.md: From that is produced smell, from that is produced taste, from that is produced colour, and from that is produced touch; from that is produced sound; from that originates doubt; and from that is produce a resolution. Thus is what is known as the sevenfold creation.

data.v: अनेनैव प्रकारेण प्रगृहीतं पुरातनैः । पूर्णाहुतिभिरापूर्णास्तेऽभिपूर्यन्ति तेजसा ॥
data.md: It is thus that all this was comprehended by the ancients. By the three full and final libations, the full become full with light.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । निबोध दशहोतॄणां विधानमिह यादृशम् ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said Regarding it is cited the following ancient story. Do you understand, of what kind the institution is of the ten Hotris (sacrificing priests).

data.v: सर्वमेवात्र विज्ञेयं चित्तं ज्ञानमवेक्षते । रेतः शरीरभृत्काये विज्ञाता तु शरीरभृत् ॥
data.md: All objects of knowledge are Mind. Knowledge only perceives it. The Individual Soul, encased in subtle form, lives within the gross body that is produced by the vital seed,

data.v: शरीरभृद्गार्हपत्यस्तस्मादन्यः प्रणीयते । ततश्चाहवनीयस्तु तस्मिन्संक्षिप्यते हविः ॥
data.md: The bearer of the body is the Garhapatya fire. From that is produced another. Mind is the Ahavaniya fire. Into it is, poured the oblation.

data.v: ततो वाचस्पतिर्जज्ञे समानः पर्यवेक्षते । रूपं भवति वै व्यक्तं तदनुद्रवते मनः ॥
data.md: From that was produced the Veda or Word), (then was born Mind); Mind (desirous of creation) sets itself on the Veda (or the Word). Then arises forin colour) undistinguished by particular colours. It runs towards the Mind. or

data.v: कस्माद्वागभवत्पूर्वं कस्मात्पश्चान्मनोऽभवत् । मनसा चिन्तितं वाक्यं यदा समभिपद्यते ॥
data.md: The Brahmana's wife said Why did Word first arise and why did Mind arise afterwards, seeing that Word comes into being after having been thought upon by Mind?

data.v: केन विज्ञानयोगेन मतिश्चित्तं समास्थिता । समुन्नीता नाध्यगच्छत्को वैनां प्रतिषेधति ॥
data.md: Upon what authority can it be said that Mati (Prana) takes refuge in Mind. Why, again, in dreamless sleep, though separatcd from Mind, does not Prana apprehend (all objects)? What is that which controls it then?

data.v: तामपानः पतिर्भूत्वा तस्मात्प्रेष्यत्यपानताम् । तां मतिं मनसः प्राहुर्मनस्तस्मादवेक्षते ॥
data.md: The Apana air, becoming the lord, on account of such lordship over it, makes it at one with itself. That restrained motion of the Prana air has been said to be the motion of the mind. Hence the mind depends upon Prana.

data.v: प्रश्नं तु वाङ्मनसोर्मां यस्मात्त्वमनुपृच्छसि । तस्मात्ते वर्तयिष्यामि तयोरेव समाह्वयम् ॥
data.md: But since you ask me a question about word and mind, I shall, therefore, describe to you a discourse between them.

data.v: उभे वाङ्मनसी गत्वा भूतात्मानमपृच्छताम् । आवयोः श्रेष्ठमाचक्ष्व छिन्धि नौ संशयं विभो ॥
data.md: Both Word and Mind, repairing to the Soul of matter, asked him, Do you say who amongst us is superior. Do you, O powerful one, remove our doubt.

data.v: मन इत्येव भगवांस्तदा प्राह सरस्वतीम् । अहं वै कामधुक्तुभ्यमिति तं प्राह वागथ ॥
data.md: On that occasion, the holy one made this answer, The mind undoubtedly (is superior)! To him Word said, I great you the fruition of all your desires.

data.v: स्थावरं जङ्गमं चैव विद्ध्युभे मनसी मम । स्थावरं मत्सकाशे वै जङ्गमं विषये तव ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said Know that I have two minds, immovable and movable. That which is immovable, is, indeed, with me; the movable is in your dominion.

data.v: यस्तु ते विषयं गच्छेन्मन्त्रो वर्णः स्वरोऽपि वा । तन्मनो जङ्गमं नाम तस्मादसि गरीयसी ॥
data.md: That mind is indeed called movable which, in the form of Mantra, letter, or voice, is referrible to your dominion. Hence, you are superior.

data.v: यस्मादसि च मा वोचः स्वयमभ्येत्य शोभने । तस्मादुच्छ्वासमासाद्य न वक्ष्यसि सरस्वति ॥
data.md: But since, coming of your own accord, O beautiful one, you enter into the engagement, therefore, filling myself with breath, I utter you.

data.v: प्राणापानान्तरे देवी वाग्वै नित्यं स्म तिष्ठति । प्रेर्यमाणा महाभागे विना प्राणमपानती । प्रजापतिमुपाधावत्प्रसीद भगवन्निति ॥
data.md: The goddess Word used always to live between Prana and Apana, But, O blessed one, sinking into Apana, though urged upwards, on account of becoming dissociated from Prana, she ran to Prajapati and said, Be pleased with ime, O holy one.

data.v: ततः प्राणः प्रादुरभूद्वाचमाप्याययन्पुनः । तस्मादुच्छ्वासमासाद्य न वाग्वदति कर्हिचित् ॥
data.md: Then Prana appeared, once more fostering Word. Hence, Word, encountering deep exhalation, never utters anything.

data.v: घोषिणी जातनिर्घोषा नित्यमेव प्रवर्तते । तयोरपि च घोषिण्योर्निर्घोषैव गरीयसी ॥
data.md: Word always comes as endued with ulterance or unendued with it. Amongst those two. Word without utterance is superior to Word with utterance.

data.v: गौरिव प्रस्रवत्येषा रसमुत्तमशालिनी । सततं स्यन्दते ह्येषा शाश्वतं ब्रह्मवादिनी ॥
data.md: Like a cow having milk, she yields various kinds of ineaning. This one always gives the Eternal (viz., Emancipation), speaking of Brahma.

data.v: दिव्यादिव्यप्रभावेन भारती गौः शुचिस्मिते । एतयोरन्तरं पश्य सूक्ष्मयोः स्यन्दमानयोः ॥
data.md: O you of beautiful smiles, Word is a cow, on account of her power which is both divine and not divine. See the distinction of these two subtle forms of Word that flow.

data.v: अनुत्पन्नेषु वाक्येषु चोद्यमाना सिसृक्षया । किं नु पूर्वं ततो देवी व्याजहार सरस्वती ॥
data.md: What did the goddess of Word then say, formerly when, though moved by the wish to speak, speech could not come out?

data.v: प्राणेन या संभवते शरीरे; प्राणादपानं प्रतिपद्यते च । उदानभूता च विसृज्य देहं; व्यानेन सर्वं दिवमावृणोति ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said The Word that is made in the body by Prana, then attains to Apana from Prana. Then changed into Udana and coming out of the body, it covers all the quarters, with Vyana.

data.v: ततः समाने प्रतितिष्ठतीह; इत्येव पूर्वं प्रजजल्प चापि । तस्मान्मनः स्थावरत्वाद्विशिष्टं; तथा देवी जङ्गमत्वाद्विशिष्टा ॥
data.md: After that, she lives in Samana. Even thus did Word formerly speak. Hence Mind, on account of being immovable, is distinguished, and the goddess Word, on account of being movable, is also distinguished.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । सुभगे सप्तहोतॄणां विधानमिह यादृशम् ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said Regarding it is cited the following ancient story. Do you understand, of what kind the institution is of the ten Hotris (sacrificing priests).

data.v: घ्राणं चक्षुश्च जिह्वा च त्वक्श्रोत्रं चैव पञ्चमम् । मनो बुद्धिश्च सप्तैते होतारः पृथगाश्रिताः ॥
data.md: The nose, the eye, the tongue, the skin, and the ear numbering the fifth, the mind, and the understanding, these are the seven sacrificing priests standing distinctly from one another.

data.v: सूक्ष्मेऽवकाशे सन्तस्ते न पश्यन्तीतरेतरम् । एतान्वै सप्तहोतॄंस्त्वं स्वभावाद्विद्धि शोभने ॥
data.md: Living in subtle space, they do not perceive one another. Do you, O beautiful one, know these sacrificing priests that are scven by their nature.

data.v: सूक्ष्मेऽवकाशे सन्तस्ते कथं नान्योन्यदर्शिनः । कथंस्वभावा भगवन्नेतदाचक्ष्व मे विभो ॥
data.md: The Brahmana's wife said How is it that living in subtle space, these do not perceive one another? What are their (respective) natures, O holy one? Do you tell me this,Olord.

data.v: गुणाज्ञानमविज्ञानं गुणिज्ञानमभिज्ञता । परस्परगुणानेते न विजानन्ति कर्हिचित् ॥
data.md: Not knowing the qualities is ignorance; while knowledge of the qualities is knowledge. These seven never succeed in apprehending or knowing the qualitics of one another.

data.v: जिह्वा चक्षुस्तथा श्रोत्रं त्वङ्मनो बुद्धिरेव च । न गन्धानधिगच्छन्ति घ्राणस्तानधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: The tongue, the eye, the ear too, the skin, the mind, and the understanding, do not succeed in apprehending smells. It is the nose alone which apprehends them.

data.v: घ्राणं चक्षुस्तथा श्रोत्रं त्वङ्मनो बुद्धिरेव च । न रसानधिगच्छन्ति जिह्वा तानधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: The tongue, the eye, the ear too, the skin, the mind, and the understanding, do not succeed in apprehending smells. It is the nose alone which apprehends them.

data.v: घ्राणं जिह्वा तथा श्रोत्रं त्वङ्मनो बुद्धिरेव च । न रूपाण्यधिगच्छन्ति चक्षुस्तान्यधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: The tongue, the eye, the ear too, the skin, the mind, and the understanding, do not succeed in apprehending smells. It is the nose alone which apprehends them.

data.v: घ्राणं जिह्वा च चक्षुश्च श्रोत्रं बुद्धिर्मनस्तथा । न स्पर्शानधिगच्छन्ति त्वक्च तानधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: The tongue, the eye, the ear too, the skin, the mind, and the understanding, do not succeed in apprehending smells. It is the nose alone which apprehends them.

data.v: घ्राणं जिह्वा च चक्षुश्च त्वङ्मनो बुद्धिरेव च । न शब्दानधिगच्छन्ति श्रोत्रं तानधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: The tongue, the eye, the ear too, the skin, the mind, and the understanding, do not succeed in apprehending smells. It is the nose alone which apprehends them.

data.v: घ्राणं जिह्वा च चक्षुश्च त्वक्श्रोत्रं बुद्धिरेव च । संशयान्नाधिगच्छन्ति मनस्तानधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: The tongue, the eye, the ear too, the skin, the mind, and the understanding, do not succeed in apprehending smells. It is the nose alone which apprehends them.

data.v: घ्राणं जिह्वा च चक्षुश्च त्वक्श्रोत्रं मन एव च । न निष्ठामधिगच्छन्ति बुद्धिस्तामधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: The tongue, the eye, the ear too, the skin, the mind, and the understanding, do not succeed in apprehending smells. It is the nose alone which apprehends them.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । इन्द्रियाणां च संवादं मनसश्चैव भामिनि ॥
data.md: Vyasa said Regarding it is cited the ancient legend of Brihaspati and the wise Marutta.

data.v: न घ्राति मामृते घ्राणं रसं जिह्वा न बुध्यते । रूपं चक्षुर्न गृह्णाति त्वक्स्पर्शं नावबुध्यते ॥
data.md: The Mind said The nose does not smell without me. (Without me) the tongue does not apprchend taste. the eye does not perceive colour, the skin does not feel touchi, the car does not apprehend sound, when deprived of me. I am the eternal and foremost one among all the elements.

data.v: न श्रोत्रं बुध्यते शब्दं मया हीनं कथंचन । प्रवरं सर्वभूतानामहमस्मि सनातनम् ॥
अगाराणीव शून्यानि शान्तार्चिष इवाग्नयः । इन्द्रियाणि न भासन्ते मया हीनानि नित्यशः ॥
data.md: It always occurs that without inyself, the senses never shine, like habitations cmpty of inmates or fires whose flames have been quenched.

data.v: काष्ठानीवार्द्रशुष्काणि यतमानैरपीन्द्रियैः । गुणार्थान्नाधिगच्छन्ति मामृते सर्वजन्तवः ॥
data.md: Without me, all creatures cannot apprehend qualities and objects, with even the senses exerting themselves, as fuel that is wet and dry cannot catch fire.

data.v: एवमेतद्भवेत्सत्यं यथैतन्मन्यते भवान् । ऋतेऽस्मानस्मदर्थांस्तु भोगान्भुङ्क्ते भवान्यदि ॥
data.md: Hearing these words, the Senses said, This what you think would be true, if, you could enjoy pleasures without either ourselves or our objccts.

data.v: यद्यस्मासु प्रलीनेषु तर्पणं प्राणधारणम् । भोगान्भुङ्क्षे रसान्भुङ्क्षे यथैतन्मन्यते तथा ॥
अथ वास्मासु लीनेषु तिष्ठत्सु विषयेषु च । यदि संकल्पमात्रेण भुङ्क्ते भोगान्यथार्थवत् ॥
data.md: If, when we are no more, there be gratification and support of life, and a continuation of your enjoyments, then what you think would be true; or, if, when we are absorbed and objects are existing, you can't have your enjoyments by your desire alone, as truly as you have them with our help.

data.v: अथ चेन्मन्यसे सिद्धिमस्मदर्थेषु नित्यदा । घ्राणेन रूपमादत्स्व रसमादत्स्व चक्षुषा ॥
data.md: If, again, you consider your power over our objects to be always complete, do you then seize colour by the nose, and taste by the eye.

data.v: श्रोत्रेण गन्धमादत्स्व निष्ठामादत्स्व जिह्वया । त्वचा च शब्दमादत्स्व बुद्ध्या स्पर्शमथापि च ॥
data.md: Do you also take smells by the car, and sensations of touch by the tongue. Do you also take sounds by the skin, and like wise touch by the understanding.

data.v: बलवन्तो ह्यनियमा नियमा दुर्बलीयसाम् । भोगानपूर्वानादत्स्व नोच्छिष्टं भोक्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: The powerful do not acknowledge the control of any rules. Rulcs cxist only for the weak. Do you seize enjoyments unenjoyed before; you should not enjoy what has been tasted before (by others).

data.v: यथा हि शिष्यः शास्तारं श्रुत्यर्थमभिधावति । ततः श्रुतमुपादाय श्रुतार्थमुपतिष्ठति ॥
data.md: As a disciple goes to a preceptor for the sake of the Shrutis, and then, having acquired the Shrutis, lives on their meaning, so do you regard as yours those objects which are shown by us, past or future, in sleep or in wakefulness.

data.v: विषयानेवमस्माभिर्दर्शितानभिमन्यसे । अनागतानतीतांश्च स्वप्ने जागरणे तथा ॥
वैमनस्यं गतानां च जन्तूनामल्पचेतसाम् । अस्मदर्थे कृते कार्ये दृश्यते प्राणधारणम् ॥
data.md: Of creatures, again, who have lillle intelligence, when their mind becomes distracted and checrless, life is seen to be upheld upon our objects discharging their functions.

data.v: बहूनपि हि संकल्पान्मत्वा स्वप्नानुपास्य च । बुभुक्षया पीड्यमानो विषयानेव धावसि ॥
data.md: It is seen also that a creature, after having made many purposes and indulged in dreams, when afflicted by the desire to enjoy, runs to objects of sense alone.

data.v: अगारमद्वारमिव प्रविश्य; संकल्पभोगो विषयानविन्दन् । प्राणक्षये शान्तिमुपैति नित्यं; दारुक्षयेऽग्निर्ज्वलितो यथैव ॥
data.md: One entering upon enjoyments depending on purposes alone and unconnected with actual objects of sense, always meets with death upon the exhaustion of the vital airs, like an enkindled fore upon the exhaustion of fuel.

data.v: कामं तु नः स्वेषु गुणेषु सङ्गः; कामं च नान्योन्यगुणोपलब्धिः । अस्मानृते नास्ति तवोपलब्धि;स्त्वामप्यृतेऽस्मान्न भजेत हर्षः ॥
data.md: True it is that we have connections with our respectivc attributes; true it is, we have no knowledge of one anther's attributes. But without us you can have no perception. Without us no happiness can come to you. objects of sense, always meets with death upon the exhaustion of the vital airs, like an enkindled fore upon the exhaustion of fuel.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । सुभगे पञ्चहोतॄणां विधानमिह यादृशम् ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said Regarding it is cited the following ancient story. Do you understand, of what kind the institution is of the ten Hotris (sacrificing priests).

data.v: प्राणापानावुदानश्च समानो व्यान एव च । पञ्चहोतॄनथैतान्वै परं भावं विदुर्बुधाः ॥
data.md: The learned know this to be a great principle that Prana and Apana and Udana and Şamana and Vyana are the five sacrificing priests.

data.v: स्वभावात्सप्त होतार इति ते पूर्विका मतिः । यथा वै पञ्च होतारः परो भावस्तथोच्यताम् ॥
data.md: The Brahmana's wife said I naturally believed that there are seven sacrificing priests. Let the great principle be declared to me as to how, indeed, the number is five of the sacrificing priests.

data.v: प्राणेन संभृतो वायुरपानो जायते ततः । अपाने संभृतो वायुस्ततो व्यानः प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said The wind nursed y Prana afterwards takes birth in Apana. The wind nursed in Apana then becomes developed into Vyana.

data.v: व्यानेन संभृतो वायुस्ततोदानः प्रवर्तते । उदाने संभृतो वायुः समानः संप्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: Nursed by Vyana, the wind is then developed into Udana. Nursed in Udana, the wind is then generated as Samana.

data.v: तेऽपृच्छन्त पुरा गत्वा पूर्वजातं प्रजापतिम् । यो नो ज्येष्ठस्तमाचक्ष्व स नः श्रेष्ठो भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Those good beings formerly asked the first born Grandfather, saying, Do you say who amongst us is the foremost. He alone will be our chief.

data.v: यस्मिन्प्रलीने प्रलयं व्रजन्ति; सर्वे प्राणाः प्राणभृतां शरीरे । यस्मिन्प्रचीर्णे च पुनश्चरन्ति; स वै श्रेष्ठो गच्छत यत्र कामः ॥
data.md: Brahman said He upon whose extinction all the vital airs become extinct in the bodies of living creatures, he upon whose moving they move, is, indeed, the foremost. Do you go where you like.

data.v: मयि प्रलीने प्रलयं व्रजन्ति; सर्वे प्राणाः प्राणभृतां शरीरे । मयि प्रचीर्णे च पुनश्चरन्ति; श्रेष्ठो ह्यहं पश्यत मां प्रलीनम् ॥
data.md: Brahman said He upon whose extinction all the vital airs become extinct in the bodies of living creatures, he upon whose moving they move, is, indeed, the foremost. Do you go where you like.

data.v: प्राणः प्रलीयत ततः पुनश्च प्रचचार ह । समानश्चाप्युदानश्च वचोऽब्रूतां ततः शुभे ॥
न त्वं सर्वमिदं व्याप्य तिष्ठसीह यथा वयम् । न त्वं श्रेष्ठोऽसि नः प्राण अपानो हि वशे तव । प्रचचार पुनः प्राणस्तमपानोऽभ्यभाषत ॥
मयि प्रलीने प्रलयं व्रजन्ति; सर्वे प्राणाः प्राणभृतां शरीरे । मयि प्रचीर्णे च पुनश्चरन्ति; श्रेष्ठो ह्यहं पश्यत मां प्रलीनम् ॥
data.md: Brahman said He upon whose extinction all the vital airs become extinct in the bodies of living creatures, he upon whose moving they move, is, indeed, the foremost. Do you go where you like.

data.v: व्यानश्च तमुदानश्च भाषमाणमथोचतुः । अपान न त्वं श्रेष्ठोऽसि प्राणो हि वशगस्तव ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said To Apana who said so, both Vyana and Udana said, O Apana, you are not the foremost (Only) Prana is under your dominion.

data.v: अपानः प्रचचाराथ व्यानस्तं पुनरब्रवीत् । श्रेष्ठोऽहमस्मि सर्वेषां श्रूयतां येन हेतुना ॥
data.md: Then Apana began to move about, Vyana once more addressed him, saying I am the foremost of all. Listen, for what reason.

data.v: मयि प्रलीने प्रलयं व्रजन्ति; सर्वे प्राणाः प्राणभृतां शरीरे । मयि प्रचीर्णे च पुनश्चरन्ति; श्रेष्ठो ह्यहं पश्यत मां प्रलीनम् ॥
data.md: Brahman said He upon whose extinction all the vital airs become extinct in the bodies of living creatures, he upon whose moving they move, is, indeed, the foremost. Do you go where you like.

data.v: प्रालीयत ततो व्यानः पुनश्च प्रचचार ह । प्राणापानावुदानश्च समानश्च तमब्रुवन् । न त्वं श्रेष्ठोऽसि नो व्यान समानो हि वशे तव ॥
data.md: Then Udana, after having become extinct, began to once more move about. Prana and Apana and Samana and Vyana said to him, O Udana, you are not the foremost one among us. (Only) Vyana is under your dominion.

data.v: प्रचचार पुनर्व्यानः समानः पुनरब्रवीत् । श्रेष्ठोऽहमस्मि सर्वेषां श्रूयतां येन हेतुना ॥
data.md: Then Apana began to move about, Vyana once more addressed him, saying I am the foremost of all. Listen, for what reason.

data.v: मयि प्रलीने प्रलयं व्रजन्ति; सर्वे प्राणाः प्राणभृतां शरीरे । मयि प्रचीर्णे च पुनश्चरन्ति; श्रेष्ठो ह्यहं पश्यत मां प्रलीनम् ॥
data.md: Brahman said He upon whose extinction all the vital airs become extinct in the bodies of living creatures, he upon whose moving they move, is, indeed, the foremost. Do you go where you like.

data.v: ततः समानः प्रालिल्ये पुनश्च प्रचचार ह । प्राणापानावुदानश्च व्यानश्चैव तमब्रुवन् । समान न त्वं श्रेष्ठोऽसि व्यान एव वशे तव ॥
data.md: Then Udana, after having become extinct, began to once more move about. Prana and Apana and Samana and Vyana said to him, O Udana, you are not the foremost one among us. (Only) Vyana is under your dominion.

data.v: समानः प्रचचाराथ उदानस्तमुवाच ह । श्रेष्ठोऽहमस्मि सर्वेषां श्रूयतां येन हेतुना ॥
data.md: Then Apana began to move about, Vyana once more addressed him, saying I am the foremost of all. Listen, for what reason.

data.v: मयि प्रलीने प्रलयं व्रजन्ति; सर्वे प्राणाः प्राणभृतां शरीरे । मयि प्रचीर्णे च पुनश्चरन्ति; श्रेष्ठो ह्यहं पश्यत मां प्रलीनम् ॥
data.md: Brahman said He upon whose extinction all the vital airs become extinct in the bodies of living creatures, he upon whose moving they move, is, indeed, the foremost. Do you go where you like.

data.v: ततः प्रालीयतोदानः पुनश्च प्रचचार ह । प्राणापानौ समानश्च व्यानश्चैव तमब्रुवन् । उदान न त्वं श्रेष्ठोऽसि व्यान एव वशे तव ॥
data.md: Then Udana, after having become extinct, began to once more move about. Prana and Apana and Samana and Vyana said to him, O Udana, you are not the foremost one among us. (Only) Vyana is under your dominion.

data.v: ततस्तानब्रवीद्ब्रह्मा समवेतान्प्रजापतिः । सर्वे श्रेष्ठा न वा श्रेष्ठाः सर्वे चान्योन्यधर्मिणः । सर्वे स्वविषये श्रेष्ठाः सर्वे चान्योन्यरक्षिणः ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said To them assembled together, the Lord of creatures, Brahman, said, You are all foremost and not foremost. You are all gified with the attributes of one another.

data.v: एकः स्थिरश्चास्थिरश्च विशेषात्पञ्च वायवः । एक एव ममैवात्मा बहुधाप्युपचीयते ॥
data.md: There is one that is unmoving, and one that is moving. On account of special attributes, there are five vital airs. My own self is one. That one accumulates into many forms.

data.v: परस्परस्य सुहृदो भावयन्तः परस्परम् । स्वस्ति व्रजत भद्रं वो धारयध्वं परस्परम् ॥
data.md: Becoming friendly to one another, and pleasing one another, depart in depart in peace. Blessings to you, do you up hold one another.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । नारदस्य च संवादमृषेर्देवमतस्य च ॥
data.md: Vyasa said Regarding it is cited the ancient legend of Brihaspati and the wise Marutta.

data.v: जन्तोः संजायमानस्य किं नु पूर्वं प्रवर्तते । प्राणोऽपानः समानो वा व्यानो वोदान एव च ॥
data.md: Devamata said What, indeed, comes first into existence, of a creature that takes birth? Is it Prana, or Apana, or Samana, or Vyana, or Udana?

data.v: येनायं सृज्यते जन्तुस्ततोऽन्यः पूर्वमेति तम् । प्राणद्वंद्वं च विज्ञेयं तिर्यगं चोर्ध्वगं च यत् ॥
data.md: Narada said By whatever the creature is created, that first comes to him which is other. The vital airs are to be known as existing in pairs, viz., those which move transversely, upwards, and downwards.

data.v: केनायं सृज्यते जन्तुः कश्चान्यः पूर्वमेति तम् । प्राणद्वंद्वं च मे ब्रूहि तिर्यगूर्ध्वं च निश्चयात् ॥
data.md: Narada said By whatever the creature is created, that first comes to him which is other. The vital airs are to be known as existing in pairs, viz., those which move transversely, upwards, and downwards.

data.v: संकल्पाज्जायते हर्षः शब्दादपि च जायते । रसात्संजायते चापि रूपादपि च जायते ॥
data.md: Narada said-From wish originates Pleasure. It also arise from sound. It arises also from taste; it arises too from colour.

data.v: स्पर्शात्संजायते चापि गन्धादपि च जायते । एतद्रूपमुदानस्य हर्षो मिथुनसंभवः ॥
data.md: Pleasure originates from the semen as well. It arises from taste also. This is the form (effect) of Udana. Pleasure is produced from union.

data.v: कामात्संजायते शुक्रं कामात्संजायते रसः । समानव्यानजनिते सामान्ये शुक्रशोणिते ॥
शुक्राच्छोणितसंसृष्टात्पूर्वं प्राणः प्रवर्तते । प्राणेन विकृते शुक्रे ततोऽपानः प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: From the semen, united with blood, first originates Prana. Upon the semen being modified by Prana, flows Apana.

data.v: प्राणापानाविदं द्वंद्वमवाक्चोर्ध्वं च गच्छतः । व्यानः समानश्चैवोभौ तिर्यग्द्वंद्वत्वमुच्यते ॥
data.md: Semen is formed by desire. From desire is produced the menstrual flow. In the union of semen and blood, generated by Samana and Vyana, the pair that consists of Prana and Apana, enters, moving transversely and upwards. Vyana and Samana both form a pair which move transversely.

data.v: अग्निर्वै देवताः सर्वा इति वेदस्य शासनम् । संजायते ब्राह्मणेषु ज्ञानं बुद्धिसमन्वितम् ॥
data.md: Agni (fire) is all the celestials. This is the teaching of the Veda, The knowledge of Agni arises in a Brahmana, with intelligence,

data.v: तस्य धूमस्तमोरूपं रजो भस्म सुरेतसः । सत्त्वं संजायते तस्य यत्र प्रक्षिप्यते हविः ॥
data.md: The smoke of that firc is of the form of Darkness. The quality that is known by the name of Passion is in it ashes. The quality of goodness originate from that portion of the fire into which the oblation is poured.

data.v: आघारौ समानो व्यानश्च इति यज्ञविदो विदुः । प्राणापानावाज्यभागौ तयोर्मध्ये हुताशनः । एतद्रूपमुदानस्य परमं ब्राह्मणा विदुः ॥
data.md: They who are conversant with sacrifices know that Samana and Vyana are from the quality of Goodness, Prana and Apana are portions of the oblation (of clarified butter). Between them is the Fire.

data.v: निर्द्वंद्वमिति यत्त्वेतत्तन्मे निगदतः शृणु ॥
data.md: That is the excellent form (or seat) of Udana, as the Brahmanas know. Listen as I say which is distinct from the pairs.

data.v: अहोरात्रमिदं द्वंद्वं तयोर्मध्ये हुताशनः । एतद्रूपमुदानस्य परमं ब्राह्मणा विदुः ॥
data.md: Day and Night form a pair, Between them is the Fire. That is the cxcellent seat of Udana as the Brahinanas know.

data.v: उभे चैवायने द्वंद्वं तयोर्मध्ये हुताशनः । एतद्रूपमुदानस्य परमं ब्राह्मणा विदुः ॥
data.md: Day and Night form a pair, Between them is the Fire. That is the cxcellent seat of Udana as the Brahinanas know.

data.v: उभे सत्यानृते द्वंद्वं तयोर्मध्ये हुताशनः । एतद्रूपमुदानस्य परमं ब्राह्मणा विदुः ॥
data.md: Day and Night form a pair, Between them is the Fire. That is the cxcellent seat of Udana as the Brahinanas know.

data.v: उभे शुभाशुभे द्वंद्वं तयोर्मध्ये हुताशनः । एतद्रूपमुदानस्य परमं ब्राह्मणा विदुः ॥
data.md: Day and Night form a pair, Between them is the Fire. That is the cxcellent seat of Udana as the Brahinanas know.

data.v: सच्चासच्चैव तद्द्वंद्वं तयोर्मध्ये हुताशनः । एतद्रूपमुदानस्य परमं ब्राह्मणा विदुः ॥
data.md: Day and Night form a pair, Between them is the Fire. That is the cxcellent seat of Udana as the Brahinanas know.

data.v: प्रथमं समानो व्यानो व्यस्यते कर्म तेन तत् । तृतीयं तु समानेन पुनरेव व्यवस्यते ॥
data.md: First is Saman. Then Vyana. The latter's function is managed through it (viz., Samana). Then, secondly, Samans, once more comes to work.

data.v: शान्त्यर्थं वामदेवं च शान्तिर्ब्रह्म सनातनम् । एतद्रूपमुदानस्य परमं ब्राह्मणा विदुः ॥
data.md: Only Vyana exists for tranquility. Tranquillity is eternal Brahma. This is the excellent scat of Udana as the Brahinanas know.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । चातुर्होत्रविधानस्य विधानमिह यादृशम् ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said Regarding it is cited the following ancient story. Do you understand, of what kind the institution is of the ten Hotris (sacrificing priests).

data.v: तस्य सर्वस्य विधिवद्विधानमुपदेक्ष्यते । शृणु मे गदतो भद्रे रहस्यमिदमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: The ordinances are now being duly declared in full. Listen to me, O fair lady, as I describe this wonderful mystery.

data.v: करणं कर्म कर्ता च मोक्ष इत्येव भामिनि । चत्वार एते होतारो यैरिदं जगदावृतम् ॥
data.md: The instrument, the action, the agent and liberation. These, O beautiful lady, are the four sacrificing pricsts by whom the universe is covered.

data.v: होतॄणां साधनं चैव शृणु सर्वमशेषतः । घ्राणं जिह्वा च चक्षुश्च त्वक्च श्रोत्रं च पञ्चमम् । मनो बुद्धिश्च सप्तैते विज्ञेया गुणहेतवः ॥
गन्धो रसश्च रूपं च शब्दः स्पर्शश्च पञ्चमः । मन्तव्यमथ बोद्धव्यं सप्तैते कर्महेतवः ॥
घ्राता भक्षयिता द्रष्टा स्प्रष्टा श्रोता च पञ्चमः । मन्ता बोद्धा च सप्तैते विज्ञेयाः कर्तृहेतवः ॥
स्वगुणं भक्षयन्त्येते गुणवन्तः शुभाशुभम् । अहं च निर्गुणोऽत्रेति सप्तैते मोक्षहेतवः ॥
विदुषां बुध्यमानानां स्वं स्वं स्थानं यथाविधि । गुणास्ते देवताभूताः सततं भुञ्जते हविः ॥
data.md: As regards the soul, that is destitute of qualities. These seven are the causes of Liberation. With them who are learned and gifted with sufficient understanding, the qualities, which are in the position of celestials, eat the oblations, each in its proper place, and according to what has been ordained. The person who is shorn of learning, eating various kinds of food, becomes seized with the sense of egoism.

data.v: अदन्ह्यविद्वानन्नानि ममत्वेनोपपद्यते । आत्मार्थं पाचयन्नित्यं ममत्वेनोपहन्यते ॥
अभक्ष्यभक्षणं चैव मद्यपानं च हन्ति तम् । स चान्नं हन्ति तच्चान्नं स हत्वा हन्यते बुधः ॥
अत्ता ह्यन्नमिदं विद्वान्पुनर्जनयतीश्वरः । स चान्नाज्जायते तस्मिन्सूक्ष्मो नाम व्यतिक्रमः ॥
मनसा गम्यते यच्च यच्च वाचा निरुद्यते । श्रोत्रेण श्रूयते यच्च चक्षुषा यच्च दृश्यते ॥
स्पर्शेन स्पृश्यते यच्च घ्राणेन घ्रायते च यत् । मनःषष्ठानि संयम्य हवींष्येतानि सर्वशः ॥
गुणवत्पावको मह्यं दीप्यते हव्यवाहनः । योगयज्ञः प्रवृत्तो मे ज्ञानब्रह्ममनोद्भवः । प्राणस्तोत्रोऽपानशस्त्रः सर्वत्यागसुदक्षिणः ॥
data.md: The sacrifices formed by Yoga is going on as regards myself. The spring whence that sacrifice proceeds is that which gives the fire of knowledge. The upward vital air Prana is the Stotra of that sacrifice. The downward vital air Apana is its Shastra. The renunciation of everything is the excellent present of that sacrifice.

data.v: कर्मानुमन्ता ब्रह्मा मे कर्ताध्वर्युः कृतस्तुतिः । कृतप्रशास्ता तच्छास्त्रमपवर्गोऽस्य दक्षिणा ॥
data.md: Consciousness, Mind, and Understanding, which are all Brahma, are its Hotri, Adhvaryu, and Udgatri. The Prashastri, his Shastra, is truth. Cessation of separate existence (or Emancipation) is the Honorarium.

data.v: ऋचश्चाप्यत्र शंसन्ति नारायणविदो जनाः । नारायणाय देवाय यदबध्नन्पशून्पुरा ॥
data.md: People conversant with Narayana, recite some Richs on this subject. Formerly animals were offered to the divine Narayana.

data.v: तत्र सामानि गायन्ति तानि चाहुर्निदर्शनम् । देवं नारायणं भीरु सर्वात्मानं निबोध मे ॥
data.md: Then are sung some Samans. There is an authority on this subject. O timid one, know that the divine Narayana is the Soul of all.

data.v: एकः शास्ता न द्वितीयोऽस्ति शास्ता; यथा नियुक्तोऽस्मि तथा चरामि । हृद्येष तिष्ठन्पुरुषः शास्ति शास्ता; तेनैव युक्तः प्रवणादिवोदकम् ॥
एको गुरुर्नास्ति ततो द्वितीयो; यो हृच्छयस्तमहमनुब्रवीमि । तेनानुशिष्टा गुरुणा सदैव; पराभूता दानवाः सर्व एव ॥
data.md: There is one Preceptor. There is no second but him. He lives in the heart, and of him I shall now speak. Instructed by that preceptor, all snakes in the world are always possessed of feelings of enimity.

data.v: एको बन्धुर्नास्ति ततो द्वितीयो; यो हृच्छयस्तमहमनुब्रवीमि । तेनानुशिष्टा बान्धवा बन्धुमन्तः; सप्तर्षयः सप्त दिवि प्रभान्ति ॥
data.md: There is one Preceptor. There is no second but him. He lives in the heart, and of him I shall now speak. Instructed by that preceptor, all snakes in the world are always possessed of feelings of enimity.

data.v: एकः श्रोता नास्ति ततो द्वितीयो; यो हृच्छयस्तमहमनुब्रवीमि । तस्मिन्गुरौ गुरुवासं निरुष्य; शक्रो गतः सर्वलोकामरत्वम् ॥
data.md: There is one dispeller. There is no second but him. He lives in the heart. Of him I shall now speak. Having lived with that instructor, under the proper mode of living with an instructor, Shakra gained the sovereignty of all the worlds.

data.v: एको द्वेष्टा नास्ति ततो द्वितीयो; यो हृच्छयस्तमहमनुब्रवीमि । तेनानुशिष्टा गुरुणा सदैव; लोकद्विष्टाः पन्नगाः सर्व एव ॥
data.md: There is one Preceptor. There is no second but him. He lives in the heart, and of him I shall now speak. Instructed by that preceptor, all snakes in the world are always possessed of feelings of enimity.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । प्रजापतौ पन्नगानां देवर्षीणां च संविदम् ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited, O beautiful lady, this ancient discourse between the senses and the mind. never

data.v: देवर्षयश्च नागाश्च असुराश्च प्रजापतिम् । पर्यपृच्छन्नुपासीनाः श्रेयो नः प्रोच्यतामिति ॥
data.md: The celestials and the Rishis, the snakes and the Asuras, seated around the Lord of all creatures, asked him, saying, Let that which is highly beneficial for us be said. To them who enquired about what is highly beneficial, the holy one uttered only the word Om, which is Brahma is one syllable. Hearing this, they ran away in various directions.

data.v: तेषां प्रोवाच भगवाञ्श्रेयः समनुपृच्छताम् । ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म ते श्रुत्वा प्राद्रवन्दिशः ॥
data.md: The celestials and the Rishis, the snakes and the Asuras, seated around the Lord of all creatures, asked him, saying, Let that which is highly beneficial for us be said. To them who enquired about what is highly beneficial, the holy one uttered only the word Om, which is Brahma is one syllable. Hearing this, they ran away in various directions.

data.v: तेषां प्राद्रवमाणानामुपदेशार्थमात्मनः । सर्पाणां दशने भावः प्रवृत्तः पूर्वमेव तु ॥
data.md: Amongst them that thus ran in all directions from desire of sclf-instruction, the tendency for biting first arose in snakes.

data.v: असुराणां प्रवृत्तस्तु दम्भभावः स्वभावजः । दानं देवा व्यवसिता दममेव महर्षयः ॥
data.md: The tendency for ostentatious pride first arose in the Asuras. The celestials betook themselves to gifts, and the great Rishis to selfcontrol.

data.v: एकं शास्तारमासाद्य शब्देनैकेन संस्कृताः । नाना व्यवसिताः सर्वे सर्पदेवर्षिदानवाः ॥
data.md: Having gone to one tcacher, and having been instructed (refined) by one word, the snakes, the celestials, the Rishis, and the Danavas, all betook themselves to various different dispositions.

data.v: शृणोत्ययं प्रोच्यमानं गृह्णाति च यथातथम् । पृच्छतस्तावतो भूयो गुरुरन्योऽनुमन्यते ॥
data.md: It is that one who hears himself when speaking, and understands it duly. Once, again, is that heard from him when he speaks. There is no second preceptor.

data.v: तस्य चानुमते कर्म ततः पश्चात्प्रवर्तते । गुरुर्बोद्धा च शत्रुश्च द्वेष्टा च हृदि संश्रितः ॥
data.md: It is in obedience to his advice that action afterwards originates. The instructor, the apprehender, the hearer, and the enemy, are placed within the heart,

data.v: पापेन विचरँल्लोके पापचारी भवत्ययम् । शुभेन विचरँल्लोके शुभचारी भवत्युत ॥
data.md: By acting sinfully in the world, it is he who becomes a person of sinful deeds. By acting auspiciously in the world, in is he who becomes a person of auspicious deeds.

data.v: कामचारी तु कामेन य इन्द्रियसुखे रतः । व्रतवारी सदैवैष य इन्द्रियजये रतः ॥
data.md: It is he who becomes a person of controlled conduct by becoming addicted to the pleasures of sense, moved by desire. It is he who becomes a Brahmacharin by always devoting himself to the control of his senses.

data.v: अपेतव्रतकर्मा तु केवलं ब्रह्मणि श्रितः । ब्रह्मभूतश्चरँल्लोके ब्रह्मचारी भवत्ययम् ॥
data.md: It is he, again, who castes off vows and actions and takes refuge on Brahma alone. By moving in the world, identifying himself the while with Brahima, he becomes a Brahmacharin.

data.v: ब्रह्मैव समिधस्तस्य ब्रह्माग्निर्ब्रह्मसंस्तरः । आपो ब्रह्म गुरुर्ब्रह्म स ब्रह्मणि समाहितः ॥
data.md: Brahma is his fuel; Brahma is his fire; Brahma is his origin; Brahma is his water; Brahma is his preceptor; he is immerged in Brahma.

data.v: एतदेतादृशं सूक्ष्मं ब्रह्मचर्यं विदुर्बुधाः । विदित्वा चान्वपद्यन्त क्षेत्रज्ञेनानुदर्शिनः ॥
data.md: Brahmacharya is so subtle, understood by the wise. Having understood it, they followed it, instructed by the Kshetrajna. even as

data.v: संकल्पदंशमशकं शोकहर्षहिमातपम् । मोहान्धकारतिमिरं लोभव्यालसरीसृपम् ॥
विषयैकात्ययाध्वानं कामक्रोधविरोधकम् । तदतीत्य महादुर्गं प्रविष्टोऽस्मि महद्वनम् ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said Having crossed that impassable fortress (of the world) which has purposes for its gadflies and mosquitoes, grief and joy for its cold and heat, heedlessness for its blinding darkness, cupidity and diseases for its reptiles, wealth for its own danger on the road, and lust and anger its robbers. I have entered the extensive forest (of Brahma).

data.v: क्व तद्वनं महाप्राज्ञ के वृक्षाः सरितश्च काः । गिरयः पर्वताश्चैव कियत्यध्वनि तद्वनम् ॥
data.md: The wife of the Brahmana said Where is that foremost, O you of great wisdom? What are its trces? What are its rivers? What its mountains and hills? How far is that forest?

data.v: न तदस्ति पृथग्भावे किंचिदन्यत्ततः समम् । न तदस्त्यपृथग्भावे किंचिद्दूरतरं ततः ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said There exists nothing that is separate from it. There is nothing more delightful than it. There is nothing that is un-separated from it. There is nothing more afflicting than it.

data.v: तस्माद्ध्रस्वतरं नास्ति न ततोऽस्ति बृहत्तरम् । नास्ति तस्माद्दुःखतरं नास्त्यन्यत्तत्समं सुखम् ॥
data.md: There is nothing smaller than that. There is nothing huger than that. There is nothing minuter than that. There is no happiness that can resemble it.

data.v: न तत्प्रविश्य शोचन्ति न प्रहृष्यन्ति च द्विजाः । न च बिभ्यति केषांचित्तेभ्यो बिभ्यति के च न ॥
data.md: Twice-born persons. entering into it, at once get over both joy and sorrow. They (then) never stand in fear of any creature, nor does any creature stand in fear of them.

data.v: तस्मिन्वने सप्त महाद्रुमाश्च; फलानि सप्तातिथयश्च सप्त । सप्ताश्रमाः सप्त समाधयश्च; दीक्षाश्च सप्तैतदरण्यरूपम् ॥
data.md: In that forest are seven large trees, seven fruits, and seven guests. There are seven hermitages, (forms of) Yoga concentration, and seven (forms) of initiation. This is a description of that forest.

data.v: पञ्चवर्णानि दिव्यानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च । सृजन्तः पादपास्तत्र व्याप्य तिष्ठन्ति तद्वनम् ॥
data.md: The trees which stand filling that forest yield excellent flowers and fruits of five colours. seven

data.v: सुवर्णानि द्विवर्णानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च । सृजन्तः पादपास्तत्र व्याप्य तिष्ठन्ति तद्वनम् ॥
data.md: The trees which stand filling that forest yield excellent flowers and fruits of five colours. seven

data.v: चतुर्वर्णानि दिव्यानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च । सृजन्तः पादपास्तत्र व्याप्य तिष्ठन्ति तद्वनम् ॥
data.md: The trees which stand filling that forest yield excellent flowers and fruits of five colours. seven

data.v: शंकराणि त्रिवर्णानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च । सृजन्तः पादपास्तत्र व्याप्य तिष्ठन्ति तद्वनम् ॥
data.md: The trees which stand filling that forest yield excellent flowers and fruits of five colours. seven

data.v: सुरभीण्येकवर्णानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च । सृजन्तः पादपास्तत्र व्याप्य तिष्ठन्ति तद्वनम् ॥
data.md: The trees which stand filling that forest yield excellent flowers and fruits of five colours. seven

data.v: बहून्यव्यक्तवर्णानि पुष्पाणि च फलानि च । विसृजन्तौ महावृक्षौ तद्वनं व्याप्य तिष्ठतः ॥
data.md: The trees which stand there filling that forest, yield flowers and fruits of two colours.

data.v: एको ह्यग्निः सुमना ब्राह्मणोऽत्र; पञ्चेन्द्रियाणि समिधश्चात्र सन्ति । तेभ्यो मोक्षाः सप्त भवन्ति दीक्षा; गुणाः फलान्यतिथयः फलाशाः ॥
data.md: There is one fire here, possessed of a good mind. That is connected with Brahmana. The five senses are the fuel here. The seven forms of Libcration originating from them are the seven forms of Initiation. The qualities are the fruits, and the guests eat those fruits.

data.v: आतिथ्यं प्रतिगृह्णन्ति तत्र सप्त महर्षयः । अर्चितेषु प्रलीनेषु तेष्वन्यद्रोचते वनम् ॥
data.md: There, in various places, the great Rishis accept hospitality. When they, having been adored become annihilated, then another forest shines forth.

data.v: प्रतिज्ञावृक्षमफलं शान्तिच्छायासमन्वितम् । ज्ञानाश्रयं तृप्तितोयमन्तःक्षेत्रज्ञभास्करम् ॥
data.md: In that forest, Intelligence is the tree; Liberation is the fruit. Tranquillity is the shade of which it is possessed. It has knowledge for its resting house, contentment for its water, and the Kshetrajna for its sun.

data.v: येऽधिगच्छन्ति तत्सन्तस्तेषां नास्ति भयं पुनः । ऊर्ध्वं चावाक्च तिर्यक्च तस्य नान्तोऽधिगम्यते ॥
