data.md: Its end cannot be determined upwards, downwards, or horizontally.

data.v: सप्त स्त्रियस्तत्र वसन्ति सद्यो; अवाङ्मुखा भानुमत्यो जनित्र्यः । ऊर्ध्वं रसानां ददते प्रजाभ्यः; सर्वान्यथा सर्वमनित्यतां च ॥
data.md: Seven females always live there, with faces downwards, endued with effulgence, and the cause of generation. They take up all the different tastes from all creatures, cven as inconstancy sucks up truth.

data.v: तत्रैव प्रतितिष्ठन्ति पुनस्तत्रोदयन्ति च । सप्त सप्तर्षयः सिद्धा वसिष्ठप्रमुखाः सह ॥
data.md: In that itself live, and from that emerge, the seven Rishis who are crowned with ascetic success, having Vasishtha for their foremost.

data.v: यशो वर्चो भगश्चैव विजयः सिद्धितेजसी । एवमेवानुवर्तन्ते सप्त ज्योतींषि भास्करम् ॥
data.md: Glory, effulgence, greatness, enlightenment; victory, perfection, and energy, these seven always follow this same like rays following the sun.

data.v: गिरयः पर्वताश्चैव सन्ति तत्र समासतः । नद्यश्च सरितो वारि वहन्त्यो ब्रह्मसंभवम् ॥
data.md: Hills and mountains also exist there, in a body; and rivers and steams carrying waters in their course, waters that are born of Brahma.

data.v: नदीनां संगमस्तत्र वैतानः समुपह्वरे । स्वात्मतृप्ता यतो यान्ति साक्षाद्दान्ताः पितामहम् ॥
data.md: And there is a confluence also of rivers in the secluded spot for sacrifice. Thence those who are contented with their own souls proceed to the Grandfather.

data.v: कृशाशाः सुव्रताशाश्च तपसा दग्धकिल्बिषाः । आत्मन्यात्मानमावेश्य ब्रह्माणं समुपासते ॥
data.md: They whose wishes have been reduced, whose wishes have been directed to excellent vows, and whose sins have been consumed by penances, merging themselves in their souls, succeed in attain to Brahma.

data.v: ऋचमप्यत्र शंसन्ति विद्यारण्यविदो जनाः । तदरण्यमभिप्रेत्य यथाधीरमजायत ॥
data.md: Tranquillity is lauded by those who are conversant with the forest of knowledge. Keeping that forest in view, they take birth so as not to lose courage.

data.v: एतदेतादृशं दिव्यमरण्यं ब्राह्मणा विदुः । विदित्वा चान्वतिष्ठन्त क्षेत्रज्ञेनानुदर्शितम् ॥
data.md: Brahmacharya is so subtle, understood by the wise. Having understood it, they followed it, instructed by the Kshetrajna. even as

data.v: गन्धान्न जिघ्रामि रसान्न वेद्मि; रूपं न पश्यामि न च स्पृशामि । न चापि शब्दान्विविधाञ्शृणोमि; न चापि संकल्पमुपैमि किंचित् ॥
data.md: I do not smell scents. I do not get tastes. I do not see colours. I do not likewise hear the various sounds Nor do I entertain purposes of any kind.

data.v: अर्थानिष्टान्कामयते स्वभावः; सर्वान्द्वेष्यान्प्रद्विषते स्वभावः । कामद्वेषावुद्भवतः स्वभावा;त्प्राणापानौ जन्तुदेहान्निवेश्य ॥
data.md: It is Nature which desires such objects as are liked; it is Nature which hates such objects as are disliked. Desire and hatred originate from Nature, like the upward and the downward vital airs when should have entered animate bodies.

data.v: तेभ्यश्चान्यांस्तेष्वनित्यांश्च भावा;न्भूतात्मानं लक्षयेयं शरीरे । तस्मिंस्तिष्ठन्नास्मि शक्यः कथंचि;त्कामक्रोधाभ्यां जरया मृत्युना च ॥
data.md: Separated from them are others; in them are eternal dispositions; Yogins would see in the body, the soul of all creatures. Living in that, I am never attached to anything through desire and anger, and decrepitude and death.

data.v: अकामयानस्य च सर्वकामा;नविद्विषाणस्य च सर्वदोषान् । न मे स्वभावेषु भवन्ति लेपा;स्तोयस्य बिन्दोरिव पुष्करेषु ॥
data.md: Not having any desire for any object of desire, and not having any hatred for any evil, there is not taint on my natures, as there is not taint of a drop of water on the lotus.

data.v: नित्यस्य चैतस्य भवन्ति नित्या; निरीक्षमाणस्य बहून्स्वभावान् । न सज्जते कर्मसु भोगजालं; दिवीव सूर्यस्य मयूखजालम् ॥
data.md: Of this fixed (principle) which looks upon various natures, they are fickle possessions. Though actions are performed, yet the collection of enjoyments does not attach itself to them, as the collection of rays of the sun does not attach to the sky. Regarding it is recited an ancient discourse between an Adhvarya and a Yati. Do you hear it, O glorious lady.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । अध्वर्युयतिसंवादं तं निबोध यशस्विनि ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited, O beautiful lady, this ancient discourse between the senses and the mind. never

data.v: प्रोक्ष्यमाणं पशुं दृष्ट्वा यज्ञकर्मण्यथाब्रवीत् । यतिरध्वर्युमासीनो हिंसेयमिति कुत्सयन् ॥
data.md: Seeing an animal sprinkled with water at a sacrifice, a Yati said to the Adhvaryu sealed there these word sin censure, This is destruction of life.

data.v: तमध्वर्युः प्रत्युवाच नायं छागो विनश्यति । श्रेयसा योक्ष्यते जन्तुर्यदि श्रुतिरियं तथा ॥
data.md: To him the Adhvaryu replied. This goat will not be destroyed. The animal meets with great good, if the Vedic declaration on this subject be true.

data.v: अन्यान्बाणान्समीक्षस्व यैस्त्वं मां सूदयिष्यसि । तच्छ्रुत्वा स विचिन्त्याथ ततो वचनमब्रवीत् ॥

data.v: ततोऽलर्कस्तपो घोरमास्थायाथ सुदुष्करम् । नाध्यगच्छत्परं शक्त्या बाणमेतेषु सप्तसु । सुसमाहितचेतास्तु ततोऽचिन्तयत प्रभुः ॥
स विचिन्त्य चिरं कालमलर्को द्विजसत्तम । नाध्यगच्छत्परं श्रेयो योगान्मतिमतां वरः ॥
data.md: Gifted with power, he then, with mind well concentrated, began to reflect. Then, O best of twice-born ones, Alarka, that foremost of intelligent men, having thought for a long time, could not obtain anything better than Yoga. Setting his mind on one object he remained perfectly still, engaged in Yoga.

data.v: स एकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा निश्चलो योगमास्थितः । इन्द्रियाणि जघानाशु बाणेनैकेन वीर्यवान् । योगेनात्मानमाविश्य संसिद्धिं परमां ययौ ॥
data.md: Gifted with energy, he speedily killed all the senses with one arrow, having entered by Yoga into his soul and thereby acquired the highest success.

data.v: विस्मितश्चापि राजर्षिरिमां गाथां जगाद ह । अहो कष्टं यदस्माभिः पूर्वं राज्यमनुष्ठितम् । इति पश्चान्मया ज्ञातं योगान्नास्ति परं सुखम् ॥
data.md: Stricken with wonder, that royal sage then sang this verse : Alas it is a pity that we should have performed all acts that are external.

data.v: इति त्वमपि जानीहि राम मा क्षत्रियाञ्जहि । तपो घोरमुपातिष्ठ ततः श्रेयोऽभिपत्स्यसे ॥
data.md: Do you know this, O Rama! Cease, to kill the Kshatriyas! Do you practise the austerest of penances! You will then attain to what is good.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तपो घोरं जामदग्न्यः पितामहैः । आस्थितः सुमहाभागो ययौ सिद्धिं च दुर्गमाम् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by his grandfathers, Jamadagni's son performed the austcrest penances, and having practised then, that highly blessed one acquired that success which is difficult to recall.

data.v: त्रयो वै रिपवो लोके नव वै गुणतः स्मृताः । हर्षः स्तम्भोऽभिमानश्च त्रयस्ते सात्त्विका गुणाः ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said There are three enemies in the world. They are said to be minefield, according to their qualities. Exultation, satisfaction, and joy, these three qualities belong to Goodness.

data.v: शोकः क्रोधोऽतिसंरम्भो राजसास्ते गुणाः स्मृताः । स्वप्नस्तन्द्री च मोहश्च त्रयस्ते तामसा गुणाः ॥
data.md: Cupidity, anger and hatred, these three qualitics said to belong Darkness. Lassitude, procrastination and delusion, these three qualities belong to Ignorance.

data.v: एतान्निकृत्य धृतिमान्बाणसंघैरतन्द्रितः । जेतुं परानुत्सहते प्रशान्तात्मा जितेन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: Cutting these with showers of arrows, the intelligent man, free from idleness possessed of a tranquil soul, and with his senses under control, ventures to defeat others.

data.v: अत्र गाथाः कीर्तयन्ति पुराकल्पविदो जनाः । अम्बरीषेण या गीता राज्ञा राज्यं प्रशासता ॥
data.md: About it, persons conversant with ancient cycles recite some verses which were sung formerly by king Ambarisha who had acquired a tranquil soul.

data.v: समुदीर्णेषु दोषेषु वध्यमानेषु साधुषु । जग्राह तरसा राज्यमम्बरीष इति श्रुतिः ॥
data.md: When various kinds of faults were reigning supreme and when the righteous were afflicted, the illustrious Ambarisha put forth his strength for assuming sovereignty.

data.v: स निगृह्य महादोषान्साधून्समभिपूज्य च । जगाम महतीं सिद्धिं गाथां चेमां जगाद ह ॥
data.md: Subduing his own faults and adoring the righteous, he acquired great success and sang these verses.

data.v: भूयिष्ठं मे जिता दोषा निहताः सर्वशत्रवः । एको दोषोऽवशिष्टस्तु वध्यः स न हतो मया ॥
data.md: I have controlled many faults. I have slain all enemies. But there is one, the greatest, vice which deserves to be destroyed but which has not been destroyed be me.

data.v: येन युक्तो जन्तुरयं वैतृष्ण्यं नाधिगच्छति । तृष्णार्त इव निम्नानि धावमानो न बुध्यते ॥
data.md: Urged by that fault, this individual soul fails to attain to freedom from desire. Possessed by desire, one runs into ditches without knowing it.

data.v: अकार्यमपि येनेह प्रयुक्तः सेवते नरः । तं लोभमसिभिस्तीक्ष्णैर्निकृन्तन्तं निकृन्तत ॥
data.md: Urged by that fault, one induigcs in forbidden deeds. Do you cut off, cut off, that cupidity with sharp-edged swords.

data.v: लोभाद्धि जायते तृष्णा ततश्चिन्ता प्रसज्यते । स लिप्समानो लभते भूयिष्ठं राजसान्गुणान् ॥
data.md: From cupidity originates desire. From desire originates anxiety. The man who yields to desire acquires many qualities which bclong 10 Darkness,

data.v: स तैर्गुणैः संहतदेहबन्धनः; पुनः पुनर्जायति कर्म चेहते । जन्मक्षये भिन्नविकीर्णदेहः; पुनर्मृत्युं गच्छति जन्मनि स्वे ॥
data.md: When these have been acquired, he gets many qualities which belong to ignorance. On account of the qualities, he repeatedly takes birth, with the fetters of body united, and is moved to action. Upon the expiration of life, with body becoming separated and scattered, he once mects with death which is due to birth itself.

data.v: तस्मादेनं सम्यगवेक्ष्य लोभं; निगृह्य धृत्यात्मनि राज्यमिच्छेत् । एतद्राज्यं नान्यदस्तीति विद्या;द्यस्त्वत्र राजा विजितो ममैकः ॥
data.md: Hence, duly understanding this, and governing cupidity by intelligence, one should desire for sovereignty in his soul. This is (true) sovereignty. There is no other sovereignty here. The soul properly understood, is the king.

data.v: इति राज्ञाम्बरीषेण गाथा गीता यशस्विना । आधिराज्यं पुरस्कृत्य लोभमेकं निकृन्तता ॥
data.md: Even these were thc verses sung by the illustrious king Ambarisha, on the subject of sovereignty which he kept before him, that king who had severed the one foremost fault, viz.. cupidity.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । ब्राह्मणस्य च संवादं जनकस्य च भामिनि ॥
data.md: Regarding it is cited, O beautiful lady, this ancient discourse between the senses and the mind. never

data.v: ब्राह्मणं जनको राजा सन्नं कस्मिंश्चिदागमे । विषये मे न वस्तव्यमिति शिष्ट्यर्थमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: King Janaka (on a certain occasion), desirous of punishing him said to a Brahmana who had become guilty of some offence, You shall not live within my dominions.

data.v: इत्युक्तः प्रत्युवाचाथ ब्राह्मणो राजसत्तमम् । आचक्ष्व विषयं राजन्यावांस्तव वशे स्थितः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, the Brahmana replied to that best of kings, saying. Tell me, O king, what the limits are of the territories subject to you.

data.v: सोऽन्यस्य विषये राज्ञो वस्तुमिच्छाम्यहं विभो । वचस्ते कर्तुमिच्छामि यथाशास्त्रं महीपते ॥
data.md: I wish, O lord, to live within the dominions of another king. Indeed, I wish to obey your command, O king, according to the scriptures.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तदा राजा ब्राह्मणेन यशस्विना । मुहुरुष्णं च निःश्वस्य न स तं प्रत्यभाषत ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by that celebrated Brahmana, the king, hearing repeated and hou sighs, said not a word in reply.

data.v: तमासीनं ध्यायमानं राजानममितौजसम् । कश्मलं सहसागच्छद्भानुमन्तमिव ग्रहः ॥
data.md: Like the planet (Rahu) possessing the Sun, a cloudedness of understanding suddenly overwhelmed that king of incomparable energy as he sat plunged in thought.

data.v: समाश्वास्य ततो राजा व्यपेते कश्मले तदा । ततो मुहूर्तादिव तं ब्राह्मणं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: When that cloudedness of understanding departed and the king became comforted, he spoke after a short time these words to that Brahmana.

data.v: पितृपैतामहे राज्ये वश्ये जनपदे सति । विषयं नाधिगच्छामि विचिन्वन्पृथिवीमिमाम् ॥
data.md: Although a (large) inhabited dominion is subject 10 me within this ancestral kingdom of mine, yield fail to find my dominion, searching through the whole Earth.

data.v: नाध्यगच्छं यदा पृथ्व्यां मिथिला मार्गिता मया । नाध्यगच्छं यदा तस्यां स्वप्रजा मार्गिता मया ॥
नाध्यगच्छं यदा तासु तदा मे कश्मलोऽभवत् । ततो मे कश्मलस्यान्ते मतिः पुनरुपस्थिता ॥
data.md: When I could not find it even there, a cloudedness of understanding came over me. After that cloudedness of understanding departed, intelligence came back to me.

data.v: तया न विषयं मन्ये सर्वो वा विषयो मम । आत्मापि चायं न मम सर्वा वा पृथिवी मम । उष्यतां यावदुत्साहो भुज्यतां यावदिष्यते ॥
data.md: Then I though that I have no dominion, or that everything is my dominion. This body is not mine, or the whole Earth is minc.

data.v: पितृपैतामहे राज्ये वश्ये जनपदे सति । ब्रूहि कां बुद्धिमास्थाय ममत्वं वर्जितं त्वया ॥
data.md: When there is a large inhabited tract in your ancestral kingdom, tell me, depending upon what understanding, has the idea of mineness been got rid of by you.

data.v: कां वा बुद्धिं विनिश्चित्य सर्वो वै विषयस्तव । नावैषि विषयं येन सर्वो वा विषयस्तव ॥
data.md: What also is that understanding depending upon which you have come to the conclusion that everything forms your dominion? What. indeed, is the notion through which you have no dominion, or everything is your dominion?

data.v: अन्तवन्त इहारम्भा विदिताः सर्वकर्मसु । नाध्यगच्छमहं यस्मान्ममेदमिति यद्भवेत् ॥
data.md: Janaka said All conditions here, in all affairs, I understand, are liable to come to an end. Hence, I could not find that which should be called mine.

data.v: कस्येदमिति कस्य स्वमिति वेदवचस्तथा । नाध्यगच्छमहं बुद्ध्या ममेदमिति यद्भवेत् ॥
data.md: (Considering) whose is this, I thought of the Vedic text about anybody's property. I could not therefore, find, through my understanding, what should be (called) mine.

data.v: एतां बुद्धिं विनिश्चित्य ममत्वं वर्जितं मया । शृणु बुद्धिं तु यां ज्ञात्वा सर्वत्र विषयो मम ॥
data.md: Depending upon this notion. I got rid of the idea of mineness. Hear now what that notion is depending upon which I arrived at the conclusion that I have dominion everywhere.

data.v: नाहमात्मार्थमिच्छामि गन्धान्घ्राणगतानपि । तस्मान्मे निर्जिता भूमिर्वशे तिष्ठति नित्यदा ॥
data.md: I do not wish for my own self those smells which are even in my nose. Therefore, the earth, subjugated by me, is always under me.

data.v: नाहमात्मार्थमिच्छामि रसानास्येऽपि वर्ततः । आपो मे निर्जितास्तस्माद्वशे तिष्ठन्ति नित्यदा ॥
data.md: I do not wish for my own self those smells which are even in my nose. Therefore, the earth, subjugated by me, is always under me.

data.v: नाहमात्मार्थमिच्छामि रूपं ज्योतिश्च चक्षुषा । तस्मान्मे निर्जितं ज्योतिर्वशे तिष्ठति नित्यदा ॥
data.md: I do not wish for my own self those smells which are even in my nose. Therefore, the earth, subjugated by me, is always under me.

data.v: नाहमात्मार्थमिच्छामि स्पर्शांस्त्वचि गताश्च ये । तस्मान्मे निर्जितो वायुर्वशे तिष्ठति नित्यदा ॥
data.md: I do not wish for my own self those smells which are even in my nose. Therefore, the earth, subjugated by me, is always under me.

data.v: नाहमात्मार्थमिच्छामि शब्दाञ्श्रोत्रगतानपि । तस्मान्मे निर्जिताः शब्दा वशे तिष्ठन्ति नित्यदा ॥
data.md: I do not wish for my own self those smells which are even in my nose. Therefore, the earth, subjugated by me, is always under me.

data.v: नाहमात्मार्थमिच्छामि मनो नित्यं मनोन्तरे । मनो मे निर्जितं तस्माद्वशे तिष्ठति नित्यदा ॥
data.md: I do not wish for my own self those smells which are even in my nose. Therefore, the earth, subjugated by me, is always under me.

data.v: देवेभ्यश्च पितृभ्यश्च भूतेभ्योऽतिथिभिः सह । इत्यर्थं सर्व एवेमे समारम्भा भवन्ति वै ॥
data.md: All these acts of mine are for the sake of the celestials, the departed manes, the Bhuttas, together with guests.

data.v: ततः प्रहस्य जनकं ब्राह्मणः पुनरब्रवीत् । त्वज्जिज्ञासार्थमद्येह विद्धि मां धर्ममागतम् ॥
data.md: The Brahmana then, smiling, once more said to Janaka, Know that I am Dharma, who come here today for examining you.

data.v: त्वमस्य ब्रह्मनाभस्य बुद्ध्यारस्यानिवर्तिनः । सत्त्वनेमिनिरुद्धस्य चक्रस्यैकः प्रवर्तकः ॥
data.md: You are indeed the one person for setting this wheel in motion, this wheel that has the quality of Goodness for its circumference, Brahma for its nave, and the understanding for its spokes, and which never turns back!

data.v: नाहं तथा भीरु चरामि लोके; तथा त्वं मां तर्कयसे स्वबुद्ध्या । विप्रोऽस्मि मुक्तोऽस्मि वनेचरोऽस्मि; गृहस्थधर्मा ब्रह्मचारी तथास्मि ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said I do not, O timid one, move in this world in the manner which you, according to your own understanding, censure. I am a Brahmana endued with Vedic knowledge. I am liberated. I am a hermit, I follow the duties of a houscholder. I observe vows.

data.v: नाहमस्मि यथा मां त्वं पश्यसे चक्षुषा शुभे । मया व्याप्तमिदं सर्वं यत्किंचिज्जगतीगतम् ॥
data.md: I am not what you see me in good and bad deeds. I pervaded everything that exists in this universe.

data.v: ये केचिज्जन्तवो लोके जङ्गमाः स्थावराश्च ह । तेषां मामन्तकं विद्धि दारूणामिव पावकम् ॥
data.md: I am the destroyer of all crcatures that exist in the world, mobile or immobile, as fire destroys all kinds of wood.

data.v: राज्यं पृथिव्यां सर्वस्यामथ वापि त्रिविष्टपे । तथा बुद्धिरियं वेत्ति बुद्धिरेव धनं मम ॥
data.md: Sovereignty over the whole Earth or over the Heaven can be compared with this knowledge of my oneness with the universe). This knowledge is my wcalth.

data.v: एकः पन्था ब्राह्मणानां येन गच्छन्ति तद्विदः । गृहेषु वनवासेषु गुरुवासेषु भिक्षुषु । लिङ्गैर्बहुभिरव्यग्रैरेका बुद्धिरुपास्यते ॥
data.md: This is the one path for Brahmanas by which they who understand it proceed domesticity, or abodes in the forest, or residence with preceptors, among mendicants.

data.v: नानालिङ्गाश्रमस्थानां येषां बुद्धिः शमात्मिका । ते भावमेकमायान्ति सरितः सागरं यथा ॥
data.md: With numerous unconfused symbols, only one knowledge is adored. Those who, whatever the symbols and modes of life which they follow, have acquired an understanding having tranquillity for its essence, attain to that one entity as numerous rivers all mecting the Ocean.

data.v: बुद्ध्यायं गम्यते मार्गः शरीरेण न गम्यते । आद्यन्तवन्ति कर्माणि शरीरं कर्मबन्धनम् ॥
data.md: This path can be trodden with the help of the understanding and not of the body. Actions have both beginning and end, and the body has actions for its fetters.

data.v: तस्मात्ते सुभगे नास्ति परलोककृतं भयम् । मद्भावभावनिरता ममैवात्मानमेष्यसि ॥
data.md: Hence, O blessed lady, you need have no fear about the world to come. With your heart intent upon the real object, it is my soul into which you will come!

data.v: नेदमल्पात्मना शक्यं वेदितुं नाकृतात्मना । बहु चाल्पं च संक्षिप्तं विप्लुतं च मतं मम ॥
data.md: The Brahmana's wife said This cannot be understood by a weakminded person as also by one whose soul has not been purified. My intelligence is very little, and contracted, and confused.

data.v: उपायं तु मम ब्रूहि येनैषा लभ्यते मतिः । तन्मन्ये कारणतमं यत एषा प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: Tell me the means by which the knowledge may be acquired. I wish to learn from you the source from which this knowledge comes.

data.v: अरणीं ब्राह्मणीं विद्धि गुरुरस्योत्तरारणिः । तपःश्रुतेऽभिमथ्नीतो ज्ञानाग्निर्जायते ततः ॥
data.md: Know that intelligence about Brahma is the lower Arani; the preceptor is the upper Arani; penances and conversance with the scriptures are what make attrition. From this is originated the fire of knowledge.

data.v: यदिदं ब्रह्मणो लिङ्गं क्षेत्रज्ञमिति संज्ञितम् । ग्रहीतुं येन तच्छक्यं लक्षणं तस्य तत्क्व नु ॥
data.md: The Brahmana's wife said About this symbol of Brahma, which is designated, Kshetrajna, where, indeed, is a description of it by which it is capable of being seized?

data.v: अलिङ्गो निर्गुणश्चैव कारणं नास्य विद्यते । उपायमेव वक्ष्यामि येन गृह्येत वा न वा ॥
data.md: The Brahmana said He is without symbols, and without qualities. Nothing exists that may be you the considered as his cause. I shall, however, tell means by which he can be apprehended or not.

data.v: सम्यगप्युपदिष्टश्च भ्रमरैरिव लक्ष्यते । कर्मबुद्धिरबुद्धित्वाज्ज्ञानलिङ्गैरिवाश्रितम् ॥
data.md: A good means may be found; which is perceived as by bees. That means consists of and understanding purified by action. Those whose understanding have not been so purified consider that entity, through their own ignorance, as invested with the properties of knowledge and others.

data.v: इदं कार्यमिदं नेति न मोक्षेषूपदिश्यते । पश्यतः शृण्वतो बुद्धिरात्मनो येषु जायते ॥
data.md: It is not laid down that this should be done, or that this should not be donc, in the rules for acquiring Liberation, those that is, in which a knowledge of the soul originates only in him who sees and hears.

data.v: यावन्त इह शक्येरंस्तावतोंऽशान्प्रकल्पयेत् । व्यक्तानव्यक्तरूपांश्च शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: One should understand as many parts, unmanifest and manifest, by hundreds and thousands, as one is capable of comprehending here.

data.v: सर्वान्नानात्वयुक्तांश्च सर्वान्प्रत्यक्षहेतुकान् । यतः परं न विद्येत ततोऽभ्यासे भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Indeed, one should comprehend various objects of various significancies, and all objects of direct perception. Then will come, from practice, that above which nothing cxists.

data.v: ततस्तु तस्या ब्राह्मण्या मतिः क्षेत्रज्ञसंक्षये । क्षेत्रज्ञादेव परतः क्षेत्रज्ञोऽन्यः प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: The holy one said Then the mind of the Brahmana's wife, upon the destruction of the Kshetrajna, became that which is beyond Kshctrajna, on account of the knowledge of Kshetra.

data.v: क्व नु सा ब्राह्मणी कृष्ण क्व चासौ ब्राह्मणर्षभः । याभ्यां सिद्धिरियं प्राप्ता तावुभौ वद मेऽच्युत ॥
data.md: Arjuna said, Where, indeed, is that Brahmana's wife, O Krishna, and where is that foremost of Brahmanas, by both of whom was such success acquired. Tell me about them, O you of undecaying glory.

data.v: मनो मे ब्राह्मणं विद्धि बुद्धिं मे विद्धि ब्राह्मणीम् । क्षेत्रज्ञ इति यश्चोक्तः सोऽहमेव धनंजय ॥
data.md: My mind is the Brahmana, and that my understanding is the Brahmana's wife. He who has been spoken of as Kshetrajna is I myself, O Dhananjaya.

data.v: ब्रह्म यत्परमं वेद्यं तन्मे व्याख्यातुमर्हसि । भवतो हि प्रसादेन सूक्ष्मे मे रमते मतिः ॥
data.md: Arjuna said You should explain Brahma to me, that which is the highest object of knowledge. Through your favour, my mind is delighted with these subtle disquisition's.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । संवादं मोक्षसंयुक्तं शिष्यस्य गुरुणा सह ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said Regarding it is recited the old discourse between a preceptor and his disciple on the subject of Brahma.

data.v: कश्चिद्ब्राह्मणमासीनमाचार्यं संशितव्रतम् । शिष्यः पप्रच्छ मेधावी किं स्विच्छ्रेयः परंतप ॥
data.md: Once on a time, O destroyer of enemics, an intelligent disciple questioned certain Brahmana of rigid vows who was preceptor, as a he was scated, saying-What, indeed, is the highest good?

data.v: भगवन्तं प्रपन्नोऽहं निःश्रेयसपरायणः । याचे त्वां शिरसा विप्र यद्ब्रूयां तद्विचक्ष्व मे ॥
data.md: Desirous of acquiring that which forms the highest good, I throw myself at your fect, O holy one! O learned Brahmana, I solicit you, bending my head, to explain to me what I ask.

data.v: तमेवंवादिनं पार्थ शिष्यं गुरुरुवाच ह । कथयस्व प्रवक्ष्यामि यत्र ते संशयो द्विज ॥
data.md: To that disciple, O son of Pritha, who said So, the preceptor said, O twice-born one, I shall explain to you everything about which you may have any doubts.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स कुरुश्रेष्ठ गुरुणा गुरुवत्सलः । प्राञ्जलिः परिपप्रच्छ यत्तच्छृणु महामते ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, O foremost one of Kuru's race, by his preceptor, that disciple who was greatly devoted to his preceptor, spoke as follows, with joined hands. Do you hear what he said, O you of great intelligence.

data.v: कुतश्चाहं कुतश्च त्वं तत्सत्यं ब्रूहि यत्परम् । कुतो जातानि भूतानि स्थावराणि चराणि च ॥
data.md: Whence aim I? Whence are you? Explain that which is the highest truth. From what source have originated all creatures mobile and immobile?

data.v: केन जीवन्ति भूतानि तेषामायुः किमात्मकम् । किं सत्यं किं तपो विप्र के गुणाः सद्भिरीरिताः । के पन्थानः शिवाः सन्ति किं सुखं किं च दुष्कृतम् ॥
data.md: By what do creatures live? What is the limit of their life? What is truth? What is penance, O learned Brahmana? What are called qualities by the good?

data.v: एतान्मे भगवन्प्रश्नान्याथातथ्येन सत्तम । वक्तुमर्हसि विप्रर्षे यथावदिह तत्त्वतः ॥
तस्मै संप्रतिपन्नाय यथावत्परिपृच्छते । शिष्याय गुणयुक्ताय शान्ताय गुरुवर्तिने । छायाभूताय दान्ताय यतये ब्रह्मचारिणे ॥
तान्प्रश्नानब्रवीत्पार्थ मेधावी स धृतव्रतः । गुरुः कुरुकुलश्रेष्ठ सम्यक्सर्वानरिंदम ॥
ब्रह्मप्रोक्तमिदं धर्ममृषिप्रवरसेवितम् । वेदविद्यासमावाप्यं तत्त्वभूतार्थभावनम् ॥
data.md: All this was declared by Brahman himself. Applauded and practised by the foreinost of Rishis, and depending on Vedic knowledge it involves a consideration of what forms the real entity.

data.v: भूतभव्यभविष्यादिधर्मकामार्थनिश्चयम् । सिद्धसंघपरिज्ञातं पुराकल्पं सनातनम् ॥
data.md: The conclusions about the past, present, and future, etc., and religion, pleasure, and profit, which are all well known to Siddhas, which belong to remote ages, and which are, indeed, eternal, I shall declare to you. O you of great wisdom! These form what is called Good, Wise Men, understanding them in this world, acquire success.

data.v: प्रवक्ष्येऽहं महाप्राज्ञ पदमुत्तममद्य ते । बुद्ध्वा यदिह संसिद्धा भवन्तीह मनीषिणः ॥
data.md: The conclusions about the past, present, and future, etc., and religion, pleasure, and profit, which are all well known to Siddhas, which belong to remote ages, and which are, indeed, eternal, I shall declare to you. O you of great wisdom! These form what is called Good, Wise Men, understanding them in this world, acquire success.

data.v: उपगम्यर्षयः पूर्वं जिज्ञासन्तः परस्परम् । बृहस्पतिभरद्वाजौ गौतमो भार्गवस्तथा ॥
वसिष्ठः काश्यपश्चैव विश्वामित्रोऽत्रिरेव च । मार्गान्सर्वान्परिक्रम्य परिश्रान्ताः स्वकर्मभिः ॥
data.md: Formerly, the Rishis Brihaspati Bharadvaja, Gautama Bhargava, Vasishtha, Kashyapa, Vishvamitra and Atri, assembled together for the purpose of asking one another. They thus assembled together after having travelled over all paths and after they had got tired with the deeds each of them had done.

data.v: ऋषिमाङ्गिरसं वृद्धं पुरस्कृत्य तु ते द्विजाः । ददृशुर्ब्रह्मभवने ब्रह्माणं वीतकल्मषम् ॥
data.md: Those twice-born persons, headed by the sage son of Angirasa, proceeded to the region of the Grandfather. There they saw Brahman perfectly purged of all sin.

data.v: तं प्रणम्य महात्मानं सुखासीनं महर्षयः । पप्रच्छुर्विनयोपेता निःश्रेयसमिदं परम् ॥
data.md: Bowing their heads to that great one who was seated at their ease, the great Rishis, gifted with humility, asked him this grave question about the highest good.

data.v: कथं कर्म क्रियात्साधु कथं मुच्येत किल्बिषात् । के नो मार्गाः शिवाश्च स्युः किं सत्यं किं च दुष्कृतम् ॥
data.md: How should a good man act? How would one be freed from sin? What paths are: auspicious for us? What is truth, and what is sin?

data.v: केनोभौ कर्मपन्थानौ महत्त्वं केन विन्दति । प्रलयं चापवर्गं च भूतानां प्रभवाप्ययौ ॥
data.md: By what action are the two paths, northern and southern, obtained? What is destruction? What, Liberation? What is birth and what death of all existent objects?

data.v: इत्युक्तः स मुनिश्रेष्ठैर्यदाह प्रपितामहः । तत्तेऽहं संप्रवक्ष्यामि शृणु शिष्य यथागमम् ॥
data.md: I shall tell you. O disciple, what the Grandfather, thus addressed, said to them, according to the scriptures. Do you listen.

data.v: सत्याद्भूतानि जातानि स्थावराणि चराणि च । तपसा तानि जीवन्ति इति तद्वित्त सुव्रताः ॥
data.md: It is from Truth that all creatures, mobile and immobile, have been born. They live by penance (or action). Understand this, O you of excellent vows! On account of their own actions they live, transcending their own origin.

data.v: स्वां योनिं पुनरागम्य वर्तन्ते स्वेन कर्मणा । सत्यं हि गुणसंयुक्तं नियतं पञ्चलक्षणम् ॥
ब्रह्म सत्यं तपः सत्यं सत्यं चैव प्रजापतिः । सत्याद्भूतानि जातानि भूतं सत्यमयं महत् ॥
तस्मात्सत्याश्रया विप्रा नित्यं योगपरायणाः । अतीतक्रोधसंतापा नियता धर्मसेतवः ॥
अन्योन्यनियतान्वैद्यान्धर्मसेतुप्रवर्तकान् । तानहं संप्रवक्ष्यामि शाश्वतान्लोकभावनान् ॥
चातुर्विद्यं तथा वर्णांश्चतुरश्चाश्रमान्पृथक् । धर्ममेकं चतुष्पादं नित्यमाहुर्मनीषिणः ॥
पन्थानं वः प्रवक्ष्यामि शिवं क्षेमकरं द्विजाः । नियतं ब्रह्मभावाय यातं पूर्वं मनीषिभिः ॥
गदतस्तं ममाद्येह पन्थानं दुर्विदं परम् । निबोधत महाभागा निखिलेन परं पदम् ॥
ब्रह्मचारिकमेवाहुराश्रमं प्रथमं पदम् । गार्हस्थ्यं तु द्वितीयं स्याद्वानप्रस्थमतः परम् । ततः परं तु विज्ञेयमध्यात्मं परमं पदम् ॥
data.md: The second step is domesticity. After this is the residence in the forcst. After that it should be known is the highest step, viz., that belongs to Adhyatma.

data.v: ज्योतिराकाशमादित्यो वायुरिन्द्रः प्रजापतिः । नोपैति यावदध्यात्मं तावदेतान्न पश्यति । तस्योपायं प्रवक्ष्यामि पुरस्तात्तं निबोधत ॥
data.md: Light, ether, sun, wind, Indra, and Prajapati, one sees these as long as one does not acquire Adhyatma.

data.v: फलमूलानिलभुजां मुनीनां वसतां वने । वानप्रस्थं द्विजातीनां त्रयाणामुपदिश्यते ॥
data.md: I shall declare the means. Do you first understand them. The forest mode of life that is followed by ascetics living in the forest and subsisting upon fruits and roots and air is laid down for the three twice-born classes. The domestic mode of life is ordained for all the orders.

data.v: सर्वेषामेव वर्णानां गार्हस्थ्यं तद्विधीयते । श्रद्धालक्षणमित्येवं धर्मं धीराः प्रचक्षते ॥
इत्येते देवयाना वः पन्थानः परिकीर्तिताः । सद्भिरध्यासिता धीरैः कर्मभिर्धर्मसेतवः ॥
data.md: The wise say that Religion or duty has Faith for its characteristic mark. Thus have I declared to you the paths leading to the celestials. They are adopted by the good and wise by their a 'ts. Those paihs are the causeways of picty.

data.v: एतेषां पृथगध्यास्ते यो धर्मं संशितव्रतः । कालात्पश्यति भूतानां सदैव प्रभवाप्ययौ ॥
data.md: That persons of rigid vows who follows any one of these modes separately, always succeeds in time to understand the production and destruction of all creatures.

data.v: अतस्तत्त्वानि वक्ष्यामि याथातथ्येन हेतुना । विषयस्थानि सर्वाणि वर्तमानानि भागशः ॥
data.md: I shall now declarc, accurately and with reasons, the elements which live in parts in all objects.

data.v: महानात्मा तथाव्यक्तमहंकारस्तथैव च । इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च महाभूतानि पञ्च च ॥
data.md: The great soul, the uninanifest, egoisin, the eleven organs (of knowledge and action), the five great elements, the characteristics of the five elements, these form the eternal creation. The number of clements has been said to be twenty-four and one (more).

data.v: विशेषाः पञ्चभूतानामित्येषा वैदिकी श्रुतिः । चतुर्विंशतिरेषा वस्तत्त्वानां संप्रकीर्तिता ॥
तत्त्वानामथ यो वेद सर्वेषां प्रभवाप्ययौ । स धीरः सर्वभूतेषु न मोहमधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: That wise person who understands the production and destruction of all these elements, that man among all creatures, never meets with delusion.

data.v: तत्त्वानि यो वेदयते यथातथं; गुणांश्च सर्वानखिलाश्च देवताः । विधूतपाप्मा प्रविमुच्य बन्धनं; स सर्वलोकानमलान्समश्नुते ॥
data.md: Hc who understands the elements accurately, all the qualities, all the celestials, succeeds in purifying himself of all sin. Freed from all fetters, such a man succeeds in enjoying all regions of spotless purity.

data.md: Brahman said That which is unmanifest, which is indistinct, all-pervading, everlasting, immutablc, should be known to become the city of nine portals, possessed of three qualities, and consisting of five ingredients.

data.md: Encompassed by cleven including Mind which distinguishes (objects) and having Understanding for the ruler, this is an aggregate of cleven.

data.md: The three ducts that are in it, support it always. These are ihe three Nadis. They run continually, and have the three qualities for their essence.

data.v: तमो रजस्तथा सत्त्वं गुणानेतान्प्रचक्षते । अन्योन्यमिथुनाः सर्वे तथान्योन्यानुजीविनः ॥
data.md: Ignorance, Darkness, and Goodness, these are called the (three) qualities. These are connected with one another. They exist depending on one another.

data.v: अन्योन्यापाश्रयाश्चैव तथान्योन्यानुवर्तिनः । अन्योन्यव्यतिषक्ताश्च त्रिगुणाः पञ्च धातवः ॥
data.md: They take refuge in one another, and follow one another. They are also joined with one another. The five (principal) elements are marked by (these) three qualities.

data.v: तमसो मिथुनं सत्त्वं सत्त्वस्य मिथुनं रजः । रजसश्चापि सत्त्वं स्यात्सत्त्वस्य मिथुनं तमः ॥
data.md: Goodness is also the match of Ignorance. Of goodness the match of Darkness. Goodness is also the match of Darkness, and of Goodness the match is Ignorance.

data.md: There where Ignorance is restrained, Darkness is seen to flow. There where Darkness is restrained, Goodness is scen to flow.

data.md: Darkness should be known to have the night for its essence. It has three marks, and is (otherwise) called Delusion. It has sin also for its mark, and it is always present in all sinful deeds. This is the nature of Ignorance and it appears also as confined with others.

data.md: Darkness is said to have activity for its essence. It is the cause of successive deeds. When it predominates, its mark, among all beings, is production,

data.v: प्रकाशं सर्वभूतेषु लाघवं श्रद्दधानता । सात्त्विकं रूपमेवं तु लाघवं साधुसंमितम् ॥
data.md: Splendour, lightness, and faith-these are the form, that is light, of Goodness among all creatures, as considered by all good men.

data.md: The true nature of their marks will now be declared by me, with reasons. These shall be stated in aggregation and separation. Do you understand them.

data.md: Whatever undertakings exist which are unmeritorious, what gifts there are which are unmeritorious, vain cating, these also belong to Ignorance.

data.md: Indulgence in calumny, unforgiveness, animosity, vanity, and absence of faith are also said to be characteristic of Ignorance.

data.md: Whatever men there are in this world, who are characterised by these and other faults of a similar kind, and who break through the restraints are all considered as belonging is the quality of Ignorance.

data.md: I shall now declare the wombs wherс these men, who are always of sinful deeds, have to take their birth. Ordained to go to hell, they sink in the order of being. Indeed, they sink into the hell of the brute creation.

data.md: These men of evil conduct, always show the marks of their deeds, sink in Ignorance. Their course is always downwards. Belonging to the quality of Ignorance, they sink in Ignorance.

data.md: I shall, after this, declare what the means are of their improvement and ascent; indeed, by what means they succeed in acquiring the regions which exist for men of pious deeds.

data.md: Born in orders other then humanity and growing old in their respective deeds, cven thus they become human beings that are, of course, ordained to return.

data.md: Ignorance, delusion, the great delusion, the great obscurity called anger, and death, that blinding obscurity. As regards anger, that is the great obscurity.

data.md: With respect then to its colour, its characteristics, and its source, I have, you learned Brahmanas, declared to you, accurately and in due order, everything, about Ignorance.

data.md: You best of beings, I shall now declare to you accurately what (the quality of) Darkness is. You highly blessed ones, do you understand what those qualities are that belong to Darkness.

data.md: These men on Earth who meditate on the past, present, and the future, who are devoted to the threefold objects of life, viz., Religion, Profit, and Pleasure, who, acting from the impulse of desire, exult on acquiring riches in respect of every desire, are said to be covered by Darkness. data.md: Repeatedly reborn in this world, they addict theinselves to pleasure. They covet what belongs to this world as also all those fruits of the world to come. They make gifts, accept gifts, offer oblations to the departed manes, and pour libations on the sacrificial fire.

data.md: Brahman said I shall, after this, describe to you that excellent quality which is the third. It is beneficial to all creatures in the world, and unblamable, and forms the conduct of the good.

data.md: Joy, satisfaction, nobility, enlightenment, and happiness, absence of stinginess, absence of fear, contentment, disposition for faith, forgiveness, courage, abstention from injuring any creature, equability, truth, straightforwardness, absence of anger, absence of malice, purity, cleverness, prowess, belong to the quality of Goodness.

data.md: He who is devoted to the duty of Yoga, considering knowledge to the vain conduct to be vain, service to be vain, and mode of life to be vain, attains to what is highest in the next world.

data.v: निर्ममो निरहंकारो निराशीः सर्वतः समः । अकामहत इत्येष सतां धर्मः सनातनः ॥
data.md: Freedom from cgoism, freedom from expectations, loO king on all impartially, and freedom from desire, these form the cternal religion of the good.

data.v: विश्रम्भो ह्रीस्तितिक्षा च त्यागः शौचमतन्द्रिता । आनृशंस्यमसंमोहो दया भूतेष्वपैशुनम् ॥
हर्षस्तुष्टिर्विस्मयश्च विनयः साधुवृत्तता । शान्तिकर्म विशुद्धिश्च शुभा बुद्धिर्विमोचनम् ॥
उपेक्षा ब्रह्मचर्यं च परित्यागश्च सर्वशः । निर्ममत्वमनाशीस्त्वमपरिक्रीतधर्मता ॥
मुधा दानं मुधा यज्ञो मुधाधीतं मुधा व्रतम् । मुधा प्रतिग्रहश्चैव मुधा धर्मो मुधा तपः ॥
एवंवृत्तास्तु ये केचिल्लोकेऽस्मिन्सत्त्वसंश्रयाः । ब्राह्मणा ब्रह्मयोनिस्थास्ते धीराः साधुदर्शिनः ॥
data.md: Those Brahmanas in this world, whose conduct is marked by these virtues, who follow virtue, who abide in the Vedas, are said to be wise and possessed of correctness of vision.

data.v: हित्वा सर्वाणि पापानि निःशोका ह्यजरामराः । दिवं प्राप्य तु ते धीराः कुर्वते वै ततस्ततः ॥
data.md: Freed from sins and grief, those wise men attain to the celestial region and create various bodies (for themselves).

data.v: ईशित्वं च वशित्वं च लघुत्वं मनसश्च ते । विकुर्वते महात्मानो देवास्त्रिदिवगा इव ॥
data.md: The power of governing everything, selfcontrol, minuteness, these great ones make by operations of their own mind, like the gods themselves living in the celestial region.

data.v: ऊर्ध्वस्रोतस इत्येते देवा वैकारिकाः स्मृताः । विकुर्वते प्रकृत्या वै दिवं प्राप्तास्ततस्ततः । यद्यदिच्छन्ति तत्सर्वं भजन्ते विभजन्ति च ॥
data.md: Such men are said to have their courses directed upwards. They are veritable gods capable of modifying all things. Attaining to the celestial region, they modify all things by their very nature.

data.v: इत्येतत्सात्त्विकं वृत्तं कथितं वो द्विजर्षभाः । एतद्विज्ञाय विधिवल्लभते यद्यदिच्छति ॥
data.md: They get whatever objects they desire and cnjoy them. Thus have I, you foremost of twice-born ones, described to you what that conduct is which belongs to the quality of goodness. Understanding these duly, one acquires whatever objects one desires.

data.v: प्रकीर्तिताः सत्त्वगुणा विशेषतो; यथावदुक्तं गुणवृत्तमेव च । नरस्तु यो वेद गुणानिमान्सदा; गुणान्स भुङ्क्ते न गुणैः स भुज्यते ॥
data.md: The qualities which belong to goodness have been declared particularly. The conduct which those qualities form, has also been properly described. That man who always understands these qualities, succeeds in enjoying the qualities without being attached to them.

data.v: नैव शक्या गुणा वक्तुं पृथक्त्वेनेह सर्वशः । अविच्छिन्नानि दृश्यन्ते रजः सत्त्वं तमस्तथा ॥
data.md: The qualities are incapable of being described as completely separate from one another. Darkness and Goodness and Ignorance are seen existing in a state of union.

data.v: अन्योन्यमनुषज्जन्ते अन्योन्यं चानुजीविनः । अन्योन्यापाश्रयाः सर्वे तथान्योन्यानुवर्तिनः ॥
data.md: They are attached to one another. They depend on one another. The have one another for their support. They likewise follow one another.

data.v: यावत्सत्त्वं तमस्तावद्वर्तते नात्र संशयः । यावत्तमश्च सत्त्वं च रजस्तावदिहोच्यते ॥
data.md: As long as goodness exists, so long does Darkness cxist. There is no doubt in this. As long as Ignorance and Goodness exist, so long does Darkness exist.

data.v: संहत्य कुर्वते यात्रां सहिताः संघचारिणः । संघातवृत्तयो ह्येते वर्तन्ते हेत्वहेतुभिः ॥
data.md: They travel together, in union, and moving collectively. They move in a body; when they act with cause or without cause.

data.v: उद्रेकव्यतिरेकाणां तेषामन्योन्यवर्तिनाम् । वर्तते तद्यथान्यूनं व्यतिरिक्तं च सर्वशः ॥
data.md: Of all these which work with one another however much they may differ in their an development, the manner in which their increase and diminution take place will now be described.

data.v: व्यतिरिक्तं तमो यत्र तिर्यग्भावगतं भवेत् । अल्पं तत्र रजो ज्ञेयं सत्त्वं चाल्पतरं ततः ॥
data.md: There where Ignorance exists in increased measure, in the lower creatures (for example), Darkness exists in a smaller measure and Goodness in a still lesser degree.

data.v: उद्रिक्तं च रजो यत्र मध्यस्रोतोगतं भवेत् । अल्पं तत्र तमो ज्ञेयं सत्त्वं चाल्पतरं ततः ॥
data.md: There where Ignorance exists in increased measure, in the lower creatures (for example), Darkness exists in a smaller measure and Goodness in a still lesser degree.

data.v: उद्रिक्तं च यदा सत्त्वमूर्ध्वस्रोतोगतं भवेत् । अल्पं तत्र रजो ज्ञेयं तमश्चाल्पतरं ततः ॥
data.md: These where Darkness predominates, in creatures of middle course, Ignorance exists in a smaller measure and Goodness in a still smaller quantity.

data.v: सत्त्वं वैकारिकं योनिरिन्द्रियाणां प्रकाशिका । न हि सत्त्वात्परो भावः कश्चिदन्यो विधीयते ॥
data.md: Goodness is the spring which causes the modification of the senses. It is, again, the great enlightener. No duty has been laid down that is higher than Goodness.

data.v: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः । जघन्यगुणसंयुक्ता यान्त्यधस्तामसा जनाः ॥
data.md: They who abide in Goodness proceed upwards. They who abide in Darkness remain in the middle. They who abide in Ignorance being characterised by qualities that are low, sink downwards.

data.v: तमः शूद्रे रजः क्षत्रे ब्राह्मणे सत्त्वमुत्तमम् । इत्येवं त्रिषु वर्णेषु विवर्तन्ते गुणास्त्रयः ॥
data.md: Ignorance is in the Shudra; Darkness in the Kshatriya; and Goodness, which is the highest, in the Brahmana. The three qualities exist thus in the three castes.

data.v: दूरादपि हि दृश्यन्ते सहिताः संघचारिणः । तमः सत्त्वं रजश्चैव पृथक्त्वं नानुशुश्रुम ॥
data.md: From a distance, the three qualities of Goodness, Darkness and Ignorance, are seen to exist in a state of union and more collectively. They are never seen in a state of separation.

data.v: दृष्ट्वा चादित्यमुद्यन्तं कुचोराणां भयं भवेत् । अध्वगाः परितप्येरंस्तृष्णार्ता दुःखभागिनः ॥
data.md: Seeing the Sun rising, men of evil deeds become filled with fear. Travellers on their way become afflicted with heat, and suffer distress.

data.v: आदित्यः सत्त्वमुद्दिष्टं कुचोरास्तु यथा तमः । परितापोऽध्वगानां च राजसो गुण उच्यते ॥
data.md: The Sun is Goodness developed; men of evil deeds represent Ignorance; the heat which travellers on their way feel, is said to be a quality of Darkness.

data.v: प्राकाश्यं सत्त्वमादित्ये संतापो राजसो गुणः । उपप्लवस्तु विज्ञेयस्तामसस्तस्य पर्वसु ॥
data.md: Thic Sun representing light is Goodness; the heat is the quality of Darkness; the shading (or eclipse) of the Sun on Parvan days, should be known to represent Ignorance.

data.v: एवं ज्योतिःषु सर्वेषु विवर्तन्ते गुणास्त्रयः । पर्यायेण च वर्तन्ते तत्र तत्र तथा तथा ॥
data.md: Thus, the three qualities exist in all luminous bodies. They act by turns in various places in various ways.

data.v: स्थावरेषु च भूतेषु तिर्यग्भावगतं तमः । राजसास्तु विवर्तन्ते स्नेहभावस्तु सात्त्विकः ॥
data.md: Among immobile objects, the quality of Ignorance predominates. The qualities belonging to Darkness are those properties of their is which suffer constant changes. Their oleaginous qualities belong to Goodness.

data.v: अहस्त्रिधा तु विज्ञेयं त्रिधा रात्रिर्विधीयते । मासार्धमासवर्षाणि ऋतवः संधयस्तथा ॥
data.md: The Day should be understood as threefold. The Night has been ordained to be threefold. So also are fortnights, months, years, seasons, and conjunctions.

data.v: त्रिधा दानानि दीयन्ते त्रिधा यज्ञः प्रवर्तते । त्रिधा लोकास्त्रिधा वेदास्त्रिधा विद्यास्त्रिधा गतिः ॥
data.md: The gifts are threefold. Threefold is sacrifice. Threefold are the worlds; threefold the celestials; threefold is knowledge; and threefold the path or end.

data.v: भूतं भव्यं भविष्यच्च धर्मोऽर्थः काम इत्यपि । प्राणापानावुदानश्चाप्येत एव त्रयो गुणाः ॥
data.md: The Past, the Present, and the future, Religion, Profit and Pleasure, Prana, Apana, and Udana, these also are permeated by the three qualities.

data.v: यत्किंचिदिह वै लोके सर्वमेष्वेव तत्त्रिषु । त्रयो गुणाः प्रवर्तन्ते अव्यक्ता नित्यमेव तु । सत्त्वं रजस्तमश्चैव गुणसर्गः सनातनः ॥
data.md: Indeed, the three qualities always act in an unmanifest form. The creation of those three, viz., Goodness, Darkness and Ignorance is eternal.

data.v: तमोऽव्यक्तं शिवं नित्यमजं योनिः सनातनः । प्रकृतिर्विकारः प्रलयः प्रधानं प्रभवाप्ययौ ॥
अनुद्रिक्तमनूनं च ह्यकम्पमचलं ध्रुवम् । सदसच्चैव तत्सर्वमव्यक्तं त्रिगुणं स्मृतम् । ज्ञेयानि नामधेयानि नरैरध्यात्मचिन्तकैः ॥
data.md: The unmanifest, consisting of the three qualities, is said to be darkness, unperceived, holy constant, unborn, womb, eternal, Nature, change or modification, destruction, Pradhana, production, and absorption, undeveloped, not small (i.e., vast), unshaking, immovable, fixed, existent, and non-existent. All these names should be known by those who meditate on matters about the soul.

data.v: अव्यक्तनामानि गुणांश्च तत्त्वतो; यो वेद सर्वाणि गतीश्च केवलाः । विमुक्तदेहः प्रविभागतत्त्ववि;त्स मुच्यते सर्वगुणैर्निरामयः ॥
data.md: That person who accurately knows all the names of the unmanifest, and the qualities, as also the pure actions, well conversant with the truth-about all distinctions and freed from the body, becomes emancipated from all the qualities and enjoys absolute happiness. That person who accurately knows all the names of the unmanifest, and the qualities, as also the pure actions, well conversant with the truth-about all distinctions and freed from the body, becomes emancipated from all the qualities and enjoys absolute happiness.

data.v: अव्यक्तात्पूर्वमुत्पन्नो महानात्मा महामतिः । आदिर्गुणानां सर्वेषां प्रथमः सर्ग उच्यते ॥
data.md: From the unmanifest first originated the Great Soul, gifted with great intelligence, the source of all the qualities. That is said to be the first creation.

data.v: महानात्मा मतिर्विष्णुर्विश्वः शंभुश्च वीर्यवान् । बुद्धिः प्रज्ञोपलब्धिश्च तथा ख्यातिर्धृतिः स्मृतिः ॥
data.md: The Great Soul has these synonymous words, the Great Soul, Intelligence, Vishnu, Jishnu, Shambhu of great valour, the Understanding, the means of acquiring knowledge, the means of perception, as also fame, courage, and memory. Knowing this, a learned Brahmana has never to meet with delusion.

data.v: पर्यायवाचकैः शब्दैर्महानात्मा विभाव्यते । तं जानन्ब्राह्मणो विद्वान्न प्रमोहं निगच्छति ॥
data.md: The Great Soul has these synonymous words, the Great Soul, Intelligence, Vishnu, Jishnu, Shambhu of great valour, the Understanding, the means of acquiring knowledge, the means of perception, as also fame, courage, and memory. Knowing this, a learned Brahmana has never to meet with delusion.

data.v: सर्वतःपाणिपादश्च सर्वतोक्षिशिरोमुखः । सर्वतःश्रुतिमाँल्लोके सर्वं व्याप्य स तिष्ठति ॥
data.md: He has hands and feet on all sides; he has ears on all sides; he lives, pervading all things in this world.

data.v: महाप्रभार्चिः पुरुषः सर्वस्य हृदि निश्रितः । अणिमा लघिमा प्राप्तिरीशानो ज्योतिरव्ययः ॥
data.md: Of great power, that Being is stationed in the heart of all. Minuteness. Lightness, and Affluence, are his. His is the hard of all, and at one with effulgence, and knows not decay.

data.v: तत्र बुद्धिमतां लोकाः संन्यासनिरताश्च ये । ध्यानिनो नित्ययोगाश्च सत्यसंधा जितेन्द्रियाः ॥
data.md: In Him are all those who comprehend the nature of the understanding, all those who are devoted to goodness of disposition, all those who practise meditation, who are always devoted to Yoga, who are firm in truth. who have governed their senses, who are gifted with knowledge, who are freed from cupidity, who have conquered anger, who are of cheerful hcarts, who are gifted with wisdom, who are liberated from ideas of mine and thine, and who are devoid of cgoism.

data.v: ज्ञानवन्तश्च ये केचिदलुब्धा जितमन्यवः । प्रसन्नमनसो धीरा निर्ममा निरहंकृताः । विमुक्ताः सर्व एवैते महत्त्वमुपयान्ति वै ॥
आत्मनो महतो वेद यः पुण्यां गतिमुत्तमाम् । स धीरः सर्वलोकेषु न मोहमधिगच्छति । विष्णुरेवादिसर्गेषु स्वयंभूर्भवति प्रभुः ॥
एवं हि यो वेद गुहाशयं प्रभुं; नरः पुराणं पुरुषं विश्वरूपम् । हिरण्मयं बुद्धिमतां परां गतिं; स बुद्धिमान्बुद्धिमतीत्य तिष्ठति ॥
data.md: The self-create Vishnu becomes the Lord in the primary creations. He who thus knows the Lord lying in the cave, the Supreme, Ancient Being, of universal form, the golded one, the highest goal of all persons gifted with understanding, that intelligent man lives, transcending the understanding.

data.v: य उत्पन्नो महान्पूर्वमहंकारः स उच्यते । अहमित्येव संभूतो द्वितीयः सर्ग उच्यते ॥
data.md: Brahman said That Mahat or principle of greatness who was first produced is called Egoism. When, it originated as I, it came to be called as the second creation.

data.v: अहंकारश्च भूतादिर्वैकारिक इति स्मृतः । तेजसश्चेतना धातुः प्रजासर्गः प्रजापतिः ॥
data.md: That Egoism is said to be the source of all creatures, for these have originated from its modifications. It is pure effulgence and is the supporter of consciousness. It is Prajapati.

data.v: देवानां प्रभवो देवो मनसश्च त्रिलोककृत् । अहमित्येव तत्सर्वमभिमन्ता स उच्यते ॥
data.md: It is a deity, the creator of deities, and of mind. It is the which creates the three worlds. It is said to be that which feels-I am all this.

data.v: अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यानां मुनीनां भावितात्मनाम् । स्वाध्यायक्रतुसिद्धानामेष लोकः सनातनः ॥
data.md: That is the eternal world existing for those sages who are contented with knowledge about the soul, who have meditated on the soul, and who have acquired success by Vedic study and sacrifices.

data.v: अहंकारेणाहरतो गुणानिमा;न्भूतादिरेवं सृजते स भूतकृत् । वैकारिकः सर्वमिदं विचेष्टते; स्वतेजसा रञ्जयते जगत्तथा ॥
data.md: By consciousness of soul one enjoys the qualities. That source of all creatures, that creator of all creatures, creates thus. It is that which causes all changes. It is that which causes all beings to move. By its own light ii lights up the universe likewise.

data.v: अहंकारात्प्रसूतानि महाभूतानि पञ्च वै । पृथिवी वायुराकाशमापो ज्योतिश्च पञ्चमम् ॥
data.md: From Egoison were, indeed, born the five great elements. They are earth, air, ether, water and light numbering the fifth.

data.v: तेषु भूतानि मुह्यन्ते महाभूतेषु पञ्चसु । शब्दस्पर्शनरूपेषु रसगन्धक्रियासु च ॥
data.md: In these five great elements, in the matter of the operations of sound, touch, colour, taste, and smell, all creatures become deluded.

data.v: महाभूतविनाशान्ते प्रलये प्रत्युपस्थिते । सर्वप्राणभृतां धीरा महदुत्पद्यते भयम् ॥
data.md: When at the close of the destruction of the grcat elements, the dissolution of the universe comes, O wisemen, a great fear possesses all living creatures. However, the man with self realisation and bold enough remains undeviated to that circumstances.

data.v: यद्यस्माज्जायते भूतं तत्र तत्प्रविलीयते । लीयन्ते प्रतिलोमानि जायन्ते चोत्तरोत्तरम् ॥
data.md: Every existent object is dissolved into that from which it is produced. The dissolution takes place in an order that is the reverse of that in which creation occurs. Indeed, as regards birth, they are born from one another.

data.v: ततः प्रलीने सर्वस्मिन्भूते स्थावरजङ्गमे । स्मृतिमन्तस्तदा धीरा न लीयन्ते कदाचन ॥
data.md: Then, when all existent objects, mobile and immobile, become become dissolved, wise men possessed of a powerful memory never dissolve.

data.v: शब्दः स्पर्शस्तथा रूपं रसो गन्धश्च पञ्चमः । क्रियाकारणयुक्ताः स्युरनित्या मोहसंज्ञिताः ॥
data.md: Sound, touch, colour, taste, and smell numbering the fifth, are effects. They are, however, inconstant, and called by the name of delusion.

data.v: लोभप्रजनसंयुक्ता निर्विशेषा ह्यकिंचनाः । मांसशोणितसंघाता अन्योन्यस्योपजीविनः ॥
बहिरात्मान इत्येते दीनाः कृपणवृत्तयः । प्राणापानावुदानश्च समानो व्यान एव च ॥
अन्तरात्मेति चाप्येते नियताः पञ्च वायवः । वाङ्मनोबुद्धिरित्येभिः सार्धमष्टात्मकं जगत् ॥
त्वग्घ्राणश्रोत्रचक्षूंषि रसनं वाक्च संयता । विशुद्धं च मनो यस्य बुद्धिश्चाव्यभिचारिणी ॥
अष्टौ यस्याग्नयो ह्येते न दहन्ते मनः सदा । स तद्ब्रह्म शुभं याति यस्माद्भूयो न विद्यते ॥
data.md: He whose skin, nose, ear, eyes, tongue, and speech are controlled, whose mind is pure, and whose understanding deviates not (from the right path), and whose mind is never burnt by those eight fires, succeeds in acquiring that auspicious Brahma than which nothing superior exists.

data.v: एकादश च यान्याहुरिन्द्रियाणि विशेषतः । अहंकारप्रसूतानि तानि वक्ष्याम्यहं द्विजाः ॥
data.md: I shall now, O twice-born ones, mention particularly, those which have been called the eleven organs and which have originated from Egoism.

data.v: श्रोत्रं त्वक्चक्षुषी जिह्वा नासिका चैव पञ्चमी । पादौ पायुरुपस्थं च हस्तौ वाग्दशमी भवेत् ॥
data.md: They are the ear, the skin, the two eyes, the longue, the nose for the fifth, the two feet, the lower duct, the organ of generation, the two hands, and speech forming the tenth.

data.v: इन्द्रियग्राम इत्येष मन एकादशं भवेत् । एतं ग्रामं जयेत्पूर्वं ततो ब्रह्म प्रकाशते ॥
data.md: These form the group of organs, with mind numbering as the eleventh. One should first subdue this group. Then will Brahma shine forth (in him).

data.v: बुद्धीन्द्रियाणि पञ्चाहुः पञ्च कर्मेन्द्रियाणि च । श्रोत्रादीन्यपि पञ्चाहुर्बुद्धियुक्तानि तत्त्वतः ॥
data.md: Five amongst these are called organs of knowledge, and five, organs of action. The five beginning with the ear are connected with knowledge.

data.v: अविशेषाणि चान्यानि कर्मयुक्तानि तानि तु । उभयत्र मनो ज्ञेयं बुद्धिर्द्वादशमी भवेत् ॥
data.md: The rest, however, which are connected with action, are without distinction. The mind should be considered as belonging to both. The understanding is the twelfth in the top.

data.v: इत्युक्तानीन्द्रियाणीमान्येकादश मया क्रमात् । मन्यन्ते कृतमित्येव विदित्वैतानि पण्डिताः ॥
data.md: Thus have been enumerated the eleven organs in due order. Learned man, having understood these, think they have done everything.

data.v: त्रीणि स्थानानि भूतानां चतुर्थं नोपपद्यते । स्थलमापस्तथाकाशं जन्म चापि चतुर्विधम् ॥
अण्डजोद्भिज्जसंस्वेदजरायुजमथापि च । चतुर्धा जन्म इत्येतद्भूतग्रामस्य लक्ष्यते ॥
अचराण्यपि भूतानि खेचराणि तथैव च । अण्डजानि विजानीयात्सर्वांश्चैव सरीसृपान् ॥
संस्वेदाः कृमयः प्रोक्ता जन्तवश्च तथाविधाः । जन्म द्वितीयमित्येतज्जघन्यतरमुच्यते ॥
भित्त्वा तु पृथिवीं यानि जायन्ते कालपर्ययात् । उद्भिज्जानीति तान्याहुर्भूतानि द्विजसत्तमाः ॥
द्विपादबहुपादानि तिर्यग्गतिमतीनि च । जरायुजानि भूतानि वित्त तान्यपि सत्तमाः ॥
द्विविधापीह विज्ञेया ब्रह्मयोनिः सनातना । तपः कर्म च यत्पुण्यमित्येष विदुषां नयः ॥
द्विविधं कर्म विज्ञेयमिज्या दानं च यन्मखे । जातस्याध्ययनं पुण्यमिति वृद्धानुशासनम् ॥
एतद्यो वेद विधिवत्स मुक्तः स्याद्द्विजर्षभाः । विमुक्तः सर्वपापेभ्य इति चैव निबोधत ॥
आकाशं प्रथमं भूतं श्रोत्रमध्यात्ममुच्यते । अधिभूतं तथा शब्दो दिशस्तत्राधिदैवतम् ॥
द्वितीयं मारुतो भूतं त्वगध्यात्मं च विश्रुतम् । स्प्रष्टव्यमधिभूतं च विद्युत्तत्राधिदैवतम् ॥
तृतीयं ज्योतिरित्याहुश्चक्षुरध्यात्ममुच्यते । अधिभूतं ततो रूपं सूर्यस्तत्राधिदैवतम् ॥
चतुर्थमापो विज्ञेयं जिह्वा चाध्यात्ममिष्यते । अधिभूतं रसश्चात्र सोमस्तत्राधिदैवतम् ॥
पृथिवी पञ्चमं भूतं घ्राणश्चाध्यात्ममिष्यते । अधिभूतं तथा गन्धो वायुस्तत्राधिदैवतम् ॥
एष पञ्चसु भूतेषु चतुष्टयविधिः स्मृतः । अतः परं प्रवक्ष्यामि सर्वं त्रिविधमिन्द्रियम् ॥
पादावध्यात्ममित्याहुर्ब्राह्मणास्तत्त्वदर्शिनः । अधिभूतं तु गन्तव्यं विष्णुस्तत्राधिदैवतम् ॥
अवाग्गतिरपानश्च पायुरध्यात्ममिष्यते । अधिभूतं विसर्गश्च मित्रस्तत्राधिदैवतम् ॥
प्रजनः सर्वभूतानामुपस्थोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते । अधिभूतं तथा शुक्रं दैवतं च प्रजापतिः ॥
हस्तावध्यात्ममित्याहुरध्यात्मविदुषो जनाः । अधिभूतं तु कर्माणि शक्रस्तत्राधिदैवतम् ॥
वैश्वदेवी मनःपूर्वा वागध्यात्ममिहोच्यते । वक्तव्यमधिभूतं च वह्निस्तत्राधिदैवतम् ॥
अध्यात्मं मन इत्याहुः पञ्चभूतानुचारकम् । अधिभूतं च मन्तव्यं चन्द्रमाश्चाधिदैवतम् ॥
अध्यात्मं बुद्धिरित्याहुः षडिन्द्रियविचारिणी । अधिभूतं तु विज्ञेयं ब्रह्मा तत्राधिदैवतम् ॥
यथावदध्यात्मविधिरेष वः कीर्तितो मया । ज्ञानमस्य हि धर्मज्ञाः प्राप्तं बुद्धिमतामिह ॥
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थाश्च महाभूतानि पञ्च च । सर्वाण्येतानि संधाय मनसा संप्रधारयेत् ॥
data.md: You Rishis knowing all duties, a knowledge of this is gained by those who are considered as persons, viz., the senses, the objects of the senses, and the five great elements, one should keep them in the mind.

data.v: क्षीणे मनसि सर्वस्मिन्न जन्मसुखमिष्यते । ज्ञानसंपन्नसत्त्वानां तत्सुखं विदुषां मतम् ॥
data.md: When everything is immersed in the mind, one no longer regards highly the pleasures of life. Learned men, whose understandings are furnished with knowledge, consider that as true happiness.

data.v: अतः परं प्रवक्ष्यामि सूक्ष्मभावकरीं शिवाम् । निवृत्तिं सर्वभूतेषु मृदुना दारुणेन वा ॥
data.md: I shall, after this, tell you of renunciation about all entities by means gentle and hard, which produces attachment to subtle topics and which is fraught with auspiciousness.

data.v: गुणागुणमनासङ्गमेकचर्यमनन्तरम् । एतद्ब्राह्मणतो वृत्तमाहुरेकपदं सुखम् ॥
data.md: That conduct which consists in treating the qualities as not qualities, which is shorn of attachment, which is living alone, which does not recognise distinctions, and which is full of Brahma, is the root of all happiness.

data.v: विद्वान्कूर्म इवाङ्गानि कामान्संहृत्य सर्वशः । विरजाः सर्वतो मुक्तो यो नरः स सुखी सदा ॥
data.md: The learned man who takes all desires himself from all sides like thc tortoise withdrawing all its limbs, who is devoid of passion, and who is freed from everything, becoming always happy.

data.v: कामानात्मनि संयम्य क्षीणतृष्णः समाहितः । सर्वभूतसुहृन्मैत्रो ब्रह्मभूयं स गच्छति ॥
data.md: Controlling all desires within the soul, killing his thirst, concentrated in mediation, and becoming the friend of good heart towards all creatures, he succeeds in becoming fit for assimilation with Brahma.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणां निरोधेन सर्वेषां विषयैषिणाम् । मुनेर्जनपदत्यागादध्यात्माग्निः समिध्यते ॥
data.md: Through suppression of all the senses which always hanker after their objects, and abandonment of inhabited places, the spiritual fire blazes forth in the man of contemplation.

data.v: यथाग्निरिन्धनैरिद्धो महाज्योतिः प्रकाशते । तथेन्द्रियनिरोधेन महानात्मा प्रकाशते ॥
data.md: As a fire, fed with fuel, becomes bright on account of the burning flames it puts forth, so, on account of the repression of the senses, the great soul puts forth its effulgence.

data.v: यदा पश्यति भूतानि प्रसन्नात्मात्मनो हृदि । स्वयंयोनिस्तदा सूक्ष्मात्सूक्ष्ममाप्नोत्यनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: When one with a tranquil soul sees all entities in his own heart, then, lighted by his own effulgence, one attains to that which is subtler than the subtle and which is peerless in excellence.

data.v: अग्नी रूपं पयः स्रोतो वायुः स्पर्शनमेव च । मही पङ्कधरं घोरमाकाशं श्रवणं तथा ॥
रागशोकसमाविष्टं पञ्चस्रोतःसमावृतम् । पञ्चभूतसमायुक्तं नवद्वारं द्विदैवतम् ॥
रजस्वलमथादृश्यं त्रिगुणं च त्रिधातुकम् । संसर्गाभिरतं मूढं शरीरमिति धारणा ॥
दुश्चरं जीवलोकेऽस्मिन्सत्त्वं प्रति समाश्रितम् । एतदेव हि लोकेऽस्मिन्कालचक्रं प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: It is difficult of being moved in this mortal world, and it rests on the understanding as its stay. That body is, in called delusion. It is this body which stretches forth, contracts, and awakens the universe with the immortals.

data.v: एतन्महार्णवं घोरमगाधं मोहसंज्ञितम् । विसृजेत्संक्षिपेच्चैव बोधयेत्सामरं जगत् ॥
data.md: This wheel of life which is connected with pairs of opposites and devoid of consciousness, the universe with the very immortals should cast away, abridge, and chcek.

data.v: कामक्रोधौ भयं मोहमभिद्रोहमथानृतम् । इन्द्रियाणां निरोधेन स तांस्त्यजति दुस्त्यजान् ॥
data.md: By controlling the senses, one renounces lust, anger, fear, cupidity, enmity, and falsehood, which are cternal and, therefore, highly difficult to renounce.

data.v: यस्यैते निर्जिता लोके त्रिगुणाः पञ्च धातवः । व्योम्नि तस्य परं स्थानमनन्तमथ लक्ष्यते ॥
data.md: He who has controlled these in this world, viz., the three qualities and the five elements of the body, has the Highest for his seat in the celestial region. By him is Infinity attained.

data.v: कामकूलामपारान्तां मनःस्रोतोभयावहाम् । नदीं दुर्गह्रदां तीर्णः कामक्रोधावुभौ जयेत् ॥
data.md: Crossing the river which has the five senses for its steep banks, the mental inclinations for its powerful waters, and delusion for its lake, one should control both lust and anger,

data.v: स सर्वदोषनिर्मुक्तस्ततः पश्यति यत्परम् । मनो मनसि संधाय पश्यत्यात्मानमात्मनि ॥
data.md: Such a man, freed from all faults, then sces the Highest, concentrating the mind within the mind and sceing self in self.

data.v: सर्ववित्सर्वभूतेषु वीक्षत्यात्मानमात्मनि । एकधा बहुधा चैव विकुर्वाणस्ततस्ततः ॥
data.md: Understanding all things, he sees his self, with self, in all creatures, sometimes as one and sometimes as various, changing form from time to time.

data.v: ध्रुवं पश्यति रूपाणि दीपाद्दीपशतं यथा । स वै विष्णुश्च मित्रश्च वरुणोऽग्निः प्रजापतिः ॥
data.md: Forsooth, he can perceive numerous bodies like a hundred lights from one light. Indeed, he is Vishnu and Mitra, and Varuna and Agni, and Prajapati.

data.v: स हि धाता विधाता च स प्रभुः सर्वतोमुखः । हृदयं सर्वभूतानां महानात्मा प्रकाशते ॥
data.md: He is the Creator and the ordainer; he is the powerful Lord, with faces turned in all directions. In him, the heart of all creatures, the great soul, becomes resplendent.

data.v: तं विप्रसंघाश्च सुरासुराश्च; यक्षाः पिशाचाः पितरो वयांसि । रक्षोगणा भूतगणाश्च सर्वे; महर्षयश्चैव सदा स्तुवन्ति ॥
data.md: All the learned Brahmanas, celestials, Asuras, Yakshas, Pishachas, the departed manes, birds, Rakshasas, goblins, and all the great Rishis, laud Him.

data.v: मनुष्याणां तु राजन्यः क्षत्रियो मध्यमो गुणः । कुञ्जरो वाहनानां च सिंहश्चारण्यवासिनाम् ॥
data.md: Brahman said Among men, the royal Kshatriya is gifted with the middle quality. Among vehicles, the elephant (is so); and among dwellers of the forest the lion; among all (sacrificial) animals, the sheep; among all those that live in holes, is the snake; among cattle, the bull; among females, the male.

data.v: अविः पशूनां सर्वेषामाखुश्च बिलवासिनाम् । गवां गोवृषभश्चैव स्त्रीणां पुरुष एव च ॥
न्यग्रोधो जम्बुवृक्षश्च पिप्पलः शाल्मलिस्तथा । शिंशपा मेषशृङ्गश्च तथा कीचकवेणवः । एते द्रुमाणां राजानो लोकेऽस्मिन्नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: There is no doubt in this that in this world, the Nyagrodha, the Jambu, the Pippala, the Shalmali, the Shinshapa, the Meshashringa, and the Kichaka, are the foremost ones among trees.

data.v: हिमवान्पारियात्रश्च सह्यो विन्ध्यस्त्रिकूटवान् । श्वेतो नीलश्च भासश्च काष्ठवांश्चैव पर्वतः ॥
शुभस्कन्धो महेन्द्रश्च माल्यवान्पर्वतस्तथा । एते पर्वतराजानो गणानां मरुतस्तथा ॥
सूर्यो ग्रहाणामधिपो नक्षत्राणां च चन्द्रमाः । यमः पितॄणामधिपः सरितामथ सागरः ॥
data.md: The Sun is the lord of all the planets, and the Moon of all the constellations. Yama is the lord of the departed manes; Ocean is the lord of all rivers.

data.v: अम्भसां वरुणो राजा सत्त्वानां मित्र उच्यते । अर्कोऽधिपतिरुष्णानां ज्योतिषामिन्दुरुच्यते ॥
data.md: Varuna is the king of the waters. Indra is said to be the king of the Maruts. Arka is the king of all hot bodies, and Indra of all luminous bodies.

data.v: अग्निर्भूतपतिर्नित्यं ब्राह्मणानां बृहस्पतिः । ओषधीनां पतिः सोमो विष्णुर्बलवतां वरः ॥
data.md: Agni is the eternal lord of the elements, and Brihaspati of the Brahmanas. Soma is the lord herbs, and Vishnu is the foremost of all that are gifted with might.

data.v: त्वष्टाधिराजो रूपाणां पशूनामीश्वरः शिवः । दक्षिणानां तथा यज्ञो वेदानामृषयस्तथा ॥
data.md: Tvashtri is the king of Rudras, and Shiva of all creatures. Sacrifice is the foremost of all initiatory rites and Maghavat of the celestials.

data.v: दिशामुदीची विप्राणां सोमो राजा प्रतापवान् । कुबेरः सर्वयक्षाणां देवतानां पुरंदरः । एष भूतादिकः सर्गः प्रजानां च प्रजापतिः ॥
data.md: The North is the lord of all the points of the compass; the energetic Soma is the lord of all learned Brahmanas. Kubera is the lord of all precious gems, and Purandara of all the celestials.

data.v: सर्वेषामेव भूतानामहं ब्रह्ममयो महान् । भूतं परतरं मत्तो विष्णोर्वापि न विद्यते ॥
राजाधिराजः सर्वासां विष्णुर्ब्रह्ममयो महान् । ईश्वरं तं विजानीमः स विभुः स प्रजापतिः ॥
नरकिंनरयक्षाणां गन्धर्वोरगरक्षसाम् । देवदानवनागानां सर्वेषामीश्वरो हि सः ॥
data.md: He is the ruler of men and Kinnaras and Yakshas and Gandharvas, and snakes and Rakshasas, and celestials and Danavas and Nagas.

data.v: भगदेवानुयातानां सर्वासां वामलोचना । माहेश्वरी महादेवी प्रोच्यते पार्वतीति या ॥
data.md: Among those that are followed by persons full of desire is the great goddess Mahesvari having beautiful eyes.

data.v: उमां देवीं विजानीत नारीणामुत्तमां शुभाम् । रतीनां वसुमत्यस्तु स्त्रीणामप्सरसस्तथा ॥
data.md: She is otherwisc called by the name of Parvati. Know that the goddess Uma is the foremost and the most auspicious of women. Ainong women who are a source of pleasure, the foremost are the Apsaras who are endued with great splendour.

data.v: धर्मकामाश्च राजानो ब्राह्मणा धर्मलक्षणाः । तस्माद्राजा द्विजातीनां प्रयतेतेह रक्षणे ॥
data.md: Kings are desirous of acquiring piety, and Brahmanas are causeways of Piety. Therefore, the king should always strive to protect the twice-born ones.

data.v: राज्ञां हि विषये येषामवसीदन्ति साधवः । हीनास्ते स्वगुणैः सर्वैः प्रेत्यावाङ्मार्गगामिनः ॥
data.md: Those kings in whose kingdoms good men languish are considered as bereft of the virtues of their order. Hereafter they have to go into wrong paths.

data.v: राज्ञां तु विषये येषां साधवः परिरक्षिताः । तेऽस्मिँल्लोके प्रमोदन्ते प्रेत्य चानन्त्यमेव च । प्राप्नुवन्ति महात्मान इति वित्त द्विजर्षभाः ॥
data.md: Those kings in whose territories good men are protected, rejoice in this world and enjoy happiness in the next.

data.v: अत ऊर्ध्वं प्रवक्ष्यामि नियतं धर्मलक्षणम् । अहिंसालक्षणो धर्मो हिंसा चाधर्मलक्षणा ॥
प्रकाशलक्षणा देवा मनुष्याः कर्मलक्षणाः । शब्दलक्षणमाकाशं वायुस्तु स्पर्शलक्षणः ॥
ज्योतिषां लक्षणं रूपमापश्च रसलक्षणाः । धरणी सर्वभूतानां पृथिवी गन्धलक्षणा ॥
स्वरव्यञ्जनसंस्कारा भारती सत्यलक्षणा । मनसो लक्षणं चिन्ता तथोक्ता बुद्धिरन्वयात् ॥
मनसा चिन्तयानोऽर्थान्बुद्ध्या चैव व्यवस्यति । बुद्धिर्हि व्यवसायेन लक्ष्यते नात्र संशयः ॥
लक्षणं महतो ध्यानमव्यक्तं साधुलक्षणम् । प्रवृत्तिलक्षणो योगो ज्ञानं संन्यासलक्षणम् ॥
तस्माज्ज्ञानं पुरस्कृत्य संन्यसेदिह बुद्धिमान् । संन्यासी ज्ञानसंयुक्तः प्राप्नोति परमां गतिम् । अतीतोऽद्वंद्वमभ्येति तमोमृत्युजरातिगम् ॥
data.md: The man who follows renunciation and who is endued with knowledge, who is above all pairs of opposites, as also darkness, death, and decrepitude, attains to the highest goal.

data.v: धर्मलक्षणसंयुक्तमुक्तं वो विधिवन्मया । गुणानां ग्रहणं सम्यग्वक्ष्याम्यहमतः परम् ॥
data.md: I have thus described to you duly what the characteristics are of duty. I shall, after this tell you of the comprehension of qualities.

data.v: पार्थिवो यस्तु गन्धो वै घ्राणेनेह स गृह्यते । घ्राणस्थश्च तथा वायुर्गन्धज्ञाने विधीयते ॥
data.md: Smell, which belongs to earth, is seized by the nose. The wind, which dwells in the nose is likewise appointed as an agent) in the perception of smell.

data.v: अपां धातुरसो नित्यं जिह्वया स तु गृह्यते । जिह्वास्थश्च तथा सोमो रसज्ञाने विधीयते ॥
data.md: Taste is the essence of water. That is perceived by the tongue. Soma, who lives in the tongue, is appointed likewise in the perception of taste.

data.v: ज्योतिषश्च गुणो रूपं चक्षुषा तच्च गृह्यते । चक्षुःस्थश्च तथादित्यो रूपज्ञाने विधीयते ॥
data.md: The quality of a lighted body is colour. That is apprehended by the eye. Aditya who always lives in the eye has been appointed in the perception of colour.

data.v: वायव्यस्तु तथा स्पर्शस्त्वचा प्रज्ञायते च सः । त्वक्स्थश्चैव तथा वायुः स्पर्शज्ञाने विधीयते ॥
data.md: Touch always belongs to the wind (as its quality). That is perceived by the skin. The wind that always lives in the skin has been appointed in apprehending touch.

data.v: आकाशस्य गुणो घोषः श्रोत्रेण स तु गृह्यते । श्रोत्रस्थाश्च दिशः सर्वाः शब्दज्ञाने प्रकीर्तिताः ॥
data.md: The quality of a ether is sound. That is seized by the car. All the quarters, which live in the ear, have been appointed in apprehending sound.

data.v: मनसस्तु गुणश्चिन्ता प्रज्ञया स तु गृह्यते । हृदिस्थचेतनाधातुर्मनोज्ञाने विधीयते ॥
data.md: The quality of the mind is thought. That is seized by the understanding. The upholder of consciousness, living in the heart, has been appointed in apprehending the mind.

data.v: बुद्धिरध्यवसायेन ध्यानेन च महांस्तथा । निश्चित्य ग्रहणं नित्यमव्यक्तं नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: The understanding is appended in the form of determination or certitude, and principle of Greatness in the form of knowledge. The unperceived (Nature) has been, it is evident, appointed for the seizure of all things after certitude. There is no doubt in this.

data.v: अलिङ्गग्रहणो नित्यः क्षेत्रज्ञो निर्गुणात्मकः । तस्मादलिङ्गः क्षेत्रज्ञः केवलं ज्ञानलक्षणः ॥
data.md: The Kshetrajna which is eternal and is shorn of qualities about its essence, is incapable of being seized by symbols. Hence, the characteristic of the Kshetrajna, which is without symbols, is purely knowledge.

data.v: अव्यक्तं क्षेत्रमुद्दिष्टं गुणानां प्रभवाप्ययम् । सदा पश्याम्यहं लीनं विजानामि शृणोमि च ॥
data.md: The unmanifest lives in the symbol called. Kshetra, and is that in which the qualities are produced and absorbed. I always see, know, and hear it (though) it is hidden.

data.v: पुरुषस्तद्विजानीते तस्मात्क्षेत्रज्ञ उच्यते । गुणवृत्तं तथा कृत्स्नं क्षेत्रज्ञः परिपश्यति ॥
data.md: Purusha knows it; therefore is he called Kshetrajna. The Kshetrajna perceives also the action of the qualities and absence of their actions.

data.v: आदिमध्यावसानान्तं सृज्यमानमचेतनम् । न गुणा विदुरात्मानं सृज्यमानं पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: The qualities, which are created repeatedly, do not know themselves, being unintelligent, as entities to be created and gifted with a beginning, middle, and end.

data.v: न सत्यं वेद वै कश्चित्क्षेत्रज्ञस्त्वेव विन्दति । गुणानां गुणभूतानां यत्परं परतो महत् ॥
data.md: No one else, but the Kshetrajna, comes by that which is the highest and great and which is above the qualities and those entities which are born of the qualities.

data.v: तस्माद्गुणांश्च तत्त्वं च परित्यज्येह तत्त्ववित् । क्षीणदोषो गुणान्हित्वा क्षेत्रज्ञं प्रविशत्यथ ॥
data.md: Hence, who understands duties, renouncing qualities and the understanding, and having his destroyed, and transcending the qualities, enters the Kshetrajna.

data.v: निर्द्वंद्वो निर्नमस्कारो निःस्वधाकार एव च । अचलश्चानिकेतश्च क्षेत्रज्ञः स परो विभुः ॥
data.md: One who is free from all pairs of opposites, who never bends his head to any one, who is divested of Svaha, who is immovable, and hom ess, is the Kshetrajna. He is the Supreme Lord. one sons

data.v: यदादिमध्यपर्यन्तं ग्रहणोपायमेव च । नामलक्षणसंयुक्तं सर्वं वक्ष्यामि तत्त्वतः ॥
data.md: Brahmana said I shall now tell you truly about all that which has a beginning, middle, and end, and which has name and characteristics, together, the means of apprehension.

data.v: अहः पूर्वं ततो रात्रिर्मासाः शुक्लादयः स्मृताः । श्रविष्ठादीनि ऋक्षाणि ऋतवः शिशिरादयः ॥
data.md: It has been said that the Day came first. Then came Night. The Months are said to have the lighted fortnights first. The constellations have Shravana for their first; the Seasons have that of dews (viz., Winter) for their first.

data.v: भूमिरादिस्तु गन्धानां रसानामाप एव च । रूपाणां ज्योतिरादिस्तु स्पर्शादिर्वायुरुच्यते । शब्दस्यादिस्तथाकाशमेष भूतकृतो गुणः ॥
data.md: Earth is the source of all smells; and Water of all tastes. The Solar light is the source of all colours; the wind of all sensations of touch.

data.v: अतः परं प्रवक्ष्यामि भूतानामादिमुत्तमम् । आदित्यो ज्योतिषामादिरग्निर्भूतादिरिष्यते ॥
सावित्री सर्वविद्यानां देवतानां प्रजापतिः । ओंकारः सर्ववेदानां वचसां प्राण एव च । यद्यस्मिन्नियतं लोके सर्वं सावित्रमुच्यते ॥
data.md: The syllable Om is the first of all the Vedas, and the vital air Prana is the first of all winds. Savitri is the first of all religious observances.

data.v: गायत्री छन्दसामादिः पशूनामज उच्यते । गावश्चतुष्पदामादिर्मनुष्याणां द्विजातयः ॥
data.md: The Gayatri is the first of all metres, goat is the first of all (sacrificial) animals, Kin are the first of all quadrupeds. The twice-born ones are the first of all human beings.

data.v: श्येनः पतत्रिणामादिर्यज्ञानां हुतमुत्तमम् । परिसर्पिणां तु सर्वेषां ज्येष्ठः सर्पो द्विजोत्तमाः ॥
data.md: The hawk is the first of all birds. Of sacrifices the first is the pouring of clarified butter on the fire. Of all reptiles the first, O foremost of twice-born ones, is the snake.

data.v: कृतमादिर्युगानां च सर्वेषां नात्र संशयः । हिरण्यं सर्वरत्नानामोषधीनां यवास्तथा ॥
data.md: The Krita is the first of all the cycles; there is no doubt in this. Gold is the first of all precious things.

data.v: सर्वेषां भक्ष्यभोज्यानामन्नं परममुच्यते । द्रवाणां चैव सर्वेषां पेयानामाप उत्तमाः ॥
data.md: Barely is the first of all plants. Food is the first of all things to be eaten or swallowed. Water is the first of all liquid substances to be drunk.

data.v: स्थावराणां च भूतानां सर्वेषामविशेषतः । ब्रह्मक्षेत्रं सदा पुण्यं प्लक्षः प्रथमजः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Of all immobile objects without distinction, Plaksha is said to be the first, that ever holy field of Brahman.

data.v: अहं प्रजापतीनां च सर्वेषां नात्र संशयः । मम विष्णुरचिन्त्यात्मा स्वयंभूरिति स स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Of all the Prajapatis I am the first. There is no doubt in this, Of inconceivable soul, the self consistent Vishnu is said to be my superior.

data.v: पर्वतानां महामेरुः सर्वेषामग्रजः स्मृतः । दिशां च प्रदिशां चोर्ध्वा दिग्जाता प्रथमं तथा ॥
data.md: Of all the mountains the great Meru is said to be the first-born. Of all the cardinal and subsidiary points of the horizon, the eastern is said to be the foremost and first-born.

data.v: तथा त्रिपथगा गङ्गा नदीनामग्रजा स्मृता । तथा सरोदपानानां सर्वेषां सागरोऽग्रजः ॥
data.md: Ganga having three courses is said to be first-born of all rivers. Likewise, of all wells and reservoirs of waters, the ocean is said to be the first born.

data.v: देवदानवभूतानां पिशाचोरगरक्षसाम् । नरकिंनरयक्षाणां सर्वेषामीश्वरः प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Ishvara is the Supreme Lord of all the celestials and Danavas and ghosts and Pishachas and snakes and Rakshasas, and human beings and Kinnaras and Yakshas.

data.v: आदिर्विश्वस्य जगतो विष्णुर्ब्रह्ममयो महान् । भूतं परतरं तस्मात्त्रैलोक्ये नेह विद्यते ॥
data.md: The great Vishnu, who is full of Brahma, than whom there is no higher being in the three worlds is the first of all the universe.

data.v: आश्रमाणां च गार्हस्थ्यं सर्वेषां नात्र संशयः । लोकानामादिरव्यक्तं सर्वस्यान्तस्तदेव च ॥
data.md: Of all the modes of life, that of the householder is the first. Of this there is not doubt. The Unmanifest is the source of all the worlds as well as is the end of every thing.

data.v: अहान्यस्तमयान्तानि उदयान्ता च शर्वरी । सुखस्यान्तः सदा दुःखं दुःखस्यान्तः सदा सुखम् ॥
data.md: Days end with the sun's setting and Nights with the sun's rising. The end of pleasure is always sorrow, and the end of sorrow is always pleasure.

data.v: सर्वे क्षयान्ता निचयाः पतनान्ताः समुच्छ्रयाः । संयोगा विप्रयोगान्ता मरणान्तं हि जीवितम् ॥
data.md: All collections have expenditure for their end, ana all ascents have falls for their end. All associations have dissociations for their end, and life has death for its end.

data.v: सर्वं कृतं विनाशान्तं जातस्य मरणं ध्रुवम् । अशाश्वतं हि लोकेऽस्मिन्सर्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम् ॥
data.md: All action ends in destruction, and all that is born is certain to meet with death. Every mobile and immobile thing in this world is fickle.

data.v: इष्टं दत्तं तपोऽधीतं व्रतानि नियमाश्च ये । सर्वमेतद्विनाशान्तं ज्ञानस्यान्तो न विद्यते ॥
data.md: Sacrifice, gift, penances, study, vow, observances, all these have destruction to their end. Of knowledge, there is no end.

data.v: तस्माज्ज्ञानेन शुद्धेन प्रसन्नात्मा समाहितः । निर्ममो निरहंकारो मुच्यते सर्वपाप्मभिः ॥
data.md: Hence, one who has a tranquil soul, who has subjugated his senses, who is freed from the sense of mineness, who is devoid of egoism, is freed from all sins by pure knowledge.

data.v: बुद्धिसारं मनस्तम्भमिन्द्रियग्रामबन्धनम् । महाभूतारविष्कम्भं निमेषपरिवेष्टनम् ॥
data.md: Brahman said The wheel of life moves on. It has the understanding for its strength; the mind for the pole; the group of senses for its fetters, the (five) great elements for its have, and home for its circumference.

data.v: जराशोकसमाविष्टं व्याधिव्यसनसंचरम् । देशकालविचारीदं श्रमव्यायामनिस्वनम् ॥
data.md: It is possessed by decrepitude and sorrow and it has diseases and calamities for its progeny. That wheel relates in time and place. It has toil and exercise for its noise.

data.v: अहोरात्रपरिक्षेपं शीतोष्णपरिमण्डलम् । सुखदुःखान्तसंक्लेशं क्षुत्पिपासावकीलनम् ॥
data.md: Day and Night are the rotations of that wheel. It is encircled by heat and cold. Pleasure and pain are its joints, are hunger and thirst are the nails fixed into it.

data.v: छायातपविलेखं च निमेषोन्मेषविह्वलम् । घोरमोहजनाकीर्णं वर्तमानमचेतनम् ॥
data.md: Sun-shine and shade are the ruts. It is capable of being moved during even such a short space of time as is taken up by the opening and the closing of the eyelid. It is covered with the dreadful waters of delusion. It is ever revolving and void of consciousness.

data.v: मासार्धमासगणितं विषमं लोकसंचरम् । तमोनिचयपङ्कं च रजोवेगप्रवर्तकम् ॥
data.md: It is measured by months and half-months. It is not uniform (being ever changing), and moves through all the worlds. Penance and vows are its mud, Passions' force is its mover.

data.v: सत्त्वालंकारदीप्तं च गुणसंघातमण्डलम् । स्वरविग्रहनाभीकं शोकसंघातवर्तनम् ॥
क्रियाकारणसंयुक्तं रागविस्तारमायतम् । लोभेप्सापरिसंख्यातं विविक्तज्ञानसंभवम् ॥
data.md: It has actions and the instruments of action. It is large and is extended by attachments. It is rendered unsteady by cupidity and desire. It is produced by varicgated Ignorance.

data.v: भयमोहपरीवारं भूतसंमोहकारकम् । आनन्दप्रीतिधारं च कामक्रोधपरिग्रहम् ॥
data.md: It is full of fear and delusion, and is the cause of the delusion of all beings. It moves towards joy and pleasure, and has desire and anger for its possession.

data.v: महदादिविशेषान्तमसक्तप्रभवाव्ययम् । मनोजवनमश्रान्तं कालचक्रं प्रवर्तते ॥
data.md: It is made up of principles beginning with greatness and ending with the gross elements. It is marked by production and destruction going on ceaselessly. Its speed is like that of the mind, and it has the mind for its limit.

data.v: एतद्द्वंद्वसमायुक्तं कालचक्रमचेतनम् । विसृजेत्संक्षिपेच्चापि बोधयेत्सामरं जगत् ॥
data.md: This wheel of life which is connected with pairs of opposites and devoid of consciousness, the universe with the very immortals should cast away, abridge, and chcek.

data.v: कालचक्रप्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं चैव तत्त्वतः । यस्तु वेद नरो नित्यं न स भूतेषु मुह्यति ॥
data.md: That man who ever understands correctly the motion and stoppage of this whcel of life, is never seen to be deluded, among all creatures.

data.v: विमुक्तः सर्वसंक्लेशैः सर्वद्वंद्वातिगो मुनिः । विमुक्तः सर्वपापेभ्यः प्राप्नोति परमां गतिम् ॥
data.md: Freed from all impressions, divested of all Pairs of opposites, freed froin all sins, he। attains to the highest goal.

data.v: गृहस्थो ब्रह्मचारी च वानप्रस्थोऽथ भिक्षुकः । चत्वार आश्रमाः प्रोक्ताः सर्वे गार्हस्थ्यमूलकाः ॥
data.md: The householder, the Brahmacharin the hermit and the mendicant, these are modes of life have all been said to the householder's mode for their root.

data.v: यः कश्चिदिह लोके च ह्यागमः संप्रकीर्तितः । तस्यान्तगमनं श्रेयः कीर्तिरेषा सनातनी ॥
data.md: The observance of every system of rules is prescribed in this world. Such observance has always been highly spoken of.

data.v: संस्कारैः संस्कृतः पूर्वं यथावच्चरितव्रतः । जातौ गुणविशिष्टायां समावर्तेत वेदवित् ॥
data.md: He who has been first purified by ceremonies, who has duly observed vows, who belongs by birth to a family of high qualifications, and who understands the Vedas, should return (from his preceptor's house).

data.v: स्वदारनिरतो दान्तः शिष्टाचारो जितेन्द्रियः । पञ्चभिश्च महायज्ञैः श्रद्दधानो यजेत ह ॥
