data.md: Always devoted to his married wife, acting like a good man, with his senses under control, and full of faith, one should in this world perform the five sacrifice.

data.v: देवतातिथिशिष्टाशी निरतो वेदकर्मसु । इज्याप्रदानयुक्तश्च यथाशक्ति यथाविधि ॥
data.md: He who cats the residue after fecding celestials and guests, who is given to the observance of Vedic rites, who duly celebrates, according to his means, sacrifices and gifts, who is unduly active with his hands and feet, who is unduly active with his eye, who is devoted to penances, who is not unduly active with his words and limits, comes under the category of Shishta or the good.

data.v: न पाणिपादचपलो न नेत्रचपलो मुनिः । न च वागङ्गचपल इति शिष्टस्य गोचरः ॥
data.md: He who cats the residue after fecding celestials and guests, who is given to the observance of Vedic rites, who duly celebrates, according to his means, sacrifices and gifts, who is unduly active with his hands and feet, who is unduly active with his eye, who is devoted to penances, who is not unduly active with his words and limits, comes under the category of Shishta or the good.

data.v: नित्ययज्ञोपवीती स्याच्छुक्लवासाः शुचिव्रतः । नियतो दमदानाभ्यां सदा शिष्टैश्च संविशेत् ॥
data.md: One should always bear the sacred thread, wear white (clean) cloths, observe pure vows, and should always mix with good men, making gifts and practising self-control.

data.v: जितशिश्नोदरो मैत्रः शिष्टाचारसमाहितः । वैणवीं धारयेद्यष्टिं सोदकं च कमण्डलुम् ॥
data.md: One should govern his lust and stomach, practise universal compassion, and be characterised by good conduct. One should bear a bamboo-stick, and a water-pot filled with water.

data.v: अधीत्याध्यापनं कुर्यात्तथा यजनयाजने । दानं प्रतिग्रहं चैव षड्गुणां वृत्तिमाचरेत् ॥
data.md: Having studied, one should teach likewise should celebrate sacrifices himself and officiate at the sacrifices of others. One should also make gifts made to oneself. Indeed, one's conduct should be marked by these six deeds.

data.v: त्रीणि कर्माणि यानीह ब्राह्मणानां तु जीविका । याजनाध्यापने चोभे शुद्धाच्चापि प्रतिग्रहः ॥
data.md: Know that three of these acts should form the livelihood of the Brahmanas, viz., teaching (pupils), officiating at the sacrifices of others, and the acceptance of gifts from a person who is pure.

data.v: अवशेषाणि चान्यानि त्रीणि कर्माणि यानि तु । दानमध्ययनं यज्ञो धर्मयुक्तानि तानि तु ॥
data.md: As to the other duties which remain, numberir:g three viz., making of gifts, study, and sacrifice, these are accompanied by merit.

data.v: तेष्वप्रमादं कुर्वीत त्रिषु कर्मसु धर्मवित् । दान्तो मैत्रः क्षमायुक्तः सर्वभूतसमो मुनिः ॥
data.md: Observant of penances, self-controlled, practising universal mercy and forgiveness, and loO king upon all creatures impartially, the man who is conversant with duties should never be careless about those three acts.

data.v: सर्वमेतद्यथाशक्ति विप्रो निर्वर्तयञ्शुचिः । एवं युक्तो जयेत्स्वर्गं गृहस्थः संशितव्रतः ॥
data.md: The learned Brahmana of pure hear, who leads the domestic mode of life and practise rigid vows, thus devoted and thus performing all duties to the best of his power, succeeds in conquering the celestial region.

data.v: एवमेतेन मार्गेण पूर्वोक्तेन यथाविधि । अधीतवान्यथाशक्ति तथैव ब्रह्मचर्यवान् ॥
स्वधर्मनिरतो विद्वान्सर्वेन्द्रिययतो मुनिः । गुरोः प्रियहिते युक्तः सत्यधर्मपरः शुचिः ॥
गुरुणा समनुज्ञातो भुञ्जीतान्नमकुत्सयन् । हविष्यभैक्ष्यभुक्चापि स्थानासनविहारवान् ॥
द्विकालमग्निं जुह्वानः शुचिर्भूत्वा समाहितः । धारयीत सदा दण्डं बैल्वं पालाशमेव वा ॥
data.md: He should pour libations on the fire twice a day, having purified himself and with concentrated mind. He should always carry a staff made of Bilva or Palasha.

data.v: क्षौमं कार्पासिकं वापि मृगाजिनमथापि वा । सर्वं काषायरक्तं स्याद्वासो वापि द्विजस्य ह ॥
data.md: The raiment's of the twice-born man should be linen, or of cotton, or dear-skin, or a cloth that is entirely brown-red.

data.v: मेखला च भवेन्मौञ्जी जटी नित्योदकस्तथा । यज्ञोपवीती स्वाध्यायी अलुप्तनियतव्रतः ॥
data.md: There should also be a girdle made of Munja-grass. He should bear maited locks on head, and should perform his ablutions daily. He should bear the sacred thread, study the scriptures, divest himself of cupidity, and be steady in the observance of vows.

data.v: पूताभिश्च तथैवाद्भिः सदा दैवततर्पणम् । भावेन नियतः कुर्वन्ब्रह्मचारी प्रशस्यते ॥
data.md: He should also satisfy the celestials with oblations of pure water, his mind being controlled the while, Such a Brahmacharin is worthy of being lauded.

data.v: एवं युक्तो जयेत्स्वर्गमूर्ध्वरेताः समाहितः । न संसरति जातीषु परमं स्थानमाश्रितः ॥
data.md: With vital seed drawn up and mind concentrated, one who is thus devoted, succeeds in conquering the celestial region. Having attained to the Highest seat, he has not to return to birth.

data.v: संस्कृतः सर्वसंस्कारैस्तथैव ब्रह्मचर्यवान् । ग्रामान्निष्क्रम्य चारण्यं मुनिः प्रव्रजितो वसेत् ॥
data.md: Cleansed by all purificatory rites and having lived as a Brahmacharin, one should next go out of his village and next live as an ascetic in the forest, having cast off (all attachments).

data.v: चर्मवल्कलसंवीतः स्वयं प्रातरुपस्पृशेत् । अरण्यगोचरो नित्यं न ग्रामं प्रविशेत्पुनः ॥
data.md: Clad in animal skins or barks of trees, he should perform his ablutions morning and evening. Always living within the forest, he should never return to an inhabited placc.

data.v: अर्चयन्नतिथीन्काले दद्याच्चापि प्रतिश्रयम् । फलपत्रावरैर्मूलैः श्यामाकेन च वर्तयन् ॥
data.md: Honouring guests when they come, he should give them shelter, and himself live upon fruits and leaves and common roots, and Shyamaka.

data.v: प्रवृत्तमुदकं वायुं सर्वं वानेयमा तृणात् । प्राश्नीयादानुपूर्व्येण यथादीक्षमतन्द्रितः ॥
data.md: He should, without being idle, live on such water as he gets, and air, and all forest products. He should live upon these, in due order, according to the regulations of his initiation.

data.v: आमूलफलभिक्षाभिरर्चेदतिथिमागतम् । यद्भक्षः स्यात्ततो दद्याद्भिक्षां नित्यमतन्द्रितः ॥
data.md: He should honour the guest that comes to him with alms of fruits and roots. He should then, without idleness, always give whatever other food he may have.

data.v: देवतातिथिपूर्वं च सदा भुञ्जीत वाग्यतः । अस्कन्दितमनाश्चैव लघ्वाशी देवताश्रयः ॥
data.md: Controlling speech the while, he should eat after satisfying celestials and guests. His mind should be shorn of envy. He should eat little, and depend always on the celestials.

data.v: दान्तो मैत्रः क्षमायुक्तः केशश्मश्रु च धारयन् । जुह्वन्स्वाध्यायशीलश्च सत्यधर्मपरायणः ॥
data.md: Self-controlled, practising universal mercy, and endued with forgiveness, he should wear both beard and hair. Celebrating sacrifices and devoting himself to the study of the scriptures, he should be steady in the observance of the duty of truth.

data.v: त्यक्तदेहः सदा दक्षो वननित्यः समाहितः । एवं युक्तो जयेत्स्वर्गं वानप्रस्थो जितेन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: With body always in a state of purity, gifted with cleverness, ever living in the forest, with concentrated mind, and senses, in subjection, a hermit, thus devoting himself, would conquer the celestial region.

data.v: गृहस्थो ब्रह्मचारी च वानप्रस्थोऽथ वा पुनः । य इच्छेन्मोक्षमास्थातुमुत्तमां वृत्तिमाश्रयेत् ॥
data.md: A houscholder, or Brahmacharin, or forestrecluse, who would wise to acquire Liberation, should have recourses to that which has been called the best course of conduct.

data.v: अभयं सर्वभूतेभ्यो दत्त्वा नैष्कर्म्यमाचरेत् । सर्वभूतहितो मैत्रः सर्वेन्द्रिययतो मुनिः ॥
data.md: Having granted to all creatures the pledge of utter abstention from harm, he should renounce all action, he should contribute to the happiness of all creatures, practise universal friendliness, govern all his senses, and be an ascetic.

data.v: अयाचितमसंकॢप्तमुपपन्नं यदृच्छया । जोषयेत सदा भोज्यं ग्रासमागतमस्पृहः ॥
data.md: He should always practise a sinless mode of conduct, which is not deceptive or crooked. Shorn of attachments he should always make one who comes as a guest eat (at least) a morsel of food.

data.v: यात्रामात्रं च भुञ्जीत केवलं प्राणयात्रिकम् । धर्मलब्धं तथाश्नीयान्न काममनुवर्तयेत् ॥
data.md: He should cat just enough for livelihood, the maintenance of life. He should eat only such food as has been got by fair means, and should not pursue the dictates of desire.

data.v: ग्रासादाच्छादनाच्चान्यन्न गृह्णीयात्कथंचन । यावदाहारयेत्तावत्प्रतिगृह्णीत नान्यथा ॥
data.md: He should never accept any other thing than food and clothing only. He should, again, accept only as much as he can cat and nothing more.

data.v: परेभ्यो न प्रतिग्राह्यं न च देयं कदाचन । दैन्यभावाच्च भूतानां संविभज्य सदा बुधः ॥
data.md: He should not be induced to accept gifts from others, nor should he make gifts to others. Owing to the helplessness of creatures, the wise man should always share with others.

data.v: नाददीत परस्वानि न गृह्णीयादयाचितम् । न किंचिद्विषयं भुक्त्वा स्पृहयेत्तस्य वै पुनः ॥
data.md: He should not misappropriate others belongings, nor should he take anything without being asked. He should not, having enjoyed anything, become so attached to it as to seek for it once more.

data.v: मृदमापस्तथाश्मानं पत्रपुष्पफलानि च । असंवृतानि गृह्णीयात्प्रवृत्तानीह कार्यवान् ॥
data.md: One should take only earth, water, pebbles, leaves, flowers, and fruits, which are not owned by any body, as they come, when one wishes to do any act.

data.v: न शिल्पजीविकां जीवेद्द्विरन्नं नोत कामयेत् । न द्वेष्टा नोपदेष्टा च भवेत निरुपस्कृतः । श्रद्धापूतानि भुञ्जीत निमित्तानि विवर्जयेत् ॥
data.md: One should not live by the occupation of an artisan, nor should he covet gold. One should not hate, nor teach; nor should one have any belongings.

data.v: मुधावृत्तिरसक्तश्च सर्वभूतैरसंविदम् । कृत्वा वह्निं चरेद्भैक्ष्यं विधूमे भुक्तवज्जने ॥
वृत्ते शरावसंपाते भैक्ष्यं लिप्सेत मोक्षवित् । लाभे न च प्रहृष्येत नालाभे विमना भवेत् ॥
data.md: The person who is conversant with the conduct that leads to Liberation should seek for alms after the vessels (used in coO king) have been washed. He should never rejoice when he gets anything, and never lose heart if he gets nothing.

data.v: मात्राशी कालमाकाङ्क्षंश्चरेद्भैक्ष्यं समाहितः । लाभं साधारणं नेच्छेन्न भुञ्जीताभिपूजितः । अभिपूजितलाभाद्धि विजुगुप्सेत भिक्षुकः ॥
data.md: Seeking just what is necessary for supporting life, he should, with concentrated mind, go about for alms, waiting for the proper time. He should not wish for carnings in common with others, nor eat when honoured.

data.v: शुक्तान्यम्लानि तिक्तानि कषायकटुकानि च । नास्वादयीत भुञ्जानो रसांश्च मधुरांस्तथा । यात्रामात्रं च भुञ्जीत केवलं प्राणयात्रिकम् ॥
data.md: He should not also eat such kinds of food as have a sweet taste. He should eat only so inuch as is necessary to keep him alive.

data.v: असंरोधेन भूतानां वृत्तिं लिप्सेत मोक्षवित् । न चान्यमनुभिक्षेत भिक्षमाणः कथंचन ॥
न संनिकाशयेद्धर्मं विविक्ते विरजाश्चरेत् । शून्यागारमरण्यं वा वृक्षमूलं नदीं तथा । प्रतिश्रयार्थं सेवेत पार्वतीं वा पुनर्गुहाम् ॥
ग्रामैकरात्रिको ग्रीष्मे वर्षास्वेकत्र वा वसेत् । अध्वा सूर्येण निर्दिष्टः कीटवच्च चरेन्महीम् ॥
दयार्थं चैव भूतानां समीक्ष्य पृथिवीं चरेत् । संचयांश्च न कुर्वीत स्नेहवासं च वर्जयेत् ॥
पूतेन चाम्भसा नित्यं कार्यं कुर्वीत मोक्षवित् । उपस्पृशेदुद्धृताभिरद्भिश्च पुरुषः सदा ॥
अहिंसा ब्रह्मचर्यं च सत्यमार्जवमेव च । अक्रोधश्चानसूया च दमो नित्यमपैशुनम् ॥
अष्टास्वेतेषु युक्तः स्याद्व्रतेषु नियतेन्द्रियः । अपापमशठं वृत्तमजिह्मं नित्यमाचरेत् ॥
आशीर्युक्तानि कर्माणि हिंसायुक्तानि यानि च । लोकसंग्रहधर्मं च नैव कुर्यान्न कारयेत् ॥
data.md: One should not perform, nor cause to perform, any such deed as involves expectation of fruit or destruction of life or the hoarding of riches or articles.

data.v: सर्वभावानतिक्रम्य लघुमात्रः परिव्रजेत् । समः सर्वेषु भूतेषु स्थावरेषु चरेषु च ॥
data.md: Rejecting all objects, content with a very little, one should move about (homeless), pursuing an equal conduct towards all creatures mobile and immobile.

data.v: परं नोद्वेजयेत्कंचिन्न च कस्यचिदुद्विजेत् । विश्वास्यः सर्वभूतानामग्र्यो मोक्षविदुच्यते ॥
data.md: One should never annoy another being; nor should one be annoyed with another. He who is trusted by all crcatures is considered as the foremost of those persons who understand Liberation.

data.v: अनागतं च न ध्यायेन्नातीतमनुचिन्तयेत् । वर्तमानमुपेक्षेत कालाकाङ्क्षी समाहितः ॥
data.md: One should not think of the past nor feel anxious about the future. One should disregard the present, biding time, with fixed mind.

data.v: न चक्षुषा न मनसा न वाचा दूषयेत्क्वचित् । न प्रत्यक्षं परोक्षं वा किंचिद्दुष्टं समाचरेत् ॥
data.md: One should never defile anything by eye, mind, or speech. Nor should one do anything which is wrong, openly or in secret.

data.v: इन्द्रियाण्युपसंहृत्य कूर्मोऽङ्गानीव सर्वशः । क्षीणेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्निरीक्षेत निरिन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: Withdrawing his senses like the tortoise withdrawing its limbs, one should govern his senses and mind, cultivate a thoroughly peaceful understanding, and seek to master every subject.

data.v: निर्द्वंद्वो निर्नमस्कारो निःस्वाहाकार एव च । निर्ममो निरहंकारो निर्योगक्षेम एव च ॥
data.md: Freed from all pairs of opposites, never bending his head in respect, abstaining from the rites requiring the utterance of Svaha, one should be free from mineness, and egoism. with purified soul, one should never seek to acquire what one has not and protect what one has.

data.v: निराशीः सर्वभूतेषु निरासङ्गो निराश्रयः । सर्वज्ञः सर्वतो मुक्तो मुच्यते नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: Free from expectations shorn of qualities, endued with tranquility, one should be free from all attachments and should depend on one. Attached to one's Own self and understanding all subjects, one becomes, forsooth, liberated.

data.v: अपाणिपादपृष्ठं तमशिरस्कमनूदरम् । प्रहीणगुणकर्माणं केवलं विमलं स्थिरम् ॥
अगन्धरसमस्पर्शमरूपाशब्दमेव च । अत्वगस्थ्यथ वामज्जममांसमपि चैव ह ॥
निश्चिन्तमव्ययं नित्यं हृदिस्थमपि नित्यदा । सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं ये पश्यन्ति न ते मृताः ॥
न तत्र क्रमते बुद्धिर्नेन्द्रियाणि न देवताः । वेदा यज्ञाश्च लोकाश्च न तपो न पराक्रमः । यत्र ज्ञानवतां प्राप्तिरलिङ्गग्रहणा स्मृता ॥
data.md: There the understanding reaches not nor the senses, nor the celestials, nor the Vedas nor sacrifices, nor the regions (of superior bliss), nor penance nor vows.

data.v: तस्मादलिङ्गो धर्मज्ञो धर्मव्रतमनुव्रतः । गूढधर्माश्रितो विद्वानज्ञातचरितं चरेत् ॥
अमूढो मूढरूपेण चरेद्धर्ममदूषयन् । यथैनमवमन्येरन्परे सततमेव हि ॥
तथावृत्तश्चरेद्धर्मं सतां वर्त्माविदूषयन् । यो ह्येवं वृत्तसंपन्नः स मुनिः श्रेष्ठ उच्यते ॥
इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थांश्च महाभूतानि पञ्च च । मनोबुद्धिरथात्मानमव्यक्तं पुरुषं तथा ॥
सर्वमेतत्प्रसंख्याय सम्यक्संत्यज्य निर्मलः । ततः स्वर्गमवाप्नोति विमुक्तः सर्वबन्धनैः ॥
एतदेवान्तवेलायां परिसंख्याय तत्त्ववित् । ध्यायेदेकान्तमास्थाय मुच्यतेऽथ निराश्रयः ॥
निर्मुक्तः सर्वसङ्गेभ्यो वायुराकाशगो यथा । क्षीणकोशो निरातङ्कः प्राप्नोति परमं पदम् ॥
संन्यासं तप इत्याहुर्वृद्धा निश्चितदर्शिनः । ब्राह्मणा ब्रह्मयोनिस्था ज्ञानं ब्रह्म परं विदुः ॥
data.md: Brahman said The ancients who always used to speak truth, say that Renunciation is penance. Brahmanas, living in that which has Brahma for its origin understand Knowledge to be high Brahma.

data.v: अविदूरात्परं ब्रह्म वेदविद्याव्यपाश्रयम् । निर्द्वंद्वं निर्गुणं नित्यमचिन्त्यं गुह्यमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Brahma is very far off, and its attainment depends upon a knowledge of the Vedas. It is free from all pairs of opposites, it is shorn of all qualities; it is eternal; it is gifted with unthinkable qualities; it is supreme.

data.v: ज्ञानेन तपसा चैव धीराः पश्यन्ति तत्पदम् । निर्णिक्ततमसः पूता व्युत्क्रान्तरजसोऽमलाः ॥
data.md: It is by knowledge and penance that those gifted with wisdom see that which is the highest. Indeed, they who are of unsullied minds, who are purged of every sin, and who have transcended all passion and darkness (succeed in seeing it.)

data.v: तपसा क्षेममध्वानं गच्छन्ति परमैषिणः । संन्यासनिरता नित्यं ये ब्रह्मविदुषो जनाः ॥
data.md: They who are always given to renunciation, and who are conversant with the Vedas, succeed in attaining to the supreme Lord who is at one with the path of happiness and peace, by the help of penance.

data.v: तपः प्रदीप इत्याहुराचारो धर्मसाधकः । ज्ञानं त्वेव परं विद्म संन्यासस्तप उत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Penance, it has been said, is light. Conduct leads to piety. Knowledge is said to be the highest. Renunciation is the best penance.

data.v: यस्तु वेद निराबाधं ज्ञानं तत्त्वविनिश्चयात् । सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं स सर्वगतिरिष्यते ॥
data.md: He who understands self through accurate determination of all subjects, undisturbed, which is at one with Knowledge, and which lives in all principles, succeeds in going everywhere.

data.v: यो विद्वान्सहवासं च विवासं चैव पश्यति । तथैवैकत्वनानात्वे स दुःखात्परिमुच्यते ॥
data.md: That learned man who sees association and dissociation, and unity in diversity, is freed from misery.

data.v: यो न कामयते किंचिन्न किंचिदवमन्यते । इहलोकस्थ एवैष ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते ॥
data.md: He who never desires for anything, who despises nothing, becomes eligible, even when living in this world, for assimilation with Brahma.

data.v: प्रधानगुणतत्त्वज्ञः सर्वभूतविधानवित् । निर्ममो निरहंकारो मुच्यते नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: He who is conversant with the truths about qualities of Greatness, and understands the Pradhana as existing in all principles, who is free from mineness and egoism, forsooth, becomes liberated.

data.v: निर्द्वंद्वो निर्नमस्कारो निःस्वधाकार एव च । निर्गुणं नित्यमद्वंद्वं प्रशमेनैव गच्छति ॥
data.md: Freed from all pairs of opposites, never bending his head in respect, abstaining from the rites requiring the utterance of Svaha, one should be free from mineness, and egoism. with purified soul, one should never seek to acquire what one has not and protect what one has.

data.v: हित्वा गुणमयं सर्वं कर्म जन्तुः शुभाशुभम् । उभे सत्यानृते हित्वा मुच्यते नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: Renouncing all action, good or bad, developed from qualities, and casting off both truth and falschood, a creature, forsooth, becomes liberated.

data.v: अव्यक्तबीजप्रभवो बुद्धिस्कन्धमयो महान् । महाहंकारविटप इन्द्रियान्तरकोटरः ॥
महाभूतविशाखश्च विशेषप्रतिशाखवान् । सदापर्णः सदापुष्पः शुभाशुभफलोदयः । आजीवः सर्वभूतानां ब्रह्मवृक्षः सनातनः ॥
एतच्छित्त्वा च भित्त्वा च ज्ञानेन परमासिना । हित्वा चामरतां प्राप्य जह्याद्वै मृत्युजन्मनी । निर्ममो निरहंकारो मुच्यते नात्र संशयः ॥
द्वावेतौ पक्षिणौ नित्यौ सखायौ चाप्यचेतनौ । एताभ्यां तु परो यस्य चेतनावानिति स्मृतः ॥
data.md: These are the two birds, which are immutable, which are friends, and which should be known as unintelligent. That other who is different from these two is called the Intelligent.

data.v: अचेतनः सत्त्वसंघातयुक्तः; सत्त्वात्परं चेतयतेऽन्तरात्मा । स क्षेत्रज्ञः सत्त्वसंघातबुद्धि;र्गुणातिगो मुच्यते मृत्युपाशात् ॥
data.md: When the inner self, which is shorn of knowledge of nature, which is (as it were) unintelligent, becomes conversant with that which is above nature, then, understanding the Kshetra, and gifted with an intelligence that is above all qualities and apprehends everything, becoming released from all sins.

data.v: केचिद्ब्रह्ममयं वृक्षं केचिद्ब्रह्ममयं महत् । केचित्पुरुषमव्यक्तं केचित्परमनामयम् । मन्यन्ते सर्वमप्येतदव्यक्तप्रभवाव्ययम् ॥
data.md: Some consider Brahman as a tree. Some consider Brahma as a great forest. Some consider Brahina as unmanifest. Some consider it as transcendent and freed from every distress.

data.v: उच्छ्वासमात्रमपि चेद्योऽन्तकाले समो भवेत् । आत्मानमुपसंगम्य सोऽमृतत्वाय कल्पते ॥
निमेषमात्रमपि चेत्संयम्यात्मानमात्मनि । गच्छत्यात्मप्रसादेन विदुषां प्राप्तिमव्ययाम् ॥
प्राणायामैरथ प्राणान्संयम्य स पुनः पुनः । दशद्वादशभिर्वापि चतुर्विंशात्परं ततः ॥
एवं पूर्वं प्रसन्नात्मा लभते यद्यदिच्छति । अव्यक्तात्सत्त्वमुद्रिक्तममृतत्वाय कल्पते ॥
data.md: Thus having first acquired a tranquil soul, one attains to the fruition of all his desires. When the quality of Goodness predominates in what originates from the Unmanifest, it becomes fit for immortality. They who are conversant with Goodness speak highly of it, saying that there is nothing superior to Goodness.

data.v: सत्त्वात्परतरं नान्यत्प्रशंसन्तीह तद्विदः । अनुमानाद्विजानीमः पुरुषं सत्त्वसंश्रयम् । न शक्यमन्यथा गन्तुं पुरुषं तमथो द्विजाः ॥
data.md: By inference we know that the Purusha is dependent on Goodness. O best of twice-born ones, it is impossible to attain to Purusha by any other means.

data.v: क्षमा धृतिरहिंसा च समता सत्यमार्जवम् । ज्ञानं त्यागोऽथ संन्यासः सात्त्विकं वृत्तमिष्यते ॥
data.md: Forgiveness, courage, abstention abstention from injury, equability, truth, sincerity, knowledge, gift, and renunciation, are said to be the marks of that course of conduct which arises out of Goodness.

data.v: एतेनैवानुमानेन मन्यन्तेऽथ मनीषिणः । सत्त्वं च पुरुषश्चैकस्तत्र नास्ति विचारणा ॥
data.md: It is by this inference that the wise believe in the oneness of Purusha and Goodness. There is no doubt in this.

data.v: आहुरेके च विद्वांसो ये ज्ञाने सुप्रतिष्ठिताः । क्षेत्रज्ञसत्त्वयोरैक्यमित्येतन्नोपपद्यते ॥
data.md: Some learned men that are devoted to knowledge hold that Kshetrajna and Nature are one. This, however, is not correct.

data.v: पृथग्भूतस्ततो नित्यमित्येतदविचारितम् । पृथग्भावश्च विज्ञेयः सहजश्चापि तत्त्वतः ॥
data.md: If it said that Nature is different from Purusha, that also will indicate a want of consideration.

data.v: तथैवैकत्वनानात्वमिष्यते विदुषां नयः । मशकोदुम्बरे त्वैक्यं पृथक्त्वमपि दृश्यते ॥
data.md: Distinction and association should be truly known. Unity and diversity are likewise laid down. That is the doctrine of the learned. Even both unity and diversity are seen in the gnat and Udumbara.

data.v: मत्स्यो यथान्यः स्यादप्सु संप्रयोगस्तथानयोः । संबन्धस्तोयबिन्दूनां पर्णे कोकनदस्य च ॥
data.md: As a fish in water is different from it, so is the relation of the two (viz., Purusha and Nature). Indeed, their relation is like that of water drops on the leaf of the lotus,

data.v: इत्युक्तवन्तं ते विप्रास्तदा लोकपितामहम् । पुनः संशयमापन्नाः पप्रच्छुर्द्विजसत्तमाः ॥
data.md: The Preceptor said, Thus addressed, those learned Brahmanas, who were the foremost of men, felt some doubts and (therefore) they once questioned the Grandfather. more

data.v: किं स्विदेवेह धर्माणामनुष्ठेयतमं स्मृतम् । व्याहतामिव पश्यामो धर्मस्य विविधां गतिम् ॥
data.md: The Rishis said Which among the duties is considered to be the most worthy of being performed? The various modes of duty, we sec, are contradictory.

data.v: ऊर्ध्वं देहाद्वदन्त्येके नैतदस्तीति चापरे । केचित्संशयितं सर्वं निःसंशयमथापरे ॥
data.md: Some say that it continues after the body is destroyed). Others say that it does not exist. Some say that everything is doubtful. Others have no doubts.

data.v: अनित्यं नित्यमित्येके नास्त्यस्तीत्यपि चापरे । एकरूपं द्विधेत्येके व्यामिश्रमिति चापरे । एकमेके पृथक्चान्ये बहुत्वमिति चापरे ॥
data.md: Some say that the eternal (principle) is not eternal. Some say that it exists, and some that it exists not. Some say it is of one form, or twofold, and others that it is mixed.

data.v: मन्यन्ते ब्राह्मणा एवं प्राज्ञास्तत्त्वार्थदर्शिनः । जटाजिनधराश्चान्ये मुण्डाः केचिदसंवृताः ॥
अस्नानं केचिदिच्छन्ति स्नानमित्यपि चापरे । आहारं केचिदिच्छन्ति केचिच्चानशने रताः ॥
कर्म केचित्प्रशंसन्ति प्रशान्तिमपि चापरे । देशकालावुभौ केचिन्नैतदस्तीति चापरे । केचिन्मोक्षं प्रशंसन्ति केचिद्भोगान्पृथग्विधान् ॥
धनानि केचिदिच्छन्ति निर्धनत्वं तथापरे । उपास्यसाधनं त्वेके नैतदस्तीति चापरे ॥
data.md: Some applaud Liberation. Some, various sorts of enjoyments. Some desire various kinds of riches. Some, poverty. Some say that means should be resorted to. Others, that this is not so.

data.v: अहिंसानिरताश्चान्ये केचिद्धिंसापरायणाः । पुण्येन यशसेत्येके नैतदस्तीति चापरे ॥
data.md: Some are given to a life of abstention from injury. Others are inclined to destruction. Some are for merit and glory. Others say that this is not so.

data.v: सद्भावनिरताश्चान्ये केचित्संशयिते स्थिताः । दुःखादन्ये सुखादन्ये ध्यानमित्यपरे स्थिताः ॥
data.md: Some are devoted to goodness. Others are established on doubt. Some are for pleasure. Some are for pain. Others people say that it is meditation.

data.v: यज्ञमित्यपरे धीराः प्रदानमिति चापरे । सर्वमेके प्रशंसन्ति न सर्वमिति चापरे ॥
data.md: Other learned Brahmanas say that it is Sacrifice. Others, again, say that it is gift. Others speak highly of penances. Others, the study of the scriptures.

data.v: तपस्त्वन्ये प्रशंसन्ति स्वाध्यायमपरे जनाः । ज्ञानं संन्यासमित्येके स्वभावं भूतचिन्तकाः ॥
एवं व्युत्थापिते धर्मे बहुधा विप्रधावति । निश्चयं नाधिगच्छामः संमूढाः सुरसत्तम ॥
data.md: O foremost of the celestials, duty being thus confused and full of contradictions of various kinds, we are deluded and unable to arrive at any conclusion.

data.v: इदं श्रेय इदं श्रेय इत्येवं प्रस्थितो जनः । यो हि यस्मिन्रतो धर्मे स तं पूजयते सदा ॥
data.md: People stand up for acting, saying, This is good, This is good. He who follow a certain duty speaks highly of that duty as the best.

data.v: तत्र नो विहता प्रज्ञा मनश्च बहुलीकृतम् । एतदाख्यातुमिच्छामः श्रेयः किमिति सत्तम ॥
data.md: Therefore our understanding breaks down and our mind is distracted. We, therefore, wish, O best of all beings, to know what is good.

data.v: अतः परं च यद्गुह्यं तद्भवान्वक्तुमर्हति । सत्त्वक्षेत्रज्ञयोश्चैव संबन्धः केन हेतुना ॥
data.md: You should declare to us, after this, what is (so) mysterious, and what is the cause of the connection between the Soul and Nature.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स तैर्विप्रैर्भगवाँल्लोकभावनः । तेभ्यः शशंस धर्मात्मा याथातथ्येन बुद्धिमान् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by those learned Brahmanas, the illustrious creator of the worlds, endued with great intelligence and possessed of a righteous soul, described to them accurately what they asked.

data.v: हन्त वः संप्रवक्ष्यामि यन्मां पृच्छथ सत्तमाः । समस्तमिह तच्छ्रुत्वा सम्यगेवावधार्यताम् ॥
अहिंसा सर्वभूतानामेतत्कृत्यतमं मतम् । एतत्पदमनुद्विग्नं वरिष्ठं धर्मलक्षणम् ॥
ज्ञानं निःश्रेय इत्याहुर्वृद्धा निश्चयदर्शिनः । तस्माज्ज्ञानेन शुद्धेन मुच्यते सर्वपातकैः ॥
हिंसापराश्च ये लोके ये च नास्तिकवृत्तयः । लोभमोहसमायुक्तास्ते वै निरयगामिनः ॥
आशीर्युक्तानि कर्माणि कुर्वते ये त्वतन्द्रिताः । तेऽस्मिँल्लोके प्रमोदन्ते जायमानाः पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: Those who without idleness perforın deeds with expectation, being full of egoism, approach the presence of Prajapati.

data.v: कुर्वते ये तु कर्माणि श्रद्दधाना विपश्चितः । अनाशीर्योगसंयुक्तास्ते धीराः साधुदर्शिनः ॥
अतः परं प्रवक्ष्यामि सत्त्वक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्यथा । संयोगो विप्रयोगश्च तन्निबोधत सत्तमाः ॥
data.md: I shall, after this. describe how the association and the disassociation takes place of Soul and Nature. You best of men, listen. The relation here is said to be that betwcen the object and the subject.

data.v: विषयो विषयित्वं च संबन्धोऽयमिहोच्यते । विषयी पुरुषो नित्यं सत्त्वं च विषयः स्मृतः ॥
व्याख्यातं पूर्वकल्पेन मशकोदुम्बरं यथा । भुज्यमानं न जानीते नित्यं सत्त्वमचेतनम् । यस्त्वेव तु विजानीते यो भुङ्क्ते यश्च भुज्यते ॥
data.md: Purusha is always the subject; and Nature the object. It has been explained, by what has been said in a previous part of the discourse where it has been pointed out, that they exist after the manner of the gnat and the Udumbara,

data.v: अनित्यं द्वंद्वसंयुक्तं सत्त्वमाहुर्गुणात्मकम् । निर्द्वंद्वो निष्कलो नित्यः क्षेत्रज्ञो निर्गुणात्मकः ॥
data.md: An object of enjoyment as it is, Nature is unintelligent and knows nothing. He, however, who enjoys it, is said to know it, Soul being enjoyer, Nature is enjoyed.

data.v: समः संज्ञागतस्त्वेवं यदा सर्वत्र दृश्यते । उपभुङ्क्ते सदा सत्त्वमापः पुष्करपर्णवत् ॥
data.md: The wise have said that Nature is always made up of pairs of opposites. Soul is, on the other hand, destitute of pairs of opposites, devoid of parts, eternal, and free, about its essence, from qualities.

data.v: सर्वैरपि गुणैर्विद्वान्व्यतिषक्तो न लिप्यते । जलबिन्दुर्यथा लोलः पद्मिनीपत्रसंस्थितः । एवमेवाप्यसंसक्तः पुरुषः स्यान्न संशयः ॥
data.md: He lives in everything alike, and walks with knowledge. He always enjoys Nature as a lotus leaf (enjoys) water.

data.v: द्रव्यमात्रमभूत्सत्त्वं पुरुषस्येति निश्चयः । यथा द्रव्यं च कर्ता च संयोगोऽप्यनयोस्तथा ॥
यथा प्रदीपमादाय कश्चित्तमसि गच्छति । तथा सत्त्वप्रदीपेन गच्छन्ति परमैषिणः ॥
यावद्द्रव्यगुणस्तावत्प्रदीपः संप्रकाशते । क्षीणद्रव्यगुणं ज्योतिरन्तर्धानाय गच्छति ॥
व्यक्तः सत्त्वगुणस्त्वेवं पुरुषोऽव्यक्त इष्यते । एतद्विप्रा विजानीत हन्त भूयो ब्रवीमि वः ॥
सहस्रेणापि दुर्मेधा न वृद्धिमधिगच्छति । चतुर्थेनाप्यथांशेन बुद्धिमान्सुखमेधते ॥
एवं धर्मस्य विज्ञेयं संसाधनमुपायतः । उपायज्ञो हि मेधावी सुखमत्यन्तमश्नुते ॥
data.md: One, however, who is gifted with intelligence succeeds in acquiring happiness, through only a fourth share (c: explanations). Thus should the accomplishment of duty be understood as dependent on means. For the intelligent man, having knowledge of means, succeeds in acquiring supreme happiness.

data.v: यथाध्वानमपाथेयः प्रपन्नो मानवः क्वचित् । क्लेशेन याति महता विनश्यत्यन्तरापि वा ॥
data.md: As some man travelling along a road without provisions of his journey, proceeds with great uneasiness and may even meet with destruction before he reaches the end of his journey, so should it be known that in deeds there may or may not be fruits.

data.v: तथा कर्मसु विज्ञेयं फलं भवति वा न वा । पुरुषस्यात्मनिःश्रेयः शुभाशुभनिदर्शनम् ॥
यथा च दीर्घमध्वानं पद्भ्यामेव प्रपद्यते । अदृष्टपूर्वं सहसा तत्त्वदर्शनवर्जितः ॥
तमेव च यथाध्वानं रथेनेहाशुगामिना । यायादश्वप्रयुक्तेन तथा बुद्धिमतां गतिः ॥
उच्चं पर्वतमारुह्य नान्ववेक्षेत भूगतम् । रथेन रथिनं पश्येत्क्लिश्यमानमचेतनम् ॥
यावद्रथपथस्तावद्रथेन स तु गच्छति । क्षीणे रथपथे प्राज्ञो रथमुत्सृज्य गच्छति ॥
एवं गच्छति मेधावी तत्त्वयोगविधानवित् । समाज्ञाय महाबुद्धिरुत्तरादुत्तरोत्तरम् ॥
data.md: The learned man, when he sees the car-path end, abandons his car for going on. Thus does the intelligent man who knows the ordinances about truth and Yoga, proceed. Knowing the qualities, such man, proceeds, comprehending what is next and next.

data.v: यथा महार्णवं घोरमप्लवः संप्रगाहते । बाहुभ्यामेव संमोहाद्वधं चर्च्छत्यसंशयम् ॥
नावा चापि यथा प्राज्ञो विभागज्ञस्तरित्रया । अक्लान्तः सलिलं गाहेत्क्षिप्रं संतरति ध्रुवम् ॥
तीर्णो गच्छेत्परं पारं नावमुत्सृज्य निर्ममः । व्याख्यातं पूर्वकल्पेन यथा रथिपदातिनौ ॥
स्नेहात्संमोहमापन्नो नावि दाशो यथा तथा । ममत्वेनाभिभूतः स तत्रैव परिवर्तते ॥
नावं न शक्यमारुह्य स्थले विपरिवर्तितुम् । तथैव रथमारुह्य नाप्सु चर्या विधीयते ॥
एवं कर्म कृतं चित्रं विषयस्थं पृथक्पृथक् । यथा कर्म कृतं लोके तथा तदुपपद्यते ॥
यन्नैव गन्धिनो रस्यं न रूपस्पर्शशब्दवत् । मन्यन्ते मुनयो बुद्ध्या तत्प्रधानं प्रचक्षते ॥
data.md: And as action is performed in this world, so does it result to those who perform them. That which is void of smell. void of taste, and void of touch and sound, that which is meditated upon by the sages with the help of their understanding is said to be Pradhana. Now, Pradhana is unmanifest. A development of the uninanife-t is Mahat.

data.v: तत्र प्रधानमव्यक्तमव्यक्तस्य गुणो महान् । महतः प्रधानभूतस्य गुणोऽहंकार एव च ॥
अहंकारप्रधानस्य महाभूतकृतो गुणः । पृथक्त्वेन हि भूतानां विषया वै गुणाः स्मृताः ॥
बीजधर्मं यथाव्यक्तं तथैव प्रसवात्मकम् । बीजधर्मा महानात्मा प्रसवश्चेति नः श्रुतम् ॥
बीजधर्मा त्वहंकारः प्रसवश्च पुनः पुनः । बीजप्रसवधर्माणि महाभूतानि पञ्च वै ॥
बीजधर्मिण इत्याहुः प्रसवं च न कुर्वते । विशेषाः पञ्चभूतानां तेषां वित्तं विशेषणम् ॥
data.md: And the five great elements are of the nature of seed and products. The objects of the five great elements are gifted with the nature of seed, and yield products. These have intelligence for their property. Among them, space has one equality; wind is said to have two.

data.v: तत्रैकगुणमाकाशं द्विगुणो वायुरुच्यते । त्रिगुणं ज्योतिरित्याहुरापश्चापि चतुर्गुणाः ॥
पृथ्वी पञ्चगुणा ज्ञेया त्रसस्थावरसंकुला । सर्वभूतकरी देवी शुभाशुभनिदर्शना ॥
शब्दः स्पर्शस्तथा रूपं रसो गन्धश्च पञ्चमः । एते पञ्च गुणा भूमेर्विज्ञेया द्विजसत्तमाः ॥
data.md: Sound, touch, colour, taste, and smell numbering the fifth, are effects. They are, however, inconstant, and called by the name of delusion.

data.v: पार्थिवश्च सदा गन्धो गन्धश्च बहुधा स्मृतः । तस्य गन्धस्य वक्ष्यामि विस्तरेण बहून्गुणान् ॥
data.md: Now, space has only one quality, and that is said to be sound. I shall speak at length of the numerous qualities of sound.

data.v: इष्टश्चानिष्टगन्धश्च मधुरोऽम्लः कटुस्तथा । निर्हारी संहतः स्निग्धो रूक्षो विशद एव च । एवं दशविधो ज्ञेयः पार्थिवो गन्ध इत्युत ॥
data.md: I shall describe at length the numerous qualities of smell. Smell is agreeable or disagreeable, sweet, sour, pungent, diffusive and compact, oily and dry, and clear. Thus smell, which belongs to the earth, should be known as of ten sorts.

data.v: शब्दः स्पर्शस्तथा रूपं रसश्चापां गुणाः स्मृताः । रसज्ञानं तु वक्ष्यामि रसस्तु बहुधा स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Sound, touch, colour, and taste have been said to be the qualities of water. I shall now speak or the qualities of Taste. Taste has been said to be of various kinds.

data.v: मधुरोऽम्लः कटुस्तिक्तः कषायो लवणस्तथा । एवं षड्विधविस्तारो रसो वारिमयः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Sweet, sour, pungent, bitter, astringent, and saline likewise. Taste, which has been said to Belong to water, is thus of six varieties.

data.v: शब्दः स्पर्शस्तथा रूपं त्रिगुणं ज्योतिरुच्यते । ज्योतिषश्च गुणो रूपं रूपं च बहुधा स्मृतम् ॥
data.md: Sound, touch, and colour, these are the three qualities of light. Colour is the quality of light, and colour is said to be of various sorts.

data.v: शुक्लं कृष्णं तथा रक्तं नीलं पीतारुणं तथा । ह्रस्वं दीर्घं तथा स्थूलं चतुरस्राणु वृत्तकम् ॥
data.md: White, dark, red, blue, yellow, and grey also, and short long, minute, gross, square and circular, of these twelve varieties is colour which appertains to light. These should be understood by Brahmanas venerable for years, knowing duties, and truthful in speech.

data.v: एवं द्वादशविस्तारं तेजसो रूपमुच्यते । विज्ञेयं ब्राह्मणैर्नित्यं धर्मज्ञैः सत्यवादिभिः ॥
शब्दस्पर्शौ च विज्ञेयौ द्विगुणो वायुरुच्यते । वायोश्चापि गुणः स्पर्शः स्पर्शश्च बहुधा स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Sound and touch should be known as the two qualities of wind. Touch has been said to be of various sorts.

data.v: उष्णः शीतः सुखो दुःखः स्निग्धो विशद एव च । कठिनश्चिक्कणः श्लक्ष्णः पिच्छिलो दारुणो मृदुः ॥
एवं द्वादशविस्तारो वायव्यो गुण उच्यते । विधिवद्ब्रह्मणैः सिद्धैर्धर्मज्ञैस्तत्त्वदर्शिभिः ॥
तत्रैकगुणमाकाशं शब्द इत्येव च स्मृतः । तस्य शब्दस्य वक्ष्यामि विस्तरेण बहून्गुणान् ॥
data.md: Now, space has only one quality, and that is said to be sound. I shall speak at length of the numerous qualities of sound.

data.v: षड्जर्षभौ च गान्धारो मध्यमः पञ्चमस्तथा । अतः परं तु विज्ञेयो निषादो धैवतस्तथा ॥
data.md: Shadaja, Rishabha, together with Gandhara, Madhyama, and likewise Panchama; after this should be known Nishada, and then Daivata, besides these, there are agreeable sounds and disagreeable sounds compact, and of many ingredients.

data.v: इष्टोऽनिष्टश्च शब्दस्तु संहतः प्रविभागवान् । एवं बहुविधो ज्ञेयः शब्द आकाशसंभवः ॥
आकाशमुत्तमं भूतमहंकारस्ततः परम् । अहंकारात्परा बुद्धिर्बुद्धेरात्मा ततः परः ॥
तस्मात्तु परमव्यक्तमव्यक्तात्पुरुषः परः । परावरज्ञो भूतानां यं प्राप्यानन्त्यमश्नुते ॥
भूतानामथ पञ्चानां यथैषामीश्वरं मनः । नियमे च विसर्गे च भूतात्मा मन एव च ॥
data.md: Since the mind is the ruler of these five elements, for controlling and bringing them forth, the mind, therefore, is the soul of the elements.

data.v: अधिष्ठाता मनो नित्यं भूतानां महतां तथा । बुद्धिरैश्वर्यमाचष्टे क्षेत्रज्ञः सर्व उच्यते ॥
data.md: The mind always presides over the great elements. The understanding proclaims power, and is called the Soul.

data.v: इन्द्रियाणि मनो युङ्क्ते सदश्वानिव सारथिः । इन्द्रियाणि मनो बुद्धिं क्षेत्रज्ञो युञ्जते सदा ॥
data.md: The mind yokes the senses, as a charioteer yokes good horses. The senses, the mind, and the understanding are always joined to the Soul.

data.v: महाभूतसमायुक्तं बुद्धिसंयमनं रथम् । तमारुह्य स भूतात्मा समन्तात्परिधावति ॥
data.md: The individual soul, mounting the chariot to which big horses are yoked and which has the understanding for the reins, drives about on all sides.

data.v: इन्द्रियग्रामसंयुक्तो मनःसारथिरेव च । बुद्धिसंयमनो नित्यं महान्ब्रह्ममयो रथः ॥
data.md: With all the senses attached to it (for steeds), with the mind for the charioteer, and the understanding for the eternal reins, exists thc great Brahma car.

data.v: एवं यो वेत्ति विद्वान्वै सदा ब्रह्ममयं रथम् । स धीरः सर्वलोकेषु न मोहमधिगच्छति ॥
data.md: Indeed, that man gifted with learning and wisdom who always understands the Brahmacharin this way, is never possessed by delusion in the midst of all entities.

data.v: अव्यक्तादि विशेषान्तं त्रसस्थावरसंकुलम् । चन्द्रसूर्यप्रभालोकं ग्रहनक्षत्रमण्डितम् ॥
नदीपर्वतजालैश्च सर्वतः परिभूषितम् । विविधाभिस्तथाद्भिश्च सततं समलंकृतम् ॥
आजीवः सर्वभूतानां सर्वप्राणभृतां गतिः । एतद्ब्रह्मवनं नित्यं यस्मिंश्चरति क्षेत्रवित् ॥
लोकेऽस्मिन्यानि भूतानि स्थावराणि चराणि च । तान्येवाग्रे प्रलीयन्ते पश्चाद्भूतकृता गुणाः । गुणेभ्यः पञ्चभूतानि एष भूतसमुच्छ्रयः ॥
data.md: Whatever exist in this world, mobile and immobile, are the very first to be dissolved away. After this (are dissolved) those qualities which compose all entities.

data.v: देवा मनुष्या गन्धर्वाः पिशाचासुरराक्षसाः । सर्वे स्वभावतः सृष्टा न क्रियाभ्यो न कारणात् ॥
data.md: After the qualities (are dissolved) the five elements. Such is the gradation of entities. Celestials, men, Gandharvas, Pishachas, Asuras, (and) Rakshasa, have all originated from Nature, and not from actions, nor from a cause. The Brahmanas, who are creators of the universe are born here again and again.

data.v: एते विश्वकृतो विप्रा जायन्ते ह पुनः पुनः । तेभ्यः प्रसूतास्तेष्वेव महाभूतेषु पञ्चसु । प्रलीयन्ते यथाकालमूर्मयः सागरे यथा ॥
data.md: All that originates from them dissolves, when the time comes, in those very five great elements like billows in the ocean.

data.v: विश्वसृग्भ्यस्तु भूतेभ्यो महाभूतानि गच्छति । भूतेभ्यश्चापि पञ्चभ्यो मुक्तो गच्छेत्प्रजापतिम् ॥
data.md: All the great elements are beyond those elements which form the universe. He who is released from those five clements goes to the highest goal.

data.v: प्रजापतिरिदं सर्वं तपसैवासृजत्प्रभुः । तथैव वेदानृषयस्तपसा प्रतिपेदिरे ॥
data.md: The powerful Prajapati created all this by the mind only. Similarly Rishis attained to the status of celestials by the help of penance.

data.v: तपसश्चानुपूर्व्येण फलमूलाशिनस्तथा । त्रैलोक्यं तपसा सिद्धाः पश्यन्तीह समाहिताः ॥
data.md: Likewise, those who have acquired perfection, who capable of the concentration of Yoga, and who live on fruits and roots, likewise perceive the triple world by penance.

data.v: ओषधान्यगदादीनी नानाविद्याश्च सर्वशः । तपसैव प्रसिध्यन्ति तपोमूलं हि साधनम् ॥
data.md: Medicines and herbs and all the various sciences are acquired by means of penance alone, for all acquisition has penance for its were root.

data.v: यद्दुरापं दुराम्नायं दुराधर्षं दुरन्वयम् । तत्सर्वं तपसा साध्यं तपो हि दुरतिक्रमम् ॥
data.md: Whatever is difficult of acquisition, difficult to learn, difficult to defeat, difficult to pass through, can all be acquired by penance, for penance is irresistible.

data.v: सुरापो ब्रह्महा स्तेयी भ्रूणहा गुरुतल्पगः । तपसैव सुतप्तेन मुच्यन्ते किल्बिषात्ततः ॥
data.md: One who drinks alcoholic liquors, one who kills a Brahmana, one who steals, one who destroys a foe us, one who violates one's preceptor's bed, becomes cleansed of such sin by penance well performed.

data.v: मनुष्याः पितरो देवाः पशवो मृगपक्षिणः । यानि चान्यानि भूतानि त्रसानि स्थावराणि च ॥
data.md: Human beings, departed manes, deities, (sacrificial) animal, beasts and birds, and all other creatures mobile and immobile, by always devoting themselves to penances, become successful by penance along. Similarly the celestials gifted with great powers of illusion, have attained to the celestial region.

data.v: तपःपरायणा नित्यं सिध्यन्ते तपसा सदा । तथैव तपसा देवा महाभागा दिवं गताः ॥
data.md: Human beings, departed manes, deities, (sacrificial) animal, beasts and birds, and all other creatures mobile and immobile, by always devoting themselves to penances, become successful by penance along. Similarly the celestials gifted with great powers of illusion, have attained to the celestial region.

data.v: आशीर्युक्तानि कर्माणि कुर्वते ये त्वतन्द्रिताः । अहंकारसमायुक्तास्ते सकाशे प्रजापतेः ॥
data.md: Those who without idleness perforın deeds with expectation, being full of egoism, approach the presence of Prajapati.

data.v: ध्यानयोगेन शुद्धेन निर्ममा निरहंकृताः । प्राप्नुवन्ति महात्मानो महान्तं लोकमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Those great ones, however, who are devoid of mineness and freed from egoism through the pure contemplation of Yoga, acquire the great and highest regions.

data.v: ध्यानयोगादुपागम्य प्रसन्नमतयः सदा । सुखोपचयमव्यक्तं प्रविशन्त्यात्मवत्तया ॥
data.md: Those who understand best the self, having acquired Yoga contemplation and having their minds always cheerful, into the unmanifest accumulation of happiness.

data.v: ध्यानयोगादुपागम्य निर्ममा निरहंकृताः । अव्यक्तं प्रविशन्तीह महान्तं लोकमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Those great ones, however, who are devoid of mineness and freed from egoism through the pure contemplation of Yoga, acquire the great and highest regions.

data.v: अव्यक्तादेव संभूतः समयज्ञो गतः पुनः । तमोरजोभ्यां निर्मुक्तः सत्त्वमास्थाय केवलम् ॥
विमुक्तः सर्वपापेभ्यः सर्वं त्यजति निष्कलः । क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तं विद्याद्यस्तं वेद स वेदवित् ॥
data.md: Born from that same unmanifest (principle) and attaining to the same once more, frecd from the qualities of Darkness and Ignorance and adhering to only the quality of Goodness, one becomes freed from every sin and creates all things. Such a one should be known to be Kshetrajna in perfection. He who knows him knows the Veda. enter to

data.v: चित्तं चित्तादुपागम्य मुनिरासीत संयतः । यच्चित्तस्तन्मना भूत्वा गुह्यमेतत्सनातनम् ॥
data.md: Attaining pure knowledge from (restraining) the mind, the ascetic should sit self-controlled. One necessarily becomes that on which one's mind is set. This is an eternal mystery.

data.v: अव्यक्तादि विशेषान्तमविद्यालक्षणं स्मृतम् । निबोधत यथा हीदं गुणैर्लक्षणमित्युत ॥
data.md: That which has the unmanifest for its beginning and gross qualities for its end, has been said to have Ne-science for its mark. But do you understand that whose nature is shorn of qualities.

data.v: द्व्यक्षरस्तु भवेन्मृत्युस्त्र्यक्षरं ब्रह्म शाश्वतम् । ममेति च भवेन्मृत्युर्न ममेति च शाश्वतम् ॥
data.md: Of two syllables is Mrityu (death); of three syllable is the eternal Brahma Mineness is death, and the opposite of mineness is the eternal.

data.v: कर्म केचित्प्रशंसन्ति मन्दबुद्धितरा नराः । ये तु बुद्धा महात्मानो न प्रशंसन्ति कर्म ते ॥
data.md: Some who led by bad understanding speak highly of action. Those, however, who are numbered among the great ancients never speak highly of action.

data.v: कर्मणा जायते जन्तुर्मूर्तिमान्षोडशात्मकः । पुरुषं सृजतेऽविद्या अग्राह्यममृताशिनम् ॥
data.md: By action is a creature born with body which is made up of the sixteen. (True) Knowledge swallows up Purusha. This is what is highly acceptable to eaters of ambrosia.

data.v: तस्मात्कर्मसु निःस्नेहा ये केचित्पारदर्शिनः । विद्यामयोऽयं पुरुषो न तु कर्ममयः स्मृतः ॥
data.md: Therefore, those whose vision extends to the other end have no attachment to actions. This Purusha, however is full of knowledge and not full of action.

data.v: अपूर्वममृतं नित्यं य एनमविचारिणम् । य एनं विन्दतेऽऽत्मानमग्राह्यममृताशिनम् । अग्राह्योऽमृतो भवति य एभिः कारणैर्ध्रुवः ॥
data.md: He who thus understands the Soul to which there is nothing prior, which is uncreated, immutable, unconquered, and incomprehensible even to those who are eaters of nectar, certainly becomes himself incomprehensible and immortal through these means.

data.v: अपोह्य सर्वसंकल्पान्संयम्यात्मानमात्मनि । स तद्ब्रह्म शुभं वेत्ति यस्माद्भूयो न विद्यते ॥
data.md: Removing all impressions and controlling the soul in the soul, he understands that auspicious Brahma than which nothing greater exists.

data.v: प्रसादेनैव सत्त्वस्य प्रसादं समवाप्नुयात् । लक्षणं हि प्रसादस्य यथा स्यात्स्वप्नदर्शनम् ॥
data.md: Upon the understanding becoming clear, he succeeds in acquiring tranquillity. The mark of tranquillity is like that what takes place in a dream.

data.v: गतिरेषा तु मुक्तानां ये ज्ञानपरिनिष्ठिताः । प्रवृत्तयश्च याः सर्वाः पश्यन्ति परिणामजाः ॥
data.md: This is the end of those liberated ones who are intent on knowledge. They sees all those movements which are born of successive developments.

data.v: एषा गतिरसक्तानामेष धर्मः सनातनः । एषा ज्ञानवतां प्राप्तिरेतद्वृत्तमनिन्दितम् ॥
data.md: This is the end of those who are unattached to the world. This is the eternal practice. This is the acquisition of men of knowledge. This is the uncensured made of conduct.

data.v: समेन सर्वभूतेषु निःस्पृहेण निराशिषा । शक्या गतिरियं गन्तुं सर्वत्र समदर्शिना ॥
data.md: This end is capable of being attained by one who is alike to all creatures, who is without attachment, who is without expectations, and who looks equally on all things.

data.v: एतद्वः सर्वमाख्यातं मया विप्रर्षिसत्तमाः । एवमाचरत क्षिप्रं ततः सिद्धिमवाप्स्यथ ॥
data.md: I have now described everything to you, O foremost of twice-born Rishis! Do you act thus immediately, you will then acquire success.

data.v: इत्युक्तास्ते तु मुनयो ब्रह्मणा गुरुणा तथा । कृतवन्तो महात्मानस्ततो लोकानवाप्नुवन् ॥
data.md: The Preceptor said, Thus addressed by the preceptor Brahman, those great sages acted accordingly and then attained to many happy regions.

data.v: त्वमप्येतन्महाभाग यथोक्तं ब्रह्मणो वचः । सम्यगाचर शुद्धात्मंस्ततः सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि ॥
data.md: Do you also, O blessed one, duly act according to the words of Brahman as described by me, O you of pure soul. You will then acquire success.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तदा शिष्यो गुरुणा धर्ममुत्तमम् । चकार सर्वं कौन्तेय ततो मोक्षमवाप्तवान् ॥
data.md: Thus instructed in the principles of high religion by the preceptor, the pupil. O son of Kunti, did everything accordingly and then attained to Liberation.

data.v: कृतकृत्यश्च स तदा शिष्यः कुरुकुलोद्वह । तत्पदं समनुप्राप्तो यत्र गत्वा न शोचति ॥
data.md: Having done all that he should have done, the pupil, O perpetuator of Kuru's race, attained to that seat going where one has not to grieve.

data.v: को न्वसौ ब्राह्मणः कृष्ण कश्च शिष्यो जनार्दन । श्रोतव्यं चेन्मयैतद्वै तत्त्वमाचक्ष्व मे विभो ॥
data.md: Arjuna said Who, indeed, was was that Brahmana, O Krishna, and who the pupil, O Janardana! Truly, if am worthy of hearing it, do you then tell me, O Lord!

data.v: अहं गुरुर्महाबाहो मनः शिष्यं च विद्धि मे । त्वत्प्रीत्या गुह्यमेतच्च कथितं मे धनंजय ॥
data.md: I am the preceptor, O mighty armed one, and know that the inind is my pupil. Through my affection for you. O Dhananjaya, I have described this mystery to you.

data.v: मयि चेदस्ति ते प्रीतिर्नित्यं कुरुकुलोद्वह । अध्यात्ममेतच्छ्रुत्वा त्वं सम्यगाचर सुव्रत ॥
data.md: If you have any love for me, O perpetuator of Kuru family, do you then, after having heard these instructions about the Soul, always act only, O you of excellent vows.

data.v: ततस्त्वं सम्यगाचीर्णे धर्मेऽस्मिन्कुरुनन्दन । सर्वपापविशुद्धात्मा मोक्षं प्राप्स्यसि केवलम् ॥
data.md: Then when this religion has been duly practised, O destroyer of foes, you will become freed from all your sins and attain to perfect liberation.

data.v: पूर्वमप्येतदेवोक्तं युद्धकाल उपस्थिते । मया तव महाबाहो तस्मादत्र मनः कुरु ॥
data.md: Formerly, when the hour of battle came, this very religion, O you of mighty-arins, was described by me. Do you, therefore, set your mind on it.

data.v: मया तु भरतश्रेष्ठ चिरदृष्टः पिता विभो । तमहं द्रष्टुमिच्छामि संमते तव फल्गुन ॥
data.md: And now, O chief of Bharata's race, it is long since that I saw the lord my father. I wish to see him again, with your leave, O Phalguna.

data.v: इत्युक्तवचनं कृष्णं प्रत्युवाच धनंजयः । गच्छावो नगरं कृष्ण गजसाह्वयमद्य वै ॥
data.md: Dhananjaya replied to Krishna who had said so. We shall go today from this town to Hastinapur.

data.v: समेत्य तत्र राजानं धर्मात्मानं युधिष्ठिरम् । समनुज्ञाप्य दुर्धर्षं स्वां पुरीं यातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Meeting king Yudhishthira of virtuous soul there, and informing him you shall then go to your own city.

data.v: ततोऽभ्यचोदयत्कृष्णो युज्यतामिति दारुकम् । मुहूर्तादिव चाचष्ट युक्तमित्येव दारुकः ॥
data.md: After this, Krishna ordered, Daruka, saying, Let my car be yoked. Within a very short space of time Daruka informed (his master), saying, It has been yoked.

data.v: तथैव चानुयात्राणि चोदयामास पाण्डवः । सज्जयध्वं प्रयास्यामो नगरं गजसाह्वयम् ॥
data.md: The son of Pandu then ordered all his attendants, saying, 'Prepare your selves and be ready. We shall go today to Hastinapur.

data.v: इत्युक्ताः सैनिकास्ते तु सज्जीभूता विशां पते । आचख्युः सज्जमित्येव पार्थायामिततेजसे ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, O king, the army got themselves ready, and informed Pritha's son of immeasurable energy, saying, Everything is ready.

data.v: ततस्तौ रथमास्थाय प्रयातौ कृष्णपाण्डवौ । विकुर्वाणौ कथाश्चित्राः प्रीयमाणौ विशां पते ॥
data.md: Then those two friends, viz., Krishna and the son of Pandu, ascended their car and proceeded on the journey, engaged in delightful conversation.

data.v: रथस्थं तु महातेजा वासुदेवं धनंजयः । पुनरेवाब्रवीद्वाक्यमिदं भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: To Vasudeva seated on the car, the highly energetic Dhananjaya once more said these words, O chief of the Bharatas.

data.v: त्वत्प्रसादाज्जयः प्राप्तो राज्ञा वृष्णिकुलोद्वह । निहताः शत्रवश्चापि प्राप्तं राज्यमकण्टकम् ॥
data.md: O perpetuator of the Vrishni race, the king has got victory through your grace. All his enemies have been killed, and he has recovered his kingdom without a thorn in it.

data.v: नाथवन्तश्च भवता पाण्डवा मधुसूदन । भवन्तं प्लवमासाद्य तीर्णाः स्म कुरुसागरम् ॥
data.md: O destroyer of Madhu, on you the Pandavas have got a powerful protector having obtained you for our raft we have crossed the Kuru ocean.

data.v: विश्वकर्मन्नमस्तेऽस्तु विश्वात्मन्विश्वसंभव । यथाहं त्वा विजानामि यथा चाहं भवन्मनाः ॥
data.md: O you who have this universe for your handiwork, salutations to you, O Soul of the universe, O best of all beings in the universe. I know you in that measure in which I am approved by you.

data.v: त्वत्तेजःसंभवो नित्यं हुताशो मधुसूदन । रतिः क्रीडामयी तुभ्यं माया ते रोदसी विभो ॥
data.md: O destroyer of Madhu, the soul of every creature is always born of your energy. Playful sport is yours. Earth and sky, O lord, are your illusion.

data.v: त्वयि सर्वमिदं विश्वं यदिदं स्थाणुजङ्गमम् । त्वं हि सर्वं विकुरुषे भूतग्रामं सनातनम् ॥
data.md: This entire universe, consisting of mobile and iinmobile objects, is established on you. You create, by modification, the four orders of Being.

data.v: पृथिवीं चान्तरिक्षं च तथा स्थावरजङ्गमम् । हसितं तेऽमला ज्योत्स्ना ऋतवश्चेन्द्रियान्वयाः ॥
data.md: You create the Earth, the Sky, and Heaven, O Destroyer of Madhu. The stainless Lunar light is your smile. The seasons are your senses.

data.v: प्राणो वायुः सततगः क्रोधो मृत्युः सनातनः । प्रसादे चापि पद्मा श्रीर्नित्यं त्वयि महामते ॥
data.md: The ever-moving wind is your breath, and death, existing eternally is your anger. In your grace is the goddess of prosperity. Indeed, Shree is always established in you, O you of the highest intelligence.

data.v: रतिस्तुष्टिर्धृतिः क्षान्तिस्त्वयि चेदं चराचरम् । त्वमेवेह युगान्तेषु निधनं प्रोच्यसेऽनघ ॥
data.md: You the sport; you their contentment; you their intelligence, you their are are forgiveness, you their inclinations, you their beauty. You are the universe with its mobile and immobile objects. At the end of the age, it is you, O sinless one, who are called destruction.

data.v: सुदीर्घेणापि कालेन न ते शक्या गुणा मया । आत्मा च परमो वक्तुं नमस्ते नलिनेक्षण ॥
data.md: I am incapable of reciting all your qualities in course of even a long period. You are the Soul and the Supreme Soul. I bow to you, O you of eyes like the (petals of the) lotus.

data.v: विदितो मेऽसि दुर्धर्ष नारदाद्देवलात्तथा । कृष्णद्वैपायनाच्चैव तथा कुरुपितामहात् ॥
त्वयि सर्वं समासक्तं त्वमेवैको जनेश्वरः । यच्चानुग्रहसंयुक्तमेतदुक्तं त्वयानघ ॥
एतत्सर्वमहं सम्यगाचरिष्ये जनार्दन । इदं चाद्भुतमत्यर्थं कृतमस्मत्प्रियेप्सया ॥
यत्पापो निहतः संख्ये कौरव्यो धृतराष्ट्रजः । त्वया दग्धं हि तत्सैन्यं मया विजितमाहवे ॥
भवता तत्कृतं कर्म येनावाप्तो जयो मया । दुर्योधनस्य संग्रामे तव बुद्धिपराक्रमैः ॥
data.md: That feat was achieved by you on account of which victory became mine! By the power of your intelligence was shown the ineans by which was duly effected the destruction of Duryodhana in battle, as also of Karna, as of the sinful king of the Sindhus, and Bhurishravas.

data.v: कर्णस्य च वधोपायो यथावत्संप्रदर्शितः । सैन्धवस्य च पापस्य भूरिश्रवस एव च ॥
data.md: That feat was achieved by you on account of which victory became mine! By the power of your intelligence was shown the ineans by which was duly effected the destruction of Duryodhana in battle, as also of Karna, as of the sinful king of the Sindhus, and Bhurishravas.

data.v: अहं च प्रीयमाणेन त्वया देवकिनन्दन । यदुक्तस्तत्करिष्यामि न हि मेऽत्र विचारणा ॥
data.md: I shall accomplish all that which, O son of Devaki, pleased with me you have declared to myself. I do not entertain any doubt in this.

data.v: राजानं च समासाद्य धर्मात्मानं युधिष्ठिरम् । चोदयिष्यामि धर्मज्ञ गमनार्थं तवानघ ॥
data.md: Going to king Yudhishthira of righteous soul, I shall, O sinless one, urge him to dismiss you, O you who are conversant with every duty.

data.v: रुचितं हि ममैतत्ते द्वारकागमनं प्रभो । अचिराच्चैव दृष्टा त्वं मातुलं मधुसूदन । बलदेवं च दुर्धर्षं तथान्यान्वृष्णिपुंगवान् ॥
data.md: O lord, I approve of departure for Dwraka. You shall soon see my maternal uncle, O Janardana.

data.v: एवं संभाषमाणौ तौ प्राप्तौ वारणसाह्वयम् । तथा विविशतुश्चोभौ संप्रहृष्टनराकुलम् ॥
तौ गत्वा धृतराष्ट्रस्य गृहं शक्रगृहोपमम् । ददृशाते महाराज धृतराष्ट्रं जनेश्वरम् ॥
विदुरं च महाबुद्धिं राजानं च युधिष्ठिरम् । भीमसेनं च दुर्धर्षं माद्रीपुत्रौ च पाण्डवौ । धृतराष्ट्रमुपासीनं युयुत्सुं चापराजितम् ॥
गान्धारीं च महाप्राज्ञां पृथां कृष्णां च भामिनीम् । सुभद्राद्याश्च ताः सर्वा भरतानां स्त्रियस्तथा । ददृशाते स्थिताः सर्वा गान्धारीं परिवार्य वै ॥
ततः समेत्य राजानं धृतराष्ट्रमरिंदमौ । निवेद्य नामधेये स्वे तस्य पादावगृह्णताम् ॥
गान्धार्याश्च पृथायाश्च धर्मराज्ञस्तथैव च । भीमस्य च महात्मानौ तथा पादावगृह्णताम् ॥
क्षत्तारं चापि संपूज्य पृष्ट्वा कुशलमव्ययम् । तैः सार्धं नृपतिं वृद्धं ततस्तं पर्युपासताम् ॥
ततो निशि महाराज धृतराष्ट्रः कुरूद्वहान् । जनार्दनं च मेधावी व्यसर्जयत वै गृहान् ॥
data.md: In the company of all those persons, Arjuna and Krishna then approached king Dhritarashtra (again). Night came and then the intelligent king Dhritarashtra dismissed all those perpetuators of Kurus' race as also Janardana for retiring to their respective rooms. Permitted by the king, all of them entered their respective apartments.

data.v: तेऽनुज्ञाता नृपतिना ययुः स्वं स्वं निवेशनम् । धनंजयगृहानेव ययौ कृष्णस्तु वीर्यवान् ॥
तत्रार्चितो यथान्यायं सर्वकामैरुपस्थितः । कृष्णः सुष्वाप मेधावी धनंजयसहायवान् ॥
प्रभातायां तु शर्वर्यां कृतपूर्वाह्णिकक्रियौ । धर्मराजस्य भवनं जग्मतुः परमार्चितौ । यत्रास्ते स सहामात्यो धर्मराजो महामनाः ॥
ततस्तौ तत्प्रविश्याथ ददृशाते महाबलौ । धर्मराजानमासीनं देवराजमिवाश्विनौ ॥
तौ समासाद्य राजानं वार्ष्णेयकुरुपुंगवौ । निषीदतुरनुज्ञातौ प्रीयमाणेन तेन वै ॥
data.md: Meeting the king, he of Vrishni's race, as also that foremost hero of Kuru's race, getting the permission of Yudhishthira who was highly pleased with them, sat themselves down.

data.v: ततः स राजा मेधावी विवक्षू प्रेक्ष्य तावुभौ । प्रोवाच वदतां श्रेष्ठो वचनं राजसत्तमः ॥
data.md: Then the king, king, gifted gifted with great intelligence, seeing those two friends, became desirous of addressing them. Soon that best of kings, that foremost of speakers, addressed them in the following words.

data.v: विवक्षू हि युवां मन्ये वीरौ यदुकुरूद्वहौ । ब्रूत कर्तास्मि सर्वं वां न चिरान्मा विचार्यताम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You heroes, you foremost ones of Yadu's and Kuru's race, it appears that you two are desirous of saying something to me. Do you say what is in your mind. I shall soon satisfy it. Do not hesitate.

data.v: इत्युक्ते फल्गुनस्तत्र धर्मराजानमब्रवीत् । विनीतवदुपागम्य वाक्यं वाक्यविशारदः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, Phalguna, well conversant with speech, hunibly approached king Yudhishthira the just and then said these words.

data.v: अयं चिरोषितो राजन्वासुदेवः प्रतापवान् । भवन्तं समनुज्ञाप्य पितरं द्रष्टुमिच्छति ॥
data.md: Highly powerful Vasudeva here, O sing, is long absent from home. He wishes, with your permission, to see his sire.

data.v: स गच्छेदभ्यनुज्ञातो भवता यदि मन्यसे । आनर्तनगरीं वीरस्तदनुज्ञातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Let him go, if you think it proper, to the city of the Anaritas! You should, O hero, grant him permission.

data.v: पुण्डरीकाक्ष भद्रं ते गच्छ त्वं मधुसूदन । पुरीं द्वारवतीमद्य द्रष्टुं शूरसुतं प्रभुम् ॥
data.md: O lotus-eyed one, blessed be you! O slayer of Madhu, do you go this very day to the city of Dvaravati of seeing, O powerful one, that foremost one of Sura's race.

data.v: रोचते मे महाबाहो गमनं तव केशव । मातुलश्चिरदृष्टो मे त्वया देवी च देवकी ॥
data.md: O mighty-armed Keshava, your departure is approved by me! You have not seen my maternal uncle as also the goddess Devaki for a long time.

data.v: मातुलं वसुदेवं त्वं बलदेवं च माधव । पूजयेथा महाप्राज्ञ मद्वाक्येन यथार्हतः ॥
data.md: Meeting my maternal uncle and going to Baladeva also, O giver of honours, you well, O you of great wisdom, adore both of them at my word as they deserve.

data.v: स्मरेथाश्चापि मां नित्यं भीमं च बलिनां वरम् । फल्गुनं नकुलं चैव सहदेवं च माधव ॥
data.md: Do you also think of me daily as also of Bhima, that foremost of powerful men, and of Phalguna and Nakula and Sahadeva, O giver of honours.

data.v: आनर्तानवलोक्य त्वं पितरं च महाभुज । वृष्णींश्च पुनरागच्छेर्हयमेधे ममानघ ॥
data.md: Having seen the Anaritas, and your father, O mighty-armed one, and the Vrishnis, you will return to my horse sacrifice, O sinless one!

data.v: स गच्छ रत्नान्यादाय विविधानि वसूनि च । यच्चाप्यन्यन्मनोज्ञं ते तदप्यादत्स्व सात्वत ॥
data.md: you like. Do you then go, taking with you various kinds of gems and various sorts of wealth. Do you, O hero of the Satvata race, also take with you whatever else

data.v: इयं हि वसुधा सर्वा प्रसादात्तव माधव । अस्मानुपगता वीर निहताश्चापि शत्रवः ॥
data.md: It is through your grace, O Keshava that the whole Earth, O hero, has come under our sway and all our enemies have been killed.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवति कौरव्ये धर्मराजे युधिष्ठिरे । वासुदेवो वरः पुंसामिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: When king Yudhishthira the just of Kuru's race said so, Vasudeva, that foremost of men, said these words (in reply).

data.v: तवैव रत्नानि धनं च केवल;म्धरा च कृत्स्ना तु महाभुजाद्य वै । यदस्ति चान्यद्द्रविणं गृहेषु मे; त्वमेव तस्येश्वर नित्यमीश्वरः ॥
data.md: O mighty-armed one, all jewels and gems, all riches and the entire Earth, belong to you alone. Whatever wealth exists in my house, you, O lord, are always the owner thereof.

data.v: तथेत्यथोक्तः प्रतिपूजितस्तदा; गदाग्रजो धर्मसुतेन वीर्यवान् । पितृष्वसामभ्यवदद्यथाविधि; संपूजितश्चाप्यगमत्प्रदक्षिणम् ॥
data.md: To him Yudhishthira, the son of Dharma, said, 'Be it so' and then duly adored (Krishna) the oldest brother, gifted with great energy, of Gada. Vasudeva then proceeded to his paternal aunt (Kunti). Duly honouring her, he circumbulated her body.

data.v: तया स सम्यक्प्रतिनन्दितस्तदा; तथैव सर्वैर्विदुरादिभिस्ततः । विनिर्ययौ नागपुराद्गदाग्रजो; रथेन दिव्येन चतुर्युजा हरिः ॥
data.md: He was properly accosted by her in return, and then by all the others having Vidura for their first. The four-arined eldest brother of Gada then started from Nagapura on his excellent car.

data.v: रथं सुभद्रामधिरोप्य भामिनीं; युधिष्ठिरस्यानुमते जनार्दनः । पितृष्वसायाश्च तथा महाभुजो; विनिर्ययौ पौरजनाभिसंवृतः ॥
data.md: Placing his sister, the lady Subhadra, on the car, the mighty-armed Janardana, then, with the permission of both Yudhishthira and (Kunti) his paternal aunt, started, accompanied by a large train of citizens.

data.v: तमन्वगाद्वानरवर्यकेतनः; ससात्यकिर्माद्रवतीसुतावपि । अगाधबुद्धिर्विदुरश्च माधवं; स्वयं च भीमो गजराजविक्रमः ॥
data.md: The hero who had the foremost of apes on his banner, as also Satyaki, and the two sons of Madravati, and Vidura of incomparable intelligence, and Bhima himself whose tread resembled that of a prince of elephants, all followed Madhava.

data.v: निवर्तयित्वा कुरुराष्ट्रवर्धनां;स्ततः स सर्वान्विदुरं च वीर्यवान् । जनार्दनो दारुकमाह सत्वरः; प्रचोदयाश्वानिति सात्यकिस्तदा ॥
data.md: Janardana of great energy, causing all those cxtenders of the Kuru kingdom and Vidura also to return, addressed Daruka, and Satyaki, saying, 'urge the horses to speed.'

data.v: ततो ययौ शत्रुगणप्रमर्दनः; शिनिप्रवीरानुगतो जनार्दनः । यथा निहत्यारिगणाञ्शतक्रतु;र्दिवं तथानर्तपुरीं प्रतापवान् ॥
data.md: Then that grinder of enemies, viz., Janardana of great prowess, accompanied by Satyaki, the foremost one of Shini's race, proceeded to the city of the Anarttas, after having killed all his enemies, like He of a hundred sacrifices proceeding to the celestial region.

data.v: तथा प्रयान्तं वार्ष्णेयं द्वारकां भरतर्षभाः । परिष्वज्य न्यवर्तन्त सानुयात्राः परंतपाः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, As he of Vrishni's family was going to Dwraka, those foremost princes of Bharata's race, those chastisers of enemies, embraced him and fell back with their attendants.

data.v: पुनः पुनश्च वार्ष्णेयं पर्यष्वजत फल्गुनः । आ चक्षुर्विषयाच्चैनं ददर्श च पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: Phalguna repeatedly embraced the Vrishni hero and as long as he was within he range of eye-sight he repeatedly turned his eyes towards him.

data.v: कृच्छ्रेणैव च तां पार्थो गोविन्दे विनिवेशिताम् । संजहार तदा दृष्टिं कृष्णश्चाप्यपराजितः ॥
data.md: With great difficulty, the son of Pritha withdrew his look that had fallen on Govinda. The undefeated Krishna also (did the same).

data.v: तस्य प्रयाणे यान्यासन्निमित्तानि महात्मनः । बहून्यद्भुतरूपाणि तानि मे गदतः शृणु ॥
data.md: The marks which were displayed on the occasion of the great one's departure, I shall now fully describe. Do you listen to me.

data.v: वायुर्वेगेन महता रथस्य पुरतो ववौ । कुर्वन्निःशर्करं मार्गं विरजस्कमकण्टकम् ॥
data.md: The wind blew with great force before the car, clearing the path of sand grains and dust and thorns.

data.v: ववर्ष वासवश्चापि तोयं शुचि सुगन्धि च । दिव्यानि चैव पुष्पाणि पुरतः शार्ङ्गधन्वनः ॥
data.md: Vasava rained pure and fragrant showers and celestial flowers before the holder of Sharnga.

data.v: स प्रयातो महाबाहुः समेषु मरुधन्वसु । ददर्शाथ मुनिश्रेष्ठमुत्तङ्कममितौजसम् ॥
data.md: As the mighty-armed hero went on he came upon the desert ill-supplied with water. there a he saw that foremost of ascetics, named Utanka, of immeasurable energy.

data.v: स तं संपूज्य तेजस्वी मुनिं पृथुललोचनः । पूजितस्तेन च तदा पर्यपृच्छदनामयम् ॥
data.md: The hero of large eyes and grcat energy adored that ascetic. He was then adored by the ascetic in return Vasudeva then enquired after his well-being.

data.v: स पृष्टः कुशलं तेन संपूज्य मधुसूदनम् । उत्तङ्को ब्राह्मणश्रेष्ठस्ततः पप्रच्छ माधवम् ॥
data.md: That foremost of Brahmanas, viz., Utanka, politely accosted by Madhava, honoured him duly and then addressed him in these words.

data.v: कच्चिच्छौरे त्वया गत्वा कुरुपाण्डवसद्म तत् । कृतं सौभ्रात्रमचलं तन्मे व्याख्यातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: O Shaurin, having gone to the palaces of the Kurus and the Pandavas, have you succeeded in establishing durable understanding between them such as should exit between brothers? You should tell me every thing.

data.v: अभिसंधाय तान्वीरानुपावृत्तोऽसि केशव । संबन्धिनः सुदयितान्सततं वृष्णिपुंगव ॥
data.md: Do you come, O Keshava, after having united them in peace, them who are your relatives and who are ever dear to you, O forcmost one of Vrishni's race.

data.v: कच्चित्पाण्डुसुताः पञ्च धृतराष्ट्रस्य चात्मजाः । लोकेषु विहरिष्यन्ति त्वया सह परंतप ॥
data.md: Will the five sons of Pandu, and the children of Dhritarashtra, o destroyer of enemies, sport in the world in joy with you?

data.v: स्वराष्ट्रेषु च राजानः कच्चित्प्राप्स्यन्ति वै सुखम् । कौरवेषु प्रशान्तेषु त्वया नाथेन माधव ॥
data.md: Will all the kings enjoy happiness in their respective kingdoms, on account of the pacification of the Kauravas brought about by you?

data.v: या मे संभावना तात त्वयि नित्यमवर्तत । अपि सा सफला कृष्ण कृता ते भरतान्प्रति ॥
data.md: Has that trust, O son, which I had always reposed on you, borne fruit about the Kauravas?

data.v: कृतो यत्नो मया ब्रह्मन्सौभ्रात्रे कौरवान्प्रति । न चाशक्यन्त संधातुं तेऽधर्मरुचयो मया ॥
ततस्ते निधनं प्राप्ताः सर्वे ससुतबान्धवाः । न दिष्टमभ्यतिक्रान्तुं शक्यं बुद्ध्या बलेन वा । महर्षे विदितं नूनं सर्वमेतत्तवानघ ॥
तेऽत्यक्रामन्मतिं मह्यं भीष्मस्य विदुरस्य च । ततो यमक्षयं जग्मुः समासाद्येतरेतरम् ॥
पञ्च वै पाण्डवाः शिष्टा हतमित्रा हतात्मजाः । धार्तराष्ट्राश्च निहताः सर्वे ससुतबान्धवाः ॥
data.md: Encountering one another they then becaine guests of Yama's palace. Only the five Pandavas form the remnant of the un-slain, all their friends and all their children having been destroyed. All the sons Dhritarashtra also, with thcir children and kinsmen, have been killed.

data.v: इत्युक्तवचने कृष्णे भृशं क्रोधसमन्वितः । उत्तङ्कः प्रत्युवाचैनं रोषादुत्फाल्य लोचने ॥
data.md: When Krishna had said these words, Utanka, filled with anger, and with eyes expanded in rage, addressed him in these words.

data.v: यस्माच्छक्तेन ते कृष्ण न त्राताः कुरुपाण्डवाः । संबन्धिनः प्रियास्तस्माच्छप्स्येऽहं त्वामसंशयम् ॥
data.md: Since, though able, O Krishna, you did not rescue those foremost ones of Kuru's race, who were your relatives and, therefore, dear to you, I shall, forsooth, curse you.

data.v: न च ते प्रसभं यस्मात्ते निगृह्य निवर्तिताः । तस्मान्मन्युपरीतस्त्वां शप्स्यामि मधुसूदन ॥
data.md: Since you did not forcibly compel them to forbear, therefore, O destroyer of Madhu, I shall, filled with anger denounce a course on you.

data.v: त्वया हि शक्तेन सता मिथ्याचारेण माधव । उपचीर्णाः कुरुश्रेष्ठा यस्त्वेतान्समुपेक्षथाः ॥
data.md: It seems, O Madhava, that, though fully able (to save them), you were in different to these foremost of Kurus who, overwhelmed by insincerity and hypocrisy, have all met with destruction.

data.v: शृणु मे विस्तरेणेदं यद्वक्ष्ये भृगुनन्दन । गृहाणानुनयं चापि तपस्वी ह्यसि भार्गव ॥
data.md: O scion of Bhrigu's race listen, to what I say in full. Do you accept my apologies also. O you of Bhrigu's race you are an ascetic!

data.v: श्रुत्वा त्वमेतदध्यात्मं मुञ्चेथाः शापमद्य वै । न च मां तपसाल्पेन शक्तोऽभिभवितुं पुमान् ॥
data.md: After having heard my words about the soul, you may then utter your curse. No man is able, by a little ascetic merit, to put me down.

data.v: न च ते तपसो नाशमिच्छामि जपतां वर । तपस्ते सुमहद्दीप्तं गुरवश्चापि तोषिताः ॥
data.md: O foremost of ascetics, I do not wish to see the destruction of all your penances! You have a large measure of blazing penances. You have passed your preceptors and seniors.

data.v: कौमारं ब्रह्मचर्यं ते जानामि द्विजसत्तम । दुःखार्जितस्य तपसस्तस्मान्नेच्छामि ते व्ययम् ॥
data.md: O foremost of twice-born ones. I know that you have observed the rules of Brahmacharya from your infancy. I do not, therefore wish the loss or diminution of your penances acquired with so much pain!

data.v: ब्रूहि केशव तत्त्वेन त्वमध्यात्ममनिन्दितम् । श्रुत्वा श्रेयोऽभिधास्यामि शापं वा ते जनार्दन ॥
data.md: Utanka said Do you, O Keshava, tell ine that faultless spiritual science. Having heard your discourse I shall ordain what is for your good or imprecate a curse to you O Janardana!

data.v: तमो रजश्च सत्त्वं च विद्धि भावान्मदाश्रयान् । तथा रुद्रान्वसूंश्चापि विद्धि मत्प्रभवान्द्विज ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said Know that the three qualities of Ignorance, Darkness and Goodness exist, depending on me as their refuge. So also, O twice-born one, know that the Rudras and the Vasus have originated from me.

data.v: मयि सर्वाणि भूतानि सर्वभूतेषु चाप्यहम् । स्थित इत्यभिजानीहि मा तेऽभूदत्र संशयः ॥
data.md: In me are all creatures, and in all creatures do I exist know this. Let no doubt arise in your mind about this.

data.v: तथा दैत्यगणान्सर्वान्यक्षराक्षसपन्नगान् । गन्धर्वाप्सरसश्चैव विद्धि मत्प्रभवान्द्विज ॥
data.md: So also, O twice-born one, know that all the tribes of the Daityas, all the Yakshas, Gandharvas, Rakshasas, Nagas, Apsaras, have originated from me.

data.v: सदसच्चैव यत्प्राहुरव्यक्तं व्यक्तमेव च । अक्षरं च क्षरं चैव सर्वमेतन्मदात्मकम् ॥
data.md: Whatever has been called existent and nonexistent, whatever is manifest, and notmanifest, whatever is destructible and indestructible, all have me for their soul.

data.v: ये चाश्रमेषु वै धर्माश्चतुर्षु विहिता मुने । दैवानि चैव कर्माणि विद्धि सर्वं मदात्मकम् ॥
data.md: Those fourfold courses of duty which, O ascetic, are known to attach to the (four) modes of life, and all the Vedic duties, have me for their soul.

data.v: असच्च सदसच्चैव यद्विश्वं सदसतः परम् । ततः परं नास्ति चैव देवदेवात्सनातनात् ॥
data.md: Whatever is non-existent, whatever is existent and non-existent, and whatever is above that which is existent and not existent, all these which form the universe-are from me. There is nothing higher (or beyond) me who am the eternal god of gods.

data.v: ओंकारप्रभवान्वेदान्विद्धि मां त्वं भृगूद्वह । यूपं सोमं तथैवेह त्रिदशाप्यायनं मखे ॥
होतारमपि हव्यं च विद्धि मां भृगुनन्दन । अध्वर्युः कल्पकश्चापि हविः परमसंस्कृतम् ॥
उद्गाता चापि मां स्तौति गीतघोषैर्महाध्वरे । प्रायश्चित्तेषु मां ब्रह्मञ्शान्तिमङ्गलवाचकाः । स्तुवन्ति विश्वकर्माणं सततं द्विजसत्तमाः ॥
विद्धि मह्यं सुतं धर्ममग्रजं द्विजसत्तम । मानसं दयितं विप्र सर्वभूतदयात्मकम् ॥
data.md: Know, O best of twice-born persons, that Dharma is my eldest-born offspring, originated from my mind, O learned Brahmana, whose essence is for all creatures.

data.v: तत्राहं वर्तमानैश्च निवृत्तैश्चैव मानवैः । बह्वीः संसरमाणो वै योनीर्हि द्विजसत्तम ॥
data.md: Constantly changing myself, I take birth in various wombs. O best of men, for upholding that son of mine, with the help of men now existing in or departed from the world. Indeed, I do this for protecting Virtue and for establishing it.

data.v: धर्मसंरक्षणार्थाय धर्मसंस्थापनाय च । तैस्तैर्वेषैश्च रूपैश्च त्रिषु लोकेषु भार्गव ॥
अहं विष्णुरहं ब्रह्मा शक्रोऽथ प्रभवाप्ययः । भूतग्रामस्य सर्वस्य स्रष्टा संहार एव च ॥
अधर्मे वर्तमानानां सर्वेषामहमप्युत । धर्मस्य सेतुं बध्नामि चलिते चलिते युगे । तास्ता योनीः प्रविश्याहं प्रजानां हितकाम्यया ॥
data.md: In every cycle I have to repair the causeway of Virtue, entering into various kinds of wombs from desire of doing good to my creatures.

data.v: यदा त्वहं देवयोनौ वर्तामि भृगुनन्दन । तदाहं देववत्सर्वमाचरामि न संशयः ॥
data.md: When, O son of Bhrigu's race, I live in the order of the celestials, I then indeed, act in i every respect as a celestial.

data.v: यदा गन्धर्वयोनौ तु वर्तामि भृगुनन्दन । तदा गन्धर्ववच्चेष्टाः सर्वाश्चेष्टामि भार्गव ॥
data.md: When I live in the order of the Gandharvas, I then, O son of Bhrigu's race, act in every . respect as a Gandharva.

data.v: नागयोनौ यदा चैव तदा वर्तामि नागवत् । यक्षराक्षसयोनीश्च यथावद्विचराम्यहम् ॥
data.md: When I live in the order of the Nagas I then act as a Naga, and when I live in the order of Yakshas or that of Rakshasas, I act after the manner of that order.

data.v: मानुष्ये वर्तमाने तु कृपणं याचिता मया । न च ते जातसंमोहा वचो गृह्णन्ति मे हितम् ॥
data.md: Born now in the order of men I must act a human being. I appealed to them (the Kauravas) most piteously. But stupefied as they were and deprived of their senses, they refused to take my words.

data.v: भयं च महदुद्दिश्य त्रासिताः कुरवो मया । क्रुद्धेव भूत्वा च पुनर्यथावदनुदर्शिताः ॥
data.md: I frightened them, filled with anger referring to some great fear. But once more I showed themselves my usual human forin.

data.v: तेऽधर्मेणेह संयुक्ताः परीताः कालधर्मणा । धर्मेण निहता युद्धे गताः स्वर्गं न संशयः ॥
data.md: Possessed as they were of unrighteousness, and assailed by the virtue of liine, all of them have been righteously killed in battle, and have, forsooth, gone to the celestial region.

data.v: लोकेषु पाण्डवाश्चैव गताः ख्यातिं द्विजोत्तम । एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि ॥
data.md: The Pandavas also, O best of Brahmanas have acquired great fame. I have these told you all that you had asked me.

data.v: अभिजानामि जगतः कर्तारं त्वां जनार्दन । नूनं भवत्प्रसादोऽयमिति मे नास्ति संशयः ॥
data.md: Utanka said I know you, O Janardana, to be the creator of the universe. Forsooth, this knowledge that I have is the result of your grace towards me.

data.v: चित्तं च सुप्रसन्नं मे त्वद्भावगतमच्युत । विनिवृत्तश्च मे कोप इति विद्धि परंतप ॥
data.md: O you of unfading glory, my heart is possessed of cheerful tranquility on account of its being devoted to you. Know, O chastiser of enemies, that my heart is no longer inclined to curse you.

data.v: यदि त्वनुग्रहं कंचित्त्वत्तोऽर्होऽहं जनार्दन । द्रष्टुमिच्छामि ते रूपमैश्वरं तन्निदर्शय ॥
data.md: If, O Janardana, I deserve the least grace from you, do you then show me once your supreme form.

data.v: ततः स तस्मै प्रीतात्मा दर्शयामास तद्वपुः । शाश्वतं वैष्णवं धीमान्ददृशे यद्धनंजयः ॥
data.md: Pleased with him, the holy one then showed Uttanka that eternal Vaishnava form which Dhananjaya of great intelligence had seen.

data.v: स ददर्श महात्मानं विश्वरूपं महाभुजम् । विस्मयं च ययौ विप्रस्तद्दृष्ट्वा रूपमैश्वरम् ॥
data.md: Sceing that high and wonderful Vaishnava form of Vishnu, in fact, seeing the Supreme Lord in (that guise) the Brahmana Utanka became filled with wonder.

data.v: विश्वकर्मन्नमस्तेऽस्तु यस्य ते रूपमीदृशम् । पद्भ्यां ते पृथिवी व्याप्ता शिरसा चावृतं नभः ॥
data.md: Utanka said O you whose handiwork is the universe. I bow to you, O soul of the universe, O parent of all things! With your feet you have covered the entire Earth, and with your head you fill the firmament.

data.v: द्यावापृथिव्योर्यन्मध्यं जठरेण तदावृतम् । भुजाभ्यामावृताश्चाशास्त्वमिदं सर्वमच्युत ॥
data.md: That which lies between the Earth and the firmament has been filled by your stomach. All the points of the compass are covered by your arms. O you of unfading glory, you are all this.

data.v: संहरस्व पुनर्देव रूपमक्षय्यमुत्तमम् । पुनस्त्वां स्वेन रूपेण द्रष्टुमिच्छामि शाश्वतम् ॥
data.md: Do you withdraw this excellent and indestructible forin of yours. I wish to see you now in your own (human) form which too, is eternal.

data.v: तमुवाच प्रसन्नात्मा गोविन्दो जनमेजय । वरं वृणीष्वेति तदा तमुत्तङ्कोऽब्रवीदिदम् ॥
data.md: To him, O Janaimejaya, Govinda of contented spirit said these words, Do you ask for some boon! To him Utanka, however said this is a sufficient boon from you for the present, O you of great splendour, in that, O Krishna, I have seen this form of yours, O foremost of all beings!

data.v: पर्याप्त एष एवाद्य वरस्त्वत्तो महाद्युते । यत्ते रूपमिदं कृष्ण पश्यामि प्रभवाप्ययम् ॥
तमब्रवीत्पुनः कृष्णो मा त्वमत्र विचारय । अवश्यमेतत्कर्तव्यममोघं दर्शनं मम ॥
data.md: Krishna, however, once more said to him, 'Do not scruple in this matter! This must be done! A sight of my form cannot be fruitless!

data.v: अवश्यकरणीयं वै यद्येतन्मन्यसे विभो । तोयमिच्छामि यत्रेष्टं मरुष्वेतद्धि दुर्लभम् ॥
data.md: I must accomplish that, O lord, which you think should be done! I wish to have water wherever my wish for it may arise. Water is scarce in such deserts!

data.v: ततः संहृत्य तत्तेजः प्रोवाचोत्तङ्कमीश्वरः । एष्टव्ये सति चिन्त्योऽहमित्युक्त्वा द्वारकां ययौ ॥
data.md: Withdrawing that energy, the Supreme Lord then said to Utanka, Whenever you will require water, think of me!' Having said so, he proceeded towards of Dwraka.

data.v: ततः कदाचिद्भगवानुत्तङ्कस्तोयकाङ्क्षया । तृषितः परिचक्राम मरौ सस्मार चाच्युतम् ॥
data.md: Subsequently, one day, the illustrious Utanka, solicitous of water and greatly thirsty, wandered over the desert. In course of his wanderings he thought of Krishna of unfading glory.

data.v: ततो दिग्वाससं धीमान्मातङ्गं मलपङ्किनम् । अपश्यत मरौ तस्मिञ्श्वयूथपरिवारितम् ॥
data.md: The intelligent Rishi then saw in that desert a naked hunter (of the Chandala class), all besmeared with dirt, surrounded by a pack of dogs.

data.v: भीषणं बद्धनिस्त्रिंशं बाणकार्मुकधारिणम् । तस्याधः स्रोतसोऽपश्यद्वारि भूरि द्विजोत्तमः ॥
data.md: Extremely fierce-loO king, he carried a sword and was armed with bow and arrows. That foremost of twice-born ones saw copious streams of water issuing from the urinary organs of that hunter.

data.v: स्मरन्नेव च तं प्राह मातङ्गः प्रहसन्निव । एह्युत्तङ्क प्रतीच्छस्व मत्तो वारि भृगूद्वह । कृपा हि मे सुमहती त्वां दृष्ट्वा तृट्समाहतम् ॥
data.md: As soon as Utanka had thought of Krishna, that hunter smilingly addressed him, saying, O Utanka, oyou or Bhrigu's race, do yoil accept this water from me.

data.v: इत्युक्तस्तेन स मुनिस्तत्तोयं नाभ्यनन्दत । चिक्षेप च स तं धीमान्वाग्भिरुग्राभिरच्युतम् ॥
पुनः पुनश्च मातङ्गः पिबस्वेति तमब्रवीत् । न चापिबत्स सक्रोधः क्षुभितेनान्तरात्मना ॥
स तथा निश्चयात्तेन प्रत्याख्यातो महात्मना । श्वभिः सह महाराज तत्रैवान्तरधीयत ॥
data.md: The ascetic refused to drink the water thus given. On the other hand, with heart stricken with hunger and thirst, he even became angry. Disregarded by the great Rishi through that conviction, the hunter, O king, with his pack of dogs, disappeared there and then. Seeing that disappearance, Utanka felt himself ashamed.

data.v: उत्तङ्कस्तं तथा दृष्ट्वा ततो व्रीडितमानसः । मेने प्रलब्धमात्मानं कृष्णेनामित्रघातिना ॥
अथ तेनैव मार्गेण शङ्खचक्रगदाधरः । आजगाम महाबाहुरुत्तङ्कश्चैनमब्रवीत् ॥
न युक्तं तादृशं दातुं त्वया पुरुषसत्तम । सलिलं विप्रमुख्येभ्यो मातङ्गस्रोतसा विभो ॥
इत्युक्तवचनं धीमान्महाबुद्धिर्जनार्दनः । उत्तङ्कं श्लक्ष्णया वाचा सान्त्वयन्निदमब्रवीत् ॥
यादृशेनेह रूपेण योग्यं दातुं वृतेन वै । तादृशं खलु मे दत्तं त्वं तु तन्नावबुध्यसे ॥
मया त्वदर्थमुक्तो हि वज्रपाणिः पुरंदरः । उत्तङ्कायामृतं देहि तोयरूपमिति प्रभुः ॥
स मामुवाच देवेन्द्रो न मर्त्योऽमर्त्यतां व्रजेत् । अन्यमस्मै वरं देहीत्यसकृद्भृगुनन्दन ॥
अमृतं देयमित्येव मयोक्तः स शचीपतिः । स मां प्रसाद्य देवेन्द्रः पुनरेवेदमब्रवीत् ॥
यदि देयमवश्यं वै मातङ्गोऽहं महाद्युते । भूत्वामृतं प्रदास्यामि भार्गवाय महात्मने ॥
यद्येवं प्रतिगृह्णाति भार्गवोऽमृतमद्य वै । प्रदातुमेष गच्छामि भार्गवायामृतं प्रभो । प्रत्याख्यातस्त्वहं तेन न दद्यामिति भार्गव ॥
स तथा समयं कृत्वा तेन रूपेण वासवः । उपस्थितस्त्वया चापि प्रत्याख्यातोऽमृतं ददत् । चण्डालरूपी भगवान्सुमहांस्ते व्यतिक्रमः ॥
यत्तु शक्यं मया कर्तुं भूय एव तवेप्सितम् । तोयेप्सां तव दुर्धर्ष करिष्ये सफलामहम् ॥
येष्वहःसु तव ब्रह्मन्सलिलेच्छा भविष्यति । तदा मरौ भविष्यन्ति जलपूर्णाः पयोधराः ॥
रसवच्च प्रदास्यन्ति ते तोयं भृगुनन्दन । उत्तङ्कमेघा इत्युक्ताः ख्यातिं यास्यन्ति चापि ते ॥
इत्युक्तः प्रीतिमान्विप्रः कृष्णेन स बभूव ह । अद्याप्युत्तङ्कमेघाश्च मरौ वर्षन्ति भारत ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by Krishna, Utanka became Glad, and to this day, O Bharata, Utankaclouds (appear and) shower rain on arid deserts.

data.v: उत्तङ्कः केन तपसा संयुक्तः सुमहातपाः । यः शापं दातुकामोऽभूद्विष्णवे प्रभविष्णवे ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said With what penances was the great Uttanka endued so that he entertained the wish to imprecate a curse on Vishnu himself, who is the source of all power?

data.v: उत्तङ्को महता युक्तस्तपसा जनमेजय । गुरुभक्तः स तेजस्वी नान्यं कंचिदपूजयत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Janamejaya, Utanka was gifted with austere penances. He was devoted to his preceptor. Gifted with great energy, he abstained from adoring anybody else.

data.v: सर्वेषामृषिपुत्राणामेष चासीन्मनोरथः । औत्तङ्कीं गुरुवृत्तिं वै प्राप्नुयामिति भारत ॥
data.md: All the children of the Rishis, O Bharata, entertained even this desire, viz., that their devotion to preceptors should be as great as that of Utanka.

data.v: गौतमस्य तु शिष्याणां बहूनां जनमेजय । उत्तङ्केऽभ्यधिका प्रीतिः स्नेहश्चैवाभवत्तदा ॥
data.md: Gautama's gratification with and affection for Utanka, among his numberless disciples, were every great, O Janamejaya.

data.v: स तस्य दमशौचाभ्यां विक्रान्तेन च कर्मणा । सम्यक्चैवोपचारेण गौतमः प्रीतिमानभूत् ॥
data.md: Indecd, Gautama was greatly pleased with the self-control and purity of conduct that marked out Utanka, and with his acts or prowess and the services he did to him.

data.v: अथ शिष्यसहस्राणि समनुज्ञाय गौतमः । उत्तङ्कं परया प्रीत्या नाभ्यनुज्ञातुमैच्छत ॥
data.md: One after another, thousands of disciples received the preceptors' permission to return home. On account, however, of his great affection for Utanka, Gautama could not permit him to leave his hermitage.

data.v: तं क्रमेण जरा तात प्रतिपेदे महामुनिम् । न चान्वबुध्यत तदा स मुनिर्गुरुवत्सलः ॥
