data.md: Gradually, in course of time, O son, decrepitude overtook Utanka, that great ascetic. The ascetic, however, on account of his devotion to his prcccptor, was not conscious of it.

data.v: ततः कदाचिद्राजेन्द्र काष्ठान्यानयितुं ययौ । उत्तङ्कः काष्ठभारं च महान्तं समुपानयत् ॥
data.md: One day, he started, O king for fetching fuel for his preceptor. Soon after Utanka brought a heavy load of fuel.

data.v: स तु भाराभिभूतात्मा काष्ठभारमरिंदम । निष्पिपेष क्षितौ राजन्परिश्रान्तो बुभुक्षितः ॥
data.md: Toil-worn and hungry and afflicted by the load he carried on his head, O chastiser of enemies, he threw the load down on the Earth, O king.

data.v: तस्य काष्ठे विलग्नाभूज्जटा रूप्यसमप्रभा । ततः काष्ठैः सह तदा पपात धरणीतले ॥
data.md: One of his matted locks, white as silver, had become entangled with the load. Accordingly, when the load was thrown down, with in fell on the earth that matted lock of hair.

data.v: ततः स भारनिष्पिष्टः क्षुधाविष्टश्च भार्गवः । दृष्ट्वा तां वयसोऽवस्थां रुरोदार्तस्वरं तदा ॥
data.md: Oppressed as he had been by that load and overcome by hunger, O Bharata, Utanka, secing that sign of old age, began to bewail a loud from excess of sorrow.

data.v: ततो गुरुसुता तस्य पद्मपत्रनिभेक्षणा । जग्राहाश्रूणि सुश्रोणी करेण पृथुलोचना । पितुर्नियोगाद्धर्मज्ञा शिरसावनता तदा ॥
data.md: Knowing every duty, the daughter of his preceptor then who had cyes resembling lotus petals, and hips that were full and round, at the command her father, sought, with downcast face, to hold Utanka's tears in her hands. Her hands scemed to burn with those tear-drops that she held. Unable, accordingly, to hold them longer, she was compelled to throw them down on the earth.

data.v: तस्या निपेततुर्दग्धौ करौ तैरश्रुबिन्दुभिः । न हि तानश्रुपातान्वै शक्ता धारयितुं मही ॥
गौतमस्त्वब्रवीद्विप्रमुत्तङ्कं प्रीतमानसः । कस्मात्तात तवाद्येह शोकोत्तरमिदं मनः । स स्वैरं ब्रूहि विप्रर्षे श्रोतुमिच्छामि ते वचः ॥
data.md: The Earth herself was unable to hold those tear-drops of Utanka. With a pleased heart, Gautama then said to the twice-born Utanka, 'Why, O son, is your mind so afflicted with grief today? Tell me calmly and quietly, O learned Rishi, for I wish to hear it in full.

data.v: भवद्गतेन मनसा भवत्प्रियचिकीर्षया । भवद्भक्तिगतेनेह भवद्भावानुगेन च ॥
जरेयं नावबुद्धा मे नाभिज्ञातं सुखं च मे । शतवर्षोषितं हि त्वं न मामभ्यनुजानथाः ॥
भवता ह्यभ्यनुज्ञाताः शिष्याः प्रत्यवरा मया । उपपन्ना द्विजश्रेष्ठ शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: Many disciples of yours, who were my juniors, have, however, been permitted by you to return. Indeed, hundreds and thousands of foremost Brahmanas have, gifted with knowledge, bcen favoured with your permission.

data.v: त्वत्प्रीतियुक्तेन मया गुरुशुश्रूषया तव । व्यतिक्रामन्महान्कालो नावबुद्धो द्विजर्षभ ॥
data.md: Gautama said Through my love and affection for you, and on account of your dutiful services to me, a long time has passed without my knowing it, O foremost of Brahmanas.

data.v: किं त्वद्य यदि ते श्रद्धा गमनं प्रति भार्गव । अनुज्ञां गृह्य मत्तस्त्वं गृहान्गच्छस्व मा चिरम् ॥
data.md: If, however, O you of Bhrigu's race, you desire to leave this place, do you go without delay, with my permission.

data.v: गुर्वर्थं कं प्रयच्छामि ब्रूहि त्वं द्विजसत्तम । तमुपाकृत्य गच्छेयमनुज्ञातस्त्वया विभो ॥
data.md: Utanka said What shall I present to my preceptor? Tell me this, O best of twice-born persons. Having brought it, I shall go hence, O lord, with your permission.

data.v: दक्षिणा परितोषो वै गुरूणां सद्भिरुच्यते । तव ह्याचरतो ब्रह्मंस्तुष्टोऽहं वै न संशयः ॥
data.md: Gautama said The good say that the satisfaction of the preceptor is the final fee. Forsooth, O twiceborn one, I have been highly pleased with your conduct.

data.v: इत्थं च परितुष्टं मां विजानीहि भृगूद्वह । युवा षोडशवर्षो हि यदद्य भविता भवान् ॥
data.md: Know, O perpetuator of Bhrigu's race, that I have been highly pleased with your conduct. Know, Operpetuator of Bhrigu's race, that I have been very much pleased with you for this. If you become a young man today of sixteen years, I shall confer on you, O twice-born years, I shall confer on you. O twice-born one, this my own daughter for becoming your wife. No other woman except this one is capable of waiting upon your energy.

data.v: ददामि पत्नीं कन्यां च स्वां ते दुहितरं द्विज । एतामृते हि नान्या वै त्वत्तेजोऽर्हति सेवितुम् ॥
data.md: Know, O perpetuator of Bhrigu's race, that I have been highly pleased with your conduct. Know, Operpetuator of Bhrigu's race, that I have been very much pleased with you for this. If you become a young man today of sixteen years, I shall confer on you, O twice-born years, I shall confer on you. O twice-born one, this my own daughter for becoming your wife. No other woman except this one is capable of waiting upon your energy.

data.v: ततस्तां प्रतिजग्राह युवा भूत्वा यशस्विनीम् । गुरुणा चाभ्यनुज्ञातो गुरुपत्नीमथाब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: At these words of Gautama. Utanka once again became a youth and accepted that famous maiden for his wife. Receiving the permission of his preceptor, he then addressed his preceptor's wife, saying, What shall I give you as final fee for my preceptor? Do you command me. I wish to do, with riches, or even my life, what is agreeable and beneficial to you.

data.v: किं भवत्यै प्रयच्छामि गुर्वर्थं विनियुङ्क्ष्व माम् । प्रियं हि तव काङ्क्षामि प्राणैरपि धनैरपि ॥
data.md: At these words of Gautama. Utanka once again became a youth and accepted that famous maiden for his wife. Receiving the permission of his preceptor, he then addressed his preceptor's wife, saying, What shall I give you as final fee for my preceptor? Do you command me. I wish to do, with riches, or even my life, what is agreeable and beneficial to you.

data.v: यद्दुर्लभं हि लोकेऽस्मिन्रत्नमत्यद्भुतं भवेत् । तदानयेयं तपसा न हि मेऽत्रास्ति संशयः ॥
data.md: Whatever gem, exceedingly wonderful and of great value, exists in this world, I shall bring for you with the help of my penances. I have no doubt in this.

data.v: परितुष्टास्मि ते पुत्र नित्यं भगवता सह । पर्याप्तये तद्भद्रं ते गच्छ तात यथेच्छकम् ॥
data.md: I am highly pleased with you, O learned Brahmana, with your unceasing devotion, O sinless one. This is enough. Blessed be you, go wherever you like.

data.v: उत्तङ्कस्तु महाराज पुनरेवाब्रवीद्वचः । आज्ञापयस्व मां मातः कर्तव्यं हि प्रियं तव ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, Utanka, however, O king, once more said these words, Do you command me, O mother. It is proper that I should do something that is agreeable to you.

data.v: सौदासपत्न्या विदिते दिव्ये वै मणिकुण्डले । ते समानय भद्रं ते गुर्वर्थः सुकृतो भवेत् ॥
data.md: Ahalya said Blessed be you, bring for me those celestial ear-rings which are worn by the wife of Saudasa. That which is due to your preceptor will then be well-discharged.

data.v: स तथेति प्रतिश्रुत्य जगाम जनमेजय । गुरुपत्नीप्रियार्थं वै ते समानयितुं तदा ॥
data.md: Replying her, 'So be it'. Utanka went away. O Janamejaya, determined upon bringing those ear-rings for doing what his preceptor's wife liked.

data.v: स जगाम ततः शीघ्रमुत्तङ्को ब्राह्मणर्षभः । सौदासं पुरुषादं वै भिक्षितुं मणिकुण्डले ॥
data.md: That foremost of Brahmanas, Utanka, proceeded forthwith to Saudasa who had become a cannibal, in order to solicit the earrings from him.

data.v: गौतमस्त्वब्रवीत्पत्नीमुत्तङ्को नाद्य दृश्यते । इति पृष्टा तमाचष्ट कुण्डलार्थं गतं तु वै ॥
data.md: Gautama meanwhile said to his wife —'Utanka is not to be seen today. Thus addressed, she informed him how he had gone for fetching the jewelled ear-rings (of Saudasa's queen).

data.v: ततः प्रोवाच पत्नीं स न ते सम्यगिदं कृतम् । शप्तः स पार्थिवो नूनं ब्राह्मणं तं वधिष्यति ॥
data.md: At this, Gautama said, 'You have not acted wisely. Cursed (by Vasishtha), that king will, indeed, kill Utanka.

data.v: अजानन्त्या नियुक्तः स भगवन्ब्राह्मणोऽद्य मे । भवत्प्रसादान्न भयं किंचित्तस्य भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Ahalya said Without knowing this, O holy one I have engaged Utanka in this task. He shall not, however, come by any danger through your grace.

data.v: इत्युक्तः प्राह तां पत्नीमेवमस्त्विति गौतमः । उत्तङ्कोऽपि वने शून्ये राजानं तं ददर्श ह ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by her, Gautama said, 'Let it be so.' Meanwhile, Utanka met king Saudasa in a deserted forest.

data.v: स तं दृष्ट्वा तथाभूतं राजानं घोरदर्शनम् । दीर्घश्मश्रुधरं नॄणां शोणितेन समुक्षितम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Seeing the king, who had become so, of frightful appearance, wearing a long beard smeared with the blood of human beings, the Brahmana Utanka, O king, did not become moved.

data.v: चकार न व्यथां विप्रो राजा त्वेनमथाब्रवीत् । प्रत्युत्थाय महातेजा भयकर्ता यमोपमः ॥
data.md: That highly energetic monarch, inspiring terror in every breast and loO king like a second Yama, rising up addressed Utanka, saying, ‘By good luck, O best of Brahmanas, you have come to me at the sixth hour of the day when I am in search of food.

data.v: दिष्ट्या त्वमसि कल्याण षष्ठे काले ममान्तिकम् । भक्षं मृगयमाणस्य संप्राप्तो द्विजसत्तम ॥
data.md: That highly energetic monarch, inspiring terror in every breast and loO king like a second Yama, rising up addressed Utanka, saying, ‘By good luck, O best of Brahmanas, you have come to me at the sixth hour of the day when I am in search of food.

data.v: राजन्गुर्वर्थिनं विद्धि चरन्तं मामिहागतम् । न च गुर्वर्थमुद्युक्तं हिंस्यमाहुर्मनीषिणः ॥
data.md: Utanka said O king, know that I have come here in course of my wanderings for the sake of my preceptor, The wise have said that while one is engaged for the sake of one's preceptor, one should not be injured.

data.v: षष्ठे काले ममाहारो विहितो द्विजसत्तम । न च शक्यः समुत्स्रष्टुं क्षुधितेन मयाद्य वै ॥
data.md: The king said O best of Brahmanas, food has been ordained for me at the sixth hour of the day. I am hungry. I cannot, therefore, allow you escape today.

data.v: एवमस्तु महाराज समयः क्रियतां तु मे । गुर्वर्थमभिनिर्वर्त्य पुनरेष्यामि ते वशम् ॥
data.md: Utanka said Let it be so, O king! Let this agreement be made with me! After I have ceased to wander for my preceptor I shall once more come and put myself within your power.

data.v: संश्रुतश्च मया योऽर्थो गुरवे राजसत्तम । त्वदधीनः स राजेन्द्र तं त्वा भिक्षे नरेश्वर ॥
data.md: I have heard, O best of kings, that the object I seek for my preceptor is under your control, O king, therefore, O king I beg you for it.

data.v: ददासि विप्रमुख्येभ्यस्त्वं हि रत्नानि सर्वशः । दाता त्वं च नरव्याघ्र पात्रभूतः क्षिताविह । पात्रं प्रतिग्रहे चापि विद्धि मां नृपसत्तम ॥
data.md: You every day give many foremost of gems to superior Brahmanas. You are a giver, O king, from whom gifts may be accepted. know that I too am a worthy object of charity present before you, O best of kings.

data.v: उपाकृत्य गुरोरर्थं त्वदायत्तमरिंदम । समयेनेह राजेन्द्र पुनरेष्यामि ते वशम् ॥
सत्यं ते प्रतिजानामि नात्र मिथ्यास्ति किंचन । अनृतं नोक्तपूर्वं मे स्वैरेष्वपि कुतोऽन्यथा ॥
data.md: Having accepted from you in gift that object for my preceptor, which is under your control, I shall, O king, on account of my agreement, once more come back to you and put myself under your power. I assure you truly of this. There is no falsehood in this. Never before have I spoken any falsehood, no not even in jest! What shall I say then of other occasions?

data.v: यदि मत्तस्त्वदायत्तो गुर्वर्थः कृत एव सः । यदि चास्मि प्रतिग्राह्यः सांप्रतं तद्ब्रवीहि मे ॥
data.md: If the object you seck for your preceptor is capable of being placed in your hands by me. If। I be considered as one from whom a gift may be accepted, do you then say what that object is!

data.v: प्रतिग्राह्यो मतो मे त्वं सदैव पुरुषर्षभ । सोऽहं त्वामनुसंप्राप्तो भिक्षितुं मणिकुण्डले ॥
data.md: Utanka said O foremost of men, O Saudasa, in my estimation you are a worthy person from whom gifts may be accepted. I have, therefore, come to you for begging of you the jewelled earrings (worn by your queen).

data.v: पत्न्यास्ते मम विप्रर्षे रुचिरे मणिकुण्डले । वरयार्थं त्वमन्यं वै तं ते दास्यामि सुव्रत ॥
data.md: Saudasa said Those jewelled ear-rings, O learned and twice-born Rishi, belong to my wife. They should be asked from her. Do you therefore, solicit some other things froin me. I shall give it to you, O you of excellent vows!

data.v: अलं ते व्यपदेशेन प्रमाणं यदि ते वयम् । प्रयच्छ कुण्डले मे त्वं सत्यवाग्भव पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Utanka said If we be considered as any authority, do you cease then to urge this pretext. Do you give those jewelled ear-rings to me. Be truthful in speech, O king.

data.v: इत्युक्तस्त्वब्रवीद्राजा तमुत्तङ्कं पुनर्वचः । गच्छ मद्वचनाद्देवीं ब्रूहि देहीति सत्तम ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, Thus addressed, the king once addressed Utanka and said to him, Do you, at my word, go to my venerable queen, O best of men, and ask her saying, Give!' She of pure Vows, thus begged by you will certainly, at my command, give you, O foremost of twice-born persons, those jewelled ear-rings of hers without doubt. more

data.v: सैवमुक्ता त्वया नूनं मद्वाक्येन शुचिस्मिता । प्रदास्यति द्विजश्रेष्ठ कुण्डले ते न संशयः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, Thus addressed, the king once addressed Utanka and said to him, Do you, at my word, go to my venerable queen, O best of men, and ask her saying, Give!' She of pure Vows, thus begged by you will certainly, at my command, give you, O foremost of twice-born persons, those jewelled ear-rings of hers without doubt. more

data.v: क्व पत्नी भवतः शक्या मया द्रष्टुं नरेश्वर । स्वयं वापि भवान्पत्नीं किमर्थं नोपसर्पति ॥
data.md: Utanka said Where, O king, shall I be able to meet your queen? Why do you not yourself go to her?

data.v: द्रक्ष्यते तां भवानद्य कस्मिंश्चिद्वननिर्झरे । षष्ठे काले न हि मया सा शक्या द्रष्टुमद्य वै ॥
data.md: Saudasa said You will find hier today near a forest fountain. I cannot see her today as the sixth hour of the day has come.

data.v: उत्तङ्कस्तु तथोक्तः स जगाम भरतर्षभ । मदयन्तीं च दृष्ट्वा सोऽज्ञापयत्स्वं प्रयोजनम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, Thus addressed, Utanka, O chief of Bharata's race, then left that place. Seeing Madayanti, he informed her of his object.

data.v: सौदासवचनं श्रुत्वा ततः सा पृथुलोचना । प्रत्युवाच महाबुद्धिमुत्तङ्कं जनमेजय ॥
data.md: Hearing the order of Saudasa, that lady of large eyes replied to the highly intelligent Utanka, O Janamejaya, in these words.

data.v: एवमेतन्महाब्रह्मन्नानृतं वदसेऽनघ । अभिज्ञानं तु किंचित्त्वं समानेतुमिहार्हसि ॥
data.md: It is even so, Otwice-born one. You should, however, O sinless one, assure me that you do not say what is untrue! You should bring me some signet from my husband.

data.v: इमे हि दिव्ये मणिकुण्डले मे; देवाश्च यक्षाश्च महोरगाश्च । तैस्तैरुपायैः परिहर्तुकामा;श्छिद्रेषु नित्यं परितर्कयन्ति ॥
data.md: These celestial ear-rings of mine, made of rich gems, are such that the celestials and Yakshas and great Rishis always watch for opportunities for taking them away.

data.v: निक्षिप्तमेतद्भुवि पन्नगास्तु; रत्नं समासाद्य परामृषेयुः । यक्षास्तथोच्छिष्टधृतं सुराश्च; निद्रावशं त्वा परिधर्षयेयुः ॥
data.md: If placed at any time on the Earth, this costly article would then be stolen by the Nagas. If worn by one who is impure on account of eating, it would then be taken away by the Yakshas. If the wearer falls asleep, the celestials would then take them away.

data.v: छिद्रेष्वेतेषु हि सदा ह्यधृष्येषु द्विजर्षभ । देवराक्षसनागानामप्रमत्तेन धार्यते ॥
data.md: O best of Brahmanas, these ear-rings are capable of being taken away when such opportunities come, by celestials and Rakshasas and Nagas, if worn by a careless person.

data.v: स्यन्देते हि दिवा रुक्मं रात्रौ च द्विजसत्तम । नक्तं नक्षत्रताराणां प्रभामाक्षिप्य वर्तते ॥
data.md: O best of twice-born ones, these ear-rings, day and night, always produce gold. At night, they shine brightly, attracting the rays of stars and constellations.

data.v: एते ह्यामुच्य भगवन्क्षुत्पिपासाभयं कुतः । विषाग्निश्वापदेभ्यश्च भयं जातु न विद्यते ॥
data.md: O holy one, if worn by any one, he would be freed from hunger and thirst and fear of every sort. The wearer of these ear-rings is freed also from the fear of poison and fire and every kind of danger.

data.v: ह्रस्वेन चैते आमुक्ते भवतो ह्रस्वके तदा । अनुरूपेण चामुक्ते तत्प्रमाणे हि जायतः ॥
data.md: If wom by one of short stature, these become short. If worn by one of tall stature, these grow in size.

data.v: एवंविधे ममैते वै कुण्डले परमार्चिते । त्रिषु लोकेषु विख्याते तदभिज्ञानमानय ॥
data.md: Even of such virtucs are these ear-rings of mine. they lauded and honoured everywhere. Indeed, they are known over the three worlds. Do you, therefore, bring inc some sign. are

data.v: स मित्रसहमासाद्य त्वभिज्ञानमयाचत । तस्मै ददावभिज्ञानं स चेक्ष्वाकुवरस्तदा ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Returning to king Saudasa who was always well-disposed towards all his friends, Utanka solicited him for some sign. That foremost one of Ikshaku's race then gave him a sign.

data.v: न चैवैषा गतिः क्षेम्या न चान्या विद्यते गतिः । एतन्मे मतमाज्ञाय प्रयच्छ मणिकुण्डले ॥
data.md: Saudasa said This my present condition is intolerable. I do not see any refuge. Knowing this to be my wish, do you give away the jewelled ear-rings.

data.v: इत्युक्तस्तामुत्तङ्कस्तु भर्तुर्वाक्यमथाब्रवीत् । श्रुत्वा च सा ततः प्रादात्तस्मै ते मणिकुण्डले ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by the king, Utanka returned to the queen and reported to her the world of her husband. Hearing those words, the queen gave to Utanka her jewelled ear-rings.

data.v: अवाप्य कुण्डले ते तु राजानं पुनरब्रवीत् । किमेतद्गुह्यवचनं श्रोतुमिच्छामि पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Having got the ear-rings, Utanka returned to the king and said to him, 'I wish to hear, O king, what the meaning is of those mysterious words which you said as a sign to your queen.

data.v: प्रजा निसर्गाद्विप्रान्वै क्षत्रियाः पूजयन्ति ह । विप्रेभ्यश्चापि बहवो दोषाः प्रादुर्भवन्ति नः ॥
data.md: Saudasa said Kshatriyas are seen to honour the Brahmanas from the very beginning of the creation. Towards the Brahmanas, however, many offences originate (on the part of the Kshatriyas).

data.v: सोऽहं द्विजेभ्यः प्रणतो विप्राद्दोषमवाप्तवान् । गतिमन्यां न पश्यामि मदयन्तीसहायवान् । स्वर्गद्वारस्य गमने स्थाने चेह द्विजोत्तम ॥
data.md: As for myself, I am always bent in humility before them. I am overtaken by a calamity through a Brahmana. Possessed of Madayanti, I do not see any other refuge.

data.v: न हि राज्ञा विशेषेण विरुद्धेन द्विजातिभिः । शक्यं नृलोके संस्थातुं प्रेत्य वा सुखमेधितुम् ॥
data.md: It is impossible for a king that is hostile to Brahmanas to continue living in this world or in acquiring happiness in the next.

data.v: तदिष्टे ते मयैवैते दत्ते स्वे मणिकुण्डले । यः कृतस्तेऽद्य समयः सफलं तं कुरुष्व मे ॥
data.md: Hence have I given you these my jewelled ear-rings which were coveted by you. Do you now keep the agreement which you have made with me today.

data.v: राजंस्तथेह कर्तास्मि पुनरेष्यामि ते वशम् । प्रश्नं तु कंचित्प्रष्टुं त्वां व्यवसिष्ये परंतप ॥
data.md: Utanka said O king, I shall certainly carry out my promise. I shall truly return and place myself under your power. There is, however, a question, O scorcher of enemies which I wish to ask you.

data.v: ब्रूहि विप्र यथाकामं प्रतिवक्तास्मि ते वचः । छेत्तास्मि संशयं तेऽद्य न मेऽत्रास्ति विचारणा ॥
data.md: Saudasa said Say, O learned Brahmana, what is in your mind. I shall certainly reply to your words. I shall remove whatever doubt may being your mind. I have no hesitation in this.

data.v: प्राहुर्वाक्संगतं मित्रं धर्मनैपुण्यदर्शिनः । मित्रेषु यश्च विषमः स्तेन इत्येव तं विदुः ॥
data.md: Utanka said Those who are skilled in the rules of duty, say that Brahmanas are of controlled speech. One who acts wrongly towards friends is considered as vile as a thief.

data.v: स भवान्मित्रतामद्य संप्राप्तो मम पार्थिव । स मे बुद्धिं प्रयच्छस्व समां बुद्धिमतां वर ॥
data.md: You, again, O king, have become my friend today. Do you then, O foremost of men, give me such advice as is approved by the wise.

data.v: अवाप्तार्थोऽहमद्येह भवांश्च पुरुषादकः । भवत्सकाशमागन्तुं क्षमं मम न वेति वा ॥
data.md: As for myself, I have now obtained the fruition of my wishes. You, again, are a cannibal. Is it proper for me to return to you or not.

data.v: क्षमं चेदिह वक्तव्यं मया द्विजवरोत्तम । मत्समीपं द्विजश्रेष्ठ नागन्तव्यं कथंचन ॥
data.md: Saudasa said If it is proper (for me), O foremost of superior Brahmanas, to say what you ask, I should then, O best of twice-born ones, tell you that you should never return to me.

data.v: एवं तव प्रपश्यामि श्रेयो भृगुकुलोद्वह । आगच्छतो हि ते विप्र भवेन्मृत्युरसंशयम् ॥
data.md: O perpetuator of Bhrigu's race, by acting thus, you will secure your well-being. If you return, O learned Brahmana, you will surely meet with death.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तदा राज्ञा क्षमं बुद्धिमता हितम् । समनुज्ञाप्य राजानमहल्यां प्रति जग्मिवान् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by the intelligent king about what was beneficial for him, Utanka took leave of the king and set out for the presence of Ahalya.

data.v: गृहीत्वा कुण्डले दिव्ये गुरुपत्न्याः प्रियंकरः । जवेन महता प्रायाद्गौतमस्याश्रमं प्रति ॥
data.md: Desirous of doing what was agreeable to the wife of his preceptor, he took the ear-rings with him and started with great speed for reaching the hermitage of Gautama.

data.v: यथा तयो रक्षणं च मदयन्त्याभिभाषितम् । तथा ते कुण्डले बद्ध्वा तथा कृष्णाजिनेऽनयत् ॥
data.md: Protecting them even in the manner directed by Madayanti, that is, binding them within the folds of his black, deer-skin, he proceeded on his way.

data.v: स कस्मिंश्चित्क्षुधाविष्टः फलभारसमन्वितम् । बिल्वं ददर्श कस्मिंश्चिदारुरोह क्षुधान्वितः ॥
data.md: After he had proceeded for some distance, he became stricken with hunger. He there saw a Bilva tree covered down with the weight of (ripe) fruits. He climbed that tree.

data.v: शाखास्वासज्य तस्यैव कृष्णाजिनमरिंदम । यस्मिंस्ते कुण्डले बद्धे तदा द्विजवरेण वै ॥
data.md: Causing his deer-skin, O chastiser of enemies, to hang on a branch, that foremost of twice-born ones, then began to pluck some fruits.

data.v: विशीर्णबन्धने तस्मिन्गते कृष्णाजिने महीम् । अपश्यद्भुजगः कश्चित्ते तत्र मणिकुण्डले ॥
data.md: Suddenly that deer-skin, with the ear-rings in it, dropped down. When the know being unfastened, the deer-skin fell down on the ground, a snake who was there saw those jewelled ear-rings.

data.v: ऐरावतकुलोत्पन्नः शीघ्रो भूत्वा तदा स वै । विदश्यास्येन वल्मीकं विवेशाथ स कुण्डले ॥
ह्रियमाणे तु दृष्ट्वा स कुण्डले भुजगेन ह । पपात वृक्षात्सोद्वेगो दुःखात्परमकोपनः ॥
स दण्डकाष्ठमादाय वल्मीकमखनत्तदा । क्रोधामर्षाभितप्ताङ्गस्ततो वै द्विजपुंगवः ॥
तस्य वेगमसह्यं तमसहन्ती वसुंधरा । दण्डकाष्ठाभिनुन्नाङ्गी चचाल भृशमातुरा ॥
data.md: The goddess Earth, unable to bear the force of Utanka's walking staff and with body torn therewith, became greatly anxious.

data.v: ततः खनत एवाथ विप्रर्षेर्धरणीतलम् । नागलोकस्य पन्थानं कर्तुकामस्य निश्चयात् ॥
data.md: To that twice-born Rishi then, who continued to dig the Earth from desire of making a path to the nether regions inhabited by the Nagas, the king of the celestial, armed with the thunder, came there, on his car drawn by green horses. Gifted with great energy, he saw that foremost of Brahmanas, as he sat there engaged in his task.

data.v: रथेन हरियुक्तेन तं देशमुपजग्मिवान् । वज्रपाणिर्महातेजा ददर्श च द्विजोत्तमम् ॥
data.md: To that twice-born Rishi then, who continued to dig the Earth from desire of making a path to the nether regions inhabited by the Nagas, the king of the celestial, armed with the thunder, came there, on his car drawn by green horses. Gifted with great energy, he saw that foremost of Brahmanas, as he sat there engaged in his task.

data.v: स तु तं ब्राह्मणो भूत्वा तस्य दुःखेन दुःखितः । उत्तङ्कमब्रवीत्तात नैतच्छक्यं त्वयेति वै ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana continued : LoO king like a Brahmana stricken with the sorrow of Utanka, the king of the celestials addressed him, saying, 'This (purpose of thine) is impracticable of being accomplished.

data.v: इतो हि नागलोको वै योजनानि सहस्रशः । न दण्डकाष्ठसाध्यं च मन्ये कार्यमिदं तव ॥
data.md: The regions of the Nagas are thousands of Yojanas removed from this place. I think that your purpose is impossible of being achieved with your walking staff.

data.v: नागलोके यदि ब्रह्मन्न शक्ये कुण्डले मया । प्राप्तुं प्राणान्विमोक्ष्यामि पश्यतस्ते द्विजोत्तम ॥
data.md: Utanka said If, O Brahmana, the ear-rings be not recovered by me from the regions of the Nagas, I shall renounce my life-breaths before your eyes, O foremost of twice-born persons.

data.v: यदा स नाशकत्तस्य निश्चयं कर्तुमन्यथा । वज्रपाणिस्तदा दण्डं वज्रास्त्रेण युयोज ह ॥
data.md: Vaishmpayana said When the thunder-armed Indra could not divert Utanka from his purpose, he united the latter's walking staff with the force of thunder.

data.v: ततो वज्रप्रहारैस्तैर्दार्यमाणा वसुंधरा । नागलोकस्य पन्थानमकरोज्जनमेजय ॥
data.md: Then, O Janamejaya, the Earth, opening with those strokes having the force of thunder, gave way to the (nether) regions inhabited by the Nagas.

data.v: स तेन मार्गेण तदा नागलोकं विवेश ह । ददर्श नागलोकं च योजनानि सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: By that path Utanka entered the world of Nagas. He saw that that region lying thousands of Yojanas on all sides.

data.v: प्राकारनिचयैर्दिव्यैर्मणिमुक्ताभ्यलंकृतैः । उपपन्नं महाभाग शातकुम्भमयैस्तथा ॥
data.md: Indeed, O blessed one, it had many walls made of pure gold and decked with jewels and gems.

data.v: वापीः स्फटिकसोपाना नदीश्च विमलोदकाः । ददर्श वृक्षांश्च बहून्नानाद्विजगणायुतान् ॥
data.md: There were many flue tanks of water furnished with flights of stair-cases made of pure crystal, and many rivers of clear and transparent water. He saw also many trees with various species of birds perching on them.

data.v: तस्य लोकस्य च द्वारं ददर्श स भृगूद्वहः । पञ्चयोजनविस्तारमायतं शतयोजनम् ॥
data.md: That perpetuator of Bhrigu's race saw the gate of that region which was full five Yojanas high and a hundred Yojanas in width.

data.v: नागलोकमुत्तङ्कस्तु प्रेक्ष्य दीनोऽभवत्तदा । निराशश्चाभवत्तात कुण्डलाहरणे पुनः ॥
data.md: Seeing the regions of the Nagas, Utanka became very dispirited. Indeed, he despaired of getting back the ear-rings.

data.v: तत्र प्रोवाच तुरगस्तं कृष्णश्वेतवालधिः । ताम्रास्यनेत्रः कौरव्य प्रज्वलन्निव तेजसा ॥
data.md: Then there appeared to him a black horse with a white tail. His face and eyes were of a coppcry colour, O you of Kuru's race, and he secmed to blaze forth with energy.

data.v: धमस्वापानमेतन्मे ततस्त्वं विप्र लप्स्यसे । ऐरावतसुतेनेह तवानीते हि कुण्डले ॥

data.md: Indeed, that hero came for seeing Draupadi, Uitara and Pritha and for comforting those renowned Kshatriya-ladies who had been bereft of many of their protectors.

data.md: That child, O son, has been born deed! Sec him, O foremost of men. You should, O Madhava, rescue Uttara and Subhadra and Draupadi and myself, and Dharma's son (Yudhishthira), and Bhima and Phalguna, and Nakula and the irresistible Sahadeva.

data.md: Uttara, O destroyer of enemies, always repeats the words said to her by Abhimanyu. Forsooth, O Krishna, those words were highly agreeable to her.

data.md: After Kunti had said so, Janardana took hold of her, O Bharata, and gently raising her from the Earth, comforted her as follows.

data.md: Hearing that Abhimanyu's son was born and dead, the Pandavas, O you of Vrishni's race, will consider themselves as imposed upon by Ashvatthaman.

data.v: अभिमन्युः प्रियः कृष्ण पितॄणां नात्र संशयः । ते श्रुत्वा किं नु वक्ष्यन्ति द्रोणपुत्रास्त्रनिर्जिताः ॥
data.md: Abhimanyu, O Krishna, was, forsooth, the minion of all the Pandava-brother. Hearing this intelligence, what will those heroes, defeated by the weapon of Drona's son say?

data.md: When, O Madhava, the son of Drona tried to destroy the embryos even in the wombs of the ladies of the Pandavas, at that time, O grinder of enemies, you said in anger to Dronas son (even these words). data.md: When, O Madhava, the son of Drona tried to destroy the embryos even in the wombs of the ladies of the Pandavas, at that time, O grinder of enemies, you said in anger to Dronas son (even these words). O wretch of a Brahmana, O vilest of men I shall disappoint your wish! I shall revive the son of Kiritin's son.

data.v: इत्येतद्वचनं श्रुत्वा जानमाना बलं तव । प्रसादये त्वा दुर्धर्ष जीवतामभिमन्युजः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of yours and wellknowing your power, I seek to gratify you, O irresistible hero! Let the son of Abhimanyu be revived.

data.v: यद्येवं त्वं प्रतिश्रुत्य न करोषि वचः शुभम् । सफलं वृष्णिशार्दूल मृतां मामुपधारय ॥
data.md: If having pledged yourself previously you do not accomplish your auspicious vow, do you then know for certain, O chief of the Vrishni race, that I shall put an end to my life.

data.v: अभिमन्योः सुतो वीर न संजीवति यद्ययम् । जीवति त्वयि दुर्धर्ष किं करिष्याम्यहं त्वया ॥
data.md: If, O hero, this son of Abhimanyu does not revive when you, O irresistible one, are alive and near, of what other use will you be to me?

data.v: संजीवयैनं दुर्धर्ष मृतं त्वमभिमन्युजम् । सदृशाक्षसुतं वीर सस्यं वर्षन्निवाम्बुदः ॥
data.md: Do you, therefore, O irresistible one, revive this son of Abhimanyu, this child who has eyes similar to his, even as a rain-charged cloud revives the lifeless crops (on a field).

data.v: त्वं हि केशव धर्मात्मा सत्यवान्सत्यविक्रमः । स तां वाचमृतां कर्तुमर्हसि त्वमरिंदम ॥
data.md: You, O Keshava, are righteous-souled, truthful, and of prowess incapable of being baffled. You should, O chastiser of enemies make your words truthful.

data.v: इच्छन्नपि हि लोकांस्त्रीञ्जीवयेथा मृतानिमान् । किं पुनर्दयितं जातं स्वस्रीयस्यात्मजं मृतम् ॥
data.md: If only you wish it, you can revive the three worlds (of being) if dead! What need, I say, therefore, of this darling child, born but dead, of your sister's son?

data.v: प्रभावज्ञास्मि ते कृष्ण तस्मादेतद्ब्रवीमि ते । कुरुष्व पाण्डुपुत्राणामिमं परमनुग्रहम् ॥
data.md: I know your power, O Krishna! Therefore do I solicit you! Do you show this great favour to the sons of Pandu.

data.v: स्वसेति वा महाबाहो हतपुत्रेति वा पुनः । प्रपन्ना मामियं वेति दयां कर्तुमिहार्हसि ॥
data.md: You should, O mighty-armed one, show mercy to this Uttara, or to me, thinking that I am your sister or even a mother who has lost her son, and one who has thrown herself upon your protection.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु राजेन्द्र केशिहा दुःखमूर्छितः । तथेति व्याजहारोच्चैर्ह्लादयन्निव तं जनम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Thus addressed, O king, the destroyer of Keshni, greatly possessed by sorrow answered, So be it! These words were uttered with sufficicnt loudness and they pleased all the inmates of the inner apartments of the place.

data.v: वाक्येन तेन हि तदा तं जनं पुरुषर्षभः । ह्लादयामास स विभुर्घर्मार्तं सलिलैरिव ॥
data.md: The powerful Krishna, that foremost of men, by uttering these words, pleased all the people assembled there, like one pouring cold water on a person afflicted with sweat.

data.v: ततः स प्राविशत्तूर्णं जन्मवेश्म पितुस्तव । अर्चितं पुरुषव्याघ्र सितैर्माल्यैर्यथाविधि ॥
अपां कुम्भैः सुपूर्णैश्च विन्यस्तैः सर्वतोदिशम् । घृतेन तिन्दुकालातैः सर्षपैश्च महाभुज ॥
शस्त्रैश्च विमलैर्न्यस्तैः पावकैश्च समन्ततः । वृद्धाभिश्चाभिरामाभिः परिचारार्थमच्युतः ॥
दक्षैश्च परितो वीर भिषग्भिः कुशलैस्तथा । ददर्श च स तेजस्वी रक्षोघ्नान्यपि सर्वशः । द्रव्याणि स्थापितानि स्म विधिवत्कुशलैर्जनैः ॥
data.md: It was also surrounded by many well-skilled and clever physicians, O you of great intelligence! Gifted with great energy, he also beheld there all articles that are destructive of Rakshasas, duly placed by persons knowing the subject. Seeing the lying-in-room in which your father was born thus equipt, Hrishikesha became very glad and said, Excellent, Excellent!'

data.v: तथायुक्तं च तद्दृष्ट्वा जन्मवेश्म पितुस्तव । हृष्टोऽभवद्धृषीकेशः साधु साध्विति चाब्रवीत् ॥
तथा ब्रुवति वार्ष्णेये प्रहृष्टवदने तदा । द्रौपदी त्वरिता गत्वा वैराटीं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: When he of Vrishni's racc said so and presented such a chcerful look, Draupadi, going there quickly, addressed the daughter of Virata, saying, O blessed lady, here comes to you your father-in-law, the destroyer of Madhu, that ancient Rishi of inconceivable soul, that unvanquished one.

data.v: अयमायाति ते भद्रे श्वशुरो मधुसूदनः । पुराणर्षिरचिन्त्यात्मा समीपमपराजितः ॥
सापि बाष्पकलां वाचं निगृह्याश्रूणि चैव ह । सुसंवीताभवद्देवी देववत्कृष्णमीक्षती ॥
data.md: Virata's daughter, checking her tears said these words in a voice chocked with grief. Covering herself properly, the pincess waited for Krishna like the celestials reverentially waiting for him.

data.v: सा तथा दूयमानेन हृदयेन तपस्विनी । दृष्ट्वा गोविन्दमायान्तं कृपणं पर्यदेवयत् ॥
data.md: The helpless lady with heart agitated by Sorrow, seeing Govinda coming, bewailed, saying :

data.v: पुण्डरीकाक्ष पश्यस्व बालाविह विनाकृतौ । अभिमन्युं च मां चैव हतौ तुल्यं जनार्दन ॥
data.md: O lotus-eyed one, sce us two deprived of our child! O Janardana, both Abhimanyu and myself have been equally killed.

data.v: वार्ष्णेय मधुहन्वीर शिरसा त्वां प्रसादये । द्रोणपुत्रास्त्रनिर्दग्धं जीवयैनं ममात्मजम् ॥
data.md: o you of Vrishni's race, O destroyer of Madhu, I seek to please you by bending my head, O hero to you! Do you revive this child of mine who has been consumed by the weapon of Drona's son.

data.v: यदि स्म धर्मराज्ञा वा भीमसेनेन वा पुनः । त्वया वा पुण्डरीकाक्ष वाक्यमुक्तमिदं भवेत् ॥
data.md: If king Yudhishthira the just, or Bhimasena, or yourself, O lotus-eyes one, had, on that occasion, said, Let the blade of grass destroy the unconscious mother, O powerful one, then I would have been destroyed and this would not have taken place.

data.v: अजानतीमिषीकेयं जनित्रीं हन्त्विति प्रभो । अहमेव विनष्टा स्यां नेदमेवंगतं भवेत् ॥
गर्भस्थस्यास्य बालस्य ब्रह्मास्त्रेण निपातनम् । कृत्वा नृशंसं दुर्बुद्धिर्द्रौणिः किं फलमश्नुते ॥
data.md: Alas, what benefit has been reaped by Drona's son by doing this cruel deed, viz., the destruction of the child in the womb by his Brahma-weapon.

data.v: सा त्वा प्रसाद्य शिरसा याचे शत्रुनिबर्हण । प्राणांस्त्यक्ष्यामि गोविन्द नायं संजीवते यदि ॥
data.md: That self-same mother now seeks to please you, O slayer of enemies, by bending her head! Surely, O Govinda, I shall kill myself if this child does not revive.

data.v: अस्मिन्हि बहवः साधो ये ममासन्मनोरथाः । ते द्रोणपुत्रेण हताः किं नु जीवामि केशव ॥
data.md: In him, Orighteous one, I placed many expectations! Alas, when these have been frustrated by Drona's son, what necessity have I, O Keshava, to carry on the burden of life?

data.v: आसीन्मम मतिः कृष्ण पूर्णोत्सङ्गा जनार्दन । अभिवादयिष्ये दिष्ट्येति तदिदं वितथीकृतम् ॥
data.md: I hoped, O Krishna, that with my child on my lap, O Janardana, I would salute you with respect! Alas, O Keshava, that hope has beelu destroyed.

data.v: चपलाक्षस्य दायादे मृतेऽस्मिन्पुरुषर्षभ । विफला मे कृताः कृष्ण हृदि सर्वे मनोरथाः ॥
data.md: O foremost of all beings at the death of this heir of Abhimanyu of restless eyes, all my hopes have been destroyed.

data.v: चपलाक्षः किलातीव प्रियस्ते मधुसूदन । सुतं पश्यस्व तस्येमं ब्रह्मास्त्रेण निपातितम् ॥
data.md: Abhimanyu of restless eyes, O destroyer of Madhu, was exceedingly dear to you. Behold this child of his killed by the Brahma-weapon.

data.v: कृतघ्नोऽयं नृशंसोऽयं यथास्य जनकस्तथा । यः पाण्डवीं श्रियं त्यक्त्वा गतोऽद्य यमसादनम् ॥
data.md: This child is very ungrateful and very heartless, like his father, for, sce, disregarding the prosperity and affluence of the Pandavas, he has gone to Yama's house.

data.v: मया चैतत्प्रतिज्ञातं रणमूर्धनि केशव । अभिमन्यौ हते वीर त्वामेष्याम्यचिरादिति ॥
data.md: I had, before this, vowed, O Keshava, that if Abhimanuyu fell on the field of battle, O hero, I would follow him immediately.

data.v: तच्च नाकरवं कृष्ण नृशंसा जीवितप्रिया । इदानीमागतां तत्र किं नु वक्ष्यति फाल्गुनिः ॥
data.md: I did not, however, keep my vow, cruel that I am and fond of life! If I go to him now, what indeed, will Phalguna's son say?

data.v: सैवं विलप्य करुणं सोन्मादेव तपस्विनी । उत्तरा न्यपतद्भूमौ कृपणा पुत्रगृद्धिनी ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said The helpless Uttara, desirous of getting back her child, having thus bewailed, dropped down in sorrow on the earth like demented creature.

data.v: तां तु दृष्ट्वा निपतितां हतबन्धुपरिच्छदाम् । चुक्रोश कुन्ती दुःखार्ता सर्वाश्च भरतस्त्रियः ॥
data.md: Sceing the princess fallen on the earth deprived of her son and with her body uncovered, Kunti as also all the (other) Bharata-ladies, deeply afflicted, began to weep aloud.

data.v: मुहूर्तमिव तद्राजन्पाण्डवानां निवेशनम् । अप्रेक्षणीयमभवदार्तस्वरनिनादितम् ॥
data.md: Resounding with the voice of lamentation the palace of the Pandavas, O king, was soon converted into a house of sorrow where nobody could remain.

data.v: सा मुहूर्तं च राजेन्द्र पुत्रशोकाभिपीडिता । कश्मलाभिहता वीर वैराटी त्वभवत्तदा ॥
data.md: Greatly stricken with grief on account of her son, Virata's daughter, O king, seemed to be struck down for sometime by sorrow and cheerlessness.

data.v: प्रतिलभ्य तु सा संज्ञामुत्तरा भरतर्षभ । अङ्कमारोप्य तं पुत्रमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Regaining consciousness, O chief of Bharata's race, Uttara took up her child on her lap and said these words.

data.v: धर्मज्ञस्य सुतः संस्त्वमधर्ममवबुध्यसे । यस्त्वं वृष्णिप्रवीरस्य कुरुषे नाभिवादनम् ॥
data.md: You are the child of one who knew every duty. Are you not conscious then of the sin you commit, since you do not salute this foremost one of the Vrishni's race?

data.v: पुत्र गत्वा मम वचो ब्रूयास्त्वं पितरं तव । दुर्मरं प्राणिनां वीर काले प्राप्ते कथंचन ॥
data.md: O son, going to your father tell him these words of mine, viz., It is difficult for living creatures to die before their time comes, because through refit of you, my husband, and now deprived of my child also, I am yet alive when I should die, unendued as I am with everything auspicious and everything valuable.

data.v: याहं त्वया विहीनाद्य पत्या पुत्रेण चैव ह । मर्तव्ये सति जीवामि हतस्वस्तिरकिंचना ॥
अथ वा धर्मराज्ञाहमनुज्ञाता महाभुज । भक्षयिष्ये विषं तीक्ष्णं प्रवेक्ष्ये वा हुताशनम् ॥
data.md: O mighty-armed one, with the permission of king Yudhishthira the just. I shall swallow some dreadful poison or cast myself on the burning fire.

data.v: अथ वा दुर्मरं तात यदिदं मे सहस्रधा । पतिपुत्रविहीनाया हृदयं न विदीर्यते ॥
data.md: O father, difficult of destruction is my heart since, though I am deprived of husband and child, that heart of mine does not brcak into a thousand pieces.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ पुत्र पश्येमां दुःखितां प्रपितामहीम् । आर्तामुपप्लुतां दीनां निमग्नां शोकसागरे ॥
data.md: Rise, O son, and see this your afflicted great grandmother! She is deeply stricken with grief, bathed in tears, exceedingly cheerless, and plunged in an ocean of sorrow.

data.v: आर्यां च पश्य पाञ्चालीं सात्वतीं च तपस्विनीम् । मां च पश्य सुदुःखार्तां व्याधविद्धां मृगीमिव ॥
data.md: See the reverend princess of Panchala, and the helpless princess of the Sattata race! Look at myself, exceedingly afflicted with grief, and resembling a deer pierced by a hunter.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ पश्य वदनं लोकनाथस्य धीमतः । पुण्डरीकपलाशाक्षं पुरेव चपलेक्षणम् ॥
data.md: Rise, O child, and look at the face of this king, who is gifted with great wisdom, and possessed of eyes like lotus-petals and resembling your father of restless glances.

data.v: एवं विप्रलपन्तीं तु दृष्ट्वा निपतितां पुनः । उत्तरां ताः स्त्रियः सर्वाः पुनरुत्थापयन्त्युत ॥
data.md: Seeing Uttara, whey bewailed thus, fallen on the earth, all those ladies, raising her, caused her to sit up.

data.v: उत्थाय तु पुनर्धैर्यात्तदा मत्स्यपतेः सुता । प्राञ्जलिः पुण्डरीकाक्षं भूमावेवाभ्यवादयत् ॥
data.md: Having sat up, the daughter of the king of the Matsyas, summoning her patience, joined her hands in respect and touched the earth with her head for saluting Keshava having eyes like lotus petals.

data.v: श्रुत्वा स तस्या विपुलं विलापं पुरुषर्षभः । उपस्पृश्य ततः कृष्णो ब्रह्मास्त्रं संजहार तत् ॥
data.md: Hearing those heart-rending lamentations of hers, that foremost of persons touched water and withdrew the (force of the Brahmaweapon.

data.v: प्रतिजज्ञे च दाशार्हस्तस्य जीवितमच्युतः । अब्रवीच्च विशुद्धात्मा सर्वं विश्रावयञ्जगत् ॥
data.md: That hero of undecaying glory, belonging to the race of the Dasharhas, promised to revive the child. Then he of pure soul, said these words in the hearing of the whole universe, 'O Uttara, I never utter a falsehood. My words will prove true. I shall revive this child before all creatures.

data.v: न ब्रवीम्युत्तरे मिथ्या सत्यमेतद्भविष्यति । एष संजीवयाम्येनं पश्यतां सर्वदेहिनाम् ॥
data.md: That hero of undecaying glory, belonging to the race of the Dasharhas, promised to revive the child. Then he of pure soul, said these words in the hearing of the whole universe, 'O Uttara, I never utter a falsehood. My words will prove true. I shall revive this child before all creatures.

data.v: नोक्तपूर्वं मया मिथ्या स्वैरेष्वपि कदाचन । न च युद्धे परावृत्तस्तथा संजीवतामयम् ॥
data.md: Never before have I uttered a falschood even in just. Never have I turned back from battle. (By the merit of those deeds) let this child revive.

data.v: यथा मे दयितो धर्मो ब्राह्मणाश्च विशेषतः । अभिमन्योः सुतो जातो मृतो जीवत्वयं तथा ॥
data.md: As virtue is dear to me, as Brahmanas are especially dear to me, let Abhimanyu's son, who is born dead, revive.

data.v: यथाहं नाभिजानामि विजयेन कदाचन । विरोधं तेन सत्येन मृतो जीवत्वयं शिशुः ॥
data.md: Never has a misunderstanding arisen between me and my friend Vijaya. Let this dead child revive by that truth.

data.v: यथा सत्यं च धर्मश्च मयि नित्यं प्रतिष्ठितौ । तथा मृतः शिशुरयं जीवतामभिमन्युजः ॥
data.md: As truth and virtue are always established in me, let this dead child of Abhimanyu revive.

data.v: यथा कंसश्च केशी च धर्मेण निहतौ मया । तेन सत्येन बालोऽयं पुनरुज्जीवतामिह ॥
data.md: As Kansa and Keshi have been righteously killed by me, let this child revive today by that truth.

data.v: इत्युक्तो वासुदेवेन स बालो भरतर्षभ । शनैः शनैर्महाराज प्रास्पन्दत सचेतनः ॥
data.md: After these words uttered by Vasudeva, that child, O foremost one of Bharata's family, became animal and began gradually to move, O king. were

data.v: ब्रह्मास्त्रं तु यदा राजन्कृष्णेन प्रतिसंहृतम् । तदा तद्वेश्म ते पित्रा तेजसाभिविदीपितम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, When the Brahma-weapon was withdrawn by Krishna, at that time, the lying in-room was lighted up by your father with his energy.

data.v: ततो रक्षांसि सर्वाणि नेशुस्त्यक्त्वा गृहं तु तत् । अन्तरिक्षे च वागासीत्साधु केशव साध्विति ॥
data.md: All the Rakshasas were forced to leave the room and many of them were killed. In the sky a voice was heard, saying, Excellent, O Keshava, Excellent.

data.v: तदस्त्रं ज्वलितं चापि पितामहमगात्तदा । ततः प्राणान्पुनर्लेभे पिता तव जनेश्वर । व्यचेष्टत च बालोऽसौ यथोत्साहं यथाबलम् ॥
data.md: The burning Brahma-weapon when returned to the Grandfather. Your father got back his, O king.

data.v: बभूवुर्मुदिता राजंस्ततस्ता भरतस्त्रियः । ब्राह्मणान्वाचयामासुर्गोविन्दस्य च शासनात् ॥
ततस्ता मुदिताः सर्वाः प्रशशंसुर्जनार्दनम् । स्त्रियो भरतसिंहानां नावं लब्ध्वेव पारगाः ॥
कुन्ती द्रुपदपुत्री च सुभद्रा चोत्तरा तथा । स्त्रियश्चान्या नृसिंहानां बभूवुर्हृष्टमानसाः ॥
तत्र मल्ला नटा झल्ला ग्रन्थिकाः सौखशायिकाः । सूतमागधसंघाश्चाप्यस्तुवन्वै जनार्दनम् । कुरुवंशस्तवाख्याभिराशीर्भिर्भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Then wrestlers and actors and astrologers and those who enquire after the sleep (of princes), and bands of bards and eulogists all uttered the praises of Janardana, while ultering benedictions filled with the praises of the Kurus, O chief of the Bharatas.

data.v: उत्थाय तु यथाकालमुत्तरा यदुनन्दनम् । अभ्यवादयत प्रीता सह पुत्रेण भारत । ततस्तस्यै ददौ प्रीतो बहुरत्नं विशेषतः ॥
data.md: Uttara, rising up at the proper time, with a pleased heart and bearing her child in her arms, reverentially saluted the delighter of the Yadus.

data.v: तथान्ये वृष्णिशार्दूला नाम चास्याकरोत्प्रभुः । पितुस्तव महाराज सत्यसंधो जनार्दनः ॥
परिक्षीणे कुले यस्माज्जातोऽयमभिमन्युजः । परिक्षिदिति नामास्य भवत्वित्यब्रवीत्तदा ॥
सोऽवर्धत यथाकालं पिता तव नराधिप । मनःप्रह्लादनश्चासीत्सर्वलोकस्य भारत ॥
मासजातस्तु ते वीर पिता भवति भारत । अथाजग्मुः सुबहुलं रत्नमादाय पाण्डवाः ॥
तान्समीपगताञ्श्रुत्वा निर्ययुर्वृष्णिपुंगवाः । अलंचक्रुश्च माल्यौघैः पुरुषा नागसाह्वयम् ॥
पताकाभिर्विचित्राभिर्ध्वजैश्च विविधैरपि । वेश्मानि समलंचक्रुः पौराश्चापि जनाधिप ॥
देवतायतनानां च पूजा बहुविधास्तथा । संदिदेशाथ विदुरः पाण्डुपुत्रप्रियेप्सया ॥
राजमार्गाश्च तत्रासन्सुमनोभिरलंकृताः । शुशुभे तत्पुरं चापि समुद्रौघनिभस्वनम् ॥
नर्तकैश्चापि नृत्यद्भिर्गायनानां च निस्वनैः । आसीद्वैश्रवणस्येव निवासस्तत्पुरं तदा ॥
बन्दिभिश्च नरै राजन्स्त्रीसहायैः सहस्रशः । तत्र तत्र विविक्तेषु समन्तादुपशोभितम् ॥
पताका धूयमानाश्च श्वसता मातरिश्वना । अदर्शयन्निव तदा कुरून्वै दक्षिणोत्तरान् ॥
अघोषयत्तदा चापि पुरुषो राजधूर्गतः । सर्वरात्रिविहारोऽद्य रत्नाभरणलक्षणः ॥
तान्समीपगताञ्श्रुत्वा पाण्डवाञ्शत्रुकर्शनः । वासुदेवः सहामात्यः प्रत्युद्यातो दिदृक्षया ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Hearing that the Pandavas were near, that destroyer of enemies, viz., Vasudeva, accompanicd by his ministers, went out for seeing them.

data.v: ते समेत्य यथान्यायं पाण्डवा वृष्णिभिः सह । विविशुः सहिता राजन्पुरं वारणसाह्वयम् ॥
data.md: They all proceeded forward to see and greeted them warnly. The Pandavas then, uniting with the Vrishnis according to the us usual formalities, together entered, O king, the city of Hastinapur.

data.v: महतस्तस्य सैन्यस्य खुरनेमिस्वनेन च । द्यावापृथिव्यौ खं चैव शब्देनासीत्समावृतम् ॥
data.md: With the voices and the clatter of cars of that powerful host, the Earth and the sky, and the firmament itself, became of it were, entirely filled.

data.v: ते कोशमग्रतः कृत्वा विविशुः स्वपुरं तदा । पाण्डवाः प्रीतमनसः सामात्याः ससुहृद्गणाः ॥
data.md: With rejoicing hearts, the Pandavas, accompanied by their officers and friends, entered the capital, placing that treasure in their van.

data.v: ते समेत्य यथान्यायं धृतराष्ट्रं जनाधिपम् । कीर्तयन्तः स्वनामानि तस्य पादौ ववन्दिरे ॥
data.md: Going according to custom, to king Dhritarashtra first, they adored his feet, announcing their respective names.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्रादनु च ते गान्धारीं सुबलात्मजाम् । कुन्तीं च राजशार्दूल तदा भरतसत्तमाः ॥
data.md: Those foremost ones of Bharata's race, O chief of kings, then paid their respectful salutations to Gandhari, the daughter of Subala, and to Kunti.

data.v: विदुरं पूजयित्वा च वैश्यापुत्रं समेत्य च । पूज्यमानाः स्म ते वीरा व्यराजन्त विशां पते ॥
data.md: They next adored (their uncle) Vidura and Yuyutsu, the son of Dhritarashtra by his Vaishya wife. Those heroes were then adored by others and they shone forth in beauty, O king.

data.v: ततस्तत्परमाश्चर्यं विचित्रं महदद्भुतम् । शुश्रुवुस्ते तदा वीराः पितुस्ते जन्म भारत ॥
data.md: After this, O Bharata, those heroes heard the news of that highly wonderful and marvellous and glad some birth of your father.

data.v: तदुपश्रुत्य ते कर्म वासुदेवस्य धीमतः । पूजार्हं पूजयामासुः कृष्णं देवकिनन्दनम् ॥
data.md: Hearing of that feat of the highly intelligent Vasudeva, they all adored Krishna, the delighter of Devaki, who was every way worthy of adoration.

data.v: ततः कतिपयाहस्य व्यासः सत्यवतीसुतः । आजगाम महातेजा नगरं नागसाह्वयम् ॥
data.md: Then, after a few days, Vyasa, the son of Satyavati, gifted with great cnergy, came to the city of Hastinapur.

data.v: तस्य सर्वे यथान्यायं पूजां चक्रुः कुरूद्वहाः । सह वृष्ण्यन्धकव्याघ्रैरुपासां चक्रिरे तदा ॥
data.md: The perpctuators of Kuru's race adored the great Rishi according to the usual custom. Indeed, those heroes, with those foremost princes of the Vrihini and the Andhaka-races worshipped the sage.

data.v: तत्र नानाविधाकाराः कथाः समनुकीर्त्य वै । युधिष्ठिरो धर्मसुतो व्यासं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
भवत्प्रसादाद्भगवन्यदिदं रत्नमाहृतम् । उपयोक्तुं तदिच्छामि वाजिमेधे महाक्रतौ ॥
data.md: After having conversed on various topics, Dharma's son Yudhishthira addressed Vyasa and said, This treasure, O holy one, which has been brought through your favour, I desire to devote to that great Horse-Sacrifice.

data.v: तदनुज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवता मुनिसत्तम । त्वदधीना वयं सर्वे कृष्णस्य च महात्मनः ॥
data.md: 0 best of ascetics, I wish to have your permission. We are all, O Rishi, at your disposal, and at that of the great Krishna.

data.v: अनुजानामि राजंस्त्वां क्रियतां यदनन्तरम् । यजस्व वाजिमेधेन विधिवद्दक्षिणावता ॥
data.md: Vyasa said I give you permission, O king, Do what should be done after this. Do you adore the deities duly by performing the Horse-Sacrifice with profuse gifts.

data.v: अश्वमेधो हि राजेन्द्र पावनः सर्वपाप्मनाम् । तेनेष्ट्वा त्वं विपाप्मा वै भविता नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: The Horse-Sacrifice, O king, is a purifier of all sins. Forsooth, having adored the deities by that sacrifice you will surely be purged of all sins.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तु धर्मात्मा कुरुराजो युधिष्ठिरः । अश्वमेधस्य कौरव्य चकाराहरणे मतिम् ॥
data.md: Vaishmpayana said Thus addressed, the Kuru-King Yudhishthira of righteous soul, O monarch, began to make the necessary preparations for the Horse-Sacrifice.

data.v: समनुज्ञाप्य तु स तं कृष्णद्वैपायनं नृपः । वासुदेवमथामन्त्र्य वाग्मी वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
देवकी सुप्रजा देवी त्वया पुरुषसत्तम । यद्ब्रूयां त्वां महाबाहो तत्कृथास्त्वमिहाच्युत ॥
data.md: Having represented all this to the Islandborn Krishna, the king gifted with great eloquence, approached Vasudeva and said, 'O foremost of all beings, the goddess Devaki has, through you come to be considered as the most fortunate of mothers. O you of undercaying glory, do you perform what I shall now tell you, O mighty-armed one.

data.v: त्वत्प्रभावार्जितान्भोगानश्नीम यदुनन्दन । पराक्रमेण बुद्ध्या च त्वयेयं निर्जिता मही ॥
data.md: O delighter of the Kurus, the various enjoyments we enjoy, have all been acquired are are through your power. The whole Earth has been subjugated by you with the help of your prowess and intelligence.

data.v: दीक्षयस्व त्वमात्मानं त्वं नः परमको गुरुः । त्वयीष्टवति धर्मज्ञ विपाप्मा स्यामहं विभो । त्वं हि यज्ञोऽक्षरः सर्वस्त्वं धर्मस्त्वं प्रजापतिः ॥
data.md: Do you, therefore, cause yourself to undergo the rites of initiation. You are our highest preceptor and master. If you perform the sacrifice, O you of the Dasharha-race, I shall be purified from every sin.

data.v: त्वमेवैतन्महाबाहो वक्तुमर्हस्यरिंदम । त्वं गतिः सर्वभूतानामिति मे निश्चिता मतिः ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said O mighty-armed one, what you say is worthy of you, O chastiser of enemies! You are the goal of all creatures. This is my certain conclusion.

data.v: त्वं चाद्य कुरुवीराणां धर्मेणाभिविराजसे । गुणभूताः स्म ते राजंस्त्वं नो राजन्मतो गुरुः ॥
data.md: Of the heroes of the Kuru-race, you shine today in great glory for your virtue! They have all been cast into the shade, O king, by you! You are our king, and you are our senior.

data.v: यजस्व मदनुज्ञातः प्राप्त एव क्रतुर्मया । युनक्तु नो भवान्कार्ये यत्र वाञ्छसि भारत । सत्यं ते प्रतिजानामि सर्वं कर्तास्मि तेऽनघ ॥
data.md: With my approval freely granted, do you worship the celestials in the sacrifice suggested. Do you, O Bharata, appoint us to whatever task you like. Truly, do I pledge myself that I shall accomplish all, O sinless one, that you may bid me accomplish,

data.v: भीमसेनार्जुनौ चैव तथा माद्रवतीसुतौ । इष्टवन्तो भविष्यन्ति त्वयीष्टवति भारत ॥
data.md: Bhimasena and Arjuna and the two sons of Madravati will be sacrificing when you, O king, sacrifice Bhimasena and Arjuna and the two sons of Madravati will be sacrificing when you, O king, sacrifice

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु कृष्णेन धर्मपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः । व्यासमामन्त्र्य मेधावी ततो वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by Krishna, Yudhishthira, the of Dharma, gifted with great intelligence, saluted Vyasa and said these words:

data.v: यथा कालं भवान्वेत्ति हयमेधस्य तत्त्वतः । दीक्षयस्व तदा मा त्वं त्वय्यायत्तो हि मे क्रतुः ॥
data.md: Do you cause me to be initiated when the proper hour, as you truly know, come for that rite. This my sacrifice entirely depends on you. son

data.v: अहं पैलोऽथ कौन्तेय याज्ञवल्क्यस्तथैव च । विधानं यद्यथाकालं तत्कर्तारो न संशयः ॥
data.md: Vyasa said Myself, O son of Kunti, and Paila and Yajnavalkya, shall, undoubtedly, achieve every rite at the proper time.

data.v: चैत्र्यां हि पौर्णमास्यां च तव दीक्षा भविष्यति । संभाराः संभ्रियन्तां ते यज्ञार्थं पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: The rite of initiating you will be performed on the day of full moon belonging to the month of Chaitra. Let all the necessaries of the sacrifice, O foremost of men, be got ready.

data.v: अश्वविद्याविदश्चैव सूता विप्राश्च तद्विदः । मेध्यमश्वं परीक्षन्तां तव यज्ञार्थसिद्धये ॥
data.md: Let Sutas well-versed in the science of horses and let Brahmanas also possessed of the same learning, select, after examination, a worthy horse in order that your sacrifice may be completed.

data.v: तमुत्सृज्य यथाशास्त्रं पृथिवीं सागराम्बराम् । स पर्येतु यशो नाम्ना तव पार्थिव वर्धयन् ॥
data.md: Loosening the animal according to the injunctions of the scriptures, let him wander over the whole Earth with her belt of seas, showing your effulgent glory, O king.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तथेत्युक्त्वा पाण्डवः पृथिवीपतिः । चकार सर्वं राजेन्द्र यथोक्तं ब्रह्मवादिना । संभाराश्चैव राजेन्द्र सर्वे संकल्पिताभवन् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Thius addressed (by the Rishi), Yudhishthira, the royal son of Pandu, answered, 'So be it!' and then, O monarch, he accomplished all that that utterer of Brahma had said.

data.v: स संभारान्समाहृत्य नृपो धर्मात्मजस्तदा । न्यवेदयदमेयात्मा कृष्णद्वैपायनाय वै ॥
data.md: All the articles necessary for the sacrifice, O king, were duly procured. The royal son of Dharma, gifted with immeasurable soul, having procured all the necessaries, inforined the Island-born Krishna of it.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीन्महातेजा व्यासो धर्मात्मजं नृपम् । यथाकालं यथायोगं सज्जाः स्म तव दीक्षणे ॥
data.md: Then the highly energetic Vyasa said to the royal son of Dharma, “As regards ourselves, we are all prepared to initiate you in view of the sacrifice.

data.v: स्फ्यश्च कूर्चश्च सौवर्णो यच्चान्यदपि कौरव । तत्र योग्यं भवेत्किंचित्तद्रौक्मं क्रियतामिति ॥
data.md: Let the Sphya and the Kurcha and all the other articles that, o you of Kuru's race, may be necessary for your sacrifice, be made of gold.

data.v: अश्वश्चोत्सृज्यतामद्य पृथ्व्यामथ यथाक्रमम् । सुगुप्तश्च चरत्वेष यथाशास्त्रं युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Let the horse also be loosened today, for wandering on the Earth, according to the ordinances of the scriptures. Let the animal, duly protected, wander over the Earth.

data.v: अयमश्वो मया ब्रह्मन्नुत्सृष्टः पृथिवीमिमाम् । चरिष्यति यथाकामं तत्र वै संविधीयताम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Let arrangements be made by you, O twiceborn one, about loosening this horse for enabling it to wander over the Earth at its will.

data.v: पृथिवीं पर्यटन्तं हि तुरगं कामचारिणम् । कः पालयेदिति मुने तद्भवान्वक्तुमर्हति ॥
data.md: You should, O ascetic, say who will protect this horse while roaming over the Earth freely according to its will.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तु राजेन्द्र कृष्णद्वैपायनोऽब्रवीत् । भीमसेनादवरजः श्रेष्ठः सर्वधनुष्मताम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana continued : Thus addressed (by king Yudhishthira), O king, the Island-born Krishna said, He who is born after Bhimasena, who is the foremost of all bowmen, who is called Jishnu, who is gifted with great patience and capable of overcoming all resistance, he will protect the horse. That destroyer of the Nivatakavachas can conquer the whole Earth.

data.v: जिष्णुः सहिष्णुर्धृष्णुश्च स एनं पालयिष्यति । शक्तः स हि महीं जेतुं निवातकवचान्तकः ॥
तस्मिन्ह्यस्त्राणि दिव्यानि दिव्यं संहननं तथा । दिव्यं धनुश्चेषुधी च स एनमनुयास्यति ॥
data.md: In him are all celestial weapons, His body is like that of a celestial in its powers of endurance. His bow and quivers are celestial. He will follow this horse.

data.md: Mounting on his prince of elephants again in the midst of that battle, the son of Bhagadatta, desirous of victory, very coolly shot a number of arrows at Arjuna.

data.md: On the fourth day, Vajradatta of great power laughed loudly and addressing Arjuna, said these words :-Wait, wait, O Arjuna! You shall not excape me alive! Killing you I shall duly discharge the water-rite of my father.

data.md: Urged on by the highly intelligent Vajradatta, that prince of elephants, as if desirous of cutting through the sky, rushed towards Dhananjaya.

data.md: That best of elephants drenched Arjuna with a shower of juice emitted from the end of his trunk, like a mass of blue clouds drenching a hill with its down-pour.

data.md: Indeed urged on by Vajradatta that prince of elephants quickly moved towards the powerful car-warrior of the Kurus, with the tread of one that seemed to dance in excitement.

data.md: Recollecting what an obstacle Vajradatta was proving to the performance of his task, and remembering the old enmity of the house, the son of Pandu became greatly excited with rage against the king.

data.v: ततस्तं वारणं क्रुद्धः शरजालेन पाण्डवः । निवारयामास तदा वेलेव मकरालयम् ॥
data.md: Worked up with rage, Dhananjaya impeded the course of that beast with a shower of arrows like the shore resisting the surging sea.

data.v: स नागप्रवरो वीर्यादर्जुनेन निवारितः । तस्थौ शरैर्वितुन्नाङ्गः श्वाविच्छललितो यथा ॥

data.md: Seeing his elephant impeded in its course, the royal son Bhagadatta, deprived of sense by anger, shot many whetted arrows at Arjuna.

data.md: The mighty-armed Arjuna baffled all those arrows with many foe-destroying arrows of his. The feat appeared to be exceedingly wonderful.

data.md: Seeing the beast once more advancing towards him, Arjuna shot with great strength an arrow at it which resembled a veritable flame of fire.

data.md: Cut to the quick, O king, by the son of Pandu, the beast suddenly dropped down on the Earth like a mountain-summit loosened by a thunder-bolt.

data.v: स पतञ्शुशुभे नागो धनंजयशराहतः । विशन्निव महाशैलो महीं वज्रप्रपीडितः ॥
data.md: Struck with Dhananjaya's arrow, the elephant, as it lay on the Earth, looked like a huge mountain-cliff lying on the ground, loosened by the bolt of Indra.

data.md: When the elephant of Vajradatta was prostrated on the ground the so of Pandu, addressing the king who had fallen down with his beast, said, 'Do not fear.'

data.md: Indeed, Yudhishthira of great energy said to me while commissioning me for this task even these words, viz., You should not, O Dhananjaya, kill those kings (who may give you battle).

data.md: O foremost of men, you should consider your task as accomplished if only you disable those hostile kings! You should not also, O Dhananjaya, kill the warriors of those kings who may come forth to fight you.
