data.md: The queen, arrived before Dhananjaya, began to weep in sorrow. Seeing her, the powerful Dhananjaya cast off his bow.

data.v: समुत्सृष्टधनुः पार्थो विधिवद्भगिनीं तदा । प्राह किं करवाणीति सा च तं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
एष ते भरतश्रेष्ठ स्वस्रीयस्यात्मजः शिशुः । अभिवादयते वीर तं पश्य पुरुषर्षभ ॥
इत्युक्तस्तस्य पितरं स पप्रच्छार्जुनस्तदा । क्वासाविति ततो राजन्दुःशला वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by her, Partha enquired after his son (Suratha), saying, Where is he? Dushala answered him, saying, Burning with grief on account of the destruction of his father, the heroic father of this child disd brokenheated. Listen from me as to how that hero was dead.

data.v: पितृशोकाभिसंतप्तो विषादार्तोऽस्य वै पिता । पञ्चत्वमगमद्वीर यथा तन्मे निबोध ह ॥
स पूर्वं पितरं श्रुत्वा हतं युद्धे त्वयानघ । त्वामागतं च संश्रुत्य युद्धाय हयसारिणम् । पितुश्च मृत्युदुःखार्तोऽजहात्प्राणान्धनंजय ॥
प्राप्तो बीभत्सुरित्येव नाम श्रुत्वैव तेऽनघ । विषादार्तः पपातोर्व्यां ममार च ममात्मजः ॥
तं तु दृष्ट्वा निपतितं ततस्तस्यात्मजं विभो । गृहीत्वा समनुप्राप्ता त्वामद्य शरणैषिणी ॥
इत्युक्त्वार्तस्वरं सा तु मुमोच धृतराष्ट्रजा । दीना दीनं स्थितं पार्थमब्रवीच्चाप्यधोमुखम् ॥
स्वसारं मामवेक्षस्व स्वस्रीयात्मजमेव च । कर्तुमर्हसि धर्मज्ञ दयां मयि कुरूद्वह । विस्मृत्य कुरुराजानं तं च मन्दं जयद्रथम् ॥
data.md: O perpetuator of Kuru's race, O you who are fully conversant with every duty, you should show mercy to this child, forgetting the Kuru prince (Duryodhana) and the wicked Jayadratha. in

data.v: अभिमन्योर्यथा जातः परिक्षित्परवीरहा । तथायं सुरथाज्जातो मम पौत्रो महाभुज ॥
data.md: As that destroyer of hostile heroes, Parikshit, has been born of Abhimanyu, so has this mighty-armed child, my grandson, originated from Suratha.

data.v: तमादाय नरव्याघ्र संप्राप्तास्मि तवान्तिकम् । शमार्थं सर्वयोधानां शृणु चेदं वचो मम ॥
data.md: Taking him with me, O king, I have come to you desirous of the safety of all the warriors! Do you listen to these words of mine.

data.v: आगतोऽयं महाबाहो तस्य मन्दस्य पौत्रकः । प्रसादमस्य बालस्य तस्मात्त्वं कर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: This child of that wicked enemy of yours has now come to you, O mighty armed hero. You should, therefore, show mercy to this infant.

data.v: एष प्रसाद्य शिरसा मया सार्धमरिंदम । याचते त्वां महाबाहो शमं गच्छ धनंजय ॥
data.md: O chastiser of enemies this intent seeks to please you by bending his head. He solicits you for peace! O mighty armed hero, be inclined to make peace.

data.v: बालस्य हतबन्धोश्च पार्थ किंचिदजानतः । प्रसादं कुरु धर्मज्ञ मा मन्युवशमन्वगाः ॥
data.md: O you who know every duty, be pleased with the child whose friends and kinsmen have all been killed and who himself knows nothing of what has taken place. Do not yield to anger.

data.v: तमनार्यं नृशंसं च विस्मृत्यास्य पितामहम् । आगस्कारिणमत्यर्थं प्रसादं कर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Forgetting his disreputable and cruel grandfather, who offended against you so highly, it is but fit that you should extend your grace towards this child.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवत्यां करुणं दुःशलायां धनंजयः । संस्मृत्य देवीं गान्धारीं धृतराष्ट्रं च पार्थिवम् । प्रोवाच दुःखशोकार्तः क्षत्रधर्मं विगर्हयन् ॥
data.md: Recollecting queen Gandhari and king Dhritarashtra, Dhananjaya, afflicted with grief, addressed Dushala who had said so to him, and answered her, censuring Kshatriya practices all the time.

data.v: धिक्तं दुर्योधनं क्षुद्रं राज्यलुब्धं च मानिनम् । यत्कृते बान्धवाः सर्वे मया नीता यमक्षयम् ॥
data.md: Fie on Duryodhana, that mean person covetous of kingdom and full of vanity! Alas, it was for him that all my kinsmen have been sent by me to the abode of Yama.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा बहु सान्त्वादि प्रसादमकरोज्जयः । परिष्वज्य च तां प्रीतो विससर्ज गृहान्प्रति ॥
data.md: Having said so, Dhananjaya comforted his sister and became inclined to make peace. Cheerfully, he embraced her and then dismissed her, asking her to return to her palace.

data.v: दुःशला चापि तान्योधान्निवार्य महतो रणात् । संपूज्य पार्थं प्रययौ गृहान्प्रति शुभानना ॥
data.md: Dushala asked all her warriors to desert from that great battle, and adoring Partha, she of beautiful face returned towards her palace.

data.v: ततः सैन्धवकान्योधान्विनिर्जित्य नरर्षभः । पुनरेवान्वधावत्स तं हयं कामचारिणम् ॥
ससार यज्ञियं वीरो विधिवत्स विशां पते । तारामृगमिवाकाशे देवदेवः पिनाकधृक् ॥
स च वाजी यथेष्टेन तांस्तान्देशान्यथासुखम् । विचचार यथाकामं कर्म पार्थस्य वर्धयन् ॥
data.md: The horse, at its will, passed through various kingdoms successively, multiplying the feats of Arjuna.

data.v: क्रमेण स हयस्त्वेवं विचरन्भरतर्षभ । मणिपूरपतेर्देशमुपायात्सहपाण्डवः ॥
data.md: In course of time, O king, the horse wandering at its pleasure, at last arrived within the kingdom of Manipura, followed by the son of Pandu.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु नृपतिर्वीरं पितरं बभ्रुवाहनः । निर्ययौ विनयेनार्यो ब्राह्मणार्घ्यपुरःसरः ॥
data.md: Hearing that his father Arjuna had arrived within his kingdom, the king of Manipura, Babhruvahana went out with humility, with a number of Brahmanas and some treasure in his van.

data.v: मणिपूरेश्वरं त्वेवमुपयातं धनंजयः । नाभ्यनन्दत मेधावी क्षत्रधर्ममनुस्मरन् ॥
data.md: Remembering, however, the duties of Kshatriyas, the highly intelligent Dhananjaya, seeing the king of Manipura arrive in that guise, did not approve of it.

data.v: उवाच चैनं धर्मात्मा समन्युः फल्गुनस्तदा । प्रक्रियेयं न ते युक्ता बहिस्त्वं क्षत्रधर्मतः ॥
data.md: The righteous-souled Phalguna angrily said, Your conduct is not proper. You have certainly fallen away from Kshatriya duties.

data.v: संरक्ष्यमाणं तुरगं यौधिष्ठिरमुपागतम् । यज्ञियं विषयान्ते मां नायोत्सीः किं नु पुत्रक ॥
data.md: I have come here as the protector of Yudhishthira's sacrificial horse. Why, O son, will you not fight me, seeing that I have come within your territories?

data.v: धिक्त्वामस्तु सुदुर्बुद्धिं क्षत्रधर्माविशारदम् । यो मां युद्धाय संप्राप्तं साम्नैवाथो त्वमग्रहीः ॥
data.md: Fie on you, O you of foolish understanding, Fie on you who have deviated from Kshatriya duties! Fie on you who would receive me peacefully even though I have come here for fighting with you.

data.v: न त्वया पुरुषार्थश्च कश्चिदस्तीह जीवता । यस्त्वं स्त्रीवद्युधा प्राप्तं साम्ना मां प्रत्यगृह्णथाः ॥
यद्यहं न्यस्तशस्त्रस्त्वामागच्छेयं सुदुर्मते । प्रक्रियेयं ततो युक्ता भवेत्तव नराधम ॥
तमेवमुक्तं भर्त्रा तु विदित्वा पन्नगात्मजा । अमृष्यमाणा भित्त्वोर्वीमुलूपी तमुपागमत् ॥
सा ददर्श ततः पुत्रं विमृशन्तमधोमुखम् । संतर्ज्यमानमसकृद्भर्त्रा युद्धार्थिना विभो ॥
ततः सा चारुसर्वाङ्गी तमुपेत्योरगात्मजा । उलूपी प्राह वचनं क्षत्रधर्मविशारदा ॥
उलूपीं मां निबोध त्वं मातरं पन्नगात्मजाम् । कुरुष्व वचनं पुत्र धर्मस्ते भविता परः ॥
data.md: Know that I am your mother Ulupi that am the daughter of a snake. Do you perform my order, O son for you would then acquire great merit. Fight your father, this foremost one of Kuru's race, this hero who is irresistible in battle. Forsooth, he will then be pleased with you.

data.v: युध्यस्वैनं कुरुश्रेष्ठं धनंजयमरिंदम । एवमेष हि ते प्रीतो भविष्यति न संशयः ॥
एवमुद्धर्षितो मात्रा स राजा बभ्रुवाहनः । मनश्चक्रे महातेजा युद्धाय भरतर्षभ ॥
संनह्य काञ्चनं वर्म शिरस्त्राणं च भानुमत् । तूणीरशतसंबाधमारुरोह महारथम् ॥
सर्वोपकरणैर्युक्तं युक्तमश्वैर्मनोजवैः । सुचक्रोपस्करं धीमान्हेमभाण्डपरिष्कृतम् ॥
परमार्चितमुच्छ्रित्य ध्वजं सिंहं हिरण्मयम् । प्रययौ पार्थमुद्दिश्य स राजा बभ्रुवाहनः ॥
data.md: Raising his standard which was decorated most beautifully and which bore the device of a lion in gold, the beautiful prince Babhruvahana proceeded against this father for battle.

data.v: ततोऽभ्येत्य हयं वीरो यज्ञियं पार्थरक्षितम् । ग्राहयामास पुरुषैर्हयशिक्षाविशारदैः ॥
data.md: Coming upon the sacrificial horse which was protected by Partha, the heroic prince caused it to be seized by persons well-versed in veterinary science.

data.v: गृहीतं वाजिनं दृष्ट्वा प्रीतात्मा स धनंजयः । पुत्रं रथस्थं भूमिष्ठः संन्यवारयदाहवे ॥
data.md: Seeing the horse seized, Dhananjaya become filled with joy. Standing on the earth, that hero began to oppose the advance of his son who was on his car.

data.v: ततः स राजा तं वीरं शरव्रातैः सहस्रशः । अर्दयामास निशितैराशीविषविषोपमैः ॥
data.md: The king afflicted the hero with repeated showers of arrows gifted with whetted points and resembling snakes of dreadful poison.

data.v: तयोः समभवद्युद्धं पितुः पुत्रस्य चातुलम् । देवासुररणप्रख्यमुभयोः प्रीयमाणयोः ॥
data.md: Incomparable was the battle which took place between the father and son. It resembled the battle between the celestials and the Asuras of old. Each was pleased with obtaining the other for an antagonist. arrow a

data.v: किरीटिनं तु विव्याध शरेण नतपर्वणा । जत्रुदेशे नरव्याघ्रः प्रहसन्बभ्रुवाहनः ॥
data.md: Then Babhruvahana, laughing, cut the diadem-decked Arjuna, that foremost of men, in the shoulder with a straight arrow.

data.v: सोऽभ्यगात्सह पुङ्खेन वल्मीकमिव पन्नगः । विनिर्भिद्य च कौन्तेयं महीतलमथाविशत् ॥
data.md: Equipped with feathers, that penetrated Arjuna's body like snake penetrating on an anthill. Piercing the son of Kunti through, the arrow went deep into the Earth.

data.v: स गाढवेदनो धीमानालम्ब्य धनुरुत्तमम् । दिव्यं तेजः समाविश्य प्रमीत इव संबभौ ॥
data.md: Feeling acute pain, the intelligent Dhananjaya rested awhile, supporting himself on his excellent bow. He stood, having recourse to his celestial energy and seemed externally like one dead.

data.v: स संज्ञामुपलभ्याथ प्रशस्य पुरुषर्षभः । पुत्रं शक्रात्मजो वाक्यमिदमाह महीपते ॥
data.md: That foremost of men, then regaining consciousness, lauded his highly. Possessed of great splendour, the son of Shakra said, Excellent, Excellent, O mighty-armed one, O son of Chitrangada! O son, seeing this feat, so worthy of you, I am highly pleased son with you.

data.v: साधु साधु महाबाहो वत्स चित्राङ्गदात्मज । सदृशं कर्म ते दृष्ट्वा प्रीतिमानस्मि पुत्रक ॥
data.md: That foremost of men, then regaining consciousness, lauded his highly. Possessed of great splendour, the son of Shakra said, Excellent, Excellent, O mighty-armed one, O son of Chitrangada! O son, seeing this feat, so worthy of you, I am highly pleased son with you.

data.v: विमुञ्चाम्येष बाणांस्ते पुत्र युद्धे स्थिरो भव । इत्येवमुक्त्वा नाराचैरभ्यवर्षदमित्रहा ॥
data.md: I shall now discharge these arrows at you, O son! Stand for fight (without running away). Having said these words, that destroyer of enemies shot a shower of arrows on the prince.

data.v: तान्स गाण्डीवनिर्मुक्तान्वज्राशनिसमप्रभान् । नाराचैरच्छिनद्राजा सर्वानेव त्रिधा त्रिधा ॥
data.md: King Babhruvahana, however, with his own broad-headed arrows, cut all those arrows, which were discharged from Gandiva and which resembled the thunderbolt of Indra in splendour, some in two, and some into three, parts.

data.v: तस्य पार्थः शरैर्दिव्यैर्ध्वजं हेमपरिष्कृतम् । सुवर्णतालप्रतिमं क्षुरेणापाहरद्रथात् ॥
data.md: Then the standard, decked with gold and resembling a golden Palmyra, on the king's car was cut off by Partha with some excellent arrows of his.

data.v: हयांश्चास्य महाकायान्महावेगपराक्रमान् । चकार राज्ञो निर्जीवान्प्रहसन्पाण्डवर्षभः ॥
data.md: The son of Pandu, laughing, next killed the king's horses of large size and great speed.

data.v: स रथादवतीर्याशु राजा परमकोपनः । पदातिः पितरं कोपाद्योधयामास पाण्डवम् ॥
data.md: Descending from his car, the king, worked up with rage, fought his father on foot.

data.v: संप्रीयमाणः पाण्डूनामृषभः पुत्रविक्रमात् । नात्यर्थं पीडयामास पुत्रं वज्रधरात्मजः ॥
data.md: Pleased with the prowess of his son, that foremost one of the sons of Pritha, viz., the son of the wielder of the thunderbolt, began to afflict him greatly.

data.v: स हन्यमानो विमुखं पितरं बभ्रुवाहनः । शरैराशीविषाकारैः पुनरेवार्दयद्बली ॥
data.md: The powerful Babhruvahana, thinking that his father was no longer able to face him, again afflicted him with many arrows resembling snakes of dreadful poison.

data.v: ततः स बाल्यात्पितरं विव्याध हृदि पत्रिणा । निशितेन सुपुङ्खेन बलवद्बभ्रुवाहनः ॥
data.md: From a spirit of childishness he then vigorously cut his father in the breast with a whetted arrow having excellent wings.

data.v: स बाणस्तेजसा दीप्तो ज्वलन्निव हुताशनः । विवेश पाण्डवं राजन्मर्म भित्त्वातिदुःखकृत् ॥
स तेनातिभृशं विद्धः पुत्रेण कुरुनन्दनः । महीं जगाम मोहार्तस्ततो राजन्धनंजयः ॥
तस्मिन्निपतिते वीरे कौरवाणां धुरंधरे । सोऽपि मोहं जगामाशु ततश्चित्राङ्गदासुतः ॥
व्यायम्य संयुगे राजा दृष्ट्वा च पितरं हतम् । पूर्वमेव च बाणौघैर्गाढविद्धोऽर्जुनेन सः ॥
भर्तारं निहतं दृष्ट्वा पुत्रं च पतितं भुवि । चित्राङ्गदा परित्रस्ता प्रविवेश रणाजिरम् ॥
data.md: Hearing that her husband had been killed and that her son had fallen down on the Earth, Chitrangada, in great agitation of mind, went to the field of battle.

data.v: शोकसंतप्तहृदया रुदती सा ततः शुभा । मणिपूरपतेर्माता ददर्श निहतं पतिम् ॥
data.md: Her heart burning with sorrow, weeping piteously the while, and trembling all over, the mother of the king of Manipura saw her killed husband.

data.v: ततो बहुविधं भीरुर्विलप्य कमलेक्षणा । मुमोह दुःखाद्दुर्धर्षा निपपात च भूतले ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said That lady having eyes like lotus petals, having bewailed much, and burning with grief, at last lost her senses and dropped down on the Earth.

data.v: प्रतिलभ्य च सा संज्ञां देवी दिव्यवपुर्धरा । उलूपीं पन्नगसुतां दृष्ट्वेदं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Regaining consciousness and seeing Ulupi, the daughter of the Snake-Chief, queen Chitrangada gifted with celestial beauty, said to her these words :-See, O Ulupi, our ever victorious husband killed in battle, through you, by my son of tender years.

data.v: उलूपि पश्य भर्तारं शयानं निहतं रणे । त्वत्कृते मम पुत्रेण बालेन समितिंजयम् ॥
ननु त्वमार्ये धर्मज्ञा ननु चासि पतिव्रता । यत्त्वत्कृतेऽयं पतितः पतिस्ते निहतो रणे ॥
data.md: Do you know the practices of the respectable? Are you a wife devoted to you husband? It is through your deed, that your husband is land low, slain in battle.

data.v: किं तु सर्वापराधोऽयं यदि तेऽद्य धनंजयः । क्षमस्व याच्यमाना मे संजीवय धनंजयम् ॥
data.md: If Dhananjaya has offended against you in every respect, do you forgive him! I solicit you, do you revive that hero.

data.v: ननु त्वमार्ये धर्मज्ञा त्रैलोक्यविदिता शुभे । यद्घातयित्वा भर्तारं पुत्रेणेह न शोचसि ॥
data.md: O righteous lady, you know piety. You are, O blessed one, known (for your virtues) over the three worlds! How is it that having caused your husband to be killed by your son, you do not indulge in grief?

data.v: नाहं शोचामि तनयं निहतं पन्नगात्मजे । पतिमेव तु शोचामि यस्यातिथ्यमिदं कृतम् ॥
data.md: O daughter of the Snake-Chief, I do not grieve for my killed son! I grieve for only my husband who has received this hospitality form his son.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा सा तदा देवीमुलूपीं पन्नगात्मजाम् । भर्तारमभिगम्येदमित्युवाच यशस्विनी ॥
data.md: Having said these words to the queenly Ulupi the daughter of the Snake-King, the illustrious Chitrangada went to where her husband lay on the Earth and addressing him, said, Rise, O dear husband, you occupy the King (Yudhishthira)! Here is that horse of yours! It has been liberated by me.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ कुरुमुख्यस्य प्रियकाम मम प्रिय । अयमश्वो महाबाहो मया ते परिमोक्षितः ॥
data.md: Having said these words to the queenly Ulupi the daughter of the Snake-King, the illustrious Chitrangada went to where her husband lay on the Earth and addressing him, said, Rise, O dear husband, you occupy the King (Yudhishthira)! Here is that horse of yours! It has been liberated by me.

data.v: ननु नाम त्वया वीर धर्मराजस्य यज्ञियः । अयमश्वोऽनुसर्तव्यः स शेषे किं महीतले ॥
data.md: Indeed, O powerful one, this sacrificial horse of king Yudhishthira the just, should be followed by you. Why then do you lie still on the Earth.

data.v: त्वयि प्राणाः समायत्ताः कुरूणां कुरुनन्दन । स कस्मात्प्राणदोऽन्येषां प्राणान्संत्यक्तवानसि ॥
data.md: My life-breaths depend on you, O delighter of the Kurus. How is it that he who is the ver of other people's life-breaths, renounces his own life-breaths today?

data.v: उलूपि साधु संपश्य भर्तारं निहतं रणे । पुत्रं चैनं समुत्साह्य घातयित्वा न शोचसि ॥
data.md: See, O Ulupi, this beautiful form of your husband lying prostrate on the ground. How is it that you do not grieve, having cause him to be killed through your son whom you did excite with your words?

data.v: कामं स्वपितु बालोऽयं भूमौ प्रेतगतिं गतः । लोहिताक्षो गुडाकेशो विजयः साधु जीवतु ॥
data.md: It is fit that this boy should yield to the power of death and lie thus on the ground besides his own father. Oh, let Vijaya, let him that is called Gudakesha, let this hero with reddish eyes return to life.

data.v: नापराधोऽस्ति सुभगे नराणां बहुभार्यता । नारीणां तु भवत्येतन्मा ते भूद्बुद्धिरीदृशी ॥
data.md: O blessed lady, polygamy is no fault with men. Women only commit sin by taking more than one husband. Do not, therefore, cherish such thoughts (of vengeance).

data.v: सख्यं ह्येतत्कृतं धात्रा शाश्वतं चाव्ययं च ह । सख्यं समभिजानीहि सत्यं संगतमस्तु ते ॥
data.md: This relationship was ordained by the Supreme Creator himself. It is besides, an eternal and unchangeable one. Do you attend to that relationship. Let your union (with Dhananjaya) be made true.

data.v: पुत्रेण घातयित्वेमं पतिं यदि न मेऽद्य वै । जीवन्तं दर्शयस्यद्य परित्यक्ष्यामि जीवितम् ॥
data.md: If, having killed your husband through your son, you do not revive him today before my eyes, I shall then renounce my own lifebreaths.

data.v: साहं दुःखान्विता भीरु पतिपुत्रविनाकृता । इहैव प्रायमाशिष्ये प्रेक्षन्त्यास्ते न संशयः ॥
data.md: Forsooth, O reverend lady, afflicted as I am with grief and deprived as I am of both husband and son, I shall sit here today in Praya-vow before your presence.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा पन्नगसुतां सपत्नीं चैत्रवाहिनी । ततः प्रायमुपासीना तूष्णीमासीज्जनाधिप ॥
data.md: Having said so to the daughter of the Snake-Chief, who was a co-wife with her to Arjuna, the princess Chatravahini sat in Praya, O king, restraining speech.

data.v: तथा विलप्योपरता भर्तुः पादौ प्रगृह्य सा । उपविष्टाभवद्देवी सोच्छ्वासं पुत्रमीक्षती ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Ceasing to lament, the cheerless queen, taking upon her lap the feet of her husband, sat there, sighing heavily and desiring also for the restoration of her son to life.

data.v: ततः संज्ञां पुनर्लब्ध्वा स राजा बभ्रुवाहनः । मातरं तामथालोक्य रणभूमावथाब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: King Babhruvahana then, regaining consciousness, saw his mother seated in that guise on the field of battle. Addressing her he said, What can be more painful than the sight of my mother, who has been brought up in luxury, lying on the naked Earth beside her heroic husband stretched thereon.

data.v: इतो दुःखतरं किं नु यन्मे माता सुखैधिता । भूमौ निपतितं वीरमनुशेते मृतं पतिम् ॥
data.md: King Babhruvahana then, regaining consciousness, saw his mother seated in that guise on the field of battle. Addressing her he said, What can be more painful than the sight of my mother, who has been brought up in luxury, lying on the naked Earth beside her heroic husband stretched thereon.

data.v: निहन्तारं रणेऽरीणां सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरम् । मया विनिहतं संख्ये प्रेक्षते दुर्मरं बत ॥
data.md: Alas, this destroyer of all enemies, this foremost of all wielders of weapons, has been killed by me in battle. It is clear that men do die, till their hour comes.

data.v: अहोऽस्या हृदयं देव्या दृढं यन्न विदीर्यते । व्यूढोरस्कं महाबाहुं प्रेक्षन्त्या निहतं पतिम् ॥
data.md: Oh, the heart of this princess seems to be very hard since it does not break even on seeing her mighty-armed and broad-chested husband lying dead on the ground.

data.v: दुर्मरं पुरुषेणेह मन्ये ह्यध्वन्यनागते । यत्र नाहं न मे माता विप्रयुज्येत जीवितात् ॥
data.md: It is clear that one does not die till one's hour comes, since neither myself, nor my mother is deprived of life.

data.v: अहो धिक्कुरुवीरस्य ह्युरःस्थं काञ्चनं भुवि । व्यपविद्धं हतस्येह मया पुत्रेण पश्यत ॥
data.md: Alas, alas, the golden coat of mail of this foremost hero of Kuru's race, killed by me, his son, knowingly, is lying on the ground, cut off from his body.

data.v: भो भो पश्यत मे वीरं पितरं ब्राह्मणा भुवि । शयानं वीरशयने मया पुत्रेण पातितम् ॥
data.md: Alas, you Brahmanas, see my heroic father lying prostrate on the Earth, on a hero's bed, killed by his son.

data.v: ब्राह्मणाः कुरुमुख्यस्य प्रयुक्ता हयसारिणः । कुर्वन्तु शान्तिकां त्वद्य रणे योऽयं मया हतः ॥
data.md: What benefit is done to this hero, killed by me in battle, by those Brahmanas who were commissioned to attend upon this foremost one of Kuru's race engaged in following the horse?

data.v: व्यादिशन्तु च किं विप्राः प्रायश्चित्तमिहाद्य मे । सुनृशंसस्य पापस्य पितृहन्तू रणाजिरे ॥
data.md: Let the Brahmanas direct what expiation should now be done by me, a cruel and sinful wretch, who has killed his own father in battle.

data.v: दुश्चरा द्वादश समा हत्वा पितरमद्य वै । ममेह सुनृशंसस्य संवीतस्यास्य चर्मणा ॥
data.md: Having killed my own father, I should, suffering every sort of misery, wonder over the Earth, cruel that I am, covering myself with his skin.

data.v: शिरःकपाले चास्यैव भुञ्जतः पितुरद्य मे । प्रायश्चित्तं हि नास्त्यन्यद्धत्वाद्य पितरं मम ॥
data.md: Give me the two halves of my sire's head today, for there is no other expiation for me who have killed my own father.

data.v: पश्य नागोत्तमसुते भर्तारं निहतं मया । कृतं प्रियं मया तेऽद्य निहत्य समरेऽर्जुनम् ॥
data.md: See, O daughter of the foremost of Snakes, your husband killed by me. Indeed, by killing Arjuna in battle I have accomplished what is pleasant to you.

data.v: सोऽहमप्यद्य यास्यामि गतिं पितृनिषेविताम् । न शक्नोम्यात्मनात्मानमहं धारयितुं शुभे ॥
data.md: I shall today follow in the track by which my father has gone. O blessed one, I cannot comfort myself.

data.v: सा त्वं मयि मृते मातस्तथा गाण्डीवधन्वनि । भव प्रीतिमती देवि सत्येनात्मानमालभे ॥
data.md: Be happy today, O mother, seeing myself and the wielder of Gandiva both, embrace death today. I swear to you by truth itself.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा स तदा राजा दुःखशोकसमाहतः । उपस्पृश्य महाराज दुःखाद्वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Having said these words, the king, sorely afflicted with grief, O monarch, touched water, and exclaimed in sorrow, Let all creatures, mobile and immobile, listen to me! Do you also listen to me, O mother! I say the truth, O best of all daughters of the snakes.

data.v: शृण्वन्तु सर्वभूतानि स्थावराणि चराणि च । त्वं च मातर्यथा सत्यं ब्रवीमि भुजगोत्तमे ॥
data.md: Having said these words, the king, sorely afflicted with grief, O monarch, touched water, and exclaimed in sorrow, Let all creatures, mobile and immobile, listen to me! Do you also listen to me, O mother! I say the truth, O best of all daughters of the snakes.

data.v: यदि नोत्तिष्ठति जयः पिता मे भरतर्षभः । अस्मिन्नेव रणोद्देशे शोषयिष्ये कलेवरम् ॥
data.md: If this best of men, Jaya, my father does not rise up, I shall emaciate my own body, sitting on the field of battle.

data.v: न हि मे पितरं हत्वा निष्कृतिर्विद्यते क्वचित् । नरकं प्रतिपत्स्यामि ध्रुवं गुरुवधार्दितः ॥
data.md: Having killed my father, there is not rescue for me. Afflicted as I am with the sin of patricide, I shall, forsooth, have to sink in Hell.

data.v: वीरं हि क्षत्रियं हत्वा गोशतेन प्रमुच्यते । पितरं तु निहत्यैवं दुस्तरा निष्कृतिर्मया ॥
data.md: By killing a heroic Kshatriya one becomes cleansed by a gift of a hundred kine. By killing my father, however, so dreadful has been my sin that my rescue is impossible.

data.v: एष ह्येको महातेजाः पाण्डुपुत्रो धनंजयः । पिता च मम धर्मात्मा तस्य मे निष्कृतिः कुतः ॥
data.md: This Dhanajaya, the son of Pandu, was the one hero gifted with mighty energy. Possessed of righteous soul, he was the creator of my being. How can I be rescued after having killed him?

data.v: इत्येवमुक्त्वा नृपते धनंजयसुतो नृपः । उपस्पृश्याभवत्तूष्णीं प्रायोपेतो महामतिः ॥
data.md: Having bewailed thus, the great son of Dhananjaya, king Babhruvahana, touched water and became silent, vowing to starve himself to death.

data.v: प्रायोपविष्टे नृपतौ मणिपूरेश्वरे तदा । पितृशोकसमाविष्टे सह मात्रा परंतप ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said When the king of Manipura, that chastiser of enemies, afflicted with grief, along with his mother, sat down to starve himself to death, Ulupi then thought of the gem that has the virtue of reviving a dead man. The gem, the great refuge of the Snakes, thus thought of, arrived there.

data.v: उलूपी चिन्तयामास तदा संजीवनं मणिम् । स चोपातिष्ठत तदा पन्नगानां परायणम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said When the king of Manipura, that chastiser of enemies, afflicted with grief, along with his mother, sat down to starve himself to death, Ulupi then thought of the gem that has the virtue of reviving a dead man. The gem, the great refuge of the Snakes, thus thought of, arrived there.

data.v: तं गृहीत्वा तु कौरव्य नागराजपतेः सुता । मनःप्रह्लादनीं वाचं सैनिकानामथाब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: The daughter of the Prince of Snakes, taking it up, uttered these words which highly gladdened the combatants standing on the field.

data.v: उत्तिष्ठ मा शुचः पुत्र नैष जिष्णुस्त्वया हतः । अजेयः पुरुषैरेष देवैर्वापि सवासवैः ॥
data.md: Rise up, O son! Do not grieve! Jishnu has not been vanquished by you! This hero is incapable of being defeated by men as also by the celestials headed by Vasva himself.

data.v: मया तु मोहिनी नाम मायैषा संप्रयोजिता । प्रियार्थं पुरुषेन्द्रस्य पितुस्तेऽद्य यशस्विनः ॥
data.md: I have exhibited this illusion, deceiving your senses, for the benefit of this foremost of men, viz., your illustrious father.

data.v: जिज्ञासुर्ह्येष वै पुत्र बलस्य तव कौरवः । संग्रामे युध्यतो राजन्नागतः परवीरहा ॥
data.md: O you of Kuru's race, desirous of ascertaining the prowess of yourself, his son, this destroyer of hostile heroes, O king, came here for fighting with you.

data.v: तस्मादसि मया पुत्र युद्धार्थं परिचोदितः । मा पापमात्मनः पुत्र शङ्केथास्त्वण्वपि प्रभो ॥
data.md: It was, therefore, O son, that you were urged by me to fight. O powerful king, O son, do not suspect that you have committed any, even the least, fault, by his challenge.

data.v: ऋषिरेष महातेजाः पुरुषः शाश्वतोऽव्ययः । नैनं शक्तो हि संग्रामे जेतुं शक्रोऽपि पुत्रक ॥
data.md: He is a Rishi, of powerful soul, eternal and indestructible. O dear son, Shakra himself is incapable of defeating him in battle.

data.v: अयं तु मे मणिर्दिव्यः समानीतो विशां पते । मृतान्मृतान्पन्नगेन्द्रान्यो जीवयति नित्यदा ॥
data.md: This celestial gem has been brought by me, O king. It always revives the snakes as often as they die.

data.v: एतमस्योरसि त्वं तु स्थापयस्व पितुः प्रभो । संजीवितं पुनः पुत्र ततो द्रष्टासि पाण्डवम् ॥
data.md: O powerful king, do you place this gem on the breast of your father. You shall then see the son of Pandu revive.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स्थापयामास तस्योरसि मणिं तदा । पार्थस्यामिततेजाः स पितुः स्नेहादपापकृत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, the prince who had committed no sin, moved by love for his father, then placed that gem on the breast of Pritha's son of incomparable energy.

data.v: तस्मिन्न्यस्ते मणौ वीर जिष्णुरुज्जीवितः प्रभुः । सुप्तोत्थित इवोत्तस्थौ मृष्टलोहितलोचनः ॥
data.md: After the gem had been placed on his breast, the heroic and powerful Jishnu become revived. Opening his red eyes, he rose up like one who had slept long.

data.v: तमुत्थितं महात्मानं लब्धसंज्ञं मनस्विनम् । समीक्ष्य पितरं स्वस्थं ववन्दे बभ्रुवाहनः ॥
data.md: Seeing his father, the great hero of in exhaustible energy, restored to consciousness and quite at his case, Babhruvahana adored him with respect.

data.v: उत्थिते पुरुषव्याघ्रे पुनर्लक्ष्मीवति प्रभो । दिव्याः सुमनसः पुण्या ववृषे पाकशासनः ॥
data.md: When that foremost of men, O powerful one, awake from the slumber of death with every auspicious sign of life the chastiser of Paka rained down celestial flowers.

data.v: अनाहता दुन्दुभयः प्रणेदुर्मेघनिस्वनाः । साधु साध्विति चाकाशे बभूव सुमहान्स्वनः ॥
data.md: Kettle-drums struck by nobody, produced their music deep as the muttering of the clouds. A loud uproar was heard in the sky consisting of the words-Excellent, Excellent.

data.v: उत्थाय तु महाबाहुः पर्याश्वस्तो धनंजयः । बभ्रुवाहनमालिङ्ग्य समाजिघ्रत मूर्धनि ॥
data.md: The mighty-armed Dhananjaya, rising up and well-comforted, embraced Babhruvahana and smelled his head.

data.v: ददर्श चाविदूरेऽस्य मातरं शोककर्शिताम् । उलूप्या सह तिष्ठन्तीं ततोऽपृच्छद्धनंजयः ॥
data.md: He saw sitting at a distance from his son, this latter's mother stricken with grief, in the company of Ulupi. Dhanajaya asked, Why is it that every thing in the field of battle seems to bear the marks of grief, wonder and joy? If O destroyer of enemies, you know the cause, do you then tell me.

data.v: किमिदं लक्ष्यते सर्वं शोकविस्मयहर्षवत् । रणाजिरममित्रघ्न यदि जानासि शंस मे ॥
data.md: He saw sitting at a distance from his son, this latter's mother stricken with grief, in the company of Ulupi. Dhanajaya asked, Why is it that every thing in the field of battle seems to bear the marks of grief, wonder and joy? If O destroyer of enemies, you know the cause, do you then tell me.

data.v: जननी च किमर्थं ते रणभूमिमुपागता । नागेन्द्रदुहिता चेयमुलूपी किमिहागता ॥
data.md: Why has your mother come to the field of battle? Why, also has Ulupi the daughter of the Prince of Snakes, come here?

data.v: जानाम्यहमिदं युद्धं त्वया मद्वचनात्कृतम् । स्त्रीणामागमने हेतुमहमिच्छामि वेदितुम् ॥
data.md: I know that you had fought this battle with me at my own command. I wish to know what the cause is which has brought out the ladies.

data.v: तमुवाच ततः पृष्टो मणिपूरपतिस्तदा । प्रसाद्य शिरसा विद्वानुलूपी पृच्छ्यतामिति ॥
data.md: Thus questioned by Dhananjaya the intelligent king of Manipura gratified him by bending his head in respect, and then said, Let Ulupi be asked.

data.v: किमागमनकृत्यं ते कौरव्यकुलनन्दिनि । मणिपूरपतेर्मातुस्तथैव च रणाजिरे ॥
data.md: What brings you here, O daughter (in-law) of Kuru's race, and what, also, is the cause of the arrival on the field of battle of her who is the mother of the king of Manipura?

data.v: कच्चित्कुशलकामासि राज्ञोऽस्य भुजगात्मजे । मम वा चञ्चलापाङ्गे कच्चित्त्वं शुभमिच्छसि ॥
data.md: Do you entertain friendly motives towards this king, O daughter of a snake? O you of restless glances, do you wish good to me too?

data.v: कच्चित्ते पृथुलश्रोणि नाप्रियं शुभदर्शने । अकार्षमहमज्ञानादयं वा बभ्रुवाहनः ॥
data.md: I hope, O you of ample hips, that neither I, nor this Babruvahana here, have, O beautiful lady, donc any injury to you unconsciously?

data.v: कच्चिच्च राजपुत्री ते सपत्नी चैत्रवाहिनी । चित्राङ्गदा वरारोहा नापराध्यति किंचन ॥
data.md: Has Chitrangada of faultless limbs, descended from the line of Chitravahana, done you any wrong?

data.v: तमुवाचोरगपतेर्दुहिता प्रहसन्त्यथ । न मे त्वमपराद्धोऽसि न नृपो बभ्रुवाहनः । न जनित्री तथास्येयं मम या प्रेष्यवत्स्थिता ॥
data.md: To him, the daughter of the Prince of Snakes answered sinilingly, You have not offended me, nor has Babhruvahana done me any wrong.

data.v: श्रूयतां यद्यथा चेदं मया सर्वं विचेष्टितम् । न मे कोपस्त्वया कार्यः शिरसा त्वां प्रसादये ॥
त्वत्प्रीत्यर्थं हि कौरव्य कृतमेतन्मयानघ । यत्तच्छृणु महाबाहो निखिलेन धनंजय ॥

data.md: O mighty-armed Dhananjaya, Hear all that I have done. In the great battle of the BharataPrinces, you had killed the royal son of Shantanu by unfair ways. What I have done has expiated your sin. You did not overthrow Bhishma while fighting with you!

data.v: न हि भीष्मस्त्वया वीर युध्यमानो निपातितः । शिखण्डिना तु संसक्तस्तमाश्रित्य हतस्त्वया ॥
तस्य शान्तिमकृत्वा तु त्यजेस्त्वं यदि जीवितम् । कर्मणा तेन पापेन पतेथा निरये ध्रुवम् ॥
एषा तु विहिता शान्तिः पुत्राद्यां प्राप्तवानसि । वसुभिर्वसुधापाल गङ्गया च महामते ॥
पुरा हि श्रुतमेतद्वै वसुभिः कथितं मया । गङ्गायास्तीरमागम्य हते शांतनवे नृपे ॥
आप्लुत्य देवा वसवः समेत्य च महानदीम् । इदमूचुर्वचो घोरं भागीरथ्या मते तदा ॥
data.md: After the fall of Shantanu's son, those celestials, viz., the Vasus, coming to the banks of Ganga, bathed in her waters, and calling the goddess of that stream, they uttered these terrible words having the sanction of Bhagirati herself, viz., Shantanu's son Bhishma has been killed by Dhananjaya.

data.v: एष शांतनवो भीष्मो निहतः सव्यसाचिना । अयुध्यमानः संग्रामे संसक्तोऽन्येन भामिनि ॥
तदनेनाभिषङ्गेण वयमप्यर्जुनं शुभे । शापेन योजयामेति तथास्त्विति च साब्रवीत् ॥
तदहं पितुरावेद्य भृशं प्रव्यथितेन्द्रिया । अभवं स च तच्छ्रुत्वा विषादमगमत्परम् ॥
पिता तु मे वसून्गत्वा त्वदर्थं समयाचत । पुनः पुनः प्रसाद्यैनांस्त एनमिदमब्रुवन् ॥
data.md: Informed of what had taken place, my father became plunged in grief. Going to the Vasus, he begged them for your sake, again and again gratifying them by every means in his power. They then said to him, Dhananjaya has a highly blessed son who, youthful as he is, is the king of Manipura.

data.v: पुनस्तस्य महाभाग मणिपूरेश्वरो युवा । स एनं रणमध्यस्थं शरैः पातयिता भुवि ॥
एवं कृते स नागेन्द्र मुक्तशापो भविष्यति । गच्छेति वसुभिश्चोक्तो मम चेदं शशंस सः ॥
तच्छ्रुत्वा त्वं मया तस्माच्छापादसि विमोक्षितः । न हि त्वां देवराजोऽपि समरेषु पराजयेत् ॥
आत्मा पुत्रः स्मृतस्तस्मात्तेनेहासि पराजितः । नात्र दोषो मम मतः कथं वा मन्यसे विभो ॥
इत्येवमुक्तो विजयः प्रसन्नात्माब्रवीदिदम् । सर्वं मे सुप्रियं देवि यदेतत्कृतवत्यसि ॥
data.md: I cannot be held, O powerful one, to have committed any sin. How, indeed, would you hold me censurable? Thus addressed (by Ulupi), Vijaya became cheerful of heart and said to her, All this you have done, O goddess, is highly agreeable to me.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वाथाब्रवीत्पुत्रं मणिपूरेश्वरं जयः । चित्राङ्गदायाः शृण्वन्त्याः कौरव्यदुहितुस्तथा ॥
युधिष्ठिरस्याश्वमेधः परां चैत्रीं भविष्यति । तत्रागच्छेः सहामात्यो मातृभ्यां सहितो नृप ॥
data.md: After this, Jaya addressed his son, the king of Manipura, and said to him in the hearing of Chitrangada, the daughter (-in-law) of Kuru's race, the Horse-Sacrifice of Yudhishthira will take place on the day of full moon in the coming month of Chaitra.Come there, O king, with your mother and your counsellors and officers!'

data.v: इत्येवमुक्तः पार्थेन स राजा बभ्रुवाहनः । उवाच पितरं धीमानिदमस्राविलेक्षणः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by Partha, king Babhruvahana of great intelligence, with tearful eyes, said these words to his father, 'O you who are conversant with every duty, I shall certainly go, at your command, to the great Horse-Sacrifice, and take upon myself the task of distributing food among the twice-born ones!

data.v: उपयास्यामि धर्मज्ञ भवतः शासनादहम् । अश्वमेधे महायज्ञे द्विजातिपरिवेषकः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by Partha, king Babhruvahana of great intelligence, with tearful eyes, said these words to his father, 'O you who are conversant with every duty, I shall certainly go, at your command, to the great Horse-Sacrifice, and take upon myself the task of distributing food among the twice-born ones!

data.v: मम त्वनुग्रहार्थाय प्रविशस्व पुरं स्वकम् । भार्याभ्यां सह शत्रुघ्न मा भूत्तेऽत्र विचारणा ॥
data.md: For, however, showing your grace towards me, do you enter your own city with your two wives. Do not cherish any scruple about this, O you who are fully acquainted with every duty!

data.v: उषित्वेह विशल्यस्त्वं सुखं स्वे वेश्मनि प्रभो । पुनरश्वानुगमनं कर्तासि जयतां वर ॥
data.md: O lord, having lived for one night in your own palace in happiness, you may then follow the horse, O foremost of victorious warriors!

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तु पुत्रेण तदा वानरकेतनः । स्मयन्प्रोवाच कौन्तेयस्तदा चित्राङ्गदासुतम् ॥
data.md: The ape-bannered son of Kunti, thus addressed by his son, answered the child Chitrangada, saying, You know, mighty-armed one, what vow I am observing? O you of large eyes, till the termination of this my vow, I cannot enter your city.

data.v: विदितं ते महाबाहो यथा दीक्षां चराम्यहम् । न स तावत्प्रवेक्ष्यामि पुरं ते पृथुलोचन ॥
data.md: The ape-bannered son of Kunti, thus addressed by his son, answered the child Chitrangada, saying, You know, mighty-armed one, what vow I am observing? O you of large eyes, till the termination of this my vow, I cannot enter your city.

data.v: यथाकामं प्रयात्येष यज्ञियश्च तुरंगमः । स्वस्ति तेऽस्तु गमिष्यामि न स्थानं विद्यते मम ॥
data.md: O foremost of men, this sacrificial horse wanders at will. Blessings on you. I must go away. I have no place to rest for even a short while!

data.v: स तत्र विधिवत्तेन पूजितः पाकशासनिः । भार्याभ्यामभ्यनुज्ञातः प्रायाद्भरतसत्तमः ॥
data.md: The son of the chastiser of Paka then, duly adored by his son and obtaining the permission of his wives, left the spot and proceeded on his way.

data.v: स तु वाजी समुद्रान्तां पर्येत्य पृथिवीमिमाम् । निवृत्तोऽभिमुखो राजन्येन नागाह्वयं पुरम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said The (sacrificial) horse, having wandered over the entire Earth bounded by the ocean, then ceased and turned his face toward the city of Hastinapur.

data.v: अनुगच्छंश्च तेजस्वी निवृत्तोऽथ किरीटभृत् । यदृच्छया समापेदे पुरं राजगृहं तदा ॥
data.md: Following as he did that horse, the diademdecked Arjuna also turned his face towards the Kuru capital. Wandering at is will, the horse then came to the city of Rajagriha.

data.v: तमभ्याशगतं राजा जरासंधात्मजात्मजः । क्षत्रधर्मे स्थितो वीरः समरायाजुहाव ह ॥
data.md: Seeing him arrived within his kingdom, O monarch, the heroic of Sahadeva, following Kshatriya duties, challenged him to battle.

data.v: ततः पुरात्स निष्क्रम्य रथी धन्वी शरी तली । मेघसंधिः पदातिं तं धनंजयमुपाद्रवत् ॥
data.md: Coming out of his city, Meghasandhi, mounted on his car and equipt with bow and arrows and leathern fence, rushed towards Dhananjaya who was on foot.

data.v: आसाद्य च महातेजा मेघसंधिर्धनंजयम् । बालभावान्महाराज प्रोवाचेदं न कौशलात् ॥
data.md: Gifted with great energy, Meghasandhi, approaching Dhanajaya, O king, said these words from a spirit of childishness and without son any skill.

data.v: किमयं चार्यते वाजी स्त्रीमध्य इव भारत । हयमेनं हरिष्यामि प्रयतस्व विमोक्षणे ॥
data.md: This horse of yours, O Bharata, seems to move about, protected by women only! I shall take away the horse. Do you try to free him.

data.v: अदत्तानुनयो युद्धे यदि त्वं पितृभिर्मम । करिष्यामि तवातिथ्यं प्रहर प्रहरामि वा ॥
data.md: Although my sires did not teach you in battle, I, however, shall do the duties of hospitality to you. Do you strike me, for I shall strike you.

data.v: इत्युक्तः प्रत्युवाचैनं पाण्डवः प्रहसन्निव । विघ्नकर्ता मया वार्य इति मे व्रतमाहितम् ॥
भ्रात्रा ज्येष्ठेन नृपते तवापि विदितं ध्रुवम् । प्रहरस्व यथाशक्ति न मन्युर्विद्यते मम ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, the son of Pandu, smiling the while, answered him, saying, To resist him who obstructs me is the vow imposed on me by my eldest brother. Forsooth, O king, you know this. Do you strike me to the best of your power. I have no anger.

data.v: इत्युक्तः प्राहरत्पूर्वं पाण्डवं मगधेश्वरः । किरञ्शरसहस्राणि वर्षाणीव सहस्रदृक् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, the king of Magadha first struck the son of Pandu, showering his arrows on him like the thousand-eyed Indra showering a heavy downpour of rain.

data.v: ततो गाण्डीवभृच्छूरो गाण्डीवप्रेषितैः शरैः । चकार मोघांस्तान्बाणानयत्नाद्भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Then, Ochief of Bharata's race, the heroic wielder of Gandiva, with arrows shot of that excellent bow, baffled all the arrows shot carefully at him by his adversary.

data.v: स मोघं तस्य बाणौघं कृत्वा वानरकेतनः । शरान्मुमोच ज्वलितान्दीप्तास्यानिव पन्नगान् ॥
data.md: Having thus baffled that cloud of arrows, the ape-bannered hero shot a number of burning arrows at his enemy which resembled snakes with fiery mouths.

data.v: ध्वजे पताकादण्डेषु रथयन्त्रे हयेषु च । अन्येषु च रथाङ्गेषु न शरीरे न सारथौ ॥
data.md: These arrows he shot at his flag and flagstaff and car and poles and yoke and the horses sparing the body of his-enemy and his cardriver.

data.v: संरक्ष्यमाणः पार्थेन शरीरे फल्गुनस्य ह । मन्यमानः स्ववीर्यं तन्मागधः प्राहिणोच्छरान् ॥
data.md: Though Partha who was capable of shooting with the bow with the left-hand (as well as the right) spared the body of the king of Magadha, yet the latter, thinking that his body was protected by his own prowess, discharged many arrows at Partha.

data.v: ततो गाण्डीवभृच्छूरो मागधेन समाहतः । बभौ वासन्तिक इव पलाशः पुष्पितो महान् ॥
data.md: The wielder of Gandiva, deeply struck by the king of Magadha, shone like a blossoming Palasha (Butea frondosa) in the season of spring.

data.v: अवध्यमानः सोऽभ्यघ्नन्मागधः पाण्डवर्षभम् । तेन तस्थौ स कौरव्य लोकवीरस्य दर्शने ॥
data.md: Arjuna had no desire of killing the king of Magadha. It was for this that, having struck the son of Pandu, he succeeded in remaining before that foremost of heroes.

data.v: सव्यसाची तु संक्रुद्धो विकृष्य बलवद्धनुः । हयांश्चकार निर्देहान्सारथेश्च शिरोऽहरत् ॥
data.md: Then Dhananjaya, becoming angry, drew his bow with great force, and killed his antagonist's horses and then struck off the head of his car-driver.

data.v: धनुश्चास्य महच्चित्रं क्षुरेण प्रचकर्त ह । हस्तावापं पताकां च ध्वजं चास्य न्यपातयत् ॥
data.md: With a razor-headed arruw he then cut off Meghasandhi's large and beautiful bow, and then his leathern fence. Then cutting off his flag and flag-staff, he caused it to fall down.

data.v: स राजा व्यथितो व्यश्वो विधनुर्हतसारथिः । गदामादाय कौन्तेयमभिदुद्राव वेगवान् ॥
data.md: The king of Magadha greatly afflicted, and deprived of horses and bow and driver, took up a mace and rushed with great speed at the son of Kunti.

data.v: तस्यापतत एवाशु गदां हेमपरिष्कृताम् । शरैश्चकर्त बहुधा बहुभिर्गृध्रवाजितैः ॥
data.md: Arjuna, then, with many arrows of his equipt with his vulturine feathers, cut off into pieces, that mace of his advancing enemy which was adorned with bright gold.

data.v: सा गदा शकलीभूता विशीर्णमणिबन्धना । व्याली निर्मुच्यमानेव पपातास्य सहस्रधा ॥
data.md: Thus cut off into pieces, that mace, with its jeweiled bonds and knots all severed, fell on the Earth, like a she-snake helplessly hurled down by somebody.

data.v: विरथं तं विधन्वानं गदया परिवर्जितम् । नैच्छत्ताडयितुं धीमानर्जुनः समराग्रणीः ॥
तत एनं विमनसं क्षत्रधर्मे समास्थितम् । सान्त्वपूर्वमिदं वाक्यमब्रवीत्कपिकेतनः ॥
पर्याप्तः क्षत्रधर्मोऽयं दर्शितः पुत्र गम्यताम् । बह्वेतत्समरे कर्म तव बालस्य पार्थिव ॥
data.md: When his enemy became deprived of his car, his bow, and his mace, the ape-bannered hero then, comforting his cheerless enemy who had been observant of Kshatriya duties, said to him these words: O son, you have sufficiently shorn your adherence to Kshatriya duties. Go now. Great have been the feats, O king, which you have accomplished in battle although you are very young in years.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्य संदेशो न हन्तव्या नृपा इति । तेन जीवसि राजंस्त्वमपराद्धोऽपि मे रणे ॥
data.md: The command I received from Yudhishthira was that kings who oppose me should not be killed. It is for this you live yet, O monarch, although you have offended me in battle.

data.v: इति मत्वा स चात्मानं प्रत्यादिष्टं स्म मागधः । तथ्यमित्यवगम्यैनं प्राञ्जलिः प्रत्यपूजयत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, the king of Magadha considered himself defeated and spared. Thinking then that it was his duty to do so, he approached Arjuna and joining his hands in respect adored him.

data.v: तमर्जुनः समाश्वास्य पुनरेवेदमब्रवीत् । आगन्तव्यं परां चैत्रीमश्वमेधे नृपस्य नः ॥
data.md: Comforting him again, Arjuna once more said to him. You should go to the HorseSacrifice of our king which takes place at the coming full moon of Chaitra.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तथेत्युक्त्वा पूजयामास तं हयम् । फल्गुनं च युधां श्रेष्ठं विधिवत्सहदेवजः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by him, the son of Sahadeva said, So be it, and then duly adored that horse as also Phalguna, that foremost of warriors.

data.v: ततो यथेष्टमगमत्पुनरेव स केसरी । ततः समुद्रतीरेण वङ्गान्पुण्ड्रान्सकेरलान् ॥
data.md: The sacrificial horse then, having beautiful manes, proceeded at his will along the seacoast, going to the countries of the Bangas, the Pundras, and the Kosalas.

data.v: तत्र तत्र च भूरीणि म्लेच्छसैन्यान्यनेकशः । विजिग्ये धनुषा राजन्गाण्डीवेन धनंजयः ॥
data.md: In those kingdoms Dhananjaya, with his bow Gandiva, O king, defeated numberless Mleccha armies one after another.

data.v: मागधेनार्चितो राजन्पाण्डवः श्वेतवाहनः । दक्षिणां दिशमास्थाय चारयामास तं हयम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana continued : Adored by the king of Magadha, Pandu's son having white horses yoked to his car, proceeded along the south, following the (sacrificial) horse.

data.v: ततः स पुनरावृत्य हयः कामचरो बली । आससाद पुरीं रम्यां चेदीनां शुक्तिसाह्वयाम् ॥
data.md: Turning round in course of his wanderings at will, the strong horse came upon the beautiful city of the Chedis called after the oyster.

data.v: शरभेणार्चितस्तत्र शिशुपालात्मजेन सः । युद्धपूर्वेण मानेन पूजया च महाबलः ॥
data.md: Sharabha, the son of Shishupala, gifted with great strength, first met Arjuna in battle and then adored him with due honours.

data.v: तत्रार्चितो ययौ राजंस्तदा स तुरगोत्तमः । काशीनन्ध्रान्कोसलांश्च किरातानथ तङ्गणान् ॥
data.md: Adored by him, O king, that best of horses then proceeded to the kingdom of the Kashis, the Angas, the Kosalas, the Kiratas, and the Tanganas.

data.v: तत्र पूजां यथान्यायं प्रतिगृह्य स पाण्डवः । पुनरावृत्य कौन्तेयो दशार्णानगमत्तदा ॥
data.md: Receiving due honours in all those kingdoms Dhananjaya turned his course. Indeed, the son of Kunti then proceeded to the country of the Dasharnas,

data.v: तत्र चित्राङ्गदो नाम बलवान्वसुधाधिपः । तेन युद्धमभूत्तस्य विजयस्यातिभैरवम् ॥
data.md: The ruler of that people was Chitrangada who was gifted with great strength and was a crusher of enemies. Between him and Vijaya took place a very dreadful battle.

data.v: तं चापि वशमानीय किरीटी पुरुषर्षभः । निषादराज्ञो विषयमेकलव्यस्य जग्मिवान् ॥
data.md: Bringing him under his control the diademdecked Arjuna, that foremost of men, went to the kingdom of the Nishada king, viz., the son of Ekalavya.

data.v: एकलव्यसुतश्चैनं युद्धेन जगृहे तदा । ततश्चक्रे निषादैः स संग्रामं रोमहर्षणम् ॥
data.md: The son of Ekalavya received Arjuna in battle! The encounter took place between the Kuru hero and the Nishadas was so furious as to make the hairs stand erect.

data.v: ततस्तमपि कौन्तेयः समरेष्वपराजितः । जिगाय समरे वीरो यज्ञविघ्नार्थमुद्यतम् ॥
data.md: Unvanquished in battle, the brave son of Kunti defeated the Nishada king who proved an impediinent to the sacrifice.

data.v: स तं जित्वा महाराज नैषादिं पाकशासनिः । अर्चितः प्रययौ भूयो दक्षिणं सलिलार्णवम् ॥
data.md: Having subjugated the son of Ekalavya, O king, the son of Indra, duly adored by the Nishadas, then proceeded towards the southern Ocean.

data.v: तत्रापि द्रविडैरन्ध्रै रौद्रैर्माहिषकैरपि । तथा कोल्लगिरेयैश्च युद्धमासीत्किरीटिनः ॥
data.md: In those regions battles took place between the diadem-decked hero and the Dravidas and Andhras and the dreadful Mahishakas and the hillmen of Kolwa.

data.v: तुरगस्य वशेनाथ सुराष्ट्रानभितो ययौ । गोकर्णमपि चासाद्य प्रभासमपि जग्मिवान् ॥
ततो द्वारवतीं रम्यां वृष्णिवीराभिरक्षिताम् । आससाद हयः श्रीमान्कुरुराजस्य यज्ञियः ॥
तमुन्मथ्य हयश्रेष्ठं यादवानां कुमारकाः । प्रययुस्तांस्तदा राजन्नुग्रसेनो न्यवारयत् ॥
ततः पुर्या विनिष्क्रम्य वृष्ण्यन्धकपतिस्तदा । सहितो वसुदेवेन मातुलेन किरीटिनः ॥
तौ समेत्य कुरुश्रेष्ठं विधिवत्प्रीतिपूर्वकम् । परया भरतश्रेष्ठं पूजया समवस्थितौ । ततस्ताभ्यामनुज्ञातो ययौ येन हयो गतः ॥
data.md: The two elderly chiefs honoured Arjuna duly. Getting their permission, the Kuru prince then proceeded to where the horse he followed lied him.

data.v: ततः स पश्चिमं देशं समुद्रस्य तदा हयः । क्रमेण व्यचरत्स्फीतं ततः पञ्चनदं ययौ ॥
data.md: The sacrificial horse then proceeded along the coast of the western ocean and at last reached the country of the five waters full of population and prosperity.

data.v: तस्मादपि स कौरव्य गान्धारविषयं हयः । विचचार यथाकामं कौन्तेयानुगतस्तदा ॥
data.md: Thence, O king, the horse proceeded to the country of the Gandharas. Arrived there, it roamed at will, followed by the son of Kunti.

data.v: तत्र गान्धारराजेन युद्धमासीन्महात्मनः । घोरं शकुनिपुत्रेण पूर्ववैरानुसारिणा ॥
data.md: Then took place a dreadful battle between the diadem-decked hero and the king of the Gandharas, viz., the son of Shakuni, who had a bitter remembrance of the grudge his father bore to the Pandavas.

data.v: शकुनेस्तु सुतो वीरो गान्धाराणां महारथः । प्रत्युद्ययौ गुडाकेशं सैन्येन महता वृतः । हस्त्यश्वरथपूर्णेन पताकाध्वजमालिना ॥
data.md: Vaishmpayana said The heroic son of Shakuni, who was a powerful car-warrior among the Gandharas, accompanied by a large army, proceeded against the Kuru hero of curly hair. That force contained elephants, horses and cars, and was adorned with many flags and banners.

data.v: अमृष्यमाणास्ते योधा नृपतेः शकुनेर्वधम् । अभ्ययुः सहिताः पार्थं प्रगृहीतशरासनाः ॥
data.md: Unable to bear, and, therefore, burning to avenge, the destruction of their kin Shakuni. those warriors, armed with bows, rushed together at Partha.

data.v: तानुवाच स धर्मात्मा बीभत्सुरपराजितः । युधिष्ठिरस्य वचनं न च ते जगृहुर्हितम् ॥
data.md: The unvanquished Bibhatsu of virtuous soul addressed them peacefully, but they were reluctant to accept the beneficial words of Yudhishthira.

data.v: वार्यमाणास्तु पार्थेन सान्त्वपूर्वममर्षिताः । परिवार्य हयं जग्मुस्ततश्चुक्रोध पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: Though forbidden by Partha with sweet words, they still gave themselves up to anger and surrounded the sacrificial horse. At this, the son of Pandu became filled with rage.

data.v: ततः शिरांसि दीप्ताग्रैस्तेषां चिच्छेद पाण्डवः । क्षुरैर्गाण्डीवनिर्मुक्तैर्नातियत्नादिवार्जुनः ॥
data.md: Then Arjuna, carelessly shooting from Gandiva many arrows with razor-like heads that blazed with splendour, cut off the heads of many Gandhara warriors.

data.v: ते वध्यमानाः पार्थेन हयमुत्सृज्य संभ्रमात् । न्यवर्तन्त महाराज शरवर्षार्दिता भृशम् ॥
data.md: While thus killed by Partha, the Gandharas, O king, exceedingly afflicted, liberated the horse, moved by fear and desisted from battle.

data.v: वितुद्यमानस्तैश्चापि गान्धारैः पाण्डवर्षभः । आदिश्यादिश्य तेजस्वी शिरांस्येषां न्यपातयत् ॥
data.md: Resisted, however, by those Gandhara combatant who still surrounded him on all sides, the son of Pandu, gifted with great energy, cut off the heads of many, previously naming those whom he thus killed.

data.v: वध्यमानेषु तेष्वाजौ गान्धारेषु समन्ततः । स राजा शकुनेः पुत्रः पाण्डवं प्रत्यवारयत् ॥
data.md: When the Gandhara warriors were thus being killed all around him in battle, the royal son of Shakuni came forward to resist the son of Pandu.

data.v: तं युध्यमानं राजानं क्षत्रधर्मे व्यवस्थितम् । पार्थोऽब्रवीन्न मे वध्या राजानो राजशासनात् । अलं युद्धेन ते वीर न तेऽस्त्यद्य पराजयः ॥
data.md: To the Gandhara king who was fighting with him, moved by Kshatriya duty, Arjuna said, I do not intend to kill the kings who fight with me, on account of the commands of Yudhishthira. O hero, Cease to fight with me. Do not scek defeat today.

data.v: इत्युक्तस्तदनादृत्य वाक्यमज्ञानमोहितः । स शक्रसमकर्माणमवाकिरत सायकैः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, the son of Shakuni, stupefied by folly, disregarded that advice and covered with many swift shafts the Kuru hero who resembled Shakra hiinself in the feats he performed in battle.

data.v: तस्य पार्थः शिरस्त्राणमर्धचन्द्रेण पत्रिणा । अपाहरदसंभ्रान्तो जयद्रथशिरो यथा ॥
data.md: Then Parhta, with a crescent-shaped arrow, cut off the head-gear of his enemies. Of immeasurable soul, he also caused that headgear to be borne along a great distance like the head of Jayadratha.

data.v: तद्दृष्ट्वा विस्मयं जग्मुर्गान्धाराः सर्व एव ते । इच्छता तेन न हतो राजेत्यपि च ते विदुः ॥
data.md: Seeing this feat, all the Gandhara warriors became stricken with wonder. They full well understood that Arjuna voluntarily spared their king.

data.v: गान्धारराजपुत्रस्तु पलायनकृतक्षणः । बभौ तैरेव सहितस्त्रस्तैः क्षुद्रमृगैरिव ॥
data.md: The prince of the Gandharas then began to fly away from the field, followed by all his warriors who resembled a flock of frightened deer.

data.v: तेषां तु तरसा पार्थस्तत्रैव परिधावताम् । विजहारोत्तमाङ्गानि भल्लैः संनतपर्वभिः ॥
data.md: The Gandharas, through fear, lost their senses and wandered over the field, unable to escape. Arjuna, with his broadheaded arrows, cut off the heads of many.

data.v: उच्छ्रितांस्तु भुजान्केचिन्नाबुध्यन्त शरैर्हृतान् । शरैर्गाण्डीवनिर्मुक्तैः पृथुभिः पार्थचोदितैः ॥
data.md: Many there were who lost their arins on account of Arjuna's arrows, but so stupefied were they with fear that they were not aware of the loss of that limb. Indeed, the Gandhara army was greatly afflicted with those large arrows which Partha discharged from Gandiva.

data.v: संभ्रान्तनरनागाश्वमथ तद्विद्रुतं बलम् । हतविध्वस्तभूयिष्ठमावर्तत मुहुर्मुहुः ॥
data.md: That army, which then consisted of frightened men and elephants and horse, which lost many warriors and animals, and which had been disordered and routed, began to wander and wheel about the field again and again.

data.v: न ह्यदृश्यन्त वीरस्य केचिदग्रेऽग्र्यकर्मणः । रिपवः पात्यमाना वै ये सहेयुर्महाशरान् ॥
data.md: Among those enemies who were thus being killed, none could be seen standing in front of the Kuru hero fained for foreinost of feats. No one could be seen who was able to bear the prowess of Dhananjaya.

data.v: ततो गान्धारराजस्य मन्त्रिवृद्धपुरःसरा । जननी निर्ययौ भीता पुरस्कृत्यार्घ्यमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Then the mother of the king of the Gandharas, filled with fear, and with all the aged ministers of state, came out of her city, taking an excellent Arghya for Arjuna.

data.v: सा न्यवारयदव्यग्रा तं पुत्रं युद्धदुर्मदम् । प्रसादयामास च तं जिष्णुमक्लिष्टकारिणम् ॥
data.md: She forbade her brave son of steady heart from fighting any longer, and pleased Jishnu who was never fatigued with toil.

data.v: तां पूजयित्वा कौन्तेयः प्रसादमकरोत्तदा । शकुनेश्चापि तनयं सान्त्वयन्निदमब्रवीत् ॥
न मे प्रियं महाबाहो यत्ते बुद्धिरियं कृता । प्रतियोद्धुममित्रघ्न भ्रातैव त्वं ममानघ ॥
data.md: The powerful Bibhatsu adored her and became inclined to show mercy towards the Gandharas. Comforting the son of Shakuni, he said, You have not, O mightyarmed hero, done what is agreeable to me by adopting these hostile measures! O destroyer of heroes, you are my brother, O sinless one.

data.v: गान्धारीं मातरं स्मृत्वा धृतराष्ट्रकृतेन च । तेन जीवसि राजंस्त्वं निहतास्त्वनुगास्तव ॥
data.md: Recollecting my mother Gandhari, and for the sake of Dhritarashtra also, I have not taken your life. It is for this, o king, that you live still, Many of your followers, however, have been killed by me.

data.v: मैवं भूः शाम्यतां वैरं मा ते भूद्बुद्धिरीदृशी । आगन्तव्यं परां चैत्रीमश्वमेधे नृपस्य नः ॥
data.md: Let not such a thing happen again. Let hostilities cease. Let not your understanding again go wrong. You should go to the HorseSacrifice of our king which takes place on the day of full moon of the month of Chaitra.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वानुययौ पार्थो हयं तं कामचारिणम् । न्यवर्तत ततो वाजी येन नागाह्वयं पुरम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having said these words, Partha started, following the horse which roamed at will. The sacrificial horse then turned towards the road leading to the city of Hastinapur.

data.v: तं निवृत्तं तु शुश्राव चारेणैव युधिष्ठिरः । श्रुत्वार्जुनं कुशलिनं स च हृष्टमनाभवत् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira heard from his intelligencebearers that the horse had turned back. And hearing also that Arjuna was hale and hearty, he became filled with joy.

data.v: विजयस्य च तत्कर्म गान्धारविषये तदा । श्रुत्वान्येषु च देशेषु स सुप्रीतोऽभवन्नृपः ॥
data.md: Hearing also the feats, performed by Vijaya in the country of the Gandharas as also in other kingdoms, the king became highly pleased.

data.v: एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु द्वादशीं माघपाक्षिकीम् । इष्टं गृहीत्वा नक्षत्रं धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः ॥
समानाय्य महातेजाः सर्वान्भ्रातॄन्महामनाः । भीमं च नकुलं चैव सहदेवं च कौरवः ॥
प्रोवाचेदं वचः काले तदा धर्मभृतां वरः । आमन्त्र्य वदतां श्रेष्ठो भीमं भीमपराक्रमम् ॥
आयाति भीमसेनासौ सहाश्वेन तवानुजः । यथा मे पुरुषाः प्राहुर्ये धनंजयसारिणः ॥
data.md: Your younger brother (Arjuna), O Bhimasena, is returning with the horse. I have learnt this from those men who had followed Arjuna.

data.v: उपस्थितश्च कालोऽयमभितो वर्तते हयः । माघी च पौर्णमासीयं मासः शेषो वृकोदर ॥
data.md: The time is come. The sacrificial horse is near. The day of full moon of the month of Magha is also near. The month is about to expire. O Vrikodara.

data.v: तत्प्रस्थाप्यन्तु विद्वांसो ब्राह्मणा वेदपारगाः । वाजिमेधार्थसिद्ध्यर्थं देशं पश्यन्तु यज्ञियम् ॥
data.md: Let, therefore, learned Brahmanas knowing the Vedas look for a sacrificial spot for the celebration of the Horse-Sacrifice.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तु तच्चक्रे भीमो नृपतिशासनम् । हृष्टः श्रुत्वा नरपतेरायान्तं सव्यसाचिनम् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, Bhima obeyed the royal command He became very glad upon hearing that Arjuna of curly hair was about to retum.

data.v: ततो ययौ भीमसेनः प्राज्ञैः स्थपतिभिः सह । ब्राह्मणानग्रतः कृत्वा कुशलान्यज्ञकर्मसु ॥
data.md: Then Bhimna went out with a number of men knowing the rules of laying out sacrificial grounds and constructing buildings. And he took with him many Brahmanas well-versed in all the rites of sacrifices.

data.v: तं सशालचयग्रामं संप्रतोलीविटङ्किनम् । मापयामास कौरव्यो यज्ञवाटं यथाविधि ॥
data.md: Bhima selected a beautiful place and caused it to be duły measured out for laying the sacrificial compound. Numberless houses and mansions were constructed on it and high and broad roads also were laid cut.

data.v: सदः सपत्नीसदनं साग्नीध्रमपि चोत्तरम् । कारयामास विधिवन्मणिहेमविभूषितम् ॥
स्तम्भान्कनकचित्रांश्च तोरणानि बृहन्ति च । यज्ञायतनदेशेषु दत्त्वा शुद्धं च काञ्चनम् ॥
data.md: Columns were raised, ornamented with bright gold an high and wide triumphal arches also were made on that sacrificial compound. All these were made of pure gold.

data.v: अन्तःपुराणि राज्ञां च नानादेशनिवासिनाम् । कारयामास धर्मात्मा तत्र तत्र यथाविधि ॥
data.md: The righteous-souled prince also caused apartments to be duly constructed for the accommodation of ladies and of the numerous kings who, coming from many kingdoms, were expected to grace the sacrifice with their presence.

data.v: ब्राह्मणानां च वेश्मानि नानादेशसमेयुषाम् । कारयामास भीमः स विविधानि ह्यनेकशः ॥
data.md: The son of Kunti also caused many palaces to be duty erected for Brahmanas who were expected to come from various kingdoms.

data.v: तथा संप्रेषयामास दूतान्नृपतिशासनात् । भीमसेनो महाराज राज्ञामक्लिष्टकर्मणाम् ॥
data.md: Then the mighty-armed Bhimasena, at the command of the king, sent out messengers to the great kings of the Earth.

data.v: ते प्रियार्थं कुरुपतेराययुर्नृपसत्तमाः । रत्नान्यनेकान्यादाय स्त्रियोऽश्वानायुधानि च ॥
data.md: Those best of kings came to the HorseSacrifice of the Kuru king for doing what was agreeable to him. And they brought many gems with them and many female slaves and horses and weapons.

data.v: तेषां निविशतां तेषु शिबिरेषु सहस्रशः । नर्दतः सागरस्येव शब्दो दिवमिवास्पृशत् ॥
data.md: The sounds which arose from those great kings who lived within those pavilions touched the very heavens and resembled the noise made by the roaring ocean.

data.v: तेषामभ्यागतानां स राजा राजीवलोचनः । व्यादिदेशान्नपानानि शय्याश्चाप्यतिमानुषाः ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthria, the delighter of the Kurus, assigned to the monarchs who thus came to his sacrifice various kinds of food and drink, and beds also of celestial beauty.

data.v: वाहनानां च विविधाः शालाः शालीक्षुगोरसैः । उपेताः पुरुषव्याघ्र व्यादिदेश स धर्मराट् ॥
data.md: The chief of the Bharatas, viz., king Yudhishthria the just, assigned several stables well-filled with different kinds of corn and sugar-cane and milk to the animals.

data.v: तथा तस्मिन्महायज्ञे धर्मराजस्य धीमतः । समाजग्मुर्मुनिगणा बहवो ब्रह्मवादिनः ॥
data.md: To that great sacrifice of king Yudhishthira the just who was gifted with high intelligence, there also came a large number of ascetics all of whom were utterers of Brahma.

data.v: ये च द्विजातिप्रवरास्तत्रासन्पृथिवीपते । समाजग्मुः सशिष्यांस्तान्प्रतिजग्राह कौरवः ॥
data.md: Indeed, O king, all the foremost ones among the twice born class that were then alive, came to that sacrifice, accompanied by their disciples. The Kuru king received them all.

data.v: सर्वांश्च ताननुययौ यावदावसथादिति । स्वयमेव महातेजा दम्भं त्यक्त्वा युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira of great energy, renouncing all pride, himself followed all his guests to the pavilions that had been assigned for this residence.

data.v: ततः कृत्वा स्थपतयः शिल्पिनोऽन्ये च ये तदा । कृत्स्नं यज्ञविधिं राजन्धर्मराज्ञे न्यवेदयन् ॥
data.md: Then all the mechanics and engineers, having completed the arrangements of the sacrifice, informed king Yudhishthira of it.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा धर्मराजः स कृतं सर्वमनिन्दितम् । हृष्टरूपोऽभवद्राजा सह भ्रातृभिरच्युतः ॥
data.md: Hearing that everything was ready, king Yudhishthira the just, full of alertness and attention, became highly pleased along with his brothers all of whom honoured him duly.

data.v: तस्मिन्यज्ञे प्रवृत्ते तु वाग्मिनो हेतुवादिनः । हेतुवादान्बहून्प्राहुः परस्परजिगीषवः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said When the great sacrifice of Yudhishthira began, many eloquent dialecticians started diverse propositions and disputed thereon, desirous of defeating one another.

data.v: ददृशुस्तं नृपतयो यज्ञस्य विधिमुत्तमम् । देवेन्द्रस्येव विहितं भीमेन कुरुनन्दन ॥
data.md: The (invited) kings saw the excellent preparations of that sacrifice, resembling those of the king himself of the celestials, made, O Bharata, by Bhimasena.

data.v: ददृशुस्तोरणान्यत्र शातकुम्भमयानि ते । शय्यासनविहारांश्च सुबहून्रत्नभूषितान् ॥
data.md: They saw many triumphal arches made of gold, and many beds and seats and other articles of enjoyment and luxury, and crowds of men collected at different parts.

data.v: घटान्पात्रीः कटाहानि कलशान्वर्धमानकान् । न हि किंचिदसौवर्णमपश्यंस्तत्र पार्थिवाः ॥
data.md: There were also many jars and vessels and cauldrons and jugs and lids and covers. The invited kings saw nothing there that was not made of gold.

data.v: यूपांश्च शास्त्रपठितान्दारवान्हेमभूषितान् । उपकॢप्तान्यथाकालं विधिवद्भूरिवर्चसः ॥
data.md: Many sacrificial stakes also were set up, made, according to he directions of the scriptures, of wood, and adorned with gold. Gifted with great effulgence, these were duly planted and dedicated (with (with scriptural Mantras).

data.v: स्थलजा जलजा ये च पशवः केचन प्रभो । सर्वानेव समानीतांस्तानपश्यन्त ते नृपाः ॥
data.md: The kings, again, saw all animals of land and water, collected there on the occasion.

data.v: गाश्चैव महिषीश्चैव तथा वृद्धाः स्त्रियोऽपि च । औदकानि च सत्त्वानि श्वापदानि वयांसि च ॥
data.md: And they also saw many kine and many buffaloes and many old women, and many aquatic animals, many beasts of prey, and many species of birds, and many specimens of viviparous and oviparous creatures, and many that are fifth-born, and many belonging to the vegetable kingdom and many-animals and plants which live or grow on mountains.

data.v: जरायुजान्यण्डजानि स्वेदजान्युद्भिदानि च । पर्वतानूपवन्यानि भूतानि ददृशुश्च ते ॥
एवं प्रमुदितं सर्वं पशुगोधनधान्यतः । यज्ञवाटं नृपा दृष्ट्वा परं विस्मयमागमन् । ब्राह्मणानां विशां चैव बहुमृष्टान्नमृद्धिमत् ॥
data.md: Seeing the sacrificial compound thus adorned with animals and kine and corn, the invited kings became filled with wonder.

data.v: पूर्णे शतसहस्रे तु विप्राणां तत्र भुञ्जताम् । दुन्दुभिर्मेघनिर्घोषो मुहुर्मुहुरताड्यत ॥
विननादासकृत्सोऽथ दिवसे दिवसे तदा । एवं स ववृते यज्ञो धर्मराजस्य धीमतः ॥
अन्नस्य बहवो राजन्नुत्सर्गाः पर्वतोपमाः । दधिकुल्याश्च ददृशुः सर्पिषश्च ह्रदाञ्जनाः ॥
जम्बूद्वीपो हि सकलो नानाजनपदायुतः । राजन्नदृश्यतैकस्थो राज्ञस्तस्मिन्महाक्रतौ ॥
तत्र जातिसहस्राणि पुरुषाणां ततस्ततः । गृहीत्वा धनमाजग्मुर्बहूनि भरतर्षभ ॥
राजानः स्रग्विणश्चापि सुमृष्टमणिकुण्डलाः । पर्यवेषन्द्विजाग्र्यांस्ताञ्शतशोऽथ सहस्रशः ॥
विविधान्यन्नपानानि पुरुषा येऽनुयायिनः । तेषां नृपोपभोज्यानि ब्राह्मणेभ्यो ददुः स्म ते ॥
data.md: The attendants of the Pandavas gave away to the Brahmanas various kinds of food and drink which were, besides, so costly as to be worthy of being eaten and drunk by kings themselves.

data.v: समागतान्वेदविदो राज्ञश्च पृथिवीश्वरान् । दृष्ट्वा युधिष्ठिरो राजा भीमसेनमथाब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Seeing those kings-lords of Earth-all conversant with the Vedas, arrive, king Yudhishthira, addressing Bhimasena, said, O chief of men, let proper honors be paid to these kings who have come, for these foremost of men are all worthy of the highest honors.

data.v: उपयाता नरव्याघ्रा य इमे जगदीश्वराः । एतेषां क्रियतां पूजा पूजार्हा हि नरेश्वराः ॥
इत्युक्तः स तथा चक्रे नरेन्द्रेण यशस्विना । भीमसेनो महातेजा यमाभ्यां सह भारत ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by the illustrious king Yudhishthira, Pandu's son Bhiinasena of mighty energy did as he was ordered, assisted by the twins.

data.v: अथाभ्यगच्छद्गोविन्दो वृष्णिभिः सह धर्मजम् । बलदेवं पुरस्कृत्य सर्वप्राणभृतां वरः ॥
data.md: The foremost of all men, viz., Govinda, came there, accompanied by the Vrishnis, and with Baladeva in the van.

data.v: युयुधानेन सहितः प्रद्युम्नेन गदेन च । निशठेनाथ साम्बेन तथैव कृतवर्मणा ॥
data.md: He was accompanied by Yuyudhana and Pradyumna and Goda, and Nishatha and Shamba and Kritavarman.

data.v: तेषामपि परां पूजां चक्रे भीमो महाभुजः । विविशुस्ते च वेश्मानि रत्नवन्ति नरर्षभाः ॥
data.md: The powerful car-warrior Bhima offered them the most respectful adoration. Those princes then entered the palaces, adorned with gems, which were assigned to them.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरसमीपे तु कथान्ते मधुसूदनः । अर्जुनं कथयामास बहुसंग्रामकर्शितम् ॥
data.md: At the end of a conversation he ad with Yudhishthira, the destroyer of Madhu referred to Arjuna who had been emaciated on account of many fights.

data.v: स तं पप्रच्छ कौन्तेयः पुनः पुनररिंदमम् । धर्मराड्भ्रातरं जिष्णुं समाचष्ट जगत्पतिः ॥
data.md: The son of Kunti repeatedly asked Krishna, that chastiser of enemies, about Arjuna. To Dharma's son, the lord of all the universe began to speak about Jishnu, the son of Shakra.

data.v: आगमद्द्वारकावासी ममाप्तः पुरुषो नृप । योऽद्राक्षीत्पाण्डवश्रेष्ठं बहुसंग्रामकर्शितम् ॥
data.md: O king, a confidential agent of mine living in Dwarka came to me. He had seen Arjuna, that foremost of Pandu's sons. Indeed, the latter has been very much emaciated with the fatigue of many battles,

data.v: समीपे च महाबाहुमाचष्ट च मम प्रभो । कुरु कार्याणि कौन्तेय हयमेधार्थसिद्धये ॥
data.md: powerful monarch, that agent of mine inforned me that the mighty-armed hero is very near to us. You begin to celebrate your Horse-Sacrifice.

data.v: इत्युक्तः प्रत्युवाचैनं धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः । दिष्ट्या स कुशली जिष्णुरुपयाति च माधव ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, king Yudhishthira the just said him, By good luck, O Madhava, Arjuna comes back safely!

data.v: तव यत्संदिदेशासौ पाण्डवानां बलाग्रणीः । तदाख्यातुमिहेच्छामि भवता यदुनन्दन ॥
data.md: I wish to ascertain from you, O delighter of the Yadavas, what has been said in this matter by that mightiest of heroes amongs the sons of Pandu!

data.v: इत्युक्ते राजशार्दूल वृष्ण्यन्धकपतिस्तदा । प्रोवाचेदं वचो वाग्मी धर्मात्मानं युधिष्ठिरम् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by king Yudhishthira the just, the lord of the Vrishnis and the Andhakas, that foremost of eloquent men, said these words to that inonarch of righteous soul, My agent, reported the words of Partha thus to me, O great king, Yudhishthira, O Krishna, should be told these words of mine when the time comes!

data.v: इदमाह महाराज पार्थवाक्यं नरः स माम् । वाच्यो युधिष्ठिरः कृष्ण काले वाक्यमिदं मम ॥
आगमिष्यन्ति राजानः सर्वतः कौरवान्प्रति । तेषामेकैकशः पूजा कार्येत्येतत्क्षमं हि नः ॥
data.md: O chief of the Kauravas, many kings will come (to your sacrifice)! When they arrive, high honours should be paid to them. This would, indeed, be worthy for us.

data.v: इत्येतद्वचनाद्राजा विज्ञाप्यो मम मानद । न तदात्ययिकं हि स्याद्यदर्घ्यानयने भवेत् ॥
कर्तुमर्हति तद्राजा भवांश्चाप्यनुमन्यताम् । राजद्वेषाद्विनश्येयुर्नेमा राजन्प्रजाः पुनः ॥
इदमन्यच्च कौन्तेय वचः स पुरुषोऽब्रवीत् । धनंजयस्य नृपते तन्मे निगदतः शृणु ॥
data.md: My man further reported, o king, these words of Dhananjaya, Listen as I repeat them.

data.v: उपयास्यति यज्ञं नो मणिपूरपतिर्नृपः । पुत्रो मम महातेजा दयितो बभ्रुवाहनः ॥
data.md: O monarch, the king of Manipura, my dear son Babhruvahana, will come at the sacrifice.

data.v: तं भवान्मदपेक्षार्थं विधिवत्प्रतिपूजयेत् । स हि भक्तोऽनुरक्तश्च मम नित्यमिति प्रभो ॥
data.md: Do you honour him duly for my sake, O powerful one, he is always attached and deeply devoted to me.

data.v: इत्येतद्वचनं श्रुत्वा धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः । अभिनन्द्यास्य तद्वाक्यमिदं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Hearing these words, king Yudhishthira the just approved of them and said as follows.

data.v: श्रुतं प्रियमिदं कृष्ण यत्त्वमर्हसि भाषितुम् । तन्मेऽमृतरसप्रख्यं मनो ह्लादयते विभो ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said I have heard, O Krishna, your agreeable words, They are worthy of you. Gladsome and sweet as nectar are they. Indeed, they fill my heart with great joy, O powerful one.

data.v: बहूनि किल युद्धानि विजयस्य नराधिपैः । पुनरासन्हृषीकेश तत्र तत्रेति मे श्रुतम् ॥
data.md: O Hrishikesha, I have heard that Vijaya has fought numberless battles with the kings of the Earth.

data.v: मन्निमित्तं हि स सदा पार्थः सुखविवर्जितः । अतीव विजयो धीमानिति मे दूयते मनः ॥
data.md: Why is Partha, always dissociated from ease and comfort? Vijaya is exceedingly intelligent. This, therefore, pains my heart very much.

data.v: संचिन्तयामि वार्ष्णेय सदा कुन्तीसुतं रहः । किं नु तस्य शरीरेऽस्ति सर्वलक्षणपूजिते । अनिष्टं लक्षणं कृष्ण येन दुःखान्युपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: His body has every auspicious mark. What, however, O Krishna, is that sign in his excellent body for which he has always to suffer misery and discomfort?

data.v: अतीव दुःखभागी स सततं कुन्तिनन्दनः । न च पश्यामि बीभत्सोर्निन्द्यं गात्रेषु किंचन । श्रोतव्यं चेन्मयैतद्वै तन्मे व्याख्यातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: That son of Kunti has to bear a large share of misery. I do not see any censurable mark in his body. You should explain the cause to me if I deserve to hear it.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स हृषीकेशो ध्यात्वा सुमहदन्तरम् । राजानं भोजराजन्यवर्धनो विष्णुरब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, Hrishikesha, that enhancer of the glory of the Bhoja princes, having thought for long time, answered as follows:-I do not see any censurable mark in this prince, except that the cheek-bones of this foremost of men are a little too high.

data.v: न ह्यस्य नृपते किंचिदनिष्टमुपलक्षये । ऋते पुरुषसिंहस्य पिण्डिकेऽस्यातिकायतः ॥
ताभ्यां स पुरुषव्याघ्रो नित्यमध्वसु युज्यते । न ह्यन्यदनुपश्यामि येनासौ दुःखभाग्जयः ॥
data.md: For this that that foremost of men has always to be on the road. I really do not sce anything else for which he could be made so unhappy.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स कुरुश्रेष्ठस्तथ्यं कृष्णेन धीमता । प्रोवाच वृष्णिशार्दूलमेवमेतदिति प्रभो ॥
data.md: Thus answered by the intelligent Krishna, that foremost of men, viz., kings, Yudhishthira, said to the chief of the Vrishnis that it was even SO.

data.v: कृष्णा तु द्रौपदी कृष्णं तिर्यक्सासूयमैक्षत । प्रतिजग्राह तस्यास्तं प्रणयं चापि केशिहा । सख्युः सखा हृषीकेशः साक्षादिव धनंजयः ॥
data.md: The princess Draupadi, however, looked angrily and askance at Krishna. The destroyer of Keshi, viz., Hrishikesha, approved of that mark of love (for his friend) which the princess of Panchala, who also was his friend, showed.

data.v: तत्र भीमादयस्ते तु कुरवो यादवास्तथा । रेमुः श्रुत्वा विचित्रार्था धनंजयकथा विभो ॥
data.md: Bhimasena and the other Kurus, including the sacrificial priests, who heard of the agrecable triumphs of Arjuna in course of his following the horse, became highly pleased.

data.v: तथा कथयतामेव तेषामर्जुनसंकथाः । उपायाद्वचनान्मर्त्यो विजयस्य महात्मनः ॥
data.md: While they were still engaged in talking about Arjuna a messenger came from that great hero bearing message from him.

data.v: सोऽभिगम्य कुरुश्रेष्ठं नमस्कृत्य च बुद्धिमान् । उपायातं नरव्याघ्रमर्जुनं प्रत्यवेदयत् ॥
data.md: Going to the presence of the Kuru king, the intelligent messenger bowed his head in respect and informed him of the arrival of that foremost of men, viz., Phalguna.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा नृपतिस्तस्य हर्षबाष्पाकुलेक्षणः । प्रियाख्याननिमित्तं वै ददौ बहु धनं तदा ॥
data.md: On receipt of this news, tears of joy covered the king's eyes. Large gifts were made to the messenger for the very sweet tidings he had brought.

data.v: ततो द्वितीये दिवसे महाञ्शब्दो व्यवर्धत । आयाति पुरुषव्याघ्रे पाण्डवानां धुरंधरे ॥
data.md: On the second day forin that date, a loud din was heard when that foremost of men, tha chief of the Kurus camc.

data.v: ततो रेणुः समुद्भूतो विबभौ तस्य वाजिनः । अभितो वर्तमानस्य यथोच्चैःश्रवसस्तथा ॥
data.md: as The dust raised by the hoofs of that horse as it walked close to Arjuna, looked as beautiful that raised by the celestial horse Uchchaishravas.

data.v: तत्र हर्षकला वाचो नराणां शुश्रुवेऽर्जुनः । दिष्ट्यासि पार्थ कुशली धन्यो राजा युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: And as Arjuna advanced, he heard many pleasing words uttered by the citizens. By good luck, O Partha, you are out of danger. Praise to king Yudhishthira.

data.v: कोऽन्यो हि पृथिवीं कृत्स्नामवजित्य सपार्थिवाम् । चारयित्वा हयश्रेष्ठमुपायायादृतेऽर्जुनम् ॥
data.md: Who else than Arjuna could return after having caused the horse to wander over the whole Earth and after having defeated all the kings in battle?

data.v: ये व्यतीता महात्मानो राजानः सगरादयः । तेषामपीदृशं कर्म न किंचिदनुशुश्रुम ॥
data.md: We have not heard of such a feat having been done by even Sagara and other great kings of yore.

data.v: नैतदन्ये करिष्यन्ति भविष्याः पृथिवीक्षितः । यत्त्वं कुरुकुलश्रेष्ठ दुष्करं कृतवानिह ॥
data.md: Future kings also will never be able to perform so difficult a feat. O foremost one of Kuru's race, as this which you have done.

data.v: इत्येवं वदतां तेषां नॄणां श्रुतिसुखा गिरः । शृण्वन्विवेश धर्मात्मा फल्गुनो यज्ञसंस्तरम् ॥
data.md: Listening to such words, agrecable to the ear, of the citizens, the righteous souled Phalguna entered the sacrificial compound.

data.v: ततो राजा सहामात्यः कृष्णश्च यदुनन्दनः । धृतराष्ट्रं पुरस्कृत्य ते तं प्रत्युद्ययुस्तदा ॥
data.md: Then king Yudhishthira with all his ministers, and Krishna, the delighter of the Yadus, placing Dhritarashtra in their van, went out for receiving Dhananjaya.

data.v: सोऽभिवाद्य पितुः पादौ धर्मराजस्य धीमतः । भीमादींश्चापि संपूज्य पर्यष्वजत केशवम् ॥
data.md: Saluting the feet of his uncle (Dhritarashtra), and then of wise king Yudhishthira the just, and then adoring Bhima and others, he embraced Keshava.

data.v: तैः समेत्यार्चितस्तान्स प्रत्यर्च्य च यथाविधि । विशश्रामाथ धर्मात्मा तीरं लब्ध्वेव पारगः ॥
एतस्मिन्नेव काले तु स राजा बभ्रुवाहनः । मातृभ्यां सहितो धीमान्कुरूनभ्याजगाम ह ॥
स समेत्य कुरून्सर्वान्सर्वैस्तैरभिनन्दितः । प्रविवेश पितामह्याः कुन्त्या भवनमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: The mighty-armed prince duly saluted all his elders of Kuru's race and the other kings present there, and was honored by them all in return, He then entered the excellent abode of his grandmother Kunti.

data.v: स प्रविश्य यथान्यायं पाण्डवानां निवेशनम् । पितामहीमभ्यवदत्साम्ना परमवल्गुना ॥
data.md: Entering the palace of the Pandavas the mighty-armed prince saluted his grandmother in soothing and sweet words.

data.v: तथा चित्राङ्गदा देवी कौरव्यस्यात्मजापि च । पृथां कृष्णां च सहिते विनयेनाभिजग्मतुः । सुभद्रां च यथान्यायं याश्चान्याः कुरुयोषितः ॥
data.md: Then queen Chitrangada, and (Ulupi) the daughter of (the snake) Kauravya, together humbly approached Pritha and Krishna. They then met Subhadra and the other ladies of the Kuru race with due formalities.

data.v: ददौ कुन्ती ततस्ताभ्यां रत्नानि विविधानि च । द्रौपदी च सुभद्रा च याश्चाप्यन्या ददुः स्त्रियः ॥
data.md: Kunti gave them many gems and costly things. Draupadi and Subha 'ra and the other ladies of Kuru's race all made presents to them.

data.v: ऊषतुस्तत्र ते देव्यौ महार्हशयनासने । सुपूजिते स्वयं कुन्त्या पार्थस्य प्रियकाम्यया ॥
data.md: The two ladies took up their residence there, using costly beds and seats, treated with affection and honor by Kunti herself from desire of doing what was agreeable to Partha.

data.v: स च राजा महावीर्यः पूजितो बभ्रुवाहनः । धृतराष्ट्रं महीपालमुपतस्थे यथाविधि ॥
data.md: King Babhruvahana of great energy, duly honored (by Kunti), then inet Dhritarashtra according to due rites.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरं च राजानं भीमादींश्चापि पाण्डवान् । उपगम्य महातेजा विनयेनाभ्यवादयत् ॥
data.md: Going then to king Yudhishthira and Bhima and the other Pandavas the mighty prince of Munipura saluted them all with humility.

data.v: स तैः प्रेम्णा परिष्वक्तः पूजितश्च यथाविधि । धनं चास्मै ददुर्भूरि प्रीयमाणा महारथाः ॥
data.md: They all embraced him with great love and honored him duly. And those powerful carwarrior highly pleased with him, made large gifted of wealth to him.

data.v: तथैव स महीपालः कृष्णं चक्रगदाधरम् । प्रद्युम्न इव गोविन्दं विनयेनोपतस्थिवान् ॥
data.md: The king of Manipura then humbly approached Krishna, that hero armed with the discus and the mace, like a second Pradyumna approaching his father. Krishna gave to the king a very costly and excellent car adorned with gold and to which were yoked excellent horses.

data.v: तस्मै कृष्णो ददौ राज्ञे महार्हमभिपूजितम् । रथं हेमपरिष्कारं दिव्याश्वयुजमुत्तमम् ॥
धर्मराजश्च भीमश्च यमजौ फल्गुनस्तथा । पृथक्पृथगतीवैनं मानार्हं समपूजयन् ॥
ततस्तृतीये दिवसे सत्यवत्याः सुतो मुनिः । युधिष्ठिरं समभ्येत्य वाग्मी वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
अद्य प्रभृति कौन्तेय यजस्व समयो हि ते । मुहूर्तो यज्ञियः प्राप्तश्चोदयन्ति च याजकाः ॥
अहीनो नाम राजेन्द्र क्रतुस्तेऽयं विकल्पवान् । बहुत्वात्काञ्चनस्यास्य ख्यातो बहुसुवर्णकः ॥
data.md: Let the sacrifice be performed in such a way that no limb may become defective. On account of the very large quantity of gold that is required for this sacrifice, it has come to be called the sacrifice of profuse gold.

data.v: एवमेव महाराज दक्षिणां त्रिगुणां कुरु । त्रित्वं व्रजतु ते राजन्ब्राह्मणा ह्यत्र कारणम् ॥
data.md: Do you also, O great king, make the Dakshina of this sacrifice three times of what is enjoined. Let the merit of your sacrifice increase threefold. The Brahimanas competent for the purpose.

data.v: त्रीनश्वमेधानत्र त्वं संप्राप्य बहुदक्षिणान् । ज्ञातिवध्याकृतं पापं प्रहास्यसि नराधिप ॥
data.md: Acquiring the merits then of three HorseSacrifices, each with profuse presents, you shall be freed, O king, from the sin of having killed your kinsmen.

data.v: पवित्रं परमं ह्येतत्पावनानां च पावनम् । यदश्वमेधावभृथं प्राप्स्यसे कुरुनन्दन ॥
data.md: The bath which one performs upon completion of the Horse-Sacrifice, O king, is highly powerful and productive of the highest merit. That merit will be yours, O king of Kuru's race. are

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तु तेजस्वी व्यासेनामिततेजसा । दीक्षां विवेश धर्मात्मा वाजिमेधाप्तये तदा । नराधिपः प्रायजत वाजिमेधं महाक्रतुम् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by Vyasa of incomparable intelligence, the righteous-souled Yudhishthria of great energy underwent the initiation for performance of the Horse-Sacrifice.

data.v: तत्र वेदविदो राजंश्चक्रुः कर्माणि याजकाः । परिक्रमन्तः शास्त्रज्ञा विधिवत्साधुशिक्षिताः ॥
data.md: The priests, well-conversant with the Vedas, did every rite, duly, moving about in all directions. They were all well-trained, and possessed of omniscience.

data.v: न तेषां स्खलितं तत्र नासीदपहुतं तथा । क्रमयुक्तं च युक्तं च चक्रुस्तत्र द्विजर्षभाः ॥
data.md: In nothing was there any deviation from the ordinances, and nothing was done improperly. Those foremost of twice-born persons followed the procedure as laid down as it should be followed in those points about which no directions are given.

data.v: कृत्वा प्रवर्ग्यं धर्मज्ञा यथावद्द्विजसत्तमाः । चक्रुस्ते विधिवद्राजंस्तथैवाभिषवं द्विजाः ॥
data.md: Thosc best of twice-born ones, having first performed the rite called Pravargya otherwise called Dharma, then duly performed the rite of Abhishva, O king.

data.v: अभिषूय ततो राजन्सोमं सोमपसत्तमाः । सवनान्यानुपूर्व्येण चक्रुः शास्त्रानुसारिणः ॥
data.md: Those foremost of Soma-Drinkers, O monarch, extracting the juice of the Soma, then performed the Savana rite, following the injunctions of the scriptures.

data.v: न तत्र कृपणः कश्चिन्न दरिद्रो बभूव ह । क्षुधितो दुःखितो वापि प्राकृतो वापि मानवः ॥
data.md: Among those who came to that sacrifice none could be seen who was cheerless, none who was poor, none who was hungry, none who was plunged into grief, and none that seemed to be vulgar.

data.v: भोजनं भोजनार्थिभ्यो दापयामास नित्यदा । भीमसेनो महातेजाः सततं राजशासनात् ॥
data.md: Bhimasena of great energy, at the command of the king, caused food to be ceaselessly distributed among those who desired to eat.

data.v: संस्तरे कुशलाश्चापि सर्वकर्माणि याजकाः । दिवसे दिवसे चक्रुर्यथाशास्त्रार्थचक्षुषः ॥
data.md: Following the injunctions of the scriptures, priests, well-versed in sacrificial rites of every kind, performed every day all the acts necessary to complete the great sacrifice.

data.v: नाषडङ्गविदत्रासीत्सदस्यस्तस्य धीमतः । नाव्रतो नानुपाध्यायो न च वादाक्षमो द्विजः ॥
