data.md: Amongst the Sadasyas of king Yudhishthira of great intelligence there was none who was not a master of the six branches of (Vedic) learning. There was none among them who was not an otserver of vows, none who was not an Upadhaya; none, who was not wellversed in dialectical disputations.

data.v: ततो यूपोच्छ्रये प्राप्ते षड्बैल्वान्भरतर्षभ । खादिरान्बिल्वसमितांस्तावतः सर्ववर्णिनः ॥
data.md: When the time came for erccting the sacrificial stake, O chief of Bharata's race, six stakes were set up which were made of Bilva, six which were made of Khadira, and six which were made of Sarvavarnin.

data.v: देवदारुमयौ द्वौ तु यूपौ कुरुपतेः क्रतौ । श्लेष्मातकमयं चैकं याजकाः समकारयन् ॥
data.md: Two stakes were set up by the priest which were made of Devadaru in that sacrifice of the Kuru king, and one which was made of Shleshmataka.

data.v: शोभार्थं चापरान्यूपान्काञ्चनान्पुरुषर्षभ । स भीमः कारयामास धर्मराजस्य शासनात् ॥
data.md: At the bchest of the king, Bhima caused some other stakes to be set up, for the sake of beauty only which were made of goid.

data.v: ते व्यराजन्त राजर्षे वासोभिरुपशोभिताः । नरेन्द्राभिगता देवान्यथा सप्तर्षयो दिवि ॥
data.md: Adorned with fine cloths supplied by the royal sage, those stakes shone there like Indra and the deities with the seven celestial Rishis standing around them in Heaven.

data.v: इष्टकाः काञ्चनीश्चात्र चयनार्थं कृताभवन् । शुशुभे चयनं तत्र दक्षस्येव प्रजापतेः ॥
data.md: A number of golden bricks were made for making therewith a Chayana. The Chayana made resembled in beauty that which had been made for Daksha, the lord of creatures.

data.v: चतुश्चित्यः स तस्यासीदष्टादशकरात्मकः । स रुक्मपक्षो निचितस्त्रिगुणो गरुडाकृतिः ॥
data.md: The Chayana measured eight and ten cubits and had four stories or lairs. A golden bird, of the shape of Garuda, was then made, having three angles.

data.v: ततो नियुक्ताः पशवो यथाशास्त्रं मनीषिभिः । तं तं देवं समुद्दिश्य पक्षिणः पशवश्च ये ॥
data.md: Following the injunctions of the scriptures, the priests endued with great learning then duly tied to the stakes both animals and birds, assigning each to its particular deity.

data.v: ऋषभाः शास्त्रपठितास्तथा जलचराश्च ये । सर्वांस्तानभ्ययुञ्जंस्ते तत्राग्निचयकर्मणि ॥
data.md: Bulls, possessed of such marks as are mentioned in the scriptures, and aquatic animals were properly tied to the stakes after the rites of the sacrificial fire had been performed.

data.v: यूपेषु नियतं चासीत्पशूनां त्रिशतं तथा । अश्वरत्नोत्तरं राज्ञः कौन्तेयस्य महात्मनः ॥
data.md: In that sacrifice of the great son of Kunti, three hundred animals were tied to the stakes set up, including that foremost of horses.

data.v: स यज्ञः शुशुभे तस्य साक्षाद्देवर्षिसंकुलः । गन्धर्वगणसंकीर्णः शोभितोऽप्सरसां गणैः ॥
data.md: That sacrifice looked greatly beautiful as if adorned with the celestial Rishis, with the Gandharvas singing in chorus and the various tribes of Apsaras dancing in merriment.

data.v: स किंपुरुषगीतैश्च किंनरैरुपशोभितः । सिद्धविप्रनिवासैश्च समन्तादभिसंवृतः ॥
data.md: It teemed, besides, with Kimpurushas and was adorned with Kinnaras. All around it were houses of Brahinanas crowned with ascetic success.

data.v: तस्मिन्सदसि नित्यास्तु व्यासशिष्या द्विजोत्तमाः । सर्वशास्त्रप्रणेतारः कुशला यज्ञकर्मसु ॥
data.md: There were daily seen the disciples of Vyasa, those foremost of twice-born ones, who are compilers of all branches of learning, and well conversant with sacrificial rites.

data.v: नारदश्च बभूवात्र तुम्बुरुश्च महाद्युतिः । विश्वावसुश्चित्रसेनस्तथान्ये गीतकोविदाः ॥
data.md: There was Narada, and there was Tunburu of great splendour. There were Vishvavasu and Chitrasena and others, all of whom were proficient in music.

data.v: गन्धर्वा गीतकुशला नृत्तेषु च विशारदाः । रमयन्ति स्म तान्विप्रान्यज्ञकर्मान्तरेष्वथ ॥
data.md: At intervals of the sacrificial rites, those Gandharvas skilled in music and well-versed in dancing, used to please the Brahmanas who were engaged in the sacrifice.

data.v: शमयित्वा पशूनन्यान्विधिवद्द्विजसत्तमाः । तुरगं तं यथाशास्त्रमालभन्त द्विजातयः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having cooked, according to due rites, the other excellent animals which were sacrificed, the priests then sacrificed, according to the injunctions of the scriptures, that horse (which had wandered over the whole world).

data.v: ततः संज्ञाप्य तुरगं विधिवद्याजकर्षभाः । उपसंवेशयन्राजंस्ततस्तां द्रुपदात्मजाम् । कलाभिस्तिसृभी राजन्यथाविधि मनस्विनीम् ॥
data.md: After cutting that horse into pieces, according to scriptural directions, they caused Draupadi of great intelligence, who was possessed of the three requisites of Mantras, things, and devotion, to sit near the divided animal.

data.v: उद्धृत्य तु वपां तस्य यथाशास्त्रं द्विजर्षभाः । श्रपयामासुरव्यग्राः शास्त्रवद्भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: The Brahmanas then, with cool minds, taking up the marrow of that horse, cooked it duly, O chief of Bharata's race.

data.v: तं वपाधूमगन्धं तु धर्मराजः सहानुजः । उपाजिघ्रद्यथान्यायं सर्वपाप्मापहं तदा ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira the just, with all his younger brothers, then smelled, according to the scriptures, the smoke, capable of purging one from every sin, of the marrow that was thus cooked.

data.v: शिष्टान्यङ्गानि यान्यासंस्तस्याश्वस्य नराधिप । तान्यग्नौ जुहुवुर्धीराः समस्ताः षोडशर्त्विजः ॥
data.md: The remaining limbs, O king, of that horse, were poured into the fire by the sixteen sacrificial priests possessed of great wisdom.

data.v: संस्थाप्यैवं तस्य राज्ञस्तं क्रतुं शक्रतेजसः । व्यासः सशिष्यो भगवान्वर्धयामास तं नृपम् ॥
data.md: Having thus completed the sacrifice of that monarch who was gifted with the energy of Shakra himself, the illustrious Vyasa with his disciples eulogised the king greatly.

data.v: ततो युधिष्ठिरः प्रादात्सदस्येभ्यो यथाविधि । कोटीसहस्रं निष्काणां व्यासाय तु वसुंधराम् ॥
data.md: Then Yudhishthira gave away to the Brahmanas a thousand crores of golden nishkas, and to Vyasa he gave away the whole Earth.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य धरां राजन्व्यासः सत्यवतीसुतः । अब्रवीद्भरतश्रेष्ठं धर्मात्मानं युधिष्ठिरम् ॥
पृथिवी भवतस्त्वेषा संन्यस्ता राजसत्तम । निष्क्रयो दीयतां मह्यं ब्राह्मणा हि धनार्थिनः ॥
data.md: Satyavati's son Vyasa, having accepted the Earth, addressed that foremost one of Bharata's race, viz., king Yudhishthira the just, and said, O best of kings, the Earth which you have given me I return to you! Do you give me the purchasing value, for Brahmanas are desirous of wealth.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्तु तान्विप्रान्प्रत्युवाच महामनाः । भ्रातृभिः सहितो धीमान्मध्ये राज्ञां महात्मनाम् ॥
data.md: The great Yudhishthria of great intelligence staying with his brothers in the midst of the kings invited to his sacrifice, said to those Brahmanas:

data.v: अश्वमेधे महायज्ञे पृथिवी दक्षिणा स्मृता । अर्जुनेन जिता सेयमृत्विग्भ्यः प्रापिता मया ॥
data.md: The Dakshina ordained in the scriptures for the great Horse-Sacrifice is the Earth, Hence, I have given away to the sacrificial priests the Earth conquered by Arjuna.

data.v: वनं प्रवेक्ष्ये विप्रेन्द्रा विभजध्वं महीमिमाम् । चतुर्धा पृथिवीं कृत्वा चातुर्होत्रप्रमाणतः ॥
data.md: You foremost of Brahmanas, I shall enter the forest. Do you divide the Earth among yourselves! Indeed, do you divide the Earth into four parts according to what is done in the Chaturhotra-Sacrifice.

data.v: नाहमादातुमिच्छामि ब्रह्मस्वं मुनिसत्तमाः । इदं हि मे मतं नित्यं भ्रातॄणां च ममानघाः ॥
इत्युक्तवति तस्मिंस्ते भ्रातरो द्रौपदी च सा । एवमेतदिति प्राहुस्तदभूद्रोमहर्षणम् ॥
ततोऽन्तरिक्षे वागासीत्साधु साध्विति भारत । तथैव द्विजसंघानां शंसतां विबभौ स्वनः ॥
data.md: Then, O Bharata, an invisible voice was heard in the sky, saying, 'Excellent, Excellent!' The murmurs, also, of crowd of Brahmanas as they spoke, arose.

data.v: द्वैपायनस्तथोक्तस्तु पुनरेव युधिष्ठिरम् । उवाच मध्ये विप्राणामिदं संपूजयन्मुनिः ॥
दत्तैषा भवता मह्यं तां ते प्रतिददाम्यहम् । हिरण्यं दीयतामेभ्यो द्विजातिभ्यो धरास्तु ते ॥
ततोऽब्रवीद्वासुदेवो धर्मराजं युधिष्ठिरम् । यथाह भगवान्व्यासस्तथा तत्कर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Then Vasudeva, addressing king Yudhishthira the just, said, You should do as you are ordered by the illustrious Vyasa.'

data.v: इत्युक्तः स कुरुश्रेष्ठः प्रीतात्मा भ्रातृभिः सह । कोटिकोटिकृतां प्रादाद्दक्षिणां त्रिगुणां क्रतोः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, that foremost one of Kuru's race, along with all his brothers, became pleased and gave away millions of golden coins, in fact, trebling the Dakshina ordained for the Horse-Sacrifice,

data.v: न करिष्यति तल्लोके कश्चिदन्यो नराधिपः । यत्कृतं कुरुसिंहेन मरुत्तस्यानुकुर्वता ॥
data.md: No other king will be able to accomplish what the Kuru king did on that occasion like Marutta.

data.v: प्रतिगृह्य तु तद्द्रव्यं कृष्णद्वैपायनः प्रभुः । ऋत्विग्भ्यः प्रददौ विद्वांश्चतुर्धा व्यभजंश्च ते ॥
data.md: Accepting that wealth, the Island-born sage, Krishna, of great learning, gave it to the sacrificial priests, dividing it into four parts.

data.v: पृथिव्या निष्क्रयं दत्त्वा तद्धिरण्यं युधिष्ठिरः । धूतपाप्मा जितस्वर्गो मुमुदे भ्रातृभिः सह ॥
data.md: Having paid that wealth as the price of the Earth, Yudhishthira, purged of his sins and assured of Heaven, rejoiced with his brothers.

data.v: ऋत्विजस्तमपर्यन्तं सुवर्णनिचयं तदा । व्यभजन्त द्विजातिभ्यो यथोत्साहं यथाबलम् ॥
data.md: The sacrificial priests, having got that unlimited quantity of riches, distributed it among the Brahmanas gladly and according to the desire of each recipient.

data.v: यज्ञवाटे तु यत्किंचिद्धिरण्यमपि भूषणम् । तोरणानि च यूपांश्च घटाः पात्रीस्तथेष्टकाः । युधिष्ठिराभ्यनुज्ञाताः सर्वं तद्व्यभजन्द्विजाः ॥
data.md: The Brahmanas, also divided amongst themselves, according to Yudhishthira's permission, the various ornaments of gold which were in the sacrificial compound, including the triumphal arches, the stakes, the jars, and various kinds of vessels.

data.v: अनन्तरं ब्राह्मणेभ्यः क्षत्रिया जह्रिरे वसु । तथा विट्शूद्रसंघाश्च तथान्ये म्लेच्छजातयः । कालेन महता जह्रुस्तत्सुवर्णं ततस्ततः ॥
ततस्ते ब्राह्मणाः सर्वे मुदिता जग्मुरालयान् । तर्पिता वसुना तेन धर्मराज्ञा महात्मना ॥
स्वमंशं भगवान्व्यासः कुन्त्यै पादाभिवादनात् । प्रददौ तस्य महतो हिरण्यस्य महाद्युतिः ॥
श्वशुरात्प्रीतिदायं तं प्राप्य सा प्रीतमानसा । चकार पुण्यं लोके तु सुमहान्तं पृथा तदा ॥
गत्वा त्ववभृथं राजा विपाप्मा भ्रातृभिः सह । सभाज्यमानः शुशुभे महेन्द्रो दैवतैरिव ॥
पाण्डवाश्च महीपालैः समेतैः संवृतास्तदा । अशोभन्त महाराज ग्रहास्तारागणैरिव ॥
राजभ्योऽपि ततः प्रादाद्रत्नानि विविधानि च । गजानश्वानलंकारान्स्त्रियो वस्त्राणि काञ्चनम् ॥
data.md: To those kings they made presents of various jewels and gems, and elephants and horses and ornaments of gold, and female slaves and cloths and immense quantity of gold.

data.v: तद्धनौघमपर्यन्तं पार्थः पार्थिवमण्डले । विसृजञ्शुशुभे राजा यथा वैश्रवणस्तथा ॥
data.md: Indeed, Prithas son, by distributing that untold riches among the invited kings, shone, O king, like Vaishravana, the lord of riches.

data.v: आनाय्य च तथा वीरं राजानं बभ्रुवाहनम् । प्रदाय विपुलं वित्तं गृहान्प्रास्थापयत्तदा ॥
data.md: Summoning next the heroic king Babhruvahana, Yudhishthira, gave to him various kinds of wealth in profusion and gave him permission to return home.

data.v: दुःशलायाश्च तं पौत्रं बालकं पार्थिवर्षभ । स्वराज्ये पितृभिर्गुप्ते प्रीत्या समभिषेचयत् ॥
data.md: The son of Pandu, for pleasing his sister Dushala, established her infant grandson in his paternal kingdom.

data.v: राज्ञश्चैवापि तान्सर्वान्सुविभक्तान्सुपूजितान् । प्रस्थापयामास वशी कुरुराजो युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: The Kuru king Yudhishthira, having a full mastery over his senses, than dismissed the assembled kings all of whom had been properly classed and honoured by him.

data.v: एवं बभूव यज्ञः स धर्मराजस्य धीमतः । बह्वन्नधनरत्नौघः सुरामैरेयसागरः ॥
data.md: Thus was celebrated that sacrifice of king Yudhishthira the just, which was distinguished by a profusion of flood and wealth and jewels and gems, and oceans of wines of different kinds.

data.v: सर्पिःपङ्का ह्रदा यत्र बहवश्चान्नपर्वताः । रसालाकर्दमाः कुल्या बभूवुर्भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: There were lakes whose mire consisted of clarified butter and mountains of food. There were, also, O chief of Bharata's race, miry rivers made of drinks having the six kinds of taste.

data.v: भक्ष्यषाण्डवरागाणां क्रियतां भुज्यतामिति । पशूनां वध्यतां चापि नान्तस्तत्र स्म दृश्यते ॥
data.md: Of men employed in making and eating the sweetmeats called Khandavaragas, and of animals killed for food, there was no end.

data.v: मत्तोन्मत्तप्रमुदितं प्रगीतयुवतीजनम् । मृदङ्गशङ्खशब्दैश्च मनोरममभूत्तदा ॥
data.md: The vast compound was filled with men inebriated with wine, and with young ladies filled with joy. The extensive grounds constantly echocd with the sounds of drums and the blare of conchs. With all these, the sacrifice became highly delightful.

data.v: दीयतां भुज्यतां चेति दिवारात्रमवारितम् । तं महोत्सवसंकाशमतिहृष्टजनाकुलम् । कथयन्ति स्म पुरुषा नानादेशनिवासिनः ॥
data.md: 'Let agreeable things be given away,' 'Let agreeable food be eaten.' These were the sounds which were repeatedly heard day and night in that sacrifice. It was like a great festival, full of rejoicing and contented men. People of various kingdoms speak of that sacrifice to this day.

data.v: वर्षित्वा धनधाराभिः कामै रत्नैर्धनैस्तथा । विपाप्मा भरतश्रेष्ठः कृतार्थः प्राविशत्पुरम् ॥
data.md: Having showered wealth in torrents, and various objects of desire, and jewels and gems, and drinks of various kinds, the foremost one of Bharata's race, purged of all his sins, and his purpose fulfilled, entered his capital. Having showered wealth in torrents, and various objects of desire, and jewels and gems, and drinks of various kinds, the foremost one of Bharata's race, purged of all his sins, and his purpose fulfilled, entered his capital.

data.v: पितामहस्य मे यज्ञे धर्मपुत्रस्य धीमतः । यदाश्चर्यमभूत्किंचित्तद्भवान्वक्तुमर्हति ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said. You should tell me of any wonderful incident which took place in the sacrifice of my grandsire.

data.v: श्रूयतां राजशार्दूल महदाश्चर्यमुत्तमम् । अश्वमेधे महायज्ञे निवृत्ते यदभूद्विभो ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Hear, O chief of kings, of a most wonderful event which took place, O powerful monarch, at the conclusion of that great Horse-Sacrifice.

data.v: तर्पितेषु द्विजाग्र्येषु ज्ञातिसंबन्धिबन्धुषु । दीनान्धकृपणे चापि तदा भरतसत्तम ॥
घुष्यमाणे महादाने दिक्षु सर्वासु भारत । पतत्सु पुष्पवर्षेषु धर्मराजस्य मूर्धनि ॥
बिलान्निष्क्रम्य नकुलो रुक्मपार्श्वस्तदानघ । वज्राशनिसमं नादममुञ्चत विशां पते ॥
सकृदुत्सृज्य तं नादं त्रासयानो मृगद्विजान् । मानुषं वचनं प्राह धृष्टो बिलशयो महान् ॥
data.md: Repeatedly uttering such deep sounds and thereby frightening all animals and birds, that proud dweller of a hole, with large body, spoke in a human voice and said, “You kings, this great sacrifice is not equal to a prastha of powdered daily given away by a liberal Brahmana of Kurukshetra who was observing the Unchcha vow.

data.v: सक्तुप्रस्थेन वो नायं यज्ञस्तुल्यो नराधिपाः । उञ्छवृत्तेर्वदान्यस्य कुरुक्षेत्रनिवासिनः ॥
data.md: Repeatedly uttering such deep sounds and thereby frightening all animals and birds, that proud dweller of a hole, with large body, spoke in a human voice and said, “You kings, this great sacrifice is not equal to a prastha of powdered daily given away by a liberal Brahmana of Kurukshetra who was observing the Unchcha vow.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं श्रुत्वा नकुलस्य विशां पते । विस्मयं परमं जग्मुः सर्वे ते ब्राह्मणर्षभाः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of the mongoose, o king, all those foremost of Brahmanas became stricken with wonder.

data.v: ततः समेत्य नकुलं पर्यपृच्छन्त ते द्विजाः । कुतस्त्वं समनुप्राप्तो यज्ञं साधुसमागमम् ॥
data.md: Approaching the mongoose, they then asked him, saying, 'Whence have you come to this sacrifice this resort of the good and the pious?

data.v: किं बलं परमं तुभ्यं किं श्रुतं किं परायणम् । कथं भवन्तं विद्याम यो नो यज्ञं विगर्हसे ॥
data.md: What is the extent of your power? What you learning? And what your refuge? How should we know you who thus censure this our sacrifice?

data.v: अविलुप्यागमं कृत्स्नं विधिज्ञैर्याजकैः कृतम् । यथागमं यथान्यायं कर्तव्यं च यथाकृतम् ॥
data.md: Without having disregarded any portion of the scriptures, everything that should be done has been done here according to the scriptures and according to reason, with the help of various sacrificial rites.

data.v: पूजार्हाः पूजिताश्चात्र विधिवच्छास्त्रचक्षुषा । मन्त्रपूतं हुतश्चाग्निर्दत्तं देयममत्सरम् ॥
data.md: Those who are deserving of adoration, have been duly adored here according to the way pointed out by the scriptures. Libations have bcen poured on the sacred fire with the help of proper Mantras. That which should be given, has been given away without pride.

data.v: तुष्टा द्विजर्षभाश्चात्र दानैर्बहुविधैरपि । क्षत्रियाश्च सुयुद्धेन श्राद्धैरपि पितामहाः ॥
data.md: The twice-born class have been pleased with gifts of various kinds. The Kshatriyas have been pleased with battles fought according to just methods. The grandfathers have been pleased with Sharaddhas,

data.v: पालनेन विशस्तुष्टाः कामैस्तुष्टा वरस्त्रियः । अनुक्रोशैस्तथा शूद्रा दानशेषैः पृथग्जनाः ॥
data.md: The Vaishyas have been pleased by the protection offered to them, and many foremost of women have been pleased by accomplishing their desires. The Shudras have been pleased b y kind speeches, and others with the residue of the profuse wealth collected on the spot.

data.v: ज्ञातिसंबन्धिनस्तुष्टाः शौचेन च नृपस्य नः । देवा हविर्भिः पुण्यैश्च रक्षणैः शरणागताः ॥
data.md: Kinsmen and relatives have been pleased by the purity of conduct shown by our king. The celestials have been pleased by libations of clarified butter and acts of merit, and dependents and followers by protection.

data.v: यदत्र तथ्यं तद्ब्रूहि सत्यसंध द्विजातिषु । यथाश्रुतं यथादृष्टं पृष्टो ब्राह्मणकाम्यया ॥
data.md: That, therefore, which is true, do you truly declare to these Brahmanas. Indeed, do you declare what is according to the scriptures and to actual experience, asked by the Brahmanas who are eager to know.

data.v: श्रद्धेयवाक्यः प्राज्ञस्त्वं दिव्यं रूपं बिभर्षि च । समागतश्च विप्रैस्त्वं तत्त्वतो वक्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Your words are creditable. You are wise. You have have, also, a celestial form. You have come into the midst of learned Brahmanas. You should explain yourself.'

data.v: इति पृष्टो द्विजैस्तैः स प्रहस्य नकुलोऽब्रवीत् । नैषानृता मया वाणी प्रोक्ता दर्पेण वा द्विजाः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by those twice-born persons, the mungoose, siniling, answered them as follows. “You twice-born ones, the words I have uttered are not false. Neither have I spoken them from pride.

data.v: यन्मयोक्तमिदं किंचिद्युष्माभिश्चाप्युपश्रुतम् । सक्तुप्रस्थेन वो नायं यज्ञस्तुल्यो नराधिपाः । उञ्छवृत्तेर्वदान्यस्य कुरुक्षेत्रनिवासिनः ॥
data.md: Repeatedly uttering such deep sounds and thereby frightening all animals and birds, that proud dweller of a hole, with large body, spoke in a human voice and said, “You kings, this great sacrifice is not equal to a prastha of powdered daily given away by a liberal Brahmana of Kurukshetra who was observing the Unchcha vow.

data.v: इत्यवश्यं मयैतद्वो वक्तव्यं द्विजपुंगवाः । शृणुताव्यग्रमनसः शंसतो मे द्विजर्षभाः ॥
data.md: Forsooth, I should say this, O focmost of Brahmanas. Listen to me with rapt attention as I truly describe to you what took place.

data.v: अनुभूतं च दृष्टं च यन्मयाद्भुतमुत्तमम् । उञ्छवृत्तेर्यथावृत्तं कुरुक्षेत्रनिवासिनः ॥
data.md: Wonderful and excellent was the event that happened. It was seen by me and its consequences were felt by me. The incident relates to a liberal Brahmana living in Kurukshetra in the observance of the Unchcha VOW.

data.v: स्वर्गं येन द्विजः प्राप्तः सभार्यः ससुतस्नुषः । यथा चार्धं शरीरस्य ममेदं काञ्चनीकृतम् ॥
data.md: On account of that incident he attained to Heaven, O twice-born ones, along with his wife and son and daughter-in-law. And in consequence of what then took place half my body became changed into gold.

data.v: हन्त वो वर्तयिष्यामि दानस्य परमं फलम् । न्यायलब्धस्य सूक्ष्मस्य विप्रदत्तस्य यद्द्विजाः ॥
data.md: The Mungoose continued : O twice-born ones, I shall presently tell you what the excellent fruit was of the gift, made by a Brahmana, of a very little measure (of powdered barley) acquired by fair means.

data.v: धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे धर्मज्ञैर्बहुभिर्वृते । उञ्छवृत्तिर्द्विजः कश्चित्कापोतिरभवत्पुरा ॥
data.md: On that righteous spot of ground known by the name of Kurukshetra, which is the habitation of many righteous persons, there lived a Brahmana observing the Unchcha vow. That mode of living is like that of the pigeon.

data.v: सभार्यः सह पुत्रेण सस्नुषस्तपसि स्थितः । वधूचतुर्थो वृद्धः स धर्मात्मा नियतेन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: He lived there with his wife and son and daughter-in-law and practiced penances. Of righteous soul and with senses completely controlled, he adopted the mode of living which is followed by a parrot.

data.v: षष्ठे काले तदा विप्रो भुङ्क्ते तैः सह सुव्रतः । षष्ठे काले कदाचिच्च तस्याहारो न विद्यते । भुङ्क्तेऽन्यस्मिन्कदाचित्स षष्ठे काले द्विजोत्तमः ॥
कपोतधर्मिणस्तस्य दुर्भिक्षे सति दारुणे । नाविद्यत तदा विप्राः संचयस्तान्निबोधत । क्षीणौषधिसमावायो द्रव्यहीनोऽभवत्तदा ॥
काले कालेऽस्य संप्राप्ते नैव विद्येत भोजनम् । क्षुधापरिगताः सर्वे प्रातिष्ठन्त तदा तु ते ॥
data.md: When the habitual hours came for eating, the Brahmana had nothing to eat. This happened day after day. All the members of his family were stricken with hunger but were obliged to pass the days as best they could.

data.v: उञ्छंस्तदा शुक्लपक्षे मध्यं तपति भास्करे । उष्णार्तश्च क्षुधार्तश्च स विप्रस्तपसि स्थितः । उञ्छमप्राप्तवानेव सार्धं परिजनेन ह ॥
data.md: One day, in the month of Jyaishtha, while the Sun was in the meridian, the Brahman was engaged, in picking up grains of corn. Afflicted by heat and hunger, he was practicing this penance.

data.v: स तथैव क्षुधाविष्टः स्पृष्ट्वा तोयं यथाविधि । क्षपयामास तं कालं कृच्छ्रप्राणो द्विजोत्तमः ॥
अथ षष्ठे गते काले यवप्रस्थमुपार्जयत् । यवप्रस्थं च ते सक्तूनकुर्वन्त तपस्विनः ॥
कृतजप्याह्विकास्ते तु हुत्वा वह्निं यथाविधि । कुडवं कुडवं सर्वे व्यभजन्त तपस्विनः ॥
अथागच्छद्द्विजः कश्चिदतिथिर्भुञ्जतां तदा । ते तं दृष्ट्वातिथिं तत्र प्रहृष्टमनसोऽभवन् ॥
तेऽभिवाद्य सुखप्रश्नं पृष्ट्वा तमतिथिं तदा । विशुद्धमनसो दान्ताः श्रद्धादमसमन्विताः ॥
अनसूयवो गतक्रोधाः साधवो गतमत्सराः । त्यक्तमाना जितक्रोधा धर्मज्ञा द्विजसत्तमाः ॥
सब्रह्मचर्यं स्वं गोत्रं समाख्याय परस्परम् । कुटीं प्रवेशयामासुः क्षुधार्तमतिथिं तदा ॥
इदमर्घ्यं च पाद्यं च बृसी चेयं तवानघ । शुचयः सक्तवश्चेमे नियमोपार्जिताः प्रभो । प्रतिगृह्णीष्व भद्रं ते मया दत्ता द्विजोत्तम ॥
data.md: Here is some clean Saktu acquired by lawful means, O powerful one! Given by us, O foremost of twice-born persons, do you accept it.

data.v: इत्युक्तः प्रतिगृह्याथ सक्तूनां कुडवं द्विजः । भक्षयामास राजेन्द्र न च तुष्टिं जगाम सः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by them, that Brahmana accepted the Kudava (twelve double handfuls) of powdered barley which was offered to him and ate it all. But his hunger, O king, was not satisfied with what he ate.

data.v: स उञ्छवृत्तिः तं प्रेक्ष्य क्षुधापरिगतं द्विजम् । आहारं चिन्तयामास कथं तुष्टो भवेदिति ॥
data.md: The Brahmana while observing the Unchcha vow, seeing that his guest's hunger was still unsatisfied, began to think of what other food he could place before him for pleasing him.

data.v: तस्य भार्याब्रवीद्राजन्मद्भागो दीयतामिति । गच्छत्वेष यथाकामं संतुष्टो द्विजसत्तमः ॥
data.md: Then his wife said to him. Let my share be given to him! Let this foremost of twice-born persons be pleased and let him then go wherever he will.

data.v: इति ब्रुवन्तीं तां साध्वीं धर्मात्मा स द्विजर्षभः । क्षुधापरिगतां ज्ञात्वा सक्तूंस्तान्नाभ्यनन्दत ॥
data.md: Knowing that his chaste wife who said so, was herself stricken with hunger, that best of Brahmanas could not approve of her share of the powdered barley being given to the guest.

data.v: जानन्वृद्धां क्षुधार्तां च श्रान्तां ग्लानां तपस्विनीम् । त्वगस्थिभूतां वेपन्तीं ततो भार्यामुवाच ताम् ॥
अपि कीटपतंगानां मृगाणां चैव शोभने । स्त्रियो रक्ष्याश्च पोष्याश्च नैवं त्वं वक्तुमर्हसि ॥
अनुकम्पितो नरो नार्या पुष्टो रक्षित एव च । प्रपतेद्यशसो दीप्तान्न च लोकानवाप्नुयात् ॥
इत्युक्ता सा ततः प्राह धर्मार्थौ नौ समौ द्विज । सक्तुप्रस्थचतुर्भागं गृहाणेमं प्रसीद मे ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, she answered him, saying, O twice-born one, our religions acts and wealth are united. Do you take a fourth of this barley! Indeed, be pleased with me.

data.v: सत्यं रतिश्च धर्मश्च स्वर्गश्च गुणनिर्जितः । स्त्रीणां पतिसमाधीनं काङ्क्षितं च द्विजोत्तम ॥
data.md: Truth, pleasure, religious merit, and Heaven, as acquirable by good qualities, of women, as also all the objects of their desire, O foremost of twice-born ones, depend on the husband.

data.v: ऋतुर्मातुः पितुर्बीजं दैवतं परमं पतिः । भर्तुः प्रसादात्स्त्रीणां वै रतिः पुत्रफलं तथा ॥
data.md: In the production of children the mother contributes her blood. The father contributes his sced. The husband is the highest deity of the wife. Through the favour of the husband, women get both pleasure and offspring as the reward.

data.v: पालनाद्धि पतिस्त्वं मे भर्तासि भरणान्मम । पुत्रप्रदानाद्वरदस्तस्मात्सक्तून्गृहाण मे ॥
data.md: You are my Pati (lord) for the protection you give me. You are my Bhartri for the means of sustenance you give me. You are, again, boon-giver to me one account of your having presented me a son. Do you, therefore, take my share of the barley and give it to the guest.

data.v: जरापरिगतो वृद्धः क्षुधार्तो दुर्बलो भृशम् । उपवासपरिश्रान्तो यदा त्वमपि कर्शितः ॥
data.md: Overcome by decrepitude, you are of advanced years. Afflicted by hunger, you are greatly weakened. Worn out with fasts, you are very much emaciated.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तया सक्तून्प्रगृह्येदं वचोऽब्रवीत् । द्विज सक्तूनिमान्भूयः प्रतिगृह्णीष्व सत्तम ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by her, he took her share of the powdered barley and addressing his guest, said, 'O twice-bom one, O best of men, do you accept this quantity of powdered barley as well.

data.v: स तान्प्रगृह्य भुक्त्वा च न तुष्टिमगमद्द्विजः । तमुञ्छवृत्तिरालक्ष्य ततश्चिन्तापरोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: The Brahmana, having accepted that quantity, immediately ate it up, but his hunger was not yet satisfied. Secing him ungratified, the Brahmana in the observance of the Unchcha vow became thoughtful.

data.v: सक्तूनिमान्प्रगृह्य त्वं देहि विप्राय सत्तम । इत्येवं सुकृतं मन्ये तस्मादेतत्करोम्यहम् ॥
data.md: His son then said to him 'O best of men, taking my share of the barley do you give it to the guest! I consider this act of mine as one of great merit. Therefore, I do it.

data.v: भवान्हि परिपाल्यो मे सर्वयत्नैर्द्विजोत्तम । साधूनां काङ्क्षितं ह्येतत्पितुर्वृद्धस्य पोषणम् ॥
data.md: You should be always maintained by me with great care. Maintenance of the father is a duty which the good always covet.

data.v: पुत्रार्थो विहितो ह्येष स्थाविर्ये परिपालनम् । श्रुतिरेषा हि विप्रर्षे त्रिषु लोकेषु विश्रुता ॥
data.md: The maintenance of the father in his old age is the duty laid down for the son. This is the eternal Shruti (audition) current in the three worlds, O learned Rishi.

data.v: प्राणधारणमात्रेण शक्यं कर्तुं तपस्त्वया । प्राणो हि परमो धर्मः स्थितो देहेषु देहिनाम् ॥
data.md: By living on barely you are capable of practicing penances. The life-breath is the great deity which lives in the bodies of all embodied creatures.'

data.v: अपि वर्षसहस्री त्वं बाल एव मतो मम । उत्पाद्य पुत्रं हि पिता कृतकृत्यो भवत्युत ॥
data.md: The Father said If you attain to the age of even a thousand year, You will still seem to me to be only a little child. Having begotten a son, the father achieves success through him.

data.v: बालानां क्षुद्बलवती जानाम्येतदहं विभो । वृद्धोऽहं धारयिष्यामि त्वं बली भव पुत्रक ॥
data.md: O powerful me, I know that the hunger of children is very strong. I am old. I shall somehow succeed in holding my life-breaths. Do you, O son, become strong.

data.v: जीर्णेन वयसा पुत्र न मा क्षुद्बाधतेऽपि च । दीर्घकालं तपस्तप्तं न मे मरणतो भयम् ॥
data.md: Old and decrepit as I am, O son, hunger scarcely afflicts me. I have, again, for many years, practiced penances. I have no fear of death.

data.v: अपत्यमस्मि ते पुत्रस्त्राणात्पुत्रो हि विश्रुतः । आत्मा पुत्रः स्मृतस्तस्मात्त्राह्यात्मानमिहात्मना ॥
data.md: The Son said-I am your offspring. The Shruti declare that one's offspring is called Putra, because one is rescued by him. One's own self, again, takes birth as his son. Do you, therefore, rescue yourself by your own self.

data.v: रूपेण सदृशस्त्वं मे शीलेन च दमेन च । परीक्षितश्च बहुधा सक्तूनादद्मि ते ततः ॥
data.md: The Father said In forin you are like me. In conduct and in self-control, also you are my like. You have been examined on various occasions by me. I shall, therefore, accept your share of the barley, O son!

data.v: इत्युक्त्वादाय तान्सक्तून्प्रीतात्मा द्विजसत्तमः । प्रहसन्निव विप्राय स तस्मै प्रददौ तदा ॥
data.md: Having said this, that foremost of twiceborn persons cheerfully took his son's share of the barley and smilingly presented it to his twice-born guest.

data.v: भुक्त्वा तानपि सक्तून्स नैव तुष्टो बभूव ह । उञ्छवृत्तिस्तु सव्रीडो बभूव द्विजसत्तमः ॥
data.md: Having eaten that barley also, the guest's hunger was not satisfied. The righteous-should host in the observance of the Unchcha vow became asharmed.

data.v: तं वै वधूः स्थिता साध्वी ब्राह्मणप्रियकाम्यया । सक्तूनादाय संहृष्टा गुरुं तं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Desirous of doing what was agreeable to him, his chaste daughter-in-law then, bearing her share of the barley, approached him and said, Through your son, O learned Brahmana, I shall obtain a son. Do you, therefore, take my share of the barley and give it to this guest.

data.v: संतानात्तव संतानं मम विप्र भविष्यति । सक्तूनिमानतिथये गृहीत्वा त्वं प्रयच्छ मे ॥
तव प्रसवनिर्वृत्या मम लोकाः किलाक्षयाः । पौत्रेण तानवाप्नोति यत्र गत्वा न शोचति ॥
data.md: Through your grace, numerous regions of beatitude will be mine for eternity Through a grandson one obtains those regions going where one has not to suffer any kind of misery.

data.v: धर्माद्या हि यथा त्रेता वह्नित्रेता तथैव च । तथैव पुत्रपौत्राणां स्वर्गे त्रेता किलाक्षया ॥
data.md: Like the three-fold objects of life beginning with Religion, or the three-fold sacred fires, there is a triple aggregate of everlasting Heavens, depending upon the son, the grandson, and the great-grandson.

data.v: पितॄंस्त्राणात्तारयति पुत्र इत्यनुशुश्रुम । पुत्रपौत्रैश्च नियतं साधुलोकानुपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: The son is called Putra because he frees his ancestor's debt. Through sons and grandsons one always enjoys the happiness of those regions which are reserved for the pious and the good.

data.v: वातातपविशीर्णाङ्गीं त्वां विवर्णां निरीक्ष्य वै । कर्शितां सुव्रताचारे क्षुधाविह्वलचेतसम् ॥
कथं सक्तून्ग्रहीष्यामि भूत्वा धर्मोपघातकः । कल्याणवृत्ते कल्याणि नैवं त्वं वक्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: The Father-in-law said-O you of excellent vows and conduct, seeing you wasted by wind and sun, deprived of your very complexion, emaciated, and almost destitute of consciousness through hunger, how can I be such a transgressor against the rules of virtue as to take your share of the barley? O auspicious damsel, you should not say so, for the sake of those auspicious results for which every family must try.

data.v: षष्ठे काले व्रतवतीं शीलशौचसमन्विताम् । कृच्छ्रवृत्तिं निराहारां द्रक्ष्यामि त्वां कथं न्वहम् ॥
data.md: O auspicious lady, how can I hold you at even this the sixth division of the day abstaining from food and observing vows? You are gifted with purity and good conduct and penances. Alas, even you have to pass your days in so much misery.

data.v: बाला क्षुधार्ता नारी च रक्ष्या त्वं सततं मया । उपवासपरिश्रान्ता त्वं हि बान्धवनन्दिनी ॥
data.md: You are a child, afflicted by hunger, and belong to the softer sex. You should be always protected by mc! Alas, I have to see you worn out with fasts, O you who are the delighter of all your kinsmen.

data.v: गुरोर्मम गुरुस्त्वं वै यतो दैवतदैवतम् । देवातिदेवस्तस्मात्त्वं सक्तूनादत्स्व मे विभो ॥
data.md: The Daughter-in-law said You are the senior of my senior, since you are the deity of my deity. You are, indeed, the god of my god. Do you, therefore, O powerful one, take my share of the barley.

data.v: देहः प्राणश्च धर्मश्च शुश्रूषार्थमिदं गुरोः । तव विप्र प्रसादेन लोकान्प्राप्स्याम्यभीप्सितान् ॥
data.md: My body, life-breaths, and religious rites, have all one objects viz., the service of iny elder. through your favour, O learned Brahmana, I shall obtain many regions of happiness hereafter.

data.v: अवेक्ष्या इति कृत्वा त्वं दृढभक्त्येति वा द्विज । चिन्त्या ममेयमिति वा सक्तूनादातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: I deserve to be looked after by you. Know, o twice-born one, that I am wholly devoted to you. Cherishing also this thought, viz., that my happiness is your concern, you should take this my share of the barley.

data.v: अनेन नित्यं साध्वी त्वं शीलवृत्तेन शोभसे । या त्वं धर्मव्रतोपेता गुरुवृत्तिमवेक्षसे ॥
data.md: O chaste lady, on account of such conduct of yours you will for ever shine in glory, for endued with vows and steadiness in rcligious rites, your eyes are directed to that conduct which should be observed towards elders.

data.v: तस्मात्सक्तून्ग्रहीष्यामि वधूर्नार्हसि वञ्चनाम् । गणयित्वा महाभागे त्वं हि धर्मभृतां वरा ॥
data.md: Therefore, O daughter-in-law, I shall take your share of the barley. You deserve not to be deceived by me, considering all your virtues. You are truly, O blessed damsel, the foremost of all persons observing the duties of righteousness.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा तानुपादाय सक्तून्प्रादाद्द्विजातये । ततस्तुष्टोऽभवद्विप्रस्तस्य साधोर्महात्मनः ॥
data.md: Having said so to her, the Brahmana took her share of the barley and gave it to his guest. At this the guest became pleased with that great Brahmana gifted with great piety.

data.v: प्रीतात्मा स तु तं वाक्यमिदमाह द्विजर्षभम् । वाग्मी तदा द्विजश्रेष्ठो धर्मः पुरुषविग्रहः ॥
data.md: With gratified soul, that first of twice-bom persons, endued with great eloquence, who was none else than the deity of Virtue in a human form, then addressed that foremost of Brahmanas and said, 'O best of twice-born oncs, I am highly pleased with this pure gift of yours, this gift of what was acquired by fair mcans by you, and which you did freely part with, accordingly to the rules of virtue.

data.v: शुद्धेन तव दानेन न्यायोपात्तेन यत्नतः । यथाशक्ति विमुक्तेन प्रीतोऽस्मि द्विजसत्तम ॥
अहो दानं घुष्यते ते स्वर्गे स्वर्गनिवासिभिः । गगनात्पुष्पवर्षं च पश्यस्व पतितं भुवि ॥
data.md: Indeed, this gift of yours is being bruited about in Heaven by the dwellers of that happy region. Mark, flowers have been rained down from the sky on the Earth.

data.v: सुरर्षिदेवगन्धर्वा ये च देवपुरःसराः । स्तुवन्तो देवदूताश्च स्थिता दानेन विस्मिताः ॥
data.md: The celestial Rishis, the deities, the Gandharvas, those who walk before the deities, and the celestial messengers, are all lauding you, struck with wonder at your gift.

data.v: ब्रह्मर्षयो विमानस्था ब्रह्मलोकगताश्च ये । काङ्क्षन्ते दर्शनं तुभ्यं दिवं गच्छ द्विजर्षभ ॥
data.md: The twice-bom Rishis who live in the regions of Brahma, seated on their cars, are anxious to see you. O foremost of twice-born persons, go to Heaven.

data.v: पितृलोकगताः सर्वे तारिताः पितरस्त्वया । अनागताश्च बहवः सुबहूनि युगानि च ॥
data.md: The Pitris living in their own region, have all been rescued by them. Others, also, who have not attained to the position of Pitris, have equally been rescued by you for countless cycles.

data.v: ब्रह्मचर्येण यज्ञेन दानेन तपसा तथा । अगह्वरेण धर्मेण तस्माद्गच्छ दिवं द्विज ॥
data.md: For your Brahmacharya, your gifts, your sacrifices, your penances, and your acts of piety done with a pure heart, go you to Heaven.

data.v: श्रद्धया परया यस्त्वं तपश्चरसि सुव्रत । तस्माद्देवास्तवानेन प्रीता द्विजवरोत्तम ॥
data.md: you of excellent vows, you practice penances with great devotion. Your gifts have, therefore, pleased the deities highly, O best of twice-borm ones.

data.v: सर्वस्वमेतद्यस्मात्ते त्यक्तं शुद्धेन चेतसा । कृच्छ्रकाले ततः स्वर्गो जितोऽयं तव कर्मणा ॥
data.md: Since you have made this gift, in a season of great difficulty, with a pure heart, you have, by this act of yours, conquered the celestial region.

data.v: क्षुधा निर्णुदति प्रज्ञां धर्म्यां बुद्धिं व्यपोहति । क्षुधापरिगतज्ञानो धृतिं त्यजति चैव ह ॥
data.md: Hunger destroys one's wisdom and drives off one's righteous understanding. One whose intelligence is overwhelmed by hunger renounces all fortitude.

data.v: बुभुक्षां जयते यस्तु स स्वर्गं जयते ध्रुवम् । यदा दानरुचिर्भवति तदा धर्मो न सीदति ॥
data.md: He, therefore, who conquers hunger, conquers Heaven, forsooth. One's righteousness is never destroyed as long as he cherishes the inclination of making gifts.

data.v: अनवेक्ष्य सुतस्नेहं कलत्रस्नेहमेव च । धर्ममेव गुरुं ज्ञात्वा तृष्णा न गणिता त्वया ॥
data.md: Disregarding filial affection, disregarding the affection one feels for his wife, and reckoning virtue as the foremost, you have paid no attention to the cravings of nature.

data.v: द्रव्यागमो नृणां सूक्ष्मः पात्रे दानं ततः परम् । कालः परतरो दानाच्छ्रद्धा चापि ततः परा ॥
data.md: The acquisition of riches is an act of slight mcrit. Its gift to a worthy person is fraught with greater merit. Of still greater merit is the (proper) time. Lastly, devotion is fraught with the highest merit.

data.v: स्वर्गद्वारं सुसूक्ष्मं हि नरैर्मोहान्न दृश्यते । स्वर्गार्गलं लोभबीजं रागगुप्तं दुरासदम् ॥
data.md: The door of Heaven is very difficult to see. Through carelessness men cannot see it. The bar of Heaven's door has cupidity for its seed. That bar is kept fastened by desire and affection. Indeed, Heaven's door is unapproachable.

data.v: तत्तु पश्यन्ति पुरुषा जितक्रोधा जितेन्द्रियाः । ब्राह्मणास्तपसा युक्ता यथाशक्तिप्रदायिनः ॥
data.md: Those men who have subdued anger and conquered their passions, those Brahmanas who are gifted with penances and who make gifts according to the extent of their ability, succeed in seeing it.

data.v: सहस्रशक्तिश्च शतं शतशक्तिर्दशापि च । दद्यादपश्च यः शक्त्या सर्वे तुल्यफलाः स्मृताः ॥
data.md: It has been said that be who gives away a hundred, having a thousand, he who gives away ten, having a hundred, and he who gives a handful of water, having no moncy, are all equal as regards the merit they acquire.

data.v: रन्तिदेवो हि नृपतिरपः प्रादादकिंचनः । शुद्धेन मनसा विप्र नाकपृष्ठं ततो गतः ॥
data.md: King Rantideva, when divested of all his riches, gave a small quantity of water with a pure a small quantity of water with a pure heart. Through this gift, O learned Brahmana, he went to the celestial region.

data.v: न धर्मः प्रीयते तात दानैर्दत्तैर्महाफलैः । न्यायलब्धैर्यथा सूक्ष्मैः श्रद्धापूतैः स तुष्यति ॥
data.md: The deity of righteousness is never pleased so much with large gifts of costly things as with gifts of even worthless things, if acquired lawfully and given away with devotion and faith.

data.v: गोप्रदानसहस्राणि द्विजेभ्योऽदान्नृगो नृपः । एकां दत्त्वा स पारक्यां नरकं समवाप्तवान् ॥
data.md: King Nriga had made gifts of thousands of kine to the twice-born class. By giving away only one cow which did not belong to him, he fell into Hell.

data.v: आत्ममांसप्रदानेन शिबिरौशीनरो नृपः । प्राप्य पुण्यकृताँल्लोकान्मोदते दिवि सुव्रतः ॥
data.md: Ushinara's son Shibi of excellent vows, by giving away the flesh of his own body, is rejoicing in the celestial region, having attained to the regions of the pious.

data.v: विभवे न नृणां पुण्यं स्वशक्त्या स्वर्जितं सताम् । न यज्ञैर्विविधैर्विप्र यथान्यायेन संचितैः ॥
data.md: Mere wealth is not merit. Good men acquire merit by exerting to the best of their power and with the help of righteousness. One does not acquire such merit by means of even various sacrifices as with even a little wealth that has been acquired by fair means.

data.v: क्रोधो दानफलं हन्ति लोभात्स्वर्गं न गच्छति । न्यायवृत्तिर्हि तपसा दानवित्स्वर्गमश्नुते ॥
data.md: Through anger, the fruits of gifts are destroyed. Through cupidity one fails to go to the celestial region. One conversant with the merits of gifts, and leading a just course of conduct, succeeds, through penances, in enjoying the celestial region.

data.v: न राजसूयैर्बहुभिरिष्ट्वा विपुलदक्षिणैः । न चाश्वमेधैर्बहुभिः फलं सममिदं तव ॥
data.md: The fruit, O Brahmana, of this gift made by you (of a prastha of powdered barley) is much greater than what one acquires by many Rajasuya-Sacrifices with profuse gifts or many Horse-Sacrifices.

data.v: सक्तुप्रस्थेन हि जितो ब्रह्मलोकस्त्वयानघ । विरजो ब्रह्मभवनं गच्छ विप्र यथेच्छकम् ॥
data.md: With this prastha of powdered barley you have conquered the eternal region of Brahman. Go you in happiness, O learned Brahmana, to the house of Brahman who is without the stain of darkness.

data.v: सर्वेषां वो द्विजश्रेष्ठ दिव्यं यानमुपस्थितम् । आरोहत यथाकामं धर्मोऽस्मि द्विज पश्य माम् ॥
data.md: O foremost of twice-born persons, a celestial car is here for all of you. Do you ascend it as you please! O Brahmana, I am the deity of Righteousness. Behold me!

data.v: पावितो हि त्वया देहो लोके कीर्तिः स्थिरा च ते । सभार्यः सहपुत्रश्च सस्नुषश्च दिवं व्रज ॥
data.md: You have rescued your body. The fame of your achievement will least in the world. With your wife, your son, and your daughter-in-law, go now to the celestial region.

data.v: इत्युक्तवाक्यो धर्मेण यानमारुह्य स द्विजः । सभार्यः ससुतश्चापि सस्नुषश्च दिवं ययौ ॥
data.md: After the deity of Righteousness had said these words, that Brahmana, with his wife, son, daughter-in-law, proceeded to the celestial region.

data.v: तस्मिन्विप्रे गते स्वर्गं ससुते सस्नुषे तदा । भार्याचतुर्थे धर्मज्ञे ततोऽहं निःसृतो बिलात् ॥
data.md: After that learned Brahmana knowing all duties, had thus ascended to the celestial region with his son, daughter-in-law, and wife numbering the fourth, I came out of my hole.

data.v: ततस्तु सक्तुगन्धेन क्लेदेन सलिलस्य च । दिव्यपुष्पावमर्दाच्च साधोर्दानलवैश्च तैः । विप्रस्य तपसा तस्य शिरो मे काञ्चनीकृतम् ॥
तस्य सत्याभिसंधस्य सूक्ष्मदानेन चैव ह । शरीरार्धं च मे विप्राः शातकुम्भमयं कृतम् । पश्यतेदं सुविपुलं तपसा तस्य धीमतः ॥
कथमेवंविधं मे स्यादन्यत्पार्श्वमिति द्विजाः । तपोवनानि यज्ञांश्च हृष्टोऽभ्येमि पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: O twice-born ones, for converting the rest of my body into gold I repeatedly go, with a cheerful heart, to the hermitages of ascetics and sacrifices performed by kings.

data.v: यज्ञं त्वहमिमं श्रुत्वा कुरुराजस्य धीमतः । आशया परया प्राप्तो न चाहं काञ्चनीकृतः ॥
data.md: Hearing of this sacrifice of the Kuru king, gifted with great wisdom, I came here with hopes. I have not, however, been made gold.

data.v: ततो मयोक्तं तद्वाक्यं प्रहस्य द्विजसत्तमाः । सक्तुप्रस्थेन यज्ञोऽयं संमितो नेति सर्वथा ॥
data.md: O foremost of Brahmanas, it was for this that I uttered those words, viz., that this sacrifice can by no means compare with (the gift of) that prastha of powdered barley.

data.v: सक्तुप्रस्थलवैस्तैर्हि तदाहं काञ्चनीकृतः । न हि यज्ञो महानेष सदृशस्तैर्मतो मम ॥
data.md: With the grains of that prastha of powdered barley, I was made gold on that occasion. This great sacrifice, however, is not equal to those grains. This is my opinion.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा नकुलः सर्वान्यज्ञे द्विजवरांस्तदा । जगामादर्शनं राजन्विप्रास्ते च ययुर्गृहान् ॥
data.md: Having said those words to all those foremost of Brahmanas, the mungoose disappeared from their view. Those Brahmanas then returned to their respective homes.

data.v: एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं मया परपुरंजय । यदाश्चर्यमभूत्तस्मिन्वाजिमेधे महाक्रतौ ॥
data.md: Vaishmpayana said O conquerer of hostile towns, I have now told you all about that wonderful incident which took place in that great Horse-Sacrifice.

data.v: न विस्मयस्ते नृपते यज्ञे कार्यः कथंचन । ऋषिकोटिसहस्राणि तपोभिर्ये दिवं गताः ॥
data.md: You should not, o king, think highly of sacrifice. Million of Rishis have ascended to the celestial region with the help of only their penances.

data.v: अद्रोहः सर्वभूतेषु संतोषः शीलमार्जवम् । तपो दमश्च सत्यं च दानं चेति समं मतम् ॥
data.md: Abstention from injury to all creatures, contentment, conduct, sincerity, penances, selfcontrol, truthfulness, and gifts, are each equal in point of merit to sacrifice.

data.v: यज्ञे सक्ता नृपतयस्तपःसक्ता महर्षयः । शान्तिव्यवसिता विप्राः शमो दम इति प्रभो ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said O powerful Rishi, kings are attached to sacrifices. The great Rishis are attached to penances. Learned Brahmanas observe tranquillity of mind, peacefulness of conduct and self-control.

data.v: तस्माद्यज्ञफलैस्तुल्यं न किंचिदिह विद्यते । इति मे वर्तते बुद्धिस्तथा चैतदसंशयम् ॥
data.md: Hence it appears that nothing can be seen in this world which can compare with the fruits of sacrifices. This is my conviction. That conviction, again scems to be surely correct.

data.v: यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा हि बहवो राजानो द्विजसत्तम । इह कीर्तिं परां प्राप्य प्रेत्य स्वर्गमितो गताः ॥
data.md: Numberless kings, O best of twice-born persons, having adored the celestials in sacrifices, acquired high fame here and obtained the celestial region hercafter.

data.v: देवराजः सहस्राक्षः क्रतुभिर्भूरिदक्षिणैः । देवराज्यं महातेजाः प्राप्तवानखिलं विभुः ॥
data.md: Gifted with great energy, the powerful king of the deities, viz., Indra of a thousand eyes, obtained the sovereignty over the deities through the many sacrifices he performed with gifts in profusion and attained to the fruition of all his desires.

data.v: यथा युधिष्ठिरो राजा भीमार्जुनपुरःसरः । सदृशो देवराजेन समृद्ध्या विक्रमेण च ॥
data.md: When king Yudhishthira, with Bhima and Arjuna by him, resembled the king of the deities himself in prosperity and prowess, why then did that mungoose depreciate that great Horse-Sacrifice of the great monarch.

data.v: अथ कस्मात्स नकुलो गर्हयामास तं क्रतुम् । अश्वमेधं महायज्ञं राज्ञस्तस्य महात्मनः ॥
data.md: When king Yudhishthira, with Bhima and Arjuna by him, resembled the king of the deities himself in prosperity and prowess, why then did that mungoose depreciate that great Horse-Sacrifice of the great monarch.

data.v: यज्ञस्य विधिमग्र्यं वै फलं चैव नरर्षभ । गदतः शृणु मे राजन्यथावदिह भारत ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Do you listen to me, O king, as I describe to you duly, O Bharata, the excellent ordinances about sacrifice and the fruits also, O king, that sacrifice yields.

data.v: पुरा शक्रस्य यजतः सर्व ऊचुर्महर्षयः । ऋत्विक्षु कर्मव्यग्रेषु वितते यज्ञकर्मणि ॥
data.md: Formerly, occasion Shakra celebrated a particular sacrifice. While the limbs of the sacrifice were spread out, the Ritvijas became busy in performing the various rites ordained in the scriptures.

data.v: हूयमाने तथा वह्नौ होत्रे बहुगुणान्विते । देवेष्वाहूयमानेषु स्थितेषु परमर्षिषु ॥
सुप्रतीतैस्तदा विप्रैः स्वागमैः सुस्वनैर्नृप । अश्रान्तैश्चापि लघुभिरध्वर्युवृषभैस्तथा ॥
data.md: The pourer of libations, possessed of every qualification, becaine engaged in pouring libations of clarified butter. The great Rishis were seated around. The celestials were summoned by one by contented Brahmanas of great learning uttering scriptural Mantras in sweet voices. Those foremost of Adhvaryyus, not fatigued with what they did, recited the Mantras of the Yajurveda in soft account. on one one

data.v: आलम्भसमये तस्मिन्गृहीतेषु पशुष्वथ । महर्षयो महाराज संबभूवुः कृपान्विताः ॥
data.md: The time came for killing the animals. When the animals selected for sacrifice were seized, the great Rishis, O king, felt mercy for them.

data.v: ततो दीनान्पशून्दृष्ट्वा ऋषयस्ते तपोधनाः । ऊचुः शक्रं समागम्य नायं यज्ञविधिः शुभः ॥
data.md: Seeing that the animals had all become dispirited, those Rishis, gifted with wealth of penances, approached Shakra and said to him, “This method of sacrifice is not auspicious.'

data.v: अपविज्ञानमेतत्ते महान्तं धर्ममिच्छतः । न हि यज्ञे पशुगणा विधिदृष्टाः पुरंदर ॥
data.md: Desirous of winning great merit as you are, this is, indeed, a mark of your ignorance of the rites of sacrifice. O Purandara, animals have not been ordained to be killed in sacrifices,

data.v: धर्मोपघातकस्त्वेष समारम्भस्तव प्रभो । नायं धर्मकृतो धर्मो न हिंसा धर्म उच्यते ॥
data.md: O powerful one, these preparations of yours are destructive of merit! This sacrifice is not consistent with virtue. The destruction of creatures can never be said to be an act of virtue!

data.v: आगमेनैव ते यज्ञं कुर्वन्तु यदि हेच्छसि । विधिदृष्टेन यज्ञेन धर्मस्ते सुमहान्भवेत् ॥
data.md: If you wish it, let your priests perform your sacrifice according to the Agama. By performing a sacrifice according to the scriptural ordinance, great will be the merit acquired by you.

data.v: यज बीजैः सहस्राक्ष त्रिवर्षपरमोषितैः । एष धर्मो महाञ्शक्र चिन्त्यमानोऽधिगम्यते ॥
data.md: you of a hundred eyes do you perform the sacrifice with seeds of grain which have been kept for three years. This, O Shakra, would be fraught with great virtue and productive of fruits of high efficacy.

data.v: शतक्रतुस्तु तद्वाक्यमृषिभिस्तत्त्वदर्शिभिः । उक्तं न प्रतिजग्राह मानमोहवशानुगः ॥
data.md: were The deity of a hundred sacrifices, however, moved by pride and overwhelmed by stupefaction, did not accept these words uttered by the Rishis.

data.v: तेषां विवादः सुमहाञ्जज्ञे शक्रमहर्षिणाम् । जङ्गमैः स्थावरैर्वापि यष्टव्यमिति भारत ॥
data.md: Then, O Bharata, a great dispute arose in that sacrifice of Shakra between the ascetics as to how sacrifices should be performed, that is, should they be performed, with mobile creatures or with immobile objects.

data.v: ते तु खिन्ना विवादेन ऋषयस्तत्त्वदर्शिनः । ततः संधाय शक्रेण पप्रच्छुर्नृपतिं वसुम् ॥
महाभाग कथं यज्ञेष्वागमो नृपते स्मृतः । यष्टव्यं पशुभिर्मेध्यैरथो बीजैरजैरपि ॥
data.md: O highly blessed one, what is the Vedic declaration about sacrifices? Is it preferable to perform sacrifices with animals or with seeds and juices.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा तु वचस्तेषामविचार्य बलाबलम् । यथोपनीतैर्यष्टव्यमिति प्रोवाच पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: Hearing the question, king Vasu, without at all judging the merits of the arguments advanced on both sides, at once answered, saying, 'Sacrifices may be performed with any of the two kinds of objects ready.'

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा स नृपतिः प्रविवेश रसातलम् । उक्त्वेह वितथं राजंश्चेदीनामीश्वरः प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Having answered the question thus, he had to enter the nether regions. Indeed, the powerful king of the Chedis had to undergo that misery for having answered falsely.

data.v: अन्यायोपगतं द्रव्यमतीतं यो ह्यपण्डितः । धर्माभिकाङ्क्षी यजते न धर्मफलमश्नुते ॥
data.md: That person of little intelligence, who, from desire of acquiring merit, celebrates sacrifices with wealth acquired by unfair means, never succeeds in acquiring merit.

data.v: धर्मवैतंसिको यस्तु पापात्मा पुरुषस्तथा । ददाति दानं विप्रेभ्यो लोकविश्वासकारकम् ॥
data.md: That low wretch of sin who hypocritically assuming a garb of virtue makes gifts to Brahmanas, only created the conviction in men about his own virtue.

data.v: पापेन कर्मणा विप्रो धनं लब्ध्वा निरङ्कुशः । रागमोहान्वितः सोऽन्ते कलुषां गतिमाप्नुते ॥
data.md: That Brahmana of uncontrolled conduct, who acquires wealth by sinful deeds, overwhelmed by passion and stupefaction, attains at last to the goal of the sinful.

data.v: तेन दत्तानि दानानि पापेन हतबुद्धिना । तानि सत्त्वमनासाद्य नश्यन्ति विपुलान्यपि ॥
data.md: Gifts made by a sinner with an impure heart, for this, when very large, become lost. Such gifts go for nothing.

data.v: तस्याधर्मप्रवृत्तस्य हिंसकस्य दुरात्मनः । दाने न कीर्तिर्भवति प्रेत्य चेह च दुर्मतेः ॥
data.md: By the gifts made by a person of unrighteous conduct, one, that is, who is of sinful soul and who is a destroyer, just fame never acquired either in this world or in the next.

data.v: अपि संचयबुद्धिर्हि लोभमोहवशंगतः । उद्वेजयति भूतानि हिंसया पापचेतनः ॥
data.md: Some one, overwhelmed by cupidity and stupefaction, becomes bent on storing riches. He is seen to persecute all creatures, urged by a sinful and impure understanding.

data.v: एवं लब्ध्वा धनं लोभाद्यजते यो ददाति च । स कृत्वा कर्मणा तेन न सिध्यति दुरागमात् ॥
उञ्छं मूलं फलं शाकमुदपात्रं तपोधनाः । दानं विभवतो दत्त्वा नराः स्वर्यान्ति धर्मिणः ॥
data.md: Men having wealth of penances, by giving away, to the best of their power, grains of corn picked up from the fields or roots or fruits or potherbs or water or leaves, acquire great merit and proceed to the celestial region.

data.v: एष धर्मो महांस्त्यागो दानं भूतदया तथा । ब्रह्मचर्यं तथा सत्यमनुक्रोशो धृतिः क्षमा । सनातनस्य धर्मस्य मूलमेतत्सनातनम् ॥
data.md: Such gifts are fraught with virtue and equal to high austerities. Such gifts, as also mercy to all creatures, and Brahmacharya, truthfulness of speech, and kindness, and fortitude, and forgiveness, form the eternal foundations of virtue which itself is eternal. We hear of Vishvamitra and other kings of ancient times.

data.v: श्रूयन्ते हि पुरा विप्रा विश्वामित्रादयो नृपाः । विश्वामित्रोऽसितश्चैव जनकश्च महीपतिः । कक्षसेनार्ष्टिषेणौ च सिन्धुद्वीपश्च पार्थिवः ॥
एते चान्ये च बहवः सिद्धिं परमिकां गताः । नृपाः सत्यैश्च दानैश्च न्यायलब्धैस्तपोधनाः ॥
data.md: Indeed, Vishmvamitra, and Asita, and king Janaka, and Kakshasena and Arshtisena and king Sindhudvipa, these and many other kings, gifted with wealth of penances, having made gifts of articles acquired by fairness, having attained to high success.

data.v: ब्राह्मणाः क्षत्रिया वैश्याः शूद्रा ये चाश्रितास्तपः । दानधर्माग्निना शुद्धास्ते स्वर्गं यान्ति भारत ॥
data.md: Those amongst Brahmanas and Kshatriyas, Vaishyas and Shudras, who perforin penances, O Bharata, and who purify themselves, by gifts and other deeds of righteousness, proceed to the celestial region.

data.v: धर्मागतेन त्यागेन भगवन्सर्वमस्ति चेत् । एतन्मे सर्वमाचक्ष्व कुशलो ह्यसि भाषितुम् ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said If, O illustrious one, celestial region is the fruit of riches acquired by fair means, do you fully describe it to me. You are wellconversant with the subject and, it is, therefore, proper for you to explain it.

data.v: ततोञ्छवृत्तेर्यद्वृत्तं सक्तुदाने फलं महत् । कथितं मे महद्ब्रह्मंस्तथ्यमेतदसंशयम् ॥
data.md: O twice-born one, you have said to me what the high fruit was that accrued to that Brahmana, who lived according to the Unchcha mode, through his gift of powdered barley. Forsooth, all you have said is true.

data.v: कथं हि सर्वयज्ञेषु निश्चयः परमो भवेत् । एतदर्हसि मे वक्तुं निखिलेन द्विजर्षभ ॥
data.md: In what way, however, was the attainment held certain of the highest end in all sacrifices? O foremost of twice-born persons, you should fully expound all this to me.

data.v: अत्राप्युदाहरन्तीममितिहासं पुरातनम् । अगस्त्यस्य महायज्ञे पुरावृत्तमरिंदम ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Regarding it is cited this old narrative, O chastiser of enemies, of what took place formerly in the great sacrifice of Agastya.

data.v: पुरागस्त्यो महातेजा दीक्षां द्वादशवार्षिकीम् । प्रविवेश महाराज सर्वभूतहिते रतः ॥
data.md: Formerly, O king, Agastya of great energy, devoted to the well-being of all creatures, entered into a Diksha extending for twelve years.

data.v: तत्राग्निकल्पा होतार आसन्सत्रे महात्मनः । मूलाहारा निराहाराः साश्मकुट्टा मरीचिपाः ॥
data.md: In that sacrifice of the great Rishi many Hotris were engaged who resembled blazing fires in the splendour of their bodies. Among them were men who lived upon roots or fruits, or who used two pieces of stone only for husking their corn, or who were supported by only the rays (of the moon).

data.v: परिघृष्टिका वैघसिकाः संप्रक्षालास्तथैव च । यतयो भिक्षवश्चात्र बभूवुः पर्यवस्थिताः ॥
data.md: Among them were also men who never took any food unless it was placed before them by others desirous of feeding them, and those who never ate anything without having first served the celestials, the departed Manes, and guests, and those who never washed the food which they took. There were also Yatis and Vikshus among them, O king.

data.v: सर्वे प्रत्यक्षधर्माणो जितक्रोधा जितेन्द्रियाः । दमे स्थिताश्च ते सर्वे दम्भमोहविवर्जिताः ॥
data.md: All of them were men who had obtained a sight of the deity of virtue in his embodied form. They had subjugated anger and acquired a complete mastery over all their senses. Living in the observance of self-control, they were freed from pride and the desire of injuring others.

data.v: वृत्ते शुद्धे स्थिता नित्यमिन्द्रियैश्चाप्यवाहिताः । उपासते स्म तं यज्ञं भुञ्जानास्ते महर्षयः ॥
data.md: They were always observant of a pure conduct and were never obstructed by their senses. Those great, Rishis attended that sacrifice and performed its various rites.

data.v: यथाशक्त्या भगवता तदन्नं समुपार्जितम् । तस्मिन्सत्रे तु यत्किंचिदयोग्यं तत्र नाभवत् । तथा ह्यनेकैर्मुनिभिर्महान्तः क्रतवः कृताः ॥
data.md: The illustrious Rishi (Agastya) acquired the food which was collected in that sacrifice and that came up to the required quantity, by lawful means according to the best of his power.

data.v: एवंविधेस्त्वगस्त्यस्य वर्तमाने महाध्वरे । न ववर्ष सहस्राक्षस्तदा भरतसत्तम ॥
ततः कर्मान्तरे राजन्नगस्त्यस्य महात्मनः । कथेयमभिनिर्वृत्ता मुनीनां भावितात्मनाम् ॥
अगस्त्यो यजमानोऽसौ ददात्यन्नं विमत्सरः । न च वर्षति पर्जन्यः कथमन्नं भविष्यति ॥
सत्रं चेदं महद्विप्रा मुनेर्द्वादशवार्षिकम् । न वर्षिष्यति देवश्च वर्षाण्येतानि द्वादश ॥
एतद्भवन्तः संचिन्त्य महर्षेरस्य धीमतः । अगस्त्यस्यातितपसः कर्तुमर्हन्त्यनुग्रहम् ॥
इत्येवमुक्ते वचने ततोऽगस्त्यः प्रतापवान् । प्रोवाचेदं वचो वाग्मी प्रसाद्य शिरसा मुनीन् ॥
यदि द्वादशवर्षाणि न वर्षिष्यति वासवः । चिन्तायज्ञं करिष्यामि विधिरेष सनातनः ॥
यदि द्वादशवर्षाणि न वर्षिष्यति वासवः । व्यायामेनाहरिष्यामि यज्ञानन्यानतिव्रतान् ॥
बीजयज्ञो मयायं वै बहुवर्षसमाचितः । बीजैः कृतैः करिष्ये च नात्र विघ्नो भविष्यति ॥
नेदं शक्यं वृथा कर्तुं मम सत्रं कथंचन । वर्षिष्यतीह वा देवो न वा देवो भविष्यति ॥
अथ वाभ्यर्थनामिन्द्रः कुर्यान्न त्विह कामतः । स्वयमिन्द्रो भविष्यामि जीवयिष्यामि च प्रजाः ॥
data.md: It matters little whether the deity pours rain or no downpours come. Indeed, if Indra does not, of his own will, show any regard for me, I shall, in that case, change myself into Indra and keep all creatures alive. Every creature, on whatever food he has been nourished, will continue to be nourished on it as before.

data.v: यो यदाहारजातश्च स तथैव भविष्यति । विशेषं चैव कर्तास्मि पुनः पुनरतीव हि ॥
अद्येह स्वर्णमभ्येतु यच्चान्यद्वसु दुर्लभम् । त्रिषु लोकेषु यच्चास्ति तदिहागच्छतां स्वयम् ॥
दिव्याश्चाप्सरसां संघाः सगन्धर्वाः सकिंनराः । विश्वावसुश्च ये चान्ये तेऽप्युपासन्तु वः सदा ॥
उत्तरेभ्यः कुरुभ्यश्च यत्किंचिद्वसु विद्यते । सर्वं तदिह यज्ञे मे स्वयमेवोपतिष्ठतु । स्वर्गं स्वर्गसदश्चैव धर्मश्च स्वयमेव तु ॥
इत्युक्ते सर्वमेवैतदभवत्तस्य धीमतः । ततस्ते मुनयो दृष्ट्वा मुनेस्तस्य तपोबलम् । विस्मिता वचनं प्राहुरिदं सर्वे महार्थवत् ॥
data.md: The Rishis who were there saw the power of penances with rejoicing hearts. Filled with wonder they then said these words of grave significance.

data.v: प्रीताः स्म तव वाक्येन न त्विच्छामस्तपोव्ययम् । स्वैरेव यज्ञैस्तुष्टाः स्मो न्यायेनेच्छामहे वयम् ॥
data.md: The Rishis said We have been highly pleased with words you have uttered. We do not, however, wish penances should diminution. Those sacrifices are approved by us which are performed by fair means. Indeed, we wish duly those sacrifices which rest on lawful means.

data.v: यज्ञान्दीक्षास्तथा होमान्यच्चान्यन्मृगयामहे । तन्नोऽस्तु स्वकृतैर्यज्ञैर्नान्यतो मृगयामहे ॥
न्यायेनोपार्जिताहाराः स्वकर्मनिरता वयम् । वेदांश्च ब्रह्मचर्येण न्यायतः प्रार्थयामहे ॥
न्यायेनोत्तरकालं च गृहेभ्यो निःसृता वयम् । धर्मदृष्टैर्विधिद्वारैस्तपस्तप्स्यामहे वयम् ॥
data.md: We should worship the celestials, practicing Brahmacharya by lawful mean. Completing the period of Brahmacharya we have come out of our house, observing lawful methods. That that your suffer any understanding, which is freed from the desire of inflicting any kind of injury on others is approved by us.

data.v: भवतः सम्यगेषा हि बुद्धिर्हिंसाविवर्जिता । एतामहिंसां यज्ञेषु ब्रूयास्त्वं सततं प्रभो ॥
प्रीतास्ततो भविष्यामो वयं द्विजवरोत्तम । विसर्जिताः समाप्तौ च सत्रादस्माद्व्रजामहे ॥
data.md: You should always, O powerful one, commend such abstention from injury in all sacrifices. We shall then be highly pleased, O foremost of twice-born ones. After the completion of your sacrifice, when dismissed by you, we shall then, leaving this place, go away.

data.v: तथा कथयतामेव देवराजः पुरंदरः । ववर्ष सुमहातेजा दृष्ट्वा तस्य तपोबलम् ॥
data.md: As they were saving these words, Purandara, the king of the deities, gifted with great energy, seeing the power of Agastya's penances, poured rain.

data.v: असमाप्तौ च यज्ञस्य तस्यामितपराक्रमः । निकामवर्षी देवेन्द्रो बभूव जनमेजय ॥
data.md: Indeed, O Janamejaya, till the completion of the sacrifice of the Rishi of great prowess, the deity of rain poured rain which met the wishes of men both about quantity and time.

data.v: प्रसादयामास च तमगस्त्यं त्रिदशेश्वरः । स्वयमभ्येत्य राजर्षे पुरस्कृत्य बृहस्पतिम् ॥
data.md: Placing Brihaspati be one him, the king of the deities came there, O royal sage, and pleased the Rishi Agastya.

data.v: ततो यज्ञसमाप्तौ तान्विससर्ज महामुनीन् । अगस्त्यः परमप्रीतः पूजयित्वा यथाविधि ॥
data.md: On the termination of that sacrifice, Agastya, filled with joy, adored all those great Rishis duly and then sent them all away.

data.v: कोऽसौ नकुलरूपेण शिरसा काञ्चनेन वै । प्राह मानुषवद्वाचमेतत्पृष्टो वदस्व मे ॥

युयुत्सुः संजयश्चैव तत्कर्तास्म्यहमञ्जसा । सर्वे ह्येतेऽनुमान्या मे कुलस्यास्य हितैषिणः ॥
इदं तु याचे नृपते त्वामहं शिरसा नतः । क्रियतां तावदाहारस्ततो गच्छाश्रमं प्रति ॥
data.md: This, however, O king, I beg of you by bending my head. Do you first eat and afterwards go to your forest-retreat.

data.v: ततो राज्ञाभ्यनुज्ञातो धृतराष्ट्रः प्रतापवान् । ययौ स्वभवनं राजा गान्धार्यानुगतस्तदा ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said son Having received the kings' permission, the highly energetic king Dhritarastra, then, went to his own palace, followed by Gandhari.

data.v: मन्दप्राणगतिर्धीमान्कृच्छ्रादिव समुद्धरन् । पदातिः स महीपालो जीर्णो गजपतिर्यथा ॥
data.md: With weakened strength and slow motion, that highly intelligent king walked with difficulty, like the leader, exhausted with age, of an elephantine herd.

data.v: तमन्वगच्छद्विदुरो विद्वान्सूतश्च संजयः । स चापि परमेष्वासः कृपः शारद्वतस्तथा ॥
data.md: He was followed by the highly learned Vidura, and his charioteer Sanjaya, as also that powerful bowman Kripa the of Sharadvata.

data.v: स प्रविश्य गृहं राजा कृतपूर्वाह्णिकक्रियः । तर्पयित्वा द्विजश्रेष्ठानाहारमकरोत्तदा ॥
data.md: Entering his palace, O king, he performed the morning rites and, after pleasing many foremost of Brahmanas, he took some food.

data.v: गान्धारी चैव धर्मज्ञा कुन्त्या सह मनस्विनी । वधूभिरुपचारेण पूजिताभुङ्क्त भारत ॥
data.md: Gandhari knowing every duty, as also the highly intelligent Kunti, adored with offers of various articles by their daughters-in-law, then took some food, O Bharata.

data.v: कृताहारं कृताहाराः सर्वे ते विदुरादयः । पाण्डवाश्च कुरुश्रेष्ठमुपातिष्ठन्त तं नृपम् ॥
data.md: After Dhritarashtra had eaten, and Vidura also and others had done the same, the Pandavas, having finished their meals, approached and sat around the old king.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीन्महाराज कुन्तीपुत्रमुपह्वरे । निषण्णं पाणिना पृष्ठे संस्पृशन्नम्बिकासुतः ॥
data.md: Then the son of Ambika, O monarch, addressing Kunti's son, who was seated near him, and touching his back with his hand, said, 'You should always, O delighter of the Kurus, act vigilantly about everything connected with your kingdom consisting of eight limbs, o foremost of kings, and in which the claims of virtue should ever be kept foremost.

data.v: अप्रमादस्त्वया कार्यः सर्वथा कुरुनन्दन । अष्टाङ्गे राजशार्दूल राज्ये धर्मपुरस्कृते ॥
data.md: Then the son of Ambika, O monarch, addressing Kunti's son, who was seated near him, and touching his back with his hand, said, 'You should always, O delighter of the Kurus, act vigilantly about everything connected with your kingdom consisting of eight limbs, o foremost of kings, and in which the claims of virtue should ever be kept foremost.

data.v: तत्तु शक्यं यथा तात रक्षितुं पाण्डुनन्दन । राज्यं धर्मं च कौन्तेय विद्वानसि निबोध तत् ॥
data.md: You are, O son of Kunti, cndued with intelligence and learning. Listen to me, O king, I tell you what the means are by which, O son of Pandu, the kingdom is capable of being righteously protected.

data.v: विद्यावृद्धान्सदैव त्वमुपासीथा युधिष्ठिर । शृणुयास्ते च यद्ब्रूयुः कुर्याश्चैवाविचारयन् ॥
data.md: You should always, O Yudhishthria, honour those persons who are old in learning. You should listen to what they would say, and act accordingly without any scruple.

data.v: प्रातरुत्थाय तान्राजन्पूजयित्वा यथाविधि । कृत्यकाले समुत्पन्ने पृच्छेथाः कार्यमात्मनः ॥
data.md: Rising early in the morning, O king, adore them with due rites, and when the time comes for action, you should consult them about your (intended) acts.

data.v: ते तु संमानिता राजंस्त्वया राज्यहितार्थिना । प्रवक्ष्यन्ति हितं तात सर्वं कौरवनन्दन ॥
data.md: When, led by the desire of knowing what would be beneficial to you about your measures, you honour them, they will, O son, always declare what is for your behoof, O Bharata!

data.v: इन्द्रियाणि च सर्वाणि वाजिवत्परिपालय । हिताय वै भविष्यन्ति रक्षितं द्रविणं यथा ॥
data.md: You should always keep your senses as you keep your horses. They will then prove beneficial to you, like riches that is not wasted.

data.v: अमात्यानुपधातीतान्पितृपैतामहाञ्शुचीन् । दान्तान्कर्मसु सर्वेषु मुख्यान्मुख्येषु योजयेः ॥
data.md: You should employ only those ministers who have passed the tests of honesty, who are hereditary officers of state, possessed of pure conduct, self-controlled, expert in the discharge of business, and endued with righteous conduct.

data.v: चारयेथाश्च सततं चारैरविदितैः परान् । परीक्षितैर्बहुविधं स्वराष्ट्रेषु परेषु च ॥
data.md: You should always gather information through spies in various disguises, whose faithfulness have been tested, who are natives of your kingdom, and who should not be known to your enemies.

data.v: पुरं च ते सुगुप्तं स्याद्दृढप्राकारतोरणम् । अट्टाट्टालकसंबाधं षट्पथं सर्वतोदिशम् ॥
data.md: Your citadel should be properly protected with strong walls and arched gates. On every side such walls, with watch-towers on them standing close to one another, should be made as will admit six persons walking side by side on their top.

data.v: तस्य द्वाराणि कार्याणि पर्याप्तानि बृहन्ति च । सर्वतः सुविभक्तानि यन्त्रैरारक्षितानि च ॥
data.md: The gates should all be large and sufficiently strong. Kept in proper places, those gates should be carefully guarded.

data.v: पुरुषैरलमर्थज्ञैर्विदितैः कुलशीलतः । आत्मा च रक्ष्यः सततं भोजनादिषु भारत ॥
विहाराहारकालेषु माल्यशय्यासनेषु च । स्त्रियश्च ते सुगुप्ताः स्युर्वृद्धैराप्तैरधिष्ठिताः । शीलवद्भिः कुलीनैश्च विद्वद्भिश्च युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Let your purpose be accomplished through men whose families and conduct are wellknown. You should always protect your body also with care in matters connected with your food, O Bharata, as also in the hours of sport and eating and in matters connected with the garlands you wear and the beds you lie upon. The ladies of your household should be properly protected, looked over by aged and trusted servitors, of good conduct, well-born, and possessed of learning, O Yudhishthira.

data.v: मन्त्रिणश्चैव कुर्वीथा द्विजान्विद्याविशारदान् । विनीतांश्च कुलीनांश्च धर्मार्थकुशलानृजून् ॥
data.md: You should made ministers of Brahmanas possessed of learning, endued with humility, well-born, knowing religion and profit, and adorned with simplicity of behaviour.

data.v: तैः सार्धं मन्त्रयेथास्त्वं नात्यर्थं बहुभिः सह । समस्तैरपि च व्यस्तैर्व्यपदेशेन केनचित् ॥
data.md: You should hold consultations with them. You should not, however, admit many persons into your consultations. on particular occasions you may consult with the whole of your council or with a portion of it.

data.v: सुसंवृतं मन्त्रगृहं स्थलं चारुह्य मन्त्रयेः । अरण्ये निःशलाके वा न च रात्रौ कथंचन ॥
data.md: Entering a chamber or spot that is wellprotected (from intruders) you should hold your consultations. You may hold your consultation in a forest hat is divested of grass. You should never consult at night time.

data.v: वानराः पक्षिणश्चैव ये मनुष्यानुकारिणः । सर्वे मन्त्रगृहे वर्ज्या ये चापि जडपङ्गुकाः ॥
data.md: Apes and birds and other animals which can imitatc human beings should all be excluded from the council chamber, as also idiots and lame and palsied individuals.

data.v: मन्त्रभेदे हि ये दोषा भवन्ति पृथिवीक्षिताम् । न ते शक्याः समाधातुं कथंचिदिति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: I think that the evils which originate from the divulgence of the counsels of kings are such that they cannot be remedied.

data.v: दोषांश्च मन्त्रभेदेषु ब्रूयास्त्वं मन्त्रिमण्डले । अभेदे च गुणान्राजन्पुनः पुनररिंदम ॥
data.md: You should repeatedly refer, in the midst of your counselors, to the evils which arise from the divulgence of counsels, ochastiser of enemies, and to the merits which flow from counsels properly kept.

data.v: पौरजानपदानां च शौचाशौचं युधिष्ठिर । यथा स्याद्विदितं राजंस्तथा कार्यमरिंदम ॥
data.md: You should, O Yudhishthira, act in such a manner as to determine the merits and faults of the inhabitants of your city and the provinces.

data.v: व्यवहाराश्च ते तात नित्यमाप्तैरधिष्ठिताः । योज्यास्तुष्टैर्हितै राजन्नित्यं चारैरनुष्ठिताः ॥
data.md: Let your laws, O king, be always administered by trusted judges placed in charge thereof, who should also be contented and of good conduct. Their acts should also be ascertained by you through spies.

data.v: परिमाणं विदित्वा च दण्डं दण्ड्येषु भारत । प्रणयेयुर्यथान्यायं पुरुषास्ते युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: Let your judicial officers, O Yudhishthira, mete out punishments, according to the law, on offenders after careful determining the gravity of the offenses.

data.v: आदानरुचयश्चैव परदाराभिमर्शकाः । उग्रदण्डप्रधानाश्च मिथ्या व्याहारिणस्तथा ॥
आक्रोष्टारश्च लुब्धाश्च हन्तारः साहसप्रियाः । सभाविहारभेत्तारो वर्णानां च प्रदूषकाः । हिरण्यदण्ड्या वध्याश्च कर्तव्या देशकालतः ॥
प्रातरेव हि पश्येथा ये कुर्युर्व्ययकर्म ते । अलंकारमथो भोज्यमत ऊर्ध्वं समाचरेः ॥
पश्येथाश्च ततो योधान्सदा त्वं परिहर्षयन् । दूतानां च चराणां च प्रदोषस्ते सदा भवेत् ॥
सदा चापररात्रं ते भवेत्कार्यार्थनिर्णये । मध्यरात्रे विहारस्ते मध्याह्ने च सदा भवेत् ॥
data.md: The latter end of the night should be devoted by you to settle what acts should be done by you in the day. Midnight's and midday's should be devoted to amusements and sports. At all times, however, you should think of the means for the execution your projects.

data.v: सर्वे त्वात्ययिकाः कालाः कार्याणां भरतर्षभ । तथैवालंकृतः काले तिष्ठेथा भूरिदक्षिणः । चक्रवत्कर्मणां तात पर्यायो ह्येष नित्यशः ॥
data.md: At the proper time, adorning your body, you should sit prepared to make gifts in profusion. The turns for different deeds, O son, ceaselessly revolve like wheels.

data.v: कोशस्य संचये यत्नं कुर्वीथा न्यायतः सदा । द्विविधस्य महाराज विपरीतं विवर्जयेः ॥
चारैर्विदित्वा शत्रूंश्च ये ते राज्यान्तरायिणः । तानाप्तैः पुरुषैर्दूराद्घातयेथाः परस्परम् ॥
कर्मदृष्ट्याथ भृत्यांस्त्वं वरयेथाः कुरूद्वह । कारयेथाश्च कर्माणि युक्तायुक्तैरधिष्ठितैः ॥
सेनाप्रणेता च भवेत्तव तात दृढव्रतः । शूरः क्लेशसहश्चैव प्रियश्च तव मानवः ॥
सर्वे जानपदाश्चैव तव कर्माणि पाण्डव । पौरोगवाश्च सभ्याश्च कुर्युर्ये व्यवहारिणः ॥
स्वरन्ध्रं पररन्ध्रं च स्वेषु चैव परेषु च । उपलक्षयितव्यं ते नित्यमेव युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: You should always, O Yudhishthira, be careful to ascertain your own shortcomings as also those of your enemies. The shortcomings also of your own men as also of the men of your enemies should equally be known.

data.v: देशान्तरस्थाश्च नरा विक्रान्ताः सर्वकर्मसु । मात्राभिरनुरूपाभिरनुग्राह्या हितास्त्वया ॥
data.md: Those men of your kingdom, who are wellskilled in their respective callings, and are devoted to your good, should be patronized by you with adequate means of support.

data.v: गुणार्थिनां गुणः कार्यो विदुषां ते जनाधिप । अविचाल्याश्च ते ते स्युर्यथा मेरुर्महागिरिः ॥
data.md: A wise king, O chief of men, should always see that the accomplishments of his subjects might be kept up. They would then be firinly devoted to you, seeing that they did not fall away from their skill

data.v: मण्डलानि च बुध्येथाः परेषामात्मनस्तथा । उदासीनगुणानां च मध्यमानां तथैव च ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra said You should always ascertain the Mandalas which belong to you, to your enemies, to neutrals, and to those who are disposed equally towards you and your eneinies, O Bharata.

data.v: चतुर्णां शत्रुजातानां सर्वेषामाततायिनाम् । मित्रं चामित्रमित्रं च बोद्धव्यं तेऽरिकर्शन ॥
data.md: The Mandalas also of the four kinds of enemies, of those called Atatayins, and of allies, and the allies of enemies, should be distinguished by you, O crusher of enemies.

data.v: तथामात्या जनपदा दुर्गाणि विषमाणि च । बलानि च कुरुश्रेष्ठ भवन्त्येषां यथेच्छकम् ॥
data.md: You should sec that the ministers of state, the pcople of the provinces, the garrisons of forts, and the forces, O foremost one of Kuru's race, are not tampered with.

data.v: ते च द्वादश कौन्तेय राज्ञां वै विविधात्मकाः । मन्त्रिप्रधानाश्च गुणाः षष्टिर्द्वादश च प्रभो ॥
data.md: The twelve (enumerated above), O son of Kunti, form the principal concerns of kings. These twelve, as also the sixty, having Ministers for their foremost, should be looked after by the king.

data.v: एतन्मण्डलमित्याहुराचार्या नीतिकोविदाः । अत्र षाड्गुण्यमायत्तं युधिष्ठिर निबोध तत् ॥
data.md: Politicians call these by the name of Mandala. Understand, O Yudhishthira, that the six incidents (of peace, war, march, halt, sowing dissension's, and conciliation) depend upon these.

data.v: वृद्धिक्षयौ च विज्ञेयौ स्थानं च कुरुनन्दन । द्विसप्तत्या महाबाहो ततः षाड्गुण्यचारिणः ॥
data.md: Growth and diminution should also be understood, as also the condition of being stationary. The attributes of the six fold incidents, O you of mighty arms, as resting on the seventy-two (already enumerated), should also be, carefully understood.

data.v: यदा स्वपक्षो बलवान्परपक्षस्तथाबलः । विगृह्य शत्रून्कौन्तेय यायात्क्षितिपतिस्तदा । यदा स्वपक्षोऽबलवांस्तदा संधिं समाश्रयेत् ॥
data.md: When one's own side has vecome strong and the side of the enemy has become weak, it is them, O son of Kunti, that the king should fight against the enemy and try to acquire victory.

data.v: द्रव्याणां संचयश्चैव कर्तव्यः स्यान्महांस्तथा । यदा समर्थो यानाय नचिरेणैव भारत ॥
data.md: The king should collect a large quantity of articles (for his commissariat). When able to march out, he should on no account make a delay, O Bharata.

data.v: तदा सर्वं विधेयं स्यात्स्थानं च न विभाजयेत् । भूमिरल्पफला देया विपरीतस्य भारत ॥
data.md: Besides, he should on that occasion set his men to work for which they are fit, without being moved by many other consideration. He should, (when obliged to part with a portion of his territories), give his enemy such land as are not productive of a plentiful harvest.

data.v: हिरण्यं कुप्यभूयिष्ठं मित्रं क्षीणमकोशवत् । विपरीतान्न गृह्णीयात्स्वयं संधिविशारदः ॥
data.md: (When obliged to pay coins), he should give gold containing much base metal. (When obliged to surrender a portion of his army), he should give such men as are not noted for strength. One who is skilled in treatics should, when taking land or gold or men from the enemy, take what is possessed of attributes the reverse of this.

data.v: संध्यर्थं राजपुत्रं च लिप्सेथा भरतर्षभ । विपरीतस्तु तेऽदेयः पुत्र कस्यांचिदापदि । तस्य प्रमोक्षे यत्नं च कुर्याः सोपायमन्त्रवित् ॥
data.md: In making treaties of peace, the son of the king should be demanded as a hostage, O chief of the Bharatas. A contrary course of conduct would not be wholesome, O son. If a calamity come over the king, he should, with knowledge of means and counsels, try to liberate himself from it. The king, O foremost of kings, should maintain the cheerless and the destitute among his people.
