data.md: Through the fault, however, of that prince of wicked understanding, and through his pride, as also through my own impolicy, a great destruction of the Kshatriyas has taken place.

data.v: तन्मया साधु वापीदं यदि वासाधु वै कृतम् । तद्वो हृदि न कर्तव्यं मामनुज्ञातुमर्हथ ॥
data.md: Whether I have, in that matter, acted rightly or wrongly, I pray you with joined hands to remove all recollections of it from your hearts.

data.v: वृद्धोऽयं हतपुत्रोऽयं दुःखितोऽयं जनाधिपः । पूर्वराज्ञां च पुत्रोऽयमिति कृत्वानुजानत ॥
data.md: This one is old; this one has lost all his children; this one stricken with sorrow; this one was our king; this one is a descendant of former kings;-considerations like these should induce you to forgive me.

data.v: इयं च कृपणा वृद्धा हतपुत्रा तपस्विनी । गान्धारी पुत्रशोकार्ता तुल्यं याचति वो मया ॥
data.md: This Gandhari, also is dispirited and old. She. too, has lost her children and is helpless. Stricken with grief or the loss of her hens, she solicits you with me.

data.v: हतपुत्राविमौ वृद्धौ विदित्वा दुःखितौ तथा । अनुजानीत भद्रं वो व्रजावः शरणं च वः ॥
data.md: Knowing that both of us are old and afflicted and destitute of children, grant us the permission we seck. Blessed be you, we seek your protection.

data.v: अयं च कौरवो राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः । सर्वैर्भवद्भिर्द्रष्टव्यः समेषु विषमेषु च । न जातु विषमं चैव गमिष्यति कदाचन ॥
data.md: This Kuru king, Yudhishthira the son of Kunti, should be looked after by you all, in weal and woe.

data.v: चत्वारः सचिवा यस्य भ्रातरो विपुलौजसः । लोकपालोपमा ह्येते सर्वे धर्मार्थदर्शिनः ॥
data.md: He who has, four such brothers of abundant prowess, for his counselors will never fall into distress. All of them are conversant with both Virtue and Profit, and resemble the very guardians of the world.

data.v: ब्रह्मेव भगवानेष सर्वभूतजगत्पतिः । युधिष्ठिरो महातेजा भवतः पालयिष्यति ॥
data.md: Like the illustrious Brahman himself, the Lord of the universe with all its creatures, this Yudhishthira of great energy will rule you.

data.v: अवश्यमेव वक्तव्यमिति कृत्वा ब्रवीमि वः । एष न्यासो मया दत्तः सर्वेषां वो युधिष्ठिरः । भवन्तोऽस्य च वीरस्य न्यासभूता मया कृताः ॥
data.md: That which should certainly be said is now said by me. I make over to you this Yudhishthira here as a charge. I entrust you, also to the hands of this hero.

data.v: यद्येव तैः कृतं किंचिद्व्यलीकं वा सुतैर्मम । यद्यन्येन मदीयेन तदनुज्ञातुमर्हथ ॥
data.md: You should all forget and forgive whatever injury has been done to you by those sons of mine who are no longer alive, or, indeed, by any one else belonging to me.

data.v: भवद्भिर्हि न मे मन्युः कृतपूर्वः कथंचन । अत्यन्तगुरुभक्तानामेषोऽञ्जलिरिदं नमः ॥
data.md: You never cherished any anger again't me on any previous occasion. I join my hands before you who are famous for loyalty. Here, I bow to you all.

data.v: तेषामस्थिरबुद्धीनां लुब्धानां कामचारिणाम् । कृते याचामि वः सर्वान्गान्धारीसहितोऽनघाः ॥
data.md: You sinless one, I, with Gandhari by my side, beg your pardon now for anything done to you by ihosc Sons of mine, of restless understanding, sullied by cupidity, and ever acting as their desires prompted.

data.v: इत्युक्तास्तेन ते राज्ञा पौरजानपदा जनाः । नोचुर्बाष्पकलाः किंचिद्वीक्षां चक्रुः परस्परम् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by the old king, all those citizens and dwellers of the provinces, filled with icars, said nothing but only looked at one another.

data.v: एवमुक्तास्तु ते तेन पौरजानपदा जनाः । वृद्धेन राज्ञा कौरव्य नष्टसंज्ञा इवाभवन् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, O you of Kuru's race, by the old king, the citizens and the inhabitants of the provinces stood sometime like men shorn of consciousness.

data.v: तूष्णींभूतांस्ततस्तांस्तु बाष्पकण्ठान्महीपतिः । धृतराष्ट्रो महीपालः पुनरेवाभ्यभाषत ॥
वृद्धं मां हतपुत्रं च धर्मपत्न्या सहानया । विलपन्तं बहुविधं कृपणं चैव सत्तमाः ॥
पित्रा स्वयमनुज्ञातं कृष्णद्वैपायनेन वै । वनवासाय धर्मज्ञा धर्मज्ञेन नृपेण च ॥
सोऽहं पुनः पुनर्याचे शिरसावनतोऽनघाः । गान्धार्या सहितं तन्मां समनुज्ञातुमर्हथ ॥
data.md: You sinless ones, I with Gandhari, repeatedly solicit you with bent heads, You should all grant us permission.

data.v: श्रुत्वा तु कुरुराजस्य वाक्यानि करुणानि ते । रुरुदुः सर्वतो राजन्समेताः कुरुजाङ्गलाः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Hearing these pitiable words of the Kuru king, O monarch, the assembled dwellers of Kurujangala all began to weep.

data.v: उत्तरीयैः करैश्चापि संछाद्य वदनानि ते । रुरुदुः शोकसंतप्ता मुहूर्तं पितृमातृवत् ॥
data.md: Covering their faces with their hands and upper garments, all those men, burning with grief, wept for a while as father sand mothers would weep.

data.v: हृदयैः शून्यभूतैस्ते धृतराष्ट्रप्रवासजम् । दुःखं संधारयन्तः स्म नष्टसंज्ञा इवाभवन् ॥
data.md: Bearing in their hearts, from which every other thoughts had been removed, the sorrow born of Dhritarashtra's desire to leave the world, they looked like men shorn of consciousness.

data.v: ते विनीय तमायासं कुरुराजवियोगजम् । शनैः शनैस्तदान्योन्यमब्रुवन्स्वमतान्युत ॥
data.md: Checking that agitation of heart due to the announcement of Dhritarashtra's desire of going to the forest, they gradually were able to address one another, expressing their wishes.

data.v: ततः संधाय ते सर्वे वाक्यान्यथ समासतः । एकस्मिन्ब्राह्मणे राजन्नावेश्योचुर्नराधिपम् ॥
data.md: Setting their words briefly, O king, they charged a certain Brahmana therewith and thus replied to the old king.

data.v: ततः स्वचरणे वृद्धः संमतोऽर्थविशारदः । साम्बाख्यो बह्वृचो राजन्वक्तुं समुपचक्रमे ॥
data.md: That learned Brahinana, of good conduct, chosen by unanimous consent, conversant with all subjects, master of all the Rics, and named Samba, tried to speak.

data.v: अनुमान्य महाराजं तत्सदः संप्रभाष्य च । विप्रः प्रगल्भो मेधावी स राजानमुवाच ह ॥
data.md: Taking the permission of the whole assembly and with its full approbation, that learned Brahmana of great intelligence, conscious of his own powers, said these words to the king.

data.v: राजन्वाक्यं जनस्यास्य मयि सर्वं समर्पितम् । वक्ष्यामि तदहं वीर तज्जुषस्व नराधिप ॥
data.md: O monarch, the answer of this assembly has been committed to my care. I shall speak it out, O hero! Do you receive it, O king.

data.v: यथा वदसि राजेन्द्र सर्वमेतत्तथा विभो । नात्र मिथ्या वचः किंचित्सुहृत्त्वं नः परस्परम् ॥
data.md: What you say, O king of kings, is all true, O powerful one. There is nothing in it that is in even slightly tinctured with untruth, you are our well-wisher, as, indeed, we are yours.

data.v: न जात्वस्य तु वंशस्य राज्ञां कश्चित्कदाचन । राजासीद्यः प्रजापालः प्रजानामप्रियो भवेत् ॥
data.md: Indeed, in this royal family, there never was a king who coming to rulc his subjects, became unpopular with them.

data.v: पितृवद्भ्रातृवच्चैव भवन्तः पालयन्ति नः । न च दुर्योधनः किंचिदयुक्तं कृतवान्नृप ॥
data.md: You have ruled us like fathers or brothers. King Duryodhana never did us any wrong.

data.v: यथा ब्रवीति धर्मज्ञो मुनिः सत्यवतीसुतः । तथा कुरु महाराज स हि नः परमो गुरुः ॥
data.md: Do that, O king, which that righteoussouled ascetic, the son of Satyavati, has said. He is, indeed out foremost of instructors.

data.v: त्यक्ता वयं तु भवता दुःखशोकपरायणाः । भविष्यामश्चिरं राजन्भवद्गुणशतैर्हृताः ॥
data.md: Left by you, O king, we shall have to pass our days in grief and sorrow, remembering hundreds of virtues possessed by you.

data.v: यथा शंतनुना गुप्ता राज्ञा चित्राङ्गदेन च । भीष्मवीर्योपगूढेन पित्रा च तव पार्थिव ॥
data.md: We were well-protected and ruled by king Duryodhana even as we had been ruled by king Shantanu, or by Chitrangada, or by your father, O monarch, who was protected by the prowess of Bhishma, or by Pandu, that ruler of Earth, who was overlooked by you in all is deeds.

data.v: भवद्बुद्धियुजा चैव पाण्डुना पृथिवीक्षिता । तथा दुर्योधनेनापि राज्ञा सुपरिपालिताः ॥
न स्वल्पमपि पुत्रस्ते व्यलीकं कृतवान्नृप । पितरीव सुविश्वस्तास्तस्मिन्नपि नराधिपे । वयमास्म यथा सम्यग्भवतो विदितं तथा ॥
data.md: Your son, O monarch, never did us the slightest wrong. We lived, depending on that king as trustfully as on our own father.

data.v: तथा वर्षसहस्राय कुन्तीपुत्रेण धीमता । पाल्यमाना धृतिमता सुखं विन्दामहे नृप ॥
राजर्षीणां पुराणानां भवतां वंशधारिणाम् । कुरुसंवरणादीनां भरतस्य च धीमतः ॥
वृत्तं समनुयात्येष धर्मात्मा भूरिदक्षिणः । नात्र वाच्यं महाराज सुसूक्ष्ममपि विद्यते ॥
उषिताः स्म सुखं नित्यं भवता परिपालिताः । सुसूक्ष्मं च व्यलीकं ते सपुत्रस्य न विद्यते ॥
यत्तु ज्ञातिविमर्देऽस्मिन्नात्थ दुर्योधनं प्रति । भवन्तमनुनेष्यामि तत्रापि कुरुनन्दन ॥
data.md: The slightest omission cannot be laid at your doors and yours sons. Regarding what you have said about Duryodhana in the matter of this destruction of kinsmen, I beg you, O delighter of the Kurus, (to listen to me).

data.v: न तद्दुर्योधनकृतं न च तद्भवता कृतम् । न कर्णसौबलाभ्यां च कुरवो यत्क्षयं गताः ॥
data.md: The carnage that has overtaken the Kurus was not caused by Duryodhana. It was not brought about by you. Nor was it brought about by Karna and Subala's son.

data.v: दैवं तत्तु विजानीमो यन्न शक्यं प्रबाधितुम् । दैवं पुरुषकारेण न शक्यमतिवर्तितुम् ॥
data.md: We know that it was encompassed about by Destiny, and that it was incapable of being counteracted. Destiny is not capable of being resisied by human exertion.

data.v: अक्षौहिण्यो महाराज दशाष्टौ च समागताः । अष्टादशाहेन हता दशभिर्योधपुंगवैः ॥
भीष्मद्रोणकृपाद्यैश्च कर्णेन च महात्मना । युयुधानेन वीरेण धृष्टद्युम्नेन चैव ह ॥
चतुर्भिः पाण्डुपुत्रैश्च भीमार्जुनयमैर्नृप । जनक्षयोऽयं नृपते कृतो दैवबलात्कृतैः ॥
अवश्यमेव संग्रामे क्षत्रियेण विशेषतः । कर्तव्यं निधनं लोके शस्त्रेण क्षत्रबन्धुना ॥
तैरियं पुरुषव्याघ्रैर्विद्याबाहुबलान्वितैः । पृथिवी निहता सर्वा सहया सरथद्विपा ॥
data.md: Forsooth, by Kshatriyas in particular, should enemies be killed and death encountered in battle. By those foremost of men, gifted with science and might of arms, the Earth has been exterminaled with her horses and cars and elephants.

data.v: न स राजापराध्नोति पुत्रस्तव महामनाः । न भवान्न च ते भृत्या न कर्णो न च सौबलः ॥
data.md: Your son was not the cause of that destruction of great kings. You were not the cause, nor your servants, nor Karna, nor Subala's son.

data.v: यद्विनष्टाः कुरुश्रेष्ठा राजानश्च सहस्रशः । सर्वं दैवकृतं तद्वै कोऽत्र किं वक्तुमर्हति ॥
data.md: The destruction of those for-most ones of Kuru's race and of kings by thousands know, was engendered by Destiny. Who can say anything else in this.

data.v: गुरुर्मतो भवानस्य कृत्स्नस्य जगतः प्रभुः । धर्मात्मानमतस्तुभ्यमनुजानीमहे सुतम् ॥
data.md: You are regarded as the preceptor and the master of the whole world. We, therefore, in you presence, absolve your righteous-souled son.

data.v: लभतां वीरलोकान्स ससहायो नराधिपः । द्विजाग्र्यैः समनुज्ञातस्त्रिदिवे मोदतां सुखी ॥
data.md: Let that king, with all his associates, obtain the regions reserved for herocs Permitted by foremost of Brahmanas, let him sport blissfully in the celestial region.

data.v: प्राप्स्यते च भवान्पुण्यं धर्मे च परमां स्थितिम् । वेद पुण्यं च कार्त्स्न्येन सम्यग्भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: You, also shall attain to great merit, and unswerving steadiness in virtue. O you of excellent vows, follow fully the duties laid down in the Vedas.

data.v: दृष्टापदानाश्चास्माभिः पाण्डवाः पुरुषर्षभाः । समर्थास्त्रिदिवस्यापि पालने किं पुनः क्षितेः ॥
data.md: It is not necessary for either you or ourselves to look after the Pandavas. They are capable of ruling the very Heavens, what need then be said of the Earth?

data.v: अनुवत्स्यन्ति चापीमाः समेषु विषमेषु च । प्रजाः कुरुकुलश्रेष्ठ पाण्डवाञ्शीलभूषणान् ॥
data.md: O you of great intelligence, in weal as in woe, the subjects of this kingdom, O foremost one of Kuru's race, will obey the Pandavas who have conduct for their ornament.

data.v: ब्रह्मदेयाग्रहारांश्च परिहारांश्च पार्थिव । पूर्वराजातिसर्गांश्च पालयत्येव पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: The son of Pandu makes those valuable gifts which are always to be made to foremost of twice-born persons in sacrifices and in obscquial rites, after the manner of all the great kings of yore.

data.v: दीर्घदर्शी कृतप्रज्ञः सदा वैश्रवणो यथा । अक्षुद्रसचिवश्चायं कुन्तीपुत्रो महामनाः ॥
data.md: The great son of Kunti is mild, and selfcontrolled, and is always disposed to spend as if he were a second Vaishravana. He has great ministers who attend on him.

data.v: अप्यमित्रे दयावांश्च शुचिश्च भरतर्षभ । ऋजु पश्यति मेधावी पुत्रवत्पाति नः सदा ॥
data.md: He is compassionate to even his enemies. Indeed, that foremnost one of Bharata's race is of pure conduct. Gifted with great intelligence, he is perfectly straightforward in his dealings and rules and protects us like a father his children.

data.v: विप्रियं च जनस्यास्य संसर्गाद्धर्मजस्य वै । न करिष्यन्ति राजर्षे तथा भीमार्जुनादयः ॥
data.md: From association with him who is the son of Dharma, O royal sage, Bhima and Arjuna and others will never wrong us in the least.

data.v: मन्दा मृदुषु कौरव्यास्तीक्ष्णेष्वाशीविषोपमाः । वीर्यवन्तो महात्मानः पौराणां च हिते रताः ॥
data.md: They are mild, O you of Kuru's race, to them that are inild, and fierce like snakes of dreadful poison to them who are fierce. Endured with great energy, those high-souled ones are always devoted to the well-being of the people.

data.v: न कुन्ती न च पाञ्चाली न चोलूपी न सात्वती । अस्मिञ्जने करिष्यन्ति प्रतिकूलानि कर्हिचित् ॥
data.md: Neither Kunti, nor your (daughter-in-law) Panchali, nor Ulupi, nor the princess of the Satvata race, will do the least wrong to these people.

data.v: भवत्कृतमिमं स्नेहं युधिष्ठिरविवर्धितम् । न पृष्ठतः करिष्यन्ति पौरजानपदा जनाः ॥
data.md: The affection which you have shown towards us and which in Yudhishthira is seen to exist in a still larger measurc, is incapable of being forgotten by the people of the city and the provinces.

data.v: अधर्मिष्ठानपि सतः कुन्तीपुत्रा महारथाः । मानवान्पालयिष्यन्ति भूत्वा धर्मपरायणाः ॥
data.md: Those powerful car-warriors, viz., the sons of Kunti, themselves devoted to the duties of virtue, will protect and cherish the people even if these happen to be unrighteous.

data.v: स राजन्मानसं दुःखमपनीय युधिष्ठिरात् । कुरु कार्याणि धर्म्याणि नमस्ते भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Do you, therefore, O king, reinoving all anxiety of heat on account of Yudhishthira, set yourself to the accomplishment of all meritorious deeds, O foremost of men.

data.v: तस्य तद्वचनं धर्म्यमनुबन्धगुणोत्तरम् । साधु साध्विति सर्वः स जनः प्रतिगृहीतवान् ॥
data.md: Hearing these words, fraught with virtue and merit, of that Brahmana and approving of them every person in that assembly said, 'Excellent, Excellent' and accepted them as his own.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्रश्च तद्वाक्यमभिपूज्य पुनः पुनः । विसर्जयामास तदा सर्वास्तु प्रकृतीः शनैः ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra, also, repeatedly speaking highly of those words, slowly dismissed that assembly of his subjects.

data.v: स तैः संपूजितो राजा शिवेनावेक्षितस्तदा । प्राञ्जलिः पूजयामास तं जनं भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Thus honoured by them and looked upon with auspicious looks, the old king, O chief of Bharata's race, joined his hands and honoured them all in returi.

data.v: ततो विवेश भुवनं गान्धार्या सहितो नृपः । व्युष्टायां चैव शर्वर्यां यच्चकार निबोध तत् ॥
data.md: He, then, entered his own palace with Gandhari, Listen now to what he did after that night had passed away.

data.v: व्युषितायां रजन्यां तु धृतराष्ट्रोऽम्बिकासुतः । विदुरं प्रेषयामास युधिष्ठिरनिवेशनम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said After that night had passed away, Dhritarashtra, the son of Ambika, sent Vidura to Yudhishthira's place.

data.v: स गत्वा राजवचनादुवाचाच्युतमीश्वरम् । युधिष्ठिरं महातेजाः सर्वबुद्धिमतां वरः ॥
data.md: Gifted with great energy and the foremost of all persons endued with intelligence, Vidura. having arrived at at Yudhishthira's palace, addressed that foremost of men, that king of undecaying glory, in these words:—King Diritarashtra has perforined the preliminary rites for accomplishing his purpose of retiring into the forest. He will start for the woods, O king, on the coming day of full moon of the month of Kartika.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्रो महाराज वनवासाय दीक्षितः । गमिष्यति वनं राजन्कार्त्तिकीमागतामिमाम् ॥
स त्वा कुरुकुलश्रेष्ठ किंचिदर्थमभीप्सति । श्राद्धमिच्छति दातुं स गाङ्गेयस्य महात्मनः ॥
द्रोणस्य सोमदत्तस्य बाह्लीकस्य च धीमतः । पुत्राणां चैव सर्वेषां ये चास्य सुहृदो हताः । यदि चाभ्यनुजानीषे सैन्धवापसदस्य च ॥
data.md: He now solicits from you, O foremost of Kuru's race, some money. He wishes to perform the Shraddha of the great son of Ganga, as also of Drona and Somadatta and Vallika of great intelligence, and of all his sons as also of all other wishers of his who have been killed, and, if you permit it, of that wicked king of the Sindhus.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा तु वचनं विदुरस्य युधिष्ठिरः । हृष्टः संपूजयामास गुडाकेशश्च पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of Vidura, both Yudhishthira, and Pandus' son Arjuna of curly hair, became very glad and applauded them highly.

data.v: न तु भीमो दृढक्रोधस्तद्वचो जगृहे तदा । विदुरस्य महातेजा दुर्योधनकृतं स्मरन् ॥
अभिप्रायं विदित्वा तु भीमसेनस्य फल्गुनः । किरीटी किंचिदानम्य भीमं वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
भीम राजा पिता वृद्धो वनवासाय दीक्षितः । दातुमिच्छति सर्वेषां सुहृदामौर्ध्वदेहिकम् ॥
भवता निर्जितं वित्तं दातुमिच्छति कौरवः । भीष्मादीनां महाबाहो तदनुज्ञातुमर्हसि ॥
दिष्ट्या त्वद्य महाबाहो धृतराष्ट्रः प्रयाचति । याचितो यः पुरास्माभिः पश्य कालस्य पर्ययम् ॥
योऽसौ पृथिव्याः कृत्स्नाया भर्ता भूत्वा नराधिपः । परैर्विनिहतापत्यो वनं गन्तुमभीप्सति ॥
मा तेऽन्यत्पुरुषव्याघ्र दानाद्भवतु दर्शनम् । अयशस्यमतोऽन्यत्स्यादधर्म्यं च महाभुज ॥
राजानमुपतिष्ठस्व ज्येष्ठं भ्रातरमीश्वरम् । अर्हस्त्वमसि दातुं वै नादातुं भरतर्षभ । एवं ब्रुवाणं कौन्तेयं धर्मराजोऽभ्यपूजयत् ॥
data.md: You should give instead of refusing, O chief of Bharata's race!' Bibhatsu who was saying so was applauded by king Yudhishthira the just.

data.v: भीमसेनस्तु सक्रोधः प्रोवाचेदं वचस्तदा । वयं भीष्मस्य कुर्मेह प्रेतकार्याणि फल्गुन ॥
सोमदत्तस्य नृपतेर्भूरिश्रवस एव च । बाह्लीकस्य च राजर्षेर्द्रोणस्य च महात्मनः ॥
अन्येषां चैव सुहृदां कुन्ती कर्णाय दास्यति । श्राद्धानि पुरुषव्याघ्र मादात्कौरवको नृपः ॥
इति मे वर्तते बुद्धिर्मा वो नन्दन्तु शत्रवः । कष्टात्कष्टतरं यान्तु सर्वे दुर्योधनादयः । यैरियं पृथिवी सर्वा घातिता कुलपांसनैः ॥
data.md: This is what I think. Let not our enemies be gladdened. Let Duryodhana and others sink from a miserable to a more miserable position.

data.v: कुतस्त्वमद्य विस्मृत्य वैरं द्वादशवार्षिकम् । अज्ञातवासगमनं द्रौपदीशोकवर्धनम् । क्व तदा धृतराष्ट्रस्य स्नेहोऽस्मास्वभवत्तदा ॥
data.md: Alas, it was those wretches of their family who caused the whole Earth to be exterininated? How have you been able to forget that anxiety of twelve long years and out living in deep forest in cognite that was so painful to Draupadi? Where was Dhritarashtra's affection for us then?

data.v: कृष्णाजिनोपसंवीतो हृताभरणभूषणः । सार्धं पाञ्चालपुत्र्या त्वं राजानमुपजग्मिवान् । क्व तदा द्रोणभीष्मौ तौ सोमदत्तोऽपि वाभवत् ॥
यत्र त्रयोदश समा वने वन्येन जीवसि । न तदा त्वा पिता ज्येष्ठः पितृत्वेनाभिवीक्षते ॥
किं ते तद्विस्मृतं पार्थ यदेष कुलपांसनः । दुर्वृत्तो विदुरं प्राह द्यूते किं जितमित्युत ॥
तमेवंवादिनं राजा कुन्तीपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः । उवाच भ्रातरं धीमाञ्जोषमास्वेति भर्त्सयन् ॥
भीम ज्येष्ठो गुरुर्मे त्वं नातोऽन्यद्वक्तुमुत्सहे । धृतराष्ट्रो हि राजर्षिः सर्वथा मानमर्हति ॥
data.md: Arjuna said O Bhima, you are my elder brother and, therefore, my senior and preceptor. I dare not say anything more than what I have already said. The royal sage Dhritarashtra deserves to be honoured by us in every way.

data.v: न स्मरन्त्यपराद्धानि स्मरन्ति सुकृतानि च । असंभिन्नार्थमर्यादाः साधवः पुरुषोत्तमाः ॥
data.md: They who are good, they who are distinguished above the common level, they who break not the distinctions which characterise the good, remember which characterise the good, remember not the wrongs done to them but only the benefits they have got.

data.v: इदं मद्वचनात्क्षत्तः कौरवं ब्रूहि पार्थिवम् । यावदिच्छति पुत्राणां दातुं तावद्ददाम्यहम् ॥
भीष्मादीनां च सर्वेषां सुहृदामुपकारिणाम् । मम कोशादिति विभो मा भूद्भीमः सुदुर्मनाः ॥
इत्युक्ते धर्मराजस्तमर्जुनं प्रत्यपूजयत् । भीमसेनः कटाक्षेण वीक्षां चक्रे धनंजयम् ॥
data.md: Having said these words, king Yudhishthira the just highly applauded Arjuna. Meanwhile Bhimasena began to cast angry looks at Dhananjaya.

data.v: ततः स विदुरं धीमान्वाक्यमाह युधिष्ठिरः । न भीमसेने कोपं स नृपतिः कर्तुमर्हति ॥
data.md: Then Yudhishthira, gifted with great intelligence, once more addressed Vidura said, King Dhritarashtra should not be angry with Bhimasena.

data.v: परिक्लिष्टो हि भीमोऽयं हिमवृष्ट्यातपादिभिः । दुःखैर्बहुविधैर्धीमानरण्ये विदितं तव ॥
data.md: This Bhima of great intelligence was greatly afflicted by cold and rain and heat and by a thousand others griefs while living in the forest. All this you know.

data.v: किं तु मद्वचनाद्ब्रूहि राजानं भरतर्षभम् । यद्यदिच्छसि यावच्च गृह्यतां मद्गृहादिति ॥
data.md: Do you, however, instructed by me, say to the king, O foremost one of Bharata's family, that he may take from my house whatever articles he wishes and in whatever measure also he likes.

data.v: यन्मात्सर्यमयं भीमः करोति भृशदुःखितः । न तन्मनसि कर्तव्यमिति वाच्यः स पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: You shall also tell the king that he should not suffer his heart to remember this show of pride in which Bhima, deeply afflicted, has indulged.

data.v: यन्ममास्ति धनं किंचिदर्जुनस्य च वेश्मनि । तस्य स्वामी महाराज इति वाच्यः स पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: Whatever wealth I have and whatever Arjuna has in his house, the owner thereof is king Dhritarashtra. This you should tell him.

data.v: ददातु राजा विप्रेभ्यो यथेष्टं क्रियतां व्ययः । पुत्राणां सुहृदां चैव गच्छत्वानृण्यमद्य सः ॥
data.md: Let the king made gifts to Brahmanas! Let him spend as largely as he likes. Let him liberate himself from the debt he owes to his sons and well-wishers.

data.v: इदं चापि शरीरं मे तवायत्तं जनाधिप । धनानि चेति विद्धि त्वं क्षत्तर्नास्त्यत्र संशयः ॥
data.md: Let him be told besides, 'O monarch this very body of mine is at your disposal, and all the riches I have! Know this and let there be no doubt in this.

data.v: एवमुक्तस्तु राज्ञा स विदुरो बुद्धिसत्तमः । धृतराष्ट्रमुपेत्येदं वाक्यमाह महार्थवत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by king Yudhishthira, Vidura, that foremost of intelligent persons, returned to Dhritarashtra and said to hin these words of great significance, 'I at first reported your message to king Yudhishthira, Reflecting on your words, Yudhishthira of great splendour spoke highly of them.

data.v: उक्तो युधिष्ठिरो राजा भवद्वचनमादितः । स च संश्रुत्य वाक्यं ते प्रशशंस महाद्युतिः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by king Yudhishthira, Vidura, that foremost of intelligent persons, returned to Dhritarashtra and said to hin these words of great significance, 'I at first reported your message to king Yudhishthira, Reflecting on your words, Yudhishthira of great splendour spoke highly of them.

data.v: बीभत्सुश्च महातेजा निवेदयति ते गृहान् । वसु तस्य गृहे यच्च प्राणानपि च केवलान् ॥
data.md: The highly energetic Bibhatsu, also, places all his places with all the riches therein, as also his very lifc-breaths, at your disposal.

data.v: धर्मराजश्च पुत्रस्ते राज्यं प्राणान्धनानि च । अनुजानाति राजर्षे यच्चान्यदपि किंचन ॥
data.md: Your son, king Yudhishthira, too, offers you, O royal sage, his kingdom and life-breaths and riches and all else which belongs to him.

data.v: भीमस्तु सर्वदुःखानि संस्मृत्य बहुलान्युत । कृच्छ्रादिव महाबाहुरनुमन्ये विनिःश्वसन् ॥
data.md: Bhima, however, of mighty-arins, recollecting all his numberless sorrows has with difficulty given his consent, breathing many heavy sighs.

data.v: स राज्ञा धर्मशीलेन भ्रात्रा बीभत्सुना तथा । अनुनीतो महाबाहुः सौहृदे स्थापितोऽपि च ॥
data.md: That mighty-armed hero, O monarch, was solicited by the righteous king as also by Bibhatsu, and induced to treat you cordially.

data.v: न च मन्युस्त्वया कार्य इति त्वां प्राह धर्मराट् । संस्मृत्य भीमस्तद्वैरं यदन्यायवदाचरेत् ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira the just has prayed you not to be displeased for the improper conduct which Bhima has shown at the recollection of foriner hostilities. This is generally the conduct of Kshatriyas in battle, O king, and this Vrikodara is devoted to battle and the practices of Kshatriyas.

data.v: एवंप्रायो हि धर्मोऽयं क्षत्रियाणां नराधिप । युद्धे क्षत्रियधर्मे च निरतोऽयं वृकोदरः ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira the just has prayed you not to be displeased for the improper conduct which Bhima has shown at the recollection of foriner hostilities. This is generally the conduct of Kshatriyas in battle, O king, and this Vrikodara is devoted to battle and the practices of Kshatriyas.

data.v: वृकोदरकृते चाहमर्जुनश्च पुनः पुनः । प्रसादयाव नृपते भवान्प्रभुरिहास्ति यत् ॥
प्रददातु भवान्वित्तं यावदिच्छसि पार्थिव । त्वमीश्वरो नो राज्यस्य प्राणानां चेति भारत ॥
data.md: Both myself and Arjuna, O king, repeatedly beg you for pardoning Vrikodara. Be gracious to us. You are our lord, O king, you can give away as you like whatever money we have. You, O Bharata, are the master of this kingdom and of all lives in it.

data.v: ब्रह्मदेयाग्रहारांश्च पुत्राणां चौर्ध्वदेहिकम् । इतो रत्नानि गाश्चैव दासीदासमजाविकम् ॥
data.md: Let the foremost one of the Kuru race give away for the obsequial rites of his sons, all those foremost of gifts which should be given to the Brahmanas. Indeed, let him make those gifts to persons of the twice-born caste, taking away from our places jewels, gems, and kine, and slaves both male and female, and goats and sheep. Let gifts be made to also those who are poor or blind or in great distress, selecting the objects of his charity as he likes.

data.v: आनयित्वा कुरुश्रेष्ठो ब्राह्मणेभ्यः प्रयच्छतु । दीनान्धकृपणेभ्यश्च तत्र तत्र नृपाज्ञया ॥
data.md: Let the foremost one of the Kuru race give away for the obsequial rites of his sons, all those foremost of gifts which should be given to the Brahmanas. Indeed, let him make those gifts to persons of the twice-born caste, taking away from our places jewels, gems, and kine, and slaves both male and female, and goats and sheep. Let gifts be made to also those who are poor or blind or in great distress, selecting the objects of his charity as he likes.

data.v: बह्वन्नरसपानाढ्याः सभा विदुर कारय । गवां निपानान्यन्यच्च विविधं पुण्यकर्म यत् ॥
data.md: Let, O Vidura, large pavilions be made, rich with food and drink of various tastes collected in abundance. Let reservoirs of water be made for enabling kine to drink, and let other meritorious works be done.

data.v: इति मामब्रवीद्राजा पार्थश्चैव धनंजयः । यदत्रानन्तरं कार्यं तद्भवान्वक्तुमर्हति ॥
data.md: These were the words said to me by the king as also by Pritha's son Dhananjaya. You should say what should be done next.

data.v: इत्युक्तो विदुरेणाथ धृतराष्ट्रोऽभिनन्द्य तत् । मनश्चक्रे महादाने कार्त्तिक्यां जनमेजय ॥
data.md: After Vidura had said these words, O Janamejaya, Dhritarashtra expressed his satisfaction at them and made up his mind for making large presents on the day of full moon in the month of Kartika.

data.v: विदुरेणैवमुक्तस्तु धृतराष्ट्रो जनाधिपः । प्रीतिमानभवद्राजा राज्ञो जिष्णोश्च कर्मणा ॥
data.md: Thus accosted by Vidura, king, Dhritarashtra became highly please, O monarch, with the act of Yudhishthira and Jishnu.

data.v: ततोऽभिरूपान्भीष्माय ब्राह्मणानृषिसत्तमान् । पुत्रार्थे सुहृदां चैव स समीक्ष्य सहस्रशः ॥

data.md: Relent, O mother! O you of great fame, do not go into the forest now! Do you enjoy that prosperity which, acquired by power, has become Yudhishthira's today.

data.v: इति सा निश्चितैवाथ वनवासकृतक्षणा । लालप्यतां बहुविधं पुत्राणां नाकरोद्वचः ॥
data.md: Firmly resolved to retire into the forest, Kunti disregarded these lamentations of her sons.

data.v: द्रौपदी चान्वयाच्छ्वश्रूं विषण्णवदना तदा । वनवासाय गच्छन्तीं रुदती भद्रया सह ॥
data.md: Then Draupadi, with a cheerless face, accompanied by Subhadra, followed her weeping mother-in-law who was proceeding on from desire of going into the forest.

data.v: सा पुत्रान्रुदतः सर्वान्मुहुर्मुहुरवेक्षती । जगामैव महाप्राज्ञा वनाय कृतनिश्चया ॥
data.md: Highly wise and firmly resolved on retirement from the world, the blessed dame walked on, frequently loO king at her weeping children.

data.v: अन्वयुः पाण्डवास्तां तु सभृत्यान्तःपुरास्तदा । ततः प्रमृज्य साश्रूणि पुत्रान्वचनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: The Pandavas, with all their wives and servitors, continued to follow her. Restraining then her tears, she addressed her children in these words.

data.v: एवमेतन्महाबाहो यथा वदसि पाण्डव । कृतमुद्धर्षणं पूर्वं मया वः सीदतां नृप ॥
data.md: Kunti said-What you say, O mighty-armed son of Pandu, is indeed, true! O kings, formerly, when you were all dispirited, indeed, I cxcited you all.

data.v: द्यूतापहृतराज्यानां पतितानां सुखादपि । ज्ञातिभिः परिभूतानां कृतमुद्धर्षणं मया ॥
data.md: Seeing that your kingdom was taken away from you by a match at dice, seeing that you all fell from happiness, seeing that you were governed over by kinsmen, I instilled courage and high thoughts into your minds.

data.v: कथं पाण्डोर्न नश्येत संततिः पुरुषर्षभाः । यशश्च वो न नश्येत इति चोद्धर्षणं कृतम् ॥
data.md: O foremost of men, I encouraged you so that the sons of Pandu might not be lost, so that their fame might not be lost.

data.v: यूयमिन्द्रसमाः सर्वे देवतुल्यपराक्रमाः । मा परेषां मुखप्रेक्षाः स्थेत्येवं तत्कृतं मया ॥
data.md: You are all equal to Indra. Your prowess resembles that of the very celestials. I acted thus so that you might not live, depending upon others.

data.v: कथं धर्मभृतां श्रेष्ठो राजा त्वं वासवोपमः । पुनर्वने न दुःखी स्या इति चोद्धर्षणं कृतम् ॥
data.md: I instilled courage into your hearts so that you who are the foremost of all righteous persons, who are equal to Vasava, might not again go into the forest and live in misery.

data.v: नागायुतसमप्राणः ख्यातविक्रमपौरुषः । नायं भीमोऽत्ययं गच्छेदिति चोद्धर्षणं कृतम् ॥
data.md: I instilled courage into your hearts so that this Bhima who has the strength of ten thousand elephants and whose prowess and manliness are widely known, might not sink into insignificance and ruin.

data.v: भीमसेनादवरजस्तथायं वासवोपमः । विजयो नावसीदेत इति चोद्धर्षणं कृतम् ॥
data.md: I instilled courage into your hearts so that this Vijaya, who was born after Bhimasena, and who is equal to Vasava himself, might not be cheerless.

data.v: नकुलः सहदेवश्च तथेमौ गुरुवर्तिनौ । क्षुधा कथं न सीदेतामिति चोद्धर्षणं कृतम् ॥
data.md: I instilled courage into your hearts so that Nakula and Sahadeva, who are always devoted to their elders, may not be weakened and rendered cheerless by hunger.

data.v: इयं च बृहती श्यामा श्रीमत्यायतलोचना । वृथा सभातले क्लिष्टा मा भूदिति च तत्कृतम् ॥
data.md: I acted thus in order that this lady of welldeveloped forms and of large eyes might not suffer the wrongs inflicted on her in the public hall without being avenged.

data.v: प्रेक्षन्त्या मे तदा हीमां वेपन्तीं कदलीमिव । स्त्रीधर्मिणीमनिन्द्याङ्गीं तथा द्यूतपराजिताम् ॥
दुःशासनो यदा मौढ्याद्दासीवत्पर्यकर्षत । तदैव विदितं मह्यं पराभूतमिदं कुलम् ॥
विषण्णाः कुरवश्चैव तदा मे श्वशुरादयः । यदैषा नाथमिच्छन्ती व्यलपत्कुररी यथा ॥
data.md: The Kurus, viz., my father-in-law and others, were cheerless when she, desirous of a protector, bewailed like a she-osprey.

data.v: केशपक्षे परामृष्टा पापेन हतबुद्धिना । यदा दुःशासनेनैषा तदा मुह्याम्यहं नृप ॥
data.md: When she was dragged by her fair locks by the sinful Dushasana without little intelligence, I lost my senses, O king.

data.v: युष्मत्तेजोविवृद्ध्यर्थं मया ह्युद्धर्षणं कृतम् । तदानीं विदुरावाक्यैरिति तद्वित्त पुत्रकाः ॥
data.md: Know, that for increasing your energy, I instilled that courage into your hearts by reciting the words of Vidula, O my sons.

data.v: कथं न राजवंशोऽयं नश्येत्प्राप्य सुतान्मम । पाण्डोरिति मया पुत्र तस्मादुद्धर्षणं कृतम् ॥
data.md: I instilled courage into your hearts, O my sons, so that the family of Pandu, represented by my children, might not be lost.

data.v: न तस्य पुत्रः पौत्रौ वा कुत एव स पार्थिव । लभते सुकृताँल्लोकान्यस्माद्वंशः प्रणश्यति ॥
data.md: The sons and grandsons of that person who brings a family to infamy never succeed in acquiring the regions of the righteous. Indeed, the ancestors of the Kaurava race, were in danger of losing those happy regions which had become theirs.

data.v: भुक्तं राज्यफलं पुत्रा भर्तुर्मे विपुलं पुरा । महादानानि दत्तानि पीतः सोमो यथाविधि ॥
data.md: As for myself, O my sons, I have, before this, enjoyed the grcat fruits of that sovereignty which my husband had won. I have made large gifts. I have duly drunk the Soma-juice in sacrifice.

data.v: साहं नात्मफलार्थं वै वासुदेवमचूचुदम् । विदुरायाः प्रलापैस्तैः प्लावनार्थं तु तत्कृतम् ॥
data.md: It was not for my own sake that I had urged Vasudeva with the stirring words of Vidula. It was for your sake that I had asked you to follow that advice.

data.v: नाहं राज्यफलं पुत्र कामये पुत्रनिर्जितम् । पतिलोकानहं पुण्यान्कामये तपसा विभो ॥
data.md: O my sons, I do not wish for the fruits of that sovereignty which has been acquired by my children. O you of great power, I wish to attain, by my penances, to those happy regions which have been acquired by my husband.

data.v: श्वश्रूश्वशुरयोः कृत्वा शुश्रूषां वनवासिनोः । तपसा शोषयिष्यामि युधिष्ठिर कलेवरम् ॥
data.md: By rendering obedient service to my fatherin-law and mother-in-law both of whom with to take up their residence in the forest, and by penances, I wish, O Yudhishthira, to exhaust my body.

data.v: निवर्तस्व कुरुश्रेष्ठ भीमसेनादिभिः सह । धर्मे ते धीयतां बुद्धिर्मनस्ते महदस्तु च ॥
data.md: Do you cease to follow me, O foremost one of Kuru's race, along with Bhima and others. Let your understanding be always devoted to virtue. Let your mind be always great.

data.v: कुन्त्यास्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा पाण्डवा राजसत्तम । व्रीडिताः संन्यवर्तन्त पाञ्चाल्या सहितानघाः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of Kunti, the sinless Pandavas, O best of kings, became ashamed. They, therefore, desisted, along with the princess of Panchala, from following her.

data.v: ततः शब्दो महानासीत्सर्वेषामेव भारत । अन्तःपुराणां रुदतां दृष्ट्वा कुन्तीं तथागताम् ॥
data.md: Seeing Kunti determined upon going into the forest, the ladies of the Pandava family uttered loud lamentations.

data.v: प्रदक्षिणमथावृत्य राजानं पाण्डवास्तदा । अभिवाद्य न्यवर्तन्त पृथां तामनिवर्त्य वै ॥
data.md: The Pandavas then went round the king and saluted him duly. They ccased to follow further, having failed to persuade Pritha to return.

data.v: ततोऽब्रवीन्महाराजो धृतराष्ट्रोऽम्बिकासुतः । गान्धारीं विदुरं चैव समाभाष्य निगृह्य च ॥
युधिष्ठिरस्य जननी देवी साधु निवर्त्यताम् । यथा युधिष्ठिरः प्राह तत्सर्वं सत्यमेव हि ॥
data.md: Then Ambika's energetic son, viz., Dhritarashtra, addressing Gandhari and Vidura and supporting himself on them, said, Let the royal mother of Yudhishthira cease to go with us! What Yudhishthira has said, is all very true.

data.v: पुत्रैश्वर्यं महदिदमपास्य च महाफलम् । का नु गच्छेद्वनं दुर्गं पुत्रानुत्सृज्य मूढवत् ॥
data.md: Renouncing this high prosperity of her sons, abandoning those high fruits that may be hers, why should she go into the inaccessible forest, leaving her children like a person of little intelligence?

data.v: राज्यस्थया तपस्तप्तं दानं दत्तं व्रतं कृतम् । अनया शक्यमद्येह श्रूयतां च वचो मम ॥
data.md: Living in the enjoyment of sovereignty, she is capable of practicing penances and observing the great vow of gifts. Let her, therefore, listen to my words.

data.v: गान्धारि परितुष्टोऽस्मि वध्वाः शुश्रूषणेन वै । तस्मात्त्वमेनां धर्मज्ञे समनुज्ञातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: O Gandhari, I have been much pleased with the services rendered to me by this daughter-inlaw of mine. Conversant as you are with all duties, you should command her to return.

data.v: इत्युक्ता सौबलेयी तु राज्ञा कुन्तीमुवाच ह । तत्सर्वं राजवचनं स्वं च वाक्यं विशेषवत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by her husband, the daughter of Subala repeated to Kunti all those words of the old king and added her own words of grave meaning.

data.v: न च सा वनवासाय देवीं कृतमतिं तदा । शक्नोत्युपावर्तयितुं कुन्तीं धर्मपरां सतीम् ॥
data.md: She, however, could not make Kunti to desist inasmuch as that chaste lady, devoted to virtue, had determined upon living in the forest.

data.v: तस्यास्तु तं स्थिरं ज्ञात्वा व्यवसायं कुरुस्त्रियः । निवृत्तांश्च कुरुश्रेष्ठान्दृष्ट्वा प्ररुरुदुस्तदा ॥
data.md: The Kuru ladies, understanding how firm her resolution was about her retirement into the forest, and seeing that those foremost ones of Kuru's race (viz., their own lords), had ceased to follow her, began to bewail aloud.

data.v: उपावृत्तेषु पार्थेषु सर्वेष्वन्तःपुरेषु च । ययौ राजा महाप्राज्ञो धृतराष्ट्रो वनं तदा ॥
data.md: After all the sons of Pritha and all the ladies had returned homewards, the highly wise king Yudhishthira his journey to the forest.

data.v: पाण्डवा अपि दीनास्ते दुःखशोकपरायणाः । यानैः स्त्रीसहिताः सर्वे पुरं प्रविविशुस्तदा ॥
data.md: The Pandavas, exceedingly cheerless and stricken with grief and sorrow accompanied by their wives, returned to the city, on their cars.

data.v: तदहृष्टमिवाकूजं गतोत्सवमिवाभवत् । नगरं हास्तिनपुरं सस्त्रीवृद्धकुमारकम् ॥
data.md: At that time the city of Hastinapur, with its entire population of men, both old and young, and women, became dispirited and plunged into grief. No festivals of rejoicing were observed.

data.v: सर्वे चासन्निरुत्साहाः पाण्डवा जातमन्यवः । कुन्त्या हीनाः सुदुःखार्ता वत्सा इव विनाकृताः ॥
data.md: Afflicted with grief, the Pandavas were shorn of energy. Abandoned by Kunti, they were deeply afflicted with grief, like calves destitute of their dais.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्रस्तु तेनाह्ना गत्वा सुमहदन्तरम् । ततो भागीरथीतीरे निवासमकरोत्प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra reached that day a place far distant from the city. The powerful king arrived at last on the banks of the Bhagirathi and took rest there for the night.

data.v: प्रादुष्कृता यथान्यायमग्नयो वेदपारगैः । व्यराजन्त द्विजश्रेष्ठैस्तत्र तत्र तपोधनैः । प्रादुष्कृताग्निरभवत्स च वृद्धो नराधिपः ॥
data.md: Brahmanas knowing the Vedas duly ignited their sacred fires in that retreat of ascetics. Surrounded by those foremost of Brahmanas, those sacred fires shonc forth in beauty. The sacred fire of the old king was also lighted up.

data.v: स राजाग्नीन्पर्युपास्य हुत्वा च विधिवत्तदा । संध्यागतं सहस्रांशुमुपातिष्ठत भारत ॥
data.md: Sitting near his own fire, he poured libations on it according to due rites, and then adored the thousand-raycd sun as he was on the point of setting.

data.v: विदुरः संजयश्चैव राज्ञः शय्यां कुशैस्ततः । चक्रतुः कुरुवीरस्य गान्धार्याश्चाविदूरतः ॥
data.md: Then Vidura and Sanjaya made a bed for the king by spreading some blades of Kusha grass. Near the bed of that Kuru hero they made another for Gandhari.

data.v: गान्धार्याः संनिकर्षे तु निषसाद कुशेष्वथ । युधिष्ठिरस्य जननी कुन्ती साधुव्रते स्थिता ॥
data.md: Near to Gandhari, Yudhishthira's mother Kunti, observant of excellent vows, happily laid herself down.

data.v: तेषां संश्रवणे चापि निषेदुर्विदुरादयः । याजकाश्च यथोद्देशं द्विजा ये चानुयायिनः ॥
data.md: Within bearing-distance of those three, slept Vidura and others. The Yajaka Brahmanas and other followers of the king laid slept on their respective beds.

data.v: प्राधीतद्विजमुख्या सा संप्रज्वालितपावका । बभूव तेषां रजनी ब्राह्मीव प्रीतिवर्धनी ॥
data.md: The foremost of Brahmanas, who were there, chanted aloud many sacred hymns. The sacrificial fires blazed forth all around. That night, therefore, seemed as delightful to them as a Brahmi night.

data.v: ततो रात्र्यां व्यतीतायां कृतपूर्वाह्णिकक्रियाः । हुत्वाग्निं विधिवत्सर्वे प्रययुस्ते यथाक्रमम् । उदङ्मुखा निरीक्षन्त उपवासपरायणाः ॥
data.md: When the night passed away, thcy all arose from their beds and performed their morning acts. Pouring libations then on the sacred fire, they continued their journey.

data.v: स तेषामतिदुःखोऽभून्निवासः प्रथमेऽहनि । शोचतां शोच्यमानानां पौरजानपदैर्जनैः ॥
data.md: Their first days' expe:"ence of the forest proved very painful to them of grieving hearts, them who were grieved by the inhabitants of both the city and the provinces of the Kuru kingdom.

data.v: ततो भागीरथीतीरे मेध्ये पुण्यजनोचिते । निवासमकरोद्राजा विदुरस्य मते स्थितः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Acting according to the advice of Vidura, the king took up his residence on the banks of the Bhagirathi which were sacred and deserved to be inhabited by the righteous.

data.v: तत्रैनं पर्युपातिष्ठन्ब्राह्मणा राष्ट्रवासिनः । क्षत्रविट्शूद्रसंघाश्च बहवो भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: There many Brahmanas who had taken up their residence in the forest, as also many Kshatriyas, Vaishyas, and Shudras, came to see the old king.

data.v: स तैः परिवृतो राजा कथाभिरभिनन्द्य तान् । अनुजज्ञे सशिष्यान्वै विधिवत्प्रतिपूज्य च ॥
data.md: Silting in their midst, he plcased them all by his words. Having duly adored the Brahmanas with their disciples, he disinissed them all.

data.v: सायाह्ने स महीपालस्ततो गङ्गामुपेत्य ह । चकार विधिवच्छौचं गान्धारी च यशस्विनी ॥
data.md: As evening camne, the king, and the illustrious Gandhari, both descended into the stream of the Bhagirathi and duly performed their ablutions for purifying themselves.

data.v: तथैवान्ये पृथक्सर्वे तीर्थेष्वाप्लुत्य भारत । चक्रुः सर्वाः क्रियास्तत्र पुरुषा विदुरादयः ॥
data.md: The king and the queen, and Vidura and others, O Bharata, having bathed in the sacred river, performed the usual rites of religion.

data.v: कृतशौचं ततो वृद्धं श्वशुरं कुन्तिभोजजा । गान्धारीं च पृथा राजन्गङ्गातीरमुपानयत् ॥
data.md: After the king had purified himself by a bath, the daughter of Kuntibhoja, gently conducted both him who was to her as her father-in-law, and Gandhari, from the water into the dry bank.

data.v: राज्ञस्तु याजकैस्तत्र कृतो वेदीपरिस्तरः । जुहाव तत्र वह्निं स नृपतिः सत्यसंगरः ॥
data.md: The Yajakas had made a sacrificial alter there for the king. Devoted to truth, the latter poured libations then on the fire.

data.v: ततो भागीरथीतीरात्कुरुक्षेत्रं जगाम सः । सानुगो नृपतिर्विद्वान्नियतः संयतेन्द्रियः ॥
data.md: From the banks of the Bhagirathi the old king, with his followers, observing vows and with senses controlled, then proceeded to Kurukshetra.

data.v: तत्राश्रमपदं धीमानभिगम्य स पार्थिवः । आससादाथ राजर्षिः शतयूपं मनीषिणम् ॥
data.md: Endued with great intelligence, the king arrived at the hermitage of the royal sage Shatayupa of grcat wisdom and saw him.

data.v: स हि राजा महानासीत्केकयेषु परंतपः । स पुत्रं मनुजैश्वर्ये निवेश्य वनमाविशत् ॥
data.md: Shatayupa, O scorcher of enemies had been the great king of the Kaikeyas. Having made over the sovereignty of his kingdom to his son, he had come into the forest,

data.v: तेनासौ सहितो राजा ययौ व्यासाश्रमं तदा । तत्रैनं विधिवद्राजन्प्रत्यगृह्णात्कुरूद्वहम् ॥
data.md: Shatayupa received king Dhritarashtra with due rites. Accompanied by him, the latter went to the hermitage of Vyasa.

data.v: स दीक्षां तत्र संप्राप्य राजा कौरवनन्दनः । शतयूपाश्रमे तस्मिन्निवासमकरोत्तदा ॥
data.md: Arrived at Vyasa's hermitage the delighter of the Kurus received his initiation into the forest mode of life. Returning he took up his residence in the hermitage of Shatayupa.

data.v: तस्मै सर्वं विधिं राजन्राजाचख्यौ महामतिः । आरण्यकं महाराज व्यासस्यानुमते तदा ॥
data.md: The great Shatayupa instructed Dhritarashtra in all the rites of the forest mode, at the command of Vyasa.

data.v: एवं स तपसा राजा धृतराष्ट्रो महामनाः । योजयामास चात्मानं तांश्चाप्यनुचरांस्तदा ॥
data.md: Thus the great Dhritarashtra set himself to the practice of penances, and all his followers also to the same course of conduct.

data.v: तथैव देवी गान्धारी वल्कलाजिनवासिनी । कुन्त्या सह महाराज समानव्रतचारिणी ॥
data.md: Queen Gandhari also, O monarch, along with Kunti, put on barks of trees and deerskins, and began to observe the same vows as her husband.

data.v: कर्मणा मनसा वाचा चक्षुषा चापि ते नृप । संनियम्येन्द्रियग्राममास्थिताः परमं तपः ॥
data.md: Restraining their senses in thought, words, and deeds, as well as by cye, they began to perforin sever austerities.

data.v: त्वगस्थिभूतः परिशुष्कमांसो; जटाजिनी वल्कलसंवृताङ्गः । स पार्थिवस्तत्र तपश्चचार; महर्षिवत्तीव्रमपेतदोषः ॥
data.md: Shorn of all stupefaction of mind, king Dhritarashthra began to practice vows and penances like a great Rishi, reducing his body to skin and bones, for his flesh was all dried up, bearing inatted locks on heard, and his person clad in barks and skins.

data.v: क्षत्ता च धर्मार्थविदग्र्यबुद्धिः; ससंजयस्तं नृपतिं सदारम् । उपाचरद्घोरतपो जितात्मा; तदा कृशो वल्कलचीरवासाः ॥
data.md: Vidura, conversant with the true interpretations of Virtue, and gifted with great intelligence, as also Sanjaya, waited upon the old king with his wife. Both of them with souls under control, Vidura and Sanjaya also reduced themselves, and wore barks and rags.

data.v: ततस्तस्मिन्मुनिश्रेष्ठा राजानं द्रष्टुमभ्ययुः । नारदः पर्वतश्चैव देवलश्च महातपाः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Those foremost of ascetics, viz., Narada, Parvata and Devala of Austere penances, came there to see king Dhritarashtra.

data.v: द्वैपायनः सशिष्यश्च सिद्धाश्चान्ये मनीषिणः । शतयूपश्च राजर्षिर्वृद्धः परमधार्मिकः ॥
data.md: The Island-born Vyasa with all his disciples, and other persons gifted success, and the royal sage Shatayupa of advanced years and possessed of greit merit, also came.

data.v: तेषां कुन्ती महाराज पूजां चक्रे यथाविधि । ते चापि तुतुषुस्तस्यास्तापसाः परिचर्यया ॥
data.md: Kunti adored them with due rites, O king. All those ascetics were highly pleased with the adorations offered to them.

data.v: तत्र धर्म्याः कथास्तात चक्रुस्ते परमर्षयः । रमयन्तो महात्मानं धृतराष्ट्रं जनाधिपम् ॥
data.md: Those great Rishis pleased the high souled king Dhritarashtra with discourses on religion and virtue.

data.v: कथान्तरे तु कस्मिंश्चिद्देवर्षिर्नारदस्तदा । कथामिमामकथयत्सर्वप्रत्यक्षदर्शिवान् ॥
data.md: At the conclusion of their converse, the celestial Rishi Narada, seeing all things as objects of direct perception, said the following words.

data.v: पुरा प्रजापतिसमो राजासीदकुतोभयः । सहस्रचित्य इत्युक्तः शतयूपपितामहः ॥
data.md: Narada said There was king of the Kaikeyas, possessed of great prosperity and perfectly fearless. His name was Sahasrachitya and he was the grandfather of the Shatayupa.

data.v: स पुत्रे राज्यमासज्य ज्येष्ठे परमधार्मिके । सहस्रचित्यो धर्मात्मा प्रविवेश वनं नृपः ॥
data.md: Resigning his kingdoin to his highly virtuous eldest Soil, the virtuous king Sahasrachitya retired into the forest.

data.v: स गत्वा तपसः पारं दीप्तस्य स नराधिपः । पुरंदरस्य संस्थानं प्रतिपेदे महामनाः ॥
data.md: Reaching the other end of blazing penances, that king, gifted with great splendour, attained to the region of Purandara where he continued to live in his company.

data.v: दृष्टपूर्वः स बहुशो राजन्संपतता मया । महेन्द्रसदने राजा तपसा दग्धकिल्बिषः ॥
data.md: On many occasions, while visiting the region of Indra, O king, I saw that monarch, whose sins had all been consumed by penances, living in Indra's palace.

data.v: तथा शैलालयो राजा भगदत्तपितामहः । तपोबलेनैव नृपो महेन्द्रसदनं गतः ॥
data.md: Similarly, king Shailya, the grandfather of Bhagadatta, attained to the region of Indra by the power alone of his penances.

data.v: तथा पृषध्रो नामासीद्राजा वज्रधरोपमः । स चापि तपसा लेभे नाकपृष्ठमितो नृपः ॥
data.md: There was another king, O monarch, of the name of Prishadhra who resembled the holder of the thunder-bolt himself. That king also by his penances proceeded from the Earth to the celestial region.

data.v: अस्मिन्नरण्ये नृपते मान्धातुरपि चात्मजः । पुरुकुत्सो नृपः सिद्धिं महतीं समवाप्तवान् ॥
data.md: In this very forest, o king, that king, viz., Purukutsa, the son of Mandhatri, acquired great Success.

data.v: भार्या समभवद्यस्य नर्मदा सरितां वरा । सोऽस्मिन्नरण्ये नृपतिस्तपस्तप्त्वा दिवं गतः ॥
data.md: That foremost of rivers, viz., Narmada, became the consort of that king. Having practised penances in this very forest, that king procceded to the celestial region.

data.v: शशलोमा च नामासीद्राजा परमधार्मिकः । स चाप्यस्मिन्वने तप्त्वा तपो दिवमवाप्तवान् ॥
data.md: There was another king, highly righteous, of the name of Shashaloman. He, too, performed severe austerities in this forest and then ascended to the celestial region.

data.v: द्वैपायनप्रसादाच्च त्वमपीदं तपोवनम् । राजन्नवाप्य दुष्प्रापां सिद्धिमग्र्यां गमिष्यसि ॥
data.md: You also, O monarch, having arrived at this forest, shall, through the grace of the Islandborn, attain to a very high cnd and which is difficult of attainment.

data.v: त्वं चापि राजशार्दूल तपसोऽन्ते श्रिया वृतः । गान्धारीसहितो गन्ता गतिं तेषां महात्मनाम् ॥
data.md: You also. O foremost of kings, at the termination of your penances, shall become gifted with great prosperity and, accompanied by Gandhari, attain to the end reached by those great ones.

data.v: पाण्डुः स्मरति नित्यं च बलहन्तुः समीपतः । त्वां सदैव महीपाल स त्वां श्रेयसि योक्ष्यति ॥
data.md: Living in the presence of the destroyer of Vala, Pandu thinks of you always. He will, O monarch, certainly assist you in the attainment of Prosperity.

data.v: तव शुश्रूषया चैव गान्धार्याश्च यशस्विनी । भर्तुः सलोकतां कुन्ती गमिष्यति वधूस्तव ॥
data.md: Through serving you and Gandhari, this daughter-in-law of yours, possessed of great fame, will attain to residence with her husband in the other world.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्य जननी स हि धर्मः सनातनः । वयमेतत्प्रपश्यामो नृपते दिव्यचक्षुषा ॥
data.md: She is the mother of Yudhishthria who is the eternal Dharma. We see all this, O king, with out spiritual vision.

data.v: प्रवेक्ष्यति महात्मानं विदुरश्च युधिष्ठिरम् । संजयस्त्वदनुध्यानात्पूतः स्वर्गमवाप्स्यति ॥
data.md: Vidura will enter into the high souled Yudhishthira. Sanjaya also, through meditation, will ascend from this world into the celestial region.

data.v: एतच्छ्रुत्वा कौरवेन्द्रो महात्मा; सहैव पत्न्या प्रीतिमान्प्रत्यगृह्णात् । विद्वान्वाक्यं नारदस्य प्रशस्य; चक्रे पूजां चातुलां नारदाय ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said That great chief of Kuru's race, endued with learning, having, with his wife, heard these words of Narada, praised them and adored Narada with unprecedented honors.

data.v: तथा सर्वे नारदं विप्रसंघाः; संपूजयामासुरतीव राजन् । राज्ञः प्रीत्या धृतराष्ट्रस्य ते वै; पुनः पुनः समहृष्टास्तदानीम् ॥
data.md: The assembly of Brahmanas there present became filled with great joy, and desirous of pleasing king Dhritarashtra, o monarch, themselves worshipped Narada with great respect.

data.v: नारदस्य तु तद्वाक्यं प्रशशंसुर्द्विजोत्तमाः । शतयूपस्तु राजर्षिर्नारदं वाक्यमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Those foremost of twice-born persons also lauded the words of Narada. Then the royal sage Shatayupa, addressing Narada, said, Your holy self has increased the devotion of the Kuru king, of all those people here, and of myself also, O you of great splendour.

data.v: अहो भगवता श्रद्धा कुरुराजस्य वर्धिता । सर्वस्य च जनस्यास्य मम चैव महाद्युते ॥
data.md: Those foremost of twice-born persons also lauded the words of Narada. Then the royal sage Shatayupa, addressing Narada, said, Your holy self has increased the devotion of the Kuru king, of all those people here, and of myself also, O you of great splendour.

data.v: अस्ति काचिद्विवक्षा तु मम तां गदतः शृणु । धृतराष्ट्रं प्रति नृपं देवर्षे लोकपूजित ॥
data.md: I wish to ask you something. Listen to me as I say it. It is about king, Dhritarashtra,O celestial Rishi, that are adored of all the worlds.

data.v: सर्ववृत्तान्ततत्त्वज्ञो भवान्दिव्येन चक्षुषा । युक्तः पश्यसि देवर्षे गतीर्वै विविधा नृणाम् ॥
data.md: You know the truth of every affair. Gifted with celestial vision, you behold, O twice-born Rishi, what the various ends are of human beings.

data.v: उक्तवान्नृपतीनां त्वं महेन्द्रस्य सलोकताम् । न त्वस्य नृपतेर्लोकाः कथितास्ते महामुने ॥
data.md: You have said what the end has been of the kings mentioned by you, viz., association with the king of the celestials. You have not, however, O great Rishi, decured what those regions are which will be acquired by this king.

data.v: स्थानमस्य क्षितिपतेः श्रोतुमिच्छाम्यहं विभो । त्वत्तः कीदृक्कदा वेति तन्ममाचक्ष्व पृच्छतः ॥
data.md: O powerful one, I wish to hear from you what region will be acquired by the royal Dhritarashtra. You should tell me truly the kind of region that will be his and the time when he will attain to it.

data.v: इत्युक्तो नारदस्तेन वाक्यं सर्वमनोनुगम् । व्याजहार सतां मध्ये दिव्यदर्शी महातपाः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by him, Narada of celestial vision and endued with austere penances, said in the midst of the assembly these words highly agreeable to the minds of all.

data.v: यदृच्छया शक्रसदो गत्वा शक्रं शचीपतिम् । दृष्टवानस्मि राजर्षे तत्र पाण्डुं नराधिपम् ॥
data.md: Going at my will to the palace of Shakra, I have seen Shakara the lord of Sachi; and there, O royal sage, I have seen king Pandu.

data.v: तत्रेयं धृतराष्ट्रस्य कथा समभवन्नृप । तपसो दुश्चरस्यास्य यदयं तप्यते नृपः ॥
data.md: There is a talk arose, O monarch, about this Dhritarashtra and those highly austere penaces which he is performing.

data.v: तत्राहमिदमश्रौषं शक्रस्य वदतो नृप । वर्षाणि त्रीणि शिष्टानि राज्ञोऽस्य परमायुषः ॥
data.md: There I heard from the lips of Shakra himself that there are three years yet of the period of life of this king.

data.v: ततः कुबेरभवनं गान्धारीसहितो नृपः । विहर्ता धृतराष्ट्रोऽयं राजराजाभिपूजितः ॥
data.md: After that, king Dhritarashtra, accompanied by his wife Gandhari, will go to the regions of Kubera and be highly honored by that king of kings. He will go there on a car moving at his will, his his body adorned with celestial ornaments.

data.v: कामगेन विमानेन दिव्याभरणभूषितः । ऋषिपुत्रो महाभागस्तपसा दग्धकिल्बिषः ॥
संचरिष्यति लोकांश्च देवगन्धर्वरक्षसाम् । स्वच्छन्देनेति धर्मात्मा यन्मां त्वं परिपृच्छसि ॥
data.md: He is the son of a Rishi; he is highly blessed; he has exhausted all his sins by his penances. Gifted with a righteous soul, he will roam at will through the regions of the celestials, the Gandharvas, and the Rakshasas. That about which you have enquired, is a mystery to the gods. Through my affection for you, I have said this high truth.

data.v: देवगुह्यमिदं प्रीत्या मया वः कथितं महत् । भवन्तो हि श्रुतधनास्तपसा दग्धकिल्बिषाः ॥
data.md: You all are possessed of the wealth of Shrutis and have burnt all your sins by your penances.

data.v: इति ते तस्य तच्छ्रुत्वा देवर्षेर्मधुरं वचः । सर्वे सुमनसः प्रीता बभूवुः स च पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Hearing these sweet words of the celestial Rishi, all the persons there assembled, as also king Dhritarastra became greatly pleased.

data.v: एवं कथाभिरन्वास्य धृतराष्ट्रं मनीषिणः । विप्रजग्मुर्यथाकामं ते सिद्धगतिमास्थिताः ॥
data.md: Having cheered Dhritarashtra of great wisdom with such talk, they left the place, going away by the path that belongs to those who are crowned with success.

data.v: वनं गते कौरवेन्द्रे दुःखशोकसमाहताः । बभूवुः पाण्डवा राजन्मातृशोकेन चार्दिताः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, Upon the retirement of the king of the Kurus into the forest, the Pandavas, O king, afflicted besides by grief on account of their mother, became very dispirited.

data.v: तथा पौरजनः सर्वः शोचन्नास्ते जनाधिपम् । कुर्वाणाश्च कथास्तत्र ब्राह्मणा नृपतिं प्रति ॥
data.md: The citizens also of Hastinapur were possessed by deep sorrow. The Brahmanas always talked of the old king.

data.v: कथं नु राजा वृद्धः स वने वसति निर्जने । गान्धारी च महाभागा सा च कुन्ती पृथा कथम् ॥
data.md: How, indeed, will the king, who has become old, live in the solitary forest? How will the highly blessed Gandhari, and Pritha, the daughter of Kuntibhoja, live there?

data.v: सुखार्हः स हि राजर्षिर्न सुखं तन्महावनम् । किमवस्थः समासाद्य प्रज्ञाचक्षुर्हतात्मजः ॥
data.md: The royal sage has always lived in the enjoyment of every comfort. He will certainly be very miserable. Arrived in the deep forest, what is now the condition of that personage of royal descent, who is, again, bereft of vision?

data.v: सुदुष्करं कृतवती कुन्ती पुत्रानपश्यती । राज्यश्रियं परित्यज्य वनवासमरोचयत् ॥
data.md: Difficult is the feat that Kunti has performed by separating herself from her sons. Alas, renouncing royal prosperity, she choose a life in the forest.

data.v: विदुरः किमवस्थश्च भ्रातुः शुश्रूषुरात्मवान् । स च गावल्गणिर्धीमान्भर्तृपिण्डानुपालकः ॥
data.md: What, again, is the condition of Vidura who is always devoted to the service of his elder brother? How also is the intelligent son of Gavalgani who is so faithful to the salt given him by his master?

data.md: King Yudhishthira pursued him alone, as he ran and entered the deep forest, sometimes seen and sometimes not seen by the pursuer.

data.v: भो भो विदुर राजाहं दयितस्ते युधिष्ठिरः । इति ब्रुवन्नरपतिस्तं यत्नादभ्यधावत ॥
data.md: He said aloud, 'O Vidura, O Vidura, I am king Yudhishthira, your favourite-Exclaiming thus, Yudhishthira, with great exertion, followed Vidura.

data.v: ततो विविक्त एकान्ते तस्थौ बुद्धिमतां वरः । विदुरो वृक्षमाश्रित्य कंचित्तत्र वनान्तरे ॥
data.md: Having reached a solitary spot in the forest that foremost of intelligent men, viz., Vidura, stood still, learning against a tree.

data.v: तं राजा क्षीणभूयिष्ठमाकृतीमात्रसूचितम् । अभिजज्ञे महाबुद्धिं महाबुद्धिर्युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: He was greatly emaciated. He retained only the shape of a human being. Yudhishthira of great intelligence recognised him, however.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरोऽहमस्मीति वाक्यमुक्त्वाग्रतः स्थितः । विदुरस्याश्रवे राजा स च प्रत्याह संज्ञया ॥
data.md: Standing before him, Yudhishthira addressed him saying, 'I am Yudhishthira.' Indeed, adoring Vidura properly., Yudhishthira said these words in the hearing of Vidura.

data.v: ततः सोऽनिमिषो भूत्वा राजानं समुदैक्षत । संयोज्य विदुरस्तस्मिन्दृष्टिं दृष्ट्या समाहितः ॥
data.md: Meanwhile Vidura looked at the king steadfastly. Casting his look thus on the king, he stood motionless in Yoga.

data.v: विवेश विदुरो धीमान्गात्रैर्गात्राणि चैव ह । प्राणान्प्राणेषु च दधदिन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियेषु च ॥
data.md: Endued with great intelligence, he then (by his Yoga-power) entered the body of Yudhishthira, limb by limb. He united his vital airs with those of the king, and his senses with the king's senses.

data.v: स योगबलमास्थाय विवेश नृपतेस्तनुम् । विदुरो धर्मराजस्य तेजसा प्रज्वलन्निव ॥
data.md: Indeed, with the help of Yoga-power, Vidura, burning with energy, thus entered the body of king Yudhishthira the just.

data.v: विदुरस्य शरीरं तत्तथैव स्तब्धलोचनम् । वृक्षाश्रितं तदा राजा ददर्श गतचेतनम् ॥
data.md: Meanwhile the body of Vidura continued to lean against the tree with eyes fixed. The king soon saw that life had fled out of it.

data.v: बलवन्तं तथात्मानं मेने बहुगुणं तदा । धर्मराजो महातेजास्तच्च सस्मार पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: At the same time, he felt that he himself had become stronger than before and that he had gained many additional virtues and accomplishments. Gifted with great learning and energy, O monarch, Pandu's son, king Yudhishthira the just, then recollected his own state before his birth among men, Possessed of mighty energy, he had heard of Yoga practice from Vyasa.

data.v: पौराणमात्मनः सर्वं विद्यावान्स विशां पते । योगधर्मं महातेजा व्यासेन कथितं यथा ॥
data.md: At the same time, he felt that he himself had become stronger than before and that he had gained many additional virtues and accomplishments. Gifted with great learning and energy, O monarch, Pandu's son, king Yudhishthira the just, then recollected his own state before his birth among men, Possessed of mighty energy, he had heard of Yoga practice from Vyasa.

data.v: धर्मराजस्तु तत्रैनं संचस्कारयिषुस्तदा । दग्धुकामोऽभवद्विद्वानथ वै वागभाषत ॥
भो भो राजन्न दग्धव्यमेतद्विदुरसंज्ञकम् । कलेवरमिहैतत्ते धर्म एष सनातनः ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira the just, endued with great learning, became desirous of doing the last rites to the body of Vidura, and wished to cremate it duly. An invisible voice was then heard, saying, 'O king, this body which belonged to him called Vidura should not be cremated. In him is your body also. He is the eternal deity of Virtue.

data.v: लोकाः संतानका नाम भविष्यन्त्यस्य पार्थिव । यतिधर्ममवाप्तोऽसौ नैव शोच्यः परंतप ॥
data.md: Those happy regions which pass by the name of Santanika will be his, O Bharata. he performed the duties of Yatis. You should not, O scorcher of enemies, grieve for him at all.

data.v: इत्युक्तो धर्मराजः स विनिवृत्य ततः पुनः । राज्ञो वैचित्रवीर्यस्य तत्सर्वं प्रत्यवेदयत् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, king Yudhishthira the just returned from the place, and represented everything to the royal son of Vichitravirya.

data.v: ततः स राजा द्युतिमान्स च सर्वो जनस्तदा । भीमसेनादयश्चैव परं विस्मयमागताः ॥
data.md: At this, that effulgent king, all those men, and Bhimasena and others, became filled with wonder.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा प्रीतिमान्राजा भूत्वा धर्मजमब्रवीत् । आपो मूलं फलं चैव ममेदं प्रतिगृह्यताम् ॥
data.md: Hearing what had taken place, king Dhritarashtra became pleased and then, addressing the son of Dharma, said, 'Do you accept from me these gifts of water and roots and fruits! It has been said, O king, that one's guest should take what one takes himself.'

data.v: यदन्नो हि नरो राजंस्तदन्नोऽस्यातिथिः स्मृतः । इत्युक्तः स तथेत्येव प्राह धर्मात्मजो नृपम् । फलं मूलं च बुभुजे राज्ञा दत्तं सहानुजः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed, Dharma's son answered armed king ate the fruits and roots which he gave.

data.v: ततस्ते वृक्षमूलेषु कृतवासपरिग्रहाः । तां रात्रिं न्यवसन्सर्वे फलमूलजलाशनाः ॥
data.md: Then they all spread their beds under a tree and passed that night thus having eaten fruits and roots and drunk the water that the old monarch had given them.

data.v: एवं सा रजनी तेषामाश्रमे पुण्यकर्मणाम् । शिवा नक्षत्रसंपन्ना सा व्यतीयाय भारत ॥
data.md: They passed that night which was marked out by auspicious constellations thus, o king, in that hermitage of pious ascetics.

data.v: तत्र तत्र कथाश्चासंस्तेषां धर्मार्थलक्षणाः । विचित्रपदसंचारा नानाश्रुतिभिरन्विताः ॥
data.md: The conversation that took place was marked by many reflections on morality and wealth. Consisting of delightful and sweet words, it was greed with various citations from the Shrutis.

data.v: पाण्डवास्त्वभितो मातुर्धरण्यां सुषुपुस्तदा । उत्सृज्य सुमहार्हाणि शयनानि नराधिप ॥
data.md: The Pandavas, O king, leaving costly beds, laid themselves down, near their in other, on the naked earth.

data.v: यदाहारोऽभवद्राजा धृतराष्ट्रो महामनाः । तदाहारा नृवीरास्ते न्यवसंस्तां निशां तदा ॥
data.md: Indeed, those heroes passed that night, having eaten the food which was the food of the great king Dhritarashtra.

data.v: व्यतीतायां तु शर्वर्यां कृतपूर्वाह्णिकक्रियः । भ्रातृभिः सह कौन्तेयो ददर्शाश्रममण्डलम् ॥
data.md: After the night had passed away, king Yudhishthira, having performed his morning rites proceeded to survey that'hermitage in the company of his brothers.

data.v: सान्तःपुरपरीवारः सभृत्यः सपुरोहितः । यथासुखं यथोद्देशं धृतराष्ट्राभ्यनुज्ञया ॥
data.md: With the royal ladies, the servants, and his priest, the king roved about the hermitage in all directions as he pleased, at the command of Dhritarashtra.

data.v: ददर्श तत्र वेदीश्च संप्रज्वलितपावकाः । कृताभिषेकैर्मुनिभिर्हुताग्निभिरुपस्थिताः ॥
data.md: He saw many sacrificial alters with sacred firs burning on them and with many ascetics seated on them, who had performed their oblations and poured libations in honour of the celestials.

data.v: वानेयपुष्पनिकरैराज्यधूमोद्गमैरपि । ब्राह्मेण वपुषा युक्ता युक्ता मुनिगणैश्च ताः ॥
data.md: Those alters were covered with fruits and roots of he forest, and with heaps of flowers. The smoke of clarified butter curled upwards from them. They were graced, besides, with many ascetics possessed of bodies which appeared like the embodied Vedas and with many laymen.

data.v: मृगयूथैरनुद्विग्नैस्तत्र तत्र समाश्रितैः । अशङ्कितैः पक्षिगणैः प्रगीतैरिव च प्रभो ॥
data.md: Herds of deer were grazing or resting here and there, shorn of fear. Countless birds also were there, engaged in uttering their sweet notes, O king!

data.v: केकाभिर्नीलकण्ठानां दात्यूहानां च कूजितैः । कोकिलानां च कुहरैः शुभैः श्रुतिमनोहरैः ॥
data.md: The entire forest seemed to resound with the notes of peacocks and Datyuhas and Kokilas and the sweet songs of other warblers.

data.v: प्राधीतद्विजघोषैश्च क्वचित्क्वचिदलंकृतम् । फलमूलसमुद्वाहैर्महद्भिश्चोपशोभितम् ॥
data.md: Some spots were echoed with the chaunt of Vedic hymns recited by learned Brahmanas. Some were adorned wit large heaps of fruits and roots gathered from the forest.

data.v: ततः स राजा प्रददौ तापसार्थमुपाहृतान् । कलशान्काञ्चनान्राजंस्तथैवौदुम्बरानपि ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira then distributed amongst those ascetics golden or copper jars which he had brought for them, and many deer-skins and blankets and wooden sacrificial ladies and Kamandalus and wooden Platters, and pots and pans, O Bharata.

data.v: अजिनानि प्रवेणीश्च स्रुक्स्रुवं च महीपतिः । कमण्डलूंस्तथा स्थालीः पिठराणि च भारत ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira then distributed amongst those ascetics golden or copper jars which he had brought for them, and many deer-skins and blankets and wooden sacrificial ladies and Kamandalus and wooden Platters, and pots and pans, O Bharata.

data.v: भाजनानि च लौहानि पात्रीश्च विविधा नृप । यद्यदिच्छति यावच्च यदन्यदपि काङ्क्षितम् ॥
data.md: Various kinds of vessels, made of iron, and smaller vessels and cups of various sizes, were also given away by the king, the ascetics taking them away, each as many as he liked.

data.v: एवं स राजा धर्मात्मा परीत्याश्रममण्डलम् । वसु विश्राण्य तत्सर्वं पुनरायान्महीपतिः ॥
data.md: Pious king Yudhishthira, having thus roved through the forest and seen the various retreats of ascetics and made many gifts, returned to the place where his uncle was.

data.v: कृताह्निकं च राजानं धृतराष्ट्रं मनीषिणम् । ददर्शासीनमव्यग्रं गान्धारीसहितं तदा ॥
data.md: He saw king Dhritarashtra, seated at ease, with Gandhari besides him, after having finished his morning rites.

data.v: मातरं चाविदूरस्थां शिष्यवत्प्रणतां स्थिताम् । कुन्तीं ददर्श धर्मात्मा सततं धर्मचारिणीम् ॥
data.md: The righteous souled monarch beheld also his mother, Kunti, seated not much remote from that place, like a disciple with bent head, gifted with humility.

data.v: स तमभ्यर्च्य राजानं नाम संश्राव्य चात्मनः । निषीदेत्यभ्यनुज्ञातो बृस्यामुपविवेश ह ॥
data.md: He saluted the old king giving his name. 'Sit down', were the words the old king said. With Dhritarashtra's permission, Yudhishthira sat himself down on a mat of Kusha grass.

data.v: भीमसेनादयश्चैव पाण्डवाः कौरवर्षभम् । अभिवाद्योपसंगृह्य निषेदुः पार्थिवाज्ञया ॥
data.md: Then the other sons of Pandu with Bhima among them, O you of Bharata's race, saluted the king and touched his feet and sat themselves down, with his order.

data.v: स तैः परिवृतो राजा शुशुभेऽतीव कौरवः । बिभ्रद्ब्राह्मीं श्रियं दीप्तां देवैरिव बृहस्पतिः ॥
data.md: The old Kuru king, surrounded by them looked highly beautiful, indeed, he blazed with a Vedic splendour like Brihaspati in the midst of the celestials.

data.v: तथा तेषूपविष्टेषु समाजग्मुर्महर्षयः । शतयूपप्रभृतयः कुरुक्षेत्रनिवासिनः ॥
data.md: After they had sat themselves down, many great Rishis, viz., Shatayupa, and others, who were inhabitants of Kurukshetra came there.

data.v: व्यासश्च भगवान्विप्रो देवर्षिगणपूजितः । वृतः शिष्यैर्महातेजा दर्शयामास तं नृपम् ॥
data.md: The illustrious and learned Vyasa, gifted with great energy and respected by even the celestial Rishis, showed himself at the head of his numerous disciples to Yudhishthira.

data.v: ततः स राजा कौरव्यः कुन्तीपुत्रश्च वीर्यवान् । भीमसेनादयश्चैव समुत्थायाभ्यपूजयन् ॥
data.md: The Kuru king Dhritarashtra, Kunti's son Yudhishthira of great energy, and Bhimasena and others, stood up and going a few steps, saluted those guests.

data.v: समागतस्ततो व्यासः शतयूपादिभिर्वृतः । धृतराष्ट्रं महीपालमास्यतामित्यभाषत ॥
data.md: Approaching near, Vyasa, surrounded by Shatayupa and others, addressed king Dhritarashtra, saying, 'Be seated.'

data.v: नवं तु विष्टरं कौश्यं कृष्णाजिनकुशोत्तरम् । प्रतिपेदे तदा व्यासस्तदर्थमुपकल्पितम् ॥
data.md: The illustrious Vyasa then took an excellent seat made of Kusha grass placed upon a black deer-skin and covered with a piece of silken cloth. They has reserved that seat for him.

data.v: ते च सर्वे द्विजश्रेष्ठा विष्टरेषु समन्ततः । द्वैपायनाभ्यनुज्ञाता निषेदुर्विपुलौजसः ॥
data.md: After Vyasa had been seated, all those foremost of twice-born persons, gifted with profuse energy, sat themselves down, with the permission of Krishna-Dvaipayana.

data.v: तथा समुपविष्टेषु पाण्डवेषु महात्मसु । व्यासः सत्यवतीपुत्रः प्रोवाचामन्त्र्य पार्थिवम् ॥
धृतराष्ट्र महाबाहो कच्चित्ते वर्धते तपः । कच्चिन्मनस्ते प्रीणाति वनवासे नराधिप ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, After the noble Pandavas had all been seated, Satyavati's son Vyasa said, 'O Dhritarashtra of mighty-arms, have you been able to achieve penances? Is your mind, O king, pleased with your living in the forest?

data.v: कच्चिद्धृदि न ते शोको राजन्पुत्रविनाशजः । कच्चिज्ज्ञानानि सर्वाणि प्रसन्नानि तवानघ ॥
data.md: Has your grief begotten of the destruction of our sons in battle, disappeared from your heart? Are all your perceptions, O sinless one, now clear?

data.v: कच्चिद्बुद्धिं दृढां कृत्वा चरस्यारण्यकं विधिम् । कच्चिद्वधूश्च गान्धारी न शोकेनाभिभूयते ॥
data.md: Do you practise the ordinances of forest-life after having made your heart firin? Does my daughter-in-law, Gandhari, suffer herself to be overwhelmed by grief?

data.v: महाप्रज्ञा बुद्धिमती देवी धर्मार्थदर्शिनी । आगमापायतत्त्वज्ञा कच्चिदेषा न शोचति ॥
data.md: She is endued with great wisdom. Endued with intelligence, that queen understands both virtue and profit. She is well conversant with the truths which relate to both prosperity and adversity. Does not still grieve?

data.v: कच्चित्कुन्ती च राजंस्त्वां शुश्रूषुरनहंकृता । या परित्यज्य राज्यं स्वं गुरुशुश्रूषणे रता ॥
data.md: Does Kunti, o king, who for her devotion to the service of her seniors, left her children, attend to your wants and serve your with all humility?

data.v: कच्चिद्धर्मसुतो राजा त्वया प्रीत्याभिनन्दितः । भीमार्जुनयमाश्चैव कच्चिदेतेऽपि सान्त्विताः ॥
data.md: Have the high-minded and great king Yudhishthira, the son of Dharma, and Bhima and Arjuna, and the twins, been sufficiently comforted?

data.v: कच्चिन्नन्दसि दृष्ट्वैतान्कच्चित्ते निर्मलं मनः । कच्चिद्विशुद्धभावोऽसि जातज्ञानो नराधिप ॥
data.md: Do you feel delight at seeing them? Has your mind become freed from every strain? Has your disposition, O king, become pure on account of he increase of your knowledge?

data.v: एतद्धि त्रितयं श्रेष्ठं सर्वभूतेषु भारत । निर्वैरता महाराज सत्यमद्रोह एव च ॥
data.md: These three, O king, are the foremost of all concerns, O Bharata, viz., abstension from injury to any creation, truth, and freedom from anger.

data.v: कच्चित्ते नानुतापोऽस्ति वनवासेन भारत । स्वदते वन्यमन्नं वा मुनिवासांसि वा विभो ॥
data.md: Does your forest-life any longer prove painful to you? Are you able to acquire with your own exertions the products of the forest for your food? Do fasts pain you now?

data.v: विदितं चापि मे राजन्विदुरस्य महात्मनः । गमनं विधिना येन धर्मस्य सुमहात्मनः ॥
data.md: Have you learnt 'o king, how the great Vidura, who was Dharma's self, left this world?

data.v: माण्डव्यशापाद्धि स वै धर्मो विदुरतां गतः । महाबुद्धिर्महायोगी महात्मा सुमहामनाः ॥
