data.v: ततः सुतुमुलः शब्दो जलान्तर्जनमेजय । प्रादुरासीद्यथा पूर्वं कुरुपाण्डवसेनयोः ॥
data.md: At this, Janamejaya, a deafening uproar was heard to arise from within the waters, resembling that which had formerly been heard of the armies of the Kurus and the Pandavas.

data.v: ततस्ते पार्थिवाः सर्वे भीष्मद्रोणपुरोगमाः । ससैन्याः सलिलात्तस्मात्समुत्तस्थुः सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: Then those kings, headed by Bhishma and Drona, with all their armies, arose by thousands from the waters of the Bhagirathi.

data.v: विराटद्रुपदौ चोभौ सपुत्रौ सहसैनिकौ । द्रौपदेयाश्च सौभद्रो राक्षसश्च घटोत्कचः ॥
data.md: There were Virata and Drupada, with their sons and forces. There were the sons of Draupadi and the son of Subhadra, and Rakshasa Ghatotkacha.

data.v: कर्णदुर्योधनौ चोभौ शकुनिश्च महारथः । दुःशासनादयश्चैव धार्तराष्ट्रा महारथाः ॥
data.md: There were Karna, Duryodhana, and the powerful car-warrior Shakuni, and the other children, possessed of great strength, of Dhritarashtra, headed by Dushasana.

data.v: जारासंधिर्भगदत्तो जलसंधश्च पार्थिवः । भूरिश्रवाः शलः शल्यो वृषसेनश्च सानुजः ॥
data.md: There the of Jarasandha, Bhagadatta, Jarasandha Jarasandha of great energy, Bhurishravas, Shala, Shalya and Vrishasena with his younger brother.

data.v: लक्ष्मणो राजपुत्रश्च धृष्टद्युम्नस्य चात्मजाः । शिखण्डिपुत्राः सर्वे च धृष्टकेतुश्च सानुजः ॥
data.md: There were prince Lakshamana, and the son of Dhristadyumna, and all the children of Sikhandin, and Dhrishtaketu with his younger brother. were son

data.v: अचलो वृषकश्चैव राक्षसश्चाप्यलायुधः । बाह्लीकः सोमदत्तश्च चेकितानश्च पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: There were Achala, Vrishaka, the Rakshasa Alyudha, Valhika, Somadatta, and the king Chekitana.

data.v: एते चान्ये च बहवो बहुत्वाद्ये न कीर्तिताः । सर्वे भासुरदेहास्ते समुत्तस्थुर्जलात्ततः ॥
data.md: These and innumerable others appeared on that occasion. All of the rose from the waters of the Bhagirathi with shining bodies.

data.v: यस्य वीरस्य यो वेषो यो ध्वजो यच्च वाहनम् । तेन तेन व्यदृश्यन्त समुपेता नराधिपाः ॥
data.md: Those kings appeared, each clad in that dress and equipped with that standard and that vehicle which he had while fighting on the field.

data.v: दिव्याम्बरधराः सर्वे सर्वे भ्राजिष्णुकुण्डलाः । निर्वैरा निरहंकारा विगतक्रोधमन्यवः ॥
data.md: All of them were dressed in celestial vestments and all had brilliant earning. They were free from all animosity and pride and divested of anger and jealousy.

data.v: गन्धर्वैरुपगीयन्तः स्तूयमानाश्च बन्दिभिः । दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरा वृताश्चाप्सरसां गणैः ॥
data.md: Gandharvas sang their praises, and bards waited on them, chanting then deeds, Robed with celestial raiment's and wearing celestial garlands, each of them was waited upon by bands of Apsaras.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्रस्य च तदा दिव्यं चक्षुर्नराधिप । मुनिः सत्यवतीपुत्रः प्रीतः प्रादात्तपोबलात् ॥
data.md: At that time, through the power of his penances, the great ascetic, the of Satyavati, gratified with Dhritarasthra, gave him celestial vision.

data.v: दिव्यज्ञानबलोपेता गान्धारी च यशस्विनी । ददर्श पुत्रांस्तान्सर्वान्ये चान्येऽपि रणे हताः ॥
data.md: Gifted with celestial knowledge and strength, the illustrious Gandhari beheld all her children as also all those who had been killed in battle. son

data.v: तदद्भुतमचिन्त्यं च सुमहद्रोमहर्षणम् । विस्मितः स जनः सर्वो ददर्शानिमिषेक्षणः ॥
data.md: All persons assembled there saw with steadfast gaze and hearts filled with wonder that amazing and inconceivable scene which made the hairs stand erect.

data.v: तदुत्सवमदोदग्रं हृष्टनारीनराकुलम् । ददृशे बलमायान्तं चित्रं पटगतं यथा ॥
data.md: It looked like a high carnival of pleased men and women. That wondrous scene looked like a picture painted on the canvass.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्रस्तु तान्सर्वान्पश्यन्दिव्येन चक्षुषा । मुमुदे भरतश्रेष्ठ प्रसादात्तस्य वै मुनेः ॥
data.md: Dhritarashtra seeing all those heroes with their celestial vision obtained through the favour of that sage, became full of joy, O chief of Bharata's race.

data.v: ततस्ते भरतश्रेष्ठाः समाजग्मुः परस्परम् । विगतक्रोधमात्सर्याः सर्वे विगतकल्मषाः ॥
विधिं परममास्थाय ब्रह्मर्षिविहितं शुभम् । संप्रीतमनसः सर्वे देवलोक इवामराः ॥
पुत्रः पित्रा च मात्रा च भार्या च पतिना सह । भ्राता भ्रात्रा सखा चैव सख्या राजन्समागताः ॥
data.md: Son met with father or mother, wives with husbands, brother with brother, and friend with friend, O king.

data.v: पाण्डवास्तु महेष्वासं कर्णं सौभद्रमेव च । संप्रहर्षात्समाजग्मुर्द्रौपदेयांश्च सर्वशः ॥
data.md: The Pandavas full of joy, inet with the powerful bowman Karna as also with the son of Subhadra, and the children of Draupadi.

data.v: ततस्ते प्रीयमाणा वै कर्णेन सह पाण्डवाः । समेत्य पृथिवीपालाः सौहृदेऽवस्थिताभवन् ॥
data.md: With pleased hearts the son of Pandu approached Karna, O king, and became reconciled with him.

data.v: ऋषिप्रसादात्तेऽन्ये च क्षत्रिया नष्टमन्यवः । असौहृदं परित्यज्य सौहृदे पर्यवस्थिताः ॥
एवं समागताः सर्वे गुरुभिर्बान्धवैस्तथा । पुत्रैश्च पुरुषव्याघ्राः कुरवोऽन्ये च मानवाः ॥
data.md: Renouncing all unfriendliness, they became established on amity and peace. It was thus that all those foremost of men, viz., the Kauravas and other kinsmen of theirs as also with their children. They passed in great happiness the whole of that night.

data.v: तां रात्रिमेकां कृत्स्नां ते विहृत्य प्रीतमानसाः । मेनिरे परितोषेण नृपाः स्वर्गसदो यथा ॥
नात्र शोको भयं त्रासो नारतिर्नायशोऽभवत् । परस्परं समागम्य योधानां भरतर्षभ ॥
समागतास्ताः पितृभिर्भ्रातृभिः पतिभिः सुतैः । मुदं परमिकां प्राप्य नार्यो दुःखमथात्यजन् ॥
एकां रात्रिं विहृत्यैवं ते वीरास्ताश्च योषितः । आमन्त्र्यान्योन्यमाश्लिष्य ततो जग्मुर्यथागतम् ॥
ततो विसर्जयामास लोकांस्तान्मुनिपुंगवः । क्षणेनान्तर्हिताश्चैव प्रेक्षतामेव तेऽभवन् ॥
अवगाह्य महात्मानः पुण्यां त्रिपथगां नदीम् । सरथाः सध्वजाश्चैव स्वानि स्थानानि भेजिरे ॥
देवलोकं ययुः केचित्केचिद्ब्रह्मसदस्तथा । केचिच्च वारुणं लोकं केचित्कौबेरमाप्नुवन् ॥
तथा वैवस्वतं लोकं केचिच्चैवाप्नुवन्नृपाः । राक्षसानां पिशाचानां केचिच्चाप्युत्तरान्कुरून् ॥
विचित्रगतयः सर्वे या अवाप्यामरैः सह । आजग्मुस्ते महात्मानः सवाहाः सपदानुगाः ॥
गतेषु तेषु सर्वेषु सलिलस्थो महामुनिः । धर्मशीलो महातेजाः कुरूणां हितकृत्सदा । ततः प्रोवाच ताः सर्वाः क्षत्रिया निहतेश्वराः ॥
या याः पतिकृताँल्लोकानिच्छन्ति परमस्त्रियः । ता जाह्नवीजलं क्षिप्रमवगाहन्त्वतन्द्रिताः ॥
ततस्तस्य वचः श्रुत्वा श्रद्दधाना वराङ्गनाः । श्वशुरं समनुज्ञाप्य विविशुर्जाह्नवीजलम् ॥
विमुक्ता मानुषैर्देहैस्ततस्ता भर्तृभिः सह । समाजग्मुस्तदा साध्व्यः सर्वा एव विशां पते ॥
data.md: Freed from human bodies, those chaste ladies then went, O king, with their husbands to the regions acquired by the latter.

data.v: एवं क्रमेण सर्वास्ताः शीलवत्यः कुलस्त्रियः । प्रविश्य तोयं निर्मुक्ता जग्मुर्भर्तृसलोकताम् ॥
data.md: Thus, those ladies of various conduct, devoted to their husbands, entering the waters of the Bhagirathi, became freed from their mortal bodies and attained to the companionship of their husbands in the regions acquired by them.

data.v: दिव्यरूपसमायुक्ता दिव्याभरणभूषिताः । दिव्यमाल्याम्बरधरा यथासां पतयस्तथा ॥
data.md: Possessed of celestiai forms, and adorned with celestial ornaments, and wearing celestial garments and garlands hey proceeded to those regions where their husbands were living.

data.v: ताः शीलसत्त्वसंपन्ना वितमस्का गतक्लमाः । सर्वाः सर्वगुणैर्युक्ताः स्वं स्वं स्थानं प्रपेदिरे ॥
data.md: Endued with excellent conduct and many virtues, their anxieties all removed, they were seen to ride on excellent cars, and gifted with every accomplishment, they found those regions of felicity which were theirs by right.

data.v: यस्य यस्य च यः कामस्तस्मिन्कालेऽभवत्तदा । तं तं विसृष्टवान्व्यासो वरदो धर्मवत्सलः ॥
data.md: Devoted to the duties of piety, Vyasa, at that time, becoming a giver of boons, granted to all the men there collected the fruition of the desires they respectively cherished.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा नरदेवानां पुनरागमनं नराः । जहृषुर्मुदिताश्चासन्नन्यदेहगता अपि ॥
data.md: People of various kingdoms hearing of this meeting between the hallowed dead and living human beings, became highly pleased.

data.v: प्रियैः समागमं तेषां य इमं शृणुयान्नरः । प्रियाणि लभते नित्यमिह च प्रेत्य चैव ह ॥
data.md: That man who duly listens to this discourse meets with everything that is dear to him. Indeed, he obtains all agreeable objects both in this world and in the next.

data.v: इष्टबान्धवसंयोगमनायासमनामयम् । य इमं श्रावयेद्विद्वान्संसिद्धिं प्राप्नुयात्पराम् ॥
स्वाध्याययुक्ताः पुरुषाः क्रियायुक्ताश्च भारत । अध्यात्मयोगयुक्ताश्च धृतिमन्तश्च मानवाः । श्रुत्वा पर्व त्विदं नित्यमवाप्स्यन्ति परां गतिम् ॥
एतच्छ्रुत्वा नृपो विद्वान्हृष्टोऽभूज्जनमेजयः । पितामहानां सर्वेषां गमनागमनं तदा ॥
data.md: Santi said Hearing this story of the reappearance and departure of his forefathers, the highly intelligent king Janamejaya became greatly pleased.

data.v: अब्रवीच्च मुदा युक्तः पुनरागमनं प्रति । कथं नु त्यक्तदेहानां पुनस्तद्रूपदर्शनम् ॥
data.md: Filled with joy, he once more asked Vaishampayana the subject of the reappearance of dead men, saying of the reappearance of dead men, saying-How is it possible for persons whose bodies have been destroyed to reappear in those very forms?

data.v: इत्युक्तः स द्विजश्रेष्ठो व्यासशिष्यः प्रतापवान् । प्रोवाच वदतां श्रेष्ठस्तं नृपं जनमेजयम् ॥
data.md: Thus asked, that foremost of twice-born persons, viz., the disciple of Vyasa, that first of speakers, possessed of great energy, thus answered Janamejaya.

data.v: अविप्रणाशः सर्वेषां कर्मणामिति निश्चयः । कर्मजानि शरीराणि तथैवाकृतयो नृप ॥
data.md: This is certain, viz., that acts are never destroyed. Bodies, o king, are born of acts; so also are features.

data.v: महाभूतानि नित्यानि भूताधिपतिसंश्रयात् । तेषां च नित्यसंवासो न विनाशो वियुज्यताम् ॥
data.md: The great primal elements are eternal on account of the union with them of the Lord of all beings. They exist with what is eternal. Accordingly, they have no destruction when the non-eternal are destroyed.

data.v: अनाशाय कृतं कर्म तस्य चेष्टः फलागमः । आत्मा चैभिः समायुक्तः सुखदुःखमुपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: Acts done without exertion are true, and foremost, and yield real fruit. The soul, united, however, with such acts as require exertion for their performance, enjoys pleasure and pain.

data.v: अविनाशी तथा नित्यं क्षेत्रज्ञ इति निश्चयः । भूतानामात्मभावो यो ध्रुवोऽसौ संविजानताम् ॥
data.md: Though united so, yet it is a certain internee that the soul is never modified by them, like the reflection of creatures in a mirror. It is never destroyed.

data.v: यावन्न क्षीयते कर्म तावदस्य स्वरूपता । संक्षीणकर्मा पुरुषो रूपान्यत्वं नियच्छति ॥
data.md: As long as one's deeds are not exhausted (by enjoyment or endurance of their fruits good and bad), so long does he consider the body to be his ownself. The man, however, whose acts have been exhausted, without considering body to be self, takes the self to be something otherwise.

data.v: नानाभावास्तथैकत्वं शरीरं प्राप्य संहताः । भवन्ति ते तथा नित्याः पृथग्भावं विजानताम् ॥
data.md: Various existent objects, attaining to a body, become united as one. Those very objects become eternal to men of knowledge who understand the difference.

data.v: अश्वमेधे श्रुतिश्चेयमश्वसंज्ञपनं प्रति । लोकान्तरगता नित्यं प्राणा नित्या हि वाजिनः ॥
data.md: In the Horse-Sacrifice, this Shruti is heard in the matter of the killing of the horse. The certain possessions of embodied creatures, viz., their vital airs (and the senses, etc.) exist eternally even when they are borne to the other world.

data.v: अहं हितं वदाम्येतत्प्रियं चेत्तव पार्थिव । देवयाना हि पन्थानः श्रुतास्ते यज्ञसंस्तरे ॥
data.md: I shall, you what is beneficial, if it be agreeable to you, O king. You have while employed in our sacrifices, heard of the celestial paths.

data.v: सुकृतो यत्र ते यज्ञस्तत्र देवा हितास्तव । यदा समन्विता देवाः पशूनां गमनेश्वराः । गतिमन्तश्च तेनेष्ट्वा नान्ये नित्या भवन्ति ते ॥
data.md: When preparations were made for any sacrifice of yours, the celestials became beneficially inclined to you. When, indeed, the celestials were thus disposed and came to your sacrifice, they were lords in the matter of the passage.

data.v: नित्येऽस्मिन्पञ्चके वर्गे नित्ये चात्मनि यो नरः । अस्य नानासमायोगं यः पश्यति वृथामतिः । वियोगे शोचतेऽत्यर्थं स बाल इति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: When such is the case he who sees a creature as disposed to take various forms, is considered as having an erroneous understanding. He who indulges in too much grief at separation, is, I think, a foolish person.

data.v: वियोगे दोषदर्शी यः संयोगमिह वर्जयेत् । असङ्गे संगमो नास्ति दुःखं भुवि वियोगजम् ॥
data.md: He who sees evil in separation should give up union. By standing aloof, no unions are formed, and sorrow is renounced, for sorrow in the worlds is born of separation.

data.v: परापरज्ञस्तु नरो नाभिमानादुदीरितः । अपरज्ञः परां बुद्धिं स्पृष्ट्वा मोहाद्विमुच्यते ॥
data.md: Only he who understands the distinction between body and self, and not another becomes freed from the erroneous belief. He who knows the other viz., self attains to the highest understanding and becomes freed from error.

data.v: अदर्शनादापतितः पुनश्चादर्शनं गतः । नाहं तं वेद्मि नासौ मां न च मेऽस्ति विरागता ॥
data.md: As regards creatures, they appear from an invisible state, and once more disappears into invisibleness. I do not know him. He also does not know me. As regards myself renunciation is not yet mine.

data.v: येन येन शरीरेण करोत्ययमनीश्वरः । तेन तेन शरीरेण तदवश्यमुपाश्नुते । मानसं मनसाप्नोति शारीरं च शरीरवान् ॥
data.md: If the act be a mental one, its fruits are enjoyed or endured mentally; if it be done with the body, its results are to be enjoyed or endured in the body.

data.v: अदृष्ट्वा तु नृपः पुत्रान्दर्शनं प्रतिलब्धवान् । ऋषिप्रसादात्पुत्राणां स्वरूपाणां कुरूद्वह ॥
data.md: King Dhritarashtra had never seen his own sons. Getting eye-sight through the favour of the Rishi, he saw for the first time, O perpetuator of Kuru's race, those children of his who were very like his own self.

data.v: स राजा राजधर्मांश्च ब्रह्मोपनिषदं तथा । अवाप्तवान्नरश्रेष्ठो बुद्धिनिश्चयमेव च ॥
data.md: That foremost of men, viz., the Kuru king had learnt all the royal duties as also the Vedas and the Upanishads, and had acquired certitude of understanding.

data.md: ighly wise Vidura acquired great success through the power of his penances. Dhritarashtra also acquired great success for having inet the ascetic Vyasa.

data.md: Janamejaya said If Vyasa, disposed to grant me a boon, kindly show me my father in that form which he had clad as he used to be clad, and as old as he was when he left this world, I may then believe all that you have told me.

data.v: प्रियं मे स्यात्कृतार्थश्च स्यामहं कृतनिश्चयः । प्रसादादृषिपुत्रस्य मम कामः समृध्यताम् ॥
data.md: Such a sight will be most agreeable to me. Indeed, I shall consider myself crowned with success. I shall have gained a certainty of conclusion. O let my wish be satisfied through the favour of that foremost of Rishis!

data.v: इत्युक्तवचने तस्मिन्नृपे व्यासः प्रतापवान् । प्रसादमकरोद्धीमानानयच्च परिक्षितम् ॥
data.md: Sauti said After king Janamejaya had said these words, the highly energetic and intelligent Vyasa, showed his favour and brought Parikshit.

data.v: ततस्तद्रूपवयसमागतं नृपतिं दिवः । श्रीमन्तं पितरं राजा ददर्श जनमेजयः ॥
data.md: King Janamejaya saw his royal father possessed of great beauty, brought down from the celestial region, in the same form that he had and of the same age as he was (at the time of leaving this world).

data.v: शमीकं च महात्मानं पुत्रं तं चास्य शृङ्गिणम् । अमात्या ये बभूवुश्च राज्ञस्तांश्च ददर्श ह ॥
data.md: The great Shamika also, and his son Shringin, were similarly brought there. All the counselors and ministers of the king saw them.

data.v: ततः सोऽवभृथे राजा मुदितो जनमेजयः । पितरं स्नापयामास स्वयं सस्नौ च पार्थिवः ॥
data.md: King Janamejaya performing the final both in his sacrifice, became highly pleased. He poured the sacred water on his father even as he caused it to be poured on himself.

data.md: Having performed the final bath, the king addressed the twice-born Astika who had originated from the race of the Yayavaras and who was the son of Jaratkaru, and said these words — 'O Astika, this sacrifice of mine is fraught with many wonderful incidents, since this my sire has been seen by me, he who has removed all my sorrow.

data.v: ऋषिर्द्वैपायनो यत्र पुराणस्तपसो निधिः । यज्ञे कुरुकुलश्रेष्ठ तस्य लोकावुभौ जितौ ॥
data.md: Astika said The performer of that sacrifice in which the ancient Rishi, Dvaipayana Vyasa, that vast receptacle of penances is present, is sure O foremost one of Kuru's race, to conquer both the worlds.

data.v: श्रुतं विचित्रमाख्यानं त्वया पाण्डवनन्दन । सर्पाश्च भस्मसान्नीता गताश्च पदवीं पितुः ॥
data.md: O son of the Pandavas, you have heard a wonderful history. The snakes have been reduced into ashes and have followed the footsteps of your father.

data.v: कथंचित्तक्षको मुक्तः सत्यत्वात्तव पार्थिव । ऋषयः पूजिताः सर्वे गतिं दृष्ट्वा महात्मनः ॥
data.md: Through your truthfulness, o king, Takshaka has with difficulty escaped a painful fate. The Rishis have been all adored. You have seen also he end that has been acquired by your great father.

data.md: Having heard this sin-cleansing history you have acquired abundant merit. The knots of your heart have been united through seeing this foremost of persons.

data.v: ये च पक्षधरा धर्मे सद्वृत्तरुचयश्च ये । यान्दृष्ट्वा हीयते पापं तेभ्यः कार्या नमस्क्रियाः ॥
data.md: They who are the supporters of the wings of Virtue, they who are of good conduct and excellent disposition, they on seeing whom sins disappear, we should all bow to them.

data.md: Sauti said--Having heard this from that foremost of twice-born ones, king Janamejaya adored that Rishi, repeatedly honouring him in every way.

data.md: Knowing all duties, he then asked the Rishi Vaishampayana of undecaying glory about the sequel, O best of ascetics, of king Dhritarashtra's residence in the forest.

data.md: Having seen his sons and grandsons with all their friends and followers, what, indeed, did that king, viz., Dhritarashtra, and king Yudhishthira also, do?

data.md: Vaishampayana said Seeing that highly wonderful spectacle, : viz., the re-appearance of his children, the royal sage, Dhritarashtra renounced his grief and returned to his hermitage.

data.v: इतरस्तु जनः सर्वस्ते चैव परमर्षयः । प्रतिजग्मुर्यथाकामं धृतराष्ट्राभ्यनुज्ञया ॥
data.md: The common people and all the great Rishis, sent away by Dhritarashtra, came back to the places they respectively wished.

data.md: The great Pandavas accompanied by their wives, and with a small retinue, went to the hermitage of the great monarch.

data.md: Do not set your mind again on sorrow. He who is wise is never moved at ill luck. You have also heard the mysteries of the deities from Narada of celestial form.

data.md: Your children have all attained, through performance of Kshatriya practices, to that auspicious end which is sanctified by weapons. You have seen how they moved about at will in great happiness.

data.md: Do you send him away. Let him return to his kingdom and rule it! They have passed more then a month in thus living in the forest.

data.md: Thus addressed by Vyasa of incomparable energy, the Kuru king, well versed in words summoned Yudhishthira and said to him, 'O you having no enemies, blessing on you! Do you listen to me, with all your brothers! Through your grace, O king, grief no longer stands in my way.

data.md: I am living as happily, O son, with you here as if I were in the city of Hastinapur. With you as my protector, O learned one, I am enjoying all agreeable objects.

data.md: I have obtained from you all those services which a son renders to his sire. I am highly pleased with you. I have not the least dissatisfaction with you. O mighty-armed one. Go now, O son, without waiting here any longer.

data.md: Meeting with you, my penances are being slackened. This my body, gifted with penances. I have been able to sustain only on account of my meeting with you.

data.md: These two mothers of yours, living now upon fallen leaves of trees, and observing vows similar to mine, will not live long.

data.md: We have seen Duryodhana and others who have become dwellers of the other world, through the power of Vyasa's penances and through the merit of this my meeting with you.

data.md: O sinless one, I have gained the object of my life. I now wish to practice the austerest of penances. You should grant me permission.

data.md: The obsequial cake, the fame and achievements, and the family of our ancestors, now depend upon you entirely. O mightyarmed one, do you then go either to-morrow or this very day. Do not tarry. O son.

data.md: O chief of Bharata's race, you have repeatedly heard what the duties are of kings. I do not see what more I can say to you. I have no longer any necessity with you, O you of great power.

data.md: Vaishampayana continued : King Yudhishthira replied to the (old) king who said so, saying, 'O you who know every rules of virtue, you should not cast me off in this way. I am guilty of not fault.

data.v: कामं गच्छन्तु मे सर्वे भ्रातरोऽनुचरास्तथा । भवन्तमहमन्विष्ये मातरौ च यतव्रते ॥
data.md: Let all my brothers and followers go as they like. With steadfast vows I shall wait upon you and upon these two mothers of mine.'

data.md: Gandhari then said to him. 'O son, let it not be so. Listen, the family of Kuru is now dependent on you. The obsequial cake also of my father-in-law depends on you Depart then, O son.

data.md: We have been sufficiently honoured and served by you. You should do what the king says. Indeed, O son, you should obey the command of your sire.

data.md: Vaishampayana continued : Thus addressed by Gandhari, king Yudhishthira, rubbing his eyes which were bathed in tears of affection, said these words bewailingly.

data.md: The king is renouncing me, a also the illustrious Gandhari. My heart, however, is bound to you. How shall I, stricken as I am with sorrow, leave you.

data.md: I do not, however, at the same time, venture to obstruct your penances, O rights our lady! There is nothing higher than penances. It is by penances that one act quires the Supreme.

data.v: ममापि न तथा राज्ञि राज्ये बुद्धिर्यथा पुरा । तपस्येवानुरक्तं मे मनः सर्वात्मना तथा ॥
data.md: O queen, my heart not longer as of old towards kingdom. My mind is wholly set upon penances now.

data.v: शून्येयं च मही सर्वा न मे प्रीतिकरी शुभे । बान्धवा नः परिक्षीणा बलं नो न यथा पुरा ॥
data.md: The entire Earth is empty now. O auspicious lady, she does not please me any longer! Our kinsmen have been reduced in number. Our strength is no longer what it was before.

data.md: The Panchalas have been wholly rooted out. Only nominally they exist. O auspicious lady, I do not see any one who may assist at their reestablishment and growth.

data.md: All of them have been reduced to ashes by Drona on the field of battle. The remnant were killed by Drona's son at night.

data.md: The Chedis and the Matsyas, who were our friends, no longer exist. Only the tribes of the Vrishnis are all that remain, Vasudeva having kept them up.

data.md: The king will commence to practice the most austere and unbearable of penances!' Hearing these words, that king of battle, the mighty-armed Shadeva with eyes bathed in tears, addressed Yudhishthira, saying, 'O chief of Bharata race, I dare not leave my mother.

data.v: यं पुरा पर्यवीजन्त तालवृन्तैर्वरस्त्रियः । तं गृध्राः पर्यवीजन्त दावाग्निपरिकालितम् ॥
data.md: Alas, he had formerly been fanned with palm leaves by the fair hands of beautiful women, was fanned by vultures with their wings after he had been burnt to death in a wild fire.

data.v: सूतमागधसंघैश्च शयानो यः प्रबोध्यते । धरण्यां स नृपः शेते पापस्य मम कर्मभिः ॥
data.md: He was formerly roused from sleep every morning by bands of Sutas and Magadhas had to sleep on the naked earth through the acts of my sinful self.

data.v: न तु शोचामि गान्धारीं हतपुत्रां यशस्विनीम् । पतिलोकमनुप्राप्तां तथा भर्तृव्रते स्थिताम् ॥
data.md: I do not grieve for the famous Gandhari who had been deprived of all her children. Observing the same vows as her husband. she has acquired those very regions which have become his.

data.v: पृथामेव तु शोचामि या पुत्रैश्वर्यमृद्धिमत् । उत्सृज्य सुमहद्दीप्तं वनवासमरोचयत् ॥
data.md: I grieve, however, for Pritha who, renouncing the blazing prosperity of her sons, became desirous of living in the forest.

data.v: धिग्राज्यमिदमस्माकं धिग्बलं धिक्पराक्रमम् । क्षत्रधर्मं च धिग्यस्मान्मृता जीवामहे वयम् ॥
data.md: Fie on this sovereignty of ours, fie on our prowess, fie on the practices of Kshatriyas! Though alive, we are really dead.

data.v: सुसूक्ष्मा किल कालस्य गतिर्द्विजवरोत्तम । यत्समुत्सृज्य राज्यं सा वनवासमरोचयत् ॥
data.md: O foremost of superior Brahmanas, the course of Time is very subtle and difficult to understand inasmuch as Kunti, casting off sovereignty, became desirous so living in the forest.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्य जननी भीमस्य विजयस्य च । अनाथवत्कथं दग्धा इति मुह्यामि चिन्तयन् ॥
data.md: How is it that she who was the mother of Yudhishthira, of Bhima, of Vijaya, was brunt to death like helpless creature! Thinking of this I become stupefied.

data.v: वृथा संतोषितो वह्निः खाण्डवे सव्यसाचिना । उपकारमजानन्स कृतघ्न इति मे मतिः ॥
data.md: In vain was the god of fire pleased at Khandava by Arjuna! Ingrate that he is, forgetting that service, he has burnt to death the mother of his benefactor.

data.v: यत्रादहत्स भगवान्मातरं सव्यसाचिनः । कृत्वा यो ब्राह्मणच्छद्म भिक्षार्थी समुपागतः । धिगग्निं धिक्च पार्थस्य विश्रुतां सत्यसंधताम् ॥
data.md: Alas, how could that deity burn the mother of Arjuna! Putting, on the guise of Brahmana, he had formerly come to Arjuna, for begging a favour! Fie on the deity of fire! Fie on the celebrated success of Partha's arrows.

data.v: इदं कष्टतरं चान्यद्भगवन्प्रतिभाति मे । वृथाग्निना समायोगो यदभूत्पृथिवीपतेः ॥
तथा तपस्विनस्तस्य राजर्षेः कौरवस्य ह । कथमेवंविधो मृत्युः प्रशास्य पृथिवीमिमाम् ॥
तिष्ठत्सु मन्त्रपूतेषु तस्याग्निषु महावने । वृथाग्निना समायुक्तो निष्ठां प्राप्तः पिता मम ॥
मन्ये पृथा वेपमाना कृशा धमनिसंतता । हा तात धर्मराजेति समाक्रन्दन्महाभये ॥
data.md: I suppose that Pritha, emaciated and reduced to a from in which all her nerves became visible, must have trembled in fear and cried aloud, saying, O son Yudhishthira! and awaited the terrible approach of the fire.

data.v: भीम पर्याप्नुहि भयादिति चैवाभिवाशती । समन्ततः परिक्षिप्ता माता मेऽभूद्दवाग्निना ॥
data.md: She must have also said, O Bhima, save me from this danger! when she, my mother, was surrounded on all sides y that dreadful fire.

data.v: सहदेवः प्रियस्तस्याः पुत्रेभ्योऽधिक एव तु । न चैनां मोक्षयामास वीरो माद्रवतीसुतः ॥
data.md: Among all her sons, Sahadeva was her darling. Alas, that heroic son of Madravati did not rescue her!'

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा रुरुदुः सर्वे समालिङ्ग्य परस्परम् । पाण्डवाः पञ्च दुःखार्ता भूतानीव युगक्षये ॥
data.md: Hearing these bewailings of the king. all those person who were present there began to weep, embracing each other. In fact, the five sons of Pandu were so stricken with grief that they resembled living creatures at the time of the dissolution of the universe.

data.v: तेषां तु पुरुषेन्द्राणां रुदतां रुदितस्वनः । प्रासादाभोगसंरुद्धो अन्वरौत्सीत्स रोदसी ॥
data.md: The sound of lamentations uttered by those weeping heroes, filling the spacious chambers of the palace, escaped therefrom and penetrated the very sky.

data.v: नासौ वृथाग्निना दग्धो यथा तत्र श्रुतं मया । वैचित्रवीर्यो नृपतिस्तत्ते वक्ष्यामि भारत ॥
data.md: Narada said The king has not been burnt to death by an unsanctified fire. I have heard this there. I tell you, O Bharata, such has not been the fate of Vaichitravirya.

data.v: वनं प्रविशता तेन वायुभक्षेण धीमता । अग्नयः कारयित्वेष्टिमुत्सृष्टा इति नः श्रुतम् ॥
data.md: We have heard that when the old king gifted with great intelligence and living on air alone entered the forest (after his return from Gangadvara), he caused his sacrificial fires to be duly ignited. Having performed is sacred rites there with, be abandoned them all.

data.v: याजकास्तु ततस्तस्य तानग्नीन्निर्जने वने । समुत्सृज्य यथाकामं जग्मुर्भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Then the Yajaka Brahmanas he had with him cast off those fires in a solitary part of the forest and went away as they liked, O foremost one of Bharata's race.

data.v: स विवृद्धस्तदा वह्निर्वने तस्मिन्नभूत्किल । तेन तद्वनमादीप्तमिति मे तापसाब्रुवन् ॥
data.md: The fire that cast off grew in the forest. It then produced a general conflagration in the forest. This is what I have heard from the ascetics living on the banks of Ganga.

data.v: स राजा जाह्नवीकच्छे यथा ते कथितं मया । तेनाग्निना समायुक्तः स्वेनैव भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: United with that (sacred) fire of his own, O chief of the Bharatas, the king, as I have already said to you, met with death on the banks of Ganga.

data.v: एवमावेदयामासुर्मुनयस्ते ममानघ । ये ते भागीरथीतीरे मया दृष्टा युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: O sinless one, this is what the ascetics have told me, those viz., whom I saw on the banks of sacred Bhagirathi, O Yudhishthira.

data.v: एवं स्वेनाग्निना राजा समायुक्तो महीपते । मा शोचिथास्त्वं नृपतिं गतः स परमां गतिम् ॥
data.md: Thus, O lord of Earth, king Dhritarashtra, coming into contact with his own sacred fire, departed from this world and attained to that high end that has been his.

data.v: गुरुशुश्रूषया चैव जननी तव पाण्डव । प्राप्ता सुमहतीं सिद्धिमिति मे नात्र संशयः ॥
data.md: Through service rendered by her to her seniors, your mother, O king, has acquired very great success. There is not the slightest doubt of this.

data.v: कर्तुमर्हसि कौरव्य तेषां त्वमुदकक्रियाम् । भ्रातृभिः सहितः सर्वैरेतदत्र विधीयताम् ॥
data.md: You should, O king of kings, now perform the rites of water to their honour with all your brothers. Let, therefore, the necessary steps be taken.

data.v: ततः स पृथिवीपालः पाण्डवानां धुरंधरः । निर्ययौ सह सोदर्यैः सदारो भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Then that lord of Earth, that foremost of men, that upholder of the burthens of the Pandavas, wen tout, accompanied by all his brother as well as the ladies of his household.

data.v: पौरजानपदाश्चैव राजभक्तिपुरस्कृताः । गङ्गां प्रजग्मुरभितो वाससैकेन संवृताः ॥
data.md: The inhabitants of the city as also those of the provinces, actuated by their loyalty, also went out. They all proceeded towards the banks of Ganga, every one clad on only a single piece of cloth.

data.v: ततोऽवगाह्य सलिलं सर्वे ते कुरुपुंगवाः । युयुत्सुमग्रतः कृत्वा ददुस्तोयं महात्मने ॥
data.md: Then all those foremost of men having plunged into the river, placed Yuyutsu at their head, and began to offer oblations of water to the grant king. And they also gave similar oblations to Gandhari and Pritha, naming each separately and mentioning their families.

data.v: गान्धार्याश्च पृथायाश्च विधिवन्नामगोत्रतः । शौचं निवर्तयन्तस्ते तत्रोषुर्नगराद्बहिः ॥
प्रेषयामास स नरान्विधिज्ञानाप्तकारिणः । गङ्गाद्वारं कुरुश्रेष्ठो यत्र दग्धोऽभवन्नृपः ॥
data.md: Having finished those rites which purify the living, they returned but without entering their capital lived outside of it. They also sent a number of trusted people well conversant with the ordinances relating to the cremation of the dead, to Gangadvara where the old king had been burnt to death.

data.v: तत्रैव तेषां कुल्यानि गङ्गाद्वारेऽन्वशात्तदा । कर्तव्यानीति पुरुषान्दत्तदेयान्महीपतिः ॥
data.md: The king, having rewarded those men beforehand, commanded them to perform those rites of cremation which the bodies of Dhritarashtra and Gandhari and Kunti still awaited.

data.v: द्वादशेऽहनि तेभ्यः स कृतशौचो नराधिपः । ददौ श्राद्धानि विधिवद्दक्षिणावन्ति पाण्डवः ॥
data.md: On the twelfth day, the king, properly purified, duly performed the Shraddhas of his deceased relations, which were marked by profuse gifts.

data.v: धृतराष्ट्रं समुद्दिश्य ददौ स पृथिवीपतिः । सुवर्णं रजतं गाश्च शय्याश्च सुमहाधनाः ॥
data.md: Referring to Dhritarashtra, Yudhishthira made many gifts of gold and silver, of kine and costly beds.

data.v: गान्धार्याश्चैव तेजस्वी पृथायाश्च पृथक्पृथक् । संकीर्त्य नामनी राजा ददौ दानमनुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Uttering the names of Gandhari and Pritha, the king, gifted with great energy, made many excellent gifts.

data.v: यो यदिच्छति यावच्च तावत्स लभते द्विजः । शयनं भोजनं यानं मणिरत्नमथो धनम् ॥
data.md: Every man received what thing he wished and as much of it as he wished, Beds and foods, and cars and conveyances, and jewels and gems, and other wealth were given away profusely.

data.v: यानमाच्छादनं भोगान्दासीश्च परिचारिकाः । ददौ राजा समुद्दिश्य तयोर्मात्रोर्महीपतिः ॥
data.md: Indeed, the king, referring to his two mothers, gave away cars and conveyances, dresses and coverlets, various kind of food, and female slaves adorned with various ornaments.

data.v: ततः स पृथिवीपालो दत्त्वा श्राद्धान्यनेकशः । प्रविवेश पुनर्धीमान्नगरं वारणाह्वयम् ॥
data.md: Having thus made many kinds of gift in profusion, that king then entered his capital named Histinapur.

data.v: ते चापि राजवचनात्पुरुषा ये गताभवन् । संकल्प्य तेषां कुल्यानि पुनः प्रत्यागमंस्ततः ॥
data.md: Those men, men who had gone to the banks of Ganga at the command of the king, having disposed of (by cremation) the remains of the king and the two queens, returned to the city.

data.v: माल्यैर्गन्धैश्च विविधैः पूजयित्वा यथाविधि । कुल्यानि तेषां संयोज्य तदाचख्युर्महीपतेः ॥
data.md: Having duly honoured those remains with garlands and scents of various kinds and disposed of them, they informed Yudhishthria of the accomplishment of their task.

data.v: समाश्वास्य च राजानं धर्मात्मानं युधिष्ठिरम् । नारदोऽप्यगमद्राजन्परमर्षिर्यथेप्सितम् ॥
data.md: FINISH AHSRAN The great Rishi Narada, having comforted king Yudhishthira of righteous soul, went away to where he liked.

data.v: एवं वर्षाण्यतीतानि धृतराष्ट्रस्य धीमतः । वनवासे तदा त्रीणि नगरे दश पञ्च च ॥
data.md: Thus did king Dhritarashtra make his departure from this world after having passed three years in the forest and fifteen years in the city.

data.v: हतपुत्रस्य संग्रामे दानानि ददतः सदा । ज्ञातिसंबन्धिमित्राणां भ्रातॄणां स्वजनस्य च ॥
data.md: Having lost all his children in battle, he had made many gifts in honour of his kinsmen, relatives, and friends, his brothers and own people.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्तु नृपतिर्नातिप्रीतमनास्तदा । धारयामास तद्राज्यं निहतज्ञातिबान्धवः ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira, after the death of his uncle, became very cheerless. Deprived of his kinsmen and relatives, he somehow bore the burthen of sovereignty. JAVASIKA PARVA

data.v: षट्त्रिंशे त्वथ संप्राप्ते वर्षे कौरवनन्दनः । ददर्श विपरीतानि निमित्तानि युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, When the thirty-sixth year (after the battle) arrived, the delighter of the Kurus, viz., Yudhishthira, saw many unusual portents.

data.v: ववुर्वाताः सनिर्घाता रूक्षाः शर्करवर्षिणः । अपसव्यानि शकुना मण्डलानि प्रचक्रिरे ॥
data.md: Winds, dry and strong, and showering gravel blew from all sides. Birds began to wheel, making circles from right to left.

data.v: प्रत्यगूहुर्महानद्यो दिशो नीहारसंवृताः । उल्काश्चाङ्गारवर्षिण्यः प्रपेतुर्गगनाद्भुवि ॥
data.md: The great rivers ran in opposite courses. The horizon on every side seemed to be always covered with fog. Meteors, showering coals, dropped on the Earth from the sky.

data.v: आदित्यो रजसा राजन्समवच्छन्नमण्डलः । विरश्मिरुदये नित्यं कबन्धैः समदृश्यत ॥
data.md: The Sun's disc, O king, seemed to be always covered with dust. At its rise, the Sun was shorn of splendour and seemed to be crossed by headless trunks.

data.v: परिवेषाश्च दृश्यन्ते दारुणाः चन्द्रसूर्ययोः । त्रिवर्णाः श्यामरूक्षान्तास्तथा भस्मारुणप्रभाः ॥
data.md: Terrible circles of light were seen every day around both the Sun and the Moon. These circles showed three colours. Their edges seemed to be black and rough and ashy-red in color.

data.v: एते चान्ये च बहव उत्पाता भयशंसिनः । दृश्यन्तेऽहरहो राजन्हृदयोद्वेगकारकाः ॥
data.md: These and many other omens, fore shadowing fear and danger, were seen, o king and struck the hearts of men with anxiety.

data.v: कस्यचित्त्वथ कालस्य कुरुराजो युधिष्ठिरः । शुश्राव वृष्णिचक्रस्य मौसले कदनं कृतम् ॥
data.md: A little while after the Kuru king Yudhishthira heard of the wholesale destruction of the Vrishnis on account of the iron bolt.

data.v: विमुक्तं वासुदेवं च श्रुत्वा रामं च पाण्डवः । समानीयाब्रवीद्भ्रातॄन्किं करिष्याम इत्युत ॥
data.md: The son of Pandu, hearing that only Vasudeva and Rama had escaped alive, summoned his brothers and consulted with them as to what they should do.

data.v: परस्परं समासाद्य ब्रह्मदण्डबलात्कृतान् । वृष्णीन्विनष्टांस्ते श्रुत्वा व्यथिताः पाण्डवाभवन् ॥
data.md: Meeting with one another they became greatly stricken with surrow upon hearing that the Vrishnis had met with destruction through the Brahmana's rod of Punishment.

data.v: निधनं वासुदेवस्य समुद्रस्येव शोषणम् । वीरा न श्रद्दधुस्तस्य विनाशं शार्ङ्गधन्वनः ॥
data.md: These heroes could not believe the death of Vasudeva, like the drying up of the ocean. In fact, they could not believe the destruction of the holder of Sharnga.

data.v: मौसलं ते परिश्रुत्य दुःखशोकसमन्विताः । विषण्णा हतसंकल्पाः पाण्डवाः समुपाविशन् ॥
data.md: Inforined of the incident about the iron bolt, the Pandavas, became stricken with grief and sorrow. In fact, they sat down, utterly cheerless and stricken with blank despair.

data.v: कथं विनष्टा भगवन्नन्धका वृष्णिभिः सह । पश्यतो वासुदेवस्य भोजाश्चैव महारथाः ॥
data.md: Indeed, O holy one, how was it that the Andhakas along with the Vrishnis, and those great car-warriors, viz., the Bhojas, met with destruction before the very eyes of Vasudeva?

data.v: षट्त्रिंशेऽथ ततो वर्षे वृष्णीनामनयो महान् । अन्योन्यं मुसलैस्ते तु निजघ्नुः कालचोदिताः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said When the thirty-sixth year arrived (after the great battle) a great calamity overtook the Vrishnis. Moved by Time, they all met with destruction on account of the iron bolt.

data.v: केनानुशप्तास्ते वीराः क्षयं वृष्ण्यन्धका ययुः । भोजाश्च द्विजवर्य त्वं विस्तरेण वदस्व मे ॥
data.md: Crused by whom did those heroes, viz., the Vrishnis, Andhakas and the Bhojas, met with destruction? O foremost of twice-born persons, do you fully explain all this to me.

data.v: विश्वामित्रं च कण्वं च नारदं च तपोधनम् । सारणप्रमुखा वीरा ददृशुर्द्वारकागतान् ॥
data.md: One day, the Vrishni heroes numbering Sarana amongst them; saw Vishvamitra and Kanwa and Narada arrived at Dwraka.

data.md: Hear now, O king, what those ascetics, attempted to be thus imposed on, said, “This heir of Vasudeva, by name Shamba, will produce a dreadful iron bolt for the destruction of the Vrishnis and the Andhakas.

data.md: O wicked and cruel ones, intoxicated with pride, through that iron bolt you will become the exterminators of your family with the exception of Rama an Janardana.

data.v: समुद्रं यास्यति श्रीमांस्त्यक्त्वा देहं हलायुधः । जरा कृष्णं महात्मानं शयानं भुवि भेत्स्यति ॥
data.md: The blessed hero armed with the plough will enter the ocean renouncing his body, while a hunter of the name of Jara will pierce the great Krishna while lying on the ground.'

data.md: Attempted to be deceived by those wicked ones, those ascetics, with eyes red in anger, looked at each other and uttered those words. Having said so they then went to see Keshava.

data.v: तथोक्त्वा मुनयस्ते तु ततः केशवमभ्ययुः ॥
अथाब्रवीत्तदा वृष्णीञ्श्रुत्वैवं मधुसूदनः । अन्तज्ञो मतिमांस्तस्य भवितव्यं तथेति तान् ॥
data.md: The destroyer of Madhu, informed of what had occurred, summoned all the Vrishnis and told them of it. Gifted with great intelligence and fully acquainted with what the end of his family would be he simply said that that which was destined would surely take place.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा हृषीकेशः प्रविवेश पुनर्गृहान् । कृतान्तमन्यथा नैच्छत्कर्तुं स जगतः प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Hrishikesha having said so, entered his palace. The Lord of the universe did not wish to ordain otherwise.

data.v: श्वोभूतेऽथ ततः साम्बो मुसलं तदसूत वै । वृष्ण्यन्धकविनाशाय किंकरप्रतिमं महत् ॥
data.md: When the next day came, Shamba actually produced an iron bolt through which all the individuals in the family of the Vrishnis and the Andhakas became reduced to ashes.

ततो राजभयात्सर्वे नियमं चक्रिरे तदा । नराः शासनमाज्ञाय तस्य राज्ञो महात्मनः ॥
data.md: Through fear of the king, and knowing that it the order of Rama also of unimpeachable deeds, all the citizen bound themselves by a rule and abstained from manufacturing wines and spirits. was

data.v: एवं प्रयतमानानां वृष्णीनामन्धकैः सह । कालो गृहाणि सर्वेषां परिचक्राम नित्यशः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said While the Vrishnis and the Andhakas were thus trying (to avoid the impending calamity), the embodied from of time (death) every day wandered about their houses.

data.v: करालो विकटो मुण्डः पुरुषः कृष्णपिङ्गलः । गृहाण्यवेक्ष्य वृष्णीनां नादृश्यत पुनः क्वचित् ॥
data.md: He looked like a man of terrible and fierce aspect. Of bald head, he was black and of tawny color. Sometimes he was beheld by the Vrishnis as he peered into their houses.

data.v: उत्पेदिरे महावाता दारुणाश्चा दिने दिने । वृष्ण्यन्धकविनाशाय बहवो रोमहर्षणाः ॥
data.md: Day by day strong winds blew, and many were the evil omens which arose, awful and foreboding the destruction of the Vrishnis and the Andhakas.

data.v: विवृद्धमूषका रथ्या विभिन्नमणिकास्तथा । चीचीकूचीति वाश्यन्त्यः सारिका वृष्णिवेश्मसु । नोपशाम्यति शब्दश्च स दिवारात्रमेव हि ॥
data.md: Sharikas chirped, sitting within the houses of the Vrishnis. The noise made by those birds ceased not for even a short while by day or by night.

data.v: अनुकुर्वन्नुलूकानां सारसा विरुतं तथा । अजाः शिवानां च रुतमन्वकुर्वत भारत ॥
data.md: The Sarashas were heard to imitate the hooting of the owl, and goats imitated the cries, O Bharata, of Jackals.

data.v: पाण्डुरा रक्तपादाश्च विहगाः कालचोदिताः । वृष्ण्यन्धकानां गेहेषु कपोता व्यचरंस्तदा ॥
data.md: Many birds appeared, moved by Death, which were pale of color, but that had legs red of hue. Pigeons were seen to always disport in the houses of the Vrishni.

data.v: व्यजायन्त खरा गोषु करभाश्वतरीषु च । शुनीष्वपि बिडालाश्च मूषका नकुलीषु च ॥
data.md: Asses were born of kine, and elephants of mules. Cats were born of bitches, and mouse of the mungoose.

data.v: नापत्रपन्त पापानि कुर्वन्तो वृष्णयस्तदा । प्राद्विषन्ब्राह्मणांश्चापि पितॄन्देवांस्तथैव च ॥
data.md: The Vrishnis, committing sinful deeds, were not seen to feel any shame. They showed disregard for Brahmanas and the departed manes and the departed manes and the celestials.

data.v: गुरूंश्चाप्यवमन्यन्त न तु रामजनार्दनौ । पत्न्यः पतीन्व्युच्चरन्त पत्नीश्च पतयस्तथा ॥
data.md: They insulted and humiliated their preceptors and elders. Only Rama and Janardana acted differently. Wives deceived their husbands, and husbands deceived wives.

data.v: विभावसुः प्रज्वलितो वामं विपरिवर्तते । नीललोहितमाञ्जिष्ठा विसृजन्नर्चिषः पृथक् ॥
data.md: Fires, when ignited cast their flames towards the left. Sometimes they threw out flames whose colour was blue and red.

data.v: उदयास्तमने नित्यं पुर्यां तस्यां दिवाकरः । व्यदृश्यतासकृत्पुंभिः कबन्धैः परिवारितः ॥
data.md: The Sun, whether when rising or setting over that city, seemed to be surrounded by headless trunks of human beings.

data.v: महानसेषु सिद्धेऽन्ने संस्कृतेऽतीव भारत । आहार्यमाणे कृमयो व्यदृश्यन्त नराधिप ॥
data.md: In cook-rooms, upon food that was clean and well-boiled, were soon, when it was served out for eating, innumerable worms of various kinds.

data.v: पुण्याहे वाच्यमाने च जपत्सु च महात्मसु । अभिधावन्तः श्रूयन्ते न चादृश्यत कश्चन ॥
data.md: When Brahmanas, receiving gifts, blessed the day or the hour fixed for this or that undertaking or when great men were engaged in silent recitations, the heavy trend was heard of many men running about but no one could be seen to whom the sound of such sound could be ascribed.

data.v: परस्परं च नक्षत्रं हन्यमानं पुनः पुनः । ग्रहैरपश्यन्सर्वे ते नात्मनस्तु कथंचन ॥
data.md: The Constellations were repeatedly seen to be struck by the planets. None amongst the Yadavas could, however, see the constellation of his birth.

data.v: नदन्तं पाञ्चजन्यं च वृष्ण्यन्धकनिवेशने । समन्तात्प्रत्यवाश्यन्त रासभा दारुणस्वराः ॥
data.md: When the Panchajanya was blown in their houses, asses of dissonant and awful voice brayed aloud from all sides.

data.v: एवं पश्यन्हृषीकेशः संप्राप्तं कालपर्ययम् । त्रयोदश्याममावास्यां तां दृष्ट्वा प्राब्रवीदिदम् ॥
data.md: Seeing these sings which showed the perverse course of Time, and seeing that the day of the new moon coincided with the thirteenth (and the fourteenth) lunation's, Hrishkesha, summoning the Yadavas, said to them these words:

data.v: चतुर्दशी पञ्चदशी कृतेयं राहुणा पुनः । तदा च भारते युद्धे प्राप्ता चाद्य क्षयाय नः ॥
data.md: The fourteenth lunation has been made the fifteenth by Rahu once more. Such a day had appeared at the time of the great battle of the Bharatas. It has once more appeared, it seems, for our destruction.'

data.v: विमृशन्नेव कालं तं परिचिन्त्य जनार्दनः । मेने प्राप्तं स षट्त्रिंशं वर्षं वै केशिसूदनः ॥
data.md: The destroyer of Keshi, viz., Janardana, thinking upon the omens that Time showed, understood that the thirty-sixth year had come, and that what Gandhari, burning with grief on account of the death of her sons, and deprived of all her kinsmen, had said was about to take place.

data.v: पुत्रशोकाभिसंतप्ता गान्धारी हतबान्धवा । यदनुव्याजहारार्ता तदिदं समुपागतम् ॥
data.md: The destroyer of Keshi, viz., Janardana, thinking upon the omens that Time showed, understood that the thirty-sixth year had come, and that what Gandhari, burning with grief on account of the death of her sons, and deprived of all her kinsmen, had said was about to take place.

data.v: इदं च तदनुप्राप्तमब्रवीद्यद्युधिष्ठिरः । पुरा व्यूढेष्वनीकेषु दृष्ट्वोत्पातान्सुदारुणान् ॥
data.md: The present is exactly similar to that time which Yudhishthira had marked at sight of those dreadful omens which appeared when the two armies were arranged in battle-order.

data.md: Vasudeva, having said so, tried to bring about those occurrences which would make Gandhari's words true. That chastiser of enemies commanded the Vrishnis to make a pilgrimage to some sacred water.

data.v: अघोषयन्त पुरुषास्तत्र केशवशासनात् । तीर्थयात्रा समुद्रे वः कार्येति पुरुषर्षभाः ॥
data.md: The messengers immediately proclaimed at the command of Keshava that the Vrishnis should make a journey to the sea-coast for bathing in the sacred waters of the ocean.

data.v: काली स्त्री पाण्डुरैर्दन्तैः प्रविश्य हसती निशि । स्त्रियः स्वप्नेषु मुष्णन्ती द्वारकां परिधावति ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said At that time the Vrishni ladics dreamt every night a woman of black color and white teeth, entering their abodes, laughed aloud and ran through Dwraka, snatching from them the auspicious threads in their wrists.

data.v: अलंकाराश्च छत्रं च ध्वजाश्च कवचानि च । ह्रियमाणान्यदृश्यन्त रक्षोभिः सुभयानकैः ॥
data.md: Their ornaments and umbrellas and standards and armour were seen to be taken away by dreadful Rakshasas.

data.v: तच्चाग्निदत्तं कृष्णस्य वज्रनाभमयस्मयम् । दिवमाचक्रमे चक्रं वृष्णीनां पश्यतां तदा ॥
data.md: Before the very eyes of the Vrishnis, the discus of Krishna, given by Agni, made of iron and having its nave composed of hardest adamant, ascended into the sky.

data.v: युक्तं रथं दिव्यमादित्यवर्णं; हयाहरन्पश्यतो दारुकस्य । ते सागरस्योपरिष्टादवर्त;न्मनोजवाश्चतुरो वाजिमुख्याः ॥
data.md: In the very sight of Daruka, the excellent car of Vasudeva, effulgent like the sun, and properly equipt was taken away by the horses yoked to it. Those foremost of horses, numbering four, and fleet like the mind, fled away, dragging the car after them along the surface of the ocean.

data.v: तालः सुपर्णश्च महाध्वजौ तौ; सुपूजितौ रामजनार्दनाभ्याम् । उच्चैर्जह्रुरप्सरसो दिवानिशं; वाचश्चोचुर्गम्यतां तीर्थयात्रा ॥
data.md: The two great standards of Krishna's car and Baladeva's car, having the emblems of Garuda and palmyra, which were reverently adored those two heroes, were taken away by Apsaras who, day and night, called upon the Vrishnis and the Andhakas to start on a pilgrimage to some sacred water.

data.v: ततो जिगमिषन्तस्ते वृष्ण्यन्धकमहारथाः । सान्तःपुरास्तदा तीर्थयात्रामैच्छन्नरर्षभाः ॥
data.md: When these omens were seen and heard, those foremost of men, viz., the powerful carwarriors of the Vrishnis and the Andhakas, became desirous of setting out, with their whole families, on a pilgrimage to some sacred water.

data.v: ततो भोज्यं च भक्ष्यं च पेयं चान्धकवृष्णयः । बहु नानाविधं चक्रुर्मद्यं मांसमनेकशः ॥
data.md: They prepared various kinds of viands and edibles and various kinds of wines and meat.

data.v: ततः सीधुषु सक्ताश्च निर्ययुर्नगराद्बहिः । यानैरश्वैर्गजैश्चैव श्रीमन्तस्तिग्मतेजसः ॥
data.md: The troops of the Vrishnis and the Andhakas, blazing with beauty and gifted with fierce energy, then set out from the city on cars and horses and elephants.

data.v: ततः प्रभासे न्यवसन्यथोद्देशं यथागृहम् । प्रभूतभक्ष्यपेयास्ते सदारा यादवास्तदा ॥
data.md: The Yadavas then, with their wives, proceeded to Prabhasa and took up their residence there, each in the (temporary) habitation which was assigned to him and all having profuse provisions consisting of edibles and drink.

data.v: निविष्टांस्तान्निशम्याथ समुद्रान्ते स योगवित् । जगामामन्त्र्य तान्वीरानुद्धवोऽर्थविशारदः ॥
data.md: Hearing that they had taken up their abode on the sea-coast, Uddhava, the wisest of men, who was, besides, well-versed in Yoga, went there and to their leave (for departing).

data.v: तं प्रस्थितं महात्मानमभिवाद्य कृताञ्जलिम् । जानन्विनाशं वृष्णीनां नैच्छद्वारयितुं हरिः ॥
data.md: Krishna, with joined with joined hands, saluted Uddhava, and seeing him bent on departing (from the world) and knowing that the destruction of the Vrishnis was night, did not feel any disposition to prevent him.

data.v: ततः कालपरीतास्ते वृष्ण्यन्धकमहारथाः । अपश्यन्नुद्धवं यान्तं तेजसावृत्य रोदसी ॥
data.md: The powerful car-warriors among the Vrishnis and the Andhakas, whose hour hand come, then saw Uddhava proceed on his great journey, filling the entire sky with his effulgence.

data.v: ब्राह्मणार्थेषु यत्सिद्धमन्नं तेषां महात्मनाम् । तद्वानरेभ्यः प्रददुः सुरागन्धसमन्वितम् ॥
data.md: The Vrishnis, mixing with wine the food that had been cooked for great Brahmanas, gave it away to monkeys an apes.

data.v: ततस्तूर्यशताकीर्णं नटनर्तकसंकुलम् । प्रावर्तत महापानं प्रभासे तिग्मतेजसाम् ॥
data.md: Those heroes of fierce energy then began to revel with drink, at Prabhasa. The entire field echoed with the blare of hundreds of trumpets and abounded with actors and dancers.

data.v: कृष्णस्य संनिधौ रामः सहितः कृतवर्मणा । अपिबद्युयुधानश्च गदो बभ्रुस्तथैव च ॥
data.md: In the very sight of Krishna, Rama began to drink, with Kritavarman, Yuyudhana and Gada and Vabhru also did the same.

data.v: ततः परिषदो मध्ये युयुधानो मदोत्कटः । अब्रवीत्कृतवर्माणमवहस्यावमन्य च ॥
कः क्षत्रियो मन्यमानः सुप्तान्हन्यान्मृतानिव । न तन्मृष्यन्ति हार्दिक्य यादवा यत्त्वया कृतम् ॥
data.md: Then Yuyudhana, inebriated with wine, derisively laughing at and insulting Kritavarman in the midst of that assembly, said, 'What Kshatriya is there who, armed with weapons, will kill men locked in the embraces of sleep and, therefore, already dead? Hence, O son of Hridika, the Yadavas will never tolerate what you have done.'

data.v: इत्युक्ते युयुधानेन पूजयामास तद्वचः । प्रद्युम्नो रथिनां श्रेष्ठो हार्दिक्यमवमन्य च ॥
data.md: When Yuyudhana had said these words, Pradyumna, that foremost of car-warriors, applauded them, expressing his disregard for the son of Hridika.

data.v: ततः परमसंक्रुद्धः कृतवर्मा तमब्रवीत् । निर्दिशन्निव सावज्ञं तदा सव्येन पाणिना ॥
data.md: Greatly enraged at this, Kritavarman, cmphasising his disregard for Satyaki by pointing to him with his left hand, said these words:

data.v: भूरिश्रवाश्छिन्नबाहुर्युद्धे प्रायगतस्त्वया । वधेन सुनृशंसेन कथं वीरेण पातितः ॥
data.md: Professing yourself to be a hero, how could you so cruelly kill the armless Bhurishravas who, on the field of battle, sat fasting.

data.v: इति तस्य वचः श्रुत्वा केशवः परवीरहा । तिर्यक्सरोषया दृष्ट्या वीक्षां चक्रे स मन्युमान् ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of his, Keshava, that destroyer of hostile heroes, giving way to anger, cast an angry look at Kritavarman.

data.v: मणिः स्यमन्तकश्चैव यः स सत्राजितोऽभवत् । तां कथां स्मारयामास सात्यकिर्मधुसूदनम् ॥
data.md: Then Satyaki informed the destroyer of Madhu as to how Kritavarman had behaved towards Satrajit for taking away from him the celebrated gem Syamantaka.

data.v: तच्छ्रुत्वा केशवस्याङ्कमगमद्रुदती तदा । सत्यभामा प्रकुपिता कोपयन्ती जनार्दनम् ॥
data.md: Hearing the narrative, Satyabhama, giving way to anger and tears, approached Keshava, and sitting on his lap, increased his anger (for Kritavarman).

data.v: तत उत्थाय सक्रोधः सात्यकिर्वाक्यमब्रवीत् । पञ्चानां द्रौपदेयानां धृष्टद्युम्नशिखण्डिनोः ॥
एष गच्छामि पदवीं सत्येन च तथा शपे । सौप्तिके ये च निहताः सुप्तानेन दुरात्मना ॥
द्रोणपुत्रसहायेन पापेन कृतवर्मणा । समाप्तमायुरस्याद्य यशश्चापि सुमध्यमे ॥
इतीदमुक्त्वा खड्गेन केशवस्य समीपतः । अभिद्रुत्य शिरः क्रुद्धश्चिच्छेद कृतवर्मणः ॥
data.md: Having said these words, Satyaki rushed at Kritavarman and cut off his head with a sword in the very sight of Keshava.

data.v: तथान्यानपि निघ्नन्तं युयुधानं समन्ततः । अभ्यधावद्धृषीकेशो विनिवारयिषुस्तदा ॥
data.md: Yuyudhana, having performed this feat, began to strike down others there present. Hrishikesha ran to prevent him from doing further mischief.

data.v: एकीभूतास्ततः सर्वे कालपर्यायचोदिताः । भोजान्धका महाराज शैनेयं पर्यवारयन् ॥
data.md: At that time, however, O king, the Bhojas and Andhakas moved by the perverseness of the hour that had come upon them, all became as one man and surrounded the son of Shini.

data.v: तान्दृष्ट्वा पततस्तूर्णमभिक्रुद्धाञ्जनार्दनः । न चुक्रोध महातेजा जानन्कालस्य पर्ययम् ॥
data.md: Janardana of great energy, knowing the character of the hour stood unmoved without giving way to anger, seeing those heroes rushing in anger at Satyaki from every side.

data.v: ते तु पानमदाविष्टाश्चोदिताश्चैव मन्युना । युयुधानमथाभ्यघ्नन्नुच्छिष्टैर्भाजनैस्तदा ॥
data.md: Urged by fate and inebriated with drink, they began to strike Yuyudhana with the pots from which they had been eating.

data.v: हन्यमाने तु शैनेये क्रुद्धो रुक्मिणिनन्दनः । तदन्तरमुपाधावन्मोक्षयिष्यञ्शिनेः सुतम् ॥
data.md: When the son of Shini was being thus assaulted, Rukmini's son became greatly enraged. he rushed forward for rescuing Satyaki who was engaged with the Bhojas and the Andhaks.

data.v: स भोजैः सह संयुक्तः सात्यकिश्चान्धकैः सह । बहुत्वान्निहतौ तत्र उभौ कृष्णस्य पश्यतः ॥
हतं दृष्ट्वा तु शैनेयं पुत्रं च यदुनन्दनः । एरकाणां तदा मुष्टिं कोपाज्जग्राह केशवः ॥
data.md: Seeing his own son, and the son of Shini too, killed, the delighter of the Yadus took up, in anger, a handful of the Eraka grass which grew there.

data.v: तदभून्मुसलं घोरं वज्रकल्पमयोमयम् । जघान तेन कृष्णस्तान्येऽस्य प्रमुखतोऽभवन् ॥
data.md: That handful of grass became a terrible bolt of iron gifted with the energy of the thunderbolt. With it Krishna destroyed all those who came before him.

data.v: ततोऽन्धकाश्च भोजाश्च शैनेया वृष्णयस्तथा । जघ्नुरन्योन्यमाक्रन्दे मुसलैः कालचोदिताः ॥
data.md: Then the Andhakas and the Bhojas, the Shaineyas and the Vrishnis, urged by Time, struck one another in that dreadful right.

data.v: यस्तेषामेरकां कश्चिज्जग्राह रुषितो नृप । वज्रभूतेव सा राजन्नदृश्यत तदा विभो ॥
data.md: Indeed, O king, whoever amongst them took up in anger a few blades of the Eraka grass, these, in his hands, became soon converted into a thunder-bolt, O powerful one.

data.v: तृणं च मुसलीभूतमपि तत्र व्यदृश्यत । ब्रह्मदण्डकृतं सर्वमिति तद्विद्धि पार्थिव ॥
data.md: Every blade of grass there was seen to be converted into a terrible iron bolt. All this, know, O king, was due to the curse imprecated by Brahmanas.

data.v: आविध्याविध्य ते राजन्प्रक्षिपन्ति स्म यत्तृणम् । तद्वज्रभूतं मुसलं व्यदृश्यत तदा दृढम् ॥
data.md: He who hurled a blade of grass saw that it pierced through even such things as were utterly impenetrable. In fact, every blade was seen to become a dreadful bolt having the force of thunder.

data.v: अवधीत्पितरं पुत्रः पिता पुत्रं च भारत । मत्ताः परिपतन्ति स्म पोथयन्तः परस्परम् ॥
data.md: Son killed father, and father killed son, O Bharata! Inebriated with wine, they rushed and fell upon one another.

data.v: पतंगा इव चाग्नौ ते न्यपतन्कुकुरान्धकाः । नासीत्पलायने बुद्धिर्वध्यमानस्य कस्यचित् ॥
data.md: The Kukuras and the Andhakas met with destruction like insects rushing at a burning fire. As they were thus being destroyed, no one among them thought of escaping by flight.

data.v: तं तु पश्यन्महाबाहुर्जानन्कालस्य पर्ययम् । मुसलं समवष्टभ्य तस्थौ स मधुसूदनः ॥
data.md: Knowing that the hour of destruction had come, the mighty-armed Keshava stood there, seeing everything. Indeed, the destroyer of Madhu stood, raising a bolt of Iron formed of a blade of grass.

data.v: साम्बं च निहतं दृष्ट्वा चारुदेष्णं च माधवः । प्रद्युम्नं चानिरुद्धं च ततश्चुक्रोध भारत ॥
data.md: Seeing that Shamba was killed, as also Charudeshna and Pradyumna and Aniruddha, Madhava became filled with anger.

data.v: गदं वीक्ष्य शयानं च भृशं कोपसमन्वितः । स निःशेषं तदा चक्रे शार्ङ्गचक्रगदाधरः ॥
data.md: Seeing Gada lying dead on the ground, his anger became enhanced. The holder Sharnaga and the discus and the mace then rooted the Vrishnis and the Andhakas.

data.v: तं निघ्नन्तं महातेजा बभ्रुः परपुरंजयः । दारुकश्चैव दाशार्हमूचतुर्यन्निबोध तत् ॥
data.md: Hear, O king, what that conqueror of hostile towns, viz., Vabhru of great energy, and Daruka, then said to Krishna.

data.v: भगवन्संहृतं सर्वं त्वया भूयिष्ठमच्युत । रामस्य पदमन्विच्छ तत्र गच्छाम यत्र सः ॥
data.md: O holy one, a very large number of men has been killed by you. Turn now to where Rama has gone! We wish to go there where he has gone.

data.v: ततो ययुर्दारुकः केशवश्च; बभ्रुश्च रामस्य पदं पतन्तः । अथापश्यन्राममनन्तवीर्यं; वृक्षे स्थितं चिन्तयानं विविक्ते ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, Then Daruka, Keshava and Vabhru left that place following Rama. They saw that hero of great energy sitting thoughtfully, reclining his back against at tree, in a solitary place.

data.v: ततः समासाद्य महानुभावः; कृष्णस्तदा दारुकमन्वशासत् । गत्वा कुरूञ्शीघ्रमिमं महान्तं; पार्थाय शंसस्व वधं यदूनाम् ॥
data.md: Finding Rama of great soul, Krishna ordered Daruka, saying, 'Going to the Kurus, inform Partha of this great carnage of the Yadus.

data.v: ततोऽर्जुनः क्षिप्रमिहोपयातु; श्रुत्वा मृतान्यादवान्ब्रह्मशापात् । इत्येवमुक्तः स ययौ रथेन; कुरूंस्तदा दारुको नष्टचेताः ॥
data.md: Let Arjuna come here speedily hearing of the destruction of the Yadavas though the Brahmanas' course.' Thus addressed Daruka, deprived of his senses by sorrow, proceeded on a car to the capital of the Kurus.

data.v: ततो गते दारुके केशवोऽथ; दृष्ट्वान्तिके बभ्रुमुवाच वाक्यम् । स्त्रियो भवान्रक्षतु यातु शीघ्रं; नैता हिंस्युर्दस्यवो वित्तलोभात् ॥
data.md: After Daruka had departed, Keshava, seeing Vabhru waiting on him, told him these words 'Do you go speedily for protecting the ladies. Let not robbers do them any injury, tempted by the riches.

data.v: स प्रस्थितः केशवेनानुशिष्टो; मदातुरो ज्ञातिवधार्दितश्च । तं वै यान्तं संनिधौ केशवस्य; त्वरन्तमेकं सहसैव बभ्रुम् । ब्रह्मानुशप्तमवधीन्महद्वै; कूटोन्मुक्तं मुसलं लुब्धकस्य ॥
data.md: Thus orderded by Keshava, Vabhru still helpless with wine but cheerless at the destruction of his kinsmen, wen away. He had rested for a while by the side of Keshava, but as soon as he had gone to a distance the ironbolt, attached to a mallet in the hands of a hunter, suddenly sprang of itself upon that solitary survivor of the Yadava family and killed him who also had been included in the curs of the Brahmans.

data.v: ततो दृष्ट्वा निहतं बभ्रुमाह; कृष्णो वाक्यं भ्रातरमग्रजं तु । इहैव त्वं मां प्रतीक्षस्व राम; यावत्स्त्रियो ज्ञातिवशाः करोमि ॥
data.md: Seeing Vabhru killed, Keshava of great energy addressed his elder brother and said, 'Do you, O Rama, wait for me her till I put the ladies under the care of kinsmen.

data.v: ततः पुरीं द्वारवतीं प्रविश्य; जनार्दनः पितरं प्राह वाक्यम् । स्त्रियो भवान्रक्षतु नः समग्रा; धनंजयस्यागमनं प्रतीक्षन् । रामो वनान्ते प्रतिपालयन्मा;मास्तेऽद्याहं तेन समागमिष्ये ॥
data.md: Entering the city of Dvaravati, Janardana said these words to his father, 'Do you protect all the ladies of our house till Dhananjaya comes.

data.v: दृष्टं मयेदं निधनं यदूनां; राज्ञां च पूर्वं कुरुपुंगवानाम् । नाहं विना यदुभिर्यादवानां; पुरीमिमां द्रष्टुमिहाद्य शक्तः ॥
तपश्चरिष्यामि निबोध तन्मे; रामेण सार्धं वनमभ्युपेत्य । इतीदमुक्त्वा शिरसास्य पादौ; संस्पृश्य कृष्णस्त्वरितो जगाम ॥
ततो महान्निनदः प्रादुरासी;त्सस्त्रीकुमारस्य पुरस्य तस्य । अथाब्रवीत्केशवः संनिवर्त्य; शब्दं श्रुत्वा योषितां क्रोशतीनाम् ॥
पुरीमिमामेष्यति सव्यसाची; स वो दुःखान्मोचयिता नराग्र्यः । ततो गत्वा केशवस्तं ददर्श; रामं वने स्थितमेकं विविक्ते ॥
अथापश्यद्योगयुक्तस्य तस्य; नागं मुखान्निःसरन्तं महान्तम् । श्वेतं ययौ स ततः प्रेक्ष्यमाणो; महार्णवो येन महानुभावः ॥
सहस्रशीर्षः पर्वताभोगवर्ष्मा; रक्ताननः स्वां तनुं तां विमुच्य । सम्यक्च तं सागरः प्रत्यगृह्णा;न्नागा दिव्याः सरितश्चैव पुण्याः ॥
कर्कोटको वासुकिस्तक्षकश्च; पृथुश्रवा वरुणः कुञ्जरश्च । मिश्री शङ्खः कुमुदः पुण्डरीक;स्तथा नागो धृतराष्ट्रो महात्मा ॥
ह्रादः क्राथः शितिकण्ठोऽग्रतेजा;स्तथा नागौ चक्रमन्दातिषण्डौ । नागश्रेष्ठो दुर्मुखश्चाम्बरीषः; स्वयं राजा वरुणश्चापि राजन् । प्रत्युद्गम्य स्वागतेनाभ्यनन्दं;स्तेऽपूजयंश्चार्घ्यपाद्यक्रियाभिः ॥
ततो गते भ्रातरि वासुदेवो; जानन्सर्वा गतयो दिव्यदृष्टिः । वने शून्ये विचरंश्चिन्तयानो; भूमौ ततः संविवेशाग्र्यतेजाः ॥
data.md: After his brother had thus gone from the (human) world, Vasudeva of celestial vision, who was fully acquainted with the end of all things, wandered for sometime in that solitary forest thoughtfully. Gifted with great energy he then sat down on the naked earth.

data.v: सर्वं हि तेन प्राक्तदा वित्तमासी;द्गान्धार्या यद्वाक्यमुक्तः स पूर्वम् । दुर्वाससा पायसोच्छिष्टलिप्ते; यच्चाप्युक्तं तच्च सस्मार कृष्णः ॥
data.md: He had thought before this of everything which had been foreshadowed by the words uttered by Gandhari in former days. He also recollected the words that Durvasas had spoken at the time his body was smeared by that Rishi with the residue of the Payasa he had eaten.

data.v: स चिन्तयानोऽन्धकवृष्णिनाशं; कुरुक्षयं चैव महानुभावः । मेने ततः संक्रमणस्य कालं; ततश्चकारेन्द्रियसंनिरोधम् ॥
data.md: The high-souled one, thinking of the destruction of the Vrishnis and the Andhakas, as also of the previous destruction of the Kurus, concluded that the hour (for his own departure from the world) had come. He then controlled his senses (in Yoga).

data.v: स संनिरुद्धेन्द्रियवाङ्मनास्तु; शिश्ये महायोगमुपेत्य कृष्णः । जराथ तं देशमुपाजगाम; लुब्धस्तदानीं मृगलिप्सुरुग्रः ॥
data.md: Having controlled all his senses, speech, and mind Krishna laid himself down in high Yoga. A fierce hunter of the name of Jara then came there, for finding a deer.

data.v: स केशवं योगयुक्तं शयानं; मृगाशङ्की लुब्धकः सायकेन । जराविध्यत्पादतले त्वरावां;स्तं चाभितस्तज्जिघृक्षुर्जगाम । अथापश्यत्पुरुषं योगयुक्तं; पीताम्बरं लुब्धकोऽनेकबाहुम् ॥
data.md: The hunter mistaking Keshava, who was stretched on the earth in high Yoga, for a deer, pierced at him at the heel with an arrow and quickly came to that spot for capturing his prey.

data.v: मत्वात्मानमपराद्धं स तस्य; जग्राह पादौ शिरसा चार्तरूपः । आश्वासयत्तं महात्मा तदानीं; गच्छन्नूर्ध्वं रोदसी व्याप्य लक्ष्म्या ॥
data.md: The high-souled one comforted him and then ascended upwards, filling the entire sky with splendour.

data.v: दिवं प्राप्तं वासवोऽथाश्विनौ च; रुद्रादित्या वसवश्चाथ विश्वे । प्रत्युद्ययुर्मुनयश्चापि सिद्धा; गन्धर्वमुख्याश्च सहाप्सरोभिः ॥
data.md: When he reached the celestial region, Vasava and the twin Ashvins and Rudra and the Adityas and and the Vasus and the Visuvedevas, and Munis and Siddhas and many foremost ones among the Gandharvas, with the Apsaras, advanced to receive him.

data.v: ततो राजन्भगवानुग्रतेजा; नारायणः प्रभवश्चाव्ययश्च । योगाचार्यो रोदसी व्याप्य लक्ष्म्या; स्थानं प्राप स्वं महात्माप्रमेयम् ॥
data.md: Then, O king, the illustrious Narayana of dreadful energy, the Creator and Destroyer of all, that preceptor of Yoga-filling Heaven with his splendour, reached his own inconceivable region.

data.v: ततो देवैरृषिभिश्चापि कृष्णः; समागतश्चारणैश्चैव राजन् । गन्धर्वाग्र्यैरप्सरोभिर्वराभिः; सिद्धैः साध्यैश्चानतैः पूज्यमानः ॥
data.md: Krishna then met the deities and (celestial) Rishis and Charanas, O king, and the foremost ones among the Gandharvas and many beautiful Apsaras and Siddhas and Saddhyas. All of them bending in humility, adored him.

data.v: ते वै देवाः प्रत्यनन्दन्त राज;न्मुनिश्रेष्ठा वाग्भिरानर्चुरीशम् । गन्धर्वाश्चाप्युपतस्थुः स्तुवन्तः; प्रीत्या चैनं पुरुहूतोऽभ्यनन्दत् ॥
data.md: The celestials all saluted him, O monarch, and many foremost of ascetics and Rishi adored him as the Lord of all. The Gandharvas waited on him, singing his praises, and Indra also joyfully praised him.

data.v: दारुकोऽपि कुरून्गत्वा दृष्ट्वा पार्थान्महारथान् । आचष्ट मौसले वृष्णीनन्योन्येनोपसंहृतान् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Meanwhile Daruka, going to the Kurus and seeing those powerful car warriors, viz., the sons Pritha, informed them of how the Vrishnis had killed one another with iron bolts.

data.v: श्रुत्वा विनष्टान्वार्ष्णेयान्सभोजकुकुरान्धकान् । पाण्डवाः शोकसंतप्ता वित्रस्तमनसोऽभवन् ॥
data.md: Hearing that the Vrishnis along with the Bhojas and Andhakas and Kukuras had all been killed, the Pandavas, burning with grief, became highly moved.

data.v: ततोऽर्जुनस्तानामन्त्र्य केशवस्य प्रियः सखा । प्रययौ मातुलं द्रष्टुं नेदमस्तीति चाब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Then the Arjuna, the dear friend of Keshava, bidding them farewell, started for seeing his maternal uncle. He said that destruction would soon overtake every thing.

data.v: स वृष्णिनिलयं गत्वा दारुकेण सह प्रभो । ददर्श द्वारकां वीरो मृतनाथामिव स्त्रियम् ॥
data.md: Proceeding to the city of the Vrishnis with Daruka in his company, O powerful king, that hero saw that the city of Dwraka looked liked a women left of her husband.

data.v: याः स्म ता लोकनाथेन नाथवत्यः पुराभवन् । तास्त्वनाथास्तदा नाथं पार्थं दृष्ट्वा विचुक्रुशुः ॥
data.md: Those ladies who had, before this, the very Lord of the universe for their protector, were now lordless. Seeing that Partha, had come for protecting them, they all bewailed aloud.

data.v: षोडशस्त्रीसहस्राणि वासुदेवपरिग्रहः । तासामासीन्महान्नादो दृष्ट्वैवार्जुनमागतम् ॥
data.md: Sixteen thousand ladies had been wedded to Vasudeva. Indeed, as soon as they beheld Arjuna arrive, they uttered a loud cry of sorrow.

data.v: तास्तु दृष्ट्वैव कौरव्यो बाष्पेण पिहितोऽर्जुनः । हीनाः कृष्णेन पुत्रैश्च नाशकत्सोऽभिवीक्षितुम् ॥
data.md: As soon as the Kuru prince met those beautiful ladies deprived of the protection of Krishna and of their sons as well he was unable to look at them, vision being obstructed by tears.

data.v: तां स वृष्ण्यन्धकजलां हयमीनां रथोडुपाम् । वादित्ररथघोषौघां वेश्मतीर्थमहाग्रहाम् ॥
रत्नशैवलसंघाटां वज्रप्राकारमालिनीम् । रथ्यास्रोतोजलावर्तां चत्वरस्तिमितह्रदाम् ॥
रामकृष्णमहाग्राहां द्वारकासरितं तदा । कालपाशग्रहां घोरां नदीं वैतरणीमिव ॥
तां ददर्शार्जुनो धीमान्विहीनां वृष्णिपुंगवैः । गतश्रियं निरानन्दां पद्मिनीं शिशिरे यथा ॥
data.md: Indeed, the son of Vasava, gifted with great intelligence, beheld the city to look even thus, reft as it was of the Vrishni heroes.

data.v: तां दृष्ट्वा द्वारकां पार्थस्ताश्च कृष्णस्य योषितः । सस्वनं बाष्पमुत्सृज्य निपपात महीतले ॥
data.md: Shorn of beauty, and perfectly cheerless, it presented the aspect of a lotus flower in the season of winter. Seeing the sight that Dwraka presented, and seeing the numerous wives of Krishna, Arjuna bewailed aloud with eyes bathed in tears and fell down on the earth.

data.v: सात्राजिती ततः सत्या रुक्मिणी च विशां पते । अभिपत्य प्ररुरुदुः परिवार्य धनंजयम् ॥
data.md: Then Satya the daughter of Satrajit, and Rukmini too, O king, fell down beside Dhananjaya and bewailed.

data.v: ततस्ताः काञ्चने पीठे समुत्थायोपवेश्य च । अब्रुवन्त्यो महात्मानं परिवार्योपतस्थिरे ॥
data.md: Raising him then they caused him to be seated on a golden seat. The ladies sat around that great one, giving expression to their feelings.

data.v: ततः संस्तूय गोविन्दं कथयित्वा च पाण्डवः । आश्वास्य ताः स्त्रियश्चापि मातुलं द्रष्टुमभ्यगात् ॥
data.md: Praising Govinda and talking with the ladies, the son of Pandu comforted them and then proceeded to see his maternal uncle.

data.v: तं शयानं महात्मानं वीरमानकदुन्दुभिम् । पुत्रशोकाभिसंतप्तं ददर्श कुरुपुंगवः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, The Kuru prince saw the heroic and great Anakadundubhi lying on the ground, and burning with grief on account of his sons.

data.v: तस्याश्रुपरिपूर्णाक्षो व्यूढोरस्को महाभुजः । आर्तस्यार्ततरः पार्थः पादौ जग्राह भारत ॥
data.md: The broad-chested and mighty-armed son of Pritha, more afflicted than his uncle with his eyes bathed in tears, touched his uncle's feet, O Bharata.

data.v: समालिङ्ग्यार्जुनं वृद्धः स भुजाभ्यां महाभुजः । रुदन्पुत्रान्स्मरन्सर्वान्विललाप सुविह्वलः । भ्रातॄन्पुत्रांश्च पौत्रांश्च दौहित्रांश्च सखीनपि ॥
data.md: The old man of mighty-arms, deeply afflicted embraced Partha with his arms and wept aloud, remembering his sons, brothers grandsons, daughter's sons, and friends.

data.v: यैर्जिता भूमिपालाश्च दैत्याश्च शतशोऽर्जुन । तान्दृष्ट्वा नेह पश्यामि जीवाम्यर्जुन दुर्मरः ॥
data.md: Vasudeva said Without seeing those heroes, O Arjuna who had subjugated all the kings of the Earth and the Daityas a hundred time, I am still alive! I see, that I cannot die!

data.v: यौ तावर्जुन शिष्यौ ते प्रियौ बहुमतौ सदा । तयोरपनयात्पार्थ वृष्णयो निधनं गताः ॥
data.md: Those two heroes who were the dear disciples of Arjuna, and who were much were course respected by him, alas, O Partha, through their fault, the Vrishnis have been destroyed.

data.v: यौ तौ वृष्णिप्रवीराणां द्वावेवातिरथौ मतौ । प्रद्युम्नो युयुधानश्च कथयन्कत्थसे च यौ ॥
data.md: Those two who considered as Atirathas amongst the foremost of the Vrishnis, and referring to whom in of conversation you were wont to indulge in pride, and who, O chief of Kuru's race, were ever dear to Krishna himself, alas, those tow, O Dhananjaya, have been the chief causes of the Destruction of the Vrishnis.

data.v: नित्यं त्वं कुरुशार्दूल कृष्णश्च मम पुत्रकः । तावुभौ वृष्णिनाशस्य मुखमास्तां धनंजय ॥
न तु गर्हामि शैनेयं हार्दिक्यं चाहमर्जुन । अक्रूरं रौक्मिणेयं च शापो ह्येवात्र कारणम् ॥
data.md: I do not censure the son of Shini or the son of Hridika, O Arjuna! I do not censure Akrura or the son of Rukmini. No doubt, the curse (of the Rishis) is the sole cause.

data.v: केशिनं यस्तु कंसं च विक्रम्य जगतः प्रभुः । विदेहावकरोत्पार्थ चैद्यं च बलगर्वितम् ॥
नैषादिमेकलव्यं च चक्रे कालिङ्गमागधान् । गान्धारान्काशिराजं च मरुभूमौ च पार्थिवान् ॥
प्राच्यांश्च दाक्षिणात्यांश्च पार्वतीयांस्तथा नृपान् । सोऽभ्युपेक्षितवानेतमनयं मधुसूदनः ॥
ततः पुत्रांश्च पौत्रांश्च भ्रातॄनथ सखीनपि । शयानान्निहतान्दृष्ट्वा ततो मामब्रवीदिदम् ॥
संप्राप्तोऽद्यायमस्यान्तः कुलस्य पुरुषर्षभ । आगमिष्यति बीभत्सुरिमां द्वारवतीं पुरीम् ॥
आख्येयं तस्य यद्वृत्तं वृष्णीनां वैशसं महत् । स तु श्रुत्वा महातेजा यदूनामनयं प्रभो । आगन्ता क्षिप्रमेवेह न मेऽत्रास्ति विचारणा ॥
data.md: I have no doubt that as soon as he will hear of the destruction of the Yadus, that hero of mighty energy will come here forthwith.

data.v: योऽहं तमर्जुनं विद्धि योऽर्जुनः सोऽहमेव तु । यद्ब्रूयात्तत्तथा कार्यमिति बुध्यस्व माधव ॥
data.md: Know, O father, that I Arjuna and Arjuna is myself. That should be down by you which he would say.

data.v: स स्त्रीषु प्राप्तकालं वः पाण्डवो बालकेषु च । प्रतिपत्स्यति बीभत्सुर्भवतश्चौर्ध्वदेहिकम् ॥
data.md: Tile son of Pandu will do what is best for the women and the children. Even he will perform your funeral rites.

data.v: इमां च नगरीं सद्यः प्रतियाते धनंजये । प्राकाराट्टालकोपेतां समुद्रः प्लावयिष्यति ॥
data.md: This city of Dvaravati, after Arjuna's departure, will, with its walls and edifices, be speedily swallowed up by the ocean.

data.v: अहं हि देशे कस्मिंश्चित्पुण्ये नियममास्थितः । कालं कर्ता सद्य एव रामेण सह धीमता ॥
data.md: As for myself retiring to some sacred place, I shall pass my time with the intelligent Rama in my company, observing strict vows all the while.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वा हृषीकेशो मामचिन्त्यपराक्रमः । हित्वा मां बालकैः सार्धं दिशं कामप्यगात्प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Having said these words to me, Hrishikesha of inconceivable prowess, leaving me with the children, has gone away some where which I do not know.

data.v: सोऽहं तौ च महात्मानौ चिन्तयन्भ्रातरौ तव । घोरं ज्ञातिवधं चैव न भुञ्जे शोककर्शितः ॥
data.md: Thinking of those two great brothers of yours as also of the dreadful destruction of my kinsmen, I have abstained from all food, and am emaciated with grief.

data.v: न च भोक्ष्ये न जीविष्ये दिष्ट्या प्राप्तोऽसि पाण्डव । यदुक्तं पार्थ कृष्णेन तत्सर्वमखिलं कुरु ॥
data.md: I shall neither eat, nor live. By good luck you meet me, O son of Pandu. Do you accomplish all, O Partha, that Krishna has said.

data.v: एतत्ते पार्थ राज्यं च स्त्रियो रत्नानि चैव ह । इष्टान्प्राणानहं हीमांस्त्यक्ष्यामि रिपुसूदन ॥
data.md: This kingdom, with all these women, and all the wealth here, is your now, O son of Pritha! As for myself, O destroyer of foes, I shall renounce my life however dear it may be.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स बीभत्सुर्मातुलेन परंतपः । दुर्मना दीनमनसं वसुदेवमुवाच ह ॥
नाहं वृष्णिप्रवीरेण मधुभिश्चैव मातुल । विहीनां पृथिवीं द्रष्टुं शक्तश्चिरमिह प्रभो ॥
राजा च भीमसेनश्च सहदेवश्च पाण्डवः । नकुलो याज्ञसेनी च षडेकमनसो वयम् ॥
data.md: The king and Bhimasena and Sahadeva and Nakula and Yajnaseni, are of the same mind with myself in this matter.

data.v: राज्ञः संक्रमणे चापि कालोऽयं वर्तते ध्रुवम् । तमिमं विद्धि संप्राप्तं कालं कालविदां वर ॥
data.md: The time has come for the departure of the king also. Know this that the hour of our departure too is near. You are the foremost of those who are well conversant with the course of time.

data.v: सर्वथा वृष्णिदारांस्तु बालवृद्धांस्तथैव च । नयिष्ये परिगृह्याहमिन्द्रप्रस्थमरिंदम ॥
data.md: I shall, however, O chastiser of enemies, first remove to Indraprastha the women of the Vrishni race as also the children and the aged.'

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा दारुकमिदं वाक्यमाह धनंजयः । अमात्यान्वृष्णिवीराणां द्रष्टुमिच्छामि माचिरम् ॥
data.md: Having said so to his uncle, Arjuna, next addressed Daruka, saying, I wish to see forthwith the chief officers of the Vrishni heroes.

data.v: इत्येवमुक्त्वा वचनं सुधर्मां यादवीं सभाम् । प्रविवेशार्जुनः शूरः शोचमानो महारथान् ॥
data.md: Having uttered these words, the heroic Arjuna, grieving for those great car-warriors, entered the great hall of the Yadavas, called Sudharma.

data.v: तमासनगतं तत्र सर्वाः प्रकृतयस्तथा । ब्राह्मणा नैगमाश्चैव परिवार्योपतस्थिरे ॥
data.md: When he had taken his seat here, all the citizens, including the Brahmanas, and all the ministers of state, came and stood surrounding him.

data.v: तान्दीनमनसः सर्वान्निभृतान्गतचेतसः । उवाचेदं वचः पार्थः स्वयं दीनतरस्तदा ॥
data.md: Then Partha, more grieved than they, addressed those grieving and cheerless citizens and officers who were more dead than alive, and said these words which were well suited to the occasion.

data.v: शक्रप्रस्थमहं नेष्ये वृष्ण्यन्धकजनं स्वयम् । इदं तु नगरं सर्वं समुद्रः प्लावयिष्यति ॥
data.md: I shall take away with me the remnants of the Vrishnis and the Andhakas! The sea will soon engulf this city.

data.v: सज्जीकुरुत यानानि रत्नानि विविधानि च । वज्रोऽयं भवतां राजा शक्रप्रस्थे भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Equip all your cars and place on them all your riches. This Vajra will be your king at Shakraprastha.

data.v: सप्तमे दिवसे चैव रवौ विमल उद्गते । बहिर्वत्स्यामहे सर्वे सज्जीभवत माचिरम् ॥
data.md: On the seventh day from this, at sunrise, we shall start. Make your preparations immediately.

data.v: इत्युक्तास्तेन ते पौराः पार्थेनाक्लिष्टकर्मणा । सज्जमाशु ततश्चक्रुः स्वसिद्ध्यर्थं समुत्सुकाः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by Pritha's son of Pure deeds, all of them hastened their preparations with eagerness for securing their safety.

data.v: तां रात्रिमवसत्पार्थः केशवस्य निवेशने । महता शोकमोहेन सहसाभिपरिप्लुतः ॥
data.md: Arjuna passed that night in the palaces of Keshava. He was suddenly overwhelmed with great sorrow and stupefaction.

data.v: श्वोभूतेऽथ ततः शौरिर्वसुदेवः प्रतापवान् । युक्त्वात्मानं महातेजा जगाम गतिमुत्तमाम् ॥
data.md: When morning dawned, Vasudeva of great energy and prowess attained, through the help of Yoga, to the highest end.

data.v: ततः शब्दो महानासीद्वसुदेवस्य वेश्मनि । दारुणः क्रोशतीनां च रुदतीनां च योषिताम् ॥
data.md: A loud and heart-rendering sound of wailing was heard in Vasudeva's palace, uttered by the weeping ladies.

data.v: प्रकीर्णमूर्धजाः सर्वा विमुक्ताभरणस्रजः । उरांसि पाणिभिर्घ्नन्त्यो व्यलपन्करुणं स्त्रियः ॥
data.md: They were seen with disheveled hair and divested of ornaments and garlands Beating their breasts with their hands, the indulged in heart-rendering lamentations.

data.v: तं देवकी च भद्रा च रोहिणी मदिरा तथा । अन्वारोढुं व्यवसिता भर्तारं योषितां वराः ॥
data.md: Those foremost of women, viz., Devaki and Bhadra and Rohini and Madira threw themselves on the bodies of threw themselves on the bodies of their lord.

data.v: ततः शौरिं नृयुक्तेन बहुमाल्येन भारत । यानेन महता पार्थो बहिर्निष्क्रामयत्तदा ॥
data.md: Then Partha caused the body of his uncle lo be carried out on a rich vehicle borne on the shoulders of men.

data.v: तमन्वयुस्तत्र तत्र दुःखशोकसमाहताः । द्वारकावासिनः पौराः सर्व एव नरर्षभ ॥
data.md: It was followed by all the citizens of Dwraka and the people of the provinces all of whom greatly stricken with grief, had been disposed towards the deceased hero.

data.v: तस्याश्वमेधिकं छत्रं दीप्यमानाश्च पावकाः । पुरस्तात्तस्य यानस्य याजकाश्च ततो ययुः ॥
data.md: Before that vehicle were born the umbrella which had been held over his head at the conclusion of the horse-sacrifice he had performed while living and also the burning fires he had daily adored, with the priests who had used to attend to them.

data.v: अनुजग्मुश्च तं वीरं देव्यस्ता वै स्वलंकृताः । स्त्रीसहस्रैः परिवृता वधूभिश्च सहस्रशः ॥
data.md: The body of the hero was followed by his wives decked in ornaments and surrounded by thousands of women and thousands of their daughter-in-law.

data.v: यस्तु देशः प्रियस्तस्य जीवतोऽभून्महात्मनः । तत्रैनमुपसंकल्प्य पितृमेधं प्रचक्रिरे ॥
data.md: The last rites were then performed at that spot which he liked while he was alive

data.v: तं चिताग्निगतं वीरं शूरपुत्रं वराङ्गनाः । ततोऽन्वारुरुहुः पत्न्यश्चतस्रः पतिलोकगाः ॥
data.md: The four wives of that heroic son of Shura ascended the funeral pyre and were consumed with the body of their husband. All of them attained to those happy regions which were his.

data.v: तं वै चतसृभिः स्त्रीभिरन्वितं पाण्डुनन्दनः । अदाहयच्चन्दनैश्च गन्धैरुच्चावचैरपि ॥
data.md: The son of Pandu burnt the body of his uncle together with those four wives of his, using various kinds of scents and perfumed wood.

data.v: ततः प्रादुरभूच्छब्दः समिद्धस्य विभावसोः । सामगानां च निर्घोषो नराणां रुदतामपि ॥
data.md: As the funeral pyre blazed up, a loud sound was heard of the burning wood and other combustible materials, along with the clear chant of Samans and the lamentation of the citizens and others who saw the rite.

data.v: ततो वज्रप्रधानास्ते वृष्णिवीरकुमारकाः । सर्व एवोदकं चक्रुः स्त्रियश्चैव महात्मनः ॥
data.md: After it was all over, the boys of the Vrishnis and Andhaka races, headed by Vajra, as also the ladies, offered oblations of water to the great hero.

data.v: अलुप्तधर्मस्तं धर्मं कारयित्वा स फल्गुनः । जगाम वृष्णयो यत्र विनष्टा भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Phalguna, who was careful in observing every duty having caused this duty to be performed, went. O chief of Bharata's race, next to the place where the Vrishnis were killed.

data.v: स तान्दृष्ट्वा निपतितान्कदने भृशदुःखितः । बभूवातीव कौरव्यः प्राप्तकालं चकार च ॥
data.md: The Kuru prince, seeing them lying killed all around, became exceedingly cheerless. He, however did what required to be done in view of that which had taken place.

data.v: यथाप्रधानतश्चैव चक्रे सर्वाः क्रियास्तदा । ये हता ब्रह्मशापेन मुसलैरेरकोद्भवैः ॥
data.md: The last rites were performed, according to the order of seniority, to the bodies of those heroes killed by the iron bolts born, by virtue of the curse denounced by the Brahmanas, of the blades of Eraka grass.

data.v: ततः शरीरे रामस्य वासुदेवस्य चोभयोः । अन्विष्य दाहयामास पुरुषैराप्तकारिभिः ॥
