data.md: Searching out the bodies then of Rama and Vasudeva, Arjuna caused them to be burnt by expert persons.

data.v: स तेषां विधिवत्कृत्वा प्रेतकार्याणि पाण्डवः । सप्तमे दिवसे प्रायाद्रथमारुह्य सत्वरः । अश्वयुक्तै रथैश्चापि गोखरोष्ट्रयुतैरपि ॥
data.md: The son of Pandu, having next perforined duly those rites that are done to the manes of the dead, quickly started on the seventh day, mounting on his car.

data.v: स्त्रियस्ता वृष्णिवीराणां रुदत्यः शोककर्शिताः । अनुजग्मुर्महात्मानं पाण्डुपुत्रं धनंजयम् ॥
भृत्यास्त्वन्धकवृष्णीनां सादिनो रथिनश्च ये । वीरहीनं वृद्धबालं पौरजानपदास्तथा । ययुस्ते परिवार्याथ कलत्रं पार्थशासनात् ॥
data.md: The citizens and the inhabitants of the country, at the command of Pritha's son, started at the same time and proceeded, surrounding that cavalcade destitute of heroes and numbering only women and the aged and the children.

data.v: कुञ्जरैश्च गजारोहा ययुः शैलनिभैस्तथा । सपादरक्षैः संयुक्ताः सोत्तरायुधिका ययुः ॥
data.md: The warriors who fought from the backs of elephants proceeded on elephants as huge as hills. The infanty also set out, together with the reserves.

data.v: पुत्राश्चान्धकवृष्णीनां सर्वे पार्थमनुव्रताः । ब्राह्मणाः क्षत्रिया वैश्याः शूद्राश्चैव महाधनाः ॥
data.md: The children of the Andhaka, and the Vrishni races, all followed Arjuna. The Brahmanas and Kshatriyas and Vaishyas, and rich Shudras, started keeping before them the sixteen thousand women who had formed Vasudeva's harem and Vajra, the grandson of the intelligent Krishna.

data.v: दश षट्च सहस्राणि वासुदेवावरोधनम् । पुरस्कृत्य ययुर्वज्रं पौत्रं कृष्णस्य धीमतः ॥
बहूनि च सहस्राणि प्रयुतान्यर्बुदानि च । भोजवृष्ण्यन्धकस्त्रीणां हतनाथानि निर्ययुः ॥
data.md: The widows of the other heroes of the Bhoja, the Vrishni and the Andhaka races, lordless now, that started with Arjuna, numbered many millions.

data.v: तत्सागरसमप्रख्यं वृष्णिचक्रं महर्द्धिमत् । उवाह रथिनां श्रेष्ठः पार्थः परपुरंजयः ॥
data.md: That foremost of car-warriors, that conqueror of hostile towns viz., the son of Pritha, escorted this huge procession of Vrishnis, which still abounded with wealth, and which looked like a veritable ocean.

data.v: निर्याते तु जने तस्मिन्सागरो मकरालयः । द्वारकां रत्नसंपूर्णां जलेनाप्लावयत्तदा ॥
data.md: After all the people had started, the ocean, the home of sharks, and alligators, flooded Dwraka, which still teemed with riches of every kind, with its waters.

data.v: तदद्भुतमभिप्रेक्ष्य द्वारकावासिनो जनाः । तूर्णात्तूर्णतरं जग्मुरहो दैवमिति ब्रुवन् ॥
data.md: Seeing this wonderful spectacle, the inhabitants of Dwraka walked faster and faster, saying. Wonderful is the course of fate.'

data.v: काननेषु च रम्येषु पर्वतेषु नदीषु च । निवसन्नानयामास वृष्णिदारान्धनंजयः ॥
data.md: Dhananjaya, after abandoning Dwraka, proceeded by slow marches, causing the Vrishni women to rest in charming forests and mountain and by the sides of delightful rivers.

data.v: स पञ्चनदमासाद्य धीमानतिसमृद्धिमत् । देशे गोपशुधान्याढ्ये निवासमकरोत्प्रभुः ॥
data.md: Arrived at the country of the five waters, the powerful Dhananjaya encamped in the midst of a land that abounded with corn and kine and other animals.

data.v: ततो लोभः समभवद्दस्यूनां निहतेश्वराः । दृष्ट्वा स्त्रियो नीयमानाः पार्थेनैकेन भारत ॥
data.md: Seeing those widows escorted by Pritha's son alone, O Bharata, the robbers felt a great temptation.

data.v: ततस्ते पापकर्माणो लोभोपहतचेतसः । आभीरा मन्त्रयामासुः समेत्याशुभदर्शनाः ॥
data.md: Then those sinful wretches, with hearts possessed by cupidity, viz., those Abhiras of ill omen, assembled together and held consultation.

data.v: अयमेकोऽर्जुनो योद्धा वृद्धबालं हतेश्वरम् । नयत्यस्मानतिक्रम्य योधाश्चेमे हतौजसः ॥
data.md: They said, 'Here there is only one bowman, viz., Arjuna. The party consists of children and the old. He escorts them alone. The warriors (of the Vrishnis) are without energy.

data.v: ततो यष्टिप्रहरणा दस्यवस्ते सहस्रशः । अभ्यधावन्त वृष्णीनां तं जनं लोप्त्रहारिणः ॥
data.md: Then those robbers, numbering by thousands, and armed with clubs, rushed a towards the procession of the Vrishnis for looting them.

data.v: महता सिंहनादेन द्रावयन्तः पृथग्जनम् । अभिपेतुर्धनार्थं ते कालपर्यायचोदिताः ॥
data.md: Urged by the perverse course of time, they fell upon that party, frightening it will loud leonine shouts and desirous of slaughter.

data.v: ततो निवृत्तः कौन्तेयः सहसा सपदानुगः । उवाच तान्महाबाहुरर्जुनः प्रहसन्निव ॥
data.md: The son of Kunti, suddenly ceasing to advance along the path, turned, with his followers, towards the place where the robbers had attacked the party. Smiling the while, that mighty-armed warrior addressed the assailants, saying. “You sinful wretches, stop, if you love your lives! You will rue this when I cut your bodies with my arrows and take your lives.'

data.v: निवर्तध्वमधर्मज्ञा यदि स्थ न मुमूर्षवः । नेदानीं शरनिर्भिन्नाः शोचध्वं निहता मया ॥
तथोक्तास्तेन वीरेण कदर्थीकृत्य तद्वचः । अभिपेतुर्जनं मूढा वार्यमाणाः पुनः पुनः ॥
data.md: Though thus addressed by that hero, they disregarded his words, and though repeatedly dissuaded, they fell upon Arjuna.

data.v: ततोऽर्जुनो धनुर्दिव्यं गाण्डीवमजरं महत् । आरोपयितुमारेभे यत्नादिव कथंचन ॥
data.md: Then Arjuna tried to string his large, indestructible, celestial bow with some effort.

data.v: चकार सज्यं कृच्छ्रेण संभ्रमे तुमुले सति । चिन्तयामास चास्त्राणि न च सस्मार तान्यपि ॥
data.md: He succeeded with great difficulty in stringing it, when the battle had become furious. He then began to think of his celestial weapons but they would not come to his mind.

data.v: वैकृत्यं तन्महद्दृष्ट्वा भुजवीर्ये तथा युधि । दिव्यानां च महास्त्राणां विनाशाद्व्रीडितोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: Seeing that furious battle, the loss of the might of his arm, and the non appearance of his celestial weapons, Arjuna became greatly ashamed.

data.v: वृष्णियोधाश्च ते सर्वे गजाश्वरथयायिनः । न शेकुरावर्तयितुं ह्रियमाणं च तं जनम् ॥
data.md: The Vrishni warriors including the infantry, the elephant-warriors, and the car-men, failed to rescue those Vrishni women who were being snatched away by the robbers.

data.v: कलत्रस्य बहुत्वात्तु संपतत्सु ततस्ततः । प्रयत्नमकरोत्पार्थो जनस्य परिरक्षणे ॥
data.md: The concourse was very large. The robbers attacked it, at different points. Arjuna tried his best to protect it, but could not succeed.

data.v: मिषतां सर्वयोधानां ततस्ताः प्रमदोत्तमाः । समन्ततोऽवकृष्यन्त कामाच्चान्याः प्रवव्रजुः ॥
data.md: Before the eyes of all the warriors, many foremost of ladies were dragged away, while others went away with the robbers of their own accord.

data.v: ततो गाण्डीवनिर्मुक्तैः शरैः पार्थो धनंजयः । जघान दस्यून्सोद्वेगो वृष्णिभृत्यैः सह प्रभुः ॥
data.md: The powerful Arjuna, supported by the servants of the Vrishnis, struck the robbers with arrows shot off Gandiva.

data.v: क्षणेन तस्य ते राजन्क्षयं जग्मुरजिह्मगाः । अक्षया हि पुरा भूत्वा क्षीणाः क्षतजभोजनाः ॥
data.md: Soon, however, O king, is arrows were exhausted. In former days his arrows had been inexhaustible. Now, however, they proved otherwise.

data.v: स शरक्षयमासाद्य दुःखशोकसमाहतः । धनुष्कोट्या तदा दस्यूनवधीत्पाकशासनिः ॥
data.md: Finding his arrows exhausted, he became deeply afflicted with grief. The son of Indra then began to strike the robbers with the horns of his bow.

data.v: प्रेक्षतस्त्वेव पार्थस्य वृष्ण्यन्धकवरस्त्रियः । जग्मुरादाय ते म्लेच्छाः समन्ताज्जनमेजय ॥
data.md: Those Mlechcchas, however, O Janamejaya, in the very sight of Partha, retreated, taking away with the many foremost ladies of the Vrishnis and Andhakas.

data.v: धनंजयस्तु दैवं तन्मनसाचिन्तयत्प्रभुः । दुःखशोकसमाविष्टो निःश्वासपरमोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: The powerful Dhananjaya considered it all as the work of destiny. Filled with sorrow he breathed heavy sights, at the thought of the non-appearance of his (celestial) weapons, the loss of the might of his arms, the refusal of his bow to obey him; and the exhaustion of his arrows.

data.v: अस्त्राणां च प्रणाशेन बाहुवीर्यस्य संक्षयात् । धनुषश्चाविधेयत्वाच्छराणां संक्षयेण च ॥
data.md: The powerful Dhananjaya considered it all as the work of destiny. Filled with sorrow he breathed heavy sights, at the thought of the non-appearance of his (celestial) weapons, the loss of the might of his arms, the refusal of his bow to obey him; and the exhaustion of his arrows.

data.v: बभूव विमनाः पार्थो दैवमित्यनुचिन्तयन् । न्यवर्तत ततो राजन्नेदमस्तीति चाब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Considering it all as the work of destiny, he became greatly cheerless. He then ceased, O king, to make further efforts, saying, he had not the power which he had before.

data.v: ततः स शेषमादाय कलत्रस्य महामतिः । हृतभूयिष्ठरत्नस्य कुरुक्षेत्रमवातरत् ॥
data.md: The high-souled one, taking with him the residue of the Vrishni women, and the wealth that was still with them, reached Kurukshetra,

data.v: एवं कलत्रमानीय वृष्णीनां हृतशेषितम् । न्यवेशयत कौरव्यस्तत्र तत्र धनंजयः ॥
data.md: Thus bringing with him the remnant of the Vrishnis, Dhananjaya established them at different places.

data.v: हार्दिक्यतनयं पार्थो नगरं मार्तिकावतम् । भोजराजकलत्रं च हृतशेषं नरोत्तमः ॥
data.md: He established the son of Kritavarman at the city called Marttikavat, with the remnant of the women of the Bhoja king.

data.v: ततो वृद्धांश्च बालांश्च स्त्रियश्चादाय पाण्डवः । वीरैर्विहीनान्सर्वांस्ताञ्शक्रप्रस्थे न्यवेशयत् ॥
data.md: Escorting the remainder, with children and old men, and women, the son of Pandu established them, who were reft of heroes, in the city of Indraprastha.

data.v: यौयुधानिं सरस्वत्यां पुत्रं सात्यकिनः प्रियम् । न्यवेशयत धर्मात्मा वृद्धबालपुरस्कृतम् ॥
data.md: The dear son of Yuyudhana, with a number of old men and children and women, the righteous-souled Arjuna established on the banks of the Sarasvati.

data.v: इन्द्रप्रस्थे ददौ राज्यं वज्राय परवीरहा । वज्रेणाक्रूरदारास्तु वार्यमाणाः प्रवव्रजुः ॥
data.md: The rule of Indraprastha was given to Vajra. The widows of Akrura then wished to retire into the forest. Vajra asked them repeatedly to desist, but they did not hear him.

data.v: रुक्मिणी त्वथ गान्धारी शैब्या हैमवतीत्यपि । देवी जाम्बवती चैव विविशुर्जातवेदसम् ॥
data.md: Rukmini, the princess of Gandhara, Shaivya. Haimavati, and queen Jambavati, ascended the funeral pyre.

data.v: सत्यभामा तथैवान्या देव्यः कृष्णस्य संमताः । वनं प्रविविशू राजंस्तापस्ये कृतनिश्चयाः ॥
data.md: Satyabhama and the other dear wives of Krishna entered the forest, o king, resolved to practice penances.

data.v: द्वारकावासिनो ये तु पुरुषाः पार्थमन्वयुः । यथार्हं संविभज्यैनान्वज्रे पर्यददज्जयः ॥
data.md: Those men who had followed Arjuna from Dvaravati, were divided into groups, and bestowed upon Vajra.

data.v: स तत्कृत्वा प्राप्तकालं बाष्पेणापिहितोऽर्जुनः । कृष्णद्वैपायनं राजन्ददर्शासीनमाश्रमे ॥
data.md: Having done all these acts suited to the occasion. Arjuna, with eyes bathed in tears, then entered the hermitage of Vyasa. There he saw the Dvaipayana seated at his ease.

data.v: प्रविशन्नर्जुनो राजन्नाश्रमं सत्यवादिनः । ददर्शासीनमेकान्ते मुनिं सत्यवतीसुतम् ॥
data.md: As Arjuna entered the hermitage of the truthful Rishi, he saw the son of Satyavati seated in a solitary spot.

data.v: स तमासाद्य धर्मज्ञमुपतस्थे महाव्रतम् । अर्जुनोऽस्मीति नामास्मै निवेद्याभ्यवदत्ततः ॥
data.md: Approaching that Rishi of high vows and gifted with a knowledge of al duties, he said, 'I am Arjuna'-~and then awaited his pleasure.

data.v: स्वागतं तेऽस्त्विति प्राह मुनिः सत्यवतीसुतः । आस्यतामिति चोवाच प्रसन्नात्मा महामुनिः ॥
data.md: Satyavati's son, endued with high penances, answered, saying, "Welcome!' Of tranquil soul the great ascetic further said, 'Take our seat.'

data.v: तमप्रतीतमनसं निःश्वसन्तं पुनः पुनः । निर्विण्णमनसं दृष्ट्वा पार्थं व्यासोऽब्रवीदिदम् ॥
data.md: Seeing that the son of Pritha was greatly cheerless and breathing heavy sighs repeatedly and filled with despair, Vyasa, addressed him, saying——Have you been sprinkled with water from anybody's nails or hair or the end of anybody's cloth, or from the mouth of a jar? Did you know any woman before the cessation of her menses? Have you killed a Brahmana?

data.v: अवीरजोऽभिघातस्ते ब्राह्मणो वा हतस्त्वया । युद्धे पराजितो वासि गतश्रीरिव लक्ष्यसे ॥
न त्वा प्रत्यभिजानामि किमिदं भरतर्षभ । श्रोतव्यं चेन्मया पार्थ क्षिप्रमाख्यातुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Have you been defeated in battle? You look like one shorn of prosperity! I do not know that you have been defeated by any one. Why then, O chief Bharata's race, this exceedingly dejected look! You should O of Pritha, tell me all, if, indeed, there be no harm in telling it.

data.v: यः स मेघवपुः श्रीमान्बृहत्पङ्कजलोचनः । स कृष्णः सह रामेण त्यक्त्वा देहं दिवं गतः ॥
मौसले वृष्णिवीराणां विनाशो ब्रह्मशापजः । बभूव वीरान्तकरः प्रभासे रोमहर्षणः ॥
ये ते शूरा महात्मानः सिंहदर्पा महाबलाः । भोजवृष्ण्यन्धका ब्रह्मन्नन्योन्यं तैर्हतं युधि ॥
गदापरिघशक्तीनां सहाः परिघबाहवः । त एरकाभिर्निहताः पश्य कालस्य पर्ययम् ॥
हतं पञ्चशतं तेषां सहस्रं बाहुशालिनाम् । निधनं समनुप्राप्तं समासाद्येतरेतरम् ॥
पुनः पुनर्न मृष्यामि विनाशममितौजसाम् । चिन्तयानो यदूनां च कृष्णस्य च यशस्विनः ॥
data.md: Thinking repeatedly of this destruction of the Yadava warriors of immeasurable energy and of the illustrious Krishna, I cannot get peace of mind.

data.v: शोषणं सागरस्येव पर्वतस्येव चालनम् । नभसः पतनं चैव शैत्यमग्नेस्तथैव च ॥
अश्रद्धेयमहं मन्ये विनाशं शार्ङ्गधन्वनः । न चेह स्थातुमिच्छामि लोके कृष्णविनाकृतः ॥
data.md: The death of the holder of Sharnga is as incredible as the drying up of the ocean, the displacement of a mountain, the falling down of the heaven, or the cooling property of fie. Deprived of the company of the Vrishni heroes, I wish not to live in this world.

data.v: इतः कष्टतरं चान्यच्छृणु तद्वै तपोधन । मनो मे दीर्यते येन चिन्तयानस्य वै मुहुः ॥
data.md: Another event has taken place that is more painful than this, O you having penances for wealth. Repeatedly thinking of it, my heart is breaking.

data.v: पश्यतो वृष्णिदाराश्च मम ब्रह्मन्सहस्रशः । आभीरैरनुसृत्याजौ हृताः पञ्चनदालयैः ॥
data.md: In my very sight, O Brahmana, thousands of Vrishni ladies were carried away by the Abhiras of the country of the five waters, who attacked us.

data.v: धनुरादाय तत्राहं नाशकं तस्य पूरणे । यथा पुरा च मे वीर्यं भुजयोर्न तथाभवत् ॥
data.md: Taking up my bow, I found myself unequal to even string it. The power that had existed in my arms seemed to have disappeared on that occasion.

data.v: अस्त्राणि मे प्रनष्टानि विविधानि महामुने । शराश्च क्षयमापन्नाः क्षणेनैव समन्ततः ॥
data.md: O great ascetic, my weapons of various kinds failed to appear. Soon, again, my arrows became exhausted.

data.v: पुरुषश्चाप्रमेयात्मा शङ्खचक्रगदाधरः । चतुर्भुजः पीतवासा श्यामः पद्मायतेक्षणः ॥
data.md: That person of immeasurable soul, of four arms, holding the conch, the discus, and the mace, clad in yellow robes, dark of complexion, and possessing eyes resembling lotus-petals, is no longer seen by me! Alas, reft of Govinda, what have I to live for, dragging my life in sorrow?

data.v: यः स याति पुरस्तान्मे रथस्य सुमहाद्युतिः । प्रदहन्रिपुसैन्यानि न पश्याम्यहमद्य तम् ॥
येन पूर्वं प्रदग्धानि शत्रुसैन्यानि तेजसा । शरैर्गाण्डीवनिर्मुक्तैरहं पश्चाद्व्यनाशयम् ॥
तमपश्यन्विषीदामि घूर्णामीव च सत्तम । परिनिर्विण्णचेताश्च शान्तिं नोपलभेऽपि च ॥
विना जनार्दनं वीरं नाहं जीवितुमुत्सहे । श्रुत्वैव हि गतं विष्णुं ममापि मुमुहुर्दिशः ॥
data.md: I dare not live, reft of the heroic Janardana. As soon as I heard that Vishnu had left the earth, my eyes became dim and all things disappeared from my vision.

data.v: प्रनष्टज्ञातिवीर्यस्य शून्यस्य परिधावतः । उपदेष्टुं मम श्रेयो भवानर्हति सत्तम ॥
data.md: O best of men, you should tell me what is good for me now, for I am now a wanderer with an empty heart, despoiled of my kinsmen and of my prowess.

data.v: ब्रह्मशापविनिर्दग्धा वृष्ण्यन्धकमहारथाः । विनष्टाः कुरुशार्दूल न ताञ्शोचितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: Vyasa said The powerful car-warriors of the Vrishni and the Andhaka races have all been consumed by the Brahmanas' course. O chief of Kuru's race, you should not grieve for their destruction.

data.v: भवितव्यं तथा तद्धि दिष्टमेतन्महात्मनाम् । उपेक्षितं च कृष्णेन शक्तेनापि व्यपोहितुम् ॥
data.md: That which has taken place, had been ordained. It was the destiny of those great warriors. Krishna allowed it to take place although he was fully competent to befell it.

data.v: त्रैलोक्यमपि कृष्णो हि कृत्स्नं स्थावरजङ्गमम् । प्रसहेदन्यथा कर्तुं किमु शापं मनीषिणाम् ॥
data.md: Govinda was able to after the very course of the universe with all its mobile and immobile creatures. What need then be said of the curse of even great Brahmanas?

data.v: रथस्य पुरतो याति यः स चक्रगदाधरः । तव स्नेहात्पुराणर्षिर्वासुदेवश्चतुर्भुजः ॥
data.md: for you He who used to proceed in front of your car, arined with discus and mace, through affection was the four-armed Vasudeva, that ancient Rishi.

data.v: कृत्वा भारावतरणं पृथिव्याः पृथुलोचनः । मोक्षयित्वा जगत्सर्वं गतः स्वस्थानमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: That great one of expansive eyes, viz., Krishna, having lightened the burthen of the Earth and cast off his (human) body, has attained to his own high seat.

data.v: त्वया त्विह महत्कर्म देवानां पुरुषर्षभ । कृतं भीमसहायेन यमाभ्यां च महाभुज ॥
data.md: By you also, O foremost of men, with Bhima for your helpmate and the twins, O mighty-armed hero, has the great work of the gods been done.

data.v: कृतकृत्यांश्च वो मन्ये संसिद्धान्कुरुपुंगव । गमनं प्राप्तकालं च तद्धि श्रेयो मतं मम ॥
data.md: O foremost one of Kuru's race, I regard you and your brothers as crowned with success, for you have accomplished the great purpose of your lives! The Time has come for your departure from the world. Even this, O powerful one, is what is beneficial for you now.

data.v: बलं बुद्धिश्च तेजश्च प्रतिपत्तिश्च भारत । भवन्ति भवकालेषु विपद्यन्ते विपर्यये ॥
data.md: Even thus, understanding and prowess and foresight. O Bharata, arise when days of prosperity have gone. These very acquisitions disappear when the hour of adversity comes.

data.v: कालमूलमिदं सर्वं जगद्बीजं धनंजय । काल एव समादत्ते पुनरेव यदृच्छया ॥
data.md: All this has Time for its root. Time is, indeed, the seed of the of the universe, O not FINISH MA Dhananjaya! It is Time, again, which withdraws everything at its pleasure.

data.v: स एव बलवान्भूत्वा पुनर्भवति दुर्बलः । स एवेशश्च भूत्वेह परैराज्ञाप्यते पुनः ॥
data.md: One becomes powerful, and, again, losing that power, becomes weak. One becomes a master and rules others, and again, losing that position, becomes a servant for obeying the order of others.

data.v: कृतकृत्यानि चास्त्राणि गतान्यद्य यथागतम् । पुनरेष्यन्ति ते हस्तं यदा कालो भविष्यति ॥
data.md: Your weapons, having achieved success, have gone away to the place they came from. They will, again, come into your hands when the Time for their coming approaches.

data.v: कालो गन्तुं गतिं मुख्यां भवतामपि भारत । एतच्छ्रेयो हि वो मन्ये परमं भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: The Time has come, O Bharata, for you all to attain to the highest end. This is what I consider to be highly beneficial for you all, O chief of Bharata's race.

data.v: एतद्वचनमाज्ञाय व्यासस्यामिततेजसः । अनुज्ञातो ययौ पार्थो नगरं नागसाह्वयम् ॥
data.md: Having heard these words of Vyasa of great energy, the son of Pritha, receiving his permission, returned to the city of Hastinapur.

data.v: प्रविश्य च पुरीं वीरः समासाद्य युधिष्ठिरम् । आचष्ट तद्यथावृत्तं वृष्ण्यन्धकजनं प्रति ॥
data.md: Entering it, the hero approached Yudhishthira and informed him of all that had taken place about the Vrishnis. JSALA PARVA

data.v: एवं वृष्ण्यन्धककुले श्रुत्वा मौसलमाहवम् । पाण्डवाः किमकुर्वन्त तथा कृष्णे दिवं गते ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said Having heard of that fighting with iron bolts between the heroes of the Vrishni and the Andhaka races, and having been informed also Krishna's departure from this world, what did the Pandavas do?

data.v: श्रुत्वैव कौरवो राजा वृष्णीनां कदनं महत् । प्रस्थाने मतिमाधाय वाक्यमर्जुनमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, Having heard the particulars of the great destruction of the Vrishnis, the Kaurava king was determined on leaving the world. He addressed Arjuna saying—'O you of great intelligence, it is time which cooks every creature (in is cauldron), I thing that what has taken place is due to the cords of Time (with which he binds us all). You should also see it.'

data.v: कालः पचति भूतानि सर्वाण्येव महामते । कर्मन्यासमहं मन्ये त्वमपि द्रष्टुमर्हसि ॥
इत्युक्तः स तु कौन्तेयः कालः काल इति ब्रुवन् । अन्वपद्यत तद्वाक्यं भ्रातुर्ज्येष्ठस्य वीर्यवान् ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by his brother, the son of Kunti only repeated the word, “Time, Time!' and fully endorsed the view of his eldest brother endured with great intelligence.

data.v: अर्जुनस्य मतं ज्ञात्वा भीमसेनो यमौ तथा । अन्वपद्यन्त तद्वाक्यं यदुक्तं सव्यसाचिना ॥
data.md: Knowing the resolution of Arjuna, Bhimasena and the twins fully endorsed the words which Arjuna had said.

data.v: ततो युयुत्सुमानाय्य प्रव्रजन्धर्मकाम्यया । राज्यं परिददौ सर्वं वैश्यापुत्रे युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: Determined upon retiring from the world for acquiring merit, they brought Yuyutsu before them. Yudhishthira made over the kingdom to the son of his uncle by his Vaishya wife.

data.v: अभिषिच्य स्वराज्ये तु तं राजानं परिक्षितम् । दुःखार्तश्चाब्रवीद्राजा सुभद्रां पाण्डवाग्रजः ॥
data.md: Installing Parikshit also on their throne, as king, the eldest brother of the Pandavas, filled with sorrow, addressed Subhadra, saying, 'This son of your son will be the king of the Kurus. The survivor of the Yadus, viz., Vajra, has been made a king.

data.v: एष पुत्रस्य ते पुत्रः कुरुराजो भविष्यति । यदूनां परिशेषश्च वज्रो राजा कृतश्च ह ॥
परिक्षिद्धास्तिनपुरे शक्रप्रस्थे तु यादवः । वज्रो राजा त्वया रक्ष्यो मा चाधर्मे मनः कृथाः ॥
data.md: Parikshit will rule in Hastinapur, while the Yadava prince, Vajra, will rule in Shakraprastha. You should protect him, Never set you heart on sin,

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा धर्मराजः स वासुदेवस्य धीमतः । मातुलस्य च वृद्धस्य रामादीनां तथैव च ॥
data.md: Having said these words, king Yudhishthira, the just, alone with his brothers, promptly offered oblations of water to Vasudevas of great intelligence, as also his old maternal uncle, and Rama add others. He then duly performed the Shraddhas of all those kinsmen.

data.v: भ्रातृभिः सह धर्मात्मा कृत्वोदकमतन्द्रितः । श्राद्धान्युद्दिश्य सर्वेषां चकार विधिवत्तदा ॥
data.md: Having said these words, king Yudhishthira, the just, alone with his brothers, promptly offered oblations of water to Vasudevas of great intelligence, as also his old maternal uncle, and Rama add others. He then duly performed the Shraddhas of all those kinsmen.

data.v: ददौ रत्नानि वासांसि ग्रामानश्वान्रथानपि । स्त्रियश्च द्विजमुख्येभ्यो गवां शतसहस्रशः ॥
कृपमभ्यर्च्य च गुरुमर्थमानपुरस्कृतम् । शिष्यं परिक्षितं तस्मै ददौ भरतसत्तमः ॥
ततस्तु प्रकृतीः सर्वाः समानाय्य युधिष्ठिरः । सर्वमाचष्ट राजर्षिश्चिकीर्षितमथात्मनः ॥
ते श्रुत्वैव वचस्तस्य पौरजानपदा जनाः । भृशमुद्विग्नमनसो नाभ्यनन्दन्त तद्वचः ॥
data.md: The royal sage informed them of his desire. The citizens and the villagers hearing it kings' words became stricken with anxiety and disapproved of them. “This should never be done'—said they to the king.

data.v: नैवं कर्तव्यमिति ते तदोचुस्ते नराधिपम् । न च राजा तथाकार्षीत्कालपर्यायधर्मवित् ॥
ततोऽनुमान्य धर्मात्मा पौरजानपदं जनम् । गमनाय मतिं चक्रे भ्रातरश्चास्य ते तदा ॥
ततः स राजा कौरव्यो धर्मपुत्रो युधिष्ठिरः । उत्सृज्याभरणान्यङ्गाज्जगृहे वल्कलान्युत ॥
भीमार्जुनौ यमौ चैव द्रौपदी च यशस्विनी । तथैव सर्वे जगृहुर्वल्कलानि जनाधिप ॥
विधिवत्कारयित्वेष्टिं नैष्ठिकीं भरतर्षभ । समुत्सृज्याप्सु सर्वेऽग्नीन्प्रतस्थुर्नरपुंगवाः ॥
ततः प्ररुरुदुः सर्वाः स्त्रियो दृष्ट्वा नरर्षभान् । प्रस्थितान्द्रौपदीषष्ठान्पुरा द्यूतजितान्यथा ॥
हर्षोऽभवच्च सर्वेषां भ्रातॄणां गमनं प्रति । युधिष्ठिरमतं ज्ञात्वा वृष्णिक्षयमवेक्ष्य च ॥
भ्रातरः पञ्च कृष्णा च षष्ठी श्वा चैव सप्तमः । आत्मना सप्तमो राजा निर्ययौ गजसाह्वयात् । पौरैरनुगतो दूरं सर्वैरन्तःपुरैस्तथा ॥
data.md: Ascertaining the desire of Yudhishthira and seeing the destruction of the Vrishnis, no other course of action could satisfy them then. The five brothers, with Draupadi forming the sixth, and a dog forming the seventh, started on their Journey. Thus did king Yudhishthira depart, himself heading a party of seven, from the city of Hastinapur. The citizens and they royal ladies followed them for some distance.

data.v: न चैनमशकत्कश्चिन्निवर्तस्वेति भाषितुम् । न्यवर्तन्त ततः सर्वे नरा नगरवासिनः ॥
data.md: None of them, however, could venture to address the king for persuading him so give up his intention. The citizens then returned.

data.v: कृपप्रभृतयश्चैव युयुत्सुं पर्यवारयन् । विवेश गङ्गां कौरव्य उलूपी भुजगात्मजा ॥
data.md: Kripa and, others stood around Yuyutsu as their centre, Ulupi the daughter of the Naga chief, O you of Kuru's race, entered the waters of Ganga.

data.v: चित्राङ्गदा ययौ चापि मणिपूरपुरं प्रति । शिष्टाः परिक्षितं त्वन्या मातरः पर्यवारयन् ॥
data.md: The princess Chitrangada started for the capital of Manipur. The other ladies who were the grandmothers of Parikshit gathered around him.

data.v: पाण्डवाश्च महात्मानो द्रौपदी च यशस्विनी । कृतोपवासाः कौरव्य प्रययुः प्राङ्मुखास्ततः ॥
data.md: Meanwhile the great Pandavas, O you of Kuru's race, and the illustrious Draupadi, having observed the preminary fast, started with their faces towards he est.

data.v: योगयुक्ता महात्मानस्त्यागधर्ममुपेयुषः । अभिजग्मुर्बहून्देशान्सरितः पर्वतांस्तथा ॥
data.md: Seeing themselves on Yoga those great ones, resolved to observe the religion of Renunciation, passed through various countries and teached various rivers and seas.

data.v: युधिष्ठिरो ययावग्रे भीमस्तु तदनन्तरम् । अर्जुनस्तस्य चान्वेव यमौ चैव यथाक्रमम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira proceeded first Behind him was Bhima;. next walked Arjuna; after him were the twins in the order of their birth; behind them all, O foremost one of Bharata's race, went Draupadi, that first of women, endued with great beauty, of dark Complexion, and having eyes like lotus petals.

data.v: पृष्ठतस्तु वरारोहा श्यामा पद्मदलेक्षणा । द्रौपदी योषितां श्रेष्ठा ययौ भरतसत्तम ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira proceeded first Behind him was Bhima;. next walked Arjuna; after him were the twins in the order of their birth; behind them all, O foremost one of Bharata's race, went Draupadi, that first of women, endued with great beauty, of dark Complexion, and having eyes like lotus petals.

data.v: श्वा चैवानुययावेकः पाण्डवान्प्रस्थितान्वने । क्रमेण ते ययुर्वीरा लौहित्यं सलिलार्णवम् ॥
data.md: While the Pandavas started for the forest a dog followed them, Proceeding on, those heroes reached the sea of red waters.

data.v: गाण्डीवं च धनुर्दिव्यं न मुमोच धनंजयः । रत्नलोभान्महाराज तौ चाक्षय्यौ महेषुधी ॥
data.md: Dhananjaya had not thrown off is celestial bow Gandiva nor his couple of inexhaustible quivers, actuated, O king by the cupidity for valuable things.

data.v: अग्निं ते ददृशुस्तत्र स्थितं शैलमिवाग्रतः । मार्गमावृत्य तिष्ठन्तं साक्षात्पुरुषविग्रहम् ॥
data.md: The Pandavas there saw the God of Fire standing before them like hill. Closing their way, the god stood there in his embodied form.

data.v: ततो देवः स सप्तार्चिः पाण्डवानिदमब्रवीत् । भो भो पाण्डुसुता वीराः पावकं मां विबोधत ॥
data.md: The deity of seven flames then addressed the Pandavas, saving—'O heroic sons of Pandu, known me as the God of Fire.

data.v: युधिष्ठिर महाबाहो भीमसेन परंतप । अर्जुनाश्विसुतौ वीरौ निबोधत वचो मम ॥
data.md: O mighty-armed Yudhishthira, O Bhimasena who are a scorcher of enemies, O Arjuna, and O twines of great courage, listen to what I say!

data.v: अहमग्निः कुरुश्रेष्ठा मया दग्धं च खाण्डवम् । अर्जुनस्य प्रभावेण तथा नारायणस्य च ॥
data.md: Oforemost ones of Kuru's race, I am the God of Fire. The forest of Khandava was burnt by me, through the power of Arjuna and of Narayana himself.

data.v: अयं वः फल्गुनो भ्राता गाण्डीवं परमायुधम् । परित्यज्य वनं यातु नानेनार्थोऽस्ति कश्चन ॥
data.md: Let your brother Phalguna proceed to the forest after casting off Gandiva, that great weapon. He has no longer any necessity for it.

data.v: चक्ररत्नं तु यत्कृष्णे स्थितमासीन्महात्मनि । गतं तच्च पुनर्हस्ते कालेनैष्यति तस्य ह ॥
data.md: That precious discus, which was with the great Krishna, has disappeared (from the world).. When the time again comes, it will return into and his hands.

data.v: वरुणादाहृतं पूर्वं मयैतत्पार्थकारणात् । गाण्डीवं कार्मुकश्रेष्ठं वरुणायैव दीयताम् ॥
data.md: This foremost of hows viz., Gandiva, was procured by me from Varuna for the us of Partha. let it be made over to Varuna himself.

data.v: ततस्ते भ्रातरः सर्वे धनंजयमचोदयन् । स जले प्राक्षिपत्तत्तु तथाक्षय्यौ महेषुधी ॥
data.md: At this, all the brothers requested Dhananjaya to do what the god said. He then threw into the waters (of the sea) both the bow and the couple of inexhaustible quivers.

data.v: ततोऽग्निर्भरतश्रेष्ठ तत्रैवान्तरधीयत । ययुश्च पाण्डवा वीरास्ततस्ते दक्षिणामुखाः ॥
data.md: After this, O chief of Bharata's race the God of Fire disappeared then and these the heroic sons of Pandu next went out with their faces turned towards the South.

data.v: ततस्ते तूत्तरेणैव तीरेण लवणाम्भसः । जग्मुर्भरतशार्दूल दिशं दक्षिणपश्चिमम् ॥
data.md: Then, by the northern coast of the salt sea, those princes of Bharata's race, went to the south west.

data.v: ततः पुनः समावृत्ताः पश्चिमां दिशमेव ते । ददृशुर्द्वारकां चापि सागरेण परिप्लुताम् ॥
data.md: Turning next towards the west, they saw the city of Dwraka covered by the ocean.

data.v: उदीचीं पुनरावृत्त्य ययुर्भरतसत्तमाः । प्रादक्षिण्यं चिकीर्षन्तः पृथिव्या योगधर्मिणः ॥
data.md: Turning next to the north, those foremost ones went on observant of Yoga, they were desirous of going round the whole earth.

data.v: ततस्ते नियतात्मान उदीचीं दिशमास्थिताः । ददृशुर्योगयुक्ताश्च हिमवन्तं महागिरिम् ॥
data.md: Those princes of controlled souls and devoted to Yoga, proceeding to the north, saw Himavat, that huge mountain,

data.v: तं चाप्यतिक्रमन्तस्ते ददृशुर्वालुकार्णवम् । अवैक्षन्त महाशैलं मेरुं शिखरिणां वरम् ॥
data.md: Crossing the Himavat, they saw a vast desert of sand. They then saw the powerful mountain Meru. The foremost of all highpeaked mountains.

data.v: तेषां तु गच्छतां शीघ्रं सर्वेषां योगधर्मिणाम् । याज्ञसेनी भ्रष्टयोगा निपपात महीतले ॥
data.md: As those powerful ones were proceeding quickly all rapt in Yoga, Yajnaseni, falling off from Yoga, dropped down on the Earth.

data.v: तां तु प्रपतितां दृष्ट्वा भीमसेनो महाबलः । उवाच धर्मराजानं याज्ञसेनीमवेक्ष्य ह ॥
data.md: Seeing her fallen down, Bhimasena of great strength addressed king Yudhishthira the just saying, 'O scorcher of enemies, this princess never did any sinful deed. Tell us what the cause is for which Krishna has fallen down on the Earth.'

data.v: नाधर्मश्चरितः कश्चिद्राजपुत्र्या परंतप । कारणं किं नु तद्राजन्यत्कृष्णा पतिता भुवि ॥
data.md: Seeing her fallen down, Bhimasena of great strength addressed king Yudhishthira the just saying, 'O scorcher of enemies, this princess never did any sinful deed. Tell us what the cause is for which Krishna has fallen down on the Earth.'

data.v: पक्षपातो महानस्या विशेषेण धनंजये । तस्यैतत्फलमद्यैषा भुङ्क्ते पुरुषसत्तम ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said, She had great partiality for Dhananjaya in particular. She obtains the fruit of that conduct today, O best of men.

data.v: एवमुक्त्वानवेक्ष्यैनां ययौ धर्मसुतो नृपः । समाधाय मनो धीमान्धर्मात्मा पुरुषर्षभः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, Having said this, that foremost one of Bharata's race went on. Of righteous soul, that foremost of men, gifted with great intelligence, went on, with mind intent on itself.

data.v: सहदेवस्ततो धीमान्निपपात महीतले । तं चापि पतितं दृष्ट्वा भीमो राजानमब्रवीत् ॥
योऽयमस्मासु सर्वेषु शुश्रूषुरनहंकृतः । सोऽयं माद्रवतीपुत्रः कस्मान्निपतितो भुवि ॥
data.md: Then the all wise Sahadeva dropped down on the Earth. Seeing him drop down. Bhima addressed the king. saying, 'He who with great humility used to serve us all, alas, why is that son of Madravati fallen down on the Earth?'

data.v: आत्मनः सदृशं प्राज्ञं नैषोऽमन्यत कंचन । तेन दोषेण पतितस्तस्मादेष नृपात्मजः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said He never thought anybody his equal in wisdom. It is for that sin that prince has dropped down.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा तु समुत्सृज्य सहदेवं ययौ तदा । भ्रातृभिः सह कौन्तेयः शुना चैव युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: Having said this, the king proceeded, leaving Sahadeva there. Indeed, Kunti's son Yudhishthria went on, with his brothers and with the dog.

data.v: कृष्णां निपतितां दृष्ट्वा सहदेवं च पाण्डवम् । आर्तो बन्धुप्रियः शूरो नकुलो निपपात ह ॥
data.md: Seeing both Krishna and the Pandava Sahadeva fallen down, the brave Nakula, whose love for kinsmen was very great, fell down himself.

data.v: तस्मिन्निपतिते वीरे नकुले चारुदर्शने । पुनरेव तदा भीमो राजानमिदमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: Upon the falling down of the heroic Nakula of great beauty, Bhima once more addressed the king, saying, 'This brother of ours who was gifted with full righteousness and who always obeyed our commands, this Nakula who was peerless for beauty, has fallen down!'

data.v: योऽयमक्षतधर्मात्मा भ्राता वचनकारकः । रूपेणाप्रतिमो लोके नकुलः पतितो भुवि ॥
data.md: Upon the falling down of the heroic Nakula of great beauty, Bhima once more addressed the king, saying, 'This brother of ours who was gifted with full righteousness and who always obeyed our commands, this Nakula who was peerless for beauty, has fallen down!'

data.v: इत्युक्तो भीमसेनेन प्रत्युवाच युधिष्ठिरः । नकुलं प्रति धर्मात्मा सर्वबुद्धिमतां वरः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed by Bhimasena, Yudhishthira said, with respect to Nakula, these words:—'He was of righteous soul and the foremost of all persons gifted with intelligence.

data.v: रूपेण मत्समो नास्ति कश्चिदित्यस्य दर्शनम् । अधिकश्चाहमेवैक इत्यस्य मनसि स्थितम् ॥
data.md: He, however thought that there was nobody who equalled him in personal beauty. Indeed, he considered himself as superior to all in that matter.

data.v: नकुलः पतितस्तस्मादागच्छ त्वं वृकोदर । यस्य यद्विहितं वीर सोऽवश्यं तदुपाश्नुते ॥
data.md: It is for this that Nakula has fallen down. Know this, O Vrikodara! That O hero, which has been ordained for a person, must have to be borne by him.'

data.v: तांस्तु प्रपतितान्दृष्ट्वा पाण्डवः श्वेतवाहनः । पपात शोकसंतप्तस्ततोऽनु परवीरहा ॥
data.md: Seeing Nakula and the others fall down Pandu's son Arjuna of white horses, that destroyer of hostile heroes, fell down in great grief of heart.

data.v: तस्मिंस्तु पुरुषव्याघ्रे पतिते शक्रतेजसि । म्रियमाणे दुराधर्षे भीमो राजानमब्रवीत् ॥
data.md: When that foremost of men, who was gifted with the energy of Shakra, had fallen down, indeed, when that invincible hero was on the point of death, Bhima said to the king, 'I do not recollect any untruth uttered by this great one. Indeed, not even in just did he say anything false. What then is that for whose evil consequence this one has dropped down on the Earth?'

data.v: अनृतं न स्मराम्यस्य स्वैरेष्वपि महात्मनः । अथ कस्य विकारोऽयं येनायं पतितो भुवि ॥
data.md: When that foremost of men, who was gifted with the energy of Shakra, had fallen down, indeed, when that invincible hero was on the point of death, Bhima said to the king, 'I do not recollect any untruth uttered by this great one. Indeed, not even in just did he say anything false. What then is that for whose evil consequence this one has dropped down on the Earth?'

data.v: एकाह्ना निर्दहेयं वै शत्रूनित्यर्जुनोऽब्रवीत् । न च तत्कृतवानेष शूरमानी ततोऽपतत् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said Arjuna had said that he would consume all our enemies in a single day. Proud of his heroism, he did not, however, do what he had said. Hence has he fallen down.

data.v: अवमेने धनुर्ग्राहानेष सर्वांश्च फल्गुनः । यथा चोक्तं तथा चैव कर्तव्यं भूतिमिच्छता ॥
data.md: This Phalguna disregarded all wielder of bows. One desirous of prosperity should never entertain such thoughts.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा प्रस्थितो राजा भीमोऽथ निपपात ह । पतितश्चाब्रवीद्भीमो धर्मराजं युधिष्ठिरम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having said so, the king went on. Then Bhima fell down, Having fallen down, Bhima addressed king Yudhishthira the just, saying. 'O king, see! I who am your darling have fallen down! Why have I dropped down? Tell me if you know it.'

data.v: भो भो राजन्नवेक्षस्व पतितोऽहं प्रियस्तव । किंनिमित्तं च पतनं ब्रूहि मे यदि वेत्थ ह ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Having said so, the king went on. Then Bhima fell down, Having fallen down, Bhima addressed king Yudhishthira the just, saying. 'O king, see! I who am your darling have fallen down! Why have I dropped down? Tell me if you know it.'

data.v: अतिभुक्तं च भवता प्राणेन च विकत्थसे । अनवेक्ष्य परं पार्थ तेनासि पतितः क्षितौ ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said You were a great eater, and you used to boast of your strength. You never did attend. O Partha, to the wants of others while eating. It is for that, O Bhima that you have fallen down.

data.v: इत्युक्त्वा तं महाबाहुर्जगामानवलोकयन् । श्वा त्वेकोऽनुययौ यस्ते बहुशः कीर्तितो मया ॥
data.md: Having said these words, the mighty-armed Yudhishthira went on, withoui loO king back. He had only one companion, viz., the dog of which I have repeatedly spoken to you which followed hiin now.

data.v: ततः संनादयञ्शक्रो दिवं भूमिं च सर्वशः । रथेनोपययौ पार्थमारोहेत्यब्रवीच्च तम् ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Causing the Heaven and the Earth to be filled by a loud sound, then Shakra came to the son of Pritha on a car and asked him to ascend it.

data.v: स भ्रातॄन्पतितान्दृष्ट्वा धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः । अब्रवीच्छोकसंतप्तः सहस्राक्षमिदं वचः ॥
data.md: Seeing the brothers fallen on the Earth, king Yudhishthira the just said to that deily of a thousand eyes these words, 'My brothers have all dropped down here! They must go with me. Without them by me I do not wish to go to the celestial region, O lord of all the celestials.

data.v: भ्रातरः पतिता मेऽत्र आगच्छेयुर्मया सह । न विना भ्रातृभिः स्वर्गमिच्छे गन्तुं सुरेश्वर ॥
data.md: Seeing the brothers fallen on the Earth, king Yudhishthira the just said to that deily of a thousand eyes these words, 'My brothers have all dropped down here! They must go with me. Without them by me I do not wish to go to the celestial region, O lord of all the celestials.

data.v: सुकुमारी सुखार्हा च राजपुत्री पुरंदर । सास्माभिः सह गच्छेत तद्भवाननुमन्यताम् ॥
data.md: The delicate princess (Draupadi) deserving of every comfort, O Purandara, should go with us! You should permit this.'

data.v: भ्रातॄन्द्रक्ष्यसि पुत्रांस्त्वमग्रतस्त्रिदिवं गतान् । कृष्णया सहितान्सर्वान्मा शुचो भरतर्षभ ॥
data.md: Shakra said You shall behold your brothers in the celestial region. They have reached it before you. Indeed, you shall see all of them there, with Krishna. Do not give way to grief, O chief of the Bharatas!

data.v: निक्षिप्य मानुषं देहं गतास्ते भरतर्षभ । अनेन त्वं शरीरेण स्वर्गं गन्ता न संशयः ॥
data.md: Having renounced their human bodies they have gone there, O chief of Bharata's race! As for you, it is ordained that you shall go there in this very body of yours.

data.v: अयं श्वा भूतभव्येश भक्तो मां नित्यमेव ह । स गच्छेत मया सार्धमानृशंस्या हि मे मतिः ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said This dog, O lord of the Past and the Present, is highly devoted to me. He should go with me. My heart is full of mercy for him.

data.v: अमर्त्यत्वं मत्समत्वं च राज;ञ्श्रियं कृत्स्नां महतीं चैव कीर्तिम् । संप्राप्तोऽद्य स्वर्गसुखानि च त्वं; त्यज श्वानं नात्र नृशंसमस्ति ॥
data.md: Shakra said You have acquired today Immortality and a status equal to mine, O king, prosperity extending in all directions and high success, and all the felicities of heaven. Do you cast off this dog. In this there will be no cruelty.

data.v: अनार्यमार्येण सहस्रनेत्र; शक्यं कर्तुं दुष्करमेतदार्य । मा मे श्रिया संगमनं तयास्तु; यस्याः कृते भक्तजनं त्यजेयम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said O you of a thousand eyes, O you, who ere of righteous conduct, it is extremely difficult for one that is of righteous conduct to perpetrate an act which is unrighteous. I do not with that union with prosperity for which I shall have to cast off one that is devoted to me.

data.v: स्वर्गे लोके श्ववतां नास्ति धिष्ण्य;मिष्टापूर्तं क्रोधवशा हरन्ति । ततो विचार्य क्रियतां धर्मराज; त्यज श्वानं नात्र नृशंसमस्ति ॥
data.md: Indra said There is no place in the celestial region for persons with dogs. Besides the Krodhavashas take away all the merits of such persons. Thinking of this, acts, O king Yudhishthira the just! Do you abandon this dog. There is no cruelty in this.'

data.v: भक्तत्यागं प्राहुरत्यन्तपापं; तुल्यं लोके ब्रह्मवध्याकृतेन । तस्मान्नाहं जातु कथंचनाद्य; त्यक्ष्याम्येनं स्वसुखार्थी महेन्द्र ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said It has been said that the abandonment of one that is devoted in sinful beyond measure. It is equal to the sin of Brahmanicide. Hence, o great Indra, I shall not cast off this dog today from desire of my happiness.

data.v: शुना दृष्टं क्रोधवशा हरन्ति; यद्दत्तमिष्टं विवृतमथो हुतं च । तस्माच्छुनस्त्यागमिमं कुरुष्व; शुनस्त्यागात्प्राप्स्यसे देवलोकम् ॥
data.md: Indra said Whatever gifts, or sacrifices spread out, or libations poured on the sacred fire, are seen by a dog, are taken away by the Krodhavashas. Do you, therefore, renounce this dog. By renouncing this dog you will acquire the region of the celestial.

data.v: त्यक्त्वा भ्रातॄन्दयितां चापि कृष्णां; प्राप्तो लोकः कर्मणा स्वेन वीर । श्वानं चैनं न त्यजसे कथं नु; त्यागं कृत्स्नं चास्थितो मुह्यसेऽद्य ॥
data.md: Having abandoned you brothers brothers and Krishna, you have, o hero, acquired a region of happiness by your own deeds. Why are you so stupefied? You have renounced everything. Why then do you not renounce this dog?

data.v: न विद्यते संधिरथापि विग्रहो; मृतैर्मर्त्यैरिति लोकेषु निष्ठा । न ते मया जीवयितुं हि शक्या; तस्मात्त्यागस्तेषु कृतो न जीवताम् ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira said This is well known in all the worlds that there is neither friendship nor enmity with the dead. When my brothers and Krishna died, I was unable to revive them. Hence it was that I renounced them, I did not, however, renounce them as long as they were alive.

data.v: प्रतिप्रदानं शरणागतस्य; स्त्रिया वधो ब्राह्मणस्वापहारः । मित्रद्रोहस्तानि चत्वारि शक्र; भक्तत्यागश्चैव समो मतो मे ॥
data.md: To frighten one that has sought protection, the killing of a woman, the theft of what belongs to a Brahmana, and injuring a friend, each of these four, O Shakra, is I think equal to the abandonment of one that is devoted.

data.v: तद्धर्मराजस्य वचो निशम्य; धर्मस्वरूपी भगवानुवाच । युधिष्ठिरं प्रीतियुक्तो नरेन्द्रं; श्लक्ष्णैर्वाक्यैः संस्तवसंप्रयुक्तैः ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of king Yudhishthira the just, (the dog became transformed into) the deity of Virtue, who well pleased, said words to him in a sweet voice fraught with praise,

data.v: अभिजातोऽसि राजेन्द्र पितुर्वृत्तेन मेधया । अनुक्रोशेन चानेन सर्वभूतेषु भारत ॥
data.md: Dharma said You are well born, O king of kings. and endued with the intelligence and the good conduct of Pandu! You have mercy for all creatures, O Bharata, of which this is a bright example!

data.v: पुरा द्वैतवने चासि मया पुत्र परीक्षितः । पानीयार्थे पराक्रान्ता यत्र ते भ्रातरो हताः ॥
data.md: Formerly, O son, you were once examined by me in the forest of Dvaita, where your brothers of great prowess met with (an appearance of) death,

data.v: भीमार्जुनौ परित्यज्य यत्र त्वं भ्रातरावुभौ । मात्रोः साम्यमभीप्सन्वै नकुलं जीवमिच्छसि ॥
data.md: Disregarding both your brothers Bhima and Arjuna, you did wish for the revival of Nakula from your desire of doing good to your (step) mother.

data.v: अयं श्वा भक्त इत्येव त्यक्तो देवरथस्त्वया । तस्मात्स्वर्गे न ते तुल्यः कश्चिदस्ति नराधिप ॥
data.md: On the present occasion, thinking the dog to be devoted to you, you have renounced the very car of the celestials instead of renouncing him. Hence, O king, there is not one in Heaven that is equal to you.

data.v: अतस्तवाक्षया लोकाः स्वशरीरेण भारत । प्राप्तोऽसि भरतश्रेष्ठ दिव्यां गतिमनुत्तमाम् ॥
data.md: Hence, O Bharata, regions of inexhaustible happiness are yours? You have acquired them, O chief of the Bharatas, and yours is a celestial and high end.

data.v: ततो धर्मश्च शक्रश्च मरुतश्चाश्विनावपि । देवा देवर्षयश्चैव रथमारोप्य पाण्डवम् ॥
प्रययुः स्वैर्विमानैस्ते सिद्धाः कामविहारिणः । सर्वे विरजसः पुण्याः पुण्यवाग्बुद्धिकर्मिणः ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said, Then Dharma and Shakra, and the Maruts, and the Ashvins and other deities and the celestial Rishis, causing Yudhishthira to ascend on a car, went to the celestial region. Those beings crowned with success and capable of going everywhere at will,orode their respective cars.

data.v: स तं रथं समास्थाय राजा कुरुकुलोद्वहः । ऊर्ध्वमाचक्रमे शीघ्रं तेजसावृत्य रोदसी ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira, that perpetuator of Kuru's race, riding on that car, ascended quickly, causing the entire sky to blaze with his effulgence.

data.v: ततो देवनिकायस्थो नारदः सर्वलोकवित् । उवाचोच्चैस्तदा वाक्यं बृहद्वादी बृहत्तपाः ॥
data.md: Then Narada, that foremost of all speakers, gifted with penances, and conversant with all the worlds, from amidst that concourse of celestials, said these words:-'All those royal sages who are here have their achievements transcended by hose of Yudhishthira.

data.v: येऽपि राजर्षयः सर्वे ते चापि समुपस्थिताः । कीर्तिं प्रच्छाद्य तेषां वै कुरुराजोऽधितिष्ठति ॥
data.md: Then Narada, that foremost of all speakers, gifted with penances, and conversant with all the worlds, from amidst that concourse of celestials, said these words:-'All those royal sages who are here have their achievements transcended by hose of Yudhishthira.

data.v: लोकानावृत्य यशसा तेजसा वृत्तसंपदा । स्वशरीरेण संप्राप्तं नान्यं शुश्रुम पाण्डवात् ॥
data.md: Covering all the worlds by his fame and splendour and by his wealth of conduct, he has attained to the celestial region in his own (human) body! None else than the son of Pandu has been heard to achieve this.'

data.v: नारदस्य वचः श्रुत्वा राजा वचनमब्रवीत् । देवानामन्त्र्य धर्मात्मा स्वपक्षांश्चैव पार्थिवान् ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of Narada, the righteous-souled king, saluting the celestials and all the royal sages there present, said, ‘Happy or miserable, whatever the region be that is now any brothers, I wish to proceed to. I do not wish to go anywhere else.'

data.v: शुभं वा यदि वा पापं भ्रातॄणां स्थानमद्य मे । तदेव प्राप्तुमिच्छामि लोकानन्यान्न कामये ॥
data.md: Hearing these words of Narada, the righteous-souled king, saluting the celestials and all the royal sages there present, said, ‘Happy or miserable, whatever the region be that is now any brothers, I wish to proceed to. I do not wish to go anywhere else.'

data.v: राज्ञस्तु वचनं श्रुत्वा देवराजः पुरंदरः । आनृशंस्यसमायुक्तं प्रत्युवाच युधिष्ठिरम् ॥
data.md: Hearing this speech of the king the chief of the celestials, Purandara, said these words pregnant with noble meaning, 'Do you live in this place, O king of kings, which you have acquired by your meritorious decds! Why do you still cherish human affections?

data.v: स्थानेऽस्मिन्वस राजेन्द्र कर्मभिर्निर्जिते शुभैः । किं त्वं मानुष्यकं स्नेहमद्यापि परिकर्षसि ॥
data.md: Hearing this speech of the king the chief of the celestials, Purandara, said these words pregnant with noble meaning, 'Do you live in this place, O king of kings, which you have acquired by your meritorious decds! Why do you still cherish human affections?

data.v: सिद्धिं प्राप्तोऽसि परमां यथा नान्यः पुमान्क्वचित् । नैव ते भ्रातरः स्थानं संप्राप्ताः कुरुनन्दन ॥
data.md: You have acquired great success, the like of which no other man has ever been able to attain. Your brothers, Odelighter of the Kurus, have succeeded in acquiring happy regions.

data.v: अद्यापि मानुषो भावः स्पृशते त्वां नराधिप । स्वर्गोऽयं पश्य देवर्षीन्सिद्धांश्च त्रिदिवालयान् ॥
data.md: Human affections still touch you. This is Heaven. See these celestial Rishis and Siddhas who have attained to the region of the gods.'

data.v: युधिष्ठिरस्तु देवेन्द्रमेवंवादिनमीश्वरम् । पुनरेवाब्रवीद्धीमानिदं वचनमर्थवत् ॥
data.md: Endued with great intelligence, Yudhishthira answered the king of the deities once more, saying, 'O conqueror of Daityas, I venture not to live anywhere, separated from them! I wish to go there where my brothers have gone!

data.v: तैर्विना नोत्सहे वस्तुमिह दैत्यनिबर्हण । गन्तुमिच्छामि तत्राहं यत्र मे भ्रातरो गताः ॥
data.md: Endued with great intelligence, Yudhishthira answered the king of the deities once more, saying, 'O conqueror of Daityas, I venture not to live anywhere, separated from them! I wish to go there where my brothers have gone!

data.v: यत्र सा बृहती श्यामा बुद्धिसत्त्वगुणान्विता । द्रौपदी योषितां श्रेष्ठा यत्र चैव प्रिया मम ॥
data.md: I wish to go there where that foremost of women, Draupadi, of ample proportions and darkish complexion and gifted with great intelligence and righteousness of conduct, has gone!'

data.v: स्वर्गं त्रिविष्टपं प्राप्य मम पूर्वपितामहाः । पाण्डवा धार्तराष्ट्राश्च कानि स्थानानि भेजिरे ॥
data.md: Janamejaya said-Having attained to Heaven, what regions were respectively attained by my grandsires of old, viz., the Pandavas, and the sons of Dhritarashtra?

data.v: एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं सर्वविच्चासि मे मतः । महर्षिणाभ्यनुज्ञातो व्यासेनाद्भुतकर्मणा ॥
data.md: I wish to hear this. I think that you know everything, having been taught by the great Rishi Vyasa of wonderful feats.

data.v: स्वर्गं त्रिविष्टपं प्राप्य तव पूर्वपितामहाः । युधिष्ठिरप्रभृतयो यदकुर्वत तच्छृणु ॥
data.md: Vaishampayana said Listen now to what your grandsires, Yudhishthira and others, did after having attained to Heaven, that place of the deities.

data.v: स्वर्गं त्रिविष्टपं प्राप्य धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः । दुर्योधनं श्रिया जुष्टं ददर्शासीनमासने ॥
data.md: Arrived at Heaven, King Yudhishthira the just, saw Duryodhana gifted with prosperity and seated on an excellent seat.

data.v: भ्राजमानमिवादित्यं वीरलक्ष्म्याभिसंवृतम् । देवैर्भ्राजिष्णुभिः साध्यैः सहितं पुण्यकर्मभिः ॥
data.md: He was effulgent like the sun and wore all the signs of heroic glory. And he was in the company of of many celestials of blazing effulgence and of Saddhyas of righteous deeds.

data.v: ततो युधिष्ठिरो दृष्ट्वा दुर्योधनममर्षितः । सहसा संनिवृत्तोऽभूच्छ्रियं दृष्ट्वा सुयोधने ॥
data.md: Yudhishthira, seeing Duryodhana and his prosperity became suddenly overpowered with anger and turned back from the sight.

data.v: ब्रुवन्नुच्चैर्वचस्तान्वै नाहं दुर्योधनेन वै । सहितः कामये लोकाँल्लुब्धेनादीर्घदर्शिना ॥
data.md: He loudly addressed his companions, saying, I do not wish to share regions of bliss with Duryodhana who was stained by cupidity and possessed of little foresight.

data.v: यत्कृते पृथिवी सर्वा सुहृदो बान्धवास्तथा । हतास्माभिः प्रसह्याजौ क्लिष्टैः पूर्वं महावने ॥
data.md: It was for him that friends, kinsmen, over the whole Earth destroyed by is were whom he had greatly afflicted in the deep forest.

data.v: द्रौपदी च सभामध्ये पाञ्चाली धर्मचारिणी । परिक्लिष्टानवद्याङ्गी पत्नी नो गुरुसंनिधौ ॥
data.md: It was for him that the virtuous princess of Panchala, Draupadi of faultless features, our wife, was dragged into the midst of the countries before all our elders.

data.v: स्वस्ति देवा न मे कामः सुयोधनमुदीक्षितुम् । तत्राहं गन्तुमिच्छामि यत्र ते भ्रातरो मम ॥
data.md: You gods, I have no wish to even see Suyodhana. I wish to go there where my brothers are.

data.v: मैवमित्यब्रवीत्तं तु नारदः प्रहसन्निव । स्वर्गे निवासो राजेन्द्र विरुद्धं चापि नश्यति ॥
data.md: Narada, smiling told him, It should not be so. O king of kings In heaven, all enmities cease.

data.v: युधिष्ठिर महाबाहो मैवं वोचः कथंचन । दुर्योधनं प्रति नृपं शृणु चेदं वचो मम ॥
data.md: O mighty-armed Yudhishthira, do not say so about king Duryodhana. Hear my words.

data.v: एष दुर्योधनो राजा पूज्यते त्रिदशैः सह । सद्भिश्च राजप्रवरैर्य इमे स्वर्गवासिनः ॥
data.md: Here is king Duryodhana. He is adored with the celestials by these righteous men and those foremost of kings, who are now jeweilers of Heaven.

data.v: वीरलोकगतिं प्राप्तो युद्धे हुत्वात्मनस्तनुम् । यूयं सर्वे सुरसमा येन युद्धे समासिताः ॥
data.md: By causing his body to be poured as a libation on the fire of battle, he has obtained the end which consists in attainment of the region for heroes. You and your brothers, who were veritable gods on Earth, were always persecuted by this one.

data.v: स एष क्षत्रधर्मेण स्थानमेतदवाप्तवान् । भये महति योऽभीतो बभूव पृथिवीपतिः ॥
data.md: Yet through his observance of Kshatriya practices he has acquired this region. This king was not terrified in a dreadful situation.

data.v: न तन्मनसि कर्तव्यं पुत्र यद्द्यूतकारितम् । द्रौपद्याश्च परिक्लेशं न चिन्तयितुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: O son, you should not bear in mind the woes inflicted on you on account of the match al dice. You should not remember the sufferings of Draupadi.

data.v: ये चान्येऽपि परिक्लेशा युष्माकं द्यूतकारिताः । संग्रामेष्वथ वान्यत्र न तान्संस्मर्तुमर्हसि ॥
data.md: You should not remember the other miseries which you suffered for the deeds of your kinsinen-the miseries, viz., that were due to battle or to other situations.

data.v: समागच्छ यथान्यायं राज्ञा दुर्योधनेन वै । स्वर्गोऽयं नेह वैराणि भवन्ति मनुजाधिप ॥
नारदेनैवमुक्तस्तु कुरुराजो युधिष्ठिरः । भ्रातॄन्पप्रच्छ मेधावी वाक्यमेतदुवाच ह ॥
यदि दुर्योधनस्यैते वीरलोकाः सनातनाः । अधर्मज्ञस्य पापस्य पृथिवीसुहृदद्रुहः ॥
यत्कृते पृथिवी नष्टा सहया सरथद्विपा । वयं च मन्युना दग्धा वैरं प्रतिचिकीर्षवः ॥
ये ते वीरा महात्मानो भ्रातरो मे महाव्रताः । सत्यप्रतिज्ञा लोकस्य शूरा वै सत्यवादिनः ॥
तेषामिदानीं के लोका द्रष्टुमिच्छामि तानहम् । कर्णं चैव महात्मानं कौन्तेयं सत्यसंगरम् ॥
धृष्टद्युम्नं सात्यकिं च धृष्टद्युम्नस्य चात्मजान् । ये च शस्त्रैर्वधं प्राप्ताः क्षत्रधर्मेण पार्थिवाः ॥

data.v: स्थिते मुहूर्तं पार्थे तु धर्मराजे युधिष्ठिरे । आजग्मुस्तत्र कौरव्य देवाः शक्रपुरोगमाः ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira the just, the son of Pritha, and not waited there for more than a imoment when, O you of Kuru's race all the celestials headed by Indra caine there.

data.v: स्वयं विग्रहवान्धर्मो राजानं प्रसमीक्षितुम् । तत्राजगाम यत्रासौ कुरुराजो युधिष्ठिरः ॥
data.md: The God of Righteousness, in his embodied forin, also came to that place where the Kuru king was for seeing that monarch.

data.v: तेषु भास्वरदेहेषु पुण्याभिजनकर्मसु । समागतेषु देवेषु व्यगमत्तत्तमो नृप ॥
data.md: Upon the coming of those celestials of resplendent bodies and sanctified and noble deeds, the darkness that had covered that region immediately disappeared.

data.v: नादृश्यन्त च तास्तत्र यातनाः पापकर्मिणाम् । नदी वैतरणी चैव कूटशाल्मलिना सह ॥
लोहकुम्भ्यः शिलाश्चैव नादृश्यन्त भयानकाः । विकृतानि शरीराणि यानि तत्र समन्ततः । ददर्श राजा कौन्तेयस्तान्यदृश्यानि चाभवन् ॥
data.md: The tortures undergone by beings of sinful deeds were no longer seen. The river Vaitarani, the thorny Shalmali the iron jars, and the boulders of rock, so terrible to look at also vanished from sight. The various repulsive corpses also , which the Kuru king has seen, disappeared at the same time.

data.v: ततो वायुः सुखस्पर्शः पुण्यगन्धवहः शिवः । ववौ देवसमीपस्थः शीतलोऽतीव भारत ॥
data.md: Then a breeze delicious and fraught with pleasant smell, perfectly pure, and delightfully cool, O Bharata, began to blow on that spot on account of the presence of the celestials.

data.v: मरुतः सह शक्रेण वसवश्चाश्विनौ सह । साध्या रुद्रास्तथादित्या ये चान्येऽपि दिवौकसः ॥
data.md: The Maruts, with Indra, the Vasus with the twin Ashvins, the Saddhyas, the Rudras, the Adityas and the other dwellers of Heaven as also the Siddhas, and the Great Rishis, all came there where Dharma's royal son of great energy was.

data.v: सर्वे तत्र समाजग्मुः सिद्धाश्च परमर्षयः । यत्र राजा महातेजा धर्मपुत्रः स्थितोऽभवत् ॥
data.md: The Maruts, with Indra, the Vasus with the twin Ashvins, the Saddhyas, the Rudras, the Adityas and the other dwellers of Heaven as also the Siddhas, and the Great Rishis, all came there where Dharma's royal son of great energy was.

data.v: ततः शक्रः सुरपतिः श्रिया परमया युतः । युधिष्ठिरमुवाचेदं सान्त्वपूर्वमिदं वचः ॥
data.md: Then Shakra, the lord of the celestials, gifted with blazing prosperity, addressed Yudhishthira and consoling him, come, said, O Yudhishthira of mighty arms, come, come O king! These illusions have ended, O powerful one.

data.v: युधिष्ठिर महाबाहो प्रीता देवगणास्तव । एह्येहि पुरुषव्याघ्र कृतमेतावता विभो । सिद्धिः प्राप्ता त्वया राजँल्लोकाश्चाप्यक्षयास्तव ॥
न च मन्युस्त्वया कार्यः शृणु चेदं वचो मम । अवश्यं नरकस्तात द्रष्टव्यः सर्वराजभिः ॥
शुभानामशुभानां च द्वौ राशी पुरुषर्षभ । यः पूर्वं सुकृतं भुङ्क्ते पश्चान्निरयमेति सः । पूर्वं नरकभाग्यस्तु पश्चात्स्वर्गमुपैति सः ॥
data.md: He who enjoys first the fruits of his good deeds must afterwards suffer Hell. He on the other hand, who first endures Hell, must afterwards enjoy the celestial region.

data.v: भूयिष्ठं पापकर्मा यः स पूर्वं स्वर्गमश्नुते । तेन त्वमेवं गमितो मया श्रेयोर्थिना नृप ॥
data.md: He whose sinful deeds are many enjoys the celestial region first. It is for this, o king, that desirous of doing you good, I caused you to be sent for having a view of Hell.

data.v: व्याजेन हि त्वया द्रोण उपचीर्णः सुतं प्रति । व्याजेनैव ततो राजन्दर्शितो नरकस्तव ॥
data.md: You had by a pretence, deceived Drona about his son. You have, therefore been shown Hell by an act of decention.

data.v: यथैव त्वं तथा भीमस्तथा पार्थो यमौ तथा । द्रौपदी च तथा कृष्णा व्याजेन नरकं गताः ॥
data.md: Like yourself, Bhima and Arjuna and Draupadi, have all been shown the place of sinners by an act of deception.

data.v: आगच्छ नरशार्दूल मुक्तास्ते चैव किल्बिषात् । स्वपक्षाश्चैव ये तुभ्यं पार्थिवा निहता रणे । सर्वे स्वर्गमनुप्राप्तास्तान्पश्य पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: Come, o king, all of them have been purged of their sins. All those kings who had sided you and who have been killed in battle, have all acquired the celestial region. Come and see them, O foremost one of Bharata's race.

data.v: कर्णश्चैव महेष्वासः सर्वशस्त्रभृतां वरः । स गतः परमां सिद्धिं यदर्थं परितप्यसे ॥
data.md: Karna the powerful bowman, that foremost of all wielders of weapons, for whom you are grieving, has also acquired high success.

data.v: तं पश्य पुरुषव्याघ्रमादित्यतनयं विभो । स्वस्थानस्थं महाबाहो जहि शोकं नरर्षभ ॥
data.md: See, O powerful one, that foremost of men, viz., the son of the Sum. He is in that place which is his own, O mighty-armed one. Kill this grief of yours, O king.

data.v: भ्रातॄंश्चान्यांस्तथा पश्य स्वपक्षांश्चैव पार्थिवान् । स्वं स्वं स्थानमनुप्राप्तान्व्येतु ते मानसो ज्वरः ॥
data.md: Look at your brother and others, those kings, that is who had taken your side. They have all attained to their respective places. Let the fever of your heart be removed.

data.v: अनुभूय पूर्वं त्वं कृच्छ्रमितः प्रभृति कौरव । विहरस्व मया सार्धं गतशोको निरामयः ॥
data.md: Having suffered a little misery first, from this time, O son of Kuru's race, do you sport with me in happiness, horn of grief and all ailments.

data.v: कर्मणां तात पुण्यानां जितानां तपसा स्वयम् । दानानां च महाबाहो फलं प्राप्नुहि पाण्डव ॥
data.md: O mighty-armed one, do you now enjoy. O king the rewards of all your virtuous deeds, of those regions which you have acquired yourself by your penances, and of all your gifts.

data.v: अद्य त्वां देवगन्धर्वा दिव्याश्चाप्सरसो दिवि । उपसेवन्तु कल्याणं विरजोम्बरवाससः ॥
data.md: Let celestials and Gandharvas, and celestial Apsara, dressed in pure robes and beautiful ornaments, wait upon and serve you for your happiness.

data.v: राजसूयजिताँल्लोकानश्वमेधाभिवर्धितान् । प्राप्नुहि त्वं महाबाहो तपसश्च फलं महत् ॥
data.md: Do you, O mighty-armed one, enjoy now those happy regions which you have acquired through the Rajasuya-Sacrifice performed by you have been increased by the sacrificial scimitar employed by you. May you enjoy the great fruit of your penance.

data.v: उपर्युपरि राज्ञां हि तव लोका युधिष्ठिर । हरिश्चन्द्रसमाः पार्थ येषु त्वं विहरिष्यसि ॥
data.md: Your region, O Yudhishthira, are above, far above, those of kings. They are equal to those of Harishchandra, O son of Pritha. Come and sport there in bliss!

data.v: मान्धाता यत्र राजर्षिर्यत्र राजा भगीरथः । दौःषन्तिर्यत्र भरतस्तत्र त्वं विहरिष्यसि ॥
data.md: Sharing the blissful region acquired by the royal sage Mandhatri, king Bhagiratha, Dushyanta's son Bharata, you will sport there in bliss.

data.v: एषा देवनदी पुण्या पार्थ त्रैलोक्यपावनी । आकाशगङ्गा राजेन्द्र तत्राप्लुत्य गमिष्यसि ॥
data.md: Here is the celestial river, sacred and sanctifying the there worlds. It is called celestial Ganga, Plunging into it, you will go to your own regions.

data.v: अत्र स्नातस्य ते भावो मानुषो विगमिष्यति । गतशोको निरायासो मुक्तवैरो भविष्यसि ॥
data.md: Having bathed in this river, you will be divested of your human nature. Indeed, your grief dispelled, your ailments conquered, you will be freed from all enmities.

data.v: एवं ब्रुवति देवेन्द्रे कौरवेन्द्रं युधिष्ठिरम् । धर्मो विग्रहवान्साक्षादुवाच सुतमात्मनः ॥
data.md: While, O Kuru king, the chief of the celestials was saying so to Yudhishthira, the god of Righteousness, in his embodied form, then addressed his own son and said, O king, I am highly pleased, O you of great wisdom, with you, O son, by your devotion to me by your truthfulness of speech, and forgiveness, and self-control.

data.v: भो भो राजन्महाप्राज्ञ प्रीतोऽस्मि तव पुत्रक । मद्भक्त्या सत्यवाक्येन क्षमया च दमेन च ॥
data.md: While, O Kuru king, the chief of the celestials was saying so to Yudhishthira, the god of Righteousness, in his embodied form, then addressed his own son and said, O king, I am highly pleased, O you of great wisdom, with you, O son, by your devotion to me by your truthfulness of speech, and forgiveness, and self-control.

data.v: एषा तृतीया जिज्ञासा तव राजन्कृता मया । न शक्यसे चालयितुं स्वभावात्पार्थ हेतुभिः ॥
data.md: This indeed, is the third test, O king, to which I put you. You are incapable, O son of Pritha, of being swerved from your nature or reason.

data.v: पूर्वं परीक्षितो हि त्वमासीर्द्वैतवनं प्रति । अरणीसहितस्यार्थे तच्च निस्तीर्णवानसि ॥
data.md: Before this, I had examined you in the Dvaita forest by my questions, when your brothers with Draupadi had fallen down.

data.v: सोदर्येषु विनष्टेषु द्रौपद्यां तत्र भारत । श्वरूपधारिणा पुत्र पुनस्त्वं मे परीक्षितः ॥
data.md: Assuming the shape of a dog, I examined you once more, O son when your brothers with Draupadi had fallen down.

data.v: इदं तृतीयं भ्रातॄणामर्थे यत्स्थातुमिच्छसि । विशुद्धोऽसि महाभाग सुखी विगतकल्मषः ॥
data.md: This has been your third test; you have expressed your wish to stay at Hell for the sake of your brothers. You have become cleaned, O highly blessed one. Purified of sin, you happy.

data.v: न च ते भ्रातरः पार्थ नरकस्था विशां पते । मायैषा देवराजेन महेन्द्रेण प्रयोजिता ॥
data.md: O son of Pritha, your brothers, O king, were not such as to deserve Hell. All this has been an illusion created by the king of the celestials.

data.v: अवश्यं नरकस्तात द्रष्टव्यः सर्वराजभिः । ततस्त्वया प्राप्तमिदं मुहूर्तं दुःखमुत्तमम् ॥
data.md: Forsooth, all kings, O son, must once see Hell. Hence have you for a little while been subjected to this great sorrow.

data.v: न सव्यसाची भीमो वा यमौ वा पुरुषर्षभौ । कर्णो वा सत्यवाक्शूरो नरकार्हाश्चिरं नृप ॥
data.md: O king, neither Arjuna, nor Bhima, nor any of those foremost of men, viz., the twins for Karna, ever truthful in speech and endued with great courage, could be deserving of Hell for a long time.

data.v: न कृष्णा राजपुत्री च नरकार्हा युधिष्ठिर । एह्येहि भरतश्रेष्ठ पश्य गङ्गां त्रिलोकगाम् ॥
data.md: The Princes Krishna too, O Yudhishthira, could not be deserving of that place of sinners, Come, come, O foremost of the Bharatas see Ganga, who spreads her current over the three worlds.

data.v: एवमुक्तः स राजर्षिस्तव पूर्वपितामहः । जगाम सह धर्मेण सर्वैश्च त्रिदशालयैः ॥
data.md: Thus addressed the royal sage, viz., your grandsire, proceeded with Dharma and all the other celestials.

data.v: गङ्गां देवनदीं पुण्यां पावनीमृषिसंस्तुताम् । अवगाह्य तु तां राजा तनुं तत्याज मानुषीम् ॥
data.md: Having bathed in the celestial river Ganga, acred and purifying and ever worshipped by the Rishis, he renounced his human body.

data.v: ततो दिव्यवपुर्भूत्वा धर्मराजो युधिष्ठिरः । निर्वैरो गतसंतापो जले तस्मिन्समाप्लुतः ॥
data.md: Assuming then a celestial form, king Yudhishthira the jut, on account of that bath, became divested of all his enmities and grief.

data.v: ततो ययौ वृतो देवैः कुरुराजो युधिष्ठिरः । धर्मेण सहितो धीमान्स्तूयमानो महर्षिभिः ॥
data.md: Surrounded by the celestials the Kuru king Yudhishthira then went away from that place. He was accompanied by Dharma, and the great Rishis uttered his praises.

data.v: ततो युधिष्ठिरो राजा देवैः सर्षिमरुद्गणैः । पूज्यमानो ययौ तत्र यत्र ते कुरुपुंगवाः ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira, thus honoured by the celestials the Maruts and the Rishis, went to that place where those foremost ones of Kuru's race were.

data.v: ददर्श तत्र गोविन्दं ब्राह्मेण वपुषान्वितम् । तेनैव दृष्टपूर्वेण सादृश्येनोपसूचितम् ॥
data.md: He saw Govinda gifted with his Brahmaform. It took after that form of his which had been seen before and which, therefore, helped the recognition

data.v: दीप्यमानं स्ववपुषा दिव्यैरस्त्रैरुपस्थितम् । चक्रप्रभृतिभिर्घोरैर्दिव्यैः पुरुषविग्रहैः । उपास्यमानं वीरेण फल्गुनेन सुवर्चसा ॥
data.md: Shining in that forin of his, he was adorned with celestial weapon, such as the dreadful and discus and others in their respective embodied form.

data.v: अपरस्मिन्नथोद्देशे कर्णं शस्त्रभृतां वरम् । द्वादशादित्यसहितं ददर्श कुरुनन्दनः ॥
data.md: In an ther place, the delighter of the Kuru saw Karna, that foremost one among all holders of weapons, resembling a dozen Suns in splendour.

data.v: अथापरस्मिन्नुद्देशे मरुद्गणवृतं प्रभुम् । भीमसेनमथापश्यत्तेनैव वपुषान्वितम् ॥
data.md: In another part he saw Bhimasena of great power, sitting in the midst of Maruts; and gifted with a blazing form.

data.v: अश्विनोस्तु तथा स्थाने दीप्यमानौ स्वतेजसा । नकुलं सहदेवं च ददर्श कुरुनन्दनः ॥
data.md: In the place belonging to the Ashvins the delighter of the Kuru saw Nakula and Sahadeva, each blazing with own effulgence.

data.v: तथा ददर्श पाञ्चालीं कमलोत्पलमालिनीम् । वपुषा स्वर्गमाक्रम्य तिष्ठन्तीमर्कवर्चसम् ॥
data.md: He also saw the princess of Panchala, decked in garlands of lotuses, Having acquired the celestial region, she was sitting there, gifted with a form effulgent like the Sun.

data.v: अथैनां सहसा राजा प्रष्टुमैच्छद्युधिष्ठिरः । ततोऽस्य भगवानिन्द्रः कथयामास देवराट् ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira suddenly wished to question her. Then the illustrious Indra, the king of the celestials, spoke to him, I his one is goddess of prosperity herself. It was for your sake that she took birth, as the daughter of Drupada, among human beings coming not from any mother's womb, O Yudhishthira, gifted with agreeable perfume and capable of delighting he entire world.

data.v: श्रीरेषा द्रौपदीरूपा त्वदर्थे मानुषं गता । अयोनिजा लोककान्ता पुण्यगन्धा युधिष्ठिर ॥
data.md: King Yudhishthira suddenly wished to question her. Then the illustrious Indra, the king of the celestials, spoke to him, I his one is goddess of prosperity herself. It was for your sake that she took birth, as the daughter of Drupada, among human beings coming not from any mother's womb, O Yudhishthira, gifted with agreeable perfume and capable of delighting he entire world.

data.v: द्रुपदस्य कुले जाता भवद्भिश्चोपजीविता । रत्यर्थं भवतां ह्येषा निर्मिता शूलपाणिना ॥
एते पञ्च महाभागा गन्धर्वाः पावकप्रभाः । द्रौपद्यास्तनया राजन्युष्माकममितौजसः ॥
data.md: These five highly blessed Gandharvas gifted with the effulgence of fire, and endued with great energy, were O king, the sons of Draupadi and yourself.

data.v: पश्य गन्धर्वराजानं धृतराष्ट्रं मनीषिणम् । एनं च त्वं विजानीहि भ्रातरं पूर्वजं पितुः ॥
data.md: Look at Dhritarashtra, the king of the Gandharva, endued with great wisdom. Know that this one was the eldest brother of your father.

data.v: अयं ते पूर्वजो भ्राता कौन्तेयः पावकद्युतिः । सूर्यपुत्रोऽग्रजः श्रेष्ठो राधेय इति विश्रुतः । आदित्यसहितो याति पश्यैनं पुरुषर्षभ ॥
data.md: This one is your eldest brother, the son of Kunti, gifted with the effulgence of fire. The on of Surya, your eldest brother the foremost of inen even this one was known as the son of Radha.

data.v: साध्यानामथ देवानां वसूनां मरुतामपि । गणेषु पश्य राजेन्द्र वृष्ण्यन्धकमहारथान् । सात्यकिप्रमुखान्वीरान्भोजांश्चैव महारथान् ॥
data.md: He moves in the company of the Sun-God. Behold this foremost of Beings! Among the tribes of the Saddhyas, the celestials, the Vishvedevas, and the Maruts, see, O king of kings, the mighty car-warriors of the Vrishnis and the Andhakas viz., those heroes having Satyaki for their first, and those powerful ones among the Bhojas.

data.v: सोमेन सहितं पश्य सौभद्रमपराजितम् । अभिमन्युं महेष्वासं निशाकरसमद्युतिम् ॥
data.md: Look at the son of Subhadra, invincible in battle, now staying with Soma, He is the powerful bowman Abhimanyu, now gifted with the gentle effulgence of he Moon.

data.v: एष पाण्डुर्महेष्वासः कुन्त्या माद्र्या च संगतः । विमानेन सदाभ्येति पिता तव ममान्तिकम् ॥
data.md: Here is the powerful bowman Pandu, now united with Kunti and Madri. Your father frequently comes to me on his excellent car.

data.v: वसुभिः सहितं पश्य भीष्मं शांतनवं नृपम् । द्रोणं बृहस्पतेः पार्श्वे गुरुमेनं निशामय ॥
data.md: Look at the royal Bhishma, the son of Shantanu, now in the midst of the Vasus, know that this one by the side of Brihaspati is your preceptor Drona.

data.v: एते चान्ये महीपाला योधास्तव च पाण्डव । गन्धर्वैः सहिता यान्ति यक्षैः पुण्यजनैस्तथा ॥
data.md: These and other kings, O son of Pandu, who had fought on your behalf now walk with the Gandharvas or Yakshas or other sacred, beings.

data.v: गुह्यकानां गतिं चापि केचित्प्राप्ता नृसत्तमाः । त्यक्त्वा देहं जितस्वर्गाः पुण्यवाग्बुद्धिकर्मभिः ॥
data.md: Some have attained to the dignity of Guhyakas, O king. Having renounced their bodies, they have conquered the celestial region by the merit they had acquired through word, thought, and deed.

data.v: भीष्मद्रोणौ महात्मानौ धृतराष्ट्रश्च पार्थिवः । विराटद्रुपदौ चोभौ शङ्खश्चैवोत्तरस्तथा ॥
धृष्टकेतुर्जयत्सेनो राजा चैव स सत्यजित् । दुर्योधनसुताश्चैव शकुनिश्चैव सौबलः ॥
कर्णपुत्राश्च विक्रान्ता राजा चैव जयद्रथः । घटोत्कचादयश्चैव ये चान्ये नानुकीर्तिताः ॥
ये चान्ये कीर्तितास्तत्र राजानो दीप्तमूर्तयः । स्वर्गे कालं कियन्तं ते तस्थुस्तदपि शंस मे ॥
आहोस्विच्छाश्वतं स्थानं तेषां तत्र द्विजोत्तम । अन्ते वा कर्मणः कां ते गतिं प्राप्ता नरर्षभाः । एतदिच्छाम्यहं श्रोतुं प्रोच्यमानं त्वया द्विज ॥
data.md: O best of twice-born, did they live in Heaven for ever? What was the end acquired by those best of men when their acts terminated.

data.v: इत्युक्तः स तु विप्रर्षिरनुज्ञातो महात्मना । व्यासेन तस्य नृपतेराख्यातुमुपचक्रमे ॥
गन्तव्यं कर्मणामन्ते सर्वेण मनुजाधिप । शृणु गुह्यमिदं राजन्देवानां भरतर्षभ । यदुवाच महातेजा दिव्यचक्षुः प्रतापवान् ॥
मुनिः पुराणः कौरव्य पाराशर्यो महाव्रतः । अगाधबुद्धिः सर्वज्ञो गतिज्ञः सर्वकर्मणाम् ॥
वसूनेव महातेजा भीष्मः प्राप महाद्युतिः । अष्टावेव हि दृश्यन्ते वसवो भरतर्षभ ॥
बृहस्पतिं विवेशाथ द्रोणो ह्यङ्गिरसां वरम् । कृतवर्मा तु हार्दिक्यः प्रविवेश मरुद्गणम् ॥
सनत्कुमारं प्रद्युम्नः प्रविवेश यथागतम् । धृतराष्ट्रो धनेशस्य लोकान्प्राप दुरासदान् ॥
धृतराष्ट्रेण सहिता गान्धारी च यशस्विनी । पत्नीभ्यां सहितः पाण्डुर्महेन्द्रसदनं ययौ ॥
विराटद्रुपदौ चोभौ धृष्टकेतुश्च पार्थिवः । निशठाक्रूरसाम्बाश्च भानुः कम्पो विडूरथः ॥
भूरिश्रवाः शलश्चैव भूरिश्च पृथिवीपतिः । उग्रसेनस्तथा कंसो वसुदेवश्च वीर्यवान् ॥
उत्तरश्च सह भ्रात्रा शङ्खेन नरपुंगवः । विश्वेषां देवतानां ते विविशुर्नरसत्तमाः ॥
वर्चा नाम महातेजाः सोमपुत्रः प्रतापवान् । सोऽभिमन्युर्नृसिंहस्य फल्गुनस्य सुतोऽभवत् ॥
स युद्ध्वा क्षत्रधर्मेण यथा नान्यः पुमान्क्वचित् । विवेश सोमं धर्मात्मा कर्मणोऽन्ते महारथः ॥
आविवेश रविं कर्णः पितरं पुरुषर्षभ । द्वापरं शकुनिः प्राप धृष्टद्युम्नस्तु पावकम् ॥
धृतराष्ट्रात्मजाः सर्वे यातुधाना बलोत्कटाः । ऋद्धिमन्तो महात्मानः शस्त्रपूता दिवं गताः । धर्ममेवाविशत्क्षत्ता राजा चैव युधिष्ठिरः ॥
अनन्तो भगवान्देवः प्रविवेश रसातलम् । पितामहनियोगाद्धि यो योगाद्गामधारयत् ॥
षोडशस्त्रीसहस्राणि वासुदेवपरिग्रहः । न्यमज्जन्त सरस्वत्यां कालेन जनमेजय । ताश्चाप्यप्सरसो भूत्वा वासुदेवमुपागमन् ॥
हतास्तस्मिन्महायुद्धे ये वीरास्तु महारथाः । घटोत्कचादयः सर्वे देवान्यक्षांश्च भेजिरे ॥
दुर्योधनसहायाश्च राक्षसाः परिकीर्तिताः । प्राप्तास्ते क्रमशो राजन्सर्वलोकाननुत्तमान् ॥
भवनं च महेन्द्रस्य कुबेरस्य च धीमतः । वरुणस्य तथा लोकान्विविशुः पुरुषर्षभाः ॥
एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं विस्तरेण महाद्युते । कुरूणां चरितं कृत्स्नं पाण्डवानां च भारत ॥
एतच्छ्रुत्वा द्विजश्रेष्ठात्स राजा जनमेजयः । विस्मितोऽभवदत्यर्थं यज्ञकर्मान्तरेष्वथ ॥
ततः समापयामासुः कर्म तत्तस्य याजकाः । आस्तीकश्चाभवत्प्रीतः परिमोक्ष्य भुजंगमान् ॥
ततो द्विजातीन्सर्वांस्तान्दक्षिणाभिरतोषयत् । पूजिताश्चापि ते राज्ञा ततो जग्मुर्यथागतम् ॥
विसर्जयित्वा विप्रांस्तान्राजापि जनमेजयः । ततस्तक्षशिलायाः स पुनरायाद्गजाह्वयम् ॥
एतत्ते सर्वमाख्यातं वैशंपायनकीर्तितम् । व्यासाज्ञया समाख्यातं सर्पसत्रे नृपस्य ह ॥
पुण्योऽयमितिहासाख्यः पवित्रं चेदमुत्तमम् । कृष्णेन मुनिना विप्र नियतं सत्यवादिना ॥
सर्वज्ञेन विधिज्ञेन धर्मज्ञानवता सता । अतीन्द्रियेण शुचिना तपसा भावितात्मना ॥
ऐश्वर्ये वर्तता चैव सांख्ययोगविदा तथा । नैकतन्त्रविबुद्धेन दृष्ट्वा दिव्येन चक्षुषा ॥
कीर्तिं प्रथयता लोके पाण्डवानां महात्मनाम् । अन्येषां क्षत्रियाणां च भूरिद्रविणतेजसाम् ॥
य इदं श्रावयेद्विद्वान्सदा पर्वणि पर्वणि । धूतपाप्मा जितस्वर्गो ब्रह्मभूयाय गच्छति ॥
यश्चेदं श्रावयेच्छ्राद्धे ब्राह्मणान्पादमन्ततः । अक्षय्यमन्नपानं वै पितॄंस्तस्योपतिष्ठते ॥
अह्ना यदेनः कुरुते इन्द्रियैर्मनसापि वा । महाभारतमाख्याय पश्चात्संध्यां प्रमुच्यते ॥
धर्मे चार्थे च कामे च मोक्षे च भरतर्षभ । यदिहास्ति तदन्यत्र यन्नेहास्ति न तत्क्वचित् ॥
जयो नामेतिहासोऽयं श्रोतव्यो भूतिमिच्छता । राज्ञा राजसुतैश्चापि गर्भिण्या चैव योषिता ॥
स्वर्गकामो लभेत्स्वर्गं जयकामो लभेज्जयम् । गर्भिणी लभते पुत्रं कन्यां वा बहुभागिनीम् ॥
अनागतं त्रिभिर्वर्षैः कृष्णद्वैपायनः प्रभुः । संदर्भं भारतस्यास्य कृतवान्धर्मकाम्यया ॥
नारदोऽश्रावयद्देवानसितो देवलः पितॄन् । रक्षो यक्षाञ्शुको मर्त्यान्वैशंपायन एव तु ॥
इतिहासमिमं पुण्यं महार्थं वेदसंमितम् । श्रावयेद्यस्तु वर्णांस्त्रीन्कृत्वा ब्राह्मणमग्रतः ॥
स नरः पापनिर्मुक्तः कीर्तिं प्राप्येह शौनक । गच्छेत्परमिकां सिद्धिमत्र मे नास्ति संशयः ॥
भारताध्ययनात्पुण्यादपि पादमधीयतः । श्रद्दधानस्य पूयन्ते सर्वपापान्यशेषतः ॥
महर्षिर्भगवान्व्यासः कृत्वेमां संहितां पुरा । श्लोकैश्चतुर्भिर्भगवान्पुत्रमध्यापयच्छुकम् ॥
मातापितृसहस्राणि पुत्रदारशतानि च । संसारेष्वनुभूतानि यान्ति यास्यन्ति चापरे ॥
हर्षस्थानसहस्राणि भयस्थानशतानि च । दिवसे दिवसे मूढमाविशन्ति न पण्डितम् ॥
ऊर्ध्वबाहुर्विरौम्येष न च कश्चिच्छृणोति मे । धर्मादर्थश्च कामश्च स किमर्थं न सेव्यते ॥
न जातु कामान्न भयान्न लोभा;द्धर्मं त्यजेज्जीवितस्यापि हेतोः । नित्यो धर्मः सुखदुःखे त्वनित्ये; जीवो नित्यो हेतुरस्य त्वनित्यः ॥
इमां भारतसावित्रीं प्रातरुत्थाय यः पठेत् । स भारतफलं प्राप्य परं ब्रह्माधिगच्छति ॥
यथा समुद्रो भगवान्यथा च हिमवान्गिरिः । ख्यातावुभौ रत्ननिधी तथा भारतमुच्यते ॥
महाभारतमाख्यानं यः पठेत्सुसमाहितः । स गच्छेत्परमां सिद्धिमिति मे नास्ति संशयः ॥
